reviews.author: Faith O.
reviews.description: Great service and beer! I had a lot of questions about the food and the cashier who helped me was very patient. I got the club sandwich with turkey and it was stellar. The beer flight was awesome too!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Honestly i would recommend this place. But, because they are fairly new i think they have some areas to improve and there are a few places i might go before coming back here.   The good.   This is a big indoor/outdoor brewery. Very family friendly. Big play scape for kids to run around. Can come here for food and drinks. Decent beer selection. Decent food selection. Clean and about what you'd expect to pay at a place like this.   The bad.   Though they have a decent food selection, it is lacking in execution. We ordered a variety of things to get a feel of all their flavors. Not very impressed. Let's just start with Texas bbq. Offer paper towels and some type of plates for share-ables v trying to eat out of a small serving box. We started with the queso and slaw with the burnt ends. The queso was lacking in brisket and the slaw was served without burnt ends. When we got the burnt ends, they were fatty (odd for burnt ends) and chewy. Not the crispy charred flavor one would hope for.   Let me preface on all the bbq, it is automatically covered in bbq sauce. This is not my ideal type of bbq. I want to control how much is on my meat.   Next we tried the ribs. Again chewy. Was really hoping for fall off the bone ribs. And again covered in bbq sauce. After trying a few, we could not even finish them.   We then got the chopped beef sandwich and the pepperoni pizza. I was hoping for a brick oven fire pizza. This felt more like a boxed frozen pizza with too much cheese, chewy crust, and thrown in the oven at 375 for 15 min. A bit disappointing. The brisket sandwich was probably the best part of the meal. Unfortunately it was also a bit too fatty for my liking and i only ate a few bites.   The beer was very good in my opinion. But considering the amazing bbq joints and pizza/beer joints around Austin, though i would probably come back, it would not be my first choice.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: A little bit out there, but worth the drive  Came here on a Saturday afternoon. The first impression of both the outside and the inside is the asthetic. It is very tastefully put together (so much so It's worth commenting on). It has the right balance of "instagramability" with a twist of "modern farmhouse". The day I came out here, it was a tad crummy, so I didn't get to enjoy the outdoor area as much as I would have liked, but it is expansive. I'll certainly be back in better weather.  It's not all look though, they do have the beer to back it up. I only got to have two different ones on tap, but they were both really pleasant. on my next visit I hope to try some more, and see what they have to offer. Overall: 4.25/5

reviews.author: Allie R.
reviews.description: Perfect way to escape the city to head out into the hill country. The drive from austin was beautiful and this brewery makes you feel like you are in the country giving you fun and different vibes. Perfect place for large groups and kids. I went on a Saturday and they had live music which was great! They also have a playground for children. The food items were delicious and came out quickly. I would definitely come back again!

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: This is my new favorite spot! Plenty of outdoor, spaced-out seating under the cedar trees. Large playground right in the middle to watch the little ones play. Air-conditioned indoor tables as well.   All the food I have tried is great. The fried chicken sandwich special, pulled pork tostadas(?), the beet and arugula salad... it's all good. Only disappointment was the Mac and cheese, pretty sure it's Kraft. But hey, that was for the kids anyway.   I will definitely keep frequenting this place when I am out on Fitzhugh, and especially once the weather gets cooler. Oh, and all the workers are super friendly as well. Good work, team!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Yet another stop on boozey Fitzhugh.   Good, fresh food. Good, standard and unique beer.  Really good people.   Comfortable setting with room for the kids to roam. Plenty of parking. Shade outside, covered patio, and AC inside. Dog friendly (outside). Great for groups. Competitive prices.   We like. We'll be back.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: The beer is great but the atmosphere is very lacking. When we showed up on a Saturday afternoon, there was no seating. You had to enter (with a dog) through a crowded patio with other dogs. I luckily found 2 chairs not being used at a table to pull aside, but oh lord. There were kids EVERYWHERE. I can handle well behaved kids but there were probably 5 kids per every adult there. It was madness. They were running all over and several times the poor guy delivering food to tables was almost tripped up by them. Our dog was super overwhelmed by parents not watching their kids running up to him.  My husband went to get us beer while I waited outside with the dog, and it took him at least 15mins the line was so long. The beer deserves 5 stars but our dog (and us) were so uncomfortable with how crowded and crazy it was, that we left after quickly sharing a flight. I'd come back, but it would only be right when they opened, and not for very long, considering they're this crowded often.  I definitely don't feel like they took distancing or mask-wearing seriously....my husband and I were the only ones outside wearing them when not at our seated area.  Oh, and the sewage smell is so insane. Rotten eggs bad. Hard to enjoy a good beer with that constant smell. Reminded me of Twisted X Brewing.

reviews.author: Allyssa S.
reviews.description: I love Fitzhugh Brewery! I always have the best time and I love how they change their beer options so you can try something different each time. Their food is also delicious, I haven't ordered anything I didn't like. It's a great atmosphere with very friendly staff, and so much space! Go out and support this small business!

reviews.author: Charlene S.
reviews.description: Great selection of brews, good food, wonderful atmosphere and a roomy place! Top it all off with staff that seemingly enjoys working there- makes for a wonderful experience! My husband and I went on a Sunday and greatly enjoyed ourselves. Wonderful to have another stellar local

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: Great food, beer, dog friendly, beer, playground, beer, burnt ends, beer, red and white wine, beer, dessert, beers. CRAZY fun brewery to visit.

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: We visit a lot of breweries and this one is top notch.  Great outdoor space.  Airy indoor space.  But the yard.  The yard is where it's at.  Kids and dogs and beer and barbecue on the nachos.  Beer was good, but less offerings than most breweries.  But it was good and we would recommend this place to anyone.

reviews.author: Delia S.
reviews.description: The space is a modern farmhouse look with high ceilings and clean, modern lines and the outside area has plenty of seating and trees for shade. Aesthetically it is close to perfect, but I have to knock a point off for the food. We ordered the smokehouse nachos and while they were delivered promptly, they were barely warm with cold pieces of brisket. I have to say, I'm amazed they can find anyone to deliver orders to, since you only get a table card for them to locate you, but in our case, we were seated close to the door, so he came straight to us. The beer was okay and I had the cider mimosa. Another thing I was less excited about, but didn't take points off for, was the number of children running around the place. There is a large playscape outside and as a parent whose child was once young, I get wanting to have places that are kid friendly, but that's just not my jam anymore. Again, I don't fault the place for that, but it'd probably make me less likely to return.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Nice large outdoor area.  Though not sure how I feel with kids on shared playscape (I don't have any but thinking of covid).  Tables are far apart and outdoors. Good food.  Interesting beer.  Don't bother with the Mac and cheese as it's very reminiscent of Kraft that you can make at home.  The fried chicken tenders were just ok.  The sausage sampler platter was tasty.  They had other items on the menu that looked good but we didn't have a chance to try them this go-round.  The Barbados Stout was a fine stout.  The Wee Scottish was more unique but wasn't as peaty as I would like, but was still tasty.

reviews.author: Seth P.
reviews.description: Great beer with a revolving selection. Same thing on the food, it's reliably good. We try and come here about once a week. The specials are usually pretty special.

reviews.author: Crystal P.
reviews.description: Great ambience and good appetizers. We had the brisket and it was delicious. Loved that they have a kid play structure and live music out back.

reviews.author: Madhavi A C.
reviews.description: The brewery had a very nice modern farmhouse feel to it. Even on a very hot day the place was shaded, cool and had plenty outdoor seating. The beer selection is good but not many other options for cocktail lovers like me. They had couple of wines and hard-seltzer options. The sandwiches are good compared to flatbreads.

reviews.author: Michael R.
reviews.description: These folks are one of the best experiences in the Hill Country.  Their beer menu is unique.  They brew a wide variety of international styles and do them very well.  Their food is superb.  We would visit just for the food.  And they are just decent, friendly folks.  This is one of my top two breweries in the Hill Country (the other being RoughHouse in San Marcos).

reviews.author: Crystal M.
reviews.description: This place is so cute and well made. Love the food and the beer is delish! Welcome to the neighborhood were so happy you are here!!!!

reviews.author: Joy S.
reviews.description: This is our "go to" place. Great unique beers, good facilities and very good food. Still deserves five stars in my family's opinion.

reviews.author: Christie P.
reviews.description: Great place to relax. Great staff, exceptional food (I recommend the tostadas), and amazing atmosphere. Nathan made it a point to ask about our service and make sure we were happy customers. Yes we are!!! We'll be back! Thank you Nathan for going above and beyond!

reviews.author: Shauna S.
reviews.description: Fantastic spot out in the middle of nowhere.. but not really.  Very friendly bartender and delicious beer. I respected the surrounding. It was a country setting with a family friendly appeal.  Very spacious outdoor setting. And my favorite part was getting a growler to go and buying a sticker. I'd for sure recommend this brewery. And it seemed you could stay there as well... super cool!

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: Great spot along the brewery trail in dripping springs. Lots of outdoor seating, live music and the beer is pretty good as well. They have food trucks so you can pick up a snack if you're hungry. Definitely a stop if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: This brewery is not like any other. It's a beautiful property with an amazing selection of beverages. We had the Texas Sun (saison), the Hilco (California Common), and the Texas Keeper Cider. All were phenomenal and suited to each of our tastes. The folks working here are the best. Thelma is an absolute sweetheart. (She and her husband own it). We are looking forward to attending the grand opening later this month and watching Ghost Note Brewing mature and prosper into the success we know it will be.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Super chill, super laid back brewery.   They have a stage for music (starts later on the weekends), a food truck slinging burgers, fries, and shishito peppers!  There's also a venue on property to celebrate special occasions.  Beer is good. Flights available so you can try a bunch. Only feature their brews; no guest beers.  Not a ton of shade, so when it gets hot, not sure it's the best place to be exposed to the unrelenting Texas heat!

reviews.author: Trina G.
reviews.description: Great out of the way right off the beaten path. It wasn't on our map to go to but did not disappoint.  We revisited and the bartender remembered us from two days prior, even what we drank. This is place is definitely worth the stop. Next trip to town we will be dropping in.

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: This was my first visit and it was amazing. The staff is very friendly! The place is very spacious. Very thankful for the staff wearing masks and gloves. There was a sign encouraging people to wear masks when they are not at the area they are sitting. Which is awesome. The beer is delicious. Recommend the Imperial Stout. The food truck that is on site has good food choices! The place is worth a stop if your are in the area.

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: This is the cutest little place ever!! Absolutely gorgeous. There is so much space- so many little cozy seating areas. Outside heaters for when it's cold, giant industrial fans for when it's hot. I'm so glad we stopped in. The owners were fantastic and great to talk to, and the drinks were equally great. Can't wait to go back for another visit.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Great beer and an even better atmosphere. Live music on the Sunday we came. Beautiful set up.

reviews.author: Anna T.
reviews.description: Of the local breweries this has the best beer. Recommend the Amber ale and the imperial stout

reviews.author: Matt H.
reviews.description: Love the atmosphere here.  I tried the Pilsner and it was great.   Beautiful grounds and tons of seating.    I just ordered burgers from the food truck

reviews.author: Blade S.
reviews.description: First visit to Ghost Note and was very impressed!  Tasty beer - nice outdoor layout with plenty of properly spaced tables and friendly staff.  Very much appreciated the staff wearing masks while serving customers and sanitizing the tables in between customers.  Tried the 4 beer flight and enjoyed them all.  Reasonably priced beer choices as well which was nice. Will be back!

reviews.author: Rachael T.
reviews.description: Amazing beer and a cool place to hang out.  Big tables with QR code's and window service.  They have a food truck, family and dog friendly.  Fans and heaters depending on the weather, mellow fun music and great service!  Go here before it gets crowded

reviews.author: Amy W.
reviews.description: Tried ghost note for the first time today. I shall be back. Beautiful setting in the hill country outside of dripping Springs. Nice, standard selection of 10 brews. Good service and live music. The "hangry" food truck was outstanding! Try their smash burger, parm truffle fries, blistered shishito peppers and especially the hot dog with bacon and sauerkraut. Delicious!

reviews.author: Dana C.
reviews.description: Good beer selection, good food truck, nice atmosphere, glad they had space heaters. We will be back!

reviews.author: Amy N.
reviews.description: We love Twisted x. The beer is great and so is the atmosphere. They have a large outdoor patio with heaters and indoor tables too. They have food trucks although they were not open when we were there. We will be back!

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: A group of friends and I came here on a Friday afternoon.   We got a couple flights of beer and really enjoyed them.   The staff was friendly, the place was clean and the decor was neat.   I would go back.

reviews.author: Alex L.
reviews.description: Nice location with a fair selection. Nothing special going on but a relaxing time. Will stop back in passing but may not spend a day there

reviews.author: Bob H.
reviews.description: First time here, indoor and outdoor seating, walk up service, food truck with pizza. Beverage selection: beer, soft drinks and some drink creations they make from their beers. Beer selection was over a dozen, about half  were IPAs. No porters, no stouts, especially for this time of year.  Overall sampling of selections was nothing to rave about, very little body and no depth in flavor. Bar staff was polite and busing the entire place. Unisex bathrooms need regular attention, bar staff should not have to do that too.  Overall impression: we won't drive to Dripping for Twisted X as a destination in the future.

reviews.author: Sue C.
reviews.description: Horrible customer service!  Their payment system did not work. They wanted to swipe the credit card multiple times. We refused. Offered to pay cash, they said no.    They wanted to write the credit card information on a piece of paper with other customers CC info. We refused.   Sidney, said that my attitude was not good. Sorry, Sidney you are not good at this business.  Your problem is not our problem.  Will not return all due to a horrible experience from Sidney.

reviews.author: shea w.
reviews.description: Had a great time here at Christmas time with our kids! They had activities for the kids and Santa was there. We grabbed our drinks and sat by a fire pit and relaxed while the kids ran around.  The musician who was playing was absolute wonderful (solo guitar and vocals). The staff was friendly and accommodating. I would absolutely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: Just 11 miles from Jester King, sits another awesome brewery, Twisted X. Good brewery ambience with both indoor and outdoor seating.  A food truck offering tacos and other Mexican snacks is parked on the premises.    Beer offerings are good with a varied selection.  Available on the day we visited, was chupaHOPra IPA, Mango IPA, Oatmeal Stout, Zwickle, Pilsner, Lager, Pale Ale and a few guest beers.  Flights available, $2 a taster for a very generous pour. Good flavor profiles to the ones we sampled.  2 bathrooms available. Out of toilet paper and not very clean on the day we were there.  Dogs are welcome, however, the outside seating area isn't huge.  Cornhole outside and the COOLEST carved tree you have ever seen!  Worth a stop and a beer just to appreciate the giant gargoyle and sombrero-wearing iguana.

reviews.author: Olivia C.
reviews.description: Pretty good beer and they have lots of activities, however the seating is pretty difficult. There's very few inside/under the roof and the rest are outside with the sun blaring down on us. They have umbrellas for the sun but they're disconnected from the table and there are only a few. Dog friendly!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: I think this place is mainly for the atmosphere. My husband and I stopped by on our random "pub crawl" of the Hill Country. I can't say I had had Twisted X beer before (or maybe I have and it wasn't memorable). The location is nice and quiet, with a ton of outdoor seating. However, the sewage smell was overwhelming! The inside was large and open but was crowded and was so loud. I don't know- I was impressed with the building, but not the beer, and definitely not the smell.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: We had such a great time at Twisted X. Loved it so much.  Starting off the drive out there is beautiful. I love getting out to dripping springs and getting out of the city. The leaves are changing and it's just a wonderful drive through hill country  We got there and were greeted with friendly faces. We got a few beers then went on a tour. Very cool behind the scenes look of how they do everything in house!  Came back and told the bar manager we trusted him to put together a flight for us. And he delivered. All the beers were delicious.   We very much so enjoyed our time there! We also enjoyed that there is a food truck serving delicious pizzas! Daniele' did great!!

reviews.author: Matt L.
reviews.description: Love this place! Great beer and great location it's my favorite brewery in Austin! The MConahazzee is my jam! And all there other beers are great too! Great lil drive out the back roads from Austin to get there!

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: OK, I am admittedly late to the Twisted X party - which is sad - particularly for a S. Austi like myself. I really have no good excuse.   This day at the Brewery was cool and so sitting outside was great - as was the beers. This is such a great space, and the service here was fantastic. They also had someone playing acoustic guitar - which only added MORE to the cool factor.   I can see spending many more days here in my future.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: One of my favorite hill country breweries for both their beer and vibe. On the Sunday that we visited it was too darn hot to enjoy their patio even with their Big Ass Fan. Inside was cool and comfy as we ordered a couple of their taproom only specialty brews and enjoyed the live music. A shoutout to the guitar player who finished his set with a great Spanish guitar-led song.   So bring the mutt and your kiddos (there is plenty of room for both them to run around outside) and enjoy a few of their wonderful craft beers.  Be sure to check out their website for taproom only beers and new releases!

reviews.author: Jeremy L.
reviews.description: Fun brewery.  Very friendly and informative people to answer my questions of the beer and location.   Beautiful space, inside and out. Not on main road so not as crowded as some places nearby.   Happy to stop and visit.

reviews.author: Karleigh D.
reviews.description: First time at this brewery and I can't recommend it enough! Service was great and the food truck outside had the most amazing pizza! Can't wait to come back

reviews.author: Theresa W.
reviews.description: I love coming to twisted x - many variety of brews and occasionally new ones! I've had the lagers and ales!  Say hi to Alex and tell them Theresa Math sent you!  You won't get a deal, but it'll make him feel special!

reviews.author: Katie L.
reviews.description: Beer was good. Very laid back place. One of the smaller breweries but still a must try when in the area.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Delightful beer, lovely setting. Live music on a Saturday afternoon. Good food truck. Excellent overall experience.  And we love that they support Divine Canines through Barks for Beers!

reviews.author: Christopher F.
reviews.description: I had been meaning to check this place out for a while.  I have been a big fan of their Chupahopra for quite some time and finally made the pilgrimage.    The brewery has nice curbside appeal.  The structure is nicely done and their is a little area for the doggies.  Of note, dogs are also allowed in the tasting room.   There is also a food truck there.  The inside is your typical tasting room with an industrial look.  It is nicely done.  The bartenders are good.    The prices are right.  I would recommend the flight so you can try ones.  I really think they do a good job on the IPAs.  Their beers are quite good.   But of all of them, i favor the Chupahopra!

reviews.author: Stefanie D.
reviews.description: Visited for the first time this past Saturday. There as a good crowd, busy but not packed, and we had no problem grabbing two seats.   It's not a huge place, but they have tables and chairs outside, an outdoor patio section and then some indoor. You can also sit at the bar. They had live music while we were there (a single guy and a guitar which was pleasant and not overwhelming, and there is a food truck on site. Plenty of parking as well.   We told the girl behind the bar it was our first time, and she did a great job of talking about the beers. I'm not an IPA fan so she recommended the German lager, which I found to be delicious. My friend got the mango IPA which he also liked a lot. And a good price at $5 per glass.   They have tours twice a day but we missed it as well as merch for sale. All in all, I found it to be a great place to hang out on a Saturday afternoon and it's in close proximity to Salt Lick and other wineries/breweries. Definitely make it part of the list to stop at!

reviews.author: Juniper B.
reviews.description: Would have given 6 stars if Jensen had been there. Overall, the atmosphere was cool, it's just not Supernatural themed.

reviews.author: Tim M.
reviews.description: As an Austin native, this business is on my small list of places that capture the quintessential charm of the Texas Hill Country. It reminds me of how Austin used to be when I was a kid. Special, sacred and just a lot of damn fun. To be honest I wish that I could have this gem to myself and keep it secret from the rest of the world but sharing it with my family is simply the only way to experience the best brewery in Austin. There are a lot of good breweries around town but few compare to the crisp, unique, and inventive flavors created by FBBC. A genuine oasis in a desert of hoppy IPA's that remind you of a bad ex. There are few things that I enjoy more than drinking a Brieux Famille on a hot summer Austin day. Do yourself a favor and take the short drive on Hamilton Pool Rd. and discover that there is a lot more to ATX than your special "Rainey Street". Love you guys!

reviews.author: Jeromy M.
reviews.description: I came to Texas earlier this month for vacation. One of the places I was dying to try was this specific beer Company. When our party arrived, it was slow. but there were only a few tables, and they were taken. It was cold outside, so we decided to stay inside and use the side table against the wall. this was fine, but then a table opened up and we got it. We went to the front to order and the I felt like I was interrupting the staff's conversation. I asked their opinion regarding the products, and they pointed to the menu on the wall. I already read the menu; I was referring to any we should try since we only got 4 on a flight. No Matter, we chose then headed to our table. They said it would be ready in a bit. ok... we sat and began talking about all sorts of stuff. after about 5 minutes, we were looking around towards the front to see if they were ready since it should have taken only a minute or so to get 4 flights poured. we are looking over and nothing. After about 10 minutes, a staff member came to the table and advised us our flights were sitting in the front. REALLY?! she came over, she could have brought them. At the VERY MINIMUM, could have told us something, flagged us down or anything to get our attention. Nope, just let the beers sit there while they went back to their conversation. We asked about food and they said the food is on the table in the form of a QR Code. ok... we looked around and was not busy at all, so we wanted to get some food. the wait time was like 40 minutes! there wasn't anyone there! Maybe 6 other people in the entire place.  The Magic of Dean Winchester Beerpub went POOF with that experience. The Glider was G*****E Black Beauty, Cabo, Cosmic Cowboy and Kick out the Yams was Awesome.  Not Likely to return to this Pub, ever. But will likely buy the beers (Mentioned above) if I see them in the stores.  Maybe staff was having a bad day. I dont know but that was my Experience

reviews.author: Netta K.
reviews.description: I don't drink so I can't comment on that but I can on the service which was severely lacking and the food.  You walk into a huge room and at the end is a small counter.  We had never been so didn't really know where to order or know anything about the beers. The people I were with are from Oregon and saw the owner on some show. I was hoping to show them awesome Austin hospitality but these chicks that were running the place seemed pissed to have to help anyone.  They finally ordered and we went outside to grab a table. About 10 minutes later I noticed other people having drinks but not the people I was with. I went up to the counter and all their flights were sitting on the bar. We had NO idea they were ready or that we had to wait for them. I have to say, if you expect a tip you have to work. They looked smug when I went up there and asked if they were ours. Anyway, service was a ZERO star.  The only thing I liked was the strawberry pizza. It sounds crazy but it was awesome! Not a lot of crust, just the right amount of cheese and it was huge! The pretzel, just don't! It's a Sysco frozen thing that was microwaved. Just stick with the pizza!  We won't be back but I sure hope I can find that pizza somewhere!

reviews.author: Belinda J.
reviews.description: Update review: Received response from owner. We did not walk our tab. We signed and closed out our tab immediately after we ordered at the counter and we purposely did not tip because of the poor service. Somehow they still felt the need to tip themselves. BS excuses!

reviews.author: Rick Z.
reviews.description: Delicious pizza, lots of beer options, great grounds, but admittedly not what I was hoping for. My family are Supernatural fans and considering the name of the establishment is a cute nod to Jensen Ackles' role in the show, we had hoped there would be some spooky theming to the establishment, maybe some fun photos or props, but there wasn't anything of the like! Anyone walking in who wasn't a fan simply wouldn't even know. A bit disappointing because while it was pleasant, it wasn't unique-- just a brewery in the hill country. *shrugs*  Ignoring my own hopeful expectations, as I said, we had a lovely time. It wasn't too busy on a Thursday night, and the staff were good about roaming occasionally to see if guests needed anything and to inform us about last call on food and later beer. We sat at one of the outdoor picnic tables and ordered with the QR code; received a text when things were ready for us to pick up. There's also some seating indoors if that's preferred. Noticed there was an area inside for a band set-up, though there wasn't anyone playing while we were there. Water is available in coolers both inside and on the patio.  Nice restrooms are clean and chic. The playground is pretty fun if you've brought munchkins. There is also the ever-popular Texas-favorite Cornhole. If it's a moist day, the ground may be a bit muddy, fair warning. The parking lot is all gravel. Turn is easy to find thanks to numerous signs along the way guiding you to the entrance.

reviews.author: Stacy A.
reviews.description: We had the BEST time here today! We made a reservation yesterday for today (good thing too because you have to have a reservation) and sat outside on a picnic table.   The hostess informed us there was a bit of a wait for the pizza and told us to put in our order as soon as possible. We got on it immediately and then figured out why she told us that - after an hour wait, we finally got our pizza.  No biggie though because the drinks are available as soon as you order them and there's a playground for the kids to play at so they weren't driving us crazy while we were waiting to eat.  The pizza was delicious! We got the pepperoni, carnivore, and Hippie and all of them were great! They're a thin crust, so you'll eat more than you think you'll want. The Hippie was my favorite.  We had such a great time listening to the band play and enjoying the perfect 70° spring weather.  We'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Jennifer G.
reviews.description: Nice place to hang out for awhile. Family friendly, playground, nice porch, pizza truck. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Order from your seat and pickup after a few minutes. If you don't live in the area it is a bit out of the way. As Supernatural fans we made the 3.5 hour trek, but wouldn't say we would do it again. The beers are fine. Nothing stood out except a dark anchored cream beer, but all were good to sip for a bit.

reviews.author: Chelsea B.
reviews.description: Came here with some friends, it was raining pretty bad when we got there so the outdoor seating wasn't an option and we found out that they wanted reservations. We were completed soaked so we decided to wait rather then go back out I'm the rain. Thankfully a table opened up and they sat us within about 5 minutes. The service is all ordered online and then you get a text to pick up your drinks or food. It was a cozy place with a great selection of beers. Flights were only $10 so we took advantage of that! The also had pretty good pizza.

reviews.author: Tracy J.
reviews.description: Update: they also gave me the wrong t shirt. I wanted black cotton and they gave me a completely different shirt. It doesn't have the same logo/wording and it's grey and in a very thin and sheer material. 50% polyester, 25% cotton. I won't be wearing it and will be reaching out for a refund.

reviews.author: Frankee C.
reviews.description: Really nice little family owned (I know shocker) brewery in Dripping Springs. The outdoor seating area was nicely spread out and there is a playground open for kids. You can order pizza from the food truck. We had the amazing.   Beers are all pretty good. The Grackle, Cosmic IPA and the Hamilton Pool Pale ale were my favorites. I was surprised at how refreshing the IPA was and happy with the flavors of the Grackle, a not too heavy imperial stout.   Would love to head back with our kids next time as the venue was wonderful.

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: We were very excited to eat here on our trip to Dripping Springs, but it felt a little lackluster to me. The food and drinks were fine, nothing special. The outdoor seating area had hardly any grass and the tables were pretty weathered and covered in ants. The playground was great for the kids, but not enough to bring us back.

reviews.author: Jena M.
reviews.description: Great beer and pizza! The staff is incredibly kind and the atmosphere is chill.  Would definitely recommend and will certainly be back.

reviews.author: Jennifer K.
reviews.description: Family Business Beer Co is so worth the drive out into Hill Country. I try to go every weekend. The beer is good, the pizza and salads are good (vegan/ non-dairy cheese available), and the setting is FANTASTIC. They have picnic tables outside in an oak grove. In the evening, string lights give the seating area a really warm and inviting vibe. I've sat at one of the tables at the edge of the property at dusk and watched a family of deer frolic nearby. You don't get that experience at a suburban strip mall restaurant.  Friendly dogs are welcomed here, as long as they remain leashed. There is even a pickup station with bags and a trash can.  The staff have all been SO friendly and welcoming every time we've gone. They'll occasionally have to remind people to please wear their masks, but this isn't a personal attack. They're just doing what they must to stay open!  Covid precautions: Masks are required for everyone unless seated at your table. You'll spend the vast majority of your time seated, so this is really not a big deal. The tables are far enough apart that this feels quite safe. The picnic tables have been covered with plastic table cloths, so they can be sanitized between patrons. The playground is currently closed, and there are no games or live music. Reservations through open table are required, to help with social distancing, but if they are not busy they will seat walk-ups.   I love this place even with everything being scaled back because of the pandemic. I can't wait to see how much more fun it will be once it is safe to fully reopen!  Things I would like to see: Cider as an option. Live music. A few more veggie choices.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: We went to Family Business with daughter and boyfriend on Sunday, December 27, for a pleasant family outing. It was so, with one exception. The positive first. The grounds are very pleasing, and FB is very careful to distance you, to sanitize between visits and to enforce mask wearing.   Their beers are well designed and creatively conceived. Cosmic Cowboy is a mildly rich, middle of the road offering and fun on the palate. Hamilton Pales is crisp with fruity tones and makes a great warm weather beer. Brieux Famille is my wife's favorite, though she usually prefers a beer that's one step beyond rainwater.  The downer was the guy in charge of passing out your beer order from inside the taproom. He was overly officious and rude. He liked the little bit of power he had, and he used it. I felt disrespected and insulted because I tried to sip my two beers down to a level such that I could carry it without spilling a bunch. I was doing that on the deck, not in the taproom, and he shouted me down. Daughter's boyfriend was offended on my behalf as well.  FB, please train your folks on how to handle customers with dignity. It's not only what you say, it's how you say it.

reviews.author: John L.
reviews.description: The beer here is excellent. Probably one of my favorite brewers in existence.  That said the visit is meh.  They've gone overboard with the outdoor masking and the covid precautions to the point where it's just not that great.  I hear some of the other establishments in the area aren't as bad re this.     I'd probably skip it until they see fit to remove the outdoor masking.    Definitely buy the beer in the store though. It's top notch.

reviews.author: Luke D.
reviews.description: Wife wanted to come here (for obvious reasons) when we visited family.  We thoroughly enjoyed the outdoor seating and the relaxed atmosphere.  The staff was friendly and beers were excellent.   We had the ESB and a couple of IPA's.   There wasn't any live music when we were there but I was pleasantly surprised with the music they were playing (Misfits, Dead Kennedys, GBH).         Looking forward to visiting family again.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Fun times! Casey, our server, was most helpful. We did a couple of flights. What an exciting taste journey! There were ups and downs, twist, turns laughs and tears.... But seriously a great experience in a fun atmosphere. Porch was nice with a cool breeze and relaxed environment. Would recommend if you are in the area.

reviews.author: Laurel G.
reviews.description: I can't say enough how much I loved coming out to this location - what an experience, and a stunning one! I drove out with a visiting friend who had heard good things. We got a couple of flights so we could experience a larger variety and enjoyed them at the picnic tables outside. This is on such a beautiful piece of land outside Austin, with mossy trees and buzzing air, and a big playground for you to set your kids on while you kick your feet up on the porch. The inside is bright and open and clean, the beer is good, and I will absolutely be returning as soon as I can.

reviews.author: Lauren S.
reviews.description: I love this place! I've visited a few years ago and made a trip out from Austin again recently. I was incredibly impressed with how seriously they're following county guidelines for Covid. All staff are wearing masks, contactless ordering and patrons are required to wear masks unless they're at their table. All dining is outdoors and the staff are super friendly. The food was fantastic as was the beer! I'll definitely be coming back when I'm in town again.

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: This place was pretty spectacular. I've been wanting to go for a while and it finally happened! It was in the low 70s and perfect weather. The hill country views are beautiful and I'd imagine sunsets here are gorgeous. Outdoor games available. Dogs on leash are allowed.   Lots of seating and an interesting idea on how to hold your seats/table. It was nice not having to worry about somebody taking our spot while playing with the animals. You can also get food for them at the bar. They were pretty gentle and didn't mind selfies.   Lots of beer, cider and wine options. I had the sweet Sangria (Messina Hof) and Cherry Cobbler by Martin House. Both delightful and fruity.   They have 2 food trucks: Gringas Grub Shak and Kelly's Hill Country BBQ. I went with Kelly's and got the Brisket Elote Parfait and it was so, so good. I want to go back just for that! There were so many options to choose from. There's really something for everyone. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Evie T.
reviews.description: Super cute and fun. Didn't see any llamas though but the sunset made up for it. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. If I remember correctly the drinks consist of beer, wine, and soda. (Water cooler is available as well)   Seating is on a first come first serve situation went on a Friday during spring break and had no problems at all!   My only con is on the day we went there were a lot of children everywhere. Running everywhere. Of course that's more so on the parents but just keep in mind that there may be a bunch of kiddos .

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: This place has amazing views. The staff is very friendly and prices are very reasonable. It is kinda of hard to miss having a great view and a good beet. The weather was on point. Plus we saw a few llamas too. It is a fun place to go and have a beer and enjoy the view.

reviews.author: Erica N.
reviews.description: Loved this spot. Can't believe I hadn't been here before. Spent the birthday weekend out in the Driftwood/Wimberely area and our friends told us about this spot and we were not disappointed. Although it's kid central (which can be good or bad for some people), the views (especially for sunset) are amazing. The drinks were good. They have multiple fire pits during the winter time. Lots of seating. Llamas Ofcourse. What more could you want?!

reviews.author: Melody C.
reviews.description: This place is definitely worth checking off the list. Great selection of beer - although it seems like the tap beer struggles to be kept cold. Everything was pretty luke warm. The llamas and donkeys were hanging out though so that was fun!

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: This is a brew pub with a lovely outdoor space, expansive Hill Country views, and entertainment for all!  | Experience | You can't beat it!  It the best of what the area wineries offer in terms of a place where you want to spend a leisurely couple of hours, with a great assortment of local craft beers on tap (and options for the non-beer drinkers).  I like that there is a variety of seating options (picnic tables, Adirondack chairs, barstools) and they are nicely spread out.  Aside from the view the main attraction is their resident llamas and mini donkeys, and trust me, splurge on the bag of feed for optimal up-close interaction with these adorable camelids!  | Beverages | A nicely curated selection of local beer on tap, and surely something to please everyone.  There's also a selection of cider, hard seltzer, wine, and non-alcoholic beverages.    | Eats | We didn't eat here, but there's an onsite resident food trailer offering tacos, quesadillas and burgers.

reviews.author: Madeline A.
reviews.description: I love this place! The Shady Llama is perfect for gatherings large and small. It's kid-friendly, dog-friendly (just don't let them get close to the llamas) and the views of the hill country are gorgeous. My only suggestion would be to add a really nice, healthy mocktail to the menu. We had the lemonade, but it was an artificial lime green, which was a little unappetizing.

reviews.author: Kristine V.
reviews.description: After a long dip at Blue Hole Regional Park, the Shady Llama is a place to go for a quick bite, beer, and incredible views. As soon as you walk in, the chairs and hammocks out provide a nice campfire style vibe. There are a ton of trees to keep you cool, and the view of Hill Country is one of a kind. To your right, there is a small fence with adorable llama's you can feed and pet. I didn't get to try the food, but the bbq smelled incredible.  Lots of beer and wine options, and great place to bring your friends for a relaxing afternoon.

reviews.author: Mallorie T.
reviews.description: This place is super cute and I had a wonderful sour for only 6$! It was really good ((: the only thing that was tough is that they have a small parking lot and it took me quite a while to park. It's a beautiful view and fun to see llamas and donkeys!

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: A friend invited me to The Shady Llama on a Sunday afternoon. Such a wonderful place! Great for hanging out with friends. The check in is nice, you tell them how many people are in your party and they give you a table sign to reserve your spot. The beer selection is local. Wine is local as well. The llamas are an extra treat to see. You can purchase feed at the bar. The view of the valley and hill country is fantastic. This is a great place for groups, dogs and is kid friendly too.  All staff members are friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Brittney B.
reviews.description: Visited here with a group of friends while on a weekend trip, and this was hands down our favorite spot. The llamas were so cute and funny, and the drinks were great. We enjoyed keeping warm by the fire pit, and I imagine the sunset view is spectacular. Wish we had spent more time here!

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: What a perfect place to enjoy a relaxed few hours on a nice weather day in the Hill Country! The Shady Llama, just west of Wimberley on the way toward Dripping Springs on RR12 is a gem of a yard bar offering Texas-based craft brews, soft drinks, and wines with a killer view and a few furry mascots to feed and pet.  Our family loves this place. We can each enjoy a tasty beverage we like, have a good lunch from the Gringa's truck we like from Wimberley, and feed some alfalfa to some llamas and burros.  There are plenty of socially-distanced places to lounge around the terraced and tree-shaded yard, and everything is outdoors. It's actually perfect for pandemic times.  Pro-tip: do not try to come here during any weekend with special events in Wimberley, like Market Days or Rodeo. The parking lot has limited capacity. Lazy Sundays are the best time IMHO.

reviews.author: Michael L.
reviews.description: THE BIG: Scenic brewery that overlooks Texas Hill Country...with a llama and donkeys!  THE BLACK AND WHITE: I thought this place was a brewery but a brewpub will do! Plenty of great drinks on tap as well as friendly bartenders.   The bae and I came here after a swim at the neighboring Blue Hole Regional Park. Short 11min drive will get you to Shady Llama from Blue Hole.  The star of the show is the petting zoo featuring the llama and two donkeys. You can get up and personal with the llama by feeding and petting. I was a little hesitant to get too close because who knows if he'll spit.  The view of Texas Hill Country is breathtaking and you could sit here for hours just taking it all in. There were two food trucks on site offering tacos and bbq.  THE FINAL BAMBOO: The vibe here was so nice. Great place to unwind after long day at the pool or chill with friends until dusk.

reviews.author: April L.
reviews.description: Cute beer garden nestled in the wimberly hills! They have a huge selection of beer and some food trucks. It is very family friendly and the llamas are so sweet! Be sure to ask the bar for some llama food the feed them.

reviews.author: Brett R.
reviews.description: Perfect place to kick back, relax, and enjoy the beautiful Central Texas weather. So simple but relaxing. Kid friendly atmosphere. Exactly what I hoped to find!

reviews.author: Cayla G.
reviews.description: We were milling about in Wimberley and wanted to find a relax, safe spot to go enjoy the sunshine so we went to The Shady Llama. It exceeded our expectations! The beer selection had at least 10 on draft and another 15 or so canned. We loved the socially distant setting, the polite staff, the llamas, and the music! I'd love to come back here when I'm in Wimberley again! Note, I cannot review the food trailer on site as I only had the beers!  P.s. the Tang IPA from Rough Diamond is 5

reviews.author: Brittany A.
reviews.description: The food trucks have some great options and the beer and wine selection is pretty extensive. However what really sells it is the whole vibe! The staff is super friendly, the view is outstanding and there's even a play area for the kiddos. My son spent about 3 hours playing and blissfully out of my hair and off the iPad! We will definitely be ba

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: Judging from the recent reviews, I guess I'm in the minority. But I miss pre-COVID Shady Llama.  It's just not the same and the magic is gone. Given that literally 100% of the place is outside,  their COVID protocols are way over the top.   Why do you need to assign picnic tables??   And all the hammocks are gone (risk of transmission is greater from canvas than wood??).  At least they stopped doing the inane requirement of reservations they were doing for a while.   So if you're uber paranoid and love restricted freedoms maybe it won't be an issue for you.    But it just made my wife and I sad to be back (1st time in a year and pre-pandemic we were regulars).   Yes they have good beer, and higher prices now to offset the fact that people obviously aren't flocking there like they used to.  And the view is great and it's fun to see the llamas and if you never went before maybe you'll be none the wiser.  But for me it's just a sad reminder of what it used to be and a testament to how much fear and paranoia have all but ruined our country.   I won't be back until they restore everything to pre-pandemic protocols.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Just all sorts of whimsical in brewery form.  Their table designation decor they give you at the front so you can claim your spot without fear of anyone scooping it up when you're grabbing a beer or going to gawk at the llamas or mini donkeys is adorbs and shows attention to detail and a winning customer service experience right off the bat.   The tables are spread out nicely and there's plenty of shaded options or exposed ones, depending on your tolerance for the sun/heat.   It's actually on top of a hill so you can get a lovely panoramic vista of Hill Country, so you better believe if you're there at sunset, you'll be getting a gorgeous setting to close out on.   They don't brew their own beer (or wine), so they offer up a glimpse of Texas' finest on tap, which I appreciate. During COVID, every order came with chips or a treat (from a Costco assortment), but there's also a taco truck in the back if you're looking for something a little more substantive.   Kid and dog friendly, and since there are cute animals roaming the grounds (but fenced away from the tables), there are a lot more kids also roaming the grounds, so if that's not your thing, this may not be the place for you ;)  They have 6 llamas and two mini donkeys, and while the guy checking us in made it seem a sighting of them is rare unless you get there right when they open because that's when feeding time is, they were ever present during our midday visit. You can purchase feed for $1/bag to lure them over, and so I have a feeling we just had an extra generous crowd that day that always kept them fence curious!

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came on a weekday evening and had a glass of rose. Was disappointed to find that the llamas had already retired for the day and usually come out during the mornings. However, the scenery was picturesque, and I loved the overall charm of the outdoor space. Service was on point.

reviews.author: Dave M.
reviews.description: Spectacular venue.   It's absolutely stunning.  People are great.  Not much else to say.  It's great.

reviews.author: Jen P.
reviews.description: Beer was fantastic, but highly recommend not ordering from the food truck.  $10 pretzel was cold and hard, sausage was ok but we'll be eating before visiting the brewery next time.  Brewery has great propery and enjoyed the shuffle board.  **update - left bells springs and went to Nomadic Brewing in Austin, highly recommend that the food truck at bells spring offering cold hard pretzels for $10 to chat with the pretzel making pretzelista at Nomadic...jalapeño cheddar pretzel was amazing...hot, soft and paired with delicious side of grainy mustard for half the price of bells springs horrible pretzel offering

reviews.author: Yvonne A.
reviews.description: Located in a beautiful area. The space is large and both with winery and beer sections are decorated nicely. Games to play both inside and out. Oh, and their IPA was pretty good too!

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: Wow! That is all I have to say. The wine tasting was great, service is outstanding and seating very comfortable. Overall, the environment is very welcoming.  The food truck run by Chef Massaro is a must. My husband and I ordered buffalo chicken, Korean bbq chicken, Cilantro dumplings and waffle fries. The food was beyond what I expected from a lunch truck, it is delicious! My husband and I will definitely be going back to order from Chef Massaro and if you go on Bell Springs Winery website, you will find the food menu and send a text with your order to Chef Massaro ahead  of time.

reviews.author: Jon G.
reviews.description: Great spot great beer.   Great people.  The variety of beer is astonishing for a new place very light and refreshing.  Truly love the cobe

reviews.author: Angela Z.
reviews.description: We were visiting a friend in town who suggested we go to this place. I was a bit hesitant as someone who didn't like beers much and as this was 30 minutes from where we were staying in what seemed to be in the middle of nowhere.   I ended up loving my visit! I tried four different ciders or IPAs and was able to find one that I could sip on for the rest of the day. Pizza was pretty good too, not too heavy.   The sun had come out by the time we finished our drinks and we got to play some corn hole and interact with some goats. Lovely trails around the farm and we even took home a few packs and merch before we left.   Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: This oasis of a brewery, goat farm (doom metal goat yoga, anyone?), and nature reserve...is epic. Super solid beers (primarily known for sours/wild ales, but great IPAs and stouts to boot), wide open spaces with 2 bars (with differing taps), a goat farm for family fun, walking trails, and even scratch-made wood fired pizza! This time we got the Mason (red sauce, mushrooms, pepperoni, red onions, fresh Lioni mozzarella, pecorino Romano) and, even though I try to never ever have pizza while traveling (something we New Yorkers aren't exactly starved for, thankfully), this...was delicious.  Could it have been the beer talking? Perhaps slightly...but this was admitted good pizza, and just what I needed. Had to try the blue corn muffin, as I do love me some corn muffin/bread - it was fine, but better to have more room for pizza or beer lol  About a 30ish min uber/lyft ride from Austin, there's absolutely no excuse to not stop by and make one incredible day of things! I was back here in March 2020 and now having revisitedin March 2022 (F-you covid and messing up SXSW 2021...and so much more), this place is a must. And don't forget to say hi to Sasha, the Golden Retriever / goat herder!

reviews.author: Leila L.
reviews.description: Stopped by here in our way back from Hamilton Pool. There was quite a line when we got there to check in for some reason, which they said was to just ID you. However in the end you put your order online and get a text for pickup.   The website claimed a 30 minute wait for pizza, but by the time we decided it was a little over an hour wait. Not ideal, and I feel like for pizza it should be pretty quick since they have the stone oven. That's the main reason I knocked a star off. The pizza itself was phenomenal. Knowing the wait we should have ordered 2 for 3 people. We got a side of olives that comes in a large container which we also enjoyed.   The ambiance here was pretty chill. You get folks who are just super casual and then folks who look like they could be instagram influencers here. Witnessed a birthday group, a bachelorette party, a baby shower, and a pug meetup all together!   There is also an area for goats if you wander far enough to check them out. There's also a nature trail which we didn't get to explore. Next to the stable was a private area where we also saw a wedding gathering.

reviews.author: Kerst G.
reviews.description: Ever hear of a place so much it makes you envious and you have it on your list of places to go whenever you get around to it? This is that place. Friends in the beer business highly recommend. This is THE coolest farmhouse brewery. From the beers, huge farm, trails, goats, rabbits, and chandelier swinging in the trees, Jester King has it all. Try the food, it's just as good as they have a real wood fired oven! Ambiance is 5/5- there are so many cool places to enjoy a cold brew- beer garden, under the outdoor tent, along the trails, the brew barn. Try the cider, it looks deceiving but it's VERY good! This is a must visit when in the Austin area.   P.s.- The restrooms are in a converted airstream!

reviews.author: Kendall H.
reviews.description: Jester king is a fantastic outdoor venue for family and friends with unique and bold beers. They have several bars, each with different offerings, to encourage you to roam around the property. They also have wood fired pizza, which does take a long time on busy nights - so order right when you arrive! We also got a chocolate chick cook and the Texas Twinkie (jalapeño wrapped in sausage and bacon) to snack on and they were INCREDIBLE! The blueberry beer and mushroom beers were my favorite from our 3/18 visit. The beers change often so get excited to try something new at jester king! Also, they have goats and a playground - just epic.

reviews.author: Erica O.
reviews.description: This place was a cool spot to visit on a skip work day Friday. They had a good drink menu to choose from. Their food menu option was great too!   Only downfall is I wish they had their brewery tour open. The traffic for Friday was good. I wasn't expecting many people to be on grounds.   It's big enough to service a lot of people. It's also family friendly with trails and a playground. For the size, I think the playground for the munchkins can be bigger.   I definitely will be back since my husband wants to see the brewery.

reviews.author: Caitlin O.
reviews.description: Love love love jester king! Great hill country escape with lots of beer or non- beer options. Pizza's are delicious! Love the amount of space to explore here and sprawl out. The goats might be my fav part but it's hard to pick.

reviews.author: Charles B.
reviews.description: Multiple bars at the venue, each with their own style, menu, and line.   Live music at the first bar was awesome. Must also go see the goats up by the metal barn and the rabbits out back by the restrooms which are housed in a converted camper.  At this bar, I recommend the white wine spontaneously fermented beer.   At the second bar, strongly recommend over any aversion to how it sounds, that you try the mushroom and sea salt beer.   They also have corn hole to play and plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: I remember when this place was a new thing. Every one of our friends would invite us but it was usually during those torturous hot summers so we never made the trek out there.  Time passed, more breweries started popping up all over and it became less of a unicorn. We still wanted to go, but we never thought about planning for it. Such is life with a three year old, you're just along for the ride...  A quick trip to the zoo, three hungry bellies and then the thought, "Isn't Jester King around here?"  Find me a prettier Austin day than 55 degrees and sunny.   The grounds are magnificent. They are diverse, offering something for everyone and they are expansive. There's so much to explore.  The food was great, the pizza reminding me of a certain Austin pizza juggernaut (Pious). The kolache and the meaty beans were surprisingly good.  The crowd was happy, engaging and...pretty. I couldn't help at notice everyone who didn't have a kid was dressed up while all of us slobs with kids were just holding it together by a thread. Either way, it was harmonious and positive.  While I didn't get a chance to sample all the beer, I did have a small sampling of two red fruity ales. I'd want to wait for a couple more trips and more beer tasting to give my definitive on the beer.  That said, the experience is what matters, and it was definitely something you'd want to do again. Sure, the stars aligned weather-wise but they often do for us in Austin so enjoy!

reviews.author: Chris L.
reviews.description: This place is truly a craft beer experience unlike any other in US!  We ventured out to Austin for a bachelor party and as we are all beer enthusiasts / professionals, Jester King was the main goal. We called ahead to let them know about our party size / arrival, secured tickets for the tour and stayed for an early dinner.   We HIGHLY recommend the tour.  I personally have been a tour guide for many breweries as well as have been on many brewery tours but this one was so personal and meaningful. Debbie gave a world class tour and really made everyone understand the reason why JK exists and the emphasis on terrior they have. The legendary coolship room was fantastic and I geeked out on the horizontal lager tanks.  We snagged a beer at the barn bar before the tour started.  The food and ambience was fantastic! Everything is so spread out and their kitchen that day was rocking. Ya can't go to JK without snagging a pizza and glass on one of their saisons.   Regan and Jerika, who I know from the Stone Brewing days, were prime examples of hospitality. From geeking out about the to go selection to just talking about the rad events they have coming up, it was all tied together to the overall beer experience.  I shared some Pure Project beers and SD gifts for their wonderful attention to detail. The overall team is a well run machine!  Go out there, try a beer you have never heard of, and enjoy the open Texas field.

reviews.author: Ron M.
reviews.description: The atmosphere is awesome. I think the brewery bit off more than they can chew. Once the original pizza place left the pizza went down hill. 2 hours wait for food?!?!? It's a shame this was one of my favorite places. We drove almost an hour. Probably won't make another trip out this far again for the service and food.

reviews.author: Alan H.
reviews.description: Came here because Jester King has two of my favorites, pizza and beer! They have a variety of pizzas so we order (3) of them and they were all good! And with that track record it is safe to assume they're all tasty! Not sure if they make their own dough but it was a good with a nice crunch.  The beer selection is pretty wide as well. Pro tip is to ask for a flight even though it's not shown on their menu. That way you can taste a bit before ordering a whole pint!

reviews.author: Pascal P.
reviews.description: This past November my wife and I were in Austin and were looking for something fun to do for an afternoon. We read about Jester King and decided to check it out. It ended up being a great find. The grounds are lovely and in November the weather was absolutely perfect. Their beer is pretty much all sour so be prepared for that. The goat tour was also really charming. When it was over there was a small hiking loop (I'm guessing a couple of miles?) that we were able to take.   Unfortunately we did not sample the pizza but that's on my "to try" list the next time we come back.

reviews.author: James B.
reviews.description: I just can't wrap my head around why people like this place.  Most of the beers are pretty awful.  The food is expensive and the pizza is definitely worse since they took over. The atmosphere is great; so I'll give it that... but how did this all happen with so many better breweries all over the place here ?  Maybe if you like sour beers and some strange brew, give it a try.  The food isn't bad either, just not as good.

reviews.author: Joe V.
reviews.description: A short drive from Austin ~ 25min outside of town. It was a cold day , so not so crowded , but great selection of draft beer and amazing wood fired pizza selections.  There was a mixture of families , singles, and couples that enjoyed a heated outdoor rustic venue.  We'd highly recommend here and a visit to Treaty Oak for a fun outing.  Tasting room reservations recommended if you want a specific time !  Beverages available for take away ;)

reviews.author: Molly P.
reviews.description: Hipster vibes for sure. Also a wedding/rehearsal venue lol This place is super cool! Lots to do here like grab a beer, walk around, explore the grounds, enjoy the scenery outdoors, pet some baby goats. They make their own beer here (obviously lol) and even had a few sours, which is sometimes rare to find! Also, you can purchase cans (and bottles?) of their beer. Very chill spot especially in the evening sitting on a picnic table with the twinkly lights and live folk music.

reviews.author: Desiree D.
reviews.description: Overall, jester king brewery was great. The grounds and location are beautiful.  There were some hit or misses with each dish I had, and the beer didn't win me over. I think why this was 4 stars because everything was just good, but the grounds and location made that 2 star go to a 4 star.   The tomatoe soup bisque was interesting. It was very watery. The flavor slowly grew on me. The grilled cheese was good, but small. I feel there needed to be another half or more bread for it.  There was too much soup to grilled cheese ratio for dipping.  The sage cookie truly grew on me. The flavor was intense and sweet. I took a bite and then needed a few mins to process this flavor.  Eventually I'd eat the whole thing.   The bread with dipping butter sucked. None of us liked this at all. I felt the bread was kinda hard, and I was expected warm bread but it was room temperate. Also, the butter it came with was super bland too.  The 2 beers i had were okay, but i felt the flavor was pretty bland. I was here back in February so maybe the batches they were working on then were not my cup of tea.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: LOVE it here, because Jester King is more than just a brewery. They also serve fresh pizza, have lots of land, have a walking trail, and also GOATS!!!   If you can, Jester King advises reservations to guarantee a spot. If not, they do accept walk-ins, but be warned it's based on availability. People spend more than the average time here to enjoy the amenities Jester King has to offer.   How it currently works: Check-in at the Pole Barn, order food from your phone using the QR code, pick up your food and order drinks at the Pole Barn, and find a seat either in the Beer Garden, The Hopyard, The Canopy or the Grotto.   The Hopyard is where we decided to settle just because it's away from the larger crowds at the Beer Garden, and you're next to the Goat Barn! I didn't find the smells of the goats too horrendous, but be warned on windy days, the dust kicks up heavily!  Brews, Ciders, and Wine is what Jester King has to offer in terms of beverages. You can also take some home with you by stopping at their shop! Jester King is pretty niche when it comes to their brews, as not only do they have pure cultures, but mixed as well. Get crazy brew people!

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: We went here on Father's Day weekend and had a great time! We did the brewery tour, which wasn't too bad. I'm not a beer aficionado... my husband is and he seemed to enjoy the tour.  For me, it was all about their outdoor seating, good food options and live music. It's the perfect place to have a nice relaxed afternoon... hanging out with family and friends. We tried their root beer, a couple of different beers brewed on site. I had the Pilzner and it was the perfect drink for a hot afternoon. They offer a pretty impressive menu of starters and entrees. We did their Asian pizza and it was scrumptious. I've never had a pizza infused with Asian flavors and I Jester King does it right!

reviews.author: Tiffany M.
reviews.description: They offer a goat experience for $10/person and it was worth every penny. My sister and her boyfriend were visiting from LA and they both loved it. You got to be up-close to day-old goats. Holding a baby goat is something you didn't know you needed to do until you try it.  Afterwards, we grabbed a table by the stage (yay live music) and got pizzas and pretzels to share. You can skip the pretzel. It was not good. The pizzas were great and it's a lovely experience to treat out-of-town guests to. It was a Thursday night.

reviews.author: Tim L.
reviews.description: Took the hike out here with some friends who were in town and also big whiskey fans and while it was a bit of a hike it was totally worth it.  I started with the Treat Oak Ghost Hill neat after seeing it in stores a couple times and it was perfectly smooth.  Next I tried the Spiced Old Fashioned from the cocktail bar and it did not disappoint. I really liked the addition of the cinnamon stick, it added the perfect amount of "winter" vibe to the drink to match the cool weather.  The offered a distillery tour that we wanted to go on but it started a bit to late for us, since we were there early.  We played cornhole and overall had a great time, will definitely be back!

reviews.author: W C.
reviews.description: Ah man, we really wish that we loved this place better than we did. We came here on Sunday with our two friends and their kids for the first time and the space is just gorgeous: lovely old oak trees, plenty of open space and tables, a little area with slides for the kids to run around and enjoy.  That's where the compliments stop. Everything else about our experience was wanting, starting with the GRUMPY woman who helped us at the bar. We ordered the burger--they were out (thanks for letting us know!). The winter smash cocktail tasted like it had zero whiskey in it and was poured from a spout. The IPA on draft was fine. The food that we did end up getting was only OK. The cucumber salad was runny and mealy, and the chopped brisket sandwich seemed like it could have been tasty that morning but by 5-whatever pm, it was dry as hell. We also didn't get the BBQ sauce that it was served with (our friends did for theirs). Our kid's quesadilla was standard. And bagged chips galore!  Also, they close at 6:00 pm. On a Sunday before a holiday. OK, fine, bad business, but you do you! Here's what's not cool: coming over to our table hot and heavy and telling us you're closing in five minutes with an attitude and demanding our food trays. We're happy to be accommodating! You just don't need to be jerks about it. If you've had a long day and just can't handle the customer service, then have enough self-awareness to ask a coworker to do the corralling.  Honestly, we went over to Fitzhugh afterwards which had good food (desserts at least), better service, a better play area for the kids, and we had way more fun there. We'd love to try Treaty Oak again, but we need to have enough time to forget the less savory aspects of our experience.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow! I can't believe I forgot to review this place.  Drinks are great, atmosphere is chill. All outdoor seating but they have fans, fire pits, outdoor games and the owner has a ranch with cool animals next door.   A must see!

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Whiskey, whiskey, and more whiskey! I've been to vineyards for wine tastings, but never to a distillery until now. The experience is similar. They have a tasting room with well-versed, educated servers who can give you the lowdown on the various whiskeys available. My guy and I are not whiskey drinkers, but we really enjoyed tasting and learning about the process.  The grounds are clean and well maintained with ample parking. There's a large restaurant with bar service as well. We went out to hear a band one Saturday afternoon, and hang out before the blistering summer sun hits central Texas. The venue is family-friendly- there were lots of kids, and dogs, picnic tables, frisbees flying, and balls being thrown. You can bring along your own camp chair too. I did love that they had flushing toilets and not just port-a-potties. Thank you! You can also tour the distillery itself. I'd highly recommend checking this place out whether your a whiskey connoisseur or a novice. Let me know if you do! Cheers!

reviews.author: Brian G.
reviews.description: I stumbled into this place and felll in love.  The drinks are amazing, the staff are really friendly.  Plus the food is awesome.   I typically don't drink Gin, but their Antique Gin is amazing.  Definitely getting a bottle on my way home.  Highly recommended  I would post a picture, but all the food and drinks are gone....

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Took my second trip out to treaty oak and was not disappointed with the day spent here. Treaty Oak is the kind of place that you want to spend the entire day at, and you totally can! What I love about it too is that it's a massive space with so much to do while on the grounds. It even has a playground where the kids can play, and an indoor space with plenty of TVs to watch football on game day.  We started off with a tasting, which you can either do Gin or Whiskey. I actually highly recommend the tasting, it's only $10 a person but gives some great background on how each different flavor/bottle is created and made. You also can put the $10 towards a bottle if you end up wanting to buy one to take home.  We then went into the bar area and got drinks, which is a huge variety of cocktails! They have plenty of picnic tables, and multiple boards for cornhole on the grounds. The restaurant on site it BBQ and was amazing! We got the brisket sandwich and pork sandwich and loved them both. What I also loved about it, was that there's multiple places where you can get drinks, foods, etc. on the grounds but your tab stays open for everything. Love this place and highly recommend making a day trip out of it if you haven't been!

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: A gem in the Hill Country area. Great outdoor seating with plenty of room for kids and adults to run around and play. Pet friendly.  We had the white sangria... which was just perfect for a summer afternoon with some brisket nachos that were yum yum yum! The kiddo had a blueberry lemonade with mac n cheese that disappeared in so little time. He couldn't stop exclaiming how good it was.  We'll definitely be back to try out the cocktail bar for a date night.  They didn't have live music but they were playing music of varying genre throughout the evening. Great way to relax and leave your stresses behind.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Here for a wedding reception. Top notch facility with top notch service. Bartenders were great! Exceptional craft cocktails all around. Catered BBQ was spot on.   Highly recommended for your special event. We'll be back for a visit.

reviews.author: Liana W.
reviews.description: I want to give this business a better review but unfortunately they had some major issues.  We went last weekend on Sunday and there was a sign to scan the QR code the for menu, we waited in a long line to order food, once everyone got to the cashier she told us that only the brunch menu was being served (it was like 2pm or something).   So everyone had to quickly change their order!   Talk about poor communication!! It should say on the menu very clearly what's being served.   Then, I tried to order vegetarian nachos but my cashier told me they were sold out of beans and that I should just get chips and queso instead, so I did. THEN my brother in law who ordered after me got his nachos which were vegetarian bean nachos (not meat like he ordered). I said "they told me they were sold out!" Again, bad communication.  Then, my brother in law ordered sangria and got a big pitcher, my dad went to order the same thing and they gave him HALF the size. So weird and confusing.   This place seems very confused internally and each worker seems to have their own message.  Also nothing for gluten-free vegans on the menu.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Treaty Oak Distillery in Dripping Springs is a great Texas distillery getting most things to make their bourbon and gin from around Texas. It has great covered patios and outdoor space throughout the property with a delicious restaurant- Alice's Restaurant, a tasting room, and a covered bar/lounge as well as an outdoor stage and small playground. We did the tour and tasting which allowed us to see the inner workings of the distillery. Cody was an excellent tour guide answering all our random questions as he showed us around the distillery. And I bought an old barrel, which I have wanted in my house for quite some time. I would highly recommend you get over there...today! Such a great time. Thanks Treaty Oak!!

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Another great distillery to add to the list when in Dripping Springs! This place is huge and perfect for a group or date or even solo! So much space for you, your kids, and your dog! Bring the family! LoL  It was actually recommended to me at my last stop, and I love me some bourbon and whiskey so it was a no brainer. However, if bourbon isn't your thing they also have options for the gin, vodka and non alcoholic lovers in your group! Something for everyone I'd say!   That being said, I took off a star mostly because the line was stupid long. They definitely could have, and should have had more than just one single file line for us to get a drink, I spent half my time in line.   That being said though, once I got my drink and was able to enjoy the drink and the vibe it was great! They have live music and a restaurant if you get hungry and I ended up getting the day tripper drink! I loved it, it was so good. I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: I'm back home in FL whining about how upset I am that we can't just go to Treaty Oak anytime we want! :(   Seriously, grab your gang and head over to this literal farm full of whiskey and great BBQ. If you don't get the brisket nachos, you're making the biggest mistake of your life. But don't eat too much, or you'll be too full for the delicious drinks!   The vibe is relaxed, the food feels almost TOO good for the rustic setting and the live music is pure Texas charm. I could stay here all day!

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Awesome off the beaten path place. Awesome drink selection and their restaurant on site is tasty AF too! Definitely coming back when it warms up lol.

reviews.author: K S.
reviews.description: Good liquor and good atmosphere. As mentioned, plenty of space to spread out.   However, there's no simple way to just stop by to pick up a bottle. Even if you're not buying a mixed drink or anything that requires work other than handing you a bottle and paying for it you have to stand in the line that's serving cocktails and drinks.   Further, when you do get service, it's been rather dismissive the last few times we went. Expect to spend time there- no way to quickly pop in, grab merch and a bottle and leave.
