reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: If your looking for some outdoor patio vibes during this gorgeous spring weather then this is your place! Just about 30-40 minutes outside of Austin lies this beautiful distillery. There's so much space and more than enough seating but even on the weekends this place can get pretty busy. As for food you can expect Texas bbq from this place as I tried both the brisket and Turkey which were both very good. If your not a booze person they also have their own in house wines and beer but if you do like a good cocktail I'd recommend hill country dreaming. Im anticipating come back here to check this place out in the evening for some live music or Sunday brunch!

reviews.author: Kaeleigh S.
reviews.description: The perfect spot for a sunny day hang, celebration activity, or date! We came for my best friend's bachelorette weekend and we are so glad we did!!   Parking was ample and so were the picnic tables! We didn't do a tour but put our name in for lunch at the restaurant, Alice's. It was about a thirty minute wait on a Saturday around 1, which really went unnoticed because we just grabbed drinks at the Cocktail Bar and sat in the open seating area until they called us saying it was ready. There was live music, lots of space and tables , cornhole, and you could go do a distillery tour too.   The bartenders were helpful in finding a gluten free drink option for me, as well as our waitress at Alice's. Our waitress was especially friendly and attentive--didn't get her name but a recent HS grad going to UT! She made sure to ask about gluten and dairy free options for me, and there were plentiful. Everyone devoured their food and were happily satisfied. I had a delicious club sandwich on gluten free bread with some salt and pepper chips. SO good. I also loved the white sangria.   All in all, I am so glad we found it and the bride said it was the perfect way to spend our day. We definitely will be back!

reviews.author: Denniz S.
reviews.description: The food, the cocktails (they are sooooo GOOD!!), the biggy canvas painting. I love it all. Treaty Oak is accommodating to everyone. We bring our toddler and she runs around on the playground while we eat and drink. They have sports on the TV inside a/ indoor dining. A tasting room and tons of outdoor seating.  If the weather is nice and we have friends in town treaty oak is an absolute obligatory stop.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: I headed out to Treaty Oak pretty reluctantly the other day. I'd been invited out there for a friends birthday and the idea of heading all the way to Dripping Springs on a hot Saturday afternoon to try bourbon (which in general all tastes like burning to me) wasn't really my idea of a great time. Man, I was wrong. First off, they have a wide selection of spirits, everything from gin and vodka to wine and beer. The setting is bucolic with wide open spaces and clusters of shade trees. A friendly staff, great bbq (try the brisket nachos) and some tasty signature cocktails (try the Pineapple Express) made for a great afternoon that turned into a lovely evening. Did I mention they also had live music? I will be back.

reviews.author: Shourjo D.
reviews.description: A really nice setup: good bbq and similar food offerings alongside their own whiskey and gin offerings.  Seriously, the cocktails are worth it, as is visiting the beautiful property and spending an afternoon there with friends.  Each time I've been, I've really enjoyed the Hill Country Dreaming cocktail.  Also, the root beer they make is delicious and will totally hit the spot on a hot day.

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: We love this place!  The drinks are always yummy and very innovative ideas - the frozen ones are my favorite!  And the FOOD!!!  My favorite item is the Cold Trio appetizer!  It is delicious!  But, the atmosphere is what is really cool!  It's spread out - dogs are welcome - and it's beautiful!  If you are in the area - you should definitely check it out!  If not, it's worth the drive!

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: A really pleasant brewery experience, if a bit out of the way  So right off the bat, this place is beautiful. The "taproom" isn't really a room, and more of a tap cavern. Lots of seating, but enough space it still feels very spacious about.  We got both appetizers and some food. for apps, we got the trio. The salsa was really really good. Queso and Guac were both good, but not exceptional. If I am being honest, I can't remember which two tacos I got, but they were fantastic. Everyone at the table really enjoyed theirs.  I had two different flights, so I got to sample a large amount of their beers. they have a lot of really original and unique flavors, while still maintaining a lot of the regulars you see at a lot of breweries. It really gives this place a lot of individuality, while not making it niche. all of the beers were at least "pretty good". Of the 8 I tried though, none really made it to the "phenomenal" level, which is my one and only complaint about the place.   100% worth the visit, and amongst the best breweries in Austin. 4.75/5

reviews.author: Todd S.
reviews.description: My wife and I needed a getaway so we loaded up our RV and looked for a place to camp at. We found this brewery just a few miles SW of Austin that just had STUNNING food! I had the chicken tortilla soup which was probably the best I've ever had. I also got a pair of chicken quesadillas while my wife got the pork tacos. Everything including the chips N queso was just great.   The vibe was relaxed and easy going, it was quiet enough to enjoy the Motown music mix, our servers were friendly, the prices quite reasonable, and food was delivered within minutes. We finished off the night with a flight of ice cream. Oh yeah -- the beer was good too. We're bringing all of our friends here first chance we get.

reviews.author: Deb L.
reviews.description: Over the weekend we had the opportunity to travel down to Austin and stay at the brewery in our Airstream. This was a fabulous place! The beer that they are brewing is unique and flavorful, along with traditional street tacos and Mexican fare, which can be pretty competitive in Austin.   When we first go there, I asked for a Topo Chico, which they don't have because they have something much better!  If you want something refreshing to clean the palette before you start trying different beers, order the Hop Water! It is amazing!  I really have to commend the staff, because they were friendly, attentive to our needs, and fast.  That is a challenge in today workforce, and there is nothing worse than having great food and crappy service.   While the beer and food was delicious - the one thing that stood out as exceptional was the ice cream flight. That is a must have if you visit Beerburg Brewing. The seasonal speciality was Atole Ice Cream and it was our favorite!

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: Amazing place to check out. It is a little gem off the regular path. Amazing views with lots of places to sit. Great place to go and even bring your dog. The staff is very friendly. Plenty of food options for everyone. Tacos were delicious. Great options of beer. Something for everyone. In the mood for a good beer and want a little road trip, this place is worth checking out.

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: Stayed here as part of Harvest Hosts and asked cousins to join us. Enjoyed a variety of beers, kombucha, and unique sodas. And the food (Ka Violeta Taqueria) was fantastic and very unique and creative. The ceviche style cauliflower was like nothing else I've ever had - delicious! Friendly service, great outside area with picnic tables, dog park and what looked like a play area for kids. And don't forget the ice cream - Mexican vanilla and Honey Bourbon Vanilla (seasonal) were both yummy! Would never have known about this place if not for Harvest Hosts!

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: I think this is my new favorite brewery!   What a quirky little place with amazing Mexican food and great beer and wine. The staff is friendly and takes their time explaining what's on the menu and even provides recommendations.  Their food is fresh and delicious ... every item we ordered was so tasty! I LOVE that they have homemade ice cream ... a variety of flavors and some of them that are seasonal. I'm definitely coming back to enjoy their outdoor seating,  try their other tacos and of course... ice cream!!!  Potatos bravas - nice and crisp on the outside, soft on the inside. Delicious seasoning. Great sauce to dip the potatoes in.  Guacamole - oh so fresh! Again, just the right amount of salt and lime in it. Chips were fresh too.  Brisket tacos - well marinated and cooked brisket (on the spicy side), with caramelized and pickled onions on a semi fried taco... yum yum yum  Ice cream - chocolate with strawberry was great although I did wish they had more strawberries in it. Blueberry cheesecake tasted just like it's name!  Beerburg Brewery for the win!!!

reviews.author: Jared P.
reviews.description: Loved this location, staff was friendly. Beer was great and so was the food. It's really nicely kept and good for families

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: I came here on a Thursday evening, maybe around 7, and there were only a couple other groups there. We had the whole patio to ourselves with just our dog and the sunset! The setting is hard to beat, a nice view of the hills, an area with trees and benches, and a dog park. They have an indoor area, too!  The beer choices were plentiful and varied, and for non beer lovers they have other alcoholic and nonalcoholic options.  We ordered flautas, brisket tacos, and patatas bravas. My favorite of the three were the patatas - great flavor, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Also quite a bit for the price. The flautas were good - the shell was perfectly crunchy. But, the taste was lacking. This was the case with the tacos, too. Also, for the price, I think 3 would be more reasonable vs. 2... Though I was satisfied (not too full) by the end. Definitely order some ice cream! Both flavors we had were great - probably the best of the food tbh!  Overall a great place to hang out with some friends and have a few drinks. Very dog friendly. The food is promising, but will have to try more to be convinced.

reviews.author: Samantha G.
reviews.description: We came here over Memorial Day weekend and had a blast. It wasn't crowded which was nice because it was relaxing- although I'm sure that won't last long...  we tried the flight and a variety of beers and enjoyed all of it! The staff was super friendly and the place is spacious and clean.   We got the mushroom asada and the quesadillas and both were amazing. I loved the fried crispy tortillas that both came with. The plates are a little small for the price but I think it is well worth to try the food! We also got pistachio ice cream. I wanted to get a flight but we were already too full. I would definitely come back though to try more as they have some interesting flavors!!

reviews.author: Kirby W.
reviews.description: Excellent brewery AND eatery outside the madness that is now Austin. You can sit among the trees and enjoy a cold craft brew while chowing down on their great, and reasonably priced, cuisine. Well off the beaten path for a reason: It's not over-run by hipsters wearing black! I'm an old white guy and I'm a fan. Go now!!!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Yet another boozy destination on Fitzhugh Road. Should have invested in property a few years ago...  Nice venue with table service! I don't have to stand in line to get a beer! Yay!!!   Hate me if you want...I've decided to stop tipping at beer gardens where I have to stand in line for more than 3 minutes.   Good beer. We tried a flight of the lighter beers - all decent. Hubby liked the Sour but wasn't happy with the prickly pear milkshake IPA. I think he got exactly what he ordered...  Had chips and salsa. Menu looks pretty good.   Love the dog park and the shaded tables. Did I mention TABLE SERVICE!

reviews.author: Grace C.
reviews.description: Great outdoor beer and food. Lovely 15 acres hill country scenery.  If it is too hot, eat and drink indoors.

reviews.author: Maggie A.
reviews.description: The waitress assumed that my dad was a racists. She said he was racists and assumed he was too much for her. She didn't know that he was Mexican Indian and didn't think twice about her ignorant comment. We live in this road... And will never recommend this place or take our family there ever again. She was white. And her privilege was not an ally. My dad was spit on when he came back from Vietnam. She was absolutely disgusting. Never will I subject my friends or family to this place.

reviews.author: Rachel R.
reviews.description: Hidden gem. I have lived in the area for a little over two years now andand have searched Mexican food several times andand this has never popped up. Food, beer and hibiscus lemonade tea was delicious! Will be a new staple

reviews.author: Sunita S.
reviews.description: This brewery was just so cool. They have a great outdoor space and really have their whole ordering process streamlined. Loved the beers and the fact that they take reservations.

reviews.author: Raymond P.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere  Great service, everyone was so helpful.  Great food  Great location  Great drinks  Really a hidden gem in the hill country. Enjoy now before everyone finds out about it. Thanks for a great experience!

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: I visited Beerburg for this year's Barks for Beers and was thoroughly impressed. The venue has plenty of seating indoors and the atmosphere was pleasant. So, the beer was delicious and the artisanal ice creams were incredible but when you visit do not forget to try the striped bass ceviche! Holy bajoles it is knock your socks off delicious. I'm looking forward to making the trek out to Beerburg again ASAP.

reviews.author: Celena S.
reviews.description: Everything we had was good. Nothing was just thrown together or slapped onto a plate. Everything we ordered was plated beautifully and tasted good. Because of covid most restaurants I've been too have been sloppy and rushed to get it out the door and not much care places in their food.   The staff were very friendly and took precautions to keep themselves and us safe, which we really appreciated.   I'm not a beer fan so I got a glass if the rosè, it was decent at best. My husband had a cider which was really good.   We will definitely be back with our dog once it cools down some and the full menu is available. It looks like it will be amazing!  Good job y'all!

reviews.author: Sally M.
reviews.description: I want to thank the owner, Trevor Nearburg, for providing a venue for a Celebration of Life for Chase Holbrook and his family and friends. Ricardo Gutierrez, the general manager and chef along with additional staff provided a perfect venue for us to say goodbye to a precious member of our family. They went above and beyond to accommodate our family and provide an atmosphere that our Chase would have loved. We are grateful for your kindness, support and professionalism in supporting our family. Just know that we will continue to frequent Beerburg to enjoy your great beer, food and wonderful facility. You all are the best!!!!

reviews.author: Madhavi A C.
reviews.description: The cocktails and the food is really good especially the tacos. The desserts they have also good. The only con is that they close the kitchen really early even on weekends like around 7:45 last call. But would definitely go again for the vibe and food.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: I came here on a motorcycle ride with my Combat Veteran Association January 22nd, 2022. It was my first time here and it is on a beautiful road in Texas Hill Country.  The company is Military Veteran owned and a very family friendly property. There is a play area with a jungle gym and lots of picnic tables outside as well as a smaller covered outdoor seating area. I honestly didn't see an indoor seating area so I'm not sure if there is one. The covered seating area is where the bar was to order your drinks. They had about 12 beers to choose from some I did a flight of 4; 3 lagers and 1 stout. It was only about $11. The flight was four four ounce pours. They also serve some local wine if I recall.  There was a food truck on site serving up great bbq. I had their turkey sandwich and a cup of beans. Both were extremely good. The turkey was freshly smoked or bbq'd and perfectly tender. The beans was saucy with their sausage and veggies. For $15 I was stuffed. They also had small buzzers to give when ordering so you knew when it was ready and worked on the entire property.  I really want to return here on a warmer day and in the spring and/or summer. The same road this is located on also has a winery or two I believe so it would make a very good day trip or even weekend adventure to the area to explore all the local spots.

reviews.author: Mitchell C.
reviews.description: Great people, good beer, relaxed outdoor family friendly place!

reviews.author: Olga U.
reviews.description: My first and only time visiting, I happened upon the best Oktoberfest celebration this side of the Atlantic I have been to yet! What an awesome accidental event to stumble upon, although I'm sure I would've had just as great of a time here were it just a regular weekend. Great beers, fun crowd, lively polka music, very cool artisan craft fair, and one heck of a time in a beautiful beer garden setting. Well worth the drive from Austin if you're visiting!

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: This place was recommended to me in a local group I'm in with fellow America lovers!  The only thing I'm disappointed in is not knowing about it sooner. Great atmosphere, great service and great beers and I'm not a beer drinker. There is something for everybody.  When you visit a place like this your faith and hope in our country will be restored. The news and maybe even your own neighborhood/community could be negative or living in fear of what's to come, get out.. turn off the tv, hang around your fellow Americans and breathe in some good ol Texas Hill Country air! Does a body good. If that doesn't make your mouth water then stay home...   Food Trucks! Live Music! Veteran owned! Dog friendly!  Face friendly! Goof folks! Oh and beer!  Cheers!!! Merica!!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: The area is nice and spread out with a ton of room for kids. We loved the shade and separation of everything. The idea that this was founded by veterans and gives back to veterans is amazing.  The beer itself, I was personally disappointed in. It was too "heavy", if that makes sense. We tried 3 and one I enjoyed but didn't love. It seemed like they were heavier/stronger than they should've been. Plus a lot of "froo-froo" drinks such as mead, etc. made up half their offerings. I get that you need some for people that don't like beer but they had too many.

reviews.author: Joe L.
reviews.description: Enjoyed Octoberfest at 12 Fox Beer Co in Dripping Springs this past Sunday. What an awesome event with vendors selling all kinds of things, food trucks providing some delicious victuals, the Reed Meisters playing some great Polka music, and 12 Fox serving up some incredible beer. Without a doubt...12 Fox brews up some incredible beers. I really loved the Negro Sombrero. One of the best and smoothest beers I've enjoyed in a very long time.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: Yeah, we really dig this place. A wonderful and eclectic variety of beer choices await for you to explore. This is also a pet friendly And kid friendly place too. Sit under the picnic tables and watch the world go by while you enjoy some of the best beer we've ever had. I also would like to mention the food menu it's pretty solid two. Come on out and get some all over you!

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful place to enjoy a few drinks. Very kid friendly with a big play area. Super friendly staff and patrons. Lots of cute caterpillars crawling on the tables under the trees. I really liked it here.

reviews.author: Brittany N.
reviews.description: We absolutely LOVE this local (veteran owned) BREWERY!!! They have many of their own beers on tap (featured beers change often) and they also feature other local beer, wine, cider and mead.  It's a family (and dog) friendly establishment featuring an awesome tactical playground!  They have food trucks, live music events, and seasonal family fun events.  We are happy to have them in our "neck of the woods".  The owners are kind and always welcoming! We hope they stay around for a long time to come!  They have over 80 picnic tables spaced outside across the property, so you can pick any table that fits your style!  Clean restrooms! Free to use water and ice machine!  Changing table!  Rona Rules! Great place to have an outside birthday party or celebration!  The list goes on and on!!!  At at time when our local businesses are struggling to stay afloat, and many are threatened with permanent closure, we are happy to support local business!  12 Fox has gone above and beyond to give back to the community, help neighbors, and support other small businesses at a time in need.

reviews.author: H C.
reviews.description: We have so much fun at 12 Fox, every time we go. I love their beer, their location, their food trucks, and the people. It's always a great time, and worth the trip.

reviews.author: josh m.
reviews.description: This place is a little slice of heaven.  Great beer and food and a playground to boot.  To all the one star review Branch Covidians - STAY HOME and leave the place to the folks who enjoy great beer mixed with the freedom Texans used to enjoy uninterrupted by your petty tyranny.  Viva la Fox!

reviews.author: t. h.
reviews.description: This is an amazing brewery located in the beautiful Texas Hill Country! The owners and staff are really great and think of everything to make their customers and friends welcome and safe. Wide open spacing for picnic tables, posted Covid rules, great brews, food options, big oak trees, fire pits, a kids playground and live music on the weekends almost all year!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Oh, what a great find! The hubs and were out brew hopping a few weeks back and we saw a sign on the corner of a crossing that stated "12 Fox Beer Co" [insert arrow]. Any of you who know me at all know my great penchant for craft beers, especially local, and I'm always up for a new brewery. So, turn left it was.  Parked in the large gravel lot. Walked up the trail to the building - HUGE kiddo playscape - I wanna slide! :) Very chill, nice place with a great patio and lots of other outdoor seating.   The proprietors/brewers are Army Combat Engineer veterans who learned about and found their love for beer while being stationed in Germany. Hence, they dozen lineup of Euro-styled offerings. They use single sourced malt and rainwater to create crisp, clean suds that aim to please. Of course there's hefe, pils, saison, dunkel...they also do a solid IPA.   Highly recommend! Really great folks, brewing their best, and serving one of the most outstanding charcuterie and cheese boards I've seen anywhere...no joke (and you might know that's also my "thing"). Go hang out in the Texas Hill Country, sip a cold one, get your snack on, and listen to live music on select nights. If a band isn't playing, some locals might start a impromptu jam session. What else could you ask for? Cheers!  Note: at time of last visit was informed they were going to have 2 food trucks on-site. Icing.

reviews.author: Holly C.
reviews.description: This 95% outside facility is just the best. They allow more than the needed room based on the restrictions in place, and have so much open space, there is freedom to chose your seating. They are meeting or exceeding Covid restrictions, in every way and every day. Beautiful, well kept lawns, with trees and tables, its just a pleasure to visit. Delicious beer, great people, and the tastiest food trucks I have ever had. I highly recommend them.

reviews.author: Stephen M.
reviews.description: Brought the family here hoping to find an outdoor beer garden with lots of space: what ought to be the perfect COVID-safe situation for a relaxing evening. Instead we found a business observing no COVID safety precautions whatsoever other than a chalkboard a-frame asking patrons to stay 6 feet apart, a guideline which I seemed to be completely alone in observing. Not a single member of the staff was wearing a mask, nor were 95% of the clientele while ordering at the bar or moving around the establishment. No capacity controls were in place, and the place was generally indistinguishable from a pre-pandemic beer garden.   A ton of wasted potential here, it's a shame the business owners aren't interested in being responsible members of the community and taking basic safety precautions.

reviews.author: Briar W.
reviews.description: Great beer and great atmosphere. They do tons of events throughout the seasons and have live music every week. Huge kid playground. Food options are a little slim.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: We've been here a couple times now, and both times we've loved it! It's all outdoors, so if you don't like that I would not show up. Plenty of seating, and you go up to the counter to order and get your stuff right away! This last visit we got the raspberry Meade, it wasn't too bad... Don't think I could drink too much of it though because it is so sweet. There's a playground for kids so parents can hang out while their kids have some fun too, lots of times they have a live band or singer playing. There's easily accessible restrooms, and a food truck if you get a bit hungry. Overall wonderful spot that's out of the way and away from the craziness... Just go here!

reviews.author: Robin S.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place! We are in Cedar Park so we don't get to visit as often as we like but wow I'd give this place 10 stars if I could. Amazing beer (and mead/cider for my gluten free hubby). Super family friendly. There's a big playground and teeter totter for the kids. Nice folks behind the bar. Amazing live music and food trucks most weekends. Came here for my bday because I knew the whole family would have fun - and we definitely did. Bought some beer, food, and apparel. So happy to support this awesome business. Highly highly recommend - you will love this cool little brewery too!

reviews.author: Michael S.
reviews.description: Can't say enough positive about this place.  The folks behind the bar were extremely friendly.  The tables are socially distanced and we felt very safe.  The beer was absolutely amazing.   The beer was absolutely incredible.  They seem to focus primarily on Belgian style beers, which is my absolute favorite, but they have some IPAs that will appeal to the hipsterist of hipsters as well.   We also tried the Cranberry Mead as well as their cider, which was crispy and dry that would appeal to any lager or Pilsner fan.   The outdoor area was expansive and, frankly, beautiful.   The staff were very friendly, accommodating, and genuinely excited to share their knowledge.  It was fun to get their perspective on what I should try.    One thing worth mentioning...that I have seen in comments:   The folks behind the bar don't wear masks.  The order process is 6 foot distances, so no big deal for me, but some may have a problem with this.  Although I feel we are being extremely careful with covid guidelines, for some reason, I felt perfectly safe here.  Overall, I was extremely impressed with the quality of the beer, the beauty of the grounds, and the charming staff. This place will be a regular haunt for us.

reviews.author: Sylvia A.
reviews.description: Vey nice away from the Austin and they appreciate all vets free beer discounts outside is the best way for all to go  family oriented and kid and pets are welcomed

reviews.author: Mistra B.
reviews.description: This establishment is owned by a very famous patriot. There are Some excellent online reviews of One Shot Distillery and the owner. Just plug the owners name, Colonel Phil Waldron, into your favorite search engine.   But if you don't have the patience, the owner, colonel Phil Waldron has concocted an amazing and intoxicating drink called the Jan 6th. The description is so funny. Tongue In cheek: Two parts my pillow guy, one part Giuliani, 1 part Trump. Colonel Phil the owner of One Shot then personally stirs it. He is such a funny guy. He really lights up this place!! He has this funny cos-play bit he will perform if you ask. With his horns and fur hat, he imitates the insurrection shaman. He does a great job. Almost like he was there. So funny!!! Love you colonel Phil.

reviews.author: Christopher T.
reviews.description: So Yelp won't let me say what I want to say. But this place is not owned by a patriot. Like the other comments say. Look up the guys name. They also open carry here and not the safest place.

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: For my husband's birthday, we spent Saturday trying a few places off Fitzhugh that we hadn't been to. It was nice to have a place to stop that had something other than beer. They had several places to hang indoors, then a big outdoor area which looked like it might have live music events. The cocktails were delicious: I had the Mogadishu Mile - like a blackberry mint mule, and the Big Red which was a vodka, grapefruit with rosemary. We ordered at the bar inside, but quite often the bartenders would come out to see if we needed anything or the owner check on us here and there. Cute spot, we'll be back!

reviews.author: Delia S.
reviews.description: Let me preface my review by saying that I'm not an avid beer drinker and only like non-hoppy varieties. I can't really comment on their beer other than to say, the three I tried were not to my liking, but what I can say is that I love this place!  I've been here twice now, with friends, and with my man and both times have been great!  The place is spacious and covered in tree canopies with a sprinkle of fire pits, Adirondack chairs and picnic tables. The service is good and the mules are divine. I love that they serve cocktails as well as beer so there is something that I like and something for the beer drinkers, like my boo.   We were lucky on both occasions to have great weather and this time around, live music. I've been to several of the breweries and distilleries along Fitzhugh and so far, this is my favorite.

reviews.author: Amanda W.
reviews.description: Great drinks, fun playground for the kids, fast service, Texas-vibe.  The negative reviews surprise me. I disagree with them.

reviews.author: Chris P.
reviews.description: My wife and I have been to One Shot several times, and the atmosphere, setting, staff and drinks are always great. Sitting under the oaks in the Hill Country is perfect by itself, but my wife and I think adding a hurricane and brown ale make it put it over the top!

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: So long and short. Rock solid 5 stars.   Our waitress Chloe was super sweet and delivered us a round of all 4 rums. The Gold had a little bite to it, but all were delicious.   The wife's hurricane was potent but delicious.   I snagged a raddler which was a little different to a traditional one, but delicious and dangerous as you can probably down 6 before the Lord almighty gets the news.   The brew house and distillery are open and outside seating is abundant.   Bring your 4-legged friends for the ride as they are super dog friendly!!!!  You would have to be drunk and mad to pass this place when visiting Dripping Springs. Wait...they might be able to take care of that for you...responsibly of course.   So. Great drinks? Check. Great staff? Check. Great atmosphere? Check? VETERAN OWNED BUSINESS?!? Affirmative. God Bless y'all for your service.   Rock solid 5 stars.

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem!! We stopped in by chance, having never heard of it, and we're so pleasantly surprised. Not only is the owner a super friendly fella, but the alcohol is legit on point. I don't remember the last time I had such a smooth vodka. And the hurricanes- wow. So. Freaking. Good. The place is adorable, by the way. Super super cute. Veteran owned is a huge plus. We'll be going back again and again.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: I'm giving them a three star, because I like the location and that there is outdoor seating... And that the staff is attentive. Otherwise I probably would not come back here, the drink I got was literally all syrup and made me extremely sick to where we had to leave... Kind of completely ruined the day. My boyfriend enjoyed the drink he ordered, which I believe was the hurricane. They have a wing food truck that you can order from, unfortunately we didn't get to try it because the drink made me so sick. We plan to go back in try the wings and will review the wing food truck. Great location for the spot, nice and relaxing... Just be careful what you order and avoid anything that has syrup in it.

reviews.author: Thomas C.
reviews.description: Thirst quenching beer. Great cocktails. Superior customer service. Everything is fresh and home-made. Definitely a must visit location. Can't wait for our next visit

reviews.author: Tara S.
reviews.description: Had beverages here this weekend! AMAZING! Excellent service and drinks on point! We had the pirates punch and then a couple of their other cocktails...all were worth it!

reviews.author: Paula M.
reviews.description: Just go!! It is awesome!! For those of us that would prefer vodka over beer but have friends that love beer. This is the place!!

reviews.author: Julie R.
reviews.description: We stopped here after to trying to get into the cluster called Deep Eddies. This was a hit, the cocktails were amazing. We decided to buy a whole bottle of vodka. The atmosphere was amazing, lots of trees, lots of space and delicious wings! Our friends enjoyed the craft cocktails! We highly recommend if you want a wonderful experience! Skip Deep Eddies and spend your time and money here!

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Staff, management are super friendly and the big red one salty is the bomb of drinks. Always have great music and love their outdoor setting. A cigar lounge next door, fire pits and food makes this distillery a great venue.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: We made our first run to One Shot on a Friday afternoon recently and thoroughly enjoyed it. They are presently distilling rum and vodka and brewing several varieties of beer.  My spouse tried a Big Red One with salt -- a vodka drink -- and a Cuba Libre.  She was pleased with both. I had their amber and liked it so much I had another.  They have a clever solution to social distancing. The two young, friendly order takers are stationed under a canopy at the edge of the parking lot by their outside seating. You place your order with them, and one goes inside to fetch your drinks. There are plenty of shade trees and picnic benches so it's a pleasant experience. The owner , Phil, came out to say hi to a fellow vet (me). Nice, congenial guy.  The Dripping Wings food truck is stationed there now, so I went back for an order for dinner. Excellent wings, particularly the Asian sweet and spicy.  Glad to have a new convenient venue to enjoy.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: We decided to get out of the house today and do a little driving. Came across this place in Dripping Springs, and stopped for some drinks. Nice, large, shaded outdoor area with lots of oak trees and picnic tables.  I had the Cuba Libre cocktail that has Star Bullet rum, splash of lime, and coke. Delicious!  Husband loves IPAs and had the Panzer IPA, said it was great.  Inside of distillery and brewery were closed, but they have two food trucks on site. Service was awesome and friendly. Would come back!

reviews.author: Robyn G.
reviews.description: I love hanging out here.  Awesome outside seating and Dripping Wings is also there.  I'm a fan of their amber beer but they make delicious drinks as well!

reviews.author: David H.
reviews.description: This is truly one of a kind! There are so many amazing things to say about One Shot. The owners and staff are so personable! Great drinks and wonderful location! This is one of the most memorable places I have ever been to!

reviews.author: Deya Z.
reviews.description: Staycation report! This was our final stop of brewery tour 2022, after visiting 2 other stops, and it was definitely up there! Small and cozy, the beertender was super friendly. Good selection of beer and a few wines available for the non-beer drinker (but who honestly takes that risk!?)   Not much else to say other than we'll make this drive out any day!

reviews.author: Chris K.
reviews.description: This place is a gem right in downtown Dripping Springs. Great beer, nice atmosphere, friendly staff.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Craft brewing at its finest!  This brewery also has a lot of English style beers.  Since it was close to closing we decided to split a flight.  You can pick any four beers for $10.  They are brewing 12 beers on a 3.5 barrel system here so they are busy bees!  Their Karnstein was the best amber lager I've tasted.  Sooo good!  We got these in the flight #8 Barghest English porter, #9 Kobold black lager, #6 Karnstein amber lager, #11 Hans Trapp Bourbon Barrel Imperial Stout (yum).  They also have pizza you can order but we were full.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Acopon was still relatively new when we went a few weeks ago.  It's a great space if you're in Dripping and want a microbrewery to stop through. They're dog-friendly (with treats) and have both indoor/outdoor seating. They also had TV that was playing soccer, and strong wifi. I love that they have flight options 4 for $10, as well as pints. It wasn't busy when we stopped through on a Saturday afternoon. They don't have food here, but if you ask the taptender...he'll tell you what food options are nearby.  Service was kind and efficient. Their beers were across the board--good. My favorite was their Aine Hefe! It was floral and super crisp for the warm weather after a long hike. They seem to do a lot of English style ales, which aren't my favorite...but you can definitely find options that suit your taste buds. They also give free stickers upon request. BOOM!

reviews.author: Dolly S.
reviews.description: Good beer selection.   Very knowledgeable staff.  Best part I watched them clean ALL surfaces while I was there

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: Great brewery in Dripping Springs. The staff is awesome. The choices of beer is amazing. The brewery seems to have a beer choice for everyone. Very people and dog friendly.

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: Acopon's interior is moody, with a strong occult vibe, and I absolutely love it! I bet they would throw a wild Halloween party. The staff is friendly, prices reasonable, though quite a few of their brews tend towards English styles.   On our visit, I had the Norwegian Juice, Bellibone and the Killiecrankie. Careful with that last one, it's delicious, but at 11.4% ABC, more than one can sneak up on you pretty quickly.   Acopon just had a really great vibe, and the fact that it's dog friendly is icing on the cake.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: This place has the coolest logo I have ever seen in regards to the various breweries I've been to. They have a really good beer menu and the prices are more than fair! I was actually surprised to see them so decently priced this far out in the hill country.   They do provide half pours in their standard sized glasses, just make sure to ask for a half pour when you order. I was happy to see they allow food from the outside as well which makes staying easier as you can bring your snacks in haha.  Not on overly crazy amount of seating, but definitely enough for 5-6 medium/large parties. They also seemed to follow the trend of allowing owners to bring their dogs inside which is always cool and fun to see.  They also have merchandise for sale and their shirts are super sick...did I mention their logo absolutely rocks!?

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: Really cute place, enjoyed their beers (try the Rye one) and their fun flavors of Walker's British crisps.  They had board games and it was kid friendly.  If you are in the Dripping area and enjoy beer, this place is well worth a stop.  Cool names for their beers and explanations behind the names' meanings.

reviews.author: Jens B.
reviews.description: A nice little find.  My bud who is a massive craft beer dude drove us here on the way back from a visit to William Chris Vineyards.  Located in Dripping Springs and in a small space felt right.  On the day we visited they had 4-5 beers on tap I believe.  I'm a larger guy, so a Bellibone was ordered up for me.  Suz got an English Bitter Gaspipes.  I enjoyed my larger, it was crisp and cool. This is a great nod to Emil Christian Hansen and the use of his Saccharomyces Pastorianus, which he first isolated in 1904.  A year before the greatest footy team in the world, Chelsea FC was started.  And he was also a Dane.  Suzie drank her Bitter and coo'ed.  We would of stayed longer, but staring a gigantic Manchester City flag was making me ill.  Just Kidding Dudes, I'm still ill after that 6 goal slacking you gave us this past February.  Drop in, grab a pint.  Bring the pup and stay awhile.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Mad props to Acopon for allowing my dog to chill inside with me this afternoon! Many places are dog friendly as long as it's on the patio. I walked in thinking the same but was quite surprised to be able to chill inside with my fur-bro. Made for a much better time in this "hotter than average" June we're having this year. I've been here a few times now, have never had a bad time here, and after my experience today I will continue to stop by when in Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Cindy L.
reviews.description: Very friendly staff enjoyed the beer and conversation of the background of the brewery.

reviews.author: William L.
reviews.description: Nice small spot. Good variety of beer and friendly staff. There isn't much else of a way for me to describe this place.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: The owners of the Barber shop wanted to start brewing something different.  They wanted to focus on creating English ales fresh from the cask. Their goal is to have at least one ale available from a fresh cask each week.  Are English ales their sole focus?  Definitely not! There are a variety quality brew styles.  You will find them here.  Their specialty though will be ales.  Acopon is just a stones throw down the street from the Barber shop in downtown historic Dripping Springs. On the Sunday afternoon I ventured here, this was a quiet and sleepy part of town. The tasting room and production are located in the same small historic building. The tasting room is comfortable, and inviting.  It feels lived in, like a proper English drinking hole should.  A nice change from the hipster modern sleek brewery tasting rooms popping up all over Austin.  The staff member behind the bar was knowledgeable and friendly.  They also have canned mead, cider, and wine options for non beer drinkers.  Outside food is welcomed.  They have some tables available outside to sit at, and are dog friendly.  I enjoyed one of their flights.  All of the beers in my flight were well structured.  I liked some better than others.  The Rowan was a stand out for me.  Good solid beers.

reviews.author: Nowlan T S.
reviews.description: Great brewery in dripping springs. Beer is great and they are super dog (and people) friendly. They always have something different but they do it right. Quality beer and great that I get to enjoy it with my pup inside.

reviews.author: Ajax S.
reviews.description: A short review: The beer was pretty good - but served in plastic cups (unforgivable) - the service was kind of slow. Good prices.  A longer review: We were there during the Songwriters' Festival so this may explain the plastic cups, even so, if you care about your beer you can't serve it in a plastic cup. It defeats the whole purpose. But, looking beyond that, the few beers we tried were good. I particularly liked the porter.  The service was slow with three people behind the bar but it seemed that only one person was really doing the work. (There was a younger lady behind the bar but as far as I could see all she did was stand there and scowl at people.) So, a mixed experience. We'll probably try it again (I suspect the beer really is good) when there isn't a festival going on, and hopefully have a drink in a real glass.

reviews.author: John R.
reviews.description: Owned by the same folks who run The Barbershop a couple of doors down. These folks specialize in British type beers, which I like, but also brew one of the best New England style IPAs I've ever had...but they don't bill it as such. Roomy enough, down home local feel. Always stop here when we're in Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Mike F.
reviews.description: Went here this past weekend and may I just say WOW!!!   The place is Fantastic.  I instantly felt a kinship with the folks at and behind the bar.  The beer was to put it mildly scrumptious.  The Rat King Double IPA was one of the very best I have ever had the pleasure of drinking.  Beautifuly balanced, malty, and hoppy at the same time, perfect nose.  Just awesome all around.  The Hans Trapp Imperial Stout was a malt bomb of the first order.  Great Beers, Great People, Great Location.  Great Brewery.  Must Go to if you're in Central Texas ...

reviews.author: Jessica J.
reviews.description: I highly recommend this brewery. It's in the heart of downtown Dripping springs, has good beer, and a good atmosphere. There is even a outdoor patio for 18 and older.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Excellent. Seven brews. Wine and cider. Friendly owner. Quiet and extremely pleasant.

reviews.author: Crystal M.
reviews.description: This place is a gem in dripping Springs. We definitely need more places like this!  You walk into a beautiful large spacious entrance where all of their vodka is on display. In the mornings they have a build your own bloody Mary bar which is definitely where I'll be camping out. The other drink we tried is one of their slushy's, the hurricane. Don't be fooled... These are doubles and they sneak up on you fast! The sugar to alcohol ratio is on point.  For the pregnant and nursing ladies there's three different mocktails, and friendly bartenders that are willing to put together anything your heart desires. The food menu is great! A little bit for everyone. Salads, soups, even a box for kiddos. Outside is beautiful spacious and open all of the live oak trees are immaculate and the space is well laid out.  They have one small play place for kids, lots of yard games and lots of different areas to sit and hang out. Including a turf area. This place is definitely want to come see!!!

reviews.author: Brooke S.
reviews.description: We had such a great tour experience Saturday! We have loved Dripping Springs Vodka, and Gin since we moved to Texas. The clean, pure taste is better than Tito's and we will miss having this when we move soon. The tour was great, and informative. Our tour guide was nice. I wanted to ask him to take our group picture, but in the hour we had our tour, he rubbed his nose, scratch his nose, and touched his nose every few seconds. It was gross. So we didn't get a single picture bc I couldn't ask him to hold my phone! Other than that, the tour was great!!!!!  I rarely leave a review, but this would change someone's mind on whether they would ever come back somewhere these days. I love this company too much not to help them change it!

reviews.author: Lorel H.
reviews.description: I cannot believe that we had never been here before. We go to deep eddy's every time and have never looked up any other distilleries in the area but I'm so glad we did this time. The property itself is gorgeous and it is coupled by the fact that there liquor is also very good. Ryan had the flight and had their 2 bourbons which he said were okay and then he had the traditional gin which we really liked. They have their cocktails on tap and I got the Raz N Shine cocktail which was made with their orange vodka and was absolutely delicious. We ended up getting another flight of the rest of their liquors after that, and I'm so glad we did because their straight vodka is so good. It's so smooth you could drink it straight. We will definitely be back next time we are down!

reviews.author: Clay R.
reviews.description: Great time touring the distillery, great to taste spirits that are only found at the distillery as well,  awesome facility and team all around

reviews.author: Ernest C.
reviews.description: Made the trip as a pre-anniversary celebration and it did not disappoint. Enjoyed the venue, the drinks and the service provided by the entire staff. Will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Priscilla E.
reviews.description: They were accommodating, kind, and entertaining to our last minute (day of) request to do the tour. The tour and tasting was well priced and included a souvenir shot glass! We enjoyed lunch and drinks after the tasting and tour. The food was delicious, the staff was friendly, the drinks were tasty, and the atmosphere was buzzing.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Dripping Springs Distilling is just now opening its spanking new tasting room, patios, entertainment venue and production facility, and it is splendid. I went there four years ago, when the tasting room was essentially the lobby to the distillery. While I great.y appreciated what they were doing with their gins and vodkas, the ambience was like drinking in the lobby of Atscott manufacturing in Pine City, Minnesota. This new facility reshuffles the entire deck.  It has taken them a while to complete, but it was worth it. The new venue is spectacular -- well designed, comfortably modern, spacious and welcoming. It's not only a tasting room, it's also a credible restaurant with an interesting menu, specials, and a exceptionally friendly staff.  We went on the second weekend of the 'soft 'opening', but they seemed to have already worked all the kinks out. They were welcoming and prompt and attentive. Our server, Jack, went out of his way to answer questions, including about plantings on the grounds and ingredients in the dishes, and to offer suggestions about cocktails.   I had the street taco daily special and an Electric Lady cocktail. My companion had the jalapeño cornbread muffins and a French 75. The street tacos were small but fully packed. The spice mix could have been spicier,  it then I like hot. The flavors though were indeed special. Nothing dominated, so you could appreciate the protein and still enjoy the comity cheese and the light drizzle of sour cream. The tortillas were a bit small, but you expect that in a street taco. My friends jalapeño corn muffins were excellent. A well constructed corn muffin with one slice of jalapeño that came up and kicked your butt on the after palate. There were plenty of them, so we took lots home for later. The regular entre menu is interesting enough (two different pot pies, additional comfort type foods) that I'll be back.  I should not forget the flight of spirits. I've always respected their two gins, and I often buy them as they are available at Twin and Specs. Very solid, unpretentious and well crafted. I'm not a vodka guy, but my friend liked their offerings. Their 1876 bourbon still needs some maturation and work though. But such is the case with whiskey.   The full grand opening is coming up, with all the hoopla expected. Once the noise is past, Dripping Springs Distilling, with its multiple brands and spirits, will be a destination you'll want to add to the itinerary.

reviews.author: Glenn C.
reviews.description: Had a great tour and excellent spirits tasting. Very informative and lots of fun. Love Dripping Springs vodka and highly recommend lime and jalapeño mixer!!  Makes a great cocktail.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: This place is amazing. The food, drinks, service, landscaping, and all the above we nothing short of awesome. If you're in the area and are looking for a good distillery to visit, then I highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Mark S.
reviews.description: Only go here if you like amazing food, drinks and people!  Otherwise this place isn't for you. Only ask: later hours on Fridays!

reviews.author: Teresa G.
reviews.description: Amazing distillery in Dripping Springs! While there, you can take a tour, have an extensive tasting, order cocktails and food, and explore various indoor and outdoor areas. Great spot to spend a few hours.

reviews.author: Marya B.
reviews.description: This was a fun afternoon outing for us.  We had tasted the orange vodka at a local restaurant, and we were intrigued at what else they had to offer.  We booked a tour, which turned out to be very informative and Talon was a great guide!  The only (teeny) downfall of the tour was the distillery was operational that day and was a little noisy and difficult to hear our guide.  We enjoyed a cocktail and lunch on the patio.  I had the Basil Sour and my husband had an Old Fashioned.  We both had the grilled cheese and tomato soup.  Everything was delicious!

reviews.author: Cody P.
reviews.description: Great experience! tour was short but informative. If you take the tour I would recommend Talon as your guide. He's well informed, and has a great sense of humor.

reviews.author: Alex B.
reviews.description: The tour was great and our tour guide was awesome. It was great to see a distillery that truly cares about their products and that people enjoy them. Will definitely go back. Dripping spring will be my choice of vodka now saw a lot of previous review commenting on size but has plenty of room indoor and outdoor. We enjoyed sitting and having a cocktail for awhile after the tour.

reviews.author: Roz S.
reviews.description: Our visit to the Dripping Springs Distillery was extraordinary. We hosted a group of 12, many were visiting from the UK. The tour and tasting was fantastic. Talon, our tour guide was so knowledgeable, engaging and witty. We started with drinks prior to the tour and Miley was so outgoing and welcoming. The follow up lunch and drinks topped off the afternoon. The food was delicious and our server Jake was so accommodating. Everyone enjoyed the beautiful grounds and tried their luck with the cornhole boards. It became a bit of a competition! The group said the day was superb and the quality of the gin rivaled the best from across the pond.

reviews.author: Terra B.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time at the Dripping Springs Distillery. Talon led us on a great tour and tasting, and then we enjoyed great drinks and lunch. I actually commented to my husband that everyone we encountered there was positive and friendly, which can be rare these days. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Carlos V.
reviews.description: My wife and I had scheduled a tasting and tour of the distillery several weeks before we were arriving in Austin.  Unfortunately, our plane flight was cancelled the day of our arrival.  We were very disappointed.  I called the manager, Kristi Quick, and she accommodated us completely.  Seldom do you see such actions any more.  She took some time our of her busy day to let us sample the spirits and even gave us some great local restaurant recommendations for lunch and dinner!  Her gracious hospitality was very much appreciated.  This is now going to be my vodka of choice...

reviews.author: Heather A.
reviews.description: We had a great experience at Dripping Springs Distiller.  Not only was the tour interesting but the staff really went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  The tasting was wonderful, especially the vodkas- so smooth.  We look forward to visiting again soon.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Still awesome as always, but even better. You don't need appointments to visit anymore and they have a great indoor/outdoor seating area where you can enjoy cocktails. They also make whiskey now. There is alot of construction onsite to build a restaurant and much more.

reviews.author: Kathleen K.
reviews.description: A tour/tasting at Dripping Springs Distillery was such a fun way to spend a Saturday afternoon.  Our guide Talon was so informative and we learned so much and had a lot of fun!  The vodka was amazing especially the Orange!  The grounds are amazing too--thank you!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Nice location with plenty of outdoor seating. Food truck with pizza next door. Dog friendly. Tried four of the brews on tap. The IPA and HC Haze were both very good. The Kolsch was okay - a little flat and slightly bitter. None of us liked the Rye Wit - must be an acquired taste.   We likely would have stayed longer, but it was chilly and windy. We'll be back in fairer weather to try the pizza.

reviews.author: Joseph S.
reviews.description: Say yes to the Saison! The Coconut Porter was also a mouth full of tastiness. We will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: We discovered this brewery after hearing about a new pizza truck opening next door to it.  Hitmaker has a nice outdoor seating area, clean bathrooms, ample parking and friendly staff.  The menu is not huge , but the Kolsch and Hazy IPA we had were good.  Great place to grab a pizza next door and sit outside with a cold beer!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Welcome Hitmaker to the South/West-ish Austin microbrew community!  I love that there's newcomers to the brew scene here in South Austin. I've had Hitmaker on my radar for a while. I came through with a good friend close to closing hours on a weekend. We were stoked to try their flights, which was great to get a taste of everything. Their menu is limited at the moment, since they're pretty new. I didn't feel any sort of type of way towards any beers in particular, but I do love that they had a Belgian called Accidental Trappist. Their rye wit I love too. They tried to have a little bit of variety in their menu which I appreciated.  The brewery also smells new too. I love it. It's like the smell of a baby or a puppy. Weird. So let's move on. They have board games for all, clean restrooms and TVs. The seating options are endless. You can go outside and play outdoor brewery games or sit indoors at the bar or in their many picnic tables. Parking is also super easy, and the taproom is easy to locate with their brightly-lit sign (especially at night). I definitely see us coming back here more often, especially since our taptender was a sweet and informative man who was so kind to stay a little past brew hours to let us finish our conversation and beers. I will definitely be back for the exceptionally kind service and cozy brew times.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: A friend recommended that we meet up at Hitmaker Brewpub. Hitmaker? The Google provided some excellent information: "The co-owners started six of your favorite neighborhood bars/restaurants - MugShots, The Hideout Pub, Bender Bar and Grill, Pour House Pub, Violet Crown Social Club and Pour House Pints and Pies." Having been to a number of their locales I looked forward to having a few Hitmaker beers.  The bottom line their beers did not disappoint. My IPA was not excessively hoppy and had that typical fruity citrus flavor. Plus one stepped out of her comfort zone and went with their Kolsch offering. My tastebuds told me this was not a typical Kolch as it was pretty lite and could have masqueraded as a lite pale ale. A good summer beer.   The bartender on duty was very knowledgable and was eager to fully describe their offerings. The taproom is cozy, dimly lit, and cool. Perfect atmosphere for quaffing excellent brews on a hot summer day. Lastly, feel free to bring your mutts.

reviews.author: A S.
reviews.description: I live pretty far from Hitmaker but have tried to visit a couple of times when I happened to be in the area. I recall both times they were closed when I was near by. My plan was almost foiled again, but this time luck was on my side. Due to Covid-19 the hours online didn't match their actual hours so I got there an hour before they were actually set to open. I didn't want to wait around for an hour until opening time so I was going to head home. As I was leaving I happened to run into one of the workers (maybe an owner) and after explaining my dilemma he graciously agreed to let me in an hour early to enjoy their beer. I was delighted and thankful. I got a glass of the Summer Saison and the Hill Country Haze and enjoyed both. The service was great and the atmosphere was enjoyable.

reviews.author: James B.
reviews.description: Wow.  8 beers tried, and 8 beers worth trying again! The kolsch is such an easy drinker, light and refreshing!  Pale ryeder and rye wit have a bit more flavor but still an easy drinking wonderful drink!  It'd be hard to stick with just one here, but if I did; I'd probably go with French Saison, wonderful taste and a bit stronger than the others.  Coconut Porter isn't the best porter I've had, but if it's cold outside this would be my drink at the brewery. Hill country Haze is an IPA I could drink, but I'm not an IPA fan.  Accidental Trappist is good.  I can't put my finger on it... you just have to try it.   The brown ale is a little heavier than most and I'd be tempted to grab it instead of the Porter.  They have some cans of wine and a cider too.  $2 tastes 6oz.  $4/5 16oz pours.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Terrific place. Numerous delicious beers on tap. Was on site during their grand opening and they handled it well. A lot of activity here. And delicious beers.  We also appreciate your support and Divine Canines through Barks for Beers.

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Review time kids!   What does one do when new to the area? If you are anything like me and the ever so lovely bride, you go exploring every chance you get!   After hitting a farmers market and a flea market we decided to take the route less traveled home by watching the compass and staying off the major arteries. This is where Lady Luck showed us a sign that I almost can never resist,"Tasting Room Open", like a mosquito to a bug zapper ,I'm in!!   I have to say I really dug this place for a few reasons beyond the fresh beer selection. First is general layout,not to big or to small,its just right. Second is decor,simple,industrial,clean. The focus here is on their craft brews not a bunch of goofy crap on the walls. Third is noise, this place was chill. I was actually able to converse with my bride without the aid of ASL!   On to their craftwork, after meeting the very friendly barkeep we decided I'm a picky bastard and he had me try a few samples, all were very good. Landing with the Kolsh really hit the spot!!  Caveman review? "Go here,have beer,bring friends too!"

reviews.author: Blair B.
reviews.description: Delicious beers with lots of outdoor seating! A great find for lovely weather. We were also able to bring our dog, which was a great plus.

reviews.author: Robyn G.
reviews.description: Excellent selection of their own craft beer and everyone is very nice!  Outside seating also!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Non of the beer was disappointing. Came here on a Sunday and it was peaceful. Place is small but clean. Definitely say give this place a try. Kid friendly. Indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Ed J.
reviews.description: Really good beer in a neighborhood bar setting.  Particularly enjoyed the Saison and Porter.  Look forward to enjoying the patio once the weather is favorable...  and love those $2 portions - great for sampling all the options and still being able to drive home (but barely).  Did I mention the beer is legit?

reviews.author: Michael V.
reviews.description: Outstanding beer!  If you are out and about doing some hill country drankin', treat yourself.  You will be glad you did. They have something for everyone.  And the taproom is awesome, too!

reviews.author: Katie T.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I stopped here for a beer after hitting up the nursery nearby. I'm glad we did! The staff was friendly and the beer was fantastic! I got the hazy IPA and she got the kolsch; both were very tasty! We'll definitely be coming back with friends.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: New taproom in the area, no food or anything but the beer is great and they have a small and friendly team. Would definitely recommend it for beer-lovers. Had the Rye Wit and Hazy IPA, the latter was incredible!

reviews.author: Gino G.
reviews.description: Great beer! JC was a pleasure to talk with on my maiden trip to HM. I'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: scott k.
reviews.description: Great beers...... recommend the French Saison, Pale Ryder and Rye Wit.  If you are in the area gotta check this place out!!!!!!

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: I keep saying it but I love seeing evidence of it.   Nature is healing.  And the scene at Frontyard on a clear, cool and sunny Saturday, with kids merrily running around, strangers awkwardly--but eagerly--striking friendly conversations was exhibit A.  The beer was smooth, the service prompt and everyone, patrons, employees and wildlife in view, was in great spirit.   Call it nature, call it the environment they provide at Frontyard--the property is immaculate--but it all came together.  Oh, and that view...

reviews.author: Dawn S.
reviews.description: It's totally worth the drive if only for the gorgeous view. This place has a little bit of everything: sun, shade, food, drinks, yard games, pickle ball, and live music. There is plenty of parking so don't worry about having to carpool. There is a lot across the street where you just kinda make your own spot.       My friend was having her birthday out here on a Saturday afternoon. It was a gorgeous spring day in Austin...so of course it was super crowded but not overly crowded. What we all noticed though is that there isn't enough provided seating. There are many picnic tables and sets of grouped chairs. Many people brought their own lawn chairs but I feel as though there should be more seating provided. The Adirondack chairs were comfy but many of us had to sit on the ground and take turns in the chairs. #mytwocents      There are actually two buildings: one for beer and one for wine. Everybody wins! The beer list is great (see photo) but a bit pricey IMHO. I ordered a beer and it came out to be almost 8 dollars. Yikes! I usually order wine most places so maybe that's the going rate these days? The beer was tasty and refreshing. A few people in my group got frozé or a frozen peachy shandy so there are plenty of options for everyone.       Dogs are allowed on leash but it was odd that they didn't have enough dog bowls to go around. Many places these days are providing paper dog water bowls (and filling station) which are then biodegradable. I wandered around and asked three different people about where I could get water for my dog. I was sent from one building to another and finally was told that there were water bowls around I just have to look for them. I was also told I could buy a water bowl. What?!? I am not buying a dog water bowl thank you very much. So this place is "dog friendly" but not very "dog accommodating". I finally got water from the free water tap in the beer building (nice touch) and just let my dog drink from the plastic cup. My dog is a person anyway so she was fine drinking from the cup. ;)      While we were there a man set up for some live music which was nice. It was loud but not too loud so we could still have a nice conversation and not have to shout over each other.       I didn't have any food but there is a pizza food truck there and it looked pretty good as people were walking by with their orders. The truck itself is pretty cool looking. It is all painted black and goes with the black and white theme of the buildings.       I had to leave before it got dark but all the trees were wrapped with lights so I'll bet it is lovely out there at night. I will definitely be back to enjoy this outside space. The view is stunning. I hope there is an improvement to the seating situation by then and I'll have to remember to bring my own water bowl for my dog.

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: Check out in the Frontyard and the Front Porch!  This brewery is just a bit outside of Austin, out in Spicewood. It's a new construction where they're making a handful of different beers, along with a winery, that share the same space, making a family-friendly place to hang out!  There were lots of kids when I came here, in fact one kiddo was celebrating his birthday out here. No, he wasn't turning 21, he seemed to be in middle school. Nobody bats an eye with the parents letting their kids cut loose and play out on the artificial turf, the pickle ball courts, the frisbee golf goals, the toys that just seem to be put out there for kids, and other playground like amenities for the little ones. Beer is served inside by enthusiastic bartenders who seem to know their goods, and like drinking it and working there. They all seemed genuinely happy to be there pouring beers, which is great!  The beers were all pretty standard beers, nothing too imaginative or risky. They had things like a Mexican lager, an IPA, a Pale Ale, etc. No strange beers, or sours that I could recollect. Their more crazier beers were the dark ones, which I skipped since it was pretty hot and I couldn't handle a deep, dark 10%+ beer. They offer growlers, and sixers to go as well.  Be sure to check out their merch area- they have some fun looking things. Some embroidered brewery patches would be appreciated! They have plenty of things that'll keep your kids entertained if they left their toys at home. The beers were all pretty delicious. I got a flight to try a wide swath. The carbonation could've been stepped up a few notches, the beers were on the less than bubbly side, but the beers were flavorful and quite delicious.  The view is worth checking out- you sit back on one of those Adirondak porch chairs in the shade of their oak trees or their porch and take in a pint of honey ale, it's as close to heaven as you're gonna get.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: Really glad I saw an ad for this place and decided to stop by! The weather had gone from freezing to sunny and we needed to get out of the house. This was the perfect place to enjoy the fresh air.   Front yard Brewing is on the same property as 5 Soul Wine Co. It's great if you have a group that wants wine and beer. The bartenders at the brewery were super nice and explained their selections to help us decide what to order. My fiancé got a beer and I ordered one of their cocktails. It was a lavender lemonade cocktail using their cider and I really enjoyed it. The only negative was that their prices were a little steep.    We visited right after the Austin freeze, so some of their inventory had not been delivered. We tried to get some food from one of their food trucks, but they were out of quite a few menu items and the winery was out of their charcuterie. We ended up trying the pizza food truck, which worked out well in the end, because it was delicious! My only other thought - I wished there was more outdoor seating. It was so busy that day, it was difficult to find a seat outside.   They have pickle ball courts you can rent by the hour, Frisbee golf, and fire pits to sit near. Overall, a relaxing place to spend a Sunday.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Frontyard Brewing is such a fun brewery in Spicewood. Great outdoor space with food trucks and corn hole. They share the space with 5 Soul Wine Co so if wine is more your thing, get some. Try the frozen sangria from 5 Soul. They have cocktails at Frontyard and non-alcoholic drinks, so something for everyone!

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: What a lovely place! I don't typically frequent breweries because I'm one of the few people in the world that doesn't like beer. But then a little birdie told me that they make hard seltzer cocktails and I was signed up! Went here for lunch on a Saturday. Arrived around 11:45am which was perfect because there were still plenty of seats. If you come after about 1:00pm, you might consider bringing some lawn chairs unless you want to bring a blanket and go "picnic style". They have a large turfed area and then real grass further beyond. People do bring their dogs, which I don't mind because I love dogs, but it's a bummer when you watch one piss on the turf. Also, there's a disclaimer on their website that their insurance doesn't allow certain breeds which is complete b.s. and they should get a new insurance company. Any breed can be bad depending on their owners. Any breed can be good depending on their owners. I am a pitbull owner and he's a sweet as pie and the thought that I couldn't bring him is sad. Even Great Danes are listed. Anyway, back to the food and drinks...The two cocktails I had were the Lavender Lemonade and Frozen Lava Flow. Both were good but they were $10 and $11 respectively which is a bit spendy. Then I got a the Frontyard Burger and fries at the food truck. It was decent, but a little dry. I did enjoy the homemade pickles and the fries were extra good. There was a lady working the food truck that I witnessed on multiple occasions being rude to customers. If the owner wants to message me to find out who, I would be happy to let them know. I just don't like blasting people for the world to see. The employees that were serving drinks were amazing so that made up for it...along with the music selection. Overall it was a good experience and I'll likely be back.

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: Frontyard is actually located inside the 5 Soul Winery property.  The overall property is super kids friendly. They have a large artificial turf area, multiple corn hole areas, a few pickle ball courts( requires $ and reservations), a few slides, and another big field.  So yeah, it's kids friendly. Maybe too kid friendly:-)  The brewery itself has some really good and wide spectrum of beer choices. I've tried their Belgium and Amber both were great. I recall seeing IPAs, Porters, Lagers and others on the list.   Prices seem a bit on the pricey side but I cannot recall the exact price.    Regardless, it's a fun place and super family friendly. Great beer, great on property food trucks, and pretty good wine next door at 5 Souls.

reviews.author: Tim A.
reviews.description: First time here with family for the Sunday gospel brunch.  Absolutely loved this place.  The music was awesome. The breakfast pizzas were very tasty.  The adults loved the salted caramel stout, the rye IPA, and the pino.  Kids loved the root beer.  All of that to say the food and drinks are really good, but pale in comparison of the staff's friendliness and the hill country ambience.  This fine establishment will become a regular place for us.

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: Such a great place to hang out with the kiddos. Beer and cocktails are great and food trucks are yummy. The wine isn't amazing but it's decent and the beautiful views and friendly staff more than make up for it! We've become regulars :)

reviews.author: Bri W.
reviews.description: Our favorite neighborhood brewery! This is a must go for a family night, or a date night. Beautiful sunset views and great beer.

reviews.author: Bill V.
reviews.description: We can here for the first time last night. Perfect 80 degree evening in the hill country. Gorgeous sunset. The beers were super refreshing. Had a flight to start and then a full beer of one of my faves from that flight. Greats stuff. We skipped the pizza from the food truck but they looked amazing. Instead we opted for some very good brats and hot dogs.   The place is adjacent to 5 Souls Wine, which sources their grapes from Paso Robles. A perfect option for the non beer drinker. The overall outdoor setup is nice with artificial turf, Adirondack chairs, tables etc. oh and pickle ball courts too.   And depending on your view, it is very family friendly so there are lots of kids. Wasn't that big of a deal, but some people will not care for it.

reviews.author: Vince A.
reviews.description: This is fun and family friendly spot , very nice and the people here are very friendly and do their best to take care of you.

reviews.author: Hilary G.
reviews.description: My family and friends and I love frontyard! The beers are all so delicious and the atmosphere they have created is what makes it so special. I love that my kids can come play and we can enjoy a beer and some great food from the truck on-site. This place is a Spicewood staple now. So glad they are here!!

reviews.author: Michelle W.
reviews.description: They have great beer, the staff are great and the winery in the same property is a huge plus when you have friends that don't like beer. Sadly though I give only 3 stars and it is for the daycare center atmosphere.  Kids running unsupervised in all directions, parts of games being thrown everywhere, yep thought I needed to duck a few times.  I don't mind kids at places but the kids here outnumbered the adults and they weren't in just one area so there was no escaping them.

reviews.author: Tracey G.
reviews.description: Love this place!! The only bad thing is that they are not Harvest Host members. Else - we would be there more often!

reviews.author: Holly N.
reviews.description: Gorgeous brewery and outdoor space!! The staff and beer were equally wonderful. The resident food truck has delicious food that is described as "farm to trailer".  We will definitely be back! Depending on the style of brewery environment you prefer read my "fine print" below.   The fine print- when we went early on a Sunday it was quiet and heavenly. Within about 30min of arriving the place was taken over by parents and kids who were not supervising their kids. Ex. Kids throwing ladder balls into a nearby tree, tossing a football across an area for seating, and swinging the porch chairs into the buildings windows. It was chaos.

reviews.author: Rose D.
reviews.description: This review is for the brewery only.  The facility is very nice and it is understandable why it is so popular.  However, when I ordered a drink from the brewery, the cashier had already chosen the 20% tip before she turned the screen around to me.  Very presumptuous and offensive.  In addition, the food truck on site was terribly overpriced.  $15.75 for a cheeseburger the size of a slider.

reviews.author: Stew B.
reviews.description: Beers were fantastic!  Got a flight and enjoyed all their suggestions.  Highly recommended.   Also, setting was great for a family with a lot of space outside to roam + different toys, games to play.

reviews.author: Milannie C.
