reviews.description: After visiting Frontyard Brewing this weekend, it has certainly taken the title of my favorite brewery in the Austin area (sorry, Meanwhile Brewery). The views are gorgeous and there is plenty of space for social distancing and for the kids to play. There is artificial turf so it's perfect for setting up a picnic area and not have to worry about bugs or dirt. Their seating areas are set up in a way that it doesn't matter where you seat, you can keep an eye on your kiddos while sipping of your drink of choice. I tried the Hazy IPA and my husband had more than a few Ambers. I also got a bottle of 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon from 5 Soul Wine Co next door. It was pretty good, but I did not particularly enjoy drinking wine from a plastic cup. The food truck has great quality food. The pretzel bites were the perfect combination of chewy and buttery and the beer cheese was tasty. The burger was perfection, but I did not care for the chips. My kids had the hot dog and grilled cheese and they devoured them faster than they eat most of their meals, so I assume they approve of this review. My only complaint is that I wish I lived closer so I could hang out here more often. Check it out... you won't regret it.

reviews.author: Jon J.
reviews.description: Great property offering nice hill country views and very good beer/wine served up by a very friendly and professional staff.  There are lots of breweries in the area, but this one is definitely on the favorites list.   I would highly recommend them.

name: Sidecar Tasting Room
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: Went today with friends. Had the red wine flight...rose', montepulciano and the Tempranillo...liked them all but not enough to buy.  Had the meat and cheese plate...yum.   Ann (sommelier) was sweet and knowledgeable.  Flagship winery is Big Springs winery (which we visited today as well)   BUY LOCAL  SUPPORT LOCAL

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: Had a great time at Sidecar. Stopped in for lunch and a flight of wines as our first stop in Dripping and really enjoyed the setup. Lunch is from a food truck (trailer) on site. My group tasted reds and whites and all were very tasty. Food was good - had burgers and they were good quality. Setup was nice with covered tables outdoors or an indoor option. I didn't check out the brewery onsite but did see some guys partaking in the brews. I would not hesitate to return.

reviews.author: Cory Jo M.
reviews.description: Super cool environment and beautiful decor! The vibe here was awesome! The wine was okay. I like sweet wine and the wine flight was dry so I didn't enjoy it like a wished I would've.

reviews.author: Lacy B.
reviews.description: This place is so cute!!! Amazing service. Delicious empanadas. Love the rosè! We sat outside under the oak trees and enjoyed the scenery. Perfect first stop of our bachelorette weekend!

reviews.author: Tiffany Y.
reviews.description: Visiting from California and we wanted to go wine tasting and this was a winery nearby so we decided to give it a try. No regrets! Anne was very welcoming and friendly. She also gave us information on other wineries/breweries/distilleries to try. I had the $15 flight of reds and she also gave me an extra cup of red wine, Needy B*tch, I ended up buying a bottle! I finally found a great bottle of red that I actually enjoy, sad that I can't get it shipped to me in California. Drippin' Sweet is also great, bought a bottle as well. Love the descriptions given to the wines it made them sound all delicious. And they were! (According to all the ones I tried).

reviews.author: Jules A.
reviews.description: This little place is amazing!! A very welcoming and clean environment and have a nice selection of wines. Also the cheese and meat platter is so good!!  We stopped by on our way to Dallas. You definitely have to check it out!

reviews.author: Tracy M.
reviews.description: Great little place to go taste and snack! We had a flight of the white and red and they were great. We had one of each of the empanadas and all three were so good! I'm not sure where they get those things but they are amazing. My favorite was the bbq one. They also have games you can play. Would be a good place for a date!

reviews.author: Jeanette D.
reviews.description: Pretty good wine tasting. We did the red wine tasting. My favorite wine was the Tranquillo wine. $15 for 3 wines which is a little weak for wine tasting but the cool ambience made the trip worth it and the portions weren't weak.

reviews.author: Briana N.
reviews.description: Talk about southern hospitality. So we came here from a airbnb in dripping springs. It was a little far for an Uber to pick us up, but we got one. So we are there enjoying wine glasses, wine flights, food, the atmosphere. Everything about this place is so cute and amazing. But trying to get an Uber home seemed unlikely. Everyone kept cancelling on us and the bartender Ann or Annie (plus the last two customers) kept telling us that we were not gonna walk the 2 miles home. Annie made sure that we stayed till she closed and literally DROVE US BACK TO THE AIR BNB!!!. She was the sweetest thing and didn't even want to take any money from us. We had a back and forth of take it, no keep it, take it!! Haha I'm 80% sure I got the money in her cupholder before I left but I was the tipsy one so who knows haha. I really hope I did because driving us back to our Airbnb was above and beyond.

reviews.author: Mallory Y.
reviews.description: Absolutely great place to stop by if you are in the Dripping Springs area. The service was top-notch and the decor is really eclectic! They have wine flight options or you can enjoy a glass if you chose. The server was incredibly knowledgeable and had great recommendations for everyone in our group. She let us try what we wanted before committing to our drink of choice. I ended up going to wine cocktail called the Texas Kiri and it fresh rosemary in it which I though was a nice touch! They also have live music outside and plenty of areas to sit and enjoy listening to it. Definitely try this place out!

reviews.author: Jenni S.
reviews.description: Super cute little place in drippings springs, but I wasn't a huge fan of the wine. Sad, because I really wanted to love it. Maybe next years harvest will be better!

reviews.author: Tanna L.
reviews.description: My friend and I were looking for a bar to hang out at. We came across Sidecar. Everyone is so friendly and enjoy the time we spent here.

reviews.author: Steven A.
reviews.description: Great experience for a weekend visit by friends from out of town. They had a great selection of delicious wines as well as live indie folk music. Will definitely come back and would recommend!

reviews.author: Jesse M.
reviews.description: Being in the Industry, it was a pleasant surprise to visit the Sidecar Tasting Room! Claire was an awesome Host, knowledgeable about the wines, and gave great info on recommendations. Clean and tasteful Wine Bar and I enjoyed the Red Flight! Took a few bottles home to enjoy!

reviews.author: Marilyn M.
reviews.description: Great ambiance, really good wines! We did the tasting and bought a bottle to take home! Hide gem in Dripping Springs!

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: We were in town for another winery quarterly wine pick up party.  That winery no longer allows you to open your bottles of wine at the party or allow dogs.  As such, it wasn't a great day.  We decided to go some place else.  We showed up around 4pm on a Sunday and had the entire place to ourselves. It is so cute.  I love the decorations and the vibe. We did the wine tasting which is $7 or waved if you buy a bottle of wine.  Megan was wonderful.  She was full of information and funny.  We had such a wonderful time we decided to join Bell Springs wine club.  Three bottles a quarter. No sign up fee. They have a wine pick up party that allows you to bring your dogs.  20% discount the first year and the discount increases every year you are a member.  Free wine tasting for you and four people either at Side Car or the winery itself. You also get to pick which three bottles you want. We signed up on the spot. What is NOT to like! We enjoyed many of their wines but really it was Megan.  She made us feel so welcomed and was so friendly.  Bell Spring treat her right, she is a HUGE asset to you.  We can't wait to attend our first wine pick up party.  Hope to make it to first Thursday soon and hang out at the Side Car.  If we lived in Dripping Springs this would be a weekly stop for us.  What a great place in this sleepy town.  We are so glad to part of their wine club and excited for the many cool events moving forward.  This should be a place to stop if you are in Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Paige M.
reviews.description: LOVED the atmosphere! Such a cute place and great dry whites. The girl working there had a wonderful personality.  She was so easy to talk to and very knowledgeable. If I'm just hanging out, looking for a nice place to chill with a glass, this will be it!

reviews.author: Aaron M.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and wonderful selection of wines. Don't let the road it's one stop you from enjoying this spot.

reviews.author: Peter V.
reviews.description: This place has a great selection and wonderful staff. Claire (taller with blonde hair) is absolutely fabulous. She really gets to know the clients. Also very knowledgeable. I recommend the Needy Bitch red wine.

reviews.author: Claire P.
reviews.description: This was the perfect stop off while driving through. They had good wine, good service and great ambiance. We would definitely recommend to anyone driving through Dripping Springs.

name: Proof and Cooper
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Larissa S.
reviews.description: Best fried chicken I've ever had in my life, and the live bands in the back are always worth a listen.  Also a cozy local night spot to grab a beer and unwind.   Outdoor pool table is cool and one of my favorite spots in the place, although it's not well kept if you're a serious player with high standards.

reviews.author: Crystal T.
reviews.description: Over priced, over cooked and understaffed.  $90 for lunch for 4, a rude waitress and a condescending manager all amount to a ruined birthday celebration. The food was almost inedible to the point of stopping for fast food on the way home. This is a sad establishment- if you want to support a struggling business, this fits the bill.  I just remembered- the couple next to us didn't get their food at all. Another table went I side to get their long overdue order. This place is a joke. And to the 'roided out manager that "thanked" me for coming in- he could tell I was upset- your customer service is truly unrivaled.

reviews.author: Tim G.
reviews.description: Sad to write this as I live right up the street and this " Could" be a wonderful establishment....However it currently is not. Staff doesn't seem to care what anyone thinks or bother to give anything remotely resembling service.  Without writing a book on all the bad I'll just say that whoever owns this place needs to start owning it, No management or leadership literally the staff doesn't GAF and it shows. As far as the food? used to be pretty descent especially the fried chicken. Now not so much...last few times I've been here everything was horrible, Even when the subpar food does finally make it to you it's cold, unseasoned, Looks like a TV dinner that someone slopped onto a plate. Again it's a great location and the bar has good whisky selection " grossly overpriced" but good stuff. I would suggest skipping this place until the owners decide to invest some time and money here. Way better options right up the road.  Sorry PandC hope you get your act together someday... word of advice hire a good GM and get this place turned around.

reviews.author: Carly K.
reviews.description: Hello, I'm just a girl from Nebraska who loves visiting Texas for their BBQ. My sister and I decided to try this place for the first time. We were looking forward to getting some brisket and pulled pork. I mean, those are two of the best kinds of BBQ in my opinion.   When we arrived there wasn't anyone to greet us for about 5 minutes which normally isn't a big deal but the place wasn't busy. There was one table and two people at the bar. We could see the waitress talking to somebody as she cleaned a knife. Finally she looked over and noticed us. But instead of saying hi and letting us know we'd be helped soon, she went out of our view.   Eventually one of the two hostesses seated us. She immediately opened the menu to the beer section. That should have been my first clue that the food wasn't going to be the main focus of the restaurant.   When the waitress arrived we ordered our drinks and she went to get them. It took longer than expected to get our waters and the soda my sister ordered. I was still waiting on my beer when the table behind us said, this beer tastes like thirsty goat not the one I ordered. I turned and said, oh so that's where my beer went. Which by itself isn't a big deal but this was just one of the things that was adding up to disappointment.   When the waitress came back to take our order she then told us they were out of brisket and pulled pork. This is something that should have been told to us when we were first seated either by the hostess or waitress. We had already decided on our order and now had to figure out a new plan. She awkwardly stood there apologizing and saying don't shoot the messenger. We just needed her to leave so we could decide what we were going to do.   I decided to change my order to Turkey and ribs instead of brisket and pulled pork.  My sister decided to just get fried mushrooms. My nephew stuck with his kids burger that they thankfully didn't run out of. My food was ok, the ribs were tender and so was the Turkey but it wasn't what I wanted so it wasn't as satisfying. There "BBQ" sauce was a bit weird for me. It tasted a lot like cocktail sauce. I was disappointed there wasn't more than one sauce option. My sister only ate two of the fried mushrooms because they were disgusting and started to make her feel sick.   She brought our bill before we were done eating and then again began to apologize and explain that she doesn't do the ordering. Again said don't shoot the messenger. Ok, we got the message, you still want your tip. She said both that she just comes to work and finds out that they are out of stuff and that usually they are not out of stuff. She also asked how our food was. We told her the mushrooms were not good and she just made a yucky face. Then I told her about my Texas toast that was actually just bread. I mean maybe Texas toast is different in Nebraska but ours comes toasted with butter. She made a weird comment that my sister and I could use it to make our hand prints. Then she started asking a lot of personal questions. At that time we just wanted her to leave and get my ToGo box.   When she came back I started to put my fries in the box and she began to tell me to just dump them in. I explained that I didn't want to keep the ones that were touching the ketchup and mustard. She replied with who eats ketchup and mustard. In my experience in the food industry a lot of people do, that's why you can find ketchup and mustard as a staple sauce in most restaurants. But what waitress comments on how someone is eating their food.   Over all I would not recommend this place as somewhere to eat and enjoy your time out.

reviews.author: Kathy D.
reviews.description: Went for lunch today and got really good sandwiches! The BLT which was a real BLT! Lots of bacon very tasty.  My husband got a pork pork and ham with melted Swiss cheese sandwich which is also very good , Lots of meats. Ordered fries and they have great delicious fries at Proof N Cooper's!  I had my daughters rehearsal dinner here last year and it was lots of fun because they have outdoor seating and places for kids to play outback. We live nearby so we've been here a few times and enjoy it each time.  Service was excellent...slow time of the day, but Jessica was very nice and friendly!:

reviews.author: Brittany B.
reviews.description: The location is fantastic. They have a little Burt and Ernie watering hole that's to die for, friendly staff, great patio view and good brews. It's a nice place to kick back, even when busy the atmosphere was pretty relaxed.  For context, we came on a day they held an event with a pumpkin patch, face painting, petting zoo and magician so there were mainly families.   They have high chairs for the little ones, and pretty good food for the adults.   We tried the queso, a few beers, smoked turkey, turkey sandwich, Nashville tenders and the brownie. Decent meal but GET THE BROWNIE.

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: We were at Proof and Cooper for dinner. Girl loves a good fried chicken so we had to check out a local restaurant serving it!    We chose to sit on the outdoor patio as it was a beautiful evening. They have outdoor lawn seating as well which is just gorgeous when the lights turn on and they have live music playing.   There was no wait when we got there. The host was very friendly and so was out server. Very prompt service and no waiting around. I had their quarter fried chicken which is a choice of leg + thigh or wing + breast with a homemade biscuit and honey. I also ordered a side of coleslaw. The chicken was fresh and tasty. They have a great ranch sauce that goes well with the chicken. The biscuit and honey tasted fresh and delicious as well. Coleslaw wasn't too great... I don't think I'll order that next time. We had also ordered fried pickles and deviled eggs as starters... both were well made. Our family enjoyed the starters. For dessert, we had the peach cobbler that was warm and served with a scoop of ice cream ... so yummmm! Great finishing touch!   We stayed a little longer after dinner to enjoy the live music and it was just a beautiful Texas summer evening.   The only reason I gave them a 4 star is that there's a bit of a fly problem that they need to figure out a way to get under control. I do want to mention that our server acknowledged the problem and apologized for it. Much appreciated.

reviews.author: Veronica Y.
reviews.description: Only been here once so far, but am surprised at some of the low ratings. Came for relatively late dinner on a Sunday evening (note kitchen closes at 9pm on Sunday but I think 10pm on other nights...better double check though if you plan on coming late). We were more than happy with the beer selection. Lots of varieties, and many of which are local beers. We also had an attentive server.   Blue cheese burger was divine -- strong blue cheese, nice thick burger patty and was cooked to a perfect medium (just slightly pink on the inside). Fries were excellent - the thicker kind that is crisp on the outside but pillowy on the inside.  The Nashville Hot Fried Chicken sandwich was also very tasty. Not very hot though, which is just fine for me. I would rate the heat level as a mild (similar level to the spicy chicken at Chick-fil-A). Biiig thick chicken that cooked through without being dry. Where it was thicker, I could have used more sauce/seasoning because the flavors didn't quite penetrate all the way through.  Mac n cheese side was decent -- creamy white sauce but not too strong on any particular cheese.   The outdoor part is definitely more atmospheric than the indoor seating, so if the weather permits, sit outside (behind the building, not in front). That area is very pretty (see picture)! The parking lot extends around the side of the building; it's not only the few spaces you can see at the front of the building.

reviews.author: Susan P.
reviews.description: Okay, I've never ever left a one star review. Ever.  Went to our favorite spot when we are traveling around this area, but the food truck on location mysteriously closed at 6;50.  Hungry.  This place was suggested to us. We were seated and told who our waiter would be. Another server turned up, and then the hostess came back and also took our order (again) telling original guy that our server was some other dude.   She came back after a while to say that my on tap local choice was not actually available. Decided to just drink water.  Husband's drink arrived.  Listened to music.  A while passed, a long while.  Then we got our food.  Our cold food.  The order wasn't even correct.     Just go somewhere else.  Anywhere else.

reviews.author: Chassey W.
reviews.description: Comfortable, rustic place. Average Texas BBQ. Our burger eater said her burger was great. They have a kids menu, some yummy looking desserts (although we didn't partake), several TVs, an arcade and additional outdoor dining on a back patio. They serve several specialty drinks, draft crafts, and feature Nine Bands Whiskey.

reviews.author: Anastasia P.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, AMAZING food! I had the hot chicken sandwich. 10/10! The server suggested their house barbecue sauce. It was delicious. They should start selling it! Great beer selection and dog friendly! We sat inside but the area outside looks nice with some games. We live in Austin but it was definitely worth the drive.

reviews.author: Leigh P.
reviews.description: They have absolutely the worst service. If you don't mind excruciatingly slow service, waiting 20 minutes to be helped, flagging down your waitress to get drinks/food, or your order messed up/ missing then this is the place for you!

reviews.author: Michelle H.
reviews.description: Food was mediocre at best. Service was bad. Didn't seem like anyone cared.  Place looks messy, tripped over a mop going out to patio. go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Barrett J.
reviews.description: Do NOT come here. Terrible service and overall attentiveness. I ordered a drink with mezcal twice and was given liquor and drinks I didn't order. Our server said "well I don't know what mezcal even is" with such an attitude. Girl go ask the bartender before serving me a multitude of drinks I didn't order and then charging me for them. We are sweet people, I'm a bartender I would have been happy to help her through the drink menu and get exactly what was ordered. She also had her dog running around the property and it tried to eat our food, a disgusting experience and I will never return. If you want inexperienced people serving you, dogs slobbering on your food, cold crawfish and people trying to not fix their mistakes: here's your oasis

reviews.author: Annabel M.
reviews.description: Best live music EVER!!! Food is good, too!  Best fried chicken and brisket! Did I say that the music is the bomb?! Beer and liquor.

reviews.author: Bonnie R.
reviews.description: Just finished dinner with friends here on the patio.  Really liked the patio but they only had one heat lamp that worked and it too went out.  I had the fried chicken with biscuit and an apple side salad which were good.  My husband said the brisket and turkey on his bbq plate were cold, however he really liked the brisket.

reviews.author: Oakie W.
reviews.description: The ambiance and atmosphere was very cool. We were seated immediately on the patio and NEVER greeted. We waited for 10 minutes. Perusing the menu to pass the time. We were thirsty, hungry and excited to try PandC....but sorely disappointed.   We even flagged someone down and asked for service but no one came. It was busy, but not packed full of customers. Upon leaving another set of people were leaving upset as well they were not served.

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: The Proof is in the Fried Chicken   It all started when I was exploring places near my home using Maps on my phone and saw Proof and Cooper. I clicked on it and there were photos of fried chicken. I love fried chicken so I bookmarked it. Days later my wife and I drove out on a nice day to this establishment.   At first I thought this was a country dive bar but I was surprised it was very family friendly, well at least during the day.  There was plenty of parking scattered in front. In front you will find porch seating with inside dining with a bar, but in back will deck and lawn seating all facing a small stage.  There is a grassy area for kids to run around including some games to play. We sat outside in the back.   There was a wide selection on the menu including barbecue, fried chicken, burgers, and sandwiches.  One item that got my attention was deviled eggs and only know one person who likes them. I ordered a Quarter Fried Chicken (leg and thigh) and being a little intimidated from talking with the staff did not make it Nashville Hot. I got the feeling it was going to be a firestorm in my mouth. I ordered a craft beer to enjoy.  My order showed up and the biscuit was huge covered with honey. The fried chicken was so good where I place it in the top three in the Austin area. It was perfectly cooked being soft and juicy with great taste with nice spices .  The crust was spectacular and was about to breakout in song!   I did not leave empty handed for we took home some barbecue Brisket, St Louis Style Pork Ribs, and Smoked Turkey to enjoy the next day(s).  The barbecue was also extremely good where the meat just fell off the bone. This was just a wonderful place with exceptional food and atmosphere, and next time wear my boots.

reviews.author: Rammer J.
reviews.description: Just not very good.  Needs a lot of work. Fried chicken was good, came out piping hot. Unfortunately, all the sides were room temperature at best. A little sad, as it is a great spot with the outdoor music venue, the bar, just needs some work.

reviews.author: Tina C.
reviews.description: The first time we are here was about six months ago. Yesterday we took our family. The Beans were crunchy the chicken was burned on the outside and raw on the inside. The only Thing descent was the brisket. This place has truly gone down hill. It's like they don't care anymore. Please do something to fix this as it is close to our house and we really loved it the first time.

name: Last Stand Brewing
address: 12345 Pauls Valley RdBldg I and J

reviews.author: Sarah W.
reviews.description: I enjoy the beer here and the food from the food truck.  Grilled cheeses, patty melts, burgers, fries - delicious!  You can do a 4 beer tasting flight and they have around 12 or more on tap.  You can buy beer to go in cans or they have growlers available and some cute merchandise.   Be aware the v neck tee shirts they have right now are cut pretty tight/narrow.    They have a nice back patio where you can eat and drink and bring your canine friends and sometimes have local craft vendors back there as well.   I really like their Coffee Kolsch beer!   You definitely need to walk next door  and check out Revolution Distillery - simply fantastic gin and cocktails with a free tasting of a few of their spirits.  Can't buy bottles of hard alcohol on Sundays but they were still open today (Sunday) and they are happy to serve you delicious cocktails!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Fantastic beer and location! Quiet and just relaxing! It's dog and kid friendly but happy there's no playground so there aren't that many kids. All of the beer is fantastic, even if it's not the style I prefer (like pales)).  The food truck is excellent as well. Make this place a priority!

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: First time here and love it! Plenty of space and open seating inside and outside. It's nice to have brewery in south Austin that offer quality drinks and food options. South Side Flying Pizza is also located inside the brewery, which is also delicious!

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: A good brewery that's just a bit overshadowed by its neighbors.  When you're standing near giants, you live perpetually in their shadow. Such is the case with Last Stand. It's a good brewery. It's got old school Hill Country funkiness, as evidenced by their chicken shit bingo games (every 3rd Sunday!)  For better or worse, it's also just down the road from the behemoth that is Jester King. Hell, there's a great distillery 10 feet away! Last Stand's brews are good; this visit I had the Citra Smash, Simcoe Pale Ale and the Fuzzelicious. But I'd be lying if I said I wasn't thinking about Jester King with every sip.

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Way overdue review! Been enjoying LSB for quite some time now. Just a great, colorful, and fun space. Large beer garden with Chicken $**t bingo every 3rd Sunday of the month. That beer tho!  They focus more on the hoppy-side (love their CitraSmash); however, they also make great porters, stouts, and other seasonal brews including barley wine. A flight of 4 - 2oz pours will set you back 10$ if it's your first visit. Then, go for a full flight!  Light snacks available (pretzels, etc.) and food truck on-site at times.   Package available for sell and they also custom fill 16oz crowlers. Cans also available at ATX merchants (e.g., HEB).   Support local!   Family and Fido friendly. Cheers to the love of great beers!

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Last Stand keeps fundraised money they owe to local dog rescues and uses it to open up a second location. I'll never again support this shady business.

reviews.author: Jarrid S.
reviews.description: While the beers are great. The customer service is not amazing. You walk in and have a seat the server greets you and asks how your day is, and then a few minutes later another server says oh if You want to order the line is over there. How about the first person tell you their process, Or better yet - how about a sign hanging from the ceiling with an arrow that says order here. Lots Of people were Frustrated by this because they too had all taken a seat because of no direction. The beers are good but manage your business better if you would like to increase the positivity of your customers experience also the revenue you could generate.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Not a big fan of the beer, but I did enjoy the environment. The staff was friendly. Cornhole outside and plenty of tables for sitting.

reviews.author: Falon R.
reviews.description: The beer is so good! We went to the south Congress location. The atmosphere was nice. My 3/5 stars is due to the build your own pizza coming with cheese (which we don't and can't intake) so we spent $20 and weren't able to eat it. I'm hoping someone else ate it because it hurts my heart to think a cow gave her milk for nothing. We were told that we had to purchase another pizza. We decided it would be best to go elsewhere for food. My only advice is to inform the customer that the pizza comes with cheese automatically. We wouldn't have known otherwise. We will be back for the Fuzzylicious IPA!

reviews.author: Greshka P.
reviews.description: This was our second brewery on our beer tour, while in Austin. Small place, and not many beers on tap, but you can still find some good ones.  Their beers are listed on the wall on tap, and they also have them in the fridge if you want to take some bottles home.  They do flights, and of course that's what I did to be able to try more. The Coffee Porter was like drinking actual coffee.  Delicious!  I left this one for the end, after one sip since it ended up being my favorite. Imperial Oatmeal stout was just OK, in my opinion.  They also had it in Whisky Barrel Aged - same alcohol content but the barrel aged process always makes it taste stronger.  I wasn't loving these so didn't finish them.   Holiday Ale - was good, tasted just like it's name implies. The one that surprised me was the Smash Citra. I usually stay away from IPAs (too hoppy for me) but this was amazing!  I could have had a second one.  Service is hit or miss.  They were a bit slow preparing our flights.  One of the ladies was really nice and friendly, the other two people behind the counter, not so much.  You can enjoy your beers inside but the outside is really cute. Looks almost like a schoolyard with long wood tables, space to walk, and a cute colorful seating area near the exit.  Across from them there's Revolution (locally mad gin) and another brewery. So, this is a good place to "park" and enjoy a drinking day out with friends, without having to drive around for more.  3.5 stars

reviews.author: Kristen L.
reviews.description: Huge space indoor and outdoor and their menu has great food. Lots of beers and wines to choose from - definitely going back often!

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Came here after a stop at JK and this place was a pleasant little surprise!  Far less crowded than JK and the outdoor patio area was fantastic on a gorgeous spring day to just vegge out, hang w/friends, enjoy some brews, and play a mean game of cornhole!  Their beers were very hit or miss for me. I did the sampler and nothing really stood out, but none were undrinkable, just not really my style. If you like hoppy beers, then you will probably enjoy their selections more than I did. Their stout was ok, but in all fairness, probably not the best choice on a warm day as it was heavy.  I will say, what stole the show for me here was our little discovery of their Revolution Spirits barn. They were doing a free tasting of their gin and Cafecito coffee liqueur, both of which were absolutely awesome!  I really like the gin as the lavender in the batch we tasted was very prevalent. I am usually not a gin drinker, but the mix of this w/the hibiscus tea that they served was perfection! The Cafecito, however, was so mindblowingly good, I immediately dropped the $25 to purchase a bottle on-site! It is made w/Cuvee and packs a delightful, caffeinated, yet alcohol-y punch. I have paired it drizzled over some coconut, chocolate chip, almond vanilla ice cream, and it is what dreams are made of!  I probably would come back here in a few months to see if they have any different beers on their rotation and to restock on the spirits.

reviews.author: Neel A.
reviews.description: Vibes. Awesome venue and a great beer list with a diverse set of brews. Juicy IPAs? Check. Imperial Milk Porter? Check. Barleywine Ale. Check.  The outdoor patio is perfect for hanging out and day drinking. Cornhole and jenga patio games make it a really fun atmosphere. Food truck was outside to add a booze buffer from the beer imbibing.   Definitely will be back next time I'm in Austin! A distillery and a cidery are also located in the same complex so it's a great vacation destination.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: I've been a fan of their Simcoe Pale and their Smash Citra IPA for quite some time now. I've been meaning to check out Last Stand and I finally had my chance recently.  Located off of Fitzhugh Rd- Same road that brought you Austin Beer giants Jester King- , Last Stand is a bit smaller but still has those breathtaking views that we've all come to know and love out there. They also offer a good selection of house beers that you can't find at your local HEB, Spec's, Twin Liquors. I had fun sampling them and look forward to seeing what they have next time I go!

reviews.author: Lana L.
reviews.description: I'm not much of a beer person, but I do try to appreciate it. Came here on a Sunday with friends to check the place out. You can ask to try some of the beers if you're not sure what you want. The samples are very generous and the people working there are nice and helpful. I sampled four different ones before deciding on the pale ale. The coffee one was also great, not like anything I've had before. You also have the option of getting a flight/sampler with four different beers if you want variety. There is outdoor seating too!  Taste | 3.5 Atmosphere | 3 Presentation | 3.5 Service | 4 OVERALL | 3.5

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: Great new brewery in the Dripping Springs area. They currently have a solid five brews on tap. Our faves were the BPA and Coffee Porter. I will say that I need a session beer from them... something a little less on the alcohol would be good, but that's just my preference.  The location is just a few minutes down the street from Jester King (so if you're already out at JK, come give Last Stand a try!). They are located in a really cool business park. There's also a distillery a few doors down!  There is a couple of places to sit inside and a full outdoor area with seating (if you're allergic to hay, it might be an issue).

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: We were out pub crawling in the Dripping Springs area and found this place. They have quite a few beer choices and an air conditioned section so you can enjoy your beer and the place is very customer friendly. Cool place.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Good beer. Good burgers. Nice spaces inside and out with plenty of room for groups. Dog friendly. Don't forget your growler!

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: This was the last stand for us during a wine trip through Hye and Johnson City. As we circled back to Austin, the Mister decided he would confuse his brain after the lovely wine tastings with a beer. This was dessert, he explained.   However crazy this idea was, I am now a fan of hitting all these breweries five minutes before closing. We were the only customers and serendipitously met the owners and their beautiful white boxer! The guys enjoyed their Coffee Porter and Pale Ale and we were on our way home quickly.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Argus Cidery's website mentioned they were open on Sunday. But when we arrived, they were definitely closed.  So since we were there we thought we would check out Last Stand.  Last Stand is located at the back of the warehouse properties in the cute little green buildings, next to revolution spirits.  There is plenty of parking.  They have a small inside tasting room with space to sit down, and an outdoor area that is dog friendly.  There are some trees shading the outdoor area, but they have also put up some netting.  The area is barked and they have some nice tunes playing.  They have a corn hole with bean bags, or across the street a Frisbee Disc Golf course set up that doesn't look like it has been used in awhile.  The only negative on the outside space is that it had a large fly population.    The competition for micro breweries in Austin has become fierce.  There are many options to select from.  There is a bit of something for everyone.  My beer tasting adventures with my expert husband have developed a palette that appreciates this alcoholic beverage.  Last Stand out of the many I have tried is just OK - Average.  The beers just fall flat and thin for me.  They are missing that full flavor quality profile. You can select from a flight of Year Round Beers ($7), or a flight of their rotating taps ($10).  Their rotating beers always feature the following: their ongoing Farmhouse, SMaSH (single malt and single hop), and a Single Barrel Series.  They also have some growlers you can select to fill up to go.  The two that I found decent from their menu were the Pale Ale and Coffee Porter.  The coffee porter is made with local Summer Moon cold brew, which you can taste in the unique roasted and nutty tones.  While not rich and creamy like most coffee porters, this still has some good flavors.  The staff were friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Crystal M.
reviews.description: Says monkeys always a fun time.  Great selection of draft brews, delicious pizza that is on point every time and it's enclosed for the littles.  Since moving to their own location they have expanded and brought in a great waitstaff and a great atmosphere. Friday nights are always busy so expect 45 minute even up to an hour wait for pizza but beer is flowing and the wait isn't very long in the line inside.

reviews.author: Jena C.
reviews.description: The hubs and our puppy Bowie were out playing in the park and worked up a thirst! And of course an appetite!!  We've been wanting to stop in here for some time and I'm so glad we finally did! The beer is tasty, I only had a few sips since I'm driving but next time I'm pounding some brews! However the pizza!! Omg!! Now that was delicious! I ate half the pie to myself and sadly I feel I could have ate the whole thing haha the crust is chewy crispy, the sauce tastes freshly made, the cheese actually has that cheese flavor and not some pre shredded cheese bs! Oh and the pepperoni!! It was so flavorful!!  Now for the atmosphere! As soon as we walked in we were greeted with smiling faces!! Everyone was so friendly!! I swear this is the first place in Texas that I felt truly welcomed!!

reviews.author: Sean B.
reviews.description: There is a lot that is planned for this place. Well, that's what I was told. Certainly has a cool canvas to work with.  The beer is good. There are lots of shiny distractions on the menu, for sure, but there are some solid entries as well.   The food is nothing amazing. It's just ok. And wow what a wasteful process to give everyone a pizza box. I guess you are not offering the pan it was cooked on or some other dish you don't need to wash or dispose of, and I'm sure they are recyclable, but you just have one trash, so what's the point. Maybe you are saving water instead of trees.   The events are cool, fun stuff. And like I said, a great space for it.   The bartender/manager guy is very snooty, but I guess if he is that proud of the place, that's good for him. You just get the feeling he'd care less if you were there or not. I can pretty easily choose not to go just to not need to deal with that.   But, I'll be back.

reviews.author: Paul C.
reviews.description: Suds Monkey has opened its new location and what a great improvement!   Large open air seating inside and out with local live music several times a week.  Fresh pizza to go with a good beer selection. Not just IPA s, Porter, Amber, Blonde, Hazy and more. Wine option also.  Membership options have nice perks too.

reviews.author: Morgan B.
reviews.description: Whatever you do, don't stop by here on a Friday night. The setup is like a beer garden but without beer garden seating. People are vying for seats. A pizza takes 1 and a half hours to get. Total sh*t show. Never again.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: Great warehouse brewery with good service and even better beer.  The coffee blonde was the absolute best.  I would definitely buy that beer again.

reviews.author: Joe Q Pubic S.
reviews.description: UPDATE::: Greg doesn't put his "Money" where his mouth is... His response 'Will make improvements is BS"  Look at the current review reviews they're keep coming..., the bartenders are still rude, and "The beer is Blah" how is this to operate a business????  You treat a customer with respect and gratitude, guess what they will be coming back.. think of all the repeat customers you losing out on, because of your rude staff...  Do appreciate small business, but if you dont even care about yours and really improving the overall customer experience, why should you...  Setting yourself up for disaster.   I would find replacement bartender with a positive attitude with a smile in their voice..  Whos there happy with their job, not watching the clock for 8hrs to go by...

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Came here real quick while I was waiting for some friends to show up to our house, and so happy that we did! We parked out front under the shade, and walked around... Then you just walk up and place your order. I ordered the Pilsner, and I can't remember what my boyfriend got and we also ordered some garlic knots. They have indoor and outdoor seating, you just have to walk around the building. We chose to sit indoors and watch the football game, wasn't too long before our food was ready and it was bread-tastic!!!! There is so much flavor, I would definitely order again it... I cannot wait to try more of their food and come back for more chill vibes! Thanks for the awesome experience Suds Monkey!!

reviews.author: Al O.
reviews.description: Great pizza, easy to order online and take out - or quick to order and drink beer while you wait! We order their pizza once a week - love the BBQ Chicken.

reviews.author: Morgan D.
reviews.description: Love this place when we go through Dripping Springs.  Never miss an opportunity to get a growler filled at the least. Enjoying the music and new environment.

reviews.author: Carlos H.
reviews.description: This is a great place to hang out and sip on some suds with your buds. Carter was awesome and feisty, but mostly witty and awesome.  Carter if you see this, please send me the video of the burn out. 301-247-3808

reviews.author: Jaime B.
reviews.description: While at the ROT (Republic of Texas) Motorcycle Rally, we found this place. This place is must visit. Beers selections are great and the service is top notch. Carter livens up the place but be careful she's a psychic, LOL.

reviews.author: Eric M.
reviews.description: Probably one of the worst breweries I've been to in Texas. The beer is just blaaa. They are unfriendly people too.  I wouldn't waste my time going here when there are so many good breweries in the area.  No need to check this one off your list.

reviews.author: Steve P.
reviews.description: Greg - thanks for promptly addressing the growler miscommunication at bingo.  Great customer service, beer, and venue.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: This small brewing company is a real gem!  The folks here are friendly and happy to chat about the brews.  They have a convenient way to order and pay by phone.  Tables are spaced far apart (covid precaution).  We had The Jugo IPA, a juicy and it was delicious!  Many places don't get the hazies right but this one got it down.  The Punk Monkey Porter, on the other end of the spectrum was equally tasty.  Looking for something to do?  Want to try some great beer?  Check this place out.

reviews.author: Jim J.
reviews.description: I'll always remember my first bite of their cheesy bread inside my hotel room at the Holiday Inn.   Wish I could comment on their beer, but it's much easier to find a good IPA than a good pizza, so that's all I was interested in this time around.   Dropping Springs is surprisingly weak when it comes to dining options, so this is a no brainer for some unpretentious food after a long drive.

reviews.author: Lola C.
reviews.description: Had the pleasure of checking out the beers at Suds Monkey. I ordered a flight of 4 and they were all really good. Reasonably priced and a really nice taproom.  There's pizza available too but didn't try that out.  If you've got kiddos there's a playroom to keep them busy as you sip on beer.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Cool brewery located near Dripping Springs that has a great selection of beers. Friendly staff and there's a pizza place located within the brewery so you can get a bite to eat while you drink or after!  They have a classic arcade machine that has a ton of old school games along with a number of board games as well. Seating arrangements are pretty open and for a Sunday afternoon, parking was not crazy.  Expect to see tons of awesome dogs with their owners and just an overall chill vibe. Can't wait to return to try the other beer options!

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.description: If i could rate lower than a 1 I would, staff is rude, I have been going to Suds Monkey since they opened at original location, new location is bad . They have forgotten how to treat customer. staff is rude, service is bad. do not go there!!!!!So many brewery options in dripping springs, pick another option.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: Just ordered delivery for the first time.  Had the two pizza deal with cheesy bread.  Awesome flavor and crust.  We also had the salad which was fresh with tomatoes and peppers and mozzarella sticks  - awesome.  Ordered the Pale Ale which hit the spot.  Five Stars Guys - easy order with perfect delivery.

reviews.author: Ray R.
reviews.description: Local watering hole with 20 or so taps and other bottles/cans/wine. Everything you can want in TX feeling and charm. One of the core businesses giving Dripping Springs a soul.

reviews.author: Jeff W.
reviews.description: If you're new to Dripping Springs or just passing through, The Barber Shop is a cool little beer bar located in the historic downtown area of DSpgs. They've got a smaller indoor area to sit and enjoy the AC, or the backyard patio has plenty of room with long picnic tables. Many a live music to enjoy the afternoons with. The staff and the customers are a friendly bunch so stop in, enjoy a cold one and enjoy the good vibes.

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: So it's called The Barber Shop, but it's really a dive bar that's located in an old gas station. Confused yet? Great, glad we cleared that up.  From the moment you walk in, it's clear this spot is beloved by the locals. The crowd was a solid mix of tourists, cowboys, retirees, and working stiffs.  The tap selection is small, but they go out of their way represent Texas brews, even hosting a tap from Acopon, which is literally about 20 ft away. It's dog friendly, with a patio and a small performing space for musicians. This place just oozes history, it's definitely worth a look if you find yourself in Dripping.

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: Don't come here you'll ruin it. Perfect the way it is. Don't want to many new people ruining it.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: We popped into this local bar to watch the Masters.  What great place.  When I saw someone at the bar with two dogs I said to myself this is the place. We ordered from the bar and then hung out for about an hour.  If i was in the area again i would seek it out for sure.

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: This Dripping Springs spot is stellar for many reasons. Low key, 99.9% percent locals hanging out in the evening. Excellent bartenders over the years. Super cool owner too who I obviously know because of my tenure in this town.   The Barber Shop is so cool in fact that my wife and I chose to renew our vows there for our 10 year anniversary. Complete with a hail storm, cake balls from nearby Well Yeah Cakes, and a Elvis impersonator in his second ever appearance.   Beer is always cold; wine list is tragically minimal to the regret of my wife (think tiny bottles like near the airport). Yet, it's charms outweigh it's negative aspects. Heard these days there is a sammich outlet on site for food instead of ordering from nearby Pizza Cave or the shi*ty fried chicken at the gas station.   Biggest note here: It's little Rooster's favorite bar :)

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Visited the Barber Shop after a full day of hiking as we needed to replenish our Carbs. Sat was their 6th anniversary so the shop was packed with live music out back and a special cask beer being offered.  I have been coming to the Barber Shop for years as a good friend of mine lives in the Springs and we always seem to default here. Take note this is a beer and wine bar only. Yes, they have soft drinks and water as well. This is a dive bar extraordinaire so there is no need to get all decked out to hang out. There are plenty of draft and bottle beers with all the usual craft suspects and always a few surprises as well. The venue is dog and kid friendly so don't step on Fido and keep your cussin to a minimum.  Friendly patrons, good service, and a great beer selection that's the trifecta. Stop by when you are in the area. Lastly don't be shamed by asking for a haircut....

reviews.author: Kacie H.
reviews.description: Excellent beer bar for a small town. Perfect quaint atmosphere and the picnic tables make it easy to get to know new friends.

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: Great beer selection and very friendly people. The added bonus is that the smokers have a section for themselves outside. We meet here every month or so for good beers and a good time.

reviews.author: Jon B.
reviews.description: I live in Seattle and have relatives in Dripping Springs -- "Dripping" -- to the locals, and have been coming here for years. In the early, early, early, early days it was a gas station and my dad told me they'd stop here for gas when traveling cross country in the 50's. I love this place because it's got a great history, the building rocks (pun intended), and the beer selection should satisfy most any beer drinker; lots of variation. They also serve wine and some non-alcoholic drinks. Children are tolerated until 9 pm. There's an area out front to gather and stand, an inside area to order and sit down, and a backyard area -- some covered, some not -- with picnic tables and chairs. There's music on some nights, a great after-work vibe, and friendly atmosphere throughout. Easy Texan drinkin' and relaxin' all the way. Stop by if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Jordana G.
reviews.description: I can't believe I've never reviewed the Barbershop. It's the quintessential neighborhood bar. Have a beer with friends (or soon to be friends) and enjoy the Texas casual ambiance. They also offer ciders and the wine selections, while not vast, are good quality choices for the major wine categories. The beer offerings are superb. I've been coming here since they opened (5 years ago?), remains one of my favorite bars.

reviews.author: Marshall O.
reviews.description: This place deserves a five star review; it has a great selection of beers in a small town. The beer is cold, cheap, and the bar has a great atmosphere.   I went in last night (Tuesday/Halloween)for the first time in a long time. The World Series was on and I decided to grab a beer and hopefully see the Astros win with other Texans but... they lost. The crowd was small and friendly but I did feel like a party crasher because they all knew each other and were passing the guitar around. I hope this place hasn't turned into a towny bar because it never was in the past.   I'm going to have to go again to make sure or at least that's my excuse to go get good and affordable craft beer.

reviews.author: Christine G.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places in Dripping!   Love to go when they have the pickers circle on Sunday.  So much fun and great local musicians.   Love the beer specials too!

reviews.author: Steve D.
reviews.description: Not anybody but locals know about this place, they prefer to keep it that way. Don't expect fancy artwork, foo foo drinks or any food. Beer, Beer, Beer, oh yeah, wine also (limited selection, tho). A small town converted garage and plenty of oddball thimgs on the walls. Be sure you have a couple of hours and a driver, it's not right around the corner.

reviews.author: Andy H.
reviews.description: This is the best place in town for a beer and some friendly faces.... they treat locals and visitors with the same respect and it's a great pub... this is coming from a "local" Englishman :-)

reviews.author: Dave T.
reviews.description: Taking a side trip out of Austin, we stopped in to visit this establishment mentioned in various travel sites' recommendations. We were not disappointed! The manner in which they've decorated the inside and out provided a cozy, intriguing, and welcoming atmosphere.  There was an impressive selection of craft brews on tap which was explained and served by our courteous server. I will definitely make a point to stop by again on my next trip to The Lone Star State! Thanks, guys!

reviews.author: Matthew S.
reviews.description: Still a great menu of brews, I love the atmosphere, I love this place.

reviews.author: Sage R.
reviews.description: I'm hesitating to post this; because secretly I want to keep this little gem to myself. I'm kinda new to dripping springs, but as soon as I stepped foot in this place, I felt like home. You'll never meet a nicer group of comrades all grabbing a beer at the end of the day. Tip well! These bartenders deserve it.

reviews.author: Deana S.
reviews.description: Rude bartender they think because they have a small town they can be rude to people because they have a place in dripping springs bad customer service leads to shut down of a business let's see where you are in one year asshole!!!!

reviews.author: Marco L.
reviews.description: After attempting to stay local and having cover charge at two other places on Mercer. The barbershop was a place for us!  Great cold beer plenty of tables good service

reviews.author: Olivia G.
reviews.description: I'm a big tequila and mezcal fan and I heard about Sotol which has a similar taste. Then I found out that Sotol is unique to Texas so I had to go try it.   The cocktails at this place are great! The most popular is their frozen margarita, you have to try it. If you really just want to get a feel for what Sotol tastes like though, try ordering the flight first.   For food, there is a food truck on the premises. I think they switch it up but when I went it was a Mexican food truck with very good Birria tacos.

reviews.author: Mahesh P.
reviews.description: This is their Sotol Tasting Room. Which may not seem all that great, but boy howdy, is it ever! They've got their sotol, of course, but also a whole bunch of (sotol and other) cocktails, food, and a pretty cool outdoor space with plenty of place to chill. Best of all, there's pretty much always some sort of musician doing their thing (this *is* Austin after all!)  If only it wasn't a decent drive away....

reviews.author: Rosario F.
reviews.description: My friend who knows all the hot spots invited me here during the stricter COVID times. It's a heck of a drive but I was really impressed with how lovely this place is. Very Instagramable location with the truck outside and the silo.   PARKING I went when it was pretty busy. I found parking but I did have to wait for like 5 minutes so cars could clear the road. It gets pretty tight once the parking spots are all full. It's all free. A lot of cars parked on the road. Just be careful crossing the road.   FOOD When I was here they only had one food truck. The options were limited. The prices were a bit too high for the food options available. I didn't try it out. My friends ordered a few things and they felt the food was just ok. I'm not sure on the current food status here.   AMBIANCE  They only had outdoor seating when I was here because of COVID. I sat on the covered outdoor seating which was great since it was around summertime. It was HOT! Really cute tables, friendly/helpful staff, and live music! I don't remember his name but there was a gentleman playing guitar and singing. He was fantastic!   DRINKS I ordered 3 drinks. The first two were the Comanchero and the third was The Copperhead. I'm glad I stopped there. They are strong!   I'm giving it four stars because I felt like the size of the drinks didn't coincide with their prices. I hope I get to stop by here again. It's a bit of a drive for me. It's a really beautiful drive though. Keep kicking butt y'all! I want to try everything!!

reviews.author: J. L.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, great drinks and great Lowe key music on the nights that they have live small bands

reviews.author: Jill C.
reviews.description: First time trying Sotol, and there wasn't a cocktail on the menu that wasn't incredibly delicious. We sat outside in the lovely fall weather, enjoyed some acoustic tunes by a talented duo with a female vocalist, and tried several cocktails -- all of which we enjoyed. My friend tried the frozen Bartender's Choice which was like a frozen apple cinnamon cocktail, and I tried the Comanchero, the Yipping Coyote, and the Rugged Flower. Each were so smooth and well-balanced. This place not only makes a flavorful Sotol with a smooth, clean finish but transforms it into mouth-watering mixology masterpieces!   Aside from the bus loads of out-of-town tourists who looked like they were part of an Instagram filter for an "Ashley/Ashleigh" compilation (complete with brimmed hat, scarf, and boots), this place is a must-visit if you're in Austin. Couple it with a trip to nearby Fredericksburg and you've got yourself an amazing day!

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Finally decided to take a day trip down to dripping springs and had to finally stop at Desert Door. To start, this place is designed so beautifully. I wish I could steal the décor and put it into my own home. Both the inside and out were so inviting, I don't know how someone could go and not spend hours enjoying the ambiance, food, and drinks. What I thought was so cool about Desert Door was that they educated you on what you were drinking and the history of Sotol. What I did not know, is that they are actually the only Sotol distillery in the US.  We started off with the Sotol flight, and two drinks. Although we did enjoy tasting the Sotol by itself, it was a lot to start the afternoon off with! We also ordered the The Copperhead (my personal favorite of the day), the River Rita, and the Sotol'd Fashioned. I loved each drink but the copperhead was definitely the star of the day, which was a Sotol version of an espresso martini. They also have a food truck on site serving out very unique food. We ordered the tacos and vegan "queso" and both really surprised us by how unique and amazing it was. We loved this trip out to Desert Door, and will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Loma G.
reviews.description: My first time at Desert Door. Drinks were delicious and the food was a pleasant surprise . The service was perfect from Nicole. She suggested the perfect drinks for my taste .  will definitely come back and hope to have Nicole be our server. ~ Loma

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: I'm generally not a huge fan of tasting rooms and find them gimmicky and far from truly experiencing the spirit of the spirit. See what I did there.   But every rule has its exception, or exceptional. Desert Door is a destination in itself. Beautiful southwestern interiors and stylish furniture. The space is cozy but didn't feel crowded, though every table was full. They do have a large patio for outdoor seating and bigger groups.   Now, the sotol. I had never heard of it and didn't know what to expect. The best way I can describe it is an agave spirit, clear, between a vodka and a tequila in its thickness/smoothness. In plain English, it's delicious.   We did the tasting flight, which was a great way to get introduced to a new spirit, followed by a round of cocktails. The cocktails were excellent and reasonably priced.   They also had a lovely food truck on site but we didn't have enough time to try it.

reviews.author: Corey R.
reviews.description: Our server was Meryl, our waitress was amazing.  Loved the frozen drink on a warm afternoon.  Live music playing.  Life doesn't get better than this!!!

reviews.author: Deborah C.
reviews.description: So glad we stopped by Desert Door on our way to a Getaway cabin.  The mixed drinks are on point! The entire staff were so friendly. Cozy/desert vibe inside! Huge outdoor covered area with plenty of picnic benches and  lounge seating.  I can't remember who our server was but she was freakin awesome! She brought our pup a pupsicool (bone broth frozen pup treat) to keep cool and occupied lol. Pup also sported a DD bandanna : )  We didn't order any food from the food truck, but appreciated the option to order quick bites.

reviews.author: Jonathan S.
reviews.description: Great Vibe, great drinks and the service is superb!! Ask for Nicole :). She was wonderful and really explained the whole history of the sotol plant. Will come back for sure as this place is a gem!!!

reviews.author: Meaghan S.
reviews.description: Ended up at Desert Door after a lunch at Saltlick. Doot, the host, got us seated right away at a cozy soft seating area outside. Great patio vibes: chill, mist fans going , and live music about to start. Inside is nice too, super clean and cute/trendy.   The sotol is great and their cocktails are delicious, as well as unique. Had a difficult time deciding which one to get but our attentive and extremely friendly waitress, Nicole strayed me the right way with the Comanchero. Hubs got the ranch water (served in a Topo Chico, gotta love that)!   Nicole our waitress and Erin the bartender are solid assets at this establishment! Thank y'all for a great Saturday afternoon!

reviews.author: CARLA B.
reviews.description: OMG!  Where do I start.  Stumbled across this gem riding to the Salt Lick in Driftwood.    Staff was great with explaining Sotols and provided amazing  recommendations.    The Sotol Flight is great.  My fav was the Gin forward Sotol as I have gravitated towards Gin in the last few months   Love band outside play with amazing indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful, can't-miss distillery in Texas Hill Country!   We were absolutely shocked by how much we loved Sotol after trying it first as a standalone shot. And they sure know how to do a cocktail, too! I got the River Rita and it legit blew my mind.   Sit and stay awhile, listen to the live music on the patio and if you need to cool down, the interior is a WHOLE mood.   Be sure to visit their gift shop to buy an adorable handmade clay shotglass (SO CUTE) and a bottle of their famous Sotol.   The staff was also astoundingly friendly and the kind of people you want to hang out with.

reviews.author: Corianne O.
reviews.description: Honestly great environment. Good drinks AND live music. So much fun. Really loved the drinks and the tequila. Nicole gave us our drinks and she had the absolute best service. If you can request her, I would. 10/10 experience.

reviews.author: Ang B.
reviews.description: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. Love these folks and I know some day we'll go out there and there will be a wait, for now it's still somewhat of an unknown. We've only had wonderful cocktails and bought several bottles of Sotol from them. I like that it has less carbs than tequila! Anyway, the choice of food truck out there is solid (Eden).  I wish I could live next door!

reviews.author: Shelly M.
reviews.description: Had an amazing hour enjoying sotol cocktails! Erin and Nicole are amazing. So glad we decided to stop in and can't wait to come back with friends! Facility is gorgeous and has a beautiful West Texas vibe. Can't wait to enjoy music on the porch!

reviews.author: Erin D.
reviews.description: Just left here with our crew! Here for a wedding and this place was recommended to us. It did not disappoint. Kelsey was the BEST waitress. She was so nice, helpful, and friendly. We all talked about her and how great she made our experience. The drinks were awesome and the vibe of the place is great. Highly recommend you come here! Be sure to request Kelsey for the best service!

reviews.author: Anh N.
reviews.description: So glad we finally stopped in to DD! Great distillery with ample patio and outdoor seating! Loved all of their cocktails. They also have live music.  Try the food truck Eden West on site, their quail bites are delish!

reviews.author: Thiago M.
reviews.description: Third update. They certainly read the reviews and made drastic improvements. Gets 5 star from me now. Drinks and food are great!

reviews.author: Chloe H.
reviews.description: Good cocktails at a good price! The wrap around patio is fantastic. I could sit out here for hours with a book or drink the day away with some friends! Worth the stop

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Great stop on your trip to Dripping Springs. A family owned and run business. The owners are super friendly, and it's such a relaxing atmosphere. I had the blackberry smash with vodka and it was so good. They have the option of vodka or gin in your cocktail depending on your preference.   Definitely a great way to spend a day!

reviews.author: Dave M.
reviews.description: We spent the weekend visiting distilleries and this was very disappointing.   It's not busy at all but they still gave us gin instead of vodka.  It would be okay to play some music as it's awkwardly quiet due to the lack of patrons.  Finally, the people at the counter seemed annoyed with people overall.  Another couple in  the parking lot stopped us and asked if we had the same bad experience so it was not just us.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: Had a great stop here. The blackberry smash was amazing. The Helen's were amazing too. They are very eco friendly, affordable and yummy. And the people were friendly. Win win win trifecta! We left with four bottles.

reviews.author: Jeff P.
reviews.description: Family owned and operated distillery makes for a welcoming experience.  Not like other local "corporate" locations.   Patio is large with plenty of comfortable chairs.   Vodka and Gin are amazing.   My wife enjoyed the Gin sample which was truly surprising.   She a vodka gal.   This is a must stop.  Bypass the corporate spots and come here first.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Definitely a hidden place with a great view! Glad we stopped at this place after seeing a sign off the side of the road and following a winding path down to see this gem.  Very homey vibes with a great patio for outdoor seeing that just has a fantastic view of the hill country. Decently priced drinks consisting of either gin or vodka.  Seating is pretty limited inside, but the outdoor space is just amazing and honestly makes the experience really that much better. I'd highly recommend 'The Bullfrog' with vodka. Tasty drink, but not overpowering and has a nice kick (smooth vodka that doesn't burn like gasoline).  P.S. They have some cool looking merch! Make sure to take a look at their terrariums...they are wicked!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Frog Pond Distillery was a pleasant surprise.  I have been wanting to come here for a while now, but always drive-by, and don't get a chance to turn around.  However, this time I made a trip purposefully to stop in.  I am glad I did.  Frog Pond is a family-owned business and passion project. The entire family was behind the bar the day my friend and I stopped in except for mom and I think a daughter.  The family owns the land and has slowly overtime built the tasting room and production area themselves.  They currently make a vodka and gin.  They offered us a free sip of each to determine which we would prefer in one of their handcrafted cocktails.  Both had a nice flavor profile that blends well in cocktails.  Their cocktails were creative and they mentioned the family came up with the recipes together.  The cocktails were delicious and very reasonably priced.  Their space has a fun modern 50's theme.  They have an outdoor patio you can sit back and relax on a nice day.

reviews.author: Rachel A.
reviews.description: This is a family run business, which is a major plus!   Love supporting local, small family operated businesses. Their vodka is top notch and their featured cocktails are great.  The views from the porch are amazing and so serene. Definitely coming back for another round.

reviews.author: Anastacia R.
reviews.description: My friends and I were doing distillery/brewery tours in Dripping Springs for a cute birthday celebration. We tried Deep Eddy's but they were closed so we decided to give Frog Pong a try and we were not disappointed! The guys at the front were helpful and kind. The drinks were so affordable and flavorful, I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Christina M.
reviews.description: What a nice change of pace from the better known distillery down the road. Instead of an overcrowded atmosphere with way overpriced drinks, this place is relaxing and affordable. There's a great wrap around porch to take in the landscape around you, while sipping a delicious cocktail. I definitely recommend stopping in if you're in the area!

reviews.author: Glenn R.
reviews.description: What a beautiful facility!  Stopped in for their grand opening and was amazed at such a sparkling clean, friendly place.  It's very obvious that a lot of careful thought has gone into this place. The actual distillery is incredible. The whole place is just beautiful. Even on a scorching Texas Summer day, there's a strong breeze out on the porch.  It's a very "Austin-esque" type place, down-home and friendly. Although I don't drink, my wife enjoyed a cocktail very much and we bought a bottle to take home. They had some nice lemonade and infused water for me too.  Great design of the logo, bottles and everything. Really worth stopping in if you're in the area or just feel like a nice drive from Austin.

reviews.author: Arko G.
reviews.description: On our way to a wedding, we stopped by for a cocktail, and this was the perfect spot. We were debating between here and Deep Eddy, and we picked here for a more off the beaten path option and chill atmosphere. And we were definitely not disappointed. The staff were very helpful and welcoming and knowledgeable about their product. Outdoor seating is spacious with impressive views. Cocktails were highly affordable and very tasty. Unfortunately, tours were closed due to COVID, but we hope we can come back for tours some time soon!

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: While driving into Dripping Springs for an anniversary get away we spotted this beautiful building set near 290, decided to turn in and see what it was. We weren't disappointed, Super cute place, nice patio to hang out on while sipping lovely cocktails. Really reasonably priced drinks (mixed drinks either $5 or $6 depending on choice). Has an area to play games out front, and indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Christiana F.
reviews.description: I stopped by after a recommendation from one of the wineries in the area. The owners were very welcoming and their drinks were fantastic! I ended up buying a bottle of gin on the way out. It was chilly and the sun was going down so we weren't able to sit outside but the view was great and seems like a fun spot during the summer.

reviews.author: Lochness P.
reviews.description: Delicious drinks! Vodka is super smooth. I recommend the Helen! And the patio with the view is beautiful!

reviews.author: Wanida S.
reviews.description: I've always wanted to stop in and check this place out. It's got a great view and their vodka and gins were tasty. They weren't overpriced and had great service. **only open on the weekends.

reviews.author: Claire K.
reviews.description: Walked in was greeted and made to feel like I was in my own home. If my home was a sweet Distillery like the Frog Pond. Patio and chair were peace on Earth. With a amazing Texas Breeze. And the Gin and Tonic was just perfect. My sister got the cocktail of the day with lavender and gin and it was amazing. Color and all. I highly recommend a stop to this Local Distillery. They are A must try.

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: They put advertising stickers on your car without permission, which is astonishing. I left the one on my trunk and added a sticker that says "sucks" under it. Unbelievable that they would do this.

reviews.author: Carey D.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem. We started off at another well known distillery down the road and googled what else was close by and found this awesome little spot with a great view. They make small batches of vodka and gin at the distillery and make a few different drinks to try. Their porch was a great place to hang out while playing giant jenga and relaxing. I noticed cornhole as we walked in as well. We watched deer randomly wandering in the distance. The drink I had was great, a cranberry vodka fizz, so I had another. The indoor space is fairly small and the patio could fit maybe 30 people comfortably. It was not crowded at all when we were there on a Sunday afternoon. We'll go again next time we're in Austin!

reviews.author: Devin C.
reviews.description: I am very new to the Gin world, but I was truly in need of an alternative to Dark liquors. I heard about this place from a coworker and decided to take a chance. I am very happy to say that the product that they are offering, not only the liquor, is amazing. They couldn't have picked a better location to place their distillery. The hills of Texas, day or night, make relaxing on the patio with the variety of gin and vodka cocktails that much more relaxing. The bright pops of color when you venture inside of the distillery are such a delight and really made my girlfriend and I feel happy to be in such a welcoming place.   The gin was delicious and I plan to buy more bottles very soon. Don't think that my lack of praise for the vodka means that it isn't good (I am just not a fan of vodka..rough nights in college) but I definitely suggesting venturing out to this family run, local organization. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery with plenty of outdoor seating, live music, etc etc, without being too over the top. It's also pretty close to Austin, about 30 min, and very close to downtown dripping springs. Plenty of wine options of course, and a food truck nearby with some tasty snacks/bbq! It's definitely enough to be a dinner if you want that, too.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: My friends and I had such a fun time this past Saturday! Wine and beer is well priced, and the space is great to spend a summer day with your friends. I really liked the rosé wine, and my friends and I ordered truffle fries from the food truck. The only thing I would change about our experience is that I wish we had made a reservation 24 hours in advance because you can't order charcuterie boards and wine flights without one.   Everyone is really nice, and on a chilly day, they even have blankets. I highly recommend making the trek out here!

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Such a cute place! Loved the outdoor and indoor areas. Brewery is right next door and you can order from either and pay at one. Wine was good too!

reviews.author: Jaclyn L.
reviews.description: It's beautiful! The rose is perfect for a summer day, there was live music, food truck, axe throwing and an amazing outdoor landscape!   A wonderful summer day spent here!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: We had a great time relaxing in the beautiful sunshine at Bell Springs! There is a winery and a brewery on site so everyone likely has an option they'll like = Best of both worlds. They have plenty of outdoor seating, which you could choose to sit in the sun or under the trees in the shade. We split a glass of rose and their sweet white and I would recommend either one. The sommelier was super sweet and helped us choose our wines. Would definitely recommend a stop here to relax and enjoy nature with a glass of wine in hand!

reviews.author: Ara A.
reviews.description: They have a winery and a brewery which is great when you have a group with people who like different taste. Lots of games and seating areas. You can have a flight or the tasting menu, lots options.

reviews.author: Caroline K.
reviews.description: Loved this winery! Such a quaint and unique place to have a tasting. Unfortunately we went with the weather being 20 degrees, but we still had an absolute blast. They have beautiful outdoor seating and cozy indoor seating in the brewery section of the property. The staff was amazing. Would highly recommend!

reviews.author: Luke P.
