reviews.description: Completely unacceptable management. For about 2 hours a group of individuals where shouting at two tables, yelling sexually explicit language, swearing profusely, and were clearly unable to drive. At a place that prides itself in a family atmosphere, where kids are running around playing in the grass and trees, this is completely unacceptable. I am looking forward to management/ownership response to this review. In a region where wineries, breweries and distilleries are a dime a dozen, plenty of opportunities to take my business elsewhere when we come visit.  What should really concern the owners and management about what happened at Bell Springs is the fact that:  1) The Hays County sheriff was called after the incident because it was so egregious. Enough of these reviews and they will be lining up outside the parking lot for DWIs.  2) The staff (7:00 pm on 6/19) did absolutely nothing to cut off a clearly over-intoxicated group that was negatively impacting people around them  3) The staff's response (blonde and burnette hostesses), ver batim, to the vulgar language and rowdiness was "free speech" and "you are the problem - I know those people".  Fantastic - best of luck in your future endeavors . Your stellar response caused one of our group to cancel their wine membership.

reviews.author: Shanita F.
reviews.description: They have three long tables for guests to sit and enjoy the tasting. It snowed the weekend we went, so of course we were inside. However, they do have an outdoor patio, bar and high bar seating. The outdoor seating probably really nice in good weather.   Call ahead or make reservations online. It's very easy and they do allow you to amend reservations over the phone.   They produce really great wine and there's a great selection to choose from. The staff is very knowledgeable about their wines and answered all of our questions. Testing comes with a **small** array of cheeses, nuts and crackers.

reviews.author: Alexa S.
reviews.description: Cute spot and their brewery next door is awesome too! Bell Springs is in a nice location and it is so green! The wine is yummy, tastings are nice sized pours! Only reason I am giving 4 stars is because when you make a reso for wine tasting and charcuterie, don't expect a lot of cheese and meats HA! It was so small, we were cracking up. I would recommend bringing your own snacks and food! Otherwise, awesome spot and I can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery and relaxing porch. However most wines are sourced from Lubbock and not from Austin.  montepulciano is from the region and pretty bold.

reviews.author: Anthony L.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to hang out with friends!   The wine is pretty good. We shared a bottle of Rosé. The real appeal of this place is the setting itself. There is ample outdoor seating under big shade trees! It's a pretty place.  There is also a brewery on site, but I cannot speak to the quality of the beer. We stuck with wine on this trip. I would definitely come back and try other wines and the beers offered!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: This is a beautiful winery. Plenty of tables spread around the grounds under trees. Lots of room for kids to run around out there. We sat up on the patio with our dog and enjoyed a lovely wine tasting. We chose the solo tour which was $15 for 5 generous pours of delicious wine. All the staff we interacted with were very friendly and helpful. The one low point is the food truck. We got the currywurst for $10 which was good, but not a large enough serving for the price. The more upsetting part was the pretzel we got (also $10, which is very expensive). The prestel was small, hard (even though it was supposed to be a soft pretzel), and flavorless. The mustard cheese dip did its best to save it, but it wasn't enough.

reviews.author: Jalise F.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed my visit here. I'm not much of a wine drinker but they were able to answer any questions I had about the wine. Also it was snowing when I went and that made the experience all the better. Will most definitely return on my next trip to Texas!

reviews.author: Anna O.
reviews.description: Nothing  but amazing things to say! We recently hosted our Dripping Springs 10 Year High school reunion at Bell Springs Winery and it was a great experience. Nate and Laura were wonderful to work with and they took care of everything making it super easy for me. The location is perfect and off the main road and the layout of the outdoor and indoor areas are well suited for any size group. Defiantly consider Bell Springs for your next event!

reviews.author: Manuela A.
reviews.description: What a little surprise! I liked their porch and plenty of outdoor seating. They have a great brewery on location so there is something for everyone. They did generous pours of 3 wine tastings for $20. We got a bottle of Cab with grapes from Washington state. No surprise as Texas cab grapes do no yield good wine. We enjoyed our time here!

reviews.author: Anna M.
reviews.description: I have been here numerous times and always had an awesome experience but today was the most unacceptable experience I have ever had ANYWHERE. I was here with my family, parents, and my brothers family with a total of 5 kids (not unusual to see kids here). While here, we became aware of a group that was likely overserved and using foul/vulgar language that we tried to ignore for a long time. Once we heard the phrase "fat c*ck" at a ridiculous volume my husband asked them to please keep it down, which resulted in a huge altercation with various threats/insults from their end. Despite their behavior management still allowed them to stay. What's worth noting is multiple people had already complained about this group and others joined my husband in attempting them to quiet down- so they were affecting loads of people at the winery. Eventually things calmed down and the argument broke, but as we were leaving they said loudly for us to hear "I'm so glad that douchebag is leaving" so I gave them the finger as I was walking away (I will concede this was adding fuel to the fire but I was so fed up at this point) and they screamed to me "FUCK YOU MOM" across the grass. Managements response? Free speech allows them to say whatever they want. Apparently this nice hill country spot is going for the dirty 6th vibe. Save your money and go somewhere with enough pride to expel those who can't keep it together while I use my own right to free speech to notify everyone this place doesn't care about their patrons.

reviews.author: Michael P.
reviews.description: Understaffed.  Cannot manage overserved men and women who are creating bad examples for family customers there as members to enjoy the facilities.  Staff is useless.  Take my membership; we are out.  There are many Other places to enjoy.

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: I am a resident of Dripping Springs and have been a frequent patron of Bell Springs Winery. I found this family-friendly venue to be welcoming and beautiful. It was for this reason that I suggested that my kids, with their families, join my husband and me for a Father's Day celebration on Saturday evening, June 19th. When we arrived just before 5 pm, we found a good picnic spot in the shade near the bag game. We all noticed, or rather heard, a very boisterous group of 12 to 15 people sitting near the brewery. As the evening progressed, and I am assuming more alcohol was consumed, the group became louder and more profane. We attempted to ignore them, but soon it was impossible due to the volume and the increasingly prevalent and disgusting language. At that point, and because we had 5 young children with us, my son-in-law went over to the group and respectfully asked them to turn down the volume so that my Grandchildren would no longer be exposed to words like "F*ck and C*ck". He was immediately met with a barrage of personal slurs and threats. 2 staff members (2 young ladies, one light-haired and the other dark-haired) working that evening came over to the group, however, incredibly, the inebriated party was allowed to remain on the premises. Shortly after, every family packed up and went home, including our group.  When walking to the parking lot to leave, a particularly vile young woman yelled obscenities at my son-in-law and daughter. I turned around and went over to the group. When I arrived, I was also barraged with a variety of slurs and called a "C*nt". Once again, the 2 female staff members came over to the table to intercede. At this point, the dark-haired staff member shared with me that she "knew the group" of offenders, which helped me understand why these folks had not been asked to leave. If you happen to know staff, you can act like filthy pigs, with the knowledge that your actions will have no repercussion, regardless of the profoundly negative impact on everyone else looking to enjoy wine and food with their families.  To add insult to injury, staff had the unmitigated gall to suggest that I was the problem, not the drunk and vulgar group. When I questioned staff (dark haired young lady) why they permitted such obnoxious behavior from any patron, she suggested that hurling profanity toward others was protected under free speech. Staff continually suggested that our "conversation was over", indicating that they wanted me to leave. Clearly, the privilege of free speech isn't applied equally to all patrons visiting Bell Springs.  In the past 15 months, I have recommended Bell Springs to dozens of family and friends. Now, I plan to exercise my right of free speech in every forum available to tell acquaintances and strangers alike about my experience, advising that Bell Springs is not worthy of anyone's patronage.

reviews.author: Robert R.
reviews.description: The wine was good.  The lawn for tasting was ample.  The amount of things to do was tremendous.  I highly recommend this, but the wine is a little over priced for its taste and quality.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: The drive is as peaceful as the landscape is serene. Like everything in and around Austin, there's a sense of "for now..."   And that's why Vista Brewery is a smart play. It may be a drive out of the way now but soon it'll be right in the middle of everything.   Hopefully not too soon...  On a cold, sunny day, the grounds are a welcomed sight for adults and kids alike. The two buildings are new and impressive but not imposing on the landscape.  Now, the beer. The stouts were quite impressive. They were smooth and strong with a distinct personality. I tasted three of their stouts, loved all three for different reasons. My wife had a couple ales and was equally impressed.  The food was acceptable but not something to write home about. I feel like they could take it to the next level if they brought on 1-2 food trucks but I get that may not be in the cards for now.  All said, it offers something for everyone and you're bound to leave happier than you came in.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Really like the venue and that they've completely opened back up. Looks like a great spot for a group event or private party.   Dog friendly. Plenty of parking. Seating inside and out. Small menu with plenty of Biergarten faves.   Just wasn't digging the beer this time. We did a couple of flights and sampled 8 different brews. The Blonde Ale was okay. Hubby and I both liked the Destination IPA. He likes the Dark Skies. Overall, the beer was a little off. Maybe next time.

reviews.author: Chelsea D.
reviews.description: Great staff, live music on Sundays. In and out door seating. Firepits and heaters for cool nights. Didnt try, but had food menu, as well!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: In lieu of having a wedding reception, we hosted a wedding luncheon for 40 guests at Vista Brewing in the Barrel Room. The staff was welcoming and extremely helpful and the venue was stunning! All of our guest commented on the amazing food. We could not have dreamt up a more perfect location. Thank you to the staff at Vista!

reviews.author: Valerie V.
reviews.description: Wonderfully off the beaten path.  I absolutely loved the modern space inside but also the very rural outdoor space. Wonderful areas for kids to play and adults to chill. Lots of great beer options for everyone no matter what your taste is. I tried the Everything is Aussome - an Aussie sparkling ale. It tasted a lot like an IPA to me. I may have expected it to be a bit lighter in taste but still a great bold flavor. Great for groups, family picnics, or just a fun day out to relax. Definitely worth the stop in the area.

reviews.author: Trevor D.
reviews.description: Beautiful spot, used to be great.  Beer is pretty rough these days.  Food offerings were always a bit comically small before the pandemic, but delicious, now they're just overpriced and not very good.  I miss the friendly staff, seems like they cycle through staff pretty regularly now.  It's a long drive and probably not worth it  these days.  This place used to be the absolute best.  The beer was epic.  Such a shame.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: This brewery should be on everyone's stop if your going to Salt Lick just down the road. Stopped here on Friday night and caught the tail end of their acoustic live music set which they happen to do every Friday night. They stage by far is the best set up I've seen In the area under a natural oak tree with twinkling lights scattered above. Could easily see this place being a great wedding venue. They also had a nice little hiking trail where there's additional seating and a kids playground located further down. Now let's talk about the beer and the brewery. The brewery is huge and has a nice modern approach with a little Texas flare. As far as beers I ended up trying a flight and by far definitely grab a Barton creek gold on a hot summer day. If your looking more of a full bodied beer destination ipa would be my choice. Can't wait to come back here once the weather starts to cool down.

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: Gorgeous brewery and hang out spot tucked away in dripping springs. We got brewmaster flights and a little meat and cheese board. The beers were good - and rotate so it encourages you to be repeat visitors. Absolutely worth the stop especially if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: I haven't found another brewery on the level of Jester King, but Vista brewing got the job done. It has a great location right by Deep Eddys and Salt Lick BBQ, which allows you to make a nice day trip out of it.  Starting with the service, my party and I were seated immediately and were served. For drinks, we ordered  1. Adair 2. Zwickled  All the beers were excellent, especially the Adair.  For food, we ordered  1. Pretzel  2. Brisket Sandwich   The food was also great and a lot better tasting than other breweries, for sure. I did think it was interesting to have brisket pastrami cold, but it was still solid.   Overall, I will definitely come back to the spot because they have great food and even better beer.

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were on a long weekend vacation and went to Salt Lick for BBQ on a Sunday. (Amazing BBQ!)  We were looking for a tap room, since Texas doesn't let you buy beer beer before noon on a Sunday.  Vista has a huge outdoor seating area and they have a real good beer menu. I got two IPAs. They had snacks you can buy as well and I got a beanie and they had stickers if you ask.  Very nice people at the bar and lots of COVID appropriations were in place. Their free was was super good as well!  A really great place to try!

reviews.author: Allie R.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this brewery! It is located on a huge plot of land with lots of room for games, swinging chairs in the trees and live music, making it the perfect place to hang (even with children). Awesome selection of beers. They also have food available.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday evening, was pretty easy to get a reservation and their patio had tons of open space. They did a great job of enforcing masks when people aren't seated at their table and made it easy for us to keep distance while in line.   Their beer selection is very diverse, so I opted for a flight in my first round. I was pleasantly surprised they allowed you to include their more expensive barrel series in the flight which made the 4 4oz pours for $12 a great deal. While those were tasty my favorite was the dark Pilsner, for such a dark beer it had a more mellow, malty flavor than you would expect.   Food wise it was fairly typical brewery fare, but the $1 hunks of watermelon really hit the spot on a hot August evening.   If you're looking for a brewery a little outside of Austin to escape the city for an evening I'd definitely recommend checking them out!

reviews.author: Brenda G.
reviews.description: Came here for a friend's baby shower.  It's near Salt Lick and there was a short dirt driveway before the parking lot.  Our friends had an area reserved for the event but there seemed to be plenty of seating.  The service was great and it's a perfect location on a nice October day.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: I wish I could give this brewery six stars, we absolutely love coming to Vista brewing. There is something there for everyone including the wine lover, most of these breweries only cater to brewing beer but Vista also has a good selection for wine. They always have cool food trucks with tasty items to round out A wonderful visit that you won't forget anytime soon. It also has a wonderful playground for kids and a band that's just the right amount for a venue like this. Bring your friends your family you're out of town cousins because this place is all that and a bag of chips.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: Vista Brewing is one of the Breweries exempt from the new closed bar order (during Covid19) because of their food to alcohol  sales ratio.  We were excited to make a reservation for a special occasion and were assured (by way of Facebook messenger) that their "kitchen was open and ready for business".   We arrived, ready for some good beer and food.  First disappointment:  Their reservation check in system.  A chalkboard sign indicated a table for to-go order pick ups and simply an arrow for reservations.  No employee to greet, direct or be helpful.  2 employees filling to go orders as we stood in what we estimated to be the 'reservation' line.  Several people were behind us when 2 young women cut in front of us and said loudly "Will you take walk ins" and to our astonishment they got an employee's attention who completely ignored us and helped them get a table.   Very rude!  Once we were checked in we found a table in the shade and went to get our  beers and food.   Disappointment #2:   No food.  Only popcorn and a cheese plate.  That was it.  We told them we had been assured over messenger that their kitchen was open and they shrugged and said  "Don't know what to tell you.  It's being renovated."     I can't understand how they are allowed to stay open with beer and POPCORN sales as food, under the Governor's new restriction.   At this point we already had our beer so we went back to the table to make the best of it.  Disappointment #3:   the amount of flies and mosquitoes. We go out to another "farm style brewery" frequently and have never had an issue with flies or mosquitoes like we did here.   Maybe it's one brewery using a spray service vs. not?  Maybe it's dog poop from being a dog friendly brewery (although, so is the other farm Brewery we go to...)  We had 4 mosquito bites while sitting there and this was at 5:00.  Flies were insane.  It was a disappointment all the way around as we had really been looking forward to several hours of relaxation, beer and food out under the trees.  Added on 7/11:  I have not changed a word of my original review, however I am adding a Star based upon the great communication I have had with one of the owners, Kent, who wrote to me after my original review.  He seemed genuinely interested in my feedback and responded in a very thorough manner.

reviews.author: Alena D.
reviews.description: My husband and I love vista brewing! The owners are so friendly, it's family friendly and they follow covid guidelines so we felt very safe. We love sitting indoors and outdoors depending on the weather and like that we have that option. They have live music on weekends and the beer/wine selection is good. Pre-covid their food was farm to table and delicious. We're anxiously awaiting the return on their standard food items. Definitely a great place to check out!

reviews.author: Anita C.
reviews.description: Come for the beer, don't stay for the food.   We came here for the first time and ordered a bunch of food and beer. The beers are good. The food is not. I didn't realize the current menu is because of covid. The sandwiches were all cold. The pimento cheese dip was good but hard because it's also cold. Literally everything came out of the fridge as they handed it to us.   It was a terrible first impression. I understand it's covid, but I think they could've at least heated the sandwiches or tried to make some better food that can be packaged.   Great venue. Not sure I'll come back.

reviews.author: Garnie B.
reviews.description: Had a school event there and it was great.  Plenty of seating in and out.  lots of room for the kids to run about and having a great staff about was wonderful.   only ding was the coordination / distribution of food.  Basically they ran out for our guests, and well, there is nothing you can do about it.   Events are hard to plan for, especially with family and kids, so we will work with them next time to better handle the food service / serving.   The beer was good, the wine selection was pretty good.   What i liked the most was the atmosphere. on a cool evening, with the stars out, it was a great place to be to unwind and chill with friends / family.    Plenty of parking..   Finding the place...well, thats tricky.  See punch in the address in Google Maps, you will be ok, just know that when you get close, slow down, and know the entrance is on top of a hill ... so you can miss it if you are not paying attention.   will I go back: of course, and I would recommend you go and visit.

reviews.author: Ed G.
reviews.description: Friday afternoon at the Vista Brewing pop-up at the galleria!  Perfect weather, perfect pour!  Check it out!

reviews.author: Alex V.
reviews.description: First time ever at Vista! Also first draft beer (not Crowley/growler) since beginning of lockdown. Such a great spot.   COVID: Vista has a GREAT outdoor area with plenty of tables distanced from one another. The ordering process specifies 6 ft of distance in line. Hand sanitizer is everywhere. Beers are delivered in single use cups. They have also started their live music Fridays again where you can venmo the artist tips. Masks are required everywhere but at your table.  You can make a reservation on Open Table for their outdoor area. Currently, they are open until 8PM.  We brought our own chairs and a blanket to use as a tablecloth. We also brought our own glasses to pour the beers into. I love beer out of a glass so this was a need for me.   Overall: This brewery has a ton of good stuff going for it. It's a little out of the way for Austinites (40 minutes), so you've got to make a night out of it. We're generally bigger IPA fans, so there are a few breweries we would check out ahead of this one. BUT they still have a ton of great beers on tap, and it is so worth checking out.

reviews.author: Brittney T.
reviews.description: So fun! This place is huge and dog friendly.   They have flights and all sorts of different cocktails for you to try. I do love vodka - so this distillery is a lot of fun.    The staff is fun and knowledgeable. They made a lot of good recs for drinks.    They have a little food stand inside for some small bites.   Would recommend to stop by if you're in Austin!

reviews.author: James B.
reviews.description: Wasn't blown away; except for the great flavored vodka.  But for $10 you only get 4oz. Which you can get at almost any liquor store.  They have mixed drinks and such. And some sort of food options. I'm not impressed with the bar service either. They have a barrier up for a line, but they don't actually use it.    Highly recommend orange, lemon, sweet tea and peach vodka.   It's not a bad stop for a drink. But only get one. There's a cop in the parking lot waiting to nab a drunk driver.

reviews.author: Gail J.
reviews.description: I'm wondering if they change the formula for their grapefruit vodka. The bottle I purchased recently was so sweet I couldn't drink it.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Deep Eddy Vodka Tasting Room is a great spot to hang with friends while sipping any number of their flavored vodkas. My favorite is probably the peach vodka and they have many cocktails to choose from. We went on a Sunday where there were local vendors there too as well as live music. Head to Dripping Springs for the great tasting room. Unfortunately, the distillery near Buda is not one that is open to the public, so the tasting room is where to go.

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: We started our bachelorette day here. The Bloody Mary was so yummy! I got it spicy. Sometimes they're a hit and miss but here... not a chance. The bartender made it to perfection! I also loved my souvenir glass I got to bring home with me. The vibe and atmosphere of this tasting room is super chill and cozy. 10/10 recommend !

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Like I was saying earlier, I find tasting rooms gimmicky and this one is a perfect example of it.   We chose to come here because I have deep respect for Deep Eddy as a company for their commitment and contributions to the local community. They've gone above and beyond again and again. Respect!  The tasting room is a large hall, with flights consisting of tiny cups of flavored vodka. You don't taste the actual spirit because the fruity flavors are so sweet.   The "Colombian" food options on-site is a joke. It's an old school concession stand (movie theater of the 80s style) with heat lamps keeping nacho chips warm on a folding table. Don't expect tacos or empanadas.  The space, both indoors and outdoor, is quite large. And they have a cute performance stage inside.  We stayed a total of 15 minutes.

reviews.author: Valerie V.
reviews.description: Wonderful space for great and unique cocktails. Both indoor and outdoor seating are roomy and spread out. They were already decorated for Christmas when went today 11/6. I loved the Spring Sling and the Ruby Red one with the jalapeño. Definitely a must do in the Austin area if your are distillery and brewery

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Spacious - great for large groups!  Food - one small food truck  Drinks - the vodka is a bit harsh; personally preferred the cranberry flavored vodka best (smoothest). Bartenders are very friendly and fast but the drinks are simply made and during Covid they are all touching the mint in their hands by smacking it. Id rather a gentle crush/roll in a glass... felt a bit gross (others commented too).  Wish there was live music Saturday afternoon at 4  Games outside like giant connect 4 etc  Parking- gets full on weekends so a bit tight  The decor was cute  Sheriff at the door to handle anyone getting a little too cray

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: A lovely farewell brunch was held here in the tasting room. There was ample seating both indoors and out. The bartenders were attentive and the drinks were tasty too. We'd like to return and sample other beverages.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Finally I was able to make it out to the distillery with my good friend early on a Saturday so that we could get some direct tasting vodka notes from Deep Eddy themselves rather than me taking shots at bars around Austin.  Parking was easy for us but do note that we showed up around 11:20AM on a Saturday so we didn't have any issues.  The later you arrive parking could be a thing and you may have to wait/stalk someone who is leaving to get a spot. Also as the day got later there were many buses and charter vans parked in the front and roundabout chilling out as the company they are driving around are inside getting down too.  Cocktails in a paper cup runs $8 with plenty to choose from the menu that is thoughtfully laid out in sweet, sours, spicy, etc. A nice mason jar with the Deep Eddy logo is $12 and slightly larger.  Do know that they will not refill your mason jar after you buy your first one so be prepared to be clanking around the distillery with your extra mason jars if you keep going the $12 route. Also be careful with your glass too - I saw many people let that mason jar slip out of their hands and the mason jar just crash on the concrete floor. So sad! Also frozen drinks / cocktails can only be purchased downstairs so be ready to wait in a little line if it is busy.   Loved the areas to sit inside the tasting room and even in the 2nd large downstairs area.  The pillows, decor, and the small touches around the sitting areas on the first floor are super cute and selfie-worthy.  I can imagine in the winter, with the large fireplace going, this space is cozy AF!  We didn't go outside at all as it was super hot in July but it looked like there are plenty of tables, shade, and seating for some large groups both in the front, side, and back areas.  After 2 cocktails in a mason jar we were feeling a good buzz and knowing we still had to trek back home (south Austin) we cut it off there. By the time we left around 2pm the place was buzzing with people, all 3 bars had 10+ waiting to be served, and I wasn't planning on waiting to close my tab in a long line.  I was super surprised to find out you can close your tab at the merch area with the cashier there so don't fret and add in that mug, stickers, shirts, bar additions, and Deep Eddy cool pool lady in red signage to your basket to check out while you close out your tab. You will save yourself some time and be out of there in a jiffy!  We plan to come back especially now knowing they are opened on Thursdays at 11am!!!!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: My Husband surprised me with a day-date to Dripping Springs, Texas. I am a huge fan of Deep Eddy Vodka and this was an amazing way to try all of the flavors.  The set-up is gorgeous and feels so clean when you walk in. You get a behind the scenes taste of where the best Texas vodka comes from. The staff was kind and knowledgeable. They answered any questions we had about the drinks. I ordered a $10 flight and my Husband got the Orange dreamcicle drink. You have the option to get your drink in a mason jar as a keep sake.  There is a great gift shop on site, so we got matching shirts because we are cheesy like that.  There was a delicious food truck out front that had Vegan and Meat Eater options available. I like that they cater to both.   There is so much to do in the surrounding area. We went thrifting and enjoyed the nature that Hill Country has to offer.

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: Huge fans of Deep Eddy's grapefruit vodka.  Great with soda for easiest of easy beach drink.  Fun first stop before three winery visits nearby.    They have a responsible pandemic process in place managing number of folks going through and requiring masks.    Highly recommend Deep Eddy's as first stop when in Dripping Springs.  Cheers y'all

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed our short visit to the Deep Eddy distillery. We are already big fans of Deep Eddy's vodka and all of their flavors, so we had no doubt we would enjoy our time there. The cocktails they serve at their bar are innovative and refreshing. I ordered the Spring Sling and he ordered the Austin Mule. We both enjoyed the drinks next to the patio where they had multiple groupings of chairs spread out on the lawn. Other than drinking, there's not much else to do here, but it's definitely a lively place to enjoy a drink with friends! Our bartender was also very kind and helped us choose the right cocktails for each of us.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: The Deep Eddy Tasting Room is making some delicious cocktails! We found ourselves here with friends on a Saturday afternoon. The weather was perfect and they have a nice little patio area. The spot is family friendly meaning you can bring your kids, but there isn't a lot for them to do except run around in the patio area. I would have liked if the patio area was fenced off and not open to the parking so I could relax a bit more. I had to keep a close eye to make sure my kid didn't wander off. I enjoyed both of the drinks I tasted and would definitely stop in here to explore more of the tastings, but will likely leave the kid at home next time.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: No complaints here. You can take home the souvenir cup or jar whenever you order. Try the Texas tea and you won't regret it. Everything here is made to order with frozen drinks being located downstairs. The service is also great! We went on a Sunday and had a wonderful experience. They also have a nice selection of merchandise.

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: In our multiple trips to central Texas, we kept missing Deep Eddy although we tried each time; just unlucky timing. FINALLY this past weekend we got there when they were open! Oh we were so excited and the place lived up to the hype. The seating atmosphere both inside and out is very roomy and comfortable. All the staff is friendly and easy-going. Everywhere including the bathrooms were incredibly clean. The cocktails... the cocktails are downright amazing. They're inventive, delicious, and fresh. You're going to have a hard decision to make no matter what kind of drinks you like... I actually ended up ordering two at once because I couldn't decide! On the way out, we stopped at their little gift shop and man do they pack that area with goodies! Talk about variety and options. The shirts are awesome and made very well to boot, and they have tons of other merch. I left with a soft tanktop, a wicked fun tin can that I plan on using for a cactus or succulent vase, a magnet, and a collapsible dog bowl! We'll be back every chance we get. Loved it, loved everything, love the vodka.

reviews.author: Ara A.
reviews.description: Excellent service, great drinks with all their offerings. They don't charge for mock tails which is very nice if you don't want alcohol.

reviews.author: Jaclyn L.
reviews.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! You got games outdoors, a stage indoors, vodka tastings, frozen vodka drinks and more! We've been here twice now and always have a good time with our daughter!

reviews.author: Riley B.
reviews.description: ‼PSA: NEVER go to the Deep Eddy's Vodka Tasting Room!!‼ HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED AS A REGULAR DEEP EDDYS ENTHUSI  My friends and I went out to celebrate Maddy Montgomery's 22nd birthday and were harassed by the manager for being "underage".   The whole group willingly gave our ID's for inspection and the birthday girl's ID was "questionable", so she was taken to a cop car by a Sheriff, put in the back and questioned.  While Maddy was at the cop car getting her ID verified, the rest of the group had our full drinks/cups (that we paid for and were able to take home), snatched out of our hands. We all requested a refund for the drinks and were denied??  After the Sherriff verified that Maddy's ID was real, the manager proceeded to threaten tresspassing charges against us??   I have never experienced anything like this and would love to be contacted/reimbursed for the mistake that was clearly made.

reviews.author: Kylie W.
reviews.description: If you have the time definitely a cool spot to check out. Indoor and outdoor seating with a little gift shop. Got some flights to taste and a frozen drink

reviews.author: Shem W.
reviews.description: Lots of outdoor space to spend the day enjoying all of the beers and to take in the hill country views. They have two tap rooms - one upstairs and one down stairs. They also have their own gin and whiskey if you're not in the mood for beer.  There was also a food truck here if you have the munchies.

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: Real Ale has been on my list of breweries to try while in the San Antonio area. Granted, that's a pretty loose definition of San Antonio area and I'm usually gone or working during their operating hours.  I deliberately flew into San Antonio early so I could make it to Real Ale on Sunday before they closed. I even got my friend to  make an early morning 3 hour drive to join me. I ended up making the hour drive to Real Ale and parked in their lot and cluelessly wandered the grounds until we found the taproom on the second floor.  While I wanted to try their beers on tap I really wanted to try their spirits. They had draft cocktails so I started with their Peanut Old Fashioned. I also tried two of their beers their anniversary Golden Stout and the Black IPA which were also pretty good.   There's not much food wise on Sundays-if there was it would have helped me stay a little longer since I definitely needed something solid to continue drinking.

reviews.author: William R.
reviews.description: Website said they closed at 6pm drove all the way up from San Antonio, I got here at 4:58. I Was told they were closing early for a private event, no signs posting they were closing early, nothing on the website. Very unprofessional and irresponsible for a business.

reviews.author: Andrea P.
reviews.description: I love this place and I don't come here enough seeing how close I live to the place. The staff is absoluy above and beyond awesome and fitted exactly for the place, the beer is hands down some of the best I come across with so much variety, I feel like I could make beer pairings with my food. The food trucks they offer are delicious.... And the thing that rounds it out is they are pet friendly! Bring your dog, or your cat, or maybe even your monkey... I dare you!

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: This place is great. The atmosphere is laid back and the staff is super friendly. I wish it wasn't so far from San Antonio- I'd go way more often. I loved the seltzer/ I can't drink beer because of a gluten intolerance so it's rad when breweries have other options, and even better when they make them themselves. 10/10- would recommend.

reviews.author: Jeanne P.
reviews.description: Tucked back in Hill Country Texas, Real Ale is like an oasis with beer flowing in a wine dominant river.   I've been a fan of their brew since stumbling upon in (sort of literally) while on a vacation to Austin. Unavailable in Louisiana, it was a refreshing change when I was really first getting to know all the various types of beer out there. Due to the generosity of a friend of ours, I get to have some every now and then when he travels here from Texas.  The brewery itself was a nice, functional building. A spacey bar and plenty of tables and games to enjoy in the cool AC, or you could hop outside on the patio and take in some hills and the occasional breeze. Picnic table outside and plenty of parking is available.   I tried one of their rotating IPAs on this visit, and it was a delicious and refreshingly smooth 6.something% tongue pleaser. It went down a little too smooth for the Texas heat, but who's complaining. On to one of my favorites, Axis, first time on draft. I was one happy girl.   Service was great, and I enjoyed watching the bartender interact with a first-timer. There were a lot of "beer guy" patrons, the type I love watching drink beer as they name off the flavors and the ages with a simple taste.   My hope is to make it back for the annual Real Ale Day in April when I can take in Texas *slightly* cooler, and enjoy being surrounded by beer guys, nerds, and geeks, tasting all the deliciousness.   Real Ale is definitely a place you should visit and give your taste buds a break from the grapes for a hoppy bit.

reviews.author: Claudia S.
reviews.description: We LOVE Real Ale! But the brewery itself is horrible. We have been here a few times and the last two visits we had it's been horrible customer service. We went today and the lady with the strip shorts is so rude and very unfriendly. We were there to celebrate a birthday but her shity attitude just ruined it for us to come back. So disappointed and we will not be going back.

reviews.author: Alicia K.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed the tour and then the brews! The stout was amazing, and  a flight of assorted brews was good enough to pick some faves! There was a food truck there the weekend we first went, so we hope they are there again tomorrow! The tour is a must! Our guide whetted his whistle with a brew while showing us around. Way to go! LOL

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Beer buds do yourself a favor and take a ride out to Real Ale brewery. I understand they recently expanded and even though their tap/drinking room is on the intimate side there is plenty of deck/patio area to enjoy your brew or their craft gin and/or whiskey cocktails. Real Ale has plenty of acreage for when they have special events. I heard from a regular that their anniversary parties are a must attend event.  Next visit I'll be taste testing their whiskey but this was a beer kind of day. I came in heavy with their Commissar Russian Imperial Stout offering. With an ABV of 9.8%, it's truly a sipping beer that is full-bodied with a nice dry finish. Plus one opted for a true summer ale, their Rio Blanco pale ale which was surprisingly flavorful. My last beer was their Axis IPA. I favor west coast IPAs but I may have found my backup. It has a perfect balance of hops and citrus flavors. Man, I wish we had a DD so we could have quaffed a few more draft options.   The barkeeps are knowledgeable, friendly, and will pour you s hearty sample when requested. Be sure to check out their production area it is quite impressive.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: Out of all the breweries I have visited in South Texas, this one seems to have the largest brewing capacity (but is also the LOUDEST).  One thing I didn't realize is that they also distill their own gin and whiskey via the Real Spirits Distilling Co.  You can purchase the gin and whiskey here, or you can order a specially crafted house cocktail if you aren't into beer.  This place is clean, up to date, and has friendly bar staff.  BUT, it is loud AF, and PACKED.  I stood at the bar for my first beer, and although I wanted to try a second beer, I just couldn't get over the loudness, and the bar scene.  I'd pick a quiet spot at the bar and then other customers would swarm to my area to place their order or mill about and hang out within my personal bubble.  I just don't dig that if there's plenty of other open spaces at the bar.  So, I fled after finishing my first beer. There are a few outdoor covered seating areas if you want a more relaxed vibe, but it was HAWT!!!  Most of Real Ale's beers can be found in a lot of grocery stores and liquor stores around South Texas, and they have a good variety of beers for each palette, so I suggest skipping the drive out to this brewery and just getting your fix at a local store or pub.  Parking is in a gravel lot and can be confusing. There's a "no entrance" sign before you drive into the parking lot, but I think it's supposed to be facing the other side street coming into the lot. Looks like it might have been turned around.  There's a collection of pictures of the character "Rerun" from an old sitcom named "What's Happening?" behind the far left side of the bar.  Ask your server the story behind that.

reviews.author: Kevin E.
reviews.description: Although the place appears to be cool from the road, The employees absolutely act as if they're doing you a favor for them being there. The people serving the beer are absolutely unfriendly and by the way the place is crazy about masks, even though everything is outside and the venue is outside they are extremely pushy about the whole mask situation even though it's not required anymore. So be prepared to wear a mask outside in the sun everywhere you go except for at your table, LOL, makes no sense whatsoever!

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Extremely impressed and proud of Real Ale for their expansion and how far they have come. Visited on a Saturday, on our way back from Wimberely. I have not been to Real Ale for clost to 9 years, so this was pre - expansion. Crazy to see how far they've come, and now they even offer spirits!   The tasting room is upstairs, but does have an elevator for handicap accessibility, which I did not actually see, I just saw the sign. The tasting room has a nice long bar, lots of picnic tables and clean restrooms. It's also nice and cool in here on a hot summer day. There is 2 tables right outside the tasting room, which is covered. You  can also walk around outside on the second level and look into the brewery or go through double doors past the bar, and have a birds eye view of the brewery. There is also some old school arcade games, FREE, that you can play!   We were able to catch a few chairs at the bar, and enjoyed a few beers. There is also seating outside, downstairs, which is covered and allows smoking. There was a food truck, which we did not eat at. There is also corn hole set up outside, and plenty of board games in the tasting room.  It did get loud, after what felt like a tour bus came in, but they were in and out so quickly, it didn't deter us from wanting to stay.   Real Ale is about a 45 minute drive N 281 from SA.   I love their beers, except all the sours... what was going on with that? Sour IPA? Never heard of it.. but maybe it floats someone else's boat. They had at least 4 sours on tap. They do offer flights of 4 tasters, or you can purchase a pint. The beer is poured at the perfect temperature! They do not sell beer to go nor do they fill growlers. But they do sell bottles of their Real Spirits whiskey and gin, as well as make craft cocktails.   The staff was very friendly and attentive. For a Saturday afternoon, we didn't ever have to wait long for help, even with as busy as it was.  On Saturdays, at 1 pm and 3 pm they offer FREE brewery tours, and you can take a beer on this with you.

reviews.author: Brandon P.
reviews.description: Just moved to the Hill Country and had to come check this place out! The beer was excellent! The beer garden is awesome and we had fun with our dog because there is so much space! Can't wait to spend more time here!

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: Really glad this place is close to the house. Some delicious beer coming out of this little local brewery. They have not only expanded to include some Gin but also have created some really good specialty beers. New beers rotate as do all breweries so make sure that you pick your favorites while you're here. A decent size picnic table area in the upstairs tasting room. Don't forget to say hi to Indy, the gray fluffy poodle-ish type dog that will greet you.

reviews.author: Elliott B.
reviews.description: Jumping back in time to before our stay in San Antonio, our stop by Real Ale Brewing (with the addition of Real Spirits Distilling Co!) in Blanco, TX was a very, very wise move.  The place closed at 6, and we got there just after 5.  Our time was short, but our visit was good.  The distillery folks had left for the day, so the beer heads couldn't answer all my whiskey questions, but they were still great to talk to.  Not only the bartender, but also the guys at the bar who'd gotten off shift and stuck around to enjoy the fruits of their labor.  The facility is tucked away off the main road, and rolling up to it is impressive.  It's BIG!  The bar area is up a flight of stairs, and it overlooks the bottling operation.  I knew Fireman's #4 was popular, but WOW!  They bottle a LOT of that stuff!  Major operation for sure.  Impressive sight, particularly for a craft brewery.  Keep in mind, Real Ale has been around just over 20 years.  They were one of the first big dogs in Texas craft brewing, and they started out much smaller than they are today.  This isn't a venture capitalist project - this is a success story built on grit and good beer.  I'll tell you what, though - as a whiskey and bourbon head, what really knocked my socks off was their new line of whiskey.  I expect little of new folks on the craft whiskey scene.  Many source product from Indiana or Kentucky, and it tends to taste the same - usually mediocre and sometimes downright bad.  Real Spirits Distilling Co was a passion project by the place's owner, Brad, and it tastes like a passion for greatness.  When you have all the stuff that goes into making whiskey already on hand to make beer, why not?  That would be one approach.  This takes it up a notch to, "Oh, and it's awesome on our first try."  I was very, very impressed.  I can't speak to the mash bill because they don't disclose it, but I seem to taste a lot of barley.  Not surprising, considering they make beer here...  :)  They don't use any rye in their beers, so I'm guessing zero rye, and I'll bet wheat is the other main ingredient.  Not sure about corn... if there's any, I'd guess it's not a lot?  I can't taste it, whereas most bourbon has a notable corn component.  (Note that their whiskey is NOT labeled as a bourbon, although they do use new charred American oak barrels.)  I'd love to know their mash bill...  I'll have to see what I can find out...  You can only buy the whiskey on site, and - like at all distilleries - you can only buy 2 bottles per month.  (Stupid rule.  Stupid lawmakers.)  So, knowing I live about 4 hours from Blanco and don't frequent the town, I naturally had to buy 2 bottles.  To be clear, I'm talking about their "normal" whiskey.  The single barrel sold out in a matter of hours when it was released in late April, I understand.  My wife loved her hef, btw.  We'll be back for sure next time we're in the area!

reviews.author: Angie W.
reviews.description: Was at a local bar one night a few weeks ago and they were doing a promotion for the Real Ale Coffee Porter.  After falling in love with it we took a drive out to the brewery to see what else they had.  Nice selection of beer and super friendly staff who helped with our choices.  We choice some beer flights and ended up getting a few six packs to the home.  Lots of variety and plenty of indoor and outdoor space.  Dog friendly!

reviews.author: Emily P.
reviews.description: We visited on our way back to San Antonio and loved everything about the beers! We had the gose, a sour, porter, moonwalk and axis IPA. So good! And all for under $30. The staff could be more pleasant...  Free arcade games to bring out your inner kid! Great outdoor area - fits everyone!

reviews.author: W C.
reviews.description: We went to Real Ale on Saturday afternoon when we were in town to go camping. We happened to get there just a few minutes before one of their tours was starting, and quickly hopped on after chugging down our flight.   The tour is interesting, but was a bit drawn out in our opinion (we liked the one that we did at Shiner a couple years ago better). The guide was a woman (yay for women working in the beer industry!) and she was very sweet and accommodating.  The tap room is kind of smallish, but it has a nice intimate feel to it. Major props for having board games available for your patrons! We've always loved Real Ale beers and enjoyed almost all of the different brews we had on our two flights. Our favorite, if we're remembering correctly, was the gose. Service from the bar was efficient but not memorably friendly. We didn't love that they had a massive television in there, but we guess it's a draw for Texas football lovers.  There's a food truck outside that looked good, but we just opted for some pretzels to hold us over. Our toddler was pretty well-behaved the couple hours that we were there, which always makes the whole experience more pleasant. Overall, definitely a must (in addition to the Buggy Barn Museum across the street!!) if you're in Blanco.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: I visited the brewery for the 20th Anniversary party. While it was wet, it was a great time. There are a lot of grounds so there was plenty of space for everyone who showed up. There was plenty of parking and so much room for people with dogs and kids. There were food trucks, live bands and tons of beer- ALL made by Real Ale. I honestly thought they only made about 10 beers. The party had 35 different ones, and that wasn't even all of what they brew! It was very hard to decide which ones to try with the 4 beer tickets each person was allowed.  I definitely recommend visiting the brewery! I am not sure how many beers they offer on their regular weekend hours, but they are all excellent, so you can't go wrong!

reviews.author: Lauren A.
reviews.description: So excited we got to visit a brewery on our way out to Fredericksburg! When pulling up, you aren't really sure about parking, but you can basically make your own spot and roll from there. There was a sign out front, but we weren't sure where the door was, so after walking around, we went upstairs into the tasting room.  When entering we were greeted by the bartender, who was helpful and educated us on a few of their beers. There was several other guest there, which is cool to see in the middle of a Friday.   I ordered a flight of IPA's- all pretty good flavor, a few were lighter than the others, but I would recommend the flight so you can sample several of their beers. Hubby snagged their Axis IPA and also a sample of their whiskey, which he enjoyed. We skipped tours, due to time. But their tasting room was roomy and had long tables which are good for groups and cool views of the property. I would recommend stopping here for some beers!

reviews.author: David P.
reviews.description: The best burgers, awesome drafts, and great pours. The staff is just friggin' Awesome! The bar is built for comfort. And those special people will understand. They have any and all the answers to make you hungry and thirtsy, with amazing musical stories, attitude, and the They Deliver! CHECK IT OUT! (And no, I don't work there...just a retired burger, beer, and tequila snob) Check it out! No snobby attitudes needed. Just be laid back, and enjoy!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: First and foremost, yay to a pretty great craft beer selection and knowledgeable pourers. Second, great patio space [esp for Lakeway], with some casual live tunes at times. Overall, a really nice place to grab a brew and chill.   Everything else: Food is very hit or miss, high $ for average/poor quality, service is also so-so sometimes, could be kept up a bit better.   Yep, 3 stars. I'll continue to return for the suds. Cheers!

reviews.author: Dhwanil S.
reviews.description: We were looking for a lunch place with patio open close by and this came up. We went there and we're amazed to see how big is their patio. Plus it was very nice and clean which is a plus.  We were greeted nicely and made to sit at their patio table in next few minutes. Our server was very good as the water came out fast and after placing drinks order it came out quick too.   For food we ordered brussel sprouts and fried cornbread as appetizers. Brussel sprouts were usual but corn break was too sweet than usual. Than we had aglio Olio pasta without chicken and it came out okay. Though I liked their chicken pesto club.   All in all, it's a nice place to have drinks with big outdoor patio, good service and decent food.

reviews.author: Gina H.
reviews.description: Honestly I really wanted to write a positive review but instead I got very sick off the food tonight and still suffering. When I return this time ithis time it's different I believe the managers are different and is now owned by someone elsomeone else. They know they no longer make the drumsticks like before now they have dried up, comma bad bad dark meat of low quality, comma instead of the succulent white meat of chicken they normally do cook. They served me a very old salad it was horrible I didn't even get to taste it the tomatoes were rotten and smell it was were rotten and smelled you could tell the salad's been in a refrigerator for a long time period period the hamburger was a $22 hamburger small I took a picture so everyone could see a $22 hamburger with little fries. I'm not a glutton I just don't understand why someone would raise a hamburger that high I know that meat cost a lot these days, but but if it is small let it be an amazing tasting hamburger and his hamburger instead of dried up. To my shock I wasn't planning to write a negative review until I got home with a bad sickness my stomach is still hurting I don't know if it's what I ate or the chicken tasted funky. I don't think I can return back to this restaurant ever again I find it to be shocking that these people were very nice to me this time around  and didn't understand Why I felt bad after 35 to 45 minutes still feeling bad is still feeling  bad stomach aches..Hope this helps everyone out there who understands that if you're gonna pay over $50 for a meal it better be a good one instead of a  stomach ache!! New ownership but not in a good way!

reviews.author: Khristina P.
reviews.description: Will have to say I'm sad to leave this review.  I LOVE the ambiance!  They have a great outdoor patio!  Could have an awesome outdoor bar too... service is horrible!!  Food comes out late, and wrong... sometimes cold. Wish they could fix that because it's a really Cool spot. I've been there 4 times and each time, The food and service were the same. :(

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: I recently discovered this place, a must try hidden in the back of shopping center. Food amazing  drinks are great and live music! How can you go wrong with this place?! Additional plus is their large outdoor lit patio.

reviews.author: Frank T.
reviews.description: What a ridiculous response by the ownership. It's very clear that the ownership of this place does not treat their employees with respect. A lot of your staff has turned over. Such a great patio that the majority of Lakeway will not go to because the owner has little man syndrome and talks down to his staff in front of customers. It's apparent now you don't take criticism very well. Re-read this a couple times and adjust your business instead of reading Dr. Seuss books.

reviews.author: Tony J.
reviews.description: First time visit. Nice restaurant. Too cold to go outdoor but it would be nice during warmer days for sure. Small kitchen and small menu with decent size bar. The food we ordered was very good. Smell of seafood overwhelmed the restaurant upon entry. Interesting layout where trays of utensils, etc from the kitchen come through the restaurant to get to cleaning room which is right off the traffic to the restrooms. Shannon was outstanding waitress!  In all, will return but it didn't become our go to restaurant.

reviews.author: AJ D.
reviews.description: Meh. Went for brunch and was underwhelmed by the menu. Very basic offerings. Also wife is obviously pregnant and waitress was pushing mimosas and drinks. Not a huge deal but kind of weird.   Got the breakfast club sandwich. One bread had burnt edges the other under toasted. Hot as heck outside and no lemonade or "refreshing" options. Again nothing concerning just off.   Wife got the "egg plate". Self explanatory. Not sure what I was expecting but wish I just went to Waffle House..

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: Fantastic restaurant!!! First time to this restaurant and we'll definitely be back.  Outstanding food and service!!   I had the BBQ baby back ribs and my wife had the salmon. Both dishes we're spot-on!! Super high quality ingredients with delicious homemade sauces. Salmon on a bed of creamy risotto and the ribs on whipped mash potatoes. Not your traditional dryrub Texas BBQ.  We had a few martini's "up" and they were perfect.  Very generous size...Shaken with little ice crystals.  We got to meet the owner Eric and he's a great guy that you can tell has tremendous passion for his business and ensures his guests are well taken care of. Real attention to detail for a small neighborhood grill.  Found out that the chef has two Michelin Stars and his food backs it up!  Finally, our waitress Shannon was as Friendly, kind and prompt as you could hope for.  Live music too!!  Great neighborhood spot!!! Can't wait for our next visit!

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: This was my first visit. They have a really nice patio where we could enjoy the sunset with social distancing.  Service was excellent. They have a very complete beer list which included a local breweries. I had a burger which was good, but not exceptional.   We had a really good time and we plan to come back.

reviews.author: Bill V.
reviews.description: 3rd time was not a charm. Instead of Hope and Thyme, more like Waste of Tyme. Was there on a Thursday night. Musician who was truly awful playing his music too loud. They tried to seat us at a table that had yet to be cleaned. Then we waited 5 mins for anyone to come by the table once we were seated.  Despite placing our orders right away, we learned 30 mins in that there were still 10+ dinners ahead of us and it would be more time. Best thing of the night was the waitress offering to cancel our order and close out our tab with our drinks only.   Our previous visits were OK but never lived up to any of the reviews we've read.

reviews.author: Adao J.
reviews.description: Great environment, taste food and delicious beer.   Really friendly staff is an addition to the delicious food and vast options of beer, drinks and wine.   The outdoor area is cosy with a great view. Also perfect to bring your dog to enjoy a brunch on the side of your best friend.

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: Tasty food, friendly and timely services plus good music. Very family friendly, especially at the patio.

reviews.author: Regina J.
reviews.description: I will never go here again. Bathrooms are broken and dirty. Food has gone downhill as the prices are higher. Issues with the New ownership relating to several things.

reviews.author: Pete C.
reviews.description: Great menu...lots to choose from and a great selection of draft beers  Ambiance outside dining under the live oaks is wonderful

reviews.author: C. J.
reviews.description: The overall quality of not only food but ingredients and recipes has declined drastically in recent months. The caesar salad dressing went from creamy and rich with anchovy, to a simple blend of olive oil and parmesan cheese. Brunch items consist primarily of store bought premade processed ingredients straight from HEB. Sitting outside long enough you will notice employees running back and forth with bags from the HEB next door as the restaurant runs short on supplies throughout the day. A simple stroll toward the bathroom provides a clear view of the pantry stocked primarily with Knorr mixes and highly processed precompiled ingredients. For example a $22 Eggs Benedict Entree consisted of store bought Thomas English Muffins, pre-packaged ice cold Parma Prosciutto, Ore-Ida frozen potato cubes, and "hollandaise inspired" Knorr Bearnaise sauce powdered mix (almost more powder than liquid sauce). The side of bacon I ordered was unmistakably signature Hormel fully cooked bacon drenched in liquid smoke and processed applewood flavoring. It is truly a disappointment to see a local staple that once emphasized farm to table ingredients transition to a business model that more closely resembles "frozen food aisle to table."

reviews.author: Tiffany J.
reviews.description: We had a great time this last Saturday at Hops and Thyme for a late Mother's Day celebration. I wish I would have gotten more pictures of the meal. Their outdoor dining area is so nice and the live music is great! All of their cocktails were great. We LOVED the Brussels sprouts. We got two servings of it. We also got the charcuterie board and fried cornbread and really enjoyed those as well. I had the aglio olio for my main and it was tasty. The bread pudding for dessert was a great finish! We met the new owner while we were there also and he was so welcoming. What a great neighborhood bar. We can't wait to come back to Austin to visit my MIL and go eat and drink here again.

reviews.author: chris w.
reviews.description: The Braveheart black and blue is one of my favorite burgers around Lakeway. The cooks know exactly how to do a perfect medium rare, and I highly suggest that.   Hops and Thyme have a great selection of beers to go with this awesome burger no matter what your preference is.   The patio is a perfect place to spend an afternoon munching on great food and sipping delicious beers.

reviews.author: Ann C.
reviews.description: This was our first time going to this restaurant and all I have to say is YOU HAVE TO GO!!!  The food was amazing, and reasonably priced for the portions you receive.  The atmosphere is awesome and the staff was so friendly!! And there is live music!!  We sat outside on the patio, and what a great time we all had.   We will definitely be coming back next time we are in town.  Thanks Hops and Thyme, well done!!

reviews.author: Tim S.
reviews.description: it was nice to get to a vineyard that was hospitable and had darn good wine.  We continued through our drive in the countryside south of Austin to the next vineyard, which was Driftwood.  after pulling in and walking down the trail to the main house we got in line to do a tasting.  actually my gal got a tasting, was happy to try a full pour of the Cabernet they have.   While we waited I took in the rooms that we were in.  It was a homey vibe with lots of small things to buy and others to just look at. The tasting was pretty good, but I took my glass of wine outside to the edge of what seemed the property as it dropped off sharply down a hill. There was some chairs there to sit and look out over the valley and that's just what I did.  it is a beautiful spot to appreciate the views of the wine valley here.  I could see the vineyards crawling over the hills on the other side.   There was a gazebo a ways to my right with a couple people people enjoying there wine there.  They had some classic rock songs going on the sound system which added to the relaxed vibe. I would definitely recommend going, and for sure enjoy the view out back.

reviews.author: Brien M.
reviews.description: OMG. Yes. Really. OMG  The wines are really well made, and although I favored some over others, I see why they win so many medals.  The tasting isn't inexpensive but the pours are generous and the quality is superior to many other wineries.  The staff was knowledgeable and friendly. The terrace view is panoramic and spectacular. I'm so glad I stumbled upon this winery again when avoiding I-35 back to Austin from San Marcos.

reviews.author: Katie R.
reviews.description: Absolutely horrible experience this afternoon. My review is similar to those before me. There is a long list of rules and policies posted at the front. The one policy not listed is one you will be yelled at for violiting and practically chased out of the building for. We went in with the intention or purchasing a wine tasting experience. The woman behind the bar was rude, as others have mentioned, and did not tell us anything about the rules. We received our pour and stepped away to sit outside since, while the website boasts table tastings, there aren't any tables inside. We were yelled at in an absolutely abrasive manner by two woman behind the bar. We were then informed that we were not allowed to take our tastings outside and come back inside for the remaining pours. They stated: "it's just too busy to allow that on the weekends". There were four other people inside. Busy? I think not. There isn't a sign anywhere stating you must remain inside for the duration of the tasting. The women were so incredibly rude when referencing a policy that isn't stated anywhere and that we were completely unaware of. It was humiliating and aggressive. So many other wineries allow you to taste at your pace and sit wherever you'd like. This was not the case. We were so thrown off by such atrocious customer service that we settled on a bottle just to get out of the building.   Hours later I saw one of the same woman chase a woman out of the building while yelling "excuse me, excuse me" because the woman had violated some other unstated policy. Chasing after and yelling at paying customers does not invite a relaxing winery experience.   We are local to the area and are members of two other wineries. We would have been back but my opinion of this "estate" winery has been permanently soured. Don't aggressively yell at customers in front of other guests and certainly don't chase them around your property. We'll stick to welcoming wineries with better tasting wine like Duchman, Bell Springs, Wimberely Valley, and Fall Creek. If you're looking for a great Texas winery skip this place and head elsewhere.

reviews.author: Aneesa K.
reviews.description: Carol was our wine tasting experience .  Super friendly, it was a Tuesday so we had the place to ourselves pretty much.  Beautiful area you can see the vineyard from up top.  Dogs welcome, to s of land outside for the doggies yo play in.   We tasted award winning wine from TEXAS grapes!  I'll just bet that when the temperature is a bit WARMER, and the sunshine's one would have a memorable time relaxing and enjoying a bottle or two  Some nibbles you can purchase, not a whole lot the time we were there, remember it was TUESDAY

reviews.author: Mary Ann C.
reviews.description: We made a quick stop at this winery and enjoyed the view while having a glass of wine.  I chose a jammy Cabernet called Lone Star Cab that was perfect. They do wine tasting but I just opted for a glass of what I knew that I would enjoy.    The cafe was not open but they had items that paired well with wine.  I'm sure it is busy in the weekend.  The Cafe is small so get your food to go and enjoy one of the many cozy spots to view the vineyards.   The staff were very friendly and the store was very clean.  They have gifts as well.  If we were in town longer, We would have come back for lunch.    The road to the vineyard is gravel so drive slow.  Parking is free and plentiful.  Follow the signs as the vineyard is about a mile up from the main road.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Gorgeous property...Hill Country vistas at their finest.  Lovely people running the place, too. The wine was fine but definitely not the sole reason to visit, so make sure you have a couple places you're bopping around to in the area. Cute little tasting glasses and there's a shop for kitschy items featuring a lot of wine puns.    I do think the crowd skews a bit older, so better suited for entertaining folks than a bach party!

reviews.author: Anna Q.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery 25 minutes from Wimberly! We stopped by during 4th of July and was surprised there wasn't more of a crowd. Strict 21+ policy (many signs warning you to turn back if you aren't 21!) but the servers were so nice and kind. We did a wine tasting which was $20 for 6 samples of white, red, and sweet wine. You can also split the sampling between people, which I shared with a friend. Server (I think her name was Julie) was so sweet and knowledgeable about the wine flavors and gave us recommendations and some history of the flavors. Our favorite was the Starry Night, or the Orange Muscat wine! A bit disappointed they didn't give chocolates or nuts during a wine tasting and overall felt a bit rushed through the process as more people showed up, but it was still a unique experience.   The patio has a beautiful view of the orchard, which is why we came here versus other wineries in the area. Outdoor seating is plentiful, many round tables for larger groups too. Definitely would've spent a good half of day out here sipping wine if it wasn't for the rain. The Bistro (food/restaurant area) was closed because of Covid so eat before you arrive so you don't get hangry or wine drunk! ;)

reviews.author: Hunter P.
reviews.description: No infant, children or teens? Seems like a great way to lose business... for sure won't be back here.

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: We were recommended this place by a friend so we decided to check it out. It is in a very remote area which makes it nice. They are on a hill so that the outdoor seating has a great view.  We got 2 tastings and for the most part I enjoyed all of their wines. The Alamo Red was great and so was the Longhorn Red. My wife enjoyed the Chardonnay as well. The servers were very helpful and help guide us to their more popular wines.   We ended up buying a couple of bottles and really enjoyed the experience and the view. We plan on coming here again soon!

reviews.author: Marty S.
reviews.description: The place is beautiful. They service when you get there is rude.  Showed no interest in serving or helping. From the immediate negativity when you pull up telling you all the tjhongd you can't do. No children no sports no smoking no sports equipment. Then comes unfriendly support staff they have are a trip. It's a shame place has great views.

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: The wife and I tasted a flight of 6 wines: including the Rose, Cab, Red Blend, Merlot, Sangovese, and Syrah.  They were all simply awful swill. Everyone of the varietals lacked depth, character and complexity.  Everyone of the reds tasted blah, and I mean blah. They all lacked the distinctive aroma and notes that each of the grapes are known for.  The Rose  lacked any minerality that one would expect, and was as bad as the others.  The tasting room experience was as bad as the wines. The server had zero personality or character either.  We came away with the same thoughts as we have from other Hill Country Wineries.  They should not, nor should they be attempting to produce well known wines, and in fact do a terrible version of Cabs, Merlots, and Chards.  They should stick to Italian varietals, as well as a few others that might be better suited to the Texas climate, even though most people have no idea about those varietals. I suppose its just marketing to attract people in to the tasting room, and once they get toasted enough it no longer matters, since once the minds fogs, its just pour me another.

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Visiting in the area for the month and have returned several times for the award winning wines and lovely view. This place is awesome if you want to sit back and relax while taking in the gorgeous scenery. Gary, who works the later afternoon shift was kind, helpful and charming--a big step up from the ladies who we have had over the midday shift.

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: This was the second stop on our wine tour during our anniversary celebration. The ambiance is fantastic and is worth the visit to just get a bottle and enjoy the panoramic views.   Pro tip: they do not allow children, so know that before you go. I believe most of the poor reviews are about this fact, but if you are prepared beforehand it will help with the planning.

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: The Napa or Texas! It's totally different I know, I know however it's a sweet little place in Hill Country. Bring a few friends and drink a bottle outside under the tree shade. They have a nice bistro menu to pair with your wine.   Prices are really reasonable $25-50 a bottle. Nice selection of whites, reds, sweets. Enjoy.

reviews.author: Tayo F.
reviews.description: The view. You gotta see the view. Especially as the sun is going down. My picture doesn't so it justice but it it was amazing. There is of course the other great things like the food, the outdoor lights they put on when the sun goes down and the wine is pretty good too but none of that compares to the view. You'll know it when you see it.

reviews.author: Trina G.
reviews.description: What a nice surprise. Wonderful place and wonderful wine. Make sure you stop in for a tasting, glass or a bottle to take home.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Second time coming here and have not been disappointed. There was a small wait for wine tasting due to limited seating inside. They wipe down tables in between people and staff are all wearing mask. Plenty of space outside for proper social distancing and enjoying some wine. We grabbed a bottle and ate at the small restaurant they have there. Would recommend you make reservations if you want a view. Service was great and food was amazing. My favorite was the pizza, don't remember the name of it but it had honey on it and it was the perfect amount of sweetness. Never thought I would like a pizza with honey on it, now I can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: Driftwood winery was our first stop of wine tasting of the day. The view was what sold me. Perfect for pictures!! They have an outdoor sitting area where you can admire the views and the bottle that you order is brought to you by a server who wears a face shield and gloves.    My group ordered a bottle of the 2017 Newsom Cabernet Sauvignon and we were pleased with our choice. It was not dry like a Merlot but just right. This winery does not allow you to bring outside food only the food offered in their bistro outdoor facility. This was not an issue for us.   Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: This was the best winery of the 8 1/2 I made it to in Texas. All of the wines had a, well let's just say, flavor I am more accustomed to tasting. Prior to this place, everything I tasted was a mixture of sour fermented grapes. Not knocking Texas wines but they are just not my style. Maybe it needs an ice cube. Every wine here, ones that I tasted, is 100% Texan and done the way I think it is suppose to taste. Also, the view from the estate is beautiful. Very worth a stop for tasting and buying.

reviews.author: Matouš P.
reviews.description: We have been club members here in the past, and really loved it. We went an 75 minutes out of our way to stop in for a tasting to see what peaked our interest in their current offerings. We loved that they have so much beautiful outdoor space. That is something that was always a major draw for us at Driftwood.   We called ahead, let them know we had a pup with us, and wanted to do a tasting. They told us to come on in. (It was a Monday and the place was very slow)  Upon arrival they told us they will only to tastings inside? What? In the era of COVID? As for the dog, they said one of us could do a tasting.   Between the lack of customer service, unfriendly attitude, and most importantly lack of outdoor tastings we will never bother to come back. WAY too many options with just as beautiful of grounds, equally great wines, safe tasting environment, and more importantly good customer service.

reviews.author: Aneesa K.
