reviews.description: Gorgeous property, fabulous restaurant.  Huge outdoor property to sit and enjoy the view.  Dogs welcome!  Big plus.

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: This winery is so beautiful, I could live there.   The views are breathtaking, and the main house is absolutely impressive, I was so impressed with the property I had to explore it further on my own.   They have been operating since 2004 and turned the former residence into a tasting, event and sales space. The sunroom and patio are perfect for enjoying a tasing or a bottle of wine among friends.   I actually sampled all of the wines on my visit to the vineyard, of course my preference is red, but I found many of the whites quite refreshing. Although the pool is no longer used for swimming, it makes an excellent backdrop, stop in and set a spell! Cheers!

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Beautiful location next to an Italian restaurant (they aren't affiliated). We got food from them and ate at a picnic table outside the winery. We tried two whites and a red, fairly inexpensive for a glass of wine. I think I paid $6-$8 per glass.. and they were all delicious! The only struggle is to find a place to sit during a weekend.. took a bit of patience before we got a spot. Dog friendly outside, too :)

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: I'm a huge fan of the property and how much green space they offer and the nibbles offered are quite tasty (especially the truffle fries). I'm not weeping with joy from any of the wines but they're easy enough to drink.  It's particularly lovely for violet crown sunsets, so save it for your last stop if you're making the rounds in this neck of the woods.  They don't have any ice, which I find supremely odd being that it's Texas and they serve white wine! If you want to keep your wine chilled while sitting outside (they've got plenty of gorgeous trees to provide shade but shade is not a wine bucket!) the only way to do so is to drink it real fast while thinking cold thoughts.

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: This is a must-stop on your wine tour and where we began ours! The architecture alone is a photographer's paradise and the wine is wonderful.   We were a little disappointed to hear that, as of our visit in May, they weren't doing tastings due to Covid because I do think it can be done safely and would've made for a better experience. Otherwise, you either have to buy a full bottle or multiple bottles if you'd like a well-rounded understanding of their wines. We opted for a blend that we absolutely loved, described on the bottle as a "patchwork quilt of grapes." It was honestly worth every penny--so delicious!   We took our bottle and glasses outside onto the expansive lawn which is just perfect for picnics. They have lots of shaded tables under the old growth trees.   Perhaps for safer tastings they could serve them "beer flight" style with the informational flyer and direct you to sit outdoors so that you can still experience a handful of their wines without breaking the bank? That would make it a 5-star experience for me!

reviews.author: Elizabeth D.
reviews.description: Lovely area and great tasting menu. They have lovely picnic tables outside to bring your own snacks or enjoy their pizza or charcuterie boards alongside bought bottles. I just wish they had some music playing it was very quiet like pin drop quiet. I feel as though that might add a more comforting ambience. However we enjoy it very much and the restaurant near by looked spectacular

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: Duchman is one of my favorites around the area. The winery is simple and small but has an European charm.   I've done the tasting before and also just purchased wine by glass. Both are delightful. Tasting is nice for first timers to explore a variety of wines Duchman produces. Because of the tasting, I was able to find my favorite red and white wine of theirs. And for $10/tasting, it is such a steal!! (Price may have changed. This was based off of 2018). After my first visit, I just opt to get a bottle or glass of my favorite red and sip it on the patio taking in good wine, views, and company.   My friends and I always love to end our Hill Country winery trek at Duchman and drive over to Salt Lick after for good ol Texas BBQ.

reviews.author: Natalie G.
reviews.description: Decided to discover wineries on a Tuesday without realizing that most of the wineries in the area are closed. Landed at Duchman's on accident but feel like we found the best one! Kate was friendly and very knowledgeable. She made our experience amazing and we look forward to returning. Took home a bottle of Progression 2!

reviews.author: Lisa L.
reviews.description: The winery is beautiful and the wine is ok but we didn't find the staff to be very friendly. We ordered two snacks and both left a lot to be desired. The watermelon was soggy and smooshed up. We tossed whether to bring it back or not, and finally I did. The girl brought me another one which was fresh. Why serve me the nasty one first?? Unfortunately our experience wasn't good.

reviews.author: Peyton M.
reviews.description: My friends and I had the pleasure of doing a wine tasting with Andrea. The wines tended to be lighter which was perfect for a hot Texan day in July! Later, we had a ton of fun chatting with Javier and some other staff while enjoying a bottle of their finest. Very fun time here and the entire property is beautiful!   The wine tasting was $17 per person.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This was actually one of my favorite stops in our Driftwood wine tasting day. This particular winery has outdoor picnics for groups and benches for smaller groups for one to buy a bottle , bring some of your own food and enjoy their wines. During this pandemic time, this is the perfect scenario to drink wine while still practicing social distancing.   They do allow you to use the restroom with mask wearing enforced for you to go inside the building.   Their wine was light and refreshing. We chose  a white wine.   If you go near the end of the day you enjoy a nice sunset followed by lighted trees giving you a Christmas vibe. Up until that day , I never knew that Texas had a winery side like Driftwood but places like Duchman Family Winery proved to me that they do exist and they have really good wine too. Highly recommend you make a stop at this winery.

reviews.author: Ann R.
reviews.description: What a LOVELY VENUE! Absolutely adored our wine!  The staff was knowledgeable.  They aren't doing tastings due to Covid but u can buy a bottle and drink on premises.  We probably would have bought more if we could taste, we usually do.

reviews.author: Ren D.
reviews.description: Before our visit we were so excited to visit this place. It was a nice place out but if we felt ignored. They really have poor customer service. I had a review but it was taken down by yelp for whatever reason, I was so surprise when from rude employee message me on my yelp apologizing personally, and apparently there was a guy anonymously message me regarding my review to be reposted. Eventually found they are working together and engaging me on whatever conflict they have. Thus, proven that they really have poor customer service , very unprofessional.I wont be surprise if they will ask yelp to take my review down again.

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Not doing wine tasting due to COVID while others in the region have all started doing it. Even glass options would be good...but you can only buy bottles. Tried the rose and it was good. Made from locally sourced Sangiovese, which was a nice plus.

reviews.author: Afshin D.
reviews.description: I live in California and only an hour away from Napa. I wasn't expecting anything close to what one would experience in Napa. However, I still wasn't fully pleased.   The only way I can imagine that someone would really enjoy it, is to bring your own picnic and use their outdoor seating area. This is of course conditioned on the weather and also whether or not there is gonna be any bachelorette party there during your visit. (We saw two when we visited and they were so loud and they had overtaken all the outdoor seatings)  We tried their tasting. It was only $15 which is relatively cheap. In Napa you pay 2-3x more than that in a good winery. They let you choose your own 5 wines out of their selection or go with their recommendation. The tasting overall was okay, nothing that I disliked and at the same time nothing wowed me. I'm not sure if I'm gonna go back there, but it was worth to try it once.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Nice stop just outside Austin for a wine tasting! The outside setting is very cool, spacious front lawn and some tables/chairs for hanging out. Dropped into this place for a quick wine tasting, consisting of 6 small pours of wine. The whites we tasted were all very smooth, not overly sweet but just the right amount of smooth and dry. Definitely recommend sampling all the whites if you have time, you won't be disappointed!  We didn't go check out Trattoria next door for food, but have been there in the past and pretty good Italian food, pairs well with the winery.  If you come here and the weather is looking good, you can expect a very scenic, picturesque spot to spend some time at!

reviews.author: Natalie L.
reviews.description: Awful. Went here for my 21st birthday celebration with a small group of friends. We were completely respectful and there for a wine tasting and there were rude remarks made about our age and backhanded comments along with nobody taking us seriously or serving us promptly.

reviews.author: Carol B.
reviews.description: Over priced tasting . $17 tasting for very small pours of 6 wines . No water in tasting room. Had to go get it yourself . No crackers or palate cleansers . If it was a free tasting I wouldn't care as much . When I made reservation I was specific about food and was not given accurate info. You are not able to order food or eat during the tasting. Food only available to purchase after tasting was over. Servers poured wine on top of previous tasting . Missed poured twice . Server changed frequently and not consistent. They obviously are not organized to keep track of what wine we should be on . Huge red wine fan( live in Europe for 6 years ) was not a fan of  any of the reds . Surprisingly liked 2 of the whites, Beautiful atmosphere and building . A shame the tasting experience doesn't match . Could be so much better!!

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: Duchman is a great winery to visit near Austin that makes great wines.  I've recently been on a kick to learn more about and try Texas wines.  I've tried wine from several different Texas wineries in the past couple months (all purchased from wine stores) and Duchman is so far my favorite.  I prefer red wines and my favorite Duchman wines are the Aglianico and Sangiovese. Since the winery is so close to Austin, my husband and I decided to visit.  The grounds are beautiful - the perfect place for a picnic.  I appreciate the precautions they've taken due to COVID-19 too.  You can't go into the building (though they will let you in if you need to use the restroom), so they are set up outside selling wine by the bottle and require everyone to wear a mask.  There is plenty of space to picnic and social distance.  They sell some picnic meals on-site, but we brought pizza from Pieous, bought a bottle of wine, and had a lovely time relaxing at a picnic table in the shade.  I highly recommend visiting Duchman.  I'm happy there is a winery that makes great wines so close to Austin.  Even if you can't do a tasting during COVID-19, it is still worth the drive to drink wine in a pretty setting!

reviews.author: Alice R.
reviews.description: Really beautiful property. We wanted to go to Salt Lick and wanted to find some other activities in the area so came here for a tasting before lunch. They do $15 for 6, which is pretty good, and was offering 5% off your total bill for following them on Instagram.   There's some beautiful benches set up outside to go with your glass of wine. It unfortunately seemed to be drought season when we visited so the actual grape plants were pretty bare. Once you step inside, there's a small room where the tastings happen and the shop where they sell bottles and all kinds of souvenirs. There unfortunately wasn't any seating indoors so we had to stand the entire time. If you walk in more, you can see barrels and label making rooms. Wish they had given us more history during our tasting but it was fun nonetheless.   It was pretty easy to get an uber out here from the city but be warned getting an uber out here may take a little while.

name: Revolution Spirits
address: 12345 Paul's Valley RdBldg G and H

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: A great little distillery for those looking to escape the hordes at Jester King.   The service here is top notch, if it's your first time they'll present you with a complimentary mini-flight so you can sample their entire range. Right now that consists of gin and various liqueurs. I wasn't a fan of the liqueurs, but the gin is an absolute steal at $35/bottle (not available for purchase on Sundays!)   They used to have a few BBQ offerings, but sadly that's gone now. While the space is dog friendly, the outdoor seating is relatively small. We were planning on bringing our pups, but I'm glad we didn't...both the parties out there with us brought their dogs and it would have been 6 pups in a relatively small area.  Drinks range from $8-10, and they regularly rotate out flavored slushes, absolutely perfect for Summer. If you go on a busy Saturday afternoon like we did, you're better off going inside and ordering from the bar.

reviews.author: Alvin D.
reviews.description: good drinks, good food, good folks!  so I first came here on a Sunday and was disappointed to learn that I wouldn't be able to buy any bottles - so came back the next day!  but that first visit got me hooked. once we sat down we had a little baby flight presented to us...I've never had a gin this good at room temperature. it was so surprising! I was also really intrigued by the damiana, and generally enjoyed the cocktails we tried. also, was pleasantly surprised that the kitchen food was also quite good. all in all if I lived here I'd hang out on the weekends.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Too much fun great energy from everyone! Group of friends had a sampling on a beautiful Texas day. They have lots of options and cool gifts inside! Owner was present and great energy and knowledge! We had a great time then sampled cocktails! Beautiful hill country retreat for a great time and buzzzz!

reviews.author: Charlene P.
reviews.description: I've been here twice and I have to say they are just the nicest people! The sprits are amazing as well. Cocktails are very well priced. Stop by. You won't be disappointed!

reviews.author: A E.
reviews.description: This is a chill place. Tried to go to Jester King down the road (and didn't get to, for the 2nd time in a row cause it's always so damn busy) so decided to go here instead. Glad we did! They were very attentive to us as soon as we came in, and we loved the complimentary tasting flight. Ended up buying a bottle of the coffee liquor we can't find at the liquor store. And I love the virgin pineapple drink they made for my toddler. Matt was fantastic! Very attentive, not pushy. Good vibes all around.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: It's gin and gin cocktails. Not my thing but since I drug hubby to wine tasting had to give a little. Nice space indoor and out. Friendly staff. Dog friendly. Hubby and other patrons raved about the cocktails.

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: This just a covid update. These guys are the shnt when it comes to keepng their customers safe. Frequent sanitizing, rejecting anti-mask morons, and STILL they providing kick ass service and product. They've recently added food service and arguably have some of the best bbq in the area. If u haven't been, ur missing out BIG time.

reviews.author: Anastasia D.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this place after a visit to Jester King on a Sunday. There was no one there, creating both a serene and deserted vibe. The tasting was free, while the cocktails were in the $8-10 range. The gin, coffee liqueur and pecan liqueur were amazing! However, because it was Sunday, we couldnt buy bottles, which was very disappointing. The cocktails were a bit of a let down that didnt let the spirits shine. The best was the gingery take on a White Russian. The service was very friendly and attentive, yet again, we were the only customers. I definitely recommend picking up a bottle of their gin and liqueurs if you can find them!

reviews.author: Tim G.
reviews.description: Upon walking in they gave us a flight to taste their liquors. This place is a hidden gem and will soon explode. I'm so happy to have experienced this place. Their home made liquors and sodas made for a great day. But then they had amazing food. BBQ 2 lb turkey leg awesome queso. The only issue I had was that I couldn't try more because I was driving. I will be absolutely making this a reoccurring stop.

reviews.author: Ray R.
reviews.description: Love the drinks and now BBQ available! Outdoor seating with heaters. Had several  hot and cold cocktails, all were fantastic. Brought home excellent brisket, ribs, and chili con queso. Amazing what these guys are doing here.

reviews.author: Maria M.
reviews.description: Excellent gin - we bought a bottle with their homemade tonic as well and it an absolutely delicious. The tasting was a pleasant surprise!   Free cocktail and tasting was included with a stamp from Jester King down the street, so glad we stopped in.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Stopped by after checking out Last Stand and I was really impressed by what these guys are producing here: High-quality gin and other spirits, and beautifully crafted artisan cocktails. These folks are some real artisans who are passionate about the craft they're putting out there.  Now is a great time to be in the Austin with so many talented chefs, artisans, and craftsmen putting out some really great products out there! There's no doubt in my mind that Revolution Spirits will soar into greatness.

reviews.author: Elaine M.
reviews.description: Visited here on a Sunday.  We loved the super friendly staff and the spirits too!  Upon entering the tasting room they asked if we had ever been before.  When we answered no they immediately brought over for a tasting - no charge.  We enjoyed most of the different offerings.  Then we picked out some cocktails to enjoy - both with their gin.  Daughters was with grapefruit and mine with cucumber.  We also purchased a cheese plate which we were told was made up for them from the local grocery store.  Nonetheless, we enjoyed our cocktails out on the picnic tables and had quite a lovely time.    Not being from Texas we were unaware of the law prohibiting liquor sales on Sundays.  We certainly would have bought a bottle if  we could have.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: We hit the jackpot when we found this place. Not only is there a liquor pretty good, but the staff is super nice. The area is pretty small, so it's not ideal for big groups, but don't let that deter you. After our tasting, they offered us a free cocktail. If you're a fan of coffee, you must try their cafecito or chocolate cafecito spirit. My favorite was their gin. If you like mezcal, try to their gin reserve in mezcal barrel. Definitely a must when you're in the area

reviews.author: Aparna B.
reviews.description: While we were sipping our ciders at Argus pondering about where we should go next, Revolution Spirits popped up on Yelp and so we of course headed there without any second thought!  This place is really amazing!! There was quite a bit of crowd as it was saturday but we were still given a great deal of attention during our tasting! My favorite was the cafecito coffee liquer and the chocolate cafecito. They're so good, that I could probably drink an entire bottle all by myself!  The best part of this place is the amazing people who own/work here and they didn't even charge us for the tastings and also gave us a free cocktail made with their gin!! So as appreciation from our end for all that they did and shared with us, we gave a nice tip :)!! Definitely, going to look for Revolution on my next trip to Spec's!

reviews.author: Sarah W.
reviews.description: You have to come here - if you have never had a gin you can sip room temperature without a mixer, you have never had a good gin.  Beautiful floral gin, wonderful amaro, and the most amazing other items.

reviews.author: Suzanne H.
reviews.description: Its sooooOooo smooooth. Gin is excellent and tasting is generous! The guys are informative and friendly. My only complaint is the place isn't air conditioned...but Gin= EXCELLENT, SUPERB, LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!

reviews.author: Chris C.
reviews.description: Avoid the crowds, get the good stuff.   This place is small, but the selection is pretty solid--everything from fruit liquors to their flagship gin and several mixers. Best of all there was no need to pay $$ upfront for a tour--just walk in and start tasting and talking.   The gin was the standout here, but all the stuff we tried was excellent except for their own cherry-limeade mixer--that was kind of a letdown, but the alcohol itself was great.   Can easily walk from here to Last Stand Brewing and Argus Cidery. There was a food truck outside as well.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Everything was done right - great customer service, clean flow for visitors, and the quality and uniqueness of the distilled liquor itself was great. To elaborate, samples were provided for the different options of their distilled liquor while an explanation of the flavors was provided, which was particularly beneficial for the 100 proof gin such has notes of grapefruit, lavender, and juniper. They also have a coffee liquour which is 50 proof, so a bit stronger than the traditional but still very sweet and flavorful. Even after the tasting, it was a nice place to hang out and was well ventilated and shaded.

reviews.author: Cait K.
reviews.description: Excellent local distillery!  My favorite alcohols were the gin and cafecito; also, the tonic they use (Springwood) which I had in a GandT I ordered after the tasting is also locally produced and top-notch.  The cherry on top is that the distillers are extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  Will be visiting again soon.

reviews.author: Shane T.
reviews.description: We've been twice and the place has a cool vibe. Friendly staff. Great cocktails. We will be back.

reviews.author: Saliba Q.
reviews.description: The head Distiller gave us an awesome tour, we had a ton of fun being walked through the steps of Andalusia Whiskeys creation. Thanks Moose!!!

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: Great venue, whisky and service.   Unique styles of whisky so well worth the visit.  Try the flight so you can sample all their styles.  Single malt so more like irish or scotch whisky vs bourbon.

reviews.author: Trey R.
reviews.description: A great tasting room experience.  You can try flights of their whiskey or try a specialty cocktail.  Even though they only make whiskey, their "white dog" (unaged whiskey) makes a great base for a wide variety of drinks.  We had a jalapeno margarita, blueberry margarita and a mule.   The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and helpful.   All this based on award winning whiskey.   A must visit if you're out in the hill country.

reviews.author: Kayla S.
reviews.description: We had a great experience today at Andalusia. The property is very nice, and the whiskeys are each very unique. We ordered a flight of 5 and a flight of 4, so we could try one of each of their 9 products. Each one had very complex flavors, but my husband loved the Revenant Oak and Stryker. He had an Old Fashioned and I tried an Irish Coffee. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly.

reviews.author: Lisa R.
reviews.description: Love this place and the owners! Margarita's and old fashion are great! Hubby likes the Andalusia white whiskey.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: We went in for the first time and found a very helpful staff. Good whisky flight. Very nice crafted cocktails. Pleasant atmosphere.

reviews.author: Vanessa B.
reviews.description: This place is a MUST!! The people there are so helpful and cool, the cocktails are amazing, and the vibe is so laid back yet fun. We stopped on our way south and enjoyed a few cocktails. Highly recommend the margarita!!! And the cucumber cocktail is refreshing on a hot day. Definitely worth stopping here!!

reviews.author: Jeanne P.
reviews.description: It's a little slice of whiskey heaven in a land of wine.   We discovered the distillery on a girls' trip to hill country recently. We had a large group, but the bartender was not bothered with us at all. She made some great recommendations. I opted for the Bloody Mary as I'd never had one with whiskey before. It was flavored perfectly.   The ambiance is a classy casual - be sure to check out the cute little room in the back. I grabbed a comfy chair and perused the book selection, finding some really good reads. I could see myself setting back there with a cocktail and a book for hours.   I would highly recommend a stop here for something a little different than the wineries around you.

reviews.author: Tiffany S.
reviews.description: I love the blue barn!   If you like whiskey and you're in the area, you need to head over to Andalusia for a tasting and ask for Riki. Make sure to stay for some amazing cocktails as you chill on the patio. ***The Old Fashioned is incredible and so is their Irish Cream! I can't wait to return during my next trip to Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Todd P.
reviews.description: This place was a breath of fresh air. Riki was an absolutely delight. Fun and informative. Moose took us to the smoking room to see the wheat being smoked. Fun, relaxed and great products. There is nothing like these smoked whiskeys. Go, you will be glad you did.

reviews.author: Shonda M.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Came here for the first time with a group for a friend's birthday and it was amazing! The space isn't too large, but it's comfortable and clean. The staff is super friendly, too. The cocktails are reasonably priced and you can buy bottles to take home.   We were here on a Saturday afternoon and it was chilly outside so we stayed inside, but there was a nice seating area outside. There was also a really wonderful Bluegrass band upstairs that was playing while we were there. So here are 2 levels, but the second isn't really accessible when a band is there. Totally worth having the band play, though.  Definitely will be back at this place. We are all from Austin and it's a super easy drive to get out here. Great for people to add to their winery tour.

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place.   I came here on Tuesday around noon (before my flight in Austin), there were only one other customer there, so I spend a lot of time chatting with the bartender.   I did the the 4 tasting, with two additional tasting of the Reserves. My favorite is the Stryker and Stryker Reserve, they are just a heaven in a glass.   The environment is very relaxed, there are couches inside and patio seatings outside.   I would love to bring my friends here next time when I'm in town

reviews.author: Stephanie P.
reviews.description: This review is for the actual whiskey (Texas single malt). Due to the Covid virus, only curbside is allowed. They also sell hand sanitizer (smells delightful - like whiskey) by the gallon, which was a life saver for my friends business. Smooth, rich flavor. I drink whiskey neat - and this was pretty perfect.  Real Irish style single malt whiskey  Can't wait to try the rest!

reviews.author: Cesar R.
reviews.description: Oh boy, this is going to be my favorite place to visit when I'm out in the Texas Hill Country!  New to the Wimberly area Andalusia is a welcome addition focusing on Whiskey and helping break the overpopulated brewery scene.  Step inside and head directly to the bar I suggest ordering the Whisky flight to familiarize yourself with their three very distinct spirits.  Done in the Scottish tradition their Peated will remind you of a well balanced Scotch while the Stryker will flood your senses with mesquite, oak and apple wood much like good BBQ.   Once you decide which of the three you like order your cocktail and wander around the beautiful space or sit outside and enjoy the scenery. My favorite cocktails were the Whiskey Mule and the Cherry Cola.  Holding the fifth star until I try the food which I hope will be soon.

reviews.author: A F.
reviews.description: Happened to stop here in the way to Real ale and glad I did. Charming atmosphere with lost of cocktails on the menu. The team work here are super friendly and really make you feel at home.  Plenty of sitting and setup in the back as well as in the second floor. Great place to meet friends and relax.

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: Had a great time at their 3 year anniversary party. Highly enjoyed bottling my own barrel strength whiskey!!

reviews.author: Lou Ann M.
reviews.description: It was wonderful news to hear that Andalusia was opening back up. Sounds like they have several restrictions still for social distancing however we will be able to get our cocktails again. The owners are doing everything to meet the requirements. We will be there this weekend. We cannot wait to see your friends again.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: If you want REAL TEXAS WHISKEY then look no further. This place is doing it right and intends to keep making fine whiskey. Follow these guys on Facebook as they expand. You will hear from these guys more often.

reviews.author: Juliana M.
reviews.description: I am a frequent and long time customer. This weekend we visited and owner Ty Phelps was there. My daughter accidentally knocked over a drink while coloring. Ty cleaned up the spill. When we were getting ready to leave I went over to talk to him. He said he didn't have time to talk to me even though he had just finished talking to another customer for 10 minutes. He said he didn't appreciate cleaning up my daughters s""t and "maybe this wasn't the place for me"  Apparently it is not because I will never go back. I was a loyal customer and encouraged others to go but never again.

name: Old 290 Brewery and Restaurant
address: 4064 W US Hwy 290Carter Creek Winery Resort and Spa

reviews.author: Marcy N.
reviews.description: Love it! Had a great weekend here! Great food and great service. Tatum in the restaurant provided exceptional customer service. Taylor at the bar made great recommendations and gave great service. Alison and Viv in the tasting room are so knowledgeable about wine and made our experience great! What a wonderful weekend. Good beer, good wine and great atmosphere and service. Rooms are comfy and very private! Love it.

reviews.author: Kaye C.
reviews.description: We stayed at Carter Creek so of course we had to try the on site restaurant. The chicken Alfredo was excellent with lots of spices and flavors that you don't normally get with such a basic meal. The stake frites meal was incredible.  The sangria was good but the waitress said all they do is open the bottle and pour it in your cup so that just made it seem much more expensive than it should have been. It was nicely flavored.   The open seating to listen to live music was wonderful. Very comfortable with cornhole and Jenga games while you wait. There is a large pavilion and lots of open areas to hang out in. Great place to spend a lazy Saturday evening   Unfortunately, the spa is not open still which was disappointing.  The front desk said they're having a hard time finding employees for it.    We had room 1710 and it was very nice.  The only downside is that you have to walk down a rickety set of stairs and then through the mud to get to the room from the parking area.  The room itself was very nice and clean. The bed was comfortable and they did a great job of having the room stocked for us. Overall, a very nice place for the weekend

reviews.author: Mandy L.
reviews.description: A good place to stop for a bite. On weekends they have live music, and a great courtyard to hang out in around sunset. As for the restaurant, the service was great - fast and friendly. The food was average. Not bad but not worth the price tag. The pizza seemed to be the best quality for the price.

reviews.author: Stephanie C.
reviews.description: Very nice spot in the Hill Country for lunch on a perfect day.  We discovered this establishment with an online search on Yelp.  Old 290 is located within Carter Creek Resort, just west of Johnson City.    The menu was varied to appeal to both younger and older palates.  Nice cheese  board as well as the Texas Twist with soft pretzel, cheeses and bratwurst.  A wedge salad was also fresh with a delectable dressing.  None of these menu items required much culinary effort, but the ingredients did not disappoint.  The burger was not impressive, as the meat was lacking in flavor and the bun was coated in something similar to an everything bagel - not traditional burger material.  Truffle fries were tasty.   Prices on the lunch menu seemed a little steep for a family outing.    We sampled a hibiscus hefeweizen and a brown ale aged in a bourbon barrel.  I recommend trying both.  Most excellent brews.  Lovely location and nicely appointed restaurant/brewery.  Outdoor dining area was covered and overlooking the grounds.    Only restroom area is outside the restaurant at the front entry of the resort, according to the waiter.  Perhaps that was a mistake.  It's a short walk, although not completely covered.  A restaurant with high-end finishes and  no restrooms inside is puzzling.  I wonder how customers would manage the trek on a rainy or snowy day.    Understaffed restaurant, but understandable under current conditions.  Hope the kinks are worked out soon for this pleasant family-owned resort/winery/brewery/restaurant.

reviews.author: Chassey W.
reviews.description: Had a great dinner with friends on their outdoor patio. It was the coldest night this year yet in Texas but they had plenty of heaters. We had chili, salads and the Brussels sprouts...all delicious. Inside, they had a live band playing good music but not overpowering. On site brewery and wine. Looks like a great venue for a wedding reception. The place is huge. And hands down, the best server I've had in ages...Kimmi. She was attentive, personable and obviously loves kids. Even though they were short handed, she didn't crumble under pressure. Sorry no pics of food!

reviews.author: Lisa H.
reviews.description: Loved loved loved this beautiful stunning venue. The food was all on point and the atmosphere was outstanding. We had charcuterie boards, pretzels, ribs, and pizza. It was all outstanding. The "oakmeal" beer that I sampled because I thought it said oatmeal was terrible

reviews.author: Lisa O.
reviews.description: I am shocked how upscale the food is at the Old 290 Brewery. I ordered a gluten free mushroom burger with goat cheese, and it was the best burger I've had in years. The chef is definitely top notch and serves exquisite food. They are so short staffed during covid, that even the chef served our food to our outdoor table.  The staff came around to light the outdoor heating lamp but it burnt out after fifteen minutes. I think it might've run out of gas.

reviews.author: Balcones Village A.
reviews.description: Disappointing at Best.   More along the lines of overhyped and not worth the time or money.    Walked in at 2pm on a Saturday excited to order a glass of wine and enjoy a nice meal.  We were told they weren't seating.  Side note:  The place had a number of other tables with menus and staff taking orders.  They close at 2:30 for a mid-afternoon break(?).  Option provided by staff:  Go to the Smokehouse and sit on a bench and eat.  We were starving otherwise this option would not have been considered.    Ordered at Smokehouse and it was DISGUSTING.  If you are smoking beef in Texas it should be at minimum edible.  Ordered a brisket sandwich and bbq tacos.  Brisket sandwich was all fat and no meat with a disgustingly soggy bun.  Fat swimming in bbq sauce.  Absolutely revolting.  Tacos, same.  Fatty, drippy and translucent meat substance in a mini stale tortilla.    Definitely overpriced.  Fast food and gas stopover giant, Rudy's does such a better job!  Seriously, not worth the money for what was served: crap in a paper hotdog basket.    Onward to Hilmy Winery to pickup our quarterly wine allocation.  No need to let a dreadful lunch ruin our afternoon.  I really wished we had passed on this badly needed substance stop.  Hilmy flock allocations had a wonderful pairing!   So glad that we barely chocked down the Smokehouse offering.   The pairings were awesome.  We won't be back to Old 290.  Too many other great places in the Fredericksburg area.  Only good takeaway here was the bag of Miss Vickies potato chips.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: We are currently staying at the Carter Creek resort where the old 290 is. We went for dinner this evening and were blown away. For drinks, my husband had the pale ale, and I had the rose. Both excellent. For dinner, the kids had the pizza and chicken strips and my husband had the burger, while I had the Tri Tip Dip. The burger was cooked perfectly and the sandwich was a new twist on a classic that I order often when we dine out- this is the best I've ever had. To finish up, we ordered both the chocolate torte and pecan pie. The pie had orange zest in it...a surprising but delicious addition. The best part? The yard in the picture I'm attaching. The kids ran around while we enjoyed our beverages and enjoyed live music. The pricing was fair, service quick and luckily they were able to get us in because I made the reservation via open table for the wrong night (the hostess said it happens often so pay attention to the date when making yours!)

reviews.author: Preston T.
reviews.description: Fine dining prices without the quality or experience to match. The food was just okay. My wife and I ordered the $27 shrimp pasta. You can get a much better comparable dish at an Olive Garden or Chili's for half the price. The service was nothing spectacular either. We saw our server maybe 3 times throughout our meal, and had to flag them down each time to wait on us. For these prices, you expect better.

reviews.author: Marvin C.
reviews.description: Definitely recommend this place!! Beautiful atmosphere and amazing staff... Thank you Steven for making us feel welcome and wonderful customer service..

reviews.author: Lisa S.
reviews.description: It was a great evening. The outside was nice and cool with lights and heaters. The food was amazing. Desserts was go good. Had. Prime rib. Stack house burger. Flat steak. Pecan pie and bread pudding.

reviews.author: Agustin Y.
reviews.description: I had to give this place a single star, i am sorry but the five stars it has on yelp is very misleading, must have been artificially inflated by employees or family members or paid russian bots because the food was ok and the service was a complete catastrophe. I think it is unfair to others that trust and have confidence in yelp. I have had some amazing undeniably amazing meals in San Francisco, Chicago, Phoenix and Miami with the help of Yelp, i felt bamboozled sitting in the dining room of the Old 290 Brewery. I understand covid has taken its toll on the industry, take out tables reduce capacity if you dont have the kitchen staff to properly serve all the guests. Our server Josh was triple sat with our table being the fourth he did a great job of explaining his game plan and he waited on his section as it was one large table, i applaud his effort. All of his tables had issues and he was never going to catch up and there was no evidence of teamwork whatsoever. A vast amount of tables received their appetizers and entrees together and and salads and entrees at the same time. I assume the restaurant has a manager i think it was the woman dressed like she was going to the Kentucky Derby she spoke to a table and brought the table water but you could tell she didnt care she just wanted to talk to the regulars, she really enjoyed the sound of her voice we called her Julie from the love boat through out or meal. I understand restaurants like this only care about the regulars that like to name drop and ask if chef/owner/president  is in... that is why i made this review so not another traveler, vacationer, honeymooners, birthday revelers (us) dont fall for the inaccurately described and awarded restaurant. The food was decent the steak tasted great and was perfectly cooked Pittsburgh Rare but there is no way to absolve all the inequities the front of the house presented. Take this review with a grain of salt

reviews.author: Bailey T.
reviews.description: Happened upon this place after our planned restaurant was too busy and we were on a time crunch. Beautiful location although tucked away off the freeway. We didn't even know it existed until google directions told us as we were heading to a winery in Fredericksburg.  Staff was very friendly and efficient. Place is clean, esp the restroom. Food was good. We had iceberg wedge salad, flatbread, Cesar ssalad, tuna salad. Everything was great except tuna slices were from a bag.  Aside from the restaurant, there is a brewery and housing- resort type set up and venue for weddings. Will try again.

reviews.author: H T.
reviews.description: Great outdoor patio for dining. We sat outside each time we ate here. Caught the live band on a Saturday night. The food here is excellent. We tried several things but our favorite was the Angry birds (boneless wings) great flavor and amazing crunch on the breading. The ribs are also good and the tropical mimosa on the brunch menu. We also had the chicken sandwich and a pizza they were both good too. If you are staying at the resort make sure to grab dinner here at least once. The staff is very friendly and attentive.

reviews.author: Kendell C.
reviews.description: Holy crap! This place is the best. Ethan, our server, could NOT be more helpful too. Great beers, great service, clean bathroom- you can't lose here!

reviews.author: Natalia L.
reviews.description: What an incredible winery  with such knowledgeable personable staff. Located on such an extraordinary piece of land. Me and my husband each did a wine  flight and picked our favorite sips and ordered a glass each which we enjoyed on the fabulous patio.  I love that with every flight purchase included is a souvenir wine  glass. Flights and by the glass were very reasonable given the type of wine  served.  We ended up enjoying our time so much that we came back an additional day.  I highly recommend this place to anyone looking to sip on some delicious wine .

reviews.author: Marlen G.
reviews.description: Went on a day out with my husband and was so pleased with this Wimberly Winery. We had to wait about an hour for their food and in the meantime we had a glass of Astoria Moscato and watermelon wine on the porch. The weather was perfect and this created a whole mood. We then proceeded to their wine tasting room and tried some of their best wines. I've got to say the Astoria Moscato was their best. At least for those who like sweet wine. My husband liked many of their dry wines as well. Definitely going back with the kids so they can pet the donkeys in the neighboring pastures.

reviews.author: Shirley R.
reviews.description: This place is so beautiful! Heads up though, make sure you make rezzies for the tastings, we didn't and were unable to since they were fully booked that day.  However, do not fret if you didn't, because the grounds are stunning. You can order a glass or a bottle, no judgment ;), from their double decker bus, that gave me some serious harry potter vibes. Then take it and enjoy the view. There is ample sitting. I would love to come back with reservations of course, and try a flight in their beautiful tasting room.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: Had such a wonderful time here, we went on Tuesday via reservation and were the only ones there until noon. Plenty of outdoor space to social distance along with animals to interact with: donkies, goats and miniature horses! A decent selection of wines with one standing out in particular to our taste-buds, can't remember the name specifically but it was red wine cherry blend, maybe seasonal?   The staff is friendly, place was very easy to find, there is a bit of construction going on in and around the place but it's not too big of an annoyance to take away from the overall great experience.

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: I truly enjoyed my visit to Wimberley Valley Winery. This was the first stop on my wine tour for my anniversary weekend. The tasting reservation process was pretty easy. The tasting price is very fair (5 glasses for $18) and the pours were generous. The wines were very good. I left with a couple of bottles. I definitely recommend the Christmas Cuveé and the Sangria wine. Once you finish your tasting, there is plenty of space outside on the patio or other areas to just sip more wine and just be.  A lovely experience.

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: This is a cool place! I'm glad I had the opportunity to visit here. I'd like to come back and try the tasting.   The outdoor seating area was nice and very spacious. I did like the outdoor patio and the arrangement of all the things. I enjoyed the red wines that they had. I really liked the season fruit wines--tasted like juice with how fruity they were (I mean that in a good way).   The food truck also served some pretty solid food. Really enjoyed the chili and cheese tator tots. The pizza was good too! The burger was a little disappointing though.   All in all, nice place to visit! Come check it out!

reviews.author: Kelli N.
reviews.description: Visited this winery today and enjoyed everything about it! The wines were better than expected and the ambiance was terrific. What I really didn't expect was the fantastic food. Finding something a gluten free vegetarian could safely eat and enjoy was beyond my expectations but wow did they surprise. Best gluten free veggie I've ever had! Lovely afternoon here, we'll definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: I was looking for something Covid safe to do outside and to get out of the house. This winery has plenty of space on the grounds to distance safely from others. We made a reservation for a tasting. Well worth it to learn about the types of wine. The staff is knowledgeable and nice. It is a comfortable environment and you can ask many questions. After the tasting we ordered a glass each and went outside. We ordered a pizza from the mobile kitchen. It was wonderful!  I suggest going on a beautiful day and enjoy wine, good food and sunshine!

reviews.author: Eric W.
reviews.description: We went wine tasting with a group of 5. The collection was big and the server was very inquisitive, informative, and kind. After our hour of tasting 5 wines, we bought two bottles and went out to the property to enjoy the day and the live music. We had a perfect spot beside the musicians (who were very very good) and had an amazing view of the property. I was at peace with all the elements in place. I will be back, bringing family, and enjoying a bottle here and there.

reviews.author: Mahwish S.
reviews.description: This is my second time visiting this winery. I loved it the first time and it left an impression on me to go back. Because of Covid, they are doing tastings by reservations only so that they can control number of people and properly space out in their tasting room. I'm sure you'll love a bottle to buy and you'll have ample time and space to enjoy it on their deck or yard after your tasting. Our tasting guide, Robert, was very knowledgeable about the different wines and a joy to converse with! They do have a good truck on their premises that bakes wood fire pizzas. I didn't try any this time because we already had brunch before coming. The port was my favorite wine. You've got to try it for yourself!

reviews.author: Gloria G.
reviews.description: This place is beautiful. Our first time in wimberly. We had such a great time, so peaceful. The live music was great. She kept it PG for the babies. The manager was walking around greeting everyone. The employees gave us suggestions on where to stay. Over all great experience.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Made a rez (required) a day in advance and was prompted seated for my 45min tasting! I decided to go with 5 TX wines to try, and they did not disappoint! My server gave super generous pours and timed it accordingly. Because I'm a slow drinking, I had the last 2 to enjoy in the spacious courtyard area. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Brittany D.
reviews.description: What a great find!! I recommend the wine slushies! Watermelon was my favorite however the red reserve one was not bad either (more dry). They have a food truck on-site which has delicious thin crust woodfire pizza. We got the Lexus of Lactose. Atmosphere was great and relaxing. Definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Betty O.
reviews.description: The Host was friendly, knowledgeable. Bathrooms clean. Beautiful building. Food Truck available. Need good GPS.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: We just moved to the area and recently took our out of town guests to this charming winery...what a treat! The wine was pretty good ( i mean it's not Napa, y'all) but the ambiance, scenery and people are amazing! The tasting was very reasonably priced and the tasting room is full of gorgeous local art. The grounds are stunning with mini horses to pet and love on and plenty of photo ops. Definitely put this place on your Austin wi

reviews.author: Brett J.
reviews.description: A year later and Wimberly Valley Winery is just getting better!  Our friends are members here and we joined them to go out and pick up their wine. While we were there we had a tasting.  They now have a full line up of "fruit" wines like Blackberry, Cherry and cinnamon, honey crisp apple, and others. They are on the sweeter side but for me were seriously tasty! I loved the cherry and the blackberry.  However at this time of year it is the mulled wine that truly wins the day for me! If you haven't had mulled wine I suggest you get off your butt, drive the distance, and sample some right now! It is so worth it!  A hearty and loud Ooooh my Goddie toooo Hottie to this wonderful glass of spiced wine that is served hot! It brings flashes of warm fire places, deep snow, thick sweaters and holiday cheer with every sip. It is my absolute favorite!  They are adding more structures to the location, the outside area is a divine place to grab a bottle and just sit and soak up the outdoors while enjoying a good sip with friends, and the inside is a great lush environment of comfy lodge like decor.  It is a great location with good people and a great selection of wines... not only theirs but a plethora of other wines as well. We always enjoy our time here!   One last note.... try the mulled wine! It is the holiday season in a bottle!

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: This place was definitely a one and done. There wasn't anything bad about our visit but there wasn't anything great about it either. They don't even use Texas grapes so these are all from out of state and only a handful are barrel aged. They were basic and not anything special. We came for a tasting so we tried a total of 5 different wines each (10 between the two of us.) They even serve store bought wines here!!! I've NEVER been to a winery that serves what I can buy myself at HEB. They didn't tell you anything about the wines other than "this is dry and fruit forward," no explanation of the grapes used, how long its aged, etc that we've become used to at other wineries. Also the alcohol content must be very low in thier wines, we went on empty stomachs and neither of us felt a thing which is not the case at other wineries we've been to. I'd give it a try if you're in the area, but don't expect much. The grounds are nice and they have a cute double decker bus they converted but for us one visit was plenty.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places EVER!  I'm a member so I go as often as I can, their member benefits are amazing. My niece and nephew love taking carrots for the horses and donkeys and kicking the soccer ball around. The venue is just beautiful and even when their are tons of people there it just doesn't feel crowded, the layout is perfect.    The wine is top notch. I  like sweeter wines so most on the menu suits me but they have some dry wine as well for folks who love a dry red or white.  Slushes in the summer, warm spiced wine in the winter, fruit wines in the fall ... this place has it figured out!  Grab a Cheese tray and hang out for an hour or stay all day!

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: We came here for our anniversary and we loved it! We'd never done anything like it before, and we were not disappointed! And honestly how often do you see blue wine???

reviews.author: Carly H.
reviews.description: Drinks were good but service was poor. Server Gabriel said we had a bad experience because he works for his ex and that we could leave a review about our "shitty experience" on Yelp. Welllll, here I am. When we walked out we got to speak to the owner and realized our tasting came with a complimentary wine glass that the server didn't provide. Owner brought it out, thankfully. Place is beautiful but had a better experience at other wineries because of service.

reviews.author: E R.
reviews.description: Good pours, tasty rum, a lovely shaded deck to sit out on, and congenial staff. Perfect spot for a quick cocktail or a wind down and a nice chat.

reviews.author: Pam S.
reviews.description: Great spot to enjoy a drink and relax! We arrived on a Thursday afternoon. Bartender greeted us warmly and talked to us about the rums are made. I appreciated feeling welcomed in spite of the lack of traffic in the out there location. We ordered drinks and sat among the trees on their awesome deck for a bit. My husband bought all three varieties when we left. Worth a visit!

reviews.author: Raymond J.
reviews.description: Been here twice now and really just stopped this time to get their bourbon filled chocolates for my guests on our drive by.  Great place to seat and enjoy the outdoor country view and have a drink.  Sample their Bourbon and have some chocolate filled Bourbon.  Come visit this place when you are near by

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: During a recent car club event, I called Cypress Creek from a restaurant in Wimberley to tell them our arrival was eminent. The lady on the other end of the call was quite nice suggesting they had PLENTY of space for our cars to park.  Well, they weren't wrong. Quite possibly the best photo opportunity of the entire weekend. Our attendees overlooking 24 cars perched in the beautiful trees of Hays County overlooking some of Mazda's genius. Free samples of crafted rum too?   I'd call that a win! Owners were quite attentive as soon as we arrived. Telling us the story of the brand; walking us through each tasting. Some drinks were ordered; maybe a bottle or two bought. Not sure we were the most receptive group being on a car tour in the Hill Country. Service was excellent!

reviews.author: Jazz C.
reviews.description: The rum was delicious! The guy behind the bar was so nice and welcoming. It's a great place to relax and enjoy a delicious drink! There's lots of outdoor space perfect for social distancing.

reviews.author: Dolly S.
reviews.description: Such a nice staff.  We were i Impressed by his knowledge.  He was very compliant the tasting was good they serve 3 different varieties we enjoyed the vanilla. The gentleman was very helpful for other things to do in the area.

reviews.author: Dustin C.
reviews.description: Tucked away behind Wimberely mear Jacobs Well stands a small distillery with a small bar and large patio.   They offer free samples of the three different whiskeys with one of them being bourbon barrel aged using Rebecca Creek barrels.   The staff was friendly and well informed on the products. Currently they are distributing to smaller local stores and will start distributing to more stores in the future.   As it is August right now we couldn't tour the distillery because it was too hot but we were informed that the tours would start in October when it cools off.   The bottles are decently priced for hand crafted rum like this.   There are plenty of tables and chairs for groups, drink cocktails were decently priced, and property is a great change from the city.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: We found this place on our way to Jacobs well. This place has great drinks and a great atmosphere. The rum is  very good. We did not take the tour, but it is offered. They have a food truck on site. Their mojito was refreshing. They even let me be part of the cocktail making process. The owners were super friendly. For those that want to taste before buying, they offer free rum tastings.

reviews.author: Rach C.
reviews.description: We made lots of stops in the area and this was by far my favorite! We made it about an hour before they closed and the guy at the bar was so nice and welcoming. The patio area in the trees was beautiful and they had this nice swing. I had the drink with the pineapple and vanilla rum.....sooooo good! It was so good my husband grabbed a bottle so we can drink it at home. If you're touring the area i would recommend coming here early and just enjoying the scenery and the lovely conversation with the guy at the bar!

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: I cant' say enough good things about this place. It is in the middle of Hill Country, and it was our last stop before heading home.   Personally, I'm not a big rum drinker, it is too sweet for me, but it tastes great in mix drinks, and they have some  great and fancy mix drinks here.   Swing by and hang out on their patio, it will be great!

reviews.author: Samuel V.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. Not only do you get to enjoy some very delicious rum, but the scenery is beautiful. My fiance and I really enjoyed getting to hang out on the raised deck and just relax for a little while. The guy at the bar was really polite and knowledgeable. Will definitely come back.

reviews.author: Kelsey D.
reviews.description: Give these hard working folks your money! The rum is delicious, affordable and local. The owner gave us a quick, free tasting so we could decide what kind of rum we wanted in our cocktails. Do yourself a favor and spend an hour or two sitting on the gorgeous upper deck catching the breeze and catching a buzz!

reviews.author: Mallory M.
reviews.description: Family run rum distillery. We visited on a weekday and were the only ones there. Great customer service! If you like rum, then this is definitely worth checking out for a tasting!

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: The vanilla rum is fantastic. Perfect place to spend the afternoon to relax and have a drink. Patio sitting is great. Lots of shade

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: Laura guided my boyfriend and my tour through the distillery.  She tries to schedule them so each party has a separate tour.  It's a really nice touch, because it shows they aren't trying to blow through tours by combining as many people as they can into one group.  The tours are $5.  We emailed her to set ours up.  We started with a tasting.  Laura had bartended for several years before the business started, so she made us a Vanilla Rum mixed drink in a sample cup.  It was nothing short of delicious.  Absolutely fantastic drink.  Atfer that, the tour started.  Laura explained how the business started up, showed us the distillery and explained all the functions, and then showed us the bottling room.  She answered all of our questions and was very personable.    We concluded the tour with 1 more sampling of their normal rum combined with a mixer.  Again, a totally refreshing drink.  We stayed and talked to Laura for about 20 minutes after and were on our way.  This was a great experience.  It's a humble distillery with a growing presence.  They've won a couple of major awards and you can definitely they definitely love what they do.  Makes for a really enjoyable tour.

reviews.author: Katy B.
reviews.description: This place is the cutest, most quaint little gem.  If there's a local distillery, I always want to try out their goods.  I didn't expect it to be at someone's home, though!  Not that it's a bad thing.  Rum, for me, is a take it or leave it type spirit.  I typically use it only in cocktails.  I don't think I've ever wanted to sit down with a glass of rum.  Now bourbon?  That's a different story.    On arrival, I just expected a tasting only, but they actually make cocktails.  They have a small menu, or you can request whatever you want from the mixers they have.  Mojito?  Of course.  Want to go dive with a great rum and just some Coke?  They won't judge you for that, either.  They make their own version of Rumchata in house and it was SO DELICIOUS.  For real.  And they'll give you the recipe.    Pick your favorite of the three varieties: Crystal, Gold, Vanilla and buy a bottle.  Then pick up a bottle of vanilla extract.  If you don't cook, make your mom very happy.  That stuff is fantastic.  In the hotter months, don't be a jerk and demand a tour of the actual distilling barn.  We all know how distilling works.  If not, the internet is your friend.  They don't want to be in the high temperatures, and neither do you.  Let them explain the process to you while you sip a nice, cool drink instead.

reviews.author: Lindsey C.
reviews.description: Stumbled upon this little gem by accident when we were looking for a winery, it was a happy find! Friendly people, good rum, and a good deck! It was a little expensive and no tours are offered but the tastings are free which is a nice change to the other places we have been.   Make sure you try the vanilla rum and take a turn on the tree swing! My nephew loved it.   Wish they would have more signs.... the first was easy, then we were feeling lost.

reviews.author: Michele G.
reviews.description: The best part of this distillery is the location...a country vibe that is beautiful. Now for the bad news...The rum is a strange flavor. I have been to other rum distilleries and have never stumbled upon such a "harsh" flavor that could never be drank alone. That being written we decided to have a drink on the patio...I'm glad alcohol kills germs because the guy serving us had the dirtiest hands and fingernails I have ever seen in my life and I have children. For example when he grabbed our glasses from the cabinet it left a dirty grip mark. I was pretty much grossed out. It's too bad because again the location is great.

reviews.author: Deji M.
reviews.description: How sweet is David, distiller, maker, and bottler of Cypress Creek Reserve? Let's examine the facts:. -- He led us through a tour of his small but highly functional distillery. -- He answered all of our questions about the process he uses, and even showed us some of the machine parts he's made. -- His wife made us two (nicely sized) tasters: a mojito, and another thing I drank even faster than the mojito that tasted like a lemon drop.  $5 each later, we skipped right down to Wimberley Valley Spirits to get ourselves a bottle, because the law is mean and David can't sell any of the goods on the premises.  Stupid Republicans, or something.  Now we check out our unopened souvenir, plotting and planning, totally giddy that we pulled into that questionable-looking lot with the signage for rum. Who were we to say no?

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: This last Friday I went to the distillery to taste their rum. All three of their rums are VERY tasty. I purchased a bottle of the aged rum. The owner's daughter-in-law (I can't remember her name) was very friendly and very knowledgeable on the rum. She made the tasting fun, and I highly recommend anyone in area to go visit. I know I'll be back!

reviews.author: Josh F.
reviews.description: Deepa made planning a rehearsal dinner from almost 5 hours away a breeze; helping me find a caterer and having the whole event go off without a hitch. Karen and Neil were extremely attentive and made everyone feel right at home. The wide variety of Texas craft beers, wines, and meads absolutely blew everyone in attendance away and we can't wait to go back to try the beverages we missed.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: Who knew there was such a thing as mead but the wonderful girl behind the counter helped us with choices and filled us with lots of knowledge.  My parents were staying at the cabins at onion creek right behind this place and when we stopped I saw a dog inside so I called my parents and said meet us up here and told my husband whoa we gotta pet that dog!  I enjoyed the bead as I had never had it before and loved the inside decor and how the place is set up.  Cozy if you want it, outside on the patio ( not for us since it was raining) up at the bar or in large tables.  If you're in the area its definitely a must.

reviews.author: Liana W.
reviews.description: I definitely recommend this tasting room!! It's right around the corner from Salt Lick and Duchman winery and definitely worth a stop!   We got a cider/mead/wine/beer flight (4 tastings, one of each).  Very cool interior design. A hidden gem- I hope you all try this place!

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: This place was ok. Didn't love it. Didn't hate it. My husband and I stopped in on a random day date through hill country on the way from Desert Door (excellent).

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Been here twice  and both times have been impressed with the variety and quality of their choices for wines and beers. Staff have been knowledgeable and friendly. Prices reasonable.  Met the owner tonight - really earnest, smart and nice guy. Only downer- Geeks who drink trivia. Absolutely despise it. Awkward format, unintelligible announcer, questions relevant only to the very young.  Won't be back for that.

reviews.author: David G.
reviews.description: Big ups to our new friend Jamie and his new place Hill country.  Very quaint place with two stories and plenty of samples for the beer drinker or wine drinker.  Your husband doesn't like wine?  No problem.   They got beer.  And plenty of it.   IPA's and Hefeweizen's will greet you at the door.   Family and pet friendly place. We will be back for sure.  Thank you for the awesome graciousness.

reviews.author: Kami C.
reviews.description: This is a great little place for wine or beer. They have a nice selection of great Texas wine and beer and the owner is a really nice guy.

reviews.author: Tracey N.
reviews.description: We are from the area and stumbled upon this gem.  The owner/bartender was outstanding and the place is out of a Pinterest page.  We bought a few bottles and hung out for a few hours.  We will be back and recommend this spot to anyone in the area.

reviews.author: Trent W.
reviews.description: Big fan of this place. Brand new building and very well cleaned and kept. We were greeted with great hospitality by our bartender. I had never tried mead before and was offered a tasting of it. We ended up having beer flights from their great selection. Perfectly located, close by to Salt Lick BBQ. Come to this place and try for yourself!

reviews.author: Cathy R.
reviews.description: We had my husband's 50th birthday party at Hill Country Tasting Room. Deepa was so helpful with coordinating all of the details. We met beforehand to plan where to place the food, decorations, and talk about special drink offerings. The staff was super friendly, went out of their way to make us feel welcome, and made it a very special night. We had a party of about 25 and the space was perfect! Would highly recommend and will definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: An oasis on RM150. Sort of in the middle of nowhere (for now), this place is a welcome sight for the people in Hill Country who like to drink. Beer, wine and mead only in a warm industrial space. The service was very accommodating, however not as knowledgeable as I had hoped, given the selection and the many questions several of us had as we tried mead for the first time. Prices seem to be a bit high considering we aren't in downtown, but it's a place we'll visit again.

reviews.author: Coby C.
reviews.description: Great selection of beer, wine and mead. The staff is very friendly. The environment is nice. We will be back next time we are in town. Thanks!

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: I loved the staff but they clearly don't want to pay for air conditioning!  Otherwise I would come back in a heartbeat!  Wine is great. They also offer beer, ciders and Mead!  If they don't realize that AC is important they won't be in business long!

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: Came out to Driftwood Tasting Room while we were on our winery "date day". We met the owner Lindsey and she was so sweet and knowledgeable. The venue is right of FM 150 in an industrial space with a great atmosphere. I highly recommend it for a date day, couples trip, or any kind of party. Locally owned and all products are sourced from Texas! Total perk -- super dog friendly!!

reviews.author: Susan D.
reviews.description: Hill Country Tasting Room is a wonderful find - I strongly recommend it! We rented out the entire venue for our rehearsal dinner, and it was absolutely perfect. We had ~50 people with an outside catered buffet dinner, and the venue was the perfect size - it still felt intimate during the speeches, but there was enough room for everyone to sit, eat, and mingle. The layout worked really well for us - for dinner, people could sit and eat on both the ground floor and mezzanine, and for speeches people mingled on the ground floor while the speeches were held on the landing. We love the atmosphere there - a combination of industrial, rustic, and chic that totally matched the vibe we were going for!  Planning was a breeze too - first Lindsey and then Deepa were both so accommodating and answered all our questions. Especially compared to some of the other venues I was talking to, Hill Country Tasting Room responded so quickly, kindly, and didn't mind when I asked a bunch of questions! I would definitely recommend them for hosting an event.  The drinks themselves were also amazing. We loved that it was all Texas beverages, and there were so many options! We were so glad to find a place that offered such a wide variety.  On the actual night of the rehearsal dinner, the bartenders were so helpful - I even got comments back from a couple of guests stating how nice they were! I can't wait until our next visit to the Dripping Springs area - we are definitely going back!

reviews.author: Joseph F.
reviews.description: Driftwood Tasting Room is tucked away in Driftwood, an oasis, but was a great stop! The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the selections they were carrying and they were able to make great recommendations based on our tastes. They have reasonable prices, they were in line with the other tasting rooms we had visited during the day. Their concept was awesome! Their selection is from local craft breweries and wineries and rotates between different companies. They also had the beverages available to take home if you found one, or more, you enjoyed.

reviews.author: E. A.
reviews.description: Two friends and I went to Driftwood Tasting Room and asked to do a wine tasting. The only employee there, Antonio, said the tasting would be $8 for four tastings. The menu had a long list of beer, mead, and cider as well as wine. We asked if we could mix and match the tastings between these drinks, and the employee said yes. We then asked, several times, if this would still be $8 for the tasting. He again said yes. When we went to pay, we discovered that our bill came out to more than twice that amount. Apparently, the tasting was not $8. He told my friends that we received full pours, and that's why it was more. Here's the thing, WE DIDNT ASK FOR FULL POURS; we asked for a tasting. The employee took it upon himself to give us the full pours, which we did not ask for and shouldn't have had to pay for. We left upset and confused as to what happened. One of my friends went back into the establishment to discuss a refund. We didn't want to all three go in and cause a scene, since the man was kind to us, we just wanted to remedy the situation. Apparently, he reexplained the full pours THAT WE DIDNT ASK FOR and then offered my friend $10 out of his pocket. She felt guilty about this and didn't ask for compensation for the other two of us that did a tasting. I repeat, tasting and not full pour. I'm not sure why he would offer us his own money instead of trying to correct the problem initially. Maybe he knew he was wrong? Or maybe he just wanted us to go away and not complain? I really don't know why he would do that. We discussed it more and felt upset about the whole situation and how it was awkwardly handled. It was a damper on what was supposed to be a nice day out. I decided to contact management through the Driftwood Tasting Room's Facebook page the next day to see if we could be fully refunded for the employee's mistake. I explained everything to the manager, Lindsey Pierce, who, of course defended the employee. I understand this, and I have nothing against the employee, but a mistake was made and I wanted it corrected. I didn't mention the $10, since it went to my friend who spoke to the employee. Apparently, this gave the manager reason to believe that I was lying. She said that my friends could contact her for a refund and I could get one after I returned the $10 cash, which I didn't even get, but ok. I mentioned how she was treating me like I was lying and like I was a criminal for complaining about what happened. Lindsey Pierce then THREATENED to take me to SMALL CLAIMS COURT for SLANDER for writing this negative review. All I tried to do was express my dissatisfaction and try to get a refund, and the manager treated me so impolitely and with such disrespect. I would never want to go to a place where the management treats a customer so rudely. There are better places down the road where the servers charge you what you expect to be charged and the managers are polite and genuinely care about your experience at the winery. I'd avoid this place at all costs simply because of how the management treated me when I tried to explain what happened.

reviews.author: Erika B.
reviews.description: Great place! Just a short, scenic drive out in Driftwood. Owners are friendly, knowledgeable, and welcoming. A great selection of local craft beer and wine that you cant find anywhere else in the area. We will definitely be back and highly recommend to anyone. Must try the Oocheenama Ale or the Mads Red Wine.

reviews.author: Marcy R.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem and definitely a much needed place for the growing area. It has huge potential and I hope they get enough business to stay in business! I live nearby and it's a nice place to grab a drink. Beautiful interior! The glasses of wine were a little pricey compared to the nearby vineyards but everything else seemed reasonable. The guy serving my friend and I was super friendly and helpful I hope they continue to have great service. The only things I would recommend would be to maybe add a couple TVs without sound on to keep some of the guys happy should there be UT games or golf on. The bar is a beautiful spot to hang out. I'd also recommend having some nice big glass jars with some pub mix or nuts in that folks could purchase by the scoop and maybe even a cheese/meat plate or some olives. It's a great hidden gem for us who live nearby to be able to have an upscale bar with great local beer and wines. And sometimes someone in a group doesn't want wine so it's nice to have the options! Something for everyone. Hopefully eventually a food truck or some dinner pairing event would be fun. I have seen some really cool events advertised on fb but haven't had a Chance to make it in to one yet. I will add as I have two kids I wouldn't recommend this a place for kids as there isn't really an outdoor space. A great date spot or place to meet friends for a small birthday. Bonus would be to add a happy hour or special pricing for driftwood locals!!

reviews.author: Lukas S.
reviews.description: We spent a weekend at Lucky Arrow for a friend's wedding. It was such a great experience!  Space: There was so much space that we never felt like we were on top of each other. Everything was kept neat and clean, too.   Staff: The staff were all so friendly and accommodating with requests for more fire wood and such.  Amenities/Rooms: SUCH nice bedding with ample room in the courtyard cabins. Loved having the hot tubs too!

reviews.author: Mandy B.
reviews.description: Sadly was not what we expected.   Nice place, poorly managed. Checking in was chaotic as I prepared for a wedding and we we left with no breakfast or coffee like we were told.

reviews.author: Eva Z.
reviews.description: PRO: Good interior decoration.  CONS:  Poor management, poor service and communication, unpleasant noise from Air Conditioning.   We booked a Lucky Arrow cabin via Trip.com.  Shortly after the completion of payment, we received a confirmation email from Trip.com with a receipt attached.  "Please show your confirmation number and PIN number to the reception." " Check-in after 16:00."  " 2- person breakfast included." We later found out that none of this information was correct.   (1) When we arrived at Lucky Arrow Retreat around 7pm, there was no reception to be found and we were trapped outside a closed gate. We tried the PIN number from the email, it turned out to be incorrect. I called Lucky Arrow a total of 8 times and sent a message to an "assistance number" printed on the lock of the gate. No one answered the phone. We were stuck outside the gate for 20 minutes and very frustrated. While we waited, there was no reply back from Lucky Arrow. We almost drove to Austin to find somewhere else to stay. We eventually got a text message back asking our names and gave us the instruction of how to unlock the main gate and our reserved cabin.    After we got past the main gate, we found there was literally nobody managing the property. We did not feel safe staying here due to the lack of any assistance from them if there is any emergency going on during our stay.   (2) There was no breakfast despite what was advertised.
