(3) The exit gate remained OPEN when we were leaving after self check-out. It appears that anyone can drive in from that exit gate which gives the guests no privacy and makes the place unsafe.   The Lucky Arrow Retreat needs a lot of improvement in communication, as we did not receive any information regarding the check-in procedure and it was difficult to contact any staff during our stay.

reviews.author: Joshua A.
reviews.description: If you plan on using this venue to having your wedding at then GET A LAWYER and make them sign a contract. Otherwise, you'll spend $10000 and not have a private space for you and your love ones. You will have strangers at the pool in you space and drinking your beer. The venue might say this and that like they did to us but in the end they didn't do anything and we didn't have a contract to follow up on them so if you want to rent this place hire a lawyer first.

reviews.author: Brittney H.
reviews.description: Wow, what a great stay! The yurt that I stayed in was spacious and spotless, the bath house was always clean, and the entire place is well maintained. The staff is amazing; welcoming and very tentative when needed. If you're looking for a peaceful getaway outside the Austin area, this is the spot and worth the price!

reviews.author: Alida R.
reviews.description: I had a lovely few nights stay at Lucky Arrow. We traveled with friends - 3 other couples and their kids - and stayed in a cluster of four cabins. It was the perfect pandemic vacation: we were able to socialize with our friends and still have our own spaces, without being indoors together. I don't think I'd have enjoyed it as much with strangers staying in the cabin cluster with me, especially since each pair of cabins shares a hot tub (which was delightful to relax in!) and all four cabins share a fire pit.  The rooms were clean and modern looking, the beds comfortable, and the air conditioning great. They have basic toiletries and good towels. There's very weak and unreliable wifi at the cabins; I recommend you come here to disconnect. I had good cell phone service with Verizon. The cabins have mini fridges but no kitchens; if you want to cook, you'll have to grill outside. Bring your own charcoal and lighter fluid!  For shared amenities, there's a lovely outdoor pool, and a big space with a large fire pit, grills, and picnic area with tables and swings (and some covered seating if you need shade). The pool has a 1-foot area with lounge seats, and lots of nice floats. We visited during the week, and it wasn't very busy; our group spent a lot of time at the pool and were often there by ourselves. There's a small walking trail, too.  It is quite pricey; I don't normally spend this much on a hotel. I'm not sure if I'd stay again if I weren't going on a group trip (with pandemic friendly housing.) If you're going with a group, call and see if they'll give you group pricing.  Warning for those who are planning to spend most of their time in Dripping Springs drinking: if you visit on a Monday - Tuesday, as I did, most of the wineries and breweries (including Bell Springs, which is attached to the resort) are closed.

reviews.author: Gina L.
reviews.description: Phenomenal! Stayed overnight. Happen to book thru Hotels.com. No issues at all. We stayed in courtyard cabin. My two children my husband and I had a great time hiking, relaxing, hot tub,fire pit and more. Already wondering when I can get more time to go again.

reviews.author: Felix G.
reviews.description: Exceeded expectations. I love being outdoors, my wife loves luxury hotels. We stayed in one of the cabins and we both got what we wanted. The grounds are really nice and accommodating to friendly conversation with other guests. The cabins are modern and feel like an upscale hotel room. I appreciated the contactless check in and check out process. We look forward to returning.

reviews.author: Adam D.
reviews.description: Very little privacy and poor management. Had a grounds keeper hop, that's right hop, on to our patio while my wife and I were changing. Wife was and is still pretty traumatized.  Took us forever to find management to let them know we are out and they told us they would pay for our room at the holiday inn. They did not.  Recommendation to LAR:  If you are going to run a wedding at your retreat, maybe consider additional help managing the facility. Only having 1 worker who is trying to run a wedding at your grounds isn't going to cut it.  * to managements response:  You want me to call you again? I'm sorry, but your response to my review makes it sound like this is the first you have heard about this incident. Is this correct? If so, this is disappointing because that tells me you have not taken steps forward to improve.

reviews.author: Erika F.
reviews.description: Great retreat close to Austin. Connected to a peaceful winery and minutes away from distilleries. Great staff and beautiful cabins.

reviews.author: Liz K.
reviews.description: Came here for a mid-week staycation. We had the place almost all to ourselves since it was mid-week in September. The weather was amazing! We rented one of the breezeway cabins with views+hot tub+fire pit. There was firewood at the cabin when we checked in. We had a fire and hung out in the hot tub to look at the night sky both nights. It was so quiet and relaxing, exactly what we were looking for. The breezeway cabins are beautiful and fun! The pillows, sheets, and bedding were comfy. The breezeway two-seater swing was cute to sit in while sipping coffee. It would be nice if the room with the couch and wet bar also had soap and a couple dish towels by the sink.

reviews.author: Mandy L.
reviews.description: I just stayed for an incredible weekend at Lucky Arrow.  Not only was the resort gorgeous, it was super clean and the staff was incredibly friendly.  This was the perfect place to unwind and still feel safe during all this Covid madness.  The check in process was all online, so we didn't have to worry about social distancing.    The rooms were so adorable and you could tell they really put time into every single detail to make sure you have an amazing experience.  We were able to sit around the fire pit, have smores and enjoy the quiet starry night with no city noise or much light pollution.    The location was beyond perfect.  It's just far enough away from town that you feel like you are truly on vacation, but there was still an HEB and tons of food options within a few minutes drive.  The gated access to the winery next door was a wonderful perk.  Highly highly recommend staying here!

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: Had a great time staying in lucky arrow! We stayed in Yurt 3, which was great. Only complaints were that there was no map provided, nor customer service available, so we had to drive around and try to find outlet yurt at 10pm. Which was fine - we found it fairly quickly. Other complaint is that it looks like the person cleaning might of got distracted and left the room, without putting the ac back together or bringing her cleaning towel. Also not a huge issue. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: April C.
reviews.description: My husband and I chose Lucky Arrow for our anniversary getaway and it exceeded our expectations. The yurt was perfection and beautifully decorated. Even the shared bath house was nice! The complimentary beer and wine tasting was great and the crepe food truck on site was an added bonus. We'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Yerlan S.
reviews.description: Great location, great infrastructure, everything is new and well maintained. A lot of activities to do within an hour range. Hot tubs, hot pool, hot showers. Great breakfast variety w wine n beer tastings. Amazing staff.  Will come again, great place for a grate value.   P.S. A/C in yurts was nice, Operational Manager George is a great dude.

reviews.author: Marisa V.
reviews.description: I have finally fulfilled my lifelong dream of glamping in a yurt!    This place was such a cool experience. I had everything I could ever want. A pool, beer garden, campfires conversations with s'mores, and even a complimentary wine tasting at the Bell Springs Winery located right next door.   As for the staff, a big thanks to Mike, Michelle and Zach! They were all amazingly friendly, kind, funny, and helpful. Your hospitality was greatly appreciated.   This place is perfect for events or a staycation. Either way, I recommend visiting!

reviews.author: Trey E.
reviews.description: Lovely glamping space close to the Hill Country and within an hour of Austin, but ludicrous pricing policies will prevent a repeat visit. This spartan campsite with tiny houses and yurts (with a bathroom space shared with pool guests) offers a close to the city getaway with minimal amenities. But with a per pet fee of $150 PER ANIMAL plus a nightly fee, they don't seem to understand how out of touch they are with pricing policies of similar establishments. With two dogs under 20lbs, you're looking at $350 just in pet fees prior to any rental rates for just two nights, and therefore Lucky Arrow won't be getting any repeat visits from us.

reviews.author: Kate A.
reviews.description: There are few things more excellent than Texas Spring, and we were delighted to spend a weekend of the best time of year out in the hill country at Lucky Arrow during their opening weekend.  There is a central event space and bar / pool area at the top of the hill with yurts as well as more conventional accommodation tucked into the trees below. We stayed in a 'courtyard cabin' one of four arranged around a fire pit with a hot tub. Which was bright and airy with the squishiest mattress, soft sheets and plenty of space to set up our travel crib for our three month old son (they also have them there if you're coming from further afield and need to borrow one)  We spent the weekend listening to live music and sipping cocktails by the pool, wandering the shady trails, admiring the view and toasting s'mores on the fire pit.   Close enough to Dripping Springs if you want supper /HEB - but far enough out that the stars are super bright and the night is gloriously quiet. They're well-behaved dog friendly, so we'll be back with our (only moderately well behaved) hound. And for a yurt, I only peeked my head inside one but I'm desperate to stay in one soon!

reviews.author: Brittany W.
reviews.description: I will definitely be back here! My group of 6 reserved 3 porch houses and they were lovely! On the inside, they are totally modern and beautiful. There are no TVs which is perfect for a weekend getaway from the world.   The check in and out process is nice, you're provided with a code to a lockbox so there is no need to wait for someone!   There is a communal area with darts, Jenga, connect four, and more by the pool and firepit area. The staff left out snacks, drinks and smore's fixings for us!   This is a peaceful place that I can't wait to return to!

reviews.author: Allie W.
reviews.description: Beware of the cancellation policy.  Extremely deceiving.  The first sentence on the website says they have a 10 day cancellation policy but you actually can't get a refund at all.

reviews.author: Celeste L.
reviews.description: We love to hang out at roughouse on a lazy afternoon or evening as a family. This is the place we go when we need to get out of the house but don't know what to do.   My husband loves the beers and gets excited to try each seasonal release. I am not a big drinker but honestly just go for the atmosphere- super relaxed, nice spot in nature, our kids ages 3 and 6 beg to go bc they have a fun area to run around and gravel with construction toys to play with. We usually order a few appetizers and sit under the trees or an hr watching the kids tire themselves out.

reviews.author: Chad B.
reviews.description: Beautiful brewery in Hill Country, Texas! Live music on weekends. Plentiful picnic table seating outdoors.  I had a chocolate chip cookie which was fresh and not too sweet!  The nachos had fresh chopped beef--similar texture to brisket or pastrami. Liquid nacho cheese is very warm.   None of the food was exceptional, but down home good.   Great place for a lazy weekend afternoon!

reviews.author: Mandy N.
reviews.description: As good as it gets!! I have always loved their farmhouse ales (Ona is probably my favorite dark saison in existence but I'm also so happy about their lager program starting up.   It's great to have refreshing approachable pilsners for people that aren't quite ready to walk on the (beer) wild side. If you're ready to go a little wild I definitely suggest their cave aged beer (the premiere has a little funkyness but it's not too crazy, like overripefruit and sourdough bread) we loved it and it feels really fun to pop a cork out in the texas sunshine.   You can always count on Roughhouse to make something creative and unique and if you come to the taps with an open mind you definitely won't be disappointed. They have beers to go in bottles and cans too which is lucky bc some of the high abv ones are really the best (but I can't have them before driving, ha!!)   Great food for snacking, we got a bbq sandwich and really liked the bbq sauce, we ended up getting extra so we could dip our chips in it lol  The setting is hard to beat, plenty of shade outside with abundant picnic tables, plus there is an air conditioned loft if you just can't handle the heat!

reviews.author: Mary S.
reviews.description: The management clearly doesn't care about their customers! This place is off the beaten path and they decided to keep the whole brewery closed on a Saturday from 11-2 for a private event instead of allowing some customers in.  We drove 45 minutes out of the way just to find out they weren't opened.  Terrible experience.  Won't ever come back!!!

reviews.author: Renata S.
reviews.description: One of the best Breweries we have been too!!  The food was delicious, we got the nachos to share and man they have a kick of spice and we loved it! The pulled pork sandwich and the pastrami sandwich were both amazing. Their beer flight are so reasonable and for the big portions too. We will definitely be coming back soon!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Absolutely beautiful and peaceful place! I was weary of trying it since the beer sounded very floral, but there is something for everyone! I love the shaded outdoor picnic tables, and there is even a fire pit for s'mores ($3 to buy the kit)! The beer is delicious and fresh and they have a menu of farm to table foods. My husband and I tried the salsa (made from the goodies in their on-site garden) and it is the best I've had with the right amount of heat. We were able to buy a quart of it to take home- yummy!  This is definitely a great place to hangout with the pups and to get some fresh, countryside air while enjoying an acoustic band and some fresh beer served by the friendliest people.

reviews.author: Jan C.
reviews.description: The food was underwhelming.  I was hoping it would be so good. The people were friendly. Good service.  Great atmosphere. Hope to come back for live music and maybe try a different app. Enjoyed the night even though food was unimpressive.

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem!!!  Very quiet and gorgeous area!!  Check them out!  Beautiful!!  Surrounded by trees and sounds of nature!  Free popcorn and dogs are welcome!

reviews.author: Casey B.
reviews.description: What's that saying...?...too much of a good thing? No, I got it: don't drink bad beer.   Admittedly, my hop-soaked beer taste buds may not be par with a more astute beer connoisseur, but bad beer is bad beer. Tis a shame: this place is a true retreat. The Austin-indie-jazz duo provided an eclectic sound which paired perfectly with this serene outdoor haven.   Their flight card/cart is cool...it's dog friendly....there's a cactus.  The point is, what can you do when the beer's bad but move on and find another place.   I'm also slightly irked when businesses refuse legal tender.

reviews.author: Rachel M.
reviews.description: Been many times, and tried many of the Roughhouse beers. Every time was a pleasure. The staff are super friendly and flexible, and I love that the outdoor patio is dog-friendly. Glad to see they're growing and building more outdoor seating. Hope they'll continue to grow and do well!

reviews.author: Carolyn V.
reviews.description: The Good:   :: local business!   :: lots of parking   :: lots of space outdoors. in these pandemic times we live in, this is critical to ensure safety and still let you enjoy yourselves   :: lots of outdoor seating options. picnic tables/benches galore   :: outdoor performance stage   :: charming outdoor lights to make the place twinkle   :: outdoor mini rock wall for kids to stay busy   :: great beers! very refreshing. if you don't know what you want, ask them for recommendations   :: great snacks/food options to accompany your beer   :: very clean bathrooms   :: very good pandemic procedures for safety  The Bad:   :: none  The Ugly:   :: none  Would I go back? When I'm in this area of town again, I'll absolutely make my way here for a drink and a snack and to relax.   This place is IN.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: A group of us drove in to get some beers on a hot early evening/late afternoon after shopping at San Marcos Outlets. And if you're debating whether or not to make that drive--do it. You're welcome.  Roughhouse has THE space, service-oriented people backing it up AND...(the most important part for all of us beer nerds) a delicious lineup of their own beers. We drove in and were surprised to find that it was tucked in at the end of this residential street. There is plenty of space here though--it gave us Jester King and TX Keeper Cider vibes with the "outback" far out drive that make you feel like you've escaped the busy city/town life. Parking is abundant in the gravel area, and from the moment you arrive you know it's going to be a wholesome good time.  We could hear the live band out there that day, and we saw people with their dogs and kids. So awesome when breweries allow all people and furry friends! There's a kitsch pickup truck out front and a huge wooden cottage-like space that is the microbrewery. The interior feels much more quaint and modern, so get out your hipster glasses and handkerchiefs, millenials! I enjoyed my flight of beers for $12. My favorite beers were Treeform IPA and Floral Print. I ended up taking a Treeform home, and the label is so tastefully done with an earthy and spritely flavor.   We also ordered burgers (that come with mac and cheese! SO ooey gooey), and I gotta say their black bean veggie burger was not bad. I'm critical of veggie burgers because most people just slap it on the grill and that's it...or they just give you a thick piece of Portobello between two slices of bread. Not at Roughhouse! We also enjoyed a game of cornhole and can confirm they also have large Jenga. They have clean restrooms and serve-yourself water. Wifi is strong and it's a guaranteed a good time. Will definitely be back. Can't wait to see them grow and expand in the community.

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: Loved the outdoor space and entertainment . Not a big drinker so can not comment on the beer but other guests seemed to enjoy themselves. It is a bit out of town yet that contributes to its uniqueness. If you like non-traditional American food then you will like the menu and can try something new and tasty.

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: We were thrilled to find a local craft brewery that was open - so much of this area is still closed or offering limited service. The beer is good, the employees are friendly, and the venue offers socially distanced picnic tables under some nice shade trees. There was live entertainment when we visited. Great way to spend a Sunday afternoon.

reviews.author: Meredith Z.
reviews.description: Pleasantly satisfied with our lunch here. We got a pastrami sandwich and a chicken salad sandwich. The wagyu beef in pastrami sandwich was particularly good!

reviews.author: Dolly S.
reviews.description: The beer is good but the food is great.  There was this lamb sausage that was outstanding.  A little in the spicey side but just enough not to burn.  It came with chips and pickled mixed veggies.   Yummmmy

reviews.author: Nicci C.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, really good beers, and dog friendly! What more could you ask for? Highly recommend the queso with pork.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Very nice brewery. Not a fan of farmhouse ales but, they are actually pretty good what they have on tap.   Love the upstairs hangout.   Suggestions- The place is in the boonies. Food specials or something to entice people to come in would be good.  Moose Out

reviews.author: Captain G.
reviews.description: Service A1, view A1, method for COVID A1, environment is beautiful except for experiment 625 and 626. Worst experiments...

reviews.author: Ben M.
reviews.description: Roughhouse Brewing is the cutest husband and wife brewing company in Texas!   If you're in the San Marcos area, this is a great place to spend the day drinking some delicious farm-style beer, wine and ciders in an absolutely gorgeous wooden barn.   The building alone is worth the drive, but the Treeform IPA is what kept me smiling ear to ear! One of the best IPAs I've ever had.   Our Saturday trip included some really nice tunes by a local acoustic guitar player on the stage in the backyard. We had a very large group in town for a funeral, and there was plenty of seating outside for us all and the staff was incredibly accommodating, offering everyone samples since we were all first timers.   We don't make it out to San Marcos often, but this will definitely be a place we visit every chance we can. Great job! We wish you nothing but the best!!

reviews.author: Dawn S.
reviews.description: We had rented a little house at the Lighthouse Hill Ranch which is part of the property so decided to check out the Arc near sunset.   The building itself IMHO is an odd shape but the views are amazing. The staff were super friendly and knowledgeable. We took the elevator to the roof and we're not disappointed. The views on both sides were spectacular.   We went back down and grabbed a glass of wine and found a nice quiet spot on the bottom floor overlooking the ranch property and the pool area. (See pics)  My friend loved her wine so much she grabbed a bottle on the way out. I can't remember the name but I do know it was a white wine and it was from Slovakia. Who knew right?    Next time you are on 281 and you see the oddly shaped building on the hill, go grab a glass or a bottle and enjoy the view!

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: It's a FIVE star view, y'all.  If you are out in this area, do yourself a favor and STOP here.  Grab a drink and enjoy the view! You won't regret it.   Even though this is out near the Texas Wine Country, they carry non-Texas wine, beer and bubbles.   Their are two patio areas- one on the first level and one a few floors up on the roof. In between the first and top floors are small rooms you can rent. The pool access is a perk for staying there.

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: On our way into Fredericksburg, we saw a sign for "wine and views!" so we pulled on up to this cool-looking building. Most of the time, spontaneous stops are the best, and this was no exception. The views really are fabulous and there is plenty of lovely seating outside to see all around in every direction. They have a great selection of different wines as well as cute cheese/meat platters to snack on. It's a fun and different stop to make while you're on a wine trip.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: I'm definitely not a wine guy, but this is still an awesome place to visit. The views of the Texas hill country are amazing!  The place is perched on top of a hill, so even the terrace on the ground floor has amazing views.  After you order your wine, head on up to the fourth-floor terrace for even more astounding views of this beautiful ranch.  As someone else pointed out, it's a wine bar; they do not make their own wine here.  But don't let that stop you from paying them a visit. I counted 29 varieties of wine on their list.  Choices from Argentina, Spain, California, Sicily, France, South Africa, Oregon, and of course, good ol' Texas wine (and many more states and countries that I haven't listed).  You can order a glass of wine, a full bottle of wine, or do what I did. You can go for the "Wine Tasting" for $14.95.  You get your choice of five different wines (one-ounce pours).  I'm new to the wine scene, so I was expecting to pick all five choices up front and have them served like a beer flight. Evidently, that's not the case with wine tastings.  You make your first choice and the one-ounce pour is served in a regular sized wine glass.  Then, you return to the bar for each choice after that. The only thing I didn't dig, is that they didn't rinse the glass when you returned for your next choice.  So, if you had a red wine, and then returned for a white wine, a little of it was mixed in with the other. Again, I don't profess to be a wine dude, but this doesn't seem right to me, if you are trying to get the true flavor of each wine.  I didn't stay here overnight; I just did a day trip.  But they have several suites you can stay in, and five or six houses on the sprawling ranch that you can vacation in.  I spoke to one of the guests who was staying in one of the suites, and he said it was "absolutely awesome"!

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: It's fun to stop here for a glass or bottle of wine if you're passing through or heading home from somewhere. Prices are fair and the view is nice.   Hideous building though, right? Like, you have all that money to build a hotel and you pick an architect that delivers the ugliest design? I don't get it.   It's funny, so we like it, and it ain't far from home.

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: On our way today to Willow City Loop to see the bluebonnets, we passed by some beautiful wildflowers right by Arc de Texas. The winery piqued my interest but I was really hoping to see more flowers as we went up the way.  Seeing the sign for chocolate made me stop in to see what was waiting for me. There were multiple flavors with pecan in the name. Each truffle is $2.95 and individually packaged. I chose 2 of each - Pecan Rum, Pecan Toffee, and Peach Bourbon. The truffle tasted great but not with a hint of pecan taste or crunch though. I could taste the bourbon but not the peach.   Maybe the next time we could enjoy some of the wine on the rooftop terrace for sunset.

reviews.author: Allison P.
reviews.description: We stayed in the King Louis IX Suite with two other couples for two nights. It absolutely blew our expectations! This suite is the penthouse and while the rooftop is available to all guests during the day, from 10pm-8am it's for penthouse guests only. Needless to say it was so much fun.   During the day we hung out and explored the property and the gorgeous surrounding areas and we made use of the hot tub one night and the fire pit for s'mores. It was really just an excellent and amazing weekend. Johnson city is super close and we had dinner in town one night which was delightful.   The views were BREATHTAKING and if you want to see stars, the rooftop is THE place to see them!

reviews.author: Sherri M.
reviews.description: It is a beautiful place with an excellent view from the rooftop. Staff was really sweet and informative.

reviews.author: Kevin T.
reviews.description: Impressed upon first view.  Majestic scenery. Good first round of wine. 20 year Tawny and a Moscato. Upon second round my jaw dropped when they went to serve us total different wines in the same glass without even a rinse. That alone drops my rating to 3 stars at best.  The view is 5 stars.

reviews.author: Victoria Y.
reviews.description: Very friendly staff and unbeatable views! The rooftop is the perfect spot to soak in the beautiful hill country. I visited for the wine bar but am looking forward to an overnight stay in the future.

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Do you like beautiful lands streaked with cool blue creeks? Do you like drinking good wine while viewing random friendly cattle that roam about? How about seeing an awesome arc backdropped to a beautiful Texas prairie.  Well then you've found the place! Really I can't say anything bad about this place, great service with awesome views. What more do you want? Bring friends, bring family! Share a bottle of wine while enjoying the view from the upper floors. They also have some delectable cheese plates for $5 or $10. Pretty good stuff on there.  I'll be back to sip some wine and watch some cows :)

reviews.author: Allegre N.
reviews.description: This is a very pretty location and the woman working was super friendly. There were plenty of places to sit and enjoy some wine. The view from the roof is very pretty and definitely worth a visit just for that. The wine prices seemed reasonable to me, with a lot of options in the $40 range.  Due to COVID they will only do bottles, not just a glass which is no problem at all, except that's where my negative part starts. I asked for a chilled red (don't judge me, it's 105F right now) which they didn't have. I rarely drink white so my partner and I finally agreed on a dry rose. There are two on the menu, one sparkling and one non. I wanted the non-sparkling but before I could say anything the lady said "oh, we're out of the sparkling rose, have the cava instead" and popped it open. So, we wound up with cava. OK, I kind like that but it was two levels away from what we asked for.  I realize that sounds slightly petty so the other issue is that we asked for a tempranillo to go. When we got home we realized it was a rioja, and not very good. We didn't get either of the wines we wanted.  I'd be a lot more willing to give a better review if the place had not been literally deserted when we arrived. There was no one there but us so I don't see much reason why the wines got that messed up. I wish we had been asked about the cava before she opened the bottle.

reviews.author: Christopher F.
reviews.description: We have driven past it many times and always said we should stop.  We finally did.  I was pleasantly surprised.  What I thought would be a road side tourist trap was an exceptionally good road side tourist trap.  We met a couple at the wine tasting room who had the same story - they finally decided to stop.  The bartender / sommelier was a very pleasant fellow.  He offered good advice on the wines as well as things to do in the surrounding area.  Although we arrived too late for the tasting (630pm on a Monday), we were able to indulge in a glass of vino.  The wine tasting room screamed of fine Tuscan influence.  The wood was solid.  There was a majestic painting in the room to give it an elegant and distinguished feel.  The commode was fit for a king or queen (unisex bathroom).   After we obtained our glass of wine, we went to the observation deck.  We had 360 degree views of well, I am not exactly sure.   Just rolling hills.  It is hill country after all.  I am sure it would be a great place to watch the sunset, but it was quite cloudy on our visit.   I give this roadside attraction two thumbs up.  It is well done and great place to stop for a glass of wine.

reviews.author: Elizabeth S.
reviews.description: Gorgeous venue! Wonderful selection of wines and definitely recommend going there for tastings but don't waste your money buying from them. They jack up the bottle prices and some can be bought for half of the price at other places online or even total wine!!!

reviews.author: Mercedes S.
reviews.description: Gorgeous place!!!! The view is unbeatable. The wine was amazing. The owner was there when I visited and there were 2 doggos. Wine and DOGS!!!! Needless to say I was in heaven

reviews.author: Kirk M.
reviews.description: My first and only visit.  I would have left a ZERO rating if that was an option.  1. We walked up to the bar and the lady behind the bar (late 40's to early 50's with glasses) was not friendly at all.  She did not greet us nor did she ask if this was our first time nor did she let us know if  she would be the one to serve us. Very poor demeanor.  However we let that pass and still decided to give the place a try.  2. While sitting at the bar area we noticed a stale cigarettes and ashtray odor, coming from behind the bar.  Just nasty , not sure if it was the bar area, bartender or trash.  3. We asked for the choice of five wines taster and how that was served The lady behind the bar answered the question by saying we can't use 5 glasses because we don't have enough to serve you all 5 tasting glasses at once.  Never really answered the question we asked. However we did note that the wine glass area had a huge selection of clean glasses. I guess she has an aversion to washing wine glasses [ see #4] .   4. We ordered our 5 tasters. They give you 1 glass of wine  and 4 'poker' chips.  When you order the next sample they take your dirty glass and 1 poker chip and then pour your next sample into the dirty glass. One would think to RINSE OUT THE WINE GLASS  so as to have a fresh CLEAN glass for the next sample.  The lady NEVER  cleaned the glasses after we tried each wine, even after we pointed this out.  5. The worst part about this visit was that the lady [older lady, a younger one showed up to help ]  was eating cheese and crackers while she was working behind the bar , and talking with her mouth full and food was falling out of her mouth while serving people. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING.  6. The area behind the bar was filthy , boxes on top of the counter close to the bar top where customers sit,  the bar top was sticky, not once did we see the bartender wash her hands between serving customers or between eating her food and serving customers.  YOU SHOULD LEARN PROPER HYGEINE TECHNIQUES.   We had a our taster and left.   We wont be back and we will make sure to tell everyone we know to avoid this business and find a place further down the road.  There are MANY other wine tasting rooms, wineries and more that have clean facilities , better hygiene and friendly staff.

reviews.author: Kimberly K.
reviews.description: Arc De Texas is the perfect stop for top of the hill views of Texas Hill Country. If you time your visit during sunset it's even more amazing. They are open until 7pm every night which is later than any of the other local wineries. Arc De Texas doesn't make their own wine but rather sells wine from all over the world. My favorite is the Insurrection red wine. Grab a glass or better yet a bottle and head to the roof to check out the views!

reviews.author: Allison G.
reviews.description: Wonderful place to stop by for amazing views and great wine! I am so glad we were there for sunset, but I would visit to take in scenery any time of day. It was busy when we arrived, but they did everything to serve us in a timely manner and help pick out a perfect wine. We will be back! :)

reviews.author: Gabrielle F.
reviews.description: This is a must-see stop on the way to Fredericksburg with great wine and service, plus amazing 360 degree views of hill country!

reviews.author: Audrey S.
reviews.description: We recently went to the Arc De Texas with a group of friends. Everyone was extremely friendly and let us taste wines before buying the bottle. There were several cheese/meat options to buy to enjoy with the wine. We took the bottles and cheese up to the rooftop to enjoy the awesome views. We liked it so much we went 2 days in a row! Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Went for a bday. Got to enjoy a jam session with a washtub bass. That was fun.  Beers were great and the brisket sandwich hit the spot.   Moose Out

reviews.author: S B.
reviews.description: Great place for some feel good American food and cold beer. TX Tech themed and down to earth staff make it a great place to fill up on football, beer, food, and friends..  Wreck'em!

reviews.author: Cheryl L.
reviews.description: We had heard that there were new brewery tap rooms in Johnson City and decided to drive over and check it out. It was empty except for the owner so we sat and ordered a flight. The beers weren't extraordinary but pretty good. We missed out on the food, he said the kitchen was closed. The art gallery part was really cool.  One of the things that put me off was even though the hours were 11-9 pm the owner was cleaning and turning things off while we were there at 5:00 pm and I felt a big "go away" vibe. Not a nice feeling when trying to relax on a Sunday afternoon. Probably wouldn't go out of my way to return.

reviews.author: Raechel T.
reviews.description: I wish I lived in Johnson City so I could be a regular.  We'll definitely stop when we're driving through.  I loved all the Texas Tech decorations.  We really enjoyed the Pilsner and the Imperial Stout....next time I'll try some other beers.  The grilled cheese was perfectly done and the sausage wrap was tasty as well.  I appreciated the hand sanitizer that's at every table.  Extremely clean restaurant and bathrooms.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Man, if you have not tried this place, you are missing out! We were here a couple years ago and it was strictly a brewery.  Outstanding beer and great people. In case you have missed it, RER now has food...and DAMN! I got the pulled pork Cubano and my wife got the Hawaiian Pulled Pork. Her sandwich was really, really good.  She even said once it was gone, "I miss it already." My Cubano was a brilliant twist on a traditional Cuban, with the traditional ingredients, including pickle, ham, and mustard.  The addition of their house smoke pulled pork sent it into the next level. The beer here has been excellent from day one, but with the addition of a killer menu, this is now a one-stop shop that really needs to be on your list.  Summing up, phenomenal beers, next level sammys, and really great people.  Why more does one need?

reviews.author: Keisha W.
reviews.description: Great beers good atmosphere and good food!  Good people create a great place. Looking for a local brewery. Check ''em out!

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: I revisited this place and found the beers and the temperature much better. This place seems to have stepped up their game, glad to see it. Love local breweries.

reviews.author: J S.
reviews.description: Visited on a packed night and still had stellar service and even got to chat with the owner a bit. Love the red ale!

reviews.author: Jeanne B.
reviews.description: Sorry...no pic. But it's a cool laid back place with good food. They temporarily ran out of brisket so I had pulled pork nachos. So good. Their salsa is homemade and it has a good kick.

reviews.author: Cindy D.
reviews.description: I had the Reuben with pulled pork on marbles rye. Super tasty! Very unique and enjoyable hangout stop along the way

reviews.author: Chad W.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a great local brewery Reck Em Right Brewery has something for everyone. They have several great food options and a ton of beer options. Well worth your stop. Friendly staff with the small town feel. A must stop for all.

reviews.author: Aliyah B.
reviews.description: this place was on our way back home and deff hit the spot! Sandwich was so good as well as the homemade root beer

reviews.author: Mark F.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a few brews last month and chatted it up with the owner/bartender. Nice guy and nice selection of brews.  Place doesn't look like much but hey, those are usually the best places, right?  Food truck outside serves up good stuff and the beers are varied and tasty, so get yer butt over there and have a few brews!

reviews.author: Jenn D.
reviews.description: Looks inviting from the road...where only locals are welcome! Our bartender Audrey had no personality and could care less, unless you were a local. She had no problem being friendly and clearing the table and asking if you wanted a drink only if you were a local. Be prepared to stop for something else to  eat, nothing spectacular and you leave feeling as if you made a serious mistake stopping in! Seriously, spinach, with 4 mediocre slices of thin out of a freezer bag chicken slivers, a dash of cheese and pico and onions and quac on one tortilla chip for a salad. Not sure how this is called a fajita salad?  So, two salads (on a paper plate and plastic fork) and a couple beers  for $40.00 plus a tip!  We stop in Johnson City at least two to three times a month on our way back from business trips. I recommend going to some of the  other locations across the street! They have wonderful Texas friendly service, nice portions of good tasty food and beer plus food is served on an actual plate! I don't like to leave bad reviews, but the service industry is tough these days and you need to have a good food service and selection and treat your patrons well so they come back!  Being as good if not better than your competition is a must! So, if you just want a brew and nothing more then stop by.

reviews.author: Don J.
reviews.description: Cozy place to enjoy some locally brewed beer.  Tim, the owner and brewmaster, is happy to tell you about his craft beers, including the Norwegian yeasts he selected for their compatibility with brewing in hot Texas weather.  To keep startup costs down, he did almost all of the construction himself - check out my picture of the beer flight holders he made from lumber.  Speaking of flights, I decided to try all 7 of the beers on tap. My favorites were the hazy IPA and both of the stouts.  All of the selections were solid.  I didn't see any food on the menu.  The interior space features an L-shaped bar good for socializing, a comfy love seat, a mini pool table, and whimsical touches such as a guitar sitting in a stand, ready for someone to pick up and play.  If hanging out indoors isn't your thing, there are a few outdoor tables under a ginormous oak branch.  While I also love the brewery around the corner, I plan on working Reck 'Em Right into my rotation!

reviews.author: Riki C.
reviews.description: The owner is super personable, the location is close to the shopping that you could sit between shopping, but lots of better parking then right off main/290!  Inside it's such a comfy and classy rustic style taproom!  I tried the amber and it was yummy and enjoyable ! I can't wait to go by when I have more time and to hang out and feel the environment even more! Definitely think you should it out!

reviews.author: Jim H.
reviews.description: Well, from the outside it doesn't look like much, but the food and beer more than make up any lack of appearance.  Awesome beers, Red Ale and Tool Shed Brown were excellent.  BBQ is home made in house, outstanding.   Well worth the time, to eat and drink.

reviews.author: Steve G.
reviews.description: Great food, friendly people!  Tim will take good care of you. Terrific biscuit, and the pineapple barbecue pulled pork sandwich was the bomb. Food is quick and easy and reasonably priced. There's a comfortable small patio out front with fans to take the edge off the heat. Great if you've got 4 people or less. Went on a Sunday evening and it wasn't too crowded.

reviews.author: B C.
reviews.description: Hole in the wall with style. Had live music with an artist that was amazing! Classic riffs of great songs and vocals that shock you...thought I was at Austin's music scene! Beer was decent and food too but just a little pricey for what we got. Two sandwiches and two beers plus tip was about $50,  which seemed a bit much.... But it tasted dang good!!!

reviews.author: Rodney Y.
reviews.description: New menu is sandwiches and chips. Seems food comes from next door. Maybe a COVID deal. Good selection of beer. Not crowded mid afternoon.

reviews.author: Vanessa L.
reviews.description: This was the cutest hidden gem. They had cider on tap, and in bottles to enjoy there or take home. It was reasonably priced. Highly recommend the gold rush cider, we took a bottle home we loved it so much. They offer live music and trivia. You were able to walk around the premises where we thought we heard peacocks. We say a bee box on the premises not sure if they harvest their own honey for their boards but I wouldn't doubt it. I will definitely Be returning!

reviews.author: Kaci C.
reviews.description: Wonderful place! We went on a recommendation while we visited family. The ciders were great, as was the food. The only issue we ran into was that we ordered hummus, and the person taking our order didn't let us know that it didn't come with bread or anything else to eat it with. Considering we had just had a conversation with her about it being our first time there, we're about to present she didn't let us know that important bit of info. Not a big deal, and the person who brought us our food outside asked if we had ordered anything to eat it with and quickly brought us an order of a baguette.  Aside from the establishment itself, the vendors selling goods were all friendly and talented, and the other patrons of the establishment were friendly as well. We struck up several conversations with passers-by.  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Super cute space- so much potential. The guy who was pouring our flights was super nice, we were excited at first to have finally checked this place off the bucket list. However, the ciders weren't that great unfortunately...we would've kept on drinking anyway, just probably ordering the other cider/wine/beer that they stock, not make. We were there on a very dead weeknight- only 3 other people were there, so you'd think they'd welcome more business- but we had to leave because we were told that we couldn't eat the tacos we got from a nearby food truck...if they sold food, I'd understand, and we would've ordered dinner there...but all they sell is super overpriced make it yourself charcuterie items (a whole block of cheese, a whole baguette, etc). The way we were told that we couldn't eat our tacos rubbed me the wrong way and the vibe was just sadly killed, so yeah, we won't be back :/

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: Very unimpressed with this place. This place has such potential! The set up is super cool and the place has a great vibe. It is a little hard to find and the road is a little rough in their lot. The place was completely empty when we were there. The ciders were all just okay and some were super sour and not great at all. The bartender was the best part of the experience. He was super knowledgeable and so friendly. Probably the biggest downfall and what would definitely bump them to at least a 4 star is their lack of food. There are no food trucks on site, they only sell outrageously priced charcuterie boards, and we found out the hard way, don't allow outside food. We were told after we got food brought to us that it was not allowed. We would have stayed and continue buying product had they allowed us to eat. Rather we sat in their parking lot and ate on our talegates. This place is so out in the middle of nowhere you would think that they would have better food options. They also were not very nice when delivering the news. Needless to say we won't be back.

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: How have I not reviewed the kind people at this wonderful establishment yet?  I so enjoy the the solace of their old farmhouse venue. And the great ciders they serve up certainly do not hurt the wallet or the ambience.  It's so relaxing sitting at the picnic tables out among the oaks listening to your favorite band. Strategically placed fans hidden among the trees aid in making the glade that doubles as a stage tolerable even on 90º days.  In these seemingly never-ending days of the pandemic, it's also refreshing to see the servers masking up indoors and out. I tend not to venture out too much for exactly that reason, but felt totally safe here even when ordering inside the tap room.  Maybe I should keep it a secret, but it's also one of those places you want to share exactly because it is so very special.

reviews.author: Ellen G.
reviews.description: We love Texas Keeper Cider! Their tasting room is out a ways from Austin, but is on the most lovely grounds. They often have wonderful live music and their drinks are absolutely perfect for a Texas summer. They are so refreshing. We got one of the picnic baskets and it was full of yummy cheese, sliced meats and bread. Highly recommend!  It is worth noting, they do not have a full lunch/dinner menu. They basically have an assortment of DIY charcuterie boards, which we really enjoyed. However, if you go expecting a full dinner you may be disappointed.

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Pretty great ciders! Did the tasting. Eat before you go if you are a fatty like me. I wasnt too fond of the food although i love their jellies! Nice outside area ... dogs and children allowed.  They also have live music!( but I was just there for the cider‍)  Will definitely go again!

reviews.author: Devon G.
reviews.description: The cider, the wine, the live music! What amazing vibes! The staff is friendly and it has some farmhouse style that is warm and comfy. They have a layout showing how sweet items are and let you sample, so you pick the right one!  Parking is massive and close to the large lot that houses bee keeper.

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: My new favorite place in Austin. Love everything about it.  It's basically the only Place I ever want to be. If you haven't been yet- get on the ball!  The cider is so delicious - nothing is overly sweet and they have a good assortment of dry and well-balanced choices. Their sampler is 9$ for 5 generous pours and is a great way to find the cider you like most. For us it's the rose, but the original is a close second. Your best bet is to purchase a bottle and drink affordably. You even get a discount when you purchase bottles to go (although I'm not sure if that's just at the end of the night - we've closed this place down a few times).   We are also big fans of the food. The carrots in a blanket are so yummy and very unique! A must-have. The curried egg salad is a go-to as well. It's made with eggs from their own chickens! They also add pickled veggies on the side which is always a win for me.   The location is so spacious and beautiful. Plenary of tables inside and out. Even a great view from one side where you can watch the sunset over the trees. I've enjoyed live music there and loved the tunes they were playing inside.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: The ciders are essentially tribute to the apple gods, extremely generously priced, and the cidery is tucked away--makes for a great escape from the city of Austin!  Came on a rainy day with some girlfriends after dinner, and we LOVED it. It reminded me of Jester King Brewery because of the fact that it felt very off-road and secluded. If you're driving at night and a little too fast you might miss the entrance, so slow down as your GPS tells you you're near. The stone cobble walkway is so organic and lovely, that it felt like we were entering into a storytale cottage. Upon entering, everything screams wood and warm pinterest vibes. The three of us sat down at their tall barstool table, and started on our flight! What prices! Normally they do 5 for $9, but they tapped out of one of the selections so we did 4 for $7! Such a great price for the variety of ciders. I loved their hefeweizen + cider combo, and the first cider on their flight list (a name I forgot). Everything was so juicy and tasty, would highly recommend coming back.   The staff is very knowledgeable, and the lady doing the taptending that night was so sweet and helpful. She trusted that we knew which selection we were on during our flight. She also told us that there are five cideries in all of Austin! So for my cider lovers--let's hit all of them up.

reviews.author: Marianne L.
reviews.description: I have been a long time fan of Texas Keeper Cider. I love the Tap Room, the grounds, the staff and especially the cider. The cider is dry and they make a wide variety of ciders to appeal to many palates.  They have successfully reopened the Tap Room and I decided to have my belated retirement party there. I was able to reserve a space for my large group and the staff was very attentive. If I had one criticism, it would be their food choices.  It's now a make your own picnic, and you choose cheeses, meats, and sides. It's not really a charcuterie tray, as they don't prep the plate.  The cheeses,  meats and bread all need to be sliced.  This made eating difficult with a large group. Most of my guests had to leave early so they could go eat somewhere else.  I know this new menu makes it easier for the staff, and they are a cidery, not a restaurant, but I miss their old menu.  I will still go to Texas Keeper Cider, but may not hang out as long.  (Or make sure I eat beforehand!) Overall, it's a beautiful South Austin gem.

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: I don't know why it took me so long to get here but now that I've been, I'll be telling everyone about it and making return trips! If you're a fan of Argus Cidery, you'll like this place. I do think Texas Cider Keeper is making cleaner ciders than Argus (nothing was infected or had off-flavors).   It's easy to miss the entrance, but it's right next to the cemetery! The outdoor space is very quaint but all Texas and has tons of picnic tables. The tasting room is beautiful with butcher block tables and plenty of seating.   We opted for the tasting flight menu which is five 2 oz. pours for $9. Their mainstay Texas Keeper Cider No.1 is dry, refreshing and well balanced. I'm not a fan of sweet ciders, so this was perfect.  I also really liked their Grafter Rose -- which is made with Rome apples and some grapes, which gives it the beautiful rose hue. It's also on the drier side, which is nice.   Our least fave of the five had to be the Cider Weizen, which had a bit too much coriander (and this is coming from a girl who LOVES coriander and hefeweizen beers).   The bartenders were all knowledgeable and really try to give you an explanation of each cider they're pouring (a la a wine tasting).   They also have a tempranillo wine on tap because in Texas it all falls under a "fruit fermentation" permit. Apples, wines, it's all the same permit.   I'll be making it a point to come here more often, and I would if traffic getting through downtown and south Austin traffic weren't so bad.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: One year later I returned for their 1st Anniversary Party and release of The Grafter Blanc.  For $9.50 (w/fees) your ticket included your admission and 10 oz tulip glass (not the standard 12 oz tulip most breweries sell for $5-6). There were no drink tickets included; all cider and other offerings were for purchase only.  Certainly not the best deal in town....a town full of breweries with taproom festivities.  The Grafter Blanc is definitely my favorite of their ciders, with the perfect balance of acidity, tartness and dryness.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Wow! So before coming here I always assumed ciders as overly sweet and flavored froo-froo drinks for those who don't like beer. I have never felt so mislead before! Cider is made from apples (no matter what the flavor), and real, legit cider is found here! It isn't overly sweet and there are many different kinds! Some reminded me of wine and a not-so-Sweet cider mixed together.  At Texas Keep there is room to bring a large group, or even the dogs or kids to run around. There is a small indoor area with games and a huge outdoor area with room to move about and enjoy the Texas sun (or stars).  The people here really enjoy and are PROUD of what they do. They are excited to tell you the story behind the names of the ciders and what they entail. They have seasonals and guest bottles and taps. Normally I would feel gross trying something out of a bottle opposed to tap, but the whole experience was so eye-opening, I didn't care. They told me their 1 bottle of (maybe a 750ml cider) has about 10mg of sugar in it as opposed to he "cider" I knew such as Angry Orchard that has upwards of 50mg PER BOTTLE! Yowza- no wonder they were too sweet!  I was definitely iffy about coming here since they didn't serve "regular beer", but I'm definitely glad I stepped out of my comfort zone- and you should, too!  Only reason it's not 5 stars- the food "truck" setup (not a truck just a station) was out of food by 6:30p on a Saturday night. We had ordered 1 of the 4 items on the menu for our group to try. When we went back to order our favorites, they claimed they were out of everything and turned around and took 1 more order. Annoying. So we ordered a pizza and left early to meet the delivery man at home. Maybe have more food or more options and we would've stayed until the 9p close.

reviews.author: Matt H.
reviews.description: We went here with some friends for the first time. It's a beautiful place at night to sit out on the lawn under the string up lights with your dogs and enjoy some cider.  The bartender was awesome and more than glad to educate us on all the stuff that goes into making cider.  Our friends got this HUGE cheese board that was really well priced too.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Such a gem that's tucked away in far South Austin/Manchaca! The. Best. Cider. It's fresh, crisp and abundant here. Even a little bit of mead on tap too. We've been here during all seasons of the year and the property is always gorgeous and inviting. Staff is so knowledgeable and helpful. The kitchen is Now built in to the main tasting room. The fresh house made popcorn is absolutely awesome. This is a family friendly establishment as well and very nice of them to accommodate young children in a pretty adult setting! We are very thankful and grateful and it certainly keeps us as loyal customers.

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a quick drive out to TKC on a Sunday. It was awfully hot and there was plenty of shade. We brought our dog too but he could not go inside which was challenging even for ordering. Our favorite cider is the No. 1! There was an event going on that sounded fun so we will definitely check out those options. We did not order food, just did a shared tasting. No one came outside to check on us or offer to pour and tell us about the cider which is common when visiting wineries with our dog and friends. It's a cute little spot for a weekend drive.

reviews.author: Liz S.
reviews.description: Súper cute romantic spot to come with your significant other or girlfriends.  The atmosphere is excellent.  They had live music on Saturday when we ran into this cute spot.  We ordered a flight of cider and had some garlic kettle corn, but regretted not getting the cheese plate because it would have been perfect with the acidity of the cider.  Zach, who served us, made our experience more memorable.  Definitely a spot to visit when in Austin.

reviews.author: Vicktoria R.
reviews.description: Super tasty food. Drinks are tops and they have toys for kids in their outdoor area. Seating was nice and the misters keep it comfortable even in the summer heat.

reviews.author: Seela M.
reviews.description: This is a great place to bring out of town guests. The 9$ flight is lovely and a bargain. The grounds are beautiful and the staff friendly. You can hang out and play bird games or sit outside on picnic tables. The food is not quite  awesome yet, but decent if you want tot munch along with your cider. The ciders are dry dry dry and not gross apple soda tasting like Eastciders (barf). "Stillage" is amazing.

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Love this place. Lots of good options. I think 8.5 minutes abs is even better than electric jellyfish.  The people that work there are great! Also they host watch parties for Austin FC. Go Verde!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: I'm writing this review solely based on their Cedrela Hefeweizen. I love Hefeweizen and have drank my fair share while stationed in Germany for four years as well as here in the USA. This was the worst glass of Hefeweizen that I've ever had. It was very disappointing, tasted watered down, and had very little flavor. The Live Oak Brewing Company Hefeweizen is much better, and it's the best I've had in the Austin area. Other than that, the place was clean and the staff was friendly. Again, this review is solely based on their Cedrela Hefeweizen.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Whitestone Brewery is a great place to grab a beer and relax after work or watch an Austin FC game. They have a large patio for all their events like trivia and bingo and plenty of seating inside. Head here for some great Texas beers.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great patio that's dog and kid friendly, complete with the Austin Steam Train behind it.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow I can't believe I've forgotten to review here. I LOVE their beer and location. Always great beers on rotation and the flight tray is cool.  Only reason for the 4 starts is today we came for what had to be the 6th or 7th  time and got kicked to the outside patio for having a dog. This is ALWAYS the brewery I go to when it's hot because they allowed dogs inside. I've had every other bartender let my dog in, love on him and have had zero problem sitting inside with him. Even their Facebook has a picture of a dog inside. Today we were told that was never allowed and should have been told to go outside. We have also seen many other dogs inside during past visits. I hate inconsistent rules. Also, super sad that we'll have to find a new brewery this summer. It's too hot to be outside and my dogs nickname is the the brewery dog.  I'll still support them during cooler months-- but dog owners should know the rules have changed. Very sad. Wish they would have posted something about this change.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: Great beer vibe. Plenty of seating inside and outside. Parking kinda sucks.  The menu has a really good range of beers that I haven't seen anywhere else. Beer is cold and food options are good too. We had nachos and loaded tots. The Austin FC bold game was on. They had green beer and if you wore green you got a $1 off

reviews.author: Ryan D.
reviews.description: A nice flight of light non IPA beers. No food. Only a food truck but nice atmosphere indoor/outdoor.

reviews.author: Nancy Z.
reviews.description: Always a great time here! They have Meade, to hop water to yummy Lovely Day IPA.  Clean place and clean toilets.   Don't forget to check out their food truck!

reviews.author: Alexandra P.
reviews.description: Pretty good ambiance. Spaced out seating inside and outdoor seating available. Place was visibly clean and also smelled very clean! We got loaded tots from the food truck outside that were yummy. All the beers that we tried were good but the mango one was my favorite!

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Awesome brewery!, excellent selection. Amazing atmosphere!, great service and the food from Van Dams is Awesome with great prices. Just became a Pub Member for these reasons!!!

reviews.author: Ellie B.
reviews.description: Phenomenal - amazing brewery atmosphere. Came on a Christmas holiday Friday night they had name that tune bingo going, was so fun to watch! Wish I had known would've joined ASAP  God I love Texas

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Whitestone Brewery. The environment felt very relaxed and casual and I loved the outside patio area. We got a selection of beers, I personally really enjoyed the Mango Crazy wheat beer and the Keyboard Gansta IPA. The service was also very friendly and they offered some samples if you are in between choices.   The taco truck outside was also very good! I highly recommend one of their loaded fries. The fries were perfectly crispy and tender in the middle, and super flavorful toppings. The tacos were also yummy and I'm a huge corn lover so the elote bowl was perfect.   I will definitely be back to try more of their seasonal beers!

reviews.author: Julie Q.
reviews.description: This brewery was so fancy and so nice. The bartender was friendly and patient with us when deciding on what type of beers we wanted to try. I got a flight of various beers which most of them were suggested by the bartenders. They were GOOD. If I get the chance, I WILL be coming back here again. It is also kid friendly. Again, super friendly/nice atmosphere!

reviews.author: Nicolette M.
reviews.description: Ambiance - 9/10 Pricing - 10/10 Staff - 10/10 Food - 10/10   Overall, the service is great! The ladies behind the counter are very nice and loaded with insights about the beers. There's a food truck outside that was delish!! (Tacos and burgers) the al pastor tacos were amazing. We did not try the burgers but from what I've seen/heard it's also very yummy! Whitestone is in a great location in Cedar Park, TX. We are heading to Balcones state park to go hiking but saw this along the way and had to stop in. I'm glad we did!

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: It's been a hot minute since I visited Whitestone- I think the last time I was here was in 2016, when it was quieter and a lot more laid back.  Fast forward to 2021 - the city of cedar park and Leander are booming.  There is a huge influx of population. The tables at Whitestone are full, there is a food truck (which is awesome) as a permanent fixture BUT the overall customer experience has left me disappointed.  Maybe because it's a Sunday with lovely weather, the guy behind the bar is done with people, or, he isn't a people person , or, he just didn't like the way I looked? But man was it hard to get him to give me an effing beer without getting hateful glances. Yeesh. Im kinda scared of coming back here now!  That aside, im not really a fan of their beer selection either - the kolsch is OK but I've had better. I guess the biggest advantage is the proximity to both CP and Leander and for the people who live around here.  So, this isn't much of a review rather than a semi rant ?   Also guys- kids have a tendency to move around from one side of the table to the other. They're not capable of sitting still and neither are you. If you'd rather than families stay away, just tell us to our faces.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Huge covered patio! We stopped by while we were in the area and what a nice brewery to grab a beer at. I had the Blonde beer and it was light and crisp. They had a Food truck hanging outside so if you wanted to partake that was great.   Suggestions- In the guys bathroom the keg should be a little bit higher. Pretty tough for tall guys lol. But, I love the concept.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Chris E.
reviews.description: Very nice place, I came from California to try. Staff was nice, bathrooms were clean and the beer was great!

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Friendly, on top of it staff and great variety in beer. Love the hop water too! We've been coming here since the opening and it just keeps getting better! Love our Whitestone Family!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Great local brewery!  Friendly and helpful staff, great tasting beers and a food truck out back - what else do you need?

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to hang out in Cedar Park but it is in a busy strip mall. The service is good and you can get some beer flights and the prices are very reasonable. My fiancé and I had a good time here and the live music was awesome!  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: We were here for an Austin FC watch party and the vibe was awesome. The band was there, they had a huge screen for the game, and the energy was through the roof.   I tried their special beer release, Mikalla Mist, and it was a beautiful, bright, crisp Pilsner! I also had their Belgian style Gold Fist. It was nice and hoppy and perfectly sour. My final beer was a stout and it was something about the Simpsons. It was also really good.  Great place, awesome tacos, fantastic beer.

reviews.author: Steven C.
reviews.description: Beer is great and reasonably-priced with good variety. The food truck out back is far better than it has any right to be, with delicious mexican food at a reasonable price.   I highly recommend the fish and barbacoa tacos, as well as the burrito+quesadilla. The chips/salsa aren't too shabby either.   Haven't tried the burgers so can't comment on those.   If you want an affordable spot to come eat, drink, and be merry in the Austin area, look no further!   Plenty of space to sit inside, or if the weather is nicer, even more space out back! You order everything at the bar, get your beer immediately, and pick up your food from the truck out back if you ordered that.

reviews.author: Junus A.
reviews.description: Megaflora has reinvigorated my love for IPAs, which waned heavily after I hit the quarter century mark. I think it's the hazy kind, and they mix it up with melony goodness (love melons - all kinds of melons). Your palate ends up fielding a fruity punch; no getting your jaw kicked in by puckering hops. Great shit. They made it year round too, with the badass stylized can design and all (most of those ones are seasonal only).  With that being said, please offer La Verdad year round. Please  These dudes' merch game is on point, they really need to take their little stylized logo print for the cans and sell it on more apparel. Whoever does their art is a fucking genius. I love my Cold Glory shirt and my Megaflora mask. I love my Lazer Salad pint glass cup thing. They have a bunch of badass koozie designs. Basically, their merch game is next level already, but I see so much potential. I guess they are keeping their operation relatively small scale, and there are only so many ppl who are going to buy brewery merchandise in central Texas, but I dunno. Love the art.   At the end of the day, though, nobody is going to buy any merchandise if the beer sucks. Beerworks' beer does not suck. The new Eastern Philosophy beer they came out with is a great example of Austin Beerworks' beer not sucking. When I read it was a jasmine tea infused lager (I love jasmine tea) I had to check it out. Super solid, 7.5% but doesn't taste like it. You're supposed to drink it over ice. So novel, so well thought out, and so well executed. ABW's motto (I think) is "Hellbent on Excellence" and they are certainly living up to that standard. I'm so fortunate to live here in Austin with great breweries like ABW. I'll be even more fortunate when I can walk into HEB and buy La Verdad year round, but that'll come in time. Thanks, Austin Beerworks.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I  came here the other day with a friend to have a chat and really get ready to center ourselves for the week ahead. I ordered a Lazer Salad which is a double IPA.   Here is the breakdown:   The beer appears as a golden amber color with a one finger head of white  foam. The aroma of the brew gives a tropical fruit vibe with hints of tangerine and mango mixed with some  undertones of a grapefruit hop and a little bit of pine. The taste begins with a tropical fruit sweetness mixed with a  doughy taste. As the taste lingers, more and more hop comes to the  tongue starting out with grapefruit followed by some flavors of an herbal and pine hop. The body of the brew is average in thickness and creaminess  with a carbonation level that is lighter. Overall this is a well-balanced fruity IPA that if you are not careful can put you on your ass!  #supportlocal

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Excellent brewery, parking can be a challenge during the weekend. They have some the finest craft brews on tap in Austin. I have enjoyed their Mexican style lager and other Pilsner style brews. They have some nice tropical IPA to satisfy even the most discerning of beer drinking palates. At least 8 tables outside that have shade, which provide a nice social gathering space to enjoy a sunny Austin afternoon with a beer and some fresh air as you contemplate the mysteries of the Universe. There is also a food truck that serves some decent fish tacos.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: I visited Austin Beerworks over the weekend for a benefit/fundraiser event and had a blast! The beer was refreshing and my frozen drink was delicious! I had 2 of the cranberry frozen mimosas, which I could have sipped on all day. I was glad to see they offered other things besides just their beer. The space was perfect for our fundraiser. My kid enjoyed the play area with the hill/tunnel and there were plenty of other kids for her to play with. I'd definitely come back here to hang out with friends or family.

reviews.author: Vanessa S.
reviews.description: A local staple. Everyone knows about this place so don't expect any one on one experiences. Great outdoor area, family friendly, and be on the lookout for events! Don't forget to walk on the right side of the bar for stickers and other treasures

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: I'm surprised I haven't been here sooner because I love their beer. There's ample seating indoors and outdoor, and they have a great selection of beer.   There was also a food truck that sold burgers, where you had to order at the bar. I would definitely come here again :)

reviews.author: Kasey F.
reviews.description: Visiting on a Sunday afternoon. Plenty of outdoor space. Nice and sunny with umbrellas and patio tables. I ordered a 4beer flight from the 25 or so they offered. They're all good so far. (My only disappointment is that they don't offer a sour. Please, make a sour!!)  Currently waiting on my food order. There's a taco truck here today.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Love this place and love that they have food trucks. Great indoor and outdoor seating as welll

reviews.author: Tristan B.
reviews.description: Solid beers, cool space. Bartenders are a little cold and the tap list while usually varied, can sometimes be a bit lacking.   That aside, still a solid vibe and a good place to meet up with friends.

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: Kudos to the staff at Austin Beerworks -- class acts all the way. We were in your original taproom Saturday (March 5) for a Celebration of Life for a friend. Your staff was amazing. It was a perfect way to pay tribute to our friend, and y'all were so great as everyone struggled to leave on time. You could have been rigid about shooing us out the door on the dot, but your staff showed great generosity of spirit toward a grieving group, many of whom were in from out of state. Thanks for creating such a warm, welcoming space for this event. You demonstrated the best of Austin, Texas hospitality and friendliness.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I feel conflicted giving a fairly low rating given I consistently think of ABW as one of the top handful of breweries in Austin, but I'm giving this as a rating of the taproom experience moreso than a rating of their beers. I've also only gone during Covid, so I'm looking forward to giving them a try in the future when I can comfortably get the full experience.   Compared to other patios in the area I find theirs to be pretty lacking. There were no fans in the summer and no heat lamps in the winter. Their space isn't particularly large so there are fewer tables than other locations. This leads it to be uncomfortably packed on weekends, both in terms of how close tables are and the lack of distancing enforced in lines.   One weird thing working against them is just how available their beer is around town. Every HEB and bar will have at least a couple of ABW's beers available, so they lose out on the necessity of going to the taproom to try their beers. Even their seasonals get around town pretty well both in stores and on tap elsewhere.   On that note, and to not make this review totally negative, their beer is absolutely phenomenal. All their flagships are good to great examples of the style, my personal favorites are the Sun Shovel (think blue moon but with some hop prescence) and Fire Eagle (leans more towards West Coast IPA, but has enough juiciness to be really refreshing in the summer time).   Their seasonals also absolutely knock it out of the park. Sputnik (Coffee Oatmeal Stout) is an absolute must if you're in Austin in December and is probably the best beer I've had since moving here. The Heisenberg (a combination of a Pilsner and Hef) and Black Thunder (Black Lager) are two other stand outs to me.  The food truck is good enough that if you need something to snack on while you're there you won't be totally dissatisfied, but I've usually felt compelled to go elsewhere for food.  Overall, can't recommend their beer enough, but you don't need to visit the taproom to get the full experience.

reviews.author: Scott S.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a couple in the tent on a recent chilly Saturday afternoon. The beer is great and the variety of experimental beers makes for a fun beer day. Good beer people!

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: After three months of sheltering at home, Austin Beer Works was a first outing.  They did an excellent job with social distancing, wiping down each table after guests left, and mask enforcement (when not seated at table) in a firm but polite way.    No inside seating right now and the outdoor tables are shaded and a good distance apart. It is reservations only. depending on the time you make the reservation for, you will either get an hour to enjoy your table or two hours.  They go over all the rules with you when you arrive.  They have some great beers, both on tap and in cans. You can purchase some to take home with you as well!  I ordered a sour raspberry-lemon Einhorn.  So summery and refreshing!  I ended up drinking two.  My husband had an Essential IPA and the Small Spoon session IPA.   We didn't care for the Heisenberg Heff-lager (a bit too banana-ish).  The only thing that would have made the difference from 4 stars to 5 would have been some kind of food! Even a bag of chips or pretzels to go with the beer would have been awesome! We saw a food truck parked there but unfortunately it was not open.

reviews.author: Sherry P.
reviews.description: I like the set up and idea. Inside brewery and seating tables. Outside food truck. Order everything inside.  Comfortable atmosphere, good inside music, and great variety of beers. The tacos and burger are fantastic!   Get you a cold one!

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: I don't have anything negative to say about Austin Beerworks other than the occasional difficulty with parking. I've only had that issue a few times though. The staff is incredibly helpful and knowledgable, but I think the best part of the experience (other than the drinks) is the atmosphere. The interior is very spacious which makes it a perfect space for a casual happy hour with coworkers while the exterior has an abundance of seating.
