I'll definitely be returning if I am ever up that direction!

reviews.author: heather g.
reviews.description: Austin Beer Works doesn't always have Spurs, but when they do, they are THE BEST!! If you haven't tried a Tropical Einhorn and you like spurs, you're missing out!  The staff are AMAZING and the set up both inside and outside are fun. Totally family friendly and they have an awesome food truck on site (permanently)

reviews.author: Novalina N.
reviews.description: Cool that they're open now!  Arrived around 4 and it was busy so waited around 20 minutes before we could be seated  There's no markers on the ground so lines seemed to form in different places when I was there. Didn't particularly like it when people were right behind me (thanks covid). Hope they add these markers soon!

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: I really want to love this place but their service is just terrible. Every single time I come, they make it feel like it's an inconvenience to them that I need a minute to order or if I have a question, they make it seem like I should have their menu memorized.   They do have a larger beer selection for local breweries, parking is hit and miss, outdoor seating is mostly shaded. Inside is picnic seating. There's a food truck here if you get hungry. I feel ok bringing my dogs here.   The service is just that bad that I can't recommend them as much as their beer gives them credit for.

reviews.author: Rebeca G.
reviews.description: The COVID precautions are great! Tables are spread out indoors as well as in outdoor seating. I was impressed with the table cards that help guest determine if tables are clean or in need of cleaning. Overall very clean space.   As it relates to the atmosphere, like mentioned kept very clean, and customer service is great. Service was great inside was helped decide what drinks to get and given samples of a few to help make decisions. Service was also great outside with the food truck.   For the quality and experience the price for everything was great! The beers taste amazing and the kombucha was fantastic. The burgers were very tasty. Best burgers I've had in a long time.   A sight you just see for yourself!

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: The bartender who waited on us was so so sweet and friendly. We felt very welcomed. We got a flight which I felt was very reasonably priced and tried 5 different beers. Now I'm no beer connoisseur by any means, so I won't even bother rating the beers. For someone who likes beer but doesn't necessarily like anything super strong or any craft beers for that matter, the amber we tried suited me perfectly. This is definitely a cool facility with the rooftop deck and plenty of seating. It just so happened to be FREEZING when we were enjoying our time on the roof. This was overall a great experience.

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: Do not believe what the website says, none of the beers on the website. Not worth the drive to their establishments.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Beer seems to be hit or miss. But overall it's a great atmosphere, dog friendly (even fenced areas for them to roam). The road is sort of loud, but it's a nice and relaxing atmosphere. The food truck is incredible! The burgers are great and the tots are extra crispy and perfect!

reviews.author: Rita K.
reviews.description: Our first time and we loved it! Adored the burgers - really hit the spot. The fried pickles were amazing. Beers were also great and staff was helpful and accommodating- your dog is welcome! Chill vibe.

reviews.author: Kaitlin B.
reviews.description: This place is total trash. Don't eat here if you are starving to death. I asked them to at least melt the cheese on the tots and it was the end of the world. They were rude and their food is gross.

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: What a fabulous hang out!  We hung out on the roof!  Food truck has yummy burgers and DELISH tator tots! Wine selection is small but the Cupcake Chardonnay isn't too bad!  Just a bit outside San Mo - cute place!  Live music!!!

reviews.author: Bridget S.
reviews.description: Loved Middleton before COVID, managed to still support them during, and am delighted to be back now that we're on the road back. They spent the pandemic brewing up some tasty new beers to add to their already delicious standards, I think Good might have replaced Third Coast as my favorite while Evil has supplanted my husband's usual Juicy Visions. And have to give a shout-out to the edition of the Burger Truck--wonderful, especially the bacon/Brussels sprout combo (I know, sounds weird but so good!). We were so worried about our local hang-outs surviving the pandemic and couldn't be happier that Middleton not only survived but is coming back stronger than ever.

reviews.author: Jorge S.
reviews.description: Nice brewery with a very nice facility. Staff was friendly and they do allow dogs. It was a little to hot outside to enjoy their roof top patio area.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: I'm going to get this out of the way real quick.  There was a cat walking around on the bar.  Yes, you heard me.  ON THE BAR.  I knew it was a dog friendly place, but come on - a cat ON the bar?  It even walked over to my side of the bar, sat down, put its leg behind its head like cats do, and then proceeded to lick its butt in front of me.  Hey cat, I'm really impressed that you can do that, but you're not getting a tip from me.  The staff member that it belonged to shooed it away, but it stayed on the bar.  Subtract one star for this show.  Next up:  As I said, it's dog friendly.  VERY dog friendly.  There were two dogs belonging to customers roaming around freely inside the place.  A third dog was on a leash, but it kept barking at the other dogs.  This wasn't outside on the patio, this was all inside.  When I go somewhere to hang out and relax, I don't want to deal with barking dogs (in my book, it's akin to bringing screaming kids into a bar).  Subtract one star for letting the dogs inside.  Keep the cats and dogs *outside* and this would be a five star brewery to chillax at.    Beer:  They have a decent selection of brews and like most breweries, they have some permanent ones and some seasonals that rotate in and out.  They have five or six store bought wines available.  Staff:  VERY knowledgeable about their beer and can suggest something for you once you describe your taste palette to them.  Food:  The food truck out front is permanently hitched up here, the one in the back changes occasionally.    Plenty of seating inside and outside, there's even a spacious deck on the second floor.  Growler refills are $14 and crowlers are $9.40 (buy three crowlers and get 10 percent off).  If your selection is over 8 percent ABV, additional charges may apply.   One more note about the dogs and I'll put this puppy to bed.  There's a fenced off area downstairs to let your dogs run rampant in - put them in there instead of bringing them inside - or better yet, leave them at home.  This whole thing with people bringing their dogs everywhere is getting out of hand.    I was going to give them two solid stars, but now that I think about it, if they let cats run back and forth across their bars, how clean is their brewing process?  It's a cool place with good brews, and I want to like it, but when I think about the animals everywhere, I think twice about what might be in the beer.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Nice spot floor brews and live music. I was told that the food trucks are good.  Maybe next time.    Suggestions- Check music lineup. Surprisingly older crowd spot.  Moose Out

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Was hoping to love this place, but we were pretty disappointed with the beer selection... Love the space and the dog friendliness! Plus we heard the food truck was awesome! But the beers just really fell short... Maybe we are a little too spoiled living in Austin around so many amazing breweries

reviews.author: Jasmine G.
reviews.description: I'm giving this place one star for the burger truck. Our beers were good and I like the atmosphere inside. The guy in the burger truck was SO rude. The table next to us also had multiple issues with their orders that they were loudly complaining about. I asked for the loaded tots with no beef and he said he couldn't ring them up that way. We weren't asking for a discount, just remove the beef???? So then he said to get regular tots and add cheese and onions/jalapeños. What did we get? Plain tots. He was also so fricking unfriendly. The table next to us retired a burger that had the bun top black/burned, and apparently he complained about redoing it. Brewery needs to rethink this employee.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Middleton is a must if you're stopping by or even in the general area.  We were driving from Wimberley (a fun day at Jacob's Well) towards the San Marcos outlets, and had to double back even to come to Middleton! We were so glad we did. My bf even walked out with their peach crowler...just a warning though, bring a cooler of some sort so it doesn't explode in your car with the heat! Totally speaking from personal experience, sadly.  We shared two rounds of tasters, which come with 5 different selections. So come with friends and try them all! You'll be surprised at how delicious they all are. Middleton is also HEAVEN for Belgian lovers. Good thing we love Belgians. Little did I know that a microbrew outside of Austin would be a great place for craft Belgians. I'm an all-around beer lover--everything except saisons, NE pale ales, and lagers, whereas the bf is a Belgian enthusiast. He always goes for Belgians. So you can imagine why we decided to get a taste of everything Belgian. I also enjoyed their Easy Ride PA, but was not a fan of the chile IPA (to each their own). It was almost impossible for me to compare and contrast the beer quality to the all-around atmosphere of the place. It oozes joy and love--they have brew dogs (and customers can bring doges too) who basically just lie around and nap, PLUS they have popcorn that is self-serve from those tiny machines that you see in Disneyland and other carnival events.  Will definitely be back to Middleton. Clean restrooms, and large space indoors for bigger groups (WITH TV's!) and cool fun outdoors games like human jenga outside. There is plenty of parking in their private loose, gravel parking area, and they had a food truck parked right outside. Awesome spot, great beer, fantastic space!

reviews.author: Benjamin B.
reviews.description: Visited for the first time in 6+ years on a quiet night. Jimmy made our vacation sweet as hell and took the best care of us possible. Good conversation and great beers. Glad to know this place has only gotten better since college. Keep killing it, guys.

reviews.author: Cesar R.
reviews.description: Heading to the Texas hill country? Love beer? Make sure to stop at Middleton Brewery!  I will confess I am not a huge beer lover but my friends are and were raving about this place so we  stopped by to watch the Euro Cup game between Germany and Italy.  The brewery is well design with great bar space and patio area. Dogs are welcome so bring your pup, children not so much ;-).   Step up to the bar and build your own beer flight you get five picks of 2-3 ounces each for $12. There wasn't a beer I didn't like! From the Porter to the American Red there were all good!   Live band was great and the two flat screens more than met our soccer watching needs.  So if your looking for a place to get your hops fix in the Texas Hill Country this is it!

reviews.author: Steve K.
reviews.description: A MUST for anyone looking for an essential hill country experience. Delicious beer in a variety of styles. Wonderful atmosphere.   2 world famous brewery mascots; Pinky the dog (as white and large as Gandalf's horse). Dunkel the cat (omnipresent and all-knowing)  Dunkel is the sweetest cat and deserves to be in the brewery hall of fame. Some heartless punk in the reviews below complained about Dunkel. This same guy has a Lonestar beer as his profile pic, so at least we know he has ZERO brewery review credibility.   As a result Dunkel's been banned from the taproom. So, Thank you, Lonestar bro, for driving out from your big city to a enchanting, rural, authentic hill country brewery and complaining about an animal for no good reason.   Knowing the type of compassionate, animal-loving people who frequent this place, I'm sure we can rally together to #FREEDUNKEL.

reviews.author: Lindsay J.
reviews.description: Didn't have a drink, but stopped in for the experience...It is a very cool vibe!!! Singing, dancing, drinking on a Friday night = Perfection!  I was jealous I couldn't stay. If only I lived in the Hill Country, I would do this all the time. There was a live band.  There is a dance floor. There are two food trucks. And, there is plenty of beer to try. The location is between Wimberley, Canyon Lake and San Marcos...As the Hill Country grows, places love me this are a great option for all those migrating South!

reviews.author: James P.
reviews.description: My wife and I took my cousin and his wife for a visit on a quiet weekend. My wife and I are avid animal lovers and thus it's hard to describe our feelings about this place. On entering, there were numerous dogs wandering around and a cat walking across the bar, and after we sat down there were animal feces and urine on the floor. Needless to say, this was offputting to our group. Unfortunately, we did not notice the animal waste until we had already ordered. The service was average and somewhat lackluster. Nobody checked on us after we ordered our beer. As for the beer, it was good quality craft beer but nothing stood out at us. Take him away the issues with the animal waste, we still would not have found this an impressive venue and probably would not return. This is truly a shame, given the place's 4.5-star reviews on Yelp.

reviews.author: Priscilla Y.
reviews.description: We made a quick stop here on our road trip to San Antonio. The beers we got were really good and it seemed like a fun atmosphere. The bsrtenders were friendly. They have an outdoor patio out front and also an awesome rooftop deck. Free popcorn! They don't sell food, but there is a food truck outside.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: We went here a month or so ago in the evening. It has some indoor seating, and a loooooot of outdoor seating along with some very tasty food trucks! Perfect place to bring a group of friends, all get your own food, and then get some drinks at meanwhile brewing. You can order drinks both indoors and outdoors, so if you feel like just staying outdoors you can definitely do that! Drink options are super varied, so likely you will find something you like... Even if you're just sleepy and need coffee :) Definitely check it out if you're looking for an outdoor drink and food place to hang out with friends.. dog.. etc. It is kid friendly, too!

reviews.author: Emily E.
reviews.description: I've been hearing "You need to checkout Meanwhile Brewing sometime" ever since it opened, and I FINALLY got to check it out!  First off, the building is massive and almost looks like a Church...for beer (aka the best kind.)  When you enter, you are greeted by bright and welcoming decor, and plenty of plush, velvety booths as well as tables/chairs for additional seating in their "private event" space.  There tends to be 3-4 bartenders at all times which is great, because there really isn't a great space for lining up so patrons end up in cluster/blob.  (Not super important.)  Beer wise, there is an extensive menu with an adequate mixture of flavor profiles.  They have several non-alcoholic options include coffee and tea, as well as some mixed drinks and even a sake?!    Their Black Lager was a personal favorite - smooth and despite its dark color from malt, it wasn't overly malty.  All around great flavor and a tad too easy to drink (wink, wink)  Their Blueberry beer had a slight tartness and sweetness.  Very pleasant.   Their Hefe was slightly disappointing for my tastes - it just felt a little flat.   Regarding their outdoors space, wow.  We came during music performances in the evening, and they went all out!  I will note that it was incredibly loud and hard to hear, so if that's not the vibe you like, avoid their music sessions.  They have three food trucks on-site to help you stay awhile!  Plenty of picnic tables and loads of doggy friends to meet!  Overall, great experience and will definitely continue to make the trek out!

reviews.author: Eugenia L.
reviews.description: Meanwhile is a great place to meet up with friends who don't want to venture too far beyond city limits. Better yet its family friendly with a soccer field, playground set, and more open space for kids to round around.  The drink menu has a little bit of everything from coffee to cocktails and of course beer. If its a warm day I'm going with the Who Doesn't Like Pineapple because it's tart and refreshing. It'll give you summer beach vibes but without the annoying tourists and sunburn. Well maybe not the sunburn part since it's TX.  With several food trucks on site it tempts you to order something from each to share with the group. Just make sure to save room for dessert at Besame!

reviews.author: Allison G.
reviews.description: Such a fun brewery about 10 minutes from the airport! We had several beers and got food from the taco truck! I tried the Pub House Ale, the Pilsner, and the Marzen. They were all super delicious! They also allow you try samples at the bar. If you're not a beer drinker, they have cocktails, wine, and coffee to choose from. They have tons of food trucks outside that seem to rotate daily. There was a taco truck today we really enjoyed. There's tons of space indoor and outdoor for seating. It has a great vibe and is also dog friendly. Highly recommend, especially if you're waiting to check into your air bnb! Definitely check it out!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: I'm a thirty something with a toddler and this is my paradise! Meanwhile is practically in my backyard in Southeast Austin. I can choose from a variety of beers, cocktails, wine, Frose or coffee to sip on AND they have a selection of 4 food trucks to fill my belly. Wait for it though .... I can enjoy these things while my kid expends her energy in a safe, kid friendly environment! Wooohoo I'm here for it! This absolutely is my favorite spot in town right now. Our family can't get enough of it.   My favorite beers are the sours! They have pizza, BBQ, taco and ice cream food trucks, so everyone can surely find something they love with this variety. The open outdoor space is magnificent. On the weekends recently they even have some flea market vendors out which is fun. The best part though is the playground for my little one! Also the astroturf seating area with the little hill my kid loves to do rolls down! At this stage of my life I don't think it can get much better than Meanwhile. I love this place.

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: Meanwhile Brewing is massive. Meanwhile has the following food trailers: pizza, taco, barbeque, and ice cream. They have a great little stage for entertainment, a good variety of beers (as well as wine and cider), and it's extremely kid and dog friendly. There is street parking (there's a parking lot, too, but it's definitely small for how many people can fit in this establishment). We thought the bartenders were friendly and efficient.

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Update:  Since management respinded to my review and mentioned an outdoor beer station being added, I'll up to 3 stars and try again after they do open the outdoor annex, at which point I'll update ratings again.  The beer and mixed drink choices were large btw.  :)  Cool venue, so I bumped Meanwhile Brewing from 1 to 2 stars.  MEANWHILE (so aptly named), below are pictures of 2 lines to get a beer.  Neither moves fast.  Really.  At a brewery?  Is this their 1st rodeo?   What's the point of having a venue if you have to wait in line 30 min or more for a beer?!?  I'm just gonna bring my wife her beer and she can hang with friends while I simply get in line again and try and tell myself not to be grumpy that my life here will be a circle of order a beer, drink it in line to get the next beer or perhaps letting an advance beer get warm so I can be out of line for a few minutes between trips.

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: One of my favorite spots in Austin. I love the venue under the live oak trees, the open space, and the playground. No hard alcohol, but I feel they make up for it with their creative cocktails and house-made seltzers.   The food trucks give enough variety that there is something for everyone -- pizza, BBQ, Mexican, and the BEST ice cream! But the best part for me is sitting back in the Adirondack, cold drink in hand, watching my little one playing on the playground with a live band in the background.   I hope we continue to get more places like this in Austin!

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: Easily my favorite brewery in town.   The food trailers here are all bomb and on point. This is an awesome spot for lunch. You can get everything from world class tacos, great pizza to Texas Monthly Top 50 ranked BBQ.   The beer is absolutely amazing. The collabs with local breweries and bars such as Cosmic and St. Elmo are all cool and tasty -AF.   The to go beer options are always great. You can have a few pints and come home with some amazing beer to finish the night at home watching a movie with.   I've seen a few shows here. Saw Eternal Champion here and had a blast. The venue is great for live music, anytime they have a live show its worth the cover to hang out and see some live tunes and have some amazing beer.   The best thing about Meanwhile for me happens to be that its extremely family friendly. They have a playground a soccer court and large open field that is perfect for flying kites. They are all fenced in so its the perfect spot for me to bring my daughter to play. My family comes here regularly and we really enjoy the family friendly aspect Meanwhile offers.   I could go on and on about how much I love the beer and just this space in general. Its really do not miss Austin location now.   Thanks for offering so much good stuff Meanwhile you rock!  edit: I almost forgot to mention how awesome the coffee and breakfast tacos by Pueblo Viejo are here.

reviews.author: Krista H.
reviews.description: A hidden gem! Meanwhile is one of my favorite places in Austin! It is located in the middle of a business park, but once you get on the grounds you feel like you are truly transported. Not only do they have their brewery and taproom on site, they also have 4 food trucks! You can pair your beer with tacos, pizza, bbq, or amazing ice cream!  My personal favorite beers here are their sours. They keep their menu fresh and change it up frequently, so if you see something you might enjoy, go quickly! The best part about their location is the open space and seating area. There are so many tables and benches throughout the back and they even have a stage with live music on certain days. The environment is so fun and you will see lots of dogs and children around too. I appreciate that they have a playground for kids.   If you are not a beer drinker, they also serve cocktails made with seltzers and amazing coffee drinks! I love their vanilla latte and will opt to get that most of the times I go there!  Overall, there is something for everyone here! Between the drink selections, food options, seating area, and live music, everyone in your group will have fun! I will always recommend Meanwhile!

reviews.author: Tim R.
reviews.description: Excelllent place. Good beer great venue food trucks on property. All you need in one location.

reviews.author: Clem F.
reviews.description: They have beer. The staff serves the beer. They seem happy to work here. Like the management have not sucked the life out of them by over working them and prohibiting them from taking time off. It's nice to see people with life and a sparkle in their eyes. I wish I still saw that when I looked in the mirror. Oh, did I mention that they serve beer?

reviews.author: Gwendolyn B.
reviews.description: Came during icemegeddon 2021 and had to come back and try it out again.  Beautiful location and amazing beers!  A must visit!

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: Here's a secret, a lot of folks who go to these breweries don't go because of how good the IPA or the cider is, they have a long list of other factors.   We had an IPA and a cider, they were good, not life-changing, but decent. I have yet to sample the entire beer selection but I will. And you know why? Because of everything else the place offers ensures I'll be back.  The tacos from the taco truck were really impressive, exceeded expectations actually. The pizza was equally excellent.   The set up for the grounds was spot on. The trees, the playground, the environment with families, dog owners, young people, it all meshed well because everyone had a section that fit their methods of socializing.  You can't tell me this isn't a science because significant thought (and money, I'm sure) went into developing this experience. Bravo!  Now I need to drink some more of their beers.

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: This is probably one of the best breweries that opened in ATX in 2020 - during a pandemic at that! Since their opening, they've been doing gangbusters business with no signs of slowing.  Obviously, when you visit, you'll notice they have a huge space and $$ was spent to fully build it out. It's not a small brewery that grew up, it was built to be big. There is plenty of seating inside and even more seating outside on the turf + mulch area. But, be forewarned this place is busy. Saturday afternoons are packed with people with pets and families. There is a playscape so parents like this place.   Now, to their beer. Meanwhile brews consistent and good beer. They have a variety of beers from regular German Pils to New England IPAs. Nothing infected and nothing with off flavors. They always seem to have a good rotation of beers.   Don't like beer? They also have wine, cocktails and coffee! Something for everyone.   While they don't serve food, there are numerous food trucks to order from.   Even though the lines can get long, they do move pretty quickly (especially the line that is at the main entrance).   We would come here more often if it were closer to us, but getting across the river is the hardest part. :)

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Amazing place! Love that it's in the warehouse district, so it's off the beaten path. A TON of shaded seating and room to spread out. There was a kid's bday party there and we didn't notice (yay for our dog). There was plenty of water to help yourself to as well as a nice list of beers. They were all incredible (even the German ones)! They also have some cocktails, frozés and coffee available. We got an iced dirty chai on our way out, since their coffee looked and smelled good. WOW! Nice and strong! I am very picky about coffee being too weak and having to add extra shots of espresso, but this was on point!  We will definitely be back! Great, friendly staff, and we especially loved that we could order beer starting at 10a on Sunday! In early and out early!

reviews.author: Rachel F.
reviews.description: A MUST go to in Austin!!! Highly, highly recommend. 100/10, great beer, tasty cocktails, delicious frozen rosé and a killer hard kombucha  This is place also has amazing food trucks too (dough boys- out of this world garlic knots with a lemon ricotta dip*drooling) and a beautiful outdoor area for adults and children (there's a playground!). Adults can have a beverage and lounge while their kids get their energy out. Very fun spot!!

reviews.author: Arlene T.
reviews.description: Third time here.... 5 stars for the outdoor area ... super cool and big play area for kids off to the side which is great so that other people who either want to get away from kids or are not particularly into kids running all over the place around them while enjoying beers won't be annoyed by them. #notthattheresanythingwrongwithkids  1 star to the beer servers.... attitude like snobby coffee barristers! I'm always mystified by ANY questionable servers ... don't they know that if they'd give better service, they'd get better tips?!?!!   3 stars to the beer

reviews.author: Tom T.
reviews.description: Meanwhile Brewing has a large complex. Plenty of seating. It is kid and pet friendly. Their selection of beers is very good. We enjoyed the beers we had. They have an area setup for food trucks. This was a well thought out venue. If you get a chance, I highly recommend trying Meanwhile Brewing Co.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: A very Austin brewery, but I mean that in a good way. A lot of thought was put into design, decor and layout - and it shows. Very chic, but also comfortable . Gorgeous outdoor spaces, this is a great place to hit when we get good weather in central Texas. REALLY good beer, tons of styles - but all really well made. Any beer drinker will love a visit here. A variety of food trucks at peak times makes for a versatile dining experience for your group. Very family friendly with a nice play area for kids. Just a great spot. Drink local!

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: Great brewery. We had eaten at the BBQ place down the road :( and decided to stop here for a few beers and are glad we did. They had several beers that were very good. The Sunset Lager, Northern Lights and Niagra Jewel (Hefeweizen), were all tasty beers. The Hefeweizen was my favorite. Usually it seems most breweries have maybe only one beer that I even half way like. The atmosphere was laid back and relaxing. We will definitely frequent this establishment again.

reviews.author: Cheryl L.
reviews.description: We had been hearing good things about this place and decided to check it out on Sunday afternoon. The interior has cozy decor, a good selection of interesting beers and plenty of snacks. We ordered a flight of 6 beers and they were all good. I especially liked a very unique cucumber infused lager that was cool and refreshing and got better as you drink it. It also went great with salty snack mix. The place was clean and well kept. The outdoor area seemed cozy too with a firepit going and lots of comfy seating. The staff was super friendly and we met the owner and he was a super nice guy. Would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Discovered on the way home from a day trip to Comfort. Nice setting with plenty of outdoor seating, yard games, and dog toys.  A little landscaping to eradicate the poison ivy around the oaks would be nice.   Tried a couple beers and settled on the Tang IPA. Refreshing on a hot day, with a hint of citrus, but not terribly awe inspiring. Bring your own munchies. As they're a few miles from anywhere, they could use a food truck.   Really like the setting and we'll definitely try to make it back next time we're in the neighborhood to give it another try.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: After visiting a very high stress brewery down the road in Blanco, I stumbled across this very cool, laid back, brewery while taking a shortcut through Spring Branch.  I seriously had no idea this place existed - I spotted it when driving by and had to do a U-turn to check it out.  It's been open about a year, has a clean bar and seating area inside, has a covered outdoor patio, and a food truck.    The brew is good and cold, they have 12 of their own brews on tap, including two meades.  64 ounce growler refills range between $16 and $25 depending on the brew you choose.  A six flight sampler is available for $9. You can even purchase six packs of some of their beer to take home with you.  Plenty of room for the kids to run around outside and stay out of your hair.  They have a corn hole washer game, the "ring-on-a-string-on-a-hook" game, a giant chess board (you know who you are), tether ball, horseshoes, and a swing.  Try the Buff Hefeweizen and the Sunset Lager - both are sehr gut!  They have sodas and water for $1.

reviews.author: James B.
reviews.description: New place and I'm loving it. It's a bit in the middle of nowhere, but worth the drive.  They have some interesting flavors, but nothing too crazy like some of the Austin Breweries. Every beer was good, but I'm going to say the Kimber Lyte was my favorite. An easy drinking beer with more than 5% alcohol. Tang IPA was finally a great tasting IPA, which I normally don't drink... don't worry they have other IPAs for IPA lovers.  The Stout was pepper flavored but good.  But they also Change things up and now they have a coffee stout.  Plenty of other beers to taste.  They have growlers and some of their stuff is bottled.  Hard to find in grocery stores.  Try HEB in San Antonio. And total kudos to the Bartender, great knowledgeable guy.

reviews.author: Bruce G.
reviews.description: I have been driving by their sign along 281 for a while. Had a little extra time and took the detour. Bought a six pack of Sunset Lager as a compromise to the better half and really enjoyed it. They are certainly off the beaten path but are worth the effort. During times such as we are experiencing we are trying to support local businesses and I highly recommend that folks in the north San Antonio area make the journey and enjoy the outdoor beer garden. Next up for me will be the IPA!

reviews.author: Sara D.
reviews.description: Such an awesome place! I do not remember the name of the beer my husband got, but I tried it and it was delicious! They have a good truck and it was some of the best food around. The animal style fries and bacon cheese burger were 5 stars! The ambiance is very laid back and they have games for the kiddos to play!

reviews.author: Dan B.
reviews.description: Very cool story by founder. Diamond miner. Cold beer good variety enjoyed the rough Diamond IPA. High IBUs but smooth not bitter. Building is clean love the pictures only feedback a little sterile in feel. Glad the are open most days during the week. And open till 7.   Nice bartender and already building a local following.   I would buy this beer as the start to distribute.   Place is  A "Diamond in the rough".....

reviews.author: Valerie R.
reviews.description: Please do not describe this place as kid friendly. We visited this place with friends and their 4 year old daughter was attacked by a massive dog who was situated next to the kid swing. Based off how the facility handled the attack it was clear this dog had been there with his owner multiple times and the bartender actually defended the owner and his dog, saying it was a "good dog" and the owners are "good people", even after the owner made threats to my husband for stating that the dog should be put down. Given how everything was handled, I would not be surprised if that dog is back on the premises next week. Please do not risk your children's safety by taking them here it's not worth it.

reviews.author: Kate A.
reviews.description: I for one love a good IPA or Stout, but this brewery had one of the most unique beers that I've had in a while.... a pumpkin spice beer! I know what you're thinking, typical white girl‍ but honesty I'm not much of a pumpkin spice fan usually.... I say USUALLY, because this one is phenomenal!!! And the atmosphere is super cute!

reviews.author: Britney F.
reviews.description: This is probably my favorite craft brewery I have been to yet. All of the beers they have made have been great. I even like their IPAs and I usually hate IPAs. The best thing to do when you go is to get a flight so you can try all of their flavors. My favorites are the kimber light which has cucumber, their bock, and their Gone Pickin apple lager. They sometimes have food trucks out there as well so I would recommend following them on Facebook to keep up with when you can go and get great food and great beers.

reviews.author: Noihad B.
reviews.description: What a beautiful surprise it was to walk in the tasting room at Rough Diamond Brewery. Great atmosphere, very friendly people and above all Great Beer, I sampled all elven brews and what a treat that was. Very well crafted  variety of awesome beers. Will definitely come back!

reviews.author: Anna S.
reviews.description: We live this place. They know us by sight snd by the noise we make when here with friends. Plenty of a variety to suit everyone's taste, even this non-beer drinker! They are trying to make it family friendly, bringing in food trucks, too. This brewery has a bright future!!!

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: This is the best craft brewery that I've visited in a while. My family and I visited on a Friday evening. The location is just off of 173 (I think) right near 281 and 46. The location is quaint with beautiful trees. As we drove in, the first things that I noticed were the games set up around the yard. They have a large chess set, corn hole, a swing, and a game were one has to swing a ring and catch it on a hook. The second thing that I noticed was a barbecue food truck. We had gotten subway sandwiches to have with our beer but ended up getting a little barbecue also. We headed inside and were promptly greeted by the bartender. The building is really clean and the tap set up is modern. I ended up doing a flight which has 6 samples from the list of 12 beers on tap. All in all, a really great experience and will definitely plan on visiting again!

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: The beer is great and the covered patio makes for a great place to enjoy the hill country breeze. The Viking Water was a pleasant surprise and perfect for a hot summer day. Broad selection and a friendly staff make this a good place to hit up on a weekend road trip.

reviews.author: Rick B.
reviews.description: Good selection. Leave the highway and slow down when you get close. Back to beer six rotate and the other six stay. The oatmeal stout is very good. I will be back to try the rest. The food truck rotates but is smells great

reviews.author: Jason G.
reviews.description: Solid!  Some nice brews, a few just ok.  Friendly staff (in fairness, during our visit there was just one guy working) and a laid back vibe.  No problem recommending this place to others.  Being picky, I wish they'd weedeat the outdoor areas a bit.  The place has some nice areas to sit under the trees, horseshoe pits, even an oversized chessboard.  But, all of it is under 2 feet tall weeds.  Again, no trouble recommending this brewery to others...and we'll definitely be back many more times.

reviews.author: Scott P.
reviews.description: Best beer hands down and I'm a serious beer guy.  I visit ALOT of breweries everywhere I go and I can honestly say that I enjoyed every single beer they offer.  And most times I avoid IPA like the plague but I like these.  I'll make a special trip just to fill up the growler for the weekend. The staff is very nice and helpful and always very accommodating.  These guys have a good thing going for sure

reviews.author: Cody S.
reviews.description: Been driving past this place for a while waiting for it to open. Couldn't wait to try it out! Finally got to go and so glad I did. Nice atmosphere inside and bartender was very helpful. Nice selection of beers. Still feels like it's coming together a bit. Would be great if they had some food trucks outside sometime to get some food as well. Looking forward to trying again!

reviews.author: Sergio R.
reviews.description: Beer was mediocre... I generally don't have high expectations for microbreweries in Texas and I would lump the beer here with the rest of them. Tangerine IPA was one-dimensional, drinkable but that's about it. Facilities were clean and spacious. We chose to stop by here because I had heard good things about it and Yelp claimed they're "Kid-friendly"... This was FAR from accurate for us. I came here with my pregnant wife, my 3-year-old son, my good friend from work, his pregnant wife and his 4-year-old daughter. In the time it took for us to find a table to sit at outside, my friend's daughter was attacked by a large mastiff-labrador mix. In a matter of a few seconds, this dog managed to escape its owners and clamp onto my friend's daughter's torso, leaving several puncture wounds, scratches an bruises in the process. Once everything was all said and done, the bartender on duty defended the dog and its owners. There was little in the way of apologies or effort to rectify the situation. I had to call 911 to ensure authorities were made aware of the attack and dog's vicious nature. I would have expected folks working the establishment to at least handle this; they did not. After EMS and Sheriff personnel handled the situation and left, I witnessed the bar server on duty taking a smoke break with one of the members of the dog owner's party... clearly small-town, take-care-of-your-kin mentality going on here. I do not recommend coming to this place unless you're part of this inner circle.

reviews.author: Alyssa M.
reviews.description: It's my first time coming to Texas and these two wonderful women that run the place did not disappoint!  They were so friendly and welcoming! There was great live entertainment with such an amazing atmosphere! Everyone was just so friendly and we felt like we were at home. If you haven't gone to this brewery yet you're missing out it's a must go when in Austin! All of the beers were incredible and so delicious! Thank you everyone for the wonderful experience we will be back!

reviews.author: Kelly H.
reviews.description: While out visiting Austin for my birthday back in February, we stumbled across this amazing brewery, which ended up being our favorite one of the entire trip!  I had multiple beers from here, but my absolute favorite was the Dye It Black.   It had such great flavor and was very easy drinking.  The other ones I sampled were also really great and it was very difficult to choose.  This brewery is kind of out in the middle of nowhere.  It's got a rustic outdoors-ish feel to it.  There were benches throughout the brewery to sit at and nothing was done up too fancy, and almost felt like you were hanging out in someone's garage (which isn't a bad thing).  Patty was our bartender and she was absolutely fantastic!  She offered wonderful hospitality and when she found out it was my birthday, she bought me a birthday beer!  Tip - If you check-in on Yelp, you get a free pint glass to take home.  It was a great souvenir to have to remember this great brewery!

reviews.author: Katherine B.
reviews.description: Greeter by a friendly CIci. She explained all the Beer flavors. Three of us opted for SexApeel. Flavorful. Better than a Blue Moon. Sit inside (a/c) or outside. It's a great place to stop!

reviews.author: Kimberly S.
reviews.description: My husband and I are visiting Austin and stopped at Infamous Brewing Company for a flight. All the beers were good, but we especially enjoyed the cream ale, cider and Hefeweizen. Service was friendly and efficient. An added bonus was the food truck park next door. We didn't eat there, but heard positive reviews from other guests.

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: Great beer. That's pretty much all you need to know. Infamous is local, the people are friendly, and you can grab food with your beer.  I really liked they do samplers so you can get a six pack from multiple beers and see what you like best.  Surely I will be going back!

reviews.author: Brandy T.
reviews.description: Great brews with variety, super friendly including dog friendly staff, lots of space to covid friendly hang.

reviews.author: Destiny T.
reviews.description: Great experience and ambiance. The deal on Groupon was a plus and visiting was a casual afternoon date idea while on our trip to Austin. :)

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love that their doing a campaign to get the governor to allow breweries to be open Like restaurants. There's so much room to socially distance! Can't wait till were able to go back into the brewery but love that they found a way for us to be able to enjoy their beer and sit outside. Technically they don't own where the tables are so another company is sponsoring it and letting us sit at the tables and enjoy your beer to go. You can't enter the brewery at all so there is a porta potty, you pick up your beer at the window to go and can sit down outside and enjoy. Their growlers are also awesome!

reviews.author: Ross H.
reviews.description: I come here more than I would like to admit. Delicious beer, great atmosphere that feels laid back, relaxing, and enjoyable. Now with the food truck park there it is even better / worse beause I end up staying there all day, with no reason to leave.

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Dropped by on a very hot Sunday.  The Dye-it Pills and Jesus Juice (Ressurection) were the perfect remedy.  The misters and fans atound the picnic tables outside were a tremendous help.  Oh--the beer was really good...best lite Pills I've ever had.  We'll be back.  Staff was very friendly.

reviews.author: Andrew T.
reviews.description: This place MUST be added on your brewery tour list. We found it accidentally while we were up seeing the oasis. The beer was fantastic and I actually had a difficult time choosing my least favorite. They occasionally have live bands, from what I hear, but this place is good for a beer in the rustic shade. There are food trucks nearby if you get hungry.

reviews.author: Jessica B.
reviews.description: Great selection of beers that are local to lake Travis. Cici was amazing and gave us a rundown of every beer they had. This is such a great atmosphere and we will definitely be back! Their sex a peel was my favorite and really great for the summer months. 10/10.

reviews.author: D S.
reviews.description: A must for anyone that enjoys beer of any type. The infamous brewery makes and pours FRESHLY made products and sells cans/bottles at the same price as retailers.  Located after Hudson Dam, nestled in a small retail/manufacturing area, you can drink inside a small area with full view to the tanks used to make the product or sit outside on wooden benches/tables.  On weekends, they have great 2-3 person music sets, sitting on top of an antique delivery truck, or inside, depending on the weather.  Personal favorites are the Peanut Stout (think Guinness but with more flavor), the Czech dark lager and my wife loves the Sex Appeal!  The bartenders are all fun, with stories and a bit an attitude, feels like old Downtown Austin.  If you are a local or guest of Austin, Infamous is a must place visit!

reviews.author: peggy e.
reviews.description: Perfect Saturday on the patio! Noodles for the photobomb! LOVE THIS PLACE AND STAFF! Everyone is so friendly, spacious patio, and great local atmosphere!

reviews.author: David F.
reviews.description: Phenomenal beer. Great vibe. Fantastic food trucks. Live music kills it!  If you haven't been - GO!

reviews.author: Linh H.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this unassuming brewery during our family trip out in Austin. We needed a few hours to kill and I'm so glad we decided to stop by here.   It is a no frills and very homey brewery/tasting room, with a few tables inside and several outside. I didn't want to risk getting bitten by bugs so we opted to stay inside.   I did not catch their names but we were helped by two ladies and they were extremely nice! We settled on a flight and a pint of their gose (from a can, as it was not available on tap). She was nice enough of offer to open the can and just include it in my flight, but I didn't want to waste any gose and had her just give me the entire pint.   Most of the beer we tasted were delicious. We picked up a mix and match 6 pack, since I enjoyed their gose so much. It is really hard to find a brewery that does the gose the way the Germans in Leipzig do it, as it is supposed to be a bit salty and lightly sour, with some funkiness to it. It definitely isn't for everyone and Infamous does a pretty decent job at making it. Most other breweries treat it as a straight sour beer, so you'd get a big sour kick in the face.   Other beer worth mentioning are the Hijack cream ale, Bugsy's fire bush amber ale and Destination red ale. Also there is a Yelp check in for a free pint glass, perfect free souvenir for myself!

reviews.author: Mitch E.
reviews.description: You can order a pizza straight to the brewery. Pretty nice. Great beer. Dog friendly. Outdoor seating. Solid prices.

reviews.author: Tom B.
reviews.description: I don't drink much nor often but when I get the urge to have a nice cold beer, I really enjoy going to Infamous Brewing. Their set up in these social distancing days is perfect. Plenty of tables and room at the next door patio area (Shout out to Lakeway Plumbing for opening up their place for folks to relax). Really, really clean porta potties too. CeCe is always ready to offer suggestions or let you sample a brew. She has patience with rookie's questions like no other! And - these are really great people trying to keep a great business viable. Go see them. Don't drink beer at all? Just go there, say "hi" and  buy a tee shirt or cap - Christmas is coming and these make great gifts.

reviews.author: Angel A.
reviews.description: This is a no bullshit brewery. Great beer, awesome owner and great staff. Fell in love with the Cream Ale but every beer is legit. The big plus is that it has a great neighborhood vibe.

reviews.author: Marie M.
reviews.description: Love this brewery.  This is the perfect place to come for a beer after a day on the lake.  Nice wide selection of beers.  Some unique offerings like their peanut butter stout, "Sweep the Leg". The day we went they had a taco truck outside, too. No frills setting for people who want a good beer.

reviews.author: Adam T.
reviews.description: This might be my favorite spot in Austin right now and it is still pretty chill/not well known so I hate that I'm writing a good review.   Some of the best beer out there I think and they've got awesome food to go with it. Burgers are really good along with all of their bar type things.  Pretty good happy hour specials during the week.   Good amount of space inside and out with a ton of parking and it is right next to Better Half so easy to hit both places without having to go anywhere.

reviews.author: Jackie K.
reviews.description: Hold Out Brewing is a good spot for bar food and drinks.  I was lucky and somehow got in line to order at the counter before the line got too long, and the food/drinks came out quickly after that.  It's above-average bar food, with nice and crispy curly fries and in-house baked chocolate chip cookies, which were nice surprises.  The one tip I'd make about Hold Out Brewing is to Uber there.  We drove, and the parking was somewhat terrifying.  There's actually a good-sized lot out back, but it gets really busy during happy hour.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: In this town, if feels like there's a brewery popping in every corner. I'm not complaining, simply making an observation. But what this means though is that you have to do something to stand out. You can't just brew your own beer and sell it in the warehouse, those days are gone.  Hold Out has a unique and very advantageous situation. They're next to Better Half (I think they're the same owner or partners?) and make great use of the property together as well as the opportunity to collaborate.  Additionally, Hold Out has their own food. While their menu isn't as complete as Better Half's, it's pretty decent for a "happy hour at the brewery" trip.  But you can't asses them without considering the Better Half contribution, which I've reviewed separately and loved.  The beer is good, although it lacked range in variety as there wasn't much darker beer. A lot of IPA selections, which I'm sure the market loves...but I don't.   I stuck to the lager and a couple other beers, all with weird names but I guess that's the game these days.   I had the vegan frito pie which was way more delicious than expected and had an interesting mix of flavors.   Of course, it all tied in well because we had dinner from Better Half and I don't need to tell you how good that was. You gotta try the grilled halloumi, trust me.  All in all, good vibe, great property.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Loved this place! All of the beers we tried were great. Not necessarily knock your socks off beer but definitely quality, good beer. I like that then allow smaller pours such as 8oz and 10oz. The staff was super friendly and easy to talk to and ask questions. Boyfriend and I both ordered the Hold Out Classic burger and it was just that - a classic burger with smash style patties. Super tasty. I ordered the comeback sauce on the side which helped make the burger not so messy. The curly fries were good too although I felt they were a little over cooked (but my boyfriend liked them crispy). If we lived in Austin, we would definitely be returning to Hold Out! Oh and also great seating options from indoor, outdoor with a covered patio and then non-covered outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Teresa L.
reviews.description: Hopping brewery in downtown Austin. Great selection of beer. Didn't eat but the food looked good. Definitely recommend to  your must visit brewery list.

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: We've been waiting for over an hour and still have no food. Please give me my food I am hangry. I got charged $2 for an avocado.  Update: food tastes good and is aesthetically pleasing. Not worth wait. Adding back 1 star

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: Major vibes! There's tons of parking and lots of space to hang out. The food complements the drinks perfectly

reviews.author: Kaitlin O.
reviews.description: I had about 8 people in my group for Sunday brunch. Was told the food wait time would be less than an hour. It took 2 hours for everyone to get food even though we all ordered right after each other. Food tasted good but definitely not worth both the price and the wait!

reviews.author: Susana P.
reviews.description: Good food, beer, and great location downtown. Also has huge parking lot out back. Recommend and would come back again!

reviews.author: Jevin H.
reviews.description: I was holding out on writing this review, but after seeing my friends rate it two stars, I had to go ham. My group was around 8 people. We ordered one dish per person. The food arrived an hour and a half later. I am confused how it could've taken so long for food to arrive. To make matters worse, the waiter said "sorry for the hold out" and laughed when he gave us our food. I held out on my laughter for that one. It should not take that long for pancakes or burgers to be prepared. No clue what was going on behind in the kitchen but the chef definitely holding out on cooking or something. Hopefully this was a one off experience, but I'm not holding out faith for this place.

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: Still relatively undiscovered. Great beer selection, friendly staff, and all around good feel to the place. I will return for one of those delicious looking burgers

reviews.author: Bernie W.
reviews.description: Wow, I would say this was our favorite place on our recent trip to Austin, tucked away on a side street off of West 6th it is a true hidden gem although no hidden handshake was needed to enter the converted spacious quonset hut.  Out side under cover were rows of picnic tables, beer was served inside and the food was brought out.  While the beers were outstanding, the food was unexpected, beyond the burgers which we did not try, they had a few interesting dishes such as a Crispy Artichoke  and Pimento and a Indian chickpea inspired take on the chili Frito pie, both were excellent and we are not vegetarians, we just wanted to try something new.  The smoky Rauchbier styled Marzen (?) was unusual and worth a taste but a pint was a little over the top.  Note for those who commented on slow service we were there on a Wednesday and there were no issues, I am sure a nice weekend might be another experience.

reviews.author: Sophia C.
reviews.description: Yummy food paired with good drinks, Hold Out is the perfect spot for a late night hangout with friends. They have a spacious outdoor patio that's great for dogs, and a convenient parking lot right across.   I ordered the fish sandwich and a strawberry sangria, and both were a hit! The sandwich came with delicious fried fish and various sauces (with a bit of spice) in between amazing thick toasted slices of bread. The sangria was refreshing and sweet, great for those who like fruity beverages!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: A modern hip Austin beer scene vibe with a full menu and brews. The beers here were pretty good. They have a spacious covered dog friendly patio. A great food menu that includes brunch. The curly fries were delicious. You can even order food next door at their sister better half cafe and get it delivered to you here. Their restrooms were brilliant. Best signage of this time!

reviews.author: Kristine C.
reviews.description: Has a couple of vegan options including the overnight oats and sweet potato hash without the sauce and eggs. We waited over 2 hours for our food to come out, portion size was pretty small and it was pretty average tasting. I got the sweet potato hash made vegan and it tasted okay but definitely not worth the wait/price!!!

reviews.author: Evan L.
reviews.description: It took 2 hours for all of us to get our food. The price was okay for the location + what I got, but personally I wasn't a huge fan of the cocoa crumble with the pancakes. Would maybe come here again and try something else if I heard the wait was less than 30 minutes

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Beer, wings, and curly fries: the essentials to the ultimate chill weekend. I would suggest ordering your own wings, do not share. I am a huge fan of IPA's. Hold Out Brewing's IPA selection did not disappoint.    TIP: Hold Out shares their private lot with Better Half, it's much easier to snag a table here versus Better Half.

reviews.author: Jay L.
reviews.description: The food is always superior here. Always exceeds expectations for presentation, freshness, and flavor. The kitchen sink salad for $6 is fantastic. Vegetables are fresh and crunchy, the beets are chilled, the nuts crunchy, the small pear shaped tomatoes are excellent and the dressing is outstanding.  1/2 for $6 is incredible value. The burgers are great and the crispy chicken sandwich (during the week ar lunch) is one of the best in Austin and for the price is perhaps best value too. Have had some ciders that seemed very vinegary and perhaps not right but food is always great.

reviews.author: Sierra J.
reviews.description: Hold out is a fairly new spot in Austin and is next to better half so we had to check it out! They have mostly Hazy juicy IPA's, so if you love those this is the place for you! My husband is one of those people and had a great time. I love sours and got the "syke!" And I thought it was great. They have food as well which we didn't get to check out but it looked awesome! I grab a cute cropped tank before we left. Hold out has a covered patio with a good amount of seating and seating inside. Our favorite part by far was the bartender that helped us. We didn't get his name but he has red hair and a mustache to match. He gave us some awesome recommendations to check out in Austin. Go for the beer stay for the hospitality!

reviews.author: Nan T.
reviews.description: Good place if you're looking for a lively spot to take friends or out of towners into the heart of Austin. Good drink prices and a good selection of beers, but I didn't find the two beers I tried to be anything special. They have a great food menu and the burger is really good, but it took quite a while for my food to come out. The ordering process was also a little chaotic -- long, long lines and loud music at the counter so it's hard to communicate with staff. Parking can be a nightmare if the lot in the back is full, and the roads are very narrow and uneven when you arrive at the brewery. Ultimately I think this is a good place for those looking to get the Austin experience, but I don't think I'll add this place to my usual rotation.

reviews.author: Scott N.
reviews.description: Central District is a great place to grab a quick beer for happy hour or get some work done. They have a generous selection of local, craft beers, including some that they brew in house. If you like sours, you can get a flight and try all of them!   In addition to plenty of space for large groups or meetings, there are plenty of outlets around for getting some work done. The staff were friendly and extremely fast. Parking can be an issue in this area, but there are plenty of paid lots nearby, so it shouldnt be an issue.

reviews.author: Cheryl K.
reviews.description: Slightly off the beaten path, near the visitor's center.  Not a lot of signage, so a little hard to find. The beer menu wasn't extensive, and was heavy on the sours.  I like a good sour so I did the tasting flight.  Hubby had a Belgian Quad that was very good. The sours were quite tasty, my favorite was the Key Lime Pie Gose - all it was missing was a graham cracker crust! The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu, so if you have questions they can point you the right direction. Inside there were plenty of tables and you could see the brewing room.  The day we were there they were not actively brewing.

reviews.author: Kristella P.
reviews.description: You can't go wrong with any beer here. This is one of the few places I got a flight and didn't not really like any of the beers.  My favorites were the Violet Crown Black Kettle Sour and Gold on the Ceiling IPA! Such quality craft beer

reviews.author: Mylesha D.
reviews.description: Getting there: Located in DT Austin, walking distance from the visitor center. Street parking is all around and there is a parking garage across the street at the hotel.  Experience: We came here to kill time before our flight, and I am sure glad we did. Their selection of beers were right up my alley. They had a variety of fruit flavored beers. The brewers were super friendly and inviting, I even let him choose my last flight choice. I loved the ambiance of the industrial rose gold with the green wall paint, and the live plant accents. It felt like a relaxing place to go work, study or just hang with friends.

reviews.author: Hani C.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed this spot. Didn't hurt that it was 2 minutes away from where we were staying and pretty much in the center of downtown.   Love any place that offers beer flights, as it's the best way to really know what you like and what your taste buds are in the mood for. I typically go for lagers or Belgian-style beers and personally loved the Lingering Sunshine and Wit-Tington.  The atmosphere is chill, laid-back, and the plants everywhere are totally my vibe. You can tell it's frequented by drinking tours as there was constantly small buses/vans waiting outside for parties drinking inside. Music also made for a nice ambiance and the girls who took care of our order upon arrival were very sweet and informative.

reviews.author: Desiree D.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem in this area of town.   Stopped in 2 times whole in town for the week.   I highly suggest coming here, their beer is great and layered with flavor. And yes they have flights.   Peep the plants hanging too!  Cute decor.  I came in February and they did not have an outdoor section. Not sure if they ever will.

reviews.author: KC C.
reviews.description: The hubby and I are from Cali, so we are spoiled with some pretty good breweries.  Came here on a Saturday for some afternoon beers.  Was so good we came back Monday to finish off the weekend.    There's a good variety of beers so we did eight tasters and ended up with three separate glasses.  They had a special when we were there called the Apple cinnamon sour; it tasted just like apple pie.  If they reproduce it, I highly recommend a glass.    The place itself is super posh, establishment clean, service was great and staff very friendly.  I would def recommend this brewery.  Oh, met Cooper...he's one of their brewers.  He's really nice.

reviews.author: Aleah H.
reviews.description: I stopped here on a whim while exploring Austin via Lime scooter, and it was a solid find! A no nonsense brewery where I genuinely enjoyed every beer I tried-- A gem!   We sat at one of the handful of the tables they have sprinkled in the sidewalk outside. The street was pretty low key for being to close to 6th, so it was enjoyable on the sidewalk! You still order at the bar which was no problem, and the service was quick and efficient!   Rhythm is a Dancer stole the show for me! It's a sour, but it is muted enough that I could drink multiple without my mouth being pursed from tartness! The Kolsch was great, as well. We also tried the soft pretzel which was SO airy which I loved. It also came with a garlic sauce so not your typical pub pretzel, but a very tasty take on one!  Employee's wore masks and maintained distancing, as well, which is great. We found this brewery on a list of spots still enforcing safety restrictions, and can confirm they were!

reviews.author: Kim L.
reviews.description: Cute afternoon day drinking spot that we found via Yelp. Bumped a star bc of their limited seating (one barrel table) outside, the main bartender was not very helpful and some of the drafts we wanted to try were out.   We sat outside and people watched and enjoyed our flights.  Really liked wit-tington ale, weiz of TX, short straw stout and violet crown. Bummed they were out of the Firenze estate.

reviews.author: Lynn D.
reviews.description: This was a really cute brewery with great service. They had some interesting beers and offered flights and snacks. Nice central location. Very clean and Covid compliant. I had a cherry lime made beer, a pretzel and a bbq beef empanada. Pretzel was a little over cooked but the empanada was delicious

reviews.author: Aaron F.
reviews.description: Absolutely wonderful stop off while walking downtown Austin. The staff was super friendly and welcoming. Tried a flight, Wit, Violent Crown, Texas Skies, Affogate. Went with the Wit. You will taste why it is a gold medal winner.

reviews.author: Chelsey S.
reviews.description: Love this small brewery in a great location downtown Austin. The space is bright, clean, and nicely decorated. My husband and I both had flights. The standout was the Wit-tington by far. The Strawberry Wayne was pretty unique and had a nice pink hue to it. The  staff was very friendly and gave great suggestions of which beers we should try. You can get a crowler of any beer, which was great for us to take home! Can't recommend CDB enough!  Really enjoyed the indie 2000s playlist as well!!!

reviews.author: Stephen S.
reviews.description: The 30+ times I've been to breweries I've discovered that they truly are the happiest places on Earth. Customer service and courtesy are typically top-notch because...well...it's a brewery.   First let me point out this rating is based more heavily on service than the wonderful beer they served( I'd give a solid "B" on that spectrum).  Walk in, bartender says "hi" and starts cleaning mugs. We look around trying to figure out when he'll actually approach us. Ok...oh look menus, guess I'll grab one. Standing there waiting for the "what can I get ya?" Or "first time? Here's our menu, let me know if you have any questions." Bartender jargon. Nothing. My wife says "yeah it's our first time here." "Oh, ok" responds bartender. Finally we decide on our own we'll do a flight and order a pretzel. I'm assuming they specialize in IPAs since they have 4! He takes the order.   I return a beer because a random fly fell in one. I tell the bartender I hate to waste good beer but can I get a new one, a fly fell in mine." No reaction, he just asks which beer and refills it.   Good craft beer, subpar service.

reviews.author: Tala B.
reviews.description: I wish we had a place like this near my home -- I would be here every weekend (once the pandemic is over, of course)!   My sister and I were visiting Austin, TX awhile ago and wanted to do an Escape Room -- There is one right next to this little brewery, so after we finished the Escape Room (we escaped, by the way!), we decided to enjoy some beer and celebrate.  This spot is in a less busy part of the city and there were not a lot of people inside, but I was in love with the interior decor and the ambience. Very calm, chill and relaxing. We enjoyed our beers too! Overall, I loved it and wish there was one near my house.

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: This is a pretty good brewery. I mostly drink IPAs so I got both of them they both tasted very good and smooth not so hoppy/ dry but very tasty and enjoyable. The ambiance is nice and quite very retro with a "we work here" feel which is a good feeling. The bartender was very helpful and attentive. Overall loved the experience and worth the stop if your in the area.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Came by with good company for some brews on a hot Sunday afternoon. The women-lead space and brewski selections are rockin', but they're missing a key component--wifi.  I know, I hate sounding like your typical phone-using human being, but every time I'm downtown wifi is super handy. It helps us decide where we want to go afterwards! Anyways, Central is set up like your typical clean and succulent-friendly microbrewery these days. They have board games and serve yourself water (sparkling OR still. THAT's a first!!). They don't have outdoor seating, but plenty of seats indoors. They also sell small bites and other drinks like wines and ciders. Their guest list is pretty solid with brews from Zilker and Independence to name a few other Austin loves. I got a taster of Central's own beers. We really did not enjoy the milkshake IPA that had a strong vanilla aftertaste. It was way too sweet, but to each their own.  Their restrooms are clean and they allow outside food too. SCORE! Now if only the owners would install some wifi...our taptender told us that the owners are still getting that set up. So that's a great sign! They also don't validate parking, so if you need to drive to get here...come on a Sunday when parking is free downtown. Pro. Tip.

reviews.author: Andy O.
reviews.description: The jalapeño bread is a must, an amazing brewery right in between 6th st and rainey st with a modern and hipster feel but good for the dad and for the mom looking for a break from The kids as well as the working adults needing a good brew, there's Baird games as well for some quick fun. Electric scooters all around so it's easy to keep bar hoping around. Great spot

reviews.author: Marc M.
reviews.description: Great little spot in downtown.  They really push the flights which is great because they have quite a number of solid brews.

reviews.author: Hilary E.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday night, and it was pretty empty actually. The guy who served our small group said they're more of a weeknight spot where people go after work. However, I liked that it was fairly empty. We could talk and hear each other, no line for more beer, the guy working was very nice, and it felt like we had the place to ourselves. I'd go back here in a minute, either earlier in the night before the rest of the evening plans or for a break inbetween places. The beer was good, and the place is very clean and pretty inside.

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Their beer is so good, light and refreshing. If you like sours, they got you covered, ipas? Sure they have that too. You can of course get a flight of beer to taste multiple flavors and I'd recommend doing that...then going back and buying a pint of what you loved the most.   The service was A-1. The woman at the front was very friendly and was open to answering my 500 questions about when they opened, if I can taste different beers, what're those people in the corner with the purple drink drink drinking? In addition to that I'm pretty sure the owners were also just hanging out in there and they were chatting with different guests which made it feel very homey and inviting  Price- on par with other breweries  Great location! Especially if you're just moseying around town ( like I was) and happen to stumble upon it.   The aesthetics are on point. Beautiful Edison bulbs and plan fixtures. Both benches and tables so you can come with a large group or chill on a date.

reviews.author: Mitchel R.
reviews.description: Jason was fantastic! I highly recommend him to anybody looking to take a tour of wineries/distilleries.  Great communication, easy to work with, and deeply knowledgeable of the area. He made great suggestions, was flexible as needed, and took great care of us! He even got us a private tour of the cellar at Hawk's Shadow Winery.  Absolutely reach out to him if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Rick M.
reviews.description: Jason was very professional and did a good job planning the day. Could not have asked for a better experience.

reviews.author: Larissa S.
reviews.description: Adorable. Great cigar selection, and so thankful they have wine and beer to sip with it. The friendliness and familiarity between the regulars and staff, which they'll warmly welcome you in on, is what really makes this place special.

reviews.author: Jared P.
reviews.description: Awesome cigar lounge. A group of our friends ventured out to Smokey's this past weekend and we had a great time. Great boutique selection of cigars, nice open floorplan with great service. We'll be back again.

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like this place - as I need a local cigar shop- but you cannot overlook their blatant disregard for local COVID requirements.   First, the shop is quaint and located in a very cool shopping area off of HWY 12. They also have a decent selection of classic and unique cigars. That is the positive.   However, they are selfishly thumbing their nose at COVID regulations. The staff does not wear masks or require patrons to wear them when they are up and about. There is absolutely no social distancing and it is usually packed to overflowing on weekends.   When a business refuses to abide by local and state guidelines in something as serious and life-threatening as COVID, it makes you question where else they ignore health and safety protocols. I do not trust that they keep their shop or the tobacco products safe and sanitary if they are unwilling to adhere to these basic guidelines. This should be a MASSIVE red flag for anyone thinking of shopping here.   I do not trust an establishment with this mindset, nor the local authorities that refuse to enforce these rules. It is shameful.

reviews.author: Dan R.
reviews.description: Great selection of my favorite stinkers...offers of firewater to those so predisposed. Canine friendly, ashHole suppresion available when necessary.

reviews.author: Levi E.
reviews.description: I love Smokey's Cigar Lounge. Nice people, great owner. I disagree with the reviewer who knocked the location due to COVID protocols. We quarantined with each other for months. We stayed 6 feet away from one another. I know; I was there nearly every day. It's difficult for any business who had to navigate the tricky waters of early 2020's pandemic onslaught. It was new territory for everyone and significantly different messages coming from authorities in the "know".  And with all that being said, you have a fairly recently opened small business trying to survive.  IMHO, anyone hating on this establishment is welcome to stay away.    Great cigars, great beverages, great community support. Don't change a thing.  Levi

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: Great cigar selection and super helpful and friendly staff to a novice cigar smoker like myself.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: My wingman and I were chilling out at Treaty Oak Distillery having a few cocktails and enjoying watching round 3 of the Masters. When by pure coincidence I met a couple who I have not seen in years. We mentioned that we had cigars but it was too windy to smoke em. They said there was a chill cigar bar right up the street. We watched Tiger make a par on 18 and off we went.  We were greeted immediately by Allison, the manager, and given a quick tour of the venue. There are comfy seats and a small bar area that serves beer, wine, and water. The humidor is laid out very well and their cigars are stored perfectly. Allison patiently explained that there are two sections in the humidor the usual favorites and "her" boutique cigars. I selected a beautiful light Nicaraguan rolled cigar. This baby smoked smooth right down to the label.   The lounge itself is ventilated nicely so you are not smoking in a haze or smoking your cigar and other guys cigar as well. There was also a good beer selection. We had a blonde ale from Two Wheel Brewery in Buda. Good choice.   Smokey's is a chill venue, friendly patrons, and professional knowledgeable staff equal 5 stars all day!

reviews.author: Laura P.
reviews.description: Great cigars! And fabulous owner Chris!  So knowledgeable of cigars and pairing with certain alcoholic beverages.

reviews.author: Jessica G.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I enjoyed this place so much. It was quaint and comfortable to relax and try cigars and drinks. My only feedback is for more variety in cigars - they had a lot of local brands which isn't bad but not a strong selection and to choose from. The service was excellent and the place was clean.

reviews.author: Chase C.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem. Allison is a cigar guru, you give her two cigars you like, she will show you three others to suit your palette. Prices are great, and the beer selection is fantastic. (Try the maduro) And if you like a little adventure, try the port with your next stick, a great pairing!

reviews.author: Lyndsey S.
reviews.description: I'm so glad we finally got a cigar lounge in Drip and Smokey's doesn't disappoint. I didn't get to sit and smoke but I saw how relaxed everyone was. I love that many of the cigars in the humidor are made by guys in Texas, especially the ones by a veteran who lives nearby. How cool is that? Make sure you talk to Allison too. She gives you the low down of every cigar and helps you find the perfect one for you. She's really nice and very helpful in her descriptions. My husband and I are looking forward to a date night at Smokey's.

reviews.author: Dino S.
reviews.description: Great spot for cigars, relaxing, and good conversation. Owner is super nice and everyone inside is friendly.

reviews.author: Henry W.
reviews.description: Best cigar bar and lounge I have been to! Great casual ambiance, super broad cigar selection in humidor, friendly staff, cold beer, fine wine.
