Music, indoor/outdoor seating, and all the amenities (big screen TV, lounge chairs, cutters/lighters, hand sanitizer, more). Meet you there June 13th from 6:00PM for live music!!!

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.description: If you haven't been, you don't know what you are missing. Locally owned and operated, this place has it all.  Great selection of cigars - my head was spinning with how many options but not to worry -  Allison was there with all of my questions. I'm def not a cigar aficionado but with the staff's help I was able to find a great smoke. I was impressed that they support local cigar companies and go the extra mile to make the everyone feel at home.  Can't recommend this place enough.

reviews.author: Amanda L.
reviews.description: I had the pleasure of meeting Chris while he was at Treaty Oak Distillery.  He is so kind has has a wonderful comfortable and just flat out super neat airstream! It was roomy, place to cut and dust off your cigar, a TV for viewing.  It was such a unique find! I would totally have had this at my wedding years ago if I knew him back then!

reviews.author: Jim P.
reviews.description: Excellent service and selection!  Comfortable lounge chairs, friendly atmosphere.  Indeed a hidden gem!  A great place to relax and have a good smoke.

reviews.author: Chanel L.
reviews.description: I was lucky enough to find Chris for my wedding. We thought their airstream would be a fun "man cave" addition to an otherwise very feminine wedding...boy were we misguided! Half the bridal party and many of our female guests ended up checking out the cigar bar and loved it! As a woman, I feel like creating a space where women feel welcome in what is traditionally considered a masculine space is a clear indicator of the quality and professionalism of their business.  Not only was Chris helpful, very communicative and and priced well - he and his wife were so much fun to be around! They both made our day special and unique and I highly recommend them for events. They definitely went above and beyond to ensure the day was special and went smoothly.   The airstream itself is luxuriously appointed and classy. Their cigar storage and bar amenities were top notch and I'm sure their huge tv would be great for sports games and such. Definitely a fantastic addition to my big day and I'd highly recommend them!

name: Oasis Texas Brewing Company
accommodations: Garage Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Jeraz C.
reviews.description: This is my NUMBER ONE PLACE to bring any one when the visit me in Austin.  Located 40 minutes West from downtown and perched on top of a cliff with sweeping views of lake Travis, this is the place I bring my guest on their last evening in Austin to watch the sunset and to serve as a poetic end to their trip.  Things I like: - The view, absolutely stunning, come hear around sunset and listen for the bell they ring as the sun sinks below the horizon. - The food, the truffle fries here are awesome and for $9 they can feed 4 people, they even have great salads and a wagyu burger all reasonably priced  Things I don't like: - Oasis is kinda far from Austin, there isn't much they can do about it, but the drive is definitely worth it from time to time - The lack of space on the balcony, if you want to sit on the balcony overlooking Lake Travis, you may be disappointed, the tables by the ledge fill up quick so you should get there at least an hour before sunset   protips: - get there early to get good seats for the sunset - avoid the oasis restaurant, they have long waits for sub par food, just eat up here instead  - TRUFFLE FRIES

reviews.author: Swetha S.
reviews.description: There was so much going on at this venue, so let me break it down based on my experience -   1. Views - INCREDIBLE. If there is one and only reason to visit this spot, it's for the view. All of their restaurants overlook Lake Travis. And it's stunning.  2. Space - there are multiple venues here - restaurants, brewery, cocktail lounge, some gift shops (closed as of Mar 2022). Every space has a viewing deck, which obviously gets filled fast. There was ample space inside and outside too. Each one is on different floor. And you cannot carry your drinks to the restaurant space as they don't have license. 3. Live music - there was no live music when I visited on a Friday. But they did have some pretty neat setups 4. Food - French fries was meh! Wait time was HUGE!  5. Cocktails - Skip them. Not worth it.  Can't speak about the beer itself as I had not tried it. 6. Accessibility - about 30 mins from Austin, so not that much of a drive.   Would come here again for the views I!

reviews.author: Ruchi J.
reviews.description: This place is so so so cute and is a great way to spend a Sunday afternoon. The view of Lake Travis is beautiful, the food is great, and the drinks are awesome too!  We went upstairs and got lucky as we snagged a table right as some people were leaving. We ordered some apps and some beers and spent some time taking pictures of Lake Travis. The view was awesome and a great way to say hello to Austin.  The place doesn't have much in the way of vegetarian options, but I did enjoy the appetizers and the view :)

reviews.author: Tanmay T.
reviews.description: Come here for a good beer, snacks and most importantly the views. I personally think the views are better from here than from Oasis restaurant. I was also impressed with the quality and quantity of the parmesan fries. They have plenty of tables inside and outside. There are plenty of space heaters near all tables, so you won't have difficulty finding a table. There are plenty of non alcoholic drinks too and the place seems kid friendly.

reviews.author: Kyle H.
reviews.description: Very cute brewery on Lake Travis with amazing views.  Had a large seating area inside and out. They have a stage for live music. They also have food, wine, and cider.  Orders their burger with truffle fries. Pretty tasty and those fries were crispyyyy! Would go back just for the views.  The beer was okay but that's not the reason you come here.

reviews.author: Slava C.
reviews.description: Great chill out place with the positive vibe.  Enjoy wide selection of beers and delicious food topping off the amazing views along with the live band performance. What else would a soul need?! Sit back, relax, have a cup of cold one, watch a sunset and enjoy life!

reviews.author: Korey A.
reviews.description: The view here is amazing and the food is so much better than their neighbors.  We love being able to hang out inside or out with entertaining things to do.   I will say that neither my husband nor I are a big fan of their beers,  which is a bit of a bummer considering that it is a beer place.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Made our way to The Oasis during a recent trip to Austin with some friends. It was definitely a bit away from the main city, but a beautiful scenic area. The Oasis is right on Lake Travis, and features a bunch of small stores and outdoor areas in the land surrounding it. We were there on a Friday afternoon, and surprisingly not a lot of stores were open, which was a bummer. Of course though, we were there for the brewery, which we were able to make it to. They offer plentiful indoor and outdoor seating; it was a nice sunny day so we opted for the outdoor seating. It was lovely outside but it was SO windy, even after we tried to switch locations outside. It was hard to keep our food from blowing away! The view was super nice though, so despite the wind, we appreciated the scenery surrounding us.  For food / drink - of course, I focused on beers. I was a bit disappointed to learn that they didn't offer flights - they had a good number of offerings, it would make sense to do flights! Oh well, at least they offered half pours, so I was able to try 2; I went for the gose (kiwi dragonfruit) and the Oktoberfest. Both were OK, not the best ever beer but refreshing; I definitely favored the gose! My friends enjoyed their pours as well. For food, we all split some apps, going for the OTXBC trio, the bretzel, and the truffle fries. The trio was a bit disappointing - it was underwhelming and a little piecemeal (we had thought everything would be mixed together but it was just a pretzel on top of the chips with the dips on the side). The bretzel itself was tasty, but the sauce was interesting; we thought it came with queso, but the dip we received looked nothing like queso and was thick with chunks of something in it (pepper maybe?). It was tasty, but unidentifiable. Lastly, the truffle fries were the best option - they were nicely seasoned and crispy with a large volume. We all enjoyed those! The prices were relatively reasonable for what we got in terms of quantity and quality.   Overall, we enjoyed our afternoon at Oasis Texas Brewing Company. The space is lovely with a great view, but the food and drink is just OK; you're definitely more there for the experience. I would definitely make it back to OTXBC during a next visit to Austin to try more beers and take in the nice view!

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: 10/10 views, okay food. Heard food was better here versus the Oasis Restaurant. We only ordered apps, so can only comment on these. They were pretty basic, though we really enjoyed the truffle fries. We arrived around 2pm on a Friday and there was plenty of seating. Very windy though FYI.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Might want to update the hours of operation  So guests know your closed before driving 30m.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: The Tap Room on the third floor and the Barrel Room on the second floor both achieve unique ambiance and draw slightly different crowds. We got to experience and enjoy the best of both in a way.   Amazing fresh made as well as barrel aged cocktails, a nice range of food options, and of course, breathtaking views.   The Barrel Room is rustic chic with fancy couches and a pool table. The tap room is plain rustic with a live music stage. The tap room had burgers and sandwiches to accompany the beers brewed on site. The barrel room offered pizza and wings to eat in between cocktail sips.   Oh, don't miss observing the really cool stairs in between the two floors.

reviews.author: Ali W.
reviews.description: Have some family in town and wanted to take them somewhere to watch a good ol Texas sunset. OTBC has some of the absolute best views in all of Austin. Even on this cloudy day the sunset still peaked through and gave us a show.   Drinks are good but food isn't really anything to write home about. Its more about the experience you get here for sure.  They have a large parking garage and parking lot on site with plenty of free parking even on a busy night. There's also a golf cart shuttle to get you from the lot to the entrance if you need it, but it's also a walkable distance.   Really great spot to visit if you want a nice spot to watch the sunset and definitely has that wow-factor for visitors!

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Have a visitor in from California and wanted to show our beautiful sunset by Lake Travis. This is a great place for that and the food is always good.  The space is large and everyone seemed to be following the safety rules while indoors. We were a party of 8 and we had plenty of space.  I ordered the basic burger and they usually prepare it Medium rare. I asked for medium well and wanted only mayonnaise and cheese. It was cooked the way I requested but was very dry since they did not give me Mayo. My wife ordered the Fish Tacos (3) and said they were great. She ended only being able to eat 2 and another guest finished her last one. She said she would order again next time.   All in all is was good just not great.

reviews.author: Van N.
reviews.description: I really really tried for this place. I took my parents here, I took my friends from out of town, and I even came for a birthday party this weekend. The whole experience overall is just underwhelming? If thats the right word. There is always the steps  1. get in line to get on to the wait list 2. once in front be told the wait is 1-2 hours 3. get in line again for the bar  4. finally get seated and wait again for slow service.   One question is Why? Why would you even go here? The wait is 2+ Hours sometimes. The food is cafeteria quality at best. They are SEVERELY understaff. Oasis Brewery has better food and literally the same exact food. The quality of the experience over all does not justify the amount of time, money and effort for this place.

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: Pretty gross, dirty, staff doesn't seem to care. The girl working on Wednesday nights is horrible and should never work around people. Seemed super angry to be there and yelled at customers tonight, then just stormed off... super weird vibes. Definitely won't be back I don't get what the hype is about with this place. Maybe if the staff actually cleaned up or were nice to customers this place would get a couple more stars.

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: An Austin must see! Beautiful views, with many options for eating and drinking. The bartenders were super attentive and nice.   Just knocking one star because I could only find one elevator and it was out of service. I'm in a boot and it was hard to get up all those stairs. If you need help call first to make sure the elevator works.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Views: 5/5. Such a scenic view overlooking Lake Travis. My favorite time to come is when the sun sets. The Texas skies are truly breathtaking during this time and Oasis is perfectly positioned for patrons to see all that the sun has to offer. Come 1 hour early to snag a table next to the railings in order to get the best (unblocked) view.   Food: 3/5. My date and I only ordered the Pico Verde. It was a refreshing snack but nothing special. We would've ordered more but there wasn't a huge selection and nothing that caught our eye.   Drinks: 3/5. Very limited selection of beers. It's almost weird that this place is called a brewery because there are literally like 8 to pick out of. Most people just come here for the view though so it's not a huge problem.   Overall, definitely a gem in Austin. It's a great place for dates or just to hang out with family or friends. It's so pretty here that it doesn't even matter what I'm eating or drinking!

reviews.author: Johnson W.
reviews.description: Family visiting Austin, Oasis is the must go place to see the beautiful lake and sunset!  We were at the brewery on third floor, ordered some beer and food, kitchen was bit slower than normal (they were busy! So that's fine), we ordered 3 items and they only gave us one and the guy took my call alarm and about to walk away, so I asked him where are my other two items, and he looked confused then asked me, else you ordered? So I told him what they were, and took him a minute to look around, and it was sitting right next to the first item, but he just simply looked confused!  I wouldn't suggest to come during busy weekend, unless you don't mind of waiting longer time, and getting mixed up on what you've ordered.  Overall still a great place to take visitors.

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: Just go! You won't regret it.   Everything is was amazing! We had French fries and avocado dip to go with our beers. Fries comes with a truffle aioli.   For the beers we had Grand Cru Dark Ale and Samurai Lager.   The Grand Cru Dark Ale comes in a small cup. The server assured me that was a good amount unless I was really found of dark ale. He was right that was a good amount because that beer is strong.   I pretty sure I wasn't going to finish the beer if I had asked for a double sized cup.   Really nice experience over all.   I would recommend this place a million times.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: I truly wanted to love this place.. Texas weather is just right this time of year, the views make you want to make the drive from Cali to the lone star state just to get that perfect pic over the lake with a drink your hand in the free state of Texas....but don't be disappointed when you are greeted by a not so friendly mask police manager that wants to wear his mask under his nose ....   the guacamole had zero taste the salsa was watery and had zero flavor... the chips were the bottom of the barrel... all of the guests seated around us were unhappy and didn't receive good service either but were happy with the views. The fellow guests/visitors we met were super cool and that was the best part... the drinks food and service were way below average... what is it with these places? get it together! the views bring us there but you need to pick it up from there... managers are clueless... bartenders were so rude....embarrassing for Austin...  so many visitors and this is their first impression of Austin unfortunately... we can do better.  We ordered 2 pizzas and left 80% of them on the table....Tasted frozen with ragu sauce.... I can't even begin to explain the regrets I have going here... The guy that gave us a ride on the golf cart up was very nice and now I feel he may have been trying to warn us about going there..  Bathrooms were gross and tables were nasty... nobody was cleaning up after people.... trash and masks everywhere and near the water... I follow not unfollowed their social media page and the pictures are very enticing but it's the exact opposite of what you actually get... from the drinks to the food.. Fire pit was a nice touch.. we stopped to talk to other guests there on our way out... Its a one hitter quitter for all..  won't be back... what a waste of location.

name: St Elmo Brewing Company
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Urvashi G.
reviews.description: To say, I love this place is an understatement.  Always, always, always a good time here. Great beers, great food, great vibe/ambience. I completely love visiting here and I try to keep suggesting everyone to go here at every chance I get. Hahahah!   Parking can be little tricky on a weekend evening/rush hours. But we eventually always find it (maybe 5-10 mins of struggling later). They have enough space for free parking.   There is "Spicy boys fried chicken" food truck here at all times, which is just absolute best. Again, I can go and on about the delicious food they carry, but this is about the brewery itself. The food truck is a beautiful perfect cherry on top.   The brewery carries wide range of selection, and I thoroughly enjoy them. The service people are also wonderful. If you sign up for the rewards program, you can save some money down the road. So I suggest to sign up online for it.   Dogs are welcomed and Thursday evenings they have live music performance going on. Enough seating indoors and outdoors.  Definitely visit here and you can thank me later ;)

reviews.author: Emmily S.
reviews.description: Fun chill environment and food trucks available!  They also have games you can play around the table. Multiple options for beer lovers, they also have a coffee infused beer that is a must try!

reviews.author: Nhi D.
reviews.description: Very nice and spacious brewery with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.  I like that there is a whiskey distillery that is a 30 second walk away, which makes it a good location for a fun night out.  Staff was friendly and answered all our questions. Beer was solid. There is a hot chicken truck on the premise and we enjoyed their food as well. Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Ashleigh J.
reviews.description: This is a fun and easy place to grab a beer and hangout with friends. There are a variety of beer options and a ton of parking and seating available inside and outside. There are a few food trucks to grab food from in case you're hungry, including Spicy Boys! I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Katrina S.
reviews.description: As we drove to the brewery it seemed like a bit of a strange area at first. The brewery is located in an industrial park that has some other stuff going on. We were surprised by how full the parking lot was.  We stopped by on a Sunday afternoon and decided to sit outside and it was very hot. There were fans but it didn't seem to help much. I will note that there was indoor seating available.    The food truck that was outside was really cool. We got the cauliflower wings with the Korean Buffalo sauce. You can order on your phone or at the window which is nice.   You can order beer inside, they have a variety of different options. I tried out the hop water (no alcohol) which was really interesting. Sparkling with some whatnot a tartness from the hops. We tried the hazy IPA which was pretty hoppy, probably not the best on a hot day. The staff was all very nice.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: This is the perfect place to meet up with friends. They have a nice patio, but they also have inside seating.   They sell beer on tap and beer to go. They don't sell flights, but they can sell you a half pint if you just want to taste a few different beers.   When we arrived, it wasn't too busy and you could just sit wherever even though all the tables had a reserved sign. Later on we returned for beer to go and noticed that you had to wait to be seated.   They have a food truck on site that also sells vegan items.

reviews.author: Matt C.
reviews.description: Great beers, some unique, some standard to appeal to most palates. The best thing of all? Honestly priced. We'll be back with our pup. Love it.

reviews.author: Carolyn A.
reviews.description: I was delighted to discover St. Elmo's in South Austin in a very attractive warehouse district. The venue is modern and the group I was with sat outdoors on the patio. Having Sour Boys food truck a few steps away was a nice addition. Enjoyed the brews quite a bit! Definitely put this neighborhood on your must visit list.

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: I had a 5 year old gift card when I went to try St Elmo Brewing Company and surprisingly, they still found it in their system. I was treated like royalty here -- the bartenders handed me a binder with tasting notes (that was theirs for reference) and they checked on me as I was working there for about an hour. Great beer, good vibes...I just wish the food options were better. I hope they will eventually cycle new trucks there.

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: Cute spot. Not crowded at all on a Friday mid afternoon.  They don't do flights RN but offer you a tasting of anything you want. The coffe cream ale was delicious, and I don't do beer and after the tasting I got a glass!! Hubs got the hazy IPA-said not the best he's ever had but he likes it. He also got the double IPA and gave it a 7/10. They had 2 flavors of frozen cocktails too: strawberry limeade (tart) and frose.   Cute outside area. Inside smelled a bit like sushi...but they weren't selling any on the premises. ‍

reviews.author: Tina N.
reviews.description: Great brewery with a food truck on location. Plenty of seating for humans and furry companions. The vibe is super chill and the beer is even chiller.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: Can't believe I haven't hit this brewery up sooner! This area has a lot to offer, and this is definitely one of the great spots in the area. The brewery has a lot of IPAs, I don't really remember which hazy I got but I remember it was really good! They also have lighter options if you aren't into IPAs. Lots of great flavors going into the beer here. They have Inside seating and outside seating, with a food truck on location for some grub as well. Overall great beer and a really cool vibe outside.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Nice spacious clean environment, welcoming patio, great selection of beers and ciders - I had an excellent cider and my husband enjoyed his beer.   I miss SourSop as the food truck option outside but Spicy Boys had good chicken wings for my husband and lovely tater tots for the vegetarian me.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Have a drink their beer a lot but never actually been here so it was so cool to finally make it and see it. There's plenty of spacing they have a fridge just inside the door to the right that you can take four packs to go they also have the draft open you can sit outside and they will bring it to you so cool plenty of spacing. Grabbed a few four packs of the Freshy Smalls soooo gooood! Also grabbed West Coast IPA yum!

reviews.author: Kristen R.
reviews.description: Awesome sandwhiches, huge open patio with lots of seating. Great spot for beers during day or night next to all the other drink spots in same strip (wine, sake, whiskey)

reviews.author: Kevin Y.
reviews.description: Very solid selection, mostly on draft. Right now you order at counter and bring back to your table.   My favorites here are the sour and then Gary (which is an IPA). Everyone else I went with were happy with their selections as well.  They have adequate indoor and outdoor seating, depending on what you prefer. There is also a food truck that stops here and pairing fried chicken with beer is a winner in my book anytime.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: The environment was high energy and had lots of space to grab drinks with friends. We stayed for a while to catch up without any issues which was great!

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: St. Elmo has plenty of beer, outside seating and live music! I recommend their raspberry beer if you aren't a big beet person. For me, it was nice and tart and masked the beer taste. Also be sure to hit up the Spicy Boy's Chicken food truck!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Pretty good beer in a Biergarten setting. Great service. Lots of folks enjoying this beautiful day. Dog friendly outside with plenty of seating inside as well. Food truck on site.

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: My favorite brewery in Austin!  St. Elmo has consistently awesome beers (focusing largely on traditional stlyes, like their flagship kolsch Carl) and is suuuuuuper dog-friendly.  There's no better way to spend a few hours, in my book, than filling my face with stout and passing out pets to allllll the floof.   Fantastic food truck, soursop, on-site.  Tap list is regularly updated on insta.  Killer coffee shop further down in the strip, Spokesman.

reviews.author: L S.
reviews.description: Awesome place!!!! Great selection of spirits!! The people there are very friendly and knowledgable. We also like giving our support to this locally (non franchised) business

reviews.author: Ju L.
reviews.description: Long overdue review, but I appreciated the gentleman who wrapped my last minute Christmas gift. I just asked for a paper bag but he went the extra miles to make it all nice with wrapping paper and bow. Thanks :) will be back

reviews.author: William D.
reviews.description: Nope, will not return here.  Barely a mumble from store employee after entering their store that was empty of patrons.  I remember coming here at their Grand Opening and they were a lot more enthusiastic about their customers. Hopefully, they will find better help soon.

reviews.author: Mike K.
reviews.description: Will not be returning here. Selection is ok not great, service is ok, however , these days most do not carry cash and to be up charged for using a debit card to pay for the CC service is a joke, and pay attention to the amount  almost 4% of the total, I am thinking another way to profit a little at a time. Just bad business not whiskey business

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: I waked into this store not expecting much.  Boy, was I wrong.  He has a really good selection of bourbon.  I walked out with a bottle that I've never seen on any other shelf, anywhere else.  It wasn't much more expensive than the larger stores, and he actually had it.  I didn't even check out the scotch selection, which I  need to go back and do.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Karen P.
reviews.description: They have a good selection but they are kinda pricey. Perfect if you just need a bottle but not if you're looking to restock several items.

reviews.author: Sarah E.
reviews.description: Came in to make it quick liquor store run, left with two welcoming friends and a much greater appreciation of all the options at my fingertips. Waylon and Weston where more than available to answer questions and make recommendations and overall create a hospitable and enjoyable shopping experience. I look forward to going back and taking some friends with me because I know we won't be disappointed in the party they help supply!

reviews.author: Geary H.
reviews.description: One of the first things when I entered their store, their dog "Whiskey" greeted me, then the owners. Handshakes when you show up; that's Texas! Whiskey Business has a diverse, quality, well-priced inventory. They had everything I needed. Even took home a six of Boerne Brewery's Old Courthouse Ale at the owner's suggestion. It's like he knew what I'd like. He did. One of my favorites is an Irish dry stout {think Guinness}, and I've now found a new favorite. Love it! I'll make Whiskey Business my go-to. Thank you for your hospitality!

reviews.author: Kodi S.
reviews.description: A new liquor store in town! Great selection, I put in a few requests and they had them in by the next visit. The staff is awesome, very friendly folks. I wont lie, I'm a regular now mostly because of their dog- Whiskey. ‍

reviews.author: Nechelle D.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable and courteous service. Definitely where I'll always go and send everyone!

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Last Stand is my neighborhood brewery! I love everything about this place. The beer selection is pretty damn good! Favorite being the Citra Smash IPA! I've had pizza, fried pickles, and crawfish here, and all of them pass the YUM test! Plus they have great happy hour specials, which is always wonderful for our pocketbooks. The vibe is chill and PAW friendly.

reviews.author: Julie H.
reviews.description: Beer, friendly bar staff and overall vibe of this place is 5 stars.  Value of food is a heartbreaking 1 star. Burger and fries for $12? Fine if the burger is decent size. We were both surprised when we were served P Terry's size burgers and less than 1/2 the fries. Honestly, nothing wrong with the portion size but it was absolutely not worth $12. The burger is clearly a frozen patty and the bun wasn't even warmed.   Just read through all the reviews and a HUGE props to the staff for enforcing mask wearing when it was required. That's enough reason for me to come back. We'll support this business and drink the great beer. We'll skip the food though.

reviews.author: Yelp Y.
reviews.description: It's a decent spot.  Big warehouse with a nice little outdoor nook populated with picnic tables.  Food in terms of the "loaded" fries leaves a lot to be desired (they're not really "that" loaded, so the price for the product is absurd); the pickles tasted good but the fry was quite irregular; the spinach artichoke dip is delicious but the chips cannot lift the dip without you helping them along, either by doubling up or scooping with a utensil.  Beer is alright.  One of the lagers is so-so but the raspberry sour is pretty good.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Super excited to have another brewery in the South Congress area to go enjoy some tasty as heck beers and get in your order for some Southside Flying Pizza or other tasty snacks and items on their menu!  This location will forever be in my heart as the first time I ever stepped foot here was when we were in desperate need for some warm food, cold beer, and water.  Beers:  I have been enjoying the melon + grapefruit notes in their Simcoe Pale Ale as well as their summer seasonal ale Vaquero Ranchers lager that is just easy and smooth to drink down on a summer day.  Unsure what to get - check out their crowlers to-go and canned beers! I grabbed a sixer to take home with me the last time we were here just so I can try the variety of other options they have here.  OH! Also I noticed they have a frozen drink machine too!  check it out for me, eh?!  Food:  We came here on a weekend and there was a crawfish broil happening to our surprise!  Easy to order online, at your table, and/or at the counter. I really love the option to order directly from your table and be able to pay without having to get up and go to the counter especially if you are nailing that ping pong game against your friends!  We really enjoy ordering and eating pizza here as Southside Flying Pizza nails it every time and there is enough to enjoy with everyone.   Outside / Inside:  all COVID safety measures are practiced here and taken seriously both inside and outside.  There is PLENTY of seating outside and ample amount of space to move around without it feeling crowded at all.  Snovid: When we experienced about 5 days without water we noticed that Last Stand Brewing were offering water fill ups. We grabbed our containers and made the quick drive down South Congress to get our fill.  I am SUPER appreciative of the kindness, ease, and availability to be able to get some water for our needs during the snowpocalypse that all of Texas experienced.  I will forever be in debt to Last Stand as the showed their genuine willingness to help their community out in a time of extreme need.  THANK YOU, Last Stand! You are truly a life saver.  I appreciate your kindness and help always!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: We weren't huge fans of the beers unfortunately, but glad to have a new option in south Austin! They have a lot of space with games, Southside pizza, and dogs are welcome :)

reviews.author: Sara F.
reviews.description: I discovered The Last Stand at the original location in Dripping Springs two years ago.  I'm  so happy that they opened a larger 2nd location in my SoCo neighborhood. It's by far my favorite brewery in Austin, they always serve great beer, good service, live music and delicious pizza.  I celebrated my birthday there with close friends and everyone was impressed.

reviews.author: Brooke P.
reviews.description: Great neighborhood spot, great atmosphere and super friendly staff.  I love the beers here, they have a solid selection.  The space is very large as well if you want to bring the whole crew.

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: Well we gave it a try, so sister and I stopped here for a nice cold beer last night. We were stopped when walking in the door by a rude ass employee (dark curly hair with glasses) literally yelling at us about a mask from across the room full of people. We are fully aware some spots still require masks and as we tried to ask if we can sit outdoors she rudely interrupted us and continued to tell us she won't serve us unless we have a mask. Shit lady haven't you ever heard of customer service or even normal communication. She could have approached us and explained their policy it was not necessary to demean us for making a mistake.      We walked outside my sister was livid and embarrassed. I talked her into staying and me walking in with my mask since she has forgot hers and her sitting outside on the bench area. I saw the employee again and asked if we could sit outside at a table which was our original plan (if she listened and didn't scold us like children) she said I can order since I have a mask but my sister can't leave the table with a complete attitude. I ordered got the beers, drank them and we left.      The beers are good but not worth the rude inappropriate staff. There are plenty of local breweries with good vibes and good beer! Don't waste your time.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: It is always great to have new breweries on the south side of Austin.  This is a great addition.  They have a large variety of brews as well as some wines and proseccos.  They have a fairly big outdoor area and indoor area.  They also have bar games inside and dogs are welcome.  The beers were cold and some were pretty tasty.  The food was just okay.  Hope to come back and try some new beers.

reviews.author: Peyton G.
reviews.description: I went on a Monday and they have the best deals!   A large pizza for $9 bucks or a burger and beer for $10!  The pizza was good and the wings were average. I love wings so they didn't disappoint. The bartender was nice. They have pool and a couple of other games. Beer is brewery price like 6-9. There are sports playing. Single and couple or group of friends. Pretty chill I would come again. They had a stage so I wonder if they have shows?

reviews.author: J P.
reviews.description: I love this place.  Beers are great and they have slushy drinks too.  Super large space with lots of tables.  The staff here is also very friendly.

reviews.author: Taylor P.
reviews.description: If you enjoy being harassed over a mask policy still while you drink mediocre at best beer, this spot is for you! Last stand more like Last Time, cause it's the last time I'll stop in.. Nothing Texas about this place either, decor is lame duck and outside tables are disgusting..

reviews.author: Marc C.
reviews.description: My friends and I enjoy the atmosphere, but we frequently don't get good service here. The bartenders don't seem to be on the same page as far as pour amounts go, either. Depending on the bartender, you may get a tap beer in a small plastic cup or a pint glass. I asked a female bartender why that was, and she said they do either "double" or "single" pours. I went back the following week and asked for a double pour of the same beer from the week before - this time with a different male bartender - and he said they only do beers in pint glasses. I guess there is a lack of communication on that front but it's resulting in customers asking for double pours and being charged more for what should be the normal amount of beer and frankly that doesn't sit right with me.  The value of the food from Southside Flying Pizza is also overpriced. The quality of the food is not equal to what they're charging, and they're frequently out of menu items and condiments by the evening. I've never been for lunch but their "special" is a slice of pizza for $4, which hardly seems like a special to me considering the quality of the pizza.  They make tasty beer, though!

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: If you're looking for your neighborhood bar, look no further. Beer is cold and the food is good! Ashley helped me and I felt at home! Live music Thursday - Saturday! Check this place out! I will be back, again!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: A great new addition to the neighborhood!! Plenty of outdoor and open air seating, and they are on point with covid precautions. The beers are good and they have some guest taps which is nice. They also serve south side pizza and have tons of games. A great place to hang out; and family friendly.

reviews.author: Jake A.
reviews.description: I believe this location just recently opened. I ordered a couple of six packs off their site for pick up to see what their beer was like. I tried the Craftsman Light and Texas Forever. Both were great tasting brews. They were both light with very distinct flavor notes from each other. I loved them both! They also went well with food as they are crisp light beers with a smooth finish. Glad that this place is nearby, I plan on grabbing some beer from here on a regular basis.

reviews.author: Ryan M.
reviews.description: This location just opened and our experience was great! We brought our two dogs and they were able to place some picnic tables out front in their parking lot. Food purchase required with beer so we got chips and queso with our Hefe and Citra IPA. Really good stuff.

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: Nice draft beer selection and a good amount of seating. The outdoor patio is a great spot for conversation and hanging out on a nice night. It's great to have another brewery in South Austin. The overall taste of the food and drinks are OK (there's better beer and pizza in Austin in general), but the staff is friendly, the location is convenient, they're pet friendly, and their prices are fair. Definitely worth a visit and will be back.

reviews.author: Rob S.
reviews.description: Great beer and the best pizza I've had since moving to Austin.   The Southsider pizza and the West Coast IPA were GREAT!!!

reviews.author: Alex R.
reviews.description: Easily missed if you're only looking on the main drag but this brewery is just off S Lamar on Oltorf. The beers are excellent of course but don't skip the food. Their pizza is the highlight to me. I would suggest getting slices because they are reasonably priced and it gives you the opportunity to try different options out. They have a wagu beef slice which is unique and delicious. My personal favorite is their Calabrese which I would describe as an elevated pepperoni pizza.  This is a great place to go if you don't have a reservation on a busy night because they have a ton of seating and parking.   Also check the schedule because they have live bands playing in the main dining hall.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: above average beer and a really nice atmosphere  came here for a flight and a little snack after work last Friday. First off, I really liked the atmosphere. there is a bunch of outdoor seating, which is always a plus.  For drinks I got a flight, so I got a variety of beers. Overall, they were pretty good, however, they don't have a lot of variety in the styles available. I also got a slice of pizza, which was much better than I expected for brewery food. All said and done, it's definitely a spot worth visiting, but isn't the best that Austin has to offer.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: This is a Highly Recommend kinda place.   Staff - super friendly and knowledgeable about the drinks and food products.   Environment - lots of seating indoors and out. You can spread out and work. You can dine in and chill. Go alone or with a party and still feel like you have the place to yourself.   Food/drinks - i have yet to have a bad food item from these guys. Everything is delicious and surprisingly thought out. It will take you by surprise. And the drinks. There are plenty of options to taste and enjoy based on your preferences.   $$$ - it is a little pricier then you might expect. But truthfully, for what you get, I will continue to come back here and spend the money.    Give it a shot. I do not think you will regret it. I would recommend this place over Pint House pizza or even Dominoes ;).

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10-24-21  As you can probably figure out, I like beer.  This is my drink of choice. And visiting breweries just takes the experience to the next level.  Quality/Quantity - Beer was mediocre. My family did not like the menu here, so I was pressured to quickly finish my beer and sadly leave.  It should be illegal to only drink one beer...  We hit Trader Joes on the way back and realized they carried the whole line of their beer, so as you can guess, I got two more six packs:)  Now, I am happier.  Atmosphere - You need a much bigger parking lot, especially since almost everyone drives a huge truck. We got lucky with a space, but had to share some of the space with the huge truck to the right and the huge truck to the left, LOL. Teri Joyce and the Tagalongs were playing tonight. They did a good job, the place was hoping. Both the inside and outside spaces are large; however, again too large for their parking lot. Can some people carpool? They also had a small outdoor stand to order beer and food. Additionally, there were plenty of seats at the bar. The team seems to be working pretty hard.  Service - The bartender was just okay. Not much to write about, I ordered, he gave me the beer, and I left; still left a tip though :)  Price - $6.50 + $1 tip  Owner Suggestion - Did I say you need a bigger parking lot? Wish I had more time to enjoy your place, but no fault of yours. Hopefully next time. Keep up the good work.

reviews.author: Jenn R.
reviews.description: We usually love ABGB, good food, good atmosphere, good service. It's a nice afternoon and we decided to come over for lunch and sit outside with our dog. Food was great as usual and initial service was awesome.   When we'd arrived, someone else was there with a big dog. Saw this person leave the dog unattended for a few moments and let it walk around off leash. This person leaves and everyone sitting outside can hear the staff saying someone let their dog poop by the tables, left it, and how gross that is. We agree, that's completely rude.   After a few minutes two staff come over to our table and loudly say something to the effect of  "hey, you let your dog sh*t over here." We politely explain it was not our dog, perhaps it was the person here before us. Sounds like they knew that person because they walk off saying  "x would never do that".   I get it, super uncool to clean up after someone else's dog, but also uncool to blame us for it. We arrived, walked right by the same staff and directly to a table (no bathroom breaks). Created an uncomfortable situation which prevented us from staying longer and ordering more.

reviews.author: Shelby L.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place! Great beer selection and delicious pizza! Outdoor area is super big and has a very chill vibe.

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: I love the large comfortable space and the superior music. The beer is good and the food is acceptable. I've been here several times and always felt safe and was able to find a parking space. This is a great place for groups, couples, singles.

reviews.author: Sj G.
reviews.description: It looks like a really nice beer garden.  The weather looked like rain so we sat inside.  They do have restrooms and they are clean.  Food is hard to decide if you are lactose intolerant.  We found a Pulled Pork and it came with a pint of beer. We also got two pizzas for the rest to share.  We had the wagyu and 2 choice of the specialty pizza cauliflower. That was a good choice.  I don't care for beer so I had a cider.   They were out of watermelon So I had cranberry.  Very tart but refreshing.  The bar tenders were all so friendly and nice.  I didn't see anywhere to get beer flights and my son had his bday.  Nothing special like a drink or come out to table.   It's a nice atmosphere with nice folks.

reviews.author: Alex M.
reviews.description: Great outdoor place with plenty of seating for medium size parties. The indoor aesthetic reminds me of a disco roller rink, super groovy.   The food alone is worth coming for, it's upscale apps that are absolutely delicious and they also have pizza.  The con (and why I'm only giving 4 stars) is that this is a beer garden that has ONLY SIX beers available - all brewed in house. I wish they at least had some local options that made the beer list a bit longer, after all it is a beer garden. They also have a small list of ciders and wine available. The "Industry" Pilsner was great and a nice light beer but

reviews.author: Jessica P.
reviews.description: We got a specialty pizza we jalapeños, ricotta and strawberries and really weren't sure what we were getting into, but good god it was delicious. Good food. Good booze. Good atmosphere. Loved it.

reviews.author: Diana C.
reviews.description: This please was a gem to find on my recent trip. The ambience is great both indoors and outdoors. Happy hour is great as well. Slice of pizza and a pint for $8

reviews.author: Clara C.
reviews.description: *COVID Update*   ABGB is a must visit when in Austin. Parking in their lot is ample. Restrooms are on-site in the corner. Seating is self-served both indoors and outdoors, and there is free WiFi! Masks aren't required here, and most people don't wear them inside or outside. The menu is on a QR code, which is posted on each table. The water station is in the back.   I got the beer flight $15 as it was my first visit. The pilsner is definitely my favorite; it's a popular one! It's odd that there's only 6 choices, but it helps especially for those who are indecisive. If you order one beer, it's about $6. When I visited on a Sunday afternoon, they had live music and many couples were dancing along. I totally missed the memo to bring my boots and hat.   I tried the Calabrese and homemade sausage pizza ($3.50 per slice). Both were delicious.   Obviously with the live music, it's loud inside, but it's a fun place to hang out with larger groups.

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: Very relaxing place. Smaller than brewtorium but at least you can hear each other. There was no music when I went on a Thursday after work. I did a flight to sample their good stuff. It's 5 five ounce pours so it's filling! The bruschetta was good but needed more salt or balsamic dressing. It was still tasty. But the stuffed peppadews were really good. I'll need to come back to try their pizza. There's indoor and outdoor seating. Staff know their stuff. Parking seems to fill up fast. Right off of south Lamar

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: I thought ABGB was a good time! I enjoyed the live music on the night we visited, which happened to be their 8-year anniversary. I had the Day Trip pale ale, and I thought it was pretty delicious. The salad I ordered was also yummy; I especially liked the golden beets. But the star of the show was the pretzel with pimento cheese for SURE.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Really like this gem of a place. Food was delicious with plenty of outside seating.  They now have ordering outside which is a real win and helps with the lines! Live music is another perk of this spot.  It gets crowded i. the evenings so ride share is a smart way to go.

reviews.author: Josh H.
reviews.description: I have to ability to work from anywhere, which let's me drop on on places randomly. It's nice because I can keep a running list of spots to check out when I find myself nearby and I don't need t hop on a zoom meeting with a client. ABGB is one of those spots. I stopped in here for a quick beer during covid and it was pretty solid, this is my first time back.   The wifi is good, clearly. I'm writing this review and it hasn't faltered at all. The beer selection is small, but what I've tasted has all been solid. Both in flavor and body, they are true to what they are brewing. Quiet and mellow atmosphere is lovely is for getting some work done and maintaining a medium focus. The garlic fries smell delicious.   The only downside is that I'm getting a little bug action. But I'm also sitting under a tree, in Texas, in June.     I'll be back and probably to eat.

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: We love ABGB.  The pizzas are delicious.  The salad is amazing.  The beer is cold.  Parking is always perfect.  The wait is always minimal.  The staff are super nice and helpful.  The taste of the pizza is ON POINT!  We always have a great time here.  When you first walk in, the smell of the pizza is out of this world.  it's a great place to take friends from out of town.

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: Great space, pizza, beer, and music. Lots of parking too. Good for large groups and an easy going night with friends.

reviews.author: Kelsey M.
reviews.description: Great place to take the dogs and have a pint! The beer is great and the pizza is equally as good! Friendly staff

reviews.author: Eric R.
reviews.description: Such a great piece of the South Austin community. The food is better than it has to be. The employees at all levels are outstanding. Everyone is helpful and friendly regardless of how busy they are.   Food and service aside, this is just a great place to spend time with the people you love/like. Every time I've been here has been memorable.  Showed up on a Saturday afternoon with a party of 25+ and we immediately found a group of picnic tables and spent the next several hours just enjoying each other's company.   Everyone enjoyed their food and drink but what we'll remember and what I'm most grateful for is the ambiance and hospitality at ABGB.   There's plenty of places to go eat, but when you have a large party and want to make memories with an Austin feel, look no further.

reviews.author: Rudy S.
reviews.description: Best beer on the "Planet"  Sad to see original tasting room move. However we are super excited for new location!  When available go for the Silverback!!  Busch League ranks high too.   Every Saturday should have a few Bucket Heads on the menu!  That is all.   Werd

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Came in on a gorgeous spring Saturday afternoon and enjoyed my free...yes free...beer tasting here. Now, the "free" tasting is 3 tastes of anything they have on the board in the little taster glasses. There is an option to purchase full pours which includes a glass.  I have always been a fan of Thirsty Planet's beer offerings as I have had them at several brewpubs around Austin. Their Buckethead and Double Buckethead are my handsdown favorites! When I was out and about and headed to some other breweries, I stopped in here and was happy I did.  The staff was very nice and there is ample communal seating inside and out. They also offer tours, but I did not take one as I was a bit tight on time.   For a glorious afternoon in a chill atmosphere with great beer offerings and a little roadtrip out of Austin, this is a great place to spend it!

reviews.author: Fernando V.
reviews.description: Nice brewery with a good selection of beers. We happened to show up during an event so we got to hang out in the breezy back and sample LOTS of beer which was great. No food and a little warm so keep that in mind when making a visit

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: Just get the Thirsty Goat. It is a crowd favorite. We stopped in on a recent Pub Crawl and the place was hopping. Since they don't sell food, your pup is welcome and we had fun lovin' on some sweet dawgs! Uh, the four legged ones.  They are great at working the crowd and selling their beer glasses. Katherine was there at the door on the one day (Saturday) that we stopped by to explain how it works. Lots of t-shirts and ball caps to pick through and new fun people to meet. Everyone's happy with a beer.  I also love that Thirsty Planet supports Divine Canines, a therapy dog group that sponsors training for dogs to service hospital patients. Just wish they were open for more than 4 hours a week. Rumor has it this outstanding brewery will soon move to a new much larger space on South Congress.

reviews.author: Heihachiro K.
reviews.description: The Buckethead IPA was awesome! 8.9% and full of deliciousness. I was rather impressed by this brewery and how similar the atmosphere and brews were to the San Diego brew scene.  We got a great deal - take home pint glass with three pints for $10! Sweet!

reviews.author: Khiem L.
reviews.description: I came here on the first leg of a drinking bonanza. The weather was behaving and so we grabbed a table outside and started boozing it up. It's cheap to get a few pours and most everything there is close to some ambrosia of sorts. I've definitely had the goat everywhere so I was glad to try the only-found in-house bevs.   I do not like IPAs so what did I try first, the double bucket head IPA of course. Awesome taste. Not so bitter but leaves you feeling good. Pretty strong so it was a great way to start the morning. I can't recall the other beers I tried but I do remember leaving happy.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Stop one of three for a brewery tour...   I had three of their beers: Lemon Bitch - Special beer on tap. I don't have any of the ABV info but it had a nice lemon taste to it. Very refreshing for the hot weather.  Thirsty Goat - American-style Amber Ale, 6.5% ABV. Had a nice spicy finish with the beer.  Yellow Armadillo - Light American-style Wheat, 4.0% ABV. Very refreshing. Had some citrus flavors in there.   There is a nice outside area with picnic tables and plenty of seating inside and out.   The guys there were so nice. Very engaging and informative when it comes to the beer info.   When I make it back to Austin, I'll definitely be stopping by again.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: Stopped by for a tasting. There are a wide variety of flavors and I especially liked the Palehead. The outdoor "patio" area is lacking but the indoor tasting area makes up for it. From what I understanding they are opening another place soon.  Take advantage of the "Barks for Beer" sale. $20 for a special pint glass that's good for a free pint in several restaurants and other breweries.

reviews.author: El S.
reviews.description: Thirsty planet was the first stop on a brew bus tour I went on.  So I remember it the best.  The only think I didn't like was their smoky beer.  But it's not like I didn't know it would be smoky.  I ordered it anyway and didn't like it so that's on me.  Regarding the brewery itself, it was a well thought out taproom with quality beers.  I liked that they have games to play - always a plus for me.

reviews.author: Sarah G.
reviews.description: More like 4.5. We had a great post-Zoo visit here on a sweaty Saturday afternoon. $10 for a sweet glass and three pints always works for me. They'll also give you a small tasting glass for free, but why bother with that?   I've been a fan of Thirsty Goat amber for awhile, and this visit turned me on to the Hoppy Blonde and Buckethead IPA. I'll be looking for all of them at local bars.  The "tour" is one room, but hey they're a small business, which is cool. Very informative, maybe more than the average beer fan will want, but beer nerds will love it and it's not hard to step out and back to the bar if you get bored.   One downside, it was super stuffy in the tasting room. Not sure if their AC was acting up or just couldn't handle the crowd and the July heat. However, that didn't stop my group for staying and drinking until closing time. I'd recommend Thirsty Planet to any beer lover visiting or living in Austin.

reviews.author: Rachel E.
reviews.description: Stopped by the brewery for a birthday beer crawl. (Is it really a crawl if you only go to 2 places?)  We signed up for the tour online (which is free) but there was no list and it seemed like they weren't going to do the tour at all. You might have to remind them. Once we mentioned our interest, they announced it and a bunch of people joined in. I'm not sure reservations are really needed at all for this. The tour was fine, nothing to write home about. If you've done a tour before you've probably seen everything they have.  I liked a lot of the beer we had, especially the thirsty goat ale. They were out of the wheat but had a rhubarb beer which was interesting.  Staff were friendly and when not totally overwhelmed with people, happy to engage in conversation about the beers.   It did get quite crowded and I understand why. The outdoor patio is lovely when the weather is nice and they have tons of games. For me it was a bit too crowded and noisy, but that's the small price you pay for free - $10 beer. (You can either get 3 tickets for a small glass for free or 3 pint tickets + a keepsake glass for $10.)

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: Checked out their brewery tasting and tour this past Saturday.  Warning: there are times it will be quite crowded like when bus loads of people stop by.  However, even despite the crowds, the bartenders did a great job of serving everyone.  $10 gets you a souvenir pint glass and three full pints (plus you can taste a few oz of the other beers they have for no additional charge, so really you can taste 7-8 taps for $10).  Their yellow armadillo and thirsty goat are both solid crowd and palate pleasers.  I liked their merch as well, bought a ladies tee for $18.  The tour was about 25 minutes long, but it was the hottest part of July and it was not a/c, so I think they mercifully made it quick for us.  We brought kiddos and the outside area was kid friendly, although not completely fenced in by the side of the road, which was a bit nerve wracking.  I wish I had brought some more small bills as tips collected in the tasting room go to a local charity, which rotates monthly or seasonally.  A fun way to spend a Saturday, would be even better in the cooler months of the year.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: Well, THIS place is awesome.   Heck yeah Thirsty Planet, go you. $10 for three pints + a pint glass + brewery tour = fun Saturday. We stopped by this place and had a swell time. The owner/brewmaster was super nice and friendly, in fact, everyone who worked there was awesome. If you don't want to drink three beers, you get a tasting glass and three free tasters. But then you don't get an awesome pint glass...   Only gripe? No AC (in August, yuck) and it is SUPER LOUD inside. And it seemed that the more people drink, the louder they got and it was just incredibly noisy.   If you like Thirsty Planet beers, or beer in general, definitely worth checking out.

reviews.author: Marshall J.
reviews.description: If there were 6 stars...  My family rented the brewery on a Saturday night for a birthday party. Thirsty Planet was flawless in their delivery! They were professional, yet easy to work with, responsive and surprisingly affordable. Jason did a great job behind the bar causally handling the beer orders while educating those who wanted about their beers.  PRO TIP: They use Sonos wireless music system, but do not have an external headphones jack. Download Sonos on your phone and the then manage/update your playlists and you can listin to an iTunes playlist by going to "This iPhone" (I assume the same for Android phones) and then Playlists. If you do not want an iTunes playlist, you can create a playlist in Sonos app ahead of time or play Pandora, Spotify, XM/Sirius, etc).

reviews.author: Holmes S.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time today, its a really cool place. I liked the beers and you really can't beat the price. Staff were really good, I wish I lived closer, i'd be here all the time.   The only downside is it was a little hot inside. But everything else was outstanding, so gets 5 stars from me :)

reviews.author: Mara F.
reviews.description: Thirsty Planet is my new BFF.   Seriously, if you haven't gone on a 'tasting' - you MUST.   It's free!  The owners are great, very knowledgeable and you can tell love their craft.  We bring out of town guests to tastings as well as part of our Tour of Austin.  Be sure to ask for their brew when dining in and around Austin.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: This is a great addition to Austin's micro brewery scene.  I first tried their Buckethead IPA at Second Restaurant and enjoyed it enough to look for Thirsty Planet's website, where I discovered they offer tours most Saturdays.  No information about the tours is provided on the website, but here's the deal: sign up online, when you go there's an optional tour, plus four 4 oz. samples for free, or you can purchase the "souvenir glass" for $7 and use it to get up to 4 pints free...a nice deal (although, I don't know about you, but I couldn't consume 4 full pints in 2 hours).  They have a nice large indoor tasting room with communal bench tables and an outdoor patio as well (but it offers no shade).  On to the beer:  * Buckethead IPA - one of my new favorite local IPAs; it is well balanced with the bitter and hint of sweet, with a pleasing Amber color and a mildly citrusy nose.  * Thirsty Goat Amber - a lighter amber, malty but with a slight hoppy finish.  * Double Buckethead IPA - an even stronger bitter taste than the Buckethead...save this one for last. * Yellow Armadillo Habanero - I could definitely taste the habanero flavor, but the spiciness was tempered by a pilsner-like base.  It's surprising how easily this beer can be consumed.

reviews.author: Evan H.
reviews.description: The tour guide was very knowledgeable and gave one of the better tours I have been on. The brewery has a nice outdoor seating area along with jenga and other games to play while you drink. Thirsty goat is a failry good brew however the other offerings on tap were pretty bland and run of the mill compared to other breweries in the Austin area.

reviews.author: Orion G.
reviews.description: I stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon while out cruising the area. It was pretty busy, but I was able to get in fairly easily.   The place had a nice welcoming feeling to it, and stepping up to the bar got me a friendly greeting. I was not familiar with their brews, but saw one called "Twist and Stout", and being a fan of the dark stuff, went right for it. Oh my... *smiles coyly" This stuff was liquid sex.... and I knew it was going to get me in trouble.  So next up, I explained my fondness of the dark, but felt the need to expand outward, what would they suggest. The man behind the counter said without hesitation - "Thirsty Goat Amber"!  Boyo was he right! After two pints of that, I had an expression similar to the one on the label, so I took some time in my truck to eat a sandwich before driving away.  Yup, I'm going back!

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: All good.  Very pleasant atmosphere and chill crowd.  Great beer, terrific value and even cool t-shirts.   What else? Well the tip jar goes to the selected charity, this time summer camp for underprivileged kids.  So good, can't wait for next visit.

reviews.author: Karina N.
reviews.description: James is the bomb! Such a nice and friendly face to walk into the place and see. He recommended the Native Texan draft and it was very well worth it. I left the place with my own Independence Brewing hoodie! I will be recommending it and I'll definitely be back. We were there for sxsw performances. The hip hop night did not disappoint!

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Stopped by this groovy place today, and it passed the VIBE check 100^! First the minute you walk in the music is on point! Then there is Rachel, which she's super friendly and beer knowledgeable! Everyone was so friendly! This is the kind of place you can definitely chill for awhile!

reviews.author: Connie H.
reviews.description: First tried this tasty brewery at Terry Black's and was so happy it is served wide and far around town.  I believe my go to was Native but had some Stash at the ball Game.  Yum

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Wasn't a huge fan of their beers (tried a few and was only a semi fan of one) but I like lighter, easier to drink beers and that didn't seem to be their thing- the two beers that sounded like my cup of tea by description wound up being sours, which disappointed me.  I also felt kind of weird about asking for a flight but then being told uhhh we're not doing those right now- seemingly bc the line was long. It was odd.  Small indoor space, kind of lacking something aesthetically - compared to other Austin breweries.   Good truck onsite but it wasn't that good :/  Overall just meh! But they host geeks who drink if you're into trivia!

reviews.author: Danielle F.
reviews.description: Solid variety of beers, some seasonal, and enough space to bring a group (though not as expansive as some other breweries that have more patio seating).  I went for the Beer My Valentine's event and the Garrison Brothers bourbon-aged Convict Hill and Indy's coconut-flavored Midnight Paradise were my faves.  Tonight there was an open area for dancing and the food truck Killa Wasi was there. Really enjoyed our time there though the great event turnout made the beer line pretty long. Will definitely return to sample other beers and see experience it during a "regular" day. Staff was very friendly and I enjoyed the stouts!

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: I was an idiot when I gave this amazing brewery four stars. It's perfect and deserves no less than a perfect rating!   The beer is great, the monthly metal shows kick ass, and it's a perfect location for me.   If you're near here and want to chill at an awesome brewery do so!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Love me some authentic microbreweries.  I haven't been to a solid microbrew spot since moving to Austin, so this was such a breath of fresh air. It seems like there are plenty of breweries that also double as restaurants and music venues--which is cool, I'm all for that, but deep down I'm a plain microbrew kinda gal.  Getting here got me so excited as our GPS took us to industrial surroundings AKA the location of every great microbrewery. There is plenty of parking, and they had a yummy-smelling food truck parked outside, but we already ate so skipped that. My friend and I walked in and immediately felt the warm, relaxed energy that Independence had. I couldn't decide on what pint to get, so I settled on a taster set of four for $10. Not too pricey. The selections were not really in my favor, as I tend to go for wheats, belgians, juicy or hazy IPA's, or oatmeal stouts. However, I knew I would find something I'd like. One can never be too picky about beer.  They also have board games and free stickers! I love that!! Their logo is the lone star on black fire--super cool. Our taptender was a wonderful and friendly man. I just wish he would have been a little more wordy with his explanations of the beer profiles. I'd assume that microbreweries attract devout beer drinkers and self-proclaimed snobs (like myself), so I would love it if he was able to elaborate more. Anyhow, I will be back even with a larger group (yay picnic tables!), but I hope that they have more varieties of beer, or that they rotate their taps often.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: This is Austin laid back recharge drink great beer! Food truck yes (Good Truck) So after much sampling while listening to live music I enjoyed an amazing burger. Employees are fun and extremely knowledgeable! Lots of seating in building and out. Tucked behind a row of office. We like hidden places!

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Indep brewing has been around for 15 years but this brick and mortar is 5 years running. Cool location, industrial feel. But let's get to the beer selection..  Freak power is going for $2/pint right now! Honestly, you would be hard-pressed to find a deal this good anywhere in Austin TX. It's a hefe and goes down easily, very easy to drink.  My personal fav is the convict hill oatmeal stout, coming in at 8% and tastes like coffee. Also very easy to drink and is a nice addition in "wintertime."  Good place, fair prices, decent selection!

reviews.author: Victoria W.
reviews.description: This is one of my favorite "hidden" gems. I don't know how hidden it is, but the first time I came, I was skeptical because it is tucked behind some businesses and inside a warehouse. However, once we discovered this great, laid-back brewery, we visit it at least monthly.  Our favorite activity is Thursday night trivia with Geeks who Drink there. We've been a few times and it's always fun! They allow outside food, so it's always fun to pick up some bites and enjoy their awesome beer as we Geek it to random trivia.  I highly recommend, especially on a Thursday night! Hope to compete against you soon!

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: Nice indoor and outdoor areas. Nice selection of drafts. I enjoyed the Freak Power Blood Orange. The Crossroads food truck has a nice selection. I loved the spicy chicken tenders and the Brussels Sprouts. Very friendly service. Located south of 71 and east of 35. Tonight I was inside and it was hotter than the hinges of Hell. Air conditioner was blowing cold so not sure why the room was so hot. At sunset they opened the garage door and it cooled a bit. High today was 100 degrees.

reviews.author: Greshka P.
reviews.description: Last stop of our brewery tour. This is more of what I'm used to in Florida...  warehouse turned into taproom. Beers listed on the wall, not that many options here but still good beers.  One of the beers I wanted to try ran out so they recommended another based on that selection. Good job, I liked it.  It was a bit sour, so it hit the mark.  But the one I liked the most was the End Credit Chocolate Hazelnut Porter. The hazelnut makes it smooth, and the chocolate flavor comes through as well.    The staff was cordial, not overly friendly, but it's patrons sure are. They made room for us to walk up an order, they asked what I had ordered, and made recommendations based on what they had already tried.  They had live music that day too.  Very entertaining, good set, he even dedicated a song to one of my friends.  Very cool!  They have games like chutes and ladders, Rock Trivia, Oversized Jenga, and more.  Beer and entertainment, can't go wrong with that!

reviews.author: Jennifer H.
reviews.description: Super impressed with this brewery! The beer is awesome, the staff are great and the atmosphere is pretty rad! 10/10 will drink there again!

reviews.author: Stacy E.
reviews.description: This brewery is an austin staple. I say hidden staple actually because it took a while to find this place, but once you do, you won't want to leave. With awesome craft beer, great hipster service and entertainment usually on the weekends you will have an awesome time. Try the beers on special, but also try the ones that are mixtures between two beers they are special and only unique to this establishment. The bathrooms are clean and there are snacks by the register, but be sure to eat before you get here since some beers are heavy and you might get full which really isn't a bad thing, but good to know!

reviews.author: Gilbert C.
reviews.description: Nice tasting beer selection. The Convict Hill stout is very good! Nice atmosphere with indoor/outdoor seating. The taco from the food truck was very delicious. Will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Wajih O.
reviews.description: I stopped by this place on a Friday and it was my first time visiting as well as my first time trying their beer(s). I was a little taken back at how low in ABV their beers were but that isn't a deal breaker by any means. In fact, out of the entire selection on tap, only two were higher than 5% and they both happened to be a staggering 9%. The interior is nice and very spacious.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Lauren L.
reviews.description: We were looking for a quick drink before heading back to the airport. We grabbed a passion fruit berliner weiss. It was light, delicious and refreshing. No frills. Plasic cup.  There's out door and indoor seating. Parking was a bit of a maze. Worth a stop if you are in the area.

reviews.author: Geoffrey C.
reviews.description: Great beer, great people, great vibes. Be careful on where your directors take you. It took us behind the brewery. But you'll find it on the other side. It's a really large place and they set up picnic tables right outside the brewery.  The Sunday afternoon I went, I believe there was some event wrapping up. DJ was playing 90s RandB/Hip-Hop which contributed to the great vibe. All of their beers tasted amazing. I ended up going with their sour beer. Perfect balance of sourness and fruit. I would definitely come here again.

reviews.author: Christopher F.
reviews.description: Cool brewery tucked away in a wearhouse.  It can be a little hard to find from the road as it is behind retail.  But once you arrive, there is indoor and outdoor seating.  There are occasional food trucks.  Plenty of games including jenga.  I like the chill vibe.  This is a great place for an afternoon drink or three.  The bartenders know their stuff.  Ask as many questions as you like regarding the beer choices.  You can do tasting flights or go right to the pint.  I prefer the Stash IPA which is one of my local favorites.  Other beers are good too.  Can't go wrong here.

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: When I was visiting friends in Austin last month, a friend and I decided to hit up a local brewery for a couple of hours (it's a tradition of ours). I had to pick up my brother at the airport after, so I was looking for a place that was southeast, so Independence fit the bill. When I lived in Austin, I used to drink Independence beers all the time, but I never made it out to the brewery. I was impressed! It's really large! Tables inside and tables outside. They have several beers to choose from. The line for the bathroom was REALLY long, but we happened to choose a day that had an event (puppy adoptions I think) and it was PACKED. All in all, good beers, they were playing good music, and I had a great time with my friend! Great afternoon, and I'd go again!

reviews.author: D H.
reviews.description: We loved our wine tour with Taste of the Hills. We visited three wineries with two other couples on the tour. Each stop was unique and Jodie was especially knowledgeable and friendly. She is completely worth trying the tour!   Bonus: we got engaged after the tour!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Jodie was the best!  I found Taste of the Hills on yelp.  I messaged Jodie in April to see what her pricing and availability was for Memorial Day weekend and she responded quickly. Paid deposit through venmo and paid the other half day of our tasting. We did one winery, one distillery and one brewery. She gave us a small history of each of the places we went too. Her cheese board setup was amazing! Very sweet and easy going. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Chandler W.
reviews.description: Jodie made my day all I could have dreamed of. Her bus is super nice, well air conditioned and plenty of space, her knowledge of each winery was very cool to hear and she made sure we were always comfortable! On a warm summer day we were kept cool, fed, and full of wine! Must book with Jodie for a trip around the hill country. Delicious wine and charcuterie board! Thank you Jodie!

reviews.author: Cheryl J.
reviews.description: OMG, Jodie is FaNtAsTiC! My bff and I were on our annual girl's trip and wanted to book a wine tour before we left the Hill Country of Texas. We were staying in the adorable town of Wimberley so I researched tours in the area.  Jodie's Taste of the Hills Tour got great reviews and went to wineries close to the Wimberley area. The day of the tour ended up being chilly and rainy. As soon as Jodie pulled up with her spectacular shuttle-like van she was out like a flash with pretty umbrellas for us! We went to 3 different wineries which we thoroughly enjoyed! After the first one, we returned to Jodie's vehicle and she had a gorgeous tray for us of cheese,  sausage,  crackers,  grapes,  olives, dips.....simply divine!!! The tour was also just the 2 of us and we loved that Jodie still did ALL of this for a tour that I believe takes up to 12 people! The next time we plan a trip to the Hill Country we are going to do one of Jodie's Beer tours!! We had such great conversations with Jodie too! Thank you sooooo much for the GREAT time! Sooooo much fun!

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: Amazing tour!!! My wife and I came into Wimberley during Spring Break to relax from teaching and this was the perfect trip to do so! Jodie made us all feel like we were old friends, even though we had never met anyone else on the bus.  She was very detailed with the stories of each winery, and explained all the different varietals, answering our every question along the way.
