The bus was very comfortable and clean, and she stored each bottle we purchased until the trip was over, but we could have had the bottles on the bus had we chosen to.  The wineries all seemed to know her, so they were expecting us and were incredibly friendly. We were not rushed anywhere, and still managed to make it back into town to enjoy shopping on the square.  My wife and I were pretty hungry by the time we had lunch, since we didn't have breakfast, but the tapas style lunch was perfect for the glass of wine we purchased to have with it. The lunch was delicious and filling.  Overall this was an amazing experience and I will be recommending this tour to everyone I know.

reviews.author: Samantha K.
reviews.description: The owner, Jodie, went above and beyond to make sure my birthday with 12 of my friends and family was a moment to remember and it was just that. She recommended the best of Driftwood and ended up going to Driftwood Estate Winery and Vista Brewery. We spent around 5 hours commuting, tasting, and even an impromptu cellar tour. Thanks again, Jodie! I highly recommend Taste of the Hills to everyone.

reviews.author: Jeffrey R.
reviews.description: Jodie is an exceptional chauffeur.  We had a blast for a friend's birthday! She knew all the great stops and her ride is smooth, comfy, and had a great sound system. We had so much fun!

reviews.author: Sona E.
reviews.description: This wine tour with Jodie is a must.  We got Serenity Inn on a Wednesday so we were lucky to be on the wine tour with only one other couple.  Jodie is such a pleasant and inviting soul. She asked about each person's preferences as to be able to personalize the tour and pick which wineries she decided to take us too.  She is very knowledgeable of the town and the wineries.  The lunch she provides is just amazing. By the time we were done I felt like I had made an incredible new friend. I can't wait to go back and do more tours.

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: This was such an incredible experience. Jodie picked us up at the Serenity Farm House Inn. She was so friendly and knowledgeable and super sweet. She knew all the best places to go. The picnic lunch she provided was amazing. I wouldn't change a thing about today. I would love to bring some friends and do it all over again.

reviews.author: Brooke K.
reviews.description: Myself,  my Aunt and my cousin took Jodie's winery tour yesterday and had an absolute blast! Jodie really personalized the tour based on our taste in wines. She has an extensive knowledge of wines, the wineries, the towns, etc. Our favorite part was lunch because of the views and the wonderful spread that was provided for us. I highly recommend this tour and in fact will probably we doing it again, soon, I hope.

reviews.author: Amber D.
reviews.description: Perfect - the highlight of our trip!  Jodie was the best, most fun, knowledgeable and coordinator.  We went to Driftwood, Duchman and Fall Creek Vineyards.  We were fortunate enough to have great people touring with us, and it made the tour all the more fun.  She prepared the best picnic lunch I've ever had.  Sugar Shack cake balls, meats, cheeses, crackers, hummus, a goat cheese something served on crackers (that I LOVED, and I hate goat cheese), spinach feta rolls, and I'm sure I'm forgetting something.  She was fully prepared for everything.  Boxes for the wine we bought, umbrellas in case in rained (it didn't), plenty of water...this wine tour couldn't have been more perfect if she tried.  Thanks, Jodie!

reviews.author: Charles J.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing!  Very knowledgeable and informative.  Has some great stories and makes it very fun.  And the wineries she took us to were fantastic!  I've been to some bad wineries and the Wimberley area has a lot of options and can be daunting to do yourself.  Plus, nice to have a driver.  . Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anita Y.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing! She asked what our preferences in wine were and brought us to wineries that best fit our palate. She had a delicious charcuterie board waiting for us. Super friendly and very knowledgeable on various places in Wimberley. I highly recommend Jodie!!!

reviews.author: Gwen L.
reviews.description: This was a Fantastic tour. The winery's were lovely and Jodie was the perfect host. Would do it again and recommend to anyone visiting Wimberly.

reviews.author: Amer S.
reviews.description: Jodie was an amazing host and she really made the evening perfect for my wife's 40th birthday! She took us to amazing tasting locations, she knew everyone and we received first class service. She even helped with dinner reservations! It really was an amazing evening largely due to Jodie and the exceptional service she provides! If you are looking for a fantastic wine tour, get in touch with Jodie and she will ensure that happens.

reviews.author: Vicky W.
reviews.description: Ahhhh! So very relaxing! Jodie Meyer knew all the tourists' names and made sure we got to know each other. She provided an excellent variety of foods including a hot portion and gluten-free (just in time `cause I was lit after the 1st vineyard). The three vineyards for that day were selected based on the wine preferences of the tourists that day (A+ perk). We never felt pushed or obligated to buy wines, but we all did because they were very good (!), and Jodie kept our purchases organized and stored for us. She also gave a good background on each vineyard and on the Wimberley area in general. We learned a lot about Wimberley and wine and were able to get tipsy knowing Jodie was an excellent driver of her comfy bus. And have you been to Wimberley? That hilly countryside is beautiful!

reviews.author: Linz N.
reviews.description: We recently went on a fabulous wine tour with Jodie on 4/15 and had a great time!  Our tour was originally scheduled for 10:30a, but got pushed back to 1:15p due to shuttle trouble (we had the option to receive our money back, but actually liked the later time).  We stopped at three wineries, including Driftwood Estate and Duchman Family Winery.  The views at all of the wineries varied, but each were unique to their locations.  Jodie provided an amazing picnic-style lunch, including a charcuterie (meat and cheese) board, chicken salad, nuts, walnut and feta salad, grapes, chocolate cake balls, bottled water, etc. At the second stop, Jodie was kind enough to call in people's orders to Salt Lick BBQ and had it all ready to take home by the third stop.  We can't wait to return again!

reviews.author: Debbie V.
reviews.description: Fantastic wine tour with a knowledgable , fun and personable guide. Jodi made our first wine tour experience a memorable one. Nice travel accommodations   We went to 3 local wineries chosen by our wine preferences. She provided a great tapas lunch and even accommodated the gluten free guests.  I would highly recommend   I will be coming back and doing it again!

reviews.author: Haeley B.
reviews.description: Jodie was awesome! We booked her for a bachelorette weekend wine tour and had an amazing day! Each winery was set up for tastings when we arrived. The tapas lunch was delicious and came with a gorgeous hill country view. Jodie went out of her way picking dinner up for us and storing all our purchases throughout the tour. She catered the tour to the pallet of the girls. I would definitely use her again!!

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: My mother and I had the most amazing time with Jodi. She was a perfect tour guide and took us to three great wineries. She gave us a lot of background information on the wineries as well as the town of Wimberley. She had a delicious assortment of snacks for us to munch on while we rode to and from each winery. She helped package our wine purchases and brought us umbrellas as it started to rain. She even went the extra mile, literally, and drove us back to our hotel since it was raining as we had walked to our meeting spot earlier in the day. We had another couple on the tour with us which was really nice since we had people to mingle with. It was a very personal experience and I felt as though we were all just great friends spending an afternoon together. Who needs Napa, everything is better in Texas!!! We will definitely be repeat customers.

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: Yesterday, I decided to do a day trip to Spicewood today. It was first to Krause Springs then found out Iron Wolf would be open lunch time. After a refreshing morning at Krause Springs, we headed to Iron Wolf Ranch and Distillery for lunch and drinks.   They have a wide variety of spirits with several award winning ones. Tiann was great in making our drinks! I had the New Fashion made with Hotscotch (a little sweet and spicy). My husband had the Luna-tic made with vodka and several fruit juices. We enjoyed the drinks while we waited for our lunch from Craigo's. We ordered the specialty pizza (sausage, pepperoni, green peppers, mushrooms and onions) and barbecue wings. Truly phenomenal pizza and wings! We also had the Giddy Up Mary with horseradish-infused vodka and Wild and Tea, an Arnold Palmer with bourbon.   We'll have to come back another time for the tasting and meet Luna, a wolf adopted by the family (she's usually there on Fridays). Most Saturdays they have live music. Definitely check their calendar online.

reviews.author: Monica Q.
reviews.description: We just did a tasting and I was not expecting that . It was so yummy. Very friendly people. Nice at home atmosphere. We really enjoyed the group tasting. It was fun hanging with everyone and hear what people like and have trouble drinking . We had vodka, gen, bourbon, scotch, etc. and we ended up leaving with a bottle of Hot iron. Can't wait to get home and have a glass of this in ice.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Made the trek for a friend's Bday get together. A little off the beaten path but worth the drive.   Beautiful venue. Plenty of seating under the oaks. Playground. Disc golf. Cornhole. Food truck (Craig O's). We had a great time.   Specialty cocktails are a little off (and a little weak). Order your preferred cocktail and you'll be fine.   Didn't do the tour or tasting. Maybe next time.

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: I mean what's really hard? It's liquor and a open space. That's all you really need to have a perfect distillery. The service was great and the staff were nice. I would recommend the bourbon and the gin because they were both smooth and delicious. This is definitely a chill and relaxing place to visit

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: This place is not set up to be a serious event venue. They have ONE indoor bathroom and a lousy pizza truck. They might be an ok distillery, but I don't know, that's not what I was there for.

reviews.author: Stephanie M.
reviews.description: I almost don't wana leave such a positive review because then more and more people will find out about this AMAZING spot and I want it all for myself!! Hahaha kidding but really this place was awesome, even though it was a day with drizzle still enjoyed it! First off the staff is beyond sweet, so warm and welcoming! The drinks were great and good price! Such a fun vibe with good music. Very mellow way to spend a Sunday afternoon. So happy they had a kids area because both my 8 year old and 2 year old had a blast and stayed busy so I could enjoy a delicious Bloody Mary. They have awesome lawn games to keep busy and a delicious pizza food truck parked on site. We will for sure be back!! Do yourself a favor and pay it a visit it was a lot better than most of the distilleries I've visited.

reviews.author: Ken G.
reviews.description: Stopped by here with some local friends, and it definitely was the best spot we went to of the whole night. The bourbon was awesome!!! They had a little fair going on, and that made the whole experience even better. Live music as well! If they had rooms we would have stayed. Haha. Definitely recommend stopping by this spot. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Sepid M.
reviews.description: We got stock there during a storm and they were the best! People are so nice and the drinks are awesome!

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: Great distillery! I'm actually not typically a whiskey fan but I like theirs! Love both the Hotscotch and Iron Hot.  Plentiful parking. Big outdoor deck seating. Live music stage. Food truck on site. Awesome Hill Country views.  Family-friendly events. Highly recommend Iron Wolf!

reviews.author: Rick B.
reviews.description: This is the fanciest metal building distillery I have ever seen!  Very shiny stainless steel still, immaculate polished concrete floors, easily the fanciest metL building I have seen!    And they have good liquor!  The tasting is informative and interesting, even if all of the idetails on the fancy bottles is a bit overwhelming.  But the real wolf is interesting.   Try it al!!  The Giddy'Up (horseradish) vodka is better than it sounds - and it makes a fantastic Bloody Mary!  Several things were good, but you must BUY this - it is excellent!

reviews.author: N S.
reviews.description: We were excited to go here. That quickly faded. There is almost no shade. I'm sorry but this is Texas. It's hot. You need to put in adequate shade. It has one indoor bathroom and one little pizza truck -which the pizza was Okay- the kids play area is huge tires with again NO shade. Please don't even say you have a play area when the only thing they could climb on are tires that would give them second degree burns. The solo artist singing was probably the only good thing as we also got 3 different drinks and didn't even finish half of it because it was gross.

reviews.author: Christina D.
reviews.description: We stopped by here as one of our stops during a brewery/wine tour. It became our last stop, the owners were super friendly and attentive to us the whole time. We started out with a tasting and even though the weather was not in our favor we still enjoyed our time around the fire enjoying their great drink options. It's a pet friendly family atmosphere and we will definitely be returning!

reviews.author: Molly F.
reviews.description: I have visited Iron Wolf many times and never had a bad experience! Staff is very friendly and hospitable. Great environment and drinks! Must try the Hotscotch liquor!

reviews.author: Alyse H.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this sprawling alcohol paradise on our drive back to Austin from San Angelo.  We originally stopped because the BBQ food truck they have on the premises is rated very high, but the liquor turned out to be the real star. Hubby partook in a liquor tasting that cost $10 for multiple samples.  They have some very unique flavors that I've never heard of anyone incorporating in a liquor before.  I ordered a bourbon and lemonade drink that hit the spot in the Texas heat.  This was a Mecca for bachelorette parties and large groups of friends.  There is plenty of room on the property to spread out and enjoy the weather.  They also host concerts on their stage next to the tasting room.  They are planning to expand their offerings here, so stay tuned as to what they build!

reviews.author: Laura V.
reviews.description: This is by far my favorite place to visit in the Hill Country. It is a party place. Large group specialty. Large area. Room to spread. Dog friendly. Great patios and food trucks. We had the Ginirita and Cucumber Cooler. We Tasted the butterscotch Vodka and bourbon and the rum. Everything was superb. My Fav Place.

reviews.author: Brian A.
reviews.description: Amazing place and people, family friendly even your Pup can come out and enjoy!  Recommend this place!

reviews.author: Missy L.
reviews.description: This is an amazing venue!  The family is so kind and attentive to all of their patrons.  We have been coming here since they've opened, and enjoy every single minute!  It's a must try!!

reviews.author: Prince H.
reviews.description: I'm rounding up to 5 stars because it is a family run business working hard to make a go of it. Small but nice distillery has tours and tastings with a large outdoor area for hanging out and a stage for occasional music acts. I didn't play but the frisbee golf looked great.  Rum, gin, fireball, and few other mixed spirits to sample.  I personally liked and purchased the gin. Low juniper the way I like it.  Odd wild eye logo is off putting but very friendly staff.

reviews.author: Jani C.
reviews.description: Great place - live music   Nice outdoor area with games and food trucks. The owners are very nice . Be sure and do the tasting so you can see how good the bourbon- vodka- gin - etc is

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Iron Wolf Ranch and Distillery is a welcome new addition to the ever quickly expanding distillery scene in the Texas Hill Country.  The owners are a wonderful husband and wife team that we had the pleasure to chat with for awhile during our visit.  We visited soon after their opened, and I have been trying to find a chance to get back ever since.  When you drive up to the tasting room and production site you immediately know this is a special spot.  Their 15 acre property has been planned and well thought out.  The current building, known as the "Still House", is just one of several future buildings that they have envisioned to have onsite.  The "Still House" provides space for onsite production and a tasting room. They also have expansive space surrounding the building for the whole family to come out and enjoy.  They have huge oaks shading the property.  Elevated decks with cozy seating and beautiful 360 views. A fire pit, bocci ball green, human size beer pong, washers, horse shoes, and a 9 disc golf course.  Did I also mention the amazing sand box for the kids!  You could easily pack a picnic and make a day of it here.    For a nominal fee you can taste a selection of their spirits, or just purchase a crafted cocktail.  Their spirit options are Gin, Rum, Vodka, and Horseradish infused Vodka.  They also have two flavored Whiskeys - Iron Hot, which is a Whiskey with all natural cinnamon and sweeteners blended with Texas peppers. I saved the best for last. Their Hotscotch, which is Whiskey blended with natural butterscotch flavors and Texas Peppers.  It is sweet meets spicy.  All the spirits were well done. But Hotscotch was my favorite. Something unique.  I have enjoyed it in my apple cider!    A fantastic space, with great drinks, and awesome people. It doesn't get much better than this.  It will be great too see how this place grows and expands in the future.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: If you have never tried Adelbert's, what are you waiting for? Adelbert's is located in a prime location near Burnet and more predominately, the Domain. Skip the crowd at Rock Rose Ave and come to Adlbert's instead. Not a single thing I would change about Adelbert's!    Adelbert's serves more than just brews, they also serve ciders, meads, wines, and non-alcoholic beverages. If you have never had meads, I'd start slow with a sample, as it's very potent in flavor! The Dale was refreshing, while the Sauvignon Blanc was a crisp white wine.   If you are wanting to host events of any kind, Adelbert's is here for it. Scott, the owner and Sean, the manager are incredibly accommodating!! They were so sweet to open early and to even allow the food truck on site to help cater to us. If you are looking for a quick tour, you can ask them as well to check out their facilities.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: I really like the beer here. I love the $18 flight and the pint glass you get to take home at the end is the coolest pint glass I've ever owned. Unfortunately, they do not allow dogs inside. As a dog owner who lives in the brewery district, this establishment is simply off my list anytime I go out with my little gal.   I do love this place but it's hard to give a perfect score to a place I can't frequent. Especially when they have ~10 competitors in a 5 minute radius and none of them share the same policy. As a result, I am updating my review from 5 to 4 stars.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: Cool Staff, great beer, really good vibes all around.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: This place is on my Covid-19 safe list. They will continue to require masks.

reviews.author: Cynthia L.
reviews.description: I sampled a flight of their Belgian style beers and enjoyed them all. The staff was polite, and the food from the Emoji food truck was tasty and reasonably priced.

reviews.author: Dan P.
reviews.description: Overall vibe: relaxed, quirky Austin  Service: good beer knowledge. Hillary was very nice at the counter.  Beer: excellent quality. Great Friday from raspberry wheat beer to Belgian style ale  Overall cleanliness: above average  Price: average for good craft beer

reviews.author: Chris T.
reviews.description: This is a nice stop. The entryway can get a slight bottleneck, just be patient. The beer is worth the wait. I got the seasonal raspberry beer that was brewed for owner daughter wedding, oh my gosh! Delicious and refreshing. I ended up buying a 6 pack to take home. I think it is gone now, but so good!

reviews.author: Rishi R.
reviews.description: Great people. Great drinks. An awesome time. My fav is the mald wine. Darts in the back food truck out front

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Large spacious venue with plenty of outdoor seating as well. I love that have arcade games and foosball, fun spot for a group. Come thristy.

reviews.author: Alex C.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of dark Belgian style beer that's not too sweet so Adalbert's gets five stars right away.  I love the Philosophizer and the October Rust.  There seems to be good social distancing. There's hand sanitizer on the counter. Growlers are a possibility as are CDB sodas. The people are friendly and seem to know about the beer. I only discovered this place after the pandemic it started so I've never really spent time inside. But I've been sitting on my own porch enjoying it quite a bit and when things get back to normal I hope to spend a few hours at Adelbert's.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: This brewery is a 10/10 if Yelp let give this opinion I would. The bartender was absolutely amazing giving me amazing recommendations. The GM proceeded to stay late with us and show us the absolute best of the best mead I have ever had. He was amazing the bartender was amazing and if I ever re-vist Austin this is a must have on the to do list. Do NOT miss out on this amazing experience. Do not go to Austin beer works this place is literally 10x better if not more.

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: This was a great brewery to go to after work for drinks with friends or coworkers. I love the idea that's you are actually in the brewery itself.   The neat thing is that they have artwork that's for sale on the walls. The art adds character and is a large variety of different themes all from local artists.   No good is served inside the brewery but there is a really good food truck on the outside.   The beers are amazing and you can sample before you buy.  Liked this brewery and beers are very creative.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love coming here and just hanging out. The bartenders are always very sweet and willing to let you try things before you get a whole glass. I always enjoy their IPAs. They have a food truck outside with I think chicken I usually just get the fresh popped popcorn it's delicious and great to snack on while drinking beer. They have a Nintendo Wii with Mario kart and two old-school arcade games they also have a Foos ball table and darts. There's also boardgames that you can check out with giving them your ID, an awesome place to hang out with friends, kids and dogs!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: I had my first Adelbert's beer through HEB, with their Naked Nun witbier. I have been hooked since then and finally made it into their tasting room.   It. Was. Heaven. They have an outdoors area that's shaded for those with doggos or who want to enjoy the heat and eat from their food truck. I had the Triple B, which was surprisingly crisp and floral for a belgian. They had a variety of beers which I wanted to taste, but we arrived late with one hour to spare before closing. That just means I need to pay another visit to truly enjoy the place.  They have a private parking area shared with neighboring businesses and strong wifi. The best part is the indoors games like 4-player Mario Kart (WHAT!), darts, and a bunch of board games. They also give free stickers, plus our lady taptender that day was so kind and welcoming.

reviews.author: Tisha T.
reviews.description: Met up with some work peeps for a happy hour of sorts. I originally didn't plan to attend since it's a brewery and I hate beer with a passion. However I checked out their site, saw they had some wine options and a food truck--so I happily tagged along. The bartender who greeted us gave us the rundown of everything. Served us with a smile and was very informative about the beers, of course. I had a great bottle of pinot grigio while my friends enjoyed the various beers available. I had a great time checking out the art that they have on the walls for sale. We also played a game of jumbo sized connect four and Mario Kart on the big screen. A large collection of board games are also available to borrow while hanging out enjoying your drink in the taproom. Very cool place, warm vibes. Great food truck on site as well.  Definitely will return soon and bring my beer drinking friends.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Really good beer at Adebert's. Lots of cool wood barrels and lots of people around for a fun Friday Night. At certain times you can challenge the bartender to a game of Mario Kart which is truly unique but just add the the overall great experience at Adelbert's

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: This place is great! Get the wristband if you're a first timer- only $15 for six "half pours" which are definitely more like 3/4 pours haha  The mango wit, naked nun, and hibiscus saison are AMAZINGGG.   Cool art, live music, food truck (although they left early, which sucked).  The only real disappointment? The brewery closes at 10- we coulda stayed all night!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Three words: Belgium style brews! Oh my goodness, where have you been hiding from me Adelbert's?! This is by far one of my most favorite craft breweries in all of Austin, if not in the United States. For those of you that really know me, you know that I L.O.V.E. Belgian beers...so much so that, yes, I traveled to Belgium JUST for the beers (okay, I ate some mussels and saw some pretty cool stuff too, but...). For those of you not in the know (no insult meant for those who are), Belgian style beers are pretty high in ABV, so amateurs enter gently. Just looking out for my Yeeps! :D  Adelbert's doesn't look like much at all from the outside. Tucked away in a warehouse district, it can a tad difficult to find, particularly at night - just look for the little white lights and the picnic tables outside. Park, walk through the plastic flat "doors" and you will discover a beautiful huge space with stacks and stacks of barrels, merchandise for sale, lots of local art hanging on the walls to purchase adds to the ambiance; plus games to play such as giant Jenga, foosball, and darts and that's one fine outing.   But the beer! Oh my gosh - the beer. Handcrafted at its best. So amazingly fantastic and such a great deal. On your first visit be certain to buy the 6 half pour (really close to full pours - yay) tastings for $13. You get to keep the glass and get $2 off beers when you bring it back on your next visit. Regular prices range from $4-6 a glass, which is phenominal in the first place for such high quality ale.   ALL great, two personal standouts for me were: *Flyin' Monks Quadrupel: 10.9%ABV, aged in rum barrels with hints of spice, deep, dark, and lovely. *Philosophizer Saison: An easy choice. 7.8% ABV, very mild carbonation with a hint of pepper. Fantastic.     To add some icing to this already oh so sweet find, the founder and brewmaster Scott and staff cannot be any more friendly or knowledgeable about the beers and brewery.   Highly highly highly recommend. Simply doesn't get better than this IMHO. Cheers!  TIPS:  *The brewery has a license so you can take a large bottle home for a reasonable price of about $9 to $12, which is average. They also sell retail at area Austin locations (visit their website for exact locations).  *Tours are available (see website for details).   *They typically have a food truck on site on Saturdays.  *Fido friendly pergola area - not allowed inside.

reviews.author: Sam V.
reviews.description: Ya'll are probably already aware of my latest and greatest obsession with collecting pint glasses from assorted breweries. For our first stop in Austin, we stopped by this unassuming warehouse. As we walked in, the live jazz band was jammin' and the beer taps were flowin'.   Michael and his bearded friend were fantastic bartenders. I really appreciated their hospitality. Michael instantly could tell I was new to this particular brewery and proceeded to explain the process to tasting their beer samples. He even noted that I had a minor with me and offered a brewed hibiscus tea for him. They really cater to all ages! We paid $13 for six half poured samples from a souvenir Belgian tasting glass. One yellow wristband later, my siblings and I were playing ping-pong and giant Jenga in the back of the warehouse.  The stringed lights on the ceiling made it feel welcome and homey. They had a wall of local art for sale ranging from $30-$300! I had my eye on a Sinatra painting, and as luck would have it, it was indeed the $300 piece lol. I stared at it longingly for most of the night, but couldn't bring myself to throw down on it. My favorite craft brews of the night were the Naked Nun and the Philosophizer. Brilliant names and great hoppy flavors.  Once it got too muggy in the taproom, we ventured out to get some grub. The food truck of the night was Emoji Grilled Cheese. (See their yelp site for my review) It was mouthwatering and delicious. We visited a couple other breweries throughout our trip, but Adelbert's was my all-time favorite.   Thanks for a great time!   -xoxoxo

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: Great place to spend an afternoon. This another place where you pay a fee, get a glass and then you get 6 pours of whatever they have on tap. I could only do 4 pours due to a time constraint but what I had was very tasty. The mango wit was a standout for me as I could actually taste the mango unlike some other brews which lose that flavor in the process. Black Rhino was also very tasty. Besides the good beers the place has TVs and games and most importantly art to sell! If I hadn't been flying on that trip there were a couple of pieces I was interested in. Overall a worthy stop in Austin instead of having to drive to Dripping Springs for good beer.

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: For a newer-ish brewery this place is definitely headed in the right direction. Sour beers are freaking delish! I wish that they had more food options when you drink and or a bar that you can walk up to, but all good things come to those who wait!!   My second time around I ordered a cheese tray from a local artist and brought it to eat outside. It was perfect. My husband loves their beers and always asks to go their before our date nights! Keep it up Hedgehog!

reviews.author: Alicia C.
reviews.description: Really nice and chill spot. Great selection of beers.. IPA, stouts, ale's just to name a few. They have plenty more. All so delicious! Ericius is the latest so good. Love this place.

reviews.author: Francisco B.
reviews.description: This brewery is literally everything I miss about the original Austin brewery scene. Also the beer is excellent

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Such an awesome place! It's all outdoors with picnic of tables, umbrellas and a few chairs and tables. Dog friendly- they have dog bowls! Pretty flowers and lots of grass for kids to run in. The beer was delicious. I tried 3 five oz pours, all IPAs they were delicious!! You order the beer online and they call you when it's ready. Quick, easy and safe. Will def be back!  They have different food trucks , check their Facebook to see what's there when you're going.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Great addition to breweries in  CP area. Multiple IPA and Farmhouse Ales. Large open patio with picnic benches and yes umbrellas.   They were also cooking up some awesome looking Pad Thai when we visited. Friendly knowledgeable folks and a great beer selection.   CC payment only via their App.  As an FYI this is where the Thousand Oaks brewery was located.

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: Clean, nice owners, great beer! I've tried a few beers here. My favorite one is Mango Tango! It is very tasty! Mango with some habanero (I believe) it is so good! Come out, you can order on your phone and relax outside in the nice picnic table/table seating area! Come on out and give them a visit! You will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Friendly people, high quality rotating  beers, nice outdoor seating. Like a nice neighbourhood space.

reviews.author: Matt P.
reviews.description: Fantastic IPA, Farmhouse, and Saison beers on tap. The beer is really fantastic and the mood is mellow. This place will be hopping once the word gets out.  Thank you for the fantastic flavors. The beer is really above par. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Audrey B.
reviews.description: A great place to go on a summer evening! I tried it for the first time Saturday and loved it! The draft choices were great, Crush ended up being my favorite! Chill vibes the whole night and just overall a fun atmosphere!

name: The Waypoint ATX Food Truck Park

reviews.author: Jonathan H.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden treasure, apparently!!  Came here with the kiddos and it has everything you'd want.  Kids had yummy chx fingers and grilled cheese and the wifey and I had AMAZING Bison Filet and Brussel Sprouts... all complemented with some hot fries that were sooooo good!!  Oh, and a yummy herbal soda to wash it all down while the kids played on the play set.   I have no idea how this place only has 3 reviews at the time of writing this.  If you are near Lake Travis/Lakeway, this is a must stop!!

reviews.author: Mousumi Q.
reviews.description: We visited the Waypoint food truck park this weekend and really enjoyed ourselves. We had some great beers at infamous beer co and amazing food from R19 Taqueria! Next time we will try yardbirds and the Italian ice place. Can't wait to see what else is in store. So exited to have this down the street from us.

reviews.author: Ross H.
reviews.description: Incredible food, with different options available, and a place for my dog to run around and play. They have a playground if you have kids, and pleanty of trees for shade. Connected to a brewery which is awesome!

reviews.author: Blaire C.
reviews.description: Great family-friendly atmosphere and delicious food options....and right next door to Infamous so you can grab some craft beers and enjoy the live music on weekends!

reviews.author: Ricardo J.
reviews.description: This little watering hole is what I love about Johnson City. Cold beer, good music, pool tables. Here you can find a mix of blue collar native locals and your more affluent transplants. JC has grown so much and its population changed that I can come here and easily not be recognized.   The service here is friendly, yet endearingly salty enough. Salty in that weathered Central Texas way that you can't find anywhere else. Hon, need another beer?  Next door is the Hot Mess Pizza truck. You will see many people here washing down a delicious hot fresh pizza with some cold Lone Star.   I highly recommend this place for the reasonable prices and the unique atmosphere.

reviews.author: Eursula C.
reviews.description: Such a welcoming place. Stopped in for pizza at Hot Mess and went in to grab a beer while waiting. Amazing selection of beers and the bartenders were so friendly that if we lived I. The area I would certainly make this a regular stop. As it is, we will make it a point to stop in when we visit the area. Both places were absolutely great finds.

reviews.author: Sumie M.
reviews.description: So happy that the awesome Hot Mess Pizza truck in the Tapz 32 parking lot did not serve beverages!  Tapz 32 had 23 beers on tap!  Great selection and the friendliest people ever!!  If you love craft beer you must come and hang out with in this family owned business!

reviews.author: Elliott B.
reviews.description: Hell yeah. A great local watering hole with a story, great ownership and service, and a more than fine beer selection. Local flavor at its finest.  Mike and Leslie used to run a construction equipment rental business out of this location. 2008 hit and they closed their doors in 2010. Years later after the family got into home brewing and good beer in general, they started over with a new business model: a local bar with an excellent beer selection - And wine, too. Local brews, too.  The building is awesome. Repurposed buildings like this make for some of the best bars and restaurants. It's gritty and has character. The decorations are cool. They have a smoking and non-smoking side. Cinder blocks and corrugated metal. The bar itself actually has some great wood and is well done. The patio is covered and was perfect for the family, including a play area for kiddos. (Mike and Leslie have a 3-year old grandson who needed a spot!) Nice breeze out back, too.  Good local hangout. Fun talking to Ron, a 20-year local and supporter of the bar. Funny - most of the locals were enjoying Bud and Whatever Light instead of the excellent draft selection. Hope they have enough demand to keep those great beers on draft! They've been open 2 years, so they're off to a great start. Mike and Leslie themselves work the bar, so you know you'll get great service.  Cheers, y'all!

reviews.author: Wanda L.
reviews.description: As a lover of the Texas hill country and frequent visitor of the wineries, breweries and distilleries out her, I cannot believe we just found this gem. A rustic but clean establishment, it is definitely worth a stop in if you find yourself in the area. The staff is super friendly as well, bonus! Check out my pix for nice selection of drinking options.  Harley riders and bikers of all types should be adding this to their riding route.

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: Great selection of beers, warm friendly place. Only draw back is that the smoke gets pretty thick in there sometime. I understand it's a bar and people smoke in bars, but a lot of them have an area for smokers.

reviews.author: Steve S.
reviews.description: This is indeed a gem of a place out in the Hill Country! Many stop by on their tour of the Texas Wine country and never leave! Great place to hang out and relax! An amazing selection of both Beer and Wine! And the owners Mike and Leslee are the greatest!!

reviews.author: Dana C.
reviews.description: The owner from Austin opened up a beer joint in his family's hometown of Johnson City. Only Texas craft beer on draft. The owner is also a woods craftsmen and the bar and outdoor seating showcase his works

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: A bit of a whole in the wall.  Eclectic furniture collection.  Great selection of beer on tap and the have wine.  Only draw back is that they smoke in the place.  The did have the doors opened so that helped.  Will drop in again next time we are going thru town.

reviews.author: Lauren S.
reviews.description: We stopped out here last night and it was the perfect ending to a long day driving through the hill country. Mike was incredibly welcoming and popped open a bottle to share with us. We enjoyed talking to him about beer and baseball. We'll be back!

reviews.author: Katelyn S.
reviews.description: Love this place. If you're a beer drinker the selection offered is incredible. Whether its your regular Bud Light, Lone Star or unique imported craft beers, the list of choices is impressive. The owner Mike is also the bartender, super laid back guy who knows his craft beers and wines (which he has 6 or 7 of on tap alongside 25 local craft brews.) The atmosphere of the bar is cozy, a little rustic with amazing artwork on the walls. By the way most of the art you will see there were done by Mike. If you haven't been to TAPZ you are missing out on a one of a kind place.

reviews.author: Dawn C.
reviews.description: Great place to try different beers. Plus,  a wonderful atmosphere. I'm excited that soon they will be adding wine on tap.

name: SLAB BBQ and Beer
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: LaShelle B.
reviews.description: We had AWESOME service at Slab BBQ at Westgate Lane in Austin, TX. After a day of fun with the family tubing in New Braunfels we headed to Austin to try Slab BBQ which we had seen on YouTube and It didn't disappoint!  The staff was amazing we had the nachos, the donk sandwich and ribs ... it was amazing!!! The nachos great amount of cheese and bbq!!! The donk was so good, meat was falling of my bun and I forgot about my table manners and I was picking it up with my hands!! The ribs are so tender and awesome no bbq sauce was needed! and   The staff was so kind they gave us free banana pudding but we all were so full we could only take a bite. I ate my banana pudding for breakfast the next morning and enjoyed it with my coffee, the banana pudding was light and sweet; simple amazing!!  Sorry we didn't take pictures ... the food looked so good we all just dove in an ate our food! (We forgot about our posts and timelines) The food is awesome best first restaurant visit ever! (Even though it is inside a bowling alley)

reviews.author: Gina F.
reviews.description: I've had a lot of bbq after living in Texas for 8 years and this is right up there with the best of them. We actually tried this at BBQ Austin, among many other popular places.   I can be quite picky about brisket and wow this was in my top two of the 10+ we tried. Perfect amount of spice rub, tender, fatty, delicious. Can't wait to go back and have a full plate.

reviews.author: Jordan N.
reviews.description: The sliders were good - some better than others. The place didn't blow me away though. It bills itself as a BBQ joint, but I see this more of a BBQ-between-buns joint.  I wouldn't go out of my way for this type of barbecue, but for those who likes brisket sandwiches and the likes, this is a good place to go to.

reviews.author: Jo R.
reviews.description: Ordinarily, I love SLAB, but the Door Dash order I just received from them was incredibly disappointing. One of the items I ordered was nachos, and the queso wasn't even completely melted. As I was pouring the queso on top of my nachos, two massive chunks of unmelted cheese (at least I hope that's what they were) came plopping out. Also, the brisket wasn't warm, as if it had been recently pulled from a refrigerator but not heated. So disappointing! Do better, SLAB!

reviews.author: Mark K.
reviews.description: This review is based solely on the food of our last visit. Our first experience with Slab was ordering a smoked turkey for Thanksgiving of 2020, and it was one of the best turkey's we've ever had. Smokey, moist, and lovely. But, since turkey is not a regular meat on their menu I am reviewing strictly on our last meal.   While down in S. ATX, I stopped in to give the restaurant a true try. Upon walking in, the menu was posted on the wall, but confusing. All we saw were sandwiches, no mention of meat by the 1/2 pound or pound and no price. Would be cool to know what options we have with a little signage. Is this a sandwich spot or a BBQ joint? Long/short, they did let us do 1/2 pound orders, so got some brisket, a few sides, and some beers.   Sides were solid. Twice baked potato salad and the smoked mac/cheese were both great. The brisket on the other hand was meh. Maybe i'm spoiled with Texas brisket and its smokey, red tinted smoke ring and crust. So it was a little sad to get something that was not that. The meat, while tender, was almost more like a pot roast. Seems like they take inspiration from many different styles (KC, Carolina, TX, etc) with sauces, so maybe this was the point, and I'm sure slathered with sauce and tossed on a bun it's probably pretty good. But if i'm going tit for tat on sliced brisket, elsewhere will allow you to fly closer to the Texas sun.    Not sure we'll be back if we're wanting true BBQ, but if we're in the mood for a BBQ style sando, we may swing by.

reviews.author: Kat M.
reviews.description: Had the Bougie bowl this time and it was quite a disappointment. The Mac n cheese tasted horrible almost like the smell of plastic. Hubby had their Tuesday special pork belly sandwich and there was hardly any meat and mostly fatty pieces.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: Back again to our favorite BBQ place. This time I gorged myself on brisket nachos with no onions or jalapeños.  Man oh man. The crispy chips. The tender, flavorful melt in your mouth, slap yo daddy and kick your cat good brisket. Tasty sweet BBQ sauce. Classic queso and what makes the whole plate a hit...chopped up pickles. A little burst of crisp vinegar to cut the richness of the cheese is a bite of what I hope clouds would taste like.   We drive from San Antonio to eat here and you should too. Call up your boo and tell them it's time to get weird and head to Austin.   What are you waiting on? Go on. Austin is calling.

reviews.author: Julia C.
reviews.description: Didn't want a sandwich, so ordered some brisket in a small salad. Yum! Fresh ingredients, flavorful brisket, and some jalapeño dressing with a KICK. The sides were delicious too. Will probably order a larger size if the potatoes...delicious!

reviews.author: Bea T.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem. Would have never known if wasn't for DDD as it's in a bowling alley. BBQ scrumptious and the mustard flavored coleslaw was cherry on top.

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Phenomenal! Food was so good. Loved the sauces too. The bar side is cute too. Smart idea to have one side more like a bar and one side a small place to eat inside. Didn't care for the plastic barriers but maybe this is required due to covid. I'm stuffed! We even have leftovers for dinner lol

reviews.author: Gretchen P.
reviews.description: The pork rib sandwich is to die for. That's all I've had here, but I've had it 3 times in the past 6 months, and it is great. Sides are just ok. My biggest complaint is that they do not serve wine, the bar keep told me they used to but it wasn't selling. So, that's a drawback for me. I am not a beer drinker.

reviews.author: Brad W.
reviews.description: Great local BBQ place. I had 2 meat sandwiches, pork and brisket with a small BBQ beans. VERY juicy and flavorful. Beans were great but slight on sweat side.

reviews.author: Cari W.
reviews.description: We loved Slab as a stand-alone restaurant.  We are sad that they closed their South Austin location to move into Westgate Lanes Bowling Alley.

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: We were looking for a BBQ lunch spot and SLAB delivers! The meats are smoked to perfection and because we couldn't decide on what to try we got two of the best sampler options on the menu - the slider trio (chicken, pork, brisket) and the epic DONK sammich (all the meats - chicken, pork, brisket, sausage and all the sauces). We also tried two of their sides because YOLO - Gouda Mac and the twice baked potato casserole. Legit, UNBELIEVABLY good. My favorite out of the slider trio was the chicken - sauces were on point, chicken was tender and juicy. The Mac and cheese was EPIC - it's a wet Mac which I love. Super creamy, smoked Gouda is just divine. Twice baked tots were also good (but my heart belongs to the Mac). If you're here for epic then go with the DONK. Single portion was HUGE but it delivers on flavor! Stacked high with meats it's also smothered in delicious sauces, crunchy onions and jalapeños. Honestly, will come back for that! Beer selection is fantastic. Get you some SLAB!

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: I tried the other location and decided to try this one when I came into town. Long story short, it's really good. The service and the food. I got the slider trio and it was good, everything tasted fresh. My only issue, which is a personal preference is they didn't have enough bbq sauce. Overall I would highly recommend.

reviews.author: Jin L.
reviews.description: It was my first time having SLAB so I wanted to try the trio to get a taste of the most popular sandwiches. Let's just say that it did not disappoint!  The portion sizes are HUGE, which is always a plus for me. The trio comes with the Texas O.G., Notorious P.I.G., and the Chicken W.A. All of the sliders were amazing, but my favorite has to go to the Chicken W.A.! Their dank white sauce is addicting!!!   For COVID-19, they are currently doing curbside takeout and limited dine in and patio service

reviews.author: Brianna E.
reviews.description: This place is pure heaven, every single time. The sink sandwich is AMAZING and huge! I also love the slider trio. Mac and cheese is great, and so is the potato salad. I haven't tried anything other than those items because they are just so good every time. They make their own bbq sauces which are for sale I believe, my favorite is the dank white!

reviews.author: Stan V.
reviews.description: I've been a long time Patron of Slab off of the Burnett Location and this New Location doesn't disappoint.   Sometimes when there's a new location, there's a drop in quality, but not here.   Its actually 2x bigger, nice and bright, just missing the Hip Hop Feel of the original location.   If you like BBQ or BBQ sandwiches, then this is the spot for you.   They gots a variety of meats for your meat eaters, sorry, I'm not a vegetarian so I don't know what they got for folks here.   The Nachos are awesome, prob best to share than eat alone.  If you don't know what you like, give the Trio Sampler a try, its a very nice place to start.   All the other sandwiches are massive (and good), and will prob put me in the hospital if I eats them again, so my goto sandwich is the McDowell, oh man, puts the McRib or any Pork Rib to shame, its executed so well.  Always tender fall off the bone rib mean between your choice of bun, bbq sauce, and pickles, so good.   The Sides are ok, but the Desert is the best, the OG cookie is so drip!   Give this place a try, its great!

reviews.author: Ali R.
reviews.description: Omg so yum! We got brisket nachos, the slider trio and we had to try the potato casserole. Definitely appreciate the queso coming on the side for to go orders. The nachos were big. Between the two of us, we had 1 slider each and about 1/4 of the nachos each. I didn't even have enough room to try the casserole... tomorrow's lunch for sure.   We'll definitely order from SLAB again!

reviews.author: Will C.
reviews.description: Got there early and thankful we did. Fills up even on Memorial Day. Brisket pork and chicken all cooked perfectly. We forgot to add any extra sauce as soon as we started eating

name: Carter Creek Winery Resort and Spa

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: We LOVE staying here! Carter Creek has it all: resort to stay pool, hot tub, workout room brewery winery restaurant outdoor amphitheater with music scheduled Thursday-Sunday  They are super pup friendly, our pup loves it as much as us!   The resort is right off the 290 trail making it the perfect place to stay and or visit in the hill country.

reviews.author: Emily K.
reviews.description: Always an enjoyable stay! Carter Creek is located in Johnson City which is by many amazing wineries. Their amenities are fantastic! Their staff is always friendly and professional. Stop by their tasting room and say hi to Melissa or Marcus for a great tasting experience. Marco at the brewery is sure to steer you in the right direction for beer lovers and a great time at the restaurant. The grounds are lovely and you're sure to come away with many Instagram worthy photo ops!

reviews.author: Kaye C.
reviews.description: Accommodations were very good, the room was super clean and really nice. I loved that they were villas so you're not sharing common space with anyone else during Covid.  The spa not being open was a big bummer. It was partially the reason we chose here so that was disappointing.  The staff was nice, they were super welcoming.  There is no daily cleaning or maid service due to Covid.  Nice location being a short 20 minutes or so to Fredericksburg.  There are numerous wineries between here and there to keep you entertained! I like that they had on site live music (one night instead of the two advertised though) and loved the open area with bandstand, comfy chairs and cornhole games to entertain.  Overall, a solid 4/5 but once spa is open and "normal" post Covid life resumes, I'm sure this will be a 5 star location.  We will come again and will update after we do.

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: We really wanted to love this place, here goes the story... We had reservations for a Saturday arrival, we called and spoke with the most unpleasant human on this planet named (Becca-Becky-Rebecca) you get the idea, not sure on the spelling so lets go with (B) - The interaction went something like this:   (Scott): Hi, we have a confirmation for checking in on Saturday, we noticed the check-in time is 4pm, we have a wedding to attend at 5pm... is there any chance to check-in slightly early maybe 3-3:30 so we have time to get ready, and also make the 30 minute drive to the venue?   (B): What is your definition of early since you stated the check-in time is 4pm which is the actual check-in time.   (Scott): Oh, ok.. well let me get with the wife and figure it out, thanks. Bye.   (B): Phone Click  Now I'm basically just flabbergasted at that point, like whoa... did this really just happen?   Long story short, we called in the following days and decided to cancel the reservation, we spoke with Susan who was amazing, and apologized! She Stated that (B) comes across that way sometimes, and she will bring it up to her. Anyways, it's sad that (B) was the ultimate factor in the loss of revenue for the resort. Being a Titanium Elite Marriot member, I average over 75 nights a year at various hotels, NEVER in my life have I had a similar interaction. Wish we got to try the wine, maybe another time.....

reviews.author: Cynthia V.
reviews.description: We had a great time enjoying the large patio and lush greenspace here at Carter Creek. Grab yourself a glass of wine (or a tasting) and soak in the beautiful views. There is plenty of space here so you can unwind and enjoy the company of your party. I especially enjoyed their sparkling peach wine - I could have easily polished off more if I didn't have to drive! It was very crisp and refreshing. Service was friendly and attentive as well.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: 4 star review, mainly for the beautiful setting they've created. It's pretty ingenious to put up a resort and spa out in Hill country. They're going to make a ton when things get back to "normal." It's connected to the 290 brewery and restaurant where we ate dinner. They provided us complimentary wine tasting. I wouldn't go home to mom on the wines but the food we ordered hit the spot. We sat inside where it was easy to socially distance and enjoy our meals and tastings. Outside was packed and people were definitely not distancing over the holiday weekend. I think the brewery could do a better job at pushing tables further apart to try to account for this. The service was a bit slow but nothing to complain about since we were enjoying the AC room.   some of the disappointments were more towards the resort. They seemed to be a little understaffed since we couldn't even check in at 5 when the booking said check in started at 4. The pool was packed the evening prior which meant no clean towels when we went the morning of our check out. The continental breakfast was cheap and limited to individual prepackaged muffins, cereal, cereal bars and yogurt. I understand covid limits what they could cook, but even hard boiled eggs wouldn't be that difficult.  The staffing was otherwise welcoming and friendly and wearing face masks. Parking is limited to the upper area so you have to walk down to your cabin. Would also recommend a better walk way to the restaurant, but we loved the wild flowers and it was a nice reprieve from the day in the sun.

reviews.author: Susie C.
reviews.description: If you want a best of Johnson City experience, stop here. We had an 11 AM tasting for seven set up and were greeted by Cody. We were able to choose five wines from the extensive list of award winning wines. He graciously poured the wines we chose, with knowledgeable notes and recommendations. The Grenache Rose, dry and tasty. Plateau Red was a delicious blend. Tempranillo true to the varietal. The Brut was a delightful and Dominum Tinto Port so luscious. Cody was Texas friendly and a true ambassador of the wine region.

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: Not at all what I was expecting! We were very disappointed overall. We planned an overnight near Fredericksburg and booked here fully expecting to visit the restaurant which is only open Thursday through Sunday. We were staying on a Tuesday night. We also planned to book spa services but the spa isn't open yet.  After attempting to turn onto the driveway which has no lights near it whatsoever we had to u-turn further up the road and attempt again. Not being from the area, you cannot see the driveway at all so I'd definitely suggest arriving before nightfall.  Upon arriving at reception, the representative had the personality of a turtle. She was not friendly nor rude. She was merely there. It was a "No, the restaurant isn't open. No, the spa opens next year."  It'd been nice to know this prior to booking as we would've booked elsewhere. The price point wasn't cheap through Hotels.com either for nothing being open at $160 + tax.  Our room was beautiful and smelled like new construction. The room itself was a perfect suite and would accommodate three people perfectly with a twin pull-out couch in the living area and a king bed in the bedroom. We really loved the bathroom with double vanity, large shower and separate water closet.  The room included a small refrigerator, coffee pot and bathrobes. Although the bathrobes are not "one size fits all" and tend to run on the smaller side.  Overall we'd stay here again if the price point were the same or close to the same and the resort is more operational.

reviews.author: Lisa O.
reviews.description: Beautiful vacay spot during the pandemic when you don't want to fly. Sure, the wine won't taste like Napa Valley or Santa Ynez, but beggars can't be choosers during a pandemic. However, the owner started his first winery in Temecula in 2003.  We received two vouchers at check in for either a tasting or a single glass of wine.  The overnight resort is GORGEOUS! I wished they delivered meals from the Old 290 Brewery, but I understand it's covid. Each villa has its own separate entrance so there's no risk of catching covid from other guests. These are brand new villas, only one year old, and they're beautifully built! Beautiful upgraded bathrooms and everything is new. There are two tvs in each villa plus a gas fireplace! Four star hotel which allows dogs!  It's located fifteen minutes from Andalucia Distillery, Hill Country Lavender, and the Exotic Resort Zoo.

reviews.author: Tocus T.
reviews.description: Great place to stay! Friendly staff, nice and clean lodging. Great wine, live music, and all the food is just ok. EXCEPT.... the Migas from  the breakfast menu, The Migas are terrible. Hands down the absolute worst Migas I've ever had. There is no eggs at all in the meal, what kind of Migas has no eggs? it's just bad.  Their "Migas" are really more like brisket nachos. They need to either rename the meal to Nachos, or revamp it, or just remove it from the menu. So.... Stay here for a great time but just DO NOT order the Migas for breakfast.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: The family and friends came for lunch to celebrate my mom's bday. It was a great experience large tables with what feels like a mile long covered patio. The table ordered various items apps,salad, pizza, burgers, fries, wine, and beer. Everything was delicious we enjoyed the live music.   Suggestions- it has two entrances.  Moose Out

reviews.author: Suzie E.
reviews.description: We had a Great experience for lunch!! All 6 of us really enjoyed our meals.  They were Delicious, large portions, and Sheldon took wonderful care of us, even though they were short staffed.

reviews.author: Eloy G.
reviews.description: Visited this place for a recent meeting and let me say this is one of the few wineries and maybe only winery with resort style accommodations. From the moment we checked in we were promptly greeted and given our rooms. While visiting we had the opportunity to eat lunch and dinner at this place and the food was really great! Kudos to the chef for the wonderful food and great pairings of wines. This was truly a fantastic visit and stay. While having lunch one day, we got to meet and visit with the owner Jim was who a great and friendly man and made us feel very welcome. He introduced to balsamic vinegar and it was amazing! This is definitely a must buy when visiting. Additionally, he told his story about this winery and it was a great story! Some employees who really stood out were Sheldon, Ethan, Marcus, and Dee! Thank you to the entire Carter creek staff for making our stay and meeting an excellent one. We will definitely be back to enjoy the Carter creek experience! If you are in the area, this is must stop especially on Fridays and Saturdays when they have some live bands. Nothing beats a hill county evening with some wine, food and friends.

reviews.author: Erika S.
reviews.description: This place has potential to be great but it's just not there yet. The spa was not open which was hugely disappointing. There were no microwaves in the rooms which is a very basic amenity for hotel rooms. The grounds were beautifully landscaped and the villas were very clean and nice. The restaurant on the property was not open on Monday and Tuesday. This was also a huge disappointment. You receive two vouchers per room for the wine tasting on property. We had 3 people staying in our room and they would not give us a 3rd voucher even though there was no spa and the restaurant was closed.

reviews.author: Shannon S.
reviews.description: I hope what we experienced was growing pains. We only visited the restaurant on a Sunday night. Had reservations and were seated right away at 645pm.  Our server was great, ordered right away and brought drinks. Meal took over an hour to arrive at the table - salad, flatbread, burger and salmon. When it arrived some dishes were extremely hot while others were like warm. We had to ask for our food several times.   Food was good but higher in price for what we received. Wine and beer were excellent.

reviews.author: Kirsten T.
reviews.description: Wow! What a perfect all in one retreat! Wine tasting, brewery, and AMAZINGLY delicious food that I will be craving when I leave. The cottages are so private, and they have their own charming Texas elegance! The pool area is perfect... and they have some special chairs that are extremely comfortable! I want one! :-) The staff is super kind and friendly. The grounds are lush, floral and picturesque.  Great location and not too far from Fredericksburg. Such a wonderful place to visit I can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Erica R.
reviews.description: The rooms come with a tasting at the winery! Cute rooms and restrooms even. Only downfall is price but that's probably not something that can be controlled and not even a biggie. It could be worth it bc it seems like 6 people could stay in one suite. Unsure if that many people are allowed. Dog friendly too!!! They have a whole field with a band.  The aesthetic of the place is very cute! Great drive to Fredericksburg and other wineries.

reviews.author: Deidre C.
reviews.description: Beautiful venue inside, but marginal on all other counts.   For our tasting other than knowing name of the wine, server knew nothing Ordered food, paid 20% gratuity and never deliver our food  Many better places to go

reviews.author: Mike W.
reviews.description: Had a great time at the resort! Which the COVID was causing so many problems. Due to COVID the resort was very limited in staff. Did the best they could under the circumstances.  The area is very nice and clean. Wine, beer and food were all very good.  Will stay again!

reviews.author: Ashley M.
reviews.description: My new favorite everything: Hill Country resort, winery and tasting room, private villas, spa, brewery and restaurant, live music, and the team here are simply amazing! I'm excited to return!

reviews.author: Danielle G.
reviews.description: Dog friendly  Good brews  Delicious paninis, I recommend the turkey one.  Great service

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: We waited until Slackers released their own brews to visit. It's great to have another brewpub open in the CP area. Slackers is located hard off 620 in the same strip mall as Interstellar BBQ.Hmmmm BBQ and beer, OK.  Slackers currently have 3 Slacker brews available and a slew of local and not so local taps. Their Belgium lager is a perfect beer to sip on a sunny day.  Round 2 was a Brooklyn amber lager. This brought back memories of our NYC trip and discovering the Brooklyn Brewery. This is a great representation of what an amber beer should be.   There are alternatives to beer such as wine. Got the munchies they have you covered. Check out their menu online.  The brewpub is very welcoming with a bar area and plenty of seating. Games are available and even a foosball table. Outside there are a few picnic benches where you can enjoy the sunshine and bring your mutt. Folks on both sides of the bar are friendly and if you are there for more than 10 minutes you are engaged in a conversation with a fellow pubster (sic)  One nit servers should be able to answer questions regarding their guest taps.   A solid 4 plus stars and Slackers is now in our brewpub rotation. Support Local!

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: Live use music. Yay.   Brand new. Can't wait to try the brews.  Great neighbors friendly    Great place.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Went there last night, the place is awesome! Currently they don't have their own beer, supply issues but they have some amazing Austin, Texas and other craft beers. Family friendly spot (a kids play area with kitchen and all!!),good music playlist and eventually some live music. They just have snacks right now but eventually said they'll have a menu. Oh yah and coffee too. We got to meet Derek and his wife, the owners. This is such a great spot to go and work or to relax at after work! Will definitely be back and can't wait to watch this business grow.  We were having so much fun I forgot to take pictures! I'll update with pictures next time I go.

reviews.author: AL S.
reviews.description: Loved the beers! Had a great time there! Friendly owner and great service! New brewery with good number of ale options! Eager to try their new brews. I'll definitely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Alexis C.
reviews.description: Came here today and loved the vibe.  Chill atmosphere and they had live music on Saturday night. Also a great variety of beer! There's a little kids section for parents who want a drink and a place for the kids to play too. Overall a nice little brewery tucked in 620. Will be coming here more!!

reviews.author: Katherine M.
reviews.description: We brought a large group here the day after a wedding. It is often challenging to plan an activity for dozens of people, or to find the space. We decided we didn't need to bother reserving space as many people would come and go during the day. Ultimately most people stayed as the beer, coffee, and food were great. We were also able to secure about four continuous tables which was great to host our family and friends.   I plan to come back as I've heard their beers are gluten reduced as well.

reviews.author: Deya Z.
reviews.description: I've been here twice and each time was a different experience. If I were rating solely on my most recent visit on a late Sunday around 8:30, it would be 2 stars. The beertender literally saw me walk in off 6th before a tech bro on the side closest to him, saw me, then proceeded to serve the other guy...the line was so short with only 2 people (one of which was me. So I walked over to the other area and he walked away. Luckily another server saw me and helped. Not sure if he was judging me bc I was wearing a mask (I'm traveling hence being in Austin)...but check your self brah. If this review was based on him alone, I'd say f--- this place.   BUT I'm basing this review on my beer experience and that is a solid 3-4 star. I had the winter warmer during my first visit and it was tastier than others I've had. More recently I had the lightning wolf IPA which was a bit more watered down than i was expecting. Still flavorful, less hazy than I thought it would be, and very subtle.

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: I wish they had more beer options but we got the Pilsner and one of their Belgian beers. Both tasty.  The atmosphere is great for hanging, day drinking, or even work related meetings. They have a huge patio space and the inside is also nice to hang.  Overall where they excel at, is their tacos! I got the carnitas and asada thinking $4 for a taco was too much... but then I got them and they are bigger than expected. My bf got the two chicken tacos and we ate them soooo slow just because they had so much flavor and the meat was so tender. I'd go just for the tacos every time. Hats off to the cook!

reviews.author: Linsie W.
reviews.description: Yum! What a fun place and good vibes for a big group. And the tacos were good! I wouldn't say it was the best or most authentic street tacos but it hit the spot just fine. It's a dog friendly place but if you're wanting to sit inside, let's aren't allowed because it's against health code. They have plenty of seating outdoors and you can also reserve a room for reservations if you have a big party. Beer was good and they also have a 20% off promo for wine if you order a whole bottle on Tuesdays!

reviews.author: Shaji K.
reviews.description: Thursday late afternoon - stopped by here to check out yet another brewery on the street. Mostly packed with people working on laptops, but the open air setup doesn't make it feel too crowded.  Was able to quickly get a seat at the bar and order from the scannable menus. Decided on the Prodigal Pills ($6) to go along with a Breakfast Taco ($3.50). Pilsener is light and crushable, though not much flavor. Breakfast taco comes out fast - packed with eggs, cheese, pico de gallo, and bacon. Thankfully not a stale tortilla and even balance of ingredients. Finished the day off with the Double Predestination IPA ($7)- definitely more of a kick, possible some overkill on the hops.   Service is a bit hectic as the bartenders work off the many tables. Fine spot to relax, especially outside where there are tables available.

reviews.author: Valerie S.
reviews.description: Brought my sister here because she was visiting and wanted to try some breweries. I'd also never been so it was a good chance to try something new. Lazarus just became my favorite brewery in Austin. Excellent vibe, great beer and plenty of space to sit and chill and chat.

reviews.author: Randy B.
reviews.description: Combine great beer (Amandus), patio (live music sometimes and huge), food and location...tough to beat. Thus I come here very very often

reviews.author: Al K.
reviews.description: First brewery stop in Austin and it did not disappoint. Great options and loved the atmosphere.  Service was great and staff were nice.  Again, the seating options and drink choices were a huge bonus. Coffee beverages looked delicious. Friend got an espresso and recommended it.  Locale is fantastic as well. Very accessible.  Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: Good spot to chill with friends. I came here last weekend with my husband to meet up with some out-of-state friends who were visiting. Their guacamole and tacos were good and so was their beer selection. I honestly don't remember which one we got, but just had whatever the servers recommended and they were all good.  The outdoor seating area was nice at night with the hanging lights and is dog friendly (always a bonus for us!).   Street parking is close to impossible to find in the area, but there's paid garage parking. It is pricey, but the only spot we were able to find that wasn't too far from Lazarus.

reviews.author: Matthew H.
reviews.description: So fancy! We showed up just in time for the great weather. The beer and the food are both equally good! Great patio vibes and plenty of parking for easy in and easy out.

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: If I were a local, this would be my hangout spot. The beers were superb. I got a Disco Prophet, a strawberry lemonade sour, and a Big Sky IPA - delicious and refreshing.  But the real star was the appetizers. We got chips and fresh guacamole, which paired excellently with the beer. But the real winner was the fried chickpeas, which were like seasoned corn nuts! I've never had anything like that, and it's enough for 3-4 people to share, despite only being $3.  The place was clean, staff was friendly, and there was plenty of seating. Definitely a must-see brewery if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: Good quality beer with a variety of awesome food. This European style brewery always seems to have something going on.   Showed up on a Thursday evening for dinner and was impressed with the amount of people who were here. There is picnic table seating out back with tents in the front for additional seating. There is also plenty of seating inside. There is plenty of seating but the like to order may take some time to get through, so plan accordingly.   I went with the torta as my meal. The bread was authentic and the fillings inside were great. If I had to change one thing I would have asked to get the torta with chorizo although it isn't listed as a protein for the sandwich.   This is a great local spot to check out and a place I will most likely be a regular at.

reviews.author: Tandis H.
reviews.description: This place has plenty of outdoor seating with fans that keep the flies at bay mostly. The inside was nice and they have everything you'd need to hit the spot. Tacos and beer.   The beer was pretty good. The only sour beer they had at the time was a Rosé flavored one that unfortunately tasted a little too much like wine, but was still digestible. My hazy IPA was not hazy at all, but was still fine. I wish the beers were served a bit colder.   The fried chickpeas were a good deal for $3 we thought they could serve like 10 people. The 2 of us only made a dent in like 1/5 of the bowl. But hey, they're snacky so maybe someone could down the whole thing if they really wanted to!  The carnitas taco was really good. I highly recommend it. The al pastor was alright but didn't pack the flavor punch of the carnitas. I doused my tacos in the free salsa that was in a mini fridge nearby. The red salsa was so good and added a layer of light smokiness to my tacos. But then after a while I thought I sensed some heat? I assumed it was the green salsa so I continued to douse my tacos in the red. Idk it must have been the red salsa that was hot, because by the end of my meal I was feeling sick to my stomach. Never felt that way from spice but needless to say the beer didn't taste too good after that either. Luckily I recuperated by sipping 2 glasses of their Yeti water until I didn't want to vomit anymore.   I can't place my distaste after this meal on the restaurant since it was mostly my own doing . I assume they label their salsas and I just didn't see it.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Super cute spot to hang out with friends! They have a ton of outdoor seating and can accommodate large parties. We had about 20 people in our group and we were able to pull up tables and chairs for everyone.   The place is really well decorated so we were able to snap a few cute pictures!

reviews.author: Bo B.
reviews.description: This is a great spot for drinks and they also have non alcoholic drinks at night too like chai and matcha lattes. There's also plenty of seating.

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were in Austin for a long weekend and this could be the best tap room I have been to in a long time. Tons of outdoor seating and great free water. I got the 40 Days and 40 Nights and the Lil' Sebastion Bach Maibock and the Walking on Water.   I ordered 3 beers and they were spectacular and the service was splendid. I ordered an al pastor taco and the carne asada tacos. They were super flavorful and perfect, especially for a tap room.  I got a couple of stickers and the atmosphere was just fantastic. You should definitely try this place!

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: A new favorite find! New Year's Eve could not be better remembered. Love the ambiance, including the music playlist. The patio is simply perfect. The beer variety has something for everyone and the tacos are a handy nibble option.

reviews.author: Karley M.
reviews.description: This brewery was walking distance from our air bnb when visiting Austin. It quickly became our favorite spot and we went back a couple times. Beer was delicious and staff was extremely friendly. They also offer other things besides beer. There's a lot of space here too. All around gem!

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: Hands down the best brewery experience we encountered in Austin. It's a little bit if everything and that's not at all a bad thing as without exception they are all done well. We saw they were open early so we went in on a weekday thinking we could knock this off our list of a full day planned. We weren't real clear on their hours entailed so there was a not so unwelcome idea of a little day / morning drinking to get the day started. We realized this was going to leave us with the opportunity to have a few small samples or perhaps one nice pour. Upon our arrival we were impressed at how the location spanned the corner of the street and had many "compartments" of seating areas. I'm no way were Amy of them on the smaller side. Street parking was easy enough and we headed on in.   Very impressed to be greeted with smiling faces along with plenty of good morning exchanges.
