We were very pleasantly surprised to see they offered an array of espresso drinks. What a welcome pivot to our plan. We ordered up and came to realize they had food as well. Pretty happy about that. There were the assorted pastry items and breakfast TACOS! I noticed there was also queso fondido on the menu and that was screaming please try me. I went to order and was told this item is generally served later in the day. I suspect my sadness to hear this news showed as there was a quick offer to fire up the required kitchen equipment to make this happen (the salamander for those curious).   The lattes were delicious. So much so we ordered up a second round. Near completion of those the awesome cheesy chorizo goodness arrived. Bubbly hot and looking superb. It was all I could do to keep myself from grabbing a chip and putting a scoop of this bubbling sub nuclear cheese in my mouth at the price of completely burning my entire mouth. With a little patience I snuck a few small bites being mindful to blow as to not scorch my mouth. OMG was this delicious in every aspect.   Right away we knew this was just fine with a latte but was screaming for a beer to accompany this perfect breakfast fast. Such an awesome selection of beers. The bartender was beyond sweet and gave us many short pull samples of the tappers. I landed on the one that worked for me. My wife found one that worked well for her. By the time the beers arrived it was clear this was not going to be a short stop. Instead it was clear this was our impromptu plan for the morning. Completely five star experience from the word go. So much so we took the liberty of an evening stop later that week. The vibe of this place was so cool with any hint of pretentiousness. I'm no expert on all the brew options in Austin but this was clearly number one for us based on all it included and the absolute outstanding hospitality from the coffee bar to the bartender to the cook who brought us the miraculously amazing queso. No matter you plans I would highly suggest  in fact nearly insist this is a stop not to be missed. This reviews has been locked in draft land fir a while but there is no doubt this place is still thriving and for all the right reasons.

reviews.author: Gennesis V.
reviews.description: the WORST customer service that I've in my life!!!!!! How is possible that I staff said ' shut your and finish your beer? I know it's was last called for getting last service, but please if you don't wanna have more clients PLEASE dont sell more drinks, really bad experience in this place.

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: This place is awesome and maybe a little too family friendly.   So 5 soul owns all the property that the brewery is also on. When we went there, they had 2 food trucks. One did pizza and salads and the other hamburgers and other food.   Inside of 5 souls is wicked cool.  We tried many of the red wine and they were alright.    The staff is super friendly and patient.  They also have non alcoholic  daiquiri  for the kids. Just a few flavors, but the kids enjoyed them. Of course they did they are just like smaller but more expensive Slushies.   The wine itself is pretty good and a tad on the pricey side IMO. $12/glass or $36 per bottle. But the atmosphere is so darn cool. It's probably one our favorite places to go to right now. Unfortunately or maybe fortunately they are an hour away.

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: Not 5 Souls, but 5 Soul.  This isn't really a winery, the grapes come from far, far away, from the land of California. This wine bar seems to be the alternative to the brewery across the lawn. This is part of a larger complex of pickle ball courts, disc golf course, brewery, and artificially turfed biergarten. This is a very family friendly place. Like one other yelper said, maybe too family friendly. "Mommy! That's your fourth drink already!" Don't mind screaming babies? Love having kids come and interrupt your drinking to ask questions? This is the place. Children are largely unattended here- you're drinking in a big play area. In fact, you can rent the wine bar for your tyke's birthday party! There's plenty of things for them to do. Whoever thinks it's appropriate to bring their children to a brewery and get upset when you curse ?  They serve up charcuterie plates that are prepackaged. They're in the fridge. The wine comes in pretty bottles. Based on the price points, it's encouraged to just get a bottle instead of going glass by glass. My favorite thing about this place is that they have (G-Rated) games to play, so everyone can play!  Parking was a bit of a challenge, but the place is clean, well lit and easily accesible.

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: 5 Soul is easily one of the coolest wine bars and tasting rooms I have ever been to. Co-located at the same address on Bob Wire Road as Frontyard Brewing, this facility is an impressive one. Their tasting room had lots of space - both indoors and out.   The indoor space was open and airy with tons of natural light from floor to ceiling windows and a modern interior. The service here is also a highlight as we noticed that everyone = the servers, bar managers and the owners were ALL making sure that everyone's experience was top notch. We found them to all be very friendly and personable - like those cool neighbors that you REALLY want to hang out with. One thing I liked is that this tasting room also had great energy to it - something that is missing from a LOT of tasting rooms and even some breweries.   Outside, the covered patio is large with plenty of seating for friends, families. The yard is extensive - an amazing space to bring your kiddos and just let them play and have fun.  This really is the kind of place that you wish was only 5 minutes (and not 45) from your house - so check them out.

name: Flat Creek Estate Winery and Vineyard

reviews.author: Katelyn G.
reviews.description: I chose this winery for my husband and I, because I found the "Grape Escape," and it was seemingly a perfect choice. A full tasting + a glass of your favorite from the tasting + a pizza to share. (And I sprung for the custom-label bottle to go with it!) It was $40 a person -- closer to $45 each at checkout with fees and what not -- which I already thought was ridiculously well-price for what you get. But then, they blew us away with the location, service, quality, and overall experience. The tasting wasn't just a cookie-cutter preset selection. Our "experience guide" asked us what flavors we preferred and talked us through multiple options for our tastes. It was awesome! Now, I'm not a wine aficionado by any means, but our guide was clearly knowledgeable and passionate about his work. And I enjoyed all of the options he brought to the tasting for us. (My experience was that all of the wines were quite unique in flavor, and the tasting consisted of lots of new wine-types I'd never even heard of!) Then, icing on the cake: getting to pick a favorite to have a full glass of! *chef kiss*  The pizza ended up coming with a starter salad as well, which was a nice surprise. The food was delicious. Well made, not over-the-top, but rather just enough to satisfy our bellies and our palettes.   After finishing up with the Grape Escape, my husband and I went for a walk around the property on a trail that leads you around the vines and gives some awesome views. This was arguably my favorite part. The property is huge and gorgeous! But, it was a gloomy and COLD February day when we visited, so we will definitely be back to see the property in bloom and in warmer weather.

reviews.author: Jeff N.
reviews.description: Our party of 4 visiting from the Chicago area. We booked a 3 course meal and wine tasting.  Our server Katie was well versed and very personable. The founder of the winery, Madelyn, visited our table and we chatted for quite a while. Great plans for the future! Our meal was incredible. One person in our party said it was the best meal  she has ever had. That is quite a statement! We asked to see the chef.  Executive Chef Shawn graciously accepted our kudos and applause. We walked the property and will always remember the great experience and fabulous property views. Well done!

reviews.author: Susan E.
reviews.description: My daughter gave me the gift of her time, along with a 3-course meal and wine tasting, to honor a special occasion. We decided to make this a weekday outing, to minimize traffic and the possibility of large groups being at the winery.  We were promptly greeted and seated upon arrival. The dining room was largely empty, and we had superb service. This was our second visit to the winery, and we plan to return.   We tasted 7 wines in all, 3 of which were paired with the November menu of panzanella (a bread salad), fennel-crusted pork tenderloin, and cannoli. The wine pairings were excellent.   We were not big fans of the panzanella. It seemed to need additional ingredients to make it more interesting and less dry. The main course, however, was fabulous. The pork medallions were crusty and flavorful. The linguine accompaniment was wonderfully garlicky, making it almost possible to ignore that the pasta was overcooked. And the cannoli was excellent. I think of cannoli as a finger food; these mini cannoli were made pretty with their presentation but more messy to eat because of the chocolate sauce. The cannoli were served with a very good port wine.   All in all, we had a very nice meal and enjoyed the wines... which we drank. No spitting for us! We are not connoisseurs, but certainly enjoy good quality wine. Some of Flat Creek's are very good indeed.   This was not a cheap excursion, but the 2 hours we spent there were worth it. This would be a great place for a romantic date, and also worked well as a mother-daughter excursion. Flat Creek has other dining options that include pizza, and there's a disc golf course on the premises. Do make advance reservations for your visit, as this isn't a large establishment and can be a long (but pretty) drive from the Austin area.

reviews.author: Jennifer C.
reviews.description: I wish I could give 3.5 stars! Overall, I had a nice time here. We did "the grape experience" for 2 people which included wine flights for both of us and a pizza each. Payed $80 not including tax + tip left on site. When we purchased online, the description said one pizza per 2 people and 2 salads but when we arrived we were given a pizza each so we had lots of leftovers :) Pizza was just okay, nothing special. Salad was really good! It was probably my favorite part of the meal. I didn't love the wines I tried, but I do tend to go for sweeter wines and these were all pretty tart. Overall, I had a nice time and the staff were all very nice.

reviews.author: Barb S.
reviews.description: A hidden gem! We enjoyed a pizza and salad and a couple glasses of their Syrah in their outdoor covered area that looks out over their beautiful property, exceptional! We did some wine tasting and bought a bottle to go, everyone was so friendly and we absolutely loved the entire experience. Highly recommend visiting this wonderful winery and experiencing their excellent food, wine and service.

reviews.author: Norma W.
reviews.description: We would give them 10 stars if allowed. Relaxing setting, good food, super friendly owner and staff. If we lived closer we would visit often. Thanks for a wonderful afternoon.

reviews.author: Bony W.
reviews.description: Came here on the spur of the moment with my family without a reservation. We were a big group of 12 people total. The management and owners were so kind and respectful. They tried to accommodate us as best as they could and we all had a great time. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Carlos V.
reviews.description: I can't say enough about this place. We've visited this vineyard a few times but our latest visit was memorable. We met the new owner Neal and John the restaurant manager and they were genuinely amazing people. They initiated conversation, asked us if everything was going well and the owner took the time to come by our table to ensure we we were having a great time and thanked us for our visit. They understand that we could've chosen to spend our afternoon elsewhere so they were genuinely appreciated for our business. The food was amazing, the servers were attentive and courteous. Then later we met Clare, a young lady that came around and asked us what else they could do to make our visit even better. She brought some wines for us to try. Incredibly amazing experience. They're a family place where you can bring your kids, your pets without feeling that you're bothering anyone. They have plenty of seating areas and amazing views. Their wines are super good and the owner explained to us that they're going to start a renovation and having a new winemaker so I can't wait to see all the great things they will accomplish to make the experience even better! Wow hard to say because they're already exceeding my expectations!

reviews.author: Jennifer G.
reviews.description: Wow I'm blown away by the 3-course meal we had today.  Every dish was seasoned and cooked perfectly!  This chef needs to be recognized for such wonderfully prepared dishes.  The customer service was great and every pairing was on point.  Balancing flavors in the food, pairing the dishes and wines, and giving 2 hours for our experience was meticulously thought out.  If Spanish wines are your preference, then you should come to this winery.  Neil is the new owner and came to chat with us.  He has great plans for this place and I cannot wait to return for wine updates.  This place absolutely deserves 5 stars.

reviews.author: Ileana P.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Totally worth it to do the tasting, food was amazing and the employees provided above and beyond expectation. All were so knowledgeable, gave great suggestions for the pairing with dinner. Can't wait to come back

reviews.author: Chloe B.
reviews.description: This winery was so amazing!! The service was absolutely incredible, we met so many awesome people here. John, even though it was his first day, did such an amazing job talking to us and making this a memorable experience. All of the staff is is so welcoming and hospitable. Neil was wonderful and so was Claire, such amazing people to talk to. the food was wonderful and so was the wine, I recommend this winery looking to anyone looking for a fun weekend activity!!!

reviews.author: Nancy C.
reviews.description: We always take our visitors here. Beautiful and the wine and food is very good. We also frequented the outdoor bistro during the height of the endemic as it is spacious and just a lovely and peaceful setting. They also have vegan cheese for their pizzas :)

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: Yes please choose the appropriate experience for your family, because apparently my family did not ‍ we ate outdoors at the pavilion, there was no wine tasting involved....My advice  this place is not family friendly, possibly they aren't even friendly.......really we did not know that disc golf was available for children under 12, this might have been something that was mentioned to us when we asked what do you have that it family friendly. In addition your apology seems very condescending and not genuine at all.  How do you know that what we were envisioning? We just wanted to have a nice time with our grands, and we were talked down to, and you're still talking down to us....

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: If you're visiting Marble Falls add this to your MUST DO list!  My girlfriend and I made our first trip to Marble falls this past weekend and are very happy to say we started the weekend off here at Flat Creek Estate.   We enjoyed the "Chef's 3 course experience" which was one of the best dining experiences we've ever had! 6 glasses of wine and a 3 course meal that took us on a  flavorful journey. At one point we felt like Remy in that scene from Ratatouille, the one where he pairs the strawberry with some cheese and feels fireworks... yes, it was really that good!  Carmen was a priceless part of the already amazing experience, she was so friendly, enthusiastic and helpful! Ask for her to be your server if you can!  We can't wait to come back to marble falls and visit here again, looking forward to next seasons wines and Chef's 3-course! Thank you guys!

reviews.author: Dave H.
reviews.description: A hidden gem in the hill country with beautiful grounds, friendly staff and an amazing array of wines and dishes. We tried the 3 course chef's dinner. We started with wine tasting followed by a spectacular wine pairing with each course. We hadn't really considered Texas wine as equivalent to Calif wines but we were wrong. All of the wines we sampled were great and because of that we ended up heading home with 14 bottles! The owner even stopped by to ask us about our experience which we gladly shared. Definitely worth experiencing this adventure.

reviews.author: Jayla M.
reviews.description: Had an amazing experience with friends. The food was good as well. We signed up for the 6 wine taste testing and it came with pizza and side salad. I really liked how Our host gave each different wines that fit us, therefore we weren't all forced to test the same stuff. We also got the opportunity to step outside and watch the sunset. Would definitely go back.

reviews.author: Dee Y.
reviews.description: It hurts me to write this review. We truly want every small business to thrive. My family and I went to the Vineyard on a Friday afternoon for an intimate celebration of my husband's birthday with our mom, dad and children, it ended in my 5-year old little one being verbally attacked by a man in the pavilion, who identified himself as 'the owner'.   We decided to try the disc golf course, and we loved our experience with Casey, he is a gem! Very knowledgeable about disc golf, and very accommodating. We let him and Madelyn (the owner's wife) know we were celebrating a birthday. The course was fun, but ridden with fire ants, red ants, sticker burs and bull nettle. It was not the polished experience we were expecting. But still fun for our family.   We finished disc golf, and returned to the pavilion around 6:00pm.  We ordered a large dinner, but since we were not offered to sit in the main seating area, we sat under the outdoor pavilion. We were in the pavilion for less than 5 minutes, and the adults arranged tables so our family could sit together (there is no waiter in the pavilion so we had to move tables on our own). During those few minutes my two small children were playing under the pavilion, not causing any harm or damage, just laughing and trotting around like kids do outside (he is 5 and she is 7).   Out of no where a man started verbally attacking my 5-year old. This man who looked to be in his 70s, was sitting at a table drinking bottles of wine with 2 other people. He continued to yell at the top of his lungs scaring me and my babies. They came running to me asking me why the man was yelling and whistling at them. It broke my heart. A complete stranger was attacking them for no apparent reason.   After protecting them, my dad and husband approached the man who was yelling the obscenities. This is when he identified himself as 'the owner'. He told us our children were 'out of control' and we needed to get them under control. I asked them what they were doing to display out of control behavior, and he didn't say a thing, besides he had guests with him and they were disrupting his evening. My father let the man know if we were going to be patrons of his business, we would not tolerate his verbal abuse of our 5 and 7 year old children. My father also told him, "We don't yell at our kids like that and if he had a problem with the way our children were behaving he could have stood up and walked over while we were arranging our own tables and told us in a normal tone of voice the problem he saw."  After the incident, the man sat at his table continuing to drink wine for 45 minutes, and sadly never came back to our table to apologize to our children for scaring them because of his obscene behavior. As we left, both of my children continued to asked why he was so angry.   We now understand this pavilion is in 'the owners' front yard. On this evening Rick (the owner) had been drinking with friends and our family was interrupting their evening. His behavior not only made us feel the most unwelcome as paying customers, but was abusive and completely out of control, especially as 'the owner'.  We should have been able to have this conversation with the business owner. Unfortunately, he left the pavilion to go back to his house, and did not return or offer an apology.  ***Update in Response to Owners Apology Below***  Your apology ends with 'resolve any confusion or fears the children had regarding why they were reprimanded'. The main point of why this experience was so horrifying: No one should ever reprimand a 5-year old child, except that child's guardians. If there was an issue with a child's safety, that concern should have been directed to the guardians who were standing between the children and the owner. Never should a stranger, much less a 70-year old man who is consuming alcohol ever 'reprimand' a child, ever! Of course of case the outcome was severe harm to the child, in this case, our 5-year old was not in severe danger.  Regarding the excuse that you 'witnessed dangerous behavior, and you had to immediately intervene': If there are components of your business that are dangerous to patrons, you should immediately remove these hazards, so that they don't become a safety issue. If you feel your deck boxes are not safe, you should store them in a storage facility where patrons do not have access.   Regarding your comment that 'you wish to leave discipling to parents but are forced to intervene when there is a safety concern': We were a party of 4 adults, and we were less than 10 feet away from our children. While we were bussing our own tables and arranging furniture, we were not aware my 5- year old sat on the 'deck box' and got down by jumping off. This type of 'danger' (i.e. sitting on a sitting area, and jumping off something that is no more than 2 feet off the ground) should not elicit the response of 'discipline' by a stranger, or 'immediate' intervention.

reviews.author: Danielle R.
reviews.description: My friend and I went to celebrate my birthday. The service (Casey) was fantastic, but I wasn't crazy about most of the wines we tried. The food was okay. Service I'd rate 5 stars, but food and wine 2-3 stars.

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Covid/"reopening" June review.   Signage not great, and cell reception can be spotty, so be sure to download the map to your cell phone in advance.   Beautiful location and building. Plenty of parking.   Inside tables by reservation only. Nicely separated, no issues being close to other guests. Not the same for reception or table service.  Server was pleasant, but had zero concept of social distancing, no mask and was right in our faces each time we had an interaction.   Menu/tasting a little confusing. Basically you prepay $40 each and get whatever you want from the menu, including wine to drink there or to go. Most wines were available for tasting pours, but not all. Some wines good, some not so much. Liked the primitivo the most of the many we tried.   Very nice for the setting and service. Great set up for limited capacity, but they really need to work on wait staff protection.

reviews.author: Amber H.
reviews.description: We went for a wine tasting during a girls weekend but decided to just sit and have dinner instead. The baked Brie was great, but the "roasted" Brussel sprouts were truly just steamed and served on a sizzling cast iron skillet -- definitely NOT roasted. It honestly was a let down as "roasted" truly didn't mean roasted. The wine was great, service was great.... But food was just mediocre for the price.

reviews.author: William R.
reviews.description: I've driven by this place a few times and have always wanted to check it out. A few friends came by to visit me this week, so I had the perfect excuse to finally go in. I am glad we did, they had a ton of great beer, friendly staff and a chill environment. Can't wait to stop by again.

reviews.author: John R.
reviews.description: I like this place. Local hang. Discounted growler fills on Wednesdays. Knowledgeable bartenders. Texas brews primarily and a great variety of styles. I like it that I can buy stouts and barley wines in summer.

reviews.author: Ruben C.
reviews.description: Great new addition to the greater Buda/Kyle metroplex area and just what beer geeks like me here needed. No more running up too ATX, San Marcos, or SA to try great, local, craft beer.  By local, they really mean it. They are trying to get brews that are local to the Buda area. And while they may carry a tap or two from breweries in Austin/SA, they really want to spotlight breweries that are not Austin or SA based, really defining "drink local."   We went during their soft opening and they had a steady, if not busy stream of customers, which all managed to get served timely and had their questions answered (some customers were new to the craft beer scene).  Really look forward to coming back here and setting their additions (outdoor seating).  No food as of yet but you can bring your own or call it in (pro tip: there's a Papa John's next door and a Thai restaurant a block away)  Looking forward to many more pints at this new hang out spot in the 78610.

reviews.author: Peggy E.
reviews.description: This is the PERFECT place to drop off your husband while you shop at HEB, Wal-Mart, or the other businesses around Growler Express. Wide selection + knowledgeable staff + a clean place = good on ya, GE!   P.S.  Ladies night is on Wednesdays!

reviews.author: Jim P.
reviews.description: What an "Over the Top" Bar. No frills or nonsense...just a Dynamic place to thoroughly enjoy Craft Brew. The owner, Roberto knows what he's doing. He possesses extensive knowledge of Craft Beer and readily engages in genuine conversation/discussion of the brews he offers...all of which are Outstanding! Natasha is behind the bar dispensing the fine selection with perfection. Genuinely friendly, I felt this would be one of my places the minute I walked in! If you want to savor what's available in Fine Craft Brew on tap...you must stop by...AWESOME! Jim Palladino, CWO3 US Navy Retired

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: Best bar in Buda. Amazing draft beer selection and constant rotation. If you love craft beer and actually getting to have a variety look no further than Growler Express. The brothers that own the place are super chill and love to talk beer. My wife and I go here all the time. 24 taps. It's beer heaven!!!

reviews.author: Oscar P.
reviews.description: Over all Growler Express is a nice spot to go have a drink casually not often to packed so getting attention from bartenders isn't hard and if it is packed they do a good job to get to you quickly. The selection of beers is pretty big and is always changing if you like options! But the reason for this review is to shout GENESIS out she has the be the best bartender there hands down!!!

reviews.author: Tiffany A.
reviews.description: My husband and I love this place. They have lots of beer. Constantly rotating taps so there's always a new option to try. They usually have weekly events with tastings, live music, and a food truck. It's a great spot if you just need a beer to wrap up your day or if you're looking for a good place to start your night.

reviews.author: Robert A.
reviews.description: Best place in the area to try a wide variety of different beers. Beer taps are constantly changing and every time you go there's something new. I definitely recommend anyone in the Austin area that loves beer to come by here!

reviews.author: Jonny M.
reviews.description: Great clean bar, great atmosphere, good vibes. Staff was friendly and had a wealth of knowledge on all the local beers that are on tap! They are definitely the experts on all of them, a must visit!

reviews.author: Michael C.
reviews.description: Cool little place with a very good selection of local and TX beers and friendly staff.  A little pricey, a flight of 4 beers was $12.99 so I am not sure why I paid 2x for the equivalent of a pint but I'll be back...for a pint.

reviews.author: Gilles P.
reviews.description: Great addition to downtown BuDa!  Good spot  to grab a local beer and just relax!   Plenty of parking too.

reviews.author: Dusty L.
reviews.description: Always so accommodating and friendly! An awesome, chill place to enjoy some of the best beers in the country.

reviews.author: Mike P.
reviews.description: Definitely cool to have a taproom in the Kyle/Buda area. Fresh, local beers, and specialty brews are great by the glass. Here's the problem: "growler" is in your name. Your taps aren't arranged to actually fill growlers. No shelf, too high, and too close together. I've had five growlers "filled" at your place, and not one was actually to the top. Need to keep the O2 out or my beer goes flat. And the price you're charging, I should have at least 63oz in a 64oz growler. Yeah, price is a bit steep for amateur hour.

reviews.author: Gerald F.
reviews.description: My wife and I had a great time, it has a relaxing  environment, beers for any taste, I had a raspberry beer, it was very good. I also got to try different kinds of beers. I was also able to order pizza from next door (Papa Johns) which they bought to my table.  We had such a good time that we went again and plan to continue going as many times as possible.

name: Zilker Brewing Company and Taproom
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Jason Z.
reviews.description: Awesome tasting beer and top notch service from Nick! Will have to return and drink more beer.

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: The space is nice and I love the food truck spicy boys that's there. Overall, the beer selection is pretty good and I love the merch. I was a bit surprised with how sweet their double ipa was, but there are other selections of beer that were more on the bitter side and less on the sweet side.  The outdoor space is really nice and I'd definitely come back here again.

reviews.author: Hannah E.
reviews.description: The only good thing about this place is that Spicy Boys is available. The one waiter with pink and blue hair completely ruined the entire experience for my friends and I. He was blatantly rude to us for no reason whatsoever.   Never coming back.

reviews.author: Anne C.
reviews.description: Super cool space and vibe!  We stumbled (not literally) upon this as we were heading back to our hotel after visiting another brewery in the area.  We were pretty full from lunch at Franklin BBQ - but they had a food truck at the ready if your stomach started growling.  We sipped our brews out side but they have a nice sized indoor seating area too if the weather gets a  bit chilly.  Super cool neighborhood vibe as I saw several families and even a softball team enjoying a pitcher after their game.  I wish I had more time here but am bookmarking it to visit again the next time I'm in Austin.

reviews.author: Shaji K.
reviews.description: Stopped by over here on an early Saturday afternoon before the crowds showed up. Large space with both inside and outdoor seating as well as a food truck parked to the side.  Decided to try a couple beers: Marco IPA ($6) and Friends with Benefits ($7). The Marco is well balanced but still had plenty of hops. Friends with benefits is more on the hazy side that sticks with you. The latter paired just fine alongside one of the sandwiches from the food truck.  Service was quick as there weren't many people at the brewery yet. A couple hours later the spot was packed, so best to come early.

reviews.author: Tim R.
reviews.description: Good beer. Nice outdoor seating area. Down the street from Lazarus brewing company. Nice place

reviews.author: Tomas R.
reviews.description: Fun spot to check out whilst in Austin or as a local. Zilker has always been a staple of East 6th even before East 6th became the hot neighborhood. They have indoor and outdoor seating and from my recent visit, I discovered they even sell wine here!  They had a food truck on the day they went so I'm certain there's food to wash down your IPA.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: All the 4 and 5-star reviews are spot on. Zilker Brewing is a great venue to have a brew or two and people watch from their 6th St patio.  Their indoor taproom is closed and they are adhering to the social distancing guidelines. We had a large picnic table to ourselves and were very comfortable chilling out on a breezy Sat afternoon.   I really enjoyed their Lazy Daisy Hazy IPA. It's a wonderful IPA that has a hint of sweetness and a citrus finish. Plus 1 gave 5 stars to their LA Beer American Pilsner. This is a typical Pils that drinks lite and is a perfect brew for a warm day.   Hungry? Spicy Boys Chicken food truck is onsite and is producing wonderful spicy chicken (Duh). They offer a range of sauces from sweet to hot as hades. We went midrange spicy and felt the heat.   Not a beer drinker, they offer wine, water, soft drinks, and surprise a frose' .  Solid 5-stars!

reviews.author: Madeline C.
reviews.description: Always one of my favorite brewery spots. They have the best hazy IPAs and great sours and generally interesting seasonal drafts, friendly staff, and a super yummy food truck (Spicy Boys) right in the patio area. Only thing is it gets pretty busy on weekends so it can be tough to snag a table sometimes, but it's worth it.

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: There is a reason that this brewery is always packed, the beer is awesome! I've checked out several local breweries in the area and this one is at the top of my list right now. The beer is great and the service is awesome. The staff are welcoming and willing to help you select a beer if you're undecided. Spicy Boys food truck is in their parking lot, so grab a few beers and enjoy the awesome food. Plenty of seating outside with some seating inside. This place is popular, so the seating will always fill up quickly. Dog friendly as well

reviews.author: Mckenna R.
reviews.description: Omg I wished I lived in Austin just for this brewery. I had their mixed berry sour and it was incredible! Also all of their Hazy IPA's were delicious as well. I love the ambiance here and can't wait to visit Austin again for this!

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Zilker BC is an awesome spot to grab a beer, grab a bite, chill out and enjoy the great vibes of both the brewery and the neighborhood. The space both indoors and out is perfect, and encourages coming together. Great for groups, but would be fine for a date night as well. A few bar stools but mostly community style seating. The food truck permanently stationed out front is great. The beer is excellent, focusing on IPAs but having many other interesting seasonals. Prices are more than fair, swag is cool. Zilker has it all, ipA to Z. Drink local!

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: Nice little micro brewery with seating indoors and out, and they are dog friendly. Good selection on tap. I had the Juicie Juice sour, and the Marco IPA - both great craft beers. Also have to mention they have some cool merchandise with very cool graphic designs for the brand.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: Quite good beer -- loved the coffee stout.   Was told that it's oddly not a normal spot for locals, not sure why.   I loved the food truck onsite.

reviews.author: Karley M.
reviews.description: AMAZING beer here. We loved the hazy IPA. The outdoor seating is fun and great for people watching on E 6th. There's a fried chicken food truck here as well that people say is the absolute best. Brewery has cool swag too!!

reviews.author: Craig T.
reviews.description: Loved this place. I've tried about 4 of their beers so far and liked all of them. Icy Boys jumps to mind if you're looking for something light and crushable. The Midnight Voyage is also amazing if you like hazy IPAs.  We went on a Friday night and sat outside because of Covid. There was a line but we got lucky and got a table fairly quickly.  The stuff is super polite, and the merch is great. Spicy Boys Food Truck is on site with great Thai Fried Chicken.

reviews.author: Jasmine C.
reviews.description: This brewery is outdoors and indoors. Good place to chill and hang out with friends. They also have a food truck outside.

reviews.author: Nina T.
reviews.description: Didn't plan the visit but passed by and thought why not! Not very familiar with beers but appreciated the staff sharing the knowledge to help picking on one. Found one high table on the corner, table was clean, weather was breezy, beer was good! Look at that half pint size. Great spot to quench your thirst in a warm weather.

reviews.author: Sam L.
reviews.description: Had a couple pints and hung out on their lawn for a while. Very relaxing, great beers. They share their lawn with a foodtruck which was incredibly convenient

reviews.author: Christa M.
reviews.description: Cool outdoor patio.  I enjoyed the 2 stouts they have on draught.  Very bold and deep with an experience of coffee notes.  Covid has preventing them from opening the inside for tasting, but they had plenty of tables outside.

reviews.author: Debbi R.
reviews.description: A Full and Wonderful Day   Our tour with Dale was fabulous. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it didn't take long to realize that not only is Dale a great tour guide, he's also a very personable and knowledgable man who makes you feel like an old friend.   The points of interest were superb and the last stop we made provided one of the best meals I've had in my life and most likely the best ribeye ever.   The day lasted longer than expected, but it was a wonderful day and ended up being just perfect. We are planning to use his rental venue for a retreat in the coming months and looking forward to it. I highly recommend his services.

reviews.author: Jaylan B.
reviews.description: First I would like to start with the facts.  1. We booked this tour months ago but unfortunately had to reschedule to a later date. (due to Covid19) This was not an issue for anyone attending the tour and the company got all $2800 paid for in full. 2. Yes $2800. We had 28 people in our group, It required two buses that were at their max capacity.  3. I would give a HUGE ZERO if I could.   The buses arrived at the pick up location 25 minutes early and expected us (all 28) to load up. Not all 28 people were even there yet. The male driver already seemed annoyed at this point.  We ended up pulling out at the agreed on time. When trying to leave the 2nd winery we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  But that unfortunately is not why I am writing this review   As we were loading the bus to go home the male driver said that would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilt something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe but she agreed to pay it she sat down. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from Him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off and the other bus also unloaded.  Now it is important to note the other driver said we didn't do anything wrong and that she didn't agree with how he was handling things. He told her he was in charge and that he would make the call. She became quiet after that. They ultimately left us there to find our own rides.  The male driver was rude and didn't speak unless spoken to the entire day. A beautiful day with amazing company was RUINED by this company and I will not recommend them to anyone!

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: I booked a birthday trip for 6 people, hoping to add 2 more. Dale told me I could book the trip for 6 and then add the 2. When I called to add the 2 he told me he would have to see if that was even possible. I didn't understand why after he assured me it would be fine and a sprinter van hold more than that. He had given the sprinter van to a larger crowd and downgraded us to an SUV without asking me (same price). I asked him when I would hear back and he said whenever he located another vehicle. I made some calls and found a better business who really wanted to host me and our guests. I called again to cancel with Dale and was told I am not the type of customer he would want. I guess a customer who wants to pay more money to add more people isn't good... very strange. Talking to a woman like that is not ok. I hope that he was having a bad few days and that he doesn't always behave like this, but I was really shocked how rude and unprofessional he was. Pros: I got my money back.

reviews.author: Blair B.
reviews.description: The owner/driver we had was terribly rude and very unprofessional. He only spoke when spoken to and when he did talk he seemed annoyed.  Do not waste your money on this company! I've had Uber drivers converse more than this "tour guide."  Worst experience ever by far!

reviews.author: Susan G.
reviews.description: Rick was AMAZING! He is the guide with the mostest - a gentleman with a servant's heart, excellent taste in wineries, and a plethora of knowledge about this  beautiful TX region. He is truly one-of-a-kind and I'm so glad we took this tour with him. Thanks, Rick - see you again soon!

reviews.author: Marcia H.
reviews.description: We were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The tour was nice. The driver was great! We visited some interesting wineries. Seeing the Texas wine country off the beaten path was well worth it. We would use this company again.

reviews.author: Doug E.
reviews.description: We had a great time.  Well worth the money our driver Laura was great.  She was helpful and was happy to be there.  When I do this again I won't change anything.  I would use the same driver and tour service.

reviews.author: Amanda G J.
reviews.description: One of the WORST experiences I have ever had with a "wine tour" company. I have been on many wine tours in my days, across different parts of Texas, and their unprofessionalism and lack of customer service and just blatant disrespect was appalling.   This "wine tour" had a total of two buses and a party consisting of 28 people. A group of people that I have known for years that have the utmost of respect and common courtesy for any company that they hire or work with.   From the start of our experience, both drivers were incredibly rude and unfriendly. The bus lacked any amenities one would think this "Premier Hill Country Wine Tasting Experience" would consist of.  The first winery.  * We arrived at the first winery at 10:48am to learn that the winery doesn't even open until 11:00am and that they WEREN'T expecting us at all... * Not the wineries fault. They were fantastic.  The second winery.  * Again, wasn't expecting us, causing us to have to sit at a tent down a road from the winery. Again, not the wineries fault, they handled it incredibly.  * When trying to leave the second winery, we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  The third winery.  * As we were loading the bus to go home, the male driver said that they would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilled something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe, but she agreed to pay it. (*To clarify, open containers were allowed as stated on their website: "Consumption of alcohol on the bus is allowed unless there are minors present.") Minor spills like this are inevitable when providing a service as they do. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off, and the other bus also unloaded.  I know these times are hard, especially for small and locally owned businesses, and by no means and am I trying to make it harder for them; in fact, I am going above and beyond to support them. After yesterday, I do think that they need to take a step back and re-evaluate their actions and really think long and hard about what they do and why they do it. In the end, when providing a service, the client always comes first.

reviews.author: Tiffany H.
reviews.description: This could not have been a better day! We highly recommend touring with Heart of Texas Wine Tours. We were so lucky to have found Dale Fortenberry. He is so knowledgeable about the area, the history and the vineyards. Dale went out of this way to accommodate the entire group of women with different tastes in wine. We all know that is not an easy feat, but he did it! Our next trip to the hill country will find us taking another exciting tour with Dale.  -Tiffany Raye

reviews.author: Christi C.
reviews.description: Absolutely best experience from beginning to end!   From ease of scheduling, picking us up on door step, and bringing us back, worry free.    Our driver Rick was great!  Shared info and answered all of our questions about the area.   He escorted us in to reserved tables at each location, pampered us all day!    Already planning our next trip with www.HeartOfTexasWineTours.com!  Thank you, Christi

reviews.author: Matthew V.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I had a fantastic time on this tour. To be honest, the cost seemed a bit high at first but having never been on a wine tour before and I really had no idea. Afterward I realize it was worth every bit of it. Dale picked us up at our BnB along with everyone else on the tour that day and we were off to the first tasting.  He seem to know everyone along the tour and at each place they were very welcoming and grateful to have our group. It really was a fun time and we had the chance to try many different wines that we would not have normally picked.  Lucky for us it was a beautiful day and everything was just perfect. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone interested in checking out some Texas wines, for a nice weekend getaway, or just to try something different.  It definitely helped that we had a good group of people who were also on the tour that day as well. It was a blast...I just wish we had taken more pictures.

reviews.author: Amy W.
reviews.description: Heads up - I'm only giving this one star so I can write a review. It would get a huge ZERO if I could rate it that way. First off, Dale is a pretentious, "underpaid monkey" as he likes to be called. He is rude, unprofessional, and has the audacity to 'hate mail' potential clients and I know I'm not the first one because I've seen the reviews! I don't have much else to say but be careful and do your research before spending any money on this place! The owner seems to not have a care in the world if it's not benefitting him. Also, be ready for rude phone calls and emails from Dale if he doesn't get his way. He was hard to get ahold of from the jump, not to mention I live out of town and couldn't wait for days in between responses. After not being able to make it to my appointment because he had failed to get back to me promptly, I proceeded on with my day. The next morning I wake up to the most rude, despicable email I've ever received. Just be careful and read reviews because from what I've read, if you want a beautiful wedding with NICE, FRIENDLY people, this isn't the place. I'll attach one of many emails. STAY AWAY FROM THE HEART OF TEXAS RANCH ALL TOGETHER!!!

reviews.author: Melody G.
reviews.description: Amazing time with a group of 7 of us girls. Our guide was Christy and she was outgoing and made us all feel like nothing was a bother for her. Picked us up at our hotel in Fredericksburg, went to pick up lunch, and then on to first of 4 wineries. She took care of everything. Even loaded up our bottles/goodies in the back of the bus and kept the AC on to keep it all cool.  Christy went above and beyond to keep everything organized, she set up our lunch, picked up our trash, offered to take us anywhere we wanted to go, and she kept us on time to all of our tastings. We bought a bottle of wine at the 3rd winery and drank in the bus on the way to the 4th. Lunch was a boxed lunch bought at local deli (very good). Everything was included. Everything was professional. The bus was large and comfy. Highly recommend this tour company!

reviews.author: Valarie M.
reviews.description: Dale was great getting everything organized and keeping us on track - and then also helping us change the schedule when we needed to.  very accommodating.  thanks Dale! you were a great host!

reviews.author: Erin K.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour celebrating my sister's bachelorette party. Dale was very prompt and polite returning my phone calls. He was also very accommodating as the number of girls going on the tour changed at the last minute. We went to Fat Ass, Six Shooter and Fiesta Vineyards which were a blast and everyone enjoyed the tastings. Our driver Rick was funny and a true gentleman. It was raining that day and he had an umbrella to escort everyone in and out of the tasting rooms so no one got soaked. One of the girls left their phone on the tour bus and Rick came back later that evening to return the phone even after we offered to meet him half way. We had a great time and would recommend this tour to anyone!

reviews.author: Tory H.
reviews.description: What a fun and relaxing time! The tour bus was very spacious and clean and the driver was very accommodating. The tour was carefully selected for us with every winery being better than the last! I cant wait to take another tour.

reviews.author: Keith R.
reviews.description: We paid nearly four hundred dollars and it was a joke. What was supposed to be a winery tour was a tour of places that sold wine. We went to a store in downtown marble falls, an art studio, a grocery store and at the very end an actual winery. This constituted our day.   This is NOT a day of going to wineries in the hill country. Everyone was disappointed on Valentine's day.   The guy who led the tour was nice but they clearly got kickbacks where we went.   When we went to lunch no one got their order and right when we were leaving this sandwich shop the tour guide asked, "everyone went to the tasting room, right?" We're talking about a sandwich place being a stop on the wine tour people.   Horribly disappointed. Considering tastings were at most $10 for each of the four "wineries" we went to, it was a rip off in value.  The company clearly avoided going to respectable wineries and instead went to dead end places where they could maximize their profit margin.   Avoid at all costs!!

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour. I booked it only two days in advance and they took great care of us. I told Dale our tastes in wine and he sent us to three great wineries. We had the bus all to ourselves too! I would definitely use them again and recommend this company for all your wine touring needs!

reviews.author: Monica P.
reviews.description: Dale is great!! He helped us find some Texas wines that we actually like! We went to a few places I never would have thought to stop by and helped us pick out some good wines to try. He kept the ride fun even though we were with 2 other groups of people we didn't know. The van was comfy and well air conditioned and stocked with bottled water. Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Dawn N.
reviews.description: Even a rainy day couldn't dampen the amazing experience the Heart of Texas Wine Tours provided.  We visited four wineries and were treated like VIPs due to Dale's wonderful rapport with vineyard owners and staff.  Dale's knowledge of wine and  the specialities and uniqueness of each winery made the tour interesting and fun.  By the end of the day, I had not only made new memories, but new friends too!

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here during a trip to Austin. Great views of the lake! There are QR codes on most tables to scan, if you don't want to order at the bar. I tried their British style beer and the Mexican style lager and went with the former. The bartender was nice and competent. Tried some of my friend's spiked hot chocolate style drink as well. Overall, a nice place to chill with some friends. Vibe is super casual.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: While you may think you should go here and get a cocktail, you should instead go and get something frozen like the margarita or the boozy popsicle! They were both the icy buzz-inducing beverage one needs on a hot ass day overlooking the water, wishing you could dive right in...but obvs, don't. And don't let too many margs tell you otherwise!

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The Barrel Room has a great selection of drinks, especially those of the frozen variety, too good in fact that I didn't even get a picture. Great view of Lake Travis and you don't have to wait in line like the neighboring Oasis Restaurant. I'll be back to The Barrel Room.

reviews.author: Markeisha T.
reviews.description: Its a full bar with 3 options on tap. Great service. Beautiful view and the top margarita was amazing.

reviews.author: Vlad V.
reviews.description: Sean made the best old fashion I've hd in my 12 years of drinking... its a dog friendly place with awesome waiters and waitresses

reviews.author: Christine N.
reviews.description: The worst food ever. I don't even give one stars but the food was not good at all, the mojito was disappointing. Don't waste your money here. There was a hair in the drink, had to take it back for a new one. My mom said "even if they offer to give us free meals, I wouldn't come back here"

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: So downstairs from the Oasis Brewing Co is this hot spot. The bar has most any drink you can think of, and a list of house creations as well. The bar staff is friendly and accommodating and there is plenty of seating from couches to regular tables. If you're going to be there for a while drinking be prepared for a hefty bill as nothing is inexpensive here. The awesome lake view helps to ease the $$ pain though. This place lends to awesome people watching as well since this area is a big tourist draw, so overall you can't really go wrong by stopping in here for a weekend libation.

reviews.author: Debbie K.
reviews.description: Super great spot on lake Travis. Great cocktails and the view is amazing. Come here and miss the crowd at the Mexican stop!

reviews.author: Anthony C.
reviews.description: I went to The Barrel Room out of curiosity and was amazed by the scenery and view! I wasn't greeted by anyone because you have to go up to the bar to order, which is pleasant for my kind of personality. They have very loud music to fit the vibe of the room and plenty of places to sit! Most importantly was the food; I was absolutely amazed by it and it was so delicious! I ordered the sisig and it was the best thing I ever had. I also, ordered a side of Caesar salad, but this was no ordinary piece of salad. It was presented gracefully and tasted extraordinary. The staff is very kind and fast paced with receiving orders. I am very glad that I came to this restaurant and hope I can revisit this place in the future!

reviews.author: sean B.
reviews.description: This place has it all, great craft beer, excellent hand made cocktails, amazing personal service and the best views and sunset in Central Texas. Try the Perfect Patron Margarita for...perfection. FIVE STARS!

reviews.author: Michelle Z.
reviews.description: Worst margarita I've ever had..definitely not worth the money. You're essentially just paying for the view.

reviews.author: K W.
reviews.description: Beautiful hidden gem at the Oasis complex. It's the brewery's cocktail lounge so not only do they have delicious beers and food but great and inventive cocktails. Can get busy on the weekends even with a full bar staff but the drinks are worth the wait.

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: Came here on St. Paddy's Day to get some BBQ from Lotz of BBQ (deaf owned) and ordered some beers to go.   This place is awesome. The food / beers were fantastic. I'd recommend the Hazy IPA.   Wish they had a year round tap room.

reviews.author: Fox E.
reviews.description: Not to be confused with 069 TNA which is what Barbi's brewing.  We're not a fan of breweries and this is no exception. I think breweries in general are overrated and again this is no exception.  Having said that this one is one of the better ones we've ever been to in Austin and their products are available all over Texas and are much better than some of the rifles. I mean rivals, but then again this is Texas, so maybe I mean rifles.

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: Outdoor seating only but tons of picnic benches.  They don't do flights or tastings but decent selection. Hubs got the IPA and rated it 7/10 for its nice light, refreshing hoppy-ness. Staff super friendly and willing to open a bottle to give me (who hates beer) a taster.

reviews.author: Jingyan Y.
reviews.description: Many tables scattered around for outdoor covid-friendly seating, dog friendly! They weren't serving from tap when we were there in Jan 2021, but you could get a growler or a 6 pack (mix 6 pack for $10) and drink it outside! They give you glasses. Bring a bottle opener!

reviews.author: Tim H.
reviews.description: Cool brewery with a huge selection of beers, but nothing extraordinary. The brewery does not have an actual taproom open regularly, but instead is open only Saturdays from 12-4 pm in their parking lot. I went during their anniversary event and it was $25 for a glass that you keep and 6 8 oz pours of your choice (you can do 12 4 oz pours instead). Majority of the pours turned out to be larger than 8 oz so you can really get trashed here. They had 44 beers on tap. Pretty insane. Unfortunately, none of the beers were that great. They had like 4 food trucks and a lot of porta potties (lines can get long).   Overall, this was a quantity over quality brewery. We had 4 people in our group and none of us were impressed, although, we are from California and are spoiled by all of the good breweries out here. If you just want to get the job done and get trashed on a Saturday afternoon, this is your spot. If your a real beer lover, you may be disappointed

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: I think all of the yelper complaints are the same: why not open more than one day a week? And for more than 4 hours at a time?!   Maybe it's an exclusivity thing...it sure works. If you are visiting Austin and have a free Saturday early afternoon, be sure to hit up 512 for your beer desires. You can take your tasting cup home as a souvenir. They have outdoor seating, merch for purch, and are kid and dog-friendly. Double wow! My boyfriend and I made it to 512 at the tail end of their Saturday hours, but we were able to share a tasting for one. That was perfect because it was the safest way to drink, play some ladderball (it was my first time playing that!), and drive to dinner afterwards.  They have clean restrooms and an easy way to purchase your guitar picks as proof of beer-drinking capability. When you park (plenty of parking btw), walk first to the door on the tasting room's left. You can purchase your tasting power, then head over to the main room for the adventure. When we went, there was basically one taptender pouring while a barback was helping him out with the glasses and stuff. It seemed like a lot of regulars were there, mostly 30+ in age, but all having a great time socializing. There wasn't a food truck there, nor any food on site, so bring your own or head out to eat afterwards.

reviews.author: Crystal H.
reviews.description: Came here during their passport beer event thing. There was live music and it was outdoors. It was $25 and you get to keep the beer glass. You get to taste 6 full glass beers or 12 half glass beers and can pick if you want them to pour half a glass or full glass. The beer list was extensive! There were probably 2 beers we really liked and tons of unique ones that were puzzling to us. They also served some complimentary cheeses. There's also a few food trucks for hungry people. The only thing bad about the event was that restrooms were porta-potties. Many people brought their dogs to the event too. Cool to people and dog watch.

reviews.author: Thomas N.
reviews.description: I really like that Smash Mosaic!  What a cool place to swing by and pick up some beer and a tacker!

reviews.author: Flora R.
reviews.description: We stopped by open house hours on Saturday and got exactly what we were looking for - a chill place to enjoy some favorites (pecan porter!) and try out a few new things (smash mosaic ipa) served up by friendly and informative beer makers. I'm glad we made a point to visit and will likely bring friends here when visiting in the future.  This place is dog and child friendly with a handful of picnic tables outside and an optional, small 'tour' if you're into that.

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: Had a chance to go to their 11th anniversary fest and it was an experience to try the whiskey barrel double pecan porter, the nitro pecan porter, the pumpkin pecan porter, the cafe oh la la and many others I had no idea produced.  Live music and many of their employees talking about their brews. Food trailers were good too. Had a B.A.T. Grilled cheese sandwich which was tasty and somewhat greasy but matched well with the selection of craft.

reviews.author: Steve E.
reviews.description: Been wanting to visit this small brewery for years but they're only open on Saturdays from Noon - 4 PM.  It was great to see a small brewery keeps you origins.  Nothing fancy here just great beer and a good vibe.  Glad I finally got to visit in person.

reviews.author: Billy V.
reviews.description: 512 Brewing Company review could be short and sweet. Only open on Saturday's 12 to 4 pm (taproom). Ugh... 512 Brewing Company was the first beer I tasted in Austin. Had an IPA. Very tasty. I like. Me, happy camper. 512 Brewing Company taproom mostly outside. Ugh... You buy your beer and hang outside in beer garden. Very unique way to order beer. Buy tokens (12 for $24) at one location. Then walk to beer taps. Ugh... They give you two 8oz glasses. Yeah... Never a fresh clean glass to try delicious beer. This is a comfort I like in a taproom I feel it makes a big difference in flavor and service. My two cents. I have only had their IPA. I am an IPA guy. I like the classic flavors and full body beer. 512 Brewing Company IPA does a good job for me. I would like the tasting experience as an option. I really enjoy a 4oz sample to try all the beers. Not a fan of using my beer token on a maybe. Oh well. 512 Brewing Company I will be back just not that often...

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Terrific! Pre purchased tickets with friends on EventBrite, then headed over for a Saturday tasting.   Limited crowd, numerous beers on tap, efficient and knowledgeable staff. It was tasty and well done.

reviews.author: B H.
reviews.description: I used to take the train downtown so I'd always stop at Champions by the station and have a Pecan Porter or three while waiting for a pick up.  After relocating and driving myself to work like a pleb for the last 2 years the thing I missed most was the beer.  The few times a month I'd venture into Specs I'd always ask the beer guy about this(and Hitachino) and was always met with the tired response citing the owners devotion to sustainability.  I grew to loathe the environment.  Every time I'd toss something in the blue bin at work I'd scowl.  It just wasn't worth it.  I wanted this beer in something other than a keg.  Low and behold on my last trip in I see a stack of 4-packs of Pecan Porter.  The most perfect stack since the pyramids.  Beer guy saw me and came over to share in my unbridled joy.  I cursed the owner one last time for making me wait so long.  And grabbed two.

reviews.author: Kiley K.
reviews.description: 512 had the honors of providing me with my first brewery tour. It was great, but definitely a little different than I expected. I attended the first weekend where they changed their "style" of the tour. They have not updated their website to list the correct details. Admission is $12 per person. This gets you the tour (optional), a small 512 glass souvenir for tasting, and 6 tickets for beer tasting.   The tour is said to start Saturday's around noon. However once you arrive, they will let you know how long they are going to wait based on the amount of people waiting. (they like to fill up)  That being said, we had about an hour wait outside on the patio-ish area (no cover, bring a hat and shades) to enjoy some brews! The weather was great and they have giant Jenga and corn hole for you to enjoy. Dogs are also welcome outside. If you plan to skip out on the tour and just enjoy the beer, bring lawn chairs as the tables get crowded after a while.   IF you decide to attend their tour, keep in mind that it may not be exactly what you expect. The brewery is small and there are only about 3 sections to view in cramped spaces. Get up close to the tour guide so that you can hear because they do not use a microphone. They have some work do to on the tour, but overall I enjoyed it.  Stop by 512! Besides, you can't beat $12 for 6 beers!

reviews.author: Greg B.
reviews.description: I really want to give 512 a 4.5. Almost a perfect experience for us. My girlfriend and I went to the Saturday open house and it was great.   For $12 you get an 8oz 512 glass to keep and 6 guitar pics to trade for different brews. There beers were all great, we even got to try some limited edition that's not being distributed yet. The "bartender" was really cool, knowledgeable about the beers, and overall pleasant to talk to. The only thing missing would be some type of food truck or snack.   Definitely give this place a try if you are a beer lover!

reviews.author: Bryan B.
reviews.description: Love their Pecan Porter. Try this places out. Had a good time in ATX. I did try most of their lineup at the time and it did not disappoint. Love 512!

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: I've been wanting to visit this brewery since we moved, but it is o my open 12-4pm on Saturdays. Outside seating only so be prepared in warm weather.. beer is great! You purchase a very small glass for $12 but you also get 6 guitar piks that you trade in for refills on the beer so actually a great deal! We would definitely come back, just earlier in the day so we can drink our 6, and also cooler weather!

reviews.author: Lorrie M.
reviews.description: It's pretty rare that I like MOST of the beers at a brewery. Usually there's one or two stand outs, and that in itself is unusual.   However, 512 takes the cake on my brewery tour of Austin this time around. We showed up around noon, definitely past their "tour" time and it wasn't even available on their eventbrite / website anymore. Regardless, the brewer (New-ish Guy, woo!) let us in the tour and filled our two glasses with delicious Pecan Porter that was on nitro at the time.  I definitely loved their IPAs (IPA and Seven), their Wit was also not bad at all. The only thing I was a little eh about was their Pils and that's ok with me. They were incredibly knowledgable, the tour was fun, and they're doing some really cool barrel aged stuff that you don't see at a lot of breweries. They're also very dedicated to self distribution, despite how difficult that seems, so I'm definitely looking forward to other 512 beers I can get my hands on in the future.

reviews.author: Caryn K.
reviews.description: Came here with the fam-bam to celebrate Father's Day and we were not disappointed. There was beer for the whole family and the outdoor seating area came complete with bags, jenga, and ladder toss. The cost is $12 for 6-8oz beer samples! Probably the best deal in town. Highly recommend this place if you are looking for a place to hangout with friends. I'd recommend bringing food with you as there isn't much close by, but otherwise great place to just go and chill.

name: AquaBrew
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Addie W.
reviews.description: We had to plan a get together for our friends service last minute and we're running into dead ends with all the places we called. We spoke to Lauren, the owner at Aquabrew and they were incredibly kind and generous with allowing us to use their venue for after the service. When we got there, the GM, Hannah, took such great care of us and everyone else who attended. They went above and beyond for us during a difficult time and helped take one thing off our shoulders and for that they have earned our business forever. Really good people! Great beer!

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: We visited AquaBrew after eating at Industry next door. This brewery has many great beers on their list. I enjoyed the San Marcos Blonde.  There is plenty of indoor seating, a great patio and of course the bar area.  It was easy to social distance from other people and very clean. We will return. The staff was very nice and helpful. If you are looking for a good local brewery to support, AquaBrew is the place.

reviews.author: Shawna L.
reviews.description: Their new location wasn't updated on any maps so we ended up waking all around it until we called to find out what else we could use on maps to locate them. When we walked in we were very disappointed in their craft selection. I had researched this prior to choosing to go there based on their craft choices showed online. Again, something else that needed to be updated. Also, they aren't serving food. There was a large dog walking around that would come right up to you or sneak up under the tables and lick your feet. I like dogs so it was ok but for someone that doesn't..... Would not go back here until they get fully moved or opened.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: After going to the outlet mall we got a little thirsty we had already ordered some other food but we're unable to eat it within the restaurant so we called and asked awkward crew if we could order some of the beer and use your patio to eat our food they were very accommodating very nice people we even got to try to of their beers which tasted great

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: They've thought about everything at this brewery.  Great food, live music, seating inside, outside, and UPSTAIRS on the deck!  When the weather is right, they have the big glass garage doors open.  Yeah, they brew their own beer here and they have a decent selection.  It's not your typical brewery where you can just stroll in and choose the table you want to sit at.  That's because they have full table service for food and drinks.  I prefer breweries that let you wander around from the bar, to an outside table, to an inside table, and then back again - you know, rinse, lather, and repeat (relaxed and unstructured - I need that once in a while).  If you just want to stop in for a quick beer, you can sit at the bar.  The bar is quite large but also very popular with the college crowd, so it's hard to get a seat at times.   Now to the serious stuff - the beer!  I've had their Kolsch (San Marcos Blonde) and their Vienna Lager.  The blonde was the run of the mill Kolsch, not bad by any means, but the Vienna Lager - wow!  It had a great malty taste to it.  I liked it so much that I purchased a crowler of it to take home.  I rarely do that, so that tells you it must be good.  Enough useless banter - here's everything else you need to know about this place:  Free parking lot right next door or free 2 hr street parking.   Patio areas in the front and the back with overhead infrared heaters and fans with misters (they have both Texas seasons covered).  This place is popular with the college kids - TOO popular.  Growler refills are $12 or $18 for 64 oz, and $24 or $36 for 128 oz, depending on the beer you select.    Crowlers to go:  $8 or $10 (depending on the beer).  You can get three for $20 or $25 (depending on the beer).  Plenty of food options.   And I almost forgot to tell you - they have a FULL bar, not just beer!

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: Aquabrew is definitely a gem in San Marcos. I learned about it through the purchase of the brewery tour on Groupon. The tour was quaint because it's not that big, but very interesting.  The gentleman who gave the tour seemed a bit rushed at the end, but he answered our questions and seemed very knowledgeable.   At the end of the tour we got to sample some beer. They also have a beer club where you buy a growler, we got the one for $100, and join their beer club. You get a punch card for 10 refills on the growler. My husband and I got one each for $200. I was thinking it an "okay" deal i guess. Truthfully I wasn't that thrilled cause of the price. But OMG!!!! IT IS WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY FOLKS!!!!.   Aquabrew has some of the best beers around. I am Army and have lived and traveled all over the world and this lil place holds its ground when it comes to beers! Purchasing the growler is the best deal too.   I have not had the food yet, but the place is always busy and people seem to love it. And they have some of the cutest guys behind the bar.  In all, I give this gem an A+

reviews.author: Maggie M.
reviews.description: Used to be my favorite restaurant in San mo but returned recently and they have the weirdest vibe now. None of their food is offered (you get two options from a backyard stand) standoffish servers and a gloomy vibe. Sooooo disappointed and hope to see this place make it back to its prime.

reviews.author: Steve S.
reviews.description: The first thing about AquaBrew that I enjoyed was the vibe. This place really has a community feel with longer style tables and an incredible open patio with fans and lighting, ping pong and live music... and of course... beer.  The food was very flavorful. Thai chicken had good spice and the chicken thigh was tender and juicy. The Margarita flatbread was fresh tasting. The arugula salad was huge and bursting with fruits and flavor.  The beer was excellent and just what you'd expect from an onsite brewery.   Overall, if you're looking for a fun place for you and your peeps to chill, eat and drink in San Marcos... you'd do well to try this place. Plus it's right up the street from the Cheetham St warehouse.

reviews.author: Jesse M.
reviews.description: The beer was good but the food was not. Should have known better than to order the steak at a bar like restaurant but it was basically inedible. Not even my 11 year old daughter would eat it. Supposed to be medium and came through well done. The waitress asked and I told her it was cooked bad and we couldn't eat it and she said "yeah I saw that" and proceeded to do absolutely nothing to fix it or make it right.   I'll go there for the beer but never again for the food

reviews.author: Robert A.
reviews.description: The beer was good, but not many choices on the menu. The restaurant is clean and has a good vibe. The food.... well it looked good. The taste... somewhat bland. My son likes it but he lost his tastebuds in an accident as a child.   I would come back for the beer and appetizers, but would pass on the dinner.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: Service - 5/5 great customer service ! Our waiter was very attentive and met all our needs.  Atmosphere - 4/5 pretty nice place . Long tables instead of individual tables to encourage people to meet new people ! Which is a really awesome concept . Also there's a large bar since it's also a brewery.  Food- my food was about a 3.5/5 , but my friends was a solid 1. Her salmon Benedict had almost uncuttable biscuit since it was so hard , and the most burnt potatoes I've ever seen. My food which was the stuffed French toast was pretty yummy, but not a lot to it.  Noise level - 1/5 THE BAND WAS SOOO LOUD. I couldn't here my friend talking 1 foot in front of me :(  Price - 2/5 wayyyy overpriced for what you get. My French toast was 11.91 and my friends meal was 15.91  Probably won't return unless it's for a group outing , but still a cool little place to check out !

reviews.author: Kris N.
reviews.description: My fiancé and I had an amazing experience at aquabrew. We got to talk a lot with the brewer CJ and he's extremely smart and knows what he's doing. We tried at least 6 of the different drafts and were impressed by them all. I definitely recommend this place if your wanting to experience a new brewery to checkout!

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Odd to see the plethora of reviews stating that the service here in subpar, as this was definitely not the case when I went yesterday. Easy to get a seat and our waitress was very attentive, despite it being happy hour and slightly busy on a Friday after work.  As a table, we ordered the: a) Brew House Pretzel - Amazingly soft and the beer queso is a great pairing  b) AB Bacon Jam Fries - HOLY! The bacon jam itself is something I've never had before and I must say this makes it a must return for me  c) Glass of Imperial Pilsner - Smooth and pretty standard for a Pilsner  d) Glass of Artificial Intelligence Tripel (9.72% ABV) - Yeah...the ABV tells the story itself  This spot has a great atmosphere, very rustic and cozy. Definitely a nice place, just wish you could order directly from the bar for faster access to beer.

reviews.author: Luz C.
reviews.description: This place is AMAZING!!! The food was well executed and so delicious that I just want to pack up and move to Austin so I can be a local!! If you want delicious food, great drinks, a casual yet elevated ambiance I'd say look no where else and go here. The waiter was fantastic (I can't believe I forgot his name). He was helpful and very knowledgeable of the menu. His suggestions were all a match to our taste buds.   Can't wait to go to Austin to eat here again!

reviews.author: Tom C.
reviews.description: You know when someone takes a picture of themselves and posts it on Instagram,and it's at just the right angle to make them look super attractive? The Yelp reviews of this place kind of remind me of that. It's not that it was bad, but I was expecting a lot more.  The highlight of my meal was the Mosaic IPA. Balanced and drinkable, this beer was really enjoyable. I also tried the Swine Dive IPA.
