The taste of this was a little too clean for an IPA and just didn't have the hoppy depth to add to its character. Not bad, but I wouldn't get it again.  Overall the food I ordered was really lackluster. I didn't hate it, but it certainly wasn't a memorable meal. My chicken empanadas were oily, and had very little chicken in the filling. The whole thing struck me as more of acorn dog egg roll hybrid, and didn't really seem like an empanada at all. I was grateful for the spicy sauce it was served with, which was pretty tasty. I also ordered the brussel sprouts. There were some decent flavors here, but I would have really preferred them to have a little more char on them. They came across as slightly undercooked and worse yet, very wet. A little crispness would have gone a long way.  Service was fair, friendly enough but really on the slow side. It took me almost a half an hour to get my food and it wasn't crowded. The couple at the bar sitting next to me ordered hamburgers. I have to admit I was a little jealous because they looked good. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing. Maybe it was a bad night. Whatever the reason I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.

reviews.author: Kevin E.
reviews.description: Great location and cool venue. It's evident a lot of time and thought were put into this place.   Great beers, especially liked the Ape-ricot Wheat.   I wish I saved room for the Porter Ice Cream Float.   The AB burger was solid, maybe a little messy tho.  Forget the fries tho. The regular fires were under seasoned and chewy. Think Wendy's fries when you  don't finish them at lunch and try to eat them at the end of your shift. Bleh  The staff was super friendly.   The outdoor portion looks great but a bit too hot out today to go and enjoy it.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: What an awkward night...Our server did not check on us. We had to continue to ask for things...multiple times, from multiple people. That portion of the night really sucked.  Howeverrrr, the street corn, queso, crispy tuna, edamame, and loaded fried were reallyyyy good. We especially loved the street corn. I wish we would've gotten the delicious food on time, instead of having to remind the staff multiple times butttt at least it tasted amazing??   I can't give them more stars even though the food was great because service is so so so important.

reviews.author: Jan C.
reviews.description: Unfortunately the new menu and chef drops the rating from 5 to 4. Still friendly waitstaff and excellent happy hour. But the reason I come to AquaBrew and recommend it to everyone I meet is the food. The "new" salmon dish isn't even close to the goodness of the previous balsamic salmon with veggies. Dry. Lacked flavor. Sticky rice instead of the delish potatoes and only green beans instead of a mix of seasonal veggies. Hubby had the tostadas and 'meh' reaction. Will give it one more try before relegating it to happy hour only place with 3 stars. So sad.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: Just left after lunch. Cute/hip spot with friendly staff.   We ordered the AB burger and I did an upgrade to their bacon jam fries ($4 upgrade). I was so excited to try these fries but they were very underwhelming to me. $4 is steep for an up charge but had I enjoyed them I wouldn't have minded. The burger was the best bite on the table. It was small in size but very juicy and tasty. Not one to split.   Next up was the fried chicken and eggs. It has so many things I typically like - fried chicken, cream gravy, bacon jam, eggs, but I didn't like this dish. It lacked dimension of flavor. It needed something. The herbed fries that came with it were good. I liked them better than the $4 bacon jam ones.   Our kids split the stuffed French toast. The only ate a little bit because it was too sweet. If a kid thinks something is too sweet you know it's toooooo sweet. Neither ate it. It was a waste of money.   Overall I'm glad we tried it but don't need to return on our own accord.

reviews.author: Emari S.
reviews.description: Omg I tried their Shrimp and Grits and they were delicious  and I Also tried their bacon jam fries and they were impeccable. I really enjoyed the margarita I had and the atmosphere was nice. Are usually never think of AquaBrew to eat at, but now that I finally tried it, I will definitely go back! Love it! The shrimp and grits is super buttery but I LOVE IT

reviews.author: Brooklyn B.
reviews.description: Amazing gem hidden in Spicewood TX. Great pizza, great bar and amazing live performances. Trevor was our server and he served us very well. Would give this place a 10/5 stars if possible! Ask for Trevor when you're there!!

reviews.author: Sarah P.
reviews.description: We grabbed a quick weeknight dinner here and walked away happy.   The cauliflower starter was packed with flavor. My husband followed it up with the classic Good, Bad and Ugly, a pepperoni, sausage, and pepper pizza that was elevated by higher quality ingredients. I tried the mushroom pizza, which was tasty as long as you're looking for something different. An umami bomb with a mushroom purée sauce, speck ham, and rosemary.  Two pizzas + the cauliflower = 2.5 meals for us, so plan for generous portions/leftovers.

reviews.author: Chaese J.
reviews.description: Love this place!   The atmosphere on Saturday nights with the live music is awesome. I started coming here a few months ago and will continue to come - every time I am here the pizza is amazing and the staff is friendly.   The arugula pizza is my favorite. I also tried the bad decisions pizza and it was good - I am not a fan of how greasy it is but it is a pizza so that typically comes with the territory   I recommend this place to anyone who wants a casual bite with a fun atmosphere and good drinks!

reviews.author: Jasmin R.
reviews.description: We recently purchased a lake cabin in Spicewood and stumbled upon this place. Great outdoor ambience and delicious pizza! We love how family oriented it is too. Why 3 stars then? Unfortunately both times we visited our service outdoor was almost non existent. We waited a very long time before someone would make eye contact with us and come over to take our order. On both occasions it took over 2 hours before we actually received our food, due to waiting so long to finally be served. I know how important reviews are to businesses so I was reluctant to give a low rating, however I really think the service outside needs to be improved. We really want to love this place and hope management takes this review into consideration.

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: Love this place!!  We're new to the area and live local. Their Wood fired Neapolitan pizzas are fantastic!! Love the roasted sweet peppers, sausage and pepperoni. Ceasers salad is excellent! Great selection of craft beers and local IPA's. They bring in high quality Live music Thursday thru Sunday.  The Big Hurt is awesome!! But the best part are people and the their staff.  Damian is the best!! He always makes your experience feel special like you're family. Highly recommended!!

reviews.author: Bryan H.
reviews.description: The pizzas and music is outstanding and the customer service is excellent. (This place is awesome and great for birthday parties.)

reviews.author: Savannah B.
reviews.description: The boyfriend and I happened upon this place with the intention to visit the farmers market in the same parking lot. No one told us that market is only open on Sunday and it was Saturday. Ha!  So we tried this place out in their dog-friendly  backyard covered patio and we were not disappointed!  - Fresh craft quality cocktails on draft  - Super fresh ingredients in the salad and pizza  It was still pretty early so we had the breakfast brunch pie and a light fennel salad and it hit the spot perfectly. When you visit, you can order straight from the bar and Emilio will happily take care of you.

reviews.author: Kip S.
reviews.description: Sorellina is hands down the best pizza in the hill country. The pies are creative, well executed and feature ingredients from local farms. I don't care for the clam offering, but it's hard to choose a favorite among the others. I guess I'd have to give a slight nod to the 'Nduja Sausage though. Regardless of which pie you choose, the crust isn't just an obligatory substrate; it's got great flavor and texture.  The cocktails are outstanding, especially the prickly pear margarita. Sunday is Bloody Mary day, and you won't find a better one outside of the next one. The mix has got just the right amount of spice and it's filled with a skewer containing salami, pepperoni, an olive, a tomato, basil and mozzarella.  The owners and staff are great, and they recently remodeled an already great patio area to include a beer garden with 30 beers on tap.

reviews.author: Bri W.
reviews.description: Hands down new favorite pizza place, great for kids and families. The outdoor space is great and we enjoy going with our kids.

reviews.author: Andrea C.
reviews.description: I came here with my kids and parents on a Saturday night. There were lots of kids playing on the swingset and a good band. The pizza was great. A good time was had by all!

reviews.author: Brian C.
reviews.description: Delicious pizza and cocktails + live music. Wood fired cauliflower and arugula prosciutto pizza hit the spot. A great place to enjoy a summer Sunday night. Bartender working the outdoor seating knows what he's doing. Try the Garden Party if you're into gin and the Tumbleweed if you like a good Mexican martini. Small playground for the little ones run around while Mom and Dad enjoy everything else.

reviews.author: Flora B.
reviews.description: Our neighbors introduced us to this fabulous, cheesy thin crust pizza joint with an outdoor patio air conditioning system within Pedernales Farmer's Market. Enjoyed the Nelson-style country guitarist from the patio and great vibes at this joint.

reviews.author: Ally A.
reviews.description: Great pizza and I'm from New York LOL and great service I hate to come on here only when I'm writing a bad review because people always respond with you only write bad reviews it must be you LOL when really I'm only motivated to write a review when I'm treated horribly or some thing is really not right with the place I spend my money at so I'm trying to write more good reviews it was too short to post by just saying great pizza. But this place has great pizza

reviews.author: M B.
reviews.description: Our family ordered takeout from Pizza Sorellina for the first time tonight. The pizzas were thin crust and delicious! My only complaint is that it's slightly pricey for the size of the pizza. We also enjoyed the cauliflower appetizer which was quite flavorful. We'll be back.

reviews.author: Wendy W.
reviews.description: Best Pizza in Central Texas. Moved to Texas from Cali. And its the best pizza I have had in decades. My fav is the crust.... superior flavor! Great Salads. Staff was friendly and accommodating as we had a large group. Over all, this place is awesome! I highly recommend! God I love Texas!

reviews.author: Christina C.
reviews.description: Verde pizza fabulous. added ham. Also loved cauliflower. Fennel and Caesar salads and margarita pizza with pepperoni.  Perfect easy place to go as a family. Very friendly and cookies looked awesome, will have to try sometime!

reviews.author: Jeannie S.
reviews.description: The atmosphere is great! Huge outdoor patio with spectacular bar and wonderful craft cocktails! The bloodies are the best I have ever had-the tomato juice is made fresh on site. The garnish is a meal by itself! Pizza dough and toppings are unbeatable. Best pizza I have had since I left New York years ago. The beers are also great although I am not a beer drinker.

reviews.author: Jimmie C.
reviews.description: Great food! Great people!  Seriously good wood fired pizza.  Now they've got the outdoor beer taps open and a good selection which makes the beer garden a nice place to catch some music on the weekend.

reviews.author: Emily B.
reviews.description: I stopped in after yoga to see what a cinnamon roll pie looked like.  They happily revealed one.  I then asked Shane if I could order a brunch pie half pork belly and half sausage and he said no problem.  Let me just say, I'm not sure where it went.  I'd like to say the dogs ate it, but I devoured it.  It was absolutely amazing!  Crust had a nice char and the flavor was delicious.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Courtenay C.
reviews.description: Whoah... so yummy. Such a good place to hang out and enjoy the outdoors and some music.

name: The Growling
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This is a really cool place to stop by and get a pint of a regional beer or refill your growler with your favorite brew to take home (growlers only, no crowlers here).  Friendly, and more importantly, knowledgeable tap masters that can match your beer tastes to the selections on tap.   You can order a pitcher of beer at this place!  I don't see this in many growler stations.  All in all, it's a very fun place.  The staff and the customers are very chill and down to earth.  It's in a strip center at the corner of LBJ and East Sessom Dr.  The address is listed on LBJ and while you can enter there, it's a lot easier if you enter from East Sesson Drive.  And there's a LOT more parking on this side.

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a great little dive bar in San Marcos with lots of local beers on tap. The bartender was very nice and knowledgeable and it was not very crowded at all. I love the music they play there as well. It is very low-key so if you feel like just sitting down and having a couple beers in talking with the regulars it is perfect perfect

reviews.author: Karma R.
reviews.description: We were just gonna share 1 beer and go but Ted was so cool that we sat here and talked with him and kept drinking until their first karaoke night  back since last year !!! Yassss!!! Good times good vibes good beer good peeps and good space !!!

reviews.author: Kyle S.
reviews.description: The decor of this place is very unique. You pretty much just have to see it for yourself. The walls are loaded with artwork for sale from local artists. Very interesting pieces. But enough about that.  This place is loaded with craft beer from Texas. Texas is apparently pretty big in that regard (and nearly every other regard). For a place as small and intimate as it is, there's a lot of seating packed in it and even some outdoor seating. There's games, lots of games. Card games, board games, darts, pool, and sometimes even a live DJ.  If you dig the craft brew scene this place is surely right up your alley. If you find yourself in San Marcos come check em out!

reviews.author: Laura K.
reviews.description: Part of what makes The Growling so delightful, is the atmosphere. I'm new to the craft beer scene -- and this was a perfect welcome.  The staff is friendly and can also help me decide what to order if I'm unsure. I've had fun trying to new beers and discovering what have become my go-to selections. (Bonus : All the beer they serve is from Texas!) Between the mix of good people and good beer - this has become my favorite bar.

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: Went to this local brew house last night and I was absolutely blown away. They have all Texas craft beers, 28 on tap, fresh, and they even have a few selections in cans and some wine!      I was shocked when I saw they had The Infinite Monkey Theorem Rose' ....impressive.   The vibe is awesome. Super laid back, chill, artsy, and hipster. Loves it.       The owners are lovely people. So nice, great service, and very informative on every single beer. They make it their priority to get the perfect beer for you.   They have some savory oyster crackers for you to enjoy while you booze it up. Cards Against Humanity is also available to play for free!        The decor was my favorite. I was super into the refurbished wooden pallets, the art work, the baby succulents, and the colors!   Will definitely be returning many more evenings.

reviews.author: Michelle O.
reviews.description: I love this bar! There are dogs! I repeat, this is a dog bar! I wish we had dog bars in San Antonio. I had no idea San Marcos was so cool. This is the first bar I visited in SMTX and I was very impressed. Very cool vibe, lots of dogs to pet and neat art on the walls. I like that they have board games and such. I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Dustin W.
reviews.description: This place has the best tap selection in San Marcos, hands down. No place in town even comes close to getting the quality beers that this bar does. The owner is always a great help for beer selection and a super cool dude. Try a craft beer or get your growler filled. I highly recommend The Growling!

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a variety of beers in a laid back spot- this is the place. We tried a variety of beers from a variety of places and the bar staff was very knowledgeable in guiding our visit. Definitely enjoyed, and will be back!

reviews.author: Brandee A.
reviews.description: In San Marcos for the weekend and checked this place out for a few beers based on the great Yelp rating. Yelpers are definately right on the mark here. Great selection of Texas beers. Very helpful staff who encouraged us to sample several based on our likes including several blends we may not have thought of trying. 2 beers led to 3 and then 4. Sad to leave but had a game to catch. Until next time, keep up the great cheer and beer!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: This place is super duper dope! Great selection, continuously changing taps all from Texas. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff, free street fighter, and chill vibes. Great place to hang out and drink delicious Texas beer.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: As far as growler places in San Marcos, The Growling is as good as it gets!  With that being said, I've been to growler places in the greater Austin area and IMHO, I think The Growling is better than most of them.  As previously mentioned, there are 28 beers on tap, all Texas-made stuff, but unlike other growler places I've been to they have a bar and you can drink a pint, invite friends, and just hang out. The owners are super friendly and work hard to set you up with the perfect craft beer experience! They even have a stage setup for live music and get live acts mostly on the weekend.  Also, as previously mentioned, there is no kitchen but they allow outside food and with Pie Society, Bobcat nation, Dos Gatos, Mocas/Javas, Rose Garden (Chinese), and Thai Thai in close proximity; you won't have to go far to fight off those hunger cravings! They haven't been open very long (less than 2 months) so they're off to a slow start but hopefully as word gets out they'll start getting busier and maybe even expand on what's an already great start! If you're in San Marcos for the River, the Square, the Hill Country, or in school looking to skip class, The Growling is every bit worth checking out!

reviews.author: Toni V.
reviews.description: Nothing like a craft brew to quench your thirst any day of the week! What a great spot - the staff is very welcoming and friendly and are very knowledgeable about the different brews on tap to help you find the right one to fit those taste buds. The beer flight the bartenders picked/poured for me were great and I look forward to coming back and tasting the other brews on tap. Looks like I found a great alternative to overcrowded beergardens in Austin so cheers to more trips I'll be making to San Marcos!

reviews.author: Lianne S.
reviews.description: The Growling always has good vibes, smooth tunes, and awesome art/entertainment selection tasty brews and great company with Manny and the undrownable countess !

reviews.author: Tabitha G.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out at the end of a long day! There are games to play on the tables, cool music, and good films running on the tv. Sometimes they have live music which is always great! Come by and check them out!

reviews.author: Lucy H.
reviews.description: So glad to discover this place! Excellent selection and awesome atmosphere, bar guy, and fellow customers.

reviews.author: Amrendra K.
reviews.description: The place is amazing, you can walk in with your dog and order food from outside. Barman is amazing, actually they take turns, the one I like is the one who lets a scorpion and is super crazy. He will always recommend the right craft beer for you. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Phoebe M.
reviews.description: Best selection of beers in sm!! They have electric jellyfish. they'll give you samples till you find what you want! Amazing service. A little pricey for a drink in a college town, but appropriate for the establishment I think.

reviews.author: Pasha C.
reviews.description: Great selection! Very relaxed and mellow atmosphere. They always have tons of beer on tap and they are all Texas beers. Plus the staff is very helpful at suggesting beers.

reviews.author: Travis W.
reviews.description: Seriously awesome local beers.  The bartender is extremely knowledgeable. A true hidden gem for craft brews of Texas.

name: Zelicks
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: I really love their burgers and those cheese fries are to die for. Ive also tried their pulled pork quesadilla, steak @ their steak night ( $16 every Tuesday!) and those are solid choices as well. I liked the chicken sandwich but it didn't wow me like the other items i've listed above. Bartenders and staff are super friendly. Overall a great atmosphere, especially now that it's getting chillier out!

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: A must stop in San Marcos. Really great chill vibes, good drinks, and good company. Haven't gone at night but apparently super fun!!

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: The staff is awful here, plenty of other places to drink in San Marcos ... look elsewhere! Also the place stinks up front, smells like sewage

reviews.author: Kimber B.
reviews.description: I love this place. Consistent good drinks, good food, good music and outstanding atmosphere.   Intimate Live music scene, chill vine with yard games check it out.

reviews.author: Griffin S.
reviews.description: Amazing spot. Great staff! Good social media presence as well... @zelicks on Instagram.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Hands down the best neighborhood bar in San Marcos! Tuesday night steak night is amazing. The flavor, texture and price is absolutely amazing. Best steak in town with the best signature drinks around. A great mixed crowd of really cool people, not just college kids, but true locals from all walks. Owned and run by two amazing brothers - They are deeply rooted into this community and really give back in soooo many ways. I love this place, centrally located with great drinks and fun clientele!

reviews.author: Natasha B.
reviews.description: Perfect dog friendly patio, lots of out door seating, drinks where good. Staff was nice

reviews.author: Cheech A. C.
reviews.description: This place was sick, drove by it multiple times and was a huge fan of the aesthetic. Great visuals and vibes for a nice day. The staff was however, sus. They seemed to have attitudes of a bar that is not in a college town but a boujee downtown bar. The bartender who was close to my age charged me for regular priced drinks when we ordered 2/3 of our drinks in the happy hour range. When I came to close out and order our (3rd) last drink. The bartender said "do you mind if I close you out?" I thought this was very odd as it was a Wednesday evening and I was purchasing not only alcohol but food. I do believe they have an amazing food truck that supplies great food. I am sure this was a one time fluke as the rest of the experience was great. I do stand by my opinion that the staff maybe biased to certain crowds so be weary.

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: Love this place!  The Blueberry Sangria is THE BOMB!  Steak night is FABULOUS!  Bartenders are awesome and the atmosphere is fantastic!  I love how diverse the clientele is, and it's just a cool place to be!

reviews.author: Jan B.
reviews.description: I love the queso and fries. I'm addicted. And my bevs are always great. Service is always timely and it has such a relaxing vibe. I always look forward to coming here....

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a great local San Marcos bar that has great service and some really good drinks. It is a fun place to hang out after floating the river! I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Patty T.
reviews.description: If I lived in San Marcos, THIS would be my local go-to spot. Great service, I felt very safe with their COVID rules and regulations. Loved the atmosphere and customer service and ice cold beers. My bestie and I had a mini day in San Marcos as a girls trip within in COVID rules and we loved this little spot. We found it while looking at houses in the neighborhood surrounding the bar. The staff was kind and courteous and the misters and fans were a nice cooling off touch with the Texas heat.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: My favorite hangout bar for casual day drinking and hanging with friends ! Always something going on from live music , art displays , to crawfish boils! They have happy hour everyday from 2-7 ( and all day on Sunday) which include a big 4$ strawberry margarita that I could dieeee for! If you are under 21 you can't stay past 7 which has always been a little upsetting considering some of my friends are underage and they are very strict about it , but still one of my favorite bars on the square .

reviews.author: Adison H.
reviews.description: Awesome spot to hang out and have some drinks. Breezy open feel with plenty of covered seating as well in case of rain. Service is fast and bartenders are very attentive.

reviews.author: Nathan T.
reviews.description: An extremely laid back bar experience. Great place to either start or end a bar crawl. A little crowded at times but that's every bar on the square. Definitely worth checking out

reviews.author: Kendall M.
reviews.description: Hands down my favorite place to get a drink in San Marcos. Great service better drinks, and atmosphere

reviews.author: Terese O.
reviews.description: Awesome bar that really has something for everyone no matter what your age is. They have a great large indoor and outdoor space making it a perfect spot to hang with friends. They even have a food truck that serves tasty bar eats. I love the michelads and bloodies. They offer many beer variations and tasty cocktails. Also, a bonus they offer HH/drink specials!

reviews.author: Stevie K.
reviews.description: Best Bloody Mary around! Cool atmosphere and love how they have their own herb garden out back. Great place to hang with friends, watch sports, and have a good drink in or outside.

reviews.author: Cheyanne H.
reviews.description: Great service, the only bar near downtown that's not riddled with frat guys and sorority girls. Dog friendly, but keep them on the leash! Friendly staff, good environment, easily my favorite bar in the area. Also, the neon sign in the women's bathroom is great, I hear the men's bathroom neon sign is pretty funny too. You must visit this place!

reviews.author: Alto G.
reviews.description: Coolest bar in town. I wish it were less crowded, but you can't be a hater when they do so much right!

name: Taproom Pub and Grub
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: F M.
reviews.description: The beer selection is fantastic. The food is is equally fantastic: good portions, tasty. One of my son's and my favorite places.

reviews.author: Ricardo J.
reviews.description: In response to Samantha S. from my previous review - I am glad that my description was accurate in allowing you to identify the employee to whom I was referring. You said I was "punching down for laughs" when he was greeting me to your establishment.   First of all, he was the one "punching down" since he kept making his jokes loud so that all the other employees around could have a laugh. He never greeted me to the establishment. Also, I kept my mouth shut, took his rudeness in stride, manned up, and moved on. Apparently his and your feelings were hurt by my relatively insignificant review and you just had to make a public display.   I neither live in the area nor will return to your business, and in the end, neither of us should really care.

reviews.author: Tyler E.
reviews.description: Wing size is terrible. The wait was a little longer than I'm used to but that's ok. I just don't understand how small the drum sticks are. They are baby chicken size. WTF.

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: I used to love this place as a young college kid but now that I am older it just didn't cut it for me.   The food is good but it's super sloppy and too much.  The service is okay.  They have a good drink selection.

reviews.author: Anna T.
reviews.description: We were in town and decided to stop by for lunch and reminisce on the good old days. We came in knowing it was under new management but wanted to still give it a shot. The waitress was very attentive and checked in on us often, and when she gave us the menus we instantly realized NOTHING WAS THE SAME. I had always ordered (and was craving) the jalapeño queso burger but that was now named something else, and based on the description I knew I wouldn't be a fan. We both ordered their 1/4 smash burger with grilled onions and a basket of fries. When we got our order we both looked at each other and knew this was not the Taproom we had during college. The food itself was okay (not great as before) and the amount of grilled onions was significantly less... unless we are in an onion shortage I feel more could've been given. After we finished eating we both agreed this would probably be our last time coming for a while. Just not the same.   Again, the waitress was very attentive, checked in often and food was okay, but it's hard to not compare the past to present.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: Food was great, beer was cold.  Place is always noisy, but as it is a pub, I can get past that.    We were seated at the bar and were served by the bartender.  He did a great job, was wonderful to talk to, and made great menu suggestions.    Excellent appetizers...great burgers.    A great stop in SMTX.

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: I like to get The Works burger with some barbecue on the side! For fries i prefer the wedge cut fries. my partner tried the mac n cheese burger and chili cheese fries and they were huge! The don't skimp here, and the service is nice as well.

reviews.author: Sanaz D.
reviews.description: Wonderful burgers! We were a group of 19 people, went in all hungry and got out super happy with the food. Amazing taste of burger and really good service in spite of the busy hour we went in on a Saturday.

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: Mixed feelings about this. I came with a party of seven so I expected the service to be a little delayed. That being said, we all got burgers so I feel like it could have been faster? The food hit the spot after a day on the river but just to get the waiters attention was hard work as they only had 4 people on duty. Then to pay the check again it was another long wait. I can't recommend this place if you're hungry, but if you have the time, sure you should go. Prices were reasonable.

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: This review is long overdue. First time visit last month and we were pleased with overall service and food. The burgers are huge (in my opinion) and they have a nice selection of beers/cocktails. Staff were super pleasant and prompt - it's nice spot for a quick fix at reasonable prices.

reviews.author: Jose M.
reviews.description: Waited over an hour for food to come out and it was just ok. The brisket didn't really have any flavor.  I would not come back to eat at this place

reviews.author: Jeremy B.
reviews.description: Salty with a side of Micro transactions.   I have had a few items here and I would have to say this is the saltiest food in San Marcos and not in a good way.  Their menu is very over priced and boy do they love their micro-transactions or add-ons.  Fries are extra with their expensive and average burgers. BACON is like $2 extra.  They charge you for using a credit card and so much more.   Their queso is Velveeta and rotel and not even that good. Most of their chips they serve with the queso is tiny broken scraps and they get annoyed if you ask for more.   The staff is either uncaring or over-worked. I have had many incidences where I am eating solo and am ignored in getting service initially and after.  This is most likely because the server is more interested in dealing with the beer drinking frat guys. Almost every time I have been there I have been left without a basic refill of water. Many times i have also sat waiting for my food with no sight of my server.   The only saving grace of this place is the half price wings on Wednesday, but even then I would get them to go.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I really enjoy this bar.  It is outdoors and there is ample seating.  I also love looking at the huge variety of plants that cover every inch of this place.  The drinks are good and the staff is friendly. Overall, a great place to unwind and socialize.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Drove up to San Marcos from SA to meet sister and niece to help move into dorms.  They were running late, so decided to stop here for some drks and grab a quick bite.  Place was not that crowded (in the front) and the tables were spaced out.  View was nice to enjoy those strolling by  the sidewalk.  The sign at the front said $3.50 bloody mary's, so I ordered one and it was the bomb (see pic).  Perfect drink that had all the fixin's.  The Chicken and Waffle Bites caught my attention, so I ordered that to hold us over.  These were really good and worth the appetizer! The reason for 2 stars knocked off were the service that was absent throughout our time here.  He disappeared all the time and couldn't find him once my sister and niece showed up.  This service made me decide to go somewhere else for lunch.  The other star was due to being charged full-price for the 2 bloody mary's.  I didn't say anything, as I wasn't sure when the waiter would come back and also felt small businesses need any extra cash during these times.  I still tipped the waiter, since they need money too but not sure how he was so busy with a light audience in the place.

reviews.author: Pam B.
reviews.description: Most delicious burger I've ever eaten!!  The bun is homemade with a hint of sweetness (think Hawaiian Bread) and the patty is thick and cooked perfectly. The fries were also to die for, crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside and perfectly seasoned. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Rebecca C.
reviews.description: They've got a good selection of beers and ciders (for the non-beer drinkers like myself). I come specifically for the pizza burgers. They are my go to burger when I get a burger craving. However, I have heard that all their other specialty burgers are amazing as well.   My one complaint is the service. It's mainly a bar, it's going to be busy- I get it. I've worked the industry. But every time I've gone, something is wrong with my order, I'm double charged on something, or the waitress hardly ever comes to check on us.   I'll keep coming for the amazing burgers- and they deserve the stars, but the service needs some improvement.

reviews.author: Amber F.
reviews.description: Chad was an amazing bartender/server! He let us know his name and was very responsive when we needed him. I would not say we waited for anything really, the food was reasonably priced, and everything was delicious.

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: Look for my previous review y'all.  no resolution was ever made for that experience to ever be forgotten by me or them. They refused to serve me and I refused to stay quiet. I escalated to the owner after his employees all worked together to ensure that customer service is not important to them at all. I spend a lot of money eating out especially to try new things and I support local businesses. But I couldn't try their food because they don't accommodate properly to accept mastercard payment on a to go order (which they now claim they do allow). Hope you all decide to go somewhere else that values you as a customer. Support black owned businesses.  I hope the COVID hits them hard in the pockets.

reviews.author: Dori S.
reviews.description: The server was nice but the food took 45 minutes to come out and was bland. My friend enjoyed his chicken club, but the Guacamole Queso Burger was baaaaad. Just a flavorless burger, buns, meh guac and velvetta queso.  The drinks were very good though. I'll probably only come back for the drinks.

reviews.author: Sara S.
reviews.description: We love the Taproom! The new owners are great. 5 stars all around! Great burgers, tons of draft selections.

name: Oz. Tap House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Katy D.
reviews.description: Always a 12/10 experience, the owners are amazing. The place is clean and family friendly, excellent drinks and even better food. We will be lifelong fans of this awesome spot.

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: My husband and I were in town for the weekend and found this place a short walk from our hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The Bourbon Berry Cocktail was my favorite! We also enjoyed sampling many different beers and wines on tap. Their crispy chicken sandwich was delicious! Very crispy on the outside and moist on in the inside.   They have crowlers and growlers for 25% off everyday. I really wish they had a smaller to go container as I would've loved to have taken some of the Berry cocktail home - I can't justify the cost of it to take home a crowler or growler. We would definitely go back if we were in the area again.

reviews.author: Dhuel F.
reviews.description: Had a good experience with friends. There was a Foosball table and se v eral games to keep you entertained  the food also came out pretty quickly. Definitely worth a go

reviews.author: Leah R.
reviews.description: Great for family and boozers! Very very pleased with service and options. Also playground and huge grass area for little ones to run around

reviews.author: Melissa S.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed this place which was an accidental find on our way back from one of our activities in Austin. It is a self-serve concept, so basically you are given a card to scan anytime you want to order a wine, beer, or a cocktail from one of their many taps. You also place your food order at the counter and they bring it out to you.   The fried avocado tacos were amazing and my significant other really enjoyed whatever tacos he had, which I believe were the Carnitas. Why four stars then? Two reasons. One is I was really confused on how much I should tip. I usually don't struggle with this being a bartender, but since we had to pour our own drinks and order food at the counter , I wasn't comfortable leaving a full 20%. Second, when you are pouring your beer, the price adds up very quick. There was one point my boyfriend poured a pint glass and the beer ended up being $22. That was a bit of a letdown. Otherwise the staff is VERY friendly and welcoming -they run a very tight ship. The bathrooms were exceptionally clean and the layout with a big outdoor patio is a bonus. Highly recommend, just watch the higher ABV beers because they add up fast!

reviews.author: priya r.
reviews.description: Awesome bar food! Wings, fish and chips, quesadillas, house tacos and sweet potato fries were all amazing!!!!!!!!

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: The uniqueness of this place really sets it apart. You are given a card to pour any of the beers on top yourself, which I had seen before and always love. What I hadn't seen was also you can pour wine or cocktails! This experience is perfect for all of those people crawling out of quarantine and not knowing what to do when they cant pour their own drinks. But now you can! And despite the setup involving many hands, Oz. keeps the place sparkling clean.  I can't speak much to the food menu. It's mostly a meat-forward fare. They have a vegan burger patty, but I was told neither of the buns are vegan. Since the patty was really soft, I am not sure it would work as a lettuce wrap. It seems weird to have a vegan patty when you can't have a full vegan burger, but at least there is a vegetarian option.  My mom liked her fish and chips.   I am really just here for the taps though!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: How lucky are we to arrive in Texas and meet this amazing place! It was like stepping in paradise. Delicious food and a whole variety of beers.   We tried a few of the beers and had some Tex-Mex.   I tried the sangria beer. I believe it was number 32 on the panel. If you like sangria and bubbles go for it, It's like sangria with bubbles (GF)  Husband had a few other kinds of beers which I tried and oh Man, It was very good! Nothing like I ever had before.   I also had the house tacos (3) with chicken, steak and fried avocado. The fried avocado was definitely a hit for me. It was full of flavor, creamy and crunchy at the same time.   If you are visiting Austin like us and want to drive away from the city you won't regret going to Oz Tap House.   Also, one of the owners is supper friendly we had the pleasure to speak with Sean briefly. Staff is also very nice, patiently explained to us how tap works.   Thanks Oz Tap House for such a memorable welcome!   I recommend this place to everyone!!

reviews.author: Sofía G.
reviews.description: The food is pretty good, but before get in I saw the reviews and the people says the service is excellent, so I was expecting that, when I walked in the cashier was unfriendly, it feels like she just don't want to work or talk, we asked about the process but still confused, it was our first time there, and don't feel like I can come back just because we saw the cashier were nice with other people but not with us, GREAT FOOD i can't say the same with the service.

reviews.author: Marlene Z.
reviews.description: The whole process is confusing. I don't like pouring beer since it can get messy. They messed up my order. The burger then quickly fell apart. Disappointing. Probably won't visit again since there's other better burger places that pour beer for you.

reviews.author: Kerri A.
reviews.description: I just ordered lunch from Oz tap house. We got fish and chips, fried pickles,  a baked pretzel, a Caesar salad and a cheesesteak.   The pro's: The ranch dressing that came with the fried pickles was pretty good, As was the coleslaw.   The cons:  The fish and chips portion was small and soggy. It was two pieces of greasy fish, that iterally had no flavor. Fish and Chips is one of my favorite foods and I've had it all over the world. Never had I gotten it without flavor. How do you make something taste like nothing? Granted. I asked that the fish and chips have no hot pepper on it. Unfortunately, Hot pepper is the only spice Oz uses.  The fries were cold inside - clearly not hand-cut. The Caesar salad, was spicy in a weird way. It was not good.  The Philly Cheesesteak was very very spicy and greasy.  The Baked Pretzel - Auntie Ann's does a better job, this was a VERY basic, previously frozen pretzel. Nothing special and not worth the price.  The fried pickles - under seasoned and instead of crisp, they were chewy. Again not good.    Everything was extremely spicy, from the fish and chips to the Caesar salad. Food items that traditionally aren't spicy, were all grossly over spiced with hot peppers. Oz Tap House needs to learn how to use spices without making things spicy. Go back to cooking school - Spiced and Spicy! There is a difference! One more thing,  Read dietary notes. There's a reason why people write them.

reviews.author: Sara O.
reviews.description: Ya know what, I loved this place. We came for the patio,but it was kind of crowded so we sat inside. We were greeted when we walked in,had the process explained etc.  Beers, a couple of ciders,and wines on tap. Pretty cool. I did semi accidentally pour myself 9 oz of wine, so it was a $12 glass, not what I'd typically spend on a glass of wine, but I also typically wouldn't be served 9 oz.  Our food came out quickly and it was really good!  I don't know much it was (folks mentioned auomatic gratuity) bc my husband paid, but it was great and we will definitely come back. They had a playground in the back that we saw,which would be great to come to with our lil people.

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: Stopped by Oz. Tap House for the first time after a Vandegrift H.S. football game, recommended to us by a family member.  "Go to Oz (pronounced Oz, like wizard of Oz) Tap House, is great.  First things first, we realized later it's not Oz it's Oz.  Notice the period after the z.  Oz. = ounce!  Makes perfect sense when you see the concept.  Dozens of self-serve taps, pouring cocktails, beer, wine, etc.  Way cool!  We couldn't tell how much vodka was actually in the Cosmos we had, but they were tasty!  The Community brand ice tea off the charts too.  Any place serving Community products knows their stuff ... oh yeah, the food.  Definitely "gotta go back for more" fare.  Fried cauliflower and jalapeños, nice ranch sauce.  Our server, unprompted, brought some buffalo wing sauce, "dip a little in here, then the ranch."  Awesomeness!  House tacos and cod tacos were delicious, depths of sublime flavors layered into top shelf flour tortillas.  Our only observation was using the house taco slaw on the cod tacos may be a better pairing than the sautéed cabbage... at any rate, the tacos were outstanding.  We'll definitely be back, lots more on the menu to explore.  And a special shout out to James working the register.  Explained the concept, led us through the process, and answered quite a few "newbie" questions.  He was great, no need to hire more employees, clone James!

reviews.author: Michaela M.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place being so close to home and having a huge selection of beers with some wine. The food was average but the outdoor area was super fun for my kiddos.

reviews.author: Rafael G.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a Sunday patio meal at oz Taphouse. They have a very clean, really cool indoor and outdoor patio. They are also dog friendly outside as long as they're leashed. I had a half order of carnitas nachos which was pretty good sized. Some of the chips were a little stale so that was my only nagative feedback. We also tried a house burger with fries which was solid. Overall they have good food and the patio is nice. Try it out!

reviews.author: Allison R.
reviews.description: I got the Brie berry burger. Everything tasted really good and I was so impressed that the burger was actually medium rare and was very pink and juicy! The onion rings were just okay. The breading wasn't very flavorful and kept falling off and the onions were not crispy. We also got the house tacos and the beef was good, and the fried avocado was amazing! Really liked the sauce they used!

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: Great place to hang and have drinks with friends while the kiddos go to town on the playset.  The card drinking system is fun and the drink selection is outstanding.    Taking 2 stars off because the food is sub par.  We've been here a few times and yet to have anything that impresses.  Tacos are dry, nachos inedible, and the chicken sandwich was such a disappointment.

reviews.author: Beth L.
reviews.description: Fun atmosphere. Good food. Variety of options.  What really stuck out to us last night was customer service - from the front order person to the in-house table bussers, and the "tap Bosses" or so to speak.  They pay attention to what's going on. They make you feel like you are the most important person that has come in all day... and it was great to see lots of customers supporting this small business.  Plus, of course, there are MANY drink choices to sample and enjoy!!

reviews.author: Rosaura A.
reviews.description: Looooved it, absolutely!  Taking my California family there, when they come out for a visit, from Santa Barbara.    Great concept with "brew tastings."  Food was scrumptious!!!  Going back for date night soon!

reviews.author: John D.
reviews.description: Great review for Oz. Tap House. Veteran owned. I came with no expectation, but was blown away by the food and drink, and most importantly the customer service. I had no idea the owner himself took my drink order, I had a berry stubborn vodka. They were expert in explaining all the options. For dinner, I had the Oz. House Burger and fries, it was very good. Would recommend.

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience here for lunch. I have loved having Easy Tiger breads from Whole Foods at home, but did not realize they had restaurants, too.   We tried out the Lamar location and it was extremely tasty and a super chill atmosphere. They have a great outdoor patio area that is quiet but comfortable (even had heaters and fans).   What I was most impressed by was how the staff accommodated the needs of an ADA guest that was sitting with us. They really went above and beyond to make everyone comfortable. I will definitely be back soon.   PS - Try the beets, they're delicious!

reviews.author: Avery P.
reviews.description: So I traditionally love Easy Tiger and we frequent the North location for happy hour pretty often. We ventured to this South location excited that they have an outdoor space for kids.  The good:  Beautiful place with indoor and outdoor seating Fenced area for kids to run around Delicious food, beer, coffee  The not-so-great: When we arrived, there were a ton of open tables but we were told there was a 30 minute wait to be seated. After roaming around for a while and seeing none of tables were getting used, we asked and were told that they were giving the kitchen a "chance to catch up." I wish they would have let us go ahead and get seated while we waited The prices seem to really be going up. $14 for a pretzel? I mean they're delicious and the cheese sauce is amazing, but I'll probably never order one again if they're the price of an entre.  In conclusion, we'll probably be back, but if we have the kids with us, we'd probably only go for happy hour or just coffee and pastries rather than a full meal. It's just too long a wait and too pricey for a family meal.

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: Loved the variety of outdoor seating options, particularly the non-smoking upstairs area. They do trivia in that section on Tuesday nights, so expect it to be packed. There are ceiling heaters for the colder days, and long family-style seating primarily. That patio also has a bar, or you can order food through table service as well.  Mostly glutenous things on the menu, so would not recommend for special dietary needs. I had the waffle fries, which were tasty and served in a small bowl. Would definitely return again.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: I still remember the first time we went there. It was on the slow end of Dirty Sixth, where the old Havana location was.   I recall it vividly because of an interesting Interaction I had with the bartender.  As I looked at the menu, I asked about the pastrami and he said, "Its good. So good in fact, it's the second best in town, behind Pious Pizza."  I remember thinking how it was honest but cocky at the same time. Sure, you may not think it's the best, but you sure you're second best?  Well, he was right.  Fast forward to a cool, hazy night in 2022 at their South Lamar location. First of all, the building is immaculate, an intentional nod to their style and culture. I love it.  My wife had the prosciutto baguette, which was delicious. Although the bread almost stole the show on that one.  The kiddo had the chicken schnitzel and, man, who puts that much effort into a kids plate? Really tasty and well executed.  I, like always, went with old faithful, the pastrami sandwich. My old friend was as delicious as always, as it didn't disappoint. The bread was great but didn't come close to stealing the limelight.   I've always worried about Easy Tiger turning into one of those Austin brands (talking to you Torchy) that loses its way, and I'm sure some may feel that way, but the experience at South Lamar could've been back at that old Sixth Street basement.   Five stars, folks.

reviews.author: Joanna L.
reviews.description: I have been dying to go to Easy Tiger ever since they opened on South Lamar. Today I was craving pastrami in particular and was in the neighborhood so I decided to go get the pastrami sandwich to go.   First impressions: convenient location, lots of parking options, clean restaurant and bathrooms, friendly but unknowledgeable staff, quick service but the restaurant was nearly empty at 3pm in the afternoon.   When I checked out at the counter I was taken back by the price. $23 for a sandwich ($18+ tip). Probably the most expensive sandwich I've ever ordered, even when staying at a five-star hotel and ordering room service. OUCH. I still purchased it in hopes for a big fat pastrami sandwich that I could possibly split up for two meals.   When I got back to home and opened the sandwich I was hugely disappointed. Where was the meat?! It only had a thin layer of pastrami and sauerkraut between two thick slices of oversized bread. WHAT?   The taste was average to mediocre. Absolutely nothing special about this sandwich. Bland, no substance, too much bread. I felt ripped off.   On the positive side the sandwich was homemade (fresh baked bread) and fresh prepared  sauerkraut and dressing, so at least I knew it was quality food/whole food and not processed junk. Sadly that wasn't enough to make it remarkable or worth the price. I was also very disappointed it did not include a big fat pickle. That would be a very easy and tasty addition.   This is Austin full of amazing food and amazing restaurants. Easy Tiger does not make the cut for me, nor would I recommend it to anyone else local or coming from out of town.   Recommendations to management: pile on the pastrami, reimagine the sauce and include a pickle. House made potato chips or even any kind of potato chips would have helped justify the price a little. Also, more training and knowledge needed for the staff as they could not answer my questions about the products and menu items.   Don't waste your money and time on a boring sandwich. I so wanted to love this place.

reviews.author: Jelexus M.
reviews.description: Okay so, I ran across this post of super cute bars in Austin. Well of course I had too try them ALL. Starting with Easy Tiger.  Location: upon arrival it looks like an outdoor situation but once you park your car around the back you slowly realize it's a indoor/outdoor vibe. Areas have great coverage from the sun and I love that they have fans as well as Heaters on the ceiling!   Food: The Food was Fan-Freaking-Tastic. I won't lie first glance at the menu I was ehh. Nevertheless I asked my waiter chandler what should I order he made wonderful recommendations.   The pretzel  10/10: crispy outside pillowy soft inside   The Cajun Chicken Sausage 10/10: that prefect snap you want from any sausage casing and the home made Chow-Chow was the prefect topping.   The breakfast potatoes  10/10 : It was like the par-boiled the pots then fried them    Brussels sprouts 8/10 : Great flavor just wanted them a little more tender   Our cocktails 8/10  We order 3 different kinds all three were just okay.   The dessert and bread too take home was also really good.   All in All I would definitely recommend stopping by.

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: This one hurts my heart because I had been so eager to come here.   A big group of myself and a bunch of other girls had decided that Easy Tiger was the place we wanted to support this night! I was so excited because, like I said, this was a top place on my list of places to go!  We had called the day of to make sure they could accommodate a large group. They said yes. We let them know when we were coming that night and how many of us it would be. All good (we thought)!  Our group starts to arrive at Easy Tiger and we realize that they thought we were coming the next morning and not the time we had told them. Okay, no biggie, we can fix this. We had also been told that there were only two servers that night. You could tell they were overwhelmed. We had made it clear that we wanted to make it as easy as possible for our server since there were so many of us. We were told that they would be able to give us two long tables next to each other so our group would be at least semi close. This didn't happen. Again, whatever... It just kind of sucked.  Now on to food! Yay! Most of us were starving. I can't speak for everyone else but I decided on the Pretzel. It looked so good in the IG photos. When it came out (fast if I may say), it was cold and not soft :( The cheese and other sides it came with felt like they were just taken out of the freezer. Inedible. Sad Ashley.  I drank a Peach Mule that was A1!! That was the highlight of my time here!  Would definitely come back, sit at the bar, and maybe order something different. I'm sure this was just a case of miscommunication and I'm excited to give them a second chance!

reviews.author: Harriet D.
reviews.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I always leave with a fresh loaf of sourdough bread. The pretzel and beer cheese is the perfect snack if you're attending one of their weekly trivia nights. My personal favorite sausage is the kielbasa - it tastes as amazing as it looks. My favorite cocktail here is their aperol spritz, or one of their weekly beers on tap if I'm doing well in trivia and need to keep my brain on. Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, bakery, food and coffee AND has a full bar. Excellent bread. Breakfast all the way to midnight this is a great place to go. Also has a rooftop deck. The price is right as well. Young and trendy without any of the modern pretentiousness.   Very welcoming.

reviews.author: Jevin H.
reviews.description: The beer at here was pretty good. I liked the heavenly haze and my friend got the pog-slammer. Haze was a IPA similar to electric jellyfish from pint house. Pog had very citrus-y flavors which I liked. I also got the pretzel which was decently sized. The dips were good for the pretzel.  The bad part... the service. We ordered three beers the first time around, which took around 15 minutes to arrive. The beers weren't really cold at this point. I am not sure how that would be possible but I expect it to be the waiting staff seemingly lounging around talking to each other doing nothing. We asked for the waitress and it took an additional 10 minutes for her to arrive. We then ordered more food and drinks which took additionally extremely long amounts of time. The kicker was that there were two other seated tables so the place was basically empty. I would really recommend going to the 7th location over this one, at least while the current waiting staff is still doing what they did when we went.   Food was alright. Service was shockingly bad.

reviews.author: Zulema R.
reviews.description: It's a Wednesday at 1:30 P - there is a ton of people at this location - parking lot practically full. I'm not sure if this is a usual occurrence. If it is, they do not have enough staff so accommodate everyone.   The hostess was lovely and sat us down immediately but we sat for 10 minutes without any water or waiter for our section.   Please hire more people

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: I like the ambience. During the day time, you can study, meet up with a friend, or go on a date! There is parking, indoor seating, and outdoor patio.   They have great pretzels and drinks. If you go from 7-10 am on the weekdays, they have $5 special of any coffee with pastry!

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: We stopped by for a late lunch on a Monday and this place did not disappoint. We decided to sit in the upstairs area. Our food and drinks arrived promptly and everything was delicious. I haven't visited after work which tends to be more lively.   Overall pleasant experience and menu prices are reasonable. If you're new in town or just visiting, it's worth a trip - I do recommend.

reviews.author: Dave A.
reviews.description: I went mid-afternoon to pick up salad and bread. They texted me ahead to let me know they were out of pre-sliced bread but had whole loaf of same flavor. I accepted it but had wanted pre-sliced. There is a lot of construction underway and it makes parking cramped.   Also, I could not locate the curbside spots. I went to the host stand to pick up. Nearly got run over by an impatient driver driving around the "Slow Down, Stay Awhile" sign. Ironic.   The Winter Kale salad seems overpriced for the portion size. It is tasty, just on the small side.   The North side location is much better. Maybe this one will improve after construction.

reviews.author: Vivian C.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed the atmosphere! My fiancé and his dad enjoyed the beers here, while his mom and I happily sipped our latte. All great.   We all shared a sourdough bread and wow it tasted so fresh and tasty! It was as if it was freshly baked (which I believe that's what they advertised) and it was more than enough to take home to enjoy for breakfast the next day. We also all shared the sausage sampler with the sauces that go with each sausage which I LOVED. Each of them had their own taste and they did an excellent job pairing them with the appropriate sauce.   As for my entrée, I ordered the prosciutto baguette which was quite huge! Very delightful, but I ended up not finishing it. Their bread portions are very generous.   Would love to come back!

reviews.author: Dawn S.
reviews.description: A beautiful fall evening in Austin deserved a patio visit. We sat upstairs and the view didn't disappoint. We just missed the sunset but the sky was still stunning.  We grabbed some menus and decided on drinks and a giant pretzel. We also got the charcuterie board. My friend got a margarita which is said was 4/10 on a scale of margs. I tasted it and to me it tasted like a melted frozen margarita. Way too sweet for my liking. I wanted a cab (wine of choice) which they didn't have...I got a Malbec which wasn't horrible but I prefer a good bold cab.  The pretzel was great as always and the charcuterie board was well laid out. Neither one of us like the almonds. They had some sort of oil on them. What I really was sad about was the jam. I was hoping for a fig jam but it was not. My first bite was not good at all. I even asked the waitress what it was...she very nicely called down to the kitchen on her little mic and found out that it was a strawberry ginger jam. Those two flavors do not go together in my personal opinion. The ginger was way too strong and over powering.  The cheeses on the cheese board from Antonelli's Cheese Shop were on point. The goat cheese with honey was great. The blue cheese was yum and the Gouda was "Gouda".  ba dum tss.   Overall- this place is a no brainer for a casual night with friends over a pretzel and a beautiful view.

reviews.author: Sean Matthew L.
reviews.description: Easy Tiger has a warm special place in my heart. When their 6th street location closed I was so sad, but then like gremlins overnight they multiplied in the best of ways. Having an east austin, and south austin offering and more is such a boon.   We love their snacking/grazing boards. What millennial wouldn't? They're basically adult lunchables. Meats and cheeses and nuts and jams, oh my.   The pretzels and beer cheese are also legendary. But so much so that they sadly often run out of pretzels like they did for us the other day.   We love the use of covered and outdoor seating, especially in this time.   Wanting more substantial fare, they got you. The sausages, pastrami, the blt, all incredible. Really you can't go wrong. So, go!

reviews.author: Linda M.
reviews.description: Easter Sunday and no reservations? No problem. My friends and I decided to check out the new South Austin location of Easy Tiger. It was my suggestion and, thankfully, everyone loved it!  We started with a cinnamon knot, a soft pretzel with mustard, and a round of mimosas. The pretzel was out of this world! Warm, with a light sprinkling of Kosher salt, a crispy exterior and the lightest, fluffiest interior EVER!  We got it with a nice whole grain mustard; cheese was an optional side. The cinnamon knot was pretzel dough in a different shape with a sprinkling of cinnamon (it was savory, not sweet). Good, too, but it wasn't warm, so it got overlooked as we focused on the warm pretzel. As you can see from my photos, we were overcome with hunger and I almost didn't get a picture of the pretzel at all! It was that good.  We moved on to the Grazing Board, a side salad, and avocado toast.  The grazing board was truly a show stopper. It included a blue cheese, guyere, and brie, Prosciutto, sweet red grapes, dark and white raisins, slices of sour dough and walnut cranberry bread, tiny, tiny gherkins, candied walnuts, apricots, whipped butter and other toppings. It was visually stunning, but equally delicious. The house salad had the best, giant croutons and a light, delicious dressing with fresh greens, cherry tomatoes, radish slices. The avocado toast was a thick slice of grilled sour dough topped with a generous mound of mashed avocado, cherry tomatoes, and thinly sliced radishes. Delicious!  The space at the S. Lamar location is very nice, bright and open. There are several outdoor seating areas, so no problem finding a spot to sit. There might be an issue finding parking, as the parking lot is small (and each parking space is tiny!)  I cannot wait to go back and try some other things on the menu as everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked good. I want to try it all!

reviews.author: Sabrina B.
reviews.description: This is a joint review from me and my partner. We went on two separate occasions. I went with my coworkers on a Thursday for an outing/birthday. The place itself is cute. Allows dogs. Twinkling lates. Cornhole off to the side. Just a cute, trendy, Austin-like place. But the experience was lack luster. The food took very long. The establishment didn't own enough cups, so part of us had to share cups or just didn't have water. The food was mediocre, save the fries. In this kind of weather, you should be prepared for flies to constantly fly around and land on your food. The drinks are also weak and the time between them will sober you up.   My partner went a separate time. This time I had three things to eat: a strawberry and goat cheese salad, French toast bites, and ricotta toast to share. The salad was ok, but smelled absolutely rank. Even the vinaigrette smelled super off, and not in a heavy-in-vinegar kind of way. The goat cheese wasn't the best, and frankly you could see the indentation of the packaging. The French toast bites bad poor texture. You'd expect to use a slightly stale brioche but instead was a baguette style. It was not soaked enough in the egg mix before cooking for it to have a fluffy texture. Instead, it was hard and unenjoyable. A poor quality baguette instead of the nice ones at real boulangeries. The ricotta toast was the best part, but still wasn't that great. Texture was also off, like an overcooked steak that takes too much force to rip apart. Not only that, but the food took 1 hour to get here.  At the end, they took his card and forgot to return it for 30 minutes. Couldn't get a hold of the waiter and left very late due to him forgetting about us.  Twice have they been very disappointing! Don't recommend this place unless you just want to waste money on a company credit card or take your young mother-in-law that you hate.

reviews.author: Piyush A.
reviews.description: What a gem on South Lamar! There are some business that have survived the pandemic, some that have folded, but there are very few that have creatively embraced it. Easy Tiger has gone beyond that where they started the business during the pandemic and built something absolutely majestic.   Drinks - Ofcourse the beer selection is amazing but the best part is that there is something for everyone. They have a great selection of wine and some really cool cocktails.   Food - This was a pleasant surprise. I have never heard my food snob wife utter the words "This may be the best avocado toast I've ever had" .. not just that the Brussels sprouts are a delight and the egg sandwich is really good too  Ambience - This is where they go from being great to phenomenal.. the outdoor area is a perfect setup and the best part is that they have a little kiddie park for the little ones. All this overlooking the green belt.. does/can it get any better?   One thing to add .. on a good day parking lot gets full very fast so plan accordingly!   A must must go for a nice sunny day or otherwise :)

reviews.author: Alan A.
reviews.description: Amazing tour, Michael was a great host. He was so attentive and helped in every way. The tour was flexible and very fun. The children, 4 and 9, were entertained also. Michael asked many questions as to ensure the experience was what we wanted. Great time thank you so much.  Alan A US Army Ret.

reviews.author: Sarita S.
reviews.description: This was a surprise bday gift and it didn't disappoint! Mike was awesome and friendly...took us to some really great spots and on gave us the grand tour through texas hill country! definitely the best way to go if you want to experience the best of the best! well done!!

reviews.author: Ana R.
reviews.description: Definitely recommend! From our initial inquiry to the tour itself they were so accommodating and flexible! I filled out an inquiry form and then was contacted right away. We booked a private tour for a couples trip. Alee was great in providing suggestions and making sure to fit what we wanted as part of the tour. We got to tour Hawk's Shadow, then had a tasting at Duchman and ended our tour with some delicious BBQ from Salt Lick, next to Salt Lick Cellars. Tom, our driver was so nice and flexible with our schedule. He reminded us of how much time we had but did not feel rushed at all. We'll definitely be booking Slowpokes for any future trips!

reviews.author: Ana K.
reviews.description: Amazing wine tour. Our group was small but it was perfect. Linda really took care of us and was so much fun. You really need to check it out if you are looking at wine tours.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: This was soooo much fun! We did this for a bachelorette party and we had a blast! Lindsey was our Tour Guide/Bus Driver/Photographer/DJ/New Bestie! She was AMAZING!!!! I would highly recommend this Tour! We did Deep Eddie, Last Stand Brewing Company and Treaty Oak!

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: Linda was fantastic and this wine tour was great! I was with a bunch of rather rowdy girl friends and she was endlessly patient and took good care of us. We had a great time and I recommend this company!

reviews.author: Deryck Z.
reviews.description: Linda is the best!!!! We did a tour for a bachelorette party and it was prefect. The personal touch Linda added made it so wonderful. She provide a very nice lunch and snack trays. Everything about the tour went so smoothly and was planned our perfectly. We even were picked up at our rental house so no one had to drive after drinking. All the girls on the tour said they would defiantly do another tour with Slowpokes Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Julie S.
reviews.description: Great day with Lindsey as our driver and tour guide! Highly recommend them-very fun day for our mom and daughter's weekend!

reviews.author: Thu F.
reviews.description: We have an annual girls trip and decided on a tour with Slowpokes Wine Tours.  There was a total of 8 girls on the tour with a couple that was paired with us and we were the perfect group.  Linda was the best tour guide anyone can ask for.  Our group had a blast and the lunch was an added bonus on the tour!  She kept us informed along the way and gave us the best details of each winery/distillery that we visited.  Linda was very personable and every location we visited had its own special charm!  Thanks for an amazing tour Slowpokes Wine Tours.

reviews.author: Kathy F.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a wonderful day set up by Linda at Slowpokes.  After talking with her she designed a day that was diverse and showed us a number of new things in the Dripping Springs area.  Our day included several of the high country wineries, one brewery and a visit to the quaint town of Wimberly. We highly recommend this group over  other Austin wine tour groups as they create a very personalized day and made sure everyone enjoyed the stops.   Our day started with lunch at Homespuns in Dripping Springs - excellent start to a beautiful day!  The Bloody Marys are highly recommended.

reviews.author: Brit F.
reviews.description: We recently completed a bachelorette party tour with Lindsey as our tour guide and it was the BEST! Lindsey chose our wineries very wisely; we started with lunch at Crowson (whose owner will drop incredible knowledge on you), enjoyed a rainstorm and a glass of red at the beautiful Ron Yates, and ended with cheese and BOOOOM wine at Hye Meadow Winery. It was lovely day of booze, conversation, and sisterhood. And, yes, we loved Lindsey so much she became a part of our wolfpack. Lindsey was fun, energetic, and knowledgeable about the area. I would definitely do this tour again!

reviews.author: April D.
reviews.description: I decided to surprise my mom with a wine tasting tour for her 60th birthday. Linda went above and beyond to make this tour special. She made a wine bottle with me and my moms photo on it with a sweet birthday message and quote.  She took so many photos of us, and really made us feel special. We were able to choose our wineries and she even picked us up and dropped us off at our BNB. She had the most amazing tapas tray, with cheese, mixed nuts, her special dip, crackers, breads and meats. She had this prepared and sat out for us at Wimberly winery,  halfway through the tour. At the end of this stop, she even had cupcakes for my moms birthday. I had actually called around different wine tours in the area and Slow Poke Wine tours offered the best value and I can tell you now, the best service. We wouldn't hesitate to do it again. This trip with my mom was priceless and so special. I thank you Linda for making an amazing memory for my mom and I.

reviews.author: Amanda W.
reviews.description: We used Slowpokes tour for my bachelorette party, Linda was great, she picked us up at the door of our rental house and had a perfect day planned for us. We went to a beautiful winery to begin and enjoyed a lunch spread while there; then we went to a distillery with AMAZING frozen mint juleps, outdoor games and great scenic views; finally we ended at the olive oil and balsamic producer for more snacks and great wine. Linda was very attentive to us and did a great job of keeping us on schedule without rushing us, she picked us up around 10:30AM and we returned around 4:30PM. Hope to enjoy this tour again in the future, a very diverse experience that I think even the guys would enjoy!

reviews.author: Mandy L.
reviews.description: I recently went on a bachelorette party with 9 girls with Slowpokes Wine Tours. It was absolutely perfect. Linda was so sweet and incredibly helpful. We didn't have to worry about anything! As soon as Linda picked us up she took care of everything. We just walked in and started having fun. She went above and beyond to make our day perfect.

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: Wow!  What a fantastic time!  Linda was on time, knowledgeable, NICE, funny, and showered us with attention.  She had everything taken care of - all we had to do is get off the van, taste wines and get back on again for the next stop. What service!  I highly, highly recommend Slowpokes and will definitely be seeing Linda again!

reviews.author: Julie G.
reviews.description: I could have sworn I wrote a review on here prior, but I JUST WENT ON MY SECOND slowpoke wine tour and it was just as wonderful as the first.  While a small group, Linda and Dave do an outstanding job of making everyone feel comfortable, no matter what the group size.  This time we went to 3 different venues and what a great experience.  They don't miss any detail.  They make the day enjoyable and relaxing.  Looking for the best wine tour in the Hill Country?  Look no further.  Slowpokes is the tour to book!

reviews.author: Trey C.
reviews.description: I used Slowpokes Winery Tours to go on a Hill Country wine tour on the day I got engaged, and I could not have asked for a better experience.  My now fiancée and I rode in the Model T Ford, which was all-original except for the brakes. I contacted Linda with any questions, concerns, and booking, and Linda picked up my fiancée in a Mercedes van.  We went to a great breakfast, and then David drove us around in the Model T Ford. The route was scenic, breathe taking, and beautiful.  The wineries we stopped at were great, and, the customer service from Linda and David was unbeatable.  They have a unique business that is more than just a van or limo driving you around to distilleries, breweries, or wineries (although they also have a Mercedes van option).  I am now going on another tour with them for a bachelor party, and they could not have provided more prompt replies to my requests for information related to travel, pick up at different locations, types of tours they offer, and pricing.  What a great business run by some truly nice and professional people who offer very reasonable pricing.  I plan to use their services again in the future.

reviews.author: Tara G.
reviews.description: Sour Beer? Say less!! Oh my goodness yes it's what you never knew you needed!   Staff was hospitable and knowledgeable. 1st timer with zero stress.

reviews.author: KayTee K.
reviews.description: My favorite brewery! Love, love, love the beer so much. They also do some really fun events! My favorite the candy themed anniversary! Blueberry cobbler is my favorite.   Jeff if you read this- please put warhead on the tap regularly :)

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: Blue Owl Brewing is known for their sour beers. I am happy to report that they also have a normal pilsner and IPA, as well as ciders and some sort of frozen beer drink. The bartender was super friendly and let us know we could split a tasting between the two of us (one of us would get a glass cup we could keep and the other person would get a plastic cup).
