Since I am currently short on glasses, I chose the cup I wanted. They had 4 choices at varying prices. We really enjoyed all of the beers we had - they are definitely unique. I did the hazy IPA and a coconut IPA. They also have a ton of soft shirts for sale, which I am a big fan of. This is a great spot to grab a cold beer on summer day, since there is indoor seating, as well as a covered patio. I will definitely return to this little gem.

reviews.author: Quinn H.
reviews.description: Buyer Beware!!   You don't get to have a choice in whether or not to buy a souvenir beverage receptacle :(  Unfortunately, Blue Owl Brewing doesn't sell beer. It sells cups and glasses, which come with beer in them.   I paid $9 for a cheap blue plastic souvenir cup in order to get one beer. I was traveling to Austin by airplane (during the weekend of the TSA meltdown at the airport) and don't have room to carry around a cheap plastic cup, much less a glass.    If you think you might want to drink two beers you have to upgrade to buying a glass for $22, which then entitles you to two beers, at $11 each. One of which comes in the mandatory souvenir glass -whether you want it or not- and the other in an even cheaper clear plastic cup. If you want to share four beers with friends you have to buy the largest glass for $32 (I may be off slightly regarding the price) and they will give you a souvenir glass and three, even cheaper, plastic disposable cups. You can also choose to refill the same glass four times. In any case this will cost you $8 per beer which is the cheapest options if you're looking for volume.  Please note, you are not allowed to bring your own reusable glass/mug/plastic cup and buy the beer. Because, this place sells cups and glasses. Not beer. The beer is a byproduct of buying a glass.  From an environmental perspective, this is not a responsible business model. Stop selling plastic cups and start selling beer. Get a dishwasher so you a can re-use your glass inventory.  When you go to a brewery it's usually because you want beer. Not a glass. If you do want a glass you can pick one up at the gift shop. Honestly, my friend and I should have walked out after learning of the cup-buying scheme, but we had just walked two miles to get there, and watching the confusion spread over the faces of thirsty consumers who came in after us was priceless.   Locals with B.O.B. growlers didn't seem to mind. I have no idea what a growler would cost, or how many,even cheaper, plastic cups it comes with.  We won't be going back unless they start selling beer instead of glasses. The business model didn't sit well with either of us. Granted this is a subjective observation. One star for the server as she was polite and seemed a little exasperated in explaining the business model. One star for the beer, they have some good flavors here. And one more for the atmosphere as it had a nice vibe.  We both placed our cheap blue plastic souvenir cups on top of the growing stack of other cheap blue plastic souvenir cups  in the recycle bin on the way out.

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: So I'm a big fan of being fair, so here goes. A friend and I stopped by while in Austin and the place was packed. I think we got there at the right time because we were able to secure a seat inside where it was considerably cooler than the outside seating.   The process for ordering was fairly simple and the lady helping me was kind enough to break it down for a new out-of-towner. We got 4 sour beers and they were really interesting. On this particular occasion I had a new experience after I finished my 2nd sour beer. I learned that sour beer gives me heart burn. 1st time ever. I was asking my friend what this fire in my chest was. She loved the sour beers she ordered and we got glasses to remember the occasion. BOB... you'll always be my first.   I recommend checking it out and if you like sour beers Blue Owl Brewing will put a smile on your face. The staff is friendly and hip, and the beer flows as does the good times.   Prohst!!!

reviews.author: Kelly M.
reviews.description: We loved coming to Blue Owl Brewing!! When we came, they only had the patio open for drinking at the brewery due to COVID, which was nice and very comfortable.   We ordered a glass and got 4 beers with the glass, if you are not able to finish your 4 beers, they will let you take the extras to go in cans! I believe the size we got was $20 per person. They had about 3 different options for sizes of glasses. The girl said we could even share one order if we wanted less beers per person.  I love all the options of the beers (they are all "sour" and DELICIOUS)!! My all time favorite that I tried was the Jubilberry!  The only complaint I would have was parking was a little hard to find but we ended up parking in a lot close by.  We will definitely be coming back when in Ausitn!

reviews.author: Catherine F.
reviews.description: The worst brewery experience of my life. Extremely long line, only one woman was working. We ordered canned beers and went outside to the patio are. She came outside and said we had to drink canned beers off the property and took away our drinks saying she could bring us new ones in glasses -- AND SHE NEVER came back. There was NO CLEAR MARKING that canned beers were equivalent to to go beers and QR code's we're on the tables with the option to order canned beers. Little to no seating and a water fan was blowing, causing the customers to get wet. I would never recommend this place!

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: Great sour beers! You can't beat their deal where you pay $20 for 4 beers and you get to keep the glass. Honestly, you can't go wrong with  any of the beers they have. I'd recommend the little boss or the van dayum.

reviews.author: Michelle D.
reviews.description: This was our 3rd time being here....as we live in Dallas....but every time we visit we come.  They always have great brews and flavors.  The staff if exceptionally nice and has great customer service. I'm not a beer fan but I do love their Peach and Blueberry beers!  Their coolest thing is for $20 you get a great glass with beer and 3 others in plastic cups. Cool concept and a lot of beer in pours.  Getting a great following and you should go!!

reviews.author: Madeline C.
reviews.description: I don't know how I've failed to review this place yet, because I literally purchase something from here every week and finally got to sit on their patio during a beautiful sunny Sunday. I cannot recommend it enough -- thought I didn't like sour beer, oh boy I was wrong. Absolutely ADORE the Tangerina, Tiki Hop Totem, Plum de Plume, Limetastico and Jubilberry beers. And they had a Plum de Plume + mango beer slushee, so yum! Patio was very full on Sunday so we had to wait to snag an outdoor table but it was worth it. The staff is always incredibly nice and feels safe for COVID. Every Thursday they spin a wheel for a growler deal -- entire growler of amazing beer for $9! And their merch is so cute, definitely have a koozie collection now. Biggest perk of in-person is if you buy a beer glass (pictured here with a very cool design) you get 4 pours for $16. It really doesn't get better than this.

reviews.author: Nishanth E.
reviews.description: Absolutely tremendous sours, possible the best I've had in the country! Would highly recommend any of their sours ranging from iLimetastico to Teeny Hopper. Picked up some cans to go as well on the way out, would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Austin and specifically around that area.

reviews.author: Kelsey G.
reviews.description: ONLY SOURS- not nice servers. The girls working were not friendly or welcoming. If you are looking for a well rounded brewery this is NOT IT! They serve only sours + 1 Pilsner. Also, policy is not ideal. You have to buy a pint glass for at least $25 in order to drink. Glass was cute, ambience outside was nice

reviews.author: Rebekah G.
reviews.description: The beer is amazing, but I'm not a fan of the 4-drink i policy. I know you can spread them out over a month or get cans, but it makes it a little harder.

reviews.author: Libby B.
reviews.description: A brewery that does only sours! I was so happy to find this place while exploring East Austin. You know, it's been a while since I walked around a neighborhood without my phone constantly telling me where to go. This time I did, and Cesar Chavez led me here and to so many other amazing spots!   You walk in, order a glass that you get to keep! And then you get 4 beers in that glass! The best part? If you are like me and get the cool goblet at 16 oz. you can't drink that much beer at once. You can keep your tasting card and come back for the other 1 or 2 that you maybe couldn't do at visit #1! I think the limit is about a month between visits, but I'm not sure. Honestly, we came here 3 times. One time we didn't have our tasting cards so just did 4 tasting size glasses. Yes, we are big fans and came back to Indy with 4 glasses!   The patio is covered which is great during Texas spring/summer. If you're lucky, and someone leaves and hands you their card, double bonus!   I highly recommend visiting because even my husband, who does not love sours as I do, found a beer he liked (Van Dayum), and we even passed on the love to my sister-in-law who lives in RR! (How has she not been here yet?!)

reviews.author: Maritza M.
reviews.description: Spent a whole evening here due to the unusual policy of requiring you to purchase a glass that comes with 4 pours. We drank our 4 14 oz pours over the course of a few hours, but it's nice that we had the option to bail earlier and take home a can instead. The patio is nicely set up with distanced tables, fans, and hand sanitizers at every table. We brought over food from Vegan Nom, a couple minutes walk away. My partner and I each tried 4 different beers. All were delicious! This was our first visit to the brewery despite buying the beer from stores many times. I would definitely come back but with the awareness of the policy that you have to buy at least 4 12oz pours (you can split amongst multiple people though). I think the real highlight of visiting the brewery are the frozen beer drinks. They had a "Mexican Marteeny" available the night we went, which is based on the Teenybopper ale with some other things mixed in. Amazing, and a great final glass! The bartender was lovely and was able to answer all our questions, too.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: Do you like sour beer? If you answered yes then why aren't you here already?  If you don't like sour beer, verify by trying the definition of it at Blue Owl Brewing because "The Owls are not what they seem." - yep, they're Lynch fans of the best show to make it to TV.  BOB is your uncle and your favorite sour beer. Come in and select a size, get 4 samples in that glass, and when you finish - keep it! The glass is yours.  Heavy rotation keeps its original and I love it. They have some staples for those trying to have a routine.  Buy some swag and get the brand out there! #LittleBossIsMyFav #BlueOwlSightings

reviews.author: Shelley B.
reviews.description: Listen- I love the beers. But the way you have to purchase them is so weird. You have to buy 4 or that's it. Sure, you can split it or take some home but sometimes I just want 1-2 beers on site and not have to buy 4. My boyfriend and I came and bought the 4 but then wanted one more. Nope, buy 4 more or none. We picked none and left. I just wish we could come and buy one or two beers without being forced to buy 4.

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: If you like sour beers, youll love this place. Personally i find it gimmicy. The sour beers dont do it for me. Also they make you buy a pint glass before you can order.  The main draws are that its in a cool neighborhood, i like that the beers are highly alcoholic. Also their patio is dece, but it could use more seating. Finally, their gimmicky ordering system causes people to leave free beer tickets around constantly. I like free beer.  The big gimmick, which I find annoying, aside from the sour beers buying a glass when you to get a drink. When you buy one, you're basically comitting to four 12 oz. pours and possibly coming back in the future. There are other sizes, but the 12 oz. Is the best value and it feels weird drinking beer from a shot glass.   You can bring a glass you already bought, but overall its annoying to bring a pint glass to a bar. If i wanted to clean my own glasses, i would drink at home. Thats why youre kinda commiting to coming back by buying one.  They give you a sheet to check off the number of pours. The sheets are transferable and can be used on different days so make sure to hold on to them. Also, we usually find a sheet of people who didnt use all their pours so youll usually get a few free.

reviews.author: Eliott L.
reviews.description: Came here with a couple of friends on a Friday night because of a recommendation from a friend of mine, and it did not disappoint. For $16, my friends and I each got a normal sized glass to take home and 4 pours of any choice (you can do 8 half pours). There are also different types and sizes for glasses, so you could opt for a bigger or smaller glas.   Beer/Sours: Great quality drinks with a wide range of flavors. If you don't like sours this may not be the place for you, but definitely give it a shot if you like beers in general.   Service: Nothing to be said here, super nice and friendly staff! Felt right at home.   Atmosphere: Great! Nothing that prevents you from enjoying your afternoon or your conversation.   Definitely coming here again, hopefully I'll collect all 4 glasses!

reviews.author: Ricky R.
reviews.description: When we were walking over to this place from Lazarus brewing my wife said, "I think they only have sours". I was like no way, I will just grab an IPA or something... Oh man was I shocked to see that they literally only had sours. With that being said let me start this shockingly high review for a place that only has sours by saying... i do not care for sour beers. So a 5 star coming from a person who doesnt enjoy sours should say something.  I loved everything about this place. This place is in a cool location, has a great logo, has great aesthetic, and a really cool flight idea. If it wasnt all sour beers... I would live at this place.  Let me explain how the flights work here. You pick your glass size... If I were to guess I would say 4oz, 8oz, 12oz... but honestly that is a guess. Then you get 4 samples in that size. You bring up your sheet, they check off the beer and you sample it. Oh and the best part is that after you are done you get to keep the glass. Oh and the prices are not crazy. I want to say it was $6, $8, $10, but that might also be off. This is definitely one of the coolest strategies I have seen for flights at a brewery ever... Oh and the glasses all looked really neat for sure.  Now onto the beer. Like I have mentioned multiple times already, I am not a fan of sours, but I liked the initial flavor of most of these beers. We had the wee heavy, the red, the earl grey one (lazarus colab), and the cherry stout. Everything had a great crafted flavor, until I hit the sour note. I relied on my wife to drink most of these, but I was very impressed by everything for sure. And my wife was happy with everything as well.  I would suggest anyone in Austin come visit this place for sure. Definitely worth the trip and more so if you like sours!!

name: Draught House Pub and Brewery
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday

reviews.author: Amir H.
reviews.description: Awesome pub, with darn good fish and chips at the food truck next door.  Love to come hang out and have a cigar with friends and enjoy a couple brews and some fish and chips.

reviews.author: Sara O.
reviews.description: Perfect place for a pint on a warm afternoon. The patio has picnic tables, some shaded, some not. Inside feels like being in Europe. We only stayed for a bit bc my husband wanted to watch some game. This place had no TV, which is absolutely fine with me! I'd love to come back.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: Cool bar with nice staff on hand, wasn't too overcrowded on a Friday night with most people sitting outdoors. It's dimly lit inside and not too bright outside either but provides an overall chill mood and environment. Food truck outside serves a good sausage and fries but everything else besides that is about $8 or more, with most things averaging out to be $11-12 per menu item, a little pricey in my opinion for food truck foods.   One ask I'd have is that they install some light features above the dartboards so it's easier to see and play on.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: This place is still great. They have a food truck now. Lots of outside seating. New bathrooms. Great Pub.

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Used to like this place... but the $7+ beers that are 5 and under anywhere have me running for the hills.  One less star because they only have meat food trucks.  Not everyone wants to be constipated whilst drinking

reviews.author: Allison C.
reviews.description: Great place to grab a beer and relax with friends. They are doing contactless ordering right now so scan the QR code at each table to order and pick up the drinks from the bar after a couple of minutes. The outdoor patio has plenty of seating and heaters to keep everyone warm. I tried a couple of their house beers which were decent enough but I'll probably try their other options when I come back.

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: As  Supreme Court nominee Brett M. Kavanaugh once said, "I like beer"! For anyone who likes beer, this is the place to be. They have about 15 that are made in house and another 15 guest brews. I tried their Golden Ale and the Blonde.  The blonde kinda tastes like bananas, but the Ale was "Golden"!   Currently there's no indoor seating, but they had plenty of options outside including a giant tent area.

reviews.author: Brian T.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to grab a beer with friends, especially during the pandemic since all of their seating is outdoors.  Beer is decent; not the best I've had but definitely a good effort for their own craft brews.  Atmosphere is a good cross between German and Renaissance-y, almost felt like we were hanging out at the ren fest.  They have a contactless ordering system set up - all ordering is done via website and they call your name when your beer is ready at the main indoor entrance.  My main complaint is that every individual order on the website REQUIRES a food order ($3 french fries from the nearby food truck when we were there).  So if you're chilling here for an extended period of time and like me, order your beers sequentially after you finish each one, you have to get an order of french fries with every single beer order.  I understand this is because of the Texas law requiring 51% food sales in order to classify the establishment as a restaurant to stay open during the pandemic.  But don't force me to help you meet your 51% quota with each drink order I place.    If other breweries can do it without adjusting their way of ordering, it can be done. We eat too many french fries, we won't have room to try more of your beers!

reviews.author: Tim W.
reviews.description: Previous visit non Covid great. Disappointing that waitstaff hid inside. Not available to answer questions or converse at all. Yelled out name after order filled from phone, with multiple beers we had to sort out who's beer went with each person, after beer brought out waitstaff immediately retreated inside. Would not go back during Covid.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: I don't do reviews. I love this place. The burger is unreal.   Context, I have gained "some" lbs during COVID. I was an athletic specimen prior.  Now I'm screwed. If I "finally" go Keto, I will live off the burger ( full size newest addition, though sliders are great)  Also: more importantly - I love the familiar faces, my golden retrievers love to nibble on the fries and the beer is amazing too!

reviews.author: Alex A.
reviews.description: The beer was good but the bartender was slightly rude and definitely didn't want to serve my friends and I. Wouldn't recommend anything when we asked.

reviews.author: Hannah P.
reviews.description: I live nearby and was really hoping this place could be our new spot. Unfortunately I was greeted by the worst attitude at the door by one of the bartenders tonight and I can't get the bad taste out of my mouth.... or is that the beer? Idk I'll keep looking.

reviews.author: Tori B.
reviews.description: We stopped in here on a recent trip to Austin. Great little place. They had a decent selection and helpful bartenders. It has indoor and outdoor seating which is nice.

reviews.author: Jessica S.
reviews.description: The Draught House Pub has been around for 50 years which is unheard of from a business perspective so hats off to them! I'd say there's a lot to like about this pub which exudes a European vibe with all the wooden decor and dark lighting. The first point of interest was their tap board which was operated by Digital Pour. This thing gives you a ton of info! Not only does it list the beer name, brewery, ABV, style, and price, but it mentions the serving size and gives you an illustration of the serving glass and -- the most intriguing feature -- the keg volume status. You're even able to deduce if they have more than one keg of said beer. I have never seen this anywhere before as most pubs and breweries -- if they use a digital tap board -- turn to Untappd. The only downside is that they have a crap ton of taps, so you have to wait for the projection to scroll through a few screens to get an idea of the full tap list.   The initial impressions were already very positive, so the fact that they served tasters was another added bonus. I believe they are known for their nightly specials and there was one going on for that night which I think was 50% off their house beers. The flight wouldn't have applied for this offer, so like we ordered a half pour of their *Triple Double*, an excellent 8% IPA. Very surprising, but the stout they brewed for their 50 anny was fairly normal. Roasty, easy-drinking, and mild.   Overall, this is a legitimate watering hole, offering the variety needed to appease every kind of drinker and the chilled out atmosphere sought after by every thirsty adult.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: I'm thrilled that we finally hit the Draught house for a few cold beers on a hot Sunday. As others have noted this a chill pub with a million (really about 70) beers on tap. They even had a Frose' available, not sure why.... (joke)  There is limited parking on site but on the weekend there is plenty of parking next door. check their website for additional parking Info. You can either hang inside, in the AC, or chill outside in the shade. Be sure to bring your mutt as well.   The beer is king here! If you can't find a beer to your liking then you ain't looking hard enough. Their Summer Ale and Rosedale Blonde was perfect on a hot day.  They were out of their featured IPA but the Bombay IPA was perfectly fine.  This would have been an easy 5-star review except for the bartenders on duty this past Sunday. Maybe I did not have a cool enough t-shirt on, was not a regular, or my 20% tip per round wasn't enough but lose the effin' attitude. When I walk up to order and say hi don't just nod and ask what do you want. when I ask you how would categorize an IPA don't respond with "it's a regular IPA" WTF is a regular IPA there are about 10 different styles of IPAs. When I ask is it similar to a west coast same response...   Seriously, if you just want to serve your regulars put a sign out front stating so. We'll return for the beer selection as it is fabulous but I'll be sure to adjust my expectations regarding the service...

reviews.author: Chuck D.
reviews.description: No apologies.  There is no Happy Hour despite the web postings. Full fare full time. Good selection on tap.

reviews.author: Crystal H.
reviews.description: Came here around 10 or 11pm and it was pretty dark inside. It was hard to see the beer-tenders because of the taps going straight across the counter. The man who took our order and gave us one sample each was unfriendly. He looked like he didn't want to be there at all. Killed our vibe! So we quickly ordered 2 pints and sat down to finish our beers.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: This review is for 4.5 stars.  This is a beer drinkers brewery.  Seemed like an endless amount of beer on tap (but probably about 60 if I had to guess).  Really hits every variety and they offer tastes even before buying.  I went with a flight to try 5oz of 4 pours.  Good portion but I was charged $1 which is pretty excessive in my mind.  Other than the price, I liked the place and location.  Really a beer forward establishment with no TV, darts, and tons of seating indoor and outdoor.  This is not your new age place - come here to drink and to conversate.  Dogs welcome and parking tough in the lot but plenty along the street.  Overall I enjoyed myself and considering free WIFi I can  forget about the lack of TV.  For beer, this is on the short list in Austin.

reviews.author: Mahesh P.
reviews.description: Tons of outdoor seating - with umbrellas for the summer, and heat-lamps for the winter. Dog friendly outdoors,  craft-beers on tap, darts, old-school wooden-beamed construction, excellent food-truck, and friendly friendly people (this *is* Austin after all) Love the place...

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: One of my favorite stops on my first visit to Austin! My friend and I chatted with the bartender, who helped us each chose our own flight of beers. We have very different tastes and were able to find four beers each that we absolutely loved. Lots of local options!   They also had a food truck outside, which provided some much-needed sustenance after our flight. We shared the falafel plate with fresh veggies, pita and hummus.   The back patio was a nice spot to relax in the evening air under a heat lamp. We moved inside for a cozier atmosphere once it got too chilly.

name: Bangers Sausage House and Beer Garden
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: robert m.
reviews.description: Loved the atmosphere and song selections. Grounds are fun to hang out for awhile. Interesting take on sausages. We enjoyed having a flight of IPA's. Works for us early in the afternoon.   Of note: our waiter Kyle was very informative and quite engaging. However, we didn't see Kyle's bio on the website, but you have two house dogs? Where's his bio. Come on. Don't worry, you still rate five stars.

reviews.author: Geoff P.
reviews.description: What?? 5 stars?  I don't hand this out often, but the drink selection was huge, the sausages were awesome and the pretzel with cheese was big, warm and soft!  I tried the Kielbasa and the Fig and Duck sausages. Both were perfect. The fig and onions paired amazing and want more as I type.   The pretzel and friend pickle spears were also a lot on with flavor. Many places do a big pretzel...this one does it right!

reviews.author: Veronica C.
reviews.description: All the food was so delicious. However, our food came out late and close to closing so when they set our food down, they opened to doors to try and get people to leave. It was below 37 degrees and our food was cold in an instant and we were rushed out of there despite it not being our fault. Not the best experience.   I would recommend the Poutine, Mac and cheese, and the Bacon and Fig Sausage.

reviews.author: Rae F.
reviews.description: We always pass by this place on Rainey and decided to try it on Sunday for brunch. The vibes flow and the service is top tier, we waited about 40 minutes (not bad for a sunday brunch) and only took 15 or so minutes for food to arrive. Bangers is getting 4 stars due to the fact that the champagne for the manmosas are pre poured, so you get no bubbly - but a flat champagne. Other than that, such an amazing establishment and good live music!

reviews.author: Kristine V.
reviews.description: Bangers is a great spot for a large group bunch or just day drinking under the sun! Came on a Saturday afternoon around 1pm and didn't get seated til around 1:45pm. They have an outdoor bar and a few open seats which makes it easy to grab a drink or two before actually sitting to order a meal.   The manmosas are large and charged with champagne goodness! Note, you have to order a snack with a purchase. I highly recommend the chicharron or pretzel!  Once you're seating, service is quick and organized. I was surprised how well our server was able to keep everything in order while we were ordering left and right. I highly recommend the smoked turkey sandwich or one of the meat plates. The meat is tender and smoky. The picked veggies on the side are like icing on the cake!

reviews.author: Kristella P.
reviews.description: Living in Austin for three years, this is my favorite place to go when I'm back and where I recommend to take out of towers / visitors. The vibe is truly what Austin represents and is in the perfect location.  The beer garden has so many different beers on tap, especially the best local ones. I strongly recommend the Live Oak Hefeweizen. If you're in the mood, they are also famous for their Manmosas which are an entire champagne bottle mixed with Oj. Their food is also amazing too - I always get their jalapeño cheddar sausage. The giant pretzel and Mac and cheese are great as well!

reviews.author: Hope F.
reviews.description: Legit the best Bavarian pretzel I've ever had. I'm still thinking about that airy, buttery goodness and the supremo cheese dipping sauce.  Service is excellent and great beer choices. I didn't immediately realize you can order flights, which is always a game changer for me.   Pro-tip: If you're not "eating", you can bypass the wait and go right into the bar... where you can also order a very large pretzel the size of your head. What else could a girl need?

reviews.author: Lindsay N.
reviews.description: I'm still in awe from my wonderful experience at Bangers yesterday. On a rainy and cold Saturday morning, I realized my previous plans to host a 2 year old's birthday party outdoors the next day was significantly at risk. In a state of panic, I called Bangers to see what last minute options there were for 35 people including 8 toddlers. Having worked in the service industry for over a decade, I recognize this ask is a nightmare of epic proportions.  Thankfully, my prayers were answered when Chris, the head of operations answered the call. Right away he went into problem solving mode, suggesting the upstairs area and letting me know he'd build a big ol fire for us.  When we arrived the following Sunday, Chris rolled out the red carpet. Even though he was having an office day, he proceeded to give us coffee from his own office, access to his own private bathroom and served us brunch items even though were weren't technically a table. And y'all, HE REFUSED A TIP AT THE END.  There are no words to express how meaningful and special this day was for me, my two year old, friends and family. What an amazing and good hearted person you have to be to do that for complete strangers. Chris, from the bottom of my heart, thank you.

reviews.author: Han L.
reviews.description: I think it's in the perfect location. It represents Rainey Street and the reason so many people come to Austin.  Not being from there, I didn't understand when people said to just get pretzels, sausages, and hot dogs... But I miss it. It's just different here. It's real food here. It's worth getting here. You'll miss it.

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: Bangers is not only one of the biggest establishments on Rainey Street, but they also have one of the largest beer selections I have seen in one location. The large smokehouse out back provides an aromatic invite right off the street.  Living up to your name is easy for Bangers, they offer a very unique and impressive sausage menu, and if you're not a fan of sausage they have plenty of other options available. Although I did not try the vegetarian options, I was told they were phenomenal by some pretty picky vegetarians!  The sausages are absolutely excellent, they seem to love the garlic aioli here which I do now as well, ketchup isn't the only thing that belongs on a brat. The beer garden is plenty big for any size group and the staff are excellent hosts.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Nicole T.
reviews.description: TLDR; Beer selection 5/5, food 1/5  When you arrive on Rainey street, where Bangers is located, you'll see tons of bars, restaurants and food trucks! The street is really charming. Bangers was super packed at 2 PM on a Friday afternoon, so I was excited to try it. There are 2 options: Full menu and Light snacks/beer  During my first visit, we went with light snacks and beer. Snack selection included chips, pig skins, pretzels. Not much to choose from here. The beer selection however, was a large selection and we were really impressed! Each beer ranged from $5-10  During my second visit, we came back to try the food. It was quite disappointing and really heavy. The servers were great though CHARRED LETTUCE: Lettuce did not seem fresh, too much sauce LOADED FRIES: There are a few different options for the loaded fries, but all of their fries are thick cuts and very starchy  DUCK FIG HOT DOG: the sausage was piping hot when it got to our table. The fig and onion were on the top, but only enough to cover the middle of the hot dog. Sausage felt super heavy and my group of 2 couldn't finish it Would probably come again to grab a beer, but pass on the food

reviews.author: sabrina c.
reviews.description: What a great spot among the rowdy bar spots on that street. I love how there's plenty of seating and live music going on at all times. I also enjoy the variety of options of beer/cider they have to offer. It's a great first stop on a night of partying and drinking.

reviews.author: True M.
reviews.description: Oh M G. Did I expect the drinks the fries the sausages to be this good?? No!!! Everyone and everything was not only good but great. Hubby is a trained culinary chef who is not cooking anymore so he is still hard to impress...alas he WAS!!

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: The hype is 10000% true: bangers BANGS!   The live music, the food, the service (shout out Derrick! He's the BEST!) 10/10  The new brunch menu is super good. The cinnamon roll could seriously feed 4. It's huge. The smokehouse fries are delish, there is brisket on top that is to die for.

reviews.author: Maricel J.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out and eat. Lots of beer, ciders selections to choose from on tap. All the staffs are nice and very welcoming. Good vibes, nice location on Rainey St.

reviews.author: Cori G.
reviews.description: Great spot for large groups! The food is pretty good too, was accommodating for vegetarians and gluten free. Recommend starting with their fried pickles that come with ranch ... yum! I loved the veggie dog and make it into a salad, the green goddess dressing is really good too! Ask for their grain mustard and sauerkraut on the side. The server we had (shoutout carissa) was so friendly and helpful!

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: You'd think that as big as Bangers expanded location is this place would be accomodating for groups.  Unfortunately over several attempts this year, I've found that not to be the case.  Most recently not only was the ability to split checks super reduced, the waitstaff was also unattentive, ingenuine, and borderline rude.    I've definitely also had positive experiences before their big expansion, but it seems clear that quantity is winning over quality at Bangers these days.

reviews.author: Chase F.
reviews.description: When it rains, it usually pours. That is, unless you plan your event with the amazing team at Bangers.  What could have been a chaotic day due to inclement weather (think 35 people including 8 kids under 3 huddled under the relatively small awning - each child taking turns grabbing pretzels from strangers picnic tables and dipping their fingers in beers - "my germs!") turned into a wonderful experience thanks to Chris and all others working on Sunday.  Without us asking for any special favors, Chris and his team went out of their way to provide us a private upstairs dining space for our party last-minute, doing so with genuine smiles and positivity despite the busy Sunday rush.  I absolutely urge anyone planning an event to consider Bangers' amazing food, beer selection, and most importantly, kind and empathetic service.

reviews.author: Kerst G.
reviews.description: Super fun spot on Rainey St, huge wall of beer taps!  Live music was great? Cool atmosphere! For sure recommend checking out. Also can't beat the snacks and the smell of bbq. I'm sure the bbq itself is great, but we only experienced through smell!

reviews.author: Chelsea A.
reviews.description: Let me start by saying the staff were amazing, sooooo friendly and fun! We came here around 3pm on a Saturday and it wasn't busy but definitely wasn't quiet. We were served promptly and the food came out relatively fast. The fried pickles were the best thing I've ever put in my mouth as weird as that is they were just delicious!!!! The hotdogs we got were super yummy and the garlic aioli sauce was lovely too. We also got the passionfruit cider which I loved and was recommended from the waiter and the giant manmosa which was huge!!!!  The toilets were modern and clean and the atmosphere was fun. Overall an amazing experience.

reviews.author: Kourtney S.
reviews.description: The inside/outside atmosphere is really cool being in an old home/building that has been redone to preserve the old age beauty. I spent my time at the patio bar. Both bartenders were such a joy; not only to myself but everyone. They spent the necessary time greeting everyone and helping to figure out how to get to a table asap. Even among small conversations between tables, the bartenders were on top of their serving game.   I have had the waterloo and center cut pork chop. I'm not usually a pork kinda person but the peach chutney was SO good. It was the perfect amount of food and tasted so yummy.   I will definitely go back when I am in Austin. This is the type of place to visit with friends and family for a great evening of sharing small plates, good drinks, and lots of laughs. Or it's old-timey beauty makes it a wonderful date night place. Or grab a cocktail and sit on the front porch people watching... the diversity of the restaurant is really for any occasion.   I can't wait to visit for a weekend brunch!   Thanks so much for the food, drinks, and amazing service!

reviews.author: Yzabelle O.
reviews.description: If you need a date night spot for a cozy dinner then @moonshine_atx is the place to be    #moonshineatx has added on additions to the restaurant, and their new bar area is intimate and cozy; Perfect for dinner or grabbing a drink    We ordered: Food  The original Moonshine corn dog shrimp served with honey mustard + blueberry dipping sauce   Baked macaroni with pimento cheese + bacon gratin   Jalapeño hanger steak served with garlic mashed potatoes   Chicken fried steak with chipotle cream gravy and garlic mash   Drinks  @mcphersoncellars 2019 Sangiovese  Dessert  Cobbler of the day: Apple and cranberry cobbler   Sera the bar manager was our server. She was knowledgeable about the wines, especially @mcphersoncellars and was a great help in selecting a great wine to accompany dinner   This was our first time trying Texan wine and it was oh so good!   If you're only looking to grab drinks or even a drink after dinner, Moonshine recently opened a Speakeasy inside the restaurant. @kinfolkaustin can be found downstairs and it's by reservation only    Moonshine has been a favorite dinner spot of ours and we always look forward to each meal here. Highly recommend for the food, experience, and service  Big thank you again to Sera to making our dinner experience even more enjoyable.

reviews.author: Jacky C.
reviews.description: #2 most reviewed spot in Austin and it did not disappoint. Southern food usually means being unhealthy and my ever failing diet goes further down the rabbit hole. No regrets what-so-ever.  We got here around 7PM where we had a 5 minute wait before a table opened up for the two of us. I got to see how massive this restaurant was as we were lead to a heated tent, which was set up adjacent to the building. The table comes with free popcorn, but we had to ask the server about it as they were never pre-served before we arrived. NBD.  I started off with a Good Hearted Old Fashion ($13). First thing I noticed was that the glass was only half full, but it's supposed to be like this due to the nature of the drink. Tastes great and it's the popular drink ordered. Just sip slowly.  For appetizers, we split the Fried Green Tomatoes ($12) with smoked shrimp, tomatillo aioli, and pimento. Pretty much a way to saying you weren't all that unhealthy, when in reality it's also battered and fried. The smoked shrimp makes it worth ordering from a price perspective and they happen to taste great together.We also ordered The Original Moonshine Corn Dog Shrimp ($12), fancy enough to their own trademark on it. Came with a honey mustard dipping sauce. Tastes pretty good, but it wasn't unique as I've had similar items like this, just not served on a stick.  For the entree to split, we got the Chicken Fried Steak ($18), essentially a giant batter fried chicken with chipotle cream gravy and yukon mashers. This alone between the two of us along with the appetizers was enough to fill us up generously. Tasted amazing and an excellent option if you're not feeling the pork or beef, essentially tired of consuming BBQ all week.  Overall, great food, great service, and a great experience. Would recommend making a stop here if you're making a stop in Austin.

reviews.author: Alex F.
reviews.description: EXPECT TO WAIT!! If you are trying to find convenient parking, they offer valet. Went up to the hostess stand and for a table of two, got quoted at least 90 minutes. That was a true 90 minutes. We were lucky enough to get a seat at the bar after 20 minutes but people who checked in around us were not so lucky. Even after people turned in their pagers and left, the wait was still true. While you wait you can order drinks and appetizers at the bar. The bartenders were friendly, helpful and attentive. We ordered Brussel Sprouts, Chicken Fried Steak, Chicken and Waffles and Banana Pudding. My favorite part was the Brussel Sprouts. They were simple, slightly sweet and cooked nicely. The chicken and waffles were good. It seemed like there is cornmeal in the waffle. I enjoyed this as I thought the similar taste to corn bread really preserves the savory part of this dish. The chicken fried steak was just alright. Expected more after hearing it was the 3rd best in the state. The pudding was great. Great flavor but if you like an abundance of wafers it might not be for you. Overall, this place is great if you do not mind the wait. I do not think I would wait that long for it again.

reviews.author: Michael A.
reviews.description: In an effort to clear out more of my old review drafts, I'll be posting some that are long overdue. Unfortunately, some of the finer details are now lost in memory, but Moonshine Patio Bar and Grill was our last meal in Austin, Texas. It was for a Sunday brunch (8/15/2021).  Conveniently located in Downtown, we were actually able to walk here from the hotel. At over 5.1k reviews, this would definitely appear to be one of the most popular restaurants in the city. That said, I was pretty interested to see what it was all about.  To eat, I ordered the steak and eggs. It took a little while to get our food, but service was friendly. The place was packed, as expected. Overall, I thought the food was good. The atmosphere is what really stood out to me though. While I wasn't super impressed by the food, I would not be opposed to returning.

reviews.author: Haley Z.
reviews.description: Came for the Whiskey selections and left pretty happy with trying that out! We sat out in the back covered patio area which is cozy. The food was very good, but not amazing. I think it's a fair price point for being downtown and being a more talked about Austin restaurant. My pork chop dish was ($22), looked good but tasted like nothing special. I would come back to try the brunch, but I'm not rushing back for anything other than the drinks and outside atmosphere.   It took a long time to get our food even though there was only 2 other small tables of customers outside and a few inside. Our waitstaff was very attentive and had great recommendations for drinks after talking to her a bit. They have vast options for drinks and drink deals on certain nights which is why we stopped by.  Street parking is a hassle here, especially on the weekends, but luckily it's close to a lot of places downtown and makes for an easy walk.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Despite the high ratings, I was underwhelmed with Moonshine Patio Bar and Grill... I came in for brunch and ordered the Chicken Fried Steak. Moonshine is the definition of a southern brunch, as there are no light meals here! The Chicken Fried Steak was nothing extravagant, comparable to Jack Allen's.

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: My friends and I came here for dinner the other night. I want to say that Yelp led me right with the photos and recommendations. Everything with the Yelp Hype is real. This place and environment overall is awesome. The staff here was  is really great! Plenty of seating, but I can see how this place would have wait when it's busy.   The place has a outdoor heated seating. It was very warm and toasty comfortable. The sliding door of the patio, you could feel like the Hulk when you're trying to open it.  All the beers we had were in a can, and we came just at the right time for happy hour. As other Yelpers stated I was truly amazed with the prices and portions of the food. I had the pork chop and man that chop was so delicious!! Another buddy of mine had the same thing. Another one had the turkey club sandwich and that thing was huge!  We also ordered some pretzel sticks and those were the perfect appetizers. You also get a bucket of free popcorn.  One thing about coming here it's easy to find; however, parking may be a bit of challenge when busy. We lucked out during our visit here and were able to park right on the front of the building.  I definitely want to come back and try some other items on the menu. Great food, drinks, and the prices are right here!

reviews.author: Cathy O.
reviews.description: We came to Austin and Moonshine was the first lunch place we hit up, based on a friend's recommendation.  I wasn't super hungry, so decided to try the cornflake battered chicken salad. The chicken was excellent. Crunchy on the outside and very moist inside. The salad came with 3 large pieces. But my problem was that I dumped the dressing throughout the salad so was therefore stuck with it. And I thought it was a not great honey mustard dressing. I am usually not at all picky, but the dressing was too thickly and too mustardy. If half stars were an option, I'd give my salad a 3.5.  My husband ordered the chicken steaks smothered in a white gravy, and really liked it. Before our entrees came, we were brought a large basket of popcorn. That was a nice touch.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Let me just share how fresh the food was. I ordered an amazing salad and added a few extra items to set it off.  I believe my friend ordered a steak with grits and I wanted to take his plate as well as mine.    The service was amazing and the atmosphere is on point. I will be returning even if it's a 48 ago but the experience is quite intense and is great for any type of meet up for business and personal.

reviews.author: Ramona A.
reviews.description: My salad was amazing! It's actually called a grain bowl... order it! I had an old fashion and a whiskey sour that were also delicious. I wish I would have tried the moonshine.

reviews.author: Brian B.
reviews.description: On a trip to Austin, we came across Moonshine and really enjoyed our dinner here.  We started with the pretzel sticks and pimento cheese as our appetizer - so good! The pimento was very flavorful and the pretzel sticks were baked to PERFECTION.  For my entree I had one of their fried chicken sandwiches. The chicken patty was very thin compared to most fried chicken sandwiches I've had, but the flavor was still there in every bite. The accompanying fries were yummy as well!  NOTE: on Mondays they have 50% off wine bottles. Just in case that's useful for you ;)

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: New Year's Day, came for lunch. We waited for about 30 minutes, but they have a bar in the back while you wait. It was walking distance from our hotel on Third Street.  We got seated at the patio outside for a party of 5, and they adjusted the shade for us since the sun was in our face.   The service was okay, the food was pretty good. The size of that chicken friend steak was definitely Texas size! The cocktails were delicious. We even got a flight of moonshines, but that was a bit hard to drink. It was way to sweet for me personally.   Overall: Cleanliness: 8/10 Food: 8/10 Service: 7/10

reviews.author: Ria G.
reviews.description: Visiting Austin and decided to check this place out for some wonderful Southern food. Everything we ordered for brunch was extremely tasty and flavorful.   If you're looking for something on the lighter side, go for the Migas. Both the Beyond Veggie Burger and Backyard Chicken Sandwich hit the spot as well. They even accommodated my friend's request to switch the bread to a biscuit. The sauce that comes with the Sweet Potato Tater Tots is phenomenal.   They have great heated outdoor seating (tent style), wonderful servers, and generally a great atmosphere!

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: This restaurant just kind of pulls you in from the street. Being one of the oldest buildings in Austin, this place is obviously well known, and we were lucky to get in.   The atmosphere inside the restaurant just emanates southern charm and the menu offers some excellent southern comfort food entrees. Any time I find an appetizer not normally seen on a menu, I have to try it, and in this case, it was the deviled eggs.   I typically don't have the courage to try anyone else's deviled eggs because I am very picky when it comes to those, so I swore they better be good and they were very good. They were creamy, flavorful and had no pesky surprises like celery or relish.  One thing I never thought I would eat for dinner is chicken and waffles and being in Austin I decided I had to try. I was impressed with the seasoning of the chicken and the light breading. The waffles were fluffy, they came with plenty of butter and syrup. This entree was the epitome of sweet and salty, and a little bit spicy.  The staff are great, the drinks are great, and the atmosphere is alive. Cheers!

reviews.author: Joy D.
reviews.description: I seen this this place on yelp and people was talking bout it. Im not impressed @ all. I'm  cut to the chase, my friend order chicken and waffle and it had hair 2x.  For real, how the fuck we spend the food back the first time, and came back with hair again. Smh.. I'm pissed!!! The manager came and apologize.  She was sincere,  and offered us round of minomas, we declined and left. I'll definitely not come back again.  The only positive is my server Tony was great!!

reviews.author: Derek R.
reviews.description: Decided to take a break from bbq and try something different. After a quick yelp search decided on this place and glad we did. It was an easy walk from our hotel in downtown Austin so that was a plus. They start you off with popcorn which is something different and nice. The popcorn was jazzed up with what I believe to be garlic and paprika and was amazing.  I got the old fashioned and wife got a drink called the fiddler which was whiskey spiced up with jalapeño. Both were really really good.  For an app we got the deviled eggs. Got to say not impressed. They used a lot of mustard and neither me or the wife cared for them.  For a main course we shared the chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes. It was absolutely enough for both of us and must say it was delicious. We also shared a side salad.  For desert we shared a banana pudding. Let me tell you order this it's fantastic.  The staff were very friendly and helpful and the ambiance of this place was also super nice and unique.  Definitely recommend and would come back.

reviews.author: Corrie S.
reviews.description: A fun spot for breakfast, brunch or lunch!  The first thing I'll say...GET THERE AS ITS OPENING. We showed up a few minutes before it opened and had a 15 min wait! Had we gotten there later, I think we'd have had to wait quite a while. Its flooded with customers on the weekend! Curious what it would be like during the week? ‍  Service was wonderful! Our waiter was fun, knowledgeable and attentive! I think that was the case across the staff. They take the service seriously!   The food is decadent! It's heaping portions with a southern flare. I got the green chili hash that was pretty good. My favorite part of the meal was the biscuits we ordered as an appetizer. Delicious!   This is a great spot! My friends and I enjoyed it! The menu is pretty straightforward. You'll walk away full of yummy food.

reviews.author: Davidm A.
reviews.description: Ok this place is delicious and very busy butt well worth every second of the wait. My wife got the chicken fried steak. Which was a big as "bigfoot" foot print. And greatly mouth watering. I got the jalapeño shutter steak which at first site looks small but will fill you and and have you in an awww that was good. Marissa our server was very attentive and could run us through the whole menu and make sure that we choose what we were craving. They start you off with popcorn at your table for some finger food and homemade cornbread with every meal. My wife also said that there moonshine was very smooth to the taste and went well with the meal. High recommend coming and eating at this reatraunt. Try and make sure you get Marissa she is great server.

reviews.author: Ginger B.
reviews.description: Great place loved the food!! I had the Salisbury steak and it was very tasty also my friend had the roasted Romain salad  So good!

reviews.author: Warren P.
reviews.description: I give this place a 5 star just on the restaurant ambience alone. Industry is open, fun and relaxing. The food is outstanding. We had the pork tacos and quesadillas which were excellent. The sweet tea is also a nice drink if your into teas. They have a patio area which is comfortable and allows for a cool indoor - outdoor experience.   I'm new to San Marcos but this is going to be my first " go-to" when I need a great taco. Hands down a highly recommend!

reviews.author: Larry C.
reviews.description: Good food, TERRIBLE SERVICE! My daughter finished her lunch before mine showed up. I had to ask the waitress where mine was, she checked and said it was next up. 10 minutes later still no lunch. I checked and it was behind 4 other orders! Their excuse was that mine had to be cooked, but it doesn't take 30 minutes to tear up a couple tortillas, heat them in salsa and fry a couple eggs to put on top!  They won't have another opportunity to provide me with bad service and excuses!

reviews.author: Deya Z.
reviews.description: Food was amazing but service was eh. I've been to my fair share of food halls and similarly set up places, but this one was a little confusing walking in. Think hop daddy or a similar restaurant. Once you order at the front, grab your seat and make yourself comfortable. I stopped by on a Saturday early afternoon, and luckily enough it wasn't super busy. If you if anyone was wearing a mask. But since this is Texas I guess COVID doesn't exist.  Onto the food! I ordered off of their brunch menu which was super delicious. The Chilla Quiles were enormous l!!    I sat down at the bar, which was OK and really where my four-star review comes from. The bartender was nice enough, but really didn't seem interested in actually serving people. She's definitely one of those bartenders that wants to give you your drink and then get you out of her face. It wasn't super clear to me how to check out so I asked another random person that came by and they were kind enough to explain the process to me. Being from out of town, folks in Texas sure aren't as nice as we say we are. And I say this as someone born and raised in Texas.

reviews.author: Jes T.
reviews.description: Randomly ended up here.  Great environment.  I ordered the pork pancakes and it was definitely something different.  I also accidentally ordered a breakfast shot, which I thought was just a drink.   It ended up being good and unique but got me buzzed so I had to chill a bit since I'm not a big drinker.  I was mostly passing through on a lazy Sunday but would enjoy coming back.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: We happened to be in the area and stumbled across Industry as a brunch option. First, today is pretty cold outside and their wall windows (?) are wide open. I get it, it's their design. We were considering finding another spot, but decided to stay and try it out. I ordered the chilaquiles w/ chicken, hubs got the chicken sando, and we had a side of the green chile queso. The food came out at a decent pace. The queso was barley luke warm. Why? It tasted okay, flavors are nothing special, but I was expecting it to be warmer than what it was. When our order came out, my chilaquiles were also luke warm, if not almost cold. Is the cold air chilling the food quicker than normal? Probably not. The side of beans and rice I had was piping hot and I ate that towards the end of my meal. The chilaquiles were made w/ the chips that they serve with their chips and dip; not a fan of that. The hub's sando was good. Overall, 3 stars cuz the flavors weren't that bad: I was willing to overlook the cold dining room, but not the almost cold food.

reviews.author: Heather R.
reviews.description: TLDR a-ok to I'm a fan despite some bumps  My first time ordering for pickup. Everything was delicious, it was ready at the time promised. The big flaw was I didn't get the beer battered squash I ordered and paid for, but as Mr R didn't check the bag before leaving we cannot lay that all on them. It was a very busy night and mistakes happen.  The other error was I didn't get the 30% off to-go booze still advertised on their online menu which is why this isn't 5*  Mr R is besotted with their black bean veggie burger. I think there must be spice in the patty as none of the other listed ingredients explain its lovely low heat. He also likes the texture of the bean patty, he wanted me to mention that.  The salmon burger was good, huge, nice fresh veg, I love the spice in the aioli and poblano ranch, but I REALLY wish they still did the smoked salmon bagel I had one brunch there long ago.  The farm beet salad? Gorgeous. Mr R gleefully ate most of it on his own and he often eats salads with a sense of duty rather than joy. I loved the white balsamic vinaigrette it came with, I'm going to need that more often in my life.  The drinks to go? Hooray! One note, bring your own standard brown pulp drink tray if you think you'll need one because they didn't provide one. The pours were fabulous on our mimosas, The Closer and White Box. Ice was the perfect amount.  The transaction could have gone smoother, but the meal went down great. This remains a place Mr R wants to go *every* time he's in town.

reviews.author: Josseline R.
reviews.description: We ordered from UberEats and after having them call to say they were out of the Salmon Burger and Catfish with Chips we opted out for the Chicken Friend Chicken and Fried Chicken Burger. The order was delayed by 35 minutes which is understandable since they had to switch out our meals. But once we got our meals we realized the sides that come with the entres were missing completely as well.  Starving my friend dug into his Chicken Fried Chicken and I took a few bites of the sandwich. He was basically done with it when he cut into the last bits and realized that the food was indeed cold and fleshy. I stopped to look at mine and I was baffled by the underlying pink on the bottom of the chicken patty. He immediately regurgitate it back up and I stopped and threw the rest of my sandwich away.    We spent over 70 dollars on a meal that had to be thrown away. The only things we did eat were our Brussels sprouts and cheese fries.   Will not be eating here again.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Great burger and fries. Mixed drinks very good. Service also very good. Definitely will return!

reviews.author: Valle K.
reviews.description: This was my first time to have brunch at Industry. I gave them an over all three stars only because they lost one star on my dish, I ordered biscuits and gravy super dry not enough gravy for the portion of the biscuit. Then they lost the second star because half way through my meal, my mimosa never arrived! I was parched and when I asked the waitress she said " I lost your ticket, I will put in your  order" I don't understand how that even works when you order at the front of the restaurant.  The food could be warmer came out cold. The presentation of the food was great, customer service was great, the ordering process smooth.

reviews.author: Dawn M.
reviews.description: Hip spot for beer, cocktails and satisfying pub grub with a twist. The burgers and fries are tops, and the salmon burger is very tasty. The loaded nachos are over the top and amazing, can feed an army. Great corner hang with friendly bartenders and staff.

reviews.author: Brii R.
reviews.description: I was on a road trip and decided to stop here and try it out. I stopped during brunch time. The menu options were limited. The food was decent but I enjoyed the atmosphere the most - very chill and open.

reviews.author: Skih N.
reviews.description: First time here was pretty okay. I ordered the brisket tacos which were $13 with a side of chips, i thought the proportions were way too small given the price. I also expected the tacos to be a bit bigger but were still good tasting. The mac and cheese tho, was p bomb ngl. Overall, the restaurant and staff were nice, I might come here again.

reviews.author: Holmes O.
reviews.description: Madison ... Madison... Madison! She was absolutely wonderful today. Welcoming.. knowledgeable and provided an amazing customer experience today. Can't wait to see you guys soon!   - Holmes

reviews.author: Halee G.
reviews.description: MANNNN, this place is such a vibe and even better...the food is amazing. I ordered a little from every food genre and each of them hit the spot. 10/10 will definitely come again!

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: The Moscow mule was amazing!! So I'm new to exploring San Marcos and I looked up most reviewed or topped reviewed. I am not disappointed. This place is great!

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: This place sucks! It's not satisfying nor flavorful. The chili is like soup no meat or anything in it! Yea it may look good but it's not.

reviews.author: Taylor B.
reviews.description: We came down from Dallas and made industry our 1st-night-in-town place for drinks and dinner. We had an awesome time with Thor as our bartender last time we were in town. He was there this time and we got to say hi again. We sat at the bar and Raina took great care of us! We tried 2 lagers from different TX breweries and had some great shots. I could not decide among 3 choices for dinner, so I let her pick and surprise me. She chose the al pastor tacos. They were delicious! We are only staying in San Marcos 4 days and are already planning to go back for dinner on Monday! Ps if you are a whiskey drinker, try this! It was so smooth!

reviews.author: Gem T.
reviews.description: This must be a very popular place. Came in for Sunday brunch and it was packed! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The $11  mimosa carafe special immediately got my attention. I knew I had to have that. Found us a booth on the left corner by the bar. Ordered the mimosa, 2 industry burgers, Parmesan fries and the tater tot casserole. The mimosa was disappointingly room temperature. The burgers were bordering on salty but were good. We especially liked the chips and salsa that came with it. The fries were good but a little expensive for what you get. The tater tot casserole , we didn't like at all. Very salty and the hot sauce did not go with the dish at all. Don't think we'll come back.

reviews.author: Leslie C.
reviews.description: There were mixed reviews...the adults loved their food! We had the CFC w queso - gave it two thumbs up!! We also had the chicken tacos and the person who had those raves about how good they were! We also had the queso, salsa, fried squash, loaded fries and Brussel sprouts for appetizer and all were a huge hit!! Most of the teenagers had the burgers and did not like them. They said they tasted like sausage. I think the issue is the burgers were very, very lean and smoked so they were a little dry.  The BIGGEST COMPLAINT were the flies...OMG!!! So freaking annoying to have to constantly be waving your hand back and forth so a darn fly does not land on your food!! Do something about that bc we would never come back solely for that purpose!

reviews.author: John L.
reviews.description: Loved the smoked brisket! Andi was so helpful and the atmosphere was chill. My daughter will attend TXSU in fall, I'll definitely be back to try other dishes like the pancakes... Great locally owned restaurant/bar. My wife is happy :)

reviews.author: Nickie B.
reviews.description: Cha cha cha cha Changes!!!!  EPBG has made a HUGE change to the menu and quality of ingredients!  #NewChef #GoodFood #NewBrunchSpot #TheNewOasis  A friend wanted me to go to Brunch and said I could pick the place.  I wanted to go somewhere new and saw that EPBG had a great menu for Brunch.  I had recently heard that the food was good now, so why not give them a try?  You know it is difficult to find a great brunch spot, not to mention one without an hour wait or more.  I ordered the Hippie Scramble and was very pleased.  For $14 the dish came with fresh spinach, wild mushrooms (not some cheap white mushrooms), heirloom tomatoes (that tasted like they just came off the vine and red onions.  The dish was topped off with homemade Hollandaise and Goat Cheese.  I told the Chef multiple times that I was in love with his goat cheese.  OMG I think I could have eaten a plate of that alone.  My friend had the Crab Cake Benedict, and I must say that too was delicious.  Tasted like fresh crab (it was not Krab) and the portion was too large to finish.  The fresh dill on top complimented the dish nicely.  Special shout out for the high-end paper plates.  Seriously, they were so nice that from a far they looked like real dishes.  I will definitely be back to try out more dishes on their new menu, enjoy the live music, libations from the bar and take in the phenomenal view.

reviews.author: Nikkita F.
reviews.description: This is a good spot if you're trying to grab a bite or drink close to Just For Fun or the Emerald Point Bar and Grill! The food is pretty basic bar food but good when you're coming off a boat. They have Great Lake Travis views as well!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: NEVER AGAIN! So sad and sickened at the same time. We need more places on Lake Travis and EPBG is such an iconic spot, BUT they have not/are not properly handling the COVID-19 pandemic. They have taken very few measures to keep their staff and patrons safe from possible infection (sure, I'll take a little hand sanitizer).   As an area resident, I've visited EPBG (and every other name it ever had since Carlos n Charlie's closed) many many times. I want the property to be open and thrive, but not with an owner who apparently places little value on human life. Plus, to be completely honest the food is barely above par (wings ok) and the drinks are $$$! $7 for a CAN of Infamous that I can buy a 6-pack of for $10 two minutes away directly from the brewery. I get, lake prices...look at comps though. Speaking of drinks... color me intrigued that EPBG is labeled as a "restaurant" (i.e., more than 51% food sales). Anyone else ever been the weekend drunk fests? I have. Hmm...literal food for thought. Shame on you Barrett Branam!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: On Sunday, October 27th, I came here with a few of my Yelp peeps after an unofficial Yelp get together we had.   *Note this will most likely be one of my most underwhelming reviews ever (I have very few pictures and I only have our drizzank receipt and I didn't even check-in...dag nab it) as I was really just taking in the scenery when we were there as opposed to focusing on making Yelp a better place!   We ordered a few items to include loaded queso and the double cheeseburger.   The Cheezborger! Cheezborger! You want doublecheez?!?Who's next!?!" -SNL  The quality of an establishment's cheeseburger often tends to be a good indicator of the quality of the food in the establishment, especially if that establishment that tends to have a limited menu which highlights the burgers such as this one. My double cheeseburger was outstanding. It was freshly grilled and the charbroiled smokiness  could be tasted throughout the burger.   The view:  As far as this locations view was concerned, it was simply breathtaking at dusk. If you are in the area on a cool Sunday afternoon, there are very few consumers here and you are sure to get an exquisite shot of the sunset. Even if you don't come here for the food, come here for a relaxing time with some friends, you won't regret it!

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: Management is absolutely awful. Overheard him tell his manager to only hire pretty girls so that the local married men have a place to come and look and spend money and they don't want to stare at "dikes".... Unbelievable.  Also, do not use your credit card here.  They triple charge and run your card no less than three times thinking you want look at your bank statements. We have been overcharged so many times it's criminal at this point.  Go anywhere but here!

reviews.author: Britt J.
reviews.description: If anyone knows Catfish.....it's not Emerald Point Bar and Grill.  It's a new endeavour in a tried and true location so being in the hood we wanted to give it a chance and try the food.....pfffft!  We looked at the menu and most prices were average.  I knew goin into to this that the Catfish Basket was $15.  That almost twice what some other places charge.  So the catfish was something out of this world......in a bad way!!!  The filets, if you want to call them that were not recognizable and they were as thin as a quarter.....yes, a 25c piece, kinda leathery and shouldn't be served as food.    That's a typical drinking straw in the photo.  Real catfish filets are 1/2" to 1" thick.  So sad that this place may not make it through the summer.....definitely won't make it through the next drought.

reviews.author: Elsa C.
reviews.description: I love going to this place, it has great views and great place to have drinks. I'm not too sure about most of their food, except for the wings. I really didn't like the wings here, they are a little different from the traditional ones. Other things I liked was that they have live bands on the weekends!

reviews.author: Khristina P.
reviews.description: Super fun time there for the weekend!  Live music, great drinks and awesome views of Lake Travis!!  Totally love every time I visit!!

reviews.author: Yan C.
reviews.description: Great spot to relax and unwind. Lots of boats chillin around parked in marina ! Good fast food service, poke bowls are amazing. Lots of fun on lake. Good bar/food at right spot and fast easy service. Don't even need to wear mask!

reviews.author: Josh H.
reviews.description: Paying $7 for a can of beer is ridiculous. But the views and convenience can make up for it, kinda.   On the other hand, the food is brutal. Not a very big menu, and the majority of it tastes like a lunchroom from 6th grade. Oh and let's not forget, just about everything on the menu will run you at least $15.   Besides the views and TVs, this place is meh.

reviews.author: Torey T.
reviews.description: Good drinks, great food, and fun music! Huge portions so we split and still had tons left!   We will be back!

reviews.author: Elizabeth Y.
reviews.description: We like to try different restaurants on the lake and were nearby so decided to give it a shot. Bad idea. First, the view really isn't that great especially compared to other establishments on the lake. Second, drinks are pricey. $7 for a bottle of corona and $7 for a Truly is pretty high. Finally, my meal was just awful. I got a Texas Cobb that was missing blue cheese, avocado, and croutons when it came out. It maybe had 1/4 slice of bacon on it and that's being generous. The cucumbers were old and soggy so didn't get eaten.  One very small egg and few bites of weird looking chicken were hardly filling. At $14 this salad was an enormous disappointment. We definitely won't be going back.

reviews.author: Sandee H.
reviews.description: Glad this place was open...but they botched my order after the ticket was tossed out.

reviews.author: Maureen M.
reviews.description: Great bar area but the lower part by the band smells like trash and vomit.  Sorry but you need to hose it down.:)

reviews.author: Stephanie M.
reviews.description: Bartender with dark hair pony tail and a hat on is easily the most unfriendly and i inviting person i have ever met.

reviews.author: A M.
reviews.description: Fun lake side restaurant with bar food.  Don't expect anything but fried and unhealthy food.

reviews.author: Miranda S.
reviews.description: Everyone here makes me mildly uncomfortable. From the ersatz chili to the guy who popped his top off with the leatherback necklace, this wouldn't be "Emerald point bar and grill without the patrons. The moment you walk in, you can take a deep breath of Indiana tobacco vape and sour cream. The "pop your top off" vibe runs rampant, taking each patron by storm. Don't wanna pop your top? Scissors available for a sleeveless option. There is no third option. Can confirm vanilla ice has been here; if you know, you know.

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: Mixed feelings for sure. The bad: Twice they've had the wrong band posted on their site AND their Facebook. When you make a 30 minute drive for the music, it's pretty disappointing to find out it's wrong. The food was mediocre. The good: It's hard to beat the view... Sunset over the lake is magical. Bartender Jena is AWESOME. She's smart, sassy, and has great customer service. I wish she'd been there the second time we went back... That might've made up for the music snafu.  I'm not sure we will be back... Maybe if it's a band we want to see, we will call and talk to a manager to make sure.

reviews.author: Emily N.
reviews.description: My roommate and I love this bar and the sunset views from their patio! Their Travis Nachos with chicken are also extremely delicious!

reviews.author: Jil P.
reviews.description: We regularly would come here after a day on the lake for a bite to eat before the drive home. Always enjoyed the poke bowls, tacos and salads. We went Saturday and there was a new menu (no more of most of our favorites) but tried it out. We ordered two pizzas, a burger with fries and the stacked Cobb salad. None of it was good. The pizzas were undercooked and greasy and for the price of $18, highly disappointing. The Cobb salad had a nice presentation and toppings but lacked lettuce. There was no crunch at all. The burger was an improvement from the previous menu but the fries weren't done. You could tell they were undercooked. We won't waste our money on food here again and are super disappointed in the changes made. Bummer for Lake Travis boaters!

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: The Blur is excellent. The food truck serves a mean fish sandwich and cole slaw. The place has plenty of parking and outdoor seating. It was a little chilly so we sat inside. Felt like we were outside with high ceilings and good air flow. Excellent acoustics so we could hear the conversation at the table. Staff was friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Christa S.
reviews.description: I've been here for a Sunday funday and more recently did the 2021 Cookies and Craft Brews at-home virtual tasting with Circle Brewing Beers and Girl Scout Cookies. The vibe at the tasting room is casual and approachable - the staff is friendly and unpretentious. For the virtual tasting I did, they had the packages ready for pickup and hosted the tasting on Zoom. It was fun even if I was tasting solo from home as there were others on the Zoom and the two who guided the tasting were informative and engaging. Here were some notes I took during the tasting:  Alibi Blonde and Shortbread - a nice blend of the maltiness and breadiness of the cookie. The beer is a blending of German Maibock style with American Blonde Ale, resulting in a rich, malty flavor with a clean, crisp finish.  Blue Texas Hefe and Caramel deLits and Peanut Butter Sandwich - this is their best-selling beer (about 2x any other) and is a traditional German Wheat beer with a touch of caramel malt and an emphasis on citrus notes. It's refreshing and definitely a Texas twist on one of my favorite types of beers.  Envy Amber and Toast-yay! - this is a new cookie this year and they paired it with the first beer they ever brewed, although it's not the first beer they released. The cinnamon toast crunch flavor of the cookie worked well with the robustness of the amber. It's an English style amber with an emphasis on dried fruit notes - they use two types of British caramel malts to contribute to the well-rounded flavor of the beer.  Ladybird American IPA and Lemonades - this was one of the pairing favorites of the crowd and I definitely liked it a lot too. It's a West Coast style IPA that is very hoppy, but not overly bitter. Solid pairing and solid beer.  Tuxedo Shirt Black IPA and Thin Mints - the hops in this beer are changed annually, so it never really has the same flavor profile year to year. I was not familiar with roasted IPA malts, but it's basically an IPA with black malt. It has a bold, roasty flavor, with a solid body. It was a smooth pairing with the Thin Mints.  Nightlight Dry Irish Stout and S'mores and Peanut Butter Patties - this beer is the CO2 version of Guinness. There is a slight bitterness to this, but it has a rich flavor with a very light body.   A few other bonus takeaways shared in the tasting conversation: * Epic Playlist is a beer that they created to interact with their fans in the market.
