It has a QR code on it that connects the drinker to the Circle Brewing Spotify playlist. * Devil's XX is a barrel-aged version of the beer (XX) and is sold in bottles. * They are keeping this tasting room, but also expanding and moving to a location in Elgin where they can grow their own ingredients to put in their beer on the 23-acre property.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Came in this past weekend to celebrate the weekend with my friend at Circle Brewing.  I love their beers and have had them at bars and restaurants around town but had never been to the brewery until this past weekend.   Circle Brewing had easy parking as soon as we pulled up even on an Austin FC Saturday game day. It was pleasant to not have to figure out where to park when they have their own parking lot with plenty of space.   Easy ordering but hard decisions to make on what pitcher of beer we were wanting to try. We noticed they have Austin FC game specials that includes their Austin Anthem draft for $18 a pitcher which is a great deal! I also saw signage on the tables that indicated 1/2 pints during the Austin FC games. Double check that is right because it almost sounds too good to be true, right? I even saw a green cup special going on - ask the bartender what they have on special just to be sure.  They have a lovely and large screen set up right in the middle of their taproom to watch any games including those Austin FC games. They have a couple of tv's as well located above the bar to keep your gaze on during any game not just Austin FC.    If you are coming in the summer especially day time be sure to wear loose clothing and/or be ready to sweat. Even at the bar top with the fans going we came out of here sweaty which is typical anywhere you are during Texas summers. Just want to give you a heads up!  Huckleberry is the food truck that slings all sorts of seafood and burgers (surf and turf!) with some easy ordering from inside the brewery.  We didn't get a chance to try out their food as we ended up brewery hopping around right after we had our pitcher of Blur (hefe) at Circle.  This may be the closest brewery to the stadium (?) but if not it sure looks like it as you can see the Austin FC stadium right from their parking lot.  Excited to come back when I am headed to a game and/or in the area as Circle Brewing beers are divine!

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: This brewery had a nice indoor-outdoor atmosphere. We were a bit divided on how we felt about the beers themselves. Some in our group loved certain beers, including some of the lighter bodied and hoppier beers. Others in our group liked the beers but didn't find any favorites from among the fight. Overall it was a nice experience - perhaps not our favorite stop on the brewery tour- but one worth going to again.

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Tasty beer with a nice quaint outside seating area. They turn on the lights when it gets dark so it's nice and intimate.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I've come by a few times and always found it to be a good experience. The staff is friendly, the beer is consistently good and they go for styles that are much less popular from Austin breweries. They also participate in some fun events throughout the year, in particular I really enjoyed the beer/girl scout cookie pairing event and the red line brewery tour.  Highly recommend trying the Blur, its a Hefeweizen and their staple beer. I would put it up there with Live Oak's Hef as a common point of comparison. If you're around in the winter time their Doppel Blur is probably the best Hef I've ever had; Imagine if your alcoholic grandmother made banana bread in liquid form. If you're looking for something darker the Tuxedo T-shirt is a black IPA, I really liked the combination of roastiness and hoppiness. It sounds like it would clash but I found the hop flavor subtle enough to work really well.    The one negative I would have is that the interior really makes it feel like they're trying to get you to sit outside, which given the vast amount of space available in the parking lot makes sense. However I don't feel like they do a great job of utilizing it, there aren't nearly as many tables as you would think and the ones they do have aren't particularly well spaced out.  The food truck situation seems to rotate pretty frequently, I've found most of them to be misses but it's a roll of the dice depending on the day. There's also plenty of good food options in close proximity that it doesn't feel like a major negative.  Overall I think Circle makes for a good hang out spot and a change of pace from the typical Austin brewery experience.

reviews.author: Lauren A.
reviews.description: Circle Brewing's taproom is open and they have excellent beers both at the taproom and beer to go. They're known for the Circle Blur, a hazy hefeweizen, but all of their beers are good. The Austin Anthem golden ale is refreshing and "crushable" and the kolsch and IPAs are good too. They have both indoor and outdoor seating and host free pre-events for Austin FC games next door.

reviews.author: Mark K.
reviews.description: Beer is good, staff always friendly... but damn does it get hot as the third ring of hell during the summer in there. Maybe "stuffy" or "swampass humid" is more accurate, but it's uncomfy when busy. I'm from southern Texas, so I'm used to it.. but it's even hot for me. Need some big ass fans or something. But.. the cold beer does help! And the food truck outside always looks good, but I've never partook in the tasty treats.   Gonna be a go to for many (including myself) pre-FC games, just hope they're OK with me only wearing my FC boxers once I've been there for 20 and sweat through my less-than-fancy Target shorts I got for $20, so I'd have more $$ to spend on their tasty beer.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: We were near this Brewery on a Saturday in early March, so decided to stop in and give it a try.  It just so happened it was a special beer release event and charity donation (for Pink Boots Society and Pink Velvet Collaboration IPA), so it was crowded.  We lucked into a table inside and tried a sampling of beers while we played a game and listened to a few interesting sounding bands that played (standing on the loading platform).  Because it was so crowded, it took a while to get served and the line for the single person bathroom was very long.  The beers we tried were good, and we would definitely stop back by on a day that wasn't quite so crowded.

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: I love breweries in warehouse districts! Very friendly staff, fun vibe inside and outside. Big variety of beers - and probably the best English pub ale in Texas that isn't a big brand beer. I personally think they would gain to have a tv or two once the MLS stadium opens. Overall great experience and plan to come back. Oh yeah - super dog friendly!!!

reviews.author: Mark L.
reviews.description: Decent food trucks and nice experience but seriously can't give it more than 2 stars because of a ridiculously inefficient policy which makes you wait in the long line of people ordering their drinks to simply close your tab. 8 minutes of my life I'd love to have back. Just updated to one star. There is seriously 1 restroom here-for both men and women to share. The place is huge. Need to work out some logistics here.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Perfect day to celebrate Circle's 6th anniversary. With the Temps hovering around 90 degrees what better way to while away a Sat afternoon than having a few scrumptious craft beers, street tacos and listening to some great music.  My companions opted for their Alibi Blonde it is a German-inspired beer but it drinks pretty light but with a hint of flowery hops that gives it a good aftertaste. I opted for their Ladybird IPA that also drank surprisingly light for an IPA and was perfect for a hot early spring day. I did see a lot of folks drinking their black IPA but it was too warm a day for that, next time.  The event was top notch 15 bucks, American, got you a cool pilsner type anniversary glass and 3 beer tokens. We gave 3 tokens away at the end as we were getting full and we !had! to attend a friends crawfish party later that afternoon. Got to leave room for dem bugs and more brews!   The first band was a Go Gos inspired female band that rocked and the second band played some great 70s, 80, and 90s cover songs. Since I was wearing a Boston Sports shirt I got to meet some other Massholes which only added to the fun.   Good times, great beer, and a wonderful event!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: I was so pumped to check our Circle during a brew-crawl, but the ambiance left me feeling unimpressed.  I had my first sips of Circle after being introduced by every Texan's good friend HEB. I believe it was the hefe that reeled me in, so I was excited to go to Circle during the Red Line Brew tour (check it out online if you've never done it). I was so excited to try a few beers, but knew I could only focus my tastes on one since we were on a crawl. I went with their Cereal Keller kellerbier which I've never tried before. It was described as "unhinged" probably because this stuff is unfiltered and not clarified! I was psyched to try a grittier version of the lager. It wasn't as funky as I thought it would be, but instead felt light, simple and slightly malty/sweet. I enjoyed it. I was pretty curious about all their others like their IPA's and the Doppel Blur, but that's for next time.  The space itself is definitely reminiscent of your small-production and grassroots taproom. They had two porta-potties outside (along with a food truck), but only one restroom inside. It got pretty crazy with our crawl of beer lovers. I can't imagine the staff members sharing one restroom, especially when the brewers are in there doing their thang. Someone's bench with weights and press station was still out, and there wasn't that much open space indoors for the lot of us to all be in there, so outdoors it was! They allow dogs which is awesome and they also have wifi. Parking seemed a-plenty, but we took public transport so that's that. Their gigantic chalkboard menu is beautiful and fully rounds out their super relaxed and earthy vibes. The people here are friendly, chill and the brewery gives off a neighborly essence. It's not an instagram-hotspot like their new next door neighbor Hopsquad. And that's the beauty of it!

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: Plenty of outdoor space (some indoor too) and good beer. Conveniently located right next to another spacious brewery, which makes for easy bar-hopping. I thought it was funny that the bathroom is wallpapered with 90's CD cover art. It's the little things.

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: Super friendly environment and very dog friendly!  I loved the atmosphere and the female bartender that helped us was so friendly and knowledgeable about the different beers. This is one of my favorite north Austin breweries to go to. You'll love it.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Definitely a cute space with delicious beer! I'm also a sucker for any brewery that has a food truck on property- we had some pretty bomb fish tacos :) The only downside was no AC inside?! It's too hot for that!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Circle Brewing was fantastic, lots of great drinks and lots of great vibes. I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere at Circle and definitely enjoyed the great beer they had. With lots of breweries in this area, Circle Brewing is still one of the top in the area

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Circle brewing is definitely my favorite brewery to come to in Austin. Not only are there tons of events that are always happening there, just for fun or to support local organizations, all the employees there are so kind and really attentive. They also change/add different beer options often which is great if you're looking to maybe get your favorites and try something new. I'd highly recommend the doppel blur and although it isn't on tap, you can still get a can in a glass of you want. If you're really wanting something on tap then I'd go with the blur! I'd definitely recommend going and bringing your pup because they are very pup friendly everywhere !

reviews.author: Katie H.
reviews.description: I love Circle. Not only is the beer great, but the location and setting speak to the nostalgic part of me that's seen a few little start up breweries begin to flourish out of industrial parks, and often with their taprooms in the brewery space itself. That's what this space is--Utilitarian is too strong a word, but it's comfortable, practical, and cozy. We've enjoyed days playing games out on the picnic tables, and others indoors on the barrel tables. The staff is friendly, and there's always parking available, or you can take the light rail or easily bike from this brewery to others nearby!

reviews.author: Tom K.
reviews.description: One bartender and 50+ people in line for a beer and a hot memorial day afternoon. Way understaffed and Completely inefficient

reviews.author: Frankie T.
reviews.description: Hands down our favorite bar in Austin. Every single person who works here is friendly, badass and great at their job. Management is top tier - Chris, we're lookin at you!   We love this bar and are so glad to live so close and to have y'all in our lives.    Thanks!  Frankie and Mike

reviews.author: Devin O.
reviews.description: Friendly place. Got too many shots were given to me that night. I think.  Was a good time. But be careful in the bathrooms that thing is loud as $h!t! So don't slam anything or people will know... mwahahaha

reviews.author: Carolyn B.
reviews.description: Ok, I want to give the 3.5 stars, but I'm rounding down for the blatantly misleading name. This feels a lot more like a sports bar with some outdoor space than a "beer garden." When I think "beer garden," I picture something with more ambiance (for example plants, string lights, communal tables, music maybe). Instead, here you have a patio with many TVs blaring the game and a dark, concrete/rock picnic area. Yes they have some string lights... on the outer edges of the parking lot #doinitwrong.  That said, they have a great selection of beers and the bartenders are really friendly and helpful. We also enjoyed the food trucks out back. Soooo, if you're looking for a chill spot to catch a game with some great beer, this will fit the bill! If you're looking for a "beer garden," like for a casual date, not so good.

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: Myself and a few friends came here for the Superbowl. The space is so fun and there is a TON of seating outside on the wraparound patio. I think there was two or three bars. We never had to wait in a long line. The drinks were fine, nothing crazy! The food is what I was a little bummed about. I ordered the cheese steak and the mac n cheese (game day special). The cheese steak was okay but the cheese tasted so weird - I'm not sure how to describe it. The bread it was on was hard and overall, extremely messy. The mac n cheese, I think, had the same cheese so it was just a little off putting. I would definitely come back, just wouldn't order food!

reviews.author: Robert V.
reviews.description: The place has a roadhouse atmosphere, most of the staff looked like they were operating a biker bar which at first made me feel a little intimidated, especially when they ignored me. The gentleman at the bar acted like whatever paperwork he was doing was more important than paying customers.  After getting my beer I walked out to the patio to find a place to sit. I was greeted by what I assume was the owner (but again the biker appearance threw me off). He was polite, welcomed me and my party and let me know that he was there if we needed any help.  The seating was comfortable and fun. There was a food truck where we ordered nachos. They were good.  After returning for my second beer I recognized that the beer was flat. I alerted the staff, they gave me another but it was still bad. I suspect the lines need to be cleaned she apologized said she would take it off my bill, I chose another beer and moved on.  Later when lying she charged me for the bad beer anyway, so confused.  Anyway, overall I was disappointed with their beer selection, and disappointed with the staff attentiveness to customers. Had they taken better care of their beer I could have looked past their other shortcomings, but you have to get the beer right if you advertise yourself as a tap house.

reviews.author: Joey R.
reviews.description: Great spot for a chill Sunday with your four legged friends! Staff was friendly and covered spaces when the sun is out!

reviews.author: Kim W.
reviews.description: Least of my fav BG's in the southside row. Staff is no where as friendly and accommodating as the guys in the other 2 spots. Patio area is fine and well covered w heaters... outside open space is small but allows those w kids to set them free. It's fine if the other two are crazy busy, which they usually are, and you just want to hang. Beer selection is  good.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: I don't live down south but boy does this place make me wish I did! Laid back, chill vibes, CHEAP beer (I don't know if it was happy hour or what, but my local hef (forgot the name, but not Live Oak) was only $4 (feel like I'm usually paying between $6-$8 for local draft hefs everywhere else), and there are TVs everywhere playing all the sporting events televised at the moment.   It's super spacious, there are wooden picnic tables everywhere for seating (covered wrap around patio and outside near the BBQ food truck), and there's also a handful of arcade-y games (not sure if they're operational at this time but they added to the backyard fun aesthetic of the place).  Nice staff, all the safety precautions accounted for, and off the beaten path cool.  Stop by just because or if you're making your way to/from Valentina's ;)

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: Honestly this is my favorite spot to meet with friends. The bartenders are very good at getting customers their drinks as soon as possible. I've watched a few pay-per-view fights here and it is always a good time.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Swung by on a warm Sunday afternoon. Apparently Raider Nation has found a So Austin home. Plenty of picnic tables under cover and outback. TVs everywhere with all the games on. Full bar with nice happy hour prices. Friendly staff and BBQ from the food truck was pretty good. Dog friendly.

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: We must've found an old menu online -- so we thought we were going to a place that had burgers, wings, salads, and snacks. Instead, it's just a BBQ trailer and every menu item comes covered in that awful bright yellow plastic cheese you get with your movie theater nachos. I don't remember the last time every single family member said "I don't like this / this is not good." The drinks were good and the staff were super friendly. The kids had fun running around on the seesaws and outdoor area. But there's simply no excuse for such terrible food in Austin in 2022. Would not recommend unless you just want drinks.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Fun spot, great staff. Had a few buddies from Ireland in town who all said they pour a "proper" Guinness here. High praise from that crowd.   I just wish there were more food options here, that would get me there more regularly.

reviews.author: Brenda G.
reviews.description: The SABG is an Austin gem!  My fiancé and I live less than a mile from this place and love coming here to unwind.  It's so refreshing to get a cocktail for less than $16 in this city!  The vibe is also so laid back.  We've never had issues finding parking but on occasion have walked or rideshared here to be safe.  We also thoroughly enjoyed the bbq food truck that is here last time we stopped by.  Additionally everyone we've seen on the property has been safe and masked which we really appreciate.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: This review is mostly for the food. As of June 2020 the food truck on site is HBQ bbq which doesn't seem to have its own Yelp page - which is a serious problem because it needs some serious love! You know the standards for bbq are high in this town, and HBQ holds its own very well for being virtually unknown. My favorite part of a bbq meal isn't actually the meat, it's the sides, so I was excited to see the selection! I ordered a little of everything (well, not everything, but about half the menu... enough that the cook asked if it were for one or two people when he saw a tiny girl come to pick up all of it!) I ordered what I thought would be a chicken salad sandwich, but maybe I ordered wrong or maybe their idea of "chicken salad" is different than mine, because what I got was a typical chicken sandwich - sliced chicken, slaw and what seemed to be mild hot sauce on a hearty roll. Despite the initial disappointment, it wasn't too bad for a chicken sandwich. It was huge! A good deal for the price. However, I didn't want to fill up on it, so I was glad when my friend's son expressed interest in the other half of it. More room for the sides! The hatch creamed corn was amazing - other friends raved about it too. It had a bit of a kick after a few bites, but nothing a spice wimp like myself couldn't handle. The mac and cheese was billed as "sriracha mac and cheese" but was not spicy. It was average in a good way, slightly on the not-so-cheesy end, that would be a disappointment to have alone as a meal, but definitely enjoyable as a side dish. The cucumber salad was surprisingly good. I didn't expect much. Who gets excited about cucumbers? I ordered it out of curiosity and so I could feel good about eating some token vegetables. It turned out to be a real sleeper hit! It was a bit like eating pickles, toned-down enough that I could eat a whole cup of them without being overpowered by brine. When they loaded the "loaded potato salad" they weren't messing around! It had a lot of cheddar cheese and bacon, and some green onion. Apparently they rotate their pie selection, and this time they had peanut butter ice box pie. The cook asked how much whipped cream I wanted on it and I told him not to hold back! It was obviously delicious. Obviously. You're probably wondering about the meats, because this is a bbq truck. I was with a large group, so I got to hear everyone's review of just about everything on the menu, and everyone was impressed. I know they tried brisket, pulled pork, ribs, mac and cheese loaded with meat and queso, and queso as a dip. All servings were a pretty decent size for their price. The queso was the only unusual thing - it was more like movie-theatre nacho cheese that most Texans wouldn't call queso. However, apparently once it was mixed with brisket, it was good, and I saw several servings of it get finished off.  Like I said, I was with a big group, and the venue accommodated is well.  Drinks seemed satisfactory. (I only had water.) I think I heard live music coming from inside. Kids enjoyed the small playground. (And to tell, the truth, at the end of the night, I went and climbed on it too.) Picnic tables, shade coverings, parking bathrooms and all those important amenities were good. I wish this place was closer in to town, but if it were, that might ruin what they've got going. Despite the long drive south, I'll be likely to return! Update: I checked their menu and they have two chicken sandwiches. It looks like I ordered the wrong one. No wonder I was disappointed, but that's good news for the rest of y'all to know that their chicken sandwich is a decent take on a typical chicken sandwich. But I'm still craving a good chicken salad sandwich...

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: We tried this place a while back and we probably won't return as their tequila and vodka options aren't that great. We each had one drink and left. Way too many smokers and even though we sat outside, we left smelling like a cigar shop.

reviews.author: Allie T.
reviews.description: The new bartender Ralph is AMAZING super attentive and makes stiff drinks! Love this place will be back!

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Went to the S Austin Beer Garden just on a whim, and was pleasantly surprised. It was a nice chill environment for those living on this side of town. The majority of the building has a patio area, so it's a perfect place to grab a beer after work, on the weekend or even mid day even during Covid. The bartenders are super friendly and helpful. Definitely check them out.

reviews.author: Sandi G.
reviews.description: I came here to watch UFC 248 with my friends and had a great time.  It was rather cold that day but we opted to sit outside so we can have prime view to the TV screen.  They brought out heaters for the outdoor seating so there was some warmth to be had.  The drinks were a bit on the expensive side but they're showing the fight with no cover so it was worth it.  What I really enjoyed was the food trucks out back.  The food was amazing!  I had the BBQ plate and the cream corn and mac and cheese were so delicious!!!  The BBQ itself was great of course.  The atmosphere was really fun and I definitely would come back to watch the next UFC fight.

reviews.author: Rosa F.
reviews.description: Visited for a couple of rounds, and we're glad we did.  It delivers in all the watering hole fronts. Their frozen / machine premix drinks were refreshing.  Their Mexican Martini was a bit tart, but we enjoyed it. Lots of places to sit outside in the shade, and out by the sun (by the food trucks).

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Good service, that's about it.  Shitty management.  Sat at a table for 3 hours worth of drinks and food, then a young group of kids in Halloween costumes came in, slapped a "Reserved" piece of paper on our table and management told us we had to move.  Shipping container restrooms reeked.  Food sucks.  Won't be back.  Much better options.  in South ATX.

name: Patio Dolcetto
accommodations: Street Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Eileen R.
reviews.description: Such a nice little hidden gem! Excellent service, super friendly staff. Yummy pizza and get the cheese plate!  Good nightly specials.

reviews.author: Erica N.
reviews.description: This place was so cute. Stumbled upon it as we were looking for a spot in San Marcos and went on a Tuesday night and dang, this place is poppin on a Tuesday!  All the outdoor spots were taken, so we made our way to the upstairs outdoor balcony, until we were able to snag a table downstairs (which is where you want to be). We quickly found out it was BINGO night. Yes, bingo night! No, it wasn't a bunch of boomers either! I wish I had gotten her name, but the girl hosting Bingo was incredible - great personality with lots of jokes and she def knew how to work a crowd!  Cons - sadly there are some. The sangria flight is awfully sweet. The pizzas are good but took soooo long to get. The food menu is very small so you better not come starving or with a picky eater.  However, if we're ever in the San Marcos area again, we will definitely be back to just enjoy a night on their outdoor patio!

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: We have enjoyed this place for years! Super nice atmosphere, relaxing vibe, great drinks and food. We celebrate birthdays here with a free drink! My favorite is the chocolate martini. The owner, Jean Paul, is very hospitable. My boyfriend has his art hanging inside.

reviews.author: Stacey S.
reviews.description: What a cool spot! Food and service was great. Everything was reasonably priced. Flight of cider was so good. Loved the blackberry one from a place in Sequin. Pizza was delicious but the recipe that I loved the most was the baked Brie! Can't wait to come back her and enjoy the very chill atmosphere.

reviews.author: Lori W.
reviews.description: Cute little place. Staff is always friendly! Drinks are super tasty and they have a great assortment! I love happy hour!! Their two level patio is very nice and relaxing!

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: This place is absolutely amazing!!! It's so charming and romantic. The food is delicious. The drinks are great then the music is fantastic for the atmosphere. The staff are so sweet. I'd definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Mike A.
reviews.description: Great service and atmosphere. Plus they currently have a rotating $5 wine that is great for those feeling adventurous.

reviews.author: Patsy R.
reviews.description: Cozy and comfortable stop with fabulous wines and cocktails and a tasty little menu of all kinds of delicious eats. Service was really friendly and we felt welcomed from the moment we arrived. It was too cold to sit outside but looking forward to coming back when we can- the patio was beautiful.

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Shelby and Grace were great helps all night! Cider flight- problem the best idea i had other than ordering the pizza ! The blackberry mead was probably my fave cider! Also the cider flight is $10!  The pizzas are pretty good! I got the white blanc both times and added pepperoni and jalapeños to one and just jalapeños to the other!  Again, i place to stop by after floating the river( normal times) or shopping at the outlets!

reviews.author: Michele L.
reviews.description: We had an excellent meal and loved the buy a bottle get a pizza for free deal.  Everything was delicious and the outside area was perfect. I want to go back for the cider flight.

reviews.author: Cydnee R.
reviews.description: This place is AMAZING. We saw it while driving around looking for somewhere to go and it caught our eye so we checked it out. We were a bit more casually dressed as I would've liked, but it's okay because it was our first visit.   The vibes here are amazing. Everything looks nice and sophisticated. We both had drinks, a couple of martinis and something else that I can't quite remember.   The Brie was something new to my boyfriend, and we really enjoyed it. My Margherita pizza was perfect and my boyfriend Chicken Blanc pizza was also sooo good. I think his was better than mine, lol!   I recommend this place to everyone I run into. It's so cute and the perfect date night

reviews.author: Dana C.
reviews.description: We popped in early for Valentines Day and enjoyed a bottle of sparkling rose' with the baked Brie. The service, wine, Brie, and ambiance were quite good. We will return...

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: Obsessed with this place! I've been many times before but we went for my friends 22nd birthday today and loved it. The pizzas are AMAZING and our waitress, Kennedy, was so nice and patient. Everything on the menu is 10/10 !!!

reviews.author: Lacey P.
reviews.description: We arrived around 10:30pm on Saturday, and we could sit wherever we want, minimal people there. Our order was taken quickly and the drinks/food were super fast as well. I highly recommend for a place to get drinks and talk with friends, but be mindful that the food is finger-food and limited!

reviews.author: Lilly V.
reviews.description: we loved Shelia!!! she was amazing. she took care of us and made us feel so comfortable   love pat dolc and love Shelia!!!!!

reviews.author: Koral R.
reviews.description: Baked Brie and white sangria was a must. Order a flight of beer for the friend. We all enjoyed the ambiance and the fact that there was heaters outdoors for us.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Tonight we tried out this quaint wine bar for the first time. For a tapas bar, they offer a limited menu. This is the only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars Bec we expected more selection. They have a few cheese plate options and small gourmet pizzas. I chose the pear and bacon pizza, which was delicious. my husband had a pepperoni pizza. I also ordered a sangria flight, which was quite nice. On Thursday nights they offer a free lava cake with the purchase of a flight. The lava cake was tasty. The servers were friendly and the decorations were nice.

reviews.author: Madeline C.
reviews.description: Pizza is amazing, definitely individual sized. Try the pear and bacon! Drinks were good priced and were amazing. Had a great night here! 100 would recommend. Loved our server! The lights were too cute on the patio!

reviews.author: Kelsey B.
reviews.description: I stopped here with a friend on our drive from Austin to San Antonio and will definitely be making the trip back to San Marcos to visit again! I ordered the white sangria, which fair warning was very sweet but it was still delicious. The menu said the white sangria had ginger in it, although I didn't taste that specific ingredient I was hoping for, it was still a good choice. They do wine flights as well, and have a pretty good happy hour.  We ordered a cheese board and sat at the bar. The cheese board was generous and filling, the service was great, and the atmosphere was on point. It is a casual wine bar, and they had live music outside which would have been nice to watch aside from the cold weather. They have a lot of seating outside, and a good amount of community seating inside.  Overall, great experience here and will be hopefully going back!

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: Nice environment and atmosphere :)   Better service the second time around.

name: River City Grille
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Stephanie P.
reviews.description: We are visiting from out of town and stopped by here for dinner on a Friday night with our 3 kids. The food was great, and came out fast and hot. The service was also great! Everyone had a smile and was happy to help with anything we needed. The view is amazing as well! Definitely 5 stars.

reviews.author: Elisa M.
reviews.description: We were in town visiting a friend and she made lots of suggestions but we ended up here and I personally am thankful this is where we ended up at.   Let me start off by saying that the staff is some of the friendliest folks I've met. We had a waitress who helped out our waitress and she did it with a smile.   We ordered the chips, queso and salsa to start off with. At first glance the salsa looked like it was marinara sauce but it was actually good. The queso was a little thin but still good.   We ordered a steak salad and a cheeseburger and both meals were good. The cherry limeade was delicious and seriously I can't think of a bad thing to say about this place.   It's located on the water so you can sit outside and take in the views or sit inside and sit by the window and still have a beautiful view.   Give 'em a try!

reviews.author: Kris V.
reviews.description: Good food, beautiful view. The outdoor seating overlooks the river. The dining room is all windows so you can sit in the ac and still have a view.  I'd imagine before covid the dining room held a few more tables.  The Paul's chicken is a large breast breaded in chips, topped with lots of hatch Chile and shredded cheese. I liked it better after asking for a side of white gravy.  The green beans are honest, not cooked to death, still green. The baked potato was typical, though not seasoned on the outside like I'm used to.  All in all, it's plenty.  The chicken fried steak was two pieces, actually seasoned in the breading, tender enough, and disappeared quickly. Gravy is good too.  The scratch cheesecake was good. I got plain, without toppings, which they offer a few. It's baked, not too dense, thick enough crust.  The bread pudding was a cereal bowl full of yummy. Pecans and raisins all smothered in a bourbon sauce, not an icing. Very good.  Prices are a smidge high, but expected for the area.  Staff was pleasant, quick to respond.  I'll come back next time we are in the area.

reviews.author: John A.
reviews.description: Family trip to Marble Falls, TX. We have been to River City Grille multiple times and for good reason. Good food and great service. The wait is always a bit long but it's because people want to eat here. The outside river view is a plus! We will be back.

reviews.author: Marlo C.
reviews.description: Enjoyed a delicious meal on the deck(overlooking Lake Marble Falls). The fish taco's were absolutely scrumptious! Salads were fresh and yummy. Service was top notch(Shane was our server). We shared a generous portion of bread pudding for dessert.  Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Alex Z.
reviews.description: Nice lake view restaurant in marble fall, the price is very good for the portion of food. Most of the food is about $10 unless you go for steak. There's outdoor seating as well as indoor seating with large window with beautiful lake view.  The service is very fast and attentive. I ordered calamari which are top with cheese powder which seems strange, it's also like a calamari fingers instead of rings. With cheese is not my favorite part. The fish taco came in three large pieces of taco with the two pieces of filet in each taco, huge portion. The green chili burger is juicy and has a good kick to it but the buns are soggy which needs some improvement.

reviews.author: Ried S.
reviews.description: I want to start by saying that the service here is probably the beat I've experienced since the pandemic began. In a world where so many restaurants are understaffed and waiters overwhelmed, the team here could not have been more attentive from the moment we sat down. There was no waiting for anything - they were incredibly intuitive and knew just when to check in with us and offer refills or bring extra napkins. 5 stars for the service.   The food was pretty good which is why I'm giving 4 stars. I had a delicious green chili burger, but the calamari fell flat for me. I don't know why they sprinkled parmesan cheese on it. My recommendation would be to offer this on the side.   Overall, solid option in Marble Falls with beautiful views over the lake. Sit outside when the weather is tolerable.

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: We stopped in here while on vacation to eat by the water and were not disappointed.   The food was great. I got the famous pork chop and green beans and it was delicious.   The atmosphere is great. We sat inside and still had great lakeside views. The parking was easy and even at prime time, we easily got a table.   The staff was friendly but the service was disorganized and slow. That is the only reason we aren't giving it 5 stars.

reviews.author: Gracie G.
reviews.description: If I could give it 0 stars, I would. Called 2 min before getting there to make sure the wait time was acceptable for a group of nine and the manager lied and said we took 10 minutes to get there and the tables that they could have used for us, were given to other parties and that they couldn't hold the tables for us. Trashy place, smelled disgusting, save your money and go elsewhere with better service!

reviews.author: Michael O.
reviews.description: I eat here anytime I'm in town for work. Beautiful views of the Colorado river on the deck. Me or my guest have had almost everything on the menu and everything thing is worth trying. If you are looking for a local place, give this place a try. The pork chops are amazing.

reviews.author: Rob H.
reviews.description: The wife decided to stop in today after I had grabbed some mounts from the taxidermist in town. We got there just as they opened and glad we did. We got a table on the balcony. Weather was perfect, staff was friendly, food was good and view is awesome. I had the fish tacos which I loved and she had the pulled pork tacos that she liked a lot. Portions were perfect as was flavor. My only gripe would be paying for salsa and chips. This is Texas! It should almost be a given to have chips and salsa at the table! We will most definitely be making a return trip.

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: We were heading back to our hotel late and wanted something quick to eat. We decided to share the Fried Shrimp House Favorite with sweet potato fries and cole slaw. The shrimp were OK but cooked just a little too long for our liking. The sweet potato fries were just barely cooked and were just limp and tasteless. The cole slaw was actually pretty good. I doubt we'll return, which is a shame given the nice view they have.

reviews.author: Vince A.
reviews.description: I have always enjoyed having lunch here. The food is good, and the management and staff are incredibly service minded. The pork-chops, are bone in with a unique brown sugar and cumin glaze, cooked to perfection. Also as an appetizer try the loaded fried potatoes .

reviews.author: Joan M.
reviews.description: Not one of my faves, service and food have always been mediocre. Great if you want to dine with a view of the river.

reviews.author: Heather W.
reviews.description: Awesome to be able to order and pay online so we were able to grab lunch without a long stop on our road trip.  Really nice customer service and clean bathrooms.  Food was disappointing. I would skip this restaurant next time unless in a hurry.

reviews.author: Blaine B.
reviews.description: I have been to this restaurant 4 or 5 times over the last 3 years. The food has always been mediocre but edible until my visit the other day that was with my wife. My sweet tea tasted like catfish and so did the green beans. I was very disappointed. My wife had a steak sandwich which she couldn't eat either. If your a fan of catfish then this is the place for you. I am not and don't want want my sweet tea to taste like it was brewed in the lake nor the food that I ordered. We both did not feel well after our meal, maybe it was just in our minds because the meal was such a disappointment or maybe it was because everything was cooked in the same grease as the catfish?

reviews.author: Drew D.
reviews.description: This was one of the first places I ate upon moving to Texas.   Usually imma chicken fried steak kinda dude (which theirs is actually incredible) but recently I've been on a sandwich kick.  The fried catfish sandwich actually bangs. The flavor was on point and the bread was super soft.  If I was just a tad bit fatter I could finish this monster and the fries, but unfortunately even my sweat shorts waistband had enough.  L

reviews.author: Ron K.
reviews.description: This is a nice place to grab a bite when driving through. We sat out on the patio and enjoyed the view of the river. The food was good but what stood out was the green chili and cheese potatoes, they were fantastic! The waitress was very nice , the food good and the view great. With a little more effort they could make this place epic. Either way, I recommend stopping here when your passing through , you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Garry H.
reviews.description: Considering the location of this restaurant, I was expecting some stupid crazy high prices. More on that later. I told the hostess this was our first time here and wanted to celebrate our anniversary on the patio. She immediately took us to the worst table on the patio. Thanks. The waitress had no problem putting us at one of the best tables on the patio. Your awesome! All staff were wearing masks. We ordered the Texas grilled Reuben and the Buffalo Chicken sandwich. Both were wonderful. Very seldom does Glenda finish a sandwich! Fries were good and the coleslaw was wonderful. I'm a huge fan of  Long John Silver's coleslaw, sweet and creamy. Very few places make it like that. River City Grille's was a perfect copy! Glenda stopped me from licking the bowl. Now, if your eating wonderful food on a wonderful patio at a wonderful restaurant facing a wonderful lake, your going to pay through the nose. Nope. Normal prices. That's why 5 stars. We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Paul M.
reviews.description: Food was good.  Service originally was excellent.  However, I ate in the bar and the bartender took my credit card and ran off before I could tell him I wanted dessert.  I thought most restaurants automatically ask if you want that.  He had to run it again and kinda acted like it was my fault.   lol

reviews.author: Janet B.
reviews.description: We had such a good time at this place! It feels like a neighborhood pub filled with friends. The staff is incredibly friendly and so attentive. We never had an empty water (or beer) glass, and they were just plain nice. With so many restaurants struggling with staff and service, it was a welcome change. The food was top notch as well! I had the brunch burger and my hubby had the mango habanero wings, and we split the queso and chips. (And by the way, their queso was hella good, especially considering they aren't a Tex-mex restaurant!)

reviews.author: Carole H.
reviews.description: Good food and beer galore on tap, a must for Austinites and newcomers.

reviews.author: Cory O.
reviews.description: This was a nice place to stop on my way home from work. They has a ton of beers on tap and the bartenders were really nice about letting me try different ones before I ordered. Never had the food, but the atmosphere and staff is great!

reviews.author: Juliet J.
reviews.description: Me and my 3 year old were feeling hangry on a Sunday. I didn't want to cook, so we ordered for pick up from Chow Hound. I know there is a no children policy on the weekend. Waitress gave us water while we waited outside. Food was absolutely delicious and worth the extra 10 minute wait. We got the chicken and waffles and sunny side up eggs and home fries.

reviews.author: Joe D.
reviews.description: this has been my neighborhood to go place. My review would have been 4 star originally. I dined there yesterday after not visiting for maybe 2 weeks.    One reason i loved the place was their unique 'curly' french fries. Yesterday, i was quite surprised to see they switched the curly fries to the scoop shape that their sister pub, Brick, serves. Meh. Friends from north Austin would often ask when I was going to Vincent because they liked the curly fries. My friend with me yesterday, said the same thing, whaddup?  i know it's not earth shaking but it made Vincent stand out for me. BUMMER

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Today we wandered into this pub while waiting for an appointment. It was lively with good cocktails and snacks. Their frozen margaritas were smooth and well-blended. I had two different vodka specialty cocktails that were well-crafted. We also ordered the. Shrimp and Poblano Quesadillas which were smoky, spicy and hit the spot.

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: Recently visited this venue for the 1st time - we are always happy to support bartenders or servers during this pandemic. As always we left 25%. The young lady was super nice, kind, helpful and provided info about the menu and venue. We will definitely return!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a chill spot with better then average base food.... this is your place. It's a very casual vibe with a great drink selection. The only downfall is the lack of seating. This is not a big place and it stays pretty crowded. The food I've had so far has been pretty good for bar food. It's definitely a step up!

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: I like this place because of the proximity. The service is slow, but seems to have gotten better. They have a limited menu unfortunately, but nevertheless the food good. The wings are delicious. They were tender and well sauced. Nachos are  crispy and put together. All in all, this place is alright

reviews.author: Glen L.
reviews.description: Been several times. Service is normally slow, although today was a bit better. Overcharged on tab today because waitress lost track of tabs. Got cut off because we were a large group that had a large tab even though no one showed signs of having been over served. Don't plan on returning at this point. Wish something close had a late kitchen, but at this point I'd rather have Top Ramen than go here to get food after 10. Slow service and management that pretends to have people's best interests makes it a no. Food is good, but management that seems judgy makes it a no.

reviews.author: Deanna R.
reviews.description: Loved the vibe of this place. Had their Brodie Smash and Sierra Shandy -- Both great. Bartenders amazing and all ages present.

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: Obviously, this is a sports bar--they have a terrific selection of brews and the atmosphere is fun. Service is hit or miss; the first time I came here and asked for a booth, the bartender became extremely frustrated when explaining their seating policy. They were busy, but still.  The food. It's good but not great--also, it's a sports bar, so it's on par with that cuisine. It's close to our house and nice enough, so we'll keep coming back for a beer and a game.

reviews.author: Michael L.
reviews.description: Total dump. Food was average at best. Added bonus: regulars who do not want  you there, and who are pretty clear about that.

reviews.author: Myra E.
reviews.description: This bar has the best food ever!  The drinks are so tasty, very comfy place, but the menu is really good. Highly recommend. Nice wait staff too and prices are great. Love this place.

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: So it's been 6 months or so since this place opened, I've been a handful of times since and thought I'd write a quick update. My first review came shortly after opening and we all know it takes time to get things in a good rhythm and sorted out, especially in the restaurant business.  The menu was a little odd to me when opening but has since won me over. They often have specials and have even opened up for lunch. Last weekend they had a crawfish boil at a very reasonable $7 lbs. The beer selection seems to be somewhat static, fortunately they have several to choose from, but it would be nice to have several rotating handles, given we are in one of the best craft beer markets around. I was a bit surprised to learn a local Pinthouse beer was $7. It's only a dollar more than at the brewery, but still, this isn't LA.  All and all, I like the direction this place is going, nice outdoor, dog friendly patio, food specials and hopefully some new local beers on my next visit.

reviews.author: Harley D.
reviews.description: Food was good. Staff nice. However my waitress was more concerned with flirting with the boys next to me than serving. Ended up closing my tab with her and just opening at the bar. I think maybe the manager saw it and called her out but still. Service is what sets a place apart. My service here was definitely not up to par at this night.

reviews.author: Kiara D.
reviews.description: This place feels like home to me! Cozy bar, with tasty food and always great company.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Decent food, great beer and wine selection. My only complaint honestly? Both times I've been there wasn't much seating available! It gets super packed! I guess because we've been wanting a bar in this area for a long time, people are really excited ha ha but I wish there was more seating!

reviews.author: Billy V.
reviews.description: I have been having a tough time finding a place to enjoy an adult beverage and watch sporting events in Austin. Most places are these large indoor/outdoor spaces with music and food trucks. Or located downtown. Or you have to drive 30 plus minutes.  Vincent's Sports Pub is just down the road from home. It has plenty of TVs. I mean plenty. You can stand or sit anywhere in this pub and watch your game. AWESOME. A lot of thought was done here with the placement of TVs.  Service outstanding. A very friendly and nice Team. You like beer. You have choices. Lots of drafts and bottled beer choices. Great feel. Very welcoming pub. Plenty of tables. Great looking bar. Nice crowd. No jerks or muscle beer dudes. I judge a place if my wife would feel comfortable alone. Vincent's Sports Pub passes with high marks.  The food is very tasty. I had most of the apps and was very happy. Tasty. Great to share. Shrimp dish very good. Crispy. Wings have some pull and good. Nice pub menu. A scratch kitchen. I did not feel or taste it was a frozen product.  Vincent's Sports Pub will definitely be my go-to pub for drinks and sports on TV. It has a nice welcoming feel. Combination of design of the restaurant, the bar placement, the tables, food and most importantly the staff.  Plenty of parking. CC friendly. Union payment option.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I met my friend here for a HH and to catch up on life. Vincent's sports pub just opened recently inside a small shopping center that includes a nail place, a dental office, and a cosmetic store.   We met up on Wednesday around 4ish and the place was quite busy. I found a table near the bar and my friend showed up shortly after. The waitress handed us the drinks and cocktail menu for our viewing pleasure. The drink menu on the back included 31 drinks on tap to include cider options.  My friend and I ordered our drinks and those were a little slow coming out to us both times. My friend had a cocktail so that is more than likely the reason plus it was busy inside the bar. We didn't order any food but what I saw did look pretty good.   Overall I really liked this place and reminded me of place that I have been to down in Buda. Everyone seemed friendly and it was a down to earth bar. I foresee myself coming here again in the future.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: This place puts every other beer store in ATX to shame. The variety of options here seems endless. The dude behind the counter knows more about beer than most sommeliers know about wine. That's just icing on the cake. They get every limited release and seasonal that drops. Prices can be a little steep but hella worth it.

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: If you haven't been to The Brewtique in Cedar Park, you definitely should check it out.   Anytime you stop by, you'll meet either the owner or his wife and they are both nice and very helpful. You can pretty much buy anything they have in singles and they always have their inventory listed online along with the untapped rating for each beer, which I find very useful. They have a solid selection of local stuff and occasionally some more rare stuff as well. If you're immunocompromised, you can call your order in and they'll bring it to your car; they also have a very sanitary setup inside and require masks (of course) and make everyone use the hand sanitizer when you come in. We've been there about 5 times mixing that in with buying direct from breweries but I really love the diversity you can get while supporting local at the Brewtique

reviews.author: Greg M.
reviews.description: Great place to try out a new beer then buy a six-pack or two. We had a couple beers each (they sell singles if you are hanging out) and then bought some to take home. Taco Truck pilsner was great, Mama Pisner, and there was a pickle beer that was probably a tad too pickley for me (go figure).  Great/fun selection, good prices, knowledgeable staff, and lots of picnic tables out to keep you spread out and safe. You can get snacks too, or play Starship Troopers pinball (Do You Want To Know More?!?). We had  a good time just chilling there on a Sunday afternoon.  Oh, and they recycle those plastic can holders that craft breweries use. Bring yours back to help out the brewers in town!

reviews.author: Philip J.
reviews.description: Really impressive beer bar and shop in Cedar Park. If you're a bit of a beer geek, head over here and you're sure to find some new stuff you haven't tried before. If you're more beer curious, head over and chat with these friendly folks. They know their stuff and helped me to pick out some new beers.  There's a good range of price points here too so you could find a good gift here.   Website is also really useful and lists out everything they have if you like to head in with some ideas of what to grab.   Good atmosphere in there too if you're drinking in.   Overall highly recommend and glad they are here.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: A craft beer lover's nirvana. Come here peruse their extensive inventory pick out a beer and enjoy either on site or grab a few brews to go. I could go on but that's it. Come here and drink good beer, but.  These guys got it goin (sic) on where else can you find a Maine Brewing Co beers or a selection of IPAs that will blow your mind.   Folks here are friendly and of course knowledgable and provide a high level of customer service. Case in point I was out of town and a pal informed me that they had a very hard to find beer available. These nice folks held my order until I arrived, almost at closing time.  Nice folks and righteous brews!

reviews.author: Meg K.
reviews.description: Such a cool spot. I don't live in Cedar Park but I'll be making regular trips here to check out the cool beverages!

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Review time kids!! So the bride is out of town for business, what does any good husband do???? He meets some buds for suds!!   We all met at another place for happy hour when bud 1 recommend this place for some take home treats. I mean,come on, we know a beer-n-burger nut like me can't say no.  This place is totally chill with a few picnic tables to relax and converse with friends. There is also a couple of other chairs if that's your thing. Sampling on sight is totally cool too.  On to the selection of beers. All I can say is,if you can't find something here that you would like, go home,empty handed and admit you have no taste. That's right, I threw the blame squarely on you! Why? Because they must have better than 300-400 different beers to choose from!  Now go, prove me wrong and try that chocolate oatmeal stout or triple ipa !!

reviews.author: Whitney B.
reviews.description: I really can't say enough good things about the Brewtique.  They have an amazing variety of drinks and they're always bringing in new items. The team is incredibly helpful, very knowledgeable about their products, and all around just a couple of really cool folks.  Just tell them what you're in the mood for, and you'll absolutely receive a satisfying recommendation.  They're dog-friendly both in and outside, and are super welcoming to well-behaved pooches. They also do some really cool charity events on behalf of some great organizations. There's almost always something going on in the evenings -- live music, comedy shows, football games, game night, beer tastings.  They also have some neat retro arcade games and board games on hand to entertain.  There's always a reason to pop in and have a drinks!

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great place. Owner always remembers you and knows what you like. They keep an amazing selection that is always changing. If you want to try some beers they have tables inside and outside. Personally love the selection of Texas beers and sours they have.

reviews.author: Short Fuse S.
reviews.description: Just a fantastic place. I had a friend come in from San Antonio and he kept saying he wished there was a place like The Brewtique in his neighborhood. There's a great beer selection, and the owner is a really cool dude. Plus, they carry my favorite beer even though I'm the only one who buys it. That's dedication to customers!

reviews.author: Javier A.
reviews.description: What can I say about Brewtique that hasn't already been said? Great and various beers available here keep me coming back and back. Mgmt is top notch, friendly, and above all knowledgeable. I am always impressed with the ambiance. It feels like a great big community. Service with a smile and a laugh makes my trip there memorable. Also they have great events, live music, and  board games to boot! 3 cheers and a beer for Brewtique.

reviews.author: Jarod P.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great selection. Knowledgeable owners.  Fair prices.  If you remember this location when it was under previous owners, you'll find it's been nicely updated, more tables, chairs and such, even arcade games.  Keep up the good work Brewtique.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Cool little place, glad to see that the old bottle shop here was replaced by another. Owner(s?) seem to care a bunch, and have been available to point out new releases/limited beers, make recommendations, and take pics of my dog.   Prices slightly higher than other big retailers, but selection is much better (tip: check their Instagram for limited beers and new stock). Also, a good selection of CBD products for those interested. I have never hung around to drink there, but you can for a small per-beer charge if you want.   Hope this place keeps getting tasty limited beverages and doesn't turn into a vape emporium like the last one!

reviews.author: Catalina M.
reviews.description: Welcome to cedar park the brewtique! Had the absolute pleasure of coming here today. Great atmosphere, awesome beer selection and such a friendly welcoming owner.  The bottle shop that lived here prior (RIP) was great, but the new layout and even better beer selection really sets this place apart! Such a plethora of great beers and a cool little shop you can crack one open and enjoy it right there! Looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: kenneth m.
reviews.description: The Brewtique has the best selection of fresh beer in the area. Prices are more than fare, and the staff tends to go above and beyond to answer questions.  Bathroom is always clean and stocked with soft and plush 2-ply charmin, they don't skimp on the good stuff! The owner was quite nice and helped me carry my order to my car, even sent me a nice wink and a smile while I was pulling out.

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Need a beer? I mean a great beer? Do you want to enjoy it while killer music played? How about suggested by avid beer enthusiasts. Well, you're home. Enough said. This place hits all the check boxes. Fast WiFi for work, big tables for games. Endless beer.

reviews.author: Luis P.
reviews.description: Craft Beer. Wine. Cider. A great neighborhood little store that always has something that the big stores don't carry. All you have to do is to ask, and they'll give a great recommendation. It's probably the thing you'll always want to do as they carry seemingly hundreds of brands of beer.   And it seems like they are trying to bring more cool events to the Cedar Park area like Comedy nights and Movie nights. Check it out and check out their vintage pinball machines!

reviews.author: Justin C.
reviews.description: If you haven't been here, please stop by. This place is absolutely wonderful. Every time I go in, always greeted and asked if I need anything. There is always something special for a random night of the week. The price to pop a top is great, individual cans or packs is really nice. Exactly what a bottle shop should be. Looking forward to the future of this place. Best of luck.

reviews.author: Marion W.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing. Great selection of beers. Really fun to pick out singles and drink them there or take them home for later. They have a lot of fun events throughout the week like game night, comedy night, and brewer educational events. The passion is obvious with the owners, and they're super friendly to boot. They're building a great community in a cool location. We love coming here and are so thrilled to have such a cool place so close to home!!

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: I love this place!  The beer selection is amazing, and the owners are above and beyond welcoming!  Every time I walk through the front door to grab one of their new arrivals, Scott and Jana greet me like an old friend.  Also it has so much more to offer than just beer, everything from game night to comedy shows and little bit everything else in between.

reviews.author: Steve M.
reviews.description: I found this place while looking for a decent cup of coffee. I prefer to support local businesses.  I went in the morning and got a cup of their breakfast blend and a breakfast taco. The coffee was very good, smooth and not bitter.  They have non dairy options for creamer if you need that. They also have raw sugar, stevia and a sugar substitute.   The breakfast taco was also very good, packed with bacon, potatoes and eggs. They have other meat options as well.   Customer service is top notch. The young lady at the front was helpful and pleasant. I'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: This location is much more chill than their original locale on Parmer. Expect the same great coffee and taps. The menu here is also more expansive than the original locale. We did not eat but checking out other diners' food the nachos are piled high and the tacos are overstuffed.  The servers are very knowledgeable and were able to expertly describe their IPA offerings.   Hopefully, they can improve their outside patio area as currently there are just picnic tables positioned next to the parking lot.

reviews.author: Mariana B.
reviews.description: We came for breakfast. It's a nice and spacious place. They brew coffee and beer. We ordered breakfast tacos, chilaquiles, bowl and croissant. Tacos is good, chilaquiles are very spice, croissant is good and bowl is ok. The latter and the hot chocolate came cold. The coffee was hot is good.

reviews.author: Brian T.
reviews.description: Okay this is my favorite coffee shop in the Austin area period.  I love how big and spacious this new location is, but the coffee is WHERE IT'S AT.  Definitely come here if you're looking for the perfect date spot, study/get work done, or just to enjoy a nice morning coffee and breakfast.  We ordered a hand pour over, a Chemex, and a double espresso.  The double espresso came out first and this one definitely packed a punch - don't let the espresso size cup fool you.  If I was just here for the caffeine content, this one definitely would've done the job alone.   The hand pour over came out next and the presentation was super impressive!  They bring you the entire carafe with the dripper on top, so it's definitely a lot.  Considering this is only $4, you definitely get your money's worth!  This one was so flavorful and the fruity notes definitely stood out while drinking it.  Now the Chemex...just wow.  For $5, they bring the entire Chemex setup to your table and you pour our of it as you drink.  The fact that they trust their patrons with the Chemex really speaks volumes about how much they care about the presentation piece!  Looks aside, this coffee (I believe we got Ethiopian) tasted amazing and on-par with the pour over.  Don't let me forget the breakfast tacos.  This was such a treat.  I got the Migas breakfast taco and this one was stuffed FULL with eggs, tortilla strips, and pico.  It was delicious and filling and for $3, this one definitely hit the spot alongside the coffee.  I also bought one of their coffee beer stouts to take home...I believe it was the House United coffee milk stout.  If taking home, you either order beer in a Crowler (two pint cans) or a Growler (64 oz).  I can't wait to try their coffee IN THEIR BEER.  But most of all, can't wait to come back here every time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: We tried this location out because we were in the area and we really love the location on 1431 and Parmer. This spot is much larger, has a bigger (and better menu) and great service. We tried the Cali burrito (cuz I'm from California and honestly looking for the perfect Cali Burrito) and it didn't disappoint. Beers were great, bartenders had good advice for certain beer tastes and overall a great experience!

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Owners need to claim their business on Yelp. Hop to it guys! We have been coming to Red Horn since 2015, (Parmer Location). Have been a fan ever since.  And we are loving the new Cedar Park location as well. Grab a great beer, (so many options you can't go wrong), and a taco! Tacos at Cedar Park. (Get the deli salad at the Parmer location. Its simple  but amazing!)  Who doesn't love an amazing taco! Vegan options too! Bring your pooch along and sit outside and enjoy the sunset.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: Great locally crafted beers and coffee. I like to come here on Fridays to work remote from my remote office lol. Their tacos and chicken sandwich are worth stopping in for lunch

reviews.author: Thao E.
reviews.description: OH ! High anticipated location! I've been waiting for this location to open since they announced it on their Instagram.   They are having soft openings right now. The space is airy, has high ceilings, and gorgeous.   Being the soft opening, it looks like they are training some new people but they are nice as can be!  They also have Tacomaye on site now for your taco needs. I can't wait to make this my new work spot!  Support your local businesses!

reviews.author: Kim B.
reviews.description: Come for the beer.  Skip the food.   I had high hopes for great tacos and queso to go with my beers.  Unfortunately, the $7 queso was basically Cheez Wiz with some jalapeños, and the beef fajita on my taco was all gristle and had no seasoning.  They could have at least cooked the bell peppers.  The other Red Horn location is much cozier for enjoying a beer.  I'll just go there next time.

reviews.author: Ru L.
reviews.description: The only thing this location doesn't have from the original is the coffee roaster. Other than that the beer is fresh, the coffee is hot, and the food is good. Tacos came fully filled with protein and veggies with two sides of salsa, one green, one red. Two thumbs up.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: This new location is the bomb! Prime selection of craft beer, coffee, tea, fountain sodas too. Plenty of seating, GREAT service, and super delicious food menu -- our favorite so far are the  carne asada loaded nachos -- a must try! Perfect for sharing . The place is really open and bright. Big screen TVs with sports playing. Family friendly. We love coming here for game night, dinner and cold beers.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: This is another place when we come down for a visit we always stop at! The coffee, beer, and food are fantastic! Then there is even dessert coffee.

reviews.author: Shannon A.
reviews.description: They care about their people because they had no kitchen on Independence Day.  The beer flight is great if your fickle or just want to try all the offing's.  It's not on the menu, but it's great.  Also had a London Fog that was absolutely delightful.  Looking forward to coming back for the soft shell crab!

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Nice location. Very clean and inviting. Knowledgeable and friendly  staff. Not a beer guy but the coffees and teas are solid.  It's not on the menu board, but they DO offer beer flights.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Been to this location several times, for both the coffee and the beer. Both are really good. Breakfast tacos are good. The soft shell crab sandwich was also good. The space is great for either socializing with friends or getting a little work done. Staff is friendly. Yeah, this is goi g to be a regular spot for me.

reviews.author: Christy M.
reviews.description: This location is great! Nice open space and a good selection of beer. Haven't tried the food yet, but the coffee is also good.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: Coffee review only. I've tried both locations multiple times hoping each time was a one-off. The coffee here is not good. Like really not good. Service has always been fine. Just really bad coffee.

reviews.author: Teresa M.
reviews.description: 2 stars for the new location - the beer is just as good as the original location and the food isn't bad, but there is zero character and no covered seating  This is Austin - people have dogs. I'm totally ok with sitting outside with my dog since you have a kitchen but man at least buy an awning or umbrellas or something. 4 random picnic tables thrown outside with no shade is an afterthought.

reviews.author: Eric F.
reviews.description: Great decaf coffee and tacos were awesome but be warned the bacon is thicker than normal but still good.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: Food is average at best and the same cashier always gives me an attitude when I order for whatever reason.

name: Culinary Dropout
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Popped into the area looking for lunch and stumbled upon this place. Glad I did!   Loved the atmosphere with it half outside dining and inside dining. I think it's so versatile you could bring family and kids here, or turn down in the evening with a hot date for a nice dinner.   The cocktails are very good. I had the "Room Service" which is a refreshing gin cocktail.   The smoked salmon appetizer was sooooo good with the saltiness from the capers, perfected toasted ciabatta, and perfectly cooked egg. Highly recommend!   The Shaved Prime Rib sandwich was very good as well, and my son had ordered the Turkey pastrami sandwich, which was also very good!   We sat at the bar and the staff was top-notch. Friendly, attentive, intuitive and on their game!   I recommend this place for any occasion.

reviews.author: Trenesia S.
reviews.description: This was my first time visiting this place we came in town for the weekend and had brunch here at the bar   - we stayed in a nearby hotel so we simply walked however there plenty of garage and street parking available if you're not close   Went on a Sunday around 11:15am for brunch ... we always choose bar seating to avoid waits .. (there was a 5 min wait for tables not bad )  I ordered the peachy mimosa and added a tequila shot it was perfect . My boyfriend ordered the breakfast sandwich he  loved it For food I ordered the hash bowl another great choice no complaints ( it did take a while to get your food which is the only reason for my 4 star review ) but the wait worth it . Bartenders were friendly and available.

reviews.author: Braden J.
reviews.description: Culinary Dropout, more like you'll wanna Drop In...bad puns aside, easily one of the best places in the Domain to gather a group of friends and enjoy their very spacious patio. Certainly compliments the great food they have to serve as well.  Atmosphere: Very fitting of the domain and Austin, modern hipster style so very open with a nice view of the domain surroundings. Live music is played on occasion as well, which really makes for that feel of a local flavor styled joint.  Food: Having come here several times and trying most their food items, you can't really go wrong with any particular choice, just whichever suits your craving for that moment. My personal favorites though is the Fried Chicken. Most certainly worth the wait, and comes with flavorful mashed potatoes and gravy mmmhmmm. Meat is well cooked with good texture and doesn't have an overly heavy taste or feel that most deep fried foods commonly come with.  Service: Every time I've gone services has been great. Staff is friendly and can help accommodate any assistance or questions you may have.   Hungry around the domain and need a place that will leave you full with a good experience? Drop-in to Culinary Dropout. Perfect for anyone seeking a casual and enjoyable night.

reviews.author: Elisa M.
reviews.description: Joined folks for lunch and I think I went wild on the appetizers that I was full when it came time for the main dish. We ordered the Brussels, deviled eggs, and  bread, my sister ordered the kale salad with steak and my friend ordered the chicken bbq salad.   So I'll start with the bread - it's grilled and has some balsamic on it. A little salty but good. The deviled eggs came 3 to an order and I love a good deviled egg but this was "meh" at best. Seems like it needed a little more seasoning and there wasn't anything special about it. I will say I'm not usually a fan of brussel sprouts but these aren't mom's brussels. These were fried and then tossed in a sauce (Korean go-guchang) and is a little spicy but oh so good. The kale salad was a lot of small pieces of kale, the steak was tender but I can't say I'd order it again (or steal it off my sister plate). The chicken salad was good and came with a deviled egg.   Overall, it was a good lunch - we did order 4 drinks and the total came up to about $100.   We were able to sit outside on the porch under a heater which made it a great atmosphere. I will say that I saw the chips and dip and will come back to try that.

reviews.author: Chastitie A.
reviews.description: Culinary Drop Out is a good place to recommended for a hang out spot with good food and drinks. Very trendy place, and there's usually live music on the weekends. The outside patio "pre-COVID" had lots of games for guest to play. There's enough TV's to watch sports from anywhere you're sitting. I recommend ordering the fried chicken and homemade mash potatoes. I think it's their most popular dish. The dish is fried to the perfect level of crisp, and it's very juicy!  I also like their salmon!  As far as the drinks, if I'm not ordering my usual Austin Eastcider, I'm getting their jalapeño margarita! One of the best in town!   The vibes are always good here.

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: I originally discovered CD when I used to live in Arizona. It was always THE spot to hang out on the weekends with large groups. I was happy to see CD had an Austin location!  We came on a week night and it was still pretty crowded. Wait time was about 30 minutes, so that gave us some time to walk around and do some window shopping at the Domain. Once we were seated, we put it our order right away.  Pretzels and Fondue: The softest pretzels!!! Perfect for dipping in the provolone cheese sauce. We actually got 2 rounds of these as they were that good.  El Matador: tequila, elderflower, ginger agave, and orange bitters. This is my favorite drink here. Has enough of a fruit taste without being overly sweet. And the bartender made it with a lot of love. Lol. Only 2 drinks and I was finished for the night.  Our server was really great and kept checking on us throughout the night. Fun crowd. Fun music. And a really fun time.

reviews.author: Ashley B.
reviews.description: Just tried to eat here tonight (Tuesday 2/15). Got here around 7:30pm and was told there was a 30 minute wait- no problem we waited. At 8pm on the dot we got a text our table was ready. We were seated and already knew what we wanted so the second our server came over we ordered, maybe 8:05pm. We saw tons of dishes coming out but figured with how busy it was it might be a bit. At 8:35pm someone (not our server) came over and told us "so sorry about the wait, you're up next" we waited 15 more minutes after at least 15 orders came out and finally couldn't stand it anymore and left. We wasted an hour and a half and still left hungry.   The sad part is this is not the first time we've experienced bad service here. Last time we came here with a reservation and were sat outdoors when we reserved an indoor table. 20 minutes passed and no one came to our table even though multiple servers passed us.
