We asked a girl who was clearing tables if there was someone who could take our order and she came back and said no one wanted to so she took our order. I guess that should've been our red flag last time not to visit again but we love the food and gave it another chance.   We've been to Culinary Dropout at several locations in Arizona and never experienced anything like this. The Austin location definitely doesn't hold the standards of the others. We won't be returning and suggest you don't either unless you have 2-3 hours to spare to wait for your food.

reviews.author: Christina F.
reviews.description: Seems like more of a young person drinking place than a good food place.   I didn't love the pretzel bread with cheese "fondue." The cheese seemed like the fake cheese you get in prepackaged containers/baseball games. The pretzels were slightly warm but were a bit dry. Would not recommend.   We both had the Turkey pastrami and didn't love or finish them. I had the French fries and they were good and friend had the side salad and said it was good.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Originally was going to stop for a quick lunch but got ahead of ourselves when looking at the menu.   Brussel Sprouts (3/5): not crispy like I expected it to be but the flavor was solid and unique.  Salad (4/5): they made kale taste good. that's impressive!   36-hour Pork Ribs (3/5): very sauce-y and therefore, very messy. At least the flavor was decent. The ribs itself were are not very tender.   Steak Frites (3.5/5): not bad but also not great. The salad on the side was great tho.   Korean BBQ Skirt Steak (4/5): lots of flavorrrr. Better than the Steak Frites. The meats on these two dishes actually tasted the same but this one had sauce. I actually liked this main the most out of the ones that we tried!   Overall, chill spot for a nice dinner with friends. I would rate this place a 3/5 for the food but probably bump it up because of the ambiance. There's lots of space and a few games to play so the vibes probably make up for the food.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: Get the butternut squash lasagna!! So amazing and melted in my mouth!! Make a reservation but great atmosphere with ping pong and corn hole.

reviews.author: Sabrina S.
reviews.description: Located in the Domain, this is a hoppin' place on an evening for a weekend dinner. Bit of a wait for a table for 4, but no worries.  Eventually we were  seated and our server was super friendly.  We ordered a couple of drinks to start. I didn't care for my cocktail two to mango at all. Hardly tasted the fruit flavors of pineapple, guava, orange or the mango white claw, since it was so overpowered by the vodka. I just passed the drink onto my son. We put our order in for our meals and it took quite a bit of time for the meals to come out. We had to flag down our server to find out what was going on. She mentioned they had many orders and were backed up.  We were a bit disappointed when our meals arrived. My burger was super dry and my son's salmon dish looked like an appetizer. The portion size of the salmon was small and the amount of risotto it was sitting on sad. We left very hungry. Service was slow, food and drinks are overpriced. Not sure we'll come back.

reviews.author: Erin S.
reviews.description: We had a party of 8 at 1:30 pm on the Friday of ACL weekend. It was pretty packed, but they were able to accommodate us. Service was great!  Here's what I tried: - Evil Jungle Princess ($13): This fruity rum drink was good! - Soft Pretzels and Provolone Fondue ($13.25): The pretzel bread was good. The cheese was good. $13.25 is a lot for what it is though. - Gojuchang Brussels Sprouts ($6): It maybe came with 5-6 total brussels sprouts. It tasted good, but super not worth it. - The M.A.C. Burger ($14.50): Their take on a McDonald's Big Mac. It was good!  Fun vibes. Convenient if you're staying in the Domain.

reviews.author: Angela W.
reviews.description: Music is loud, crowd is loud, I consider this a great place for my family of 4 dining out. With two young kids, I often have to rethink my choices. Culinary dropout is great. We love their grilled asparagus, it comes chilled and their seasoning plus whatever methods used really brings out the sweetness of asparagus.  Fish and chip is the real deal, been to many places and felt disappointed, NOT here. Pure deliciousness and we can't wait to come back for more!   Sorry for my rather short reviews nowadays, my hands are kind of full lol

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10-25-21  Quality/Quantity - Gochujang Brussels Sprout - I would have preferred the brussel sprouts to have been a little more crispy. Could not really taste the gochujang flavor, not spicy at all. Kurobuta Pork Ribs - My favorite, good flavor. Would have preferred more fries though. Spicy Vegan Curry - My daughter's choice, I guess it was good, but not something I would have ordered. Had a hint of lemon grass after taste, which is a little different from Indian or Thai Curry. Separated rice versus rice combined in the sauce is also preferred, so we can control the flavor.  Atmosphere - This is a very good spot. I like both the indoor and outdoor space. There were a few activities (cornhole, etc) for the guests. I like the choices of seating - regular tables, high top tables, bar seating, couches, etc. Additionally, your huge wrap around bar was nice. Lastly, I am always a fan of an open kitchen concept.  Service - Julia did a good job; she came back and refilled our water often. It was really busy and the entire team seemed to be working hard. I also noticed 2 employees picking up garbage as they walked back and forth serving customers, this is always a positive plus.  Price - $49.80 + tip  Owner Suggestion - Seems like you are very successful, owning quite a few restaurants. Congrats on all your success, and wish you many more. I look forward to trying your other restaurants in the future.

reviews.author: Brittney T.
reviews.description: Wow - this place is SO good. We were in town for the weekend and decided to eat here because it's dog friendly and right near our hotel. Place was very busy on a Saturday night - multiple parties out on the porch.   I still dream about their chopped chicken salad! - so good!    They have a big drink menu with cute cocktails. Staff was so nice and my dog loved all the loving he got from everyone there.   It's definitely a casual/loud/fun ambiance!

reviews.author: Samantha L.
reviews.description: This is one of the biggest bar/restaurants I've ever been to in America! They have indoor seating and half outdoor seating (it's "outside" of the restaurant but still covered on all sides - great for when it's cold out!   It's a cool bar with live music and games but my favorite part is the food!   We got the cheese fondue that came with a bowl of pretzels and it was nothing I expected at all - pretzels are okay at best usually and most places has cheese that taste gross but this was the best pretzel/cheese combo I've ever had!! The pretzel balls were pretty big in size from what I was expecting, they were warm and perfectly seasoned and delicious! And then the cheese - wow I could literally drink a jar of it if I wasn't my age and getting heartburn everyday as is. I haven't stopped thinking about the pretzels and cheese since my first bite! I definitely want to go back to Austin just for this dish.   And then for entree my boyfriend and I split the butternut lasagna and they were so nice enough to split the dish for us without us having to ask.   Oh yeah and for drinks (I forgot to take a pic) but we got the Smashed Irishman and it was so good we ordered 5 through out dinner.   The staff was really nice and the place was super busy so some things took a little longer to come out and we were forewarned before ordering anyway.

reviews.author: Savannah M.
reviews.description: This place was such a good vibe. We came for brunch, and it would have been an hour wait but open seating at the bar. To my husband and my luck there were 2 seats open.  It was Sunday around 2ish and there was a guy singing with his guitar.  The speakers were amazing you can hear him inside and out on the patio.  Friendly staff. The food was so good. My husband and I are some carnivores but today we both ordered vegetarian options  Don't let that fool you. Both dishes were packed with flavor. My favorite was the vegetarian spicy curry. Holy cow was it good. So good. Would definitely visit again!!

reviews.author: Jeremie T.
reviews.description: Nice location. Great outside and open atmosphere. Vibe was just right. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Austin domain area.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: It's something about the atmosphere that continue to have my attention. The service is attentive and coming to CD for a good piece of fried anything works for me.   At this point I just need to wait for the games to return. The waitress shared that before Covid they had games for adults like png pong.  I'm ready!!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We've heard great things about this place and decided to give it a try for brunch. Made a reservation. Glad we did, as it filled up fast soon after we were seated.   This is a great place for large groups. More bar than restaurant.   Cocktails were tasty and reasonably priced. Large selection of beer on tap. The menu is a little thin, and our brunch items weren't anything special.   Service was top notch. We'd come back for happy hour, but probably not for a meal.

name: Nate's
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: James R A.
reviews.description: My wife and I visited from Wimberley, meeting her grown children for a late afternoon drink; they came down from Austin.  Audrey was our server and she did a great job. We sat outside and requested the volume of the music be decreased enough to allow conversation. Everything went well.  Nice place, good parking, attentive service.  Give it a chance.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Get to know the bar tender well  because if they don't know you, you'll wait forever for another drink while he chats with the regulars. Not a busy sunday. An apology was offered for bad awareness. Apology accepted

reviews.author: Ana R.
reviews.description: I used to love going to Nate's until recently. Aside from the great ambiance, open patio, fire pit and decent drinks, I love the location. However, during my last visit, I had a really off putting encounter with one of the male bartenders. When I first arrived, I was carded by a female employee who served me two drinks upon reviewing my Texas issued ID. I went to sit down with my friend and after finishing our drinks I went back into the bar to order two more. When I went inside, the male bartender stared at me for sometime and then offered to assist me with getting two more drinks. He requested he see my ID again after I had already been carded and served two drinks with an open tab. At first I gave him the benefit of the doubt because I understand that I do look very young for my age and he was just trying to do his job. In addition, this is a neighborhood bar with many regular patrons so he probably had not seen me before. Thus, I went back and got my ID from the table and showed it to him again. After three minutes of him starting at my ID he took it to the back and questioned the female bartender about my ID who had already checked it. He then started scratching at it and bending it several times to see if it was fake. I told him that I was indeed over 21 and had other forms of IDs to prove it but that he was making me very uncomfortable with his odd approach.   I started to get flustered because it was getting the attention of other patrons and I felt very singled out especially being the only African American woman in the entire establishment. It truly me feel as though that because I was a young black women who seemed out of the norm, it took part in his  questioning of my integrity and the validity of my ID.   After several minutes he finally gave me my ID back and told me , "fake IDs are really getting great these days...don't get upset..at least you can take it as a compliment that when you're older you'll still look so young."   I was very taken a back about that comment as I felt that was extremely misogynistic of him to say as a woman's beauty and looks aren't tied to her age. Regardless of looks or age, every woman deserves to be treated with kindness, respect and the same standards that any other patron would experience.   This entire encounter really upset me because I felt that prior to this experience, Nate was a very friendly, safe place for people of all drinking ages, ethnicities and genders to have a relaxing drink and watch the sunset. This encounter made me feel otherwise and hope that this review draws the attention of management so that other's don't have to experience.

reviews.author: Glenn B.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a nightcap and stumbled into trivia night. Perfect. What wasn't perfect was the bartender. Husky Filipino/ Hispanic bruh with a gray shirt and backwards cap. Never got his name because he was too busy looking pissed off at the world and just couldn't be bothered. Ordered two drinks, a beer and a cocktail. He poured the beer then asked for my card. I said "Oh, I also had a whiskey". He said " I know". Pretty rudely. Asked if I was starting a tab. I said "No. I'll pay as I go". Then not a word after. Now I work in the airline industry and have really thick skin. But, his attitude did not set well with me. Especially since his job includes tipping for service. Why cut your nose off despite your face?    Told my wife what had transpired. She went in to see for herself. Even she said he was rude.   But he had time to chat up regulars and a cute girl sitting at the end of the bar.   The only thing that salvaged the experience was the host for trivia night and the waitress working the outside patio. She had lots of people out there. Took care of all of us with a great attitude and friendliness.   Probably will not come back. Too bad. The place had potential.

reviews.author: Rick Z.
reviews.description: After getting the frozen margarita flight next door at Los Olivos, we weren't quite ready to head home, so we walked over to Nate's where my bro and his wife got another alcoholic beverage, while my partner got an espresso and I got a hot chocolate. The hot chocolate is a bit pricey ($4) but it's prepared with the espresso machine to froth the whipped cream directly, so it gives it a nice smooth feel that's quite a yummy experience.  Their outdoor seating was pretty full, so we opted to sit indoors and take one of the corner booths where there were pillows to cozy up on. The outdoor deck is really nice, positioned under a grand oak tree with lots of string lighting, along with a long firepit for cooler weather! Get there early before dusk to secure yourself a spot, is my advice.  While there are a few deli sandwiches and the like to partake in, this joint is mainly a bar with a variety of drinks. Scan the QR code to view on your phone and order with the guy behind the counter.  The inside decor rocks the industrial vibe that's become so in fashion currently. Bathrooms are clean and well-stocked.

reviews.author: Glenn P.
reviews.description: The best place to meet for drinks between Austin and San Marcos. Love their outdoor patio and the inside is great for warmer days. I would give them 5 stars if they had more of a food selection. They are worth 5 stars all day.

reviews.author: Tatiana G.
reviews.description: I have been here 3 times now hoping that each time I'll have a better experience. I went there yesterday on a Monday, March 28th, with a girlfriend of mine to celebrate my birthday. We walk in and go up to the bar, the bartender was a philipino/Hispanic looking guy, and was very rude and had the worst attitude. We go up to the bar and he just looks at us with no greeting or anything, so I finally say "do y'all have any menus we can look at?" He hands us two menus which only had about 4-5 drinks on there. Me and my friend saw on their website that they have charcuterie boards, so I asked him "do y'all have an appetizers or finger foods?" And he said "this isn't a restaurant" so I told him "okay well on your website it says y'all offer these meat and cheese boards. " so he pulls one out and puts it in front of us so rudely. We order our drinks and me and my friend sit outside. Everytime we went up to him he seemed so annoyed and bothered by us trying to order something. Literally the worst service. Everytime I have been here the bartenders are so rude. Do yourself a favor and take your money elsewhere! I honestly shouldn't have even left a tip for this guy, that's how bad his attitude was.

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is such a cool bar and it would be cool in Austin not just Buda!  The ambience is really cool and their signature cocktails are amazing! I definitely want to go back it is a fun place to hang out and the service is awesome.  They are taking all of the proper precautions and it is worth a drive from wherever you are to come visit this place and hang out either inside or outside depending on the weather.

reviews.author: Sophia L.
reviews.description: I love Nate's. It's cafe/bar is cute. The low rating has to do with the female bartender that worked tonight Saturday 02/20/2021. She is abrupt, rude and has a huge ego. She looked miserable and seemed to hate working tonight. I noticed over 10 people walk out of the bar due to her attitude. She was annoyed by everyone. When I gave our order she made an ugly face as if my order was a bother. She continued to get worse during the night. She doesn't belong in a career of customer service. Her sour attitude has cost the place to lose money and new customers.

reviews.author: Carter C.
reviews.description: Growing up, I had a best friend named Nate.  When I heard about this place, I assumed it was his.  Just like when we were kids, I burst through the door and scream "Hey Fart Face"! Everyone turned and looked but there was no Nate.  I asked everyone but no one had seen fart face.  Disappointed with not seeing Nate, I passed the time with some great drinks on the spacious deck.  I never found Nate.  I wanted to relive some of the great times we had growing up watching snowy HBO to catch a glimpse of something we shouldn't and seeing if his sister was still single.

reviews.author: Kay S.
reviews.description: Excellent service and amazing live band on the open patio. It had amazing atmosphere and best tequila mule I have ever had!

reviews.author: Kyndal C.
reviews.description: Nates is a nice spot to go to grab a drink on the patio and the patio is super nice. Unfortunately there is a bartender that works there that has the WORST attitude. She is super rude and I asked why she was being so sassy, and she said "because it's fun".  All of the other bartenders/servers were absolutely delightful and I hate for this to make them look bad.   Here's the thing, I have worked in customer service and in the industry for a long time, I get it, some days SUCK, but the way that this young lady was acting was unacceptable and I agree that she does not belong in customer service. I also agree that Nates is losing money and customers because of her.   I hope that she finds another industry that she enjoys, because clearly this isn't it and her tone clearly states it.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: Who knew this quaint bistro type place existed in "Bubba land"?  Great cocktails, coffees, pastries/ desert and sandwiches. This establishment also lets pizza deliveries arrive too. What a wonderful place to stop and share with friends!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We approve of Nate's. Buda deserves a great neighborhood bar. Like the industrial decor. Great seating inside around the bar, at tables, and outside on the patio. An abundance of Misters and fans make even an August afternoon comfortable outside.   Great selection of local craft beers on tap and nice happy hour prices.   The real reason we came and why we'll come back: the Bartenders. They are friendly and know what they are doing. Well crafted original and classic cocktails. We threw a few obscure requests their way and they made perfect drinks without having to consult the "googles." That will always get my crowd to become loyal repeat patrons.

reviews.author: Vince A.
reviews.description: I really like Nate's, they always have great spins on craft cocktails, a really fun atmosphere, and great themed parties.

reviews.author: Keyana S.
reviews.description: Nate's is great and love their live music on certain days. I'm hoping to bring my friends here again whenever they do open the patio again.

reviews.author: Amy Q.
reviews.description: I'm saddened to say that I don't think I'll ever go to Nate's again.  I have lived in Buda for several years and make an effort to support local businesses but I have tried Nate's 3 times now and every single time the same bartender has the WORST attitude and has ruined my night out for the last time.  The first couple of times I just brushed it off but he seriously is so foul and unwelcoming that I can't stand going there.  He not only has been rude to me, but also my family members, and most recently friends visiting from out of town.    Management- if you want people to frequent your business, get rid of staff that obviously hate their job.

reviews.author: Ruben C.
reviews.description: Linda listen.  You have ATX. You have SAT. Each great in their own right in terms of culinary and mixology prowess.  Enter Buda, TX.  Nate's could be described as country chic meets 21st century industrial look.  The 3-4ish times I've been have been exceptional. Not only is the staff fantastic but if you ask nicely, the staff will share their beverage and beverage history with you.  Nate, Shelly and Clarie are personable and what the ideal bar staff should be: professional,  knowledgeable yet friendly and engaging.  If anything, their old fashioned is a must; best I've had.   While they do not have a kitchen, they do offer snacks.  These are brought in daily from local businesses  (sandwiches, salads, etc.) They do have meat and cheese trays they make there which are made with quality meat and cheeses. The selection changes daily so check the counter (immediately as you come in) for what they have available.  18 craft beers on tap and craft cocktails? Buda, you're soon becoming my favorite non metroplex destination.  Muah!

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Cocktails and bartenders were not so strong when it first opened but each year has improved dramatically! Went for Maddie gras this past February and it was crowded and still tons of fun. Great event-themed cocktails and great bartenders that know what they're doing. The cuvée coffee isn't my thing but it appears to be a big hit with other people! Had some cake balls while enjoying my fruity cocktail that was delicious and beautifully decorated. Nate's is a solid local bar for hang out time with friends, casual trivia game playing and for unwinding after a stressful day.

reviews.author: Lysa T.
reviews.description: Amazing cocktails, atmosphere, music, and even pastries! Haven't had the small selection of sandwiches they offer.... I've seen some people bring pizza on the patio from an outside restaurant but not sure if that was technically allowed.   I get the drink special every time and so far I've never been disappointed. Been about 3 times and I'd say the only thing "bland" is the service. I hate to say it but my service experience every single time was less than friendly. Not rude but.... just not welcoming. Which is sad since this place is so awesome. It's not bland enough to keep me coming back, just hope they see this and take it as constructive feedback and hopefully improve!!! I think the girls have been more friendly than the guys.   Either way, 4 stars! YUM.

reviews.author: Mattie I.
reviews.description: There is a lot of breweries in the area but Celis is one of my favorite. They are family and women owned and very receptive and kind to their customers. They have reposted my pictures on social media and allowed a close friend to film a short film there for free. The beers are unique and delicious, with lots of options on tap! They have nightly specials and events, all of which are fun! For example trivia on mondays and Thursday, and they have little long horn saloon come do chicken shit bingo once a month there as well. At one point I was going every week for the Tuesday 99c east coast oysters. Among many other specials. There has been some miscommunication in the past with showing games but the manager working at the time is always very quick to help out. For example none of the TVs had sound on when they advertised they all did, there was confusion inside but the manager was outside and apologized and immediately turned on the sound inside and changed to social media to reflect inside. I also noticed that someone had paid to play the juke box and he paused their songs and gave them a free beer for rhe inconvenience. The dog park is also very nice and spacious and the new beer patio is very well put together! I am looking forward to live music!   Unrelated to Celis itself, but Black draft pizza truck is good there but overpriced. I am excited to try the new con todo truck!

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: Average spot for some beers  Came through on a weekend afternoon. had some drinks at the inner tap room. overall, the place was a bit meh. the beer didn't really stand out, and I am not really sure why, but the vibe of the place just seemed off. It wasn't a terrible experience, but I probably won't see myself back here in the future. Overall: 2.5/5.

reviews.author: Matthew P.
reviews.description: Solid beer, beautiful taproom, nice beertenders. I continue to not understand why they pump their music so loud. This place should be pretty chill - there's nine people here either chatting (or trying to) or working as I type - but they're blasting the music as always. It's kind of bizarre, doesn't fit the vibe, but they always do it. Thus I knocked off a star.  Look for oyster nights, a real highlight here.

reviews.author: Carly C.
reviews.description: Celis Brewery has a huge outdoor space, live music, an indoor area, very dog friendly, and I counted at least 4 food trailers. I think the food trailers consisted of pizza, tacos, German sausages, and sliders. I loved the ample seating, mixed crowd of people, and the decent variety of beers. I am pretty sure it's strictly beers and ciders here - no wine or cocktails.  This place will be great for a hot summer day and cold beer.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Love the beer and bartenders are awesome! There's a giant fenced area for dogs to play. They also have a huge beer garden with a stage for live music and two different food trucks. Got to randomly enjoy oysters here too. Definitely a go to brewery.

reviews.author: Ken Y.
reviews.description: I recently visited Austin after quite a few years, and maaaan... has it changed.  Aside from all of the gentrification and inflation, there are some pretty positive things happening here.  Food joints and breweries are everywhere it seems!   That said, Celis is one fine brewery.  My Austinite friend and I stopped through for a few cold ones.  Great service, chill atmosphere, huge drink selection.

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: The outdoor lighting drew us to this place.  There are seats outside and inside and they serve delicious craft beer.  There are also daily specials that we want to return for, such as, oysters on the half shell for $1 each served on Tuesdays.    We brought our craft beers outside and enjoyed them immensely. The customer service you get is above and beyond! Thank you!!  They have good prices and you get what you pay for. This is a must place to try and I recommend it to anyone that loves a good dark - or light - craft beer. You will not be disappointed you came.

reviews.author: Amber H.
reviews.description: The absolute BEST that you could ask for. The food trucks, the vibe, the BREW, and the staff are genuinely elite. Cass has served us on multiple occasions and deserves all of the raises. There's zero chance to be disappointed here.

reviews.author: Jocelyne V.
reviews.description: This is officially my favorite Brewery for happy hour in North Austin. Their selection is amazing and the atmosphere is both relax and inviting.  I highly recommend the raspberry beer and the sour cherry one, I can't wait to go back and try their tropical fruits and lime!  They have a taco truck with very good braised Tacos and que so as well.

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: We didn't like most of the beers on our flights. Perhaps we aren't the right audience, as this brewery specializes in the sweeter Belgian style beers, but we tried beers across the spectrum and although some were ok there were none we felt we'd go back for a pint of. The atmosphere was cool and medieval feeling inside though and it looks like they have tons of weekly events like trivia etc.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: The front of house versus the back was a big contrast. Front of house was a nightmare. They were blaring music so loud - outside - that we couldn't have a conversation across the table. Every customer looked like they were only there for Instagram pictures and the perfume was so thick you could see it hanging in the air. The waitress inside is ummm... dressed to get big tips. Ahem. Then you go back to the outdoor concert area, and it's a lot of families with kids and regular people. Weird. Beer was okay, but after the cloud of perfume I was honestly too sick to drink. Maybe someday I'll come back and avoid the front entirely. Then I went to cash out and the walking cloud of perfume was in front of me in line.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Love love love the new outdoor area at Celis! This has always been a super dog friendly brewery but now there's even a dog park! Beer is always good here. I'm normally an IPA person, but found their Mexican lager to be great on a hot day. Lots of outdoor seating and a couple of TVs to catch the game. There's some food trucks on site too. Definitely turning into the new go to spot with the pups

reviews.author: Brittany L.
reviews.description: One of my all time favorite breweries. Their Raspberry beer is incredible. I stock up every-time I'm in Austin! Go check'em out and their awesome food truck outside.

reviews.author: Veronica H.
reviews.description: Great place to have a good drink and date night. Great atmosphere. I will be back! My friend love the beer.

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: Staff not wearing masks, Backdraft Pizza staff not wearing masks, patrons not wearing masks. That makes us feel safe and secure that all is now well.....  Nice space, good music with a casual atmosphere where you can even bring along man's best friend, both inside and outside.  Backdraft Pizza OK, nothing great nothing bad.... Celis Hazy; tasted like cardboard, and the Raspberry Beer, not so good.

reviews.author: Caitlin G.
reviews.description: Lots of parking Outdoor and Indoor Seating  Really appreciate Celis hosting a vegan pop-up over the weekend! We came for the food and decided to check out the brewery as well. The music inside was pretty loud, but I'm also an old lady.  It was pretty easy to find a seat indoors and out. I only wish they had a non-beer/gluten-free alcoholic option like cider or wine. Please add this to your menu in the future!

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Super chill place with great people and two new fantastic food trucks, family run Neapolitan style pizza and delicious Hawaiian plates (shrimp is fantastic).

reviews.author: Abigail G.
reviews.description: Went to this brewery for their Tuesday's $1 oyster special, and had a great time! The brewery is easy to get to, has plenty of parking, and tucked away in a low key part of north Austin. Perfect place to stop by after work on a weekday. The oysters were outstanding, the price is awesome for east coast oysters. We also tried some of their beer, the Raspberry flavored beer is a must, absolutely loved it.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here to hang out with a small group on a Wednesday night. They have a big open space well suited to groups big and small. They also have events pretty regularly like weekly trivia and I saw posters for a democratic debate viewing party happening the next day.   The vibe here is very relaxed, they're dog friendly, have a couple of board games and a ping pong table. They had a food truck outside that seems to rotate fairly often. If you're up around the area and looking for a chill place to hang out after work you can't beat the vibe.   The only thing I had to give them a small knock for was the beer. I tried a flight and went mostly with the (very friendly I might add) bartenders recommendations. Outside of their standard witte they were all quite extreme versions of their respective flavors.   Their hazy ipa was super biter and lacked that usual juicy quality you'd expect from the name. The lime Berliner weisse and raspberry wheat were both missing much non fruit flavor. If you has given them to me blind I would have thought they were both sours.

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: How and why have I not reviewed Celis!?! I'll put it down to old age.  Celis, as y'all know, is an Austin institution- steeped in history, the first craft brewer to bring Belgian beer to the craft world in ATX (I think), so y'all can rest knowing that their wheat beers are AWESOME.  The tap room is large, airy, albeit a little dimly lit. There's patio seating outside and get this- DOGS ALLOWED INSIDE AND OUT!   They also welcome kids! Actually I think everyone is welcome here. It's one of the friendlier breweries in ATX IMHO.  We've visited almost every Sunday during covid and I can say that they're taking every precaution. There's live music on the weekends from 6-9pm.  Beer wise - I like the options. If you're a sour beer connoisseur, you'll enjoy the raspberry sour. Light beer? Lo Lo Lager. Safe, easy drinking? Celis White.  I know this place has had its ups and down but as Austinites, we need to show support to our local businesses and just be cool with each other.

reviews.author: Tina N.
reviews.description: New brewery with lots of seating inside and out and dog friendly! Also has a food truck on site and is down the street from St Elmos, Austin Winery etc. The beer was good and I imagine as more people hear about it, the vibe will pick up!

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: We came here what I believe was opening weekend! They had 5 beers on tap, with the option to get a flight (3 pours- $7), beers to go, or full pours to enjoy. They  had staples like a Pilsner, or you can try something a little different like the sparkling golden ale (IMO heavy on the brut flavor). They have seating inside as well as outside, and they're dog friendly! They also had some cute shirts/apparel with their logo on it for purchase. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying this place once they expand their selection a little bit, but overall it was good! It's also right down the way from St Elmos Brewing, so add it to your list and hit them up when you're in the area/getting your beer fix.

reviews.author: Bryon T.
reviews.description: Visited for the 1st time on Friday 6/25/21.  Had the pleasure of meeting the owners who were very friendly, helping serve customers.  The gentleman who served us our beers was also very friendly.   The beers were all very good and we enjoyed our flights.  Sometimes new breweries take time to develop a good list of beers, but I was impressed.   The setting was nicely laid out and decorated.  Indoor seating with AC for those hot days, as well as outdoor seating.   Check out Vacancy and support local independent breweries!!

reviews.author: Jeff W.
reviews.description: Spectacular!  Taps are unreal top to bottom. If you miss the Juicy Lucy or the June, you're mistaken.

reviews.author: Steven A.
reviews.description: Add this to your list! The beer is great and so is the vibe. There's seriously not a bad beer on tap, so try them all. They've got Indoor/outdoor seating and are dog friendly. To top it all off the staff is really friendly!   P.S You'll thank yourself for trying the food truck   Cheers!

reviews.author: Amanda B.
reviews.description: Not inclusive at all. Felt really uncomfortable after walking in and asking some questions. Implied I was old and didn't know about beer. Kinda weird since I am a brewer from another state and I didn't realize there was an age limit on beer.

reviews.author: Martin P.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Great selection of beers, great atmosphere, seating inside and out, and dog friendly. The food truck was good too and it was nice to get to chat with the owners a little bit - good luck to them!

reviews.author: Russell B.
reviews.description: Great beers especially loved the IPAs space is really cool and well designed. Will be back again soon.

reviews.author: Brenda G.
reviews.description: Crafter's Cocktails is a great business providing quality drink mixers for great value!  I love that delivery is provided with each order in the Austin area.  They release their weekly mixers during the week so make sure you're on their list serve.  I was able to get a holiday drink mix that I paired with some liquor I already had.  The mix paired really well and each drink would be the equivalent of a $16+ cocktail if I'd had it at most Austin establishments.  You can also recycle the bottles they use by placing them outside during your next delivery

name: Gourdough's Public House
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Late Night, Dessert
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Kike A.
reviews.description: I visited Austin about a year ago and I still remember this experience vividly!   First, the ambience was very casual but the food was so good! For all my people with a sweet tooth, this is definitely the place for you. With all the fried foods you can think of, I definitely had to pace myself.  I also got "The Big Cheez" (not pictured) to start. It was sooo good. It's mozzarella cheese wrapped in donut dough deep fried with a butter and cilantro buttermilk dressing. This is definitely not a place you go to and every week unless you plan to spend some nights in the gym LOL.   This is great for cheat days and I love that they have very fun takes on regular donuts.   Check out my video + pics on my food page for more!  @TreatsofTexas  https://www.instagram.com/p/CFQBlzOHXnL/?utm_medium=copy_link

reviews.author: Fay G.
reviews.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE. The donuts are fried to perfection, every time. The plates are unique. Gourdough's is great to bring guests to experience what Austin has to offer.  Portion sizes are very filling, except for the Grilled Cheese. The prices are high, but you will have a quality, fun and delicious experience.  My second time here, I ordered the Country Clucker, and the Piña Colada (again). The Piña Colada was still delicious, but I fortunately the bartender did not go all out like last time (I missed the coconut shavings and umbrella). The Country Clucker was a solid choice. I LOVED the candied jalapeños (slightly spicy). The creamed corn was a bit flavorless for my liking, there was a HUGE piece of chicken, and the donut was great. I'm not sure if I'd order this dish again, but I did love the jalapeños. The entrees do not come with a side like the sandwiches and burgers, so my dad and I split a side of fried okra. The side of okra is different from the appetizer of fried okra - instead of frying the entire okra, it's just little balls. The side also does not come with the delicious dipping sauce, but luckily we were able to ask for it. I was soooo full after this meal. My dad ordered the Pork My Avocado - he devoured it! If you like fried avocado and refried beans, it's a good choice. Kind of a Tex-Mex spin, with the queso on top too! He always loves a local beer, and orders the McConaughaze beer every time. My sister ordered the Double D's. She couldn't finish it! Instead of the chips, she got the jalapeño potato salad (subbing a side will cost extra). It wasn't spicy at all, and I wouldn't say it was outstanding and worth paying extra for it. Her S.O. ordered "built his own" Grilled Cheese with garlic bread and two types of cheese. He is a VERY picky eater, but he loved it! Said it was "better than anything he can make himself," which is saying something. He was the only one out of us who had room for dessert. He got the Sin A Bomb and ate it all up. It tasted like a king cake filled with cream cheese!  The service from our waitress could have been improved. She was not attentive, and the service was slow. We relied on communicating with other staff members for some of our requests.

reviews.author: Melissa V.
reviews.description: We came in for lunch and it wasn't very busy. Took a long time to get waited on, but a grumpy guy finally showed up and took our order. Drink... Raspberry something Flora Dora... not good, tasted like chemicals. It was bad. Our sandwiches were extremely greasy, and brussel sprouts arrived cold. A table across from us sat empty and dirty nearly the entire time we were there. Waiter only checked on us once and my kid had to get up to ask a waitress for ketchup at the counter. It was all around just a poor experience.  The only positive I can say is that we encountered one friendly employee who said Hi while she worked on rolling napkins. She was busy and still made the time to be friendly.  Been here before and that experience was completely different. This was just regrettable! With so many dining options in Austin, I doubt very much that we'll ever go back.

reviews.author: Jim O.
reviews.description: Ah, good   weather has returned and with it outdoors dining! So to Gourdough's we go. Alas, in these times everyone is having staffing issues. And I have to confess that there were problems in the service at the beginning. But I spoke up and we resolved the issues and  Krystal turned out to be one of the best servers I've had in a while. Yes the food is still to much but just resign yourself to getting a doggie bag!!!

reviews.author: Rachel A.
reviews.description: Yumm!! Everything we had at Gourdough's was fantastic!   Drinks: totally recommend Rubys Lube especially if you don't likes sweet drinks ...and it's refreshing!   Food:  Wizkaleefa  Twisted Eggs Netflix and Chil Count Gordo Cristo sandwich  Mother Clucker   All the food was delicious!  There's so much more that I want to try so will definitely be back soon!

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: I really wish I could rate this 4 or 5 stars but we had a pretty bad experience with our service. For background, when we originally visited Austin several years ago we fell in love with Gourdough's (I have a really serious sweet tooth). Since then we make this a must-stop whenever in town.   We ordered the blue balls and the country clucker along with a regular coffee and the donut coffee. Blue balls was as amazing as ever! The country clucker was brought out WITHOUT the candied jalapeños and we had to wait several minutes before our server came back to check. The candied jalapeños really make the dish. We ran out of our drinks and also had to wait several more minutes for our server to come out with more coffee and water.    After flagging down the server 4-5 times throughout the meal, it kinda seemed like he didn't really care to check up on us.

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: Gordough's is a MUST TRY for any sweet lover! The warm fresh donut with delicious toppings is my family's favorite for dessert. My best friend was visiting from out of town during the holidays,. We took her there and she fell in love with the Nutty Valentine (extra pecans). She requested that we go there a second time before she was going to fly back. We of course, happily obliged! My go to is the nutty valentine with a topping of pecans, my son loves the black out, and my husband loves the black betty with icing on the side.  We hope to try the savory donuts the next time we're there, it's just so hard to decide between sweet or savory!

reviews.author: Kip S.
reviews.description: Bar service is outstanding, but table service is beyond abysmal. As I type this I've been sitting at a completely empty table for 25 minutes without so much as a greeting from any of the staff. There are at least four servers milling about, but not one has offered me a menu or so much as a glass of water. Crickets. Even though it's close to home and I sit at the bar often, this experience is enough to burn the bridge. The food is solid, but the WiFi is even worse than the table service, and if their social media management is as bad as their patio service, I doubt they'll bother responding to this, which would hardly be surprising. What a clown show.

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: I can't say no to the donuts!!!!!!! Mezcal Paloma Was ! Dumpling soup satisfied my soul and the Cuban sammy is my personal fave. Blue balls were taken home to enjoy poolside next day :)

reviews.author: Cydnee R.
reviews.description: I loved the concept of this restaurant. It's so creative. I was wondering how'd they execute our meals and was pleasantly surprised.  I'm not sure if this place gives sports vibes to anyone else but there were several screens/projections available to watch various games. The outside seating was adorable. They have a bar out there as well, I believe.   Our appetizer, Three Little Guidos, was sooo good. The bacon literally melted in my mouth. I thought maybe it'd be too much bread but honestly it was really good. The McGourdough sandwich was delicious and so filling. I loved how they utilized donuts in different ways. We shared a mimosa carafe. For dessert, we took home the Cherry Bombs donut holes. The cherries added the perfect touch.   Overall, I really enjoyed this restaurant and I am eager to go back.

reviews.author: Josh M.
reviews.description: When I first moved to Austin, I went to Gourdough's nearly every other week and eventually burned myself out on the overly sweet, donut concoctions. Now, I revisit them every few months.   It's always dead empty, no matter when I go. It's so surprising how easy it is to come in for brunch on the weekends.   My go-to is the Dirty Plucker (fried chicken on top of a maple glazed donut), the Big Cheeze (giant moz sticks with dipping sauces) and pitcher of mimosa.   Service is generally great.

reviews.author: Aurora M.
reviews.description: From a small food truck to full blown restaurant, Gordoughs still has it! Lots of variety and still the tried and true Gordoughs doughnuts they're known for. The menu is entertaining and interesting to say the least! We got the saucy cock (LOL) which was amazing! I was looking forward to the Count Gordough Cristo, but it flopped in my opinion. The sandwich arrived cold and the ham was colder so I don't recommend this dish. Other than that, lots of TVs to watch the game and great drinks of all kinds!

reviews.author: Ken D.
reviews.description: Gourdough's answers the questions that you didn't know you had. And the answer is always donuts!    How do you make mozzarella sticks better?   Wrap them in donut dough, aka The Big Cheez.   How do you make a breakfast sandwich better?  Serve it on donuts.  The McGourdough is maple sausage, egg, and cheese (on donuts, of course) with maple on the side (opted not to have the pour-over). There's plenty of maple flavor in the sausage so I never used the side of maple syrup.   Once again, how do you make Kolaches better?  You guessed it, use donut dough, aka Gotchie Yo Kolache  And finally, is it even possible to make a Cuban sandwich even better?  Yup! The Cubano, a Cuban sandwich on donuts.   I'm shocked that they didn't figure out how to serve me my beer in a donut!  That's right, a full-bar to go with all that doughy goodness!  Donuts and alcohol, what more do you need?

reviews.author: Minly L.
reviews.description: There is nothing I like more than mixing sweet with savory. It is extremely satisfying when executed successfully, so shout out to Gourdough's for doing it extremely well.   I was actually expecting the doughnut to be sweeter on my dish, and I'm happy it was not. Everything really paired well together.   The vibe is very Austin-esque and the staff was super friendly. My friend asked for no cheese on her burger, they put cheese, but the waitress happily got it fixed up for us.   I can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Trevor L.
reviews.description: This was my first by time here and was sort of disappointed in what I received; I guess my expectations were higher. The description state "crispy fried fillet chicken breast smothered in honey butter."  I did request to have the honey butter on the side. I got two chicken tenders instead of a chicken breast (not to be too critical but the description should be updated if chicken breast = chicken tenders). The honey butter sauce was not what I was expecting; (not a fan). On the bright side, the donut was pretty good. Even thought it wasn't a chicken breast,  the tenders were tasty and had a good crunch.   I did order the miss shortcake and it was pretty good. But nothing special I suppose. Maybe I'll try a sandwich instead so get a full experience. I'll try them again and see if I get a different experience.

reviews.author: Brandon S.
reviews.description: I struggle with rating this place. The food is fantastic and different, when you can get it. Showed up on a Sunday for breakfast and there were SO MANY THINGS I wanted to eat. I picked one thing intending to visit Monday morning again to get the other.   Our group showed up on Monday morning only to be told that their ENTIRE brunch menu was not available during the week. What the fuck man? Nowhere on the menu does it say that. They list brunch offerings with everything else on one giant menu.   The waitress proceeds to tell us how she has to break peoples hearts just about everyday. If you have customers everyday that aren't aware of your limited offerings on a weekday, the problem is you, not your customers.   How hard would it be to add a little graphic anywhere on the menu that says brunch is only available on Sat and Sun? Not sure what genius decided not to include key info on the menu or the website about limited brunch offerings.

reviews.author: Mechila B.
reviews.description: I came here with a couple of friends yesterday and there was something off abt this place. The food was AMAZING, don't get me wrong, but off vibes.   1. Smells super weird in there Idk if I'm smelling old oil or what but it's weird.  2. There are lots of people working here, yet getting service or someone's attention was hard. We were approached when we first walked in and then after that, it was half assed.  3. I got the cucumber mint drink and it's like a mojito but with rum and cucumber instead of mint. Wasn't my fave, wasn't sweet enough, just tasted like cucumber water and lime juice.  4. Our donuts were really good but I was told by my friend that they were smaller than the donut food truck which is disappointing.  I got the sin a bomb and it tasted just like a cinnamon roll. My friends got the cherry bombs and peach donut and we all enjoyed it!  5. Vibes were just off and my friends agreed. If you're looking for good food, sure, but if you're a vibes type person like us, you'll feel weird here lol.

reviews.author: Hannah K.
reviews.description: The donuts here are pretty good if you're looking for a fancier dessert donut! I usually only come here for the dessert donuts. The restaurant itself is a little dark but they have candles lying around so that it makes the mood!

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: The donuts here never disappoint! They are so good and delicious. I usually get the black out but this time I got the miss shortcake which was delicious and wasn't too excessive like the black out can be. Excellent dessert spot for sure. The reason I'm giving it four stars is because we had to wait roughly 40-45 minutes to get three donuts? That seems a little excessive especially since they did not seem to be understaffed. And when the donuts came out they felt lukewarm like they had been sitting out for 10+ min which is a bit disappointing. Maybe there was something extra going on which is why I'm willing to give them the benefit of the doubt. Great taste which is why I recommend it but maybe just go to the food truck next time?   Overall: 3.9 stars

reviews.author: Jim S.
reviews.description: I really wanted to love this place.  The place is cool and the vibe is great - loved the 90s music and TVs playing lots of great random stuff. The wait staff was super nice and helpful.    The menu is also amazing - so many thing we wanted to try. We went for the fried green tomatoes, the Buffalo chicken sandwich and the country fried chicken. When our food arrived everything was beautiful. Really great presentation. But unfortunately when we tasted it we were in for a big disappointment. Everything just tasted like salt. The flavors of the toppings and donuts all just blended together with nothing interesting or any pops of fresh flavor. I will say everything was cooked to perfection, but the flavor was just off/missing.   Bummer.

name: Black Star Co-op Pub and Brewery

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: A shady porch, games for everyone, inside and out, family friendly, dog friendly and oh so yum!  This place has it all.  The food is outstanding, particularly the avocado club. During May, they sponsor Barks for Beers supporting Divine Canines Therapy dogs. You buy a Pawsport for about $30 and get a free draw at over two dozen local craft brewers! Miss Sophia will be around to greet you most of May, and whenever else her human wants something good to eat!  One of Austin's hidden gems

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: This is a good little spot to come have a beer. I think the food is a little pricey for the quality.   I tried the fish and chips and it was alright, for 22 bucks I would hope I would be able to say more than that but I can't. The batter is great but I can tell the fish is frozen.  I will say the fries are pretty good.

reviews.author: Mary S.
reviews.description: We like coming back to this location for the great food and beer selection. They have a large group and dog-friendly patio seating area that this part of Austin really needs. Their service is great and friendly. I recommend coming here with a growler for some of the best beer brewed in Austin. The food is always excellent and never disappoints, regardless of what we select.

reviews.author: Alex C.
reviews.description: There's plenty of space here to sit outside and it can't be be on a beautiful day. There's a great selection of beers and now you can even take some home in a sixpack. The menu seems to change now and again but I've never had anything I didn't like. It's hard to beat a basket of fries or the buffalo cauliflower. I've always enjoyed the fish and chips and veggie burgers. The staff has always been friendly and helpful with suggestions.  Anytime I brought a friend we've always had a good time. I'll be back here.

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: I've been here twice and both times were pleasant visits. Last time I tried the "Wish You Were Queer," which is a hoppy, floral beer. I loved it! I also ordered the avocado club sammy. The fries were thick and salted. I'm sure I'll be back!

reviews.author: Wes O.
reviews.description: One of the best "better" burgers in Austin.  Plain and simple.    It's a bit hard to find from Lamar because it's semi-hidden in the Midtown Commons apartment complex.  Like the Triangle and most other new Austin developments, there's retail and restaurants on the ground floor.  Decided to drop in here tonight because the burger came highly recommended.  I'm definitely glad I tried it.  The burger is deceptively small.  It looks like a smaller burger, but the density of the high quality burger patty combined with their bun makes it more than a meal.  Don't forget their fries, which were described to me as English style chips.  The fries look like flattened steak fries and are exceptionally crispy.  I'm not sure what the seasoning is, but it's strangely addictive.  Black Star has a huge variety of beers for the drinkers.  For the non-drinkers, they have a variety of canned and bottled soft drinks, although no fountain drinks.    Being a co-op, the service is friendly and obviously takes a lot of pride in their pub.  The quality of the food and the service both show that.

reviews.author: Gurpreet L.
reviews.description: I tried some of their veggie options, including the impossible burger, and would say their food is average. However, their range of beer selection is on point. There is a little something for everyone - from sours to stouts. I had one of the sours, a cider, and split a beer flight of beers I can't remember. Loved all of them!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Brewpub: dog-friendly, veggie options, friendly staff and strong wifi! SCORE!  Came through with a good friend and my pup. We loved it. Pups have to stay outdoors, but you're allowed to bring them indoors to place your order. They have tons of beer options, great in-house brews. I was floored by their options! I always go for the flight when I try a new brewery to get a better taste of what they offer. I loved pricing: 4 for $10, and my favorites were the Island Baby (pineapple what!!) and juicy Fructis hazy IPA. They had a bit of everything, so that's always nice for beer geeks. Quench my palate, Black Star! They have their beer menu overhead--super easy to read. They also have great happy hour, but we arrived later after it was over. The food menu is on the paper menu that they have at the front of the line. Grab yourself the menu while someone stands in line for ya!   They also offer food specials for that day. It looked good--I think it was some sort of tofu (veg) tacos, but I wanted fries...so went with their avocado club. It was a bit heavy on the mayo, but it tasted great. Their chips...crisps...fries whatever you want to call em were the REAL WINNER. Y'all. Fries are so crispy and uneven...wedge-style. BUT not dry or lukewarm. They are delicious. I would go back just for their addictive fries. Trust me. They also offer the impossible burger too for veg folks, and other options like grilled cheese. I just love how veg-friendly they are. THANK Y'ALL. Grilled cheese gets old for us who don't eat meat.   The atmosphere is very chill and with a darker ambiance. It seems like the perfect spot for group hangs or a relaxed date. Parking was easy, especially since there's a customer parking structure that's free. It's also close to public transportation if you choose to take it. I love this spot--I can see this becoming a new favorite.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: Vulcan IPA and the best fish and chips in Austin. It's a bit pricy, but tips are included in the price and people there are paid a living wage. If I lived closer, I would be a member.

reviews.author: Kimber G.
reviews.description: I adore this place!  Cool (ABD humble) people, great beers, ciders and such delicious food!  Right now menus are limited but I hear they are getting more beers next week for Octoberfest!   Thank you BlackStar Coop!  We LOVE you!

reviews.author: Danielle R.
reviews.description: Checked this place out for the 1st time today and LOVED it! Very good beer and delicious food too. Had their house hazy IPA and Oktoberfest beer, wonderful! Sundays and Tuesdays are the best for great $$ deals too. Their burgers, fries, wings, and  chicken sandwich was very good and the staff is incredibly friendly!! We are definitely coming back again soon :)

reviews.author: Esther S.
reviews.description: I cannot emphasize my love for this place enough!!! Usually I am not the type of person to seek out breweries/pubs simply because they are loud and not too clean. I make an exception for this location due to the fantastic service I am given every. single. time. (NO TIPS HERE!! They work and treat you well because thy are paid good/decent wages!!!!!!)  Atmosphere: 4 Pretty big, can get crowded on evenings (cause it's freakin great). Lots of indoor seating and ample outdoor seating (covered)  Food: 4.5 Most of the food I have had here has been pretty decent. I knock off half a star because I've noticed a slight inconsistency in the servings (read about fish and chips) Fish and chips: my go-to food. Usually comes with 2-3 strips of fish and the potato wedges/strips are always well cooked, and come it's this out-of-the-world sauce!! Addicting af but wish they would consistently give 3 strips of fish ): Fried avocado tacos: awesome!! Sounds like it would be plain, but came with these giant thicc bacon strips on it that really added the savory taste Cheese board: nice variety, definitely love that the cheese is locally sourced from Antonelli's! Good mix for everyone's taste buds and really liked how there was plenty of bread too. Ice cream: seasonal flavors but I tried the pecan and regretted only having one scoop.  Service: 5 The servers here are always!!!!!!!!! SO cool and nice and helpful. Whenever we need drink recs, or anything at all, they are there to help! Even called in to ask if they were playing a game before, and offered to put down the big screen to have us come by and watch as we ate.

reviews.author: Laura G.
reviews.description: loved it! Staff was friendly and the food and beer were great. I got the cauliflower app and my boyfriend got a fried chicken sandwich that he said was the best thing he has eaten in a while

reviews.author: Nikki A.
reviews.description: I've always seen this place and been curious to try it. So, when my friend was visiting from Vermont, I decided it was the perfect time! I always like to eat locally. We split the tofu tikka masala and buffalo cauliflower (we added bleu cheese). I'm sure I could've eaten the whole bowl of of buffalo cauliflower by myself. It was super tasty. The sauce was just a little bit vinegary and the cauliflower soaked up all the flavor. Get it with the cheese, if you aren't vegan. It gives it that extra sharpness. The tikka masala was a bit spicy. I was surprised by that. We both liked it. The tofu was perfect with it. You have to know how to do tofu just right, and this was it! Everything was gluten free, for my friend. I can't wait to go back after I have my baby so I can partake in the adult beverages. I had my eye on some that they made there.

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: Black-star Co-op is cool, but the food isn't all that. They brew their own beer and rotate other craft brews, but I always get their Vulcan, a rye IPA.  Foodwise, the only things I've liked are the chicken snack, and the seasoned chips. The burger is just okay, but the fish for the fish and chips needs salt and let's get some dang tarter sauce. They serve it with an aoli, which lacks seasoning. A side of coleslaw would go a long way too.  I'd be back, primarily for a cold one, and I would not not go for food again, but not by my will.

reviews.author: Nikkita F.
reviews.description: Great spot for post work drinks. I think theres only beer so keep that mind.   Pros: easy to find a spot inside or outside (although Texas so nothx), easy parking (lot or garage), delish fries and cheese boards and fried avo tacos, you can get flights of house beers for only $10, I believe they have board games too   Cons: I think only beer available (fine by me but depends on your group)

reviews.author: Condescending K.
reviews.description: My fav brewery in town! Deeply wish they would bring back the island baby and the wings w/ spicy bbq (?) sauce.

reviews.author: Shawn P.
reviews.description: This place was legit delicious. Had the buffalo cauliflower and it was amazing! The atmosphere is great and the beer was yummy. Lots of options veg and beef options

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Chill beer garden style hang out spot, having passed by a bunch of times it never seems crazy busy and on a beautiful Saturday night we were able to get a table outside without any issue.   Their beer selection is great, with a wide variety of beer made in house and other local breweries. The food selection leaves a little bit to be desired. The season chips were delicious, they reminded me more of steak fries if you put them in a broiler to give them a nice crunch. Besides the chips nothing on the menu really stood out to me as too interesting, and most of the reviews I read were pretty disappointed with their other food.   They also seem to have events  and good happy hour deals pretty frequently during the week. Overall, it's a good place to grab a beer in the area and enjoy a nice night outside, but I wouldn't come here too hungry.

reviews.author: Goretti A.
reviews.description: Good for takeout! Fish and chips was so good and the wait time for pickup was mot super long at all. Highly recommend!

name: Odd Duck
accommodations: Street Parking, Validated Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Quin T.
reviews.description: AMAZING!  I have been wanting to check out this place for 2 years and we finally bit the bullet. The hold up has been the negative feedback from my trusted foodie friends. However, I have a feeling they all must have visited during a weird menu transition that they did not find pleasing because Odd Duck has great ratings! I could not acquire a reservation for 2 so we arrived around 4:45 to ensure we at least snagged a spot at the bar. However, the hostess provided us with a table on the patio with the knowledge that another party would be arriving at 7:00, no problem! I was thoroughly impressed that they had employees lined up behind the hostess stand to show each guest to their seat!    Happy Hour runs from 5-6 so we took advantage of their delicious $8 paloma's! I could seriously drink those all night! They also have 25% off bottles of wine under $100.  We dined on the redfish ceviche which was refreshing, the cheddar cornbread that was so delicious, between 2 people, we ate the entire serving! The scallops were delicious, but I was obsessed with the celery escabeche that accompanied my husband's wagyu sirloin cap. I think the next time I will inquire about having the scallops prepared with the escabeche.  We also tried the chocolate fudge pie, but although the dried chiles were only sprinkled on top of the pie, it was still too spicy for my husband.  I clearly gave Odd Duck 5 stars because I was highly impressed and I plan on making a quarterly trip here to check out the new revisions.

reviews.author: Andrew K.
reviews.description: Underwhelming, overhyped, nonsense.  If you are going to act like the best restaurant in Austin then guess what I am going to review you like one.  First things first, don't bother coming if you don't have a reservation, they have the tables and the space just not the will or want to seat walk-ins.  First time we showed up directly at 5pm as the place opened.  There was a minimal crowd ahead of us, maybe 10 people.  We were informed for a table for 2 it would be a 3 hour wait...  The restaurant was practically empty.  If you are this lauded as a top restaurant but can't employ enough people to take a 2 person walk in at open, then something is seriously wrong.  So we came back the next day with reservations for 5 o'clock, again no shortage of tables, but a definite shortage in staffing/management.  We were seated promptly, told we could only order once from the menu, and our server didn't understand what or wasn't on the happy hour menu.  We were told 2 cocktails were on the happy hour menu turns out this was incorrect and was only corrected once we pointed out the cocktail we ordered was not listed on the menu as being discounted.  He was nice enough to "discount" the drinks, but again for a top restaurant in Austin your waitstaff seems to be poorly trained and unfamiliar with the menu.  By the way the happy hour is absolute worst.  5-6pm, 1 off a few beers, 8 dollar palomas, and 25% off ridiculously priced wine, and large beers.  The eazy peel from jester king was going for 44 dollars here.  I picked it up from specs for 15 dollars, absolutely outrageous.  Do not come thinking the happy hour will save you any money.  Uchi down the street does a much better job (not only at happy hour but for everything else in general)  We ordered the kale beignets, the achiote carrots, oyster mushroom salad, wagyu burger, seared scallops, and the sirloin cap steak with broccoli.  I will be the first to admit that the veggie plates were outstanding.  Really amazing flavor combinations, fresh ingredients, I was thoroughly impressed. The wagyu burger with collard green, chicharron and pimento was also a highlight, cooked perfectly and extremely juicy.  Then came the 36 dollar wagyu sirloin cap...  The aftertaste from this steak was horrid.  I've never encountered this flavor before but was a chemical taste that had me wretch, a few bites and had had enough.  My wife also felt something was severely off, and we sent it back.  The sear scallops (35 dollars) were just ok.  A lovely sear, mediocre sauce miso butter sauce and 3 tiny scallops a complete let down.  This restaurant thinks far too highly of itself.  If you are going to act like a pricey exclusive restaurant that makes me jump through hoops to dine here and charges an arm and a leg, I better be wowed at ever step, and that's far from what happened.

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like this place. We came here at the recommendation of multiple friends but I just felt like the food was good but not as exciting as the hype. I feel like the similar concept food in Chicago is much better.   The vibes were fun and everyone had a good time. Pricing was reasonable.   Free valet parking

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Having really high expectations for a restaurant can be a tricky thing.  My expectations for Odd Duck were extraordinarily high... and the food, drink, and service blew my expectations away!  This experience was simply an incredible delight for my tastebuds!  I was seated at the bar and service was attentive and prompt!  Prior to taking my order, the bartender asked if I had any food allergies or dietary restrictions.  When I told him I was restricted to gluten-free items, he grabbed a special gluten-free menu for me and explained the differences to me.  Most everything on the main menu was either gluten-free or could be made that way without differing from the original recipe too much!  My visit was during Happy Hour.  Odd Duck doesn't offer a ton of HH drink specials -- in fact, the paloma is the only cocktail at a reduced price.  I opted for that and good thing I did because it was the perfect paloma!  Truly the best I have ever had!  Of course, I went there for the food... so let's talk about that. I started with the Redfish Ceviche -- I have enjoyed many variations of ceviche and Odd Duck delivered the absolute best!  So far I was 2 for 2... so I was quite happy with myself, but also a little worried that the entree could not live up to the rest of the meal.  My worries were silly and unfounded -- the Wagyu Sirloin Cap was packed with layers of flavor and was the best part of my meal!  Overall rating: *****FIVE STARS*****  Gluten-free rating: *****FIVE STARS*****

reviews.author: Rajiv K.
reviews.description: The old fashion was made well. The food had incredible flavors.  Tapas style. Loved the first two dishes: roasted carrots and mushroom tostada. The accompanying seasoning is incredible. The scallops were equally good, but only three scallops came in the dish. This was not so hearty given the price of the dish, but flavorful. The pork dish was nicely made, smoky flavor, had kind of an Indian grill feel to it... but for us the taste had a quick diminishing return. The dish was hearty though with a lot of meat on the plate.   I wasn't too much in a dessert mood. Was simply going to have a spoon or two of the chocolate pie, but they brought out the donuts by mistake. Thank goodness, they were amazing. I enjoyed it more than the chocolate pie.   Service tonight was simply outstanding. The waiter took my dietary restrictions to heart and really did a great job helping me navigate the menu. I wish more places did this. I felt the service here from our main and accompanying servers is what other restaurants should aspire to. Bathrooms were kept clean. I wish this place continued success. They have something really great going on!

reviews.author: Lauren W.
reviews.description: This was simply the best dining experience I've had in the recent years or maybe, ever. From beginning to end, I was thoroughly impressed with the staff and how easy and enjoyable it is to dine at Odd Duck. It's a place with friendly staff, great drinks AND great food, and ambience is casual but unique. Perfection.  You can tell the owner takes their time to hire the right people because everyone we interacted with were so friendly. I think it matters a lot walking into a restaurant and enjoying a meal.   Parking around this area is usually not the most pleasant but fear not, they have complementary valet parking! That easily eases off the anxiety of missing your reservation time because you were looping around the area for a decent parking spot.   We came here on a Saturday at 5:30pm and it was perfect because I get hungry around that time. Okay, there are more reasons-it was not very crowded, it was happy hour for some drinks, and the lighting was perfect with the blinds pulled up since the sun has set.   Surprisingly, the drinks here were super good, like high quality to sip on. I got the draft paloma and it was very well-balanced. The other drink we ordered was Nice, Bryce, we were eyeing it and the waiter also made that suggestion. Both are different and definitely would get again.  Everyone was great about making their recommendations and the top choice was the scallops and ceviche. We couldn't get seafood this time around but I will definitely come back for those two items.   Waiter was great at making recommendations based on what we like and what he thinks is great. Easy to talk to, checking in on us just enough, and other staffs help with serving the food and filling up the water so that was cool to see everyone work as a team.  On to the food! So we got the cheddar cornbread, mushroom chorizo tostada, achiote roasted carrots, and wagyu sirloin cap. Cheddar cornbread is a must, it was fresh, the butter on it was amazing, and filling too. Mushroom chorizo tostada had a bit of citrusy to the flavor and it's delicious. For the achiote roasted carrots, what stood out to me was the burnt toast hummus!! I want a tub of that whatever it is! I think I would've liked more of the hummus and less chunks of the carrots. Don't get me wrong, the flavor profile is still very good, I think for my likings, the carrots can be slices so it's easier to consume. Wagyu sirloin cap was the star of the show for us, it was cooked very well (as in good job not well steak!), though I probably want it to be a bit more well.  We came here to celebrate our anniversary but it is a casual place so this is good for a date night or regular dining! The great thing about this place is that the menu changes so you can always find reasons to come back here. I can't wait until I come back.

reviews.author: Leah D.
reviews.description: This place was delicious! The restaurant offers complimentary valet which is nice. The restaurant is decorated with wood from the original Shiner Brewery. The staff was very friendly and gave off the fantastic Austin vibes!   We sat at the bar and had the frozen chili margarita. It had great flavor and was well balanced. I tasted the Paloma and it was one of the best I've ever had! I also had the Naked Lunch cocktail which has beets. I'm not a huge beet fan but I'd drink this again. There was a special cocktail called Buckle Up Buttercup. The drink was a little salty, a little sweet, and you could really taste the bourbon.   For food we tried the kale beignets which were soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. We also had the mushroom chorizo tostada with beautiful, fresh bean sprouts on top. I LOVED the mushroom chorizo! I could put that s*** on everything. Lastly we had the ceviche. The fish was fresh and the homemade chips it came with were the perfect pair.   As a first time guest, I was very impressed! I'll be coming back next time I visit Austin. Make sure to call a few weeks ahead for a reservation. They book up pretty fast!  10 out of 10 would recommend. The food was too good to take pictures

reviews.author: Chris J.
reviews.description: Visited Odd Duck after months of waiting for a reservation, and was met with food and service that went above and beyond expectations. A local farm to table establishment with an elevated twist, I highly recommend Odd Duck as a go-to spot in Austin.   As many other Yelpers have surely noted, Odd Duck's menu is seasonal, so I'll spare you the details regarding the food I ate, as the menu has most likely changed. Feel free to sit back and trust your waiter's suggestions, as they are veterans of their craft.   One thing that I would like to commend Odd Duck on is their extreme attention to detail, which was immediately noticeable to me. From their unique plates and cutlery to the maintenance of their restrooms, this dining experience made it well worth the price point. Additionally, our waiter made it a point to clean our table throughout the meal, which was awesome.  5/5

reviews.author: Tiffany H.
reviews.description: Odd Duck is an OG in ATX's food scene; I've known about it since undergrad (10+ years now!) but haven't had a chance to try it until I was in town recently for work.   Before local/farm2table was cool - Odd Duck was doing it. It still feels great to support local farmers and producers though.   The food here was OUTSTANDINGLY flavorful -- bringing it to that edge but showing finesse and balance. I also appreciate that they made vegetarian versions of certain dishes so there are some options for Vegs!   My only regret? Not coming here sooner!   The menu will be different when you visit, but we thoroughly enjoyed each dish! We had the:  *Redfish Ceviche (leche de tigre, persimmon, cucumber, potato chip) *Cajun Pork Rillette (apples, pickles, Sour Duck Market sourdough toast) *Dry-aged wagyu burger (pimento, BBQ sauce, beer battered onion ring) - like an EXPLOSION of flavor.  *Wagyu Sirloin Cap (beef fat papas bravas, soubise, green bean salsa verde)  *French Toast (Vanilla Ice Cream, Cajeta, Apple, Pecan, Brown Butter Cereal) - yes, we had French Toast for dessert! So good and I recall just a pinch of salt from keeping it from being overly sweet!

reviews.author: Karen Q.
