reviews.description: Pictures of menu on August 17, 2021. Reservations are strongly recommended as this place is quite popular (rightfully so though)! We picked the tomatoes, quail, and cornbread and everything was 10/10. I don't typically eat cornbread but theirs is MAGICAL and a must do! Their service was also A+, they were kind enough to mark the menu with vegetarian options, they even provided ways to alter some of their dishes to make them vegetarian (see photo). The French Toast dessert was also a delight. I'm a big fan of their rotating menus and will happily return to try more.   There is complimentary valet parking. You can also find street parking by the restaurant. They have happy hour 5-6pm daily with drink specials only.

reviews.author: Henry Y.
reviews.description: Review 10-K Odd Duck Trading Symbol: ODD  Item 1. Business The Odd Duck is one of the places that I've been meaning to try ever since I first came to Austin for undergrad so many moon ago. Generally, the dishes are thoughtful and come together in just the right spots. There are a few aspects of the dinner where the execution could be more polished, but I'd wager the average visiting venture capitalist would hardly notice.  Item 2. Discussion and Analysis of Results of Operations The assets: - The roasted carrots were phenomenal. It's rare to find a dish where the carrots were the star of the dish, and Odd Duck hit it out of the park. If there was one element to highlight that enabled this, it would be burnt toast hummus. Spicy and savory, hell I'm waiting for this dip at the nearest Central Market. The crunchy fried chickpeas were a welcome airy, textured munch. - The wagyu sirloin cap was thoughtful in its conception. The celery, broccoli and dill really brought herbaceous elements that complemented the subtle earthy-funkiness of the dry-aged beef. Extremely enjoyable and every bite was as satisfying as the last. Medium rare but not bloody - Dessert was the dried chile chocolate fudge pie. Holy cow, while chile chocolate isn't exactly a new combination, it's certainly not seen in many restaurants. Who says you can't turn up the heat during dessert? The white chocolate peanut butter whip is something I'd eat by the spoonful (and I'm a 'cold brew, no whip'-kind of guy. *Chef's kiss*  The liabilities: - Obviously by the price of the wagyu, there's no way it's Japanese wagyu. But   I found the wagyu a bit *too* firm. You chew, and chew, and chew, and chew some more. It's really a mouth-work out, which can be so antithetical to how wagyu is classically portrayed, e.g. melt-in-your-mouth goodness. I get that it's not the real deal, or that it's just the sirloin cut, but much leaner and less marbled than I would've expected. - Cheddar cornbread was decent, but did not excite, which is something I'd expect given the rest of the menu. It's a fairly expensive piece of cornbread given the price. I will say the texture is extremely fine, but at least nostalgia's sake, would've appreciated more grittiness/texture, perhaps a thicker crust. One final point would be the consistency of the cook, the bottom 10-15% of the cornbread was under-cooked and relatively more 'mushy' than the rest - One suggestion for the fudge pie is to add an ice cream or light sauce element because the pie was fairly dry  Item 3. Other Information - Complementary valet parking is always welcome along South Lamar - Great vibes and ambience - Always appreciate when a place focuses on shareable plates

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: My first encounter to Odd Duck I went solo as my date was feeling ill. I opted to try two main dishes starting with the quail which was outstanding. The goat cheese stuffing was beyond perfection and while I normally don't like chorizo it wasn't overburdened w/ traditional spices making the protein aspect of the dish wonderful; crispy and juicy.  The baba ghanoush had just a weeee to much cilantro for my tastes but overall a spot on accompaniment to the dish. Finishing the dish the salsa macha hit the perfect notes for heat.   Being a huge scallop lover I'm a stickler for the perfect mollusk. Odd Duck seared them to perfection with a great amount of caramelization and tender on the inside. While the menu said "celery puree" I picked up right away the it wasn't something in my years of being a chef never experienced. The puree was Kohlrabi. The vegetable mash was a smart move as the acidity cut the fattiness from the bacon lardon. The chili crisp was a very nice addition as it gave the dish a sweeping hint of heat, enough to compliment, not overpower. Well done.  I paired my dinners with the Hi Sign "El Berto" Lager. A very nice draft beer which went down smooth and didn't have the "hoppiness" that a more robust beer like an IPA has. I also sampled "The Hop Sauce in My Bag". What a refreshing beverage. The codka went down smooth while the ginger and citrus flavors made me with I was on a porch with a nice cool breeze!   My second encounter didn't live up to the first experience. I split the marinated cucumber and melon salad which was perfect for an early July night. The melon was juicy and the fragrant herbs of mint and basil made sure each bite popped with flavor. Excellent starter.   I opted for the aged Pork and while flavored spot on had an extreme amount of gristle. I found it very hard to impress my date while having to napkin off my mouth to expel what I couldn't chew. The rest of the dish complimented the flavors very well so no complaints for the overall flavor profile.   This was my dates' first time at the restaurant and she opted for the nachos. It was a rather bland dish overall but was saved by the amount of chicken and a good choice of using vadouvan pico.   Dessert was the lime panna cotta. Let me tell you the citrus in this dish make eating it like listening to a symphony from heaven! The almonds gave a nice texture balance juxtaposed to the toasted meringue which gave a somewhat campfire marshmellow vibe.     We split a bottle of Elyse Zin which was bold yet smoothed out in the mouth after just a moment.  Very nice and went with both of our entree's perfectly.   All in all these were brilliant efforts and before I forget, the staff was amazing. Kudos to the hard-working chefs and the knowledgeable front of the house for making my move to Austin memorable.

reviews.author: Katherine M.
reviews.description: When people say Austin has a great food scene, I think of Odd Duck as the pillar of that. My friend and I both agreed that Odd Duck would populate our top 10 restaurant list that we had ever been to.   We had the scallops dish, ceviche, beets, and tostadas. Everything was delicious, but the scallops dish was the best.   The interior and service are on par with Michelin starred restaurants, but have a more authentic Austin vibe. A must visit if you are in town.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: A gem in Austin for their authenticity and willingness to explore.   I loved dining at Odd Duck so much that I'd say it's now one of my favorite restaurants in Austin (first time was earlier this month). I'd go through all the dishes but that wouldn't be helpful because the menu changes seasonally (since they are a farm-to-table restaurant +1). First, I love that it's tapas styled (+1) because it means you get to try more dishes and nottt feel like you're over ordering!   What stands out to me about this restaurants is their sauces. The ones that I had with the heavier items (the red meat dishes) were rich and dimensional. Some of the flavors were unique because it had some aspects of familiar tastes mixed with ones that were foreign to me. I loved being able to try all the dishes because I knew I was tasting a unique dish that was created (or crafted) by a talented chef.   From a bar seat, I could tell that the servers and chef love what they're doing (trust me, it doesn't go unnoticed). I love knowing that my meal was made by people who are exploring, learning, and having fun! I honestly think it's hard to NOT want to support a restaurant like this..   Every foodie's must-try for sure.

reviews.author: Grace K.
reviews.description: Odd Duck is definitely a must-visit if you are in Austin!  This restaurant supports the local Austin community, so it is neat seeing the various sourced goods within the innovative dishes here. It started in a trailer but transformed into what it is today with its farm to table creations.  We found street parking luckily, which was right on Gibson Street W. I did notice there is a private parking lot with valet included in it. I highly recommend making reservations. I found my reservation about ~3 days prior to the date. There are bar top seatings and outdoor seatings available. It's great for dates, friends or family (more for adults).  FOOD: Cajun Pork Rillette (4/5; Apples, Pickles, Sour Duck Market Sourdough): The cajun pork rillette was decent but enhanced with the addition of the veggies. The pickled veggies brought life to the dish. It was my first time trying rillette though, which is pork meat that is submerged in fat then cooked at an extremely slow rate. Another important note was the sourdough (it was baked perfect).  Mushroom Chorizo Tostada (5/5; Squash and Pepita Butter, Radish, Pickled Onions): This tostada was something else! It is very unique, and I loved all of it (including the texture of the tostada). There are 3 pieces, but I ate 2/3. I could have ordered another one for myself. The squash and pepita butter had some flavor, which helped bring another part of the taste element into play. Nothing overpowered another.  Apple Salad (4/5; Smoked Squash, Lavender, Chevre, Black Pepper Pecans): This is a lighter dish. I am not a big fan of apples, but I can assure you that I ate them in this salad! Great flavors that burst in your mouth... even the black pepper pecans.   Wagyu Sirloin Cap (5/5; Papa Bravas, Soubise, Green Bean Salsa Verde): My date loved this. He is an all time meat-lover, and he raved about this. The wagyu was cooked perfectly at medium-rare. It easily became one of my top 5. I also have to mention the pickled veggies with the papa bravas because they were delicious. I did not try much of the soubise (white onion sauce), but it was not overpowering. It added a nice, subtle savory taste with the wagyu.   Service was great and attentive. Everything came out on time. Our drinks never touched bottom.  Would I come back!? Definitely!!! They change the menu pretty often too. I am a fan.

reviews.author: Comyar Z.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic dinner at Odd Duck. We had a large-ish group of 6 with various dietary restrictions and our waitress was really amazing about catering to everyone! She created customized menus for each person indicating what they could/could not eat and even came back with variations of dishes the chefs said they could do. The service here is excellent, as was the food.  Food is tapas style, so we were ordering tons of dishes for the table. Their menu changes frequently, so what you get really depends on when you go. Overall, we had a great time here and would love to come back!

reviews.author: Elizabeth Y.
reviews.description: Great place to eat at while in Austin!   Even when it's hot, the outdoor patio has shade and fans. the inside was blastingly chilly!   We were greeted immediately by the hosts and taken inside. The drinks were amazing. we ordered cornbread to go since we heard such amazing things but I wanted to try so many things on the menu and there were only 2 mouths to feed.   Unfortunately no duck egg for the dinner menu.  We got the wagyu beef which was slightly a bit more raw then I would have liked it.   Drinks were pretty good with the Cucumber Daze and a watermelon drink (can't recall it was one of their seasonal drinks)

reviews.author: Stephanie O.
reviews.description: Food was unique and delicious. Open kitchen also was cool and made you really appreciate chefs.

reviews.author: Anni D.
reviews.description: Do yourself a favour and just make a reservation here. Odd duck is spectacular.  The happy hour drinks are a steal - $6 for some awesome cocktails. We tried the in house sodas as well and they were really unique.  Our server was super attentive and designed a tasting menu for our big group. Every dish was *fantastic*. My personal highlights were the scallop, zucchini salad, and French toast.

reviews.author: Alex R.
reviews.description: So right now this is my favorite restaurant in Austin. I think it's the best value for food, experience and price. I had their steak most recently which was delicious but if you're not looking to splurge like that the burger here is awesome.   The look and feel of this spot is super modern and cool.  But I think the best part of this place is the service. I mostly eat at the bar and they're exceptional there. One thing I was really impressed with is that they really take care of people that have different food preferences. I personally don't have eating limitations but for those that do they have curated menus so you don't feel that you have only one item to choose from if you're vegan/vegetarian.   Pro tip - make sure to take advantage of the valet. I believe it's fee (plus tip). The adjacent street parking on Gibson is a hill and is normally full anyway.

reviews.author: Kaitlin V.
reviews.description: I get the same thing every time: caramel latte with oat milk. I never drink coffee as fast as I do here and it's because I can't put it down. It's always clean and a friendly atmosphere as well, great for working on homework or projects. Will always come back for more!

reviews.author: Raquel D.
reviews.description: Café late was super strong but not bad.  1/4 cup of chia pudding was $5!  thats way over priced for chia seeds + almond milk in a plastic cup IMO

reviews.author: Jordan N.
reviews.description: If you're looking for both coffee and beer, this place has it.  Limited pastries. Coffee is okay - I find it a bit too burnt for my liking. Beer selection is good - lots of craft beer and good options from tap.  Communal space is great for working, studying, and hanging out - although not much space outdoors (it fronts a highway anyways).

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: Great little hangout in an unassuming area.... with great coffee and beer! I was a little surprised when we pulled up here. The building was nice, but wasn't what I was expecting.   The vibe here is great. A lot of young professionals clearly "working from home" but needed to get out of the house for a few hours. Very friendly customers and staff.   I ordered a vanilla latte and it came out wonderful. They had an awesome selection of beers on tap if that's your thing.   If I am in the area I will definitely be back for a visit.

reviews.author: Krista H.
reviews.description: I came in on a Saturday afternoon and the whole outdoor patio was occupied so I was expecting there to be a line inside. I was pleasantly surprised when I was able to order right away! I got an iced cinnamon sugar latte with almond milk which came out to about $6.25. The price is a little steep, but the flavor and milk substitute added about $2.   The coffee came out relatively fast and was pretty good! The cinnamon was subtle, but the coffee was smooth and rich. My fiancé and I both enjoyed it! I don't know if I would come out of my way for this coffee, but if I was in the area I would definitely stop by again!   The location is convenient and there are other businesses on the same strip to try out as well. I would recommend coming here and getting some coffee to go!

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We went to stouthaus on Friday early afternoon, they have few tables outside and few inside with socially distanced, lady who took our order was kinda robotic.  we ordered cappuccino, coffee and cinnamon roll, post covid we are mostly doing takeouts but while we were waiting for the order we saw staff sanitizing table and chairs in between each customers so we felt comfortable to sit and enjoy the coffee there itself.  Cappuccino was good but little thin, coffee was pretty good, cinnamon roll was just ok.  Overall, definitely worth a visit and really appreciate the way they're handling the business in pandemic!

reviews.author: Lilan N.
reviews.description: Love this coffee bar. Going here on a lunch break is the best! There's plenty of seating indoors and outdoors. It's a great place to go get some work done. The drinks are delicious too, I've gotten the Mexican spice mocha latte and it was so good! I want to go back and try the cold brew. The workers are sweet and there is plenty of parking!!

reviews.author: Taylor S.
reviews.description: Great spot to grab a good coffee and get a little work done.  The coffee is legit good and they have beer on tap if you splurge toward the end of the day.  Parking is ample as well.  This is my go-to spot to meet my local rep while working in Austin.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here on a weekend afternoon and tried a local hefeweizen, the rose latte, and a brownie. The beer was tasty, and the rose latte was super smooth. The brownie was decadent and rich, with a crisp exterior and chewy interior. I like their patio space, but their inside space could do with more comfortable seating. Overall, service was good.

reviews.author: Magen D.
reviews.description: Stouthaus is such a cute spot! The vibe is very relaxed. The coffee and pastries are above average in taste, the staff were incredibly kind, and they had a ton of seating (indoor and outdoor). There were a lot of people, but it didn't feel overly crowded because of how large the space is.  They followed Covid protocols and everything was very clean!

reviews.author: Cyril G.
reviews.description: Cute coffee shop with plenty of places to sit and work. I got their coconut cold brew which was really good and not too sweet. They have some food options too but I wasn't hungry so I didn't get anything. Would recommend!

reviews.author: Kate Z.
reviews.description: A nice open cafe by the highway.  There's a number of seats with surprisingly heavy chairs. The outdoor seating is very spacious but it's pretty loud with the cars zooming past us.   The pumpkin spice latte was okay. Not amazing. My friend says her cappuccino is just like any other.  The WiFi is solid. There are real and fake outlets (literally a sticker on the wall lol). It's a nice place to work or study. I like the temperature and the music is an okay volume.   I'd come back!

reviews.author: Olivia V.
reviews.description: Not a fan of leaving a bad review for a nice place, but I think I may have been served slightly off dairy milk here today (I'm not sick, but the taste was bad). I've been here a few times over the past years and it's a really cute, quiet spot for working. Today however I was served a matcha latte with a really funky taste to it. It seemed like the matcha powder used just sat in a thick later on top of the (1%) milk, without being well combined, and the milk tasted a little off to be honest. I regret not saying something but I think I attributed the taste to the matcha mixing issue at the time. The person I went with had a coffee which tasted fine, but used a different (dairy) milk from mine. Really a shame since my drink was so bad from the first sip, we just ended up leaving. Sorry stouthaus!

reviews.author: L P.
reviews.description: This is just the best lowkey coffee shop/hangout place. Every single staff member I've interacted with there is kind and accommodating and seems to genuinely like what they're doing. I'm not usually a flavored coffee drinker but they have a homemade cinnamon sugar syrup that is SO GOOD. I wake up craving it, lol. The golden milk latte is also a favorite of mine, and great for having later in the day when I don't want caffeine.

reviews.author: Bobbie L.
reviews.description: Cute little spot where you can drink coffee and beer. I would recommend the nitro coffee/iced latte. I wish there were more seating indoors and outside.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: I know Stouthaus is an Austin favorite, but I was pretty disappointed by my experience. They don't have a ton of seating indoors, but they do have a nice outdoor patio area. My friend and I both ordered an iced vanilla latte, and it was pretty meh. Nothing to come back for.

reviews.author: Elizabeth V.
reviews.description: Delicious coffee, friendly service, dog- and work-friendly patio seating. Pro-tip: Stop circling the crowded first parking lot in the daytime, and head past the front of the building to the wide-open north lot! *Masks required for ordering inside as of 9/2021, and there's a box inside the door if you need one.

reviews.author: Westin P.
reviews.description: I had to actually spit out my coffee. It was a simple cold brew. Wife also trashed her vanilla latte.

reviews.author: Warren D.
reviews.description: Covid and Snowvid had me feeling creatively tapped. Coffeeshops have always been good to me but there are very few open for staying inside. Stouthaus was my muse! The coffee is really great and if I'm able to get some good work done I'll have a beer. The selections are priced right and curated well. The views aren't spectacular but that helps me focus on work for a little while. The staff and ownership seem to care about the work they are doing.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: I dig what Stouthaus is trying to do, it's a hip little joint that has coffee and beer which are both things I like.   It's pretty small inside, so if it's cold outside I wouldn't plan on finding a seat, but their patio is a nice addition with a beer garden feel. It is right off the highway though so don't go expecting a nice view of trees, but with the right company I don't think that really matters.  When I went the coffee didn't blow my mind, and they also didn't have any brewed at 1pm on a Thursday which was kind of strange to me for a coffeehouse so I had to wait. But that did mean it was fresh which is always nice.   They have fake outlets (they're stickers) which is kind of funny I guess but wasn't funny to me when I found a seat and my laptop died... they also have real ones though so don't worry.   All in all a cute little place and worth checking out if you're in the mood for a new local coffee shop. Or a low key place for a beer.

reviews.author: Adam C.
reviews.description: I dont have any pictures of the pizza but this place never fails to please me.  First off their beer (especially electric jellyfish) is amazing..ive never had a bad beer from pinthouse ever.Its much better to get it straight from them as it's cheaper and tastes better.  The pizza rolls are a absolute gift from the Gods.I could probably live off them.The pizza is always incredible as well.  The only downside is it's always packed no matter what time you go which should tell you what ya need to know.

reviews.author: Donovan T.
reviews.description: Finally made to my favorite beer brewery and the experience was everything I hoped it would be.   Pinthouse has some great food and the craft beer selection is extensive and delicious. This place lives up to the social media hype for sure. Electric Jellyfish is one of my favorite beers.   It seemed like all of the employees truly enjoy working here. They were all super friendly and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Gina C.
reviews.description: Huge Pinthouse Pizza fan!! I was visiting from out of town have been craving good pizza for weeks.   We went on a Saturday night so it was lively and hard to find a table. We ended up finding a spot out on the patio and the staff was very kind to help with a heater so in the end wasn't a problem!   I love the casual vibe and energy inside. The restaurant has a "seat yourself" policy with long picnic tables inside. I didn't realize the location brews their own beers which was so cool - I loved the Old Beluga Amber Ale and Dry Irish Stout (I did have a sample of the Pastry Stout but decided the taste wasn't for me).   Pizzas and salads were all phenomenal. I love when a pizza can have a soft and fluffy crust without being too thick. The pepperoni was my favorite and I'd definitely order the Sundance Salad again.   Great experience and will definitely come back again!

reviews.author: Jenelle R.
reviews.description: PHP never disappoints. Hadn't been here in several years, and it was still as incredible as I'd remembered and remains as one of my favorite pizza spots. I'm not a huge beer fan, but I enjoy their selection of ciders and wines too. Also, another important tidbit to mention is PHP also has one of the best ranch dressings this side of the Mississippi. Actually probably on both sides of the Mississippi.

reviews.author: Linda M.
reviews.description: I'm happy to post this follow-up to my previous review:     Stopped by today for lunch, and there's a great lunch special:  $12.50 for a personal sized pizza, small salad, and soft drink!  You can select from any of the pizzas and salads on the menu.  I had the margherita pizza and classic house salad.  The salad came out quickly and was really good:  crispy veggies, the house-made ranch dressing is delicious, and no skimping on the cherry tomatoes or parmesan!  Even though it is served in a small bowl, there is a lot of salad packed in the serving.  Loved it!  It wasn't too long before our pizzas were delivered (not sure if this is the normal pace, we were there about 1:30 p.m. after the lunch rush).  The pizza was good, too!  This was more food than I could eat; a really good lunch deal, imho.      The restaurant itself is pretty casual with picnic style tables placed end-to-end in rows and a few picnic tables around the perimeter of the large room.  Great for big groups!  The staff was unfailingly friendly and welcoming.  This location brews its own beers, none of which I tried so I cannot comment now.  Guess that means a return trip is in order!

reviews.author: Pranav A.
reviews.description: Pros: - Lively ambiance - Lots of seating - You get your food pretty quickly - Pizza is cooked really well, the crust is as soft as a cloud on the inside with a nice, not too chewy or tough exterior - The classic pies have great flavor and ingredient combos, definitely try them even if something seems out of your comfort zone  Cons: - Might be hard to find group seating since the tables inside are bench seating, similar to long picnic tables - Parking may not be available  If you are going on a typically busy time and day of the week, call ahead of time and ask about the wait time

reviews.author: Millie C.
reviews.description: Delicious pizza and beer selections! The people working there are always friendly and helpful! Love the back patio, we love bringing our dog with us.

reviews.author: Marlo K.
reviews.description: It doesn't matter if you are picking up a quick lunch curbside or hanging inside for great beer and amazing food, you will never be disappointed with the food, atmosphere or beer.

reviews.author: Michael W.
reviews.description: I'll put this out there: IM A HUGE PHP fan. I'm here almost weekly either for take out or dine in. I love love love the crust on this pizza and the vegetarian options available are fun and intriguing. I'd definitely recommend this place to just about anyone!   The reason I'm not going to give PHP a 5 star is the damn bar tenders. OCCASIONALLY there will be someone nice behind the bar that I'd actually want to tip, but for the most part, y'all are horrible at choosing staff to run your bar. Literally I'd say the majority of your bartenders don't give 1 Flying Monkey Turd about proper service. For being a brewery and me knowing the "selectivity" of your bar staff, y'all could do better.  Come mainly for the pizza and brews, just ignore the idgaf vibes from the bar staff.

reviews.author: Jiyoon S.
reviews.description: A fun spot that's perfect for families on a casual weeknight or large groups due to the ample seating. While it's certainly not the best brewery selection/pizza in Austin, it definitely more than hits the spot! Pizza is a tad on the roughies/chewy side, not too much of a char or crisp as I'd like but some people might prefer that! Fun topping varieties, although I'd stick to the classics, our cauliflower pesto pizza fell a little short flavor wise.

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: Picking up pizza from this location is super easy with plenty of curb-side pick-up parking. Also a good spot to catch a game and have a few beers inside. The outdoor patio has potential, but it seems to have been neglected. The few times I've sat outside I think the wait staff forgot about us. Not a huge deal, and they made it right with a feee pizza voucher.   All their pizzas are good and worth trying, but my go to is the pepperoni and basil.

reviews.author: Drew G.
reviews.description: I went to pinthouse brewery and pinthouse pizza in the same week and was not disappointed either time. The staff was super friendly, knowledgeable and fun to bull shit with. Food was delicious beer was banging. Get here and have a good time.

reviews.author: Nan T.
reviews.description: My favorite pizza in Austin by far! South Lamar is also the best location imo -- friendlier staff, more seating, and a better vibe overall. Every single pizza I've tried is insanely good and their Pinthouse Salad is one of the best salads I've had in Austin. And don't even get me started on their beer selection -- their in house beer is amazing. Their Electric Jellyfish IPA = do not forget to try this. Phenomenal.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: This is a great place to enjoy good beer and delicious pizza. It's easy to get to and has a nice outdoor patio.

reviews.author: Marko M.
reviews.description: Pizza is bomb, beer is great, staff is always friendly! Did curbside pickup and the were quick and my beer cans were cold and pizza hot. Love this place

reviews.author: Morgan B.
reviews.description: PHP is my absolute favorite brewery in Austin. Staff are courteous and friendly, food is delicious and fast, beer is on point, and merch is trendy and stylish. Always can expect a good time here. Keep up the good work!!

reviews.author: Kristi K.
reviews.description: Amazing food, salads, desserts, and brews! Staff is always so kind and accommodating. I order take out for my @snapology austin staff frequently and am always impressed at how thorough they are at pick up. They want the orders to be just right! Happy to support an awesome local biz!

reviews.author: Ruth Y.
reviews.description: A great place for a casual get-together for unique pizza and drinks!  FOOD: Their "El Queso" (basically chips and queso) was delicious and a hearty appetizer for 2-3 people. My friend and I also ordered small sizes of the Banh Mi and Shroomin' Goat pizzas to share. The Banh Mi was alright - not amazing, but perhaps that is why Banh Mis are meant to be sandwiches. Beware: the Banh Mi has jalapeno slices on it that make the pizza very spicy, unless you're into that. The Shroomin' Goat is a balance of mushroom, salty goat cheese, fresh arugula, and garlicky goodness. Smalls are 10 inch and would probably be the perfect portion for 1 person to finish. Since we also had an appetizer and shared pizzas, we only ate about half of each. I would be remissed if I didn't also mention the huge selection of beers on tap. Since I'm not a beer person, I got myself an Austin EastCiders Sangria which was pretty good.  SERVICE: Not sure how to feel about the service because there wasn't too much to it. I was a little confused because there seemed to be separate counters for food and drinks, but apparently both have to be ordered at the bar. The server brought the food out to us and when we asked for water, he said that there were cups inside - this would not have bothered me if I wasn't finding myself filling cups of water at the same drink station where the server was filling up my friend's root beer float...The server also brought us to-go boxes for our leftover pizza. Overall, the employees were friendly, but I also wondered if they needed that many for so little to do.  LOCATION: The front is already inviting with a beautifully lit outdoor seating area. The host greeted us in front of the restaurant and takes you to a seat - we sat in their other outdoor patio area which ran along the side of the restaurant and connects to the inside. Unlike some other patio dining, there is plenty of space and tables. Inside, the restaurant is nice and spacious with lots of seating, although they seemed to be sticking to the booth seating for COVID precautions. We came here on a Thursday night and it was fairly busy, but not crowded by any means.  PARKING: Plentiful since it's in a shopping area.

reviews.author: Claudia E.
reviews.description: I live PHP. Very good pizza and beer!  People is always cordial.  Pizza is always good! Love their variety of IPAs!

reviews.author: Chris J.
reviews.description: dank.   The Honey Pear pizza is a must try if you've never had it. The subtle sweetness of the honey and pear matched perfectly with the house cheese blend that Pinthouse uses. With some caramelized onions to top it all off, it was a great medley of flavors that paired nicely with the prosciutto.  Personally being a fan of meat-lover pizzas, we ordered the Cannonball as well. Typically, I find these types of pizzas to be a little heavy when it comes to oil and grease, but this wasn't the case for Pinthouse. The pizza was sparing with the oil, but still contained the substance you would be looking for. After eating 6-7 slices myself, I somehow didn't end up in a food-induced coma and even managed to shoot around for a bit afterwards.   Overall, great experience. 5 stars - will be returning

name: Wright Bros Brew and Brew
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Minly L.
reviews.description: This place is really cool. The food is great. The drinks are interesting. I honestly had a great time here with my roommate. We are super excited to go back.   We both got one of the abbreviated breakfast sandwiches, on the potato bun. It was so amazing. I loved how it just collapsed together really nicely and tasted amazing.   Staff is super friendly too.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: This bagel is one of the best bagel sandwiches I've ever had. You have to get here early though because they do run out!! The bagel was perfectly crispy and the egg + cheese went so well with the jalapeño cheddar bagel. My bacon was also extra crispy which I like! I also got a lavender latte, honestly not worth it and pretty pricey.   The inside also isn't very big so we had to wait for a table. They also have an outdoor area for seating, but it was too cold to sit outside.The staff is very friendly and our food came out hot and fast! Took away a star because of the over priced latte and lack of seating.

reviews.author: Jin L.
reviews.description: Checked this place out after the Austin Half marathon to pass time before lunch reservation. The atmosphere was a really cool, college-like bar/cafe with fun music. Got a cup of coffee while my friend got a beer and he enjoyed his beer! The coffee was pretty standard. Got BEC bagel and unfortunately they were out of everything but the cinnamon raisin (we got there at 11:15) and it wasn't that great. Probably just alright. Overall nice place to sit down, grab a beer or coffee and read or just hang out.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: I hadn't been at Wright Bros for years as I no longer live in Austin, but having a local place to walk to during my visit was great. It looks like they have a wider menu than I'm going to mention, but I was just happy to be able to get a tasty, toasty bagel every morning.

reviews.author: Jin L.
reviews.description: One of my favorite local coffee shops. I love coming here for a quick breakfast bagel and a coffee on the weekends. The staff is always really friendly and do a good job of making sure that you're taken care of!  My favorite thing to get here alongside a cold brew is breakfast bagel sandwich. They serve Rosen's Bagels, which is the closest thing you can get to an NYC bagel in Austin (not an exact replacement, but close enough).  It's definitely one of the coffee shops that you need to cross off your Austin list!

reviews.author: Irene G.
reviews.description: First time visiting Austin and got to say this place has amazing coffee! My favorite thing about it this cafe was definitely the rusty vibe. Visited on a Saturday morning and def felt like reading here or just journaling

reviews.author: Sara V.
reviews.description: I only eat here when I'm hungover, otherwise it's just ok.  Pro: That aioli on the breakfast sandwich deserves 5 stars all on its own.  Con: If you order a triple shot iced latte, they'll just make a cold brew with milk to save time. I almost stopped coming here after that experience until my next hangover called for a breakfast sandwich.   Do: order breakfast Don't: order coffee

reviews.author: Kayla S.
reviews.description: Kind of obsessed with this place. I've only been for breakfast because it's BOMB.com! They have dishes for everyone; meat eaters to vegans! I have ordered 2 versions of their breakfast sandwich S.O.B. And I have to say both are delish in their own way.  Vegan SOB made with beyond breakfast sausage and a house made cashew cheese. It's just stacked with flavor. Then their original SOB you can get a few different meat options I went with sausage - there some kind of aioli, avocado and taters! Such a mess but worth it!   They have craft beers you can take to go- I love that they carry the brand Untitled art. It's a traveling craft brewery that makes incredible flavors!   Dog friendly and just a must stop spot! GO!

reviews.author: Andrea R.
reviews.description: What a cute spot. Made multiple trips here during my stay in town. The coffee was great. The flavor options, milk accommodations, outside seating, to go options all made it really inviting. Bagel with lox always a favorite and being from NJ it's a staple I usually judge pretty harshly on but was happy here during my stay in Austin. They also have cute merch, some CBD and beer items too. Local, small business. Would happily come back on my next trip.

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: Nice location, the service was amazing. I ordered the honey lavender latte, made perfectly..it was like a hug in a cup!

reviews.author: Rob B.
reviews.description: Super nice people and a great location. My coffee was good, I think this place has some hidden greatness covered in Covid shroud

reviews.author: Jennifer J.
reviews.description: Fantastic drink menu and friendly staff - we'd definitely stop back in based on the craft beer selection alone!

reviews.author: C R.
reviews.description: I visited on my last morning of vaca in downtown Austin due to craving a hearty bagel. It was easy to find from my hotel and primely located across from target on 5th street. The signage only says "brew and brew" so I was confused but soon confirmed that I was at the correct place. I know I desired the bagel with smoked salmon so I ordered it but was not impressed. The bagel was cold, flavorless and the smoked salmon was flavorless. I love a good culinary concoction but this just kissed the mary. It was pretty yet did not taste amazing. Presentation was nice however and service was good.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here to do some work on a Wednesday afternoon. There were a good number of people hanging out, but plenty of available seating with large tables and ample outlets available. The noise level was perfect, not so quiet that you'd be uncomfortable having a private conversation, but quiet enough that you can get work done.   Coffee drink offerings were pretty standard in terms of options and prices. They have a really wide variety of beers available, as with most spots in the area most of them are localish. They could expand a little bit on their food options, especially on their non breakfast items since they seem to lean more towards the happy hour crowd.   I went for the cold brew which tasted great- super smooth and didn't need much milk to get a nice creamy taste. Be warned it is super strong, it takes a lot for me to get a caffeine rush from coffee and this really did the trick.   Overall I think it's a great place for a date spot, to get some work done, or hit a casual happy hour. I can definitely see myself coming back here in the future

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Typical Austin coffee and beer spot. Seating is very limited and wraps around the building leading to good people watching. Street parking is available, but limited. Cold brew was one of the better ones I've had in a long time! Beer selection is average, glad they had some local beers available.

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: I actually think I was here the time Ivan down there is talking about. He was being a dipshit about his mask (like acting like he was wearing it, but then intentionally wearing it wrong so the staff had to say something). He took a call and didn't wear it and that woman said something so he got all in a huff and walked out. It didn't seem like anyone threw him out, to me. I did kind of want to toss him myself but guys like that always have some virus. Don't want to get close.   Anyway I've been home to Texas a few times lately. A friend told me to try this place and I've gone every time I'm home. The food, beer (I don't like coffee) and staff have always been really good. Made me feel welcomed home. They do it right. Ivan does it without his mask on.

reviews.author: Sama C.
reviews.description: Very unique concept with different types of coffee and microbrew. You can have a boost of some strong pick-me-up coffee made fresh to order by the barista. You can also have a wide range of local craft beers.  This place has plenty of seating; indoor and outdoor. It has a chill flow feel to it so you can unwind, pregame or bring your laptop and do some work.

reviews.author: Isaac T.
reviews.description: I stopped by here for cold brew today - nothing too exciting about what I drank. I do like the concept of this place offering beer and coffee.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: A local biz that I've frequented many times over the years. They help to keep Austin weird as they say.  Surrounded by many new construction projects is a small coffee and brew joint nestled on the corner - you might pass it if you drive too fast - please don't!  I came in recently for breakfast and I was saddened a little as the menu had changed from my last visit. I'm normally chill about this however my wife was excited about the breakfast offerings I described only to realize they trimmed the menu down a bit.  I went 4 stars solely due to the reduced menu from the past. I just wish they did more breakfast on the weekend.  The coffee is great (FlatTrack) and beer even better I'd say. I find going over to FlatTrack gets me a little more for breakfast vs here although the venue is larger.  This isn't a diss but a request to improve is all. The mainstream is coming and I want my local to stay.

reviews.author: Sparky H.
reviews.description: While staying in eastside Austin on vacation, I made a point of visiting every independent coffee house in walking distance.  I made it to five in all.  Wright Bros. Brew + Brew was the clear winner!  They had an extensive menu, with lots of choices -- a very big factor for me.  My vanilla latte and my everything bagel were delicious.  The staff was warm and friendly.  Of course, there's no indoor service right now, but you can sit and eat outside on the patio.  And it's conveniently close to Target and Whole Foods.

name: The League Kitchen and Tavern
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Ali V.
reviews.description: In a world where work (regular or enjoyable) in the hospitality industry is hard AF to come by, this place exceeds expectations! It's truly a Cheers-esque environment where everyone feels welcome and everyone knows your name (and drink)! Marissa, Kiyani, Sophia and Aaron all make everyone feel welcomed and valued. We've lived here (6 minutes away) for 10 years and this is BY FAR the best regular crew they've ever had! Management is a revolving door, though, and there have been some great ones along with dozens of others (good and bad) who are no longer at this location or with the company. Drew, who is newish, though, is awesome and one of the best to ever grace this location's presence.  All I can say is, if you're local and haven't been but are considering stopping in - go here. If you're out of town and visiting - go here. If you're a regular - write a review. You know the folks here who make this your regular spot deserve the shout out. I, personally, feel bad it's taken me so long to give them a public shout out!  Management - you're lucky to have a team like this during this time. Treat them as the valued people that they are!  Thanks y'all!

reviews.author: Liz F.
reviews.description: I've lived in Cedar Park for years and I can't believe I've never been here! Went tonight finally to get some fare on patio since it was such a nice evening, and omg, we were blown away.  Stated with the fried pickles, I don't even care for pickles, but with the Buffalo sauce! Uhmmm yass these were amazing! Perfectly crispy, crunch of the pickle, and the zip of the sauce, it was pretty darn good!  I had the spicy passion fruit margarita, it was more sweet than spicy, but still tasty. I liked the blood orange Bellini a little better, and the house margarita was also good.   I got the coconut shrimp for dinner, again, perfectly fried, with a nice crunch. The coconut was subtle but I really enjoyed the chile sauce with it. I got a "side" of fries to go with it, the fries could have been my meal. Super generous portion, and do yourself a favor, add the truffle, Holy moly!    Our waitress was great, as long as every other member of the wait staff that touched our table. We came on the recommendation of friend and I feel I have to spread the love. This place is a must try, and I can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Kat B.
reviews.description: Great spot with a very relaxed vibe. Our server was Priscilla I believe. She was great and did an awesome job.  My husband and I both got the southern burger and we both really enjoyed it. The homemade fries were great as well. My brother in law had the dip and said it was really good also. I liked the ambiance of the restaurant as it was sort of an upscale sports bar. It was clean and the staff we encountered were all very pleasant and friendly.

reviews.author: Jill L.
reviews.description: One of my ladies lunch clubs meets here and the service and food always delight. I've toured the whole menu over the umpteen times dining here and my go-to is the meatloaf, either as an entree (hungry days) or bites with a side of Brussels sprouts for a lighter day.  Crab cakes are my second choice. Bar drinks are consistent and the wine list is ample.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Very unassuming from the outside but walk in and you find a upscale gastropub style restaurant. We came at lunch and though I was initially hesitant to bring in kids, there ended up being plenty off other families in there. The menu was upscale American. Given it was lunch time, we went with hamburgers and sandwiches. The main dishes were all really good and a decent portion (not too big, not too small). The sides we got were a bit under seasoned though. Lastly, there should really be a hamburger on the kids menu.   Overall, really enjoyed this place. Will come back for dinner to try more of the menu.

reviews.author: Mainer D.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I loved this place. It was our first time coming and we will definitely be back. The food was amazing and so was the service. If you guys are looking for a restaurant to try out I highly recommend this place. Our server name was Aaron and he was very knowledgeable on the food menu and drink menu. He was very friendly on top of his great service. Plus the manager Zach came out and greeted us with a free dessert after finding out this was our first time here. He also was very friendly and nice. Overall one of the best experiences we've had in a long time.

reviews.author: Ken D.
reviews.description: The League is part neighborhood bar, part gastro-pub and I love both parts!    The bar and dinning areas are separated.  Despite both being relatively small, there's plenty of seating.  Choose from high-tops to semi-circular booths to high-back swivel bar stools.  And they have an outdoor patio as well, but not much of a view.   The League is a great place to meet a friend for drinks, a casual date, weekend brunch, watch Sunday football, or to just to ride the bar solo.    Excellent food with new, weekly specials, including a burger-of-the-week. On Mondays they have 2-for-1 burgers for dine in - can't beat that!  They also have cocktail specials to go along with their food specials (in addition to their menu and drink standards).  I wish they had a bigger beer wall, but the selection is serviceable.   The League is one on my regular spots and I've yet to be disappointed with their food, drinks, or service.

reviews.author: Vincent W.
reviews.description: If you are in the mood for elevated bar food in Cedar Park, this is a good choice.    Good food and good service.  Half bar half restaurant menu.  Fairly new facilities.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The League Kitchen and Tavern does not disappoint when I'm craving elevated bar food. The burgers are excellent as are the drinks and I don't go enough. This time we ordered the Pappardelle Bolognese and the Jamaican Jerk Mahi Mahi. Probably won't get these again but they weren't bad. I just will try something else. Always great service here.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I was so pleasantly surprised when we stopped here for a quick lunch. Friendly service and helpful staff members greeted us at the door and I loved the Prohibition era style and decor. Lots of variety on the menu. I tried the Society burger which was tasty and my husband had the club sandwich. $3 mimosas and they sent us home with a complimentary dessert- can't beat that.

reviews.author: Michael Q.
reviews.description: Came here for lunch with a few of my coworkers and it was pretty good.  Lunch was solid service was good but I think that was partially because there were only 4 tables occupied when we were there but the service was attentive.  Menu is pretty large and has breakfast items during lunch so no complaints there because I do love me some breakfast for lunch or dinner.  Overall solid place would come back if I'm in the area not making a special trip here but if I'm here I definitely would come back.

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: 7/4/21 1st visit.  Already a crowd at opening.   Waitress : Kenza - very attentive, paying attention to details. ( even asked about allergies ) There's definitely a spirit of cooperation- every employee was eager to help out.  Drinks : Bloody Mary's delicious and at $3.00 a bargain. Arron the bartender jumps in to help out in the dining area. Great guy !! Food : Pot pie (basically a biscuit with gravy with a fried egg on top - WOW filling and Delicious!! Wife had the steak salad - steak cooked exactly as she ordered it.  Mother in Law had a breakfast anytime.  All of our food was delicious!!  All and All we had a GREAT experience!! Definitely will come again.  A quality restaurant ! Absolutely nothing negative to report.  As a treat on your 1st visit - we'll show up and ask about it.  Prices were VERY REASONABLE!!

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have been going to The League for a couple of years now. I get my hair done around the corner so it's convenient for my husband to hang at the bar. Sometimes we eat here and sometimes not.   Upside; Bartenders are always friendly and welcoming, they have great happy hour prices on drinks and apps. Also weekly food specials.   Food can be hit or miss. Between the two of us we've had everything on the menu. Club sandwich is always as hit and so is the spinach artichoke dip. Burgers sometimes a bit dry. The salmon is usually perfectly cooked. Fish and chips over battered and greasy. Prime rib sandwich is hit or miss.  Burger of the week this visit was Frito Pie Burger. I had the garlic butter grouper, which was a huge portion, but lacked seasoning on both the fish and couscous. Garlic butter was on the side, but was just melted butter with a chopped garlic at the bottom. No other seasonings.   We will continue to come hang at the bar and eat here occasionally.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: 5 stars for service and 2.75 stars for food. My 4 stars are on the generous side.  We dined here this afternoon. The server was very nice and took care of us. I'd give her service 5 stars.   For our food we ordered the chicken fried pork chop, the full rack of ribs, the southern burger, and the kids Mac and cheese.   Our little guy loved the Mac snd cheese. It was decent and definitely not out of a box. It didn't come with anything else but was only $5.   Hubby had the Southern burger with truffle fries ($2 up charge). The burger was solid. It could have been a slight bit juicer but it was a good burger. The "truffle" fries were not. The fries were limp and soggy and sprinkled with Parmesan but had no truffle flavor at all. Actually when you picked up a fry the cheese all fell off too. Pretty bad fries to be honest.   Older son ordered the baby back ribs and enjoyed them. They were your standard fair. Similar to what you'd find at Chili's but they cost $30 and come with a side of mashed potatoes.  I had the  chicken fried pork chop. It was very over cooked and dry and was topped with jalapeño gravy but there was no heat or jalapeño flavor at all. The gravy made the pork chop less dry though. I subbed Brussels sprouts instead of mashed potatoes ($2). They lacked seasoning or flavor. I like the taste of Brussels sprouts so I ate them but they had no other seasoning that I could detect.   The food was all fine. Not bad but at their prices I would definitely not run back.

reviews.author: Gail M.
reviews.description: Tonight I met a friend to taste their Prime and Wine deal. Half price bottles of wine and two sizes of Prime Rib. The beef was perfectly cooked, nicely seasoned and fork tender. The mushrooms cooked in a savory salty balsamic sauce were the perfect accompaniment to the prime rib. I asked for fries rather than the Yukon mashed because I know their fries are fresh and hand cut. Some people complain about soggy fries. Well, if you put them in a cardboard box to take home, they WILL steam in the box and get soggy. Duh! But ours were nice and crispy. The cut of beef was thick which I really appreciated as opposed to a wide thin-cut slice. I think it was maybe 3/4 of an inch thick? Maybe more. I'm posting a pick but I had already dug in when I remembered to take a photo. Sorry. I like The league a lot. Even the Mgr came by to ensure we were happy. Nice young man was our waiter. This was all good!

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Overpriced bar food.  Fries were soggy. Burger needed basic salt and pepper to give it flavor. It was medium rare.

reviews.author: Kasti K.
reviews.description: This place wildly exceeded my expectations.   We are in from out of town, it's a perfect Sunday spot for lunch and to watch football. The Sunday crew in the bar was super fun, our server Aaron was really kind   Their Sunday drink special is $3 mimosa and bloody Mary's.   Their gluten free bun is the best I've had at a restaurant, it is nice and chewy and stays together.   The chicken sandwich was great, a huge chicken breast with lots of bacon and avocado. They do a "first timer" complimentary dessert of their chocolate dump cake, my husband said it was great!

reviews.author: J K.
reviews.description: I ordered the "elevated" or perhaps called "adult" grilled cheese and tomato soup. The soup was very tasty and I would order that again.  The sandwich was not an adult version and not elevated. Cold congealed cheese on what looked like white bread. No spreads or bacon jam or fig or combination of cheeses.. nothing to elevate this sandwich to justify the $13.00 price tag.  I make 'em better at home.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This place is our most visited restaurant since moving here thirteen years ago. As a former restaurant owner / operator, I appreciate the consistency and quality of the menu offerings. The facility is always clean and tables are cleared immediately when a party leaves. They have some really good deals, like burger Monday where you buy one and get one free. They also have a mouth watering prime rib special on Thursday that we can't wait to try.  One more attraction is , if you are into science or astronomy, you might be waited on by Galileo.

reviews.author: Chantel C.
reviews.description: We WILL be back! So, tonight my little family and I discovered this hidden gem. We had no clue about this place until tonight when I was looking for a family friendly restaurant, Little did we know it's only 10 minutes away from our house that we lived at for over two years. We were greeted as soon as we came in, it looked upscale and as soon as we sat down my husband said "are you sure this is kid friendly"  it ABSOLUTELY is. The food was amazing from the appetizers, main course and dessert. The customer service here was outstanding, I've waitressed myself for many years and have been to many restaurants and have never had service like this. Sam took care of us tonight and was so accommodating to us and our 1 year sassy daughter. Zach the manager on duty was also outstanding as well, he took care of us well for it being our first time there, We left in disbelief with the service we received... thanks yall! We look forward to many more dinners here.   Plus I got a nice tote for the to go food

name: Sean Patrick's Irish Pub + Texas Grub

reviews.author: Kyle S.
reviews.description: We're visiting the area to prepare for a future move, drove past and decided to stop in. So glad we did. My husband had the Texas Philly and I had the chicken pot pie. The pot pie was so good. The crust and gravy were perfect. I wish there was more crust. I had the lunch portion. I'm not sure if the regular portion is bigger but I definitely wanted more.

reviews.author: Alan F.
reviews.description: Surprisingly liberal - the sparse and reluctant service was crutched by a chicken pot pie that was actually quite good

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: Gave this place a try and was impressed. Ordered Mushroom burger and fish and chips for delivery. Very good.  The menu has a great selection to choose from. Prices are very reasonable. Great place to order from a bit to eat.

reviews.author: G G.
reviews.description: Specials were crazy good today. Cod for the fish today and app special was an excellent irish egg roll (corned beef and cabbage)

reviews.author: Shawna L.
reviews.description: We had 7 in our party and everyone loved their meal, especially the pulled pork. Atmosphere was great and so was the service. Vic was great at recommendations and was patient while we made our decisions. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Karin P.
reviews.description: WiFi password is Guest2018...  I haven't been to Sean Patrick's since I graduated from Texas State in 2011... Not much has changed and I'm glad for that. It was nice to reminisce.   Meet a couple for dinner while going through town. They recommended this place because they have "The Incredible Burger", a vegan burger option. They have driven to San Marcos a couple of times from Kyle just for that burger. One got it on a Patty Melt and said the Texas toast was the perfect addition. The other got it on a regular bun. Both with fries. Both disappeared quickly! They also had a Bloody Mary each. The staff was very accommodating in regards to one's request for extra olives.   My husband had the fish and chips Irish style, so a Guinness based batter. I had the fish and chips Texas style, so a corn meal based batter. Both were fantastic. I tried some of his. His better was crunchier and crisper than mine. Both were very good.  My husband had the Solid Gold lager. He said it was pretty light but good.   The overall noise got a little loud quickly but it's a Saturday night in a college town so that's not unexpected. There are a couple of pool tables and several TVs. It's a great college hang out place.   Lots of beer options.   My husband said there was a trough in the men's restroom... The ladies could have used some attention but mostly well maintained.

reviews.author: Jeff P.
reviews.description: I've been here for the last 3 fights and I'm watching the last one I will watch here. 15 bucks to watch on half the really poor quality TVs. Though that is just the tip of the iceberg. Got here 2 hours before the fight and they would not turn any of the TVs to the prelims out on the patio. We asked 3 times and the 3rd time they said they could not cause people wanted to watch the soccer game that wasn't even on yet, also we are the only people at the time watching on the patio. Next is there was no cover when we got here, walked in sat down been drinking and eating and they are coming around telling us we have to go buy 15 dollar tickets at the door. On top of that the food is not high quality but the most expensive on the square and the service just isn't really there.   Also half the TVs are the fight and they are small TVs! Like super and low quality  Just ripping regular people off cause they are the only people on the square that show the fights. Bad business.

reviews.author: Connor B.
reviews.description: Two stars only for the food. Service was trash. Have to wait in line due to "Covid" yet no real Covid restrictions. Can't order another beer without getting back in a long line. Won't come here for at least another year until they fix some things.

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: I've been going to Sean patricks for a couple years now regularly with my girlfriend and my service dog. Every time we go someone always makes a comment to me about how well trained and well behaved my service dog is, and this evening was no different in regards to that. I always had a great experience with nice employees who were very welcoming.  I've never had a worse customer service experience in my life as I did today. The manager on duty Marshall Wyatt or Wyatt Marshall kicked me and my service dog out because he didn't have a vest for show that says service dog on it from Amazon. I explained to him more than I legally needed to in regards to my service dog. He at first turned me over to his manager under him, who was very nice, as employees usually are at Sean Patrick's. I compromised with sitting outside as they were busy on the inside anyways, and I didn't want to cause any issues. Then we were getting stormed on outside with winds blowing everything off our table and getting rained on while we ate. We only needed to have their coverings for the outside patio rolled down, but they took forever, and after asking multiple times for someone to come take care of it, I began taking care of it myself when finally Marshall Wyatt or Wyatt Marshall comes out and attempts to take care of it, but the covering just kept flying into our table and hitting my girlfriend. While we are getting pummeled by their outside seating covering. I pointed at it while making eye contact with Mr Wyatt, he makes eye contact, but continues being fixated on a tv while he leisurely walks over to assist. He walks back inside after putting a chair in the way. Well, the chair blows back on us with the crazy winds. We walk inside and get harassed by a bar back because Marshall Wyatt instructed him to in regards to my service dog. After explaining the law to the bar back we sit down, and I determined it was time to talk to someone about the experience I've had tonight. I spoke with the manager under mr Wyatt. Again, she was very nice, welcoming, and apologetic. After speaking with her mr Wyatt comes over to ask me how he was "rude" to me. I explained to him my experience, and he proceeded to argue every detail to defend and deny his lousy service. I thought he would come over to take responsibility as a manager and apologize, so I was caught off guard and told him that I didn't want to hear his argument, he then snatched everything off our table and kicked myself and my girlfriend out, saying that my service dog was in there "illegally," even though I tried to explain to him that he can simply refer to the ADA website. I cannot say I will be coming back until Mr. Wyatt is gone.  Owner Brian Jeffrey, please make this right, and reach out to me. I will miss going to Sean Patrick's, but who my money goes to is a huge thing for me.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: If you are looking for some hardcore authentic snooty nosed Irish pub...don't come here (lad or lass).  You're NOT in Ireland!  This is Texas!  If you are looking for a place with some great food with an Irish flair, you are good to go.  If you like cold beer, and a great selection of it, again, you're good to go.  If you like good service, yep, good to go.   Lots of TV's.  Great place to take in a game.  Wonderful place to hang out in a college town and pass some time.  They've got pool tables, shuffleboard, a nice outdoor patio for you and your dog.    Overall, great drink selection.  Great beer selection.  Tasty food.  One of my SMTX faves, and certainly my GO-TO when I am in town!

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: Love the food here, good drink selection too. Great place to watch a Texas State away game.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: I've been here before and previously would've probably given 3-4 stars , but they have definitely stepped their game up!!!  Me and my boyfriend came in to watch the World Cup game because I remembered this place had tons of tv's, and the most seating out of pretty much any bar in San Marcos . We ordered drinks , chili cheese fries, and a DELICIOUS 2$ scoop of pistachio almond ice cream in a waffle cone . All the food was awesome ( which I can't remember saying in past experiences .)   After the game we opted for some shuffle board and darts , which was a great end to an awesome World Cup game . Couldn't have asked for a better place/ environment for watching , enjoying great food, and hearing a lively crowd !!!

reviews.author: Alex N.
reviews.description: So the waitress said my buddy was good to bring the dog inside to order, but when he did the bartender told my buddy that he had to get the dog out of there since it didn't have a service vest on, and my buddy said sure and was telling his girlfriend the order then the bartender cussed him out saying did he fucking hear him, and to get the fucking dog out of there. He was the tall bug eyed one

reviews.author: Mari B.
reviews.description: 1st time here and we were beyond thrilled with the food, drinks and service. We were made aware of the specials immediately and offered lunch portions. Bangers and mash was excellent!  We will be back!

reviews.author: Kim C.
reviews.description: My husband and another couple came in to have a few drinks and some food. The other couple ordered fish and chips. When their order came out the fish and chips were awful, breading was soggy and the 'white' fish was grey in color, they were refunded the meal, but didn't want to take a chance on anything else. Later I went to use the restroom, only to be in a stall that has no toilet paper. Very disappointed as I was from out of town and looking to try something local. Very disappointed.

reviews.author: Ben S.
reviews.description: Love coming here this is one of my go to places in San Marcos. They have great food I recommend always getting a triple play for an appetizer! The beers always cold plus $6.50 mini pitchers on Fridays can't beat that!

reviews.author: Christie - Matt R.
reviews.description: This place is far from being like an Irish pub with Irish food. Any Non-American visiting would tell you Shepard's Pie is made with lamb and not beef.  It's ok to make it with beef but one must correct their menu as it's correctly called "Cottage Pie" when made with beef.   Blackjack Burger - Pretty Good Philly Cheese Steak - No Flavour (yes, there's a damn U in it) Smithwicks - Ran Out (pronounced incorrectly... don't say the W)  As a immigrant this is far from Irish, in fact so far removed from anything Irish it's an insult. No offense, but an American would never know the bloody difference! In addition, the bathrooms are named "Lasses" and "Boyos".... the ladies is a SCOTTISH name and the men's is WELSH name; no S at the end. This damn place needs to learn some shit really quickly, because they look like fuck'n idiots to everyone out of county.  Skip this shit-hole and get a decent beer and food at Aquabrew down the street... you were warned, so go ahead regret it at your leisure!

reviews.author: J D.
reviews.description: Pros: Good draft beer selection; good pork chop; amazing in-house Guinness BBQ sauce; pretty good BBQ bacon burger (pro tip order BBQ sauce on side so you get a healthy helping); very good onion rings  Cons: Can be very loud; small dipping sauce containers (may charge extra for BBQ sauce)

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: My husband and I had drinks and dinner here last night. He ordered the pork sliders and they were horrible.  The meat tasted like it had been cooked for a week.  The BBQ sauce was gross.  I had the pretzel and it came from a box. I paid $9 for it. The drinks barely had a shot in them and were over priced. We won't waste our time going back.

reviews.author: E. A. J.
reviews.description: First time at this bar, good atmosphere and good deals on beer. Server was okay, nothing special but that's not why we came. First off we ordered fried jalapeños and got fried pickles, but didn't say anything because it wasn't that big of a deal. The issue was at the end. We tried to tell him separate tabs, handed him a 20 and a credit card for the two tabs. He kept the 20 and didn't bring back any change, and charged all of the drinks on one tab- never saw him again. We were in a rush so couldn't track him down to correct it. Needles to say, a little disappointed...

name: The Dig Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Carlie M.
reviews.description: This has been one of our favorite local places for years now. The new owner, who previously worked here, is a real stand-up guy and has been nothing but awesome towards us. He has taken on a lot more than being an owner; he actually works his business and takes serious pride in the place. Having taken over just before the pandemic, and knowing what that did to restaurants all over, it is hard to see people leave such horrible reviews. You can tell some of the reviews might reflect the person leaving them and not the place itself. Do not let those deter you from trying this place. You will not regret it. The area outside was a great addition for the dogs and kids run around. We have favorites but like try something new from the menu when we go and have yet to be disappointed. Also, pretzels and beer cheese with beers...mmmm!!! My husband likes big beers and I like Kolsch. Want wine? They have that too. They always have something that makes us both happy and that is what keeps us going back for more. Every time we have friends or family in town, this is always on the list to take them. Help keep this local gem afloat! They deserve it! And remember, the more we go now, means the better the place will be in the future. He has plans up his sleeve but that takes revenue :) Keep it up, Dig Pub!

reviews.author: Justin S.
reviews.description: Not too much to say.  The workers are very friendly and the beer selection is okay. It's a strip mall, suburban kind of bar.   The manager told us she was the manager like 50 times so we'll never forget that she's the manager.    "I'm the manager". "So I'm the manager and I can add beer to our menu if you like". "I'm the manager, so I make decisions". "So I'm the new manager here and I can make things happen".   It was definitely a laughable but enjoyable experience. Nothing to special.  Just convenient because it's located nearby.   The guests were mostly old white people. The outdoor area is nice.  At least they have that, so you're not cooped up inside a small space with die hard Trumpers who hate everyone and everything different than them.  .

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: Evening in the suburbs and the dining options were dwindling. I was getting hungry and being out with my buddy meant that I'd have at least one more beer. My friend went through his mental list of places and came up with The Dig.   We arrived there and fortunately got there in time, it was a slow night and the kitchen was about to close so we quickly made our choices. I saw that they had Scotch Eggs and I'm a sucker for Scotch eggs, but unless you're a vegetarian/vegan what's not to like about an egg wrapped in sausage that's then deep fried?  I also ended up getting their Buffalo Chicken Sandwich because...actually why do you need a reason?  The egg was good, a little thin on the sausage side but the mustard dip added a little more savory. The sandwich had a good amount of spice but the sauce was pretty runny so it was messy but otherwise good.  They do have a lot of taps and I appreciate that they try to have a little bit of everything and focus on locals. I get that they have to strike a balance between locals who want a beer that's cold, yellow, fizzy and domestic and crazy whale chasing beer nerds that are into barrel aged, wild/lacto, hopheads but for my visit it was a little more on the tame side. I had a sour from Prairie and a local mead which was great and at the time, that was about it.

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Drove by here today and thought I would check it out and I liked it! I ordered a Peacemaker Beer, an ale that tasted good. The next time I want to try the Blackberry beer. The name itself is appealing. Since it was close to dinner I figured I should order food instead of going home and cooking. I got the fish and chips. You can order the 2 piece or 4. I got the 2 piece with cut fries. It was cooked good. The fish was flaky and not oily. The pubs tarter sauce was good.. the fries were very good too..   The service was very good. There was a sign to sit yourself which I did and within 1 or 2 minutes my server stopped by to get me started. She showed me the ropes and got my beer and food quickly. I was really surprised at how fast my food came out. I can say it was just under 10 minutes but I was still surprised at the promptness. There was quite a few customers but the servers were on top of it. They talked to the customers as if they were family.   The place was clean and there was good parking. The beer menu had several types of craft and IPA beers. I'm  pretty sure I will return when I have time. My total cost including the food and beer was only $14, amazing! Thank you Dig Pub for being in Cedar Park and giving up another place to get a beer and some grub in a friendly way!

reviews.author: Michael R.
reviews.description: There are lots of reasons to come in: Erick the bartender, the local beer options, the chill vibe, Erick the bartender, the buffalo chicken sandwich, Erik the bartender, and the whole staff is super cool. Never miss a chance to swing in on Tuesday or Sunday when I'm free. Welcoming, unassuming, the regulars are tons of fun, and overall a good time.

reviews.author: Nicki T.
reviews.description: The Dig Pub--new manager, new owner, now a new chef, things are really looking up, Cedar Park, Texas! The Sunday brunch is fabulous and should be famous, and the hollandaise sauce is definitely the best I've ever had. Topped off by Guinness and fried pickles, brunch was a hit. The chef hinted at more things in the works, like beer pairings and monthly specials, so we can't wait! Way to rock the craft beer, and now the food is being perfected by the chef, formerly of Snooze, Loro, and now the Dig! Awesome, mate.

reviews.author: Krista L.
reviews.description: In their left side room with 2 booths, the first booth was propped up to look like it was stable, but it collapsed when I sat down ...  my butt literally hit the floor! And I've broken my tailbone twice while playing sports. My wife and I reported this to several staff and received shrugs!! We stayed long enough to finish our beers and while we were drinking, staff propped the booth bench back together. I disassembled it twice but they kept putting it back. This place is just begging for a customer to get hurt and get a lawsuit!  If someone does, then I'm willing to testify.   I've posted photos of the bench c

reviews.author: Adrienne S.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and service. Food is typical bar/pub food but definitely a great place to grab a beer.

reviews.author: Lucky N.
reviews.description: This place is interesting. The right side of the restaurant looks pretty nice and lively and the left side of the restaurant looks like they gave up or ran out of money on decorating and just put a few tables out. They also have an outdoor area but no shade so I didn't want to sit out there unprotected, otherwise, it would have been nice because I had my dog. It was a bit busy so unfortunately had to sit on the left side (maybe everyone else there agrees the right side is better and that's why they all preferred to sit there). It didn't look or feel particularly clean and I'm a clean freak so I didn't particularly enjoy sitting there.   The service was fine; the waitress was nice. The food was pretty decent, but nothing outstanding or memorable where I feel I have to come back again. It was fresh though and I appreciate that for comfort food, it wasn't soaked in oil. I think the ambiance had already turned me off so I didn't enjoy my food as much as I would have it was clean.   They are known for their beer but I don't drink beer so take my review with a grain of salt. Clearly I'm not a dive bar kind of girl (unless it's out for drinks and bar hopping) but plenty of people are fine/really like those types of places so if you do, you'll enjoy this place. I'm not knocking this place and I would come back if friends wanted to go but I like more of an ambiance when I go out to eat.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Not only did the owner private message me after my last comment, he accused my wife of being in the way, while sitting at the bar top...  this place is a joke a JOKE What an ignorantly run, managed facility. Then he accused us of throwing things, If I had known this was coming I would of thrown half of my plate at the server, maybe then she would of gotten her tongue out of her boy friends mouth and actually gotten our order correct!

reviews.author: Kelsea K.
reviews.description: Good selection of various beers! Lots of tap options. Grilled cheese might have well been on the kids menu, pretty flat and boring... but my 5 year old liked it!  The adults got the Thor's Hammer and BLTA with fries and the table shared scotch eggs and pickle chips for apps.
