Sandwiches were straightforward and tasty and the fries were thick but crispy outside and soft inside.   Scotch eggs were better than Renaissance festival... but could have more sausage.  Pickle chips were average bar food. Overall, good meal and fair prices!

reviews.author: Rainey B.
reviews.description: So...for those who believe that The Dig is run by snotty brats, perhaps you should have some consideration for the amazing service industry folks who have gotten us through the last almost 2 years of Covid he!!. Erik, Sage, Miles, Kayla and the rest of the crew have been considerate and friendly throughout and the food quality has always been outstanding. The beer selection now is better than it has ever been (coming from an Austin beer snob who used to live on Rainey). Don't pass this place by if it is on your radar!

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: What a great evening at the Dig Pub! We took our dog and enjoyed sitting outside in the casual picnic area. Ben and Ashley provided the best service we've had in quite a long time. The food was fresh and quite tasty. Many choices for beer on tap...wine and cider, too. We will be back soon!

reviews.author: Chris R.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable staff about beer options. Friendly staff. Good food. Plenty of indoor and outdoor sitting.

reviews.author: Will S.
reviews.description: The Dig is a great local place in Cedar Park to meet friends and try out some really tasty brews, or wine if you prefer.  Lots of good seating both inside and out for  those who want a more open environment. Their pub grub is excellent, Scotch eggs to die for and some really tasty cheese offerings as well as some standard fare. The whole staff is friendly, honestly, never had a grumpy server and I really like sitting on a couch...one of the seating options depending on where in the pub you are. Check this place out, you might find that you....DIG it too.

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: Food - Acceptable Service - So-so Friendliness - Poor Chance of a return visit - Zero, mostly due to the unfriendliness of the waitress. Perhaps some training in the area of making your guests feel welcome in your establishment would help alleviate this problem.

reviews.author: Howdy B.
reviews.description: Nice place with relaxed environment. I'm not a beer drinker but I saw lots on tap. It's dog-friendly and the food is yummy. Alexander was super friendly and accommodating. We will be back!

reviews.author: Jim O.
reviews.description: The place to go in Cedar Park for a brew. Wife and I went for our anniversary night out to grab a bite and a brew. We had a blast. Service was exceptional with four different staff asking if we were good or needed anything. They were prompt and courteous and just plain nice. Food was served quickly and was delicious. Wife had the patty melt and I had the monte cristo; both were exceptional. The poutine as an appetizer is also on the to do list. We will be back.

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: We have been craving some loaded fries so we did a search and found this place. Recently they started offering delivery so we decided to order loaded fries, fried pickles, and a few beverages. The order was done fast and delivery was fast as well. Delicious food for a decent price. Support your local restaurants!

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: Very good food. Wings on Tuesday, fish and chips on Friday. Erik does a REALLY GOOD job. Good beer selection too.

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: Great spot with super friendly staff, and boasting a nice assortment of beers - from kolshes, pilsners and wheats to IPAs, red ales, IPAs, sours, and barrel-aged stouts (and guest taps included meads and ciders), there's something for anyone here!  My buddy and I stopped by on my first day in town, and we clearly started things off on the right foot. We each got flights - and I was very content with each beer I got; and they even allowed the barrel-aged stout to be one of my choices (some places can be somewhat stingy with their BAs).  Solid, under-the-radar brewery - will definitely be back next time I'm in town!

reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: Never heard of this brewery or seen any of their beers in stores and restaurants so we just serendipitously stumbled upon it one weekend. I've been trying to branch out and visit more local breweries as of late.  I can wholeheartedly recommend this place as somewhere to just relax and hangout. Got a flight with a sample of 5 beers - can't recall off the top of my head the names of the one I tried but they were all good!

reviews.author: Sergio S.
reviews.description: Tasty brews provided by friendly folks (and a people-loving pup).  Josh provided wonderful recommendations on what to taste based on my likes, and some great conversation for an out-of-towner like me. I was even greeted by Roman, a large unshy black lab.  This is a place I will always come back to whenever I'm in Austin.

reviews.author: Steven K.
reviews.description: This place is great and they have gluten reduced beer. Understand, this is normal beer that uses an enzyme to reduce the gluten. Very kind staff and comfortable surroundings. Give them a try.

reviews.author: Margaret L.
reviews.description: So we've been on the road since last May and this is a place that I'm inspired to review. Great beer. Great space. Great food. Good people. As a nomad from Austin's little sister city (Asheville, NC) we give you a hearty 5 stars!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We've tried to stop by a few times on weekends but it was always packed. Now I know why - this place is great! Swung by for a weekday lunch and it's almost deserted. Plenty of seating inside and out. Mutt friendly. Beer was pretty good. Not very hoppy IPAs but good nonetheless. I like places that don't have pretentious attitudes towards food when food is not their primary business. Paninis are perfect for a brewery - low fuss, easy, fast. And tasty! Had the Reuben and the turkey/pesto. Now that we know this is a midday weekday kinda place, we'll be back!

reviews.author: S J.
reviews.description: Well the sandwiches are bomb, the beer is bomb, but after a year of requesting a changing table.. speaking to the owner and him promising a changing table .. coming back multiple times and no changing table .. I'll have to just go to every other brewery that Can accomdate mother's... sorry of our neighbor booth that had to smell shit next to us but we had to change in the booth ‍

reviews.author: Jen P.
reviews.description: Beer on point, staff awesome, jalapeño cheddar pretzel...delish!!!  Brice and team have an awesome thing going on here, highly recommend swinging by and checking out their brew.  Porter and Saison were our favorites!

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Neat little brewery tucked away only about a block from Congress Av. Got a flight of 5 beers including the tropical haze, cider, PBB Stout, BBA Stout (11% but still very smooth and wouldn't be able to tell it's that high with how easy it is).  Enjoyed all the beers but went back for 2nds with the BBA Stout, comes in a 7oz pour due to the higher abv.  They serve a variety of diff sandwiches, we tried their Hartie Artie, basically a crispy sandwich with artichoke and tomatoes in it, real crunchy and satisfying! Whole heartedly recommend coming to check this place out yourself!!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: COVID-19: Open! Order by calling in OR you can also order in person. I called in.  I've been here pre-pandemic and during, and I gotta say...I'm so glad they're here to grace the South Austin beer community with their presence. When I visited the first time they had just opened and their taproom was still a work in progress. They still had a good selection of board games, self-serve water and beer/cider in a dog-friendly taproom. Yes, I repeat...bring yo dawgs.  Most recently, I ordered a trio of their 32 oz crowlers. There was a deal going on, and I GOTTA SAY THE SEVEN STILLS OMG. That scotch ale was deliciously dark and creamy without being overboard. I was afraid it would be burning on the throat and too infused with that liquor aftertaste. BUT it was so deliciously decadent. It had a dark chocolate feel with a full and steady mouth feel! Deeeeelish. I hope they brew it again. Their Peak Season IPA was also SO yummy and refreshing. I just checked out their tap list and there are so many creative and interesting beers right now. SO GET ON IT Y'ALL.  Pro Tip: check out their instagram page because there are usually cool deals or posts (like one time they gave free warm pretzels to the first few customers)!

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: Much thanks to Simon for listening to my preferences and letting me taste Call Me Sir. I liked it so much I brought some home. The parking is spacious and the bathrooms clean. Service is excellent and lots of seating inside and outside.

reviews.author: Neal N.
reviews.description: My new favorite brew pub,  the IPA I had yesterday was splendid. I bought a Barks for Beers... for a friend.

reviews.author: Charles W.
reviews.description: These guys, you just have to root for them.  I was here one time while in town for vacation.  If im back in Austin, im back at Nomadic.  Great people with great beer and unsuspecting great food.    Peak season is a top tier hazy IPA.  Radberry was a great sour that was sweet without being fruit juice.  I think it'd satisfy both the tart lovers and Kettle sour seekers.  I was saving my appetite for a BBQ heavyweight but after tasting my girlfriend's turkey pesto I totally regret my decision to not get food.  The whole thing was a delight.  The flavors and texture all come together to deliver one heck of a Sammy.   Definitely a destination to stop at!

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: This was a wonderful experience!  We had the sunrise get down and the stay classy beers - both great!  I had the Turkey pesto panini which was to die for!  It's on easy tiger sourdough bread which I love too!  It was hot and melty - so delicious!  The BF had sweet prosciutto panini which he loved too!  But I liked mine better!  The staff was really friendly and helpful. We're will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here to hang out with a large group on a Saturday afternoon, they have a sizable space with plenty of tables, space to stand, and games to play while you're there. There was a lively bunch of people throughout our time there, but it never got too crowded.   Their beer selection was fairly limited, but it's understandable given they're quite new to the area. The bartender was super helpful and let my friend and I sample a few of them. Being indecisive I still chose to have a flight after.   My personal favorite beer I tried was the dry hopped wheat, but the hazy IPA and the raspberry milkshake IPA also stood out! Their menu was quite IPA heavy, so hopefully they'll continue to branch out, but it does look like they rotate their menu quite often.   There's also a fantastic Korean food truck out back that I highly recommend checking out while you're here.   Overall, I think the combination of good space to hang out, tasty beer, and delicious food is well worth checking out.

reviews.author: Kate C.
reviews.description: A wonderful local business! I am not much of a beer fan, but they were able to recommend one closer to my preferred taste and let me try some other samples as well. Dog friendly, but only a few picnic tables outside. They also have great coffee, if you go during the day it is nice and quiet! Friendly staff as well.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: This place is great! We tried a few beers and really liked all of them! Super cute space- really open and fresh :) Definitely gonna go back to try their coffee!

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Beer. Cheers for beer! And cider. South Austin brewery location that's brightly lit inside and clean with several tables and a bar. They serve their brews in a relaxed environment. The porter was very good!  Picnic tables available outside when the weather is nice. Also has Kimchi Jon's food trailer if you want a bite.

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: Very pet-friendly-- there seemed to be dogs everywhere and they even have a bin of free dog treats. Good beer and good vibes. Indoor and outdoor seating available.

reviews.author: Sarah B.
reviews.description: Nomadic Beerworks is such a hidden gem!! Their beers are hand crafted and taste AMAZING. We were on a brewery tour and we started with a flight. Everything we tried was so mind blowing we had to stay!   The peak season and south swell beers were some of our favorites. In addition the food is a great balance between freshness and greasiness which is perfect for buzzed eats.  I will be taking beers home with me for sure!

reviews.author: Larry S.
reviews.description: Stopped by with some friends for a few drinks. If we had not bene pressed for time, I would have stayed longer. We liked the open atmosphere. They have done a good job of making it a comfortable place to stay and have a drink.   While there is a German theme to the food and beer, there are plenty of other options. We really liked the Steel Drum Stout (Milk Stout) and the Disco Infiltrator (Sour Cherry Porter).   I need to mention the Soft Pretzel....It is probably the best pretzel I have had. Served warm and baked to perfection with just the right amount of salt.  Service was friendly. I know it is hard to find staff in the current environment, but the Brewtorium did a good job.  I'd go back if I find myself in the Austin area again.

reviews.author: Gill S.
reviews.description: They have a wide variety of German style beers, with a few modern offerings and even mead on tap! I was not happy that they werent serving flights, but they told me they are understaffed and dont have a barback to deal with flights. Makes sense that all those small glasses would overwhelm the understaffed team, but a sign would have been nice explaining the situation.  The pretzels they serve here some of the best Ive ever had! It was actually soft, with a touch of chewy texture. The big malted bread flavors were pronounced, with the coarse salt on the surface being a cherry on top. The sauces they give you are horseradish, sour cream, and beer cheese. I mostly snacked on the beer cheese, but the other two were a nice change of pace every other bite.  Seriously these are the kind of pretzels I dream about or imagine tasting when I think of a good pretzel.   I will admit the seating situation is confusing. Yes theres a sign that explains the process, but what other brewery does this? This type of setup would be more manageable with a hostess, but thats not gonna happen with them already being understaffed. Ive only been here once, so Im not sure whats the reason for this unusual seating assignment. Perhaps too many small parties hog up the tables? This place is huge and has plently of seating, so its not a lack of retail space. Who knows but unless they figure something out, the current setup is cumbersome.

reviews.author: Jeremy S.
reviews.description: Bar staff yelled at my pregnant wife and her pregnant friend and child because we didn't order food before sitting at a table (I was in line to order when he came over and yelled at them). When there where other open tables for people to sit at.   We had also been sitting in the spot for almost 20 minutes before someone decided to come over and be this rude. Really used to like coming to this place it always had a very chill atmosphere but now it seems it's taken a turn for the worst. Wouldn't recommend anymore.

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: Really love this spot! Great food! Great beer! Great for large parties! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: This place is fine.   The whole seating situation is confusing. You're supposed to get assigned a table at the bar, but the sign is hard to see and if the line is long it seems like groups tend to seat themselves and send a person to the line. Then, the food menus are only at the bar or at a table with a QR code, so it's confusing how you're supposed to look to decide what you want, and you have to decide on the spot at the bar. After all that, our table was actually taken and we had to be reassigned, which isnt a big deal but the whole thing seems unnecessary.   Regarding food and drink, our pretzel was good but my Cobb salad was pretty bland. It was a solid burger with a good pickle but the potato wedges or whatever they are supposed to be are mushy and not like fries or chip. They were sold out of brats.   My beer was tasty, I got the Confabulator, but my partners beer was terrible. He got the "Mark It 8, Dude," which is described as "toasty, smokey and not out of line." It tastes only of artificial smoke and caramel. I drinkable in my opinion. Probably won't be back.

reviews.author: Mimi Y.
reviews.description: I'd like to acknowledge the playlist that was played  tonight on Friday the 28th was great, I felt like I was home. Thank you for completing a 90s baby OG playlist. Whoever made the playlist for tonight please link me!!

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: We stopped in on St Patty's Day and had the Mac and cheese with pork belly and the cottage pie. Flaky pasty crust was delicious! The beer garden is cozy and cute and the blackberry mead was a little lighter than I'm used to, but still tasty.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: nothing particularly bad about it, but doesn't really stand out from the noise.   First off we will start with the beer. I had a flight, which come with 5 beers. I had the Dr. Doctor, the Skee-Ball champ, Electric Lederhosen, the Hopheaded strangler, and the barrel aged shadow tower. They were all pretty good. And in most markets it would have been a good lineup, but in Austin, it was nothing more than average, and they didn't really have anything that helped differentiate them from the competition.   The food falls victim of much the same problem. I had the Beer-Belly burger with German Potato Mashers. It was good. Nothing really to complain about it, but there was nothing that made it pop. It was a hearty heavy dish and delivered what it promised too.   The service was fantastic. Everyone was nice and polite, and I really had no issues with it whatsoever.   The atmosphere was so-so. The place was clean, well spaced and decorated, but the inside is essentially a large hall with a bunch of individual tables which gave the place something like a cafeteria vibe, which is the exact opposite I want in a beer garden.

reviews.author: Sunita S.
reviews.description: I almost don't want to review the brewtorium because I don't want a ton of people to discover this amazing place. The brewtorium has a wonderful patio/beer garden that has a lot of space even during a time when all bars with an outdoor patio are over crowded with people. We usually always go here for the beer and soft pretzels which are amazing, but I tried the Joe vs the avocado bowl today and it was incredible.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: Spacious and super cool eatery and brew house in an industrial area of Austin. Cool Spanish music playing and really interesting bar with knowledgeable staff on alcohol. We had a burger with pork belly on it that was delicious...pork belly could have been a little crispier and burger a little less cooked, but that's just a personal preference. Flavor was spot on! Hummus was fantastic, and curried tomato bisque was AMAZING. Salad was okay too, but I don't think that's their selling point. Overall, great Austin eatery.

reviews.author: Javier E.
reviews.description: [Pro's]  It is a very spacious area, plenty of tables and seats. The restaurant seems very clean, it feels great for dining alone, drinking alone, with friends or family. The staff are very friendly. The food options are very interesting.   [Con's]  It can be quite pricey for the amount of food you receive. If you do not like pickled/fermented dishes or German-inspired foods, I recommend you skip out on this one.

reviews.author: Brianna E.
reviews.description: This place is great! All of the food is amazing and average price. The beers are great and change seasonally. I really love some of the summer beers here with tropical hints. Service is also good every time. Plenty of space. I highly Reccomend the pretzel and beer flights.

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: We stopped by after picking up shirts from Kong. They offer a good selection of beers and snacks. We had the nachos, which I highly recommend. The space is large and good for groups. The also have an outdoor patio. Overall we enjoyed our visit and I'd definitely go back.

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: If you go for the food, this place might disappoint. The sandwich and burger I have had were decent but severely overpriced. I enjoy a lot of the IPAs here and that's why I continue to go back. It's a great place to take a dog and visiting friends. I love the guy who works in the outdoor section -- he's a hoot.

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: Great place to grab a beer and some snackity snacks. The indoor space is large with plenty of seating and there's also a patio in the back.   Food and drinks are ordered at the bar.   The menu is German inspired with items such as delicious and fluffy pretzels to flammkuchen (flatbread). The vegetarian flammkuchen is really tasty with the cashew pesto. I usually order the Stay Golden beet salad, which has quinoa and yummy toppings. I pay a little extra for chicken on top.  The beers are consistently good and the tap list is a good mix of styles. Chris, the owner/brewer (also former homebrewer), has always been great at German beers and he continues to do so on a larger scale.   If you're a non-beer drinker, there are wines and ciders available as well.

reviews.author: Kip S.
reviews.description: I had a couple of Dad Jokes and shared the pretzel and currywurst.   A Mexican lager, the beer was cold, crisp and refreshing. Hard to beat that. I feel like the lime wedge could've been more substantial, but that's pert near splitting hairs.   Buttery, chewy inside, baked to a golden brown and kissed with salt, the pretzel would please even the most cantankerous German tastebuds.   The currywurst consists of sliced bratwurst slathered with tangy housemade curry ketchup served over German potato mashers. It seemed ambitious and I was skeptical, but it turned out to be great.  And of course the patio is dog friendly.

reviews.author: Chi V.
reviews.description: I've come here a fair few times with friends after bouldering next door. Just to be clear, I'm not into drinking, so I can't say what the quality or character of the alcoholic drinks are like with confidence.  The atmosphere is consistently warm and welcoming, with cool, helpful staff and actually great food. The mac and cheese is amazing (which is notable because I normally don't go for that dish), and the pizza, specifically the Pearsciutto, is scrumptious. The wait times can get a little hefty if you come during peak meal hours, and food tends to run out on Friday evenings, but otherwise, it's a great spot to chill at with friends in the area. Expect to see leashed dogs and tired but happy boulderers enjoying a cold glass of beer and hot food with their friends after a solid session. Overall, one of my favorite places to be after bouldering.

reviews.author: Maritza M.
reviews.description: We got takeout from here during the pandemic, then went in person with an out of town guest recently. We're essentially vegetarian, so we tried several of those options: the pretzel, the mac and cheese, the corn cup, and the pizza that comes with tomatoes and balsamic vinegar on it. All four of those menu items are delicious - so much so that when we returned, we ordered the exact same set of food. Great takeout, great in person.   Beer selection varies quite a bit, which is nice because there's something for everyone. We've tried a few different IPAs and wheats, and they were all nice.   The outdoor seating was really nice, well spaced, and it was easy to get food and drinks. They have a setup where you can order from your phone, which helps with social distancing and makes it super simple to pay separately. There is a lot of seating in general, which was cool. I would definitely come back here, especially with a group.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: As a very German person, this place rocks. The Euro style beers are spot on. The wurst and the kraut are amazing. Excellent German experience, and it's a brewpub too. Prices are higher, but it's a brewpub not a Denny's. I like it.

reviews.author: Ray R.
reviews.description: Giving 4 for serving my beer in a plastic cup when plenty of glassware was available. The beers we tried were excellent. Weekend at Ernie's super rich and smooth. Fancy Rocketship great hops with big malt backbone. Did not try food, so that us not a factor in this review.

name: The Beer Plant
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Natalie N.
reviews.description: ~ * VERDICT * ~ so good i still think about it till this day  ~ * PARKING * ~ shared lot with other businesses  ~ * SERVICE * ~ quick and friendly  ~ * ORDERED * ~ - mimosa: can never go wrong  - chicken sandwich with potatoes: YUM, that is all  ~ * OVERALL * ~ SO good and worth it  ~ * OTHER * ~ i'm not from here but definitely coming back when i'm in town

reviews.author: TJ R.
reviews.description: Wow. What a meal.   The menu is very short and I like that: it means they can focus on making those few items excellent. And they so are. All vegetarian as far as I can tell too. The drink menu also looks top-notch.   Parking is tightly packed and not much of it. Tarrytown is a neat area. Outdoor seating had some fun flames to keep people warm. We sat inside and had a reservation.   We ordered the Brussels Sprouts, the Buffalo Cauli, crabcakes and The Burger. Wow. I'm not sure I've tasted appetizers so well prepared. I wouldn't change a thing. All of it was so very delicious and filling. Its like magic: just the right amount of everything. This is how food at restaurants should be.  To drink we has the Hot Toddy and The Mule. Both perfectly flavorful and gorgeous. Food and drinks and tip for two was about a hundred bucks. Worth every penny and I'm going back for sure.

reviews.author: Donna S.
reviews.description: I can't BELIEVE I haven't reviewed this place yet!?  We used to live nearby, when they opened. We have eaten here SEVERAL times. We always get the Brussel sprouts and, usually, the wings too. Both are GREAT!  HONESTLY, I've tried every dish. I like them all. If you like heat, the Nashville is the way to go. If you're needing some comfort food, that have GRAVY! Tonight I had the eggplant parm. Didn't disappoint.   And their drinks are ALWAYS creative and SO flavorful!   Whenever we're nearby at mealtime and they're open, it's a no-brainer.

reviews.author: Sarah G.
reviews.description: This was my first time at the beer plant and probably my last. The food took over an hour and a half to come out once we ordered! The Sriracha Brussels sprouts were tasty and spicy, but a little soggy and I like my sprouts a little crispy. So we took them home and popped them in the air fryer  the fries were delicious I enjoyed the spices on them, but I could not get over how tasteless the burger was (I know it's not real meat) but it's just not for me - I just think it needs more flavor/spice etc. All in all great vibe at the restaurant and would recommend to anyone who is vegan/vegetarian or wanting a healthy dining option.

reviews.author: Megan M.
reviews.description: My mouth is happy. Spicy and burning but happy. Good Nashville hot sandwich. And the Buffalo cauliflower sauce is one of the best I've had. Got the night at the opera to drink. Yum

reviews.author: Casey H.
reviews.description: I really wanted to love this place but it's just so expensive for what you get. Went there for brunch and ordered the oyster mushrooms and grits, fruit plate and a side of toast. The grits were great, but included a tiny bit of mushrooms and at $17, just absurdly overpriced. The single, thin piece of toast was $4 and the fruit plate consisted of a small handful of blueberries and a couple of melon chunks. The food is good, but way overpriced and of poor value. Maybe dinner is better - I want to come back and try it. On the plus side, the food and coffee were tasty, and service was friendly and very good.

reviews.author: S T.
reviews.description: The  beer plant curry . Is a  bit  spicy .  Pro: Beautifully presented , edible  Con :  The flavor was off .   Overall I give the dish a 4/10 . It was edible ,but I don't want to mutter through eating  my food especially  if it's a hearty  dish , I want to enjoy my  meal .   The country fried chicken -   Pro : the mash potatoes  were decent    , the "skin " of the chicken was ok Con :  The fried chicken was  two gelatinous bricks ,    Overall: 3/10    The pictures  shown is of  all the food I left behind , so now I'll still have to find something else to eat. All  of the food was room temperature and very mild flavored.  After I expressed I didn't care for the dishes I was ignored, I had to flag down someone  to pay.

reviews.author: Philip M.
reviews.description: OMG! This food absolutely delicious! The service is friendly and the ambiance is "grown n sexy".. The only thing is that straws aren't in a wrapper and are brought to you in their hands. I asked to grab our own straws and was allowed to but overall,  it was a great visit.  We visited them twice in one week.

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: Read a bunch of restaurant reviews on Yelp before deciding on this place. There are so many great eats in Austin and this one is definitely worth writing about.   I went in on a Sunday evening around 8:45pm. There was hardly anyone inside so I decided to eat at the bar. The bartender (Laura Lee!) helped me dwindle down my options. I had read about the tomato and nectarine salad, but was worried that it would have a mustard flavor in it. She assured me that there wasn't and admitted that she, too, wasn't a mustard fan. SO glad I ordered it! It was such a perfect balance of flavors and I finished the entire thing.   Next up - should I get the eggplant parm or the "crab" cakes. She thought about it and says "go with the crab cakes." Holy moly!!  These were INCREDIBLE! So flavorful and the sauce that came with it - just perfection! Highly recommend!!  Check this place out if you want something a little away from 6th street. It's just a few minutes away and so, so worth it. :)

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: Third visit to this upscale plant-based restaurant and were not let down. Recommend making a reservation especially if you want indoor seating. We enjoy the dimmed ambience, but sometimes large parties do make it loud inside. Our favorite starter: the Buffalo cauliflower with blue cheese. Favorite entree: the spicy "chicken" sandwich with oyster mushroom (nice that it isn't cauliflower). Not a huge fan of their Mac and cheese or loaded fries. On our most recent trip, we tried The 'burger' which was delicious especially if you like arugula. They serve upscale cocktails, beer, and wine. Pricing is pretty fair: $6-$12 for a drink and $13-$20 for an entree. Huge bonus: parking has never been an issue!!!

reviews.author: Day R.
reviews.description: Used to be one of my favorite go to places especially for special occasions. Unfortunately, the quality of food has declined. Something is off with the hot crispy sandwich, maybe they changed the mushroom, but it not as delicious as it once was. many of the items I used to enjoy are also no longer on the menu. Service was good but the quality of the food, and limited options, no longer matches the vibe, or price.

reviews.author: Allison C.
reviews.description: I went on a weekend for dinner and I can definitely understand why it was packed. I ordered the burger with loaded fries and was impressed with the flavors in both. I also tried a lot of the shareable appetizers such as the Buffalo cauliflower wings and those are also worth a try. The cocktails are also very creative. I loved the Nightwing (pictured below) which visually is very cool due to the activated charcoal.

reviews.author: Katie G.
reviews.description: I had been here once before, right when they opened, and was less than impressed. However, I'm so glad we gave them another chance!!! Portions are very generous and we were happily stuffed. The cauliflower and Brussels sprouts appetizers are amazing. We split the kimchi grilled cheese and I crave it now! The cocktails were also great. A lot of people mention its pricy, but we really didn't think so compared to other restaurants in austin and for the portion size. We'll be back soon!

reviews.author: Sophia G.
reviews.description: I feel bad for giving this place a two star review because the customer service was absolutely amazing. But everything else here fell short. First, parking. Super narrow, one way, extremely tight. If you miss the correct turn be prepared to either U turn out or drive down and hope you're not in anyone's way. Second, the wait time here is excruciating. Ordered an appetizer I'll be honest, I didn't time this part. But it was long enough of a wait to constantly wonder where's my food? There's a lot of waiting here. It was pretty insane. We decided at 5:20 we were done eating. We didn't see anyone to ask for our bill until 5:51 (I checked this time). When I finally got someone for some reason they looked confused when I called??? I went inside to pay I did not want to wait a moment longer in the cold. Even to pay I had to wait. Like I really can't catch a break in this place. Third, food was very disappointing. The Mac and cheese was good. But my entrees were subpar. I have very high expectations for vegan food in Austin. I usually get the best vegan meals here. But this place fell flat. Like 1/5 for sure. For $50 I expect way more in the flavor department. Also, the items on the menu on Yelp are different from items I saw here. Double check the menu before coming. I think they rotate through their menus. So I was also upset by my options. I didn't like the options I saw and assumed I picked the safest option The Burger. Hard to mess up, so I thought. They were out of pretzel buns so I was given sourdough bread. That is the toughest bread I've ever had. So that didn't work for me either. Mango ice tea was bad too. Just tasted like water. We also had the Kimchi grilled cheese which was just okay. Fourth, I'm not upset I was seated outside. I was freezing out there. Even with the outdoor heaters were on. I am upset that I could not make reservations online. I attempted to days before coming in but the website told me I could not make reservations for 2 people??? Bizarre. With such a rule one would hope they'd have plenty of seating. They did not. My options were either outside or at the bar. Don't like bar seating so we picked outside. Super chilly windy day so I was uncomfortable. With super tiny tables. We barely had room for all of our plates. Every time another item came we had to rearrange everything just to make the item fit. My server was very nice though. Just wish I saw him more often.

reviews.author: Michelle B.
reviews.description: Great plant based food in the heart of Austin. Versatility and creativity in the menu with an array of beverages, including zero Proof and cocktails.  Would highly recommend and when back in town will definitely return.

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: The food was average. The seasoning and flavor was good but I was expecting more based on the reviews. Service was pretty slow. Atmosphere is nice inside.

reviews.author: Tracey Z.
reviews.description: A really fun concept. I love that everything here is vegan so I don't have to worry!   Starting off with the Sriracha Brussels - very tasty. I wish there was more glaze on it though and that it packed more spice. It's pretty mild but the sprouts were still quite tasty. The Carolina was a very interesting sandwich. I was expecting them to use jackfruit in a pulled pork sandwich but they used banana blossom instead. The flavor was there especially with the bbq sauce but the texture was definitely weird.  My favorite from this place is the kimchi grilled cheese! Being no dairy I have not had a grilled cheese in AGES and it was definitely something I really craved. This grilled cheese hit the spot. I love that they added kimchi and pear to give it more depth. The kimchi was pretty overpowering though. But overall the sandwich was so delicious.  Great food, slightly pricey.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: This place is pretty good for all vegan options. The food was flavorful and the service was good. We ordered the Nashville hot chicken sandwich and the hill country chicken and gravy. There was a lot of breading on both "chicken" dishes which was a bit much but the flavor was pretty good overall. The mac n cheese was a little bland, but that was the first vegan Mac n cheese I've had. We ordered the loaded fries as an app. Those were my favorite of everything we ordered. This is a pretty loud restaurant, but isn't always a bad thing if you get seated next to the right guests! Overall, I recommend at least trying this place out! There's an extensive drink menu, so it would probably be good for happy hour!

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: This place is seriously awesome. Like for real, the burger is somehow better than a regular burger. And the buffalo cauliflower (which seems like it's everywhere now) is the best I've had. Not to mention the beer selection and full bar at a vegan restaurant.  I'm actually considering going vegetarian now (I admit I am not)

reviews.author: Swati G.
reviews.description: This may be my favorite vegan restaurant in Austin. The cocktails and food are great, moderately priced, and the ambiance is just intimate enough to enjoy your meal with your group without feeling too pretentious. Even if you don't have any dietary restrictions, I'd recommend trying this place out and enjoying an evening in this quiet neighborhood. No reservations required either

name: Abel's On the Lake
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Hermes P.
reviews.description: I came into use the restroom since Mozart's next door was beyond capacity. I was told customers only. That's fair. I asked if I could just pay for something so I can use the restroom. I was told the cheapest thing was an $18 shirt. Upon checking the menu online, I can see that that was a lie. I would have gladly paid for $12 nachos to eat but nope..the cheapest thing was the shirt. Gotta keep people from not using the bathroom.  I can understand the policy. But lying and turning away a transaction to hold a principle? It deserves a Yelp review.

reviews.author: Nikiba J.
reviews.description: I would really like to give Abel's their 5 stars which they probably deserve but the Restaurant sits at the bottom of a hill. This is not ok when you're bringing in a bus loaded with passengers. Shell passengers at that (Shell has a zero tolerance for unsafe practices). Cars on every side of the street so a bus would have to unload in the street. Luckily for me this time Heaven was on our side by allowing us to get our buses up from the hill. Going down the driveway was just as challenge because we had to turn just right to make the turn to drop the passengers off at the door.  The OS came when we had to turn the buses just right to get out the drive and up the hill onto the street. What makes this even more dangerous are the pedestrians walking in front of the bus, to the side of the bus and in the back of the bus.  It takes a skilled driver (like myself) to be able to get out of the mess I was in. This was the perfect time of all the times I should told my clients dropping them at the door was unsafe. But there I went.  If I didn't position the bus just right getting up that hill a tow truck would have to be called to unstick me. That's what we call bottoming out the bus, when the axil is stuck on concrete enabling the bus to move.  Now my coworker trusted me and followed me right down that forsaken hill and tried to get up the hill as I did.  Now mind you, if we get the buses stuck it will take a tow truck at least 2 hrs to be dispatched and out to our location. It's cost $$$ for a bus pull out, the restaurant is located in a neighborhood so they would have to use an alternate to their homes, patrons inconvenienced, our passengers stomachs full they ready to go to get to their hotel. Shell most definitely will report us for an unsafe practice and we would have to answer for that unsafe practice....just a mess. Anyways, I got my bus out and the other bus as well. There was no bus parking not enough curb parking so we were unable to dine at the restaurant. I forgot about that so I change my rating to 1 star. J/k

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: Great spot for a local craft beer by the water.  Not too many vegetarian items on the menu, but they are willing to adjust on request. The items I enjoy are very tasty.  This spot is extremely puppy friendly, so enjoy your doggie date! The Christmas light show is also amazing!

reviews.author: Stacy B.
reviews.description: The food definitely exceeded our expectations, and "Rob" our server was beyond amazing. We look forward to visiting again.

reviews.author: Andrew R.
reviews.description: The location is so fantastic that it's tragic the low quality of food served here. The prices are low, but you get what you pay for. My wife got sick from spoiled coleslaw in her shrimp tacos, my burger was bad but maybe it's just me with the burger bun was like some kind of home made wonderbread bun where my finger goes through the bread ruining the burger with such thin bread. The steak sandwich my son had was covered in processed cheese. processed cheese says it all. I might go back and order the club sandwich my other son had which looked as good as the classic plate gets. I'd love to see a new cook and menu take over this idillic location.

reviews.author: Aleric H.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing Experience! Great Food, Great Views and Rob my waiter has been fantastic the couple of times I've come so far!  I have to say that I almost didn't go because of the reviews here, but my experience was totally different. And it was absolutely a 5 star experience.  Overall the Views are objectively great right off the water, the food has been very good both times - I had a really good Salmon dish most recently. But more importantly the waiter Rob has been incredibly kind and attentive - even offering Iced Tea "to go" both times.  I'd recommend you judge Abels for yourself and come to the restaurant -- I actually asked them about previous reviews and they did say they've been really shifting all of their service to be the best and that's what I've seen first hand.  I can't speak to how they were in the past, but today the experience is 5 stars!

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Each time I come here I'm more and more disappointed. I used to come here frequently when I was new to Austin but I think my standards were lower and theirs were higher. First of all, it's a pain to get parking around here. Once you're parked, you're better off going to one of the neighboring establishments. The food is so mediocre and overpriced, and I've nearly tried it all. It's not bad, but I'd say it's on par with many chain "bar and grill" type of restaurants. The view of the lake is the only asset that draws crowds.

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: My son held his wedding here !  The staff was extremely nice and polite! The food they catered was delicious! The views are great ! It's was extremely cold this weekend but I will be back when it warms up!

reviews.author: Kim B.
reviews.description: I came here for my graduation dinner (NOT on graduation weekend - so it wasn't that busy) and it was honestly one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. It was embarrassing for me because I picked the place. Thank God that my friends and I are pretty chill people, so we just rolled with it.  However the service was abysmal, the Mexican Martini was not drinkable, bathrooms were filthy and there was not a manager in sight the whole night. Well, at least not until we left and saw them all chatting on an unoccupied patio to the side of the restaurant. I guess it was socialization time while their servers are outside floundering. The girl who served us was seemingly taking care of the whole patio (although failing) and said it was her first week. Wild.   Two people from my party didn't get their meals until everyone else finished. We had to basically beg for our drinks. And the food was honestly 2 stars at best...  Only good thing about this place was the ambiance

reviews.author: D S.
reviews.description: I would give this 20 if I could. Visiting from San Diego, we found Abel's on an idyllic Sunday afternoon.  Although there was a wait for a table, Johnny, the BEST bartender/server EVER, found a couple of barstools and made room for us at the bar.  Johnny makes a GREAT host, and GREAT Bloody Mary!  World class. Perfect blend of spices with other ingredients.  I had the Texas burger (YUM) and my husband had Abel's Tex-Mex twist on a Philly steak sandwich. "Absolutely delicious!" The open air bar on the lake is a beautiful setting, the weather was perfect, multiple football games on big screens, and a great vibe.   Fabulous food, and not at all expensive.  But Johnny made our experience superb.

reviews.author: MIchael P.
reviews.description: I've been coming to Abel's for years but hadn't been back since the start of the pandemic. I went tonight and I am so happy I did!  Abel's will be in my routine rotation from here on for dinner and drinks.   They have always had a strong kitchen for an affordable bar and grill - so much better than the place next door. Tonight, I was taken care of very well by two affable gents at the back bar, Stuart and Eric. Stuart told me I should try the blackened redfish. He shared it was a new rotating special. I was amazed how perfectly it was seasoned and cooked.  One of the best redfish dishes I have had in months. I immediately asked what I need to do to convince them to serve this on the regular menu. They said let our management know online so here it is.  I was texting friends about how good it was and that we need to come back soon. Please keep this dish on the menu - as often as possible - and give your chef a raise.    Another fun plus - Stuart and Eric know their sports. We had a fun smart conversation about all current sporting events.   Bottom line.  If you are a sports fan, go here. eat the redfish, ask for Stuart and Eric. drink, have fun and repeat. Also, brunch on Sundays for early fantasy games is another great call.   Five stars on this visit. See you soon.

reviews.author: Ben B.
reviews.description: One of my favorite spots in austin! Love sitting on the water after a day on the lake. Friends and family always enjoy the food as well.

reviews.author: Molly G.
reviews.description: Sweet waitress. She was clearly slammed. That's not the issue here. Sweet potato fries were delivered to the wrong table by someone running food. Pancakes were burnt. Both out of her control. She got them both taken off rightfully so.  The BIG ISSUE was ours and two different tables cards were wrong up wrong, mixed up, and delivered to wrong tables. Our credit card went to someone else's table and we found it ourselves. Still not mad at that sweet girl at all for the record. Our tab came out cheaper and we signed it and got out. Forgive us of our sins. What was EXTREMELY CONCERNING is the manager approached my father IN THE BATHROOM and chased him out the front door. My father explained that a transaction was made and there was a signed document, end of story. Argue that with anyone especially when we were on the street walking to our car. What does the manager do? He THREATENED to call the cops! My husband, who paid the tab suggested to the manager that we go inside and talk privately. The manager proceeded to discuss this private matter  in front of customers IN THE PARKING LOT! Legally, we did nothing wrong. Transaction was made between the establishment and our family. Signed document. Off the property. Boom. If he would have came up to us and started with excuse me, we messed up, can we fix this please- would have been the start to a better approach. Chasing my father. Threatening to call the cops. Discussing in front of customers after we left. We could have sorted it out had he not been so aggressive. I was in the service industry for 8 years, he was 1000% out of line. The scenery is pretty nice though. One star fir that.

reviews.author: Viviana R.
reviews.description: First time here... and yeah the food was not good at all. Ordered chips and queso, chips were stale and queso was clumpy. I had the chicken sandwich and it was bland. A person of color definitely did not make the chicken, because if they did it would have been seasoned. Best part of the whole thing was the Dos xx.

reviews.author: Karyn C.
reviews.description: We went for dinner with 3 kids and 3 adults. Food was good.  Came out fairly quickly. Our server was nice as well.  Beautiful view and had a nice time.  We got there early and thankfully got right in. :) wish they had crayons and coloring pages for the kids.

reviews.author: Amber R.
reviews.description: Bad customer service, I felt like I was being discriminated. Drinks are pricey and don't even taste so great!!!

reviews.author: Aubrey A.
reviews.description: Have no idea what the food is like because I didn't get to try it. Came in with a few friends and sat for about 15 to 20 minutes, after waiting I had told the hostess that we hadn't been helped yet, she then said someone would be out shortly to help us. Waited there about another 10 minutes and still no help. They were not understaffed by any means, in fact there were people standing around doing nothing which was why I was so irritated. I had read the bad reviews and decided to dismiss them and try this place for myself, wouldn't recommend.

reviews.author: Alicia R.
reviews.description: I've been to abels three times now and had Carrie as a server every time, she is extremely helpful and attentive every time! She's made very good suggestions for food and drinks and always makes sure we have everything we need! Next time you're in texas come visit Carrie at abels!

reviews.author: Jeff L.
reviews.description: Please don't come here. The managers are rude, servers are 45 year old men who think they have power and are so rude. Don't come here waiters are rude and food takes minimum 1 hour to come out.

reviews.author: C A.
reviews.description: Bad costumer service they take 20 mins after u seat just to take u order and drinks are so expensive that they still have no shame to ask for tip and if u say no I want my change back they get all with a attitude and they don't even come back to ask u what else u need and they really racist they were acting like we weren't going to pay so after they brought our 1st drinks they brought the check right away what kinda costumer service is that I'm pretty sure I'm making more money then them and they don't even know it y'all need to work in a lot of things in this place cause that's why it's empty all the time cause of y'all service have a nice day!!

reviews.author: Gene H.
reviews.description: Stopped in last weekend for a drink and some good curry, we were not disappointed.  Beer selection is good, we ordered two trios so we could get a taste of everything, it was all delicious.  Nice being able to sit outside too.  Thanks for a great meal!

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: North Street is a coffee shop, beer bar, and Indian restaurant... and it's amazing.  We went late (well late for us, it was 8pm) on a rainy Saturday night. It was medium busy, most of the indoor tables were filled up and the bar had a few other people. We sat at bar seating and were helped right away. Being so close to the university, it's a college vibe.   I ordered a chai hot chocolate, it was amazing. Something about hot chocolate on a rainy day.....  We ordered loaded samosas (Vegetable samosas topped with chana masala, curry queso, cilantro walnut chutney and cucumber mint raita) and a sampler trio. We got spicy powder on the side.   Great flavors. We left full and happy. If we lived in the area this would be a regular spot for happy hour.

reviews.author: Woodley P.
reviews.description: I walked in and made myself "home" by taking a seat at a table and waiting 15 minutes to be served on. The two servers walk by my table and didn't make eye contact, as though they had never seen someone with so much melanin before. They continued to serve other seated and even folks coming in for the first time. It was embarrassing. It's 2022 and the last thing I want to assume is that it was because of race. Frustrated, I walked to the bar and asked for a manager. The bartender (Josh) informed me it was the dark hair gal and that is when I was acknowledged. Josh was very nice and served me and took my order.  Josh saved the day, but they need to work on their customer service.   I had their taco and the fries were absolutely delicious! The food blunted my frustration. I will come back because I believe in 2nd chances...and of course the food.

reviews.author: Mitchell T.
reviews.description: We really wanted to like this place.  It has a great casual ambiance and we loved the place when we walked in.    We went on a Sunday, and it wasn't too busy.  There wasa couple with a great dane there, so it's dog friendly.  My bride ordered the samosas, and I ordered the curry trio with saag paneer, butter chicken, and chicken tikka masala.  We got north street fries as a appetizer.  So, the samosas came out nice and warm.  My wife thought the bread was overcooked, but she was hungry.  Perhaps it was old oil on a Sunday evening after a busy weekend.  The fries were warm-ish and a bit soggy.  The seasoning was very good, though, and the basket of fries was a good size for two.  The curry trio was disappointing.  The saffron rice was hard and warm-ish.  I don't know how else to describe it.  The Saag paneer was kind of tasteless.  I've eaten great saag paneer, and this ain't it.  The Chicken tikka masala was similarly underspiced.  The butter chicken as well, but I expect that from butter chicken.  I had ordered it as a counterpoint to what I had hoped would be some spicy dishes.  At this point, I'm wondering if it's us.  I've worked with Indian nationals that have taken me to some hole in the wall Indian places in Irvine, CA, and they absolutely knocked my socks off.  We go to many places in Texas that have a good yelp rating, and we get a lot of bland food.  We really like to patronize smaller places, and I hate to give poor ratings, but have to be honest.  We really liked the people and the place, so will give them a try again in the hopes the stars align for a better experience.

reviews.author: Andrew R.
reviews.description: I came here to meet a friend for drinks and a light lunch -- we both got appetizers since we were planning heavier dinners later that night -- and when it comes to the food and drinks, I was not disappointed.   I got the vegetable samosas, and the samosas were nearly perfect, with the potato and pea filling having just the right level of seasoning. They came with beautiful mango chutney whose chunks were visible and a lovely green chutney. Both were so delicious I was hard put to decide which I wanted to put on each of the three samosas.  For drinks I had two of the Wasatch Polygamy (a nitro porter), and it was fantastic. It had a hint of sweetness, but wasn't as overwhelming as a milk stout, but also the delicious flavor of a porter.  The patio dining was great, with plenty of shade.  The only reason I'm not giving five stars is that service was... slow, with respect to both drinks and food. Otherwise, the whole thing was outstanding.

reviews.author: Jeri T.
reviews.description: My mom and I were looking for a new place in San Marcos. We come here often from Kyle and tire of the places right on the interstate. The establishment is adorable - informal seating inside and out.   I first got some pappadum and a few chutneys-tamarind and mint. They were spicy! Caught me off guard but delicious for sure.    My mom ordered the Curry Trio with chicken curry, paneer tikka masala, and saag paneer. I ordered  a beef kabob curry taco. Every bite of every dish was delicious. While I loved my taco, I highly recommend the Curry Trio because you get a great choice.   When we first got there, I was like meh. Only a few tables were seated outside and the inside was empty. But right after we ordered, the place quickly filled up! Wow.   The service was superb. I couldn't have asked for a better server. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Laura R.
reviews.description: The food here is amazing and the staff is very friendly! The idea of putting a Tex-Mex twist on Indian food is brilliant.  I was very pleased with the variety on the menu and how tasty everything was. My children loved the curry queso, saag paneer, and the paratha.  My husband and I enjoyed our paneer tikka masala tacos (I had chicken).  The Mango lassi was different as it is icy and minty, but we really enjoyed it, and so did my children.  I can't wait to go back! One thing that was also really surprising is that the coffee was super good! Please remember this is a fusion restaurant, so it is not your typical Indian. I noticed a lot of lesser star reviews complained about it not being Indian food. Yet, it is Indian Tacos. It is a fun twist and something different. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Maribel D.
reviews.description: Visiting San Marcos and North street popped up on my Yelp top restaurants.  Restaurant is in a renovated older house with super cute outdoor patio seating. We sat inside it's smaller but very cozy. They have a bar with many draft beers, wine and specialty drinks.  We started with the vegetable samosas and it came with side of mint sauce and mango chutney that was so tasty. Both complimented the samosas in a wonderful way. The flavors were amazing.  I ordered the tiki masala taco that was filled with so much flavor and very filling.       A must try!! And hubby had the trio which he choose tiki masala, curry chicken and butter chicken along with coconut rice. All three were fantastic.  Service was good and food was fantastic and very reasonably priced.  I'm excited to come back and try something new on the menu and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND North Street!! #supportsmallbusiness

reviews.author: Deepa S.
reviews.description: Nice patio, cool vibe .. we ordered below food- Chicken tikka - 2/5 Panner butter masala 4/5 Saag panner 2/5 extremely bland no flavor  Samosa 4/5 came with good chutneys

reviews.author: Irma D.
reviews.description: Ok. Here comes another Indian restaurant review. But wait! Its TexMex Indian!  Went to lunch with coworkers on the first day of fall, so we got a table outdoors, never stepped foot inside. Service was slow, but it seemed it was only one waiter, so no points taken away for that.  Server was detailed in explaining what everything was and the level of spice and comfort. We had one vegan and one spice sensitive guest in our group, so he pointed out what would be best for the group to order. I ordered chicken nachos, and paneer tacos, wanting spice and meat. Other guests ordered samosas with mango chutney, vegan nachos, and spinach paneer. It was filling enough with a beautiful presentation! The jalapeno cream mixed with tamarind on the tacos mixed perfectly with the Indian spices.  The curry on the shredded chicken and tortilla chips (couldn't tell if they were made in house or store bought) had me trying not to lock the bowl. Will definitely go back to try more items on the menu!

reviews.author: Emily P.
reviews.description: I'm not sure if the "authenticity" of the food at North Street, but what I can say is WOW it's delicious, regardless.   The building is absolutely adorable and beautifully decorated. Bathrooms are always spotless and the women's bathroom kindly offers hair ties, feminine products and occasionally mints. (It's the little things!!)  They only offer beer or wine cocktails but even the wine cocktails feel and taste pretty craft cocktail-y. The ginger lime spritz is my fave!  Being a self proclaimed queso connoisseur, I was hesitant on curry queso. Why fix what ain't broke? I was wrongly hesitant, North streets curry queso is liquid gold and oh so delicious.   I don't think there's a single bad thing on their menu.  The Katz brothers truly do no wrong

reviews.author: Josh Y.
reviews.description: Hilariously good Tex/Indian fusion. The chicken Tika and curry tacos are out of this world. The queso is ok. But seriously, if you're not already in San Marcos, come here. And eat this. It's that good. If you think you're a foodie and haven't tried this, fix that. So incredibly good. And for $9 per taco that's basically a meal and a party in your mouth, it doesn't exactly set you back much. They have a great beer selection too and cool ambiance and attentive service. But the tacos are the draw. Come here. Eat the Indian style tacos. 5 stars.

reviews.author: Abby Abby M.
reviews.description: Great food, friendly and casual ambiance. Loved my curry queso and nachos! Yum! Guillermo was super friendly and helpful with our experience.

reviews.author: Akhilesh B.
reviews.description: Hidden Gem! I have never had so much authentic flavors of North Indian food in the whole of US until I tried this small Indian place close to Texas State University. The food is great, the staff very friendly and the ambiance makes you feel you are in India!

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: If you want Indian food, this isn't the place. And if you want to know anything about the menu, I hope you get a different waitress than we had. Nothing was spicy, everything tasted the same and our order got messed up. Would not recommend unless they changed their food and staff.

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: I got a to go order here. The place was super cute with a nice ambiance. The food was amazing! I'll be back to dine in!

reviews.author: Rebecca P.
reviews.description: Unique spot with a mix of great options of drafts and curries!  We enjoy having different types of beers and this place has a good unique assortment of drafts to try.  I was able to get some lavender cider since it was pretty early in the day, but the porter and stout options were very tempting (some at over 12% alcohol).  The dogs were with us so we settled outside in their spacious yard that has a lot of shade and a fan blowing.  We ordered curry fries as an appetizer and they were wedged exactly like chic fil a fries seasoned in a curry mix powder.  These were good, but can do with a pinch of sugar and lots of extra spice.  I had the chicken Tikka masala plate and my husband got the chicken 65 taco.  The taco looked more like a wrap and wasn't as filling as what he expected, but tasted pretty good.  Fried chicken seasoned in sauce inside the taco had a good kick to it.  My chicken Tikka masala plate was delicious, but a little extra spice would help.  Also, I think the restaurant can do better by adding naan! Great concept to check out!

reviews.author: Rachel M.
reviews.description: This is my absolute favorite spot in San Marcos for dinner! I take all my friends here when I get the chance. It's a must any time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Justin B.
reviews.description: Have gone twice. Service was good both times and the food is fantastic. I enjoyed and would recommend the curry trio; it allows you to try a little bit of multiple items to decide which is your favorite. Good vegetarian options as well.  Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Adrienne E.
reviews.description: A Gem. Concept is to sit outside under the big pecan tree, eat great Indian food, watch the dogs play in the "dog park"  seating area, drink lassis or craft beer, enjoy great service and listen to their fun music selection. So relaxing and satisfying.

reviews.author: Avery S.
reviews.description: The food was great!! Had great customer service from our waiter Chris! Very nice place to come and visit!

reviews.author: Karine S.
reviews.description: Great pizza and wonderful choice of local beer... Shout out to Chris who helped me decide, after few samples ,lol, what beer I wanted . Loved #23.... reminded me of home, Milwaukee and the place I go to, Vennture... for great beer.. Thank you Chris for your hospitality and knowledge.

reviews.author: Bruno S.
reviews.description: We had a work meet and greet here for lunch , so unfortunately I wasn't able to taste their craft beer but it looked so good I felt like I was drooling on the inside.   Really nice place with both indoor and outdoor seating. Bench style seating.   I was able to order everything from my phone after scanning the QR code.   I ordered a chicken bacon ranch which is what I normally get when eating California style pizza. It was very good. Although, everyone else ordered the South Austin and it looked really good, they all loved it, but The salad on a pizza just ain't for me.   I am not from Austin so I don't know what to compare to, but I will definitely be back to try another pizza and definitely the Hazy IPA.   They also have dessert pizza which I brought home and it didn't last 20 minutes.

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: This was not where I planned on going on the night I visited, but it was still an enjoyable experience. The beer selection is pretty good and the pizza was yummy (but not blow-your-mind level yummy). I will say my boyfriend's pizza, The Flying Garlic, was amazing and so flavorful  The service was the best part for sure; I felt comfortable and taken care of during my meal. I'll probably try to visit their Parmer Ln location in the future!

reviews.author: Sean Matthew L.
reviews.description: Aviator Pizza was solid, not amazing, but okay. We grabbed togo and picked it up on our way home from the gym so we could just collapse and eat some pizza. We got one white pie with arugula on top. It tasted like the greens weren't washed, and they were all wilted and slimy by the time the pizza got home 10 minutes later.   The other pizza was better with a variety of meats and veg on top. But overall the dough felt a little undercooked on both and generally was a bit chewy.   I'd be willing to try this spot again and likely sit down to eat it in person and hope that it's better right out of the oven, maybe it just doesn't travel well? But pizza is a notoriously delivered food item, so I would hope that's not the case.   All in all, i'm not that impressed but willing to give them another go.

reviews.author: Mark J.
reviews.description: I thought I would give Aviator a try while in Austin for the weekend since I found good reviews and it was close to my airbnb. I am sad to say I was not impressed. We ordered the Caesar salad which was good. We also ordered a Hawaiian and Ground Control pizza. They were very disappointing. I have to assume that the cheese used on the pizzas is a blend and not just mozzarella since it had a funk to it. I assume provolone. The crust and sauce were not bad but there was way too much sauce. This will also sound like a strange thing to complain about but there were too many toppings. Something can be said about minimal toppings. I don't really care for a pile of toppings on my pizza that are so thick. Overall, I was disappointed in the pizzas given all the good reviews.

reviews.author: Holmes O.
reviews.description: Born and Raised in Austin and I can say this is the best best place in town. Not only was the Pizza amazing, but you don't get the heavy, groggy feeling after eating. Derek provided an amazing customer experience and I can't wait to be back!

reviews.author: May C.
reviews.description: Shout out to Chris! Great customer service and very knowledgable in beer and wine taste! Love this place!

reviews.author: Luna J.
reviews.description: The dough need a little more salt but overall there are good pizzas!!!  A little to bright inside. They should dimmer the lights a little.   Great for take out!

reviews.author: Laura W.
reviews.description: Like the pizza here, it is one of my go to pizza places in town. The cheese bread should be illegal and the flying garlic pizza is dreamy. The quality has been consistnet and then it wasn't. This last visit, they came up a little short of the runway.  The dough was not cooked all the way and one of the  9 inch pizzas was 7 inches.  Emailed them about the short order about a week ago and have not heard back. I am disappointed and it just makes me wonder about quality control in general.  How could they not notice the pizza was almost 2 inches smaller than ordered or do they just not care? The lack of response indicates the later.

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Love Aviator pizza! It's a really chill place to grab a drink and meal with family or friends. Service is always really good. The buffalo pizza is my go to. I also love the cinnamon pecan dessert! They have a wide selection of local beers and are constantly rotating them. 10/10 recommend!

reviews.author: Dan M.
reviews.description: So ... views of photos over past 90 days at record high: 197k, but views of reviews down to 10.5k from 32k over past 90 days. I think this means I should write about pimps and gangsters in purple Cadillacs.   No ... there were no purple Cadillacs here. Sorry! And I was the only one there. But I got me a pizza and a salad (no beer). Then went next door and dropped $300 in a cash game at Shuffle 512 because a Facebook friend/fan sat right next to me and we were having fun and gambling.   If I had gone in to Shuffle 512 first, I might have won. Therefore, theoretically, this was a $300 pizza and salad. I'd leave a woah emoji, but not sure if it will show up on Yelp. I mean, the emoji comes up but I have tried it before and it was just a weird space. And I don't want you to associate me with pimps, gangsters, and weird spaces (purple Cadillac okay).   As far as the pizza goes, traditional bar pizza. Good not great. Salad pretty solid. Atmosphere very good but I was there early so not 100% sure.   Overall, recommended as a feeler to see if it's for you.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place! Variety of pizza choices. All are delicious! Plus beer  Service is friendly. Great date night.

reviews.author: Lyndsey D.
reviews.description: Whenever I'm craving pizza and beer, this is my place. It's laid back, very friendly service, and the beer selection has something for everyone. And of course the pizza is delightful! Last time we went, we got something with arugula on top and my fiancé didn't love the amount (how often does one complain of too much of something?!?) but I loved the flavor combo, plus I felt like I got my greens in. Speaking of which, the salads are great, too!

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: First time here recently; we had planned on 'waiting' here while our daughter got a haircut next door but it turned out we were hungry so we ordered ceasar salads and a large meaty pizza.  I ordered Dem Berries beer and my honey ordered a mic ultra.  The pizza was a-m-a-z-i-n-g!!!!! The bread was out of this world.  The toppings were fresh and had delicious flavors.  The staff were nice however we asked for her to change the TV to the TX/OU game but she kept forgetting.  We asked her again and finally tried to locate it however the cable they had didn't allow the game so we had to watch it on our phone.  We wished they offered nicer plates and flatware; they gave us paper plates and plastic forks but we aren't fancy people so it was all good.  The place was super clean and relaxing.  I would definitely recommend this venue.

reviews.author: Mary M.
reviews.description: I am not a thin crust person. I'm just not. Aviator's pizza crust is the perfect thickness to me, where you can enjoy the bread as well as the toppings. Their garlic pizza is one of my favorites, but the cheese burger and south Austin are also solid choice.   We always have to get their mozzarella bread because the cheese/garlic/butter/crust combination makes it one of the best things on the menu.   They have a huge rotating beer selection and plenty of seating if you're wanting to eat there. I've taken pizza to go a few times too and it transports well.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: I mean their pizza is amazing!! Chicken bacon ranch! The el nacho Mexican pizza too omg my favorite. Everyone at our table kept wanting a piece of it. It was that good!  We also got the South Austin, the one with prosciutto and arugula which was good but next to the chicken bacon ranch and the El Nacho... it's was just good not GREAT

reviews.author: Sergio V.
reviews.description: Saw $3pints 7-9PM Tuesdays, on their online menu.. the bartender said that wasn't a thing. When I asked available deals, he also said happy hour ends at 6, when the menu also said 7-9PM. I ordered a 12in/ 3 topping and 2 beers, $30. I saw the tip auto generated to $12, so I lowered it due to false information and frustration w the employees. Today my Aviator transaction is $50 for a 12in and 2beers Definitely felt ripped off.

reviews.author: William W.
reviews.description: Ate here with my sister and nephew. First off the pizza is great and love the beer selection BUT after ordering I used the restroom and there was a crew member that used the restroom at the same time and didn't wash their hands. I brought this up in comments about how they were doing when I had my receipt emailed. It seems whoever answered back did a half ass apology by saying maybe they were washing their hands in a different sink or were intending to wear gloves. I'm sorry but I don't wanna eat at somewhere where a higher up thinks it's appropriate for a worker to use the restroom not wash their hands put on gloves and touch my food.

reviews.author: Eric E.
reviews.description: We just arrived in town on Sunday night and needed dinner. We called and ordered a specialty pizza for pickup. It was ready super fast. The price was reasonable. The staff definitely appeared to be on top of COVID precautions.   The pizza was so so. The crust didn't impress. Sort of like a grocery store premade crust from a bag. The toppings were just kinda blah. The pizza didn't feel incredibly hot for being just out of the oven.   There was nothing wrong. It just wasn't all that. Maybe it was an off day.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Hahne Estates Winery Tasting Room is located in downtown Johnson City next to the Pecan Street Brewery.  The tasting room has been open for about four months, but owner and winemaker, Gary Hahne, has been making wine for a lifetime.  Gary is a Texas Hill Country Native and his family roots date back to his great grandparents who immigrated to the Stonewall area from Germany.  His parents were close friends to LBJ and Lady Bird. The Hahne surname in German translates to the English word rooster, which ties to the colorful rooster found on the winery's logo.  There is no tasting fee to sample the four dry wines, and one sweet Sangria style wine on the tasting menu.  Each bottle of wine tells a different story of the Hahne family and the surrounding hill country.  As you sip and savor the flavor of the well balanced, delicious, palatable wines. You can walk around the winery and enjoy the historic pictures of the Hahne family, and hear about the family and area history.  I had the great pleasure of being able to talk with Gary himself about his amazing family heritage.  I enjoyed all of the five wines.  My favorite was a bold; well balanced, red blend (Tempranillo, Cab Sauv, and Nero D'Avola) entitled Texas Tapestry.  I also loved the Texas styled Chianti appropriately named Texanti.  This was a softer red, fruit forward, but well balanced with lingering notes.  I also very much enjoyed the dry rose that is named after Gary's grandfather, Opa.  The Viognier blend was also surprisingly good, with interesting peach like notes.   My visit here was delightful, and I hope to return soon.  Gary is passionate about making quality wine to enjoy with us, and to pass down his story to be remembered for years to come.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: This winery is either completely closed or moved. Another business is here now. This makes second winery today I found on Yelp that was closed down.

reviews.author: Carolyn S.
reviews.description: This was my very first winery to attend. I did not have a clue what to expect but whatever it was Mr. Hahne exceeded all my expectations. Mr. Hahne seemed a little rough around the edges until he started spilling out all the beautiful memories him and his family made through the years. We talked about cars, churches, presidents and of course, wine. I couldn't have been anymore impressed with the knowledge he has acquired. Mr. Hahne's winery was clean, filled with old music and had the perfect ambience of the Hill Country. Thank you so much for making my first experience one to remember!

reviews.author: Bre V.
reviews.description: Such a nice wine tasting experience. Owner and winemaker is fantastic. So much history in this winery. If you're in the area please stop by and support this local family owned winery. Cant wait to come back

reviews.author: Jill L.
reviews.description: Saddest little winery. Wines are not good - the sweet option is awful - but they could be better if the inside of this venue didn't smell like moldy vomit. Not good. Owner shares historical tidbits about his family's service to LBJ and seems nostalgic for the "good ole days". The good thing is that there is no charge for a tasting, but we'd gladly pay for a better experience.

reviews.author: Claudiana C.
reviews.description: This was by far the BEST winery we visited in the area. The owner and winemaker, Gary was just as fabulous as the wines. He welcomes you like family and we listened to all of his great stories. We wanted up staying for two hours and enjoying a bottle of the Texanti, it was difficult to decide which one we enjoyed the best. The wine tastings are at no charge and all five are the best we tasted in the area. We have never gone to a winery and enjoyed every tasting we had, but here we did. We would not only go back but, this would be the sole reason we would visit the area again. Thank you Gary for the wonderful wine and visit. We will definitely see be back soon.

reviews.author: Monica F.
reviews.description: Such a sweet spot! Good wines, simple and kind winemaker that loves to share his sweet history and family stories. Check it out.

reviews.author: Mike And Robin C.
reviews.description: If you've never met owner Gary Hahne before, then you're in for a real treat.
