Besides his wine making history, he always has great stories to tell about the Hill Country and LBJ Ranch.  His family has good history to one of the states famous politicians, Lyndon B. Johnson.  Gary has many tall and true tales that makes a good story telling experience while sipping his wines. You can also view much of his family's history with the Johnsons as can be seen with some unique photographs that are displayed on the wall.  Besides the family history, he has a good selection of wine to try out.  Right now, he's getting his grapes from just about anywhere he can.  In Stonewall, he is planning on planting a vineyard starting with an acre of Nero d'Avola.  This is one of the hot and dry Italian varietals that has a potential to do well in the Hill County's climate.  There are currently five wines available in his new tasting room that opened up back in July.  For the whites, you'll start off with the Blanco.  It's a Viognier blend with nice intense favors.  The Blanco River artwork on the label is quite spectacular.  The Opa is a dry Rose` that is a blend of Riesling, Thurgaw, and Spatburgunder (aka Pinot Noir).  A very nice chilled Rose` to have for those extended summer fall months in Texas.  The label depiction is a pencil drawing version of Gary's grandfather on a horse.  The actually picture is on the wall.  Yes, his "Opa" actually did what you see on the label and, of course, there's a good story Gary will tell you about that one as well.  The Texanti is Gary's take on Chianti style wines - good fruit flavors for this Sangiovese blend.  Gary's take on a Bordeaux style wine is called Texas Tapestry.  It's a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Tempranillo, and Nero d'Avola.  It's quite bold, has good tannins, and well balanced.  The addition of Nero d'Avola is his unique take on this classic red blend.  He might be on to something here.  The last wine is Armadillo WH.  The WH stands for World Headquarters.  It's a sweet Cab, but with only 1% residual sugar - quite nice to have in the afternoon.  It's a real treat to have a true local making wine in the Texas Hill Country.  The great and interesting stories Gary tells just adds to that unique experience that you won't find elsewhere.  Stop by his shop along Johnson City's square on your next wine trek thru these parts. You'll have a pleasant time here sipping and chatting with Gary. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: We happened into this neck of the woods because the red M3P that we've been waiting on from Tesla for a millennium is finally being delivered this week, so we're on the hunt for an excellent Tesla service center (the one next to us up north leaves a bit to be desired), which we have now most definitely found here on St. Elmo (shout out to Sadie and Kyle)! Luckily, it also happens to be right next to this absolute gem of a winery! #winning   Travis, our wine journey guide, was the sweetest, most knowledgeable, and most approachable human being on earth, and we thoroughly enjoyed our Saturday afternoon stop! The bright and airy space, the pitch perfect music, the yummy wine (we had both the Work Horse Red Blend and the Violet Crown Tempranillo. Deliciously dry reds!), and Travis all collaborated to make this a most excellent pit stop!   Thanks, Austin Winery! Thanks, Travis!

reviews.author: Ria G.
reviews.description: I'd give this place 5 stars for the interior and overall vibe, but only 3 stars because we were a bit disappointed with the wine itself.   The atmosphere is lively with board games and great decor inside, and a food truck and lots of picnic tables outside for large groups.   However, my group ordered 2 different red wines and 1 sparkling white wine and felt that the wines were lacking in flavor and very watery. Maybe this is how Austin wine is, but if you're looking for deeper, richer flavored wine, I would go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Ayca U.
reviews.description: Great wines selection to try from, all gluten free.  Friendly service and highly recommend the charcuterie and cheese - great presentation   Clean and well kept Must try

reviews.author: Aditi P.
reviews.description: 10/10 holistically on this place. Everything from wine, environment and experience were on point. We had a group of girls in for a bachelorette and the service did not disappoint. The owners have an amazing story telling ability when it comes to their wine. The ambiance of interiors down to the charcuterie presentation is all thoughtful.

reviews.author: Diana M.
reviews.description: Great selection of wines and a wonderful place to get "away" for an afternoon. A friend and I visited Austin last weekend and found this winery located about 10-15 minutes from downtown. In a area that looks redeveloped from warehouse bays the selection and space is super cute! Would return next time I'm in town!

reviews.author: Stefany W.
reviews.description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was just a nice place to relax, drink some wine and read a book which is exactly what I did. I came with a friend and we enjoyed trying all the various wine they had to offer.   They also apparently had a monthly oyster pop up which was fun. I ended up ordering some and they were delicious! Highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Ok so I accompanied my boyfriend to the brewery and distillery nearby, so of course we had to stop for the obligatory glass of wine for me.  I was not going to get any snacks, but their cheese and charcuterie board was calling my name.  We both got the tasting. Each of us got different wines. Our favs were the Tempranillo, Grenache and spaghetti western. You can get all your wines at once or one at a time. I suggest getting them all at once because staff can get busy.  The cheese and charcuterie board paired well with our wines and it was definitely the perfect snack. Loved the cheese selection. The bread sprinkled with olive oil made my day cause who doesn't love bread They have inside and outside seating available. Parking is onsite, but shared with other businesses.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: Pretty laid back spot. A nice spot to grab a quick glass of wine with a friend or 2. For a locally ran winery, I'd say it's worth going for sure. The menu selection for cheese variations are subpar. We did try some octopus and squid, which was an interesting discussion over some glasses of wine. You can only imagine how these convos went lol! All in all, I highly recommend stopping in for an interesting glass or two. Cheers to more wine!

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: Went to Austin for a short solo trip and what a nice surprise. This place was so cool and chill. The service was great, the tables were well spread out, the flight and snacks did not disappoint.   I had the:  Friends with Benefits Opening Ceremony Gerwuz  Vermentino   All a selection of whites and sweets.   I would highly recommend this place to get a taste of Austin and also enjoy a quiet spot.

reviews.author: Krystle U.
reviews.description: My partner and I first found their wine at Travis Heights Wine and Spirits and fell in love w the malbec, so we decided to visit the winery. The first time we came here, they had a private event going on so that was sad. The second time, we got here a few hours early so they hadn't opened - that's our fault. Finally, our third attempt was fruitful!  The service here is super chill and on top of things. We 2 flights so we got to taste a good variety of samples. Great pours. We ended up leaving w one of their best bottles and now we're saving it for a special occasion.   We got (ranked from 'pour me another' to meh): *Violet Crown *Tempranillo Nuevo *Vermentino *Red-Nat *Picpoul *Piquette - this seems to be a star here but we personally hated it - tasted a bit like dilute pickle juice  A bottle we had before coming to this place was their Hill Country Rosso and that's still my favorite.  As far as COVID safety goes, the tables are super spread out, the staff wears masks at all times, and everything seems clean.   This place is super cool and what seems to be a hidden gem.

reviews.author: Jenni N.
reviews.description: Very cute tasting room within an industrial area. You would not think there would be a place like this there. The Yard is the location and they have several business including this winery, a distillery, a brewery, and a few other places. The wine was good and the cheese and charcuterie board was a good size. I'd like to give 5 stars, but we had to ask for napkins, no plates given either. It was also a bit messy inside. Not sure if they were re-organizing or what. But friendly staff, good wine, and cute space! I recommend a stop in!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I stopped here to enjoy some new wine and some pizza from Lil Nonna's. I made reservations on the way there. During the 'rona, it is recommended to ensure you can get a spot.   My hubby and I did a wine flight a piece. We tried all the reds, the rose, and white wine (Vermentino). We ended up buying a bottle of Malbec to take home which we both had enjoyed. Note, the staff was very knowledgeable and helpful.   I really like the atmosphere of the winery as it is inside a warehouse where they make their own wine and buy their grapes. The winery has a few things to eat or you can buy pizza from Lil Nonna's. The pizza takes awhile but you can always purchase online and set a date. If you are done at the winery you can also bar hope in the area for beer, cocktails, and whiskey.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: It's simple, if you're not pretentious and you like natural wine, you'll enjoy this place. Industrial spot located in the Yard, great natural lighting and some benches outside for the big groups. A truly gorgeous selection with some fantastic small plates as well- tinned seafood, quality cheeses and bread, etc. Always an enjoyable time.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: We each ordered flights. The staff was knowledgeable, quick, and polite which made the experience even better!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Star service and a non-judgmental space. I dig you, Austin Winery!  We decided on Austin Winery after we had plans to go to Spokesman next door for some beers. Unfortunately, Spokesman had an event going on that looked a little noisy and full for our study date, hence the change in venues. The winery was very spacious and lofty--I love that in an industrial winery! We asked if we could move a table (to plug in to their only one outlet--score!) and do some computer work with their wifi. The gal at the tasting room was fantastically wonderful. She gave us a large smile and told us to do whatever we wanted. Wonderful service alone will get me to come back. That's for sure.  We each got a flight of wine to try, and got down to it until they closed. They have a good selection of whites, rose's and reds, so fret not friends. All is provided. They also have some light bites like cheeses and charcuteries, so you can definitely go with that if you're hungry. The tastings were a little pricey compared to what you might get at a wine tasting out in the vineyards (I used to work in the industry), but you're paying for the convenience of being in South Austin and lots of space to hold conversations, play board games and just be with your groups. They have loads of seating and an upstairs area (that a Bachelorette party was using). Restrooms are clean and wifi is strong. We also walked home with some Brose (a hilarious take on rose especially because it was a women-lead winery effort). Clean, classy and airy space.

reviews.author: Alec B.
reviews.description: Awesome winery, love that it's so close to the city. All the staff was super friendly and knowledgeable about the wine selection. They had several really good wines, my favorites were the Violet Crown and GSM.

reviews.author: Mike L.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our visit here,  the staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  A must visit when near b Austin.

reviews.author: Kan C.
reviews.description: Cute place. Not a huge fan of the wines but the food was great.  Will try again ! Maybe my pallet was off

reviews.author: Hailey W.
reviews.description: Very cool industrial spot. Lots of good wine options and there was a food truck. Good spot to visit during covid due to availability of outdoor seating

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: This place has a great vibe and both indoor and outdoor seating.  The staff are friendly and knowledgeable.  Lil' Nonna's pizza truck is right outside of the door and has fantastic pizza - try the VBR!  The bummer is they only have Texas wines and I am not a fan.  I tried 5 different options and truly am not a fan.  I would love if they had other options.

name: Pour House Pints And Pies
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Chalin S.
reviews.description: What a cute lil place! Lots of outdoor seating!   Lots of beers and they make a good marg.   The snack - are what I'm all about here, the hummus was good, friend cheese oh lord (but wait you can't go wrong with that can you?) and the MUSHROOMS were so yummy!   Warning - the house red will give you a headache

reviews.author: Ruth S.
reviews.description: Not sure why people are giving more stars than this place deserves. If you actually read the peoples' reviews, they really meant to give less stars.   Here's why:  The pizza is just bar pizza. It's nothing special and if I'm being honest, I would have been much happier just going to Costco for pizza   Imagine your pizza covered in melted plastic that has cheese flavor. That's what's the pizza is like; bar pizza. Pizza you'd love to eat when hammered. It tasted like Red Baron.   Let's talk about the cocktails. I can't speak over every cocktail in existence but if they're anything like the margaritas... lol... don't order a cocktail. The margarita here was so bad, I'm sure my husband could make one better with margarita mix and Jose Cuervo. Gross .   I wish I could tell you that our experience here was fluffed with great service... unfortunately, that isn't the case. I understand being understaffed because of the C word, but I watched my waitress, and she was so inefficient, I was very tempted to get up and serve myself. Also, they weren't understaffed. There were plenty of servers for the lack of people that were present. Be prepared to sit for awhile staring at your feet until you can order anything. Be prepared to stay thirsty while you eat. Ask for everything you need from the start, or be prepared to not need it by the time you receive help.   Last but not least, the bathrooms. Those things are important, are they not?  they are to me. I will say, they are definitely public bathrooms. Have you ever been to a really gross gas station bathroom? Ok, then you know what these bathrooms are like. I wonder, does anyone even clean them? Oh well, we will just blame it on the C word this time around. ‍

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: Still here.  Still serving tasty food.  A large, varied, frequently changing 35 tap wall and smart friendly beer savvy staff.   This remains a favorite neighborhood hangout and I love the food, the beer and the staff and really love the place.  Pretty sparkling clean, nice patio and if they had some heaters a patio that would be great in December,  January and February too.    The formula here, as with all the bars in this ownership group, is simple and effective: great staff, nice place, decent food, good beer and inexpensive drinks.  No wonder they have outlasted the last 5 occupants of this building!

reviews.author: Ralph S.
reviews.description: The pizza is usually delicious.  Our cocktails are reasonable.  The staff Always are Friendly and accepting!  Our pie tonight didn't meet our expectations.  We ordered the el supremo.. if was good but it was too dependent on the pepperoni and not enough of the other toppings.

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I've been passing up some awesome food and beers for years.  Don't make the same mistake I did.  I Yelper plead with you!  I also learned two things I've been missing in pizza, too.  I've passed this place dozens of times.  It sits on the fringe of a west Austin neighborhood and several apartments/condos between them and 183.  I believe it is affiliated with a restaurant that has a place in Fort Worth, too, but I might be wrong.  What I'm sure of my first visit there was killer!  I'm planning on going back when I can eat and drink a whole day away!  They have a great outdoor area with plenty of umbrellas and we chose a table.  The server acknowledged us right away.  We QR'd the menu and by the time we'd made a choice of food our beers were on the table and cold (good pour on the Guinness, btw).    We ordered a pizza of our own:  Sausage, mushroom, green peppers and spicy marinara sauce.  Okay, first... You know how some chain pizzas you have the ingredients all coming off together leaving you with less than even a cheese pizza?  Not here.  Every thing is chopped into small pieces and spread evenly over the entire pizza.  Every bite comes with a mouthful of exactly what you ordered.  Second, put some of that marinara on a piece of canvas and I'd eat it.  The spices brought everything together.  We got wings too.  Golden Buffalo.  Perfect heat! Crispy.  Meaty. Those wings were gone so fast I was looking at other tables to see if someone had snatch a couple off our plate LOL  We were licking the hot sauce off the plate.  I'M DOUBLING THE ORDER NEXT TIME!  Great service, cool vibe, good food!  Did I get lucky or find bar food Nirvana?  I dunno.  I'm going to rock a five star and adjust as I need to, but I'm not going to deprive myself of another visit here for sure!!

reviews.author: Russell B.
reviews.description: Still absolutely wonderful after all these years! They remember our order and pay good attention to our table. Will be back soon and often.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Fun Neighborhood joint.  This feels like a place where you'd walk in and they'd say, "Norm!"...if that were your name and you were on an episode of Cheers.  The beer was deliciously cold served in a thick glass to keep it that way. The pizza was generously embellished with toppings, and the crust was above average. The service was timely and courteous. I really liked the outdoor patio. Part of it is covered with fans, and part was uncovered with tables with umbrellas. The only drawback is there's a lot of road noise. We sat at a table as far away from the road as possible, and it was acceptable noise-wise. When our world health situation is better, I hope to see all the tables filled with large groups of friends enjoying pints and pizzas. For now, come check it out with your close friends and/or significant other.

reviews.author: Cristian S.
reviews.description: Excellent beer ! Excellent pizza ! Very rich crust ! I loved this place! I'll be back soon !

reviews.author: Krystal M.
reviews.description: I'm a pizza fanatic! Pizza is one of the best simple yet so tasty. Went on a Friday early evening busy but service was  good and manager came out to help his servers and cleared tables. Kid friendly and pets welcomed would definitely recommended

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place. It was way more laid back then I expected (place is always popping outside!!) which was great, I'm not for the "pay twice what it's worth because we are fancy pants".  Everything was very reasonably priced, and freaking delicious! We tried a few of the drinks (I tried a few of the beers) and it's safe to say I left tipsy and happy! Can't wait to visit this place again and try some new pizzas and beer!

reviews.author: Andrew S.
reviews.description: Great waitress service initially. Drinks served very fast. Good pizza and tasty fried pickles. Would have been a 5 star review until the douchebag black dude in the red hat that works there ushered us out very rudely since they needed our table even though the back dining room was basically empty. Will never go back

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: I hope they open earlier again soon. I miss going there at 1 or 2 after work.   The parking lot area on the right is awful. So park in the back for you don't get hit.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: My friends like this place, but I don't see the draw. The pizza is mediocre. Fortunately tonight I discovered their sandwiches are good. I got the Pourboy, with Fries. Everyone else in our group who wanted food ended up being in a sandwich mood, so the Chicken Parm sandwich got good reviews from two of the guys. The fries were well-seasoned and looked promising, but were a little cold and soft. Other times I liked the Fried Pickle Chips, but could only eat a few pieces before they got overpowering. It's not like we'd eat that many pickles out of the jar in one sitting! I think the server mixed up my friend's beer order. The final blow to this spot is that their outdoor chairs are wildly uncomfortable. I even brought my own seat cushion the last few times I came! This time it saved my butt, but my back still hurts. I'd give Pour House a 3.5 but I'm in a generous mood so I'm rounding up.

reviews.author: Darrel R.
reviews.description: Been monitoring the website to see when this place is open, and I STILL have not seen this place close down for even a day while clearly rat infested. Clearly haven't taken any time to fix their rat problem. Will not be coming back until I see an exterminator outside.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable staff. Friendly staff.  Rotating taps. Great food.  What's not to like.  Comfortable patio.

reviews.author: Mickey W.
reviews.description: Visiting from Seattle and went here with my son this week.  We both ordered pizza which was excellent. Tasty crust on the pie and toppings were top notch.  Tried their "West Coast" IPA, not to hoppy but well balanced.  I'll be back!!

reviews.author: Loren B.
reviews.description: At first glance, the interior of Pour House looked a little un-maintained. But, then of course, Austin. Where everything is underground. I was excited about the local beer list, though the stout selection was a bit thin. I went with Redhorn, a coffee stout that was a little short on stoutness for me. But, the flavor was good.  We ordered three 8" pizzas to share: El Supremo, Hawaiian, and a Veggie pizza, providing plenty for two adults and two children. The pizza was quite good, as in Austin-good. I couldn't put my finger on it, but there was something unique about the flavor.    Our server was very good, personable and informative. We ate a late lunch, during which a growing number of what appeared to be regulars gathered mostly around the bar. The location is a bit secluded from the rest of Austin. But, it's near the technology district, where I was working for the day.  Parking was a little confusing because we approached the building from a side where the entrance wasn't visible. It's a private parking lot with plenty of space. Outdoor seating is available. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Karan P.
reviews.description: Pour house is a pleasant open patio brewery serving delectable pies and the best garlic bread in Austin! I prefer an afternoon visit to enjoy the sun on the patio. The garlic bread has a nice char and is brimming with heavenly garlic flavour!

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: Wow, what a comeback from Corona this place has had. I've never been happier to see the wait staff and bartenders (especially Justin) return to their jobs. They're really into sanitizing every space that has been used and I've never had a vegan pizza like The Spock. Couldn't be happier with this place's redemption. Come support them, especially at the beginning of the week!

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: This was the first trying out this place. My guys from work and I were in training this week so we thought about trying it out. The environment was chill and not too busy during lunch time so that was a plus for us because we needed to be back for training within the hour.  Three of us ordered the Cubano and it was so tasty! I definitely enjoyed the pickles and pork amongst other fine ingredients they packed on that pizza! One of guys ordered the regular pepperoni pizza and he said he liked it a lot. The crust and dough of the pizza was cooked perfectly thoroughly.  There salads were delicious and portioned perfectly. When you arrive the parking is all in the back area pretty much, and you enter through the patio area. They have signs for you and that guide you to entrance.

reviews.author: Dennise M.
reviews.description: The good: wonderful environment and ambience, great views.  Delicious drinks.  Perfect for a girls night or small get together.  (Perfect for pictures)  The bad: didn't have actual entrees only small sides tapa style. With that being said the food was beyond  flavorful and exquisite!  They may be small but did not lack in flavor! The shrimps were big and appetizing. The mushroom pasta with an egg yolk was mouthwatering delectable.  The ugly: due to COVID 19% gratuity is added to all tickets. I feel like this caused our main waitress to overlook our order. Luckily there was a a girl who brought the food who was extremely attentive which made up for it.   Would I still recommend? Absolutely yes, If you don't have a big appetite and are looking for a perfect drink, tasty appetizers and wonder ambience.... You must try P6!

reviews.author: Karley C.
reviews.description: I wish I would have been here for happy hour!  I probably would have tried more drinks/food if I was there during this window of time.  This place is definitely *a vibe*.   The staff were a little sassy though.  If you are in Austin for a girls trip, this place makes sense to add to your itinerary.  Fun fact: It's called P6 because it is an old parking garage.  I had to explain that to the people in my group, so apparently not everyone connects those dots.   Pro tip: Be sure to make your reservations well in advance. We were stuck with a 9pm seating time (on a random Wednesday night) and let me tell you it gets CHILLY up there on a March night.

reviews.author: Greshka P.
reviews.description: We got here on a Sunday afternoon, around 1:30pm.  We were quickly seated outside on a high table.  We would have prefered the lower ones, which looked way more comfortable but were told those were for larger groups, even though some were still open the entire time we were there.  We scanned the code to see the menu and waited and waited (we almost left) for our server to finally arrive to take our order.   The drinks came out looking pretty, nice presentation, but flavor wasn't great.  We looked at the menu again to see if there was something else we might like but debated having to wait again to be served.  Instead, we drank what we got, enjoyed the lake view, and people watching, and when our server finally came around again we asked for our check.  Cute "rooftop" but not on my list to go back to.

reviews.author: Casey T.
reviews.description: GREAT ambiance, but food was incredibly mid.  P6 has great vibes and is a fun place to get drinks, however, it just didn't live up to the hype. The view itself isn't as great as advertised, as the balcony overlooks the roof of the LINE hotel and doesn't have the view of the downtown skyline. The drinks were just OK, and the food just didn't taste as good as it looked. The menu options are extremely limited as well.  If I came here again, I would come just to get drinks and get food elsewhere.

reviews.author: Alice Y.
reviews.description: P6 is an ideal place to take out of towners! It's got a sweeping view of ladybird lake and great for sunsets.  Happy hour is 3-6pm which features a couple of food items marked down $2-3. Glass of red wine is $6. Their regular dinner menu is tapas-style, but full entree prices! Specialty cocktails range $13-16. If you're looking to get full, expect to pay $40-60 per person. Food is average for what you pay for.   Parking- the hotel offers $10 for 3 hour valudation. You can chance street parking which runs $2 per hour. The Mexican American Cultural Center has a moderately sized lot and is a 10 min walk away.   Beware of an automatic 19% gratuity added on, no matter your party size.

reviews.author: Carrie J.
reviews.description: This is my new favorite place! I wish I had known sooner what an amazing tapas menu they have here! We will be bringing our family and friends here!   Cammie was our server. We lucked out to have a girl that was so friendly, quick, and helpful!

reviews.author: Tiffany D.
reviews.description: Hotel restaurant on the side top floor.   Nice lounge and bohemian decor.   I feel like the cuisine is a mix of tapas, Mediterranean and Italian ingredients. Carpaccio was my favorite. Ordered up pasta and hummus dip.   Accommodated our ordered when it was about an hour or less before kitchen closed.   Service was on point.   View of the lake was admirable.

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: We came here as soon as the restaurant opened because we knew it would be packed. This place has such beautiful decor and is on the rooftop/patio, so there is a beautiful backdrop of Lady Bird Lake. You will definitely be taking tons of photos here.  We made reservations just in case, but we pretty much had the whole restaurant to ourselves for the first hour P6 was opened. Everything looked delicious, so we ordered quite a bit:  Vegetable Frittata: This was perfect for a light meal. Lots of veggies and the eggs and butter lettuce was perfect.  Shrimp and Grits: Soooo bomb. Every bit of this tasted great. Just wished they would have removed the shrimp tails as most other places do.  Patatas Bravas: The potatoes were great for a side/appetizer.  Sourdough Garlic Bread: I love a good garlic bread, and this totally delivered. And I like that fact that it was pull-apart bread.   Everything tasted amazing and we really enjoyed our time brunching here.

reviews.author: Teah R.
reviews.description: Stop 2 of the night with our group of 9 for a bachelorette party. We made reservations ahead of time and were seated indoors. But we convinced our way out to the patio early in the night which was better (but a little chilly). Why would we want to come to a rooftop bar if we can't be outside, ya know?!  The servers were nice - we had multiple throughout the night. They occasionally came and checked on us. The place was packed on a Friday night.  We all had a lot of fun here and the drinks just kept coming! They were tasty and swanky.  There weren't many parking options other than valet that I saw but I can't remember how much that was. We had to walk through the hotel to get to the rooftop. The hotel looked very nice with mood lighting and modern decor touches.  Overall though, P6 was great - moody and fun!

reviews.author: Adrian N.
reviews.description: Cool for the view, the vibe was very chill and relaxed. I suggest to try going during a sunset because you get an amazing view of the river. The staff was very attentive but I probably wouldn't be back for some time because the drinks are very very pricey.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Visited P6 for happy hour with a friend while visiting Austin and had a good time! We arrived when they were just opening, and luckily we had a reservation - it filled up really quickly after a bit. The space has a great vibe and a great view - even though it's not on the roof, the space offers a lovely view of the city and river and the open concept of the bar makes for a perfect environment to relax and enjoy some sunshine. The space is filled with countless plants and pink decor, which I truly appreciated - it felt quite posh and eclectic yet incredibly put together at the same time.   For drinks, I opted for the ladybird spritz, perfect for a refreshing afternoon cocktail. Featuring rhubarb, aperol, and cava, it was light yet flavorful, really being able to taste the rhubarb throughout the entire drink. Quite good! My friend went for the sundown cobbler, which she also really enjoyed. Since it was happy hour, we snagged some food too. We both split the pita bread with chimichurri and the hummus. We were given a bunch of pita bread, which was much appreciated! The pita was good, but not the best I've ever had (a little dense for my liking). The chimchurri was OK - the ratio of oil to spices was a bit off so it felt like it was swimming in oil. The hummus was quite nice and featured a nice touch of cashews and chili oil. I appreciated the inclusion of various veggies in addition to the pita for a change of pace! The hummus overall was good, but again, not the best I've ever had, but still filling and delicious and balanced our drinks well. While the prices of the cocktails were quite discounted from normal, they were still a bit steep, but to be expected when you consider the ambience of the place.   Overall, we enjoyed our HH at P6! I really enjoyed by spritz and the hummus / chimichurri was a nice balance. The prices are a bit elevated, but to be expected in relation to the space. If you're looking for a nice HH spot for visitors to Austin, I would definitely suggest P6!

reviews.author: Dmitri J.
reviews.description: Had a fantastic tic rooftop cocktail here. Great views overlooking the city. We went on a cold night but the heaters were going the space was enclosed and the staff was ready to accommodate. I'd recommend for sure.

reviews.author: Deborah W.
reviews.description: Rating: 3.5 stars  My friend and I decided to stop here for brunch on Sunday. We didn't make a reservation ahead of time but were able to be seated right away indoors. (If you are interested in sitting outdoors - we were told reservations book out 1 week in advance so make sure to plan accordingly)  Even though the indoor space did not have the same ambience as outdoors it was still very nice and well decorated.   Service was very friendly and efficient.  For our brunch we decided to order:  --PATATAS BRAVAS: Well fried with a great flavor. Definitely a great brunch item to order! My only complaint would be they didn't really give us many potatoes since the portion covered less than half of the bowl it came in.   --FRITTATA: Ours was a veggie frittata that was filled with flavor and topped with a great tomato based purée. It did come with a giant handful of lightly coated romaine lettuce which seemed a bit mismatched. Additionally the portion of the frittata was slightly too small for the price.   --PICKLED PEARL ONION HUMMUS: Really good portion of food. The hummus is just bursting in flavor. There was also a ton of bread and veggies it comes with to dip into the hummus. Definitely a solid order!   All in all, a nice brunch option for the weekend if you are staying at The Line.

reviews.author: Desiree D.
reviews.description: Great views overlooking the river and congress bridge. Loved the eclectic furniture and vibe. Food was decent and service was good. You are definitely there for the views.

reviews.author: T N.
reviews.description: Server Colby is awesome!  Bartender Eric needs to be careful of mad muggin' the customers.    Cool place to watch the sunset.

reviews.author: Elizabeth L.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped by P6 for appetizers and cocktails while we were in town and we had the best time!!  The cute, Instagrammy interior is only topped by the incredible backdrop of the balcony view over the river. We got a shady table by the edge and kicked back with a rosé and carpaccio. The plating of the carpaccio was gorgeous, and it had a beautiful mix of salty and fresh flavors. The pita chips that came with it were perfectly crispy too!  This was the best view we were able to get while in Austin, and can't wait to come back! But next time - we'll make it in time for their amazing happy hour deals.

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: Came here for a bachelorette brunch. The food was SO FRESH and tasted bomb. The views where we sat was also breath taking. The weather was perfect and our waiter was so nice. He gave us tips on what to do and where to go. I've been recommending this place to everyone that visits Austin!

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed brunch the other day here on their patio that overlooks Ladybird Lake. Had a reservation for 6 and the hostess was able to accommodate my request of sitting outside, which I really appreciated. The ambiance is very pretty and totally Instagram worthy with their pink overhangs and colorful couches/decor. They also had semi-large fans for each outdoor table which was much needed in this Texas heat.   The food was really delicious and not too overly priced. For brunch, most of the plates were pretty small so, if you're hungry I would recommend ordering 1-3 plates and sharing if you have the ability to do so. We tried the Greek Yogurt Parfait, Patatas Bravas and Hummus and it was all sooo good! Will definitely be returning here.

reviews.author: Christy V C.
reviews.description: I came here with a couple of friends and we had a blast! The ambiance is incredible and I just loved the view! We came during happy hour, which is literally one hour, 4-5pm, and I ordered the Sundowncobbler and Homemade Pita bread. Im not a huge drinker, but I really enjoyed my drink and loved that there was fruit in it. The pita bread was incredible! I loved how soft and warm the pita was. It was perfect with the chimichurri.  Parking- You can park in the garage for the hotel, but they only validate for the first hour I believe, which is only $5. Luckily we found street parking next to the garage which isn't nearly as expensive.  Payment- I actually really loved that you paid online! It makes it very easy to split the check amongst friends without bothering the servers!

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: Views are excellent... IF you even get a table anywhere near them. This restaurant is poorly executed in my opinion. They have beautiful views of the river but there is no guarantee that you will even be able to see it from your table (even with reservations) and yet you're still paying "fancy view prices".   My experience: - Arrived at The Line Hotel (which is way cool btw) to find that there are no signs on how to get to P6.  - The elevator is super sketchy and in the back corner without any airflow at all (seemed like an afterthought or service elevator). - Originally was sat at a "table" (their seating are little vignettes of couches/patio furniture that is NOT comfortable AT ALL and really impractical to eat at) nowhere near the view. The tiny view that we did have was completely obstructed by a shade they rolled down. - We asked to be moved to a "table" with a view and were finally re-seated but still had a difficult time seeing the view as we were further back at a SUPER low to the ground vignette.  - The staff was friendly but the drinks and the menu items were overrated. - Stayed for an hour and a half, took some pictures, and went somewhere else to eat more food.  My order: - Sundown Cobbler cocktail - Yummy, but tasted mostly like sprite. - Paper Plane cocktail - Yummy, smooth, easy drinker. - Whipped ricotta - Way more food than we expected but the olives and the nuts were better than the ricotta. It lacked a lot of flavor and mostly just helped to fill me up.  Long story short - NOT worth the hype.

reviews.author: Bijal P.
reviews.description: First time here and am impressed we were sat down right away considering it was really busy.  The restaurant itself is pretty new they have a really simple menu and a great selection of beer on tap I should mention margarita on tap so good really craving one of those right now  Our server Ethan was very friendly gave us really great service.  We ordered a few drink I really liked my old fashion is was really good.  We really enjoyed our good everything was perfect especially my steak it was cooked to perfection. My husband also enjoyed his burger he said it was the best burger he's had.  I am definitely coming back to try something else thank you for the great service and being so hospitable

reviews.author: Kat B.
reviews.description: What a great restaurant! I was in town visiting my brother in law and he said he really enjoys this place so we went. Our waiter was friendly and patient. We started with the chips and queso, which were absolutely fantastic. We grabbed more chips because they're delicious and homemade. Highly recommend them. My husband and BiL got the patty melt and I ordered the chicken sandwich. I was very pleased with my sandwich and tots as were the boys.  My BiL and I both got the sangria-rita our waiter recommended and I loved it. Wish it was bigger, but absolutely no other complaints.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: We came during peak time on a Saturday evening. This means we are seeing them at their most challenged time. And I was a little "hangey" having to wait a half hour to be seated. But it was worth it. The waiter checked back with us every few minutes (mandatory for a good restaurant). And our order was delivered hot and fresh in a reasonable amount of time (a little slow because they were very busy - but in a reasonable amount of time).  We had chips and queso as an appetizer. The chips were the thick, homemade type. And the queso was their own recipe with ancho cili drizzle, crema, some sort of pico de gallo, etc. Really good - exceptional.  I had a chicken sandwich. It had a lot going on (in a good way). It was not just a run of the mill chicken sandwich. And the sidewinder fries are fresh and homemade.   My wife had the watermelon, which she also said was really good.  Overall, some creative foods that were well executed, and on point service  Definitely give this place a try.

reviews.author: Nick D.
reviews.description: Seriously, the best Sunday brunch north of Austin! And quite an impressive bourbon collection.

reviews.author: Linda P.
reviews.description: First visit. Very impressed. Quick service at the bar. Beer served in ice cold glass and well made mixed drink. Friendly server. We ordered Texas on Horseback, Queso Blanco, and The Republic Rustler. All so delicious! Great atmosphere. County music playing. Family friendly crowd. We'll be back.

reviews.author: Vandesha L.
reviews.description: I've had take out and dine in. After 3 consistent visits I can truly say this is my new favorite neighborhood bar. Eliana has been my bartender every time. She is amazing at referring a menu item or drink. All of the staff are pleasant and the vibe is definitely upbeat and happy. They are inclusive and go above and beyond to make sure each guest has a pleasant experience. I hade a Hell or High Water cocktail followed by a Pineapple Express. The drinks are fairly priced and worth the price. For food I had a Wrangler Patty Melt that knocked my socks off. I did substitute the Texas Toast for a regular toasted bun. The Jalapeño mousse gives me all of the feels and the carmelized onion gave the burger a sweet smokey taste. I'm not a french fry fan so I opted for the Mesquite-Sriracha Tater Tots. All I can say is ORDER THE TOTS! Even the side house salad was delicious. They toss the salad in a sweet and tangy dressing that's just enough. I love that this place is so close to home and does takeout. I will become a regular!

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Sorry this is a little late but I wanted to give a review. I stopped by here a couple weeks ago for dinner. The place was full, but they squeezed me in at the bar. I asked for a menu and a beer. The bar tender let me sample one of the beers on tap. I liked it so I ordered one to drink. I also ordered a patty melt with tater tots. The burger was think and made to order. I had to cut the burger because I did not want a big mess from trying to get a bite into my mouth. The burger was juicy since I ordered it medium and very tasty. I can say it filled me up. The beer was cold, nothing better than a cold beer, well almost nothing.  The atmosphere was as most sports bars are, a little noisy but people seems to know each other and they were friendly. The bartenders were busy but kept getting those drinks. The servers were also busy taking food and refilling cups of the patrons. There is outdoor seating but it was one of those HOT Days so I was glad I was inside. The parking is decent but they share with several other businesses. It was not too far away from the entrance so no need to wear the sneakers unless you want to.  Thank you Republic Kitchen + Bar for being a good neighbor and giving us another option to dine in Leander, Texas.

reviews.author: Polina W.
reviews.description: It was easy to grab a spot indoors. I had the salmon dish- it was spicy and salty for my tastebuds. I must not have read the description very well.  The Kids corn dog was tasty. The chicken steak dish was devoured, as was the watermelon salad.  All in all it was a good afternoon lunch.

reviews.author: Meagan H.
reviews.description: My family and I ate here on Friday. The food was good. I had the special which was a fish. My husband had a shrimp po boy. The kids had chicken strips and mac n cheese. The beers were good and cold. I love how they bring the beer in icy glasses.   We chose to sit outside but soon discovered the flies were way too many to be able to eat in peace. We couldn't stop waving our hands or the flies would land on the food. I'll go back, but sit inside next time.

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Decided to try a new place tonight, and glad we did! I had the patty melt, it was good. The only complaint I have about it is that they put the bread on the grill to get grill marks, but all I tasted was burnt toast. They do the top if the burger bun the same but it's not as grill marked. So next time I will ask for them not to do that, I hate black charred burnt toast. My husbands burger was good as well and both the tots and fries were tasty and perfect portion. They have a big bar with a good variety. I had a Hell or High Water to drink, and will definitely order that again. Delish! And last but def not least the service was great! Our server Kelsey was attentive and very sweet. Definitely looking forward to the next visit...word is they have a good weekend brunch, so we'll be checking that out.

reviews.author: Kate R.
reviews.description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere, love this place! Been here many times and have never once been disappointed. Great outdoor and indoor seating. Love sitting at the bar!  One recommendation only: maybe put chive tv or something else on just one (of 7'ish) tv instead of just sports

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: The chicken fried steak needs seasoning. It was missing some salt and the sauce over it was so much it took off the breading. But the mash and veggies had great flavor and tasted good!  Texas Smash is good if you like a honey whiskey, I don't.  But the old fashion was just how I like it!  Overall good place to try, the service was good. They have tvs on but I'd recommend that they put subtitles on all of them so since we can't hear them we can at least read and know what is going on.

reviews.author: Jacque M.
reviews.description: Ordered the chicken sandwich and honestly it was great until I got to the bottom of the second piece of chicken and it was completely raw. I almost threw up because I was worried how much raw chicken I had eaten. I wish I would've take a picture but I got so grossed out I tossed it immediately. I understand sometimes cooks can be rushed and I'm sure this rarely ever happens. Everything else was great but I couldn't get over the meat being raw.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: Great food. Great drinks. What more do you need? I absolutely love the barnyard fowl chicken sandwich. It's seriously delicious. All of the drinks I've tried are solid and they have a great beer and wine selection. Republic is a great option for anyone in the Leander area looking for a nice, trendy restaurant without driving all the way in to Austin. They also have a solid kids menu. We'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Tara M.
reviews.description: The atmosphere here is great. Everything seemed good at the start. Then we went to order food. Out of steak. Out of salmon. Out of wings. Out of shrimp. Out of some Cabernets. They were out of everything we went to order. The server could not have been more kind and sweet. She said it was because they run out of a lot of things on Saturday nights so Sundays they're just out. Well, I did a quick review of the comments on this restaurant and this is apparently a running theme. 1. Shame on me for not checking the comments before we came, 2. Shame on them for not resolving this clearly on-going issue. I know times are tough, but just close on Sunday nights if you cannot have more product delivered. We finished our drinks and left without ordering dinner at all.

reviews.author: Andrew S.
reviews.description: First time visiting. The drinks and location drew us in. The 3 okra dish ( it's Okra prepared 3 ways) was an instant hit. This was a quick first review and I want to come back for a meal. The Drinks are interesting and a good mix.  Pro tip - parking can get challenging in the evening. This strip mall has a lot of customers, early helps or enjoy the walk :-)

reviews.author: Lora O.
reviews.description: First time here. Ethan, our server, was excellent. He did the best he could with working with so many items out of stock. I mean you're  out of Jack Daniels? And steak? And Salmon? Yikes! We had chicken fried steak and the chicken sandwich. Both very good! Pictured is a yummy dessert! A brownie on top of graham cracker crumbs topped with a toasted marshmallow. Along side comes vanilla ice cream drizzled with caramel and dark chocolate with a drizzle of raspberry coulis and fresh raspberries.  We will try you again.

reviews.author: Leena N.
reviews.description: I didn't love this place. I totally understand that with COVID, many restaurants have had to cut back their menus.   With that being said, it seemed like breakfast-y food definitely prevailed during our Sunday afternoon visit. Seeing that they do a Sunday brunch, I get it, but always pictured that included a few other options not focused around eggs or waffles.   My husband ended up ordering their burger (which isn't even obviously advertised as a burger), and said it wasn't anything to write home about. My mother-in-law had their chicken sandwich and seemed to be okay with it. Not much fanfare from my husband's stepfather or his girls.  I ended up ordering the chili and didn't have any major complaints. I would've loved to see more in the "siesta" part of the menu that wasn't a salad.   My other complaint was the noise. The music was so loud that we could barely hear each other across the table, which pretty much awkwardly split our party in half. At first, we tried to get past it by borderline yelling, but that got old.   In between waiting for condiments, I asked our waitress if there was any way to knock the volume down by a click or two. She mentioned that she would see what she could do, but that it wasn't guaranteed since "people pay for it". My brother in law ended up seeing the jukebox in the corner, and while that's fantastic, I don't think it's too much to ask to keep music at a reasonable level in a place where you'd expect your guests to socialize at their table.

reviews.author: T N.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time and was ecstatic about visit. Ordered a salad and asked for ranch. Said salad arrived drenched in something I thought was ranch. Tasted said salad and immediately my mouth was on fire. Asked waitress to verify if it was ranch and she says... "oh we don't have regular ranch, just a spicy one..." that would've been nice to know. I CANT EAT SPICY FOOD!! She proceeded to suggest I use another dressing to bring down the heat. Word of advice to owner... put the dressing on the side. I was sick all day from this incident.   Partner got French toast and it was amazing. Sadly we won't be back..

reviews.author: Donna C.
reviews.description: This was one of the worst experiences we've had in a restaurant in a long time.  The server was rude, the manager condescending (strangely, I don't remember him being so rude at Texican) and the place was dirty.  The table was sticky, and they knew it, even said there was nothing they could do about it because it was "resin"...it wasn't.  We ordered four entrees, and they came out in stages. The first ones to hit the table were cold.  The third followed five minutes later, and mine didn't show up for another five minutes, at which time I told them to just keep it.  The "hash" was runny and not at all hash, the scrambled eggs cold, bacon underdone, and no condiments available; when we asked for them, they acted like it was an imposition.    $92 worth of bad food and crap service.  Very disappointing considering the executive chef was wearing a Fox Hole chef's coat, and Fox Hole is one of my favorite places in this area; I assumed from the get it would be extraordinary after seeing that...I guess not.  Oh, and word of caution, when the server handed my fiancé the mobile payment device, she selected the 20% tip option.  Make sure you watch out for that...there is no signage indicating there is an automatic gratuity so the servers have NO business choosing their own tip amount.  Update: while we were out of town, we discovered my fiancé's debit card had been hacked.  Oddly, the odd charges started AFTER using the mobile payment device, which was WiFi powered.  I cannot stress this enough...BEWARE!

reviews.author: Haley Z.
reviews.description: All the cocktails on the menu are delicious! Vast options for sake and even offer flights. Beautiful interior and Japanese-style seating benches where you can take your shoes off too. I love how the inside is an experience and contributes to the calming atmosphere. Outside picnic tables and high top tables out in the sun. Busy place usually but quick service and everything tastes amazing. Great location in The Yard.   They had a great band playing when we visited. Try the food truck out front too! We'll definitely be back to try out more of the menu.

reviews.author: Kolby G.
reviews.description: I cannot rave about how awesome this place is! Went to their Sunday night comedy show, laughed out loud nonstop. Staff is phenomenal. Super knowledgeable, and incredibly friendly ! They have a really great selection of sake and some fun nonalcoholic beverages as well.   Cocktails:  Berry Poppins - 5/5  Definitely hit up the handroll food truck out front. Staff is amazing! Food is super tasty!   Handrolls:  Bluefin Tuna - 4/5 Salmon - 4/5 King Crab - 5/5 Pork Belly - 5/5 Spam - 5/5 Crawfish Tails - 5/5  The king crab is amazing. The spam is phenomenal. The crawfish tails was a special roll for the weekend, and tasty! Love this place. Super unique. Gotta order the Pringles and Caviar on my next visit.

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: I love Texas Sake Co.  All the sake is fantastic, the sparkling sake is super fun.   The food trailer out front serving teriyaki bowls is slammin.   I've gone here and watched Sumo a few times and its an amazing experience. Sake tastings and Sumo just put me in a happy place.   Dont skip, go to Texas Sake and you'll have a great time.

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed the ambiance of Texas Sake!  I live close by so we walked over.  We tried the Sample Flight, but didn't like the flavors of those options.  2nd round I had the Berry Poppins and my friend had the sparkling Ginger Lime Sake.  We both preferred our 2nd options.  Definitely made me want to learn more about Sake.  Bartender was friendly but busy!

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: I love this place! Like most people I know, I'm not a huge sake drinker, but I appreciate it for what it is. As soon as we walked in here, I was drawn to the huge mural and the Japanese-style seating. I love that they have flights to really give you a chance to try some different flavors. Ordering at the bar was easy, and the bartender explained things well and gave us good explanations. We even purchased some snacks to eat with our sake. Although I probably won't choose this place as a destination in itself, I hope to be back when I am over in this complex (which has so much to offer!).

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: I'm not a big fan of Sake, but I took a chance. We had a flight of both sake and sparkling sake. My favorite was the lime and ginger parking sake. I even bought cans to go.  For the sake flight, you get four tasting and the for the sparkling, you get three.  The tasting room is big. Plenty of seating.  If you're hungry, there's a food truck right outside.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: This review is for 3.5 stars.   As far as a unique experience goes, Texas Sake Co hits the marks. Random Japanese centric spot in the middle of the Yard. Sumo on tv, umbrellas hanging from the ceiling, and sake galore. Nice outdoor seating area out front adds an Austin flare.   But the sake was just not good. Ordered the flight and only finished 1 of the 4 5oz pours. About $20 for high quantity, but there was so much oak and smokiness that it didn't resemble any type of sake I've had in my life. The cloudy unfiltered sake with yuzu on special for the day was edible but the rest were actually off. And on top of that, the booths are just impossible to get in and out of. Supposed to be the old school Asian variety but they're not built for people with long legs and there's zero room to scooch in.   Experience was fine and love the vibe of the Yard, but just couldn't get down with the drinks or seating.

reviews.author: Kim G.
reviews.description: Tried a flight and liked 2 of 4.  Oak junmai- didn't like  Junmai- liked  Some milky one- didn't like  Sake marg which was a pre made mix - liked   Ordered at the food truck, texas sushiko.  Flavor and food was good. The price for the quantity  was a rip off. Ordered:  Salmon  Fatty tuna  Oyster mushroom  $36  Expensive and not a lot of food. At least when I do rolls I feel full. Split with my family and was hungry after. Limited menu.

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: The Sake here is only out done by the amazing food truck. Texas Sushiko has some of the best Sushi Rolls we have ever had. Worth the trip here alone.

reviews.author: William I.
reviews.description: Love this place; definately one if the friendliest bars I've ever been to. The personally think the sake taste great and the decore inside is a refreshing change frim you normally find in Austin. There is also a sushi tryck out front that is a perfect way pair your sake with. Definately a must to stop for anyone in Austin.

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: Really awesome concept, great selections and people! Make sure to check the address here as they are on the south side not the north!

reviews.author: Amy F.
reviews.description: My husband was thrilled with his flight! I'm not a big sake drinker, but I enjoyed the snacks that came with the drinks!

reviews.author: Americus A.
reviews.description: Enjoyed the flights of sake! Great space and atmosphere. Enjoyed the Japanese snacks with my sake. Great place to wind down after dinner.

reviews.author: Kimmie D.
reviews.description: This place was cool and located in an area that seemed like it had lots of potential. I realized though that I do not like sake. My hubby and I shared a small flight and honestly couldn't finish them because we just did jot like the flavor. Also, it was quite warm in the space which made it a bit uncomfortable to stay for a long time. Basically given it 4 stars for the experience.

reviews.author: Brenda R.
reviews.description: Very relaxed setting with plenty of different sakes to pick from. The bartender was friendly and informative. He gave us great information about each sake and even talked about his fave. It was a bit warm inside, but it was tolerable. They had a front outside area with a few games to play and misters to keep cool. I can not forget to tell y'all they have snacks as well. Chocolate cookie pandas that were delicious and I took home some dried up edamame that I want to go back for more lol   They also sell their sake to take home any of your faves you tried and they are also very reasonably priced.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: A small batch sake distillery in Texas?!?!?  YES!  I really wanted to like this spot, but our visit was just OK. The staff didn't know where their rice was sourced and seemed disorganized.  Surprisingly, there are rice farmers in Texas along the lower Colorado river (https://stateimpact.npr.org/texas/tag/texas-rice-farming/).  They started farming rice in the 19th century.  Unfortunately, no one was knowledgeable enough to confirm or deny the rice's source.    The spot is hard to find. Just drive to the back of all the strip mall (behind Book Women), and you will finally get there.  There is plenty of parking available.  The tasting room is small, dingy, and dark.  You can peer into the production facility in the back of the tasting room.  There are only a couple of seats around the tasting room bar, and some standing tables.  Thankfully there was a makeshift outdoor seating area in the parking lot area with tents and picnic tables.  You can select from a tasting flight, Sake cocktails, or a shot glass size of their sake.  Bottle purchase are also possible.  We tried their clear, and milky white sake. It came with a bowl of pretzels. The clear sake was OK.  The milky white sake was unique, and actually better than the first.  But, both were subpar to other sakes that I have had.    We were supposed to take a tour. They offer tours at 7pm, 8pm, and 9pm on Friday and Saturday.  We showed up in time to attend the 7pm, but as it got closer to 8pm, we asked about the tour.  There is only so long you can nurse an OK glass of sake. They said it would happen in 3 minutes.  By the time 8:16m rolled around we peaced out.    The one thing that we learned was that the ownership had changed a couple of years before, and it was now being run by the same people who own StrangeLand Brewery.  Wonder how that changed the experience and quality.  Was surprised to see this place rated so highly.

reviews.author: Caitlin M.
reviews.description: This place was awesome!  I'm an out of towner and I've never had too much sake aside from ordering a "hot sake" from sushi restaurants, which I've always enjoyed.  When I heard about this place, I couldn't wait to try.  We got there at dark, and it looked unassuming aside from some lights hanging overhead, a few picnic tables, and a cornhole set up, and even the inside isn't too different from what you'd expect from a basic distillery.  I ordered the sample flight of sake so I could try a bunch of different things and actually learn something about sake while I was there.  The staff that was working was super friendly and great about answering any questions we had.  When he brought out the flights, he explained what each one was like and what to expect from it.  Despite my five star review, I didn't like all of the sake on the flight, but the point was to try a bunch of different types!  The sample flight came with four different types of sake - Junmai, Nigori, Nama, and Oak.  My two favorites were the Junmai and the Nigori, with the Junmai being most similar to the basic "hot sake" I'd always had before and the Nigori being a really smooth sake.  The Nama, in my opinion, was really strong, so it wasn't really for my tastes.  The Oak also felt a bit strong, but it was tempered by the oak-y taste that came with it.  We were also offered a taste of their Blood Orange CBD infused sake, which had really intrigued me.  It didn't taste like I had expected any sake to taste like, but I really enjoyed it!  I would definitely love to come back the next time I'm in town and try the tour to learn even more!

reviews.author: Dmitri J.
reviews.description: Super excited we have a south location. Sadly they opened the same week of covid-19 restrictions. They are taking carry out sake and food truck orders. The staff is there and ready to help you out. The location is beautiful and the people are amazing. I'm so ready to patronize this spot.

reviews.author: Dana P.
reviews.description: I think the previous reviews are fair.  It was fun for the experience; staff super cool and knowledgeable; the actual sake nothing was a stand out for me.  It is definitely a unique experience in Texas and worth the adventure.  We did the groupons but didn't get souvenir glasses. But then again, we didn't ask.  They did have some flavored ones- this one was coconut sake.  Bitter at first sip, nutty on the back.

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: This was my first time coming here.  I was so excited as I've not heard of any sake places anywhere I have lived.  I approached the bar and the bartender came up to me.  I told him that it was my first time here and what should I do - order at the bar, sit at table, wait to be seated, etc....  His reply, "Buy sake".  That was rude to me.  I ordered a flight and sat down annoyed.  Then, the sake.  It was VERY watered down.  I did not taste well.  Great space but that's all it's got going for it.

reviews.author: Jackie K.
reviews.description: Brunch/breakfast at Better Half Coffee and Cocktails was fun!  It's a relaxed, family/dog friendly environment with counter service, with a huge patio that's connected to the brewery next door.    We arrived a little after 9am and only had to wait in line for about five minutes.  The food was great--here's what we tried: -Cauliflower tots: A fun, savory treat that's exactly what it sounds like.  It actually reminds me of cauliflower gnocchi from Trader Joes, but more fried.  Good appetizer -French toast: Delicious, and I'd say that it's more like bread pudding because it's super moist and is drenched (in a good way) with whatever sweet batter.   -Chicken biscuit: A perfect little breakfast entree, and I liked the salsa that came with the fried chicken and biscuit.

reviews.author: Danh H.
reviews.description: Went there for an early morning brunch. Food was not great. Everything was brown: brown donut holes, brown french toast, brown crumbles, brown cauliflower tots. Nothing felt fresh or bright unless it was a salad. I mean, they could add strawberries or blueberries to those dishes I mentioned as they were overly rich. Everything was super sweet. Some fresh creme or custard to lighten up the sweetness would help. The dipping sauce for the donut holes was like dipping into caramel. It was not needed at all unless you have a 4 year old sugar freak with you. My friend was in the mood for a cheesecake and they were out of it along with other desserts on the menu except for (brown) cookies. I have no idea how this place is so popular. It does have a nice backyard and their brewery neighbor (Holdout) is a fun so you have that option if you're in the area. I would recommend getting their food. For people watching I'm not sure why there were some with travel bags. I wouldn't make the place the first or last stop if I was visiting Austin. There are plenty of options.  I understand the whole staffing issue and people there look glazed. I think management either needs to hire more people to help or give these people some sort of morale boost. They just were not friendly or give off positive vibes. They were just zombies running food to your table.  I don't write negative reviews to stop people from going but want management know they need to adjust some things to make it a better experience.

reviews.author: Avalyn J.
reviews.description: During my 3 day stay in Austin I went to Better Half every morning for my cold brew and danish.  The cold brew was very good. The Gabagool Danish was excellent.  It's a danish stuffed with pork and cheese with shredded coconut on top. A yummy mouthful of savory sweet and saltiness. A must get if youre there in the morning!! I knocked a few stars off because of 2 things.  First the hit or miss service. The staff were either friendly or would act as if you were bothering them. The other is because I bought a tshirt which I saw on their website for $25. When I checked my receipt I was charged $30.  Granted I should have asked the price but didnt see any reason why it would cost more in person. Overall if in that  Austin neighborhood again I would go back .

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: Came here for breakfast on Saturday morning, waited in line to order. It was pretty crowded for seating but we were able to find a table right away. They said that the food would take 45 minutes to an hour, it came out in 5-10 minutes! Super fast. Good queso. Great breakfast sandwich - very messy to eat, expect to get your fingers dirty. Salad was okay, large portion size was good, sweet potato chunks were too large for a salad. Cold brew was not good, recommend getting a different coffee drink. I would definitely come back because it was a chill spot with good food and cheap prices.   Pros: good food, affordable   Cons: no tvs on patio, cold brew wasn't good

reviews.author: Haley Z.
reviews.description: Wonderful, flavorful brunch spot. We went very early about 8:30am and it was perfect. We sat outside at a table as we visited last year. Very empty that early and everything still in stock! I enjoy that they have a more limited menu because they focus on every dish being a homerun. Quality food and drinks!  This place(and the brewery) get extremely busy so I recommend a reservation or going earlier instead of peak brunch times. Very pet and kid friendly. We didn't see our server much, but luckily we didn't need much and she was great when we did need her.   Softest cake donut I've ever had and a rich chocolate taste almost more of a dessert than brunch but that's right up my alley! Menu seems to change quite a bit by the season, so I can't wait to try more different plates. We'll definitely be back with friends and family visiting.

reviews.author: Rachel F.
reviews.description: I love this spot!  I love their coffee and their healthy but tasty food options.  I really love their cauliflower bites with beet ketchup and their lattes. They had homemade syrups which I love- I think they taste less gummy and more natural. My mom and I both got the breakfast sandwich, the English muffin definitely tastes homemade too! And we got a salad- great quality and fresh ingredients. We also got their chocolate chip cookie- it was so chocolate and gooey  theres an inside and outdoor space plus a brewery next door. The. Chef does the better half for breakfast and lunch then hops over to do the brewery's food in the evening. Overall a cute, quality spot! Also pretty quick- so you can't beat that!

reviews.author: Casey T.
reviews.description: Lovely (and popular) spot to get brunch, but they are BUSY! Expect a 2-hour wait if you come during a peak time.  Better Half has ample outdoor seating (and cute pink picnic tables!). I loved their lemonade and cauliflower tots - they were the star of the show. Otherwise, I didn't feel like the food justified the extremely long wait, I would say their menu is pretty on par with other brunch places in the area - it was nothing too special.   I did have a great time here am willing to give them another try at an off peak time! The indoor area was super trendy and ccozy

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: This pandemic has taken us all for a ride. The folks at Better Half had a nice and cozy building then a worldwide pandemic hit that required you to avoid that.exact.environment.  And they rolled with it.   On several occasions, we used their pickup and it was great. They were efficient, considerate (all the utensils and napkins) and the food was always good considering we would eat it while parked at Zilker.  Well, we finally decided to eat there this time. They have an awesome covered...tent or something, that fits up to 60 folks. They even had a heater blowing in that thing!!  And the food, whew. The grilled halloumi plate was so creative, we loved the mix of flavors. The spicy chicken sandwich was different than at other places, in a good way. I left trying to place all the flavors and can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.  A cool bonus is the view from the parking lot. I was able to take a quick picture.

reviews.author: Josh M.
reviews.description: Great vibes. The service has been hit or miss, though. Sometimes I get people that make me feel welcome, other times they seem disinterested. I guess that's how all places are, right?   Love the chicken biscuits. Always get it with donut holes.  The cocktails and coffee are great. I love the little canned cocktails.   One of my favorite brunch spots in Austin.  Dinner is super underwhelming. Can't recommend coming for late eats.

reviews.author: Gurpreet L.
reviews.description: I've only ever come here for happy hour and I highly recommend. It has a wonderful patio area (everything is pink!) and is a good place to work from during the day.   During happy hour, they do a few specials on their beer and sangrias but the real star of the show is their burger deal! They have $6 burgers - meat and veggie. Cant go wrong with that

reviews.author: Zach Y.
reviews.description: This place is really good! I really appreciate the outside seating. Coffee is a little pricy but really good. Great place for outside chilling, pet friendly, cabanas for shade.   The inside is really modern and really fast. They get you your drinks and will walk and deliver them to you outside. Great place for a morning coffee with friends!

reviews.author: Soujanya G.
reviews.description: I hate giving bad reviews, but the portions for a $11 dollar entree were minuscule. The coffee was decent, but I just couldn't get over how small the better half brunch sandwich was. I will say the backyard outdoor seating is really nice as there's some huge trees and the vibes are good, but the sand which didn't really have anything special to it.   Overall disappointed despite the hype around this place.

reviews.author: Kali R.
reviews.description: We walked down to this restaurant recently because we were craving a burger, a beer, and a safe place to enjoy them during the pandemic. Better Half has added a ton of outdoor dining areas and some are even under a tent.   The burger? It was just okay. Kind of small. A bit overdone, a bit dry for me, but then I have high expectations. The fries were crispy and salty and hit the spot.  The Hold Out Brewing beer was lovely, too.   The surroundings? They were outside, so perhaps harder to maintain but the table was sticky and when I got home there were dirt marks on my pants from where I sat on the outside bench.  It was too bad because it is so convenient, but perhaps we will give it another try in a month or two. Maybe it is a better breakfast choice

reviews.author: Arianna L.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch with a friend on a Sunday! They were relatively busy but we got served quickly.  I ordered the waffle iron hashbrowns. The portion was smaller than expected but the food was really good - the had browns were crispy and the Parmesan with the sunny side up egg paired really well with their gravy. I liked how the pickled onions added a sour kick to the gravy, but preferred the dish without the onions.   Would definitely come again and sit outdoors, if the weather permits!

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: Great place to come for light eats and drinks- my friends and I came here in a group of 6 around 8pm on a Friday and found it easy to grab a table on the patio. Parking was also relatively easy since they have their own parking lot. They have happy hour Tues-Fri and Sunday 3-6pm, with $6 burgers! They also have reverse happy hour 9-10pm daily (also $6 burgers). The patio is very dog friendly and there is a self-serve water jug as well to help yourself. The food was delicious and a good portion for the price.

reviews.author: Shelby L.
reviews.description: This is truly one of the most enjoyable meals I've had in a while. We went on Labor Day so it was quite busy and took probably a good 40 minutes to get our food, but it was absolutely worth every minute of the wait.  The Pastrami Sandwich had the best, smokiest pastrami I've ever had and everything from the mushrooms to the bread to the berbere horseradish sauce was just so well executed and damn delicious.   The Big Springy salad was a nice healthier contrast that still tasted interested and decadent (okaay, we added fried chicken, that might not be the healthiest). It was a little light on the cojita-chimichurri dressing so we got some more, and I just wanted to jello shot that condiment cup straight into my mouth it was so good.  I started off with the chagacinno and while it was a tad sweet for my preference, it was still absolutely delicious as well.

reviews.author: Brittney D.
reviews.description: Mmhmm.  Better Half was gudt eatin.  There was a line out the door on Sunday morning but it moved quickly.  Parking was easy.  Shout out to my guy, Dylan, the coffee program manager for my latte.  It was slammin, just like he used to make em in HOU.  For eats, I got a biscuit with avo and the cauli tots- like the cauliflower, not the beet ketchup, but I'm not a beet girl.  Great space.  Great color scape.  Plenty outdoor seating to spread out and catch up with ur folk.  I'll be back.

reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: One of my go-to coffee shops in Austin! I always take my friends and family here on the weekends for brunch. I absolutely love the backyard patio vibes - seems like a very chill spot to just hang out and chat.  I don't really recommend coming here to study or do work as this place can get quite rowdy. The same owners also opened a brewery right next doors called Hold Out Brewing, so you can slowly transition from productivity to drunken stupor if that's your thing.

reviews.author: Desiree D.
reviews.description: Cute little place with a great outdoor area that was dog friendly. Food was pretty good, even if you did have to order things a la carte (burgers/sandwiches had no sides). The cauliflower tots were delicious. Would definitely check this place out again next time I'm in Austin.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Better Half Coffee and Cocktails belongs in the book of Austin AF restaurants. What does that even mean? Innovative menu using fresh ingredients with high prices.   Our table of 3 split the entrees and shared as easy apps to get the full experience of the brunch AND lunch menu. For brunch, we ordered the Waffle Iron Hashbrown, which was literally a plate of overcooked hashbrowns, topped with coffee and cream gravy, cotija cheese, an egg, pickled onions and scallions. Sadly, this was just basic to me (or as Gen Z calls it Cheugy). Nothing that I would die for...  For lunch, we ordered the Vermicelli Salad, the Chilled Ramen, and a side of the Cauliflower Tots. I could not get enough of the Vermicelli Salad and strangely the Cauliflower Tots! The Vermicelli Salad was refreshing and light, and I enjoyed the Pineapple "Fish" Sauce substitute they use to make this dish vegan friendly!!
