The Cauliflowers admittedly looked like burnt bite-sized toast when it arrived, but as soon as I dipped it in the beet ketchup, I couldn't put my fork down.   BEWARE! If you order any of the Frozen Sloppee Frozen Cocktails, this thing will mess you up (in the best form possible). I would advise ordering with caution! The Spicy Peach'arita was my poison of choice, and though delicious, if you add Texas heat, it will melt fast and have you only tasting tequila!

name: Perla's
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Validated Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: I love Perla's! I have been here a handful of times and every time I go it's a positive experience. This past time I went I got the Halibut - it was buttery, flakey, cooked to perfection. I could have gone without the tomato it came with and would have preferred different garnish. My boyfriend got the pasta dish that has lobster in it (I forget the name) but let me tell you...it's to die for! Best thing by far on the menu. My only complaint is that they only offer it limited times of the year. Perla's is so cute. Their patio is first come first serve. I made a reservation so we were seated inside. I wish if you had a reservation they gave you the option to sit outside. Definitely a great date night place. Be ready to spend some money, it isn't cheap, but the quality is 10/10.  Pros: food and atmosphere   Cons: expensive

reviews.author: Gigi B.
reviews.description: Food was decent, but the parking situation ruined our experience and we likely won't return as a result.   There is a parking garage behind Perlas where they supposedly validate your parking. Apparently there is a new system in place in the parking garage that requires you to scan a QR code to pay for parking then somehow you get it validated at the restaurant. However, when you pull into the garage there is no QR code. So I walked to the restaurant to ask how to validate parking. They gave me the QR code but I had to have my license plate. So I had to walk back to my truck to get license plate. By the time I got back to my truck there was already a parking ticket on my truck!   I reached out to the manger of this parking garage, Travis, to explain the situation, but he refused to waive the parking ticket even though I showed him a copy of my receipt from Perlas which proves that my parking should have been free not to mention the confusing process.

reviews.author: Obed F.
reviews.description: Every time we come to Austin we stop by Perla's no matter if its for Breakfast, Lunch or dinner. This time we stopped in for lunch. We got there an hour before our appt and host was very accommodating and sat us early. Not to mention we had our 4 month old in a stroller. We took the option to sit outside because the weather was great and they have an awesome patio. The waiter was very nice and very knowledgeable on the whole food menu and drinks. We wanted get something light since we have been eating so heavy on our vaca.   We split 3 dishes a ceviche, the lobster bisque and the wedge salad. All the 3 were very light, tasty and delicious!! It was exactly what we were looking for.   I would absolutely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Kimberley R.
reviews.description: The location of this restaurant is just fantastic, located in the heart of South Congress. They have a great deck, the service was very friendly and fast. We went for lunch and had the Ahi tuna tostada, calamari and grilled mahi sandwich. The best thing we ate hands down was the tostada. The tuna was like sashimi and it was packed with flavor from the aioli and topped with Serrano. Absolutely delicious! Our other two dishes were good, not great. The mahi sandwich was a bit of a disappointment, especially given it came highly recommended from our server. I felt like it lacked season and was very bland. Regardless I am intrigued and would like to return for dinner some time.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Had to come back and bring a first timer- I had been hyping the food up so much and thank goodness, everything we ordered was on point. I was just kinda disappointed in the service- we waited really long stretches in between visits from our waitress...it just stands out when your expectations of a spot (and the price point) are so high.

reviews.author: Fatmis E.
reviews.description: Great ambiance and food. their tuna tostadas were delicious and the cobb salad  with a twist was surprisingly good.

reviews.author: Linda H.
reviews.description: Great drinks! Tried the ahi tuna tostada and the ceviche. Loved the tostada...the ceviche was...meh. The ambiance and location were cool. Enjoyed the vibe

reviews.author: Adrian N.
reviews.description: Calamari was amazing! I would skip on the lobster roll. Although good, it was a little too pricey for how much you get.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: Love it here. Return every time I'm in Austin. They oysters are skillfully shucked and there is a great selection. The rest of them menu is great from what I've tried as well, though I stick to the seafood.

reviews.author: Mel E.
reviews.description: Erin, GM, was amazing from pre-arrival, arrival and departure. What an amazing young lady! Thanks Erin, for the reservation accommodation and delicious bite.  Jacob, my server, was incredible and every dish he recommended was beyond amazing! It was totally worth the flight. This is huge for me because customer service in my opinion, has declined drastically, so when I rave about an experience such as Perla's, it's #facts! This evening I enjoyed some glasses of Chenin Blanc, from South Africa, some delicious oysters (Jacob chose all of them), fried okra, crab cake and the famous potato crusted sea bass and a sea salt dessert! Thanks Perla's for the amazing experience! Thanks for the warm welcome from the staff outside and the lovely hostesses inside. I'll certainly be back and cannot wait! Be safe. Be blessed. Be kind and enjoy good food! Perla's

reviews.author: Amanda D.
reviews.description: Always been a solid spot for oysters. Happy that they allowed my pup to be in with me... In fact, the place's got a wall of pup pictures... one star less because I was so looking forward to the Spanish Octopus dish but it was a tad too salty.

reviews.author: Denise D.
reviews.description: I probably go here more than any other place when I'm on or near South Congress.  Great seafood, good service and a lovely patio perfect for people watching.

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Been waiting a while to go here, and finally got to make it while it was still nice out; We thought there was supposed to be a happy hour, but it turns out/doesn't seem like there is one anymore unfortunately.  Naturally, we got a few appetizers, oyster shooters and oysters, plus the octopus that came with a savory sauce and potatoes. I'm not a fan of bloody mary's so the shooter wasn't my favorite since that's how they were prepared, and kind of spendy at that. The oysters were a small bit still good; again,  no happy hour pricing.  The octopus was my favorite, grilled perfectly, same as the potatoes, covered in herbs and a butter/mayo sauce that paired nicely.   We both got fish, mine had a bit of spice to it, and the ahi was very nice and fresh; Overall, pleasant meal, more expensive than we would've liked but glad to have tried it. Personally, I think it's better to just get some appetizers/drinks and save the entree for somewhere else; while it's definitely good, I think it's overpriced and could make something comparable for a fraction of the cost.

reviews.author: Brian N.
reviews.description: Dined here on a Saturday night and was lucky to get bar seating without a reservation. The bar tenders served us fairly quickly.  The grilled oysters were excellent, especially with the added Cajun spices.  The fish and chips were nicely battered and very crispy; it also came with a lot of fries.  The portion sizes were big and very filling.

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: We stopped by for a birthday brunch and had a great time. We were promptly seated and greeted by our server, Dylan - he was fantastic. We ordered a variety of shareable dishes, cocktails and several carafes of Mimosa. So pleased that everything was spot on. Definitely worth the trip if you're visiting or new to ATX - I do recommend.

reviews.author: Nada S.
reviews.description: Beautiful place .. was visiting Austin for the first time and I was extremely hungry and could not wait for a barbecue place. Stopped by this and it did not disappoint

reviews.author: Kevin M.
reviews.description: Service was professional and prompt. The server, Donovan, was quite excellent at providing suggestions and information without need to go back and consult a chef or manager. What this says is that the restaurant (and chef) ensure the employees taste what they serve so they can provide info to diners. This is one mark of excellence.   The setting is beautiful. Since it was a pleasant autumn day, we opted for outdoor dining and enjoyed our decision. It's hard to write about the vibe but this is closer to a low-key fine dining. It isn't fancy but the food and service make it close.   We had grilled (or broiled) oysters and they were as good as the ones I had at Felix's in the French Quarter. We also had a sampler of oysters in the half-shell and we were guided by Donovan who knew the types of oysters and sources and showed us that by flipping the shell, the underside gives clues as to the waters they originated from.   Tuna Tartare was excellent (I've only had it as good in Aspen, Co for 3x the price).  Then smoked octopus and grilled red snapper. Both of those were outstanding too.   Price is reasonable for the quality but our bill was over $175 (we ate a ton and didn't care) this restaurant is right on price considering the quality on the plate and from the staff. We will definitely go again.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: Perla's is an amazing date night spot for many reasons. The staff is accommodating, the food is tasty, and the environment is welcoming. I would definitely come back!

reviews.author: Alan J.
reviews.description: Our first time here for an occasion with my wife's second cousins. Two guests split a dozen oysters and loved them. We split the calamari and it was among the best we've had in Texas. Top two, maybe top five ever. My wife had the redfish on the half shell and loved it. I ordered an oyster Po Boy but was disappointed in the size of the oysters and was very salty. The shoe string fries were fine by my tastes despite what some reviews state. Kind of high price for what we got for lunch but that's what you get now with the CA invasion of Austin. Seafood seemed fresh which is rare in Texas.

reviews.author: Chris P.
reviews.description: Amazing oyster selection and great service. Can't wait to come back and try the calamari it looked awesome!

reviews.author: Lizzy W.
reviews.description: We were absolutely blown away by the waitstaff at Eberly's. The complimentary valet was such a great surprise with the traffic from SXSW. Our group was in town for a bachelorette and they were so accommodating. They provided several things to make our bride feel special. I would recommend Eberly's over and over again!

reviews.author: Sabrina C.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed Eberly for dinner. We had a group of 7, with a Saturday night reservation. Our server, Sofie, was great- attentive, knowledgeable and had great recommendations for food and drinks. I ordered the brussel sprouts as an appetizer, beef ragu for my main meal, the watchtower for my drink because I love blackberries, and the sticky toffee pudding as my dessert. All of these items were absolutely delicious!   Since we had dinner reservations, the atmosphere inside was intimate with lights lowered, and candles at the table. There is no dress code, but it is a place where you can dress up.

reviews.author: Steven X.
reviews.description: The ambiance is fantastic. But just be aware that if you plan on being in the atrium, it'll get hot during the day (unless you get there in the morning).   The restaurant staff is friendly as well  However, the food could be much better, especially for the price. I'd do a hard pass on the smash burger; the meat was over cooked and chewy and the fries extremely basic. Definitely not worth anywhere near $18. That said, I did quite enjoy the brisket hash, brisket was very flavorful and tender, but also quite pricey.

reviews.author: W C.
reviews.description: We were here on Tuesday night to celebrate our anniversary. Overall, it was a nice experience, but the only thing that really wow-ed us was the decor. One of us had been to the back bar area for drinks before, but we were in the main dining room this time around and the atmosphere is lovely. We didn't enjoy the massive circular booth that we were in but whatever. It was definitely quiet around 6:00 pm when we arrived, so we were happy to be leaving once it got busy.   Started with drinks, and Eberly is keeping the trend going of idiotic names for them. The mezcal in the "Don't Look Back" completely overpowered the rest of the drink, including the apricot puree which had sounded like a promising addition. The "Nick the Lounge Singer" (eye roll emoji here) and "lonesome traveler" were fine.  For food, we got the beet salad and the grilled octopus as starters. For the salad, the beets were cooked (what the hell was "pickled"?, um no) and ain't no way that was labne unless it came out of a plastic jar. It wasn't bad, per se, but it's annoying when dishes don't come out as advertised. Re. the octopus: it was sliced up, like into PIECES. What the actual F? Are you KIDDING? Why on god's green earth would you serve the octopus in slices unless you 1) precooked it and then are just heating it up or 2) are really trying to get away with such a measly amount. That dish was so creative and delicious (seriously), but the presentation just ruined it. For mains, the pasta ragu was light on the meat but tasted good; the short rib hit the spot--perfectly cooked and the flavors popped.  Dessert was nothing impressive: couple random ice cream flavors and a mediocre frangipane tart. Service was kinda fine. It took the guy a long time to come over initially (even though the place was dead) and he forgot to put in the house salad that we also ordered. But after that, he managed to get the job done.  Bottom line: good, not great, though we'd be willing to go again. 3.5 stars: one of us thinks it should be rounded down, but the other thinks it should be rounded up and he's going to win this time. 4 stars, but you can and should do better, Eberly.

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: In short: definitely don't go to this place for special occasion, below average food and sucky service for higher price!!  We made a reservation for our anniversary brunch almost two weeks before, and mentioned in our reservation under special occasion, so when we checked in, saw there garden covered patio was not full, and asked if we can get a table there, and the girl who was checking in told, they have a reservation for that place at 12:45, we were there @ 11:30 and I asked we too made a reservation and there's no where you can pick a place while making reservation, then she thought for a minute and told, you can add it as a request  So you pick them for a special occasion and specify it in the reservations and request something, which they could've done, but they say no and give you a lame excuse??  Our host was okay, dint even bother to check even once if everything was okay.  Food is okay nothing special, we ordered milk rolls, hot chicken sandwich, French toast, El Paso( cocktail )  Milk rolls: it looked glossy, but it's just like Hawaiian rolls, warm on top and cold at the bottom, they haven't even warmed up thoroughly.  Cocktail was just okay   French toast: this was good, but single slice French toast   For$$$  Hot chicken sandwich: there was nothing hot in it, it's just dry hard chicken breast in between the bun, we dint taste any white cheddar or burnt onion aioli as they have described it.  So overall I don't recommend this place, and especially not for special occasion!!

reviews.author: Katherine M.
reviews.description: Cool decor inside and good food, albeit priced higher than it should be for the level of service received. I can't knock anything for slow service given most places are short staffed, but it just felt like they weren't really present for a place with a nearly $100 aged ribeye.  That said, I would come back again just for the cocktails and dessert, including the sticky toffee pudding and the Dont look back Mezcal drink. The harissa chicken tasted great and was very juicy but only came with a couple pieces of asparagus and not enough vegetable.

reviews.author: Yvonne C.
reviews.description: This is possibly the best cauliflower I've ever eaten. There was so much flavor and the perfect amount of cauliflower. There are some places I've gone to where they have some sort of expensive cauliflower dish and it'll only have 5 pieces of bland cauliflower. It kind of feels like you're getting robbed. Eberly does not do that! Their dish is an entire head of cauliflower that has so much flavor and detail. It's obvious in every bite that they put effort into creating it. One of my new favorite places!

reviews.author: Amber L.
reviews.description: We had a great experience here.  It was an anniversary weekend for us and we went to the Eberly to celebrate.  They gave us a nice card when we got there. Very kind.  Started with the Cold Fashioned which was very nicely made, though I have never had one of these, I enjoyed the flavors and tastes.  I will definitely try it again.  I went for the spicy chicken sandwich which was broiled not fried, I loved the flavors and the coleslaw and tangy spicy sauce. It comes with tons of fries.  Also tried the Avacado toast which was nice.  Our strawberry coffee cake came out last (not bad, just were expecting it earlier).  It was very nice, lots of flavors and textures.  Our server seemed to want us to leave though as she kept asking us if we wanted to wrap up the cake , if we wanted anything else or the bill.  We were only there for 45 min total.  That was strange.  Overall great place for breakfast.

reviews.author: Doug T.
reviews.description: We came to Eberly on our son's request. There's not any parking and they have complimentary valet parking. The place is really non assuming but once you walk in wow. Very modern. Very dark but chic.   We started off with the Japanese milk rolls. They were pretty good. Very soft and good. Then had the mussels. Very good. Cooked just right and with the mussels they give you bread. Soak it in the mussels and it's really good. Then we had the potato leek croquettes. These were pretty good. Nice and soft inside but all of these were really good appetizers.   I had the short ribs and it was really good. Very tender. Very well cooked and so good. We also got the sides of crushed potatoes, Brussel Sprouts, and asparagus. All three were very good. Loved the potatoes. Little crispy but soft and good. Brussel Sprouts and asparagus and really good too. Spot on and really good.  My wife got the salmon and she was really happy with this. I got a bite and it was cooked perfectly. Very moist. So good.   Our server was pretty good. She kept our water glasses always filled even when they provide a bottle of water on the table.   So overall,  great food and loved everything about this meal from the appetizers, entree, and sides. Very filling for us. Very fresh food. Really good service and yet the ambiance was intimate but little loud. We had a really good meal and enjoyed it very much. I would have no problem visiting again cause the menu changes so you don't have to worry about same old same old. Enjoy. We did

reviews.author: Pranav A.
reviews.description: Beautiful interior and friendly staff. Our food took a while to come out, but that was most likely due to the fact that my group consisted of 12 people and most of the food came out in batches so that nobody got their food alone.  The food was tasty, especially the French Toast and milk buns (both are must gets). The crispy potatoes can be skipped. They aren't that great.  The other items we ordered received good feedback overall though, so I would still recommend Eberly. The interior, service, ambiance, and food each have their own highlights, so all together they make this out to be a good brunch spot.

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Nice place near Zilker Park.   We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. They checked all the boxes.  Service was great. Everyone working there contributed to make sure we had what we needed.  Cocktails are a star attraction. Lots of interesting twists on classics.  The food was very interesting. I had the short ribs which were fantastic. My wife had the harissa chicken which she loved.  Topped it off with dessert and coffee. The apple tart was great. The only part of the evening that was a disappointment was the coffee. I'd definitely pass on this.  Can't wait to go back and try more options.

reviews.author: Andrew B.
reviews.description: Eberly is a gorgeous restaurant with solid food, drink, and service. 100% the kind of place I'd choose for a first date if I was in my mid 20s and wanted to impress. Hell, even in my mid 30s this place still hits. It's like suddenly living life through an Instagram filter.   My partner and I carbed up with Japanese milk rolls, mushroom mafaldini, and braised pork cheek ragu. All were delicious. Roasted banana crème brûlée and apple frangipane tart were even better. But I think my favorite items here were the cocktails. I highly recommend the Don't Look Back if you like mezcal. I never know what to do with mezcal other than drink it neat, so whenever a place nails a mezcal cocktail, I'm always impressed. Loved the Tristezza and Watchtower as well, but they all sounded great. Definitely need to return for the Anejo Manhattan.  Only thing holding me back from giving it 5 stars is the fact that I've only been here once, and we were seated at a bar high top. While the bar is super cool, and I want to try dining in The Study with some friends next time to get the full experience.

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: Went here for NYE Galactic Rodeo event! It was super fun! The whole place is enormous. They had multiple seating areas and a bar when you step in with plenty of space to walk around. The whole restaurant is designed elegantly and has wood features on the bar. I am really curious to see what it's like functioning normally.  The event had a lot of food, they served us BBQ with a full spread. The brisket, Mac n cheese and potato salad were my favorites. I have no idea if it was catered or if the restaurant made it, but it was really good.  They had a DJ downstairs with awesome decor and lights. Upstairs is Cedar Tavern, which I think maybe partners with Eberly or is owned by the same people? It was a good drinking area, with games and a mechanical bull. They had Symply Courtney hosting the mechanical bull rides and he was very entertaining. We talked to him after the show and he was super nice as well.   There was also a guy doing lasso tricks with a rope! I did not catch his name but, he was very talented.   The rest of the staff was really awesome too.   Overall 10/10 event, would definitely do another NYE here and am super curious to try the restaurant on a normal basis.

reviews.author: Marwa S.
reviews.description: Came to Texas for a little vacation. Loved the food and the vibe around us. Everyone was super friendly and the food was really good

reviews.author: Ani S.
reviews.description: Came here for mine and my friends bday! Such amazing ambiance, service, food and drinks. Obvs we had made reservations since it's always so busy. I had the halibut with the side of crushed potatoes and it was delicious. Absolutely yummy with my spicy margarita. The entire staff also signed a bday card for us which was so cute and a little added touch that was appreciated. We had a wonderful time and even lost track of time to go to our other reservation!

reviews.author: Aarti P.
reviews.description: In person, in dining room, reunion dinner!!! Yes!!  After a long 15 months of not meeting in groups, my original core ATX friends decided we needed, nay, had to meet up.. Eberly was unanimously chosen out of 4 options.  I have always loved the interior of this location, yet to nab seats in the Atrium :(, one day it will happen.   Our evening was just perfect, from the Service, Meal - Starters to Dessert, Wine to Post dinner drinks at the bar.   The reason for 4 stars not 5, the vegetarian pasta entree didn't deliver, the menu description had potential, what I was served paled disappointingly in comparison to everything else that graced our table.   I just noticed that the menu has changed just like our season has. Dinner date anyone? :)

reviews.author: Cynthia W.
reviews.description: The restaurant is BEAUTIFUL!!  The atmosphere, fantastic!  Service was good.  I was so looking forward to having brunch here but was thoroughly disappointed.  In a haste, I chose my usual brunch fare, Eggs Benedict, without reading the ingredients and questioning what exactly was in my meal.  Prior to my going,  I did see many favorable reviews regarding the Eggs Benedict however, none mentioned Braised Collar Greens.  Yes!  Eggs Benedict with Collard Greens.  I'm a HUGE fan of vegetables but let's just say that after trying it at Eberly, I'm NOT a fan of Eggs Benedict with Collard Greens.    I'll be back, Eberly.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: My first visit to Eberly was the end of Jan of 2021 when I came down to visit a wonderful woman. We decided to frequent a few restaurants that evening so we limited our culinary adventure to appetizers. As for beverages I opted for the Piattelli Melbec which was a very well balanced wine, full of flavor but it didn't overpower the diverse plates we ordered.   We opted for the Kanpachi Crudo which was a very pleasant dish. The amberjack fish was delicate and had a nice light flavor. The jap/cucumber broth was very well conceived complimenting the fish, allowing it to take center stage, while just adding hints of heat and earthiness. The radish provided a nice crunch to enhance the flavor profile in terms of how it hit the pallet.  Now, I used to be a chef on the eastern shore, but I've never had octopus worth mentioning nor have I cooked it myself. However, and I'm not being hyperbolic, the octopus blew my mind. It was tender, flavorful, smoky, and had an ever so slight seafood brine to it. The romesco anchored the whole dish, pushing the natural flavors of the octopus to the forefront while enhancing the perfumed smoke juxtaposing it with the red peppers and slight tang of the sourdough, only uncovering it after several pleasurable chews. This dish was my favorite dish I've had so far in Austin.   I came back to Eberly in June of 2021. My date and I ordered three small dishes which never seemed to live up to my fond memory of a my previous visit. I opted to leave my wine comfort zone and ordered the Domaine Nais Rose wine. It was light and perfect for a hot July night with subtlety being the most distinguishing characteristic.    The first dish was the Tuna Poke which I liked but not loved. This had more to do with my anticipation of a higher sesame profile than the vision of the head chef. Aside from that, the tuna was fresh and sized right while the yuzo soy was divine offering, the perfect hint of fermentation.    Dish two were the steamed mussels. Typically I'm not a huge mussel fan (sorry Arnold Schwarzennegger) but these were outstanding. The mussels were cooked to perfection and all were opened (ie not dead before the cooking process) while being large and succulent. The white wine added a perfect spike of acidity while the 'nduja was flavorful complimenting the seafood. The corn added a nice sweet pop to the dish and the herbs were spot on.   As I previously stated, I had the octopus 6 months earlier. I considered telling the wonderful woman I had been courting I wanted the octopus again almost as much as I wanted to see her, however this was internal monolog of which it was never outwardly spoken. Joking aside perhaps the previous experience was a fairytale that I built from a hut into a castle in my mind. The octopus was once again was flawless. Being boiled for the absolute perfect amount of time then getting a kiss of smoke from the grill. However, my letdown came with the avocado-cilantro puree. The acidity didn't compliment the dish as my previous experience and the romesco. Rather it overpowered the fish, competing for the dominate flavor in my mouth. The olives and pine nuts were ok but the battle of sauce vs protein diverted my attention from enjoyment to befuddlement. My take away is, and this is paramount, Eberly knows how to provide a wonderful culinary experience and can cook Octopus! It is well worth your time and money to try this exhilarating experience. This restaurant is one of my favorites in town and the front of the house operations work flawlessly with in-depth knowledge of all customer centric aspects.

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: I had never noticed this place and I drive right by it all the time. Valet parking for tips. Impressive interior. Couldn't tell if the bathroom was clean (one bathroom for everyone) it was very dark in there. We had reservations for dinner but gathered early thinking we'd sit at the bar but you need a reservation at the bar. I had the halibut which was fine, nothing special. I added an order of asparagus which was generous and covered in a lot of yummy sauce.

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: This place is pretty good. Cool vibe. Great for a date or brunch with pals. Food is really good, I recommended the monkey bread.   Be careful if you sit in the middle atrium section, it's a cool place to sit but it's very humid in there, almost no air flow.

reviews.author: Joshua M.
reviews.description: In the latest wave of gentrification in this town, it seems like all I can find are hipster breweries that serve "craft" beer and overpriced food served on rectangular plates. If you like that kind of crap, go to aqua brew, you animal. If you want to go somewhere with cheap drinks and cool people (and if you live north of campus like this guy), look no further than Treff's. Some highlights.  You call it nights and you call it week:  Every Sunday, Treff's does $2.50 you call its, and $2.00 you call its on Tuesday. In addition to that, Treff's picks one week out of every month to be You call it week. That means $2 you call its all week. Going there, getting piss drunk, and stumbling back to my apartment, is among my fondest memories.   Atmosphere:  This place is dirty and divey in the best of ways. I used to go here with my friend from work all the time, and I always enjoyed seeing the bartenders and regulars. Really interesting people. Another upside is the patio, which allows filthy smokers like myself to smoke, drink, and have interesting conversations with other people. Another thing to mention, though, is that Treff's is much more of working people's bar. If you're a frat bro or sorority girl looking to blow mommy and daddy's money on a night of partying, you probably won't have a lot in common with the people here.  The glasses: This is just a little nitpick of mine, but I always hate going to the square and getting served drinks in a plastic cup. Treff's gets ridiculously busy some nights, and they still manage to serve all of their booze in glass, which is something I like. On another note, the bartenders here are absolute rock stars, and they don't take shit from anyone.   I haven't gone in a while since I don't have anyone to go with, but you can bet your ass the first place I'm taking my girlfriend when she turns 21 is gonna be Treff's.

reviews.author: Todd B.
reviews.description: I wandered around the square and didn't find anything besides frat boys doing brunch. Found my way to this place and it was great. Not for everyone but if you want a local crew and a few cold drinks and shots this is your place. I loved it and it will be even better when the upstairs is open. Not for children. Adults only in a drinking sense.

reviews.author: Kick I.
reviews.description: Patrick T. is full of BS- he did not open The Tavern when he was 25.  It was in existence way before he blew into San Marcos, and was known as the coolest, anti-frat bar in San Marcos.  That's why he bought it from Andy and Ben Linn, original owners.  He has expanded, added alot of TV s and updated the interior, but it will never be the place it was in the late 80's.  Keep blowing smoke, Patrick, - the Green Parrot is calling your name.

reviews.author: Enrique T.
reviews.description: They obviously water down their liquor. Had 7+ shots and only felt buzzed. We are not heavy drinkers in general.

reviews.author: Janeisy S.
reviews.description: Treffs is a nice casual spot to hangout, drink, play games and have a good time. It's a nice gem away from the square. They have $2 you call it week once a month! Can't beat it. Karaoke is also offered on Sundays, which is my favorite day to visit. Different events are hosted just about every day of the week. Although they don't serve food, they allow you to order at the restaurants near by and enjoy it there while washing it down with a cold alcoholic drink. Pretty awesome!

reviews.author: Estefania Z.
reviews.description: I loved Treff's until they kicked out my brother.ñ for some lame excuse. One of the bartenders is racist af and he should be kicked out.

reviews.author: Re'Ven S.
reviews.description: I love the $2 you call it weekalthough not all drinks are $2 and they fail to inform you of this before ordering it. I was willing to look pass this until I went in around 12am and had a few drink and was allowed to order a drink at 1:52am and they close at 2am. At 2:03 they bouncer was stand at our table demanding that two of my girlfriends and I chug our drinks and leave when we stated we'd like to not get drunk and drive the entire bar staff proceed to attack us and demand we finish our drinks, that we had just got and paid for, and leave or they'd take them. I felt very uncomfortable and attack so my friends and I just left. It was not a good way to end my night.

reviews.author: Eva R.
reviews.description: The bouncers and bartenders are always so friendly and have always enjoyed going to get a drink and chill. 10/10

reviews.author: Travis M.
reviews.description: It's Treffs.  Great owner and bartenders. It's got a ton of $2 you call it weeks and every Tuesday.

reviews.author: Lee W.
reviews.description: 3 stars because the ratio of ADULTS to college kids was surprisingly good. i.e. greater than 3:1. Im 48 and looking to not be around college kids every time I go grab a beer. Im kinda done with that nonsense, ya get me? I'll know more next time. Cool place.

reviews.author: Alyssa C.
reviews.description: My friends and I were here this past Friday with other work friends and we ordered a round of drinks. A few minutes later another friend met up with us and brought a round of shots. Within 10 minutes of being there a bouncer came up to us and told us we need to leave because we were "too drunk". I told him we weren't and we hadn't drank at all before we got there, we had all just been at a work function. He told us the bartender saw us walking to the bathroom "looking drunk". He wouldn't let us finish our drinks that we had just been served and only made the 4 people with shots out of my friend group leave. I think the staff there is racist just like other reviews are saying. Won't be coming back.

reviews.author: Anon A.
reviews.description: Well liquors were $2 tonight, and we were served well vodka and charged $6 a shot! The bartender who is also manager and share-holder DID NOT MENTION TO US  that well vodka in the form of a pickle shot would be $6. As a longtime bartender being served by a long term bartender, when I'm told "wells are $2" I trusted that Chad would be honest with us. Instead, he took us to the cleaners. If I could give no stars I would. I have been in San Marcos for over 10 years. About 6 years ago I was man-handled by a door guy for no reason. I did not return to Treff's for almost 4 years. Since then, I have gone back a handful of times in hopes that it was just "one bad apple", but now I see that the employees at Treff's are out for nothing more than money. Even the door guy tonight was short and smile-less. I have received nothing less than awful service at this bar and I will not be returning.

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: I would definitely love to give Treff's more stars but to myself it is a solid 3.5.   This was my second visit to Treff's because the first time i had been there i did not have a great experience. However, I am a big fan a second chances because who knows what might had been going on that night.   The drink prices are very reasonable. Whiskey Sours only $3.50 and then they have some killer drink specials during the week I believe on Sundays and Tuesdays they have -You - Call -  Its- for only $2!!   The upstairs bar area has a bunch of darts to play and even a pac-man arcade game to entertain with.   As for this little dive, I would return.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: As a graduate of Texas State, I lived up the street from Treff's and spent moderate amount of time and money here. Great little place. A toss between "dive" and "college bar", this establishment has cheap drink specials and the students know it! Beer selection is moderate, but for a college hangout there's a few local and craftbeers in the mix of domestic "moneymaker" beers.  The bar gets super busy, especially during "$2 Tuesdays" when everything is $2 and I mean EVERYTHING! With other various specials during the week, this is a must if you're a student looking to have a good time and stretch you're student loan/ scholarship/ college fund/ or emergency credit card that mom gave you just a little more...

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Monday: $5 Pitcher Beer Night  Tuesday: $2 You Call It  Cool joint, cheap drinks and usually always pretty full inside. Oh yeah, and Happy Hour starts Early @ 2pm.  Parking is a little limited but there is more behind Grins.   Good place if you just wanna get away from the Square or try something different.

reviews.author: Karson E.
reviews.description: Cheryl is great. Prices are good. Happy hour deals are fantastic, and games are available to play upon request.

reviews.author: Mindy N.
reviews.description: Awesome bar with a great, casual, cozy environment. It's perfect for nights where you just want to be in the comfort of good company and drinks. The people are what really makes this place! Brandon, our bartender that night, was a blast to get to know and talk to. Excited to come back!

reviews.author: Alicia D.
reviews.description: Love this bar! It is fun and down to earth. Great drink specials! Best nights are 2 dollar u call it Tuesdays and Sundays! Sundays also has karaoke and they play all the football games!

reviews.author: Lindsey H.
reviews.description: So I went here on a Saturday.  The inside was wayyyy too loud, and very little people were inside. Their selection of beers was so/so, although I had heard that they had more than what they actually had.  The parking lot was awful. Construction going on and one way in and out. Only about 10-13 cars could park and you can forget it if you're driving a truck, as the guy driving a f250 found out after hitting the parked Mercedes.  Not a great place for a huge group of people, but not bad for a San Marcos bar. When visiting just be wary of the parking lot and crazy drivers.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: So I'm usually at Treff's on Tuesdays for $2 you-call-its (best deal on the best night to go) but tonight was a friend's birthday and she wanted to have a few drinks there before heading to Austin.   Well, as usual, we squished into a parking spot in the front of the tavern, walked in and sat at an open bar stool. I ordered an Ace pear cider and started chatting with friends while the jukebox was going with a vast array of music choices! Thats the beauty of a jukebox and I love the diversity!  Okay so I decided to check in (via Yelp) and saw that they had an offer for $2 drinks which really excited me because it wasn't a Tuesday and I still could get some $2 drinks? HELL YEAH!  WELLLLLLL.... it was more like a HELLLLLL NO because the bartender didn't allow me to redeem my deal. He even said he texted the owner and that the owner had no idea what kind of deal I was talking about? Well, the offer is still open on my Yelp app and I plan to find the owner next time I'm at the bar and ask him about it because that offer didn't magically come to be!!!  Anyway, yes Treff's is a super chill, casual and cool bar but they lost some points with not accepting my Yelp offer (I mean that's what the offers are there for hellloooooo)!! Guess I'll stick to only going in on Tuesdays...

name: Loro
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Highly recommend Loro for both Austinites and visitors alike. Fusion between the owners of a popular BBQ spot and a high-end sushi restaurant, It's a great representation of the Austin food scene, with creative dishes consisting of both BBQ and Asian flavors. The patio has great vibes.   Get the potatoes, you won't regret it.

reviews.author: Dean L.
reviews.description: Food is awesome, but the system sucks. On a Monday at 1pm, we ordered a brisket sandwich, two salads, and a zucchini dish. The salads came to the table after 10 minutes about 10 minutes apart. Then the sandwich came about 5 minutes after that. After another 20 min, and we finally flagged down an employee who implied that the server probably gave up because of where we're sitting (which is out back with everyone else). She came back to tell us that we weren't charged for it, and would bring it out anyway. She did, promptly, and it was delicious.  The Mandarin margaritas are rockin', though small.

reviews.author: Melanie Y.
reviews.description: One of Austin's most famous restaurants - created by the owner of Franklin BBQ and sushi chef of Uchi!  Perfect for large groups and almost always packed, Loro creates their dishes with a bit of an East Asian inspired twist and Texan BBQ spirit! The rice bowls come with a fish sauce that's really delicious, and pair well with the small portions of meat.   The shrimp was flavorful and the smoked prime bavette was incredibly tender - you won't overeat here with the portion sizes, but it's a great experience to try out with a group or on a date! The boozy mango slush was also SO yummy and definitely boozy.  - Crispy Potatoes ($6.25) - Chicken Karaage ($10.50) - Texas Sweet Corn ($6) - Sesame Rice Noodles ($5.25) - Curry Marinated Shrimp Rice Bowl ($14.50) - Smoked Prime Bavette Rice Bowl ($14.50) - Mango Boozy Slush

reviews.author: Emmett T.
reviews.description: What a clever idea to pair concepts from two of the more recognizable Austin eateries in Franklin Barbecue and Uchi. The result is an Asian fusion smokehouse serving unique takes on some classic items. We called in a fairly large to-go order and then drove over to the location in the South Lamar District to pick up the food. The place was half full for a Monday evening so it wasn't overly busy. There were a couple of outside patios with seating along with a spacious interior dining area that had booths, high-top tables, and picnic style tables along with a bar.  Bar Food, Snacks and Veggies, Meats, Sandwiches, Rice Bowls, and Sweets were the menu categories. Our picks were the following... * Crunchy Sweet Corn Fritters (served with sriracha aioli and cilantro) * Crunchy Cabbage Salad (served with cashew-ginger vinaigrette, cucumber, and lemon zest) * Coconut Scented Rice (seasoned with lime leaves and lemongrass) * Tomato and Cucumber Salad (served with cantaloupe, cilantro oil, lemon zest, and mint) * Sesame Rice Noodles (seasoned with chili vinaigrette, black sesame, and green onion) * Malaysian Chicken Bo Ssam (marinated with yellow-curry yuzu vinaigrette and Thai basil) * Char Siew Pork Belly (marinated with hoisin sauce and celery) * Smoked Turkey Breast (served with apricot chutney and chicken skin) * Smoked Beef Brisket (seasoned with chili gastrique and Thai herbs)  The standouts to me were the fritters, pork belly, and turkey breast. The sweetness of the fritters was contrasted with the spicy aioli. The pork belly was sliced into small square pieces and coated with the familiar flavor of hoisin. The fruitiness from the chutney and the crispiness of the chicken skin gave a citrus tone and texture, respectively, to enhance the smoked turkey.  I do think the meat servings were small for the charged prices. For example, there was maybe a half pound of smoked beef which cost nearly $20. The quality of the meats was good, but I think the brisket was not quite up to the Franklin standard. There had been a buzz about Loro when it first opened in 2018. It has been on my to-do list for Austin, and I was happy to be able to sample a variety of offerings.

reviews.author: Andrew W.
reviews.description: I love Loro! I've been to their location in Dallas before, but the OG Austin location probably has an even better setup with a larger partially-covered outdoor patio area.  I really enjoy casual counter-serve type places like Loro where you just order everything at the bar - easier for big parties like we had too. Loro's draft list and drink options are expansive and fantastic, and you can't stop by here without trying their boozy mango or coffee slushie (they sadly ran out of the coffee slushies when we went ).  The food at Loro is some of the best food pairing for casual weekend drinking that I've ever had. Szechuan spiced karaage - just get multiple orders of this for the table and thank me later. The brisket is smoked onsite under Aaron Franklin's supervision, and is absolutely fantastic in a fusion pairing with pickled onions, chili gastrique, and Thai herbs.

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: A culinary delight pulled off without pretentiousness. Everything was just perfect. Tomato and Cucumber Salad (cantaloupe, cilantro oil, lemon zest, mint), Char Siew Pork Belly (house hoisin sauce, celery), Smoked Prime Bavette (shishito salsa verde, cilantro, pickled onion), Oak Smoked Salmon(cucumber-yuzu broth, parsley, lemon), Coconut Scented Rice (lime leaves, lemongrass), Oak Grilled Zucchini (cashew sambal, walnut bagna cauda, lemon), And Smoked Beef Brisket (chili gastrique, thai herbs).   It should be noted that the brisket id only available until 4pm! This brisket is amazing and worth the wait.

reviews.author: Kerri M.
reviews.description: Loro is a must if you live in or are visiting Austin! While they don't take reservations, waiting isn't too bad there. We got there around 6 on a Saturday night and were told it would be a 30 minute wait for 2 people. They have outdoor seating and a bar outside so you can hang out and have a drink while you wait. We ended up getting seated 15 minutes later (I think we just got lucky).  Once you get seated, you have to go to the front and order and then they bring it out. It gets pretty crowded at the front, so not quite ideal if you are planning on having multiple drinks or ordering more food, so it might be easiest to order all of them at once.  I ended up getting the Typhoon and frozen gin and tonic to drink and then shared the crispy potatoes, brisket, brisket rice bowl, and rice noodles. The food came out super quick, but unfortunately, the brisket was cold. All of the other food was great and even the brisket in the rice bowl was warm, it was just the brisket by itself.  Overall, I was really impressed by the uniqueness and flavor of all of the food and drinks! They also have a decent amount of meatless options too if you are vegetairan! I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Rolando N.
reviews.description: Very interesting fusion of Asian and smoked BBQ. Executed perfectly and boy does it work.   Do yourself a favor and sample the different appetizers. Crispy potatoes, chicken karranga, grilled snap peas and the wonton chips and salsa were delicious. Very unique and interesting flavors that blend well together.   The pork belly and tofu bowls were well portioned and equally delicious.   Crispy chicken and brisket sandwiches were also hits at the table.   Service was prompt and friendly.   We will be back.

reviews.author: Frank P.
reviews.description: Stop everything you are doing in Austin Texas.  If you are a fan of Franklin BBQ..... and ....., Uchi Japanese restaurant s.... Go to LORO!!!  It is the fusion of both of these fantastic restaurants!!!  I couldn't believe the great food and beverages we had here at LORO!  We started with the Heifenweis beer on tap which was very good.  We sat at the bar and the bartender suggested the flank steak Meat plate along with the pork belly rice bowl, snap peas and sesame noodles.  I don't know what made me agree to order this mess of food but when it came out I was sure happy I did!!   Our bartender's name was Huy and he sure knew his stuff!  The sesame noodles were fantastic!!  Kind of Pho like noodles but with Al dente texture served fried with sesame oil!  FAntastic!!!  Then the flank steak served with pickled radishes and cilantro!!  Really good!!  The snap peas with Kimchi sauce was super tasty but the pork belly rice bowl was the best of the lot.  If you come to LORO'a you should get this dish.  It's hard to explain but it's a fusion of thick bacon, rice, some sort of veggies and a  ginger soy sauce that would make you smack yourself in the head if you'd forgotten to mix it in.  It's simply magic.  It's ridiculous.  You gotta have it.    We paired it up with an Argentine wine "Trento Negro" which was again fantastic!!     We finished with a cookie that was kinda chocolate chip and kinda macadamia nut mix.... Served with a coffee slush that knocked our socks off!!!  Ambiance was Asian smokehouse cool vibes.  Staff was friendly and unbelievably helpful to midwesterners like  us.  Bathrooms were clean and prices were reasonable.    This is 5 star food served in a super cool atmosphere with great prices.  Do not go to Austin without trying this place.   It should be at the top of your list!!

reviews.author: Jazel M.
reviews.description: To be very clear, I am a total snob about Asian food. I am like why ruin a good thing by fusing it with other things?? ITS GREAT THE WAY IT IS!   HOWEVER! Loro did a great job. I loved the corn fritters and I got the cabbage salad and added grilled shrimp. Everything tasted amazing! I love the atmosphere and I currently work close enough to walk there. Perfect outside seating for the weather when I went. I will have to go back for happy hour. Food came quickly but there were a TON of people so if you are still COVID paranoid, probably just try to take out! Good luck!

reviews.author: Chris L.
reviews.description: Loro is so very popular, but they make waiting fun with a cute waiting area.  They have an extended parking which makes it less stressful.  I love ordering at the counter, but you have to be pretty strategic.  Look at the menu while wait and send someone to order immediately so that you can get that food!  We usually order a lot so that we can try everything.  Below is what I remembered from my trip:  My partner loved the Brisket Sandwich especially the sauce that came with it.  The Turkey was good, but odd.  It comes with mandarin oranges so it's kinda like have cranberries on Turkey near during thanksgiving   Their version of karage was surprisingly great!  Char Siew Pork Belly - pieces were great.  They were sweet and soft and came with hoisin,  Coconut Rice  had perfect flavor  Corn Fritters were hyped for me.  It was more about the sauce that made them interesting and you have to eat them right away.  Letting them sit for more than 5 minutes ruins the texture.  Smoked Beef Brisket was soft and amazing   Wonton Chips were also a bit hyped for me and they are VERY oily.  Potatoes were basic, but parents enjoyed them.  Singapore noodles are a solid crowd pleasure.  It's definitely a unique space with a kitchen that tries to be innovative.  It's definitely worth a shot.  Not all dishes are winners, but if you order enough you'll find something you like!

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: Cultural Culinary   The quick review is the food was excellent, craft beer ambiance, and dog friendly with outdoor seating.  I have driven along South Lamar for a long time but never stopped by.  My impression was it was too Asian for my wife where she may not like the taste.  After talking to my niece who ate there said we would definitely love it, so in looking for a new place to try Loro was on top of the list.  Built under huge oak trees Loro provides many seating options from bar, indoor, patio, and outdoor seating. It was a bit chilly so decided to sit at the bar noticing some sat outside under large heaters.  First you find your place to sit and then order at the bar.  It seemed to work well and gives that country bbq feel.   Taps of local brews were in front of me with decorations along the wall perhaps from a garage sale adding to the ambiance of Austin coolness. The menu was on a peg wood wall with old school lettering or scan the QR code using your phone. I ordered the Oak Smoked Salmon with Coconut Scented Rice. The bartender noted to return on either Sunday or Monday to try the Smoked Baby Back Duroc Pork Ribs where you will sing about it they next day.   We dressed Austin casual so not need for business attire or bow ties, and there seems to be quite a bit of parking even though saw a few arrive on e-scooters. The average age here is 20-30s which made me feel young here.   Looks like it's a place where the food is brought to you when ready, not sitting under a heat lamp. A side bowl was placed in front of me with a delicious looking piece of salmon in a puddle of some juice.  The rice was in a white takeout box. The salmon was extremely good and went along fine with my Live Oak Hefeweizen draft beer.  I was so tuned into my fish I forgot about the rice. I opened the little box and tasted it where it was very good too with a buttery taste. Forgot to ask for chopsticks but again lost all consciousness on enjoying my salmon. As for my wife she enjoyed the Oak Smoked Beef Brisket Sandwich where said the best she had tasted in a long while perhaps on our Texas Monthly BBQ tour.  Definitely added a pin on this place to my restaurant regular rotation where there are a few other menu items I need to try.

reviews.author: Tracey Z.
reviews.description: While the vibe of this place is really dope, I do think it's slightly overrated.   Yes the food is very high quality and is well sourced and prepared, however, I think that this restaurant has been so talked about and so highly regarded, I expected a lot more.  I got the smoked salmon rice bowl - the salmon didn't even taste like salmon, I felt like i was just eating smoked meat. The coconut rice is definitely a hit - I really like the nice sweetness to it. The rest of the bowl was a LOT of cilantro and pickled vegetables that didn't add much except take up space.

reviews.author: Candice N.
reviews.description: Came to Loro for the first time and had a great experience. We ordered the house pickles and the pickled cauliflower in this dish were SO good. We also had the corn fritters and shared the chicken karaage (unfortunately not pictured because we devoured it) both equally great.   It was pretty chilly outside (Texas weather!) but the staff was working tirelessly to make sure the heaters were on for those of us waiting for a table. Such a great evening at Loro; we will be back!

reviews.author: Ruchi J.
reviews.description: The vibe of this place was great but we were really confused about the service/organization of things.   We came on a weekend evening and there were tons of people here. The parking situation was a bit confusing but we figured it out (there's WAY more parking than we thought there was). When we got to the line to check in, we got a buzzer so we could sit outside. We were told to not sit at any of the tables outside so we got some drinks at the bar outside and hung out outside on some chairs not near any of the tables. When our buzzer came, we went back inside only to be led outside to the tables and then told to order "at the bar". We were really confused if that meant the outdoor bar or the indoor bar and other people outside were confused as well. Turns out indoor bar was the right answer!  We ordered inside then came back out and awaited our food. We got everything except the corn fritters and had to remind the host about them. Overall, the food was good, but the chaos around the service didn't make the food worth it.   We liked the kale salad and the string beans. The corn fritters was a little too heavy for me (after all that waiting!)

reviews.author: Kathy C.
reviews.description: Came here for happy hour and it was such a treat. My friend and I ordered a couple of their plates from the HH menu to split and also two of their alcoholic slushee drinks.   What we got:  - corn fritters: in my opinion, the star of the show. They were so crispy on the outside and the inside was more chewy and had a nice bite.  - chicken burger: to be honest, I wasn't a fan of the seasoning on the chicken but my friend enjoyed it. - karage: these little fried chicken bites were crispy and yet still juicy. The cilantro topper helped provide a refreshing bite. - mango slushee: I believed this was mixed with sake but you really wouldn't be able to tell. Tasted like juice! - coffee slushee: this was the exact opposite of the mango one, the alcohol taste was strong but the coffee flavor was goo

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: A hit Loro was with my out of town family visit. Always happy I am when making the right choice. Nice and easy atmosphere. A taste of this and that with our family style lunch spread.   Each dish was popping with flavors, including their tantalizing "Cucumber and Tomato Salad"; beautifully spiced "Malaysian Chicken Bo Ssam"; and, scrumptious "Loro Cheeseburger". A lunch my family will long remember!  CHEERS!

reviews.author: Victoria K.
reviews.description: Happy I finally took the opportunity to stop by! A few co-workers of mine suggested Loro's when I first moved to Austin, and after dining here - I can see why!  My sister and I both ordered a chicken sandwich, and crispy potatoes! Wow, we were not disappointed. Both the sandwich and potatoes were delicious. We will back very soon to try more!

reviews.author: Emma S.
reviews.description: Went here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. It was pretty busy! For lunch you choose your own table and then order up at the bar. My friend and I shared the tomato, cantaloupe, cucumber salad, and the Malaysian curry chicken rice bowl. Both were fantastic! The coconut rice is so flavorful and the chicken was very tender!

reviews.author: Leah S.
reviews.description: TL;DR; Really quality food; cocktails are solid; service is nice with an interesting concept; cool vibes. Get the chicken karaage.  My husband and I came here for a date night on Saturday and had a great time. Seating was surprisingly easy (we got there around 6:30pm? We're seated at the bar within 5 minutes). We sat at the bar, which was nice because we didn't have to go up and order food/drinks (which is what you'd have to do if you are seated at a table). Bartender and service was nice and attentive, host was friendly but not annoying.   Originally, we came for drinks and try a few dishes to share, but everything sounded so go that we stuffed ourselves with too food to get to the drinks. I did try the Typhoon, which was pretty good. The frozen drinks looked good, but was too full of food to get one.  Would DEFINITELY come back for the food. We both got rice bowls (husband got the chopped smoked brisket and I got the char siew pork belly), the corn fritters, and chicken karaage. DO NOT SLEEP ON THE KARAAGE. So delicious--the sauce they drizzle on top is *chef's kiss*, the jalapeño aioli was a perfect pair, and it was super tender, juicy, and crisp all at the same time.  Corn fritters tasted great, only critique is that the sweet corn was SUPER sticky/gummy (stick to your teeth in every aspect).

name: Irene's
accommodations: Good for Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, Late Night
Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking
Best nights on Thursday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Christina D.
reviews.description: Been here a few times in the last 5 years and it's still a cute little spot to have brunch.  Food is good. Not the best food in ATX but the vibe there and the brunch drinks make it a good place to go to!

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: Best place in Austin for brunch period. End of review.   Okay, I can elaborate.   Irene's is seriously the best brunch I've had in the Austin area. The chilaquiles ($11) are seriously amazing. Pork, salsa verde, tortilla chips, feta, sour cream, eggs, onions, arugula, radishes. Yum. I finished every bite on my plate and craved more hours later once my appetite returned. This is the best thing by far on the menu.   If you are looking for an appetizer (aka their snacks) the pimento cheese dip is wonderful. One of the best ones I have ever tasted. Also Texans LOVE pimento cheese.   During brunch they have $5 mimosas, $5 frose, and $5 bloody Mary's. Yum.   They occasionally host drag brunch, which I have also attended with my girlfriends. We booked a table a month in advance and had a wonderful experience. Super fun for a girls "day" out/birthday party/etc.

reviews.author: Cara C.
reviews.description: Cute decor, good food, and reasonably priced drinks. Came for brunch with some girlfriends and really enjoyed the food, mimosas, music, and decorations.   We of course took a picture in front of the Irene's sign outside after eating.   There is a parking lot next door but it was pretty crowded so we opted for street parking instead.

reviews.author: Sydney N.
reviews.description: The Bloody Mary here was one of the best ones I've ever had! I accidentally ordered my food without realizing it had cheese on it(I have an allergy) and they brought it back and made me a new dish! You MUST try the strawberry cake!

reviews.author: Kaitlyn P.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I came here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised with how amazing everything tasted! When you walk in, you get to pick where you want to sit and the server will approach you with service. We ordered 3 entrees and everything was a bit pricey not going to lie. For $15 a plate, we'd expect there to be sides as the portions are a bit small. However, everything is sold a la carte. Would recommend anyone to give this restaurant a try though!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: My friends and I attended the Rhonda Jewels Drag Brunch on Sunday and it was such a blast!! I've never been to Irene's and it's such a cute Austin vibe. The brunch tickets get you a bottle of Frosé wine on the table upon sitting down, so yummy and perfect way to start the morning off for the show. The menu items all sound so great and I know I'll have to return to try a few other things I had my eye on. Our group did Cachapas, brunch grilled cheese, avocado toast, quesadilla, and big breakfast plate. The show was so lively and entertaining and it's a great brunch date! Parking can be pretty tricky down in that part of town so arrive at least 10 mins before you want to be there to find a good spot. If the Drag brunch isn't your vibe then definitely check out the inside, it's a much quieter cafe style feel, restrooms are located in the back behind the bar front area and if you don't have time to sit down then they also have a walk up cafe to go window. They've really hit the mark w this spot and it's a great place to check out!

reviews.author: Melissa P.
reviews.description: Cute iconic spot! Stopped in here for the first time before Le Garage shopping. Have indoor and outdoor seating options, fun photo spots and food was good. Great drink specials for brunch. Perfect spot to pull up diner seat and laptop or meet a group of friends to catch up in cool joint with good fare.

reviews.author: Tracey Z.
reviews.description: Cute little spot on sixth - screams austin from the vibe to the decor to the food. Super cute spots for pics and the inside looks like you're in a hip airplane.  Not a lot of vegetarian/vegan options though.   I got the broccoli sandwich which was pretty tasty. Very buttery in my opinion, definitely not light if that's what you're looking for.   Friendly staff and eclectic vibes.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: Updating my review, because I loved it more the second time.   Excellent sliders: 1. Our favorite was the kimchi bacon slider. So excellent, beautiful texture and taste. Honestly a bit mind blowing  2. The Buffalo chicken is quite good, but perhaps should have eaten it faster because the bread got a bit soggy  3. The fried chicken slider was average -- a bit too dry and flavorless -- compared to the others.  Enjoyed my friends peach vodka drink, had a weird maitai wouldn't recommend.   The strawberry cake was just fine

reviews.author: Andy O.
reviews.description: Been to Irene's a handful of times, a go to spot for brunch and lunch, the food and service is unmatched. The coffee is amazing and they have some amazing sweets. I believe if your searching for a place to eat and don't know where to go, consider Irene's you won't be disappointed

reviews.author: Minly L.
reviews.description: Came in for a roomie lunch day!   Got some amazing pictures and delicious food. I got the sliders while my roomie got the burger. Sliders were the perfect portion. Staff was super friendly.   We also got a few of their fall coffee drinks. Both super sweet and tasty for those who love iced coffee.  Overall a lot of fun, vibey and a great experience. Would definitely recommend anyone to go at least once!

reviews.author: Chastitie A.
reviews.description: So me and my best friend were just driving around downtown looking for a different spot for dinner that was cute and trendy...and we came across Irene's. The outside patio, and pink lit up letters caught our attention. We noticed it was pretty packed because they were having a Bachelor watch party lol.   When we walked up to the window, my eyes lit up looking at their desert display  but I knew I had to eat dinner first. We both ordered burgers, but mine were sliders.   I will say that the meat was cooked to the perfect medium well temperature on a lightly toasted buttered bun. Great flavor! I had it with a side of chips, and washed it down a delicious froźe.   The vibe was super chill, and it's a great patio to hang out at on a good weather day.

reviews.author: Mia S.
reviews.description: I came here to get some work done during the day and sat on the back patio. My server was amazing! I will absolutely be back to spend some afternoons here.

reviews.author: Redha U.
reviews.description: My friends and I came here for our final brunch of bachelorette weekend. This place is really well known spot that I've been hearing about for years as a San Antonio native.  On weekends they usually don't take reservations, but bc we wanted to reserve for a bachelorette, they let us reserve in advance for $18 a person. The price includes popcorn, Jell-O shots, and a dessert as well.  Popcorn was a bit stale, and for the dessert they had bite sized rice krispy treats. I was expecting actual dessert or the option to choose a dessert, but that wasn't the case. They ran pretty short on the jello shots so they offered to cover a drink/coffee for the entire party. I didn't try the dessert or the jello shots so can't really review that, but I did get a latte and that was pretty basic. I liked that they had alternative milks to choose from!   For the actual eating portion, I decided on the French toast platter. It's supposed to come with berries on top and choice of eggs and protein/avo (I chose poached w/ avocado).   The platter was good, especially for the price ($12 for a well known brunch spot!). Instead of adding berries to it, they added peaches. Still good but it would be nice to be notified of the change. My Eggs and avocado looked a bit sad and small, which was unfortunate. I'm guessing they just skimp out on poached eggs because my friends had theirs scrambled and it filled up the plate. Food overall was pretty good tho aside from the minor drawbacks!   This was definitely a learning experience for me. I would love to come back again, but next time would avoid making a party reservation (to avoid an extra $18 fee) and get my eggs made differently!

reviews.author: Linda P.
reviews.description: Irene's is such a cute brunch spot!!! We came here on a Friday afternoon. They have a small parking lot right next door that you can text to pay- super easy but pricy.   Walking in, we went straight to the host and was seated immediately- they have indoor and outdoor dining. We chose to sit indoor because it was so hot today!  Our server greeted us quickly and we decided to order our drinks "to-go" but not really to go because of the cute capri-sun/koolaid pouch style drinks.  The drinks were great- nice and strong. I got buzzed off of one!!!   We decided to order light since we were going to eat somewhere else after.  The food: 1) Al Pastor Tacos: meat and tortilla were really dry. However the pineapple salsa was nice and refreshing. 2) Kimchi beef sliders: ordered as medium,  but came out as well done. But the flavors were great, I enjoyed it!!  Service was average. Checkout was quick. Would come back to try other food items.

reviews.author: rosemarie d.
reviews.description: Service was super slow and food was okay. It is a beautiful setting though and while I was not overly impressed I would try this place again.

reviews.author: Marcela P.
reviews.description: I was visiting Austin for the weekend with a few friends and we were looking for a good brunch spot and ended up at Irene's.   It was pretty busy as we went during prime brunch hours on a Saturday. We had the option of either putting our name down on a list and waiting for about an hour for a table or ordering through an outside checkout line and getting a table in the outside seating area (first come first serve). We chose the latter and it was pretty easy to get a table outside and the outside checkout line was pretty seamless!   I thought the food was basic (nothing great but also not bad) and the service was good - the food came out quickly despite it being very busy!  Overall, I would give Irene's an average rating.

reviews.author: Nicholas W.
reviews.description: [covid review] Quick and helpful service! Just kinda pricey and portions were small, food was also pretty average/normal. Maybe come for the aesthetics?  Came at 11am on a Sunday morning with 5 others and was seated immediately. Their patio area is large and well spaced out with adequate ventilation. Pretty cute decor and vibes.  Now, onto the food. It wasn't bad by any means, but was below expectations. My order (baked eggs) was probably the best thing we had, and the mixture of grits, kimchi, and eggs was decently filling with a lot of different flavors (not for everyone imo). The bread it came with was really good! On the other hand, my friends got the brunch grilled cheese and chilaquiles, and both were small portions and looked like you could make them (better?) at home. Flavors and seasoning for the chilaquiles were not good according to my friend (I trust his judgments).

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: I really wanted to love this place. The atmosphere and location are prefect! I love the frose and some of the other drinks....I enjoy sitting at the bar or on the patio and people watching while enjoying the music. That being said.....the food just isn't good. At best, it's average. We were so hungry when we got there and just kind of filled up on drinks instead of finishing the food we ordered.

reviews.author: Darlene K.
reviews.description: This place was great! Drove up from SA last weekend. My husband arrived early and sat at the bar from the minute it opened. When I arrived, he was already in pretty deep. He offered to order some food for me, but I doubted he would have ordered what I would've wanted considering his state.  Upon arrival there was a massive wait list already going. I sat next to my hub at the bar and ordered a pozole, confusing the bartender because she thought I was going to order a drink. She was super nice and the pozole was delicious. I was surprised at how filling it was. I'm used to crushing a huge vat of pozole, and here's this petite cast iron pot of it.   Our friends arrived an hour later. I was determined to have a slice or strawberry cake and since I'm so health conscious...some vegetables christened with slabs of friend chicken.  The cake came first. It was good. Fresh strawberries dotted the cake throughout. Jam separated each layer. The cream cheese frosting was sweet, but played nicely with the tartness of the berry and the cheese.  The salad was good, with butternut squash and apples. The fried chicken was so moist. It think it was chicken breast..but the moistest chicken breast I've ever had.  Se stayed seemingly til the end of service. The service was wonderful throughout. What a nice Sunday in Austin.

reviews.author: Elizabeth W.
reviews.description: I arrived in Austin, TX on 10/18/18 with no plans until the following day and thought a tour was a good idea. However all the traditional tours appeared to be booked. I stumbled upon the Austin Brewery Tours' website while searching on Yelp for ideas.   I had an awesome time exploring Austin's growing beer scene. I also had a great time meeting and making friends the other tourists on our tour.   I enjoyed all of the 3 breweries but the behind the scene tour at Independence Brewing Co. made it my favorite.   The price is very fair when you consider it includes your tastings and tips for your severs.   In a nutshell, a good alternative tour for those interested in the Austin craft beer scene.

reviews.author: Greshka P.
reviews.description: Apparently it's become a tradition that we do a brewery tour when we travel. One of the breweries I was told I MUST visit, while in Austin, was Jester King. Searched online for brewery tours that included this and finally decided on Austin Brewery Tours.  Almost daily tours, online booking was so easy, and we got a reminder, a couple of days earlier to our tour, via email.  Tour starts at noon.  Meetup time was 11:30am. At around 11:25am the van was there.  Out comes Shane, owner and tour guide. He immediately introduced himself, thanked us for being on time and proceeded to ask us our names and where we were from. Once the other people taking the tour arrived, we were all introduced and in the van we went.  During the time we were driving, he would ask us questions to get to know us better, and see the style of beers we liked. He also gave us an intro of each of the breweries we would visit. He made the time driving pass by fast and welcomed all questions we could have.  At each of the breweries, he explained the process and what we had included in the price of the tour. At Jester King, they even had a special release and he bought a sample of each (which was not included in the price but he gifted us with it) making sure we had the complete experience.    You can tell he enjoys doing these tours and meeting the people.   He even took us to Revolution - which was in front of one of the breweries we visited - to try locally made flavored gin.   So greateful he allowed us to do this quick stop - this was delicious, and gave me the opportunity to talk more with one of the ladies on the tour, exchanging ideas on recipes with the gin we had just tried.    Shane is grate at incorporating everyone in the tour and conversations.  He allows you plenty of time to enjoy each brewery and every beer you choose.   He is now friends with the staff at each of these breweries, which works on the advantage of everyone in the tour since we got excellent/ friendly service at each stop.  Best part of this all, is you meet new people, get to enjoy all the beer you can drink, and don't have to drive. Great way to spend a day in Austin.  If looking for a beer tour, look no further, this is it!

reviews.author: Talia H.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our tour. Our guide James was very informative and friendly. No one In our group lived in Austin so it was good to get some info about the city and neighborhoods. The 3 breweries we stopped at were all unique from each other in size, atmosphere, and beers. At each stop you choose two beers to try which is great. We've been on other tours where you do not pick. We were given about an hour at each stop which was ample time. I would highly recommend this tour company!

reviews.author: Zachary D.
reviews.description: So the scene is a bunch of guys down to Austin from NJ/NY for our buddies bachelor party. Of all the awesome people we met and food we ate, our guide Shane as well as the guys at the Lotus Joint food truck were freakin awesome!  SXSW had Austin jammed with a lot to do but Shane made sure we got to see Austin and its beer community like the locals do. He was insanely knowledgeable not just about beer but also about Texas. When you've solo traveled the world like he has, you gain a perspective that makes you far more relatable too which made him an all around cool guy to hangout with.  Most important.. The beers were phenomenal! (Try the goat tacos at Lotus also!)  In town for a day, a week, or a life time - Hands down recommend this for anyone in Austin!

reviews.author: Myriam C.
reviews.description: Best tour ! The people we met were so friendly. Our tour guide Alex was the best . She was very knowledgeable and very welcoming.  She is very passionate about beer . She made the tour very enjoyable. All breweries were great . We got to meet the owner of Independence and the owner of Nomadic. Their stories are very motivating  . I would do this tour again with Alex . She was the highlight of the tour. Alex thank you for your hospitality !

reviews.author: Chloe F.
reviews.description: Took a group of 14 on this tour for my birthday and had an absolute blast! The customer service from when I first booked through the entire tour was top notch. They made it so easy to have a fun day planned. Our tour guide, James, was the best! Great driver, super cool guy, and made sure we had the best experience possible at each brewery. He made the day so fun, stress-free, and kept us all on track.  We stopped at a mix of well known and off the beaten path breweries. If you're visiting from out of town, this is one of the best tours to see the heart of Austin craft brewing. I can't recommend them highly enough.

reviews.author: Leslie B.
