reviews.description: Thank you, Shane for the awesome tour!!! Knowledgeable, fun and an all around good time. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Barry F.
reviews.description: I was in Austin for meetings but had some free time prior. I like to visit breweries (who doesn't?) and saw this tour. I was so pleased with the entire tour: Shane is an amazing host who took us around, shared lots of information about the area, along with the breweries. He was very friendly and ensured we had a good time. Even though it was about 1000 degrees outside, he kept the van cool and ensured we were cared for.  We had opportunities to not only sample excellent beers, but also visit several food trucks in the area. His rapport with the brewery owners gave us extra attention and really made us feel special.  I would absolutely do this tour again!  Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Deena C.
reviews.description: My husband and I had a great time celebrating his 40th birthday with a private tour. Shane was great with his knowledge of the breweries and he was very personable. He even made a pit stop for a picture at the "I love you so much" mural for us. It was a great experience and we would totally do it again.

reviews.author: Kyle A.
reviews.description: Absolutely loved it, had a blast.  Took my dad and step mom on a tour.  Our first time in Austin, rather than just passing thru on I-35.  We went to 3 different breweries, learned alot.  Our driver was very informative and friendly.  Answered all of our questions.  The folks working at the breweries were very nice too.  Lots of fun and great beer.  Highly recommend going on a tour.

reviews.author: Greg L.
reviews.description: We went on this tour the Sunday before Christmas to celebrate my son's 22 B-day... Everything was absolutely flawless and we had the good fortune of having James as our tour guide... I must say this trip was to be excellent to begin with, but James made it SPECTACULAR!!! His knowledge of beer in general along with his totally chill attitude and attention to every little detail ( making sure we had water along with our tastings to matching our individual tastes in selecting what we should explore ) was over the top customer experience!!! We're looking to do another tour in early 2019 and would NOT HESITATE to use Austin Brewery Tours again!

reviews.author: Victoria E.
reviews.description: Austin Brewery Tours was awesome! This was a Christmas gift for my husband and we both had a great time. Brooke was a wonderful tour guide, and she made good beer recommendations (especially considering that I'm not much of a beer drinker).   We did the Hill Country Tour and visited Jester King, Last Stand, and Skull Mechanix. Each tour had a tasting option (one where we all tasted beers as a group and the others where we each got to pick our own beers to try). After selecting beer to taste, we got to explore each brewery on our own before moving onto the next location. We had enough time to eat (plan on eating at Jester King. The food is awesome and we spent the most time there) and to drink at every place, while still getting to individually wander and see all that these breweries had to offer. We also got to take the Jester King tour, which is really cool.   I'd highly recommend an afternoon with Austin Brewery Tours!! Thank you Brooke for a great day!

reviews.author: Samantha E.
reviews.description: My friend booked this for her birthday and it was a blast! Our driver James way friendly, informative, and kept us on schedule! I would highly recommend! He also took us to a brewery I've never heard of and was great!

reviews.author: Aaron W.
reviews.description: Highly recommend this tour. Our group had an awesome time getting to check out the Austin Craft Beer scene. 3 breweries in 3 hours is perfect. Our guide Shane was so knowledgeable with suggestions.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Shane took the 10 of us to Southern Heights, Live Oak, and Independence breweries. We were on a bachelor party where everyone loved craft beer, and wanted to find out what Austin has to offer. The breweries we visited were perfect since they offered a wide variety of options, and Shane kept us on time without rushing us.  It was truly a fun and professional experience. I'll be recommending ABT to others who inquire about brewery tours in Austin.

reviews.author: Carl R.
reviews.description: I was in town for a bachelor party and the Brew Tour was the concessions highlight of the weekend. Shane (the owner) made the planning process a breeze. He was extremely helpful and prompt in all of our communications. Also, the van we took was clean and very comfortable.   The tour itself was AMAZING and huge shout-out to our guide Brooke, you killed it! Tremendous job moving us from location to location while never making us feel rushed, so glad it wasn't on me to wrangle the guys when it was time to go :). Also, your beer recommendations were spot on! Same with your suggestions for things to do for the rest of the weekend.   I have been on similar tours in other cities and Austin Brewery Tours is the gold standard now. I have already recommended them to a few people planning trips to Austin and I know others in our group have as well.   Thanks Shane and Brooke!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: October 2018. 5 out of 5. We decided to take a brewery tour while we visited Austin. This ended up being a great decision. The tour is structured well. We did three stops which gave us a good opportunity to try three different breweries without having to worry about driving, parking, or any of the attendant Logistics. The tour covers all expenses including tips which is a nice touch. You can tell that the tour is well organized and that the breweries appreciate the business. That means you end up getting much better service at all of the breweries than you sometimes get with such packages. The tour guide also is able to make excellent suggestions so if you don't have a lot of experience with craft beer this is a great way to learn. If you have any interest in a brewery tour while in Austin I highly recommend this tour.

reviews.author: Leyla W.
reviews.description: This was a super fun beer tour for those who like breweries. Shane, the owner was very knowledgeable about the three places we stopped and knew his beer styles well. He was great at mingling with all the different groups within our group (there were 6 groups!) and was a great tour guide in general. He mixes up which breweries he goes to which makes it exciting if you do this several times. It's definitely well worth the money to get a fun, convenient way to enjoy beers of Austin.

reviews.author: Lauren H.
reviews.description: We used Austin Brewery Tours for a private group tour during my sister's bachelorette party and it couldn't have been more perfect. Shane was very easy to work with, and very responsive to all of my questions prior to getting this booked. We had 2 large vans for a group of 25 girls and it worked out perfectly. Shane picked out 3 wonderful breweries for our group with a wide variety of beers (and some with other options like ciders) - all locations had plenty of space for our large group, delicious beers, and food trucks available when the group got hungry. Overall, our group had a wonderful time. I highly recommend Austin Brewery Tours!

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: My husband and I had a great time today celebrating our 1 year anniversary! Shane was super personable and took us to breweries specific to what we like! We had a fabulous time and enjoyed every minute of it. I strongly recommend Shane and Austin Brewery Tours!

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: Idle Hands are the Devil's playthings!  This Rainey Street Bar is a cool place to lounge out, relax with some Cuban drinks, and enjoy some live music! They've got a small stage set up in the front, to entice people to join them on their elevated patio, which is covered in astroturf. I'm not sure that the place is handicapped accessible, since you have to climb stairs to get in.  The interior looks like some sort of coffee shop. There's a bar where they're pouring imaginative drinks. In the rear, there's an outdoor patio that's a bit more intimate than the front patio. The place is clean, and well lit.  It's a fun place to hang out under the shade of their big oak tree and relax in the sunlight. The vibe here is always relaxed and chill. They serve bar food here, but I didn't opt for any when I came. Think Cuban fare, with burgers and fries.

reviews.author: Karol M.
reviews.description: We visited for the first time during SXSW week, due to the bands they had booked for their outdoor stage. Several of these were bands that draw a sizable crowd (think festivals or medium sized halls), and unfortunately Idle Hands isn't set up for that kind of crowd. Not even close. People were lined up waiting to get in and they were at capacity.   The open patio is out front, shaded by oaks, and covered with astroturf. It's not big, by any means. The stage is a small dugout box that instead of being raised, seems to be sunken down below patio level. So if there's a sizable crowd, you may be able to see the tops of the band members' heads onstage, unless you are 6'5". Maybe. This might be okay for a sparse crowd, but these weren't sparse crowds, and I have a feeling that Rainey Street often draws crowds.  That particular day, there were giant costumed sports characters trying to make their way through the wall-to-wall crowd. They couldn't really see through their costumes, so they knocked over some things and bumped into people who were trying to watch the bands. It isn't a kid venue, so it wasn't clear why they were there. They may have been wondering the same thing.   The indoor area looks like a modern coffee shop cafe, and they have a full bar. We did not try the food. Our mixed drinks were well balanced and tasty. Some staff were friendly, others were just not, to the point that it left a fairly negative impression of the place.   This week at Idle Hands for us was a two star experience. Others have had a better time when visiting on less busy times and for reasons other than seeing live music shows that draw a crowd. So keep in mind that your mileage may vary, depending on the day and your goals for your visit.   Rainey Street has a lot to offer within a couple of blocks, much like the West 6th Street of old, before the live music scene moved east of I-35. So if you don't find what you want here, you might find it close by.

reviews.author: Sapna D.
reviews.description: Love the live music, outdoor area, and they make a fantastic espresso martini! We will be back!

reviews.author: Chad R.
reviews.description: We booked the backyard of Idle Hands for our private event.  It was our first choice venue after looking at he photos online.  When we walked in, everything felt perfect so we booked it on the spot.    We had some random requests like being able to adjust the music volume, film in the space, have dedicated security, and have a custom drink and glass (photo attached).  Idle Hands was able to accommodate everything (thanks Matt!).  During the event, Gabriel from Idle Hands helped ensure all of our guests were well-attended to.  Everything went super smooth, if you're considering a private event, you're in good hands with Idle Hands :)

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: Love the drinks, menu and staff. Very friendly service and with the bar being mostly outside, a safe space to enjoy a cocktail or a bite to eat. And as a bonus they have live music almost every night!!    My faves: The Painkiller - it goes down way too easy.  The Lover Boy - a killer chorizo-infused burger that will make your mouth water.   Lots of great staff and be sure to save room for the dessert! Tyler is an amazing baker who makes all the desserts for this place. The cheesecake was incredible!!   A few words about Covid restrictions - I've seen most of the bars on Rainey - almost none of them are following the protocols. I feel like this place is the exception. No lines or large groups gathering on top of each other inside. Outside seating spaced well. Staff all have on masks. That plus the food, drinks and service mean I'll be back many more times. The menu evolves some too, always like a place willing to add and try new things while keeping some of the faves on the menu.  Thank you Idle Hands - finally something good out of 2020!

reviews.author: Sirio B.
reviews.description: Nice joint on Rainey which punches above its weight in terms of drinks and food. Rainey in general is a bit of a mixed bag but this place was surprisingly good.   They have a Cuban food focus and use an interesting ticket system with every drink you get that you can redeem for food (probably to ensure enough food sales to stay open during Covid). I had about 4 Painkillers, a properly dangerous pineapple/coconut/orange and rum drink that was delicious. Summery is the best way to describe a lot of their cocktails.   Had some of the best fried plantain chips I've ever had with guacamole and ceviche. My only complaint was I wish they had comfier seating for hanging out and it ended up shortening our time we spent there (lots of high chairs and hard back seats). They dont have a decent back deck like a lot of Rainey places do so the seating was mainly up front where speakers were blasting, including the neighboring businesses music. So it ended up being a little chaotic.   Either way its a nice spot. Service, drinks and food were great so I think we'll drop by again.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Didn't go into the bar so keep that in mind. Only did delivery for their burger and fries. The burger was just OK. Read all these reviews raving about it and thought it'd be better. I guess y'all were smashed from the fancy cocktails lol. It wasn't bad, just didn't really standout and for $12 for a burger and fries, I think there's better options in town. My fault for expecting culinary excellence from what I assume is a bar kitchen.

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: Great place, good drinks, people instantly seemed friendlier as I was there alone and hung out with like 3 different groups. Highly recommend. Oh, and it was very clean, constantly wiping down tables and grabbing empties

reviews.author: Patricia S.
reviews.description: LADIES, if you want to feel uncomfortable, if you want to be harassed, assaulted and invalidated this is the place to go! The manager Tyler is incompetent and does not care about the well being of his customers.   Never going back to this bar again and I suggest you don't either.   Been coming to this bar for years with no issues, ever and have spent SO much money here (I live on Rainey). The staff have always been great until...  Tonight I had a group of young girls create a conflict with my group of friends for no reason. They swarmed our table and harassed us - pulled my friends hair, STOLE MY FRIENDS PHONE and, on top of that, a man that was part of this group forcefully grabbed my arms. The bouncers did nothing to get our phone returned nor remove a girl who pulled my friends hair and was cursing me out and flipping me off. They made me sound crazy when I asked for help. My voice did not matter. I asked to see the cameras and conveniently there are no cameras located in the front (which is absurd given that this is where all the tables and chairs are). It is one thing that these mean girls tried to start conflict with me and my friends for no reason, but this man grabbed my wrists so hard that I could not move and I had to front kick him in the stomach to get away. This is not okay under any circumstance and the fact that the bouncer and manager turned a blind eye is disgusting.  I wish there were cameras because I would press charges. This is so incredibly degrading as a woman and I am still shook that appropriate action was not taken.

reviews.author: Tara V.
reviews.description: This is a generous two star offering. Love the location, the great local talent playing on the porch and our drinks were very tasty.   Big however...  The food was pitiful. The black bean burger was an oversized sopping, crumbly mess with zero flavor and the fries were cold and uneventful. The ranch may as well been runny, salty mayo. My lady pal got the plantain chips with guacamole. They gave us tortilla chips with guacamole. My guy friend went in to ask for the plantain chips that they were supposed to come with. He took a photo with his phone of the chips and dip to show the bartender and he practically laughed in my buddies face and mocked his photo taking as a means to justify his request (he's in production and art, okay? Let the guy make art and an example of your crappy food).   The man brought us the plantain chips out a few moments later to go with the guacamole. Which was the worst guacamole I've had. Del Taco makes better guacamole. Salt? Lime? Heat? Maybe just try to make it flavorful...  Oh and the quinoa bowl-- that one veggie thing. What the heck even was that? It had no sauce; oil or spices to bind together what was basically a sad bowl of vegetables and bitter arugula.   Way off the mark with the food, guys. Good thing the music was kickin' and the mezcal ritas were nice n' zesty.   Get drinks and an earful or music and skip the food. All 3 of our dishes were very weak.

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: Best bar on Rainey by far. My roommate and I came from SF, CA, and on our second night we randomly stopped here because of the live music - who actually was a contestant on the voice!! WOW!!!! We ordered "That One Healthy Thing" and some very specific drinks made by Brennan. He is an amazing bartender! I hope if the owner sees this, he/she gives him a fat raise. Thanks Idle Hands for making our first trip to Austin above and beyond our wildest dreams!

reviews.author: Angel A.
reviews.description: This is a wonderful addition to Rainey St. Its a casual, modern Tiki spot with great service, drinks and music. Visited two times since they've opened and it's been a great experience each time.   I'd recommend the Mai Tai for sure!

reviews.author: Santiago R.
reviews.description: Cool spot on Rainey, There's a good amount of seating as well as room to stand, and they have a good variety of beers on tap to choose from.

reviews.author: Israel C.
reviews.description: Staff is very friendly and they have wonderful cocktails! We've been here twice and felt very safe during COVID time.

reviews.author: Kenya R.
reviews.description: We stopped in for snacks and drinks. It was one of the few places that wasn't crowded, so we thought it was a win for us. Ummm no, we get there and they are doing contactless payment. The guy said that the app only works on iPhone. I think it was a bad business move to use a payment app that only works on iPhones.

reviews.author: Nicole H.
reviews.description: Great service and amazing drinks! The atmosphere was cool and the staff was super friendly. One of the only places that was open during the ice storm, thank you!

reviews.author: Argenis T.
reviews.description: Love the vibe and crew. The atmosphere was probably the best we've experienced while in Austin.

reviews.author: Tommy B.
reviews.description: Don't get a $14 draft cocktail here with the auto 20% gratuity. Walk a half block down to the Tipsy Alchemist, they're $15 -- not only are they twice as big, but also made to order!

reviews.author: Savannah S.
reviews.description: This bar was the highlight of our night! We had a big group of people for my birthday and the bouncer made sure everything was set up for us, he even put our table right next to the live music!   The servers were all so kind and helpful! Someone at our table spilled a cocktail and they replaced it quickly and for free!  One cool thing about this bar is that they give you tickets every time you order a drink, and tickets add up to be free food items! Their fries and chips/queso were good. The cocktails were very strong too! Would definitely come here again!

reviews.author: Dave B.
reviews.description: This place was really cool. Awesome patio and unbelievable live music by a guy named Josh Klaus. So so fun!

name: Lenoir
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Came here for my wife's birthday with some friends and we all agreed it was probably the best meal of our lives. The courses all featured spice in very well balanced dishes, and as a person who doesn't normally search out spicy food I had no regrets after this experience. The crab fingers were a fun and light way to start things off, just enough to whet the appetite without being heavy. I loved the curry sauce and the chili oil was enough to feel it but not enough to overwhelm the crab or curry. Next was a tuna tartare with more spice, this was really good but probably my least favorite of all the dishes. The biggest surprise for me was the charred cabbage. It was marinated lightly and then seared over flame, and the combination of those two steps made it extremely flavorful and easy to eat. I don't normally think of cabbage as something exciting, but combined with the spices and furikake mushroom curry sauce I'd go back just for this! Absolutely floored my whole party. The main course of pork three ways over dirty rice and greens was a hit, with a lightly tangy mustard sauce and simple, excellent flavors all around. Finally, dessert was a delicious cake with I believe a pumpkin sauce topped with a heavy cream and pumpkin seeds. I'd punch a child just to have that sauce alone, the rest was a bonus.   Most of my group did the wine course, allergies had me under the weather so I had only one glass and a few samples. Everyone agreed the wines paired really well, although feelings were mixed on the necessity of the dessert wine given the dessert was sweet enough. That being said, no one had complaints after the trip and we are eagerly planning our next outing.   The staff was amazing and we felt very well taken care of all night long. My compliments to Lenoir for a wonderful evening!

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: Recently went here with a friend for dinner as a visitor to Austin and while the food was good, probably  4/5, I cannot recommend this business as I lost my wallet in between this dinner and a direct drive back to where I was staying.   After retracing our steps and turning the place and car inside out, my wallet could not be found and two days later, none of my cards had been used. However, I did have $300 in cash and a $200 rewards debit card that was in there. Lenoir refused to pick up after multiple calls and messages, which they also refused to return. Once we finally got through, employees denied having it, despite there being only one logical place it could possibly be. So while I had a decent meal, I'm now out almost $800 with the added bonus of having to replace my REAL ID and cards

reviews.author: Lono _.
reviews.description: Our dinner at Lenoir was magical.   We sat outside under a gorgeous tree, adorned with beautiful glass lanterns on a cool, moonlit night drinking bottles of wine and feasting on the chef's choice menu option, while trying not to fill up on one of the best bread plates you will ever experience. Each course was a bonafide gastronomical treat, coupled with unique and delicious wine pairings and curated by an exceptional staff with a level of fine dining service you are unlikely to ever experience in an environment as laid back as Lenoir.   And the desserts were incredible. We ordered them all.  Highly, highly recommend.   We loved it, think of it often and can not wait to return.

reviews.author: Leslie K.
reviews.description: Super cute dining area outside. Very limited parking- we parked off of W Annie St.   We were a party of 6. Only offered the chef's choice menu. There were good and less memorable dishes, but we really enjoyed the atmosphere.

reviews.author: Thomas S.
reviews.description: This place is such a gem. Service is always on point, knowledgeable servers on the wine, pretty solid wine list, limited glass selections tho, but I hate to say it but I recall when the food was equally as good... maybe it's the seasonal menu but it was a bit salty and generally underwhelming... I've had much better at Lenoir. Hoping to see a return of great food... quality of ingredients were on point I think it's the cooks... will still be back. Love y'all

reviews.author: Lauren P.
reviews.description: The outside patio is so cute would recommend going at night for a really romantic vibe. Staff is nice and brings out plates in a timely manner as not to overcrowded the table. My favorite dishes were the crab legs and the yellowfin tartare.

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: We did the prefix menu and it didn't disappoint. The staff are amazing and ambiance outside is charming. Our dishes flowed well and tasted even.

reviews.author: Carmen G.
reviews.description: Lenoir is a cozy outdoor space with delicious food. We came in with 14 people and they accommodated us in the back. We arrived on time and got seated promptly. We had a 5 course meal and only one wasn't to my liking. The char shui was moist and flavored well. I was a little skeptical at first glance but it turned out delicious.   My only gripe was that dinner took 2.5 hours. It cut into our other plans that we had that night. So, if you have a big party, plan accordingly.   PS - Because it's near a creek, please careful of water bugs... As I was cutting the char shui, one crawled across my lap napkin. Imagine a screaming woman frantically waving her knife around as her first initial reaction. Yep, that was me. *Raise hand* I almost stabbed my friend while trying to get it off me.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: As I drove up, I was unsure of parking and which building to go to! After I was pointed to the correct destination I found the ambiance to be quaint and inviting with a nice hint of sophistication. A semi-open kitchen with a trendy bar area invited me to relax and enjoy the evening on Lenoirs terms.    I'm a former chef, however when I order beverages, I prefer to tell the staff my interests and let them suggest my vino(s) of the night. My waiter proved to be worth his salt as my 'pearl snap' which was perfect. I'm not a fan of IPAs so this suited my palate. As for the wine, I opted for the matthieu barret from Rhone. I told the waiter I prefer French wines, especially being at a French restaurant and this beverage didn't disappoint. It was a light bodied wine with a great bouquet that kept me guessing what flavors were prominent. The Syrah/Shiraz seemed to have hints of oak and cherries while other flavors I couldn't pick out but in a fun way. Our evening started with the "crab fingers". The crab was cooked perfectly however I there wasn't much meat on them and picking at the claw proved tedious and the chili oil was a bit hot. That said the curry leafe leche was a true delight. We also opted for the tuna tartare which was fresh but the salsa macha again seemed to be aped up on heat. More on the heat aspects later.    As for dinner my date and I both opted for the oxtail tagliatelle. Again, heat was the star of the dish. I then asked the waiter why every dish had such a heat signature and they said it's fusion to the local vibe. To me I can't take heat so it brings the occasion down. That said, there's a true skill in the dish as the oxtail was cooked to perfection. Tender and flavorful while the kale provided a nice flavor contract being sharp to cut the fat from the oxtail. The pasta was al dente and married well with the sauce. Besides the heat, this dish was outstanding! The waiter suggested a desert wine of Malvasia-trebbiano. I wasn't a fan but my date loved it. Also it paired wonderfully with the coffee semifreddo. This desert was classy, filling, not to sweet and a wonderful capper to the evening.   All said, I really enjoyed my experience at Lenoirs and I suggest this establishment to anyone that wants to add flair to a first date while not being pretentious. The food is skillfully crafted, the wait staff knows their restaurant and the ambiance is romantic. An inviting experience not to be missed.

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: Wow only outdoor seating at this time and food was 4.5 but the ambiance and friendly service bump to a 5 star experience. Go for the HH for 1/2 bottle robes and great mixed drinks the watermelon chiller was pretty and refreshing.  We got the cab franc bottle and was light and paired well with our meals. - HH bread with pimiento was interesting  -HH shrimp boil was different with fresh shrimp and okra and corn and something crunchy on top  - lamb vindaloo was not spicy but tasty and oddly accompanied very well with the sliced watermelon  - mp bass with Goan crab curry was delightful and complex flavors to create a light main entree  Service was so friendly and just stellar and we enjoyed our culinary experience for 2 hours on a Thursday night and in no way felt rushed  Romantic and fun place to be.  Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: The best meal we've had in Austin. We ordered the tasting menu ($58) and 2 bottles of wine.   The tasting menu kept us excited and pleased the whole way through. The opening items (an Amuse bouche of falafel-like crisps with a lovely sauce and a sashimi with a tangy sauce) were so good. Blew us away.   Personally, the third item, gnocchi, was not my favorite. It is made from corn flour, not potato, which is slightly off putting. My friend described it as enchilada in bite form. I liked the spinach.   The steak was amazing. I liked the texture and the taste. It had a lovely chimichurri like sauce with leeks. The cucumber salad bopped too.   Finally, the dessert -- light and pleasing. Highly recommend trying the tasting menu if you come.

reviews.author: Greg K.
reviews.description: While visiting Austin, I chose Lenoir for a romantic vibe with a setting that felt uniquely "Austin." We went with the chef's tasting menu and didn't look back. We received a selection of 5 dishes that we mostly would not have ordered on our own, and we loved each one. Each dish was full of pleasantly surprising flavors and they were all beautifully presented. The tasting menu also left us happily full without being overstuffed.   To go with our meal, we chose a bottle of wine from their ample selection. They also offer a few cocktails, beers, and some wine by the glass, but getting a bottle seems to be the way to go.    Our server, Dustin, was fantastic. He was very willing to hear any and all dietary restrictions or quirks, and was happy to work with the the couple that I mentioned. He was clearly passionate about everything on the menu and his excitement for what we chose showed. He even gave us great tips on places to check out in Austin later that night.   Dining at Lenoir was a highlight during the few days we spent in Austin, the food was phenomenal and the atmosphere was wonderful.

reviews.author: Sharon L.
reviews.description: The tasting menu was really good-- a lovely birthday dinner evening in a beautiful space (located right by a creek, so lots of mosquitos unfortunately).   FOOD: Delicious and thoughtful menu. We did the tasting menu for a birthday, and it took about 2 hours (we're quick eaters, too). They asked very intentionally at the beginning if we had any allergies and dietary restrictions, which was really thoughtful. Slight side note that the plates and serving ware was quite cute, which is just an ancillary sort of plus.  SERVERS: Speedy and really quite nice. They had recommendations, provided bug spray, were knowledgeable about the beverages. No complaints.  AMBIENCE: Currently (Oct 2021) only outdoor seating. It was well-lit and covered overhead. Quite good dinner date spot.   BATHROOMS: Gender neutral bathrooms indoors. It's may be a 50-ft walk to the bathrooms? Two single-person bathrooms. Clean, stocked. No complaints.  PARKING: A few (Like 10ish?) parking spots in a lot, otherwise I think it's street parking.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Noticed they were doing their Chef's Tasting menu (five courses) for only $29 during January so booked a table the last weekend of the special.  The wine patio was a perfect happy hour spot pre-COVID, and so it's no shock that with a few finishing touches like a tent and heaters, it would make for a wonderful dinner experience, too.  Anthony was our server and he was so on top of it all night long. In addition to taking care of the dietary restrictions of some of the group, he also was very generous with the wine pours!  I can thankfully eat everything, but just want to give a hats off to the kitchen for accommodating the two gluten-free diners. They even made a special dessert for a friend that is allergic to eggs!  The menu was pretty stacked with seafood options which made it light but satisfying. I am not a huge oyster fan, but Sweet Home Alabama were theirs tasty! The tuna pappardelle was interesting...someone's hot take was that it reminded them of a more sophisticated tuna casserole. Impressive there was no dairy in the dish but it had a creamy, cheesy texture. My favorite was the seafood stew-esque dish with the delightful bread for dipping.   The $40 wine pairing was a steal! Not only were the pours accompanying each dish full (not a sissy tasting pour), but Anthony would just magically top off our glasses like a vino ninja, so I felt as if I had prob consumed an entire bottle by the end. And, definitely not mad at that!  While the half off special may not be a thing any longer, I still recommend visiting Lenoir for a nice dinner out, with all the precautions in place/being observed.

reviews.author: Jennifer K.
reviews.description: Wow. I wasn't expecting to love this place so much but it was a fantastic experience all around.  The outdoor gravel patio is like sitting in someone's backyard under huge oak trees. They have simple lanterns strung from the tree branches and umbrellas all around. I loved the ambiance.   We ordered the tasting menu and the wine flight. The wine pairings were one of the best I've ever had. I'm not a fan of white wine but the owner picked the best French wines that paired perfectly with each course.   The first course was a hamachi crudo- perfectly light with subtle flavor.  Second course was a green bean salad- this was my favorite of the night. The beans were lightly pickled then charred and served on a yogurt queso fresco sauce- HEAVENLY. I make a mean green bean but theirs was the best I've ever had.  Third course was shrimp and vegetables. This was my least favorite, and it was still amazing.  Fourth course was the char siu and watermelon. Perfectly cooked and the balance of flavors was delicious. I was so full at this point but I still soldiered on.  Last course was ice cream with almond crumble. I'm not a fan of ice cream but this was really good.  Our server Quentin made our experience an unforgettable one. We'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: Leila L.
reviews.description: Partner and I went to Lenoir for a date night. It's been a long time since I've dined here and didn't realize they had this nice spacious beer garden! They are offering 50% off their chef's tasting which is a 5 course tasting. They serve things family style and had an upgrade to a fish dish for an additional $25. Overall the dishes were good, though the beginning dishes were a little spicy and acidic. I very much enjoyed the whole fish that they mostly deboned. Dessert was a flan and churro-esque cookie that was a light way to end the meal.   During COVID it felt safe dining as it was outside and it was well spaced. They do have a covered area which unfortunately we didn't get to sit under. There was some light rain during the meal which they provided umbrellas for, but awkwardly we had to hold it up ourselves. Most tables had an umbrella but ours didn't.

reviews.author: Karen S.
reviews.description: We were so disappointed in this restaurant. No cocktails, only beer and wine. We did the tasting menu and it was awful. One dish was just cabbage. Nothing else....a 1/4 head of cabbage. The sauce with it was good but who wants to eat just cabbage for a dish? The wine was so bad - even on its own but none of it paired with the dishes. We're coming from SF so we're spoiled but at least match the wine with the flavors of the dishes. We were still hungry after the tasting menu and ordered the tagliatelle - which was amazing. All in all, it was a letdown and we will not be back.

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4 Food: 3.5  Came for the January chef's tasting menu ($29) outside. Been wanting to try this place for some time so there were definitely some expectations after having seen and heard about it. Overall it was a good experience, but the food was not as great as expected.   Started with an oyster on the half shell - how can you go wrong with that? They did it perfectly.   Next up was a winter salad, which had beets, roasted butternut squash, some tomatoes, and beer infused peanuts; the peanuts were delicious, and the squash was nice; I didn't care too much for the texture but the flavor overall was decent and fresh.   A cooked "salad" was next with roasted broccoli, mushrooms, walnuts, and grapefruit, with melted taleggio cheese on the bottom. Interesting mix of flavors and textures, saltiness of the cheese and bitterness of the grapefruit were different, but the broccoli were very large pieces. Nice to try but probably not something I'd eat often.   The main dish was a baked fish with shrimp, arugula, and sliced radish in a tomato soup. TBH it was kind of underwhelming for the main dish and a bit too bitter and salty for my taste. The shrimp and fish were nicely cooked but not my favorite on flavor.   For dessert was a coconut cake, and a rice pudding. I didn't try the cake, and I know that rice pudding should be al dente, but this was a bit undercooked. It was nice of them to whip it up since I couldn't have the cake due to gluten, but it just wasn't that great unfortunately.

reviews.author: Siia K.
reviews.description: This is a nice place with date vibes. The food was great , me and my partner decided to do chefs menu, pescatarian version. Started with hush puppies, strawberry aguachile, avocado tostada, large crab stuffed fish and citron cake.   One thing I'm confused about still is if we got one order of each or was it two servings as everything came in 1 plate for 2 people to share.   We additionally had Pullman bread and peach, strawberry cocktails. Everything was great.   Advice: ask if you opt for chef menu do you get 1 or 2 serving of the item when 2 people are eating. I believe we got only 1 per item to share in which case you are better off ordering from menu yourself rather than chefs choice.

reviews.author: Shari D.
reviews.description: Wow! We had such a lovely time at Lenoir! I was slightly worried when we arrived when the host told us that our table was not available and it might be 30 minutes. I realize they can't remove patrons! But, we didn't have to wait that long and they seated us in a little area while we waited and gave us a pitcher of water (and two glasses!).  We opted for the the chef's menu and wine pairing. We really, really enjoyed it. the ambiance was specular, outside under the Live Oak trees and lanterns. The servers were excellent. We will be back to try other items on the menu. Honestly, we felt like we were on vacation.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Went here on a whim. Overall i would recommend this place.   I'll start with the food.   We had the fried pickles and the wings (naked). The pickles were very good and the wings were a bit bland. For entrees we have the slider trio and the tacos (mahi and chicken). The slider trio was very very good. The BBQ was delicious, though the brisket was a little fatty. But the turkey and pulled pork with the bread combo were delicious. The tacos were also very good. The mahi was a little more spicy than expected but still good. We also had a few beers off the draft. Wish they had a little bigger selection here, but what they had was ok.   Staff.   They were very friendly. We sat at the bar as it was seat yourself anywhere in the place. Overall it was ok service. Would not say it was the best. Clearly they need more staff but i know how hard staffing is these days due to covid so i will not hold it against them. Though it did make getting food/drinks kind of slow but we were not in a hurry.   Cleanliness.   This is where i take a star. It was ok but the bathrooms men and women were gross and clearly ignored. The overall establishment just felt like it needed a good cleaning. While we were sitting at the bar a couple silver fish ended up crawling on me. Luckily this was at the end of my meal otherwise i have no idea what i might have done during. Cleanliness is important and an indicator of whether i would go back or not. I'll have to put some thought into it.

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Never heard of A TX Twinkie before so I had to give it a try; it's basically just a jalapeno popper. I was hoping it was a bit more cooked. I think it was underdone and too hard so it was a bit tough to eat.  The 2 plate bbq dish was good though, especially the brisket (how can you go wrong with brisket?). The "coleslaw" wasn't the best and could have used more seasoning and either a better vinegar or mayo base to give it a better texture.  The drinks are pretty good and their atmosphere is overall nice; would definitely go again and check out their HH menu.

reviews.author: Megan V.
reviews.description: They no longer do bottomless mimosas! I came for that exact reason and was pretty disappointed when I found out they discontinued it. We instead ordered the mimosa carafe for $12. Presentation could have been better. They were just served in normal water glasses which made the mimosas go flat pretty quickly.  We ordered the Whiskey-infused Banana Bread French toast and the Eastside Benedict. Banana bread is on the crunchier side as opposed to fluffy (which I don't mind). My friend liked her benedict and thought the brisket was cooked well!  I was not blown away by any means, but I may come back another time to try out their dinner menu.

reviews.author: Emily N.
reviews.description: I had the bacon cheeseburger and brisket tater tots. Both were delicious and very filling although a bit pricey. The restaurant is great for large groups and handles reservations for 25+. The waiter was very attentive and accommodating. I would come back again!

reviews.author: Elizabeth J.
reviews.description: Loved this place. Low key and fun vibe. Great prices and food options . Everything was yummy. Great service too !

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: I hate that this is one of the last remaining bottomless mimosa spots in Austin because I would give it lower than one star if I could. The food sucks, and the service is even worse. I came once during July 4thweekend, and it started pouring. Waiters would still bring food on trays that had an inch of water in it, and I was one of those unlucky ones who received food after it started raining. I asked the waiter if it was possible to return my food because it was drenched in rainwater, and he said it was too late because I had already ordered it. Excuse me?? I was genuinely shocked. I went downstairs to ask a manager if I could get a refund, and he said I would have to dispute it with the online ordering system company. Absolutely ridiculous. I couldn't say enough negative things about this establishment. Please, anybody else, do bottomless mimosas because I'm tired of having only this one crappy place be the go-to despite how terrible the service and food is.

reviews.author: Ganina R.
reviews.description: I'm really upset with spending my money here! The food was ok but the service was extremely horrible! Super disappointed with how our server treated us. I work in the culinary industry and was a server before it's not that hard to be a good decent service. I would highly recommend getting you're servers the proper training on how to treat your customers.

reviews.author: Marissa T.
reviews.description: What a vibe here! Natural lighting, lots of seating options, and drinks kept on coming!  There's a small parking lot where I was able to snag a spot so we are off to a good start! Music is good and service was nice and friendly.  Got the smoked wings for an appetizer and bottomless mimosas to start. The wings were good and the homemade bbq sauce was sweet tangy and a hint of spice, *chef kiss. For brunch I got the breakfast taco plate, it was good as well!   Great spot to checkout for bottomless drinks/brunch/bbq

reviews.author: Ariane V.
reviews.description: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME HERE!  Decided to visit this place as it kept on popping up on TikTok. Service was horrible!  There was a confusion on our table. We asked for an umbrella, the server said she'll go check and when she came back she said they had broke? Then we asked if we could be switched tables and there was a big confusion between the servers. We were blamed for the confusion and on top of that the manager handled the situation really bad! She asked us to pay and box our food and leave, the way she talked to us was very unprofessional. Then the server confronted us and asked who was the one that got her in trouble and lied to the manager that we had cursed her out. LIES LIES LIES. Like really????  Overall POOR MANAGEMENT and HORRIBLE SERVICE.  On top of that the food was nasty!

reviews.author: Edgar R.
reviews.description: Went today during brunch to celebrate my birthday and my experience was probably the worst I've ever had at any restaurant.  I asked the hostess to place us on the waitlist for a table inside and she tells me it'll be about 30 min wait. In the meantime, my party and I decided to sit outside and order a drink while we wait. We never got a text letting us know that a table was ready.   We stayed outside and ordered food. 3 of us ordered the chicken sandwich, one of us ordered the brunch burger, and another friend ordered the Brussel sprouts. Well, everyone got their food except me. I waited a little over an hour, asked 3 different waiters, until I finally got my food. My entire party was already done eating.   I had also ordered the bottomless mimosas, but I never received that either. Everyone at my table kept getting their drinks, while I was still waiting for mine. I got up, went downstairs, and asked the hostess if she could remove the mimosa from my tab since I never received it.   Food is ok, but service is TERRIBLE. Still can't believe how bad of an experience I had.

reviews.author: Janet B.
reviews.description: This was such a fun place! We aren't from Austin, but we were diligently seeking a sports bar to catch the Cowboys wild card playoff game. (Newsflash: they lost.) Anyway, we showed up to this place and we almost left because it was sooooo packed! It was during their famous brunch time, and so we had to get the mimosa carafe. We ended up changing seats when the bar opened up, so we'd have a view of the game. Loved all the ladies working there. They were nice, friendly, funny, and it made it such a fun day! We ate some loaded fries but added their brisket- omg so good! Also had some fried pickles, but forgot to take a photo.

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: I was invited to come here by one of my peers and the locations and the views were great. Not to mention the food or the East austin energy I felt while brunching here. Everyone is happy and enjoying the beautiful weather. As I got a chance to look at the menu I only took a glance and new exactly what I wanted. The Trifecta is amazing and it just complements an already near perfect experience at eating here.

reviews.author: Shelbie P.
reviews.description: My friends and I were visiting Austin for a 30th birthday. We were looking for a bottomless mimosa brunch spot so we looked online and found this place. It turns out that they do not do bottomless mimosas they just sell the bottle or glass by their price. So they should really take off their advertisement of $14 bottomless mimosas because we would have went elsewhere. When we were there, the app that they have went down, so everything was chaotic and no organization was there. My friends and I ordered food and drinks, my friends food came out but mine did not and it was a whole ordeal to get my food. I ended up having them box it up because my friends already finished their food because I didn't want them to wait for mine and have their food get cold. I spoke to the manager on shift and she basically was just trying to make excuses for all their mistakes rather than just own up to them and apologize for all the miscommunication going on that day. Katie, the server, who wasn't even our server, was AMAZING. She was the only one who truly cared about our problems going on and she will literally be the only reason we would ever come back to this place. She should be placed in management. If you do visit here, ask for Katie to be your server because then you will have a great experience for sure!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: We used to love EastSide Tavern and sitting at the rooftop was our fave thing to do. Today was not the best experience. You have to order and pay through an application which removed the ability to receive our meal in courses. We got appetizers and meal all at once. It took over 45minutes to get our food which was subpar. The cornbread was completely burned. The BLT sandwich literally had one slice of bacon and the queso was lukewarm. This is a foodie town and today's experience was below quality considering citywide options.

reviews.author: Veronika F.
reviews.description: This review is not for our server, Zach, who provided excellent service. This review reflects the nonsensical reservation system that requires one to email (not call... email) 24 hours in advance. I emailed a bit over 24 hours ahead and they said that my requested time wasn't available, which makes no sense if reservations are indeed only taken 24 hours in advance. We were seated outside in the baking sun with no umbrella because they are a "liability." We were told that outside seating with shade was completely reserved which again makes no sense because we again emailed over 24 hours ahead of time. We were also told that there was no inside seating and that they "can't control the weather." It's Texas in April, you need to provide people with some kind of shade. Disappointing as this used to be a favorite bottomless brunch spot. No bottomless, no logical reservation system. Go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: Social distance what? They've never heard of it clearly. I know times are crazy but this felt very pre-covid with how many people were smushed into the restaurant.   We came for brunch and the food was just okay. Nothing special. We got Brussel sprouts, nachos, and the breakfast bowls. We had mimosas but they were out of orange juice?(lol) they had cranberry and grapefruit juice instead.   P.s. Parking lot is like maybe 8 spots so not exactly ideal.

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: Lousy food and drink served up with an attitude. I ordered a margarita that was made with an artificial mixer, and was not made with dress squeezed limes. I politley told the waitress it did not taste right and seemed artificial. She got all upset when I asked for a Hazy Beer instead, and stormed off, only to return with a Lager instead of the Hazy.  I ordered the 3 meat BBQ plate. All three meats were totally dry, and tasted like nothing. The wife ordered the 2 meat plate; both meats were dry and tasteless.   $85 dollars for lousy food and service.

reviews.author: Kasey M.
reviews.description: This place was amazing. Magically decorated for Christmas! Chill dog friendly patio. Queso was good. Burger and fries were amazing. What really made the experience 5 stars though was our server Katie. All around rock star and kind soul. Will be back to see her again. PS HIGHLY RECOMMEND MARGARITA WITH PINEAPPLE JALAPEÑO FLOATER + CHAMOY

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Adding to my existing reviews with a pro tip - ranch is the best dipping sauce to accompany their garlic parm fries.

reviews.author: Joe S.
reviews.description: I today was my first time eating there I walked in the place smelled great look clean people were friendly but once I wanted it to me played it was the worst brisket I've ever tasted the sausage did not taste like it was either smoked or cooked in a pit brisket clearly was Yesterdays brick brisket just reheated in the oven it had that reheated taste I've been around barbecue all my life I have work in restaurants and you can tell when somethings been reheat it or from the day before will never go there again

name: Corner
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Garage Parking, Street Parking, Validated Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Alexander R.
reviews.description: Came here the other day, my server Manny was beyond amazing, amazing would be an understatement! He was astonishing! Drinks were fantastic, food was delicious. Will definitely be back, only want manny as a server.

reviews.author: Stuti D.
reviews.description: We loved our evening at the outside seating at the JW corner. The drinks, service and chips and 3 dips were great.   While he crowd was a little older crowd, we landed having a great conversant some loud laughs... everything a weekend drink is meant to be.

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: I've been to Corner 3 times now. If you need a place where you can get a table fast especially for a large party this is an easy choice. Service is great too. They serve you fast. As far as food, it is sub-par. I got the oven roasted chicken this time. Chicken was very dry. Didn't pair well with the quinoa which is also very dry. I wouldn't get again. I got a glass of Sauvignon Blanc. Our table shared the chips and dip trio for an appetizer. It was good. Good size for price. Probably won't be back until they update their menu or improve food.   Pros: great service and fast seating for large parties  Cons: food is bland and boring

reviews.author: Soolin W.
reviews.description: The warm chocolate cake is chocolate lava cake, unfortunately by the time they top it with salted caramel and whipped cream and powder sugar it's too sweet and I couldn't finish it. We were given the chips and corn dip for checking in on Yelp that was quite good, the chips are thin and crispy, good chips.  My favorite thing was the spicy deviled eggs, the sauce it comes on is delicious and there is a thin sliced of fried jalapeño on top and it provides a nice little crunchy bite.  I ordered an americano with my dessert and was very disappointed , it tasted so acidic and gross. Nit good coffee.  The service is good hear though.  I forgot to take a photo but I had the Caroline salad with salmon on top, not a great salad, just a bunch of mixed greens salad with a few blueberries and cheese . Thought it tasted boring and not super fresh. Quite disappointed.

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: Though it's a hotel restaurant, it's actually pretty good.  Well crafted cocktails and lots of delicious bites to share.  An outside table is especially nice for people watching.  House-Made Zucchini Cornbread: Comes in a cast iron skillet with a nice crispy top.  Underneath is a warm moist grainy cornbread that goes excellent with the butter on the side.  There were green bits in there, but you won't even notice it's zucchini thankfully.  Burnt Ends: An often overlooked meat that is so good!  Came in cubes that were well cooked and nice and tender.  Seemed more wet than typical BBQ, so maybe it was braised?  Either way, it tasted so rich and so delicious against those little dinner rolls.  Three Dips and Chips: I got this for the queso.  And the queso kinda tasted like the traditional Velveeta variety.  It hit the spot for sure, but wasn't anything original/innovative.  Beef Barbacoa Tacos: A huge amount of meat.  Especially loved the crispy shallots on top to give it a nice crunch.  The herbal chimichurri was a great pairing too.  Pork Carnitas Tacos: Very porky and very meaty.  Didn't quite have that fried (after braising) texture that some some carnitas does.  But was still delicious.  Shrimp and Grits: The grits were smooth and creamy.  The shrimp was big and plump, but kinda bland / unseasoned.  Though the tomato sauce on the edges of the grits helped liven it up.  Warm Pecan Brownie: Wow, this was delicious!  It managed to have a lot of delicious crispy edges but also warm gooey center.  And the fresh Texas pecans, way better than when brownies use bitter walnuts.  Really great with ice cream.  Tres Leches: Came in a little mason jar with a smear of dulce de leche on top.  The cake seemed firmer and less soaked than other tres leches I've had before that is just swimming in cream.  But it was moist enough.  And the bites with dulce de leche tasted great.

reviews.author: Lucy M.
reviews.description: Although this place looked good online, eating here was the by far worst restaurant/bar experience I have had in Austin. My friend and I are visiting from out of town, we sat at the inside bar. We were never greeted by an employee. A bartender handed us menus without saying a word 15 minutes after we sat. Taking our order and getting waters took 30 minutes (the bar was not busy). The food was really sub par, we had to wait for the manager to bring us silverware because the bartender never returned to check on us. With all of the great food and hospitality we've experienced here in Austin we were really disappointed with how the staff here operated. Don't go here!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: The ambiance and service really get the stars here. I got a Hibiscus Margarita and it wasn't great. Overpriced, felt pre-made and was expansive at $14. Beer selection was great! I ordered the Shishito Peppers two ways, they were the best I've ever had. I regret not ordering the seven layer salad after seeing a few pass by while I was sitting at the bar. I got the barbacoa style tacos and they were loaded with meat. Besides the overload of tender beef-no real other flavor enhancers involved. My boyfriend ordered the egg white omelette. The dish was just ok. Great ambiance and the hotel connected is gorgeous.

reviews.author: Olivia G.
reviews.description: Went here for a group dinner with three of my friends. The vibe and atmosphere is really warm and cozy and both the drinks and the appetizers (we ordered the nachos and cornbread) were very delicious so it made for a good outing with friends. The server was also polite and efficient. However, the main entrees left much to be desired. The salmon, chicken sandwich and shrimp and grits were all only OK and definitely not worth the prices they were charging. Overall, this is a great spot if you just want to chill with a group of friends and just do some drinks and appetizers.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Been here on several occasions and never disappoints. My plus one almost always goes w the chipotle honey glazed salmon dish and I usually hop around the menu to try new dishes. We always get the trio chips and dip that comes w queso, salsa, and guacamole. We also did try the winter cocktails this time around with the spiced winter old fashioned, very aromatic and delicious. This particular visit I tried the braised wagyu beef tips w a mashed purée and mushrooms. It was very soft, tender, and rich in flavors. I loved that the mash soaked up all the juice and flavors. The roasted vegetables had a rustic approach and although flavorful I wouldn't have missed them on the dish. If you do try the restaurant also be aware you can go into the hotel lobby for a nice lounge feel and casual seating post dinner.

reviews.author: Grace L.
reviews.description: I really want to enjoy this place. The first few times I came here it was top notch, but it was also weekday lunches for work. I came recently for lunch on a Friday and they had a limited menu. Came two days later for dinner and AGAIN they have a limited menu. Annoying but nothing one can do about it, apparently they do this any time the hotel is over sold. However, they did serve me 100% raw salmon the last time I ordered it here. It took 20 minutes to get another, and it was the worst meal I've had here unfortunately. My frequenting this establishment will now be limited to booze, apps, or the grouper only (when they have it on the menu...?)  Service is good and drinks are great, people watching is superior. Go for drinks.

reviews.author: Dyänâ Sëwër R.
reviews.description: We ordered the Crispy Chicken Sandwich  and the zucchini cornbread . The Chicken Sandwhich  gets a rating of 3.5/5 the chicken was cooked well, veggies were fresh, and the fries were meh (average).   The zucchini gets a rating of 2.5/5 with the use of the butter  without the butter it's a 2/5. The zucchini makes it unique but the cornbread itself was a little bland. However, the display of the food was amazing 5/5. Finally the vibe of the restaurant was super chill and all the waiters and staff were amazing!!

reviews.author: Brittney D.
reviews.description: I feel so very meh about this place.  I was staying at the JW and figured I'd give it a shot.  Service was inattentive and I sat at the bar.  Like, had to wave someone down for a box. Boo.  My food was 50%- the zucchini cornbread was bomb, but the shrimp n grits was lackluster.  Texture of the grit was good but shrimp lacked flavor.  My drink was satisfactory.  I'd say, come for the drinks and grab dinner elsewhere.

reviews.author: Jojo G.
reviews.description: Solid spot for a meal after a night of exploring downtown austin. Food is great. Had the burger and it was very juicy. Plenty of choices to eat inside. Would visit again

reviews.author: Shā A.
reviews.description: Sooo here's my honest review. Ordered the crispy chicken sandwich to go... I see what they were trying to do there. I definitely appreciate the flavor pairings... there was good flavor there and it was on a good bun. The issue is I received cold chicken that seemed like it was sitting there awhile. Who wants cold and old crispy chicken? My sandwich wasn't warm at all. My to go box had a pickle in it that was sitting on my fries so that caused the bottom part of my bun to be soggy and some of the fries. They placed the burger on top of the pickle... seems a bit careless.

reviews.author: Courtney S.
reviews.description: I had originally made a reservation for another place close by that ended up talking though due to bad communication on their end. So my friend and I walked down the street and found Corner! A blessing in disguise. They seated us right away! The wait staff was a little on the slower end but it looked like our waitress was the only one covering the outdoor section, so I understand! No problem there.   I am bumping off one star because the food was pricey pricey as well as the drinks. I ordered the Jalapeño Honey Mustard Grouper which was very good but didn't knock my socks off. The cocktails were crafted well and tasty but also pretty expensive compared to other places.

reviews.author: Beth M.
reviews.description: The outdoor patio seating looks great, if you can grab a spot there to enjoy only drinks, I'm sure you'll have a great experience. If it's late, you're hungry, and you can only sit inside? Keep walking down the street and find somewhere else. Food was average at best, but with an upscale price tag and the service was friendly, but sooooo s-l-o-w. We got to the point where we debated throwing in the towel and hitting up Whataburger and when we finished our meal we wished that is what we had done. Love Austin, can't wait to visit again, will definitely not be back to Corner.

reviews.author: Kenny C.
reviews.description: We were staying at the JW Marriott for the weekend and ended up trying this restaurant as it's located in the hotel (which is in a nice location in downtown). The food was surprisingly good and our service was awesome. We ordered the nachos (huge portions and our favorite!), burnt ends, and vegetarian tacos. Everything was pretty tasty and came out quickly. The restaurant seems to be pretty large and has a cool indoor/outdoor patio setup too. I'd recommend checking this place out if you're wandering around downtown and looking for a decent spot for food and drinks.

reviews.author: Malinda F.
reviews.description: Drove by corner and looked interesting had outside bar and tables. Parked and came to it. Had rope across entrance weird since people in there. Finally got someone's attention and they told us not the entrance! Turns out we had to walk length of building to go to hostess stand. It is a hotel bar in jw Marriott. Since our interaction outside was less then stellar we chose to eat inside. (Btw several empty tables outside!) inside had large bar and both booths and tables  Good choice. Attentive waiter. (CA guy new to Austin) Nice atmosphere. Tried crunchy fish and pork carnitas. Heavy on pork meat( if you like meat) and fish had bite to it. Both very good I tried bees knees drink very tasty  I would go back!

reviews.author: P B.
reviews.description: 3 because it's an open outdoor bar. Love that but everything else- a hard pass.  Bartender acts bothered to make me a drink. And the Corner marg was below average. Nothing worse than bad service and sub par drinks.

reviews.author: Lisa G.
reviews.description: Glad this place was opened a little later because most places around were closed by 9:30-10p. We were Ake to order some appetizers and a round of drinks. The burnt ends were not as crispy as I liked and a little to fatty for my taste. The Brussels sprouts were good but didn't have enough little pieces of pancetta. The staff was overall friendly for the most part. We had to find a place at the bar top since all the tables were full. It was the end of the night and we stayed till last call.

reviews.author: Rachel W.
reviews.description: Pinthouse is my go to pizza and salad place. My mom and I discovered this place when we were looking for restaurants with gluten free options and I'm so glad we gave it a try.  To start off, I got the Pinthouse chop salad. This has to be the best darn chopped salad I've ever had. All of the ingredients were adequately chopped up and had just the right amount of dressing. I daydream about how good this salad is.  I also ordered the honey pear pizza on gluten free crust and WOW- what a genius combination! The sweet pears complement the prosciutto, balsamic, and basil so well. It was like a symphony in my mouth.   I love the patio area- just the right amount of sun hits it.   This is an Austin staple for me and I'll keep bringing friends and family here. Next time I'll have to try a beer on tap while watching a sports game and chowing down on amazing pizza.

reviews.author: Anthony T.
reviews.description: The environment of pint house pizza is really chill for grabbing a drink. Came here during happy hour and got a beer and pizza.   Got the local jellyfish IPA and a sweet pizza that wasn't too sweet. A nice sweet and savory flavor that combo the beer well. Also tried the pretzel for appetizer. It was my first time and was a bit too salty for my liking.  Parking was a bit rough to get to since barely in the front and back of the building but coming in early should be fine.

reviews.author: Amy Z.
reviews.description: Pinthouse is a great place to come, especially if you're with a large group of people and looking for a casual setting. They offer pretty unique pizza flavors, and this time I tried out the Honey Pear (8.5/10) and Shroomin' Goat (7/10). The Honey Pear was a nice contrast of savory and sweet, without being overly sweet. I'm a huge fan of honey on pizza, so this was definitely a good choice! The Shroomin' Goat has crumbles of goat cheese, with lots of greens and mushrooms. I liked this pizza, but it was a bit too salty for me, and I wish it had more balanced out flavors.   I ordered a medium pizza (~$20) with half of each topping, and I'm glad I got to try out both combinations! The medium pizza, by the way, is huge and more than enough for one person. I was pretty full after three pieces but am happy to take home leftovers. The place also has a nice bar area that has pretty well-priced beers and ciders. There's a blood orange cider that I tried, which was really good. Overall, definitely recommend Pinthouse for anyone who wants a chill, fun pizza and beer night!

reviews.author: Diana N.
reviews.description: Between the 2 of us, we got 2 smalls, and it was plenty to share! Thin crust, very crispy, very fresh! Pretty cheap for great pizza! You can get 2 different kinds on a pizza, even a small!  Small 10" - $8-8.50 Medium 14" - $16-17 Large 16" - $19.50-20.50  In order of favorite pizza: Cannonball and The Works (tied), then The Hoe Down and all a'sprout it (bf doesnt care for goat cheese though).  **CANNONBALL (like a meat lover's)- Red sauce, house cheese blend, pepperoni, bacon, local crumbled sausage, Canadian bacon. Very good. Very crispy.   **THE WORKS (like a Supreme)- Red sauce, house cheese blend, pepperoni, Canadian bacon, local crumbled sausage, green peppers, garlic, mushrooms, red onions.  Good, basic supreme pizza  THE HOE DOWN- Red sauce, house cheese blend, roasted red peppers, roasted CAULIFLOWER, roasted GARLIC, RICOTTA, pepita PESTO. Kind of expected more out of this bc I love roasted cauliflower and ricotta. It was good but probably pass next time.   ALL A'SPROUT IT (monthly pizza) - roasted BRUSSELS SPROUTS, caramelized onions, savory BACON, GOAT CHEESE, BALSAMIC reduction. Love goat cheese and roasted Brussels sprouts. However, this was good but passable.   **My bro's favorite is HONEY PEAR-  Extra virgin olive oil, house cheese blend, sliced pear, caramelized onions, blue cheese, prosciutto, basil, local honey. I will try this next time even though I'm not a big fan of blue cheese.

reviews.author: Nicole I.
reviews.description: They get it right every single time. I'm blessed to live so close !!!! Thanks to the crew as always

reviews.author: Emily N.
reviews.description: Best pizza in austin! Better than home slice!  For starters; MAKE A RESERVATION/JOIN THE WAITLIST ONLINE when you're on the way so you don't have to stand outside and wait in texas' jank weather.  They have a beautiful variety of locally brewed beers that are solid and also go on sale during happy hour!  Interior is a ton of long tables which are perfect for groups.   Great innovative flavor combinations across the menu for pizzas. Would recommend.

reviews.author: Alyssa K.
reviews.description: Great laid back dining experince! The inside can get pretty crowded since it is first come first serve seating!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: This review is based upon the bar and drinks only.  My husband and I stopped in for a drink since we had dined earlier next door and didn't want to overpay for another drink. In retrospect we should of dined here instead because the prices were way better and it smelled amazing.  Anyway, the bar area was nice and plenty of places to stand and or sit in the dining area. The food smelled so good and would love to grab a slice and a drink next time while here. They have gluten free options to include side and pizzas.

reviews.author: peggy e.
reviews.description: Best beer, best staff, best pizza! The staff is always  my favorite reason to come here! They have improved the "Beer Mates" appetizer and it's a meal on its own! We love Pinthouse!

reviews.author: Allison W.
reviews.description: We ordered ahead on their website right when it opened at 11 AM. We got a medium honey pear ($17) and a medium banh mi ($16).   Banh mi: the pickled red onions were the star of the show for me. The flavors of the toppings do remind me of banh mi. I would eat this one again for sure. The sriracha on it was a nice touch. It had a good balance of acid, spice, and freshness.  Honey pear: this flavor surprised me in a good way. I just gave this place 4 stars since I thought the toppings on this pizza was lacking a bit as I felt that there was a bit too much crust at the edges, especially compared to the banh mi pizza. I feel like the topping placement could have been more even - some slices didn't have much else besides caramelized onions.  We ordered ahead, and then just picked up our pizza from them and sat down in the store. This place has no waiter, you just order from a counter. The seating is very homey since it's a lot of big tables and bench seats.

reviews.author: Andy N.
reviews.description: Wow. Without a doubt, one of my favorite places in Austin, TX. I had grown tiresome of pizza, but Pinthouse reignited my love. Their innovative twists on a classic dish was truly incredible from the first bite when the diversity of flavors exploded on my tastebuds. Also, the price was phenomenal for the amount you get. One small pizza was MORE than enough to fill me up and leave me beyond satisfied. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying all their specialty pizzas. If you're looking for something incredible and affordable, this restaurant is an absolute MUST. Innovative, fresh, affordable, and delicious; it can't get any better.

reviews.author: Edgar R.
reviews.description: I've been to Pinthouse Pizza a couple of times now, but decided to take my family for the first this past weekend.  They really enjoyed the music, loved the food, and liked the variety of draft beer. The people at the bar were really nice and offered assistance with picking different beers for our flight. The lady taking our food order was in a bad mood, but that shouldn't take away from the restaurant's review.  Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Ann K.
reviews.description: Obsessed with the pizza rolls, best GF pizza in town, and Italian chopped salad is delicious and you can add golden raisins, pepperoni, blue cheese, and it will knock your socks off! Love this place!!!!!

reviews.author: Carly K.
reviews.description: Awesome beer and great pizza. The one with honey is fantastic and the salad is pretty good, too.

reviews.author: Doug P.
reviews.description: Super fun place with lots of cool beers.  They have pizza, pretzels and other brewery food.  The chips and salsa could have bought at the convenience store across the street as there was no creativity for $6.  The pretzel and pizzas were top notch.  We tried several of the beers over the course of two visits in two days.  All were really good and I would have the. Again if I ever go back.  The beer bases are awesome as well. Very helpful in finding the right beverage on a hot Texas Summer day.    Worth visiting!!

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: I went once and will def go back! They have an extensive beer menu and the food is great. This was our backup dinner after our planned dinner failed and I was really happy to have a good experience as we randomly chose to dine in. Service was friendly and offered beer suggestions when I asked. We ate chips, queso, and pizza. queso and salsa were great considering we weren't at a tex mex place. The pizza was cheesy with flavorful toppings. They have a small patio and there's parking in the strip center it's located.

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Always been such a huge fan of all things Pinthouse...food and beer! Their crust sets them apart from other 'za joints and they craft brews are right up their with any of the big guys (if you know, you know!).   During Covid quarantine, I have been taking advantage of their online beer release ordering and curbside pickup. Yay! Really hope this "new" process doesn't change. I also discussed they sell their dough to go, so I've been getting more creative in my own kitchen making pretzels and other yummies.   What else can I say? Nothing really, except go...just go! If you haven't yet, you're sadly missing out on this Austin institution.   Congrats on all the expansion and continues success Pinthouse! Cheers!

reviews.author: Sandra Y.
reviews.description: I'm a fan! I love this place! Their happy hour is amazing! I want to drink their ranch by the pint!  (I've discovered I only really LOVE love their specialty pies though - Honey Pear is possibly my favorite pizza of all time and the Banh Mi one is so fun and spicy and there's so many textures and flavors but it all works really well.)  Pictured is The Works and it wasn't anything special in my opinion. But I will always go back!! For Honey Pear  Note: Happy hour is M-F from 4-6pm and its $2 off pints of PHP beer as well as $2 off beer mates (cheesy garlic bread). Only complaint is I drink beer too slowly so maybe next time I'll order 2 before happy hour ends ;)

reviews.author: Daniel D.
reviews.description: Not only are the pizzas here at PHP unique, the flavors somehow just work amazingly well. For example, my friend convinced me to try the honey pear pizza (I was suspicious but got it anyways), the tanginess of the pear with the sweetness of the honey and caramelized onion, with the saltiness of the prosciutto made it one of my all time favorites! Of course, they have "regular" pizzas as well, which were also quite delicious. PHP is also a brewery. I won't claim to be a beer connoisseur (it was good beer, that's all I can say), but the combination of beer and pizza here is amazing! Great laid back atmosphere with excellent pies.

reviews.author: Monica S.
reviews.description: My favorite pizza place in Austin (and maybe ever!). I always go for the honey pear pizza with a side of ranch and a TX Keeper cider. Last time I was there, they let me know that my pizza wasn't to their standards because the dough had bubbled up a bit too much and caused some of the cheese to pool in places. I would've eaten it happily anyways, but they promised to bring me another, better pie after a while. They did bring one, but it still wasn't quite right to them, so they brought it to me in a to-go box, and promised to get the next one right. A little later, they brought out the "perfect honey pear" alongside a $20 gift card for my patience. I've never had a staff go so above and beyond for me! Always feel taken care of here, and always leave feeling wonderful.  Thanks, Pinthouse!!

reviews.author: Tomas R.
reviews.description: The drawings on the wall are basically a visual for my thought process and what goes on in my mind. It looks chaotic at first but if you take the time to look, you'll see it's actually quite interesting and there's a lot to see.  Spokesman - Highland is neatly tucked away in an industrial cul de sac that is next to a milk factory (yes, you read that right), but more importantly a brewery! There's a few parking spots right in front so I was able to snag one and walk up the few steps to get here. Their menu is immediately to your right and you can walk up to the counter to order.  I love how high the ceilings were and the back glass windows give you a sneak into the rock climbing gym business. Take the time to walk upstairs and grab a seat for a more intimate feel.
