Just be aware there weren't many outlets on the second floor, so plan accordingly!  Now for those of us that need a bite, they do have breakfast tacos and a few other items to munch. My beverage of choice was their cold brew black and damnnnn was this a clean roast. It wasn't watered down whatsoever and genuinely enjoyed both glasses.  It was nice to see minimalism yet artistic industrial feel to this coffee shop. I'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Dorris W.
reviews.description: The coffee shop is very nicely situated with plenty of parking. Outside there are benches and tables to work or eat on. Inside they had art all over the walls giving it an urban ambiance. There is also a window wall to see into the climbing gym next door which I thought was cool.  I got myself an oat latte and I was really disappointed since the barista had made such a nice leaf design. My coffee came out tasting sour so it was definitely under extracted and the oat milk itself tasted watery. The latte reminded me of the coffee I get in hotel rooms from a Keurig machine.   I would maybe go back to try something else besides the coffee.

reviews.author: Stanley D.
reviews.description: Sitting and drinking an Americano at this moment and it's really freaking good.  Good vibes, what Austin used to feel like.

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: Spokesman in Highland was modern and hipster. Vivid and bold caricatures danced across the walls while loud music blast across the speakers.   I arrived slightly after their happy hour. By then, they had sold out of all of their tacos and pastries which was disappointing. Their menu offered a wide selection of coffee and beer. I ordered a Hans Pilsner which was cold, crisp, and bright.   The pros were that the place is family friendly, minimalistic, and generally clean. The cons were the slow wifi, the abundance of drain flies, and the lack of backing on chairs.

reviews.author: Sara P.
reviews.description: Ambiance and decor was unique! You can grab a coffee and sit upstairs with a view of people climbing in the Climbing Center next door.   Coffee itself was expensive and mediocre. Music was fun but too loud for actually working.

reviews.author: Samuel C.
reviews.description: Entertainment value - Five Stars  Coffee - Two Stars  Long Term Place to Work - Two Stars  Keep Austin Weird - Six Stars  **********  Spokesman Coffee is for all intents and purposes an appendage of the Crux Climbing Center next door.   This is one of those artificial rock wall centers   Where people learn how to climb mountains   Being able to fall on to a mat rather than off of a cliff.  The second floor has huge wrap around windows where you can see the climbers in action.  Watching the climbers is like watching blooper out-takes from American Ninja.  People are just learning how to climb the rock walls.  Climbing rock walls is hard.  There are a lot of shenanigans trying to get up to the next nub.  There are a lot of shenanigans trying to stay on the old nub.  People go down a lot.  They go down a lot in harmless but entertaining ways.  For artistic contrast, there are also the buff ballet dancers of the indoor climbing world.  They are elegant, athletic, and can do all sorts of suave sophisticated moves.  They look even more elegant and athletic because Zeppo and Mimi,   Both Rank 1 Amateurs,   Are doing Three Stooges stuff trying to get up to the third nub.  * * *  If you are not here to watch the Brave Buffoons Falling Off the Wall Show,  then the stock of Spokesman goes way down.  The coffee is terrible.  I had an almost tasteless espresso. The taste that was there was less than wonderful.  My wife did not finish her cafe au lait.  She didn't like the coffee itself.  She didn't like the sweetened alt-milk that had been put in it.  Breakfast tacos were acceptable, but not worth leaving the house for.  As a work place, the tables are very very small.  You will work hard to fit your coffee, your food and your laptop all on the same postage stamp.  Worse - most seating stations have no backs.  This is by probably by design.  They don't have many seats.  They want to encourage you to move along   So someone else can buy some coffee and pay the rent.  There are also some people who can work on backless stools for hours.  I am not one of them.  My lower back gives out over time.  My back gives out over time because of the unusually weighty thoughts I have while I write.  These require extra furniture support.   If you don't like the previous explanation,   You can go with Samuel C. being old and washed up.  He needs a chair so he doesn't fall over while drooling.  Either way, if I am going to get work done, I am going to need better furniture.  Internet provision is very good though.  Give Spokesman credit for that.  The spray paint job on the walls?  All the more reason to watch the climbers.  If you look at the walls, you could hurt your eyes.  * * *  Overall, there are more negatives than positives at Spokesman.  But watching the climbers IS a riot.  If you are working on your grand masterpiece on "THE DECLINE AND FALL"  You might be able to do that here.  You can write about the climbers falling off the rock face.  You can write about yourself falling off your stool.  You can write about your espresso cup falling off your microtable.  You can write about how standards in coffee making have fallen off.  If you are there to study for your chemistry exam at ACC,   Your grades may end up falling off too.

reviews.author: Wayne N.
reviews.description: This place is as Austin as Austin gets. The spray paint decor really works and the space is cozy but a good place to work in if you need a place to study or work remote.   The drinks at the Spokesman are excellent. I ordered a caramel iced latte and it was very good. The milk options are on the lower end (whole, almond, oat), but the coffee is clean and flavorful and the caramel sweet enough but not overpowering. That said, prices are on the high side for a drink, especially for the size of the drink. It's definitely treat or entertainment coffee and not an everyday affair. Still, when those times roll around, more than happy to get my pick me up at the Spokesman.

reviews.author: Jan C.
reviews.description: Legit Chai here my tea people. What a joy to watch the barrista make it. Not that syrupy sweet chai out of a box but spicy warm foamy goodness. My hubby said his americano was the good stuff too. The space is edgy modern cool. Small stools are not comfy. Tables super small. Fun to watch the climbing gym. Close to Blue genie if you are out shopping over their next few weeks holiday bazaar.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: My friend and I came in today, and we were so impressed with their coffee! It's not frequent that we take a sip of our drinks and comment in amazement, but that was exactly what we did when we picked up our coffee. My iced matcha latte was definitely on the expensive side (~$6) and came in a pretty tiny cup, but it was one of the best matcha lattes I've ordered in Austin. My friend ordered a drip coffee, and he said the acidity and balance was perfect.   The inside of Spokesman is really unique! It seems like a great place to study, and they're open later than many other Austin coffee shops. I would definitely come back again.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: This place has really nice vibes along with delicious drinks and tacos :D I especially recommend the mint matcha!  Its a nice place to relax or study with outlets on the first floor. Or if you want to people watch, the second floor is nice too

reviews.author: Kaylee D.
reviews.description: The latte's are incredible! And the staff is always so nice and welcoming! Very cool environment to work or study.

reviews.author: Marie M.
reviews.description: Cool place for coffee, a selection of local beers (including their neighbor Brewtorium's beer!), and snacks. Good place to work-perfectly sized tables for a laptop and coffee. Upstairs seating overlooks climbing place on one side. Some outside seating (with outlets), too. Really friendly folks making the coffee, which is delicious. This may be a new work spot!

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Fantastic coffee and presentation, very cool two-floor space connected to the CRUX climbing centre, nice people. They have some great draft beers and even a canned piquette from the Austin Winery. Espresso comes with a little Rolo... nice touches !

reviews.author: Geoffrey C.
reviews.description: Great coffee spot sandwiched between Crux, the Brewtorium, and then Blue Genie off to the side. Parking is a plenty, outside seating is kind of not. It's just a couple picnic benches. Inside you can sit upstairs and overlook Crux. The decor is pretty interesting, it's basically a bunch of graffiti but only in black spray paint.  Coffee is pretty solid. I picked up a bag of their Ethiopian beans. It's good but the notes aren't as strong as I hoped. They open relatively late and close early compared to other places. But that's ok because once they close you can move it next door to the Brewtorium!

reviews.author: Adel L.
reviews.description: One of my new favorite places to get coffee. They brought samples into my work and I've started going since then. Im not sure what roast the cold brew is I feel like it's a lighter one but it gives it a nice flavor while black. It's pretty smooth compared to a few places I've been. They serve vegan tacos which is great and delicious, on the flip side their vegan coffee cake isn't that good. Maybe it needs to be warmed up? I'm not sure. The option to choose your espresso for lattes is amazing and one of my favorite things about this place. You can tell the beans here are quality just from opening and smelling inside the coffee bag if you buy one. I'll be coming more often.

reviews.author: Quyen D.
reviews.description: Visited their new location today and was greeted by two very sweet and welcoming baristas!   I got an iced pumpkin spice latte (the gourdon ramsay) because it was such a warm day but I recommend trying it hot for the best experience, especially if you appreciate milk texture and want an enhanced flavor of the spices! (Can't go wrong though!)   Same amazing art and vibes as the Elmo location. This space feels a little smaller, but they have an upstairs area. Tables are nice and spaced out, and there's hand sanitizer near the front. :)   Stop by if you're in the area! Might be a little difficult to find at first, but if you're on airport, turn on denson dr and then onto Dillard Cir. There's plenty of parking on the street facing the store.

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: This spot has a very cool vibe. It has patio seating, a loft area that overlooks Crux Climbing gym and a delicious pumpkin spice drink called the "Gordon Ramsey".

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: Stopped in this afternoon for the first time. This location is great, across from ACC and next to Blue Genie and a climbing gym and brewery.   I had an iced mocha, I usually get it with skim milk but they didn't have that so it was extra creamy than I usually get, super delicious. If you stay in for your visit they have glassware to serve drinks In.   Nice patio out front, and seating on 2 levels inside. Plenty of room to spread out. Free WiFi. Bike racks in front of the shop and I saw plenty of parking but I bet it's tight on the weekend. Inside had music playing but not too loud. You could have a private conversation with no problem.   Covid safety: all employees were masked up, customers need to a mask inside except when eating or drinking.   I like this place and it's close to home, I will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Ian H.
reviews.description: My wife and I have been on a question to try as many coffee shops as we can in Austin. Since moving here from Chicago during the summer, we've made our way through our list at a pretty good clip. I'm not sure how Spokesman wasn't on our radar until this week, but boy am I glad we found it. We took advantage of the baby's nap time to walk with her and make the 1.5-mile trek over to their new location off Highland.  What we found was an awesome environment, delicious coffee, and two super friendly baristas.  Kudos to both of them for the engaging conversation on snow, Houston, and peppermint mochas -- and most importantly, for the delicious coffee. If mgmt is reading this, it was the two baristas whoring on the morning of 1/18. One of them was subbing in from another one of your locations.  I can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Karen T.
reviews.description: They have amazing cold brew! The offer oat milk which is a HUGE plus!  They were super friendly, although I might suggest: It was my first time there and I led with "hey, it's my first time here" and the girl at the front didn't bother to suggest a thing. I used to manage a place like this and can tell you that for certain my experience would've been more enjoyable if she would've suggested something. Nonetheless she was super friendly!

name: Yard House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Manuel C.
reviews.description: Been here a few times. I must say that the waiters and waitresses here are phenomenal. During my most recent experience our waitress was Karisha.  Late 30s early 40s generation like me will LOVE the music selection here - I felt like they were playing my old playlists from high school or something!   (And they actually have a barcode to listen to their playlist on Spotify which I thought was cool)  I ordered the 20 oz ribeye. (I had a very paltry breakfast and had recently worked out so my body was lusting for some bovine carnage)  My better half ordered truffle fries and the Gardein Buffalo chicken - which she absolutely loved - and trust me that's a rare sight - so Thank You Yard House!  Meanwhile, this steak had everything I hoped for - it was bone-in, juicy and cooked to perfection. The server even asked me to cut into it to ensure it was to my liking - I had to ask her to repeat herself because I've never had someone ask me before.. how thoughtful! And cut into it I did, again and again until all that was left was the bone.   The Parmesan mashed potatoes were also scrumptious! Just the right texture and not too cheesy at all, the right touch of Parmesan.   Oh and there was also the healthy baby broccoli. The heads were very good, the stem was a little tough for me to chew but that's probably because they are grilled (as opposed to steamed) but that's fine because I usually only eat the heads anyways.   I don't usually drink but they are supposed to have a large selection on tap as well as bottled beers. I had the Heineken 0 (0% alcohol) and for those who used to drink Heineken I recommend it because it tastes exactly like the real thing! I was amazed they had it, so I guess there's something for everyone here.  I think this place is a keeper and I will return to see what other delicious adventures are lurking inside that menu. I've had the steak bowl before and it always hits the spot! The burgers are also delicious - though sadly I'm watching my carb intake recently.   In the end, you can't go wrong with this place! It can get pretty busy but all you have to do is give your name and number and they text you when your table is ready! Just go walk to Restoration Hardware and look at extremely expensive furniture you'll never buy in the meantime or stroll on over to Amazon books and play with their toys :) the possibilities are endless

reviews.author: Tim D.
reviews.description: I have always seen this place but never really made it in until recently. I will add the disclaimer that we did go during SXSW as well as Spring break. On top of understanding most places are dealing with coming out of covid restrictions and labor storages.  We went while walking around the Domain. It was busy, but not packed. We were sat with no wait, but then sat for almost 15 min before someone came to greet us and get our drink order. We had already decided on trying several of the apps and then maybe splitting a pizza. So we ordered our apps with our drinks. We got the pretzel, edamame, cheese curds, and calamari. Another 10 min go by and our drinks (literally a coke, water, and tea) are finally brought and the food about 15 min later. We didn't see our server again. Calamari was very rubbery and cold and bland. The pretzel was ok on it's own but the beer cheese they made with it was really beer forward and couldn't taste much else. The cheese curds were a little over cooked but not horrible. And the edamame was almost inedible. A different server came after about 45 min and asked if we wanted refills, our glasses being empty for more than 30 min. We decided to not order the pizza and just pay and leave.  I gave them 3 stars because like I said I totally understand the staff shortages and it being SXSW and all that. But really not great food or service. Their bar menu looked very detailed for those who drink, and we might give them a shot later down the road to see if things are better without a big event going on. But not any time soon.

reviews.author: Bruce S.
reviews.description: We've come here almost every week, sometimes multiple times a week since we moved to Austin 3 months ago. The hours are great and the food has always been good, you get a full menu and happy hour specials. I'm not sure if we've been here any other Sunday but this past Sunday the food was absolutely awful. I'm not sure if the head chef, kitchen manager, etc. is off or what but both our meals and appetizer tasted like they were microwaved leftovers.   We got the ahi tuna and it was very strange this time, so strange I didn't want to really eat it but the portion was so small this time we just ate it. I guess that kind of shows we're really not picky so when I say something was terrible it's really-really bad. I know anyone reading this will say that's your fault for getting ahi tuna from a sports bar but we've got it dozens of times and it was always surprisingly good. The tuna sandwich and poke nachos are great as well, but we didn't get them this time. We did get the fish and chips and the hot chicken sandwich. The fish was 100% microwaved, it was rubbery and had no crisp to the breading so they're dead giveaways. Also, the coleslaw was brown so that was nice. The chicken sandwich tasted nothing like the chicken sandwiches we've had from there before, and the taste of this one was not pleasant. We still ate most of our food so I wasn't going to complain that it was terrible unless our waitress asked and to my surprise she never did. lol. I think she knew so she avoided that question.   The cocktails and beer selection is great from here and they make great drinks for a sports bar. During happy hour they have small discounts on drinks and larger discounts on food. I don't remember what they all are but I know the cocktails are 2 dollars off, nothing crazy but hey I'll take it. I ordered my first cocktail during happy hour and about 30-40 minutes later another. The waitress took my order for the drink and came back later maybe 10-15 minutes and asked if I still want the drink I ordered. I was confused and said yeah so another 10 minutes or so I got my drink. My girlfriend was on her phone and noticed she came back to ask right after 11 PM when happy hour is done. So I was charged 2 dollars extra for one drink, I could care less. But it was really weird for her to do that.   I don't think we'll stop coming here because of our bad experience. I figured I would take my time to at least let the establishment know of our experience. So they can improve - if they want to. I know a lot of restaurants have staffing issues and there is a massive amount of competition in Austin. A bad meal isn't the end of the world by any means.

reviews.author: Linsie W.
reviews.description: This place was busy on a Saturday night! I think this place is just alright. I think it's overly hyped perhaps because of the location. But overall the service was good and the food was ok. I got the steak bowl but had it sent back to the kitchen because the steak was so extremely tough! The meat in the picture looks red but it was so tough. The best part of our meal was probably the truffle fries. They had a nice truffle flavor but other than that, nothing too spectacular about our meal.

reviews.author: Angel C.
reviews.description: Exceptional service(two waiters were both checking on our tables and made sure we had everything we needed!) and pretty solid food! I got the KBBQ Cheesesteak sandwich, which had decent flavors and nice presentation. I would personally have preferred a stronger tasting gochujang sauce, but it was still tasty as is. My friend got the whiskey salmon, which had great sauce! The sweetness and whisky flavors mixed very well. I had a pretty good experience overall and was really happy with the atmosphere and waiters! Tim and Noah, you guys were cool!  I also had Yard House in the past once at maybe 1am and ordered their pepperoni mushroom pizza and Margherita pizza, both which tasted great! Definitely a great meal after being out with friends. Would recommend as a fun, laidback place to eat and drink!

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We absolutely love yard houses HH! We have tried bunch of there appetizers and they are all pretty good, and most of there appetizers are 50% off and pizzas too. But if it's outside the HH time, I this it's bit pricey.  Chicken nachos: skimpy on the chicken and too much of sour cream.  Korean chicken wings: it was pretty good, it had a nice hint with a hint of sweetness and our kiddo loved it.  Onion rings: I mostly don't like onion rings because it's greasy and feels heavy, but at the YH, it's light, crispy and non greasy.  Chicken strips: chicken strips comes with the small basket of fries, chicken stripes itself doesn't have much flavors or seasoning, but it's good if you dip it in some sauce.  They don't have online reservations, so that sucks. Ordering and paying is with the tablet they have on the table and that's not convenient either, we had to try atleast 4-5 times for payment to go through and it's so confusing, otherwise everything else is good.

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: Always a pleasure to eat and drink here when I'm in town! The management staff is amazing, very accommodating to our group of 13! Our work team visits the Domain area once a year and we always stop in to have dinner. This time was just the same...great staff and awesome eats! Can't wait to visit again!

reviews.author: Dan K.
reviews.description: Great food, ice cold beer with a huge selection and amazing staff. I travel to Austin a few times a year. This will make my list of have to go places. Blake is a rock star bartender. Lots of TV's too if you like sports.

reviews.author: Alina Y.
reviews.description: Yard house has the best happy hour!!  I get the nachos everytime because the size is huge! but all the other happy hour stuff is just as good!

reviews.author: Savannah M.
reviews.description: A Must Go!!!... Every time we come visit close to the Domain , we have to come to YARD HOUSE! THE ATMOSPHERE is nice.  Very spacious.  The staff is Amazing and professional but not so much where they're snobby.  Just a kick back place.  While my husband and I sat down at the bar there was a guy watching a game..GO DODGERS!! To our left.. a couple to our right and a blind date across the way. I feeds everyone's needs.   Our bartender KEITH was fantastic...  if your ever so luck for him to make you a drink... you'll be in mixer heaven. He recommended a beer to my hubby some kind of blonde.  Jez I wish I can remember the name... any who, he's gave himself a sample and that was the end of that.  Also, we ordered shots and I ordered a dirty martini.  EVERY.  SINGLE.  DRINK.  Was delicious haha. But also, he was  good company and made sure we're taken care of.   Pros: EVERYTHING!!!! FOOD IS ON ANOTHER LEVEL.  CHEERS TO THE KITCHEN  Cons: nothing. And I always find something that can be

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Yard House in my opinion, is a chain that is highly underrated especially when it comes to their happy hour. In case you didn't know, during happy hour all their apps are half off.! Unfortunately I only took pictures of the calamari and nachos, however some of my appetizer favorites are the ahi sashimi, poke nachos, fried calamari, and the chicken lettuce wraps. I also like the chicken nachos, classic sliders, and have heard great things about the cheese curds. Often times, I come here for the happy hour and don't even end up ordering an entre just get a few half priced apps!

reviews.author: Tangela C.
reviews.description: I've been here one time years ago and I had a nice experience that time. I had a good experience this time as well. The front staff and my waitress were nice. The waitress that assisted me was attentive, knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. My order came out in a timely manner. I ordered blackened shrimp tacos that came with rice and beans. The sauce that is on the tacos is spicy. For my drink I ordered a Sangria. The food and drink were great!   I sat outside on the patio because it was a nice day outside. The patio is a nice size that has a lot of tables. The restrooms were clean and they are unisex. It's a parking garage across from Yard House which is convenient.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: This place lends itself to whatever mood you're in whether that is bar, indoor more personal dining or outside patio. The drinks were pretty and tasty cocktails, the poke nachos are always delicious and we went w our usual favorites there, mine was the carnivore pizza and his was the spicy jambalaya. Overall a nice chill vibe and atmosphere and nice little stop in the domain.

reviews.author: Zoly N.
reviews.description: Me and a friend just having our lunch today and i am in love with their drinks, foods is fantastic! Coming back for our lunch next time!

reviews.author: Elyssa C.
reviews.description: I live for these nachos. They're SO good and cheap! It's technically an appetizer but I get it as a main dish and it's so filling. Huge plate!  The pineapple Maui chicken was tasty! Broccolini is the BEST vegetable. Period.

reviews.author: Hal F.
reviews.description: What a great surprise!  I have passed the Yard House several times since I moved to Austin, and never eaten there.  Finally, last night I had dinner at the Yard, and was so pleased.  First, Miguel, our  young wonderful Server who was just the BESTEST-helpful, kind and patient.  You couldn't ask for more.  Second, the food, the appetizers, buffalo wings and Sushi Nachos were so impressive, fresh and tasty.  The bacon cheese burger were amazing.  Good beef, and delicious fries.  Of course the Beer was good too, and cold.  All in all I am already planning my return until I sampled everything on the menu that appeals to me.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: So this is my second visit to the yard house. I enjoy coming here because they remind me I'm home except for the beach is missing. The one I attended back home in California was on the Long Beach Beach sure.   I do enjoy coming here because of the bomb vampire tacos and the atmosphere. I also enjoy coming here and hanging out with my girlfriend. It's been one of our spots!

reviews.author: Rachel W.
reviews.description: Doesn't support local UT sport and will only   amplify professional sports. Never go to this bar if your wanting to watch collegiate sports. This sports bar should rebrand themselves as a bar only.

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: It's spacious. Our server Jess was attentive. 9 oz pour of wines are $3 off during late night happy hour. Some appetizers are also half off including the onion ring tower. I found a really good mushroom pasta dish that two others ended up getting as well. the check out system is manual at the table. so that's nice.

reviews.author: Anna G.
reviews.description: When it comes to brews and good food, you just can't beat Yard House. Such good wings and the ipa white cheddar beer sauce complemented the Bavarian pretzel so well. Loved the mew offshoot ipa!

name: Whisler's
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: SHAKE IT TILL YOU MAKE IT!   After dinner last night we decided on going bar hopping. I really don't know the places to go so I trusted my brother and his girlfriend's opinions here. They wanted to show me the places where they have gone on dates and enjoyed.   Whiskers was one of the first stops we made after dinner. My brother told me that this bar had plenty of different rooms that you could go into. So we first walked around and went into each of the rooms before ordering some drinks.   Me being the smart 25 year old that I am decided for the evening since I had already had vodka at dinner I was going to only drink white liquor for the evening because I did not want to screw myself and be really hungry over when my parents got here the next day. (HAHA)!   I looked over the seasonal menu and decided on the Sage Advice drink! It had citrus juices in it as well as vodka. And it was spectacular. All of the flavors in this beverage complimented each other very well. It is definitely one of those drinks I would classify as dangerous. If you had a few of those you might be on the floor. It honestly tastes like juice. So one too many might lead to you not being able to walk. So just be warned.   The inside of the bar was decorated for christmas. They went all out. There were chandeliers at the bars and lights everywhere and even one big christmas tree all decorated in white lights.   It is definitely one of those bars that you need to check out next time you are in Austin. I have only seen it with the holiday decor, but I am sure they decorate it all out for other holidays as well!   The staff and service was great! Very quick and easy. It is a busy bar so you might have to wait a few minutes to get a bartenders attention. But it it all worth it at the end of the night!

reviews.author: Brandon Y.
reviews.description: An East Austin staple with an eclectic and quirky décor.  If you are looking for a quiet, stuffy cocktail bar, this place is not what you're looking for (at least on the weekends). I would characterize it as sort of a slightly dressed up dive bar with some very unique vibes. The interior has the feeling of an old wild west sort of saloon, crossed with an old cathedral, crossed with an old hunting lodge. Past patrons have written messages on the walls and it is interesting reading some of their musings while sipping on an old fashioned. The exterior bar is fairly standard, although there is a random bath tub located in the middle of the backyard area, which is another interesting quirk.  Generally, the cocktails here are quite good; sometimes they pre-make the cocktails in a larger batch, cutting down on the wait time a bit. My experience has generally been positive with the pre-made cocktails.  One downside here is that it is very popular and is therefore quite crowded much of the time. During the busiest hours on weekend nights, you can expect to encounter a line to get in and another line to get drinks. That said, if you're with the right company, a few minutes wait for cocktails is pretty tolerable.  If you are visiting Austin, this is one good spot to check out to experience the "charm" of the area. Additionally, being on 6th, this place is very walkable to other bars and makes for a great place to start or end the night.

reviews.author: Anni D.
reviews.description: Was recommended by multiple people to check out this spot but I was pretty unimpressed. We came here on a Thursday night and it was extreme packed. Waiting 30+ mins at the bar to order drinks is not fun.   The drinks themselves were just OK. Nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary. Not sure what the hype is about.

reviews.author: Katherine M.
reviews.description: This is my favorite bar in Austin. Take that with a rim of salt as I do love Mezcal. Their frozen cocktails are delicious and reasonably priced. There is plenty of space downstairs, but if you really enjoy Mezcal head upstairs to the tasting room where an expert will line you up with a tasting based on your preference. A must visit in Austin.

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Whisler's has been a gem on the east side withe great vibes and phenomenal cocktails. Came here on a Saturday afternoon and had the best time getting some drinks while sitting on the patio. The bartenders are awesome and extremely helpful when ordering.   We ordered a few drinks, and we loved each one of them! They even offer happy hour 2-5 daily which includes an old fashioned, a gin lavender drink, mule, and many more. As we were leaving the lines for the bar were getting pretty long, however the bartenders move pretty quickly so the wait was not too bad. Love this spot, especially if you are looking for some unique cocktails.

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: Whisler's is an excellent stop on E 6th street. Their cocktails, service and music selection are top notch.  It's often easy to find a spot to sit indoors or outside. I highly recommend the Temple of Doom cocktail if you like mezcal and pineapple. Great spot for a drink before or after dinner.

reviews.author: Swati G.
reviews.description: This is my all time favorite bar in Austin, and the only reason it isn't getting five stars is because of how busy it can be on weekends. The bar upstairs is a mezcal tasting room which has yet to disappoint me. The bartender will tailor your tasting to what you and your guests are interested in trying and also ensure that the space isn't too overrun by other guests. Push through the crowd and add this bar to your itinerary when visiting Austin and I can assure you won't be disappointed with the experience.

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed my drinks here, and the inside ambiance was awesome. It was a hot afternoon, and it got a bit uncomfortable inside (no a/c), but it would be an awesome place on a cool fall day (the four we have in Austin!). I tried the old fashioned first, having heard it was "signature." It did not disappoint! My second drink was not as good (something to do with ambition in the name?), so I will stick to the old fashioned next time.   Also, I feel it's worth mentioning that I didn't feel any sort of discrimination. Having read some of the other reviews, I was a little nervous to visit as older than 30,  but I found no problems at all. I had no issues getting drinks. Only once did an employee act like a jerk because the inside bar was closed, but that wasn't readily apparent, and he got snippy that I was waiting there. He did it with others, too, though. I think everyone's experiences are valid, but my experience was not that this bar only caters to picture perfect 20-somethings.

reviews.author: Kolby G.
reviews.description: Easily one of the best spots in Austin. Staff is amazing and super friendly. Drinks are tasty. The inside is a lot of fun. Normally a very chill spot but can get busy and noisy on the weekends. They even come up with off menu mocktails on the fly. Fantastic spot!

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: This was one of my go-to bars to take visitors in Austin pre-COVID and I am so happy that I have been able to visit now that bars are reopening (safely)! Definitely recommend going after dark because the setting of the inside of the bar is part spooky/part western-y/part old-timey and kinda makes you feel like you could meet a vampire in the corner... but in a cool way! I have had many different drinks from their set menu but admittedly their bartenders know high quality cocktails on and off the menu so order your heart's wishes.   My most recent order: - Twisted Nerve - Fancy, not-too-sweet, and so refreshing on a warm day! - Whisler's Old Fashioned - Smooth and will put some hair on your chest.  Give this bar a shot! Or take a shot... No judgement here.

reviews.author: Sheila K.
reviews.description: Loved the vibe here. Plenty of space, two bars, and a tasting room. Great local place to visit in Austin if you're from out of town. There is also a small tequila tasting room upstairs.

reviews.author: Karley M.
reviews.description: Loved the environment here and the outdoor seating. Super chill with lots of space. There's a food truck here but we didn't eat there so I can't comment!

reviews.author: April L.
reviews.description: Hey y'all! This is my first review on yelp. My bestie went to wee wee and...get this...GLASS!!! On the floor!!! Ok and I'm not like the least clumsy person . I've made mistakes in my life !!?!? But like hazard much??? Hoping for more whiskers

reviews.author: Joey D.
reviews.description: A little pricey but a great vibe and amazing crafts. Will definitely return next time I'm in town.

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: A true East Austin Vibe. Great specialty cocktail list, food truck outside, solid bartenders.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Whisler's was the best accident I stumbled upon in East Austin. Delicious drinks, no matter what was ordered. The tea + alcohol mix is the best thing that's ever been created. I can't have any thing else! If you're one of those people who say, "I don't like *insert disdainful alcohol color of choice*", trust me, you won't discriminate alcohol after coming to Whislers.

reviews.author: Sophie H.
reviews.description: Jesse is the most outstanding bartender at this establishment! After the bald fellow working at the indoor bar proceeded to ignore my group for 15+ minutes while he served people who came in behind us, we confronted him and he said "it's called waiting your turn"  we made our way to the back bar where Jesse took our order and immediately made the drinks, (which were amazing!) and apologized for his coworkers incompetence. His great service completely saved our visit and we will be returning to this establishment!

reviews.author: Junus A.
reviews.description: Last night my wife and I made the mistake of going to another cocktail bar that wasn't Whislers. Big mistake. ~$30 and 45 unimpressive minutes later, we hightailed it over to East 6th.   First thing I noticed is that they nixed their dinky parking situation to make room for even more patio tables. Perfect. It's not like Whisler's really needed the space, but with the interior bar unmanned and COVID in the air, it's a welcome addition.  I'm always surprised when people say the cocktails here are unimpressive. I don't know where else they are drinking (in ATX at least), but I'd appreciate a clue-in. Whisler's does a damn fine job; we always drink too much here because we can't stop sipping on inventive and tasty cocktails.   Last night's outing had two standouts I'd like to highlight. First, the Drab Majesty. With rum, cachaça (a fermented sugarcane liquer), beet, raspberry and lime, the drink struck a sweet spot between sweet and savory, with some carribean flair to boot. Next, the Feel Good Hit of the Summer, mint julep-inspired with an attitude. Couching the bourbon inside a fruity melangerie of cantaloupe, apricot, lemon and lemongrass made for a supremely sippable summer drink - a sublime libation if I ever had one.   Last note; I love coming to Whisler's and walking out having tried multiple types of alcohol I never knew existed. It's always fun to learn a thing or two!

reviews.author: Caroline N.
reviews.description: I had heard really great things about Whistlers. My expectations were that I would have a great drink and prepare to wait for it.   To my surprise, I got a great drink without the waiting part. I had a twisted nerve which was fantastic. Not sweet, not dry, just really smooth. The other patron in my party had an old fashioned and said it was perfect!  The prices are great for how strong the drinks are. The music and energy were reminiscent of the speakeasies. I definitely recommend and will be visiting this establishment again to try some of the other drinks on the menu.

reviews.author: Ashleigh K.
reviews.description: When staying at arrive hotel in Austin I was thrilled to see that whisler's was directly across the street from our hotel. This place is bustling at night. I am not sure if there was an upstairs as we hang out on the lower level. Downstairs there's was two bars one inside and another outside in a tented area. The vibe here is very romantic and relaxed. It has almost a speak easy feeling about it. We ordered several drinks off the menu and loved all of them. The bartenders were all pleasant and kept up with the amount of people. I would not recommend if you are someone who gets claustrophobic though as it can get really packed. Whisper's is super loud and open very late.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Love getting a pizza from here while enjoying some craft beer at Celis. You do have to order thru the app, you can't just walk up and order. I've had a few different pizzas from them, and they are all good. Definitely one of my go to's.

reviews.author: Virginia R.
reviews.description: We really wanted to like this place... we live really close by. I didn't want to make dinner and my husband suggested that we try BackDraft.  It took over an hour to get our order. The brewery was having trivia night so maybe they were swamped with orders? Regardless, while the food tasted great, the portions (pizza and pizza rolls) were pricey for what we got. Paid over $50 for dinner (one salad, one small pizza, 3 very small pizza rolls and one dessert.)

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: BackDraft Pizzeria would have gotten 5 stars for the flavors of the pizza and pizza rolls but the timing was so slow, it left me wondering if I was just starving when the pizza was finally ready. They were so busy that they ran out of cheese and took about 40 minutes to prep the ingredients. I did enjoy the dough and the selections of pizza.

reviews.author: Thomas O.
reviews.description: On a slow afternoon trying to use their app. Asked the guy if he could help and he is every kind of rude. Place the order wait 40 minutes. No text so I go check and get snapped at. At 1 hour I go back to tell him to forget it. OH its ready now. All I ordered was pizza rolls. They were burned on the outside and cold in the middle. Terrible just terrible.

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: Terrific pizza, but painful service.  BackDraft Pizza is wonderful pizza.  But, ordering it, customizing it, and paying for it is a pure pain in the ass.   I've gotten their pizza on at least three or four times over the past year.  And each time, the ordering process is a bad joke.    For example, last night, with a windchill of about 20 degrees, I stood in the ordering window for roughly 10 minutes, because the ordering app would not work.   After entering my debit card info including cell number and email address, there was no "submit" button on the app.  I handed my phone to the clerk and asked him to show me where to click it.    After getting my phone, he squinted at the screen, stating he didn't have his glasses, and couldn't read it.   We fumble with the app for another five minutes, with no success.  Meanwhile, I'm freezing my ass off.   Finally, after almost 15 minutes, the guy grabs the iPad, takes my card and enters the order manually, and then has to re-insert my debit card. Once they finally get the order, I ask how long it will be.  "About 20 minutes" he answers.  I look at my watch and it's 7:15.   At 7:40, 25 minutes later, I had not gotten a text yet.  Since I had waited more than 25 minutes, I went out to check on it.    I figured they'd have it ready by then.   Oh no!  It'd be another 5 minutes.  This was like the Seinfeld episode at the Chinese Restaurant.  "Another 5 minutes."  I had to duck around the corner, to get out of the wind.  I had left my coat inside, as they had led me to expect the pie to be ready.   These as**holes  kept me waiting another 15 minutes, before they finally delivered the pizza, about 40 minutes after I first ordered it.  I thought I would freeze to death before they handed over the pizza.   It was terrific, as usual, but I won't be subjecting myself this type of suffering, because the Company can't get its app to work--and then subjects the customer to a consistent routine of misery, just to order one of their pizzas.  It's great pizza, but definitely NOT worth the labor required to simply ORDER ONE ONLINE.  The pandemic's nearly over. Perhaps it's time to junk the app, and TRAIN THEIR STAFF HOW ACCEPT ORDERS MANUALLY.

reviews.author: Olivia H.
reviews.description: BackDraft keeps switching up their home on us, but we will follow them all over Metric. Our favorites are the Shrooms to the Moon (Mushrooms, Caramelized Onions, Sausage) and the Backdraft (Sausage, Pepperoni, Jalapeños) pizzas.   They are the perfect accompaniment to a pint of draft beer from whichever brewery is housing them at the moment. But if you're looking to just bring their pizza home, you can also order online ahead of time to skip that 20 min wait on site.

reviews.author: Ashlynd B.
reviews.description: The food itself was really good. My only gripe is that the photo for the pizza rolls shows 6 of them, and there's nothing in the description to tell you otherwise, but you only get 3. I was quite disappointed to pay almost $8 for 3 pizza rolls.

reviews.author: Marcia L.
reviews.description: This is the 3rd time they canceled!!!!! Horrible service. Don't act like you're taking orders when you can't! Total BS!!!! I will never again try here.

reviews.author: Justin H.
reviews.description: Ordered a few pizzas over the weekend, and thoroughly enjoyed them!  If you like pizzas that are lighter and refreshing, then this is a place to try. My favorites were the Twisted Rita and Sweet Sow. The Shrooms to the Moon had some good umami to it -- it's the most flavorful, but a bit heavier than the first two. Also -- if you like pizza rolls, then I would definitely try the Rollin' Ronies.  I will definitely be ordering these again in the near future.  Note about ordering: I ordered online and picked up the food. I will say, however, that the order was not ready by the estimated time. Instead, you can wait for a text notification to pick up the order. I didn't know that, but now I do!

reviews.author: Abby T.
reviews.description: The pizza and garlic bread was good but they didn't deliver my dessert. More sauce is needed but overall, ok

reviews.author: Sam G.
reviews.description: I ordered using Yelp grub hub for my very first time , apparently they never got my the order. I went to them and made me pizza  on the spot I ordered around 6:30 finally getting my pizza at 9:16 and had to pick it up myself  tried to cancel my order and they never picked up the phone . I dnt know where there was a disconnect but it needs to be fixed . Delivery was trash but also no communication with the customers.

reviews.author: Joe I.
reviews.description: I know this review will never make it on the board. The pizza was average at best with no significant flavors, crust or sauce components.  Maybe I have Covid (been vaccinated), but can't agree with all the great reviews about this place.

reviews.author: Olivia V.
reviews.description: Looking at recent Yelp reviews, I was nervous about how this place would turn out. BackDraft did NOT disappoint.   First off, where is it? There is conflicting info on Yelp and their website. I called ahead because going to the wrong pickup spot would turn me into a hangry rage. They did not answer the phone but the host breweries did. CONFIRMED: They are currently located at Celis brewery.   We ordered 2 pizzas for pickup on Grubhub on a Friday night. BackDraft and pepperoni. They were ready in about 30 minutes. CONFIRMED: The pizzas were AMAZING. Like... hands down some of the best pizza I've ever had. Their homemade sausage and humongous thin pepperoni slices were phenomenal.  I can't speak for anyone else's experiences recently. It sounds like delivery may be questionable? But as of April 2021, if you can drive to pick up a pie, this is the place you need to go.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Really nice Naples style pizza with quality mozzarella. Nice crust and supplied parmesan and red pepper. Cute lil baby in the truck.

reviews.author: Christian C.
reviews.description: Oh man.  The pizza here is fire.    It's located right in front of 4th Tap Brewing Co-Op  which is a perfect pair.  We ordered their signature pizza, The Backdraft.  It's topped with House Made Spicy Sausage, Pepperoni, Fresh Jalapeños, but we also added mushrooms on ours.  It's a thin crust style pizza that is PACKED with flavor.  Our buddy ordered the Kale Yeah Caesar salad which he was very pleased with.  The guys that run this truck are really cool and definitely dedicated to their craft.  Backdraft Pizzeria is definitely up there on the short list of Austin's best pizza.  I'd be surprised if they didn't branch out and open up another location in the near future, especially in the downtown Austin area.  I would highly recommend giving them a visit and try their food.  How can you say no to a fantastic pizza and a frothy craft beer to go with it?

reviews.author: Britt C.
reviews.description: Had a craving for "real" pizza and BackDraft was in the top 3 when I did a search but it was the great reviews and photos that sealed the deal. We quickly ordered the Backdraft pizza, a pepperoni pizza, and wings. The order was delivered contactless and on time, hot and ready to eat. We've lived in Austin for almost 2 years and I've been disappointed by all the Austin favorite pizza spots but my days of yearning for good pizza are DONE. My husband and I are both now completely obsessed with Backdraft and I'm sure will be ordering it again very, very soon.

reviews.author: Danny H.
reviews.description: I ordered on Yelp App to delivery.  2 pizza and a salad, but I just got 2 pizza. where is the salad.  I called to the restaurant but didn't answer.

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: I'm a sucker for a good cheese pizza, and this place has it. I was super impressed by the dough, tangy sauce, and the perfect amount of cheese. I do wish there were a few more options to kick off the meal but hey, when I'm craving cheese pizza, this is the only place to curve that craving.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: TLDR: BackDraft is back, and they're better than ev-VAH!  I'm a longtime fan of BackDraft, even once calling it 'the best pizza you can get off a truck'.  That's damning with faint praise, as this is some of the best pizza in all of Austin.    Back when I first tried them, the food truck was parked down on 360 near Bee Cave.  But now that both I and they have moved to the north quadrant of Austin, and they're attached to an excellent brewery to boot!  By far, my favorite is a slightly altered 'Shrooms to the Moon', which is a triple-whammy combo of homemade spicy sausage, mushrooms, and carmelized onion. If you look at the picture, you'll see that the crust has the  right amount of 'char' or 'leoparding' as some call it.   Whoever's doing the pizza-slinging at BackDraft knows their stuff. Get down here when they're open, grab a brewski, and you're in for one of the best lunch combos that Austin can serve up!  Some Tips:  1) I said 'best lunch', but be sure to check their hours before you come. I'm pretty sure they just do lunch Friday and Saturday.  Otherwise, they follow brewery peak hours and just do evenings.  2) Try the Shrooms to the Moon but ask them to hold the caramelized onions.  Without the onions, you get a spicier, hotter pizza which goes perfectly with a pale ale beer to wash it down.  You'll end up with a pizza-nirvana feeling of a warm glow in your tummy.  This place scores a 5 out of 5 on the 'CTJ Scale', as noted below.  5 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing away after finishing a plate here. 4 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary. 3 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus' Dad. 2 out of 5 stars: Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn't have my last supper here. 1 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn't have my penultimate supper here, either.

reviews.author: Jeannie L.
reviews.description: At noon on a Friday, it only took 13 minutes to get my food. I got pizza and wings to go. This is one of the best pizzas I have had in Austin so far. The crust was very thin and had a good crunch to it. The sauce for the wings had a slight sweetness and wasn't too hot. I also appreciate that they put the buffalo sauce for my wings on the side, so that they wouldn't get soggy before I got home.

reviews.author: Karen B.
reviews.description: All the way from Vancouver Canada! This is the best BBQ I've tried in Texas! (Yes, I've been to all of the BBQ places in Texas).  Clean restaurant, great music and the service is superb!   Thank you!

reviews.author: Brendan L.
reviews.description: Best no-line waiting bbq in Austin  Absolute goodness   Yep good stuff they want me to write more

reviews.author: Mark V.
reviews.description: My wife and I love slab, but we were extremely upset that the Burnet location decided to close 15 minutes early on a Saturday. Closing at 8pm is already a bit early for a weekend night, but shutting off the open sign at least 15 minutes early is crazy. It could have been longer, but it was off when we got there, so who knows when they did shut it down.   The new phone and order system also sucks. You can't talk to anyone, it just sent us to voicemail. Even the online now shuts off early due to toast tab not taking pickup orders when we tried to put one in on our way there.   You are not the only place in town that sells great bbq, guys. If you keep making it difficult to buy yours, people will just go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Danielle W.
reviews.description: The ribs were so Smokey and delicious! They fell right off the bone. The sides were great! Nothing was dry. The glaze on the ribs was the perfect sweet and spicy with the habanero glaze.   We are definitely going to be back.

reviews.author: Nikiba J.
reviews.description: My niece and sister spoke very highly of Slab BBQ, I'm all for some good bbq! I save calories for good food.  The first turn off for me the secret shopper was that the cashier stated he could not change $100 bill for a $55 order! Wow.  Second, as you can see in my pictures my sliced beef sandwich was drrrrry! So d@'-dry I got beef stuck In my throat from trying to wash that dry ass beef down and that was without the bread!! I felt some foul vibes when we approached the counter but I just thought I was tripping. I truly believe the meat cutter knew he sold us that dry ass sandwich as well, so 1 star jerk!

reviews.author: Bell A.
reviews.description: Slab was just okay. I wasn't wow'd by my food. I did love the restaurant set up and music. The staff was nice too.   I ordered the Chicken W.A. With a side of mac and cheese. I love baked mac and cheese and I don't believe this one was.   Overall meh for my tastebuds.

reviews.author: Kara M.
reviews.description: Great BBQ for an even greater price! I was really impressed with everything we tried, and for it all being just under $50, it was worth it. It's not your "traditional" BBQ stop - the menu is really fun and there are some pretty creative treats to try, from Texas-sized sandwiches to habanero strawberry glazed ribs. The meats were tender as could be, the flavor was incredible, and the sauces were amazing. Will definitely be visiting again!   Service: 5/5 Food: 5/5  Individual food ratings: - Habanero Strawberry Glazed ribs (5/5): sweet and spicy (but more sweet), these ribs were perfectly tender and had really great flavor! You can get them without the glaze, or get the glaze on the side. - Smoked Gouda Mac'n'cheese (4/5): pretty tasty mac, very cheesy and creamy, would be great with hot sauce or meat. - BBQ nachos w/brisket (5/5): super loaded, huge shareable portion, and great flavors! Add extra sauces on top to get saucy. - El Jefe sammie (5/5): brisket, onions, peppers, and Fritos for some crunch, this was a great sandwich and super filling! - Twice baked potato casserole (3/5): needed a kick or maybe some more salt/pepper, but was good overall with the dank white sauce on top.

reviews.author: Priscila M.
reviews.description: First time at Slab BBQ and it's already our go to bbq in the area. First, all meats are gluten free! Yay!!!! Second, their meats are delicious! I had the chicken and the brisket and both were really good , seasoned well and very moist - cooked to perfection. I couldn't finish my salad and took maybe half of it home. So, portion wise, this is also a win. My daughter had the 1/2 ribs and we were all taken by surprise on the flavor. Seriously, TRY their RIBS!!!  They have a selection of different sauces, including a strawberry one that came with the ribs. I was very skeptical at first, but it worked pretty well. However, their mustard based one is my favorite.  We can't wait to be back!

reviews.author: Rose J.
reviews.description: Finally a barbecue joint worth raving about. When you enter you are met with the smooth sounds of  music. Very chill vibe!!!   The menu pretty easy to survey and food comes out quick fresh and hot! Those are the things I love quick fresh and hot. The prices are appropriate and the sides are reasonably priced. Also the baked beans was the business. Oh, yeah the nortorious BIG was delicious! It's topped with Cole slaw and piled with brisket very tender meat!   I love this place and it was a short drive from the hotel.

reviews.author: Mandy W.
reviews.description: Staff is great, atmosphere is relaxed and fun and food came out promptly but the food was just meh. Not bad, not great but I was expecting a little more flavor. The smoked gouda mac n cheese just tasted like smoke, no cheesy texture or taste. The twice baked potato casserole was just mashed potatoes. The pulled pork was dry and flavorless you definitely have to use sauce for it.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Good stuff! I was very hungry in the late afternoon and heading to play many competitive games of ping pong, so I stopped here. The food was yummy. The pulled pork sandwich had very good flavor and the Mac and cheese was fabulous. They also serve beer which complements BBQ , IMHO. The service was courteous and prompt. The dining area was clean, though we opted to sit in their temporary outdoor seating area because it was a beautiful day. Check it out as an alternative fast food option.

reviews.author: Yoko C.
reviews.description: This is the Texas standard!! (4.5 star) I really wish I came here starving. We only made it here because people say it is worth trying after having brunch at somewhere else. Their ribs were awesome!! We were advised to try assorted sliders, but personally I wish I ordered even more ribs. I like the idea of using berry jam as sauce as well, something I've never done but quickly appreciated. Let me come back here to try more ribs in the near future!

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: This is an easy to find place that gives you a feel of a comfortable locals/neighborhood place. Lots of TVs and some covered outside seating as well.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal! Our party of three started with the double meat bbq brisket nachos, then we shared 1/2 # of ribs, a Texas Tornado wrap with double brisket (absolutely LOVE their brisket) then added an extra large order of the smoked Gouda Mac and cheese, green bean casserole and finished up with a banana pudding .  Gotta say I haven't eaten such great bbq for years AND took home enough for another meal.  This is my new go-to for Austin BBQ! They have a nice selection of regular and craft beers as well.  Definitely a repeater!!

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: I've now been here 3 times and if it wasn't for my last visit, it would probably be a 5 star but the last trip was definitely not ideal. The first two times I came here, I ordered the nachos and walked out so satisfied. It is a massive portion that includes all the toppings you could ever want.  They are truly some of my favorite nachos in all of Austin.   This most recent time, I decided to switch it up and went for the trio slider.  My buddy ordered the same thing and both of us walked out of there, not sure if we would come back.  The bread was hard, and the meat was room temp at best. We came in around 12:30 on a Saturday which I would have assumed is a pretty popular time with some of the freshest food but I was definitely wrong. It almost seemed like they were trying to get rid of food from the day before.  I will probably be back at some point but I don't think I would ever order the sliders again (which is such a bummer for a place 100% known for their sandwiches)  All that being said, the first two trips made a great impression and the workers there are all fantastic so I'm still happy to support this place.

reviews.author: Kels H.
reviews.description: Run, don't sit on this place. The food is out of this world!! Delicious, hot, fresh and fast! The staff is also knowledgeable and friendly! Very underrated. Austin has lots of great bbq, but this place hits the top of my list on all accounts.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: There were brisket nachos involved too but I only got a photo of the ribs as the nachos were halfway gone by then  they were excellent and a generous portion. The St. Louis ribs are some of the most tender I've had.  I wasn't a huge fan of the bbq sauce that came with the ribs but it's on the side and they have other sauces available as well- the one it came with was a little sweet for me. Planning on bringing my small rib aficionado this weekend after the pumpkin patch.  One complaint... the kids meal ribs says it comes with two.. TWO. Mine will be asking where the rest are if I ordered him a kids meal  they do have a great amount of meat on them but I have a 3 year old that eats like a teenager when he has ribs in front of him so these kids meals won't work for us  we will be getting a whole rack and I'll be lucky if *I* get to have two.

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: I got the Texas tornado and the McDowell. Two separate occasions and they were amazing. True Texas bbq. The Texas tornado was delicious and perfect for the one who isn't sure what they should get. The McDowell is the McRib on steroids, I wasn't ready. The staff  is welcoming and friendly on top of it all. 10/10. Next time I'm going to order the Chiknwa.

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: Stopped by for the Yelp Texas Trending Machine today around 11:30 and it was clear that this plce already has a place in the heart of locals. The line was long, but luckily I was able to head to the to-go desk and place my order fairly quickly...Brisket Nachos packaged with all the ingredients separated so as not to get soggy. They easily survived the drive home to Cedar Park and were super delicious and unique! Like a chopped brisket sandwich on tortilla chips with queso. Um, yes, please.  This barbecue place has a vibe like no other. The walls and music combine hip hop with classic Texas in a way I would not have dreamed possible, but it works. Pretty trendy spot. I really appreciated the clear partitions separating tables as a covid precaution.

reviews.author: Eduardo C.
reviews.description: Food came out fast and was pretty good. I would recommend they have a person always at the bar that way people can be welcomed to eat there and get more drinks. I would come back for sure though

reviews.author: Lorri P.
reviews.description: We hadn't had any bbq since we arrived in Austin for our vacation. We found Slab on Yelp and we were impressed! The sliders, brisket nachos and chicken sandwich were all delicious. The max n cheese was good, it had a smoky flavor, like it was cooked on the grill. The potato salad didn't have any flavor but we just know not to order it, it was a side and not the star of the show like the meats. The music was great! If I lived here, I would definitely be here once a week! Great food and vibe!

name: The Jackalope
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Joseph S.
reviews.description: When we arrived in Austin the Uber driver recommended this dive bar for their food. Can we say they did not disappoint! We did only order a burger and fries but they both were perfect.   Also the drinks tasted to perfection and matched the service. To cap it off the bill was amazing as well!

reviews.author: Ashley B.
reviews.description: My go-to bar if I'm ever out on east 6th.  Divey vibe and chill place to grab a drink during the day.  At night it's more lively.  They host events sometimes.  There is a second bar up the stairs straight ahead from the entrance.  I also appreciate the emo and rock music they play.  Brings me back to the mid 2000's when wearing side bangs and a bow in my hair was a thing.

reviews.author: Andrew M.
reviews.description: The Jackalope in downtown Austin. It was a blast great drinks and it attracted great people. The food was even good, including the drinks. I would go back for sure, pretty cool atmosphere as well.  When I went I had done research and everything. There are other places to go to but, this was the best for a Sunday. I arrived just a bit before happy hour and enjoyed myself.  I had the Jackalope burger and it was plenary to eat. With the toppings I didn't even need anything else. I usually get honey mustard and mayo, I didn't need it but, I did put mayo on it. There were plenty of pickles and the burger meat was tasty.   I had a frozen margarita, the frozen was out after that and I switched to a hibiscus margarita. I know your thinking hibiscus flower, yea it was even pretty like the flower. I also had the huge Heldarado as well. Man let me tell you now have a few people would help you finish but it was good.   It was just great company we had fun there I met a couple cool people there and it was rememberable. It's kind of what we are looking for when we go out to eat or something. The server was good even when they switched out for shifts, the only thing I will get you don't want us they could use a few more extra service. Great experience I definitely go back.

reviews.author: Gabriel P.
reviews.description: A friend came from California to 6th street and this is one of the places that I took him to. The drinks and music were good, but it was really crowded. Other than that we had a great time. Don't forget to get a picture on the Jackalope!

reviews.author: John H.
reviews.description: This place was really unique.  Came here on a Sunday night. Sandwich was great.   Place had a fun vibe and seemed like everyone knew each other.  A cool stop to make in Austin.

reviews.author: Britta M.
reviews.description: This bar is located on 6th street and is a solid stop to make on your bar crawl. The giant jackalope inside is very insta-friendly, they tell you to feel free to hop on and take a pic.   Our bartender was really friendly and funny, and served us right away. He gave us a few suggestions, and we ordered drinks and a round of shots. They were all good and mid-priced. The only downfall was they didn't shake the pineapple chaser, so it was lukewarm.   Overall, a solid and memorable bar experience!

reviews.author: Gillian W.
reviews.description: Come on who doesn't love this place? I love coming here when I'm downtown and to/from the airport, always love getting on the jackalope and taking a pic. The menu is limited now, but still good. I love the atmosphere and who you meet here. You never know, you might just find a life long friend. Staff is fun, personable and friendly. Always a regular stop for us when we can! Stop in if you haven't.

reviews.author: Rich R.
reviews.description: Very cool bar with an excellent vibe.   Check it out if you are in Austin.  The bartender was great and made the experience even better.    There was an outdoor section in the back of the weather is nice.   I didn't try any food.

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: Pretty cool place.  Drinks are weak, music is not really my type, but friendly service!

reviews.author: Ryan H.
reviews.description: The bartender Tay pulled us off the street to give us a gigantic cocktail!! Great Guy, Good Music and Good Vibes

reviews.author: Ernest H.
reviews.description: Food was good when it came out correctly but had to send back what was put in the computer versus what I asked for.    Tonight October 30, 2021. I put a food order in for honey jalapeño wings, an order of waffle fries and a dos xx draft. Total came to 22 and was given order number 80 around 8:00 Pm. Order came out as a burger and side of fries which after checking your menu, should've only been 14$ plus what ever the beer was which I'm sure isn't 8$ for a draft beer in a plastic cup.   I informed the food runner it should've been wings and he showed me where the food was rung in as a burger instead, no harm no foul a simple misunderstanding or so I thought. The bartender who rang it in informed me I ordered a burger when I "shouted" my order at him and said I like that with fries. By my calculations, if I did intact order the burger with a side of fries it should've been 11.5 for burger plus 2.5 for fries. Not almost 16 I'm assuming plus 6$ for a dosxx.   I get it it's Halloween weekend. But if you can't fully hear the order then just make sure with customer before finalizing and putting order in and over charge them if in fact you thought I ordered a burger. But also don't give attitude when customer asks for the wings and believes the wings only come with 8 like you PDF menu states. Not from Austin but will not be back anytime soon. Unfortunately I paid in cash or I would ask for a refund for the difference because I'm entitled to that I believe. I understand customer isn't always right. But food costs can't be that high that you need to argue about the wrong button being pressed on your end.   And yes this is the exact same review I sent to the contact us for on the website, I'm sure nothing will change with how orders are put in on busy nights, but just make sure you get your itemized at this establishment so that you know before you walk away from bar.

reviews.author: Sabrina M.
reviews.description: We came from San Antonio to try this place out due to great food reviews.  There are no servers that come to your table, if you want food you have to order at the bar. The staff wasn't very friendly at all and of course didn't have good customer service quality's.  The lighting inside was very dim and dark - more like a bar setting but the variety of appetizers was great. The D.J. was playing some good tunes and when our food came out - They had the best wings and Cheese Waffle fries. We had a couple of drinks and ordered a couple more appetizers but then we saw the WORST - A RAT ran above us on the beams and then my husband and cousin saw another RAT in front of him running along the opposite end!!!  And we all know if there is 1/2 rats their are more to follow. Obviously this is an issue that they are aware of. Needless to say we grabbed our stuff and left! I felt so disgusted and nauseous!!!  Coming out the restaurant we met a couple (locals) outside and they told us they have heard as well about infestation of rats. So if your looking for a good restaurant- Don't come here!!!

reviews.author: Alex D.
reviews.description: If you must go to 6th Street in Austin, this is a must stop. Cheap shots, a giant jackalope statute and food that is actually good. Burgers are some of the best in a town with alot of good burgers.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: Pretty good burger on Sixth St!   The place is a fun bar at night, with a big Jackalope Statue you can climb up onto. However, I also came earlier in the night to grab a bite. I had a bacon and Brie burger, but I substituted the patty for an impossible patty. There was plenty of cheese and lots of pickles on it.

reviews.author: Terry P.
reviews.description: Our bartender "Happy Hour" aka Justin, was the bomb. Just enough rough and sparky. Loved him. He also pour a really good cocktail.   Try the fried pickles. They are yummy and hit the spot.

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: This place was absolutely empty due to the cold weather but the atmosphere was modern and inviting. I loved the jackalope that i was able to climb and sit on the most . I would go back, but on a warmer night !

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: IF I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE ZERO STARS - I WOULD.   DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU ARE TRYING TO HAVE A GOOD TIME.   We came here during a BACHELORETTE.  I understand circumstances are weird due to COVID-19.  I get that. We ALL get that. We are in Austin visiting for our best friends bachelorette and on our second night here we decided to take the advice from our waiter at Caroline's and go to The Jackalope.  We went there at 9pm just to check it out and our bartender, Bart, gave us complimentary drinks. We were so thankful, we paid for the giant mixed drink and went next door for a few hours and then went back to The Jackalope because the bride requested it. We sat down for 20 minutes even ordered some drinks (which they never brought) and they were playing the jams -- so naturally we started dancing around our table.   Even the other bartender, Dimitrius, was hitting on one of our bridesmaids HEAVILY and hanging around with us while we were dancing - not even one whole song went by before Dimitrius told us we couldn't be dancing and that we needed to be in our seats. We said okay, that sucks but sure. So we sat down and made sure our butts where planted -- next thing you know some random came up to us and started twerking at our table then on jumped on the couch and started twerking and spreading her legs in the air. Again - SHE WAS NOT WITH US. None of us even knew who she was. Immediately, some angry bartender (that clearly needs to get laid) with a ponytail ran over to us being loud and demanding that WE get out meanwhile Twerker conveniently slinks on back to her table    I can understand if we were the ones doing THAT and you wanted to kick us out - FINE.  But that was not the case. No one wanted to even hear us out, one of our bridesmaids does not drink and she was very civil in trying to explain to Ponytail Bartender but he literally was non-stop raising his voice to us. He even yells at Bart to come over - and this fool just straight up decides to "go with his boys on this one" and preceded to gesture us to get out  Ponytail could not WAIT to kick us out, let me tell you. Like there's some underlying issues there  He yelled at us saying "You're not even ordering drinks! You're not even ordering food!!!" NOPE. Wrong again, Ponytail.   We DID order food and drinks but your stubborn hating ass didn't accommodate us  Meanwhile Twerker (aka THE PROBLEM) is still running rampant inside the bar   Also, the pink haired lady was GOD AWFUL. Not helpful whatsoever.  Bart you were the biggest disappointment, and Ponytail -- you just suck. Thank you for ending our night horribly and giving us a HORRIBLE first trip experience.   I do not recommend this place whatsoever for anyone who is looking to actually have a good time.

reviews.author: Tamrynn H.
reviews.description: I used to love this place..the drinks are cheap and the food is good.  It was actually the first bar I went to when I turned 21.  However now, the bald bartender that is on the heavy side is a TOTAL DICK.  HE PRACTICALLY YELLED AT ME!  He seems to always be there too.  I gave a card tk hold and I was going to pay cash at the end...well, during shift change he said he doesn't do that and I need to pay each time.....umm, u have my card, idiot.  I still tipped him but he is an asshat.  I won't go back if he is working.

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: Great food, good location, good portions. The only thing that was not great was the bar tender, not the friendliest person. But he didn't ruin the experience and the food

reviews.author: Karla D.
reviews.description: Holy poo this is absolutely hand down, no questions asked my favorite bar in Austin! In fact it's in my top two. That's right, top two.  I just love everything about this place. It's on Sixth and sure it gets the tourists in but it's definitely a hang out for regulars. Because we have family in Austin, we're here often. If it were in Pittsburgh it would definitely be one of my locals.  The beer selection is fabulous and so are the prices. The crowd is cool and fun.  The Mac and Cheese Burger is so freaking good and yummy and big! Definitely shared it with the boyfriend.  My favorite cocktail is The Jezebel. It's tasty and refreshing.   Dive bar personified!

name: Vigilante Gaming Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: We've been here twice pre-covid. I'm not sure what it looks like during the pandemic.   Great food, lots of board game options.  I wish there were more 2 player options. I like how the game menu is categorized.

reviews.author: Dorris W.
reviews.description: It's different from other board game cafes I've been to; first the whole inside ambiance is very rustic with dim lighting giving it a very nice cozy feeling. Next each table has a little bell you can call a server which is nice especially if you are in the middle of a game and you don't want to be distracted trying to flag down a server.  When you book a reservation they need the number of guests because they have a special menu for games that cater to a certain number of players which I think is an amazing and smart idea. They also have a game master available if you have any questions, but the servers were also very knowledgable with gameplay. The games all have a wooden box container to make give it a fine wine kind of vibe which I thought was cute and quirky.  The reason I had to knock off a star is due to the food ordering. So they have a deal of ordering 3 dishes and you get $3 off. You think simple right? No, there is no writing on the menu or explanation from the staff that you MUST tell the server that you are doing this deal which I think is silly needing to DECLARE it and the next is you have to order to the multiples of 3 dishes all in one go. Besides that annoyance, I think overall the food was inexpensive and delicious. I like that it comes in smaller portions so you try a little bit of everything. I had the mushroom kingdom burger, fries, pretzel bites, and cookies (remember to order at least 20 minutes before leaving since it takes time to bake). All the drinks were good like the boozy milkshakes and fyi if you want a cute instagram photo get the rainbow road.

reviews.author: Amy Z.
reviews.description: I absolutely loved the concept when I heard about this board game bar for the first time! They provide you a menu with a huge variety of different games. The workers there were incredibly helpful in recommending and explaining games. I was so impressed by their knowledge and how well they were able to go over game rules so we all knew how to play.
