Then you can decide for yourself if you will return. I will not!

reviews.author: Havalah W.
reviews.description: I am always surprised by this place. Service is always pretty good, and the food is consistent and delicious! The wings are quickly becoming our favorite, and the mimosas are really really well balanced! Honestly that's hard to find for me... there's always too much juice or the bubbles are flat... not here! I like the spring salad w chicken.. not too unhealthy and V-tasty!! Also bringing the pups are an option on the outside patio!!

reviews.author: Tyler W.
reviews.description: On a week night we watched a hockey game, which lasts maybe 3 hours got kicked out of this place. We ordered food, 4 pitchers and got kicked out. 3 people, 3 hours , 4 pitchers and were actually forced to leave. While ordering the food and drinks we were given poor service but who cares at a sports bar. But after they got the orders we were kicked out for tabc. If you look up tabc rules on our tab we were in line, even if we were close it's a sports bar grow up. Games over and we want to watch the last 1.5 minute of a nba game, and we were actually forced to leave. I get following rules, but when you follow rules you don't know anything about, then you're just out of line

reviews.author: Sammy C.
reviews.description: This is a friendly neighborhood bar with a fun relaxed vibe. I find the servers to be very welcoming and helpful, and the food is seriously great! This is not your run of the mill bar food; the tenders and wings are some of the best I've ever eaten, no joke. The fried pickles and cheese curds are delicious. The onion rings are absolutely perfect -- hot and crispy, not greasy-- and it's always worth it to get the full basket. The Chicago Dog is one of my favorites too. I haven't tried the burgers yet, but I can't imagine I'd be disappointed in the least. Very highly recommended!

reviews.author: Jordan W.
reviews.description: Not a bad location if you're trying to just go watch a game, chill with friends, or just kick back and let the Austin traffic die down. Lots of TVs so during football season I'm sure it's a full house. The drink choices and food are good, but there are a few minor complaints I have.  There are daily specials on select Texas drafts, cocktails, and other drinks. However, I wish there would be more choices of drafts because it didn't seem like they have any. But I really like the choices I tried, and they even have some others from different breweries. They also have select drinks in cans and bottles.  The food is good, but it wasn't really what I expected. I just had 8 wings to watch a basketball game. The Buffalo medium sauce was excellent, but the lemon pepper dry rub had a little too much of the powder on it, decreasing the integrity of the taste. But I must say the Buffalo sauce and the taste of the chicken wings were pretty good. Maybe a burger or something next time.  I think I'll be back during football for some games, or another time whenever I want to bring a friend. Go try it out and maybe you'll like it. Parking is available in the back by Cindie's, but get there early as spaces run out quick.

reviews.author: Matt P.
reviews.description: Wow...had the most egregious experience in here last night. Lady bartender treated me like a dog that just shit on the floor. They then proceeded to serve me cold chili. When I asked if they usually microwave each serving or keep a whole batch hot, she said they keep it hot. This tells me they dropped the ball and risked my wellness. They'll be receiving a visit from the health department soon.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: This place has gone to hell. Burgers used to be great they suck now  Service has gone from "it's a dive bar" to "why am I being treated like I killed this persons family?" When asking for Anything. Yes everyone is short staffed but if ownership isn't doing anything to help their staff enough that they're not total a€~holes probably not a place I'd go anymore.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Best tater tots ever! Worst mixed drinks! Stick to beer, enjoy your burger, don't forget to order the tater tots - I promise you!

reviews.author: Keilon L.
reviews.description: This is a solid bar with plenty of options.  They have a mildly exhaustive beer selection which will please any palate, discerning or otherwise.  I plan to visit more and scroll through the list of options again.  There's also a number of daily food and drink specials and I believe there is a happy hour offered as well.  I typically come to here to watch [European] football  (soccer) with a cold beer and standard American bar fare.  My one gripe is that they have a pretty good burger that they just don't know how to cook at medium temperature. I've ordered it twice and reiterated that I'd like it medium and it comes out well done each time.  That's mad annoying but I'm still holding out faith that they'll get it right one day. The fries are pretty top notch.  Again, you can't loose coming here just on the strength of the beer selection alone.  I'll be back for a better burger experience soon.

reviews.author: Kate C.
reviews.description: Black Sheep Lodge is one of my local favorites for when I'm wanting to watch a game, have a cool drink, and eat food that is going to do some damage to my stomach later.  Definitely like any other bar, but drink specials are unbeatable and, as I stated above, they have amazing food for a bar but it will make you say "diet starts tomorrow" every bite.  Dog friendly outside, but only downsides are the tables can fill up quickly and parking isn't ideal.

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: Gary was great! The sweet tea vodka was super yummy and my My My the lemon drop martini is a must !

reviews.author: Jan C.
reviews.description: Going for convenience before a movie.Didn't expect that good here. Expectations exceeded. Good food. Black bean pizza was spicy and tasty. The pork queso was so good my husband couldn't stop eating it.  $3 happy hour drafts. Yes please. Patio. Board games. Very chill. Just right service. We will return.

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: I came here for trivia and it was packed to the gills. Not sure if this is the standard but when we got there about half the tables were reserved for people who come to trivia each week. I get honoring loyalty, but this was a big turnoff for newcomers or people visiting Austin.   The biggest perk of this place is the ability to order off the Alamo full food menu for the chocolate chip cookies or bottomless popcorn. Otherwise, it's nothing you couldn't miss for another nearby bar. Perhaps I just hit people on an off night, but that's my opinion.

reviews.author: Orli W.
reviews.description: Great selection of tequilas and mezcals! Definitely a great happy hour spot before seeing a movie. The cocktails are a little over priced for the location, but like I said, happy hour is worth it. Very cute decor, a little roaring 20s-gatsby vibes. Didn't try the food but will next time

reviews.author: Christena R.
reviews.description: Going to a movie? Need a nice, chill cocktail beforehand? 400 Rabbits is the place. Big patio, comfy booths inside, TVs and board games...all perks of this in-theater bar. There's a full food menu (different from the menu in the theater) and a tasty, creative cocktail menu with a really nicely priced happy hour! The bartenders might seem a little grumbly but they're super accommodating and tweak our drinks just how we like them. We've made a pre-movie drink part of our routine.

reviews.author: Pamela O.
reviews.description: Wait staff extremely frustrated, understandable if people called in on a Friday night, but to take it out on newly arriving customers that have no clue as to your current staffing situation is straight up rude and unacceptable.  We had to figure out whether to seat ourselves or wait, by asking.  No eye contact from either waiter/waitress.  Annoyed the waitress told us to sit anywhere and someone will be with us. We sat at a dirty table didn't see a better option.  After 5 minutes we were approached but after a hufff and a puff the fat winded waiter walked off without saying a word then came back with a towel and aggressively began to wipe the table.  Mid-wipe I told the waiter we are just going to go somewhere else and he condescendingly responded "Oh! Perfect! Thank you ladies!" Then he quickly turned around  and threw the menus on the wait stand near by.  Friday evening shift 08/02/19 8:50PM

reviews.author: Ryan E.
reviews.description: They've continually improved their service and speed. Food its great and we really enjoy going here now!

reviews.author: Ty H.
reviews.description: To bad, I was trying to prove to my wife we could order good food. Used DoorDash, driver text that the pork stew is no longer an option. Ok, you have like 6 items on the menu, how do you cut 15% off your menu without updating it across your online retailers? So let's just be clear, Dinner for two is now an order of seasoned nuts and a piece of corn on the cob.

reviews.author: Luci H.
reviews.description: I have to hand it to any bar attached to a movie theater that doesn't jack up their prices.   All the craft beer varied from $4-6. That's incredible considering a $4 pint is unheard of in ATX. Alamo had gotten a lot of grief in the past couple of years, but they keep raising the bar. We've all have just gotten complacent.

reviews.author: Shelby Shy H.
reviews.description: I love coming here for happy hour . The drinks are yummy and only about $5 for a rather large, quality cocktail. I always get the buffalo cauliflower with vegan ranch. SO GOOD!! I highly recommend if you are about to see a flick or maybe after your film. Obviously you can eat in the Alamo that's connected but I personally don't fully enjoy my meal in the dark and my mind is occupied on the film. The staff is friendly but if you sit outside you might need to go let them know what you want if the bar is busy (depending on the time you go) bathrooms are super clean ! Enjoy !

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: Cutest bar, ever OR I'm biased because my family are known as the Rabbits and I love all Rabbit related venues, etc. Staff were nice. Cozy little bar. I'm definitely returning.

reviews.author: Barry K.
reviews.description: Crappiest. Service. Ever  Food took over an hour, beer was flat, and bartenders barely paid attention

reviews.author: John Q.
reviews.description: Just ate here and a few problems:  1) service was absolute garbage, seriously atrocious.  2) food took over 40 minutes to arrive, in that time the server didn't think to put a set of cutlery on our table.  3) I think my dish was actually someone's leftovers from Alamo, some of the spinach had fork holes in it and the dismal amount chicken looked old (another reason I think it was someone else's dish, there was almost no chicken.)   4) I'm currently on the toilet in my apartment blasting the bowl, leftover chicken is even worse coming out.   I won't be coming to this bar, or Alamo ever again. I hope this place gets shut down before they give food poisoning to someone who can get seriously ill.

reviews.author: laura w.
reviews.description: I should have posted this months ago but didn't because it kinda broke my heart. We've been Alamo Drafthouse fans for 20+ years so I really want to love and appreciate this location -- but the food is awful and the service at 400 Rabbits is unpredictable. It hasn't always been that way. But the last year or so, I've met friends on several occasions for drinks and snacks. Chewy nuts, flat drinks. My last visit was the final straw: I couldn't even get a glass of water and the two dishes we ordered were terrible. Chili fries and pumpkin dip. Overly complicated food ideas and poorly executed. The pumpkin dip was bland and unappetizing. The fries were almost inedible but it came with a dip that made them bearable.  Please managers, fix this place. We love having an Alamo in 78739. We don't want some chain to come in and sweep us off our feet. But it wouldn't take much.

reviews.author: Edith B.
reviews.description: This place is close to my school, and I didn't realize it is a part of The Alamo Drafthouse. The decor is... exquisite. It makes me feel so classy being there. There is outdoor seating with patio furniture and fancy cocktails inside. Kyle helped us, and was very helpful when we were choosing beverages. The prices are a little high, but we also got the specialty cocktails and not my usual beer.

reviews.author: See V.
reviews.description: Always enjoy drinks and Queso and Elotes (which are great) while we are waiting to go into the movie at the fantastic Alamo Drafthouse. Very nice.

reviews.author: Roni W.
reviews.description: We love coming here for beverages and dinner or apps!  We always sit on the patio and we know it's a smoking area - YUCK!  But, do your employees have to take breaks in this area and smoke like chimneys?!?  I love you Alamo and will not stop coming here but please please please have your employees not blow smoke in my face during their breaks!

reviews.author: Elyse L.
reviews.description: This bar is connected to the Slaughter Lane Alamo Drafthouse, making it a nice way to kill time while waiting for your movie to start. We had about half an hour to spare and lucky for us, got to partake in the happy hour specials. Happy hour is Monday-Friday 4-7 and all day on Sunday's.  They have a Mexican inspired menu so there are a lot of tequila drinks (they even do flights) as well as dishes like queso con chorizo and grilled elotes which are corn on the cob with mayo, queso cotija, lime, and chili.   We had tickets to what they call a 'feast', where dinner is included with the movie, so we only wanted drinks. They have a lot of fun ones here and one called the Love Bug caught my eye which I think was made with sparkling wine, strawberry, lemon, and honey? I can't remember but I do know it was like $9. Gut punch!  I instead went with the more pocket friendly option of the happy hour Austin Eastciders Original Cider for $5. I'd never tried it before and it was really good!  My husband got a Karbach Sympathy for the lager for $3 which he also enjoyed.   The inside is small but there are both sit down and stand at tables, as well as bar seating. They also have games you can borrow and play while you are there which I think is awesome. And bonus! If you haven't finished your drink by the time your theater opens, they are cool with you taking it in there.

reviews.author: Caroline N.
reviews.description: I've been a big fan and frequent customer of Alamo for pretty much my entire life, but my experience tonight at 400 Rabbits was absolutely horrible. I assume they are managed and operated by Alamo given that they share a menu.  We came here for the Geeks Who Drink trivia, which was pretty much the only part of the experience that went as expected (though a tad slow).   We arrived at around 7:45 and ordered some drinks (a cocktail, a soda, and a water). The water was dropped off about 10 minutes later and the cocktail and soda a good 10-20 after that. The moscow mule was very watery and had no noticeable alcohol. It just tasted like very watered down ginger beer.   The waitress was friendly enough, but seemed extremely over burdened and scatter brained. I think she was the only waitress for the entire bar which was crowded due to trivia.   We ordered our food around 8:20 and I don't think we got it until 9:20 or so. We got a burger, chicken strips, and a chicken quinoa salad. Doesn't seem too complicated. The chicken quinoa salad looked like it'd already been half eaten and had no noticeable chicken in it. They did give us a side of chicken quickly after my fiancé showed it to them.  Alamo's food is never particularly amazing, but it was definitely lower quality tonight. The waitress was definitely aware of the bad service but didn't offer any sort of remedy.    TMI, but my fiancé is currently in the bathroom dealing with the repercussions of subpar food.   Extremely disappointed in this place and the Slaughter Alamo as a whole. A lot of reviews recommend it just as a bar, but I can't recommend it for that either as I don't think I was actually given alcohol.

reviews.author: Jens B.
reviews.description: Really a 3 plus...400 Rabbits is not just a place to grab a drink while waiting for your movie to begin, it's a destination bar for us.  It also happens to be in our hood, which makes it very convenient indeed.  We have frequented the bar a few times now without so much as wanting to see a movie.    What we like?  We love the decor and retro feel of the bar itself.  We like sitting in the middle of the bar so we can watch the black and white silent movies on the screen in the lobby of Alamo.  We like a certain blonde, bubbly waitress who always seems to be happier than my Suzie, which is quite a feat in itself.  The Grilled Elotes are really yummy, but incredibly messy.  They need to have a couple of corn stabby handle things so you don't have to cover your fingers with butter/mayo and spice.  Having just said that, what the hell is wrong with having butter/mayo/spice hands?  At least give us an option please.    What is average?  Service can be a challenge at times.  If our blondie is not working, you can sit around for awhile with an empty drink in front of you.. even at the bar.  If you are there for Happy Hour, it would be really refreshing if they would come by the table and ask if you would like another drink before HH ends.  When movies are cycling in and out, you can be left a little abandoned while the hustle of getting new drinks out to folks ensues.  I am not totally convinced that the Bartenders really know a great deal about all the Tequilas they serve, which as a Tequila Themed bar, they really should know how one differs from the other.  We enjoy 400 Rabbits and can see how it could be really awesome destination for drinks and munchies for the neighborhood.  A little more attention to awesome service, hell just clone blondie, and that would be a great start.

name: The Wheel
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Victor H.
reviews.description: (from June 2021)  One dope ass bar!  The bartenders, ambiance, drink selection, and people make this place a blast.  They have multitude of whiskeys and beers to pick from.  Plus the outdoor seating and dog friendly atmosphere make this a chill spot for mingling with friends or soaking in the awesomeness of the state capital of Texas.  They also sell awesome shirts.  Sadly the Excite Bike shirt I saw the bartender rocking wasn't available so I settled for the blue shirt.  Please get more of those in!  The Wheel, keep on spinning!

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Finally got to try The Wheel after a long wait. Moved to the neighborhood almost a year ago and when I tried to come here, they hadn't reopened. Came today to have a celebratory vaccine cocktail. It looks like they used to have a $4 whisky of the day... well, it's now $5 but the winning bet is to make it as a cocktail for $8. An $8 old fashioned? Can't say I'm mad about that. Jenny behind the bar was super friendly and I gotta say it's nice to sit at an actual bar again.

reviews.author: Misha T.
reviews.description: Good bar. Lots of wheels. Indoor and outdoor seating with a solid beer selection. Staff is gruff but responsive. No complaints.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Wonderful cocktails and beautifully presented! Love the intimate ambience of this place even with covid plexi-glass in place inside. Bar staff was very kind and very knowledgeable which is greatly appreciated. Outdoor and indoor seating options were great. Crowded on a Friday night which is a good sign!

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: Update: We left a cash tip for our $66 tab, and after the charge cleared, we just found out they charged us a $15 tip on top of the cash we left. We have spent a month fighting it with the credit card company. It's disappointing because the staff there was great. And the drinks were fantastic, but this kind of behavior is pathetic and makes us question returning.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Great spot! Super awesome bartenders, very chill vibes. Go have dinner across the street at Sour Duck and then come here for a cocktail :)

reviews.author: Emily J.
reviews.description: Love the dark and divey vibe! Super cool! We live a couple blocks away and I am kicking myself in the ass for never coming here before! Def kinda bar

reviews.author: Melissa H.
reviews.description: I got stood up on a date here but Jenny and the other bar staff turned it into such a fun night! They made me the most delicious Daiquiri and had me laughing almost to the point of tears. My new favorite spot!! Awesome staff, delicious drinks, and guaranteed to cheer you up if you're having a bad night! 10/10!

reviews.author: Aarti P.
reviews.description: Been here a few times, sat outside, sat inside!! It's just one of those solid kind of places that you know you are guaranteed a satisfying drink served up by a friendly and knowledgeable team surrounded by others who like me just want a nice chill environment to sip on their libations.

reviews.author: Winston M.
reviews.description: Big shoutout to the staff at The Wheel for creating a welcoming and responsible environment! They're following all the safety protocols while still offering a relaxed and warm outdoor bar experience. Thank you!!!  Came here yesterday with my housemates to enjoy their cocktails with some ADP. The Layla and Ashley are perfect pairings with the warm weather and ADP's tortas.

reviews.author: Nicholas B.
reviews.description: I really want to like this bar. It's cute, has a nice variety of seating... inside and outside and kinda-dense-in-a-good-way. The bartenders are cool folks with lots of great knowledge. The music isn't too loud - a good volume for talking but still bumping :-)  Unfortunately though... its quite expensive, and the staff isn't super transparent about the pricing. For instance, the whiskey of the day is supposed to be $5. I got it with ice, and was charged an extra dollar. This might be trivial, but it sucks getting charged without warning, especially for something that shouldn't get an upcharge (even if the on-the-rocks pour is slightly more liquid)... kinda like getting charged for napkins. And in general, everything's pretty pricey for a neighborhood bar.  I guess I'm a little too old school for all the new hotness in Austin. But I don't see any reason to visit The Wheel when you have so many other places that are both inexpensive and cool.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Parking can be troublessome, and space is limited, but easy to have a good time here.  More of a hangout spot than a sports bar.  No TV, limited beer selection that runs out quickly (both IPA kegs tapped out on a random Tuesday night), and no food.  You come here to let the night get away from you and order some strong cocktails.  Lots of outdoor space is cool and bring your own food is actually a plus in my book.  Beer selection 8 on draft, but good prices at $7/ish per big pour.  Everyone is nice and vibe seems 20s-30s clientele. I liked the Wheel for what it is, a good starting point nearby my apartment to begin a drinking night.

reviews.author: Tristan B.
reviews.description: In a town exploding in size and popularity, The Wheel retains a strong neighborhood feel. The bartenders are extremely friendly and seemed genuinely interested in conversation beyond just your tip.   They definitely specialize in cocktails so I would probably look elsewhere if you are looking for a nice draft or bottle of Shiner. I had 2 different specialty cocktails, both of which were good but definitely on the pricier side ($10-$15 each).   They have a large patio space for meeting up with friends and the indoor bar is intimate enough to make it a decent  first date spot worth checking out.

reviews.author: Jeff C. J.
reviews.description: Cool vibe, friendly staff, loud music. Great cocktails! Expertly made with detail, unique bitters, and perfectly balanced.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: They redid their patio and it is spectacular! Covered? Check. Heat lamps? Check. Amazing way to spend any giving evening in ATX? Check!  Ok, so this place is just super adorbs in a very approachable, contempo-rustic, "shhhh, don't tell anyone or else the ubiquitous "they" will ruin it for the rest of us" kinda way.   The barkeeps know their stuffs, their cocktails are legend (wait for it) dary without the arrogance or pretension you might expect from a place of this caliber; I think the lack of self-importance this place and the staff exude is one of my favorite things about it!  If you are looking for a low-key place to drink handcrafted, amazing cocktails (the Madison, I'm just saying) in front of a draught-tap water fountain amidst a menagerie of interesting EastSide Austin folk, then come here and enjoy (you can even have ADP delivered!). Just please remember...mum's the word, the password changes daily, and if fratty bros or hipsters catch wind of this place...I will look for you, I will find you, and I will give you the spiciest side-eye of your life!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Sometimes I need .... A little bit of Madison in my life, a little bit of Molly by my side A little bit of Layla is all I need, a little bit of Ashley is what I see A little bit of Lyllian in the sun, a little bit of Avery all night long  Lou Bega anyone? This place is definitely cool for sure! I love the cocktails and all the ladies names, very cute!  My friend introduced me to this new spot.  It is located off Martin Luther King right next to the Austin daily Press.  The inside bar are is small and quaint.  I love the side patio and this is where I spent a beautiful evening sipping on some cocktails and enjoying a sandwich which was delivered from next door.  I had the Molly and the Layla cocktails and both were excellent, refreshing and went down nice and smooth.  The patio has a gorgeous fountain with tons of beer taps spouting out water ... it was cool and creative feature to the atmosphere.    The bartenders here are super nice and professional!  If you are in the area I would absolutely recommend stopping in here for a Molly or Madison in your life!

reviews.author: Oscar N.
reviews.description: A local gem, with awesome bartenders and affordable drink prices. A highlight is their whiskey of the day 4 dollar wells and 7 dollar cocktails. Great indoor and outdoor season and a great place for a date or meet up.

reviews.author: Kim Z.
reviews.description: I was in Austin for a conference and stumbled on this bar thanks to Yelp. I truly enjoyed every minute of the experience, and my tasty Old Fashioned which was a perfect choice to compliment the atmosphere. The bar tenders are super friendly and the place is eclectic, dark and decorated in a vintage style. They also have the best t-shirts I have ever seen at a bar. I was bummed that the Excite Bike 80s Nintendo themed shirt was sold out in my size because I'd be rocking that all the time. Good vibes, great ambience and a great spot to hang after a long day.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: The Wheel was really well decorated, which set the evening off to a good start. The indoor area is intimate, dimly lit, and has a sort of prohibition-era bar feel with its tin ceiling, newspaper clipping wallpaper, and red lighting. Outside, you'll find a large patio with lots tables, and a great fountain made from beer taps. The drinks... well, my beer was way too expensive for what it was (a fairly generic IPA), and their selection for beers was limited (on draft: 8 taps, 1 IPA). HOWEVER, I know that's mainly due to the fact that The Wheel's specialty is whiskey. If whiskey's your drink of choice, I'm sure you'll love it here. They have $4 daily specials, and a number of specialty cocktails.  I'm glad I gave it a shot, and I'll definitely recommend it to my whiskey drinking friends, but if you're looking for anything besides whiskey (or maybe a nice cocktail) I'd steer you elsewhere.

reviews.author: Jon B.
reviews.description: Went in on a weekday, atmosphere is always dead/quiet. I ordered a few rounds and was surprised to see something in my drink. I think the taps need to be cleaned... on top of that the bartender automatically added the tip to my bill. Oh well, I wont be coming back.

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: Pretty standard American fare, but great about food allergies and substitutions, particularly for gluten free individuals. Equal amounts of indoor and outdoor seating, including a picnic table area under some large oak trees. Pup friendly outdoors.   While it's not a place I'd drive across town to visit, I will definitely be back again when in the area.

reviews.author: Rose L.
reviews.description: Let me just say, food is consistently good and they have kept the same recipes and menu since they opened, even when they changed owners yay! Place is clean and does not smell, the ice is the best and for some reason the water there is so crisp! But unfortunately, the service has gone downhill. Especially when the guy behind the bar sees you waiting to be seated and can't even say from a few feet away, "hello we will be right with you." Or even a hello period. I mention this because it's been like this for the last few times we've been there. Usually there are two other servers helping the seated tables and he's just there all bothered looking. I have wanted to politely get his attention by asking him to come seat us. Mind you, it's usually not too busy when we go. I suppose it's frustrating when you know the person chooses to ignore you. Even though it says wait to be seated... it's nice to be acknowledged anywhere you go. Especially if you are fortunate to enjoy an evening out. Other than that, food is good. Service sadly, not so good. Side note- can you please change the 90s-2000 playlist that has been playing for the last 6-7 years lol. Same songs, same playlist. It's cool once in a while but some variety would be nice. I can tell the chef is the same and we thank you for that. It is the only reason we continue to show up!   *This review is to provide feedback in hopes that your business will benefit from an honest customer presenting this information.

reviews.author: Irene C.
reviews.description: It's not easy taking our dog to brunch but this place was easy.  The irony is that he is not interested in dog biscuits so we do have to bring him something tasty or else he wants our delicious food!

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: Best place in town for a date with your pup!  The patio is cozy and the great oak embraces you as you gaze over the Austin skyline.  The Zilker Love pizza had become its own food group in our home, and there are many vegetarian delights to delight, as well as craft beer and a fabulous brunch! The staff is thoughtful and diners tend to be very pleasant as well!  If you see Miss Sophia while visiting, please drop by and say hello!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: With new management comes change  and reviews can change too, so the old sign that seemed a little pisdy towards dogs is gone.  I forgot pics, bit there's a dedicated dog area, not just at the seating just outside the front door but also across the parking lot with lots of shade, picnic tables, and a water station.  Our server, Luis, made our experience the best as he was willing to serve us across the way under the trees since things were slow.  His recommendation for salad dressing was cool too as we mixed 2 on our Southwest salad and that was awesome (cilantro and chipotle I think).  All in all, the pizza was good, and there is a dedicated brunch menu, which was unexpected as well.  We'll be back another time to try more things beyond pizza and to take pics.

reviews.author: Joseph D.
reviews.description: Food was great! 5 stars for the food it the  service was terrible, our server Luis looked so bothered to take our order, couldn't get cream or sugar for our coffee, or even get our drinks refilled. Food was good but not worth going back to.

reviews.author: Isobel B.
reviews.description: The perfect place to bring your dog to as our dog loved socializing with the other dogs there! They even gave us some dog treats :) Definitely get the trio of fries and capitol pie pizza.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Austin Terrier is a low-key restaurant hidden in the hills-ish. Plenty of unique pizzas and burgers, Austin Terrier focuses on new American taste, mixed with the old.   Vegans rejoice, as there is a pizza and burger for you. The Greenbelt Pizza (sub for vegan cheese) and the Impossible Burger are going to be your go-tos. What makes the Greenbelt Pizza great is the truffle oil, the fresh and plentiful arugula, topped with red onions and mushrooms.  Add the Trio of Fries (sub the truffle parm fries), and you have a perfect meal for two.

reviews.author: Steve R.
reviews.description: Ordered delivery the other day--the Trio of Fries and the Groovy Gravy Mushroom Burger. Super tasty and again enjoyed the fries. Didn't need the gravy (on the side) for the burger to taste good.

reviews.author: David V.
reviews.description: Great neighborhood spot with a lot of outdoor dining.  New expanded seating area with picnic tables.  Great for groups or families (dogs included).  Burgers, salads, pizzas.  Interesting options.  Nothing will blow you away.  But all thoughtfully out together and tasty.  Wide range of beers on tap.  Decent cocktail selection.  Limited wine.

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: Nice and chill spot. Very clean, great draft beer selection and the bar staff are awesome and attentive.

reviews.author: matt p.
reviews.description: Good for a lite lunch, nice atmosphere - nice people helping us with our order. Good selection of brew, sandwiches are a nice change and soup was perfect for a cold day.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This was such a cool little gem!  We sat outside on the patio under the tree and it was a great time.  The waiter was super friendly and helpful. I had a pretty delicious sandwich with Brie and apples, and my boyfriend had a pizza.  The crust on the pizza was perfect and probably one of the best crusts I've had on a pizza in a long time.  My sandwich was just okay....I definitely ordered wrong.  I would love to go back and try some of their other menu items and enjoy a beverage from their extensive menu.

reviews.author: Vinnie R.
reviews.description: Just moved into town, and definitely found a Gem! Had The Diablo burger with Truffle fries!!! I definitely won the clean plate award, everything was delicious  great lunch on the patio with my best  friend  Joe, service was perfect as well Thank you Danny and Kat we'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Roby M.
reviews.description: Food was mediocre, bathroom and parking lot were dirty and gross. Final straw tesla chargers are a joke. 28 miles per hour of charging. Waitress was nice so I will give them 2 stars.

reviews.author: Vivien K.
reviews.description: Tory was fantastic. The restaurant was packed and she was a one woman show. Not only did she give us great recommendations but also dealt with a ridiculously demanding Karen/ Kevin with grace. We will DEFINITELY be coming back for the great food and impeccable service.

reviews.author: Jane P.
reviews.description: I'm so grateful for this family friendly spot. It's gluten free and dairy free options were always a selling point for me. Our go to's are the Diablo burger (spicy) and green belt pizza (delicious) ... swap the cheese for goat and request both to be gluten free. PLUS they were quick to accommodate for my child's allergies. The server went to the back and snapped a photo of what goes into their crust/bun so that we didn't expose her to any tree nuts. We love this place so much!

reviews.author: Lou K.
reviews.description: This is slowly becoming my go-to lunch spot. The salad and sandwich combo is spot on. Add in a nice patio and it is a win.

reviews.author: Whitney R.
reviews.description: I live in south Austin and this place is more north so I hadn't been. Went last night with my doggo to meet a friend with her doggo, and we had the funnest and best waiter named Chad! I got the chipotle chicken sandwich and it was phenomenal. We also got a platter of 3 diff kinds of fries that were accidentally ordered for us and he told us to keep them lol. Then he covered our drinks for us because of a long wait time that wasn't even a long wait time! The dogs all played and got treats and tons of love from the staff. My enormous Bulldog couldn't get back into my car at the end because he was tired and my fiancé wasn't there to help me so Chad helped me lift him into my car lol. Anyways this place is awesome! 5/5 recommend!

reviews.author: Ari R.
reviews.description: A touch pricey for what you get, but the food is good, and the staff is consistently friendly. It's a nice little restaurant that really leans into the hipster vibe. Lots of beer, the TVs aren't loud, and cute Terrier art is on the walls. Dogs are welcome in the outside seating area.  There are a few vegetarian options, and I'm pretty sure they can be made vegan.  After coming here several times, I have to suggest ordering the Trio of Fries. Three different seasonings and three sauces let's you try a variety of flavors and fill up on carbs. That's absolutely my jam. It's great for sharing with 2-3 more people and gotta really well with a sandwich. The Toro is pretty good. It tastes fresh and is really satisfying.

name: Yellow Jacket Social Club
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday

reviews.author: Megan V.
reviews.description: Lots of outdoor seating, good ambiance (I think all the trees and lights really contribute to this), and the food/drinks are really quite cheap.  Took advantage of the full kitchen and bar and got the sweet potatoes! Was pleasantly surprised by how good they were. They came with a curry masala mayo (which my drunk friend loved so much, they basically licked my plate clean). Will have to come back and try the sandwiches everyone is talking about

reviews.author: Nicole C.
reviews.description: Went for brunch. I had the Mister and wasnt very impressed. I did have a bite of my friends French Toast though and that was definitely the way to go. My other friends raved about the pork belly. Mimosa bucket was a make it yourself with a bottle of champagne and fruit juices.   Easy to park. Easy to get seating - seat yourself. Good for big groups.

reviews.author: Anni D.
reviews.description: Cool vibes and bomb sandwiches!!! Taking off a star because my friend waited 45 mins for his sandwich (I think the kitchen forgot the order?).   We tried frito pie (so good!), meze plater and ham cheese sandwich. Meze platter was bit underwhelming but everything else was great!

reviews.author: Cait Z.
reviews.description: Had a great experience here for a little lunch. I ordered a sparkling water at the bar and the bar tender added some cherry bitters with a lime and it was delicious! Fantastic suggestion on her part. The meat and cheese boards we ordered were SO GOOD. A top spot for a drink, some snacks, and great conversation with friends. Next time I'm in Austin I'll make sure I come back!

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: This is a great East Austin hidden gem. They have an amazing local craft beer selection, and a full bar plus kitchen. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. I haven't tried the food, yet I've heard great things about it. Will definitely return.

reviews.author: Nick B.
reviews.description: This review is long overdue. I first came here 4 years ago and loved everything about this bar. I'm not sure what the building used to be but I just think it's so cool.   The inside is dark and cool, but I love it. The food is amazing, the drinks are cheap, and the ambiance is cool asf. I came back here this weekend and not a single thing changed.   We got to sit outside this time and everything was perfect. Yellow Jacket Social Club is a diamond in the rough.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: My husband and I came here on a Saturday late afternoon. We ordered a couple of drinks and sat outdoors on one of the picnic benches. In total, we had two drinks apiece and slightly more experience compared to other places in the area. I have been here once before and had some fries. They had been pretty decent. Overall, I would recommend and will be back in the future.

reviews.author: Aleah H.
reviews.description: We came here on a Saturday night for the open patio seating and the grungy vibe. We got lemon drop shots, Vegas bombs, and Modelo's... Props to the bartenders for making legitimate lemon drops instead of hating us for ordering them.  They had bar service, and line was never longer than 3 people or crowded. We didn't have to wait for a table at all when we arrived. We sat in a table nestled in the trees and although I saw reviews that complained about the birds, the trees were a nice back rest, and the social distancing was comforting! It's definitely not a fancy or experience-based spot, but it has a time and place!   Pro tip: If you get stuck on the wrong side of the really long fence in the street, one of the panels to the right of the entrance is unattached and you can step through!!

reviews.author: D L.
reviews.description: I tried to give this place a second try. Should have know, like your exes, you shouldn't go back if it wasn't good the first time. I walked it and was completely ignored. It felt like if I wasn't into indie music or dresses like a local I wasn't look at. I had a coworker who loves this place and raves about it. She was a very rude person so I shouldn't have know she would love this place. Like minded people, like minded spaces. I tried to give you a shot Yellow Jacket, but you weren't batting an eye. So I left and found other bars who didn't judge me in my appearance.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: We visited Yellow Jacket Social Club for an after work cocktail and they did not disappoint. From the guy at the door to the bartender, everyone was super kind and helpful. We ended up ordering the watermelon frozen margaritas - I could be wrong but I think they change up their frozen cocktails quite often. If you come across it on your visit, I would definitely recommend it. They had a variety of beer options and even though I didn't order any food, their menu looked appetizing.  They have a cool vibe with an expansive patio setup. If you get the choice between small/large cocktail, get the large. The price comparison is $7/10 and the large seemed like a way better deal. The birds above can be a little bit of a nuisance so try and sit somewhere with less tree above. They were also very Covid safe and instead of having everyone order in the bar, they had a makeshift bar setup outside where you would place your order. I recommend grabbing a patio seat here on a beautiful day!

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Some big improvements over here. They expanded the inside and are adding more outdoor bench seating, but still has that old divey vibe. Also they have Rosen bagels! Brunch is served until 3pm. Nice to be back to a familiar spot after the pandemic and see it's looking good!

reviews.author: Diana B.
reviews.description: Outdoor vibe, so nice! The trees make it nice and shady. high school vibe for sure. The grilled cheese was delicious! The staff was friendly

reviews.author: Ashley V.
reviews.description: Their beet sandwich is what vegetarian dreams are made of. Every component was delicious!   I feel like this is the central version of Little Darlin and i love it. Super chill, patio, dog friendly, yummy food and full bar.

reviews.author: Shaun S.
reviews.description: I came here for happy hour, based on a local's recommendations. There really weren't any deals but the drinks were considerably priced. Bartender was alright but the staff overall and vibe of the place were not as hospitable as other places nearby. The inside is small with a five bar feel, which I'm fine with, the outside area is probably nice on days where it isn't raining but I sat out there during cloud cover and it was just alright. The parking lot gets flooded after rain so take that into consideration, The bright spot of this place was their potato wedges. Not even kidding. They aren't your typical wedges and I was delighted at how good they were. I'd return just for the those, to be honest. If you want no frills and to keep entirely to yourself, this is probably your place. Social butterflied would be best served somewhere else.

reviews.author: B Abigail T.
reviews.description: Very chill atmosphere. Positive vibe and both the service and the drinks were incredible. The watermelon slush was perfection! After reading the reviews I had to have a grilled cheese and I have to tell you that it did not disappoint. Can't wait to go back and have another.

reviews.author: Al R.
reviews.description: Top notch hole in the wall bar, rad patio surrounded by Crape Myrtle trees and bamboo.  Great menu and food is great.

reviews.author: Jabari M.
reviews.description: Very good vibe and outdoor seating. Had an amazing local Blood Orange Cider, and a very well thought out Grilled Cheese. If you go tell them Jabari sent you, won't do anything for you just say it for me!

reviews.author: Audra O.
reviews.description: I'm from the Philly area and we take Italian subs very seriously. This place has the best Italian sub I've had since I moved to Austin. The roll they use is outstanding. They always have delicious frozen drinks. I also love that they play metal the majority of the time.

reviews.author: Marcus Q.
reviews.description: Not my type of music but that's not why I came. I came for the awesome patio atmosphere and the Frito pie. Which did not disappoint! Sometimes you just wanna kick back and enjoy the nice outside vibes and views. I like mature crowds that know how to go out and have a drink and appreciate what that means. I can do that here so  I will be returning.

reviews.author: Nicholas A.
reviews.description: Cool under tree seating kinda out of the way of everything else and good food menu. Good vibes.

name: Hopfields
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Christopher W.
reviews.description: Exceptional Service. Thats the thing that really stood out to me here. The staff was friendly, attentive and made sure my party had a good experience. This a smaller establishment thats easy to miss but you should definitely pay attention and stop by if you're in the area. The decor and coziness makes you feel like you're in a classic pub. I had the port of havana to drink and it was delicious. Lighter on the alcohol(as intended) but it still tasted like a real drink and had an assortment of flavors that I haven't had before but I loved them. For food I tried the burger which was really solid. Cooked well, tasted fresh and the flavor from the caramelized onions made sure it was far from bland. Overall I really enjoyed this place and think its perfect to grab a drink or quick bite after work.

reviews.author: dotsandloop s.
reviews.description: I'm embarrassed that I brought friends to one of our favorite places and that we were met with not so great service. The food was stellar however.  We wanted to sit outside and have table service and were told by the tall male host-  no, sorry - those are reservation only and our reservations are full today. So we opted for a table in the parking lot and ran to the bar to order. It was cold and we were the only ones out there - no offer to turn on a heater.  We sat outside from 5:30-9 and zero ZERO people showed up for all their "reservations".   I get that you may have to plan staffing around your booked reservations or maybe you didn't have someone to wait on tables but just be upfront about it.   I'm hoping this is an anomaly because usually the team is stellar there.

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: We ate here for Valentine's Day2022. After being seated and our initial order taken, our server didn't return for 50 minutes. I asked the person that delivered our dinner if I could place a drink order with them, to which they replied "I'll get your server". The server never came. When our server finally checked in and we communicated we hadn't received any service for a very long time, the reply was "do you want to order dessert".  We ate our main course with nothing to drink.  This is my girlfriends favorite restaurant, and she was very upset that my experience was so terrible.  I called the next day to discuss with a manager. None were available, so I left my name and number. I never received a call back, so at least they are consistent. This may be a labor shortage issue, to which a little communication would have gone a long way.

reviews.author: W C.
reviews.description: We went back here on Monday night for the first time since 2017 and had a better experience than our last visit--but not by much. (Oh, heyyyyy Jennie BTW....)  The space is still as cute as we remember it and the cocktails are great. We split the scotch egg, salade Rachel, and the moules frites. The scotch egg was a unique take and while one of us enjoyed it, the other one said it wasn't sitting well afterwards. The salad was phenomenal but it was too heavily dressed--loved the poached celery though. The artichoke seemed fresh too. Moules frites: flavor of the sauce was wonderful but the whole dish was kinda odd. Like, is the intention to have all the fries at the bottom of the bowl get soggy with the sauce?? Why not just include one slice of something toasted to sop that up? The garlic sauce on top was delish and the mussels themselves were great. Also literally EVERYTHING needed more salt. (Our friend wanted us to include that her mushroom-leek tart hardly had any leek in it :) Dessert was chocolate mousse and creme brûlée: nothing special but both were well-executed.  Service was mostly efficient but definitely snooty. He didn't check up with us about the food until we were almost half way done and there were several missed opportunities for asking us about another round of drinks. Clearing was also haphazard and sloppy.   So, overall, a sliiiightly better experience than last time. The food was pretty good, though, and we were happy to be in a cute little space with our friends, so we're willing to round up to four stars. We think you just need to come in here with the right mindset by not expecting them to excel at anything and for you to pay more than you should. But it's better than most of the restaurant crap out there in Austin--we will say that.

reviews.author: Kseniya K.
reviews.description: Make reservations for dinner. Midday, you usually do not need a reservation, unless you are visiting during a holiday/peak busy time.   Indoor and outdoor seating available. Super casual outdoor setup--plain, wooden, picnic tables and benches, under umbrellas, which do nothing to shield you in hoooot weather. Better sit inside, and enjoy the classy, French province style ambiance. Really enjoyed both times I visited this place and dined indoors. Great for a date, a family gathering, or a casual friends get together.  For lunch, you order and pay at the bar, and then wait for your food and take it to a table of your choice. For dinner, a waiter serves you, providing a complete dinning experience. Staff are friendly and accommodating.  Loooved the pascal burger $16. It hit the spot the first time I tried it. When warm, the soft Camembert cheese melts into the cornichons, caramelized onions, and grain mustard, creating a perfect medley with the juicy patty. The meat was flavorful and well-seasoned, bursting with flavor. Definitely, one of the best burgers I've ever tried. Try this. Eat it while it's hot. When it cools down, it looses its ooomph. When I ordered this during my second visit, I waited until it was cool, and I did not get the same kick out of it.  Fries were perfect--well seasoned, crispy, and delicious.   Duck confit with polenta $27 was a small portion, but every element was executed perfectly. The duck was delicate and bursting with flavor, thanks to the bright, citrusy orange sauce. Polenta was crunchy and fun to eat, fried in a form of thick sticks.  Would return anytime I'm back in Austin!

reviews.author: Van N.
reviews.description: We came here for a 'light' meal. My friend got the mussle and fries which were definitely good enough to share if you wanted to. I got the scotch egg and escargot dumplings. Its after all just an egg and a few dumplings. They were super filling! A super delicious mistake on my part. Then of course we had to get the dessert creme brulee was okay. The star of dessert was the bread pudding. I cannot wait to come back and try everything else on the menu.

reviews.author: Vivian P.
reviews.description: I fall in love with this place the first time I tried it after living in this neighborhood for so long. You can come here for drinks at the bar but also sit down for a full dine in experience. Their desserts here are especially amazing. I tried their banana crepe and it's amazing!! I love how the banana tastes didn't get completely covered by the chocolate and also how cute they decorated the plate!

reviews.author: Will C.
reviews.description: First visit, so my assessment change over time. My initial sense is that while the food is good, the service needs some work.   No complaints about the food, which was quite good, such as the Heirloom Tomato Tarte and the Salade Niçoise.  The ratatouille could've used a bit more bread, and I thought the toffee flavor of the mango gelato-bread pudding dessert we got to be overpowering.  Drinks were varied and interesting, with French component takes on standard cocktails (e.g. "The Vielle Fashioned") that worked for some (their variation of the French 75) and  less so for others (I believe the Frontera Sidecar).  What definitely fell short was the service. I don't need overly attentive service, but it's not reasonable to be out of water for half an hour, unsuccessfully trying to flag down a waiter time after time.  This is particularly a problem given the small size of their water glasses and the lack of a water bottle for the table. Fixing this relatively small problem would be huge.

reviews.author: Bree B.
reviews.description: The service is out of this world at Hopfields. Every single employee welcomes you as a dear friend. The beer selection on tap is incredible and every single dish is curated with fresh ingredients while keeping the menu innovative. I think this would be a perfect place to go on a first date or meet up with friends. The ambience is intimate, but also very warm and open.

reviews.author: Sunita H.
reviews.description: The cheese board was the highlight of our meal. My partner got their Pascal burger and didn't love it, I got the lamb bolognese which was more of a stew sauce and not a marinara. I like the ambience of this place more than I liked the food.

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: Updating this review because I've now done brunch at Hopfields for the first time, and it was just as lovely as dinner! Everyone I was with really enjoyed what we got -- we tried the French toast with berry jam and toasted coconut, croissant breakfast sandwich, avocado tartine with a fried egg, eggs benedict, and grapefruit mimosas. Great service, chill ambience (especially for brunch at 11am on a Saturday!)--just great all around. I continue to be surprised by this place but I'm not sure why it's surprising anymore, Hopfields is just genuinely good!

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: We had our first visit to Hopfields tonight and I definitely think we'll be back. Its one of the most interesting places we've been in a long time. This restaurant had low key MeowWolf vibes. Every room a little different and the menu was full of surprises. Don't come here expecting a classic version of what you see on the menu!  We had the escargot dumplings, ratatouille, and moules- all presented quite differently than what we imagined. The food is good, not great, but very fun to experience. I wished we could have tried a few more things just to see what they would bring. Dress for the possibility that you might spill red sauce on yourself, because you will. Overall, it was a great little night out and definitely something new and different. If you're expecting traditional French food, you will probably be disappointed. If you're open to surprises, I think you'll enjoy it here.

reviews.author: Kimberly T.
reviews.description: AMAZING. such a great restaurant. Escargot dumplings and mussels are to die for! Going back as soon as I can.

reviews.author: Alan C.
reviews.description: February should be the peak of PEI mussel season.  We came for the mussels.  Unfortunately I don't think the cook particularly likes them.  I had the overwhelming feeling that the cook never tasted the dish as it cooked. There was no sauce, the mussels appeared to be steamed okay and then a ton of chili powder or paprika was dumped on them and that was how they were served.   The powder made for kind of a paste because there was no, or very little, other liquid such as wine or vinegar or tomatoes or much of anything else.  I love to scoop up a tasty broth in the mussel shells and sip it while gulping the seafood,  but this was very dry.  The dryness and high chili content made it very hard to taste the mussels. The fries on top soaked up what little moisture that had been present.    The french onion soup, however,  was excellent.

reviews.author: Stevie K.
reviews.description: Always love a nice lunch at Hopfields! The duck Rueben is mouth watering good, but you honestly can't go wrong with any food item! Love the chill atmosphere and patio option.

reviews.author: Henna A.
reviews.description: We got here on a Sunday evening and were told there was a want of 30 mins to sit indoor when there were empty tables but we were okay and sat in the back lot where they had outdoor chairs and picnic tables. If you're outside you have to get your food and drinks by going back inside by the bar to put your order. To our surprise, the cocktails didn't have actual liquor which was strange. The boards they brought out after a good hour after ordering along with the fries were a bit lackluster. The indoor dining was very cute however overall experience and food taste wasn't great to come back to

reviews.author: Jenn B.
reviews.description: We ended up finding Hopfields thru Eaters List of best Burgers in Austin! Hopfields was #5! #5 guys and not to be snooty but I didn't even look at anything past P Terry's which was around #15! Hehehe P Terry's is good (it's a local chain, made to order) but it's a drive thru and I was looking for more of an "elevated" experience tonight! No shade to my P Terry lovers!! So the Paschal Burger is $16 Medium rare, and slathered in ooey gooey camembert cheese and mustard! I enjoyed it! I regularly lean toward a sweet burger with carmelized onion (which were included), BBQ sauce, bacon jam and other ingredients like these. This burger is just savory not too bold and a textural delight! See the video for the "unboxing"! I would give it a solid 7/10.

reviews.author: Courtney E.
reviews.description: This place has hands-down one of the best burgers in Austin. It's a casual little bar with craft beer and amazing French food. Their burger, covered in camembert or brie, carmelized onions and whole grain mustard is so delicious!! Pair it with crispy Pomme frites and homemade aioli...it's a mic drop moment. The staff is kind and helpful, their craft beer choices and a small but wonderful wine list just rounded out the afternoon. All they have left to do is claim their yelp listing! LOL  But seriously, if you are a foodie, this should definitely be on your list of places to frequent. I'm sure they have many other amazing things to eat there, but their burger is so good that we've never ordered anything else!

reviews.author: Javier E.
reviews.description: It has a very classy vibe to it, the choices for food and drink reflect it. I wish they had more variety in their menu, with cheaper options. I suppose you pay extra for the upscale vibe of the place.  This is not saying that the food is bad, in fact it is very good. The wine and beer options are the best in the area, now that Vino Vino is closed. The great thing is that you can go there for drinks, without ordering food, and have a great time sitting indoors or outside. The staff are very professional, welcoming, and they use their knowledge about the different wines to make suggestions.

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Came for dinner, without reservations, on  Friday. It was pretty empty and easy to get a table, so we sat in the middle room of the place, which was somewhat of a makeshift library/lounge with old foreign decor.  We got olives and almonds to start, with escargot, which came with small lettuce leaves and was in a red sauce (not your typical garlic butter). It was really good, different and interesting to try it in a different preparation. For the main, we split the steak and frites. It was probably the smallest portion of steak I've ever seen and if I had eaten it myself I probably still would have been hungry. But, it was really nicely cooked and seasoned, as well as the fries. So despite the size it was super good.  Don't know if I'd come again, also because they only had some special cocktails and not a full bar, but it was interesting to try the place.

name: School House Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday

reviews.author: Logan N.
reviews.description: This small place was a nice stop while in north Austin. The cocktails were good but the Montreal fries were amazing! Small place so seating is limited. Unique feel to the place... like a hole in the wall but not. Outside seating was nice for the cool night.

reviews.author: Teri M.
reviews.description: This used to be one of my favorite places on Manor to grab dinner and a drink, but unfortunately I don't think I'll return again. The vibes here are so uncomfortable since they hired an incredibly rude bartender/manager who barks at customers like they are her subordinates in the army.  I've noticed she has been on staff during each of my visits since the pandemic began. It's hard for me to imagine how someone with such poor social skills has been placed in a customer-facing role. I will however continue supporting Techo, the mezcal bar upstairs, with super friendly staff and lovely atmosphere.

reviews.author: Amy B.
reviews.description: Great sliders! Omg! Awesome pub ambience. We were hungry and no other nearby restaurants were still open. I'm definitely going back!

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: Its safe! Its socially distant compliant! Its employees are masked and enforce masks! Its Schoolhouse Pub!  This little gem is sandwiched behind Mi Madre's and El Chilito. You'll miss it if you blink! Swing around back for parking or walk up from the front.   Indoor/outdoor seating with puppers welcomed outside.   + Tasty noms (get the fried deviled eggs. Woo!) Classy cocktails Very relaxed vibe Minimal staff contact  Safety measures in place Cute little floating books  Clean bathroom  - This place is smaller, dont bring a big group.  No cash, yall. Its dirty, ya know? Small parking outback   I took my cousin and we had a really nice time. The staff and bartenders were incredibly kind and went above and beyond to be helpful.   Definitely check this place out with a friend or two...or a pupper or two.

reviews.author: Mylan D.
reviews.description: Food is delicious! I came here twice to order their deviled eggs!  It's best if you come during recess hours (happy hour) and check out their discounted menu! Otherwise, expect to pay minimum $14 for your main course. I love that their menu, decor and the restaurant reminds me of an elementary school.   Service was wonderful and food came out about 15 mins on a slow day. It's also conveniently located between a couple of taco restaurants if you need a quick snack!   Patio is Bob and dog friendly! There's water bowls for your thirsty pup on the side of the restaurant if you choose to bring your furry companion!   Bartender made me a cute mimosa to enjoy before heading back to the airport. Definitely coming back to visit when I'm in town again!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Visited for happy hour and wasn't smitten with any dish (except the mac 'n cheese). Everything was fine; just nothing that makes me want to return again any time soon.  I love the indoor seating with its broody, dark interiors and the plentiful outdoor seating on park benches (hard to get in and out of if you're wearing a skirt/dress!) and when the sunset is that beautiful magenta/hot Texas orange color, this venue is perfectly situated to stare longingly at it. I also like that you order from the counter instead of traditional table service because sometimes it's nice not to be interrupted (make sure you have everything you need before you sit down, though, because if the line is long, it makes it difficult to track someone down for something).  A solid place for a drink if you're a sunset chaser.

reviews.author: Robert S.
reviews.description: I'm surprised this place has a rating as high as 4 overall. It's the worst pub food I've had, and I tried a few of the dishes. How can you mess up fish and chips? A mess. Drinks are basic and uninteresting. If you want a decent site to sit and chat with your friends, it's a good place to hang, but you can find the same atmosphere elsewhere and get palatable food and better cocktails.

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: Solid neighborhood bar, but i probably wouldn't come if i didnt live near by.   The best feature is the patio, Manor road is a cool neighborhood and its fun to people watch. The inside feels a little cramped for a group and it can be pretty loud. The neighborhood in general is nice. If your in the area you should stop by.  They also have some good happy hour deals. 6 dollar fish and chips and 5 dollars off bottles of wine. Each day of the week has a different deal and they're all pretty good.  In terms of drinks, they have a decent selection of beers on tap. Theyre selection extends beyond the basic austin starter pack too which is nice.  In terms of food,  Its a step up from bar food, but i definitely wouldn't call this a gastro pub. The fish and chips are good but definitely greasy and the portions are inconsistent.    The burger is pretty good. The patty is pretty thick and they put a jam on top thats sweet which stole the show. I think the jam was made of onions. I only wish they put more jam on top. It has a similar effect as ketchup. be warned, the saten burger is a little tough.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Very cool vibes here and super friendly staff.  The food was just ok in my opinion- we shared the fish and chips, Montreal fries, and ravioli. Nothing blew me away, but it was good!  It's more about the drinks and atmosphere- great beer selection and cocktail list :)  Definitely want to go back for happy hour prices and brunch!

reviews.author: Scott L.
reviews.description: Great outdoor seating: $2.50/pint Lone Star is a thirst quencher. But $15.00 Special "Birro Mac and Cheese?" No. I don't care how Much Sirracha you add to Hamburger Helper: fool me once, shame on you. I'll never order food here without looking at the price again. And if you think topping it with grated cabbage justifies the ridiculous price, think again!  Come here for the atmosphere and justifiably cheap beer..

reviews.author: Kerthy F.
reviews.description: BEST BURGER FRIES AND ONION RINGS!!  I live nearby, and this is my go-to when I want a great burger and fries. The orange marmalade/ carmelized onion / homemade pickle combo is so good. It's my fave burger in Austin. And solid cocktails. Nice people, nice service, GREAT FOOD.

reviews.author: robert t.
reviews.description: Super sad that this pub, which I have always liked on Manor, has a super condescending female working at the bar. Everyone has always been so nice until yesterday, may 19, 2021. Dark hair heavy set lady with tattoos in her 20s was so rude to me three times and while I was simply ordering in line. Rude to others as well, very bossy and not friendly. Reaching out to the owner today. Sad. Covid is no longer an excuse.

reviews.author: Angela B.
reviews.description: Love this place! Fun atmosphere inside (when things are normal) and a great patio for outside eating. The husband and wife owners are awesome people, and their staff are so friendly. Delicious drinks and amazing, elevated pub food! Highly recommend it ALL!! Their location in central Austin near UT. Definitely check it out NOW!

reviews.author: Meredith E.
reviews.description: This place is a great casual, laid-back, rustic bar to grab a drink and grub with a group. The only parking available is street parking behind the bar in the neighborhood, but you don't have to walk too far. (Less than 5 min)  This bar has a throwback school vibe with chalkboards on the walls and mini composition notebooks for your receipt. They have a good craft beer selection and their food is delicious and higher quality than your average bar food. We ordered the wings and pretzels. The pretzels are a bit more oily, however it being bar food, filled my greasy food craving. The mustard seed it came with was a great pair (although i highly recommend adding a queso dip!). The wings were delicious as well and were mild spicy. There is patio seating out back and picnic tables out front, as well, so there is plenty of space for a group.

reviews.author: Tiffiny S.
reviews.description: Hated getting a hall pass in school...but getting the hall pass at the School House was amazing! Got vodka rather than gin!  Fresh fruit, yes please! Insane! Their beyond burger was beyond words! Best food and perfect unique house made drinks on the east side!

reviews.author: Svetlana M.
reviews.description: love the cocktails here. they are amazing and creative. all the little theming touches are cool too. this place has a really nice chill vibe. totally fun. and the bartenders are all super friendly.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: I had been meaning to check this place out as it is literally down the street from a friend's apt on Manor and having investigated almost every other place on the block, my FOMO was kicking in when I would see this place packed to the hilt every time we drove by. Luckily, I came on a quiet weekday evening and barely made it for their HH (the bartender was nice enough to honor it since it was but a minute over).   I like the vibe here, it is very trendy eastside but w/o the pretension or self-importance of other places nearby.   I had my sights set on the Montreal fries as I am a poutine enthusiast (and purist, to be truthful) , so I will establish right now these are not traditional poutine, but a conceptualization. First off, the serving was massive and I probably reached my sodium quota for the week by finishing every last bite, but I'm not a quitter and setting this heap of short ribs, gravy, cheese curds, and fries in front of me was instantly "Challenge: Accepted!". It took me almost an hour and a half whittling away one bite at a time and having to take literal breathers in between, but it was ::MISSION ACCOMPLISHED:: (in the unironic non-Bush sense) and I had 0 regrets.  In the 90mins of unleashing my hardcore Fatty for all to see, I got to interact w/the staff and other patrons and I have to say, there were no judgements (aamof, I got several nods and eyebrow raises of approval at my endeavor). I'll admit, everyone I encountered was a very Austin-y version of splendid! We laughed, I cried (when I finally finished the Montreal Fries), and even rebuked the very handsome bartender's insinuation I would even think about a to-go box!   All in all, I enjoyed my visit here and can see myself coming back on an off/quiet night. The seating inside is pretty cozy and the patio is smallish as well, so I can only imagine how chummy you have to get with your fellow "students" when the Friday bell sounds and weekend recess is in effect!

reviews.author: Yiana Y.
reviews.description: Hidden gem of a Sunday brunch spot in Austin and there's usually not a wait, which is hard to come by these days. They even have vegan biscuits and gravy that are SO good. Nice, casual, chill option for your Sunday brunch needs

reviews.author: Angie W.
reviews.description: Came in for the first time the Sunday of the World Cup final.  Friend suggested it would be a fun place to watch. They opened early and there was already a line.  Think it was worth it.   While small the space was great and the food and drinks on point. Loved the smokey blood Mary. Got the potato hash vegan style and it was tasty.   Only thing that was a miss was the way they handled the crowd. Couldn't order food and drink until after a time past open which isn't their fault but there wasn't enough staff to handle the crowd. Food went to wrong people and no one to check on diners.  They did the best they could but poor planning.   Will give them another go on a normal day and think things will be five star worthy.

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: What a great little spot! Stopped in during HH on a Thursday and posted up at the bar. Super friendly bartenders and just a great vibe overall. Went ahead and sampled some beers, grabbed a Dogfish Punkin Ale - they guy even threw some sugar and freshly ground cinnamon on the rim! This is the only way you should be drinking a pumpkin beer!   Ordered the fish and chips - $5 bucks on HH! These things came with some serious garlic fries.. I want you to take what you think is a lot of garlic, then multiply it by 83874... Somehow still delicious, the tarter sauce on the side deserves an award.. It was like a tarter/greek tzatziki sauce hybrid! I should have asked for some to-go. No idea why they give you ketchup as well.. Doesn't really fit the plate because of the fry seasonings and garlic. The fish was tender and crispy... perfect balance.   If you haven't had a chance to check this spot out, throw it on your list!  One last thing - if you do order the fish and chips.. Don't go get your game on for the night without brushing and gargling a gallon of mouthwash, throw some gum in for good measure! Be responsible, people!

reviews.author: Gina F.
reviews.description: Love, love, love this place! I come here often to work and hangout. There are a lot of spots to plug in, sit and work both inside and outside.   On top of all this, they have vegan breakfast tacos and yes they are extremely delicious. For someone like me who doesn't drink coffee (I know it's odd), really appreciate the delicious tea selection as well.   Thanks spokesman for being my go to office away from home!

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: In East Congress next to a Tesla dealership is an industrial part of town with tons of crafts breweries, a winery, distilleries and Spokesman Coffee. Walk inside and you're surrounded by an industrial space with high ceilings and murals on literally every wall. It's quirky and beautiful!   Walk up the the barista and order a coffee from a full coffee menu. They roast their beans and sell it across the country. Next to the coffee bar is an actual bar with beers on tap from ales to cider and even a fruit punch and pickle sour type drink.  I ordered a vanilla latte for over just $6, tapped into their wifi and found open seating in the back patio. Only 3-5 tables are near outlets inside, but the back patio has a few outlets. However, the wifi isn't as strong outside.

reviews.author: Vivian F.
reviews.description: Solid vibes and good coffee. They serve beer and food too. Seating is not the most comfortable but friendly staff! Parking is a bit tough as it's in a commercial lot, but there's additional parking across the street.   Wifi is very spotty, ended up needing to hotspot from my own phone to continue working. Wifi password is witty thought -  you'll see what I mean.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: This is one of my favorite coffee places they roast their own beans they do Collabs with other places creating really good stuff. Morning noon or evening it's always good staff is always friendly and they serve beer tacos bake goods you can't go wrong.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Really cool spot. Dark, artsy, inviting. Very kind baristas, wonderful coffee, tasty vegan breakfast tacos. Arguably the best croissant in town offered as well (sour duck market). Love this place.

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: So funky and awesome in the warehouse area and indoor plants and Great Wall art. He enjoyed his cappuccino and I had a lovely time with a lime Roibos tea that was so relaxing and aromatic. Shaded picnic tables to chill out and enjoy the beverages and wedged in between the Austin Winery and Texas Sake this place must be sooo happening at night.  Highly recommended!!

reviews.author: Ashleigh J.
reviews.description: Stopped here one Sunday mid morning and it was pretty calm and quiet. Parking was easy, and we were able to order our drinks quickly. The aesthetic in the place is really light and fun, and they have a lot of outdoor seating area. There were a lot of people doing work/homework of some kind, it is definitely a place where you can come and chill for a while. There was a large selection of drinks, including some seasonal options. I decided to get an iced Americano which I thought had a good flavor. Drinks were to us pretty quickly, and there was a water station four easy water access. The cream and sugar area also had almond milk, which I thought was a nice addition. Most places usually only have half and half, so a non-dairy alternative was nice to see. They sell beer, however I didn't look at the beer selection so I'm no help on that! Worth checking out, I plan to go back soon!

reviews.author: Garnie B.
reviews.description: decent place for coffee in the afternoon...  like the art and decor.  kind of loud, so bring your headsets if you want to read / study   had a meeting with a friend there, just chatting.  The coffee was good, did not try any of the food.   Team there was helpful and friendly.   I would recommend this place to get away from the coffee franchises Supporting the local team.

reviews.author: Jen T.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. Got a hot chai latte with oat milk and it was delicious. Nice ambiance with plenty of plugs.  I gotta give a special shout out to the staff. There were a couple of people from the deaf community here when I came in. The staff member was just as courteous to them as everyone else and even knew some sign language. Love the inclusivity.

reviews.author: Lena L.
reviews.description: Love the coffee and the layout of the shop!  I ordered a vanilla iced latte and it was super flavorful and hit the spot. I also really liked the two story layout and the art all over the walls!
