reviews.author: Victoria D.
reviews.description: AHHH THIS PLACE IS SO COOL. This is an excellent example of a business making an effort to seamlessly live in its environment-- in other words, this coffee shop found a way to complement its outside surroundings near the Tesla factory, and almost gives off a steam punk vibe. I'm a pretty sunny person, but even I can't resist. Also, the drinks are actually good. Very glad that they were able to have an aesthetic look and comfy vibe without sacrificing the quality and taste of their drinks. I got the matcha latte with oat, vanilla, and turmeric !

reviews.author: Sean Matthew L.
reviews.description: Spokesman is everything I want and more. I worry to yell too loudly about how great they are because then everyone will know and make them busy all of the time. On the one hand that's great for business, on the other I want to keep them all for myself.   A lot of coffee shops can be snooty and pretentious, but this ain't that. Everyone there truly loves coffee and people. They just want everyone to be caffeinated and happy. What better a mission than that?  They roast their own beans which means you're getting a truly unique cup when you go there. All of their espresso pulls are doubles to start. That's why I love getting the 1:1 when I go to sit down. You get a single shot of espresso and a baby latte with the other single shot inside. You also get a glass of sparkling water and a Hershey kiss. Total perfection. This lets you explore and taste the espresso on its own and then see it in a drink with the milk. It's an awesome way to discover what you might like or not like about a particular roast.   Then on your way out if you liked it you can buy a bag of those beans to take home for your coffee there for the week. It's the best.

reviews.author: Lauren F.
reviews.description: Fun inventive coffee that is quite good. Love the unique flavors. Interesting location in semi-industrial area. Will be back!

reviews.author: Lauren S.
reviews.description: I looooove this place! I always get my coffee beans from Spokesman and the few times I decide to try something else, I always end up wishing I hadn't. They just have great coffee, great food, great people, and great vibes. Oh, and the art....killer!!

reviews.author: Annie C.
reviews.description: Really dug the vibe at this place. If I was a local I would be here all. the. time. The art on the walls is really unique and the art + music + beer/coffee options gave it an awesome grungy feel. Everyone was super friendly and it felt like a neighborhood kind of place where you could happily become a regular.   They also cover all the coffee shop basics- My Chai tea was great, the wifi was fast, plenty of outlets, and the seats were comfy.

reviews.author: Whitley B.
reviews.description: This is SUCH a cool place. It's my favorite place to work from right now. Great vibe, great beer selection, and good coffee. Staff is so nice. I love being here and feel at home when I go.

reviews.author: Elsa J.
reviews.description: Such a cool place, and so totally vibe-ing Austin. Major kudos to the Spokesman for embodying sustainability in a cafe setting. They've got compostable take away cups and utensils, which is so rare. Their tea comes loose leaf in a steal strainer, and all their food is severed on reusable plates and in mugs.  I got the Turkish tea, flavorful and now one of my favorites. I'm not sure if this is a house mix, but the tea tasted unique and strong. Unlimited hot water refills, just go up to the bar area and ask! With tea I got the tasty morning bun, kind of like a cinnamon roll but with different nuts and really big. Flakey croissant exterior with a goo-y interior, this was a really nice cafe treat!  I think tourists and locals both enjoy the distinctive graffiti art on the walls of this cafe. It's located in a shipping container area that has a nice outdoor seating place too.

reviews.author: Gabrielle A.
reviews.description: Such a friendly vibe at this shop. The coffee reminds me of my favorite place in New York so I'll definitely be Back!

reviews.author: Sharleen C.
reviews.description: San Francisco vibes. The art work all over everywhere kept my eyes, mind and imagination entertained while I waited for my coffee. Cool coffee shop...Starbucks watch out!!

reviews.author: Devin O.
reviews.description: I landed in the Austin airport and wanted to find a local brewery with good food and character. I found Spokesman on yelp and was delighted by what I found. Granted, I thought the navigation was taking me somewhere very odd as Spokesman is a bit off the beaten path and was a bit harder to find in the dark. But it's worth it. I was greeted by a friendly staff and an interesting menu. The beer was fantastic and I got a cold brew coffee to go for the next morning.    For food, I'd suggest the chicken salad sandwich. It was delicious! However, the bread is toasted a bit too much--so crunchy it hurt my mouth a bit. But overall, crisp and fresh flavors that left me wanting more. I'd order it again, just asking that the bread not be so hard.

reviews.author: Lilia S.
reviews.description: Great place for a date night or just going with friends, drinks are always delicious and there's plenty of options to try. I started liking mezcal after coming here, definitely try it out -- the place is very intimate! Love it

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Techo Mezcaleria and Agave Bar is a great speakeasy on Manor Rd. If you are a fan of mezcal and/or tequila, this is the place for you. Small bar with a patio too (with a heater). Ian is a great bartender and took care of us. You should definitely try the "stuff in a cup" (Ian's favorite mezcal cocktail with passion fruit). The spicy mango mezcal margarita was also enjoyable or you can sip one too. Great spot to to ring in the new year.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Really cool concept, with mediocre drinks. It was a nice spot that transported one to a LatAm local bar. But the drinks are disappointing. It's a really small space so getting a seat is a coin toss.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: This place is very confusing on how to actually fine. I thought it was connected to meet Madrid. But it is not. Actually go next-door and then to their backyard and then go up and you are at the spot. It's very small it's almost gives you a speakeasy feel. The bartenders were super cool and we really enjoyed our time there. It was a group of seven of us and we took up most of the bar. Drinks are very good as well. If you're not a tequila fan this is not for you but you should still try to experience it at least once. They have frozen on the rocks and other delicious cocktails.

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! I have been driving by Techo everyday for years, and we frequent the area for the other restaurants and bars, but for some dumb reason beyond comprehension, we never gave them a try. We are completely hooked now! The space is cozy, intimate, and inviting. The drinks are just out of this world, and SO strong! The flavors are unique, and even if you aren't a mezcal fan, some of the drinks completely cover up what's even in it! They had a cool nook tucked away next to the bar that we are hoping to sit in once things open back some more, and we would love to hang out inside and enjoy their cool vibe inside! The patio is tucked away upstairs, and even though it's in a busy area right along the street, you don't even notice! They have TONS of misting fans outside that made the 102 degree heat totally tolerable for once!   They had dog bowls out, so I would venture to say they are dog friendly, which we plan to take advantage of very soon!

reviews.author: Alexandra W.
reviews.description: Ambiance is everything here. In an unassuming spot, If like you like mezcal or tequila you won't be disappointed. As an FYI you have to go through school house pub to find this spot

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: Hands down one of the cutest Mezcal bars I've been to. It's not very big, as most mezcal bars seem to be, but such a nice space. Cool little nook that seats about four. Great mezcal recommendations and the cocktails were delish. I highly recommend the Crudo, Ta Cabron, and Tepache.

reviews.author: Keristen B.
reviews.description: I hesitate to write this review because I love that Techo currently feels like a secret, locals only Mezcal bar. But they have my favorite margarita in town, incredible ambiance and authentic tasting experiences - that you just have to KNOW about it. This is the first bar I bring visitors too - usually right when they open, so we can snag seats at the bar and get guided Mezcal tastings from Techo's very knowledgeable and easygoing staff. I never leave without ordering at least one of their Frozen Guava Agave Margaritas with the chili salt rim (do NOT pass on the home-made chili salt, it is the perfect pair for this sweet/tart drink).  Every one of my girlfriends love that drink! My boyfriend also loves that he can get a strong mezcal centered cocktail from their list (which has 10-12 house cocktails that are great). Their Micheladas are also a crowd fave.   When you start to get hungry - walk to Salty Sow for happy hour apps or down to Patrizi's to share some crazy good home-made Italian food from a food truck! You'll have a line at Patrizi's - but it's a great option for your visiting friends, who have probably never had an Italian food truck experience.

reviews.author: Lindsey L.
reviews.description: This has to be one of the cutest mezcal bars I've been to. The vibe is very cozy and intimate, tucked away above Mi Madre. We sat in this little nook that had seating for four, it felt very private from the rest of the bar, we enjoyed it! I had their mezcal margarita and the flavor was so good, I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Brandon R.
reviews.description: This place is a fantastic hideout. Kind of small but fits the rustic atmosphere.   Bar tenders were very knowledgeable and attentive. Tried my first mezcal margarita there and have a new favorite cocktail (normally prefer an old fashioned).   Fried crickets are a nice add on as well.   Will definitely go back. A date might be more impressed by this than another random brewery!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Love this place. Perfect date spot. Awesome service, amazing drinks. Very romantic feel, kind of secret and hidden, off the beaten path. Don't even want to post this review because I'm afraid more people will start crowding...

reviews.author: Jacob R.
reviews.description: Awesome mezcal bar, have to go up the stairs. Recommend the Mezcals in the green bottles!

reviews.author: Trish C.
reviews.description: Selfishly I hate to say everything I love about this place because one of the character points is how small and intimate is. But I think the words out because it is really rocking Friday and Saturday night! What I love most... amazing bartenders and mixologist... They enjoy making something to please you if they don't have a line 5 people back. I can go on and on but let's just say if you like Mezcal and tequila this place will not disappoint!

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: Techo Mezcaleria reminds me of why I still love Austin: the unusual, hidden gems that are tucked away all around the city.  Most other folks already hit the highlights. It's tiny, seats maybe 10, and you enter through the Schoolhouse Pub gate, despite Techo actually being on the second story of Mi Madres. Word of caution: Mezcal ranges from "lightly smoky" to "I'm drinking liquid smoke." Personally it's not something I can have a lot of, we had three sample sized shots and that was plenty between the two of us. Just be forewarned.   Our bartender Ian was awesome, we had a nice, rambling forty minute conversation about mezcal versus tequila versus whisky. Unfortunately, we went on a Saturday when there wasn't a happy hour, so we didn't get a chance to sample the margaritas, but that gives us a great excuse to go back.

reviews.author: Kevin L.
reviews.description: My first time here tonight and it's the day of the dead celebration. Just found my new favorite bar. I'm having a special drink they have only for tonight with mezcal and a touch of absinthe. I'll be back.

reviews.author: Abby M.
reviews.description: Mixed feelings, liked the drinks, liked the overall vibe, but will forever be remembered as that place where a guy in front of us in line told my friend and I we should have a man order drinks for us and continue on in a bizarre manner. I feel everyone gave him the "just a dumb drunk pass" but the more I think about it the more I think if he was drunk like that maybe he shouldn't have been served anymore or asked to leave. Also this was around 6-8pm not your average time for people to be so belligerent. Drink pictured is the violeta.

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: Awesome selection of tequila and mezcal at this little cute bar found upstairs. Extremely crowded in the evening around 6P, probably due to their happy hour. Enjoyed our drinks though except for the overly sweet frozen margaritas.

reviews.author: Javier R.
reviews.description: Great place if you love mezcal. Micheladas are also very good! Definitely try their crickets.  Bartenders are very knowledgeable and cool!

reviews.author: Pri J.
reviews.description: Nice decor. Horrible service. Make sure you are clear and repeat the order to the bartender or they will make their own interpretation of the drink, refuse to admit that they didn't hear you correctly, and charge you for both the wrong drink and the drink you originally ordered. So disappointed.

reviews.author: Meredith E.
reviews.description: This is an Austin gem and hole-in-the-wall place if you're looking for a unique, romantic spot. They have a good sized drink menu and also offer frozen drinks, which is always a fun addition.   They have a fantastic selection of Mezcal and Tequila and it's a fantastic spot for a date because they have a few nooks inside great for a few to sit. The ambience is also very romantic-very dim inside with lots and lots of candles everywhere. The place itself is upstairs of SchoolHouse (there are stairs outside to the right of the restaurant). It is pretty small, only seating maybe 20 inside and about the same outside.   However, worst case scenario if you arrive and they're packed you can head downstairs to SchoolHouse for a drink!  This is a must visit and will impress others when you introduce them to a what-feels-like hidden gem.

name: Mort Subite
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Vanessa D.
reviews.description: Tried two beers and settled with Tripel Karmeliet. Delicious. Sat outside. Cool vibe. 11/10 recommend.

reviews.author: Cheryl K.
reviews.description: Found this place walking around Austin.  Great little find.   The bar focuses on Belgian beers, and has an extensive selection.  Bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable of the menu, willing to point you the right direction.  Added bonus, all beers are served in their appropriate glass!! Inside is a little small, but they have a nice patio area in front.   A little pricy compared to other breweries we stopped at, but considering the unusual and hard to find beers they carry, it is worth the price to treat yourself to something from here.

reviews.author: John F.
reviews.description: Quite the find in Austin for just walking by and thinking of a beer.  Great stop and a super-gal bartender who was really knowledgeable of the beers.  Great draft selection, in fact an OUTSTANDING draft selection.  They even have some bottled selection too. I really like that they don't carry the Milwaukee or St Louis brands and are all craft.  My only criticism would be that beer shouldn't be served in a small (almost) wine glass at $9/beer. That's just too rich that it limits me to one.  If it were a pint the value would be better. Four Stars instead of Five.

reviews.author: Plucked P.
reviews.description: A fantastic bar with knowledgeable and kind staff and an exceptional variety of Belgian beer a must Stop for anyone visiting Austin!

reviews.author: Patrick L.
reviews.description: I'm not into Belgian Beers, but I love Mort Subite!  Awesome vibe, amazing selection of beers (not all Belgians) and excellent service.  Not sure what's not to love about Mort Subite?  5 stars!

reviews.author: Brian H.
reviews.description: I would have given this place 5 stars, but they covered up the Tintin mural with a refrigerator.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: Straight outta Belgium! I love it!  I popped by this place for a beer and found it interesting that I previously and unknowingly walked right past when meeting friends at the TexMex joint next door.  Service here was great during the day - when I stopped in. I presume the guy running the bar was the owner but didn't get into a convo about that. He appeared to have moved from San Francisco a few years back from what I gathered and he was very beer knowledgeable which made for my sour selection.  We spoke of some other sours in the area and such. He was a genuine guy having a genuine conversation. That small chatter right there made me feel like I could call this a regular watering hole in a town usually piled high with trendy pop-ups.  He celebrated 3 yrs just recently and I can see why he's still here. It reminds me of a small establishment I visited in Brussels last year right adjacent to Mannekin Pils (the famous peeing baby statue for those unaware). It had a sense of community and Mort Subite also has that. Maybe it's a Belgium thing but I felt like I was right back there when I sat here.  I really enjoyed myself here and although I had but one drink (i was doing my own beer exploration day), I will be back.

reviews.author: Kim N.
reviews.description: We love this bar! Fabulous draft choices in the proper stemware!! Even an outside patio to bring the dog. Talked to bartender about Chimay, Belgium.

reviews.author: Will S.
reviews.description: Great talk bar with inviting, chill atmosphere and access to the only Belgian beer pipeline in the state, iirc. Like all bars, the bartenders set the standard and, hence, the five star review. Anthony and Piper are a great team and are professional, warm and inviting with customers. The draft beer selection is exceptional and you'd be hard pressed to find an equal rival in the city. Directly across the street from Elephant Room on Congress and 3rd, you get a great mix of residents and tourists, alike. There's outdoor seating both in the front and back (including a solid American fare trailer in the back -- good philly cheesesteak). But I digress, it's all about the ambiance, beer and good people at Mort's.

reviews.author: Peter B.
reviews.description: Worked in Brussels many years ago and the belgian beer selection here is on a par with most of the bars around the Grand Place. Bar tender knew his stuff ... great to see a place that has the correct glass for each beer and takes pride in serving the beer the right way. Will be back.

reviews.author: Max G.
reviews.description: If you like Belgian beer, or if you just want to try Belgian beer, Mort Subite is the place you should go.  This cozy bar features about 30 Belgian beers on draft, and has many more in bottles.  Of course, every beer is served in the brewery's unique glass.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  They also have an Indian food truck behind their outdoor beer garden.  Delicious food that goes surprisingly well with the Belgian beer.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Very cool Belgian ale bar right in the heart of downtown. Can't believe I haven't seen this place while walking around dt.. a real hidden gem if you're looking for Belgian beers.  They have a nice selection of Belgian ales on tap, most I had never heard of which was nice to be able to try all new things. They also have some higher % beers in the frig which appear to be some of their fancier ones, eager to have a go at these next time.   Real cool spot, good for going in and trying some new Belgians to get an idea for this particular subset of beers, right in the heart of Austin.

reviews.author: Darci F.
reviews.description: Wow...warm beer off the tap 10 minutes and almost undrinkable.But what the choice in music for a belgian bar-Nope it ain't dope.. Learn to pour a good head..this is European beer and they know how to get the beer right.I had Kwak beer in the Netherlands in April it was  great beer out of the bottle this..well I tried it twice at 9 bucks I should have just got a 6 pack

reviews.author: Crystal R.
reviews.description: The only thing good about this place was the variety of Belgian Beer, which is what they're known for. They had 2 of our favorites, 1 of which is incredibly hard to find in Austin, La Trappe. I do appreciate the beers in the proper glass. The front patio gives nice European vibes. However, the service is horrible. I wish I had gotten her name, tall thin woman, medium length blonde hair. Very rude and short with our group, the birthday boy with us had questions and she wasn't happy to help. She told him to stop talking in the middle of their conversation. Then when we went to close our tab the bill was $135 for 4 beers. Four beers, by the glass. Now some of the beers are pricier than others since they're imported but we were aware of that as the prices are listed on the chalk board behind the bar. We also don't mind paying good money for quality beer. We questioned the tab and the person behind the bar investigated and said the tall thin woman, who was short with us earlier, charged us for the two large bottles of some vintage or specialty bottle, which is not what we ordered nor what she served. She eventually fixed the tab but it was a very sketchy 'mistake' and the entire experience was memorable in a terrible way. We will not be back and are disappointed since we went in very excited to try it out. I don't recommend this bar.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: I love all beers Belgian so I have been wanting to come here for a while now.  Came in on a cold Wed January evening and my friend and I, save for whom I can only assume was a regular, were the only ones in the bar.  The bartender was very friendly and appreciated that we concurred on beer suggestions for my friend.   I really loved that they serve the beers in their correct respective glassware (especially the Kwak, which is worth ordering for the glass apparatus alone!).  The prices per serving are a bit on the higher-end of the Belgian Beer spectrum from other bars I have had the same beers at, but honestly,  I liken this sitch to the line from "The Prince and Me"..."you can really taste the extra 10 cents".   For a place that's French for 'Sudden Death', it isn't nearly all that intesnse, but when I had my first pour of their Gulden Draak 9000 Quad, I did kinda feel like I'd died and gone to Belgian Beer heaven!

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Absolutely phenomenal beers! After more than a year of experiencing this place, I have yet to try a beer I didn't like. Yes its on the pricier end but the quality of the beer here is worth its weight.  I wish they could pour the beer a bit better. Most of my beers come out with more than half as foam.

reviews.author: Tim K.
reviews.description: This place gets two-stars because of their selection. Being from Belgium, I enjoy looking up places in America and Mort Subite might be the only Belgian place in Austin.  To my big disappointment, besides the selection they have, there's not much attraction for a native to come here, unless you want a badly poured beer and rude service.  The first time I came to Mort Subite I can no longer remember, probably because it was underwhelming but after a lot of people told me to go there as a Belgian, I figured to give it another chance as I was pretty excited to have a La Chouffe on draft. When I noticed that the bartender was pouring this high ABV beer wrong, I asked him if I could give him some advice on how to pour it better. His answer was simply "no" and walked away while he handed my my check. Completely mesmerized, I still tipped him, and walked away. When I explained to my friend what happened, he said I needed to have given context.  So I went back in, ordered another La Chouffe and as soon as he placed the glass under the tap, not holding or tilting it, I apologized for earlier and asked him again if I could give some advice as a Belgian who has had many years experience working in bars. He immediately stopped the pour and  looked at me. When I explained him to hold the glass, tilt it and pour the beer on the spot where your finger is, and how that technique is very common and necessary to pour high ABV beer, he just stared me dead in the eye and continue to pour as he started, wasting a lot of beer and giving me a shitty poured beer.  I send management an email since I thought that they would love to be aware about this before I put anything online but after almost a two weeks of no response, I feel obligated to share this experience.

reviews.author: Ricardo M.
reviews.description: Please do yourself a favor and come try delicious belgian beer. The place is clean. Service is fast and friendly.  Clean bathrooms and a friendly atmosphere sets this beer garden a step above the rest nearby. Come see what you've been missing! Adam, thank you for the amazing service!! I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Gave Mort Subite another shot as Belgian beer is the one true god of beers and can't stand not going to one of the truly Belgian bars in the country.  Again, takes a long time to get served as each pour is perfect and looks delicate.  Menu doesn't change often on draft and was 90% the same.  However, this is some of the freshest draft Belgians I've ever had, and have some rare varieties that you mainly only see in bottles.  Prices are very high and 150% of any other bar in town, but this is the quality stuff and high abv.  Now that they have a food truck out back with some good looking Indian, Mort Subite might be worth adding to my list of usuals when in that Belgian mood.  You should expect a long wait at the bar, high bill, but overall a great beer pour.

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! A Belgian beer bar? In Austin?! Yes please. Awesome rotating selection of Belgian beers. Our bartender Anthony was very friendly and did not hesitate to explain each beer. And he steered to one that we loved. They have a food truck in the back, Indian food, if you are hungry. We did not eat, but I am glad it is there if needed. I will be a regular here. I love Belgian beer, and hate having to hunt for it at local bars, restaurants, or trying to get it delivered online is hard and expensive. THIS IS THE PLACE FOR GREAT BELGIAN BEER!

name: Anthem
accommodations: Hipster, Romantic, Intimate, Trendy, Upscale, Classy, Casual
Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Tanya S.
reviews.description: Anthem is our favorite spot for amazing food and the best drinks on Rainey street 10/10 recommend their chicken sandwich, it is JUICY and has all the sweet, spicy, and savory flavors packed into a sammy - get it with yummy fries on the side  for drinks - we LOVE the lychee lowdown which comes with grey goose, lychee, ginger and lemon, it's 10/10. the frozen blood orange marg and EXSW drink are also amazing  can't forget their KFC chicken as an app, that's a staple when you come here!

reviews.author: Capers B.
reviews.description: Came here on a date night while my boyfriend and I were in town and this place was pretty cute.   We Ordered:  Mai Thais - Sweet and strong Lychee Lowdown - Tasty and a great price for their all day (?) happy hour Charred Spicy Edamame - The char has good flavor but the seasoning wasn't spicy and left it a little greasy. Would just get it salted next time. Queso Loco - Not bad, had good flavor.  JFP Popcorn Chicken: Kung Pao - Really delicious, I could have eaten just this.  Nam Nom Noodle Salad - Also really tasty and would definitely get again. Bonus: it came already split so we didn't have to fight for the last bites. Hilo Hawaiian Sandwich - Was too full to really give this a good enough try but what I could manage to eat was great.  Hong Kong Waffle - Best dessert I've had in a long time. I'm a sucker for treats that make you feel like a kid and this absolutely nailed it.   Our server didn't seem like they wanted to be there but it seems like the crowd can get pretty rowdy so I don't totally blame them. With a few swaps in food, though, I'd definitely still come back.

reviews.author: Shaurica M.
reviews.description: First off, let me say that Anthem has INCREDIBLE food!!   My husband and I ordered tons off the menu (lol) and enjoyed every bit! My special favorite was the deviled eggs! Who knew deviled eggs could be so fancy! We had incredible service as well, and the ambiance was absolutely beautiful, one of our favorite spots to dine when we were in Austin!

reviews.author: Sallie D.
reviews.description: Ample outdoor seating.  I really loved the yummy fries, which was basically waffle fries doused with okonomiyaki toppings and pickled pink ginger.  Surprisingly tasty!  Other stuff was good too though not as much of a standout to me personally.  Lots of fried college food stuff (it is Rainey Street) and the saucy dishes kind of start tasting similar if you order enough of them..  Fun place to eat at but maybe less ideal if you're watching your calories / carbs.

reviews.author: Adriana C.
reviews.description: This place was so awesome! The drinks come in the coolest cups. The brisket rangoons were life changing and I got a chicken sandwich as well. The area is cool, speaking as a tourist lol, and it was a great spot to kick off our first night in Austin!

reviews.author: Brian B.
reviews.description: Before I get to the DELICIOUS food, I wanna give a shout out to our server, Christian. He was super friendly and helpful and made us 2 Austin visitors feel right at home. Thankful for you!!!  Now, the food. The JFC Popcorn Chicken was FIRE. We ordered the honey sesame version that was sooooo tasty!!  The sweet potato waffle fries were a hit too, and so was the chips and guac.   We also had espresso martinis that were surprisingly without coffee beans but still tasted good!  Overall, we LOVED our experience here. Whether it was Christian's incredible service or the amazing food, everything about this place was a treat. Would love to come back next time we're in town!!!

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: This place was great.  I came for happy hour with a friend and we got several happy hour snacks and drinks.  Both of our drinks were so delicious that we each got the others drink order for the second round.   The yummy fries were so so yummy.  I highly suggest.  The brisket wontons also were so great.   The place is super cute.  I would have much preferred to sit in the front more part of the restaurant with the bar. It's decorated so adorable and the booths are intimate and adorable.   The service was amazing. We had several different people waiting on our table so I'm not super sure how that worked out but it did.  It worked very well.  10/10 recommend.  Great place.   It was kinda hard to find parking tho.

reviews.author: Brittany N.
reviews.description: Located on Rainey street. There is a public parking lot right next to it which I recommend for a short walk. The vibes and decor are amazing and the music is bopping. Asian fusion food serve here and they're all amazing. I don't think I've ever been so impressed with an Asian fusion menu and that's coming from a person who loves Asian fusion food! Honestly everything tasted so great I would recommend everything haha. The host did check us in and mentioned it would be an hour to hour and a half wait but we honestly only waited for 20 and was seated right away! Food is delicious but more on a smaller portion/tapa style for what we ordered.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: A cute sorta tiki lounge. Want a micro staycation? If you allow your imagination to suspend disbelief, Anthem could be a tiki lounge on one of the islands of Hawaii...without the airfare to get there. The decor of longboards, hula girl jiggle figurines, and tiki torches can transport you for an hour or two to a tropical paradise.  The service was perfect! I unfortunately did not get the bartender's name, but he was prompt in greeting me, and offering to get me a drink to start my evening. My guy was parking the car so I ordered appetizers and drinks before HH ended. We had blood orange frozen margaritas which were delicious. We tried the fried cauliflower and some guacamole. Both had good sized portions and were tasty.  Another bartender checked on us as she walked by, which was great. I love when everyone works together to provide excellent service. There were two hosts at the door to greet people- they were both professional, warm, friendly, and prompt as well. Good job, Anthem in choosing excellent staff.  The decor was spot on. It felt upscale without the upscale prices. We sat at the bar, and the stools were comfortable enough to have a full meal if you were to choose to do so. Overall, the place was clean and spacious as well. Go check it out and let me know what you think. Aloha!

reviews.author: Teah R.
reviews.description: I was blown away by this place - Texasian?! I have never heard of that fusion before but I am so glad it exists. I wish this was everywhere!  A group of 9 of us came here for dinner and we were all so impressed with the food. The appetizers are where it's at . The yummy fries blew some of us away - WOW. The brisket rangoon was outstanding. And the miso mac daddy....c'mon.   I would say the appetizers were more star players than the entrees. Don't get me wrong, the entrees were delicious too but I can't get over the apps.  The service was good. Our waitress was attentive and checked on us frequently. However, she did tell us there was a 2 hour service limit....  The decor was very cool and the whole restaurant had mood lighting. We had reservations at 6:30 and it was pretty dead at that time but really picked up 30 minutes later. Once it was a full house the atmosphere became louder and more vibrant. Right on S. Congress, where the bars are, I didn't see many parking options.  Overall, I want to come back here. I want a texasian restaurant in my city immediately! For now, i will just have to recreate their menu on my own.

reviews.author: Elissa S.
reviews.description: It was late and we were hungry on a Saturday night...  we assumed we had Fast food or ihop as options but took a gamble and stopped in to see if they were still serving and found YES ... until 11:00!!! We had burgers which were tasty and cooked perfectly... fries were delicious also .  The staff was friendly and chill ...the vibe is great and while it felt busy it still offered a sense of intimacy. I look forward to going back!

reviews.author: Darlene K.
reviews.description: Everything was good. Really enjoyed everything about this place.    I would love a little more sauce. I'm just obsessed with all the sauces they used on the cauliflower.  The noodle salad was like the insides of a spring roll with hoisin/peanut sauce. Also, they were nice enough to split the salad for us.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: It's probably clear from other reviews that two of their best dishes are Brisket Rangoons and Miso Mac Daddy. However, don't sleep on the Nam Nom Noodle Salad! I almost never order salads from restaurants, but this one is worth it. It's the most flavorful salad I've ever had, and the balance of textures sends it over the top. Just as I was proofreading this post the manager came by to check that my meal was good. Their attention to detail keeps Anthem at the very top of my favorite restaurant list!

reviews.author: Roberto G.
reviews.description: I waited few minutes to be seated but once I entered they were friendly and I really enjoy the cocktails and the meal.  The quality for the price is amazing, I definitely recommended

reviews.author: Andy O.
reviews.description: Been here a few times and the vibe + good always on point. The Mai tai in the Chinese to go box is worth the experience. Outside sitting is fun because of the sounds of rainy st

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Lychee cocktail was great and Sputnik beer was good. Hawaiian burger was great. Had the cauliflower bites which were delicious. Good place nice staff. Would go again.

reviews.author: Kia L.
reviews.description: LOVE LOVE LOVEEEEEE this cute gem! I can't believe it's tucked away on Rainey street. Street parking is hard to find unless you come on a weekend day. They have weekday happy hour which is basically only good for the drinks. Not many shareable food items on it. I'm so glad to have found this spot. The drinks were so great! These two drinks gave me the perfect buzzz. If you like fruity drinks try the Splash and EXSW (East by Southwest) hate the name but love the drink. We ordered the furikake fries which is the perfect comfort food and filling definitely big enough to share between 3-5 people! We also ordered the popcorn chicken, I personally did not like whatever coating/breading. Service was fast. I would definitely dine in again for weekend brunch or an early dinner.

reviews.author: Dale D.
reviews.description: Came to the street just to see it.  Needed a meal before getting on a plane home.   Food was pretty darn good. The tiki vibe and staff were a bit odd.  I had been so use to the welcome wagon from everyone since we were tourist but not here.  Felt like a locals only spot.  Again food was pretty darn good.

reviews.author: Melissa D.
reviews.description: Wooooow this place is awesome. I read about this spot online and wanted to try it because of the extremely unique menu items. It was a fantastic decision. It is a savvy mix of Asian and Latin cuisine with a fun spin, and it's affordable. Don't sleep on the miso Mac daddy -- it's a combination of like Mac and cheese balls and sushi. Truly amazing. The fried tofu app was delicious as well. For entrees, my partner had the noodle salad (yum), and I had the vegan curry dog (comes on a pretzel bun), and you can't go wrong with either. Really, it seemed like you can't go wrong with anything you choose here. Staff are all young, welcoming, and friendly. Added bonus: GREAT happy hour and cocktail menu in general. I'd eat here weekly if we were local.

reviews.author: Moquita Q.
reviews.description: I loved dinning out here. The staff was nice the Decore was inviting. It reminded me of the surf restaurants off the beaches of Galveston. The food was great. I would recommend you order their fried shrimp and French fries. They have a bit of spice and come with cole slaw and dipping sauces! You get about 10-12 pieces and a ton of fries. It's enough for 2 people.

name: Whip In
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Marsha M.
reviews.description: Dear Lort, why was it so cold during my visit to Austin when I stopped into Whip In? On an average sweltering Austin day/night I can imagine Whip In being the essential local spot for a quick beer or 5. With a great selection of beers on tap, along with extensive coolers for carry out, this place seems just great.  Apparently they have food too? Whip In should be the norm for corner stores/bars everywhere. Kudos fellas

reviews.author: Jeremy D.
reviews.description: Are you hungry and upset leaving empty-handed after waiting 45 minutes? "Oh well" will essentially be the response.  Ordered/paid for pick-up. No food or even an acknowledgement really of something gone wrong.  I think it's a management issue - just a waitress and cook were there to shrug and say maybe someone else took it.  Mistakes happen, but the lack of reaction leaves me baffled i.e. offer empathy or refund or comp...  Sorry, but y'all lost a neighborhood regular!

reviews.author: Sarah C.
reviews.description: I ordered a to-go meal tonight via Postmates, and when I went to pick it up, I was met with extremely rude and disrespectful behavior by one of the bartenders. Upon arrival, I asked where I needed to pick up my food, and I was pointed to a shelf. The bag had my first and middle initial, but not my last name and was labeled UberEats. I asked them to find my order. With some back and forth, it was determined that my order had been mislabeled. Mistakes happen, and I understand that. As I'm trying to sort this out with a female bartender and a cook, the other bartender, a tall burly man with a beard, a Marlboro hat and a camouflage shirt rudely shoved the bag of food at me, cutting me off, and said, "this is yours" and turned around and walked off.   I supported this business at the beginning of COVID by shopping in their makeshift grocery store, and even buying t-shirts. I only recently acquired a taste for Indian food, so I was excited to try it tonight. I will never be back. I was also told they don't have a manager around, nobody is in charge, and as I searched online for a way to contact anybody running this place, I came up empty.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: This is a unique locally grown spot that is worth a visit in South Austin. Prior to the pandemic a popular spot to catch bands on the outdoor stage, not too sure about the music situation right now. The Whip In is a corner beverage depot with a quality selection of craft wine and beer. If I may add, a very quality selection of wine and beer. If you want to expand your palette and try  a new craft beer or wine, def stop in. Very large selection of chilled rose, which I found impressive. The selection of beers by the glass is also impressive. This is a very cool spot to come in and meet friends, and grab a pint. The Whip In is also an Indian restaurant. The quality of the food is not a 5, but a 4. If you are looking for great Indian food there are better options, but the overall experience here and what it offers is above average and worth a visit.

reviews.author: Isobel B.
reviews.description: Lowkey but super yummy. It's a really chill place to talk and catch up with people while having amazing Gujarati food. I got the lamb biryani and lamb samosa and would highly recommend.

reviews.author: Rishi K.
reviews.description: Quality of food is progressively becoming bad.  Last night the garlic naans were cold and dry.  It seemed they reheated it to serve.  Curries were cold too. Bit disappointed.

reviews.author: Michelle C.
reviews.description: Great selection of local and international beer and wine. The food is fresh, and consistently meets expectations. It's a great environment.

reviews.author: Hope F.
reviews.description: Really disappointing tonight at the Whip In. I think it was an off night? First off, the draught board which is usually full up to 70+ was very scarce, so not sure what was going on there.  We ordered the chicken vindaloo and chicken shawarma. I was confused when our food came out for 2 reasons: 1) I wasn't expecting a wrap and fries for the shawarma- just was expecting rice since the menu didn't describe it as a wrap, but whatever - my bad 2) it came in takeout containers with only one set of silverware (plastic)  I went back inside to ask for another set and also asked if why (out of curiosity) the presentation had changed to takeout containers. I was told "it's a covid thing". I tried to explain nicely that I understood - but have only been in Austin since covid and have come every week or so since January, always with plates etc. She repeated, seeming annoyed with the question, that it was a covid thing, shoved me two mini plates and some silverware and walked away. Ok, cool!   I'm only giving a 3 because I have been here 6-7 times, always with a great experience. Tonight was a 1 star for service, but honestly food was below par as well. Leaving a sad customer :(

reviews.author: Jessica L.
reviews.description: Love love love whip in!! I always get the nachos...they're the best nachos in ATX!!! Also love the beer selection!!! Whip in   isn't like a fancy place, it's more chill atmosphere.

reviews.author: Heather H.
reviews.description: Man I used to love this place. But ever since the new owners came in, fired the management staff, TOOK TIPS FROM PEOPLE THAT EARNED THEM, and the outstanding amount of disrespect I see to their employees- I'm never coming here again. Or the Quickie Pickie because they own that too. And they treat those employees horribly as well. I can't believe the things I have seen and heard the owners say!! Cannot support this, and I plead to everyone else to do the same.

reviews.author: Candice L.
reviews.description: What's not to love sbout a convenience store/taproom/indian restsurant/package store? Efficient and friendly service. Indoor and outdoor seating. Nice, clean restrooms (a very pleasant surprise). Easy parking. Convenient location. It has everything. The food is genuinely good whether you're getting standard bar fare or the tasty Indian specialties. We hope to return when a band plays on stage, but we had the best relaxed lunch on the covered patio on our way out of town. Who knew you could find a little calm oasis so close to the interstate? It's quirky and perfect.

reviews.author: Matt C.
reviews.description: Beers on tap for days, weeks, months, years even! Amazing little spot totally worth taking a break from I35 or the snowpocalypse or COVID or whatever!

reviews.author: Neil O.
reviews.description: This might be one of the hardest reviews I've ever made. I have come to the Whip In for years (I still remember playing a show here when I was a kid in my father's band and having one of best and most interesting Indian fusion chicken fried steaks of my life) and always appreciated (and still do) what they're doing. But the prices are just getting too damn high.        As of the past week, every single beer on tap has risen by a price of roughly $3 on average; essentially the base price for any beer on tap STARTS at $8, and without a doubt that's the highest I've seen at any establisbment in Austin, and I have been to an uncountable number. I also had their $12.99 Kurma (also known as Korma in some resturaunts) and it was good, but more like a $8.99 Korma at Tejis as fas as quantity and depth of flavor goes.        Make no mistake, this is an indesputed historic establishment that's likely also struggling with COVID and I'll still support it, but seeing these changes is just disheartening and it's getting harder and harder for me to justify still stopping in on the weekend.

reviews.author: Caroline G.
reviews.description: Really disappointed. I've come to the Whip In each time I've traveled through Austin for years, and always loved it for its ambiance and food. Most everything has changed. When I asked about NA beer options for my partner I got a curt "No" and the server left. The layout is much less cozy than it used to be, and sadly, I won't be going back.

reviews.author: Andrew V.
reviews.description: Whip-In, what happened? I've lived down the street from this place for a year and have come at least once a week. It has steadily declined. Constant staff turnover, and the menu and beer selection has shrunk to basically half of what it was.   The food in particular is a shadow of what it used to be. Tonight, after finding out they didn't have any of the specials on the board, we ordered chips and queso and after bringing us one order, they brought us a second mistakenly? Both had stale chips and the queso was burnt. I asked for no cilantro in my dish due to an allergy and it was absolutely lousy with it. Tried to drown my sorrows with a beer and was served the wrong one.   Honestly, not sure what changed but this place isn't what it used to be. Hopefully it's just an off night, but I've thought that several times in the past few months and it's only become worse.

reviews.author: JR L.
reviews.description: Went here for a work meeting and I truly enjoyed the environment. Pretty relaxed and helpful bartenders and servers. It has a decent selection of both food and beer. I ordered a chicken tikka masala curry along with two beers - Belgian ale and a wheat. The CTM was a decent size and quality for the $12 tag. I'll definitely come back again to relax with friends and my doggo in the future. I thought the fridges in the back full of beer was pretty cool.  TLDR - decent food and draft beer selection - bunch of freezers with lots of beers and shelves of wines - cool music - had one TV inside from what I could see

reviews.author: Candace A.
reviews.description: I love this place.  From the outside you would have no idea how great this place really... dare I even call it COOL?! The beer selection for purchase might be my favorite in town that I have found so far. They carry my two favorite breweries which aren't found many places and then have a multitude of beers on tap, too! I love the tarot card feel at each of the booths and then the perfect little patio outside.  Dog friendly, live music when the world is allowed to sing again, and Indian food? You would never know.... we brought some friends here recently and quite honestly... this might be my new little "let me take you to a local spot we love....." for our guests. Go. Have a beer. Buy some to take home.... and definitely get some garlic naan.

reviews.author: Marcus M.
reviews.description: They have a really great selection of wine and beer as well as both on tap. I got the Chicken 65 which was really delicious. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Dmitri J.
reviews.description: I'm so pleased the Whip in is here to stay! They have a multitude of beverage and menu options. I got one of the curry's and it was exquisite. They also cater to many different diets. The staff is friendly and location is beautiful. If you haven't been in a while they remodeled the indoor area which is super conducive to COVID-19 distancing. The patio is covered and a great place to grab a drink and a bite. 10 of 10 stars.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Great place to pick up some mainstream as well as your out there beers. This place has a little bit of everything, from beers to ciders, wines, and even serving beer on draft as well. They also have a nice little courtyard on the side which looks fairly pleasant. Overall definitely enough beers in stock to keep you busy, only thing I've noticed is that their price point is a little higher than say Specs by $1-2 on various beers.

reviews.author: kelsey w.
reviews.description: Legit will be craving this Cleopatra sammich for the rest of my life. Nice and light with delish pickled veggies on the side. Fiancé has the Orgy and he loved it. Dig the laid back vibe and easy parking.

reviews.author: Tim L.
reviews.description: Went here on St. Patrick's Day to grab a Reuben with my girlfriend.  The pub is dark and divey, but it also has a nice outdoor patio area, that is dog friendly. There was plenty of parking when we showed up which was nice - it can be a challenge in their area.  The sandwich itself was fantastic. Rye bread, warm corned beef, melted Swiss, sauerkraut, and the cherry peppers I added were all perfectly complimented by the orgy sauce the sandwich was smothered in.  Honestly, the only thing disappointing was the chips. They were ice cold, unsalted, and relatively flavorless. I put on some Yellowbird Serrano to give it some flavor and used them to scoop up what had fallen out of my sandwich. I just can't help but think how much better they would have been fresh!

reviews.author: TJ H.
reviews.description: On a recent trip to Austin upon arriving around lunch time we checked into our AirBnB and were in need of some lunch quickly!  Our AirBnB host recommended Gourmands as a good local spot.  We headed over and found there was plenty of parking and it was very quiet on a random weekday around lunchtime.  I like their system of scanning the menu and just ordering from the table, however it was sort of odd to not interact with anyone upon entering.  The only real greeting we received was from someone poking their head out of kitchen to let us know we could sit anywhere and order with the QR code. I imagine that would be a but different when the restaurant is more crowded though. We ordered some soup in a bread bowl and a couple sandwiches.  The food was promptly brought to us.  The bread bowl was awesome, along with the chili.  The sandwiches were also good, high quality bread and everything on the sandwich tasted very fresh!  Gourmands was a solid place to get some fresh food quickly without having to wrestle with parking and lines in some of the more populated areas of Austin. Good lunch spot!

reviews.author: Terran O.
reviews.description: Gourmands is one of my favorite takeout places in Austin. I usually get the Second Deadly Sin with fresh avocados. The salads can be weird, and I'm not a fan of the soup+bread bowls, but conceptually they are interesting.   Eating in at Gourmands is more fun if you go alone. The atmosphere is very traditional pub, so if you're seated at the bar having a meal and your drink, you'll almost always find good conversation. It's less fun to go with someone for a sit down meal, as it really is more of a bar than a restaurant, even though the food is pretty good. Quirky's not exactly the right word. It's idiosyncratic, and kind of addicting?   After Thoughts for Advanced Listeners: I want to be at a place in my journey where I can eat a Cleopatra and not feel I'm missing out on meat.

reviews.author: Janet S.
reviews.description: I have gone to Gourmands for years and I was so excited to take my out of town friend there for the delicious soup served in the bread bowl.  But when it was delivered to our table it was just in a regular bowl. When I asked they said well yea they were out of the bread.  I understand being out and that is cool but if they would of told me that when we ordered we would of ordered something else.  Our server asked if we wanted anything else. But never mind.  Bummer.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: First, I have to say the ambiance of this place is pretty awesome. Very chill and there isn't loud music. The staff are friendly and the food is even more amazing! I got the Po-Po. This was basically a BLT but they put an amazing garlic mayo spread on it. I think the best combination is to have it on wheat bread. It was so stellar that as I finished and looked up, my bf and two friends were only halfway done eating! Definitely going back to this place!  Street parking, outside patio, bar inside with seating as well.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: I really wish I loved this place more because I was so excited to bread bowls, but it fell really short of my expectations. My friend and I sat in the outdoor patio area, and there were so many empty tables with eaten food left on the tables that hadn't been cleared yet. Summer is coming, so there were a ton of flies that were attracted to the food that eventually came to bother us when our food arrived.   My friend and I ordered spinach and artichoke dip to share, and I had the clam chowder and Deadly Sin sandwich combo. Firstly, the spinach and artichoke dip had so much cream cheese in it that it didn't taste like artichoke or spinach. It was really thick and gloppy, and I felt heavy just eating it. My clam chowder was really lacking in the clam flavor, and it also wasn't that good. The sandwich was okay. Nothing special about it.   I am pretty sad that I didn't love this place because prices aren't terrible, and the concept of soup in bread bowls is awesome. Not many places in Austin serve that. However, they seem really understaffed and the food itself isn't good enough to warrant a second trip.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: I tried the Broccoli Cheese Soup again and realized the funny aftertaste is probably not from the cheese, but from the beer in it. As a non-drinker my tastebuds didn't compute this right on the first try. The soup and bread bowls are delicious but of course they leave you feeling extremely full! I'd been craving a chicken salad sandwich, so the Foghorn Leghorn hit the spot.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Sandwiches are amazingly good. I get the Cleopatra on rye and it's superb. I love their pickled sides and veggies too. Their soups and salads are fantastic too. Their delivery system is a bit cumbersome and has glitches but they're aware and make it right when it messes up. In person, this place has awesome ping pong table set up as well as a great outdoor space. It's a great hangout. Chill and has great food - the two best things you want in a gastro-pub.

reviews.author: Katrina B.
reviews.description: I love Gourmands! Great spacious patio, plenty of seating inside, relaxed divey vibes, a game room, and parking is pretty easy. The sandwiches are beyond incredible and can't come recommended enough! Right now, you seat yourself and order from your phone at your table via a QR code.   We got the Second Deadly Sin and Chili, and both came out delicious and served with house made pickles and chips. The Black Bean soups is in incredible vegan option I've had multiple times.   Bring your pup when you go to the patio!

reviews.author: Mayra A.
reviews.description: Great food and awesome vibe. This place feels like classic Austin 15 years ago . The sandwiches and soup are fantastic and they even serve 32 oz beers. Highly recommended

reviews.author: Kirsten G.
reviews.description: Super fun place with a very roomy outdoor patio.  The staff wears mask and your order drinks/food via QR Code at the table.  The atmosphere here is relaxed and you can bring your dog on the patio.    I had a Philly Cheesesteak it was super tasty and they have options if you don't drink or want to try something else.  They have a great tasting  Prickly Pear Lemonade.  The rest of the people in my party had great looking food come out too.    And they have a parking lot, but there is also easy street parking too.  And the staff was super friendly!!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: A combo lunch that doesn't skimp on portions for only $10?!? Hot dog! Well, more like hot soup and sandwich or salad (no hot dogs on the menu).   The soup is served in a bread bowl (French bread, not sourdough!) and they have four or five options. I went with the broccoli and cheese which was more like queso with a few chunks of broccoli in it, but heck, maybe Gourmands knows me better than I know myself, as that's probably what I really wanted anyhow! I scarfed it down and had to stop myself from eating the entire bowl of bread. The chicken salad sandwich was lovely, but because I went full hungry girl on the soup (and homemade chips), I didn't eat it until the next day for lunch. Again, a lot of combo for your buck!  The place definitely blends in with the neighborhood, it's dive-y looking on the inside with a bunch of cheerful regulars at the bar (also the type of establishment you'd see a baby on a hip and a beer in hand), a TON of tables and booths for groups, and ping pong and skee-ball in the back. They've got a small parking lot, too.

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: This place has a great atmosphere with an equally amazing staff. The inside is a pretty good size, but it also has a big patio which is honestly my favorite.   I was pleasantly surprised by how bomb the sandwiches are here; I think the chips are homemade too , which is a big plus.   My group of friends started coming here pretty frequently and it's definitely a good place to chill; they have ping pong, ski ball, arcade games...it's everything someone would want in a bar experience!

reviews.author: Don E.
reviews.description: Had a soup and sandwich. The portions are a good size and the food is priced fair.   I had the orgy which is a hot peppered pastrami, Swiss cheese, coleslaw, and house-made Thousand Island dressing. Served on pumpernickel rye bread. With a broccoli beer cheese soup. The sand which was ok not great. Bread was a little hard and the soup was a bit too watery.

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: This place is really gone downhill here right after work on a Tuesday and the bartender seems like half asleep and attentive and pouring very weak weak drinks I do not recommend this place unless you're here they're in or one of his friends in order to get attention

reviews.author: Meg B.
reviews.description: I'm so glad that Gourmands is open and has an amazing patio bar to enjoy during these unique times. Their food is outstanding house made....well just about everything! Their bread bowls and soup are so tasty. Sandos even the boys of letterkenny would crush. Plus friendly staff. 11/10 recommend.

reviews.author: Anna K.
reviews.description: You guys i've been going to gourmands for years and I finally went back since they reopened and it was...awful. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip which we always do and it was literally milk with artichokes it was pretty gross. Then it took over an hour to get our soups and sandwiches. THEN on top of that i ordered the royal and they gave me mushrooms instead of meat (which I didn't order). I did tell the waiter and all he said was sorry(didn't offer to fix it). It sucks but i don't think i'll be returning there which is a shame bc i tell all my friends and always speak so highly about it.

reviews.author: Frances H.
reviews.description: I am a person who loves a good pub. Dark inside with regulars bellied up to the bar and not a high turnover rate within the wait staff. That's this kind of place.   I can see this place being an awesome, standard spot to grab a drink with regulars on any given day or night, but what we came in for was their highly-rated bread bowl soups and dang - they don't disappoint. The bread was soft and the perfect consistency - sturdy yet edible, which I feel is hard to come by with bread bowls. They offer a lot of great lunch options, like a soup and salad, sandwich and salad, or salad and soup. I went with the cobb salad and their black bean soup. To be fair, the server did warn me the soup was spicy, but I was definitely sweating a bit while sipping this delicious soup. The bread was a wonderful compliment to the spice and really soaked it up so I could keep going back for more!  On the way out, we noticed a room in the back with skee ball. Yep, we will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: The Bucchus was really good, but everything else was average. The Spinach and Artichoke dip was a lot thicker than I had expected, but I did like that it came in a bread bowl (maxed out on carbs this day). The sandwich we ordered was just okay.  The food came out super fast and everything is relatively cheap!

name: Doc's Backyard Grill
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday

reviews.author: Dawn S.
reviews.description: This place is a go-to local sports bar hidden in Sunset Valley. It's tricky to find as it's in the corner and maps or Waze doesn't pinpoint it exactly. Don't get discouraged if it's your first time trying to find it. You can do it! We went to watch some NCAA hoops and luckily found a great table outside in front of a huge TV. Dogs are welcome and they have disposable water bowls for dogs and you fill them up yourself.  The beer on tap is great. They even have Pinthouse Pizza's ELECTRIC JELLYFISH on tap!  I have been here a lot and the food is decent. It comes out hot and the portions are typically a good size. I was underwhelmed by the Buffalo chicken sliders today and here's why... The taste was great. The bun was fresh. We got real blue cheese on the side and fresh lettuce. The size of the chicken on the bun was disappointing. It seemed more like a chicken nugget than a slider. The bun to chicken ratio was way off. Put more chicken on the bun and this would be a fantastic little slider.  The place closed at 11 and they didn't kick us out even though we were the last ones there and they were cleaning around us. The game was tied and there was two minutes left. We couldn't leave yet! March Madness Baby!  Grab your friends, your dog, and your appetite. This place is great.  Side-note: there is a great playground and lots of room for the kiddos. So bring them along too. You can send them off to play while you kick back with friends and enjoy the patio.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We've been here a dozen times so it's crazy that I haven't left a review...  It's a bar. It has beer, and wine, and cocktails. Duh. It's convenient. Friendly service. Great happy hour. Slightly better than average bar food. Not outrageously priced. Plenty of parking. Indoor and outdoor seating. TVs play sports. Playscape for the 2 legged crumb snatchers. 4 legged crumb snatchers welcome on the patio.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: What can I say that hasn't already been said about this place? If you want a clear-cut verdict from me, this may be it: If they didn't have a playground we would never go.  But they do, so you have to work with what's available.  The food was somewhat subpar, and it has been, consistently, over the years. The fries were the best part of my Buffalo chicken sandwich. The kiddo got chicken strips that were especially dry.   Then why the three stars?  The beer was flowing, the environment happy, with TVs showing the college football games and the kids were happy playing on the aforementioned playground.  So...it's a decent option for young families. And that's worth it on a midday Saturday meal.

reviews.author: Davidm A.
reviews.description: I had a really good time here... wide bar lots of t.vs and their sliders were actually really good. Great for a party or lots of people that you have. Waitresses making sure your doing good and having a great time clean and fun. Definetly will be going back to enjoy some fun time!

reviews.author: Windy H.
reviews.description: We wanted to give this place a try because of the playground. We go sit down.....10 minutes rolls by, no one even acknowledges us. We switch spots, 15 minutes goes by and finally a rude server comes up to us to tell us that this section is closed, he closed it 10 minutes ago. So he closed it, while I was sitting there. Didn't say a word to me about it. The best part is I actually asked a server if I could sit there, he said yes and that it was his section.  Totally rude and incompetent staff, we literally didn't even have waters ever brought to the table. We will never come back here.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: So glad we stumbled upon Doc's while Christmas shopping. We were able to enjoy their awesome happy hour. $4 Texas drafts and $6 appetizers, small boneless wings, or sliders. We decided to share three items. The blackened shrimp nachos were super tasty. I probably enjoyed these the most. The boneless wings with Buffalo sauce had just the right amount of sauce. The pulled pork sliders were a little short on the amount of pork, but still good. We ordered Eastcider drafts for $4 each. Our server was super nice and attentive. Everything came out fairly quickly too. Would definitely recommend their happy hour!

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: Doc's is definitely my new favorite! Their happy hour specials are the best I've seen so far. The drinks are very well made and so are the appetizers. We sat out in the patio under one of the misting fans, it was so nice! There are also multiple TVs and a large playground out back for the kids to enjoy. This is a great spot for anyone and everyone to hang out, they are even dog friendly!   The staff of course is what made this experience amazing and we plan to come back very often for happy hour.

reviews.author: Sydney S.
reviews.description: Good food but where the f*** is ESPN+? We came to a SPORTS BAR specifically to watch the one professional soccer team in austin tx play soccer and had to watch on our phones! what kind of SPORTS BAR is this

reviews.author: Brenda S.
reviews.description: We were charged $21 for a pitcher of beer which should have been $12.00+.  Unbelievable!!!!  They were trying to make up for the horrible queso we sent back. We won't be back and I'm so sad because we've loved this place before this.

reviews.author: Valerie B.
reviews.description: We came Saturday night the service was great and the food came out fresh! I would definitely recommend, It's a chill little spot and you can sit outside as well

reviews.author: Bethany P.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I wanted to find somewhere we could sit outside, have a drink, and get some food on a beautiful day. We decided on Doc's and I'm happy we did! The environment is warm and inviting, we came on a Sunday around noon and most tables outside were taken so we waited for one to become available. It's a family friendly atmosphere and they allow dogs as well! We got some draft beer and ordered the cheese fries, which were SO good! I had the shrimp tacos, which had great flavor and came with rice and black beans. My boyfriend got the Applewood BBQ bacon burger, which he said was pretty good. Overall we were happy with our visit and would come again!

reviews.author: Andy P.
reviews.description: This place has such potential but has the worst food and most overpriced beers. I want to love it but will never come back.

reviews.author: Jenelle R.
reviews.description: Tried Doc's for the first time on our weekly date night adventure, and it did not disappoint. It was a little confusing and chaotic upon arrival, as it was not clear if there was a host or hostess to seat us, or if it was open seating. And then once we were seated, there was some slight scrambling on who would be waiting our table. But other than that, it was smooth sailing and we really enjoyed our experience! I enjoy the fact that they offer happy hour even on a Friday, and their HH specials really can't be beat. My boyfriend gave high regards to the traditional wings, and my HH shrimp quesadilla was quite tasty too. Our waitress was pleasant and attentive, and the manager also went above and beyond for us to honor a special request. Much appreciated! We will be back for sure!

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Came here for their $1 frozen margaritas ($2 for a "large"). The margs weren't strong or even frozen. Our waiter shared that they only have one machine for it. On Mondays, you can bet everyone is here for the margs.. At around 10PM, she told us that they ran out of margs...They seemed very understaffed. As for food, it wasn't great - Nachos were cold.  On the bright side, they do have plenty of outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Olivia M.
reviews.description: Sooooo... my service dog and I walked thru the door closest to us to go use the restroom and some crazy man(employee) dressed In black kept screaming at us... "HEY, HEY!!! HEY!!!!" But honestly I had no clue they were yelling at me... so I kept walking just trying to mind my own business... but when I stepped into the bathroom and started doing my "business" some guy opened the door and started screaming to me about my dog (mid-piss) that I can't have my dog in the restaurant... ummm okay I guess I get it, I'll just leave to the patio as fast as I can.  WELLLL.... I left the bathroom... I was literally 3 steps away from the back door as possible.... and the SAME GUY literally screamed at me to go to the front, 30 feet to the front door (just to go to where my table was right next to the door where I was sitting with my gf along with another couple.)  He then tried forcing us to leave and said they were going to call the cops? I let this man know that we already paid out and were about to leave  and she was finishing her drink as this man GRABBED the drink from my girlfriends hand (half full) and pushed us out. Never felt so disrespected. Wont be returning.

reviews.author: Lily G.
reviews.description: This review is for the food, which left something to be desired. We ordered some appetizers including the fish sliders and regular doc's sliders, boneless wings and fried pickles. The fish sliders (blackened kind) were way too salty. The Doc's sliders were bland, and the wings did not have enough sauce on them, not to mention the meat was tough and did not seem fresh. The fried pickles were not good; not really much flavor. The best food item we ordered was the fajita quesadilla. As far as alcohol, the beers were really good and next time will probably skip the food here altogether and just have some drinks. We had the 40 acres cocktail, el Hibisco beer and Redbud beer, all very good.  I did like the atmosphere and the large outdoor area that is close to a playground for kids. It was a fun experience except for the food quality.

reviews.author: Alejandro M L.
reviews.description: Megan was greatTexas drafts on special during happy hour. White wings, fried mushrooms and egg rolls for apps. Garlic parm, thai lai, and buffalo wings were great. They have that crispy dive bar finish that I love in a wing. Opted for the sweet potato fries, which did not disappoint. Goat cheese salad was delicious as well. Don't have any pics bc we horked it down so fast. Did capture this brownie dessert picture. As you can imagine, it was absolutely to die for.

reviews.author: Cynthia B.
reviews.description: Since I have to put a star I guess one will do. My server gisel was rude and very monotoned. She never checked on us and gave her cold tots. Thanks for the poor service

reviews.author: Shama P.
reviews.description: This place was just okay. The food wasn't anything special, but the vibes were pleasant. It seems like a nice spot for families, not so much for foodies.

reviews.author: Martha H.
reviews.description: This is a delicious, fun, friendly place to take the entire family  - even your pup! The menu is extensive beginning with all types of tempting drinks and appetizers. My husband and I went for lunch - skipped drinks (I almost tried the special margaritas. They were only $2 and highly recommended by our cute, excellent server, Gracia.) We did lap up the piping hot chili con queso (topped with fresh tomatoes and red peppers), salsa and chips. I chose chicken fajita tacos - excellent! My husband devoured his blackened shrimp tacos dinner. They were beautifully presented and topped with fresh avocado (including black beans and rice).  We love this restaurant. Everyone is quite friendly. It is clean and provides spectacular patio dining under gorgeous trees and colorful umbrellas.

name: The Butterfly Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Anna H.
reviews.description: A little oasis! Butterfly is friendly to all, has world-class drinks and service, and a top-notch rotation of adorable shows on their projector

reviews.author: Damon R.
reviews.description: Meh experience, at best. Bartenders don't seem to know what they are doing and can answer no questions about their drinks. They're also relatively expensive for the experience (for not knowing how to explain them). Also, I just don't find them good. Strong alcohol taste, and not in a good way...   On another note... Patrizis is an absolutely banger. 10/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: Kaitlin O.
reviews.description: This review might be a bit biased because I don't really enjoy the taste of alcohol, but here it goes:  I ordered the margarita and added the mango flavor for an additional $1. I couldn't taste any mango as it was all masked by the strong tequila. I'm not sure if all margs are like this, but it could have been because the ratio of tequila to everything else was off. My friends and I all agreed that the taste of alcohol was a bit too strong for a drink like a margarita.   I did like the ease of ordering drinks. We were eating at Patrizis and I liked how you could order and pay off your phone and they'd bring it straight to your table within 5min.

reviews.author: Tatiyana B.
reviews.description: The food was delicious the fire pits and the lights were super cute love the vibe and that dogs are allowed

reviews.author: Dominique E.
reviews.description: This bar is a hidden gem in the Austin community. While it is a bar, it is a multi space of theater, live music, food and the occasional markets. I love taking my friends from out of town here to show the spirit of the true Austin scene. The added bonus are the kitty cats everywhere :)

reviews.author: Stefanie D.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time about a month ago. It's definitely an "East Austin" vibe, like a crazy backyard with statues and lights and mismatched patio tables.   I like that they do have a hostess at the front gate to seat you, so you don't have to do that awkward wandering around the yard looking for a table and feeling like everyone is staring at you. They also check IDs and take your temperature at the front.   Currently, all the ordering is done via your cell phone. Scan the QVC code, and then view the menu and place your order to your table number and they carry out your drinks. Note that when ordering liquor, it requires you to order food with it, so they have a menu of $2 bar snacks. After the first round, we notated that we had already ordered snacks, and were not required to buy more with every drink purchase. But they did check for the snacks when the drinks were brought out.  I've only tried the margarita and a dirty vodka martini, $9 and $10 respectively. DAMN. Those margaritas are GOOD and STRONG. I had 2 and i was....feeling no pain. My martini was also PERFECT. Worth the money, and if you get there during happy hour, the margs are only $5! I did also enjoy the little $2 package of trail mix with MandMs.   One thing I noticed was that the cup size seemed to change, one time i went and they were served in these short plastic cups and another time these taller plastic cups. I was a little concerned that there are inconsistent portions but I can't be sure.  Will definitely be back, those drinks are FIRE and i want to try the food truck. Also plenty of non street parking which i appreciate!

reviews.author: Jesse C.
reviews.description: Excellent drinks , excellent food and great venue for local and international artists . Super chic and bohemian to the excellence . Great service and great vibes. Great place to come and hang out .I got the lick to come during SXSW 2022 and experience this awesome group from Belgium "plain Jane" absolutely talented !

reviews.author: Stacie H.
reviews.description: Butterfly Bar has casual, good vibes. There are some fun drinks available, hula hoops and a roaming black cat! It's a great environment to enjoy Patrizi's as well.  As a heads up to anyone prone and/or sensitive, the last few times I've visited I've been swarmed by mosquitoes which has unfortunately dampened the experience. There is now bug spray available outside but they still persist.

reviews.author: Anna J.
reviews.description: I used to come in here allll the time over the summer! It was my regular spot. The drinks were amazing and the staff was awesome. But we came in here this week and it was awful! Idk what happened. There were new people behind the bar, and they were so rude. Also, google says they are LGBTQ+ friendly but me and my partner did not feel comfortable at all. So sad we are taking this off our list of favorite places.
