reviews.author: Jordan S.
reviews.description: Really cool atmosphere with lots of outdoor seating and entertainment. They were doing trivia last night. The drinks are also really good and they do happy hour 5-7. One of the bartenders was a little snappy but not too notable to ruin the time there. Patrizis food truck is there with really good looking pasta. I didn't get to try because the line got too long and the whole bar was actually very packed especially for a Tuesday. Will definitely be back though!

reviews.author: Samuel C.
reviews.description: A magical circus of a place.  Never mind they have a real circus wagon out on the side, out of which they serve Italian food.  Never mind the strings of colored lights that make the back yard look like a carnival midway.  Never mind that the Vortex theater is right inside.  So if you are a paying customer, just beyond the velvet door curtain of the Vortex, there really ARE sword swallowers, lesbian ring masters, dancing dryads in water pools, and mega-gods of universal destruction.   Actually what is behind the velvet door curtain changes every few weeks.   When you go it may be nuclear rainbow unicorns, cybernetic tap dancers and the Flaming King of the Empire of the Ashes.  There will always be something interesting behind the Vortex velvet door for sure.  However, it is just as magical out in the bar.  The bar magic goes on all night rather than ending at the one hour and forty minute mark.  Of course, part of the magic is EtOH.  EtOH produces far more intoxicating illusions than anything that goes on in the main hall of the Vortex.  (EtOH is chemical-ese for ethyl alcohol, otherwise known as booze.)  The Butterfly Bar serves first rate EtOH.  Most of the house drinks are girly cocktails of classical or recent provenance. These are fine for what they are.  However, they do one wicked little number called the Whippoorwill which is fine bourbon, cold brew coffee, New Orleans style chicory and foam with secret flavor ingredients.  The Ghost of Sherlock Holmes appears and takes you down all the secret passages of the house.  The magic is generally enhanced by broadcasts of best-of scenes from past Vortex productions, projected on one wall.  There are projections of obscure documentaries on another wall. These have no sound, and I can promise you, you have never heard of any of them.  There is a vending machine on the wall that will sell you thirty dollar forks, knives and spoons that will save the world.  (I am not making that last detail up. Check it out for yourself.)  There are cats who run the establishment and have more authority than the bartenders.  One particular kingly and somnolent feline decided he was going to take his nightly nap at my table on the bench.  He claimed his space where I otherwise would have preferred to sit, and owned half of my table for the rest of the night.  He occasionally roused himself for twenty seconds just to make sure no service dogs had entered the establishment. After that, he returned to his regal slumbers.  The most magical parts of the establishment however, are not the food truck, the colored lights, the video loops, the drinks or the cats,   The most magical parts of the Butterfly bar are the patrons.  This is one of the most fantastical people watching spots in Austin.  It is a world of twenty nine different genders. It is a world of eighty nine different art forms. It is a world of magical costumes to die for. It is a world of back stories that makes your Ghost of Sherlock Holmes seem relatively tame.  The imaginary characters on the Vortex Stage have nothing on the real-life characters that populate the Butterfly Bar  So come to the Butterfly Bar and watch all of the limits of your plain-jane everyday reality dissolve.  Bring your magic hat even if it is just an old Chicago White Sox cap you got as a kid at a ballgame.  After half an hour, you will be able to reach inside that baseball cap and pull out a talking marmoset.

reviews.author: Jessica U.
reviews.description: Relaxing outdoor Nature scenery, great for happy hour. It's quite a hidden gem. I had a margarita they were delicious, strong and not too sweet or sour. The staff was friendly and they do an awesome job of following CDC guideline to keep their patrons safe with temperature checks and 6ft rule. Did not get to try the food because they were so busy that my food would be taking an hour to get, so don't go starving.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: This review is for Togo drink service only. My work needed 40 bloody Mary's catered. Butterfly bar was super accommodating and easy to work with in getting this order done in less than a weeks notice. We got disposable cups, garnishes, mix, and vodka in very organized boxes. We had to order a snack cause of the covid law in dealing with to go drinks. We messaged the bar directly for this service. Thanks so much!!! These are sure to be a hit for our mindhunter book club social hour!

reviews.author: Sunny S.
reviews.description: Great spot for drinks (and food if you order through Patrizi's food truck). Nice casual, outdoor drinks vibe. It's an assortment of random seating layouts, comfortable for any size group. They have great shade structures, a stage for music, and firepits

reviews.author: Nina F.
reviews.description: I arrived there the Wednesday before Thanksgiving.  Before riding there on my bike from 4 miles away,  i mapped out the route on Google Maps beforehand and Google said it was closed. the phone recording on the bar's answering machine said they were open for business. Still wanting to confirm,  i tried ordering some food/drink over the website and again it let me order food/drink.  So i arrive to the bar and there is a piece of paper stuck on door that said "closed." About 4-5 others were standing around also surprised that it was closed. Butterfly Bar management lacked a modicum of courtesy to its potential customers by omitting  to mention on its website/ answering machine/ FB  that it was indeed closed on a non-holiday. Surprise!Customers are going to rely on that answering machine msg and actually take an Uber or ride their bikes several miles to get there. It would make sense to at least turn off the answering machine completely if you are not going to bother to change the outgoing message. I doubt i will venture out to Butterfly Bar again. Luckily, the very professionally-run Salty Sow nearby gave us excellent refreshments and earned the $100+ we spent that night.

reviews.author: Niki B.
reviews.description: A fun, hippie, outdoorsy spot to grab a quality drink.  Kind of hidden from the main road, the Butterfly Bar has one sign and a gate that you follow to an outdoor garden full of twinkle lights and laughing people. There's a stage where there's often performances and a little indoor cabin part where you order drinks. It's almost pitch black outside at night, but makes for a fun date and casual atmosphere.   I ordered a mojito and it was delicious and strong. I would 100% recommend going here if you're in the area! So fun and unique.

reviews.author: Sasha T.
reviews.description: My friend and I came here on a blind double date for the first time on 9/17 at around 7:30 p.m. and thought the vibe was great until our waitress came up and introduced herself, but unfortunately I have forgotten her name( server: inside B) . She asked for a card for the tab and we asked if we could do two separate tabs to which she basically told us that we could be on one tab and figure out the rest on our own. Then as I offered up my card with a bit of hesitation she made a comment about how some of us in the group didn't know what it was like to go out prior to Covid and open a tab. Her facetious comment was directed at me being that I recently turned 21 and was the youngest. Next we received our drinks, I understand that some drinks are made bigger than others, but when my friends were brought their drinks they were all filled to the top, weheres mine was filled 3/4. I let it go and asked if we could get some more water and our waitress said ok and never came back until it was last call and my friend asked again, then she brought the water. Let me mention that we were not belligerent, we were in a space by ourselves and we had each ordered a single drink and had food. When we asked for our check, my friend asked our waitress how her night had been, thinking that if it had been busy then maybe she was just a bit frustrated and we should be understanding of that, instead she said it had been an easy night, then why rudeness directed at me? All people  in my party (with 2 being practically strangers) noticed the difference in attitude towards me compared to them. Overall it was very upsetting as a POC to get this clear difference in treatment from another POC at an establishment that loudly advocates for POC. I still tipped her, because we are in a pandemic it's the right thing to do, but I felt so strongly about this that it made me write my first yelp review.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Divey but really good service.  Expect cans and full pours here for $5-7 for beer and cocktails $8.  Great service that is quick and active, not the typical where you're standing there trying to make eye contact for 10 minutes.  Patrizi's out back so you got great food with good drink; not best selection of beer but local Texas.  Got a projector on the wall for special showings, but expect a hangout on most nights and not a get-some-work-done type of venue.  Overall a good spot and easy to find parking out back.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Pretty sweet spot- super divey, kinda hidden behind a fence off Manor. Amazing food truck. Live music.

reviews.author: Claudia Z.
reviews.description: I love this place! I have only passed by this when driving on Manor like 1,000,000 times! It is truly a hidden gem and super divey! Getting into the parking lot kind of sucks if you are coming from Manor because it is such a small little entrance, if you have a bigger SUV, it might be tight for you. Otherwise, this place is amazing! There are a lot of different picnic tables outside and some w/umbrellas and some without. Also, some of them have heating lamps for when it is cold. They have a food truck here apparently that is supposed to be amazing, we didn't try it because we had already had dinner but the line to the food truck was literally out the fence. The butterfly bar also has indoor seating but the outside seating is more lively and fun! I had a sangria and it was super tasty! It had OJ and brown sugar in it made w/red wine! I love this place. They have a couple cats walkin around too, don't pet them, they don't like it. Cheers!

name: Alamo Drafthouse Cinema South Lamar
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Karson S.
reviews.description: SUCH A FUN DATE NIGHT! Loved the vibe at Alamo drafthouse - we went to see the new Spider-Man and had a wonderful time. We were STUFFED by the end of the movie, but we couldn't help but try as much as we could.  I love that they have tables with the seats - so much nicer if you're actually having dinner. We started with popcorn (actually some of the BEST movie theater popcorn I've ever had) and chips and queso. The queso was AMAZING!! Similar to Torchy's cult classic queso. Then we got some soda and beer, a pepperoni pizza (excellent) and a burger.  We were so full that we didn't get to try the shakes, but we will next time.  The movie theatre itself was great, staff was helpful, place was clean and wait staff had their masks on so I felt very safe, and the movie itself was awesome. Can't say enough good things about this place!

reviews.author: Reed W.
reviews.description: How tf you gonna have chairs that don't recline in the front row of a movie theater?!  Great service from the staff, but in desperate need of a renovation.

reviews.author: Lisa Q.
reviews.description: I know that the Alamo Drafthouse is super popular, even iconic in Austin. I just don't really find that the seating is particularly comfortable. In addition, the reach to get to my food is awkward.  And not being a super foodie, I prefer a slightly simpler menu. I just stick with unbuttered popcorn.   I apologize for being a Debbie Downer. But new options are opening up for an evening at the movies and I'm shifting more toward those.

reviews.author: Josh M.
reviews.description: One of the primary reasons I chose to move to Barton Springs was to be close to this Alamo. I go once-a-week. Great vibes to see a movie. I'm not a fan of the food and service (The servers literally interrupt you during the climax of the movie to say "last call"!).   I wish they shook up the menu and did more creative things. As I mentioned, I go frequently, and it's just the same stuff and it's honestly not that great.   I wish they had the the truffle parmesan popcorn or churro popcorn on the menu like the Alamo in SF.  This location is always dead. I'm so used to seeing Alamo bustling and energetic. You walk in...and nothing is happening.  Highball is always closed.   The Shining photo op set-up is getting quite old and wish they did more fun stuff with the space.

reviews.author: Constantine J.
reviews.description: Such a cool concept! This is how movies should be done! A great movie theater taken to the next level with gourmet food and drink that is brought to you while you enjoy your movie. It's everything that you would want!   They have burgers, pizza, salads, chicken fingers, great appetizers including cauliflower wings, mozzarella sticks, great popcorn and much more. My personal recommendation is to try the milkshakes (adult versions too) makes for a perfect combo while you watch your film.   The staff and service is incredible. They are prompt, kind and super friendly.   This is a great venue and makes for a great overall atmosphere for your movie day or night!

reviews.author: Kasey F.
reviews.description: I visited from out of town, and some friends told me this theater experience was not to be missed. I purchased online in advance (they sell out), picked my seats and showed up early for the previews. We watched the new Wes Anderson movie set in France, so all of the previews were in French and of old French films. Quirky. Our waiter was friendly and attentive, and the popcorn was good. The only things I didn't like were that the volume was really loud in the theater (a plus for some!), and the seats were fairly uncomfortable. Although it seems like a fun place to take a date, it probably isn't. They have a strict no talking policy  and promised to kick out anyone talking during the film.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: If you have food allergies - beware! The menu looks friendly, but the kitchen and staff are not.   I wrote down my order for a gluten-free pizza - cauliflower crust - and the server took it. Well, she vanished. The second server said he would followup on it. When the pizza arrived, we had our doubts so we asked the runner whether it was gluten-free.   The runner swore that the kitchen confirmed it was gluten-free. Well, here I am throwing up my guts because of my allergy - so, no, it was not gluten-free.   The first server was nowhere to be found. The second server tried to convince me I never mentioned gluten-free - well thank goodness I had my order in writing. I can't believe he tried to put their mistakes on me. Especially when I was the one suffering from the allergic reaction.   The manager said we should have received a square plate for a gluten-free pizza, not round. And basically, that there's nothing he can do about it.   Places that don't try to cater to food allergies - I get it. They're ignorant and need educating.   It's much worse when a place pretends it knows what it's doing but screws it up and has no system to fix it.   Here's a first step -- train the employees on food allergies? And please, if you make a mistake, apologize. Don't call your customer a liar? And don't just make it catering to vegan or gluten-free a "marketing gimmick" -- follow through in action.

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: Five Star Movie Showings, I finally got a chance to get here because every time I try to purchase tickets here it's always full or sold out. But I honestly went super early and finally got the chance to attend. My movie experience was amazing and the food just complimented an already perfect experience. I will become a regular here now that I have had this experience.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: Absolutely world class spot for offbeat entertainment. Weird Wednesday, Terror Tuesday, and more. The facilities are quite good. The service is killer. Great food and drinks, and I've personally seen them kick out a movie talker. Thank you, Alamo!

reviews.author: Xiao Z.
reviews.description: I've been to other locations and I love Alamo Drafthouse as a cinema for true movie fans. They provide lots of interesting stuffs, including their crafted videos for each movie. The seats at this location are a bit outdated. But the service and the OG environment are absolutely satisfying. I ordered a punch drink, and enjoyed my stay there! Oh also it's not freezing cold inside so I'm pretty happy about that as well.

reviews.author: Alysia G.
reviews.description: Glad to be back here and glad they are here to welcome us! Food tasted fresh, and staff are super friendly. My favorite go to is the chicken tendies I am looking forward when they can bring back events

reviews.author: Chloe M.
reviews.description: I love coming to the Drafthouse. Staff is friendly, willing to help, and wearing masks. Theater rooms and bathrooms are clean. They truly take silence seriously so it's always enjoyable to watch a movie here.  The parking garage is a bit tight to navigate, so it helps to drive slowly especially around turns. It's free though so that's great. I wish they had more plant-based menu options but it seems they're slowly starting to add some which is greatly appreciated.  Special events are starting to happen again, too! I can't wait for Master Pancake and movie parties to return! So much fun.

reviews.author: Marlene Z.
reviews.description: Since they opened again waiters do tend to forget food, mess up orders. Also, the theater has gotten rid of the fried pickles and one of my favorite pizzas. I like the other food options though - burgers, pizza, popcorn of course.

reviews.author: Hugo S.
reviews.description: I recently rented out the theater for a private event, my 30th birthday party.  To say my party was an absolute success is an understatement. I was able to curate my own video dance party and because of the Drafthouse, this event was everything I was hoping it would be.  From the staff being so helpful and accommodating (for ex. every time someone bought me a shot, if I wasn't at my seat, they made their way to find me and deliver it :p), to the help from the event manager David with all the fine details. The Studio 54 themed party I had envisioned came to full fruition that evening and the incredible people at the Alamo Drafthouse really made the night so special.   All my friends and family were just in awe of how well put together the party was and again, I have the Drafthouse to thank for that.  I could go on and on because I'm still on such a high due to the full success of the party.  10/10 would recommend. THE BEST THEATER CHAIN THERE IS. PERIOD.

reviews.author: Steven M.
reviews.description: The Alamo Drafthouse Cinema is one unique movie theater. I came here last week for its "terror Tuesday" event with some friends and since I'm not from Austin, was quite surprised with the movie theater. Upon entering you are welcomed by a giant carpet and screen from the shining and can even take a picture in the tricycle (which is very, very cool). The theater itself is well decorated and gives you the feeling of a real old school cinema that takes movies very seriously. Upon entering the theater you are handed some water which is quite possibly the most thoughtful thing a movie theater can do instead of forcing you to pay $6 for a pop of bottled water. The theater itself is pretty standard minus the ledge in front of the seat. The seats themselves are by no means nice or comfortable, think old school stadium style seats but for what this theater is going for I actually get it.   If you are lucky enough to live near a movie theater that does all these special movie nights and plays old movies, you absolutely need to come and check it out. I really enjoyed seeing "Let the right one in" on the big screen and hope everyone keeps enjoying terror Tuesday's!

reviews.author: Mary D.
reviews.description: I love Alamo! The S Lamar location is one of my favorites- the staff is always super friendly and accommodating, and the food and drinks are always something to look forward to. I can't wait for the Highball to open back up fully, what a great concept!

reviews.author: Alma B.
reviews.description: Ordered a pizza and loaded fries, coffee and ice tea to drink...once the drinks were empty that was it nobody came by asking if I needed a refill on either. Next time someone came by was much later and it was to drop off the check...by that time pizza was cold and no longer appealing so just left it...Alamo has a clever way of saving money with their "bottomless" beverage policy. Row 4 seats 6and7 on August 27th that server needs training possibly.

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: A fun dinner and a movie venue. The a great job curating content before the movie pulled from various popular social media sources. The good is about what you'd expect from a movie theater...just ok-ish. The billing was also misdirected , likely because its hard to see in a dark theater.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: I've been here enough it's tIme I post a review.  :)  It's an Alamo Drafthouse.  Food, drink, movies.  Comfy seats, great digital projectors.  Unique movies and events alongside first-run hits.  Coke, popcorn with REAL BUTTER, and a few hours of entertainment.  What more could you ask for?  Oh, yeah, that south Austin vibe!  I live north and often find myself at Village or Lakeline.  It's like being in a different city, though, as the eclectic and "Austin flair" mixes well with the everyday folks coming to the movies.  We just don't get that at much up north and it's good to remember how pleasantly diverse this city is in taste and style from restaurants to neighborhoods to people.  Will I be back?  Tomorrow night - already have my ticket (go go Season Pass!!!)!

reviews.author: Abbie S.
reviews.description: I experienced some of the worst customer service last time I went here. The woman running tickets was rude and when I asked a question, she completely ignored me. I will not be coming back to this location

name: Cover 2
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Charlotte B.
reviews.description: We had a great time here with friends! Great waiter! We enjoyed our 2-22-22 at Cover 2!!

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: When Chief was here bar service was stellar. I have been coming here since it opened. Now bar service is lackadaisical, inattentive, distracted and sub standard.   I like this place. The food is good the beer selection is passable and I can watch any sporting event live or read a book or both. But these two are killing the place for me. Ordered a beer and sat for 20 minutes with no one asking me if I might like to order food. Had to literally flag someone down to order a meal. That is not how this business works.   Wearing a mask under your chin until you walk up to a customer is not how this works either. And the tall one did that all night long. Now looking for a different place to spend an evening eating a meal and enjoying a beer.

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: Horrible service today.  Sat in a booth for over 15 minutes while others came in after me and got their orders taken. Person who had seated me brought me a drink then nothing. Though a minimum of 5 different servers were standing right next to my booth.  I understand a restaurant may be short staffed but limit your seating if you cannot handle it.  I've had the similar experience here multiple times.  Last time I patron any of the restaurants in this local chain.  And "the remedy" after speaking to a manager when I asked for the check for my half drank coke...oh no need to pay for the coke.  FAIL ALL AROUND!

reviews.author: Asha T.
reviews.description: Literally the first visit we had and this last visit were like night and day.   If I EVER come back here it's gonna have to be at the bar. Apparently you get service that way.   Literally just walked in and got sat, was busy due to a UT game no problem. And then we just sit and wait and wait and wait. The supposed waiter for our area literally helped everyone around us and kept skipping us. Idk if it was because we didn't have UT gear on or I was basically the only black person there at the time but ppl that just walked in the door got greeted before we did.   We just got up and left. There's no way the dude in the area didn't know we had not been helped as he purposely kept ignoring the table and was serving EVERYONE around us.   Terrible service.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love this place! They are so accommodating, even in football Sunday!!! The servers are polite and the manger runs around and works just as hard (love seeing that) all the food I've had is amazing. Great specials daily and weekly, worth a stop anytime but especially for football!  Not pictured but worth it: chili and eggs, giant pretzels, wings and shrimp pasta!!!

reviews.author: Sabrina I.
reviews.description: Not usually a Sports Bar fan but as they go this place was nice. The service was great, tables clean and wings were tasty.

reviews.author: Chantel C.
reviews.description: We've lived by cover 2 going on 2 years now and decided Saturday to finally check it out. (Previously came here and was seated but waitress seemed like she was just so busy she couldnt get to us and the vibe was just off? so we walked out) but let me tell you I sure am glad we gave it a second shot because the food was absolutely amazing and service was even better! Can't remember our waiters name but he was above and beyond. Everything came out quickly and tasted perfect... the environment was a plus! We willl back yall :)

reviews.author: David A.
reviews.description: Had dinner with my son Tuesday night. The service was incredible and I wish I remembered the servers name to give her kudos .  We ordered the trilogy appetizers and it's always good. We split the chopped chicken salad and brick chicken sandwich.  Way too much food and delicious! The Salas came out late, so they discounted the bill. Will be going back for March madness!

reviews.author: Bonsai B.
reviews.description: If I could do 0 stars I would... Sunday at 1500 and it's not too busy.. not sure who out waiters name was because he didn't introduce himself, so we will call him island boy.. black island boy hair cut doesn't give a care in the world...He ignores the tables, continually walking by spaced out.. didn't get any service unless i asked. I even had to ask for the check! Why does he even work, just go home and live off unemployment.. he is the face of this bar/restaurant and I won't be back.. good riddance!

reviews.author: Caryn C.
reviews.description: Horrible service and even worse food. The only thing half way decent were the fries and they were cold. The hostess was condescending and sat us in a high traffic area in front on a tv that a group of 6 were watching and yelling. We had to ask to be moved. We had to ask for our waiter to serve us. We went at a time that was not considered busy or I would've understood. We had to ask multiple times for drink refills. We will not be back.

reviews.author: David C.
reviews.description: Goofy loser waiter ignored us because he's racist. Type who says "canadians". You're black and racist toward other black people. Living like that's not good for your soul you rotten little jerk.  Decent game bar if you sit at the bar. Wings were aight

reviews.author: Colette B.
reviews.description: I never thought I would describe a restaurant as "disgusting", I have a lot of respect for food .... But our experience was just that! We fancied burgers and thought that a sports bar would serve delicious burgers! What a mistaken idea!! We started with a cup of onion soup: it was edible, not delicious, a little strong on the acid side, but ok. Then came the burgers: a 3mm leather sole burnt to death!! Awful! Horrible!! My husband had to leave the restaurant and was sick in the car park!! The fries were smothered in fat... yak! The waiter on the other hand was a sweetheart!! VERY professional! When I mentioned it wasn't good, he immediately offered to comp them, which he did! I am tempted to say that he had been through a similar situation before, maybe several times!!! He didn't hesitate and didn't offer an alternative: he KNEW the food was bad! Shame on management to allow this to happen! It's a Burger after all, and we are in Texas!! Land of Beef!! Cover 2, I'm afraid you will not see us again!!

reviews.author: Robert F.
reviews.description: Cover 2 off research always hits the spot it's got the best shoe string fries I can't seem to find anywhere else in Austin . Even though they may just be French fries and not a main course there is something so satisfying about them . My favorite dish is the buffalo chicken sliders , I personally get the blue cheese on the side with ranch to dip . These are amazing and have the perfect thin not to thick cut of chicken that's battered nice and crispy but stays juicy tossed in tangy but not spicy buffalo sauce. The bread doesn't take over the sandwich so that's not all you get full on and is super soft . They also have a buffalo chicken salad that has a good amount of chicken if your not wanting a sandwich but need to cure that buffalo craving . I've only had the burgers other than that and they are equally delicious again especially with those shoe string fries that are always crispy .  This place is relaxed and a good place to have a beer while you cool off after a long day or just dining with the family.  The staff is pleasant and the deserts are huge . Well at least the brownie is . If you like bars and burgers are in the area and don't know what to eat stop in and try the buffalo sandwich it's my go to and recommendation for cover 2 . If not that than at least grab a beer and some shoe string fries and relax a minute .

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: My husband and I go here pretty often as it is super close to our place and we love their food! They have a great menu and our favorite thing is the fried pickles! They have rotating specials, soups and flatbreads. The servers and staff are all very friendly and hard workers. I also bring friends here and they have all loved it as well! They have great deals on their happy hour and a good variety of beers and wine that are not crazy overpriced. I have loved everything I have ordered and they have great portion sizes! We usually come for lunch or dinner, but we recently had brunch which was also fabulous. I had the chilaquiles and they were amazing! The portions are also super generous so I've left with leftovers multiple times. If you're a sports person, they have a ton of really nice TVs and always have games on. I am honestly so happy this place is close by and will continue giving them my business! I would also like to add that like many places these days, they have also experienced shortages with staff and when that happens, we have seen the managers out on the floor helping out and also working their butte off! This restaurant has amazing food, service and is such a great place to have a nice dinner, go hang with friends or just pop by for a drink! Thanks for rocking it Cover 2! Oh and the Round Rock location is also awesome as I went their with a group of work friends once they also had excellent service and the food was equally as delicious!!!

reviews.author: Shelby L.
reviews.description: We always have a good time here, especially during football season. The food is above average. Bar seating can be limited since everyone wants to sit up there.

reviews.author: Andrew M.
reviews.description: So today was my first day in Austin. I searched Yelp. I drove by a number of joints. I even walked through Whole Foods. Alas nothing struck my fancy. Heading back, I swung into Cover2. I'm glad I did.  The greeting, Silvana as server, and the whole support staff weekend terrific.  I started with a cup of French onion soup. It was just a tad too sweet for my taste. I'm also a purist in looking for a single crouton under the  hood (of cheese).   The fries and prime rib sandwich were a pleasant surprise. I will typically keg wrestle you to keep the horseradish sauce off the plate. The sauce here actually was mellowed very nicely and didn't fight the meat. The fries were great! Nothing more need be said.   This was a terrific first meal in a new town. This might become my extended kitchen it was that solid of aa performance!

reviews.author: Robby T.
reviews.description: Normally this place is one of my favorites.   Today come I. At 220pm.  Semi full, wait up front for 5 mins to be greeted.    Then wait 15 mins for a drink.   Only ordered 2 appetizers and wait 35 mins for those.   Mention this to the server and she has a near come apart about being short staffed and it is what it is.     Very disappointing, until manager comes by.   Would give Miranda a raise.   Very nice and helpful.

reviews.author: Mia L.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I visit this place the other day and wow! It was so good- we got the giant pretzel to start. When they say giant- boy do they mean it. They're drinks are also very very good and the server was very polite as well.

reviews.author: Pamela M.
reviews.description: Would have been nice to actually eat. Ordered our drinks then watched as our server waited on everyone (even those seated after us) without taking our order. I try to give servers the benefit of the doubt cause maybe they're short staffed but after multiple issues with the same server and seeing tables sat after us putting their orders in and getting their food, I'm getting disappointed with the downhill service at Cover 2.   We received our drinks at 6:45 pm. Left money on the table for the drinks and left the establishment at 7:20 pm after our server ghosted us with empty drinks and no food order placed.

reviews.author: Matt S.
reviews.description: Great place to come watch sports, drink, and eat some food.  Staff here was nice and friendly. food was hot and fresh, I had the franks red hot chicken sliders that they had as a special and was good.  Flatbreads were split between the table and were good as well.   Drink prices are not that bad.  Nice walk to our room from here and was convenient.

reviews.author: Ian B.
reviews.description: I wanted to highlight that the hospitality of the General Manager, Jack Beckett, was outstanding on my visit and really made the experience.  The restaurant made a mistake on a dietary restriction, and while the server was defensive and tried to minimize the issue, Jack stepped in and offered an incredibly humble apology and took care of us.  Mistakes happen at even the nicest restaurants, but what stands out to me is how the restaurant handles it, and in this case Jack saved our experience and ensured we would return.  The food is fantastic - the biscuits are to die for, the grits are delicious and somehow they cook their brussels sprouts to melt in your mouth.  Highly recommend Fixe!

reviews.author: Lisa S.
reviews.description: We came in recently for a date night and everything was perfect. Warm knowledgeable service, beautiful ambiance and everything we ate was lovely and well executed. Both of our signature cocktails were a bit sweet for my taste (but I find most mixed drinks to be too sweet, so that's probably a me thing!) and the server immediately helped me with a lovely glass of wine instead.   We will absolutely come back.

reviews.author: Jim S.
reviews.description: Only one word needs to be said:  BISCUITS!!!  They are made to order and come out piping hot with honey, homemade jam, and whipped butter. I'm from Georgia and these are still the best biscuits I've ever had. They take about 10 minutes to make so order them right when you sit down.   Other than biscuits everything else was good too. The fried chicken was probably the highlight though.   The biscuits alone are worth a visit though. Yum!

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: Great for large parties. Super nice in the inside. Very clean. Gives off the vibes of a nice steakhouse. Service was on point and fast. Nice workers. Food was average. We went for brunch. The best part of brunch was the menu's pricing. Very affordable for downtown Austin which you don't see very often. I got the burger, it was good. But a little dry and lacking in flavor. Fries and French toast were good. If I was to go back I would try their biscuit breakfast sandwich. The party I was with said their biscuits were delicious. We will definitely be back to try dinner next time.  Pros: price, service, cleanliness, and ambiance   Cons: improve on flavor in dishes

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: Highly recommend! It's my birthday week and the girls and I motored up to Austin for wine tasting and fun! We ALWAYS do Sunday brunch so we had to do it in Austin. This place is great for large parties and it's beautifully decorated.  I had the CIDE-car, their apple cider version of a side car... Very tasty and STRONG! Biscuits were big, fluffy and flaky like they came from biscuit heaven and your great grandmomma was the one making them. The deviled eggs were DELICIOUS and I'd like to think of myself as a deviled egg connoisseur. Cinnamon roll. Better than ANY cinnamon roll you've ever had the pleasure of stuffing in your mouth. ABSOLUTELY DIVINE!!! And the chicken fried ribeye with white gravy and collards..... All I can say is babyyyyyyyyyy this was definitely the definition of Southern cooking and hospitality. Our server Katie was ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL!!  Here is what the others in my party had to say:  To start I had a Cide Car to drink, deviled eggs, and a mouthwatering buttermilk biscuit. My entree was the Chicken Fried Ribeye, served with a side of braised collard greens! I finished my meal off with a hot and fresh cinnamon roll! Everything was delicious! I cleared my entire plate! The service was amazing! Katie went above and beyond to build a strong connection! I definitely give everything a solid 5!  It was an amazing experience from the front door to the table. The manager came by to make sure everything was good. Katie (Server) she was so on point and made the dining experience pleasant. If you ever get a chance to go please ask for her. She took pics of us and made sure the table was happ. For me this place was a solid 5 and I will be back soon!

reviews.author: Denise D.
reviews.description: I visit this place every time I have visitors in town, because it does not disappoint!  I'm especially fond of the biscuits and bacon.

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Definitely come here but get ready to spend!  Service - amazing! So friendly and knowledgeable. I even asked to surprise me with any drink (with a few notes) and all my drinks were also well balanced and delicious.  Food - impressive.  Get the biscuits! Made fresh, so soft and fluffy. Comes with butter and honey. We also ordered the beets, and brussel sprouts. Both were great but the beets were delicious snd had more creative flavors. My man got the pork chop. He took a bite, closed his eyes, and leaned back. I've never seen him do this. Are you ok? Apparently the pork chop is really good. Melts in your mouth. I got the red fish which was tender, perfectly cooked and not dry. Also I don't like "fishy" tasting fish and this one was gentle in flavor. The risotto was flavorful and creamy too.  Parking - they have valet but it's slow. The guy was overwhelmed because he was working Alone in a saturday night downtown. Not his fault at all but def piles up.  Def a special date night spot

reviews.author: Ciarra N.
reviews.description: This brunch was one of my favorites in the city! A group of us decided to try it for Galentine's Day and let me tell you, it didn't disappoint. We started with a round of drinks. I ordered the Cold Brew Martini. If you like a strong drink, this is perfect for you. My friends also ordered mimosas and spicy Bloody Marys, which they were very happy with.  For entrees we ordered: - Fried catfish with French fries and hush puppies - Pulled pork sandwich - Fried chicken biscuit sandwich with two eggs  - fried chicken sandwich with fries  With a side of: - duck fat roasted potatoes - French fries - Boudin country gravy  - Fresh biscuits  We had no complaints about our food at all. The potatoes and fries were cooked to perfection and the gravy was so creamy and delicious. Collectively, we all agreed these were the best biscuits we'd ever consumed. They bake them in house right after you order them, making them hot, flakey, and melt in your mouth. 10/10 would recommend.  My only complaint would be it was a bit pricey for brunch and almost all the sides were al a carte

reviews.author: Sean C.
reviews.description: My wallet was telling me no, but my stomach was telling me yes! Some friends and I came in for brunch on Sunday and really enjoyed our time there. We started off with a cinnamon roll, which the server explained was made from biscuit dough. It was outstanding! We then ordered some biscuits for the table, and those blew us away. Hot, fresh, buttery biscuits served with butter, honey, and jam. Those might be the best biscuits I've ever had. For the entrée I ordered the Pollo Frito Loco Biscuit, chicken topped with slaw and honey. That was friggin great, super crispy chicken on a butter biscuit. Our server was great as well, he was the bartender, who made some mean mimosas for us. 10/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: Brian N.
reviews.description: Excellent service and great food and drink options to appease everyone in our group of 6. The biscuits are a must order: hot and fresh out of the oven.  If you're wanting another southern app, the hush puppies are also just as good. The entrees don't come with sides, but are good portions anyways. I really enjoyed my fried chicken entree with a side of salt and pepper fries. The breading on the chicken was perfectly crispy and not over cooked.  The food for our table came out pretty quickly for a busy Saturday night.

reviews.author: Danielle A.
reviews.description: Dear Fixe, thank you for a great birthday night out!  We didn't have a reservation but you were able to accommodate us in the bar which was so great!  We ordered the brussel sprout appetizer, beat salad, biscuits, fried chicken and a couple of lovely drinks!  I loved everything food and drink wise but I felt the chicken was beautifully done in the middle and burnt (slightly not bad at all) on the breading.  The salad that goes with the chicken, the Brussel sprouts the beet salad drinks and biscuits are rave worthy!  We LOVED them! We also LOVED our server/ bartender and all the attention to detail for a very fantastic upscale and super comfortable restaurant!  We left with full bellies and full hearts!  Thank you!

reviews.author: Melody D.
reviews.description: We came on a Saturday with a group of 9 for brunch and had a reservation. We had to park on the street and pay expensive parking fees. We were seated promptly and our waiter was nice and attentive! The atmosphere was great, However, the brunch menu is very limited in variety and is overpriced for the portion and quality in my opinion. The pollo frito loco was dry and the duck fat potatoes were very bland and slightly uncooked too. They are extremely limited on gluten free options for their brunch menu as well.

reviews.author: Rini S.
reviews.description: Had a great time here but unfortunately, my pocket did not.   The service is great, the drinks are great, and the ambience is great. The food was pretty good but the biscuits were hands down freaking amazing. I highly recommend!  Also got the Brussel sprouts and pork chop. No complaints with either, but not craving a second order of these either. Biscuits were definitely my favorite item out of the experience.   Nice place for date night or dinner with the parents.  Parking PSA: Fixe only offers valet parking but there's plenty of street parking/lot parking nearby. I recommend looking around versus spending even more on valet.

reviews.author: David W.
reviews.description: So this is my third time at Fixe. Each time has been great. The first time was the night i got engaged and its been a special place for us since. We had some St Louis friends in town and they were game so six of us headed over there. First i have to mention the wait staff. It is glaring when you get great service now that when you do, it is really special. Wyn was alternately flirty and fun (with six big gay bears) but most importantly she was excellent at her job. I'd go back even if the food was bad for such good service.   The food is not bad. It is great. We started with the deviled eggs. They're so good. And the biscuits. Omg that is how a biscuit is supposed to be made. Flakey and perfectly cooked. I had the pork chop and sampled everything. The pork chop was prefectly cooked and smokey in a good way. They had really tasty carolina gold rice grits. Its nice to see restaurants supporting bringing back heirloom grains that actually taste like food. The peach cobbler wasnt as good as my mom's but it was purty good. I wouldnt go for the desserts but they were fine at the end of a great meal. Food is an A and the service is an A+.  Definitely worth your hard earned money if you're looking for upscale southern dining.

reviews.author: Erika N.
reviews.description: It seems like Fixe Southern House has had its moment already - the empty tables both inside and outside at 7pm were both a blessing and a bit nerve-wracking. I called ahead of time to ask if they were dog friendly on their patio, and they are! I saw no reviews of being dog friendly on Google, Yelp, or on their website, so that was a nice surprise. They even brought a bowl of water for my pup. FYI, you can find street parking nearby quite easily.  The food was pretty great overall - our table shared multiple dishes. I enjoyed the homemade biscuits with seasonal apple butter and the pimento cheese and focaccia dish. The beet salad was so sweet and savory at the same time - delicious! I enjoyed the lobster and crawfish pot pie but wish I had eaten it faster when it was piping hot. The fried chicken was a bit burnt some places but did have a great crisp. The deviled eggs were deviled eggs and nothing to rave about, and the broccolini was a bit salty. I still really enjoyed my time there.  We didn't try any drinks but we did get dessert! The pecan pie was very sweet and heavy, I only had a bite. I did enjoy the blackberry cobbler and ice cream. How delightful.  Overall, a solid service and food selection make this a great stop for southern food. Perhaps an even better place to stop than some other spots in Austin for southern food due to ease of actually getting a table and nice/upscale (although not super modern) ambiance.

reviews.author: Carissa C.
reviews.description: Great food and great service! I went again for dinner on my birthday with family and it was perfect! Not only was our server awesome, all the food everyone got was good and we all shared the biscuits as an appetizer. I got 2 different drinks, both were delish! I would highly recommend this restaurant.

reviews.author: James G.
reviews.description: Biscuits were great. Good food as I had the pork chop and my friend had the fried chicken. Place was packed.

reviews.author: Cristina I.
reviews.description: Went for valentines and it was so good. Hubby got the prime rib and I ordered the vegetarian plate. I didn't have super high expectations for mine but it was so good! Their spicy Margaritas were strong and tasty. Biscuits were a must based on the reviews and they were just ok imo.

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and friendly staff. The reputation of the restaurant is excellent southern biscuits. However the brunch menu had mostly glorified breakfast biscuits that were dry and overpriced. The Pollo Frito Loco was an attempt at a fancy honey butter chicken biscuit. The shrimp and grits tasted like it had velveta in it. We also ordered the Duck Fat potatoes. $8 for unsalted, unseasoned potatoes.  I would not recommend this food for this price point.

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: The biscuits were so good and fresh- a must try here!! The fried chicken was also tasty with a lightly breaded take on the dish. We also had the pork chop that was cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious. We tried the beet salad which was tasty but a bit plain.   Disappointed in their cocktail list as there were very few options and they didn't have much mixers or fruit to muddle in. The service was also slow but pleasant.

name: Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse- Parmer Lane

reviews.author: Jennifer N.
reviews.description: Such a great addition to the neighborhood! Perfect place for family night. Who doesn't love pizza. There is great outdoor seating and has a playscape for the kids. The pizza is good as well, there is a combination for someone. There is plenty of seating inside too. The lunch deals are such a good deal. The staff is friendly, we like to do the curbside orders on nights when we are too lazy to cook. It's fast and easy, plus there is so many options you don't feel like you are eating the same thing over and over even if you come here weekly.   The new COVID ordering is nice though you don't have to leave your table and you can split the check among who orders what. It is annoying for those who haven't had it set up on their phones already but otherwise it's super easy after the initial set up.

reviews.author: Kara M.
reviews.description: My fiancé and I have been here 3 times now, and we enjoy our visit every time. The pizza is good, the selection of beers and ciders on tap is pretty phenomenal, the soda selection is great as well, and the vibe of the place (Parmer Lane location) is family-friendly and fun!  This time, we ordered The Lazy Goat and the Buffalo Chicken pizzas. The Lazy Goat gets a 5/5 - it was perfectly balanced, and I loved the artichokes and goat cheese with red sauce. The Buffalo Chicken was just okay, I'd give it a 3/5 - it was as expected but left you wanting something more.  In the past, we've tried the Chicken Bacon Ranch (3/5), Ground Control (4/5), and The South Austin (4/5). The focaccia bread sticks are also good!   Overall, it's a nice place to drop in after work or to get Friday night pizzas from. When the weather is nice, it's fun to sit outside - though I can't recommend the high top table chairs, as they are quite uncomfortable. We will definitely be visiting again!

reviews.author: Shauna S.
reviews.description: Just back from vacation and had zero desire to cook. And a major desire to have someone bring me food. The cheese focaccia bread was rather tasty.. the pizza was good. I especially like the unique and earthy flavor of the cheese.  The bonus was they delivered a growler which I'll check out later...(it's later and yummy Pilsner) Will I order it again!?! Probably not. But it was a solid meal nonetheless.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: I met up with a group and was definitely impressed with the spot. I loved the outdoor seating area and the playground. My little one was occupied the entire time and barely took time to eat because she didn't want to stop playing! The pizza was delicious. We shared a simple pepperoni pizza and cheese focaccia bread. I liked that the crust held up well. It wasn't too think or thin - just right! My kid finally up ate 3 pieces when she sat down from playing. If you are a parent and looking to have a cold beer and relax then this is definitely the spot for you. They have tons of beers on tap! Beer, playground and pizza - how can you not be a fan of that?!

reviews.author: Ian P.
reviews.description: Awesome job on the charcuterie board to the Aviator PizzaandDrafthouse Team! It taste as good as it looks! Highly recommend for a family night out in North Austin

reviews.author: Esther A.
reviews.description: Super family friendly with outside play area for kids.  Lines were a little confusing. I ordered the major tom, pepperoni was very crispy but the veggies were a little undercooked would've preffered them a bit more cooked.  The meat almighty was better, pepperoni was crispy and the cooked ham was very tasty (i dont usually like ham that much!) The dough was doughy, and floppy.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Pizza dough was undercooked.   Hefty toppings  $10 for a large sized personal pan pizza  You order straight from your table via your cell phone.   Nothing special worth returning.

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: This is the worst experience I have had in awhile with management. To begin, with follow my pics.. I ordered a major tom (supreme pizza) with EXTRA sauce thru door dash. At 7:55 within a few min I received notification it was being picked up.  I call store to inquire how is that possible if it was freshly made. The store hung up on me. So, I worked w door dash who asked me to wait for delivery to see if there is a quality issue. I did just that, only to receive a pizza that was warm but based on the cheese amount, semi chilled veggies I knew I wasn't too off base when I had my reservations about it to begin with.  I call store - ask for manager, even though I know door dash will ultimately handle. However, I just wanted to know how you can make a pizza in 5 min and say its fresh. Manager says sorry for the hang up like she's singing to a tune of a tiny violin; then tells me they don't have base pizzas sitting around (kind of like Villa in the mall that adds toppings when u order). I ask why is there so much cheese then and no sauce. Clearly cheese is added and is already rubbered up. Short answer and ultimate answer from her was another unbelivable sorry and to work with door dash.   What's sad here..Villa Pizza (mall pizza) is better than this any day. And I'm kicking myself for not going with Salvation pizza instead. Aviator down south was awesome but this Parmer Lane site is lacking customer skills and good pizza.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: 2nd favorite pizza in Austin!  I love pizza. If I were choosing my last meal it would be a toss up between pizza and beer or filet mignon and merlot (or Shiraz). I digress...pizza...it must have a great crust-never EVER soggy, a well-balanced sauce, and just the right amount of cheese. Lastly, the maker must not skimp on the chosen toppings.  Well done, Aviator! My friend and I shared the "pizza of the day", and it was fabulous (though I don't remember the name of it). The crust had that initial crunch followed by the perfect chewiness. We each had a light beer with hints of blueberry-um...yummy!  Aviator is new to this location, and still getting established, so it was dead inside. I suspect this will be a popular lunch place for nearby companies such as Apple, Oracle, etc. There is a huge outside play area for those of you who have kiddos-great for birthday parties.  I prefer quieter places, so it misses the mark for me regarding atmosphere. You can see the pizza makers through a glass window, and the kitchen appeared clean. There are ample choices of beer and lots of great food options too. I've been twice and suspect it will be a fav of mine. Give it a try. Let me know what you think.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Great pizza, good selection of beer, staff is always friendly! Clean inside and always plenty of seating!!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Absolutely love their pizza! Usually get it to go. I've been at other locations in Austin, and they are all good.

reviews.author: Blair V.
reviews.description: First time I ordered from here was through Door Dash and we enjoyed very bite of our order. Second visit we decided to dine in. It was crazy packed on a Friday evening but they had plenty of seating indoors and outdoors!  We ordered the Foccacio cheese sticks (basil, mozzarella and goat cheese) - a hit for us when we ordered to go previously. We also tried something different which was the Monty. We also ordered a Caesar salad- pricey for a salad in my opinion but this is a good option if you feel like you need that balanced meal!  The Monty was the least of my favorite. We have stuck to ordering the Flying Garlic Pizza after our first visit and it never disappoints. It has become a must order for us and will continue to stay that way!

reviews.author: Shaun S.
reviews.description: Great pizza. I get the thin crust bbq chicken pizza and the Hawaiian. The bbq chicken pizza is the best.

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: Great pizza with even better beer selection. We tried the garlic pizza and it was delicious. My friends got the vegan option and it looked fantastic. We will be back

reviews.author: Ken P.
reviews.description: As another reviewer said, they should change the order to list Drafthouse in front of Pizza.  This place has an AMAZING tap selection, even better than Pinthouse.  They also have a great outdoor area and sometimes they have live music.  The pizza looks amazing and the ingredients are fresh but the dough has no taste.  Pinthouse on the other hand has an amazing crust and severely limited outdoor seating.    I really hope the crust changes because the outdoor area and taps would keep me coming back.  However I can't see going here over Pinthouse.    If they nailed the dough I would absolutely chose this place

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Today, I ordered a to-go order for pick-up so I could do yet ANOTHER lunch and learn... how much learning do I really need to do?????? I ordered two items: the caprese salad and the black olive and caprese pesto grinder.   Caprese-  Caprese salad is a simple Italian salad, made of sliced fresh  mozzarella, tomatoes, and sweet basil, seasoned with salt, olive oil, or  balsamic vinaigrette. This is a menu item that really can't be 'messed up'. It is simple and to the point. This caprese was accompanied by a side of vinaigrette.  Black Olive and caprese pesto grinder-  This item was unexpectedly good. This meatless Monday treat contained black olives, mozzarella, red onions, baby spinach, and a Roma tomato pesto base. This sandwich provided a balanced mixture of sweet (from the tomatoes and red onions) slightly sour (from the mozzarella) and earthy (from the pesto) bites. Although hearty in its contents, this sandwich was actually very light on the palate.   #supportlocal

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Currently writing this updated review in my car because for the 2nd time, my curbside pickup was messed up. My pickup time was 6:20 pm, and it's now 6:50 pm.  The 1st time I wrote off because I thought it was a fluke. Also, I know the staff is busy on a Saturday night and it's tough to find staffing these days during COVID. Maybe I'll try eating in store next time.   But cmon now, my wife is pissed off because I convinced her to get Aviator over another pizza shop. Well, whenever I get my order, I'll eat it in the doghouse when I get back.

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: Yay, more pizza! I love pizza, and I feel like there's a lot of pizza places popping up in Austin over the years. So many options but I'm not sure if this will be high in my rotation of pizza places.   I do like the restaurant space. The outdoor area is nice and kid friendly with the playground. Aviator has a wide selection of beers (at least from what I could tell). I think the pizza is good but unfortunately I think there are better places for pizza. Weirdly, I think their normal pies (with red sauce) are kind of lackluster. I did enjoy their non-traditional pies. The chicken bacon ranch and the taco pizza were pretty great!

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: On this deliciously lazy Sunday, the darling husband and I knew that pizza was just the only thing that would do. Jersey Giant Pizza, he suggested? Quick, easy, cheap, and reliably tasty. Closed on Sundays, I lamented. DeSano's, I countered? His eyes lit up, but then I remembered that, although we adore DeSano Pizzeria Napoletana to bloody distraction, we should probably try something brand-new for a little variety...and for me to review! Why not? Enter Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse!  Local? Check! Solid reviews? Check. Hubby's a helicopter pilot and trying out this place is, therefore, too hard to resist? Check. Cute pizza names? Check. Yummy pictures? Check. Let's do this!   (Note: all three are takeout 9-inch pies with no mods, except for hubby's deletion of the green peppers on his Ground Control.)  The Greek: this one was my flavor profile to an ABSOLUTE T! It reminded me a bit of Joe's Pizza at Star Pizza in Houston, but better! A riotous feta, pesto, artichoke, basil, mushroom, and kalamata olive party on a crust! Hugely flavorful! This goes on the culinary Rolodex post-haste!    The Flying Garlic: very garlicky! Shocker, right? Lol! Well, we are garlic people, so we endorse this pie whole-heartedly! The buttery crust, the garlic cloves, and the feta were just unctuous!   Ground Control (minus green peppers): Hubby liked this, but he didn't super-love it. He kept snagging pieces of the Greek and the Flying Garlic. I asked him what his least favorite part was, and he said that it really wasn't fair to judge it on such a small pie. He wants to give it one more shot with a larger pizza! His theory is that small pizzas make the fillings hard to shine. Makes sense!   As I write this, though, he's literally humming Ground Control to Major Tom as he kicks back on the couch playing Call of Duty: Cold War with a warm and happy belly, so I consider this a solid win. We'll definitely be back soon to dine in! Thanks, Aviator!

reviews.author: Cheyenne H.
reviews.description: I've passed by Aviator several times and finally decided to try it with a friend.  We came at 8pm and the place was fairly busy. Unfortunately, the ordering process itself was very confusing. You can either follow a bunch of arrows to the counter and order (with few menus available), or you can seat yourself and order through a QR code and have someone bring your food to you.  We chose to go to the counter and ordered two Bear King beers that had great flavor- we were allowed to sample before ordering which was a plus. There were 50+ beers/wines to choose from so endless options... you can opt for a flight too. We also ordered two small pizzas (BBQ Chicken and Spinach and Artichoke) that came out in ~10 minutes. The pizzas had a thicker crust and were DELICIOUS! I'd definitely order again.   There were plenty of picnic style tables inside and out, and the outdoor patio had beautiful string lights, a playground, umbrellas, and lots of open space. Parking is easy in and easy out, and the staff were friendly.  Overall, I'd recommend Aviator. Great quality pizza in North Austin.

name: The Tigress Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Lizzette R.
reviews.description: The Tigress and their folks are the best in the business of bartending and making drinks as a craft before "craft cocktails" became a thing. Located on North Loop with other special places to shop, drink and eat, Tigress is your place to watch cool classics in the TV whole drinking the classics.   We are truly blessed to have the Tigress in our city.  You will not leave disappointed.

reviews.author: Michelle H.
reviews.description: Quality cocktails. Nice vibe! Great happy hour prices. Best when it's not busy.  Nola Monday  Tropical Tuesday Signature Saturdays $2 off until 8pm

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: We stopped by our favorite place to for drinks and had an absolutely amazing time as always. Every time we walk into this place, I suddenly feel at home and I'm always looking to make new friends. Jill was behind the bar making some amazing cocktails.

reviews.author: Elida M.
reviews.description: Amazing service. Owner is super friendly and sweet and does an amazing job taking care of her guest. First time here but highly recommend and will be back.

reviews.author: Kristina L.
reviews.description: I came here on my birthday and had the best experience. I was actually really sad, and coming here totally turned things around. Really good atmosphere, great drinks, and friendly bartender. Em. was an absolute joy. She made such wonderful suggestions and was just the best. As a woman drinking alone, I felt like I was in a safe space. I would go back all the time and recommend it to anyone, especially if you are wanting something low key and chill. Will go back. Make sure you tip the bartenders! They works so hard and do an amazing job!

reviews.author: GS P.
reviews.description: Want to thank the friendly, helpful Kelsey and Holly for making our Friday evening special. We stopped in for a to-go order. We got the Moscow Mules and a growler of lager, both of which were excellent.   The big surprise was their special offering due to COVID, their GRILLED CHEESE sandwich!! And what terrific sandwich it was - super crispy, firm, delicious sourdough, and melty, tasty cheese and---no greasy fingers! Pickles were satisfyingly crunchy too!   Thank you Tigress Pub for a delightfully delicious experience tonight. Looking forward to our next visit!

reviews.author: Abraham S.
reviews.description: One of the top 3 cocktail bars in Austin.   I stand by this statement and challagne you to visit and not be blown away. It's literally unpossible.  Bonus! They make a FANTASTIC grilled cheese. And there's bread pudding, allegedly....

reviews.author: Aaron D.
reviews.description: 3.5 stars for the cons, given that other, less refined establishments in town lack these issues entirely.  Pros: Cozy ambiance, intimate atmosphere inside, quaint almost romantic patio in the back that still feels as such even with multiple parties outside. Fit that in with some personable bartenders, and you've got the makings for a really nice date night! The Bartender who hosted us personally was wonderful company for conversation with the rest of my party, and she took the BEST care of us during our visit that she could.  Cons: An arguably limited selection of liquor for a place that seems to focus its pride on craft cocktails. It's understandable that the pandemic had severely limited business as of late to give any benefit of doubt, but combine that with a lack of providing customers with a preference of liquor for classic standard cocktails exacerbates this. The coups de Grace in dissatisfaction came when I was informed that the bar had absolutely no cherries to compliment a cocktail that is typically garnished with one. Other regulars who overheard me went out of their way to mention that it's a decision from the ownership down. If it's a matter of affordability for something as trivial yet pertinent as a jar of Luxardo cherries, then bigger core issues exist elsewhere; if it's a matter of personal opinion as to what constitutes tradition in a drink, that's even worse when any reasonable bartender or connoisseur should know that the "best way" to serve a drink is however the person consuming it wants it dressed.

reviews.author: Eric W.
reviews.description: We ordered several cocktails from here in preparation for the holidays and we were so impressed by the organization and quality. Each cocktail came with garnish, instructions and was so delicious. Also, the price was very reasonable. 10/10 will definitely order from here again.

reviews.author: Allie R.
reviews.description: The Tigress is the  OG of classic cocktail culture in Austin. They opened their doors well before the craft cocktail madness took over the local blogosphere. There are no codewords, no hidden doors, and no over the top marketing gimmicks used to try to make them stand out from the pack. They don't need to. They just offer highly skilled staff serving up classic cocktails the way they were meant to be.   I'm a cocktail enthusiast and admitted "drink snob" with very high expectations of any place that claims to be a "cocktail bar". The Tigress is like a "small batch heaven" located off the beaten path. The rotating menu is carefully curated and the liquor selection, though small, is a blend of unique, local, and masterfully crafted offerings. You won't find mass produced, highly generic, overly commercialized well spirits here. Though the seasonal menus are small, the bartenders are highly skilled and can handle almost any classic cocktail request. In fact, they've even introduced me to a few that I'd not heard of previously, but are now part of my "at home" offerings (The Trinidad Sour is a favorite I didn't know I had previously). From the perfectly selected glassware to the outstanding skill of the folks behind the bar, this place is a must visit for every cocktail conisouer looking for that one special place where you stop in for a drink and leave having had a memorable experience.    Despite having all the right things to lend itself to being a high-end elegant cocktail bar, The Tigress has a casual, local, friendly feel. If you don't fancy yourself a cocktail person, have no fear.The drinks are very reasonably priced and the bartenders are highly skilled at asking about your flavor profile preferences and making the perfect recommendations for both the experienced drinker as well as the cocktail novices of the world. Don't be afraid to ask their advice. I take friends and visitors from out of town here regularly and they've never steered us wrong.   Cheers!

reviews.author: Priyakshi K.
reviews.description: Hmmm!  The interiors of this place are very different - very old / rustic sort of style. They have outdoor seating which can probably seat around 10 ppl - very small tables surrounded by a few chairs.   For drinks we ordered the boys of summer, paper tiger, leash-less and native tongue.  The drinks were very okay, hit or a miss . I liked the boys of summer, wasn't the best drink I've ever had but certainly better than the others.   Our hostess was a little moody for some reason. She asked   Overall- can surely try it out for a drink if you are in the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Neysa K.
reviews.description: The cocktails were undrinkable. We ordered the punch, the negroni and the rum and coke. Also the tables and floor were sticky. Yuck.

reviews.author: Jules F.
reviews.description: This is a fun little bar with good service and a nice selection of alcohol.   The seating offers a variety of options from social to private to belly up to the bar.   The parking here is limited though, not the bar's fault. A biker smashed into my side view mirror as I walked outside and he was screaming obscenities along with "who parks here?" To which I realized that I was parked (along with many other cars) in an extra wide and poorly marked bike lane.

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: Wow, I never thought I would have a reason to walk two stores down past Workhorse...but my roommate insisted we get out tonight. This place has a great vibe--super casual. The bartender was so great--extraordinarily confident and she knew her shit. Check this place out for happy hour!   Now I have no reason to go to Drink Well.

reviews.author: Kasy S.
reviews.description: What a great experience in a cool space. I had another delicious old fashioned and a proper pint of scotch ale. My wife had the green drink which was a fantastic concoction of fresh herbs and peppers. Highly recommended cocktail as long as you aren't diametrically opposed to cilantro and fresh jalapeños

reviews.author: Alek Z.
reviews.description: Cool little pub, good drinks, a little on the expensive side, but they mix their drinks *well*. A lot of alcohol but you can't hardly taste it. You'll feel it though! They could use more seating. Also they need to start serving their Moscow Mules in copper mugs. But otherwise, it's a cool place.

reviews.author: Yelp Y.
reviews.description: Where the fuck is the 3.5.  This is a strange haunt, bigger than it used to be by opening into the antechamber.  The staff remains like clockwork.  If this were a Western saloon, there'd be a piano player, mopping his damn brow and waiting for higher spirits before smashing out a tune.  (you can even smoke outdoors, and if it's cold enough, no one will come out for a solid hour, guaranteed)  If you are not the type to make friends with every moron at the bar, this is a good place to seek some quiet and forgetfulness on off-hours, which are pretty much all hours not the weekend.  TCM is always on, subbed; Ida Lupino, Fred Macmurray, the Bogart, etc, become regulars to you, and inevitably some doofus pipes out, sure as God, "You know, I think Empire Strikes Back is one of the top ten films on the planet."  Sit long enough, still, like a walking stick; in comes a Bumble date once or twice a week: a leather daddy with a face pitted by acne that got the best of him years ago is making up big time by going to absolute town on some mixed girls, reciting the old lines, sure as Old Faithful, pat and safe and just this shy of rote PUA material; a young guy is meeting a blonde with a bob, discussing schadenfreude, saudade, acentrism, kicking canes out from mobility-disadvantaged Nazis, and everyone works at IBM or Dell.  There is always a gang of strangers who know each other over drinks, stinking of the day; every time you come in, they're here, swigging down Claire's Knees and Plump Perfections.  Some of them probably even had a cookout or two before life got in the way.    Every year they do Tiki Week.  Someone's written them up recently.  One of the top cocktail holes in this wreck of a town.   There is something disgusting in being known. Thank the Lord if you are the type who is able to weave little shrouds and stitches of obscurance around your neck wattle and your denimed shanks.  This is a place to hide, to commiserate with your immoralities.

reviews.author: Julie H.
reviews.description: Tigress was recommended to us, so being in the neighborhood, I thought sure! I was told that cocktails were their specialty so I just wanted to keep it simple and asked for a rum and diet coke.  The bartender immediately replied "we don't carry anything with aspertame in it!!"  Yet I could see regular coke in their cooler, so I think high fructose corn syrup is that much better?  There was no need to make that comment, simply state you don't have DIET. A little attitude, so so drinks.  No wonder at prime time there were only 4 or 5 people in the place.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: Pam is an amazing bartender. Sweet, sincere, knowledgeable...  She makes a mean black old fashion.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: Went for an impromptu drink on a Tuesday night. The place is quaint and charming. Not too big but not too small. Tuesday had maybe 8 other people there.   Dim lighting and wood booths line the place. Funny to say, but they have he most comfortable bar stools I've ever sat on!   The bartender was very friendly, talkative and great at recommending drinks.   First, I had The Green Drink! She said you can only get it 1-2 times a year! Unique and tasty! Never had a drink with cilantro in it. Good balance of fresh herbs, pineapple and citrus.   Second drink, she made a custom cocktail for me. I was in the mood for gin but my favorite drinks are mojitos and vodka presses. She didn't bat an eyelash and whipped up something exactly to what I asked for.   Prices are average for a craft cocktail ($9-10). The green drink was $12 but not crazy for the specialty and freshness.

reviews.author: Michael T.
reviews.description: I've walked past this place so many times and never walked in.  Tonight I went in there for a comedy night on a quiet Monday and ALL KILLERS it was the funniest lineup I have ever seen in my life.   This place knows what I want, but who's to say if I'm right.. you'll neeed to decide yourself bro

reviews.author: Steven C.
reviews.description: I came to this place with no expectations, just meeting a few friends for some live music and a couple drinks. I showed up before my friends and chose to sit at the bar rail and order an old fashioned. The bartender who I believe to have been the manager was wearing a Clemson University quarter zip. Idk if this guy was just having a bad day or what but boy did he make it obvious.   This guy was rude from the jump. Extremely short mannered, made the worst old fashioned just dumping simple syrup all over the outside of the glass and just tasted bad and left me with sticky hands. I asked what wines were available and was told they had mini bottles (2 glasses each) for $40+ no thank you.   In my opinion a bartender or waitstaff should make you feel welcome, make you feel appreciated for your service especially with Bars having been shutdown for almost 2 years with a hundred other options in a 4 block radius. I felt like I was doing him a disservice by showing up with a few friends and ordering drinks. The bar had maybe 10 people in it at the time so staffing was not the issue.   My advice, get out of the industry. Go find a job sitting behind a computer. Wouldn't recommend if it was the only bar open in town.

reviews.author: Bobby H.
reviews.description: Best dive on Red River. Low key and clean. Exactly where you need to hang when you want to be able to hear your friends instead of screaming over loud music. True locals spot. Come for the comedy, stay because you're shit faced.

reviews.author: Colleen C.
reviews.description: I love this bar and hope more people come out to it. Beautiful space, good drinks and music of course. Really hope business picks up here because it's a great spot.

name: Clive Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: L. W.
reviews.description: Great bar! Great vibe for my most recent sxsw trip! The staff were beyond lovely and great energy. This is a must stop when you wanna meet amazing energetic people. Austin was the best! Made us feel welcome :) love from some Cali kids!

reviews.author: Brendon G.
reviews.description: This an awesome bar to go hang out get drinks and get crazy. Great vibe for the bachelor party this past weekend. Staff is friendly and bar tenders are excellent at serving you drinks and not making you wait 20 min. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Sheree S.
reviews.description: I feel like I walked into the movie idiocracy. That's the type of people they're attracting now.

reviews.author: Kristin P.
reviews.description: love -almost- everything about this bar!  really great vibes all around except for one of the female bartenders on the top floor randomly yelled at me to calm down when I was waiting for her to take my drink order.
