I was taken aback because I didn't say a word to her and was smiling in my own little world so I thought her negative energy towards me was unwarranted.

reviews.author: Charlie T.
reviews.description: This bar is located on the popular Rainey Street. My visit here was to check out Bar Ilegal, a small mezcal based bar that is located in a small shed-like building in the back.  Both bars were popular as there were a good amount of people hanging out in the area. I ordered a Mexucan Mule and it was great. I liked the bite that it had in the drink. The bartender was super friendly and also suggested a couple of other bars that I should check out.

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Fun place! Great live music and a lot of people played Corn Hole.  The place wasn't obnoxiously loud.

reviews.author: Tim D.
reviews.description: Clive bar is nice, but it's really a front for Bar Illegal, which is a private bar for bikers and vampires.   About midnight,  the queen of the damned will come out and dance with a python and if you are lucky she will allow you to drink mezcal off her.  Backroom access requires one must know the secret knock before the peephole opens and challenge  password ensues.  Dont even try without the invitation, but fortune favors the bold.  Should you go crossing the silvery brook, it's best to leap before you look.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Been to Clive Bar several times, and is usually one of my first go-to's if I'm in the Rainey area. Their bar itself is not one of the biggest bars there is but the overall atmosphere seems to be a mix of chill and lively without being too much at times. Located just a stone's throw away is the elusive Bar Ilegal, which used to be a really subtle and unnoticed mezcal bar before Rainey became what it is today. Overall Clive Bar is a great place to warmup for a night out on Rainey, esp with Container Bar just across the street.

reviews.author: Wendy G.
reviews.description: Oh Rainey Street what can I say about you.......  To be honest, I was wandering down Rainey Street on a Saturday night, with certain bars with lines wrapping the block. Clive Bar though, seemed chill with no line and a decent amount of people where I could still have my own personal space.   Quickly got in and into the bar, bartenders were easily accessible which is a big bonus. 2 specialty cocktails for $20, I'm not complaining. Both drinks were made with love and a little heavy hand but you'll never hear me complain about it.   Another bonus, I was able to snag a table for our group and we were set for the evening. They had an awesome DJ playing 90s + 00s hip hop and RandB. Super dope bar with a cool outside space (Cornhole available) with a mezcal speakeasy as well.   For all the lines and drunk people, I'd come back here for a chill, lowkey night.

reviews.author: Kristen B.
reviews.description: Neat spot - good music, good drinks, lots of space and a speakeasy {Bar Ilegal) to boot! I only visited once while staying in Austin for a week but would definitely come back.

reviews.author: Maria W.
reviews.description: I have some mixed emotions about this place. I went at 2pm on a Sunday afternoon and had a great time drinking and watching the game on the patio with my friend. Well if I'm honest, she was watching the game, I was people watching!  The location is great. It's on a corner and has a good view of the street below. The rustic vibes and good music made for a nice time. The bartenders were all very kind and worked quickly. The drinks were made very very well. I had their signature Mule and my friend had a Strawberry Fizz. They were $10 each and I felt worth every penny. Now by 4:00 a younger rowdy crowd came in and the relaxed vibe changed. They stood in front of the tv and those of us watching the game quickly decided to leave. I am not taking away any stars for this because  I had a really good time and the bar itself cannot be held responsible for the how people act. Just go early

reviews.author: Thomas N.
reviews.description: The Clive Bar is a really fun place to meet with friends when venturing out on Rainey Street. Attentive wait staff, good drinks and music. Also don't miss checking out the Mezcal Bar in the back area. The bar tender knows her mezcal and can create some magic for you.

reviews.author: Muriel S.
reviews.description: Can we talk about the illegal mezcal house outside? Take a step into history into this little stable that is now used as a bar. The bartender told us all about how the building was used and he had a Hiiii he variety of mezcal and tequila. This was truly something out of a movie.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Clive Bar holds a special place in my heart and is probably my favorite bar on Rainey Street.  When my husband and I started dating in 2011 it was where we would go often.  It was a different Rainey Street all together back then.  There were only like 3 bars in the area at the time.   Clive Bar used to have the frozen peach teas that were amazing!  I still think back to those and wish they still had them.  I usually ask every summer if they will bring them back - I really really wish they would.  All the bartenders here are amazing and super nice!  I love their drink menu and they have a nice selection of beer on tap as well.  They have some infused liquors too that change out every now and then.  Honestly if you don't know what you want just ask the bartenders what they recommend and tell them the flavors you like and they might be able to whip something up for you.    I also love the openness and atmosphere at Clive.  No matter the season it is always good.  They also have a Mezcal bar that is open on the weekends in the back.  If you have never experienced this I would highly recommend trying a flight to taste.    So if you are on Rainey Street - don't skip Clive Bar - it is a must stop for sure!

reviews.author: William T.
reviews.description: Came here a couple of times recently and definitely enjoyed myself.  First, the bar has both an inside and outside area - the outside area is reasonably large, so that's where we spent most of our time. One point I want to make is that the bartenders were really nice throughout our visits there. They were friendly, remembered my name, and just did a great job in general.  One fun thing about this bar is that they have cornhole outside. Of course, it's only one set of boards, and you'll have plenty of other people wanting to play, so you can pretty much play a few games max. But a few games of cornhole is better than no games at all! One small negative about the place is that they had some pretty subpar BBQ restaurant serving food there (on a Thursday). Granted, it's not like the bar itself is serving the food, but I would have preferred they allowed a better restaurant to take up real estate.  Overall, I definitely recommend people come here and have a drink. And if you don't like it, you can go to one of the other many bars on Rainey St. :)

reviews.author: Kevin W.
reviews.description: My review will focus on Bar Illegal. My friends and I were on the hunt to find speakeasies in Austin, and Bar Illegal is one of the easier ones to get to. It is visible from outside Clive Bar, but to get to Bar Illegal, you must walk through Clive Bar's outside area and into the small building that is roughly the size of a shed. The small structure seemed to be made of stones, and it had many cultural items representing Mexico that were spread around: religious paintings, prayer candles, skulls, and other decorations. There were only four other people not including the bartender and my group of three. I would approximate the 'comfortable limit' would be 10 people. The bartender was well educated on the topic mezcal! He got a sense of what we individually liked to drink, and he selected a different type of mezcal for each of us. I drank my mezcal as a shot since it's a little too strong for me, but the bartender suggested drinking it slowly. The prices of the mezcal were all under $10 for shot glass sized servings. The bartender was also awesome enough to suggest other speakeasies and tell us 'passwords' for one.

reviews.author: Stephanie Q.
reviews.description: Clive bar is a real chill bar. We sat outdoors and played cornhole. There are also lots of TV screens for you to watch your favorite sports teams!

reviews.author: Adam F.
reviews.description: I'm a huge fan of mezcal, so when I heard a bar had a speakeasy-ish room in the back that specialized in it, clearly I had to pop in and check it out. I do feel like it would make more sense for it to be its own yelp page, as while it is owned jointly and running under the same liquor license, the purpose (tasting high quality mezcal) and menu (just a long list of mezcals) are totally different from the main bar. I didn't visit the main bar, just Bar Ilegal.   Anyway, unsurprisingly, it's tiny (could fit maybe a dozen people before it'd start to get uncomfortable), but when we were there, around 9 PM on a Saturday, it only had about 6 people in it - I suppose a bar for just tasting mezcal is pretty niche (they do have 4 mezcal cocktails as well, but they honestly didn't look like anything particularly spectacular). The bartender clearly knew his mezcal very well, and prices are actually surprisingly reasonable for a spirit-focused bar. I asked to try the smokiest reasonably-priced mezcal he had, and got one - Del Maguey's San Luis del Rio - that I absolutely loved, a half-pour for $6.50 (I also love that they do half-pours, for if your primary motivation is "sample new mezcals" rather than "get crunk"). Based on previous experience with places like this, I assumed it was a truly ludicrous markup and that I had just found my new favorite affordable mezcal, but nope! It's a 70 dollar mezcal. So, happy that I got to try a 70 dollar mezcal (it was delicious), but also a little sad because now I'm still looking for my "can always keep a bottle at home" affordable type mezcal. Oh well.   But anyway, yeah, if you like mezcal, you have to check out Bar Ilegal. Really wish my favorite mezcal bar locally would do mezcal samplings like this one does.

reviews.author: Michele L.
reviews.description: My favorite bar from the whole area from 6th street to Congress to Rainey.  It's located on the corner with plenty of front and side outdoor seating. The interior is dark with leather studded bar stools and a few tables at the bar. The bartenders were friendly and attentive with good pours on our Maker's for $7 each and specialty bourbon drinks for $10 each.  They have an awesome Rock band that plays each Sunday afternoon. Really good set-list, front man, and rockin' guitar jams.

reviews.author: Brian S.
reviews.description: During our first night in Austin last week, we ate at Emmer and Rye and then walked up Rainey looking to get the full experience so we tried out a handful of places. Clive really stood out to me as having the full package.   The inside space is cozy and lodge-y. Coming from MKE, we felt right at home. The outside deck and patio space is huge. Plenty of room for everyone to spread out and still keep a game of Bag Toss going.   Later in the week, we were with a bunch of our KW coworkers and one of our party members thought it would be a good idea to try out Container Bar. Wrong. It was a like an undergrad frat house in there. SO loud, SO sweaty, SO many college kids. No offense if that's your thing. Clive Bar SAVED THE DAY.   Get the Matthew Pecan-aughey.

name: Crown and Anchor Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Friday

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: After calling a dozen other restaurants and bars, who have posted in inaccurate hours on Yelp, which we found out by calling all of them to find them all closed and they said they were open, we stumbled upon the Crown and Anchor. 38 nicely chosen taps, amazingly friendly, with a awesome atmosphere. Jarrod, the bartender, and Sam, the waitress made us feel at home and I made what was it looking like a pretty bleak Christmas Eve into a wonderful party night. Between the two of them, awesome awesome is the only word that I can use to describe the feeling of hospitality on Christmas Eve, it saved our night and made us loyal customers of crown and anchor whenever we will layover in Austin or visit.  Bravo and Cheers to Jarrod and Sam. We will be back whenever possible! Thank you!

reviews.author: Brian E.
reviews.description: Great beer selection and awesome burgers.  This is a great spot to sit outside, drink a few beers, and just enjoy the day.

reviews.author: Kaelyn M.
reviews.description: Decent food and atmosphere. EXTREMELY disrespectful and inconsiderate bartenders and cooks. This place has definitely gone downhill in the past few months. Could have potential if it weren't for the horrible staff.

reviews.author: Amanda F.
reviews.description: So, being new to Austin I'm always looking for cool local spots to take my pup that aren't pretentious with some good grub and drinks. Let me tell you...this is hands down my new favorite place. The staff here is amazing!!! They even brought my dog a piece of bacon!!! The fries and BLT were delicious. They even came out to check on me and gave me a free local entertainment paper so I can see what's good in Austin :) Thank you guys so much! I can't wait to be back!!!

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: I have been driving by CandA up to 4 times a day on my way to/from work for years now and kept thinking "we need to go, we need to go". We finally decided on a random Tuesday to pop in after work and we're kicking ourselves for waiting so long! This place was so great! They have QR code menus on each table for both food, and beer, and they were so user-friendly, and easy to navigate. The tables are spaced out, and there's seating on the front deck, under the cover on the patio, and some inside as well. The staff was seriously THE friendliest we have encountered in Austin, especially during COVID times. They checked on us regularly, and basically made it so we never had to go in and order anything, because they were SO on it! They are amazingly, over the top, dog friendly!!! It's one of the few spots we can sit under cover with our dog, they have tons of water bowls, free snacks, and they even brought him out a very special snack from the kitchen! They gave him lots of love, and were happy to have him there.  We ordered cheeseburger baskets with fries and they were so delicious! The portions were huge, but the burgers weren't so fat you couldn't handle them semi-gracefully. They were loaded with melting cheese, and the smoked bacon was amazing. There was an abundance of toppings, and a huge pile of perfectly crisped fries. The beer selection and HH is just awesome, we have zero complaints at all! We'll definitely become more regular patrons here, and I highly recommend going out of your way, giving them a chance, and checking out this perfect neighborhood bar!

reviews.author: Feather F.
reviews.description: This place is the best ! My boyfriend is an alumni and I look forward to coming here more than anywhere else when we come back to visit Austin . Best burgers and fries ever !! See you in November Crown !!!

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: A+ beer selection, delicious burgers for an incredibly cheap price and possibly the friendliest staff I've ever met at a bar (and I drink at a lot of bars).  My fiancé is that obnoxious person who walks into a room and immediately tells everyone we're from out of town. Maybe that attributed to the friendliness but I won't complain.  We were trying to see as much of Austin as we could in one day, but if we had more time we would have stayed for a few more beers. Great patio too.  I can imagine this place being a complete cluster during football season. My alma mater plays Texas in 2025 and we may need to be here to find out :)

reviews.author: Jessreen P.
reviews.description: This place is awesome, and the staffs are very friendly. You can also bring your pets here. 10/10

reviews.author: Néia H.
reviews.description: Been coming here for 20+ years. Best burger and fries in Austin, and always a good beer to go with it. COVID-19 precautious in place,  which we appreciate being in the healthcare for Le. Now we just call in an order to go and sit in our car to eat it. While it's not the same as hanging out on the patio, it's still a great experience.

reviews.author: Jonny M.
reviews.description: Looking for a slice of "old Austin"? A large selection of craft beers? Affordable and tasty food menu? Great atmosphere?  Look no further than the Crown and Anchor pub.   If you're looking for an expansive beer menu, they have it. Just about any craft beer you can think of is available.   If you're looking for great atmosphere, they own it. The owner Derven has been operating the place for 25 year and is a true Austinite. He has played gigs with many of the areas legendary musicians back the 80s. You can find him at the register most days haggling regulars and slinging beers.   Food? The food menu has the essentials and is affordable and tasty. It has enough options to satisfy just about anybody including a vegetarian or vegan and the food is always great and reasonably priced.   What else? Pool tables. Check. Darts. Check. Plenty of sitting area? Plenty of parking? Check and check.   Overall Crown and Anchor is a mellow and great dive to try a new beer, eat good burger or to clank glasses and cheers with beers at.   The old show Cheers comes to mind. It's a must stop for the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: The second member of the grad school holy trinity (the other 2 being spiderhouse and taco joint).  Its basically the perfect neighborhood bar. Basic wooden tables, a nice porch, 3 dart boards and 2 pool tables. You dont have to pay for darts, but you need collateral. They always have a great selection of beer, also they always have a nice deal on some type of beer they're trying to get rid of. Your dollar will go far at this place, especially during happy hour.  In terms of atmosphere, its no frills. Its great for big groups and small groups and hanging out. The porch is enclosed with screens but it is a little hot in the summer. Its great in the fall and spring though.  In terms of food, nothing is really stand out. But, it isnt bad either. Their burger is like the perfect backyard barbecue dad burger. Their fries are pretty good too but there jot artisanal. The cheese fries have a healthy amount of cheese. The nachos are fine too. The prices are a little high compared to the drinks. But, they're not unreasonable.  A lot of researchers at the university have happy hours here, so it gets busy on fridays especially during the semester. People from the neighborhood come too so theres always a crowd. That being said, youll usually be able to get a dart board or a pool table if you want it.

reviews.author: Bill G.
reviews.description: Hey! You have to have some beers here before you walk to the stadium for a football game. Yes, you have to. I do. Many people have been doing it for years and you can see it in the age difference. old and young, people grow up drinking here before Texas Football Games. An Austin tradition and staple.

reviews.author: Kelli R.
reviews.description: I'm new to Austin and this is one of my favorite places.  It's a locals spot right next to the UT campus, so of course it attracts a small college crowd, but it also attracts this amazing group of locals who are super friendly and welcoming.   The people that work here are so nice and they are the reason I went back.  They also have a great beer selection and the bartenders are very knowledgeable about all of the beers.  This place has been there forever and is just a great laid back spot to play pool or darts and just hang out with good people.  Also the burgers are SO good!!

reviews.author: T M.
reviews.description: This place is the best. Hands-down my favorite burger and fries and ranch in Austin... maybe anywhere. Just a simple down-home delicious burger. There are some really awesome staff here (only one pill to occasionally deal with) but overall pretty good odds. Good atmosphere, really affordable, extremely crave-able food in my opinion. Only thing missing is dessert! The first time I came here I ended up going at least once a week since, until sadly I had to quarantine out of state. When I get back though, it's ONNN! I'll be there twice a week probably! I miss it ALL THE TIME!

reviews.author: Soham R.
reviews.description: The ambience is great for watching sports with friends. I didn't have drinks but the food was not that great - the bacon and toast were a bit overdone.

reviews.author: Thomas H.
reviews.description: Friendly staff, good prices, clean bathrooms.   Main downside is they don't serve liquor, as to why? I have no clue.

reviews.author: Troy H.
reviews.description: Spent a moment and made a meeting place for myself and friends. Came here for the burgers and some conversation and we were not disappointed with either.    I am not a burger snob, but I really do enjoy a nice burger and here they have it. You cannot rate it at the top with many others in the area of Austin, but for the price, the atmosphere, the location, and the great staff you cannot go wrong here.    It's a really solid burger that can feed your conversations with friends or fuel your hunger for a long night at the pub. On a side note, the fries were really good as well.

reviews.author: Ashley A.
reviews.description: I walked in and my fiancée took a picture of the menu so I could read it on his phone - I wasn't wearing my glasses and the beer menu was too small/ far away to read it. I encouraged the customer next to me to go ahead and order because I didn't know what I wanted and the bartender was SO rude and rolled his eyes and said we were instagramming. I left immediately and I'll never return. I don't need some angry hipster rolling his eyes at me when I'm about to tip him. There's a lovely bar just a half a block away (walking distance) called Posse East with better service and more seating space. Don't waste your time on the pretentious staff here who judges their patrons. Horrible.

reviews.author: Ty C.
reviews.description: This is borderline 5 stars, so I'll give the benefit to them.  Nice bartenders.  Great beer selection and beer prices.  The price varies depending on the type of beer and whether it is happy hour or not.  I got a pint of 512 pecan porter for $4 during happy hour.  They also have pitchers available.    This place is not upscale, but it is a chill place to grab a beer and hang out, watch the game (NBA playoffs and baseball were on while I was there) and there is indoor and outdoor seating and two pool tables.  I was there on Sunday night and pool was FREE!  I suck at pool and don't particularly like pool, but I was up for a few games to help kill the time, so that was an added bonus, especially if you like pool.  There were probably 20 or more beers on tap, lots of bottle and can options, so I'm sure you will find 2 or 5 things that you like.  Parking was free on Sunday.  Pro tip, go on SUNDAY!  I didn't get any food, but it looked like everyone was ordering nachos.

reviews.author: Oscar N.
reviews.description: A great campus bar with cheap food and cold beer l. This is a great dive bar on the north side of UT with great cheap food and lots of beer specials. A spot to meet for a drink or two.

name: It's Italian Cucina
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Ron Y.
reviews.description: The food was outstanding , we started with the Meatball appetizers, focaccia bread and Capri salad. They were very nice and substituted chicken for our Piccata (In place of Veal), we also had the house special Spicy Rigatoni, lobster ravioli, and a delicious chicken vegetable. All this complimented by a few Martinis (shaken not stirred), a few glasses of red wine.  Would definitely recommend

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: Very Good Service and I wanted to try something different as far as Italian food and I may have found a gem. I loved the way my chicken was cooked as the mushrooms And spaghetti noodles to compliment the meal. The sun was also dazzling as this will not be my last time here.

reviews.author: Briana S.
reviews.description: The foccacia was amazing and the cheese board was also pretty good (though I think over priced for amount of food). I ended up getting the Salmon w/artichoke and spaghetti in garlic cream because my waiter said the Squid ink pasta wasn't the greatest and I wish I had just gotten that anyway because the salmon dish was pretty bland. I wish they had opted for another side as well because artichoke really is only good with spinach in a dip. I also felt like we were there for ages and our waiter didn't come by as often as I would've liked but my biggest issue with the restaurant was that the manager was buzzing around the entire night and both my friend and I noticed he seemed to check on every table but ours which after sitting there for so long definitely started to rub me the wrong way. We did get lucky and were able to get a table on a Friday night with no wait and without a reservation but I wouldn't come back here or recommend coming to anyone else because I'm sure there are better, if not just plain better lit, restaurants.

reviews.author: Lupita C.
reviews.description: I definitely recommend this place if you're in Austin and want an authentic Italian meal! It's also a really romantic dinner place! The food was great! This has to be by far one of my favorites! I will definitely be going back! Our waiter was great, the service was fast! Overall great experience! I also got dessert but didn't have a chance to get a photo cause it gone in a second hahah.

reviews.author: Janea W.
reviews.description: I had an excellent dinner her with some coworkers. I started with the Calamari and Verdure salad. It was very tasty. My entree was Branzino. Mediterranean Sea bass filet sautéed with shrimp, served with Asparagus in white wine and delicious seasonings. It was mouth watering good. I finished with a delicious cheesecake with extra strawberry sauce. Yummy!! Lastly, I enjoyed two delicious chocolate martinis. I would recommend this restaurant

reviews.author: Shari D.
reviews.description: My husband and I disagree on our feelings on this restaurant. Because this site is in my name I get to decide. I am going to give it four stars because I really liked the ambience, the cocktails (Cosmopolitan, aperol spritz, Hendrix Martini and a Tito's dirty martini). The calamari was good but not as crispy as I prefer. My friend and I each had the ink squid with muscles, clams and shrimp. My other friend had fettuccine with shrimp and my husband had the risotto with zucchini. The four of us split the flourless chocolate torte (magnificent). In general I like the restaurant but probably would not return. Their yelp review said two dollar signs and let me just say that is not the case. I don't think the ink squid had enough flavor but in their defense I asked it not to be too spicy. There are several other Italian restaurants that I would go back to but not this one. By the way my husband would probably give it three stars.

reviews.author: Lisa K.
reviews.description: Threw a celebratory dinner here with family. Super versatile menu if you want to go the traditional rich Italian route full of the delicious pasta an breads, or if you're more health conscious and want to stick to grilled vegetables and fish or chicken. They are accommodating to people with gluten and dairy issues (a big deal for an Italian restaurant!). Stuffed my face with GF bread and pasta, came home 5 pounds heavier, and 10/10 would do it again no regrets.

reviews.author: Walker D.
reviews.description: On a lark went to It's Italian Cucina last night.  Had a wonderful time and thoroughly enjoyed the food.  I got the Prix-fixe dal mare dinner.  It was heavenly, ESPECIALLY the lobster raviolis!!  I could eat an enormous plate of these things!!

reviews.author: Ryan O.
reviews.description: Small place that doesn't offer a lot of table space (which is my ONLY critique) but the food is DELICIOUS! The staff are super attentive and the cocktail menu is on point!  The Negroni options are phenomenal and the Sardo Negroni (I think is what it was called) is one of the best cocktails I've ever had.   Think about this place often. Haha. Will be back many more times in the future.

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: First time visit this past Saturday and it was a wonderful experience!   We wanted to try a new place and hubby made a reservation the day of. Upon arrival, we were promptly greeted and seated. Restaurant has safety measures in place to guarantee social distancing.   Our server was very polite and attentive. Service was spot on - timely, efficient and frequent check-ins made us feel very welcomed. Everything was delicious - from our drinks, appetizers, and main course. Next time I'll try to leave room for dessert.  I look forward to the next visit - I do recommend!

reviews.author: Danya K.
reviews.description: I am wildly impressed by the attention and service we received while dining at this restaurant. And parking is not an issue at all while, which was very convenient.  I have to say - before I arrived I already had high expectations since they informed us there would be a fee if we canceled our reservations 2 hours prior to arrival and that we had to call if we were going to be 5 minutes late. Now I get why. So many people are involved in ensuring you have a great experience and a last minute cancellation could take away from someone else having that same great experience.  When we arrived they promptly took us to our table which was prepared as we requested. Won't lie, we had a lot of very specific requests since some of the attendees had major gluten allergies or had particular food preferences. Altogether this restaurant delivered! The food tasted great, our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and seamlessly answered all our question.   We will definitely be back again!

reviews.author: Lauren A.
reviews.description: It's Italian is indeed Italian, mostly pasta. You're not going to be disappointed in the food, but I wouldn't go out of your way to come here. The bolognese and arrabiata are good and the cocktails are strong, but the menu seems overpriced. The burrata is served ice cold and not as creamy as I've had it in other mid-priced restaurants in Austin. I highly doubt they make the rigatoni in house, but who knows! The service is good and the patio has fans in the summer and heaters in the winter.

reviews.author: Alexis R.
reviews.description: The husband and I decided to get out of Harker Heights and see what other eateries Austin had to offer. My husband and I  were in the mood for some really good pasta and drinks, so we decided to come here and try it out. Let's just say it was the best decision ever.  Place wasn't hard to find at all and parking was extremely close and not crowded at all. The place opened at five, we got there a few minutes early and we were allowed to still go in. We waited to be seated and took in how beautiful the place looked. We were greeted wonderfully by everyone in the restaurant and were directed to our seat. Our waiter introduced himself to us, asked us how our day was going, let us know what the special of the day was and kindly gave us time throughout the ordering process to order our beverages, appetizers, entrees, and dessert. Our waiter was amazing, very patient and gave us enough time to decide on what we wanted and checked on us frequently to make sure that we were enjoying our food and refill our wine glasses with our glass bottled, still water that we ordered. Every item that we ordered was beyond delicious, portion size was perfect, the tiramisu (spectacular) and my alcoholic beverage was divine, especially the house made maraschino cherry. The pasta and the calamari was so fresh and flavorful. The sauce for everything was amazing. The husband and I love this place so much already and we are definitely coming back. Thank you for making our experience here an amazing one.

reviews.author: Mackenzie W.
reviews.description: I always love going to It's Italian Cucina. There isn't a bad thing on the menu. Serving Northern Italian cuisine is their specialty and they have choices to suit every palate all the way from drinks to dessert. The service is excellent. Everyone is so gracious and welcoming, especially the owner, Al. Walking around with his ever-present glass of vino (sommelier!), ready to say hello, offer a recommendation from their unmatched wine selection, or crack a joke. I take a new guest with me almost every time I go because I feel it's my duty to introduce people to the amazing food that delights from its tucked away spot on South Lamar. Try it once and you'll become a regular too.

reviews.author: Chelsea V.
reviews.description: Cucina had been on our date night list, so we were excited to try it. I'm writing this review a little later (we visited August 7th). For what we paid (Our bill was around $200+), the food was less than worth it. Our wine choice  - Lopez de Haro Crianza Tempranillo 2017 Rioja, which was a $44 bottle on their wine list. We use the Vivino app for reviewing wine, and making purchase decisions. This bottle sits at a 3.6 rating and sells for an average of $11.99 (eye roll). We love tempranillos but this was not good.  For appetizers we tried the Foccacia Bread, and the Arancini: Risotto balls. The risotto balls - SUPER dry and the breading was overcooked and practically charred. The saving grace for those was the marinara sauce to dip them in so we could add some flavor and soften them up. I can not believe these were $16. Moving on to the main dishes. We chose Gnocchi Diavolo - Fried potato pasta w/spicy Diavolo sauce ($27) and the Rigatoni Fornaio W/ pancetta, basil, tomatoes, mozzarella ($29). The Rigatoni - was one of the WORST pasta dishes i've ever had. I've made better in my kitchen at home. I don't know how one manages to make a pasta dish taste dry - but Cucina succeeded. It was like chalky paste in my mouth. And the mozzarella looked like packaged great value shredded cheese you get from the cheap section of HEB cheeses. It was also cold, and not melted in the slightest. I couldn't even finish it. The Gnocchi - which you can't normally go wrong with - it pains me to say we had to ADD SALT to the dish to make it taste like anything. I'll say it again... we had to ADD SALT TO OUR PASTA. The spicy Diavolo sauce, there was no flavor or spice. For an expensive Italian restaurant I expected way better. Zero excuse for customers having to add salt to their pasta dish. Desert and drinks - we chose the Affgato'bout it: Frangelico, Chocolate gelato and Espresso for $14. This was fine, you can't mess up ice cream - Probably came from a tub of $5 ice cream from HEB though. Finally we tried the Luxardo Limoncello, Campania - $10 and the Dow's 10 year Old Tawny n/v Port for $12. Fine just fine. Honestly yes, if we weren't happy about our food we should have said something to the waitress. However the wait staff was super kind and super great so we felt bad complaining. But this experience overall has weighed on us more and more as we've shared this terrible Italian food experience with our friends. Upset that we wasted our date night on this place, $200+ was insane. I'd choose Patrizy's food truck over this spot 100 times over.

reviews.author: Cayla G.
reviews.description: It's mediocre. It's delicious hard salami. It's decent spaghetti bolognese. It's tasty, standard cocktails. It's street noise when seated outside. It's seventeen-minute waits with dirty dishes on the table. It's not my favorite.

reviews.author: Diego C.
reviews.description: Excellent food and service, great ambiance, good wine list. Last time had pork chop, asparagus, and limoncello cake. All delicious. It is one of the few restaurants as my go to for in town guests.

reviews.author: Lauren P.
reviews.description: All I can say about this place is WOW.   We came here for a work dinner while in Austin for our annual conference. Our group was served food family style, starting with charcuterie boards, followed by salads, and amazing, hearty entrees.  The charcuterie and salads were delicious, but obviously the real stars of the show were the entrees.   My absolutely favorite was the tomato cream sauce gnocchi. Holy CRAP this stuff was good. I kept going in for more, and more, and more... I noticed we had plenty to go around so I didn't feel bad about going in for like four helpings (literally). It was thaaat good.  The chicken parmesan was really good as well. Chicken was nice and moist and the dish overall had amazing flavor.   Another shining star on this establishment is the owner. He is the SWEETEST man I've ever met! We walked in and we were immediately treated like we were family. I'm talking hugs right at the door! He was just so sweet and clearly so passionate about people loving the food. Business owners like him are one of the reasons why I love working for Yelp - I really do get to meet the best people!   Highly, highly recommend if you're a lover of tasty Italian food and of course, wine. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Elizabeth S.
reviews.description: I'll be honest. I passed this place many times thinking "That is the dumbest name" and never went there because of it. But one night I found myself wanting a nice dinner and it was nearby and open. I ate at the bar and the bartender was delightful. The owner also hung out with all of us at the bar and chatted us up. The food, every morsel, was fantastic. I had the focaccia to start off with a mezcal Negroni. So freaking tasty. I forgot to take a picture of my main course because I was so excited but it was a tomato and gnocchi that was to die for. I had to get the tiramsu at that point and was full and not disappointed. Definitely doing a date night here soon.

reviews.author: Briana P.
reviews.description: Oh my goodness. We made reservations on a slow night and when we got there there was one other table but despite that, the host acted totally dismayed that we had a stroller with us and informed us (very rudely) he'd have to switch our seat. I couldn't understand why that was an issue considering there was an abundance of seating, all of which could comfortable fit our small stroller. Just really bad customer service and the food wasn't worth the price either.

name: Growler USA - Austin
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Derian T.
reviews.description: This place is outrageous! Every time I find myself in this establishment, I am off-put by the care shown to me by the staff, and how excruciatingly good the service always is. Also another thing that irks me is just how good the pretzel is. Why can't other tap rooms produce a pretzel of the quality of the Food Truck Bavarian Pretzel.  Also the price of beer during happy hours, Friday's, and Sundays is OUTRAGEOUS. $3 on select beers?? What is this? My friends fridge?? On top of this the incredible selection makes me red in the face with frustration, that like that special someone, keeps me coming back for more.   All and all this establishment is painfully well run and makes me smile.

reviews.author: Addison R.
reviews.description: Rude manager and poor price transparency  I visited with a group of friends this weekend and ordered a pitcher for the table. We didn't have the menus out anymore so I asked the waiter how much it cost. "About $20" she said. When the bill comes, the pitcher was actually $50! The whole table ordered some, and we were all pissed.   I called the manager afterwards to express my frustration with how the waiter mislead us. He proceeded to criticize, mock and delegitimize my concern. He said I should have "read the menu", but the waiter should also know the prices. "About $20" is wayyyy off from $50.   Growlers literally does not care about their customers, and will gladly yell at you for THEIR mistakes.

reviews.author: Ryan K.
reviews.description: Great, friendly bartenders... so many options on tap. Great place to try a new, local brew!

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: Came here with a few friends for the Friends Trivia night.  We ordered some draft beer from the many selections. The waiter was very informed on all of their selections and was able to answer all  of our questions - with a smile.  Ordered some wings, a sandwich wrap, chips and salsa. Food was decent and priced fair. Service was fast even on a busy night.  Pros: Beer selections Staff's knowledge on the products offered here  Cons: Parking - Parking and Parking well rather lack of

reviews.author: Eliott L.
reviews.description: Good vibes, and great location. $3 draft IPA? Sign me up-- they have great daily specials and have a super nice staff. Ask for Sam if you get the chance.

reviews.author: Madison W.
reviews.description: Everything taste so good and cooked so well. Will definitely be coming back! Ordered online and was ready 10 minutes early. Stayed warm the whole way home and is delicious!! The sauce is to die for!

reviews.author: Nathan F.
reviews.description: Love this place and one of the only places near campus that provide growlers to go and have a variety of stuff. Friendly and helpful staff and great selection I'm basically a Covid regular

reviews.author: Roy G.
reviews.description: Average tap house with decent food.  The parking lot is small but there was parking both times I came by.  The beer selection is pretty good.  They capture a broad spectrum of tastes and styles of beer. The food is bar style, wings, fries, tots, sandwiches, etc.  nothing I ate was noteworthy. There is room for improvement on greeting and service times.  There was one person working the bar and another waitress floating but no one approached us so we got up and asked.  Then another gentleman came from the back to wait on us.  There were not enough people in this place for the service not to be swift and great. Especially when I bring a party of 8 that are all eating and drinking. Anyway it's a good stop for a quick bite and a beer if you're in the area.  Just not a place on my list to revisit.

reviews.author: Bethany M.
reviews.description: My weekly go to, I love the friendly service and upbeat atmosphere, and of course beer selection.  Great specials and a full menu.

reviews.author: Sirena L.
reviews.description: Growler USA is definitely one of my favorite places to go to for drinks and food. There's a fantastic selection of beer; with something like 100 taps, you're bound to find something you like, whether you want a sour, IPA, or stout. Most of them are Texas beers and the selection is always changing. If you're not feeling beer, there are plenty of other drinks too: sodas, kombucha, wine, cider, mead, etc. A huge plus for me about Growler USA is they have pours starting from 4oz -- perfect for flights and lightweights! -- to the typical 12/16oz, and of course they fill growlers.  There is also decent food that goes a bit beyond typical pub food and is of course more varied than a food truck at a brewery. I'm particularly fond of the tater tots and mac and cheese, but it looks like they've added some new items to the menu in the last couple of months.   Another great aspect of Growler USA is the incredible staff. There is one woman in particular - her name eludes me - but she is extremely knowledgeable about beer of all kinds and can give you some great suggestions based on what you're feeling (or even if you're trying to do a beer and food pairing)!  I believe there is also some kind of special every day of the week. I know Sundays are $1 off sours, happy hour all day (discount on all appetizers), and I believe the tapover beers are discounted as well. Plus they do special events like Beer 101 classes. For all these reasons, I think Growler USA is a great value overall and there really is something for every taste. I know I'm always learning and trying something new every time I come here, and it keeps me coming back!

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: I'm so glad this place opened in such a safe manner during COVID. Everything is so clean and follows the procedures. Also AJ's playlists are fire. Tap takeover is a must

reviews.author: Lauren S.
reviews.description: Take advantage of the specials and this can be a very reasonable place to get a good beer. The extensive menu and regular Tap Takeovers encourage would-be cicerones to expand their palate.  Don't bother with an entree. Food is mostly overpriced and underwhelming, so maybe get a large appetizer to share with your party. The wings and tots are alright and I hear good things about the pretzels.  The staff is all pretty nice. The price point and atmosphere attract a slightly older crowd for a location so close to a university, so don't worry about this place being flooded with undergrads like myself most of the time.

reviews.author: Rohan C.
reviews.description: Growler is an American classic. If you're not going to Growler during Tap Takeover on Thursday, what are you doing? The staff is amazing, AJ and Cannon are amazing people.

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: This place has countless things going for it: a friendly and knowledgeable staff, phenomenal selection of beers, and stellar food.   My partner and I come here at a minimum of once a week.

reviews.author: Tom B.
reviews.description: *MANAGEMENT PLEASE READ THIS*  Whoever you have bartending today needs to be spoken to. I generally write positive reviews, but this needed calling attention to.  I just walked with my wife and daughter for lunch.  We waited a few minutes to be seated, or told to seat ourselves - but were totally ignored.  Finally a guy at the bar told the bartender that we had been waiting a while and she said, loud enough for us to hear, "I don't care, I'm busy."  The place was not remotely packed.    Terrible, and very rude, service by the bartender working today.  Candidly one of the worst experiences I've had, and we didn't even make it to a table.  We headed over to Torchy's for a great meal instead.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: Great Lunch Place!!!  Really cool place. I love it. You can get your eats, drinks and growler for later. Yummy fish tacos. The menu was fun. Tots and tacos sound good to me!   I didn't think to buy a growler but the manager told me about their growlers. I now have a glass   free growler that is insulated.    Love the samplers. And they have kombucha on tap that is the Best I have ever had. A few beer and a kombucha for good measure.   YUM!  After a bevy you can go to Malvern's and Oat Willie's.    Thanks!

reviews.author: Kathy Z.
reviews.description: This place is great for happy hours for small to medium sized groups. They have a broad selection of draft beers and the menu is organized so you can easily find the type of beer you are in the mood for. The tap takeover beers are $3. I've been a few times when tap takeover brewery is there and they let you sample some of their beer. They also have reverse happy hour on Saturday nights. I've had the tater tots and pretzel, and both are simple but delicious. Parking is easy, and the staff is helpful and friendly.

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Wow oh wow! Free wifi, tons of awesome board games with all the pieces, lots of seating and the ability to raise the windows, plus over 100+ beers on tap?!?!). This is an amazing hidden gem on campus... I can't believe I haven't went to this place before! They have some awesome deals and $3 growler fills on certain days (which is unbelievable deal).  I will be back thirsty to drink! Check this place out for sure! If you come during happy hour they have some awesome deals for food as well (your typical bar fare).

reviews.author: Hillary K.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. It's definitely got that local bar feel. The people walk in and are greeted by their first names. My favorite thing about this place is the selection of beers and that you can get 4oz choices for roughly $2. That way if you don't care for something you didn't spend $6-$8 on a glass. There are TVs and good music playing. The staff were incredibly nice and helpful. The food selection is good and tastes good as well. We will definitely be back. This is a feel good place to relax and have a drink and bite to eat away from the typical touristy spots in Austin.

reviews.author: Laura O. D.
reviews.description: First customers in yesterday,and had a great experience with bartender "AM". She was friendly and knowledgeable about huge beer selection. In the end we bought 2 additional growlers on her suggestion about some rare / different local beer from Live Oak Brewing. Also bought the 512 IPA for my Bro. Honey Sriracha wings and tots were a nice snack while we tasted the different beers. Great place and atmosphere!

name: Little Woodrow's Southpark Meadows
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: We really enjoy going to Little Woodrow's to watch NFL Sunday! They have 16 TVs spread out around the room. There's a mix between high tops and low tables, plus a large U-shaped bar in the back. They also have a front and back patio with additional TVs.  This location is strictly drinks so we usually bring food in with us we pick up on the way. The vibe is fun on Sunday's and if you want to mix it up, they have ping pong and beer pong out on the patios free to play.

reviews.author: Kayla A.
reviews.description: Honestly, this place is such an underrated gem in South Austin. The layout and vibe of the bar is amazing with great indoor/outdoor flow for those days when the weather is not our friend. Their back patio is tucked away and offers some peach and quiet while still being able to enjoy the game. We have hosted a few UCLA Alumni events here and the manager, Casey, is always very helpful! They share a kitchen with the pizza joint next door. Though I can't recommend the pizza the wings are phenomenal.

reviews.author: Maddy C.
reviews.description: I've been coming to this location for a few months and am finally moved to leave a review. The GM Sam is extremely hospitable and really impacted our experience. Top tier service. Ask for her!! We will be back!

reviews.author: Voltaire L.
reviews.description: This place is horrible! They over charge you and then supplement the charges buy saying you order "FREE NACHOS SALSA" if you so happen to not want the free salsa and chips they and leave on the table unopened!!! Yup you guessed it they!! Wipe the table downs and recycle the chips and salsa! I wrote a review on this "RACIST" place on yelp for another HORRIBLE experience! But my buddy wanted to go yo local place and he duped me Into coming here on a fight night!   I wrote this review already and I think they got it removed because it was so damaging to what they call "business motto"!  I WILL MAKE THIS SIMPLE!  I went to this place to watch a fight with a buddy!  I am not a big drinker!! I ordered one drink!! JUST ONE! My buddy had two drinks I believe and he also happened to also not order free bag of chips and salsa! But they made they way from behind the bar to our table! SPLENDID!!!!! Fight is over and i want to pay my bill will honor and dignity!! NOPE NOT TODAY!!   The waitress brings the bills, my bill is over charged! So i asked her why am i being charged for chips and salsa! "Hold on lemme get the manager!"   This Sorry excuse of a manager walks to our table and requested the issue! As I explained to him that you are over charging customers, he states "i do it to everyone and no one has a issue but you!"   Ok, Manager today you will not over charge me and you will correctly charge me so i can be on my way!!   He violently yells at me and tells me to get out but then remembers he has to get rid of the evidence so he voids my transaction!  Charges My friend because he paid before me and DIDNT notice the over charge!   THIS PLACE IS RACIST!! THE way that Manager treated me as if we meet him before! I am a minority!! Why would he treat me as if i am hanging around this place! I was a patron and he treat me less then human after I discovered they COVID Gorging secret!! If allowed i will add pictures of receipt! Second bad experience i was in where i found myself being yelled at by a WOODROW employee while trying to pay!! I HAD TO WRITE ANOTHER REVIEW because they may have removed my other one!! I just want an explanation on why are you doing this to customers and why are you so aggressive with black customers! He was emotionally violent and it scared me so i walked away!  I just want clarity and a non aggressive place to have a beer or watch a fight in SOUTH AUSTIN while being BLACK!! Nothing much!

reviews.author: Kristina H.
reviews.description: Loved this little place , had good atmosphere and some comedy . Food truck burgers were so good

reviews.author: Dmitri J.
reviews.description: I like this location although the building could use a massive upgrade at this stage. The staff is attentive, the beer selection is dope, and having a traditional low key sports bar on the south side has been great. The food trucks that are adjacent never seem to be open when I come but the walk up Brooklyn Pie Co. is a game changer. All in all if you are a south sided looking for sports and cools beer with friendly service Little Woodrow's south is a safe bet. Just don't expect Bella and whistles. That's not what they do.

reviews.author: Clarity A.
reviews.description: This is a great place to get drinks and watch sports. However on a day when the temperature is 30 degrees, I wish they would close the door. We might as well be sitting outside. Looks like a ski lodge with everyone bundled up. Not to mention covid and cedar are both high right now. Furthermore if I was running this establishment I think people would be more inclined to drink more if they weren't freezing their asses off. Anyways it's a great place just seems like a no brainer to close the door on a below freezing day so your customers are more comfortable.

reviews.author: Kylee K.
reviews.description: Such a cool place to hangout at! Weekend or weekday!   We went on a Friday night. $5.50 fireballs and $4.50 big mugs!   They have indoor and outdoor seating, a fire pit, TVs,  swings and bochee ball.   They are located right next to Brooklyn Pie Co. and they also have a Mexican food truck on site!   Dog friendly is always a plus!   21+ after 5pm.

reviews.author: Gail H.
reviews.description: Near the end of the day I had to take my mother to the emergency room (never fun).  The outcome was a good one, but the day was long.  My son and I decided to wind down at Little Woodrow's. Temp was in the 30s that night, but they have a really big and nice fire pit outside.    We arrived around midnight:30 on a Monday and the crowd was light and fairly quiet.We sat in a booth not far from the door (but also not far from the bar).  Only one bartender that night so the wait seemed a little long, but there was really no reason for them to staff two bartenders on a Monday evening.    Drinks were good, conversation was easy (no need to yell at each other because the crowd wasn't loud), and the place was nice and clean (restrooms too).  This was my first visit to Little Woodrow's, but I'd go back :-)

reviews.author: Rachel T.
reviews.description: In What world do you go to Little Woodrow's and get AN OL FASHION MIXED with club soda... I'll tell you which ONE, Woodrows Southpark Meadows because they are adding  club  soda  to  their whiskey so therefore they use the illusion of giving you a decent serving. It's just a serving of club and a 1/2 shot of whiskey. News flash that's not part of the recipe... It is essentially orange pill to wipe around the rim, whiskey Pour  over an ice ball/block, bitters and then it's not meant to be shaken it's meant to be stirred   Yuck!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: Since I am the Yelp duchess of the UFC gym in Southpark meadows, I had to check out the UFC gym sponsored event at Little Woodrow's. As a side note, Cowboy Harley Davidson also co-sponsered the event. There was give aways and a chance to ride on a bike (it was stationary). I had a chance since I know the manager at UFC, to put my skills to the test and throw on some gloves and do some of my kick ass kickboxing moves. However, having been maybe drunk/heavily buzzed at the time this happened, I was more concerned of not falling on my ass and less concerned on my actual technique.   I honestly a little excited for this event because I really couldn't wait to see some of the UFC fights on the fight card. Plus I got a chance to check out Little Woodrow's since it is close to my house.   Overall Little Woodrow's is a dive bar. They don't serve food and it is strictly about the booze. You can order from the pizza place next door but if you read my review of that place I would recommend getting food else where.   Anyway, the bar also had a dusty dirty chiller machine with jager and whiskey fireball bottles chilled and ready for shots. I will say they need to clean that fan that keeps it cool before it catches on fire. haha This bar was great for watching the fights since they have multiple TVs and a huge big screen that comes down.

reviews.author: Ryn B.
reviews.description: I only started coming here, reluctantly, after the bar at the end of my street closed and this became the closest adult beverage dispensary. I've warmed up to it quite a bit. From what I can tell, it operates really well and you're gonna get consistency.  Things of note: - Large patio space with plenty of seating and TVs - I don't really care for sportsball, but they play all the big games, matches, etc. and a lot of people turn out to watch, and the community is just *fun* - Open mic standup on Mondays (it's not terrible usually!) - Attentive bartenders; have twice seen them taking care of too-inebriated patrons. - Good food truck, also have popcorn (from a local place) - Very regulated with last call and when you have to finish your drink by. They will be open at the posted hours. - Patrons can get a little crazy but they're almost always friendly.  A solid bar, by far the best in Southpark Meadows.

reviews.author: Joey R.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to spend a chill night. They have corn hole,live music and friendly service. Perfect place to let loose and enjoy a happy hour.  They have a patio that is shaded by large trees and protects from the sun.

reviews.author: Susan N.
reviews.description: Walked in the bar and no one greeted myself or my husband. Every table except one was full. The table had fake skeletons sitting in a booth so we couldn't use that table... they lost service over fake skeletons that shouldn't be out, it's about to be December lol. Oh well, never going back.

reviews.author: Ben L.
reviews.description: First time here and I'm loving it so far! They have a big backyard with a stage and also in the front. Lots of game time screens with a giant one in the middle for the main game! Love the atmosphere! It's fun and lively!

reviews.author: Ashley F.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this place. I go about twice a week. I love talking to the regulars there. They put up with my rambunctious puppy and the beer is great. My two favorite brews are the Big Ben and the green room. I also enjoyed the open mic comedy night.  Pros: 1. Plenty of seating  2. Lovely bartenders and Barbacks  3. Nice ambience  4. Free comedy show 5. Christmas lights and a Christmas decorated cactus  6. Friendly people 7. Dog friendly 8. Easy and free parking  9. Great food I ordered pizza and wings from Brooklyn pie company

reviews.author: Diego R.
reviews.description: I had an awful experience at the south park meadows location. After being IDd at the door I was harassed by a server while already sitting. It might have been racially fueled as I was the onlyHispanic person sitting at the table. Nobody else's was asked to re show ID and we're able to receive service. I will never come back and I urge you to spend your money elsewhere. The staff is as unprofessional and rude as they come. They ruined my night along with everyone I was with. If I could leave zero stars I would. DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE! There are many other bars with better atmosphere where you won't get harassed!

reviews.author: Aaron C.
reviews.description: I have been coming to this bar for the last year.  Unfortunately, on my visit tonight, i found myself a bit surprised by my bill.  Tuesday night is "big beer night", which means that 22 oz drafts are the same price as 16 oz drafts.  Cool.  I drank  3 22oz lone star drafts.  Pints of lone star are 3.00, so, i was a little surprised when my tab was over $13.  I asked about it, and was told that lone star was different.  This had me start doing Math.  Apparently, on normal nights, 16Ox is $3, while 22oz is 5.50.  Your paying almost $.07 more per ounce on a 22oz glass than on a pint.  Even with the minimal discount of "big beer night", you are STILL paying more per ounce on a 22oz beer than on a 16oz beer.  Way to screw your customers  LW.  You now have one less customer.

reviews.author: Jess R.
reviews.description: Great place to watch the fight. Guy bartender was so nice and easy going. Only complaint is that a y'all curly haired bartender with a cap on OVERCHARGED MY DRINKS. My total was supposed to be $12.99 and she said $14. I just let her keep the $1 since she needed it so bad.. but cmon now. Stop over charging. Especially sober people.. but def recommend this place. Just watch the SNEAKY bartender.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This place...this place is AWESOME!  So don't come here.  You are going to make the crowd bigger and then you will take my seat at the bar and this will just get awkward.  Just kidding...maybe.  I love that they offer several cider options and that they check on you often.  I never feel like I was forgotten about.    No cover for UFC and the regulars that come here are just as friendly.  I actually met a couple of people here and we now hang out together.  Thank you Little Woodrow's for helping me grow my social circle!  They usually have something fun going on as well.  Totally my go to spot on a Saturday night when there is a good fight on to watch.

name: Haymaker
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night

reviews.author: Blair B.
reviews.description: Dom and Justin had the best service! Welcoming and great catering for to the large crowd there for gameday!   They were great at recommending drink options! Five stars for the two of them!

reviews.author: Hayden H.
reviews.description: Marvelous bar, excellent atmosphere. Foot with a higher ceiling than it reaches.  For example, their namesake "Haymaker" entree would be excellent, but someone decided to dilute and diminish that excellence with tomato and lettuce.

reviews.author: Wayne S.
reviews.description: Awesome and chill spot with good food and bevs. Jason, our host this evening, is fantastic (just like his shirt says). He recommended the melted gruyere with chips. Delicious.

reviews.author: Brenden K.
reviews.description: We visited here. with friends last Friday. It was our first time since moving to the area. The venue was packed but the spacious outdoor seating still made everything feel comfortable.  Our server was kind and put up with my wife's and mine poor ordering habits. My wife got the croque monsieur, and I got the pressed Cuban burger. Both were very good. We also got the chips with Gruyère cheese sauce. Also delicious.  Their drinks were okay, nothing to write home about. I'd stick to beers here.  Overall we had a good experience and would come back either just for dinner for us, or with friends.

reviews.author: Se N.
reviews.description: The foods was okay cause of it was that it going to make you full but it not like on wow the best tasty juicy but I just guess you gotta try it for yourself . The bar was okay it wasn't that like clean I see dust's and  the bar kinda smell like funky lol. But overall you just gotta try it for yourself and see what you think :):

reviews.author: Jiyoon S.
reviews.description: Super casual local neighborhood bar vibes here, nothing out of the ordinary but nothing terrible. The food can be hit or miss but you're really coming for the drink specials let's be real.   Perfect place to get a bit rowdy and a bit tipsy before heading to greener and possibly rowdier pastures

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: Super chill and casual bar with indoor and outdoor seating. Great service and I love the cherry limeade frozen drink. Parking is a pain in the booty during peak hours but that's expected for the area.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: While this place holds the unique position of THE #1 Austin establishment in which you are most likely to find yourself surrounded by belligerent, toxic cis dudes (I mean a specific brand of Panhellenic acolytes who casually and *very audibly* rank women as they walk past), I still on occasion like to come here if I am nearby and a friend suggests we swing by for a quick happy hour bevvie. Their happy hour is pretty great. Still, I never stay longer than an hour, because as I mentioned, it is _toxic_ bro city up in this bar, unfortunately.  As for their food, their poutine is delicious. As is their Wisconsin Wurst, and honestly most of their sandwiches are up to par. The bar staff are always kind and helpful.  I only wish the environs were a bit less nauseating.

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: Nice bar. Quiet for a Monday around 2. Our server was attentive. My rosebud drink was good and refreshing. Food was good bar food. It got warm inside. I would get the wings again and come back to try their sandwiches but we just wanted a bunch of apps.

reviews.author: Andoni S.
reviews.description: On the whole I was sadly a bit disappointed in the quality of food and experience at Haymaker.  On the experience, their mobile web UI is very dated and not fully functional: we ordered online for in-restaurant pickup, and never received a confirmation via phone or email that our order had been placed. After waiting some time, I went inside to check on our order status, and they indicated it had not been received. Slightly inconvenienced, I placed the same order again in person. A few minutes later, the server let me know that the web order had, in fact, come through, and that they were producing one order and a separate, duplicate order. I asked them to cancel the original order placed through their mobile website, but their system does not allow for reversal of web orders. I had the in-person order reversed, having encountered friction while attempting to simply place an order at several steps along the way.  On the food, their grilled chicken sandwich was substandard quality at best. The meat was rubbery, and the secondary ingredients (lettuce, tomato, pickles, bun) were of pretty transparently low quality. I'm open to giving it another shot, but the first-time experience was, all things considered, an unfortunate one.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Great spot! The staff awkwardly removed these annoying Texas fans for my Villanova meetup.   Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: Pretty cool spot to hang out. Met with a couple friends to play some poker and have some beers. :)   Parking was easy since they have their own lot and you are socially distanced with other tables.  We haven't tried any of their foods, but the beer selection was good. I'd come back here again!

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Been here a couple of times pre covid and once fairly recently. Their outdoor space is a great spot to hang out and watch a game with plenty of tvs and well spaced out tables. They have reopened for indoor dining but when I went in to use the bathroom the space between fairly crowded tables was definitely too close for comfort.   In terms of food they have a pretty nice variety of out there sandwich/burger options along with typical bar fare. While I appreciate the variety I've found most of the food I've tried to be okay at best. Most recently I've tried the wings and Italian hoagie. The wings were super bready and the sauces weren't very flavorful. The roast beef and sausage on the hoagie were also both fairly bland.   They have some pretty solid drink specials (when I last went on a Tuesday all Texas beers were 3$) and compared to similar spots they have a really wide selection of options.   Overall, I think the vibe here is great and the drink deals are hard to beat. But between the less than stellar food and questionable crowd control I can't say I'd recommend coming by in the near future.

reviews.author: Emma D.
reviews.description: Haymaker is my go to spot. I come way too often, but the vibes are just too good! My friends and I will sit for hours and always have the best time. There is always tons of cute pups around, which is never a bad thing. Everyone is great, but if you get Justin or Abbey... you are in for a treat! Good options for vegetarians/vegans. The pretzel bites rock my socks. Overall, Haymaker does not disappoint.

reviews.author: Ryan M.
reviews.description: I've been living next door to and coming to Haymaker for years and they often reserve a part of the bar for fan clubs which is a little strange. The problem is they don't know how to communicate or remove people from the reserved area without being assholes about it. The sad thing is that our business with 70+ employees is located just down the street at The Station and now we will be going to Love Supreme or Oddwood or Batch or The Vortex for any happy hours.

reviews.author: Anndie K.
reviews.description: I've never had a bad experience at this place. The service is good and the beer is cold, however tonight I was eating my spinach dip (from a to go order) and bit into a STAPLE. I tried calling about it, unfortunately nobody answered. I am 7 months pregnant so this is kinda scary.

reviews.author: Byron S.
reviews.description: The patty melt was so-so. Not a true patty melt but a cheeseburger on Texas toast. I applaud their service on paper trays from an environmental perspective but presentation was unappealing.

reviews.author: Xiao Z.
reviews.description: The sandwich is sooooo tasty! The cheese, turkey breast, ham, with apple slices are really good combination. And the toast was perfectly cooked, a little bit crispy. The coleslaw was also quite refreshing. Service was excellent.

reviews.author: Stephen S.
reviews.description: Treated my friends like ass today. Should treat native Texans with respect and not use " go back to California " line they use often.

reviews.author: John G.
reviews.description: Disrespectful to Texas Alum. Removed us from the dart area because Vila-no-one-cares was playing basketball. I was about to win a 1K dart game and they ended it with abruptness and rudensess. Bar tender told me "go back to california" told the guy can u read my shirt says "Texas" just came from the basketball game.. sad...

name: Hi Hat Public House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Julia C.
reviews.description: Pros: The food is delicious, the service was friendly and great, the venue is small and cozy.   Cons: We didn't experience any negatives...but I could imagine there being a long wait during peak hours.   We loved the tar tar, the burgers, the Mac and cheese, and spicy Brussels sprouts. Yum!

reviews.author: Chelsea M.
reviews.description: I cannot wait for this place to come back! They have an amazing, mouth-watering burger that's the perfect size to leave you satisfied but not stuffed.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: On the corner across from Livestrong you'll find Hi Hat - an establishment that knows what it's doing.  I stopped in during the week with no preconceived notions or ideas of what to expect. So what did I learn? Its a cool little craft beer bar with some great food items.  The night we came in they had a distributor there handing out all kinds of marketing swag, stickers and such. It wasn't pushy at all it was just laid back and I loved it.  The beer list now that is a headache - there's so many choices! OMG :)  It's around the corner for me and I have already stopped in about 3 times. Each visit has been the same for me - just perfect.  So far it isn't log jammed with crowds of people which I enjoy being able to sit without the typical ATX line w/a 20 min or more wait. Let's hope they are busy enough to stay around but not too much that I can't sit right away! ;)  Thanks for the great local vibe you put on guys. I love it!

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Came back to try a few more things that had been calling my name from the menu. I realllllly wanted to try the soft pretzel because reviews were good and it looked amazing! The first few bites while it was hot were so good, but as it cooled off and I became satiated, it was just alright. I wouldn't be surprised if the cheese sauce that came with it was the same as the sauce on their macaroni and cheese. I think it tasted familiar. I gave the tomato soup another try, and it was just alright too. It's got a funny tangy metallic aftertaste. House pickles were fresh and interesting but I could only eat so much before they became overpowering. This time they included beets, green beans, and okra. I checked on their spiciness and was told they had a kick, but it wasn't too bad for me. I hate to say that the best thing I had was a free piece of Halloween candy from the bar. I really want to like this place. The owner was there most evenings and is friendly. However the food never meets expectations and is a little pricier than I'd consider appropriate.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Popped by Hi Hat Public House on Saturday night due to the amazing reviews on Yelp. Have to admit it, I was kind of underwhelmed. The bar was sparsley populated for a Saturday night, though they did have a live band playing.  I got a Founders Solid Gold beer for $5.50 and ordered the pork belly hoagie for $12. The food came out pretty quick, but it felt like the kitchen staff wanted to get ouf of there and kind of rushed it together. It was just OK, not the kind of food I'd expect from a 4.5* establishment.  Nothing really wrong with the place, but I don't see how the ratings are so high. Perhaps there's people living in the building and they're just pleased to have a better than average bar in their building? I don't live here, so I don't know if I'll ever make it back in.  Bottom line: good bar, but so many bars in Austin, it didn't grab me as anything amazing.

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: Stopped by after work today, not too busy and I got a spot at the bar. They had a huge beer selection and they also had wine.  I had a beer and the special of the day burger, it was cooked perfectly and delicious, just the right size. I opted for Mac and cheese and that was delicious too, I had a big enough portion that I took half home.  I'd come by again. It was worth the trip.

reviews.author: Janny T.
reviews.description: So happy that the Hi Hat is back open. They're doing a great job disinfecting everything and keeping everything tidy. The food is delicious and so are the drinks. For vegetarians, they have the best avocado toast I've ever had and that's coming from someone in LA where we are as basic as it gets. I've also had their shrimp benedict that is not currently on their menu which is so yummy. Lastly, I usually don't like micheladas but they make the best!! The mix is homemade and it taste like perfection with the new Zilker rice beer. Thank you!

reviews.author: Jamel O.
reviews.description: On a recent visit to Hi Hat, our group sat at the bar while a band played music.  I got chicken wings.  They were not your normal fried wings, they seemed like a flavorful baked wings hybrid.  Different but not bad, because I was hungry and they had the kitchen open late.  There is outdoor seating as well.

reviews.author: Leah S.
reviews.description: Cool spot, with good food and drinks. More low key than expected, but still cool vibes. Parking may be harder to find than some places (street parking).

reviews.author: Zain R.
reviews.description: We were walking around on what was quite possibly the rainiest weekend this year so far and went to another place which had a 30-45 minute wait time. We walked around thinking we'll have to go back to our friend's apartment and drive somewhere when we ended up at this place purely by happenstance.   The good, the bad, and the ugly:  The good: The presentation of the food is so pleasing to the senses. Just as pleasing as it is to look at it, it is equally pleasing to your taste buds. I substituted my chips for the beets and oh boy, what a great a choice that was! The guy taking the order (Oh, btw, you have to order at the bar) told me that some people don't like them because they taste too earthy. I have never understood how people cannot enjoy eating beets. The highlight of the entree was supposed to be the portobello mushroom burger served on a bed of creams with some guacamole and aioli but the side of beets totally took the center stage. The vinaigerette they were sitting in when mixed with the cheese totally elevated the dish and give it so much dimension once you really mix it in together. You really want to take pictures and tell your food that this one is for the gram. I'll let the photos speak for themselves  The bad: Portions are a little bit on the smaller side but that could possibly be because we have huge portions in Houston. Or that I have a food addiction. No one else seemed to have that problem so you can just ignore the last statement. But, the service was a little lacking even though the restaurant was pretty empty.   The ugly: This does not necessarily apply to me but my friend is a vegan and they don't carry soy milk. Their reasoning, we put it out but no one used it and we were throwing it away. Solution could be, just give it to people who ask for it?!  I think, overall, we had a really good time over here. The food was great. On Sundays, they have live music where we were told that the music doesn't get so loud that you are not able to hold a normal conversation.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Rolled in here for the first time on Saturday afternoon and had my eye on their reuben. I was NOT disappointed! They brine their corned beef for 11days and it is juicy, crumbly perfection! The kraut they use is actually on par as well, w/the perfect balance of sweet and sour.  I am not gonna lie, the reuben here might just hold a candle to my all-time ATX fav at Waller. They are different stylistically, but both hold their own.  While I was here Saturday, I did their little sampler pour of one of my fav high abv beers, Wake up Dead on nitro by Left Hand. It was just what I wanted. At 10.2%, doing a full pour is a bit much, but their little $3 sampler was perfection.
