I also discovered their "Wine Wednesdays" during my Saturday visit and after the gracious bartender Phil (who I have affectionately nicknamed "GreenBay") let me sample their 1000 Stories Bourbon Barrel Aged Zin. I was smitten from first whiff and in full lust after the first sip. I knew I had to return to make a half price $44 btl mine!  As luck would have it, my schedule allowed me to come in on the following Wed. I am not going to lie, I was so looking forward to doing damage to a bottle of a 1000 Stories all by my lonesome. However, because my "luck" has always been spelled w/a capital "F", they had just sold their last btl of 1KStories when I walked in. I was heartbroken. But, the wonderfully empathetic staff here not only let me sample the Substance Cab (it was a lovely cab, but I had my heart set on the BB-aged Zin!) before offering me a glass from the last open btl at HH pricing. GreenBay even let me kill what little remained at the end of the night. Great service will always make or break any experience, in my opinion.  It was busier than usual due to it being ATX Beer Week, but even the patrons at this place were gracious. There was not a seat to be had in the house and this kind man at the bar let me have the very tightly squeezed-in seat next to him.  BTW, the reuben here is so nice I had to have it twice! It was just as perfectly delicious the 2nd time as it was the first.  I will definitely be back the next chance I get for another attempt at Wine Wednesday and anytime I need an old school reuben fix. So glad I discovered this place, its vibe, and wonderful staff!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This is definitely not what I expected when walking up. It is more of a hole in the wall type bar nestled in definitely austin. Parking is hard to find so be prepared. The food was just okay and the service was eh. They do have a large selection of beers though. The place is very small inside a d the bathroom are somewhat outside....sucks in a cold night. It's definitely an interesting little find. Not one of my favorites though.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Came only for the beer. 2 dozen taps and although mostly local, they hit all the types. Packed inside but nice patio that's extremely dog friendly. Parking is street and WiFi available. Free music co Stanton with a stage literally in the corner ready to go on short notice. Specials daily and happy hour until 7pm on Tuesday through Thursday. Food looked good but I was here for the beer. Fresh draft line makes me happy so no complaints here. One TV and friendly service. Floor and tables clean and although loud it's not in your head intrusive. Really can't ask for much more from a neighborhood bar.

reviews.author: Jannifer K.
reviews.description: Love, laughter, and happiness. That's what I feel when I come to Hi-Hat. I visited not too long ago and had their eggs benedict for Sunday brunch which was nothing short of amazing. He ordered the Hi-Hat plate which he also enjoyed. We ate and marveled at the talented jazz band that was finishing up their set. This place is cozy, has an enormous selection of beer, and a knockout menu for you to explore (with daily specials). I would come here again and again.  10/10 would recommend this place to others.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Wow!  I just love this place ... small menu and all items cooked to perfection!  Weekends include brunch until 4:30 and Sunday comes with live jazz!  Standout items include the veggie taco and steak and eggs!

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: First off, we wasn't planning to come here but looked what was in the area and this place popped up. When you go in, the area is a bit small. You can grab a menu off the wall and then order from the bar. They have a few chairs for bar seating and about 6 tables inside varying from a two seater to a six seater, and there are about 3-4 tables outside and then a bar top around the patio. If it is pretty warm, I would definitely recommend sitting inside. They said that this was the busiest they'd been so food took longer to come out than usual 30 min-1 hour. It was definitely worth the wait! I ordered the eggs Benedict with a cilantro sauce on top and it had chorizo as well! It was greatly prepared and was the perfect amount of food. The biscuits and gravy are also pretty darn good! You can pick how you want your eggs with it, and it also comes with bacon. We only did self serve water, but our total was $26...in the halfway mark price range. WORTH IT THOUGH! The staff are polite and try to do everything to accommodate you and keep up with other customers/work. The only reason I knocked off a star is due to the seating inside, making it hard to fit everyone!

reviews.author: Lucy L.
reviews.description: The people here are cool. And the food is good. I like the vibe of this joint. We ordered some beer, eggs benedict, Mac n cheese, and spicy brussel sprouts. Can't say that I've ever had chorizo in my Egga Benedict so that was interesting. I'm not sure if I love it but it's def decent. I'll have to say the mac n cheese stole the show hands down. I added it to my order after the bartender and another customer both recommended it. I don't normally eat mac n cheese but I'd def order theirs again!

reviews.author: Shveta M.
reviews.description: 4.75. An amazing brunch spot, a great casual place for a low-key dinner and beer, and the staff are so friendly. I crave their roasted beet salad and pop in frequently just for it.   They have a spot-on beer selection and their Mac and cheese is to die for.   Beware of their spicy Brussel sprouts - they're spicy!  If you go for brunch, they have mimosa pitchers for a reasonable price. And order the Hi Hat Plate. It is absolutely the best brunch dish I've had. Crunchy, zesty, filling and indulgent!

reviews.author: Meagan W.
reviews.description: We rented an Airbnb within walking distance of the Hi Hat. We came for appetizers and beer before an evening tour we had scheduled. The owner greeted us and came over to chat...really nice guy with a lot of well deserved pride in his establishment. We ordered 4 appetizers as a meal. THEY WERE HUGE!!! Easily could have just had two! Everything was delicious. Their pretzels are the best I've ever had, taco was amazing... it was all great. Excellent beer selection on tap, and good live music too!

reviews.author: Ryen B.
reviews.description: Lunch on the patio while in the area for work. The roasted mushroom sammy with avo spread, roasted tomatoes, and pickles was great. The buttery brioche roll- yum! The side of roasted brussels were also tasty, the serving too big for one person. I'm not typically a sandwich fan, but if you are, this place is a good option.

name: Little Woodrow's - Austin
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Okay okay okay listen up everyone. if you happen to go to little woodrows on 6th street, make sure to ask for Coco. She is the best bartender ever!!! So nice, thoughtful, helpful, and efficient. Nothing more, just amazing!!!

reviews.author: Cole A.
reviews.description: I dare you to poop in the guys bathroom. Also, this place is dope and as a bonus, there is a guy named Glen that works there and gives free foot rubs.   Go. Drink beer. Experience a Glen massage. Enjoy your life. That's all.

reviews.author: Monica T.
reviews.description: Probably one of the most disappointing places. The bartender was terrible and there was only 4-5 other people there.

reviews.author: Garrett F.
reviews.description: Gotta get the tacos!  Probably about the best tacos I've ever had. Bar area is great lots of outdoor seating. Bartenders really kind and fun!

reviews.author: Niguel B.
reviews.description: Went in for some tacos. Tacos were great. Got a beer. Bartender was stand-offish and unfriendly. At one point my friend got sick and I checked on her by calling for her outside the woman's bathroom. I was aggressively confronted by a little blond bartender for opening the door to the woman's bathroom. She knocked my full glass of beer out my hand and kicked me out like I was Jeffery Epstein trying to enter a daycare. Worst experience. I hope that bartender slips on a lime and falls on the shattered glass of the beer she knocked out my hand.

reviews.author: Kassidy E.
reviews.description: This is a very cool bar located in downtown Austin. They have a taco truck and a very large selection of drinks. The prices are very good. The tacos from the truck were very tasty. The salsa was extremely spicy but very good.

reviews.author: Carolyn A.
reviews.description: Open air sports bar right on 6th.  Lots of outside space  with tv coverage. Downside is drinks are pricey, and staffing short for the table #s. Plan to travel on foot or other public transport parking is rare and $$.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: This place is wonderful for Sunday football viewing! The atmosphere is fun and they allow dogs. They have plenty of tv screens, a taco truck on site, and decently priced drinks. They have a variety of games on and even when they couldn't get one on the tv for us, they put it on the speakers. At least the tried! The waitresses are friendly and service is quick. We'll definitely be back for more Sunday football and drinks!

reviews.author: Trip S.
reviews.description: Best bar in Austin. I come here for football games, hinge dates, post bike ride beers, and sometimes just to talk to the cool ass staff.  Prettiest bartenders downtown, coolest management. Or prettiest management, coolest bartenders. It's all about perspective.

reviews.author: Eric H.
reviews.description: Really cool spot to watch Sunday NFL football. The outdoor area is great, and there are no shortages of TVs. The food truck seems to be the only option for food which is tough because your options are very limited.   Considering games kickoff at Noon, this was perfect for the first half, but we ended up leaving for another bar with a full food menu around halftime of the early slate. Awesome drinking spot that i imagine is a blast on a super nice day

reviews.author: Gillian W.
reviews.description: Loved stopping in here before Covid, sure do miss them! always loved the service and ambience. I'm not sure if they are open again yet, I would assume no, since a lot of downtown things aren't open but hope to get back there some day.. sigh

reviews.author: Dan C.
reviews.description: Had a great time this weekend watching both pay-per-view events of the UFC and Boxing. Great atmosphere. Good prices on drinks and the foot truck was awesome. On a cold night, it was nice they had heaters pretty much everywhere. Tv's also everywhere you could look.

reviews.author: Dee R.
reviews.description: I don't even know how this is excusable.... it's 9:30pm on a Sunday... i didn't want to be that jerk asking for the manager but I'm glad I did! They said it was an "accident" and fixed my bill down to $5 (price of drink, no discount, which is fine). I didn't get an apology and the manager tried to play this off as if we were friends. I don't know these people and they tried to charge me $40 for a well drink. I understand I'm young and drinking but I expect basic decency. Once I accidentally spoke to the manager, my bill was fixed.....  but how many tipsy people have been screwed over by this bull?

reviews.author: Michael K.
reviews.description: If I could leave a one star review I would. Cops came to this place on Jan 18 2021 and they refused to let anyone else in even after the fact the cops left. They accused me and my friends of being too drunk to go through, i felt violated and disrespected. I am not one to write reviews but this was necessary. They need to know how they disrespected my wife who is military and my friends.

reviews.author: Chelsea V.
reviews.description: I would leave zero stars if I could. The bouncer at this place was being very disrespectful today is Monday 18 January 2021. I am military and this act is very disrespectful to me and my friends. We weren't allowed at all and were accused of being too "drunk" after not having any conversation with this bouncer.

reviews.author: John L.
reviews.description: Was coming here for a few months when I first moved to town and service was pretty good. Seems to have changed pretty dramatically though since then. Last three times Ive been here for football on Sunday and each time whole sections of the bar have been staring around looking for a non-existent waitress for thirty minutes at a time. This most recent visit I got a beer when I first sat down and literally didn't see a waitress for an entire half of football after that. When I finally did get another beer ordered they forgot it four times. That is not an exaggeration. FOUR times. The fourth time I was slightly annoyed as you'd imagine and she acted like I spit in her face and gave ME all sorts of attitude...like I'm some prick for asking for the beer Ive paid for and that you keep forgetting?? I just go to Rustic Tap next door now.

reviews.author: Michael E.
reviews.description: First of all, if you are a Seahawks fan like me, GO HERE!! They have a great little food truck attached called "One Taco" which has really good food, and Little Woodrows definitely has a great selection of draft beers  (in two separate bars that you can grab it from) along with a great environment. The staff is super friendly and remembers you if you come in often which makes it a fun place to go.  I don't  come here a ton outside of Sundays for gameday, so I can't give too much advice on whether or not it is the place to go on other evenings

reviews.author: Nick N.
reviews.description: Food: 4/5 Service: 4/5 Cleanliness: 3/5 Decor and Style: 4/5  Spacious outdoor seating and really fun to hang out for a sports event. Not a good place for dining, but better for sports and late night snacks/beer.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: I love it when live music is in the house . It makes the experience at Little Woodrow's even better . The crowd connects with the music and the fun begins.  The staff works so hard to serve the customers and do not seem overwhelmed .  My wife and Have seemed Little Woodrow's as our fun destination

reviews.author: Selena K.
reviews.description: I like that they had a bar in the middle of the city where you could sit outside and enjoy everything that's going on. They did also have space heaters but not too many. There is also a covered outdoor area but no heaters under those. They have tons of tvs so a perfect place to watch a game. The indoor part of the bar is tiny. Definitely don't go there if you want to be inside. From what I saw there was no lawn games like other Little Woodrow's like cornhole. I think I did see a ring game but that was all. They have multiple bars however during the day only the inside one was open. I loved the vibe though, really chill and perfect to be in the feel of Austin. The best part was the food truck there One Taco. This is the only food there in comparison to the ones in San Antonio with full menus. Would definitely come back!

name: Violet Crown Social Club
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: We have been here a couple of times and it is usually our last stop on the Eastside before heading home. We love the vibe here and you can always quickly score a strong pour even when they are busy.  During SXSW we figured it would be wall-to-wall and we were pleasantly surprised to find the bar area pretty empty (the patio area was jammed). We scored a nice side booth that was great for people watching.  They do have some decent beers available and if you have the munchies there is a food truck on site. Good pours and a good vibe...

reviews.author: Tayo F.
reviews.description: This place has my vote for 2 reasons. 1) the drinks are nice a cheap 2) The sandwiches from the food truck gave me day dreams for days. Who knew something so simple as a mac n cheese sandwich with a tomato dipping sauce could cause this type of euphoria. Mis that with the porch outside with a view of 6th street and it a great place to spend an early evening

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Solid dive bar with lots of space to hang out in. Pretty cozy with the booths and outdoor patio seating. Great place to end night in east Austin.

reviews.author: Jordan W.
reviews.description: Violet Crown is a perfect way to end your night on East 6th. We stopped in late on a Friday evening, and sat in their expansive patio for drinks and conversation. The place was full enough, but wasn't exceptionally packed like many other spots on this street, making for a more relaxed vibe. Their creamy orange frozen drinks were a dream, and we had several, served up by a friendly and unpretentious bartender. We look forward to coming back on our next trip.

reviews.author: Matthew L.
reviews.description: Random divey-ish bar that was playing Mad Max Fury Road and the basketball games on TV - two of my favorite things: good movies and sports.  The prices for drinks were affordable as well, and a good variety of music was playing - definitely a good spot for a casual drink.

reviews.author: Blue A.
reviews.description: TLDR: Cool bar, local beers. The pizza outside thooo. ___  I came in while I waited for my pizza being made in a little truck outside. I knew I had about 15 minutes so I thought it would be the perfect chance to catch up on social media and drink something local.  I got a local hefe ($7). It was really good. Super friendly staff. The bar is cool - kinda divey and just really chill. I took a seat outside in the little patio and the pizza folks will actually bring the pizza in for you - clutch.

reviews.author: Megan R.
reviews.description: This bar is a hidden gem! Looks very deceiving from the outside and entrance, but once you get in, it's a romantic and unique ambiance. The bar tenders create crafty cocktails (even when not in the menu) and always present you with a glass of water upon seating. I've tried 4 different cocktails and they were all very impressive. Full of flavor and crafted to perfection.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: My roommate tells me I've been to Violet Crown Social Club... before we moved to Austin and we were in town looking at apartments. I don't believe him. I finally went this past weekend since I didn't remember going before and dug the spot. Not as social Shangri La, but on a Friday night they had a sign up for $3 wells and had decent music playing, so it was A-OK with me. I'll have to work this place into my bar rotation.

reviews.author: Kara M.
reviews.description: Great happy hour and always cheap drinks other wise. Dim lit inside with booths along the walls. There is a patio out back with picnic tables and tables. Just had an Iron Claw and it was delicious. It's a black cherry white claw in a glass of Violet Crowns signature drink Iron Whip.   Cluck-n-Burger is the new food truck outside. Great burgers, wings, and shared plates. I would recommend the buffalo burger and crispy red potatos. The meat and cheese charcuterie is delicious too.

reviews.author: Linday C.
reviews.description: Violet is a reliable sweet spot to me. When you open the door, you know you can expect a nice cool, dark, rad place to have a drink. Every time I have been here it has not been overly crowded which is a good thing. We came here on a late Saturday afternoon and we were all able to get seats at the bar so we could laugh and talk to each other. I'm one of those picky people I can't drink well drinks and majorly batched sugar stuff so I asked if he could make me a skinny margarita. The The cute bartender said we usually do not have time to make skinny margaritas, but since I'm not so slammed I will gladly make one for you. He made a really good one. I am a big fan of his. My brother and his pals really liked the whip drink, a specialty frozen drink that is orange and super delicious looking.

reviews.author: Bobby H.
reviews.description: Whoooo boy. Have i been drunk in here. Solid dive. Bartenders are cool and bootleg movies galore. Plus, dope pizza when you're shithoused. What's not to love?   Park on 7th to save yourself a hassle on busier nights. Parking is way easier.

reviews.author: Sanchia R.
reviews.description: I'm not a big fan of bars but I did enjoy this bar. I got drunk and that was the point, so no complaints and it was a super clean.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: I would say I am absolutely a fan of Violet Crown Social Club!  The drinks are always strong and delicious.  It's cheap here which is always nice.  If you are looking for fancy this is not the place.  If you want friendly people and nice bartenders this is the reason to come here!  Plus they have some of my favorite pizza right outside from Via 313 - how can you not be a fan of this place?!  It seems anytime I am out and about on the eastside I end up stopping in here for a drink or 2 or 3.  I like to sit out back on the patio sipping on my drink and waiting for my pizza.    It's definitely a happy place for me.

reviews.author: Brandon S.
reviews.description: Cockroaches.   My group snagged a great table outside by the back door during a busy Thursday night, ordered drinks at the bar and sat down. About 5 minutes later we noticed the first 3" roach climbing the wall beside our table. We tried to just deal with it until I started spitting more roaches. Lots of them right by the backdoor. Upon confronting the bartender about the situation I received a shrug and he handed me my full check. Nobody finished their drinks and we left disgusted and without a drink. Not cool.

reviews.author: Chad H.
reviews.description: I always try to stop here when I visit the East side. Pretty cheap drinks and they have had Adelberts Triple B on draft for like $4 when I have visited!! A MUST GET for any beer drinker!  I think everyone knows about the infamous 313 pizza!  I love this place!

reviews.author: Geoffrey C.
reviews.description: Great drinks, great vibes, great prices. The place was pretty busy on a Saturday night, especially compared to Liberty which where I was at before here. There weren't any places to sit inside, so we opted for the outdoor. Not that many seats, but still a great place nonetheless.  There's apparently a really good pizza truck that is right outside of this place. You really can't miss it. Heard it's suppose to be amazing pizza after an amazing night out.

reviews.author: Brent W.
reviews.description: Great after work bar to hit before the late night surge comes to east sixth.  Can't wait for it to re-open and catch up with everyone.

reviews.author: Andrew K.
reviews.description: Somehow they employed a racist bouncer. I have no idea in Austin how this happens but it is really sad that it did here. This place used to be great, but clearly has gone downhill.

reviews.author: Elise V.
reviews.description: This place would be my main reason to moving to Austin. That and the Via 313 pizza trailer right next door to it.  I was wandering around Austin by myself and I found myself here. This place did not disappoint. Pretty simple and open layout inside. I actually braved the cold and sat outside admiring all the twinkly lights they had up, along with the cute hipster boys sitting at various tables smoking .   I still can't get over the fact that the drinks were so cheap here. Definite plus in my book. Having a pizza place next door made it even better. Service here is awesome. The bartenders were super cool and nice.   In the four nights I was in Austin, I was at this bar 3 nights in a row. No shame. I definitely would go back here again the next time I'm in Austin.

reviews.author: Mitch E.
reviews.description: Picking where to start the night can be tough. All the pressure is on you. Will it be good when we first get there? Does everyone like the environment? Will the bartender put on the football game your friends request?  The answer to those was no, but What can you do. You're not gonna please everyone, and seeing how this was 30 people, a third of which I didn't even know, I could care less about them. My friends were happy. That bartender could have put on the Giants game though.   Nice bar, with a great selection of drafts. The outdoor patio in the back was perfect for the evening, catching the sun as it was going down. You can even order pizza from the food truck out front. I know it's off to pizza in Austin, being from New York, but I was craving something small and satisfying. Plus it was night one of many. I needed to keep room for the rest of the vacation.

reviews.author: Cheryl K.
reviews.description: Lambert's was the reason for our return trip to Austin.  They have amazing boars ribs on the menu - so good we've talked about them since we got back from our 2015 trip.  And they were as good as we remembered.  They are on the small side, so don't try to share an order. The BBQ is delicious.  They have an extensive whiskey menu with some nice options at varying price points. There was a small outside patio area that during warmer weather appears it would be good for hanging out and dining.   Staff is friendly, knowledgeable and everything was delicious.   Be sure to get reservations because they are always busy.

reviews.author: Carolyn J.
reviews.description: Underwhelming mostly due to the awkward service. Waited at the podium alone for about 8 minutes before we were greeted (bad sign). We had reservations for lunch and were seated quickly once help arrived.  Started with queso which was disappointing after reading reviews. It's standard cheese sauce with some tiny bits of meat and bbq sauce on top. It is probably made in house but maybe not, can't tell.  I had the chicken chop -- good, filling, Outbacl-ish, too much blue cheese for any human, as expected.   Partner had the three meat (brisket/sausage/rib) which was yummy. Note that you get a single piece if each meat so don't get too excited if it feels like a deal. Filling and tasty but not a great value.  Overall I would not go back as there are too many other good BBQ options around to go to what is clearly your typical expense-account-hold-the-personality establishment.

reviews.author: Tari O.
reviews.description: Enjoyed dinner at Lamberts on a Friday evening. We made a reservation which was essential because the place is full! The restaurant is an upscale bbq restaurant  with fun takes on classics as well as an upstairs dining area with live music on certain nights. The food was delicious, perhaps overpriced(adding one sausage link was upwards $8-10). We enjoyed the waffle fries, Mac n cheese, salads, brisket, and more. We also enjoyed espressos martinis and a bottle of Pinot noir.   The only real critique was that even before our food was finished or all our dishes were served every 5 seconds someone came to ask to take our plates at one point they didn't ask and just took it. I would get it if we had been lingering for hours. This was maybe 30 Minutes in before our main course was even served. We were so annoyed we just paid and left a bit hungry. I've never experienced such a thing. Maybe they overbooked?  It's an Austin staple but there's better barbecue to be had without the hassle.

reviews.author: Shane V.
reviews.description: What can you say. It's a legend downtown Austin and it lives up to the hype. From the deviled eggs to the bbq it's fantastic. That being said, my dad had the pork chop and it was the best pork chop he's ever had. That's saying a lot.

reviews.author: Phillip D.
reviews.description: Not a completely typical TX Barbecue joint with collard greens, wild Boar ribs and other unique twists on the tradition. I got brisket which was tender, smoke forward and really good! Great service, a bit upscale and a great experience. The sides are tiny. Kind of a joke or tease because they were good. Left me wanting more. Nowhere to park so rideshare or walk.

reviews.author: Lyly D.
reviews.description: Awkward service and today's picks were not yum. Hangar steak was meh. Hot link was aiite. Hamburger was fine.

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: Great food on a Saturday night in November. The live music from upstairs was good, but plenty loud enough downstairs. Ate in a corner of a bar. Better live music and bar experience than restaurant experience. For the food and the money, there are other barbecue places in town. Good brisket. Very solid, filling, and excellent mac and cheese that felt almost concentrated or reduced. Some of the sides were quite spicy

reviews.author: Tiffany D.
reviews.description: Arrival late evening and first meal in Austin in search of bbq!   Fancy bbq and dining here and they are booked - even to the last hour prior to closing! Whew!  Luckily, there were bar seats available for 2. I can see why! The bbq shops around this one (just a couple) were out of favorable meats so this is the only spot that has all the selections on the menu and stays quite late open.   Their bbq meats, such as brisket and baby back ribs, were savory to delve into, moist and delightful! Service was superbly attentive! I adore their collard greens. Other bbq shops only serves up coleslaw and maybe string beans. Yum!   Housemade bbq sauces, went along with the meats!   For what it is as bbq dining meshed with fine setting, it is appealing here, surely!

reviews.author: Erin L.
reviews.description: I am from the midwest, I also recently went to Nashville, so I have tried good BBQ...but THIS spot was next level.  Everything here was FANTASTIC.  From the service to the food this was a 10/10 experience.    A friend who used to live in Austin recommended this spot and I couldn't be more grateful.  I came here for lunch on a Sunday before my flight out of Austin.  Upon arrival we were greeted by the host and, after we were seated, given warm mini corn bread muffins - WOW, I mean I would come here JUST for these...so delicious, and such a hospitable touch.  My friend and I wanted to share an array of item, so we ordered the two meats BBQ plate with 2 sides.  We chose the potato salad, cider braised JBQ collards, and we added a side of the mac and cheese (we just had to try it).  For the meats we got the Texas brisket and the fennel and coriander crusted pork rib.  The food came out fairly quickly and we dug in...after the camera took the first bite ;)  The food was INCREDIBLE....I can't even think of a word to describe how EXCELLENT this BBQ was...the pork ribs were out favorite but the brisket was sooo tender and delicious.  The sides were out of this world...I mean if I had to ask for a last meal, this one might be it... the mac and cheese was creamy and flavorful, the collard greens weren't overcooked or mushy, they were the perfect savory flavor and consistency.  I will say, the potato salad was good BUT if I had to only pick two sides in the future I wouldn't go with it again.  It was pretty basic and I am not always a fan of the large red potatoes in a potato salad.  The house made pickles that are included in the meal were a delicious way to round out our meal.  Compliments to the chef - the food here is something I will dream about.  If you aren't convinced already - you should ABSOLUTLEY add lamberts to your list if you are visiting for the weekend or become a regular if you live in Austin.  Next time I visit, I hope to make it for one of their live music dinner events, but just a lunch here was a treat in itself.

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: Came here for lunch and the prices seemed a bit more reasonable than the dinner menu.  The portions were very filling with a Chips and Queso and 3 Meat Platter easily filling up two adults.  Kinda wish they had more BBQ meat types available at lunch (beside other sausages).  Chipotle Queso with Burnt Ends: This appetizer so filling, it's almost like a light meal.  The queso isn't your typical microwaved Velveeta, but some sort of yummier in-house blend.  And then they toss in a bunch of BBQ meat with a nice drizzle of BBQ sauce.  There were some freshly made flour tortillas on the side, which were perfect to wrap up some cheese dipped meat.  And the thick fried corn chips were great for soaking up cheese alone.   Prime Texas Brisket: Definitely the best meat I tried here.  Thick, tender, fatty, meaty.  All the perfect things BBQ could be.  I kinda like the mustardy sauce pairing with this one more than the sweet sauce, but it's actually very tasty by itself.  Fennel and Coriander Crusted Pork Ribs: Felt a tad over salted / over smoked.  It tasted jerky-like and had a firmer Chinese spareribs texture.  I prefer when pork ribs have the meat almost falling off the bone and are primarily infused with just a subtle smoky flavor.  Texas All Beef Hot Link: Lots of nice spices in this.  Not as complex as the brisket or ribs, since it's basically just a sausage.  But really good for a sausage.  Baked Mac and Cheese: Loved how creamy and flowing the cheese sauce was.  The al dente pasta did a great job carrying that cheese sauce.  Sadly, no gratinéed cheese on top like fresh out-of-the-oven mac and cheese.  But the breadcrumbs gave it nice texture.  Ranch Style Borracho Beans: Hardy pinto beans.  Lots of good sauce, which seemed tomato-centric.  Some subtle sweet tones.

reviews.author: Chrystina B.
reviews.description: FIRST TIME AND LAST! THE PORTION, TASTE,  AND PRICE ARE A TOTAL MISS. $34.00 AND NO SIDES? NEXT.   My first time in Austin, and we were looking for some great bbq. Well, I thought I had found it and I'm super sad this place Moses the mark. Who pays 52.00 for a plate with two sides? Let's get into this. . .   PROS: HAPPY HOUR MENU is the biggest pro! If you're a light eater like myself, happy hour menus can really help to try things in a way smaller portion. Pro #2-I had a reservation for two, and it ended up being for 3. There was no drama, or extra wait. The customer service was a 10/10! Most places get really upset about changing reservations (no idea why? More money is a great thing lol) so I'm glad this place didn't.   CONS: THE PORTION. THE PRICE. NO SIDES. I don't mind when food is expensive, just please be worth it. At Lucilles bbq it's 36.00 for 3 meats and two sides ;enough to feed TWO) . Here, it's 3oz of 2 meats and 1 sausage and 0 sides for 34.00. What the hell? Just like all the other comments stated, the food was not worth the price. We got 2 "table sides" which is 18.00 tacked onto the 34.00. I'm paying 52.00 for something that's usually $35.00. No thanks. Now let's get to how the food tastes. .   FOOD: 1/10.  Mac and cheese: The Mac and cheese was crispy? No cheese? Not wet inside, and HARD. -10! Beans: 9/10- the beans were amazing. But 9.00 for a tiny bowl? What the hell, lol.  3 meats plate: rib- 1/10 jalapeño sausage: 2/10 brisket 9/10. The only thing worth getting on this plate was the brisket. It was really tender and amazing.  Starter: Queso dip-The queso dip that was truly amazing and literally the only thing worth getting at this restaurant.   All around. I will never come back. I wish we would've spent this money at a different place. I get they're trying to do upscale bbq, and it totally missed the mark. There was nothing special or different that was worth the price or taste while having a vacation type dinner. The ambiance was the only thing that I can truly say was special on this visit.

reviews.author: Jeff D.
reviews.description: My friends and I went to Lamberts on our first night in Austin, in search of a great entry to barbecue in Texas! I'm a little bummed to say Lamberts missed the mark for us.   As far as the location itself, it was a generally nice building and it was really great that they had reservations available (when many barbecue places often don't). However... when arriving at the restaurant, our table wasn't ready at our reservation time so we ended up waiting for 15-20 minutes. Not really the end of the world, but it was a little disappointing, and the staff recommended that we get drinks at the bar... which would be great if there was space to hang out by the bar or in the waiting area.   Onto the actual food and drink experience: the drinks were solid and we all tried various cocktails and didn't have any bad experiences there. The food itself is one of my bigger qualms with Lamberts -- quality is OK but quantity is really not there for what you're paying. I understand the appeal of an upscale barbecue restaurant, where the ambiance is nice and you can get a table indoors, but it just didn't seem like you were remotely getting your value for money here with the food (both the main dishes and the entrees). Portions are small, and the quality is *just* ok, especially compared to some of the more notorious barbecue spots in Austin (which provide better taste and quantity for less $$).   Service was solid and the staff was nice overall -- they made their best efforts to overcome any challenges of the evening.   In general, I'll say you can probably find a better barbecue spot in Austin than Lamberts if you're really looking for good taste and good value for money. if you're really looking to get the ambiance of a cozy restaurant and get some decent (but expensive) barbecue, Lamberts could work just fine for that purpose.

reviews.author: Jin C.
reviews.description: Happy hour here is such a great deal! From 5-7pm, Tuesday's through Saturdays, a selection of their appetizers are discounted. I got the crispy wild boar ribs, the frito pie, the red snapper ceviche, and the bbq clams.  The boar ribs were prepared like Buffalo wings; there was even blue cheese. The frito pie was shockingly good, I really liked the brisket buried underneath the mountain of frito chips and sour cream. The red snapper ceviche was served in a glass that was annoying to eat out of, and it was good but not the best version of ceviche I've had. The BBQ clams in white wine sauce was interesting and I liked the sourdough bread in it, but I'm realizing I just don't like clams very much.  Regardless, all of the dishes were done well. Service was also excellent - they start you off with jalapeño cornbread, and end you off with wet hand towels.

reviews.author: Carlos I.
reviews.description: Am under rated happy hour in my opinion... really enjoyed my brisket sandwich and old fashioned. The ambience is great and the brisket is even better

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: My husband and I ate here for a dinner date tonight. We were a little nervous about eating indoors, but the staff did a good job of spacing tables and wearing masks.   The food was incredible! We had ceviche, brisket, Mac and cheese and the 3-meat plate. I was a little fussy about paying this much for bbq (it's a tad on the spendy side) but it was worth it. Completely delicious food.   There was a little side of sauerkraut that came with the 3-meat plate that I could eat every day. It was as good as kraut I have had in Germany and perfect with the sausage.  Beware of the carrots on the side of the bbq plates. They are tasty but SUPER spicy.  We found the atmosphere a bit noisy and there were several larger parties where heavy drinkers were getting a little out-of-hand, which was a bit of a damper on the date night vibes. Parking was also a little tricky, but typical for downtown: either street or garage.   We did have reservations via Open Table which I would recommend because they were pretty busy.   We appreciated the clean atmosphere, friendly staff, curated cocktail menu, happy hour specials until 7 PM, and delicious food.

reviews.author: Emma C.
reviews.description: Went for our anniversary and was greeted with champagne and such a warm welcome. The waitstaff was some of the most progressional and kind we've ever encountered could not speak more highly of the service from the chef who came and brought us complimentary Mac and cheese ( delicious!) to our wonderful waitress and host. The food was incredible please do yourself a favor and order the grilled clams just such a special meal we will definitely be back thank you for making our time in Austin so great!

reviews.author: Bernie W.
reviews.description: Had the two meat combo with brisket and ribs along with the Mac and cheese and greens.  While I am use to a nice moist brisket, I got a very fatty cut, highlights were the greens and cornbread.  The building was nice and it seemed like a popular business lunch spot but I was expecting top notch smoked meats.  Really did not tasty the coriander and fennel in the ribs although the meat quality and smoke ring was present.  Would definitely come back to experience the music upstairs which seemed a very intimate setting.

reviews.author: John G.
reviews.description: I had the pork ribs. They were juicy and not overcooked. I was able to remove the meat from the bone without it just falling off. Perfectly done. The spicy sauce wasn't spicy but did add a nice flavor.

reviews.author: D.J. M.
reviews.description: Never eaten here.  Each time I've tried there has been no available seating.  That's not justification for a 1-star review.  But the rudeness of the hostesses is when unable to accommodate me is.

reviews.author: Jody S.
reviews.description: After conquering the bats on the Congress Bridge, I worked up a slight appetite.  Lambert's was one of the few BBQ joints open on Sunday at 9:30pm.  This is a very nice establishment.  The service was excellent and the food was even better.    The host recommend I try the sampler, which consisted of a pork rib, beef hot link and their brisket.  I added a side of collard greens and mac and cheese.  Let me tell you, this was probably the best brisket I've ever had!  So moist and smokey.  The greens and mac were awesome as well.   The ambience was nice also.  Very nicely done.  If you're downtown Austin, go check it out.

name: Jack Allen's Kitchen Anderson Lane
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: We were hoping for the most amazing brunch buffet in the city today, but due to Covid concerns, they have taken the responsible approach to temporarily put it on hold. In the meantime, the full menu is offered. Nonetheless, we were attended to by Alfonso whom we discovered was as knowledgeable about the menu and beverages as he is passionate about the company. Their version of pimiento cheese is phenomenal. My fried pork chop was incredibly juicy, and Edwyn's salad was well thought out.  The new GM Josh stopped by to make sure everything was as it was supposed to be, which they certainly were. In a nutshell, this is an absolutely amazing place.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: I have been to all of the locations in the Austin area and they are consistently good.   I met a client for lunch. They arrived early and ordered the guac and chips as an appetizer.  It was fresh, the chips were not overly salted, nice and crisp and a good amount to share for more than just 2 people.  We both ordered the special that day- the "Spicy Jambalaya" as it sounded really good. I have yet to have an entree here that I did not like.  This one was just ok. It was supposed to be chicken and shrimp.  Both of us only had one shrimp and only a couple of pieces of chicken. To me, jambalaya is at least 50% meat and 50% everything else. This was primarily rice and so much tomato sauce that was all I could taste. It was not spicy either so they brought us their habanero sauce (which is really good) which added the kick it needed.   The service is always great, the food is fresh and overall a good place. I was disappointed in this particular dish so I would not order it again but I will certainly go back.  There are a lot of really good items on the menu.

reviews.author: Royal B.
reviews.description: Atmosphere 4 Cleanliness 4 Service 4 Food 4 Likelihood to return 5 Price/Portion 4 1-5 (5 Best!) 4.2  My first visit to Jack Allen's.  Our work group met for lunch today, there were 8 of us.  Most had not been.  Our server was on point.  Management was in the dining room backing the servers up.  The team worked together to take care of all guests.  The food was generous in portions, outstanding in quality, and delicious in taste.  I had the Fat Jack Burger.  It was perfect.  One of the best burgers I have had since coming to Texas.  It was not dry, prepared med rare, and had great flavor.  The bun was awesome.  Restrooms were spotless and smelled clean.  Good job, thank you.  I will be back.  Support local!!!

reviews.author: James T.
reviews.description: Man oh man! The fried pork chop was awesome!  It was my first visit thanks to an invite to dinner.

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: We've been coming to Jack Allen's for their heavenly brunch for years now (hello, tomato basil pie!), and I'm beyond remiss to only be reviewing it now, when we're eating "linner" here for the first time! If my husband were a restaurant, he would be Jack Allen's. Classic. Stylish. Cool Cat Texan. 90's grunge rock comfortable. FYI that Jack also feeds Camp Mabry on the regular, so we're both definite fans! You'll never ever go wrong with their boozy Sunday brunch. Period.  But does that culinary wizardry extend to Sunday linner? Why, yes. Yes, it does!   Can I say straightaway that the Slow Braised Beef Barbacoa Enchiladas were slap yo mama yum? If you're in the market for southwestern comfort food, look no further! The slow braised beef was flawless, cheesy goodness! Diet food? No. Excellent food? Yes!  First things first, though! The House-Made Pimento Cheese with Flatbread Cracker amuse bouche was stupid good! If pimento cheese was on your childhood menu, like it absolutely was on mine, you'll find this starter profoundly soul-warming! We bought a mason jar full of the cheese to take home because como no?   The Crispy Chicken Lollipops appetizer was out of this world! Crispy sweet heat and the most tender chicken thighs on earth with a pile of Jack Slaw that we would buy by the pint! This would actually be a perfect entree size for me for next time! I'm filing this away!   The Chicken Fried Pork Chop is straight up Sunday dinner at Mom's! If your mom is a stellar chef, of course, which we all know that they all are, right? The masher and the gravy were a cashmere throw! Ridiculous! Just look at the picture, y'all! You. Will. Not. Be. Disappointed.   The drinks all go without saying! The chemists behind the bar are wicked good! My agave skinny cocktail was on point! I knocked back three. No judgement! Hubby's Moscow Mule was bracing and bright! He knocked back three! No judgement!   The Blondie pie? Best dessert ever! I really don't know what else to say about it! I'm without words, and my husband is currently apoplectic!   By the by, our server, Christian, was the pitch perfect Jack Allen guide! Jack Gilmore is lucky to have him! As were we!   p.s. We picked up the Jack Allen cookbook while we were there. Tomato Basil Pie, we shall bake you!

reviews.author: Christopher F.
reviews.description: We had a lovely meal here. The margarita took a while to arrive but was delicious. We shared the Chunky Queso with guacamole. So good. I had the ribeye tacos. An enormous amount of food and tasty. The steak was prepared perfect and was tender and flavorful. We even had pie for dessert. All the food was great. Plenty of places still struggling to have enough servers but our guy tried very hard and was extremely knowledgeable about the menu. Look forward to returning.

reviews.author: Jay H.
reviews.description: Today I ordered cheese Quesedas from this location, when I got back to my work I found they had given me the Barbacoa instead. I called and they transferred me to Josh one of the managers,  He quickly found the order understood the issue and immediately gave me a refund and gave me what I had ordered at no charge! Fantastic customer service I will be telling everyone I know about my experience.

reviews.author: Kammie L.
reviews.description: I haven't been back to JAK since my last review. I thought I would give them another shot....I mean how can you go wrong with a Cesar Salad? When I got home I was so disappointed and annoyed that I just paid $9.60 for this pile of  lettuce and a few strips of parmesan. That will never happen again!!!

reviews.author: Hammond H.
reviews.description: *Update*.....Jack Allen's Kitchen on Anderson Ln is my go to eatery for fresh comfort food. They were doing farm to table before it was a foody phrase. Everything on their menu is excellent! Burgers and fries, fish tacos, salads and chicken fried steak are some of my favorites. These guys get it!!! They don't overthink their food and make the dishes something they're not. I often say, "Simplicity is best served warm with a side of sweet potato fries." If you feel this way, Jack's is for you. In short, they prepare recognizable dishes with fresh ingredients at a good price point. I highly recommend Jack Allen's Kitchen for your next comfort food.culinary excursion. You simply will not find better food for the money anywhere in Central Texas. Run, don't walk, to any of their locations for great food.

reviews.author: Susan W.
reviews.description: Wow....I guess I forgot to check in here before because I've been here at least a couple times. It's always fabulous. They have one of the best happy hours in the area with all their appetizers half-price it was very easy but Bring a friend and you're set for life. A lot of options for a little bit of dollars!  Margaritas are fabulous I don't know about the rest but I see a lot of people drinking beer!

reviews.author: Shelby L.
reviews.description: Love Jack Allen's. I'd never been to this location but went with my family last night. The food was absolutely delicious, everyone at the table was pleased. Our Server was Mike, he did a great job, very polite and attentive. I had a couple bites of the flour less chocolate torte and the blonde brownie, both are to die for. This location's decor is very nice and cool and there's plenty of parking.

reviews.author: Kris T.
reviews.description: The food was okay, but nothing outstanding. Not a great sign when the appetizers were the highlight of the meal. We had the Barbacoa Stackers, guacamole, and catfish to start, and all of them were very tasty but not really great for splitting among a large group.  Didn't try dessert, and the drinks weren't bad just a little pricey to me. The entrees were lacking however, I split a plate of Chorizo Stuffed Pork Tenderloin, and Pesto-marinated Crab Stuffed Chicken. Both dishes were fine I guess, but both were light on flavor. There was barely any chorizo or crab in the respective dishes.  Short version, I'd recommend the appetizers, but that's about all.

reviews.author: Samantha M.
reviews.description: Absolute bombshell of a place!! Incredibly tasty everything I ordered (got crab stuffed chicken) and chicken nachos for appetizer. Waitstaff was fantastic and super knowledgeable!

reviews.author: Jim T.
reviews.description: Each plate was carefully prepared and presented. We aren't easily impressed, but this food is off the charts!!

reviews.author: Gabrielle A.
reviews.description: Had such a fun night! This is our second time coming back. Honestly the management is so awesome, servers awesome, food is unique and great! Bar and drinks are great.   You can usually go to a restaurant and only find one good thing from the list above but this place has everything!

reviews.author: Joshua S.
reviews.description: I understand sometimes you have to wait, however, asking a family to wait 1.5 hours when tables and patio are empty seems like a mismanagement of a business.

reviews.author: Diana N.
reviews.description: The first time I ate at JAK was for a Sunday brunch buffet, and it was amazing!  Today I came in for happy hour for a light dinner. Happy Hour is a steal! Monday-Friday 3-7PM *Featuring 1/2 priced appetizers and $1 off all drinks.  BARBACOA STACKERS $9.99- [barbacoa, refried black beans, jack cheese, JAK slaw, cotija cheese]  Comes w/ 3 stackers (basically large nachos), and it was a small meal for me. Good but I expected a bit more flavor. I would get it again though for $5!

reviews.author: Mara M.
reviews.description: I like Jack Allen's. I didn't always, but I've come around.  First, I love the atmosphere. It's a fun place to be, but feels classier than a Chili's. The service is always good. The food is consistently good as well.  My only -1 is the food tends to be a little bland imo. Still good, just missing a kick, if that makes any sense. I've had many things off the menu now, chicken fried chicken, enchiladas, pasta, appetizers, etc. They're all good, but never my favorite. In fact part of the reason I've tried so many things is I'm looking for that ONE thing that makes me say "let's go to Jack Allen's for dinner." But again, the food is good. I wouldn't hate on someone if they suggested we come here for dinner.

reviews.author: Jon I.
reviews.description: The catfish and guacamole appetizers are both world class.   The service is always excellent.   If you haven't tried green chile gravy on chicken fried chicken and your cardiologist isn't going to know, then you should do it and thank me later.

reviews.author: Mariah K.
reviews.description: Besides having to wait a long time this place was yummy!! Kind of off the beaten path but definitely worth going out of your way. Also if the key lime pie is on the menu, GET IT!!!!

reviews.author: Pancho R.
reviews.description: Came by for a beer and left adopting a dog... Chilli Dog that is. Being that Frazier's is a stones throw away from my temporary home this location sold me pretty quick (literally it's across the street) Already having the trio in mind I ordered the Chilli Dog, the lil OG Burger and Frizzl Fries. With a precise appetite and this place in sight - The Price Was Just Right.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: I can see myself here for a bite to eat, something nice and strong to drink, and do some mingling with my friends as my first visit here was pretty spot on.  I really dug the music as soon as I walked in and decided where my clan was planning to post up. That is always a good sign especially for me who thrives on good music + strong drinks.  Parking is limited but there is plenty of parking up and down the street along the fancy apartment condos. The street is lit up so I felt pretty safe with my car parked a little further down from the entrance of the bar.  Super chill crowd and vibes here from all staff and the patrons. I enjoyed sitting outside on the small but mighty picnic tables. It seats 4 super comfortably with a few friends who were able to stand at the end of the table to converse and use the bar top holder behind them to set their drinks on.  Love their french fries as they were thick and almost curly-esque? I also loved the long corndog they have on their menu too. Everything is made to order and came out piping hot!  Cool local bar that is off the beaten path. We came here after visiting a brewery down the street so we could enjoy some spirits and shots!   Looking forward to more hang outs here at Frazier's in the future!

reviews.author: Nicholas M.
reviews.description: I'm traveling and popped in mid week. I really liked the vibe as a tourist. So much that i went back on the weekend and had even a better time. Try the cheese fries, lone star beer, and the beer plus a shot thang

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: I enjoyed the vibe of this place and the chill crowd. The service was good too. I got a hot dog and the dog itself was delicious but my bun was cold and even had remnants of ice on it. I ate it but it was very sad, sad hot dog experience.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Frazier's has easily grown on me over the past few years! It's my hometown bar located on the east side of town slightly south of the river. It's close to my neck of the woods. The spot is a little old school feeling, cool and chill. The drinks are good. The food is delicious! The tunes are rockin! The bartenders and door guy always seem to be on their game. Did I mention they also have Jell-O shots here ... yes, that's right! Go on and order one to start out your night right or heck, end your night! I love coming in here with my husband, sitting at the bar sipping a drink and ordering a corn dog or mini burger or fizzle fries with cheese  - it's all killer here. Writing this review is making crave those fries! I'll see you soon Frazier's!

reviews.author: Cristina I.
reviews.description: It's a dive for sure but that's what I like. Austin has some good food but honestly their vegetarian chopped cheese is legit one of the best things I've eaten out here. And honestly those fries are amazing. As a native NYer it was pretty spot on. I only wish they would deliver.

reviews.author: Derek T.
reviews.description: Dope spot! Bartenders were on it. Crowd wasn't too bad and friendly people. Will return for sure.

reviews.author: Sean Matthew L.
reviews.description: Frazier's is everything I want in a local bar. I wish I lived closer so I could call it my own. It's the type of place you want to walk to after work is done and sit down with a drink and brush off the day.   There's loads of space inside and the people there seem to really enjoy it all.   The closest bar in town is Nickel City, they seem like sister spots. If you like one you'll love the other.   Food. They got that too and it's all the greasy fried nonsense you want at a bar when you're knocking back drinks. Corn dogs. Yup. They got em and they're damn good. Want a breakfast corn dog you ask? Yeah, got those too. So next time you want brunch head on over and grab some pancake batter dipped and fried breakfast sausage and dunk it in maple syrup and thank me. Totally worth it.

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: This place is AWESOME!! The whole vibe is just so right, and the staff are so friendly and welcoming! We had been searching for a new local bar that had food AND was dog friendly, and we definitely found it in Frazier's! They have an awesome retro vibe inside, with some vintage arcade games, a jukebox and pool table. The bar is long, with plenty of seating, and plenty of TV's with sports on. They also have a small outdoor patio which is smoker-friendly as well. We decided to order food after hearing everyone within earshot talking about their menu favorites, and it was the very best choice we made all day! The chili dog was huge, and although they say it's Cincinnati-style chili, it was not cinnamon-heavy like most are, which we appreciated! The wings were some of the best in town, and so meaty, and perfectly crisped. They came extra saucy automatically, so again, another win for Frazier's! The fries are something to write home about, let me tall ya, they are the thick, twisty, plump potatoes, which they sprinkle with their wing seasoning. Holy cow were they amazing! The drinks were cheap, the beer was cold, they had frozens, they have a super fun brunch menu, there literally isn't a single other thing we could have asked for in a bar! And the BEST part, they are completely dog friendly, both inside and out which is a total jackpot win for dog parents, and they even have treats behind the bar for your pups, with lots of love and attention to give!

reviews.author: Cynthia B.
reviews.description: Love it! Would totally come back here again!!!! Recommend to all my friends and family

reviews.author: Teddy W.
reviews.description: Not pretentious at all, I had the OG cheeseburger and loved it. They were playing some hard rock and tune you just ain't gonna hear at Olive Garden. I was very happy at this establishment, they delivered a good experience, it is a step up from a real dive bar and they make no bones about it, I would have given 5 stars but for the drug dealer and rap video filming in the parking lot.

reviews.author: Lucia G.
reviews.description: Hands down best bar food in Austin. We've been looking for a tried and true hotdog and this was it. So simple yet so delicious and everything was piping hot. They have a great selection of sauces as well. The fried pickles and patty melt were awesome and the fries had a seasoning that was finger licking good. The bar itself is very cool and divey. Feels like what Austin used to be like! Will definitely be a regular here moving forward

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Bartenders suck. Service is so slow with three bartenders. Barstools present but must get in a long line to get a booze drink? Barback that buttons one button at the bottom of his shirt is a hot-headed douche . I think he was irritated because his chain got stuck in his two chest hairs. Gonna drop some baby powder off for him. Front door guy with long hair chill. May bring a flask and hang with him in the lot. If you like a bar where everyone looks at you a bunch but doesn't serve anything but a side-eye... go here.

reviews.author: Jordan B.
reviews.description: Such a fun spot!!! Great for brunch, happy hour or getting some work done. The sausage on a stick (brunch item) I was still dreaming about this morning. Looking forward to returning soon.

reviews.author: Olga I.
reviews.description: The hot dog 5,000 is beyond this world. Get it with everything on it. Now, let's move onto the more important thing - let's talk service. Exceptional? Friendly? Got your back? Will put a smile on your face? Allow you to rock your juke box selection? Extra chill in the atmosphere? Long and low? More like Wide (open arms) and High (quality of your day). 11/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: Frazier's is big cold mugs of beer fantastic! Its dark its loud its enchanting. The bar has some cool vintage beer signs and artifacts for decor, custom pool tables and is all around classy in all the right ways.   The food served at Frazier's is bar food perfection. You'd be hard pressed to find a better corn dog and they've made classic greasy bar food like the patty melt relevant again. I've seen them insist that they are "Making Patty Melts Great Again" and I don't think you can prove them wrong.   Frazier's is also home to one of the best Thai style chicken sandwiches I've ever had. Which brings to point the unabashed diversity of the bar menu.   Take for example the "Chopped Cheese" sandwich served at Frazier's. A New York staple famed for its low cost at local bodega's. Finding one as authentic as the one served here (at least in Texas), is as far as I know impossible. They also continue to respect the heritage of the sandwich's low cost and sell it for only 5 dollars.   The staff at Frazier's is the most amazing and friendly group of folks you could ask for. Service is fast, friendly and delivers that everyone knows your name local bar feel that so many places strive for and never achieve.   Frazier's deserves nothing less than a perfect score, I cringe when I read reviewer Concerned C.'s review that refers to Frazier's as "Hipster". I cant help but imagine that for him to make such a misnomer he must not be hip enough to even identify what "Hipster" is. His statement that the TV's are never on only continues to reveal his ignorance (see attached photo of TV's on showing the game) shame on you Concerned C.  So I give Frazier's Five glowing stars, I'd give them six if it were an option and I look forward to spending many days eating chopped cheese and drinking from giant frosty mugs. Kudo's Frazier's Long and Low may you live long and prosper.

reviews.author: Shane C.
reviews.description: There are many restaurant/bars in Austin, but Frazier's is the best.   I wouldn't go anywhere else.   Just go home afterwards and sleep.

reviews.author: Cale R.
reviews.description: Fantastic joint! Great old school dive bar feel, but more importantly, the food, drinks and service are outstanding! Seriously, seriously, best 3$ burger you've ever had.

reviews.author: Conner S.
reviews.description: These guys are huffy and butt hurt cause I left a bad review so they refused to serve me. Suck it up and get better, also maybe stop cutting off your shirt sleeves to washed up metal bands. You look like a sad sack :/

reviews.author: Matt S.
reviews.description: What a fun out of the way cool hipster bar. Drinks and food are on point the menu is very inexpensive! I had Vinnys chopped cheese which was delicious and it was only five bucks. I also had their frozen margarita which is a nod to the locations past being a Mexican restaurant it was delicious. Watched the after work crowd slowly trickle in to enjoy ice cold beer and a game of pool. This place is a great chill during happy hour or grab a quick bite to eat.

name: Cannon + Belle
accommodations: Good for Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Valet Parking, Garage Parking, Street Parking

reviews.author: Candice K.
reviews.description: This place has super nice staff and we're open on Christmas.  I think the food was really great! I'm stingy with 5 stars so 4 they get but that's high in my book! Great turkey club and cheeseburger.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Came here for a Friday dinner and was excited to finally try a nice restaurant inside of in our favorite hotels in town. The seating right off the bay was a little less "nice" than we had imagined but we didn't let that bother us.   The problem came when we received the menu and it was much smaller than advertised online as well as more expensive. When we asked the server he was fully aware, but seems as though they had made no initiative to fix the issue. The plus side at this place is your inside of a nice hotel like Hilton, but other than no upside.   We ended up leaving without eating and went to Velvet Taco which never disappoints.

reviews.author: Shelby S.
reviews.description: Ate dinner here last night while staying at the Hilton on vacation. We had to sit outside of the restaurant because they were so busy (and it was a Monday night)- definitely recommend making a reservation. The waitress was so friendly! We started with the chips and dip, which were great. My husband and I split the roasted chicken and steak. Everything was so tasty. The kitchen was totally happy to modify their pepperoni pizza to be half cheese for the kids we had with us. Really great! They have a great cocktail menu as well. Just a note, the menu listed on their website right now doesn't match what they are serving.

reviews.author: Yoko C.
reviews.description: We really appreciate that this place was available in the last minute when everywhere else open for Christmas Eve was fully booked. We ordered assorted cheese, chicken wings, Caesar salad, hummus, margarita pizza, goat cheese pizza. We also ordered some liquor including Cuban, Prosecco, Pinot noir, etc. All their food items we ordered were shareable, great for a group of five. The food quality is not the top tier, but the place is great for just getting together and enjoying each others company (3 star).

reviews.author: Steffy N.
reviews.description: I came here for my sister's graduation. We had reservations made ahead of time which made it a lot easier. The staff is so friendly and attentive. We had a large table dedicated for our party. We had the option of doing a buffet brunch or just ordering meals from the menu. It's a lot of food, and so tasteful. I think 1 person of our party of 7-8 people totally was able to finish all their food haha. We definitely took our leftovers to-go.  This restaurant is located inside the Hilton hotel. Super nice!!

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: 5 stars for an excellent staff! Genuinely friendly and focused on great service.  We went here not once but twice while we stayed at the Hilton in Austin.  For dinner, I highly recommend their handmade pizza (we tried pepperoni) and their salmon entree. Scrumptious!  We tried a few of their desserts and I'd rate them in the following order - chocolate cake (decadent!!!) , bourbon bread pudding (served with ice cream!) and their cheese cake (served with fresh peach slices).  Great ambiance and a lovely bar as well. I didn't try any alcoholic beverages but they make a mean virgin mojito!

reviews.author: G T.
reviews.description: Staff was looking tired and their face showed it. Food was good. Ordered the burger and a club sandwich. As soon as I checked in yelp offers free appetizer. Asked waitress and she came back manager said that expired.  Service was very slow i believe they are understaffed. Had breakfast next morning. Everything was good staff still looked tired and unhappy.

reviews.author: Jessica G.
reviews.description: I have never written bad reviews for any place but I wanted to let ppl know how bad it was so you don't waste your time. We were seated 15 min before our arrival time and were ignored for 30 min. The manager put in our drinks. Our table was four ppl, we finally were about to order appetizers. I want to be clear we never got any food and we're there from 7:15pm until 9pm. During this time no one took our dinner order. We cancelled the apps and I told the waitress we didn't want dinner as we never got the apps anyway. She promptly told me it wasn't her fault. We paid for our drinks and left. It looked like most ppl there were upset and had a similar ordeal. I understand when it's short handed but if there is a problem getting food out I think we should have been informed. Worst restaurant service any of us have ever had.

reviews.author: Angel G.
reviews.description: My husband and I decided to have dinner here since we stayed at the Hilton, the decor was very cute, drinks were good and that's about it. We ordered the pepperoni pizza and brisket mac andcheese it was blah. Service was okay.. the bar got crowded around 6:30/7pm and it seemed to go downhill from then, we finished our drinks and it took about 20mins for our other drinks to come.. the bar took up more priority over the customers at the tables. Over all it was decent. If you're staying at the hotel and don't feel like driving, its convenient, better than fast food.

reviews.author: Jerome M.
reviews.description: We tried to go there for dinner on a Sunday evening. The hostess sat us away from the bar area where they had seating in the hallway/walkway. There was a dining room but it was not being used. I was kind of concerned and asked if it had table service - we were assured it did. I wouldn't have minded ordering at the hostess desk or bar and picked up the food but was told we would be taken care of. :D Yeah, 25 minutes later we left - tried to flag down wait staff after 15 minutes which is when we started researching other places to eat. I get it. They're short staffed and the hostess placed us really out of the way. But this Hilton has real problems managing expectations and keeps falling short of their promises. I would just avoid this place if possible.

reviews.author: Carlos H.
reviews.description: Hands down the best old fashioned I've ever had. Had it as a nightcap two nights in a row and they were both as good. Our bartender Jonathan is a craftsman. I highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Diane O.
reviews.description: While it doesn't state it in the description, this is the hotel bar at the Hilton. We arrived at around 5:30 pm. It's loud and crowded during happy hours, but then tapers off. The menu is limited. I enjoyed the grilled salmon with veggies and my husband had an excellent club sandwich.

reviews.author: Linh Q.
reviews.description: I absolutely loved the food here ! of course the restaurant is inside the Hilton hotel , and just FYI you'll have to pay for parking every day that you're here , which is about twenty five to forty dollars . when we got to the restaurant I believe it opens at five o'clock to ten o'clock or eleven , and everybody was really nice . because of Covid you must have your mask when you arrive , however when you sit down you can take your mask off . we got to sit actually anywhere around the vicinity of the restaurant , so we sat further away from The inside seating and sat a little bit across from the restaurant. The waitress was really attentive, she informed us of different things on the menu, please see my pictures of the menu. I really enjoyed the tomato soup, this is not your regular Campbell's tomato soup, it was so creamy I love the croutons that was added, it was definitely very savory and sweet. I also enjoyed the apple cider wings, they were cooked to perfection, the meat was falling off the bone. I also enjoyed that they had hot tea and gave you a little bit of honey with it, and the honey is like a new jar That you can take home. Overall I would deathly come back here to try some more food, they also do to go and they will deliver to your room if you stay in the hotel.

reviews.author: Debbie M.
reviews.description: Reservation for 3 and they tried to but us at a 2 top, then a table for 10.Slow service, told 1 waiter in full restaurant. Didn't clear table until asked, after empty plates sat for 20 minutes while we waited to order dessert.  Food just ok

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: In town for a conference and staying at the Hilton...needed a place to do my fantasy draft and Cannon and Belle was perfect. Secured a corner spot on the bar, grabbed a margarita and hung out for 2 hours.  I got the brisket Mac and cheese and the cornbread to go and both were awesome! The pizzas looked good too.  They have a bourbon bar which seemed to be pretty popular as well!

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I've hit this place a few times en route to events at the hotel.  The pizzas are very good.  The meatball pizza has fantastic, seasoned, tangy meat.  The crab cakes are very good, tasty but lacked a little zing in the sauce.    But, perhaps most importantly, the drinks are outstanding lol.  On my last venture there, I was suffering from a stuffy head and relied on the bourbon bar magicians to doctor me up.  The drink was citrusy, rich and healing.  Thanks Doc!  See you next time!

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: On a day to pick up our SXSW badges at the Austin Convention Center food was on our mind since it was lunchtime. Since we were located next to the Hilton Austin I remembered reading Cannon + Belle was very good.  So we walked inside and had no problem getting a table.  It was near 11:00 AM and our waitress notified us breakfast was ending and gave us two menus. I did not feel like eating eggs so I ordered a Grilled Chicken Sandwich and my wife got the Brisket Pizza from the breakfast menu.  The place is nice and uses gold ware.  It's bit of fanciness to match elegant drink ware.  I reminded me of my grandmother's with her luxury dinnerware.   Soon our food arrived and my chicken sandwich came with creole potato chips. It was a bit spicy, but my sandwich was very good and the chicken was fresh, soft and juicy.  I enjoyed the sandwich very much.  I looked over to my wife's huge pizza where it was covered with diced bbq and scrambled eggs in the center. I tried it of course and the bbq had a smoked taste, and the eggs were farm fresh.  I pretty much ate her eggs and some of the pizza crust which was very crunchy.  Our server was excellent and kept our drinks full.  This place definitely meet and exceeded my expectations.

reviews.author: Roxy S.
reviews.description: This restaurant never disappoints! The selection and flavor is amazing! Their shrimp is phenomenal and tasty! I love the customer service and how timely they are. Easily one of my favorite restaurants!

reviews.author: Shani S.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a quick breakfast before our tour that depArted right next door at the Austin Visitor Center.   Located in the Hilton lobby.  They have a full breakfast buffet at $22 per person. We didn't have a lot of time so we chose to order off the menu.  Good selection and good prices.  Mostly business attire as it was people staying at the hotel. But you can come as casual as you wanted. It literally is in the lobby of the hotel.  One block from visitor center.   Super fast service so go even if you are in a hurry!!  I got Just a side of pancakes for under five dollars, it was the perfect size and the butter is mixed in with cinnamon. Yum oh

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: This place was a life saver!  My family and I were displaced due to snow storm knocking out our homes power, we were forced downtown for an overnight stay.  This seemed to be the only location open to get a meal, and although they were under staffed and overwhelmed by patrons they  handled the rush like champs and still provided a quality meal!! I had the CandB Burger and wasn't disappointed, flavorful, juicy and cooked to perfection.  I'll be back under a less stressful situation to text other items on the menu.

reviews.author: Jamie H.
reviews.description: Native Experience did a great job planning and executing our two day, custom tour. Michael is incredibly knowledgeable about Austin and the surrounding area. He has a lot of options that will work for any occasion. For our group we had a certain set of things we wanted to accomplish and Michael put together a custom experience for us that 100% delivered.   Michael is fun, knowledgeable and professional. He was prepared with anything we could have asked for and when we asked for an audible he was able to accommodate with zero problems.   I think it's also worth mentioning that his bus is immaculate, new and comfortable. That's a big deal when you spend a couple days traipsing around TX.   Highly recommend Michael and Native Experience for your Austin adventures.

reviews.author: Joel S.
reviews.description: Went on a four-hour Austin tour with Michael and cannot recommend highly enough. Michael - a history buff - was born in Austin and is highly knowledgeable of all things about the area. If you are in town, do yourself a favor and book a tour. Looking forward to coming back and doing a brewery tour with Native Experience soon.

reviews.author: Caitlin S.
reviews.description: Such a great experience!  We were with a large group that hired Native Experience for a full day wine tour.  Michael picked us up at our airbnb in Austin and drove us out to Fredericksburg for the day.  This was such a great alternative to staying a night in Fredericksburg because we didn't need to drive.  We went to a couple of really unique spots and had a couple of hours to explore Main Street in downtown.  It was a fully custom tour based on what our group wanted to do.  Michael really made the experience - he was a super entertaining driver and had a ton of local knowledge about the area.  I would highly recommend a tour with Native Experience and would definitely do it again.

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: Booked a river trip for a friend's birthday, and I still can't get over how easy and affordable it was!  Mike was a great guide with extensive knowledge of the area. It was so nice to not have to worry about parking or driving home. Will definitely book again for any event with travel!

reviews.author: Glenn E.
reviews.description: Michael was a great tour guide -- we got to see three breweries up close, sampled many great local beers, and had a behind the scenes tour at one of the breweries.  A fun afternoon, with personal and personable service in a clean, comfortable van.

name: North Italia
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Michelle P.
