reviews.description: I haven't been here since I lived in Irvine, but we were craving some Italian food after all the barbeque, so thought North Italia would be a safe choice. This location is very spacious compared to the Irvine location. I love the atmosphere and ambiance of the restaurant. It gives off a classy casual vibe. We came here for a late lunch around 3pm on Friday and there was no wait.   Margherita pizza - You can never go wrong with a margherita. We did feel like the proportion of the crust to the actual pizza slice was really off. The crust was super thick while the pizza was so thin and flimsy. Pretty hard to eat. The bottom of the pizza was also burnt. The pizza topping itself was really tasty though.   Spicy rigatoni vodka - The star of the show every single time! The dish is bursting with flavor and every bite is amazing. I wouldn't miss out on this. I've tried their other pasta dishes but this is always my go-to. It also does have a little spice kick.   Service was friendly and quick. We were a bit disappointed in the pizza but nonetheless, it was a great quick bite to fulfill our cravings.

reviews.author: Nicole C.
reviews.description: The food was DELICIOUS...that's where the positive stops. We were told 20-25 minute wait, ended up being 40 (no worries, estimating can be a challenge), ordered a $150 bottle of champagne which didn't see flutes (ever..) along with 3 cocktails. After waiting 20 minutes for glassware, we asked for wine glasses since "there were no flutes..the wind keeps breaking them" (or so we were told) still also didn't see our cocktails for 25 minutes (post order time) due to the glassware shortage. An hour and 15 minutes after placing our order until we asked about our entrees, 3 out of 5 arrived within 10 minutes of asking and we needed to wait another 10 minutes for ONE more and 4 minutes after that for the last (which happened to be the soon-to-be bride... go figure). We decided to skip table side dessert due to the time issue and asked for one coffee to go... saying it was lukewarm is generous... then the bill comes.   If you have endless time, don't want updates on what's going on, enjoy lukewarm coffee, and drinking champagne out of wine glasses THIS is the place for you!

reviews.author: Skylar F.
reviews.description: ABSOLUTELY REGRETTED COMING HERE!   1. On a positive side the wait was much shorter than they quoted us.BUT when we sat down our (party of 2) food took over 1 HOUR. We came for an early dinner at 4:30 before catching a show later that night. Our food arrived sometime close to 6. We both ordered pasta dishes which usually tend to be the quickest.   We were very easy going and polite despite everything going on. People who sat down after us have already received there food and we're still waiting. After an hour the manager eventually comes over to us to let us know our food will be out...20 ish minutes later it comes AND MY PASTA IS COLD. It was so cold the sauce was already solidifying.  2. Portions are extremely small. I'm so glad that this place wasn't crazy expensive cause then I would be super upset. We were so hungry we decided to eat and leave to eat at the show lol.   Beautiful area. Lousy service.Don't do it

reviews.author: Kent R.
reviews.description: First time to visit North. Others than very slow food delivery it was overall good experience. Our wait staff, Douglas, was excellent. We had Wagu dish + scallops entree. Both were excellent and menu was reasonable. There was no wait and they were half to three quarts full yet the two entrees took 45 minutes which was disappointing.

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: I go to North at least once a month. It's one of my favorite places. Yes, it's a chain, and you can go in multiple cities across the US, but it never disappoints. This time I went I got the Charcuterie Board; you get a lot on it for being only $18. I also got the Italian Farm salad. I get this salad every time I go to North. I CRAVE this salad. It's my favorite thing. My boyfriend decided to try something new and got the spicy rigatoni pasta with Italian sausage. He loved it. It will now be one of his go-to's. Service was standard. I will continue going back over and over again because of the consistency, price, accessibility, and taste of food.  Pros: everything on the menu is good, well priced  Cons: need to have more specials

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: Lovely place for an afternoon lunch outside - the patio gets some lovely sun and is dog friendly. Their bruschetta is delicious and a great twist on the dish. I don't think you can go wrong with anything here! Service was a little slower than you'd probably get inside, but that's pretty usual with patio service.  I parked down the street at the library which was inexpensive and a quick walk to the restaurant.

reviews.author: Tawny T.
reviews.description: Food is good but they did not have angel hair for their spaghetti, nor they had any mayo to go with my coworker's hamburger.  Not our server's fault.   Our server was funny and efficient.  Kudos to him to elevate our experience, otherwise I would have given this a worse review.

reviews.author: Aurora C.
reviews.description: Girls night out. Sunday dinner. This place was great. We made reservations and was seated right away. They have indoor and outdoor seating. Inside is very clean and I love the decor!  I got the Sicilian margarita and spicy rigatoni vodka. Both very delicious. The bowls are filling.

reviews.author: Hammond H.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful lunch with the family at North Italia today.  The dishes were all well prepared and the pasta was freshly made. BTW...It is fun to watch them make the pasta in their kitchen. I had the Spaghetti and Meatballs with a large mixed greens salad ( see picture). The others had chicken pesto, Squid Ink Malfadine and shrimp over pasta and shrimp scampi over pasta. It was one of the few Italian restaurants that is open for lunch on Sunday. They also have a small Sunday Brunch menu ias well. I highly recommend North Italia at both locations. The food is always fresh. The wine was pretty pricey by the bottle but, that is to be expected.

reviews.author: Nandeeta P.
reviews.description: Always a huge fan of North Italia! White truffle garlic bread is always a hit. Soooooo warm and yummy and creamy. Love it always. We are vegetarian and got the spicy breakfast pizza special without the bacon... I can't explain how tasty it was!!! The sauce was spicy and tart and just to die for. The arugula on top was also so fresh!!!! We even asked for a side of the sauce to complement our strozzapretti pasta which we asked for without the meat. I had a glass of wine (usually don't like wine or alcohol while I'm eating ever) but the Riesling was actually mild and sweet and went well with the food. I will always recommend North Italia to whoever will listen

reviews.author: Blake J.
reviews.description: Pretty disturbing to see the calories of some of these dishes... we enjoyed our meal here but the service was extremely slow. I'm not sure if that's because it's SXSW and they're more busy and understaffed but we waited sooo long for our food and they didn't seem to be all that concerned that we had waited. Both the bolognese and the truffle garlic bread were great. The ricotta on the garlic bread was delicious and fresh.

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: I don't even know where to start because it was all wonderful. From the Pomegranate Mule, to the Italian meatballs, to the prosciutto pizza and followed by Tiramisu. It was all so good. Later that night I was lying in bed craving more of those dang meatballs. For me you know it's good when you want more and a day hasn't even passed. The white truffle garlic bread is also a must. So much flavor! Service was great. The only thing that's weird about this location is that there isn't really a place to sit while waiting for a table unless you want to stand outside... which is fine as long as it's not freezing outside. It's not enough to take away a star because the food and drinks were fabulous.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: A decent Italian fare.   The drinks were somewhat terrible, but the food was quite good.   The pizza and the meatballs were the best.   The minestrone soup tasted truly mediocre.   Bolognese was salty but tasty   Carpaccio could have used more dressing and taste.   The hazelnut torta was quite excellent

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Pizza and salad delivery was on point. It's definitely an expensive order for the portions but the execution meets expectations.  The Pig was oink oink and the salad was very hail, Caesar!  I would order again when laziness prevailed over budget.

reviews.author: Laura C.
reviews.description: Just stopped in before heading back to San Antonio for a drink and aperitifs and are keen to try out their food options on a repeat visit. We had the classico charcuterie to nibble on and and we found it comfortably suitable for two with drinks. It was tasty and well balanced. Give it a try when in the 2nd district.

reviews.author: Paola C.
reviews.description: Very good and not too long of a wait time. Only down side is you have to find and pay for parking. Chicken parm was divine. Pollo frito was good but if you have to choose, pick the chicken parm.

reviews.author: Tommie S.
reviews.description: Listen: I don't eat much Italian food, but do yourself a favor and stop by.  You might need a reservation to experience such fresh and authentic flavors! I indulged in shrimp scampi, short rib pasta, butter cake--YAAAAASSSSSS!--and 2 drinks. Decor is cool and the atmosphere was perfect after a full day of @conferencing." Renee is the best!

reviews.author: Sandra Y.
reviews.description: Ugghhhh this is one of my favorite places of all time to dine at. Some items are hit or miss but I typically order an app, pizza, and pasta to share between 3 and have enjoyed everything I've ordered after trial and error.   The Calamari is arguably the best appetizer they offer. It's cooked perfectly and sooo good with the lemon squeeze and arugula salad on top. Any pizza has always been delicious and my favorite pasta has probably been the Strozzapreti although it is super heavy and filling. I think the location at the Domain offers larger portions at the same price point so I would recommend that one over the Downtown location tbh.   Also, they do free birthday desserts! My friend ordered the butter cake and it was divine. We love their sangria as well and a pitcher is great for a table of 3 to share.

reviews.author: Ashley T.
reviews.description: The food was delicious here! Everything about the place was great. We also ordered the calamari and it was my favorite! I would definitely come back here on my next visit to ATX.

reviews.author: katy j.
reviews.description: Met and exceeded all my expectations. The flavors were amazing in every dish that was ordered. The prosciutto burrito was my FAVORITE item we ordered. The asparagus was a nice addition and the truffle oil sealed the deal. Regarding appetizers - the burrata anolini was delicious. The heirloom tomatoes were roasted perfectly and fell apart in your mouth. I will be returning to North Italia asap.

reviews.author: Kristoffer K.
reviews.description: From pick up, to drop off the experience was phenomenal! Spacious, clean, and comfortable. An unplanned stop to provide a bathroom break before arriving at our destination was provided upon our request and was greatly appreciated. We ended up losing one of our group and our Driver allowed us to wait and look for them. Additionally, a phone was lost in the furniture and again our Driver provided concern, patience, and assistance in order to retrieve the seemingly stuck device. I have now ridden with this service three times and every time has been beyond excellent.

reviews.author: Julia F.
reviews.description: We used ThunderDome over this past Memorial Day Weekend and had a fantastic experience. Daniel was incredible to work with. He was quick to provide a quote and answer any questions leading up to our trip, and was early to pick us up. 38 of us fit comfortably in the 40 person bus along with all of our belongings. The bus was clean, speakers were great, and Daniel truly went above and beyond for our group. We'll definitely be using ThunderDome for all of our future trips!

reviews.author: Traci S.
reviews.description: Daniel was awesome!  Right from the start he was quick to respond with a quote, details, etc.  Easy to work with and has the little extras like coolers, ice, waters, etc. that went above and beyond.  He was prompt, professional, a safe driver, accommodating and just an overall solid guy.  Would highly recommend for a group large or small!

reviews.author: Kristie L.
reviews.description: AMAZINGGGGG SERVICE! We looked into several party buses around the Austin area and compared quotes. Daniel beat everyone's price AND provided ice and cups when that didn't even cross our minds! THANK YOU THUNDERDOME SO MUCH FROM CAPITOL CHEVY! Definitely using your services in the future! The whole process was smooth, and overall satisfying!

reviews.author: Caitlyn L.
reviews.description: ThunderDome Party Bus was great - Daniel was knowledgeable, friendly and super easy to work with. Couldn't recommend him/ThunderDome enough!

reviews.author: Monika G.
reviews.description: I have used Daniel and ThunderDome Party Bus two years in a row and they are awesome! They're communication is reliable and fast. The morning of, he always calls to let you know he is on time and ask if there are any last minute questions. I've recommended his bus to all of my friends. Everyone has always enjoyed their experience!

reviews.author: Brielle A.
reviews.description: Probably the best quote I got in Austin, especially since the cost included everything we needed! They were even able to make two drop off locations for our party which was really awesome! My friends loved the inside of the bus and we had a great night out, will definitely use again in the future!

reviews.author: Christa E.
reviews.description: My group of 16 had an amazing time on the Thunderdome Party Bus! Daniel was super accommodating, easy to work with, and a genuinely nice guy. I highly recommend this company for your next group night out. Tip: Go ahead and book an extra hour to whatever you think you'll need - you won't want to get off at the end of the night, it's that much fun!

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: ThunderDome was awesome! Tony arrived on time and supplied exactly what we were told. He even helped us set up the Bluetooth system for us to play our music. The bus was clean, cool, and ready to party! We took it to a river float for my bachelorette party and it was perfect. Tony even stopped on the way home for a bathroom break. I will definitely book with ThunderDome the next time I need a party bus.

reviews.author: Maggie S.
reviews.description: We wanted to book a party bus to do a distillery tour. I did not have a lot of information on the distilleries and Daniel was incredibly helpful when figuring out where we should go. We had 19 people on the bus and we had SO much fun. The bus was super clean, Daniel was great and we had the best time. We originally had the bus for 5 hours but Daniel was nice enough to let us add an additional hour to our trip for just a small charge. I would recommend ThunderDome Party Bus to anyone.   We definitely want to plan another trip in the summertime to go floating.  Thanks Daniel!!!

reviews.author: Angelie E.
reviews.description: I booked thunderdome party bus to take a big group of us to float the river. The bus was on time, and even made accommodations to pick up a second group at a different stop. The bus itself was spacious and clean, and everyone had an awesome time! Once we were done floating, the bus conveniently picked us up at the exit of the river. I would highly recommend Thunderdome for big group parties.

reviews.author: Martin G.
reviews.description: This review is long overdue.  I booked the Thunderdome Party Bus for a bachelor party back in May 2017.  The bus was perfect!! Seated our group of 15 comfortably.  The stereo system was bumping, and Daniel, our amazing driver, had no issue with us turning it up to 11.  Our group was most guys in their 30's and Daniel gave us good recommendations on spots to check out that were age appropriate.  In between spots, Daniel drove me to a gas station to help me restock on beer. He even came in and helped me carry and load beers into the coolers.  Great communicate from Daniel from beginning to end, and he someone found the perfect spot to pick us up on busy Rainey St at the end of the night.   Great value and great experience.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Ben D.
reviews.description: Coffee in the Time of COVID. There I was, deep in North West Austin. I really needed a cup of joe to soothe my nerves after the drive and the only place close by was a little boutique cafe innocuously named Coffee Shark. The out door seating area was populated by middle aged professionals, who I presumed were working on their screenplays while on lunch. The cafe was in an office place overlooked by Mac-mansions perched on the hills surrounding it.  I girded myself for the aromatic punch of patchouli and sandlewood mixed with the audible assault of world music and hemp-wearing hippies. I entered the cafe and was pleasantly surprised by the lack of the typical Austin vibe. The young lady at the counter took my order, a medium cappuccino, without a hint of pretentiousness. I perused the wares for sale, mugs and tshirts, local coffee beans, metal straws. Thinking I should prepare for disappointment I grabbed some sweetener.  The cappuccino arrived promptly, hot and inviting. To my delighted surprise it was rich, creamy and flavorful.  I skulked out of the cafe, my expectations of over-priced culture dashed on the rocks of pandemic panic-less normalcy. Great coffee and great service.

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: Pretty nice for a hidden coffee shop in a large commercial complex. Would not notice it from the road or walking past unless you know what you're looking for, as it blends in with the rest of the modern building architecture. Not the warmest building from the exterior, but they've done a good job trying to make it welcoming indoors. A variety of seating with one high top table. Most of the seating is 6+ capacity tables, so if you don't like sharing, this is not the place for you to study/sit alone. There is bench window seating, but with two walls of windows I imagine those seats might get warm in the summer. Some outdoor seating as well, for those who prefer that.  I got the grilled cheese and apple sandwich. The flavor combination was well done, but I was a little disappointed by the ratio of filling to bread and felt the sandwich could have been fluffed out a little more in terms of filling. The chips were neither amazing nor terrible; pretty standard fare.   I also got two different hot chocolates. One regular with almond milk, one Mexican hot chocolate with oat milk. Of the two, I'd recommend the first one. Good flavor and nice quantity of whipped cream if you ask for it in a mug. The default seems to be to-go cups, so make sure you're clear if you want to sit and stay a while when ordering. My friend got the Mexican hot chocolate with regular milk and the spices smelled fantastic, but with oat milk they got overwhelmed and it was mostly an oaty flavor.   Welcoming and friendly staff. Would definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: I ran into Coffee Shark for a quick pick me up during my lunch break and was pleasantly surprised. First of all, the place is huge. I don't think anyone would ever have trouble finding a seat and it seems like a nice quiet place to work for an afternoon. I appreciated the fact that they had a lot of flavor options. I decided to get a Vanilla Rose Iced Oat Milk Latte and it was so good. The flavor was subtle and it was perfectly brewed. The only reason I knock it down to 4 stars is because it's definitely on the pricier side. I would expect to pay minimum $7 for a latte when you go in. While it may not be an everyday stop, I would still go back for sure.   COVID Precautions: Masks required for employees and customers.

reviews.author: Julie F.
reviews.description: First time here. The latte was terrible, really bitter and 3/4 foam. They gave me the wrong pastry, which is really a shame as the one I wanted looked delicious, instead I got a really dry cinnamon roll. The breakfast sandwich was fine, at least it was cheap.

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: Great little spot with a big menu full of coffee and treats - lots of outdoor seating. Covid precautions are the best I've seen in and around Austin! Check them out!

reviews.author: Ace L.
reviews.description: Clean and quiet local coffee stop with a great menu. Coffee's really great but a wait over ten mins for two cups ain't it!

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We went late morning, it wasn't  crowded but for weekday and late morning, there were more people than I expected. We went to this place to try the steampunk coffee as other fellow yelpers have mentioned but I dint see option of steampunk coffee on their menu. There was only oNe person behind the counter for taking order and  making.  We ordered  blueberry scone, cranberry muffin, cappuccino  and house coffee. Muffin was huge, both muffin and scone wasn't  fresh at all, tasted like, when you leave them for couple of day on  top of the counter and take a bite. cappuccino  and coffee was good, service is ok, they  have ample seating. Recommend  cappuccino and cOffee not baked goods though.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: Probably one of my worst coffee shops in Austin I've been to. It seemed so promising, but my friends and I ordered three different drinks, and each one was incredibly medicore. The chai latte was almost bland, vanilla latte tasted worse than an instant version I could buy at a grocery store, and even the normal latte lacked flavor.

reviews.author: Sara O.
reviews.description: We've come here several times now so we must like it.   I have ordered a breakfast sandwich that's good. There's a pretty well endowed breakfast menu, not huge full breakfasts, like pancakes, but for a coffee shop there's a lot of offerings.  Our coffees are consistent.  It's definitely not my favorite, but it's always good. Consistency is hard, which is why I don't have a favorite coffee shop.   The outdoor area is great bc we always have my kids in tow and sometimes there's another kiddo out there for them to mingle with.   The details: It's an older, white, crowd. The industrial decor is neat, but the chairs are really loud when you move them.  There's plenty of parking. Staff is friendly.   It's always relatively quiet. *the reason i noticed the loud chairs *

reviews.author: Veggie L.
reviews.description: I live about an hour away from Coffee Shark but every single time I'm in North Austin I'm giddy because I get to go to Coffee Shark. My family has food allergies (celiac disease) and everyone is so kind and informative. The coffee is so smooth and absolutely divine. I actually bought a shirt awhile back because coffee from coffee Shark brings me so much stinking joy! I don't feel this way about any other local coffee shop! So grateful you are a part of Austin and I wish this business ongoing abundant success!!!

reviews.author: Kim K.
reviews.description: I miss pre COVID times because Coffee Shark was a great place to study and have some coffee and a light bite.   Coffee is good, food is even better. Most recently I ordered online - wanted a scone but got a muffin, but no bother, muffin was still good.

reviews.author: Ivan C.
reviews.description: If you're not Indian or white you'll get bad service. Also they shut off reviews on google so there's that. There's better coffee out there.

reviews.author: Judah J.
reviews.description: Coffee is good. I have nothing negative to say about that--just the absolute worst customer service I have ever encountered in a coffee shop to date. The owner, or whoever he was, was so terrified of people I wasn't even sure if I was supposed to be there. Pictures look great, I'm sure the place can be a lot of fun if it weren't for COVID-paranoia. Seriously, I went all over Austin that day and NO ONE was halfway as petrified as this guy.  My brother tried to take a sip of his coffee but was soundly rebuked for exposing his nose and mouth for 10 seconds. I understand we need to be careful, and we were, but if you go to a coffee shop you should at least be permitted to make sure the thing is edible before you leave!! BTW, we wore a mask and were very careful the entire time being there.  Won't be back. There are many other decent coffee stops in Austin.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Quaint little place, convenient if you live or work nearby. Good food, excellent desserts, and consistent coffee brewing skills exist here.  4 stars because while everything is good overall, the nitro cold brew coffee on the other-hand well to honest...sucks! Its just weak cold brewed coffee, it doesn't pack a punch of caffeine like other cafes that offer it on their menu. If you're gonna do something, do it right or do it better!  But great little place. Indoor and outdoor seating. Good lighting inside and fairly quiet environment if you're working out of the office.   The staff is friendly but not super helpful.

reviews.author: Juliana H.
reviews.description: Such a cute little location. Iced mocha coffee was amazing and the baked goods are great too. Patio is large too and you get a view of the mountains.

reviews.author: Steph R.
reviews.description: Nice spot close by that had really flavorful drinks. We got a flat white and chai latte. I love coffee but I'd honestly would get the chai next time - it was absolutely delightful. We also sampled our fair share of pastries including a blueberry muffin, pumpkin bread, and croissant. The muffin and bread were really moist and delicious, but the croissant was very bready and not a flaky, buttery croissant I was looking forward to. I think they get their pastries from a local bakery so that was cool and I would definitely try out their other pastries. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Steve R.
reviews.description: Have been going here since moving to the area last spring. Service is always great and friendly, and enjoy the selection of pastries. Appreciate the COVID-19 mitigation measures in place--super prudent and considerate. It has become my go-to weekend stop for a takeout coffee and pastry.  Hoping to one day perform there (acoustic guitar and sing).

reviews.author: Bonnie T.
reviews.description: Occasionally I work nearby and I have always found Coffee Shark convenient any time of day. In the morning I can grab coffee, pastry or even a breakfast taco. For lunch they have a great selection of sandwiches, soups, salads and pizza. They even have bar service as well.  It's always clean and the service is nice. It's a great place to have in the plaza.

reviews.author: Lil P.
reviews.description: This place is amazing and the customer service is stellar except when the new tall thin guy with the backwards cap is working. He overcharges and fails to deliver. Literally....Doesn't make your drink. I've had this happen twice now. Not sure if he's a new manager but each time I walk in and see him, I want to walk out. Today was no different. Even the young kids working there have better customer service than he does. I'm a little peeved he's really screwed with the friendly vibe the others have mastered.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: I've only been here once but absolutely loved it when I went in. Great beer selection, that's all we went there for, but their menu looks amazing for coffee and small plates. Very relaxing environment saw lots of people there working or just catching up with friends. The staff was incredibly sweet as well. They have a fun little outdoor area with games to play, and a few games inside too. If you're looking for a relaxing getaway with both amazing beer and coffee choices this is the place to go!

name: The Park on South Lamar
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Late Night
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: A Special Wing Outing   In searching for a new place to enjoy chicken wings there was one place I have not been to in a long while, The Park. At first I thought I should have made reservations where the place was packed but luckily there was a table available. The place felt like an upscale sports bar and great place to hang out.  TV monitors were all around showing various sports programming. The place was a bit loud but if you want a quieter atmosphere then suggest sitting in the partially outdoor bar area. Plus the patio area would been a good spot for those still cautious where patrons were seated really close together.  I ordered the 5 Garlic Ranch Rub Farm Fresh Wings along with a draft beer.  The wings were really good having a unique flavor among other restaurants. From my experience chicken wings tend to taste better from restaurants than wing places. They tasted like were slow cooked with nice spices on them. It had a side of ranch sauce to dip them in.   We had a great time here and be back for more.

reviews.author: George A.
reviews.description: Ugh! I guess their MB sales out perform their food sales, because this place was really not that good.  But it's always busy. It only goes to show that people follow the crowd and not their tastebuds.   Beer - barely cold Michelada - no flavor Mexican Martini - There MIGHT have been alcohol in it; at $10 Chicken carbonara -Rago and noodles NO FLAVOR; this is why I cook at home Wings - must have a had a sale a my Sam's for Tyson Buffalo Chicken Wings  The Oasis is know for their atmosphere and horrible food. The Park falls into that category.  Maybe they have a different menu for weekend brunch, but their regular lunch is not good.

reviews.author: Ashleigh J.
reviews.description: It was exactly what we were looking for! Decided to stop here since I was in the area- we were sat quickly and there was plenty of space inside and out. We just missed happy hour but we grabbed a few drinks and food anyways. I decided to get a burger and it was delicious! Bun was soft, meat was seasoned well and tasted great with the fresh jalapeño! It's a great place to grab food, chill for a bit, watch a game and have a michelada!

reviews.author: Armando W.
reviews.description: I came here with my friends to get some dinner and the waiter was extremely rude and unhelpful. At one point he let us know one of the drinks we ordered was not available and then walked away without waiting for us to order something else. As soon as we got our food he asked us how the check would be split and shortly after brought us the bill. It was not a great experience and will think twice about coming back here again.

reviews.author: Michele H.
reviews.description: I went out here last night with an old friend. It was a well established business and the food was amazing and the drinks were good too. I love how they allow pets to come here!

reviews.author: Julia V.
reviews.description: Food was great!! Hits the spot and the jalapeño ranch is so good! Unfortunately the service wasn't good. We waited 40 minutes to get any service and had only 10 minutes to order happy hour.

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: I was surprised about this place. The food is quite delicious. Whether you go for chicken fried chicken, a burger, or the mac and cheese, The Park delivers. Their menu is quite broad, with many good options.   Good selection of beers, a very large covered patio, and good service. Recommended.

reviews.author: Allyson L.
reviews.description: Overall, a good place for a large group to grab drinks. I went to happy hour here with 8 of my coworkers and the outdoor seating was really spacious and well distanced from other tables.   Highlights: Their frozen margaritas (pretty strong especially for my low alcohol tolerance lol), the free tequila sampler my group received (:, the service, and the fact that they are really flexible with splitting checks for large groups!  Needs to be improved: The food was way too greasy and there weren't any plant based options for my vegan coworker. It would be nice if they had a smaller selection of dishes that were better quality and with half the oil added.

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: Let me tell you what- those sliders were amazing and the $5 frozen mojito's on the happy hour menu HIT and did not miss. It was the perfect late afternoon snack to unwind from the day. We had the sweetest waitress that gave us great customer service.   P.S. there's plenty of parking :)

reviews.author: Rose D.
reviews.description: A great, always reliable spot! They have a ton of outdoor seating with lots of shade, and excellent deals on drinks + food. Definitely a sports bar vibe, with lots of TVs, but never gets too loud (at least when I've been there) as it's really spread out. They seem to have a nice separate outdoor space that people sometimes use for private events, which I love!  The food is good -- typical burgers, sandwiches, salad, tacos. I love that they have the option to get any time of burger/sandwich on a gluten free bun or a lettuce wrap. Their lettuce wraps are huge and keep everything together! I got the Hippie with grilled chicken and loved it -- the chicken was blackened and spicy - yum! My boyfriend got the Fat Chick (not what he ordered..whoops, but still was delicious). Fried chicken with gravy, mashed potatoes, and sautéed veggies. They have a "Hot" (adobo) and "Skinny" (grilled) version of this. Nice to see some healthy and more indulgent options.   Definitely recommend if you're looking for good food, strong drinks (and some fun cocktails), and a nice place to hang with a friend or a group!

reviews.author: Jeremiah G.
reviews.description: Actually really good, chill spot. At first, I was thinking I was going to be walking into an Applebee's and I don't think I was that wrong but where The Park separates from Applebee's is the fact that The Park is actually has good food. Well at least their burger was amazing.   Friendly staff. Good, really good, drink happy hour. We sat outside and while a normal outside sitting decision is dangerous in Texas heat The Park actually made the sitting experience enjoyable.   If you are confused on what to get, as I was, may I suggest The Rebel burger. A good sized, well done, burger with fried pickle chips on it. My thinking is this. I'm going to get pickles anyways, I might as well get them fried as well.

reviews.author: Violet F.
reviews.description: This place was awesome, great music and door spinach artichoke dip: the thing that really made this place stand out though was the awesome bartender, Alexis. She knew the menu like the back of her hand and was really delightful to talk to; can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Courtney K.
reviews.description: Ordered the southwest egg rolls and my order was delivered to the wrong table. The waitress handled it all really well and apologized, the manager came out to tell me it was on the house and again apologized for the delay. I think it says something about the establishment when they handle mistakes with integrity and is 100% a place  I would go back to!

reviews.author: Kathryn A.
reviews.description: I ordered the calamari as an appetizer and they gave such a big portion that I almost felt like I didn't need an entree, lol. It was super good! I would definitely recommend. The atmosphere was very chill and the service was good as well. Definitely going to come back

reviews.author: Robin W.
reviews.description: We went there today, just because so that you could actually sit and enjoy your food instead of it being all to go!   The service was very friendly and she gave a great suggestion on the mushroom burger.  The fries were perfectly crispy and not to large of a serving that I was overly stuffed.  I love that their burgers don't come with mustard and mayo and will only add them if you request it.   The hubby had the park burger with onion rings, which he enjoyed buy nothing extravagant.      I did like that they were playing old music videos.

reviews.author: Crystal Y.
reviews.description: Really amazing waitress, great service, yummy food, huge screens for watching baseball.  Very good sports bar. Tons of outdoor seating. Stick to the burgers here, y'all. I got the veggie, which had a delicious flavor and texture, it was black bean. My bf got the grilled chicken. We both loved out burgers and they have great topping choices too. Huge drink menu. Great mac and cheese and sweet potato fries too. Waitress was the nicest person.

reviews.author: Marcie M.
reviews.description: July was awesome and very attentive. Corn Flake Chicken Tacos were the bomb.com! Yum! Rice and beans on point. They were like home.

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: The Park Has always been my go to spot to get a great food and great service. I love the Sunday Brunch it's amazing and the service is always good big thank you to our server who was amazing. The food was cooked fresh and also prepared well. If you ever come to Austin please stop by.

reviews.author: Elizabeth D.
reviews.description: After going to the domain location for the first time in January of 2022, a friend invited me to the location on slaughter and I was excited to go do the brunch special that's $16 because it was amazing at the domain. All the the food was old and just sitting there, we were there for about 2 hours and not one did they change anything out. My favorite thing to get is max and cheese and I checked 4-5 times to see if they changed it out. I didn't want to be rude and ask someone to change it out to I asked our waitress for a side of max And cheese (already $5 extra even though it's included in a $16 buffet) so she brought me the photo of the Mac and cheese in the smaller plate which looked like they scooped it out of the Mac and cheese that had already been sitting there. It was dry and barely tasted like cheese. This place doesn't even deserve 1 star! I was super disappointed. We ended up having to order food on top of our brunch special because the food was so old and nobody would replace it for TWO HOURS. The domain location is the one I would recommend instead.

reviews.author: Bo B.
reviews.description: Came here for the Happy Hour menu. I had the Mahi mahi tacos with broccoli and sweet potato fries that were delicious. The works pizza was also very good.

reviews.author: Ty G.
reviews.description: Very cool place. Great staff, great drinks, great atmosphere. The vinyl is a perfect touch. The sound is great and their selection of albums is fantastic. Go there. You'll love it.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I've found Long Play to be a good reliable hangout spot if I'm looking for a non-brewery casual environment in the neighborhood. They have a wide array of drink options that should keep any group satisfied.  There's lots of sizable tables on their patio. Enough so that even though they allow smoking outside I've never had to sit close enough to a smoking table to be bothered by it.  The bartenders are all really friendly and happy to make suggestions. If you're there on a less busy night the indoor seating has a nice intimate atmosphere, but can get crowded fast on the weekends if the weather isn't great outside.   The Korean food was super unexpected the first time I visited, and while I haven't made it part of my experience most times I've come here, I can't remember myself or any friends having a bad experience with the food.  Overall I'd highly recommend giving them a try if you're looking for a casual bar in the area!

reviews.author: Misha S.
reviews.description: Y'all, I  think this place is delightful.   Extremely chill vibe, great north-central location, and a big, beautiful patio. They have old fashions on tap for $5, which I think sets them apart - as well as assorted Korean food, including dumplings.   This place reminds me of eclectic, old Austin, and I absolutely love it. I could see it being an institution in 20 years like Lala's is now.   Can't wait to go back :)

reviews.author: Nancy C.
reviews.description: Moving into the neighborhood and so happy to have this spot nearby! Awesome happy hour with $5 old fashioneds on tap. Cute patio picnic tables are frat for casual groups and our pup! Can't wait to come back to try some food.

reviews.author: Zak S.
reviews.description: Cool bar with a nice dog friendly outdoor space. The hot dog place just outside was SO GOOD!! How Much?!

reviews.author: Beth E.
reviews.description: We found this place on google by chance and I am glad we did. Love the theme of the bar. Love the vinyl records that they were playing on the turntables . We discovered new music. We enjoyed a couple of Christmas cocktails. We enjoyed the vibe of the bar. We will be back!!

reviews.author: Kip S.
reviews.description: Long Play may be the best neighborhood bar in Austin. The cocktails are outstanding, especially the Pinkerton. They serve Korean food, which is out of sight. I had the fried chicken, which was crispy, juicy and just a little bit spicy. It was served with a radish salad, I think. My friend had the bibimbap, which was also excellent.  It's kind of small inside, but the patio is pretty spacious and dog friendly. And the best part is they play full vinyl albums over the outdoor speakers. They've got great taste, and I would definitely be a regular if I lived closer.

reviews.author: Kaia K.
reviews.description: This spot has become our local neighborhood favorite. We love the proximity to our home. This place is the perfect relaxed atmosphere to enjoy a savory bite and a great drink. Great playlist, outdoor and indoor seating. Overall very friendly place.

reviews.author: Joe M.
reviews.description: Very chill vibe reminded me a lot of an NYC/Williamsburg bar. Inside is small but has an awesome decor setup. Very romantic good for a date night. Bartenders were very kind and helpful/funny as well. Had old fashions on tap which I've never seen before. Also has a big parking lot which was a nice touch

reviews.author: Alejandro D.
reviews.description: I loved this place in my new 'hood.   Great, reasonably priced cocktails. Outdoor seating (a must during pandemic). Friendly, welcome service.  Great food (new Korean menu-- try the Korean pizzza). And walking distance to my place.  What's not to like?

reviews.author: Zach I.
reviews.description: I loved this little bar! Great ambience with the classic music. They also have a fairly large patio outside with tables and chairs. Small on the inside; however, it's extremely cozy. Went here for happy hour and had a cocktail - strong and delicious at an excellent price. Will most definitely be back'

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: I love this place, their happy hour is great and the pecans from their pecan tree are delicious

reviews.author: Kent R.
reviews.description: First time here and truly truly enjoyed the experience. Super calm vibe. Great vinyl selection. Only had cocktails. No food. Cocktails were reasonable and crafted well. Overall very good first impression and we will be back.

reviews.author: Jed P.
reviews.description: Super smart liquor selection and quality choices on draft. Record selection is impressive as well.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: I liked the vibe of the old spot, Royal Jelly, so it was a relief to find Long Play is very much a worthy successor.  Stopped by for a margarita and a bowl of meat chili while running from point A to B on Sat eve.  The chili is indeed delicious - no beans, with a good amount of heat inherent - I'd place it as one of the best bowls I've had in all of Austin.  Good liquor selection for cocktails, and a goodly amount of picnic tables out front to soak up the sun.  They were spinning Herbie Hancock and Specials records, which hits some sweet spots for me.  Added bonus that I easily nabbed one of their adjoining parking spots.  Hoping this one sticks around - it definitely has the makings for a great neighborhood bar!

reviews.author: Javier E.
reviews.description: Drinks are interesting, food could be a LOT better! I find the record/vinilo aspect of it endearing but not practical.

reviews.author: Teresa A.
reviews.description: We went on a mixed winery and brewery tour and had a great time! Our host, Woody, was personable and entertaining, and he knew all the good places. It was very cool to see the inner workings of the brewery and we actually learned a lot about the wine-making process and different types of wines. Getting a little tipsy while being driven around in a limo just can't be beat!

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: We took the 6 pm sightseeing tour on a Saturday. This was a sunset tour in good weather. When we waited, there was free Wi-Fi from the nearby Hyatt. Great trip! We sat at the front for the best view. Quiet electric barge, no spray. Could not hear commentary; boat may need Bluetooth speakers at the front. Good views of downtown buildings! We saw two groups of egrets settling in for the night. We saw some bats flying out of the Congress Ave bridge! Not many bats because this was in November.  We missed a few bats because the boat returned to the dock to drop off some people who needed to use the bathroom :( The tour guide could have stated that the boat had no bathrooms. It is obvious to the guide but not to the first-time visitor. Tip: go to the bathroom before you board the boat.

reviews.author: Kristen P.
reviews.description: We had an excellent time on the Bat Tour yesterday. With family visiting in town, we wanted to take them on something that was fun for both adults and kids. Capital Leah was great as she lead us on the tour of the lake and city, with the finale of the trip seeing the bats fly out from congress ave bridge. Definitely recommend to anyone! We love our bats here in ATX

reviews.author: Denise W.
reviews.description: This was a no frills, relaxing float around the lake. It was a warm, humid evening and we enjoyed watching the city light up as the sun set. The bats are still finding their way back from Mexico but it was still fun to see the bug hungry little critters emerge a few dozen at a time and head out for a night of dining on the local farms. If you want the full bat experience that happens in July according to our boat captain.

reviews.author: Tracy B.
reviews.description: I've been on a few of these cruises and every time we have so much fun! Staff are courteous and let your crew just hang out and have a fun time under the lights and stars of downtown while cruising town lake. It's especially fun during bat season! Highly recommend for bdays, wedding parties or client events.

reviews.author: Kristin B.
reviews.description: Holy shirtballs Batman! Or rather bat mama's. Please please please do yourself the favor of taking this extraordinary tour. Captain Leah said dress warm and boy was she right. Sunset on the water delighting in the balance of nature and civilization. I was humbled.

reviews.author: Diana B.
reviews.description: Capt Alec was great. Nice lil evening boat ride. Very informative!!!! I would highly recommend very affordable

reviews.author: Beka H.
reviews.description: We had a great time on the sunset tour! It was beautiful and the guide (Captain Molly) was very knowledgeable and entertaining. Would strongly recommend!

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: My daughter was visiting and wanted to rent the swans  parked at the Hyatt and easily found our way out to the dock was informed  about rules and how to move the swan ride around the lake  What a fun time my daughter and I had. Was a bit hot in the sun but brought water sunblock  and snacks  such a good time can't wait to do this again ! Thank you agaIn !

reviews.author: Vanessa L.
reviews.description: This place is not worth it! They made us wait for an hour did not tell us 4 people wouldn't be able to ride until it was time to sign the waiver! They are trash I will never come I do not recommend made me waist 1 hour of my trip!!! They suck!!!!!!!

reviews.author: Claire L.
reviews.description: Swan boats $40/ 2 hours for 4-person swan.   Great service and overall awesome experience.   We visited at almost 7pm and were able to enjoy the laid-back waters without too much of sun. Loved seeing the sunset. The breeze was warm and nice.

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: My family took the bat cruise and it was perfect. The tour included city views with running commentary followed by the bats flying out from under the bridge for a very long time. Our questions were addressed and we saw many unusual birds and other sights. It was a real highlight for me. My only concern was that my GPS took me to the bus entrance and I was almost late trying to find my way to the parking garage and then through the hotel to the boat dock. The rest of my family got there in plenty of time but they were more familiar with the area. I got a great video of the bats so it was totally worth the hassle.

reviews.author: Tom T.
reviews.description: It's a very entertaining cruise. Our Captain, Alec, guides you though the lake with interesting information and jokes. But the Bats were great to watch. Highly recommend the the Bat watch.

reviews.author: Philip G.
reviews.description: Sailed on 3.12 with Georgia at the helm and she did awesome. Loved her enthusiasm for music (being from Seattle and a huge music fan myself I can relate), Austin and the Bats. Keep up the good work and maybe see you at Hotel Vegas!!!

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: Such a wonderful experience for our family!  You cannot reserve their Swan boats (first come) but the day we went, the four man boat was available.   We spent about 45 minutes paddling around Ladybird lake and had a great time.   The people working at Capital Cruises wore masks and offered our children life jackets.   We will definitely return!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Not sure if this is a winter thing, but the two times I've been on a self-captained boat (it's electric) with them in the last couple months it's only been $75/hour. We've always had 6 folks, so it's a super economical outing and it's BYOB and snacks. They have a little thingie for you to plug your phone in for some tunes, too.  Very little interaction with staff beyond checking in, getting the quick lay of the land, errr, lake, and when they help you dock at the end, so super COVID safe, in that respect.

reviews.author: Nicholas H.
reviews.description: We had a lot of fun on this cruise. The guide Gabe was super helpful and knowledgeable. Would return again when bats are more active in the warmer months.

reviews.author: Anita Y.
reviews.description: It's my second time visiting Austin and I found out my mom has never been on a pedal boat so I made a last minute decision to rent a swan boat. I'm glad I got there at the time I did because there was an even longer wait time for all the people who came after me. It was $18 total for us to rent a two-seater for up to an hour. Totally worth it. We saw Austin from a whole different perspective. Also, it was quite a workout - a nice one though.

reviews.author: Monique H.
reviews.description: I have rented from Capital Cruises several times. Twice was for bat cruises and once for paddle boards. All of which were a great experience!   They are open right now and a friend of mine and I rented stand up paddlebords recently for an hour on the lake. We went mid morning (they opened at 10am on a Tuesday) and it was glorious. Hardly anyone was on the lake. The staff is super friendly. They have a tent outside and a touch less payment system. Prices are reasonable and their equipment is good too. They have some outside cubbies for your stuff should you choose to leave anything at the dock. The pics are from the bat cruise in October 2019. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: Great experience especially for the price. Lorrie our tour guide was knowledgeable and funny (and we had a bit of a weird situation with a passenger being disruptive which she and the other employees handled quickly and professionally). There was a neat boat tour of some major buildings before getting a good spot and seeing/learning about the bats. Will definitely go again when I have visitors in town.

reviews.author: Taylor L.
reviews.description: We did the bat tour, and it was lovely! A nice, long, educational tour of the city and the buildings from the river during sunset...ya can't beat it! Another person on the tour said she thought it'd last around a half hour, but we were on the boat for nearly 2 hours! Watching the bats was incredible. We went in early November, so we weren't sure how many bats would be left, and there were TONS! It's truly an experience I'll never forget. Thank you to the employees and captain!

name: The Park At The Domain
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Gregory S.
reviews.description: The Hostess was very nice and our wait person was  very nice    The review on the food  we came in for the Happy Hour Burger and my dad got the Park Original - Chicken with Fries which was a upcharge i believe 2.00 for the fries   they do not give you enough fries for having a 2.00 upcharge   I ordered the El Juanito - Burger with Fries  the Burger was a good size burger    The inside of the restaurant seems very nice  and the outside seating area was very nice we both enjoyed our meal  On a side note  all the servers were not wearing a park logo'd shirt except for a bartender if they have a Park Logo Shirt you would think all employees should be required to wear one

reviews.author: Bethany A.
reviews.description: I ordered one of the burgers. It was subpar bar food. It was super heavy and greasy.  The service was slow. The waitress was nice, but not very helpful with answering our food question s. Next time I'll go to the Irish pub or one of the other bars around the corner. I feel like I'll have better luck.

reviews.author: Tu L.
reviews.description: Overpriced for what it is. The brunch was okay at best. The service was decent, felt like my waiter was brushing me off whenever I was there. Was okay but like not a place I would deliberately go for

reviews.author: P H.
reviews.description: This place has the worst service I've ever received at a restaurant. Food doesn't taste fresh and as if it was from a previous day. Service was so bad it was ridiculous. Unless you love not being helped, and poor tasting food, stay away. Too many places in Domain and Austin to pick from to waste your time here.

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this restaurant! I called to make reservations for a large work group recently. They were super nice and accommodating for a group of 13! Our server was amazing and stayed on top of everyone's wants and needs! The atmosphere was chill and the food and drinks were great! Our table ordered a variety of eats and everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meals. I recommend going to this location! Definitely will be back next time we visit Austin!

reviews.author: Joseph T.
reviews.description: IF YOU HATE YOUR DATE OR FRENDS THIS IS YOUR PLACE.  Service is nonexistent.  Ordered the bypass burger, should've have called it by pass that burger with raw meat. Could not finish it, pathetic. I was with a big group so we also got the southwest rolls things...We're not crispy but chewy and have this odd coldness to them in the middle, truly Miserable. Also ordered their chips with different dips for an appetizer as well...the cheese hardened so fast the chips they gave us was so weak that they would just shatter so you could barely eat the cheese. Only  the red Salsa was good the other two sauces were forgettable at best. I'm  suggesting a different place next time for my gang of friends

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: The Park is so god awful, I tried erasing this from my brain... unfortunately, I was reminded the other day when driving through the Domain. The Park demands to be seen, it's located on a busy street where it's not hard to miss.   I came in to meet a few friends for The Park's Sunday Funday, where they boast about a ~$20 Brunch Buffet and 5 different flavors of Mimosas. Everything tasted dry and bland in the ingredients. But, what more do you expect for such a low cost? The typical breakfast is served (eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles/pancakes) with handful of lunch entrees (fried rice) and a variety of desserts (pudding, cookies).   Would not return.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: The service was so terrible, no one ever came to greet us, ask our drinks or take our order after 15 minutes. Then we went to the bar which finally got a bar tender with an attitude problem. I gave her my ordered she didn't take it and processed to walk away. It's been over 20 minutes at this point of no service and attitude.  Also it's Tuesday. It shouldn't be that hard to take an order. Don't go here. There are plenty of other places at the domain.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: They did a good job accommodating our monthly happy hour group, both outside and inside. We found that our server/s kept track of our orders and drinks all evening with few hiccups.  The happy hour specials are great, so if you're curious about The Park, come check it out then.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I've frequented The Park on many occasions, but finally did a Sunday funday brunch w the buffet and $2 mimosas. Not exactly anything to rave about but a really good variety for what you pay for and the atmosphere more than makes up for it w versatile seating options and plenty of tvs to watch sports on. Mimosa flavors are great and the buffet had plenty of options to appease everyone at the table, even the picky ones. It is obviously a go to for many as the line was wrapped around and down the sidewalk by 11am when they opened. It's usually my go to in the domain when I want to have a quick catch-up w someone.

reviews.author: Shernell H.
reviews.description: This was my second time visiting this place. The only thing I remember from the first visit was that the mimosas were good. Well, this go around, everything I had was really good.   We did the brunch buffet, which was about $16... a win. The food was really good. The French toast, the eggs with veggies, potatoes, fried chicken, and the macaroni hash *mouth waters* was all cooked with love and seasoned well. The mimosas during brunch was $2.  I had a pineapple basil or something and that was very tasty.   Our waitress was very attentive and gave good recommendations.

reviews.author: Samantha M.
reviews.description: I thought I had heard good things about this place and I will give you my Mahi mahi tacos had good flavor. Biggest complaint would be the occasional long black hairs in my food and the filling felt a bit scrimpy (pic attached)- there just wasn't much meat, mostly cabbage in the taco, and the tortillas were just too large. I honestly chose this place because of the sign out front advertising the frozen mojitos, and that was the first thing I inquired about and they didn't have them. I got a regular mojito and it was honestly made alright but a horrible experience consuming it because instead of putting mint leaves in, they were finely chopped up so I got pieces of mint in my mouth every sip I took. Probably won't be back.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Can I say eat good! I had such a amazing experience eating with my small family today. My first time in a while out and the service was on point with the continued mimosa which there are 8 types. My favorite thing about the park is eating outside and given gloves to make my plate each time you go to the buffet for brunch. The chicken enchiladas are on a point as well.   Recommendation: go early to avoid long waits

reviews.author: Marissa T.
reviews.description: Stopped in for happy hour and I was rather sad! I think they are understaffed at the moment and couldn't provide the best service.   They have a great happy hour menu that I will have to stop by again to give another try! However parking garage is right across the street and it's free so that's always a plus! I had their margarita and chips and dip, nothing to rave over but nothing to "complain" about. I know they have more potential and quite possibly caught them on an off day. Will update this review when I revisit!

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: The food was indeed amazing I love eating here and being in this atmosphere. I love watching the game and being I this spy it's nothing like being here watching the game and eating.

reviews.author: Jeremy T.
reviews.description: Vibes. I can't say it I dislike it but, it's much less "fun" than it was at one point. Affordable AF, the staff is cool enough and if you're smart you'll get there early to get a table.

reviews.author: Isaac E.
reviews.description: Thanks to Yelp we were able to join the waitlist. It was a long wait with lots of people ahead of us, so make sure you check in early.   The place is lively and has a dark, rustic feel to it. Seating inside and out!   I liked the fries the most. It was unlike any fry I've ever had. It was fluffy and addicting!   Based off of how good our burgers tasted, I'm sure any of the other choices are just as good! They were so large, we could hardly finish it. Tastes just as good for leftovers.   Don't skip the fried pickles! They're a good starter.   Mac and Cheese was good, could've been a little more cheesier, but it was creamy and it had an adequate amount for what it's worthy (lots of people get skimpy when it comes to adding a side of Mac and Cheese)   Our server was friendly and attentive. Great at memorization--he didn't have to write anything down with no mistakes. And those who dropped off other food at our table were nice as well!

reviews.author: Marcy C.
reviews.description: Came for dinner: ordered the 20 piece wings, Parmesan  fries, Cesar salads and Cobb salad. Fries and wings were good but the salads were another story. Now I know why you should wash your lettuce! Both salads had grit in them making them inedible. I have a pepper mill at home and use Himalayan rock salt so I know the difference. This was not that-it was like sand. I'll probably come back for the wings or a drink but I definitely won't be ordering a salad;)

reviews.author: Jasmin M.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch very sad buffet hardly had anything in it .. after waiting 2 hrs to sit down had to wait 20+ min to order  By the time we got our check one of the people in our party still hadn't even gotten her food(pasta) she got the bill for her food before she even got her food

reviews.author: Mattie I.
reviews.description: The food and the drinks are mediocre to average but the happy hour is one of the best in the area and the staff is attendant, especially in the outdoor bar section. Not as great service in the outdoor seating to the left. Lots of outdoor space.

name: Workhorse Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Junus A.
reviews.description: This place is STILL GREAT. Only ever had one bad burger here (was a bit dry).   I am just going to affirm that this is my favorite bar in Austin. I have lots of drinking experience in Austin. Workhorse nails it. Anyone can come here, feel comfortable, enjoy super-solid food, a great beer selection, and walk away with an affordable tab. It's just perfect..  LOVE the new COVID sidewalk space. PLEASE keep it. Probably 90% of the patrons here smoke cigarettes and the back patio only barely sufficed.

reviews.author: Will C.
reviews.description: I can't comment on the bar itself since I didn't get the chance to drink there, but it's decent burger at a great price.  The burger itself was overcooked and dry; I don't know if this is normal, if the kitchen was having a bad series, or if the customer can request medium-rare.  Something to consider for next time.  And there should be a next time too, because this is still a great deal: burger + side for under $10.  Sure, it'd be nice if cheese wasn't an upcharge, but that's really a minor quibble.  Inside, the décor is funky and vibey, much like the other restaurants and shops in this North Loop neighborhood.  What stands out most inside is the massive album art print from Stone Temple Pilots's Purple.  Thanks to this, I haven't been able to get "Interstate Love Song" out of my head for the past four days.

reviews.author: Veronica R.
reviews.description: Nice and friendly staff. Willing to make a drink off the menu. Good local crowd. Parking is a little hard but i can walk. Lol

reviews.author: Henry Y.
reviews.description: Came here with the coworkers on a Friday right after work. This is a great spot with an outdoor seating area in BOTH the front and the back (which I didn't know at first).  Their drinks are pre-California exodus cheap, so grab a beer or two or three. They also have grub. There's plenty of burgers to choose from, a coworker said their portobello burger is bomb. I got the burger special, which was arugula and blue cheese. My burger was slightly overcooked and a coworker's was well-done, so you'll have to be mindful of that; if you like yours med-rare or medium, I would call it out. I thought they were pretty generous with the blue cheese, but the burger itself could have been slightly larger; they're thick but relatively tiny. Buns are toasted. I think next time I'd go with one of the classic burgers since I felt the burger special was really heavy, the arugula doesn't bring enough balance for the funkiness of the blue cheese. The parmesian fries were alright, a tad too salty for me.  The guys behind the bar were nice, a bee got stuck in my bottle and they kindly replaced it.  PARKING: there's a few spots out front, but there's plenty of parking around the corner in the residential area.  Come for the drinks, stay for vibes.

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: When we went earlier today for lunch and cocktails, we were, as always, welcomed by the same amazing team. We had a Bastrop Burger, a BL sandwich, both with Parmesan fries, some margaritas, a Paloma and a Pimm's Cup. Everyone and everything keeps us coming back.

reviews.author: Andrew J.
reviews.description: It's a good dive, with tons of beer on tap and surprisingly good food. Lots of vegetarian options too. Service is pretty decent considering how grungy the place is.   However: I definitely got at least one drink in a dirty ass glass, and the kitchen staff is, shall we say, pretty casual about food hygiene. And yet I still liked it somehow. Maybe because so many other places in present-day Austin are just gentrification normie hellscapes-- this is a nice change of pace.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Great bar and grill across from vintage row. BLT and fries were great. Good music too not to mention a lot of beer on draft to pick from  we will be back

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Try the pretzels, you'll thank me. Great neighborhood spot for beers and burgers on the outdoor patio out back.

reviews.author: Mason M.
reviews.description: Amazing food. Definitely get a burger and the Parmesan fries! Tables and atmosphere are a little awkward if you aren't there for the bar part. I would highly recommend it as a bar/burger place.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Was I just transported to a mountain town where everyone just got off their shift on the slopes? Oh, nope. Still in Austin.   This is a cozy, neighborhood bar. The seating is a bit hodge podge cabin lodge so you might find yourself standing if it's crowded, but as is the case anywhere that's solid. All the drinking options for all the drinking types. The burgers look legit, but I didn't have one.  Bundle up and throw 'em back.

reviews.author: Endy L.
reviews.description: Quick service, food, drinks, price. Only thing is merch designs seem lazy. Will be back!

reviews.author: Shawn M.
reviews.description: The place is a cool dive and seating outside but the drinks aren't dive bar prices and the cooks never wash their hands before preparing your meal.  I guess they don't care about this pandemic at all.  I watched the cook scratch his head, grab his phone and text then started to assemble a burger without a care in the world or concern for cleanliness.  So if I were you I would eat before I go to this establishment.

reviews.author: Kayla H.
reviews.description: Good food. Not great service.  I was excited by all the vegetarian options on the menu. My mac n cheese was good. The fried pickles were soooo good. Definitely recommend those.  We came midday, and I'd have preferred there be a few more non-alcoholic beverages. It seemed there were usually quite a few choices, but they were out of most things. Not sure why.  We'd come again.

reviews.author: Kelly N.
reviews.description: This is a great bar! The food is really delicious and there's a lot of different options for everyone. You can order everything from burgers to mac and cheese to sandwiches. There's even veggie options for those of you who are vegetarian! The fries are great. The beers are awesome and there's a big selection.  It is pretty hot here here though, especially outside during the summer. I love the location and sometimes it's hard to find parking but it's a great spot for a beer and some food. It does get crowded but the service was still quick.

reviews.author: Jenny L.
reviews.description: this used to be a hipster bearded ax throwing dude bar.   it's now a whitewashed college kid bar, and packed af.

reviews.author: Sylvain B.
reviews.description: It's a dive bar so I'll keep my review short: - extremely cheap beers: down to $1 a bottle and $3 a pint of draft beer - amazing selection of great (local and non-) beers - super friendly bartender who knows his products and gives great advice on the beers to choose form. - great ambiance, nice patron, fun atmosphere and great music.  So it goes in the 4 stars dive bars!  Note: They have an outdoor patio in the back.

reviews.author: Nickie B.
reviews.description: I have been to the Workhorse Bar three times before yesterday, and those experiences were all 3-4 stars.  But this most recent visit was teetering on between 2-3 stars.    I ordered the White Manhattan, which has always been awesome!  This visit it tasted like they poured me a glass of watered down Moonshine and added a twist of Orange.  I ordered a second one just to make sure it was just not a bad pour.  Nope the second one was as bad as the first. The odd thing is they bartender who made them both, was the same bartender who has made them for me on my prior visits.     We were also quite bothered by the loud group behind us slamming their cards on the table as they played some unknown card game.  They were overly loud and obnoxious.  We were not the only customers who were annoyed.  The other pet peeve I have is when large groups of people stand at the front door of an entrance to smoke cigarettes.  On this visit there was always a group of 3-7 people puffing away well within 15 feet of the front door.  People...please go smoke out back on the patio.  The upside of this visit was the music from the jukebox.  For $2 we were able to select 8 tunes.  Music selection is random, but good.

reviews.author: Tina M.
reviews.description: Workhorse is the perfect little neighborhood bar. It has a fairly large and very affordable selection of drinks, an all-around-the-clock "happy hour", great bar food and a nice staff! They also have a jukebox (select 4 songs for a dollar) and a patio in the back.   In the food department, they've got a good selection of sides and appetizers, as well as burgers, salads and fries. Vegetarians will be pleased to find out they have several veggie options, including two types of veggie burgers and many sides. The food is cheap and tasty. I don't know about you, but for me that's getting pretty close to my definition of heaven!   If you want available seating space for the duration of your stay, I recommend visiting between Monday and Thursday. Friday and weekends are very popular nights and you might not be able to find a cozy spot to sit, although that goes for most bars.  If you pass by the North Loop strip one evening, you should definitely drop by and have a taste of Workhorse.

reviews.author: Bill G.
reviews.description: This is a great neighborhood bar. I don't live in the neighborhood but I do love this hangout. Friendly staff and patrons, genuinely Austin. Food and drinks are definitely in the affordable range. Cool art on the walls and an awesome jukebox. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: We visited this place last week and are so sad that it hasn't been our go-to all along. It's located in such a chill part of Austin, so it's perfect when you feel like going out, but not going out (if you know what I mean)! They have a ton of beers on tap and handful of yummy sounding cocktails. We didn't eat here, but when we saw their blue cheese bacon burger with huge azzz onion rings on the side we were wishing we did! It was totally embarrassing, but my husband accidentally spilled his first beer on the bar and the bar tender did a great job at not acting completely annoyed at him, although he was. He even poured him another which we were not expecting at all, so that added to our great experience here! Highly recommend, but only if you're not a high-maintenance little princess because it definitely has some grunginess to it ;)

name: Lavaca Street Bar At Rock Rose
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Santiago R.
reviews.description: Ate here awhile back but forgot to leave a review. The food here is decent. Giving it 4 stars since it can be a good venue to watch sports at and it is a nice venue overall.

reviews.author: Lydia H.
reviews.description: I ordered some tater tots and fries to go -- they were super oily and didn't taste fresh at all. I ended up getting sick and throwing up about 30 min after eating them.

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: The whole area is fake af. Bunch of losers revving their engines, overpriced drinks, and staff that is watching the clock. I'd rather be downtown dodging bullets.

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: Beers a little pricey but bartenders super nice. Fly rite popup is a nice addition, and seating is plentiful.

reviews.author: Anna G.
reviews.description: No bad experience just wasn't impressed by the grunginess and casualness of the bartenders. The beers were also pricey for Austin and considering the place isn't anything special. I got boneless wings at Flyrite inside. It was fine.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: For flyrite only:  We stopped in here when they first converted over to fly rite and ordered the chicken quesadilla, buffalo chicken sandwich, kale slaw and tots. In my opinion the best things were the tots and the quesadilla. The quesadilla had A LOT of veggies, more than it had chicken. The kale slaw didn't have much flavor and the sandwich was average.   Overall, it is a little pricey for the quality and with so many options nearby, we probably won't be back.

reviews.author: Jaclyn V.
reviews.description: Just reviewing the vibe bc we left in search of seafood. cool place with plenty of patio seating on busy rock rose, but we were bummed that they have done away with their variety of oysters.  We specifically went down there to get oysters bc we heard that they were full of flavor. Not sure if the limited menu is just during COVID or if it is to stay.

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: After a long day walking around the Domain our last stop was to find a place to relax and have a drink before returning home so selected Lavaca Street Bar. From the outside it looked like a sports bar and it was. When you enter you can order food from a full menu of mostly seafood cuisine. We just skipped this and headed straight to the bar where located right in the middle of this establishment.  This place has lots of flat screens showing a wide variety of sports entertainment. The beer choices was excellent and enjoyed the one I had. Staff were nice and tended to our needs very well.  Fun atmosphere where there was an adult birthday party going on here. Another nice design is very open to the outside even if sitting inside unless way in the back. We enjoyed it and next time pick something off the menu.

reviews.author: Chris N.
reviews.description: Over decent spot to grab drinks and watch a game. Staff did a pretty solid job given the crowd during the AFC conference game

reviews.author: Preston W.
reviews.description: I was visiting from out of town and stopped in with a friend of mine today. The bartender seemed annoyed with us because we were taking her away from her friends on the other side of the bar. I had to call her to come over after our one drink to close my tab. We would have stayed for more drinks but she wasn't in the least bit friendly. There are too many other places to choose from in this area. Save yourself the trouble

reviews.author: Patrick P.
reviews.description: Stopped in here Sunday when visiting friends and walked around Domain for a bit. We decided to eat lunch and find a place that had some of the NFL games on. We ordered food through fly rite chicken, and I ordered a Bloody Mary from the bar. Pretty tasty food, Bloody Mary was tasty and enjoyed that on a warmer afternoon.   Lots of cool places to visit around this area. I suggest trying the Buffalo chicken sandwich with a side of tater tots.

reviews.author: Julie B.
reviews.description: LAVACA STREET BAR YOU OFFICIALLY RUINED YOUR PLACE. The real reason we even came here was for the fantastic poboys, seafood sandwiches. We haven't been to your place in a while due to the pandemic. We walk in excited and salivating and walked out disgusted to learn it was like Fly chicken or something like that. Seriously? You had a perfect blend of affordable high-end food and now,,,, wow you offer such exiting fare as chicken sandwiches?! How is this something anyone looks forward to? Such typical bar food.  I told all my neighbors this and they were shocked. GET BACK THE OLD RESTAURANT. Guys, *that's what made you special and memorable. Your bar isn't that exciting or enticing without it.. think about your Rock Rose Street competition. We were sooo sad to see these food items go. I hate to say it, but we will NEVER be back. Why did you ruin a good thing?!?

reviews.author: Nathan B.
reviews.description: March 9th we walked in and zero safely protocols. Bartender not wearing a mask and not able to answer why she wasn't wearing one.  What a joke

reviews.author: Kathleen M.
reviews.description: Was in the mood for a late night meal and decided to hit the Domain for Lavaca's 30th Anniversary Party to grab a bite to eat. An absolutely phenomenal decision as the food was delicious!
