reviews.description: Stopped by with others for a quick pop as we were beered out from Whitestone's delicious Oktoberfest beer. Bartender was patient with us as we pondered our last cocktail of the day. Notice I said day not evening. We settled on shots (why not??!!). We all received generous pours at a reasonable price.   Shooters is a great sports bar with multiple TVS (they do have the NFL ticket). There are plenty of pool tables and games to keep you occupied. I would definitely come here to watch games but the cigarette smoke stench is too much for me, and I'm a cigar smoker. We visited for about 10 minutes and my clothes stunk of smoke. I wish they would go smokeless like their other venue on 620 or at least add some additional smoke eaters. If you are a smoker it is a 5 star joint... for others 3 makes it AOK and a fair rating.

reviews.author: Jeff D.
reviews.description: Love this bar. Great atmosphere, friendly bar tenders,  and good drink selections. Monika, Shelby, and the entire staff are the best

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: Sunday pro football here is the best! $2 zeigenbach and $1.50 cheeseburgers and hotdogs off the grill. Can't beat it! Outdoor seating and smoking inside. Great place to watch football    * they don't have the cheeseburgers and hotdogs outside any longer but still a great place to watch any game you want. Please read reviews and understand it is a smoking bar and if that will make you mad don't come

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: Shooters is the worst bar I've ever been to. Service sucks and the staff was extremely rude and all their glasses were dirty.

reviews.author: Sean G.
reviews.description: Unable to show the Texas longhorn game in the ATX is sad.  Drinks where really good and the pool tables where nice.

reviews.author: Toni G.
reviews.description: Two things about this bar. They allow smoking. Which I could have left, I know. Second, if you keep a tab open they automatically add 20% gratuity to your bill! There was only 2 of us. There's nothing posted about this. We were tipping the bartenders as we ordered. So on top of the $32 in tips we gave, we were forced to pay another $23 on our bill. They should have a notice if you plan on keeping your tab open, a gratuity is automatically added. Even for a party of 2. Ridiculous

reviews.author: Nickie B.
reviews.description: A-OK place, but be warned you WILL smell like smoke if you come here.  They offer a bar with ample seating, plenty of individual tables for seating, several pool tables, have a stage (that was empty when we visited), have an outdoor patio and an add collection of gambling machines in the back corner.  I am sure it is not real gambling, but the game players certainly looked like they were in Vegas.  Prices are reasonable.  Would not come out of my way to come here, but it is a decent dive bar.

reviews.author: Jason D.
reviews.description: Really disappointed at how this place has changed. New GM or manager or whatever has no clue on customer service and taking care of people that come in more times than others. And the waitress was rude to a friend after closing out and said "Have fun with your Slut Pants".... Whatever that means..... Really..... Keep it classy CP!!  Fast Eddie's is the place to go if you don't won't the Jerry Springer drama!!

reviews.author: Steven S.
reviews.description: It's a smelly filthy place.   Ridiculous low end pool tables I wouldn't think about playing on.  Go back in the kitchen and look for yourself how filthy it is.   The entire place smells like a wet old homeless person.

reviews.author: Jason L.
reviews.description: We went on a friday night and the place was relatively busy. Drinks were good, but the way under staffed for a friday night. The only reason I'm giving it a 4 star is for the fact that our waitress was trying soooo hard. She was running drinks, bar backing, cooking food and bartending. Also not to mention she was the only waitress there. But all in all we had a great time!

reviews.author: Young K.
reviews.description: This is nice and cool place to hang out with friends and family.. dates..cause live music and play pools..also friendly great services from bars and wait staff..i am enjoying and have a great time on my each visit...thanks for all great services to management!!!

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out but they have smoking and for me that is a HUGE minus because I believe that such places should keep the environment clean and focused on the pool players.

reviews.author: Manda L.
reviews.description: The bartender, an older gentleman, has been extremely rude on the 3 occasions we have visited this bar.  The bar set up is great, but with rude staff like this why would I want to come back.  Bad service lost you 4 ladies who spend a good amount and tip well....and earned you a bad review.  If your staff is so miserable they cannot give good service, maybe it's time to clean house.

reviews.author: Amgad E.
reviews.description: this place is terrible. They are racist and horrible. I came here to have a beer and for no reason the bar tender decided I was to leave. I had no problem with leaving as long as he refunded the beer I didn't even take a sip off - except he wouldn't. In fact he called d the cops and lied to them that I was disturbing the peace. I never  been more humiliated and disappointed before... this place is a total trash can for trashy racists

reviews.author: Deb G.
reviews.description: As others have suggested, definitely do a Tipster Walking tour early in your Austin stay.  We walked with Laura on the Downtown tour and the Eastside Art tour, both of which were fantastic.  She is knowledgable and a good story teller.  My husband and I learned a lot from her both historically and fun facts along the way.  She provides other suggestions while staying in Austin along with restaurant favorites.  Thank you Laura, keep up the great work!!! Glad you will be vacationing in STL soon!

reviews.author: Vic C.
reviews.description: Tipster Tours is a must do if you are visiting Austin for the first time (they also offer a tour in San Antonio's downtown if you also visit during your trip since it is only 90 minutes away from Austin). There are 5 tours available to choose from (some require a minimum of a group of 6 though) and are free! This walking tour allows for you to give any tip that you want after it is done. You are under no obligation to tip anything, but it would be nice for the tour guide to get something from you.   During our visit, we only went to the downtown tour, where you meet outside of the state capitol. My husband wanted to check out another tour but during our visit, it was raining and I just didn't want to walk in light rain and mud (yeah I'm a sore sport). For most tours, you just show up at the location. There is no need to RSVP (you can see the dates and time available on the company's website).  For our tour (about 90 minutes), we had Laura as our tour guide. Because this tour is all outside, we brought our little girl dog (she told us this was her first time having a dog on her tour). For this tour, it leaves the capitol, heads to the small park across the street, then to the governor's mansion (where you will most likely see either the governor's golden retriever, Pancake or their newly adopted little puppy golden retriever), various murals, other historical places and ends at the Driskill Hotel.   We learned so many things on this tour, the 3 of us enjoyed it (I am sure my little girl was happy to mark her territory as we walked along) and would highly recommend this tour. The walking is pretty easy and so most should be able to be fine.

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: Our guide, Laura met the groups on time and was easy to locate. No reservations or upfront payment is required. In fact, the tours are billed as free! However, being "Tip"-ster, they are appreciative of tips and in the FAQ suggest $15-$25 per person per tour. Over a 2 day period, we took 3 tours...Music, Downtown and Eastside Arts. Each tour was 1 1/2 hours. Laura was very knowledgeable and was easily heard and understood. Questions were welcomed and answered. At the end of each tour, we were given information on what we could do next. Check the website before you go, as the time had changed from the week before when I planned. The time change was bolded, so easily found. Highly recommend these tours. Since we were on a "stay"-cation, we may do the others they offer soon!

reviews.author: Robyn P.
reviews.description: There's a great new tour guide service in Austin and it's not to be missed!  Newly unveiled in October, this company allows participants to "pay" for their tour once its completed by tipping their tour guide. This is a fantastic idea because it practically ensures you'll get a fun and informative tour.   Joey, our guide, was very friendly and knew his Austin history. He delivered his facts and info with wit and humor which kept everyone attentive and entertained. I highly recommend him if it's possible to request a guide. Bonus: Joey looks like "Lip" from Shameless.  Have fun!

reviews.author: Bethany K.
reviews.description: Natalie's East Side Art Tour provided an amazing opportunity to see cool pieces on the east side of Austin. She was informative and super knowledgeable about local artists and different styles! She also had great recommendations of local places to try.

reviews.author: Ky C.
reviews.description: WILLY~~spelled like willy wonka not like willie nelson, was a great guide. we had him for our austin music tour which started at lambert's bbq on second. he came with a guitar and took us around to all the cool historic music spots and sang along the way. i would strongly suggest you spend some time with them and get to know austin!

reviews.author: marissa a.
reviews.description: I've done two tours so far, both with Laura. Had a friend in town to visit a few weeks ago and we did the Downtown tour, then returned yesterday with my sister for the East Side Art tour. I have to be honest and say that I didn't anticipate enjoying the art tour (art isn't usually my thing), but it was super fun and informative. Both tours were great and completely worth the time and money. Love the idea that you pay what you can afford in order to bring tours to people who wouldn't otherwise be able to participate. I definitely plan on making my way back to take the other tours!

reviews.author: Carrie B.
reviews.description: We did the East Austin brewery tour with Korie yesterday and it was amazing! Our group was made up of about 12 people from 5 different countries. Korie was informative and friendly and helped with suggestions of places to go after the tour. Now I want to sign up for more of the Tipster tours so that I can learn more about the city I've lived in for 20 years!! So whether you're an Austin native or just visiting, I'd suggest making time to tour the city with Tipster.

reviews.author: Bill T.
reviews.description: Austin music tour was great! Lots of fun and informative. Tour guide Willy was knowledgeable 'and s lot of fun. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone.

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: We had such a great time on this tour!  We did the Austin Music Tour and had a nice time with our guide Laura!  She took us to some cool places and it was fun to learn what the venues once were and how they came to be what they are today.  My boyfriend wrote down some places and we visited them later that night.  Walking tours are such a great way to explore a new city and I love the idea of tipsters- pay at then end what you think the tour is worth.  I also feel that Laura took the time to create a great tour and was very passionate about her Austin music!

reviews.author: Cody D.
reviews.description: Would definitely recommend! We did the Downtown Tour and our tour guide Joey was entertaining and new his Texas history. He provided a lot of  recommendations for the rest of our stay. No pressure to tip a certain amount...just pay whatever you can.

reviews.author: Jd C.
reviews.description: I had a great time on the east side beer tour. Even as a life long Austinite Kelly taught me a lot about the local beers and East Austin. Loved it, the beer flowed like wine and beautiful women instinctively flock like the salmon of Capistrano. Great work!

reviews.author: Shani S.
reviews.description: What a wonderful time!  As a bachelorette "day party," we gathered together and hopped in the super roomy and comfortable All About Central Texas SUV and headed out on our journey.   Kim is extremely knowledgeable about each winery; the history, the best wines to try, the "wine club" or other bonus things each winery has.   We stopped in on 3 different wineries and Kim had made superb choices in each spot; from the wines to the view to the suggestions on what to try and how to make the most of our samples so everyone could try as many as possible (thanks for that tip, Kim!).   Be it an afternoon with a group of friends, or a romantic day for two, All About Central Texas is an outstanding choice.  Thanks for everything, Kim!

reviews.author: Donna D.
reviews.description: All about Central Texas was really great- Kim was so knowledgeable about the area and had great info on wine and Texas! I did the Fredericksburg tour and based on my wine preferences she had some great suggestions on which ones to stop in, there are so many! I even joined a wine club, the tastings were informative and she is just a lot of fun and I didn't have to worry about driving or directions and could enjoy the pours and some snacks.  I highly recommend All abt Central Texas tours, they are personable, you can really get to meet the others in these small groups- Thanks so much!

name: Austin Taco Project
accommodations: Good for Dinner, Late Night, Dessert
Valet Parking, Garage Parking, Street Parking
Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Carolyn A.
reviews.description: This place is hopping! Delicious food and accommodating staff despite the crowd craziness make this a very nice spot. An idea: vegetarian tacos for the very sophisticated menu would also be nice. Thanks, everyone.

reviews.author: Samantha S.
reviews.description: Horrible service. I'm staying at Hilton and wanted to try this place since it's inside the hotel. A couple of days ago, I wanted to place a to go order for breakfast. I called countless times for over two hours (no joke) and was either placed on hold or sent to voicemail but no one ever assisted in placing my order. So that day was shot and I went elsewhere.   I tried placing another to go order this morning and called over 40 times, literally! But once again no luck. So I decided to stop by in person on my way to work. (If you're wondering why i kept trying it's bc the hotel offered food credit to be used at the restaurant.) I advised the male host that I attempted to call and even showed him the call history on my phone and that no one ever answered the phone. He claimed he just arrived at work and couldn't explain why there was no answer. He was not sympathetic one bit. I proceeded to place an a order for the açaí bowl to which he responded that they couldn't serve it since it was no longer breakfast time. Mind you, I had attempted to place my order by calling before breakfast ended and I wanted to show him my call history before 11:00 am but he could have cared less. So I proceeded to ask for the manager. (My apologizes for acting like a "Karen" here but I felt justified.)   While waiting for the manager, I dialed the restaurant again to test if they would answer since the restaurant was not busy. The phone is next to the host's stand where I was standing and I noticed that the calls were not being answered. The ringer was off but the phone would light up. The phone also reported 117 missed calls! Wth?! That's a lot of business they're losing from potential customers that want to place food orders.   Richard, the manager, just added fuel to the fire. I waited nearly ten minutes for him. When he finally surfaced from the back I explained the situation. He was very cold, not apologetic and just asked me if the açaí bowl was all I wanted. When I answered in the affirmative he said "ok" and walked off. Never said it'll be right out and never apologized. So rude and unprofessional and so disappointing coming from management.   I eventually received my order but not an apology.  The food prices are also excessive. Can get much better tacos at much lower prices elsewhere with much better customer service.

reviews.author: Lisa D.
reviews.description: SXSW beware.   I came yesterday for lunch. Carne asada tacos were great and the salsa was also great. The server was a middle aged white guy who was beyond nice.   So my punishment for coming back today is mediocre food, visibly smaller portions, and rude service from a young woman with braids uptwisted.   I asked for a sample of queso. They aren't even close to capacity. Walk up seating. The response was "No.". Not, I'm sorry we aren't allowed to sample. Just NO.   I kept looking at her with a blank stare and she said "I'm serious. I would have to charge you to get anything from the kitchen!"   Since I never asked for a FREE sample, I just looked at her and placed my order.   Chips and salsa. Overpriced at $14. And confit pig tacos $12.   Here's the thing. I came yesterday and got my salsa in white bowls served on the white plate.   Today someone decided since I was by myself I would get a half portion.   This is so fcuking ghetto. You're getting the same $14 it doesn't matter how many people are at the table.   At this point I'm pretty done. However the icing on the cake. I've been sitting here for 45 minutes. I finished my food. And this waitress hasn't once stopped to see if I need anything. AGAIN. The restaurant is at 50% capacity as to what it was yesterday when I got better service and better food.   I won't be back.

reviews.author: Greg B.
reviews.description: As a long time Austinite I have a real problem paying for chips at a Tex/Mex place and this place wants $7(?!) for a bowl ($14 if you want salsa with that) But it's a taco restaurant in the touristy Hilton so I can't say I'm surprised.  I was working in the area and pressed for time so I thought I'd give it a try.  Having said that, their Confit Pig tacos were fine (great flavor and sauce) although the pork was a little tough and at $12 for 2 these are the cheapest tacos on the menu.  $19 Carne Asada Burrito? You must be joking. I probably won't be back.   They've got nothing on Torchy's, Tacodeli, Veracruz, or any of the multitude of great, inexpensive, and authentic taco trucks in town. The ubiquitous hipster logo says it all. Don't be a tourist!

reviews.author: Isles G.
reviews.description: This place is terrible. Ordered four tacos for two people and ate 1. And 1/2, which was too much. Shouldn't have eaten any of it. If you have frozen fish sticks at home your tacos will be better, and the carne asada tacos looked like they were leftover from last week. Do not waste your $ or time even if it is convenient to the hotel.

reviews.author: Corinne T.
reviews.description: In a city of amazing Mexican food, the tacos and queso were no bueno. Queso just tasted like velveeta and I could have made better tacos at home.

reviews.author: Bryce M.
reviews.description: Overpriced, rude staff, and incredibly underwhelming. My "chorizo" breakfast taco was 90% egg with some ground turkey and black beans in it. No flavor and honestly pretty gross.

reviews.author: Glenn P.
reviews.description: Taco was cold, burger was burnt. Kids grill cheese was quit good however. Kids meal came out 30min before rest. When the hostess was asked for catchup for the kids fries. She told us to ask our server.

reviews.author: Chuck F.
reviews.description: Never go - it's terrible   Incredibly slow  The place was nicely decorated   Service was so slow  The hostess was overwhelmed  Food runner was incredibly rude   The staff was really not nice  Our server was trying but not prepared or able to get food out timely   Never go for food - or experience

reviews.author: Cindy B.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I ordered the ceviche, pork tacos, and the brisket tacos. Super overpriced for what they give you. Mediocre at best and the service was slow. The bar was "backed up" but the restaurant was not even half full. Only amazing service we had was from the guy refilling our water cups.

reviews.author: B G.
reviews.description: Came here for breakfast. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. The hostess was a horrible girl. We asked to sit outside and she said that the servers were not going outside. Cut to 2 minutes later and she sat customers outside. Meanwhile we are stuck next to a family with 2 small children, loud as all heck. Will not be back. Rather go to taco cabana.

reviews.author: Rosie G.
reviews.description: It was pretty bad. It was on open table to we booked a reservation. Food was cold when it came out. I got the buffalo chicken taco that I bit into and it was raw. The waiter was nice but I watched him tell the manager and the manager didn't come up to us to apologize at all. So many other places to eat, don't make the same mistake as us.

reviews.author: Meghan C.
reviews.description: An hour and a half for 3 tiny tacos. Terrible service and dessert never arrived. Would not eat here again.

reviews.author: Seo Youn C.
reviews.description: Admittedly I came here on New Years Eve for some late night munchies before the countdown, not knowing this joint was part of the Hilton Hotel. That explains why the prices were slightly high when tacos are ubiquitous in Texas.   The fish taco was actually really good. I think they might have been a close tie for tacos I've had on my Texas trip. However the old school tacos were kind of boring and a little difficult to eat because they were getting soggy.  Our drinks were really good...but really sugary. It would be hard for a drink to taste bad with that much sugar. I would commend a bartender that can make a drink taste good/sophisticated without resorting to all that syrup. I felt like I was drinking candy syrup. This missed the mark for me in creativity or sophistication.  Would I recommend this place again? I'm unsure. If I stumbled upon here, I would definitely eat here again but I'm not sure I would go out of my way to eat here

reviews.author: Jennifer J.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed the food and drinks here on my recent trip to Austin. I haven't been to Austin in over 12 years so it was nice to get back downtown and see what's changed and what's not.  On a quiet Thursday night, stopped in to a relatively empty house.  Guessing given it was a weekday, on a rather chilly night for Austin, and with 6th street so close by - that's why it was so quiet.    To our benefit though, as we got great service.  My prickly pear margarita was perfectly balanced, great drink to end my night on.  For food, started with the guacamole, fried brussel sprouts, and for my main I got the al pastor tacos.  Let me tell you, those brussel sprouts are were it's at! They were perfect, the flavor was outstanding.  The soy glaze that's on top is delicious.  While the guacamole itself was great, the chips were a total let down.  For a taco joint, you'd think they'd fry up some fresh chips - these were sadly not - but good enough to get that guac to the mouth.  My al pastor tacos were pretty good, but I would have loved a little more char on the pork.  The pineapple was a refreshing topping, just enough not to be overwhelming.  Again, service was great, not too intrusive and at a good pace.  Def. look forward to coming back here when I return in March!

reviews.author: Lucy M.
reviews.description: While the food didn't blow me away, it's great that they're open late. They have a trendy, colorful decor and very nice staff that were friendly and attentive.   A friend and I split a bunch of things off their bar snack menu. The deviled eggs with pickled mustard seeds and bacon were fine, but the mustard seed was a weird addition that managed to completely mask the bacon. The carnitas tacos were bland, couldn't taste the salsa verde. The Chimichurri tacos were better, the steak was nice, but again the flavor was mellow at best.   The tots absolutely stole the show though, this is what you should order. Tater tots covered in fried cheese curds, poblano gravy, and a sunny side up egg. This was hard to finish because of its density but is so good you'll put yourself through the pain to try!

reviews.author: Mike Z.
reviews.description: Cool little place located a floor before the Hilton Austin mail lobby and across from the convention center.  Bad thing is they don't open till 4pm, good thing is they are open till midnight or later depending on the night.   Decent size full bar located in the back of the restaurant. Great selection of local craft beers and some that are local!  Then there are the tacos, they come out really really fast after you order them, bad thing is they come really fast after you order them .  They are lukewarm at best.  And rather tasteless, no seasoning or lack of.   Came here multiple times during a week stay at the Hilton, service at the bar was never an issue.

reviews.author: McKenzie S.
reviews.description: When our first choice for dinner didn't pull through we were desperate to find a quick (we had less than an hour!) and tasty place to find dinner. It also needed to seat 7 of us... oh and it was a Saturday night.   That's a lot of requests, right?   Well lucky for us, Yelp found us Austin Taco Project. You would never know that this was inside the Hyatt hotel, but it is! And it's pretty darn cute.   It's divided into two sections - the bar and seated. Both of which will get you a waiter. We opted for the bar area and were super comfortable. Our waiter was amazing and everything you'd want in a waiter. Unfortunately his name escapes me, but he was pretty darn fabulous. Quick, efficient, even taking off a drink that never arrived (totally not his fault) yet still giving the drink to our friend in the end.   The tacos at this place were all over the map - and I like it like that! A little different, a little strange, but still familiar. I ordered the Umami Taco which was both vegan and gluten free (not that it matters to me) but I do love anything mushroom. The waiter indicated it was salty and suggested I add avocado to cut the salt. He was so right! I do love me some salty things but the avocado was exactly what was needed - and some lime!   I also ordered the deviled eggs . Why? Because I always order deviled eggs. And they didn't disappoint! A great treat on a hot day!   Cocktails were splendid and on point. And everything on the menu was a delight.   Definitely look to this spot for a quick cocktail and bite with friends!

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: My friends and I came here for dinner on our first night in Austin and had a decent meal. I had made a reservation in advance, but it wasn't super necessary as the restaurant wasn't crowded around 8pm.  To start, we all split an order of Tots (fried cheese curd, poblano gravy, and a sunny side egg) and the Elote (charred corn, chipotle aioli, queso fresco, cilantro). Both were super delicious, and far surpassed the tacos I ordered for my main meal. I got an order of the Umami Tofu (mushroom mix, fennel salad, and candied ginger). Having candied ginger on a taco was a super interesting experience, and honestly I'm not mad about it. Overall the tacos were decent but a little cold and incredibly oily.   I appreciate what Austin Taco Project is trying to do with unique taco creations, even if they don't always work out, but honestly my biggest complaint is about the slow service. Despite the restaurant being relatively empty and our waiter standing 15 feet away from our table for the majority of the night, he visited our table very infrequently to check on us.   Overall it's not a bad spot, but the food quality and service could definitely use some improvements.

reviews.author: Tammy L.
reviews.description: Parents, hubby and I landed here after a particularly harrowing travel day. We were eager to get our grub on and this place sounded nice so we trekked 5 minutes on foot to get here.  I was a little turned off by the host taking leading (?) us to the table, leaving the menus on the table and walking off without pausing to see us to our seats. He continued walking off without saying another word or a backward glance at us. It was like he went for a stroll, slowed down to leave some menus on a random table and went on his merry way. Mind you, the place was mostly empty so he wasn't like, rushing back to seat more people.  Anyway, our server came by in short order and took our order. To start, we ordered the onion dip, the ribs, deviled eggs and the elote. I definitely recommend the elote which was delicious and quickly devoured, followed by possibly the onion dip. It did double duty as saucing for the tacos (more on that later).  My parents enjoyed the ribs. I abstained.   As for the deviled eggs...I'm willing to allow may be it was just this batch but we're fairly confident this gave me the runs all night and some of the morning, too. I ate 75% of the dish while hubby ate the rest. He had diarrhea once that night.  Parents were fine because they didn't have any. In any case, they tasted a-ok, maybe a bit on the tangy side.   For mains, we shared some carne asada tacos (x4), brisket tacos (x4), carnitas (x2) and Eisben (x2).  The two types of beef tacos were just ok in our book, both leaning towards the dry side. The carne asada was a bit extra dry, hence why I decided to throw some onion dip on top. In contrast, the carnitas were really great as was the Eisben, also a pork-based taco.  For drinks, I ordered the sea foam paloma which didn't do it for me. Can't say why...I think I would just preferred a salt rim, I think.  Anyway, our server was nice and professional...got us our requests in short order so that was a plus. However, I don't think I would make this a repeat.

reviews.author: Natasha A.
reviews.description: Such a dope ass place, it's a convenience store with the best bfast tacos you could ask for. The vegan options were good, fresh.  Love the coffee options, spicy green sauce is probably the best in the city

reviews.author: Jeff D.
reviews.description: Quickie Pickie is just an unassuming spot for a great experience - it's a combination of a small store, coffee shop, and mini-restaurant, and delivers on that combination in a great way. We initially stopped in after a nearby restaurant had a 1.5+ hour wait, and I'm really glad we did!  The staff at Quickie Pickie is super friendly, and quite helpful in making suggestions for coffees and tacos as well. The tacos are pretty decently sized, so I'd say 2-3 would be a good quantity for the average person. I personally got 3 and was stuffed by the end of them. There are a good amount of small tables inside and outside so it was fairly easy for us to nab a spot even at lunch on a weekend.  Overall, I'd definitely recommend checking out Quickie Pickie if you're in the area and looking for a bite to eat!

reviews.author: Michael S.
reviews.description: Came here after wishfully thinking we could walk into Paperboy on a Sunday morning... rookie move.  Lucky for me, QP has some solid breakfast tacos and coffee!   I will def be back for the tacos but might pass on the brioche breakfast sandwich, something about the bread didn't hit the spot.   Good salsas too!  Thank you Paperboy for the QP intro.

reviews.author: Manny G.
reviews.description: Excellent spot to pick up some coffee or cold drinks. The employees are super friendly and the vibe is chill. You can sit outside and enjoy a drink.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Would definitely recommend if you want to sit with your laptop and get a little work done, have a beer or a coffee, just a place to stop in real quickkkk- no pun intended ;)  But the food was not a great experience for me :(  And there's not many seating options- uncomfortable and couldn't stay long because of that.

reviews.author: Bob E.
reviews.description: Neat combination of restaurant and store that has that Austin vibe to it. It has a limited menu, generally hot and cold sandwiches, but also has a selection of beers on tap.   I had and enjoyed the cheese burger.

reviews.author: Bree B.
reviews.description: Super cool pit stop for a quick beer or buying groceries or both. The staff didn't seem to be too inviting, but they were quite busy stocking the shelves and tending to the store itself. The beers on tap were great and very affordable. The grocery items were all slightly expensive, but were quite diverse - tons of vegan and dairy free ice cream options if that's your thing. Can't wait to go back and try the tacos. I think this place is a great pre-game or before dinner drink option without any frills.

reviews.author: Lolly S.
reviews.description: What a fun kitchey place. Perfect for an afternoon lunch. Great tacos!! My fish taco had the biggest piece of fish I have ever seen in a taco. Hubby had chicken fajita loaded with big chunks of chicken. A crazy amount of fries that came with a yummy green dipping sauce.  Huge selection of beers on tap  and also a good selection of wines and other beverages. With an array of people coming and going this place seems to appeal to a wide array of people.

reviews.author: Adam C.
reviews.description: My favorite hangout in Austin. Such a chill atmosphere. Plenty of beers, groceries, and made to order food.

reviews.author: Sam H.
reviews.description: Just moved to the neighborhood, and we've been loving the quickie pickie so far... my only complaint is that the drink selection (aside from beers) is very small...

reviews.author: Jen M.
reviews.description: I've been disappointed in Quickie Pickie lately. I feel like their standards have significantly gotten lower. Some of the staff are so rude, Acting like I'm inconveniencing them by ordering a coffee. And the coffee is rarely how I ordered it. It's so close to my work and convenient for breakfast, coffee and snacks but I think I will be finding a new place. It used to be so great and now it's terrible. The employees need training in customer service.

reviews.author: Catherine B.
reviews.description: Decided not to go to Hillside Pharmacy because they only had the brunch menu unfortunately! We saw Quickie Pickie and decided to head on over.  They have an incredible variety of national and international beers. I also appreciated the fact that they had a fridge where you could buy just a can. They also had a wide variety of red wines and non-alcoholic drinks. They provide free WiFi (password is winebeer) and have lots of seating inside and outside. This would be a great place to camp out with your computer and work offsite. There is a restaurant that serves hot food but you can also grab some quick refrigerated bites that are in a fridge on the right side of the place. I got the Waistline and it was pretty good, it was pretty dry. They serve their sandwiches with ruffle-style potato chips. I wouldn't come back for the sandwich but I do appreciate the beer variety!

reviews.author: Bridget K.
reviews.description: Being from out of town I think this is the coolest! A little grocery store with homemade food, outdoor/indoor seating and a dessert case! I felt like I walked into heaven. This kind of place is totally my jam!  They have a wide variety of drinks and various snacks you can choose from, grab and go food and stuff they can make there. It's also in a great, easy to walk to location.

reviews.author: Emily J.
reviews.description: We love quickie pickie! From the coffee to the food it's delicious! Its a short walk from our house so whenever I bring my daughter to the park we stop by first and get some fresh fruit for a picnic! The breakfast tacos are bomb as well as the hot sandwiches, I'd suggest the founder (: and I'd def stop by if you've never been, from my experience you can't really go wrong with anything !!

reviews.author: Alexandrea C.
reviews.description: (Review is for back in late 2016 when I first moved here. LOL delayed review...sorry.)  I used to work down the street and without exaggeration would come here like 4/7 days a week.   I always LOVED how it was like a small grocery and had a few isles worth of thoughtful products to choose from along with their actual menu.   The avocado and vegan tacos were my favourite--they PACKED them so you definitely get your money's worth.   Staff was always friendly and talkative. Wait times were never longer than they needed to be.

reviews.author: Elizabeth R.
reviews.description: I had a very poor experience at the quickie pickie this morning. After placing my order along with the orders of my 3 family members, we took a seat and patiently anticipated the arrival of our food. After about 30 minutes I walked up to the cashier and asked about the food, he said he would ask about it.. Moments later the long haired man with the attitude called me back to the counter and handed me a bag of cold bagals and tacos " I called this order like 3 times he snapped." (This I knew was untrue because I had 4 pairs of ears intently watching and listening for every single order that was placed.) Why he was so hostile, I cannot say. When I unbagged the food I noticed we were short a bagal. I went back to the man and asked for the bagal they had forgotten. He found the receipt which had no 'classic bagal' on it. Of course this meant nothing to me other than another mistake on their part and inconvenience for me. To my surprise he actually rung up an order for a classic bagal. "That will be 6.50$" I looked at him half shocked by what I was hearing. "I don't have any intention of paying for that" I replied. "Ok well just get out then." He sneered. I understand it I hard to find good labor these days. But never have I been so appalled by any establishments customer service.

reviews.author: Kyra H.
reviews.description: I had been told years ago when visiting Austin to come check this place out, but it just never happened until recently when we were asked to meet some friends here for brunch. It is such an Austin spot. The inside is kind of like a bodega, but they have a working kitchen and coffee bar. We arrived 5min til 2PM when they switch to their afternoon menu. The girl behind the register told us to make a quick decision because once they put the breakfast stuff up they do not pull it out again even if you were in line. I ordered a bacon, egg, and cheese taco. This is my go to order when getting breakfast tacos. I had considered getting two, but I'm glad I didn't. Those things are loaded! I took advantage of the three different salsas that you can put on your tacos as well.  Our group sat outside on the front porch. It was nice and seclusive. We forgot there there was traffic driving right by on the busy street.

reviews.author: J R.
reviews.description: I generally liked this place but I just went for the first time since covid started and their setup is not great. First, their online ordering system wasn't working. Then when I asked about it, the lady simply said "you can't order online." Yet, they're on DoorDash??? Both hand sanitizer dispensers were empty, and there were none next to the register despite the fact that they make you sign a paper with a pen - even if you use ApplePay. Food was fine. Not worth the anxiety levels provoked by this experience.

reviews.author: Cynthia C.
reviews.description: This place is basically a hipster convenience store coffee shop. I felt like a kid in a candy store shopping through their aisles of ice cream, healthy frozen foods, health bars, different jerkies, wine, and kombucha! I was very tempted to blow a lot of money here, and I wouldn't have even felt bad because of how healthy everything is. The prices are pretty reasonable, so you can get quite a bit here. There was even lamb jerky in bar form and I'm now obsessed with Kosmic Kombucha, which is brewed right in Austin. Matcha Peachu is a cleverly named flavor and delicious! I was happily surprised to have found Bobo's bar since I found them on Instagram literally the night before.   The coffee was yummy and a lot of people seem to come here for brunch. The people here are incredibly sweet and represent Austin very positively. There's also a good amount of seating inside and outside, perfect for the absolutely beautiful day that it was.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: Not a bad coffee/beer and work spot depending on what you are looking for.  This place has a cool variety of groceries to choose from or a menu while you sit and do work.  The environment is comfortable and casual.  The chairs inside, however, are stools with no backs which is super uncomfortable when you work for long periods of time on your computer.  The food was also not that great.  All in all, it is not a bad little spot to get some work done and have a beer.

name: Mister Tramps
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: This time I figured the best way to evaluate them would he to try one of their staples, so I got a burger. Specifically, I got the "Drunken Burger" covered in queso. Their queso has beer in it, hence the name, which I thought made it taste funky. The burger patty was cooked to perfection. The bun was ok, better than some, and at least it was toasted. The pickles on the side also tasted funky but I couldn't tell if that was a sign they're "higher end" or cheaper than standard dill spears. My side of onion rings was the best part of the meal. Portions were huge and service was good.

reviews.author: E k.
reviews.description: This was my first visit to Mister Tramps.  It was laid out decently, had a reasonable selection of beer, the patrons were friendly, and the staff was awesome, but the whole place smelled like a bathroom.    I couldn't tolerate it long enough to finish the delicious amber beer I was served.

reviews.author: Melissa S.
reviews.description: While we were charging our electric car in Austin, we were looking for a place that was close by to eat late at night on Monday. There were not a whole options in the specific area aside from burger joints and a Chili's. I stumbled upon this place on Yelp and I am glad I did. When you first walk in, it is very dark and gives you a dive bar feel, which is totally fine with me. After looking at the food menu, I wanted to try everything. We opted for the pear, fig and Brie pizza and the Ruben pizza. Both were probably some of the best pizzas we had had in a very long time. The bartender and the entire staff were very friendly, in fact a few people checked on us while we were sitting down. $5 doubles were a bonus. This place didn't disappoint.

reviews.author: Shaun C.
reviews.description: Just come here.  Awesome and safe  Food display is professional.  Legit. Taste is equal.  Atmosphere chill Friendly people every day.  Becoming a frequent for me for good reasons

reviews.author: Karissa A.
reviews.description: I love this place (and it's not just because I'm an eagles fan, well, okay, that might be a bit of an exaggeration). First off, their mimosas are fire and I haven't found anywhere in the area who can make them nearly as good! Definitely better than most of the brunch places I go to expecting a killer mimosa.   Their prices are great and the food is pretty good. I dig their queso fries because the queso isn't thick, but I have seen reviews where people aren't the biggest fans. Their sandwiches are good and it's always a good time on sundays.   Everyone there is welcoming, no matter the team they're rooting for. Also, the reason they get five stars is because the service is amazing. They all work together and truly pay attention to the customer.   I advise anyone (eagles fan or not!) to check it out.

reviews.author: Larry B.
reviews.description: me and my wife just came to austin texas yesterday (from the bay area) to run a spartan race. and i must say hands down this bar is amazingly fun  our bar tender dan (his birthday is in 3 days uall buy him a drink. he has a great personality great service and makes great drinks next time we are in austin texas and want a nice great bar to come to we will be here thank you for your service god bless yall

reviews.author: Justin B.
reviews.description: Last years Super Bowl I almost got fought by a group of regulars because I was on the phone with my mom, who I hadn't seen in years, and left my girlfriend, whom I live with, at the bar (10 feet away). They all started talking mad shit to which I said who the fuck are all you people and then I got kicked out while the dumb bitch regular bar rat that fucks all the bartenders was able to stick around. Even tho I had frequented this joint during the football season with ZERO problems. Clown fucks.

reviews.author: Brett J.
reviews.description: This is a bar... a true BAR... that happens to have food options, but make no mistake the main thing here is drinks and sports.  However it is a pretty interesting food option... they have some cool pizzas like the one with green chili's on it, or the bacon and pesto, and some other interesting combinations.   We were here for a movie premier... my wife friend was in a 21 min shirt film and this is where it was premiered. It was a cool deal!!  The place has s back room with a projection tv on 3 of the 4 walls. We got have some light food, got a free drink and watched the premier... it was pretty good!  The location is loud, lots of bar people, large outdoor seating area... like I said it is a bar with some interesting food.  Bartenders were fun, quick and on top of their game!   The event was well done.. photo both set out outside, kids dressed up to open doors... it was pretty cool!  Nicely done!!

reviews.author: Bruce B.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time to catch a game the other night and was surprised by both the service and the food. The place has very much a sports bar feel and a decent patio. We ordered a few things off the appetizer menu and was satisfied with every bit of it. The bartender Megan was super friendly and attentive, making us feel welcomed and keeping our drinks full. Will most likely be back for the next game if she is working.

reviews.author: Dario C.
reviews.description: Came here for my birthday a couple nights ago and this bars entire staff totally killed it. Welcomed and accommodated our whole party from beginning to end. Great selection of local beers on draft and awesome food. Definitely plan to come back soon. Can't thank the whole staff enough for such a great night. Cheers

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: My only regret is not taking advantage of this bar earlier in the football season. Excellent place for Watch parties! (I went to see my boys play the steelers). There is a group of hardcore cowboy fans that meet up on Sundays to watch the game organized by a guy named Dan (he's awesome).  The service was excellent. Room full of rowdy fans and our food/drinks were on point with flavor, price, and the time it took from ordering to receiving the food. Our waiter was great! Didn't catch his name, but he was fantastic.   I'm in love with Mister Tramps.

reviews.author: Don E.
reviews.description: This sports pub is really awesome. First time here and the staff is extremely nice and welcoming. I always get weird about going to new bars but we walked in and the atmosphere is inviting the and staff just makes it that much better. Drinks are priced reasonably and the food was great. I ordered a Brie pizza. Enough for two maybe three people.

reviews.author: Ryan D.
reviews.description: Love the events and bar staff is good too. Interesting characters there. I plan to go to more film meetings there.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: Called in advance to make sure that had MLS package.  Drive 30 minutes to find it the dedicated stuffer bar in Austin doesn't have the game but streams it. They can only stream 2 games at once and even though I called before they couldn't do it.  So I still had to pay for a watered down drink that was made wrong and missed my game.    I also question whether or not their streaming is legal feeds for a bar.

reviews.author: Jen A.
reviews.description: The food is good and there's a great selection of beer, but $5 a beer is not going to make me hang out for very long.  I'll go to my regular spot where they have a great selection of $3 craft beer.  The food is priced well here, but not the beer.  I also wish it wasn't so sports bar like with the bad music. This area doesn't have any other bars that I know of, and I live nearby, but I don't like to visit this place much with the expensive beer and annoying music.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places to eat and drink. Amanda and all of the staff are fantastic. TBH was a little worried when the bar was sold. While I deeply miss the old crew, the new one is amazing. Personable, attentive, same quality food (I think the kitchen staff is the same).  Love this place.

reviews.author: Kathleen M.
reviews.description: I've recently started coming here regularly for trivia night with Geeks Who Drink (cue "Hello,... it's me") Anyway, my standard drink is a vodka sour and I was pleased with the cost, quality, and efficiency of the staff. My friends also got lots of drinks and I didn't hear any complaints coming from them so....I think it's safe to say that it lives up to its reputation as a good pub/bar.   The entire location appears to be dedicated to a soccer team, but as a non-watcher, I can't really comment on that other than to say that they play multiple kinds of sports on the many tv screens, and they are always open to requests as well from what I've observed.   The staff is absolutely lovely and very good about checking in with you, getting orders correct, and being extra friendly. (Don't forget to tip your waitress/waiter!)   I've only ever been for the trivia, but I know they also offer stand-up and I'm sure they offer more on other nights of the week. Anyways, this is a cool place and I will definitely be a frequent attendee!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Dear Mister Tramps,   You are so cool!  I love you!  You have all the things I love in life!  You make me happy on a cloudy day.  You are the sunshine on the northside.  You serve me drinks that are perfectly made.  You have delicious bar food.  You make my world whole by giving me free pizza with my pitcher of beer.  You absolutely know the way to my heart.  Nope it's not the beer, liquor or shots ... it's all about the pizza!   You are the perfect way to end a day.  You are lovely on the inside and out.  You will continue to be my northside stop!   Love always,   Amanda S.

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: I'm not too sure about the "café" part; however, Mister Tramps is certainly a great place to watch sports (TVs everywhere, including the front outdoor patio where the smokers congregate AND even one in the lady's room!). They do offer some pretty decent standard bar fare: wings (they state they're "oven roasted, never fried" and I am totally perplexed at how they get that outer crispy goodness), burgers (not huge but good), pizza (especially after midnight - see tip below) would be in my top three. This dive-ish joint also has some of the friendliest staff around and a great beer selection with awesome prices - including some local craft selections: Infamous, Stash, Thirsty Goat and more - over a dozen different selections of craft on tap at any given time, plus all of their bottle selections and other libations. There is always a shot special board, so be sure to check that out if it's your thang.  And, if you Bleed Blue like me, you will be thrilled to know this is Cowboys country y'all!!! How 'bout them Cowboys?! Fans gather by the masses to Mister Tramps on game day...there's even an entire large viewing room with three HUGE projection screens that is curtained off by what else but Dallas Cowboys curtains (they support other teams as well; maybe more than one set of curtains?). If you want to partake in the fandemonium get there early to procure a seat at one of the many communal tables.    Overall: Yay, I'm a fan...I'll be divin' in again real soon! ;) Cheers!  Tip: Order a pitcher of beer after midnight and you can buy a pizza for a buck - yup, one dolla! Full menu available every day until 2am.

reviews.author: Olivia M.
reviews.description: Nice enough spot to catch a game and chill with friends. Plenty of tv screens on the inside and outside. Decent outside patio area with a nice amount of space for a medium sized group. Friendly staff. Pretty chill place. I'll have to return to try the food, at which point I'll update my general review.

name: Jack and Gingers
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Roberta V.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this Irish pub.  The wait staff was very friendly and efficient.  Just the perfect about of time to check in us and make sure all was well.  The place was very clean.   The food was very good.  I loved the garlic green beans, could easily of been the best part of the meal (if you like veggies... as I do).  The fish was tender and seemed fresh. Came with my favorite kind of fries... thick steak fries.  The pretzel was warm and very good, was the same as a perfect old fashion European pretzel.   The fried pickle slices were very enjoyable as well.   I absolutely loved the Redhead In Bed drink, a new favorite for sure.  The Bonkers Grapefruit Cucumber drink was a relaxing refreshing drink.    I do recommend this Irish Pub. I am giving it a 4 star only because it is like so many other pubs I have had the pleasure of visit.

reviews.author: Grace R.
reviews.description: Great happy hour spot with an awesome patio! Huge picnic tables that are great for groups  $12 for a pint of beer and huge pretzel? Sign me up! Service was good, food was good, drinks were good. Didn't try any entrees, but will definitely be back for happy hour!

reviews.author: Jaki T.
reviews.description: Stopped by for dinner as I always love a good Irish Pub.  The beer was good, food was good but the "Irish" was missing. I suppose for a younger crowd who cares nothing about actual Irish ambience , it's a great bar.  But personally I prefer a bit of Irish music as opposed to the rap that was being played .  So In short, it's just another bar, nothing Irish about it other than the decor.

reviews.author: Vivian C.
reviews.description: My fiancé and I came in for a late dinner, and it started off pretty well. Our waiter was really nice, and our pretzel was tasty! My fiancés Irish breakfast was flavorful and great, but my chicken sandwich had the texture of rubber boots and was extremely bland. The Mac and cheese was also very unremarkable which is very rare for me. Probably won't come back again.

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: I have come here several times and I've never been disappointed. The food is good and the drinks are good. My bartender was Shannon this day, and she was super chill and cool. She made me a the red head drink and I was not disappointed

reviews.author: Laure H.
reviews.description: Love their new little picnic tables by the street. It's usually sooo loud inside the bar area/on their patio so this is the happy middle ground and don't have to scream to hear your friend speak.  I've honestly never tried their food because I'm usually not in the mood for dive bar food, but can speak to how great their variety of beers is. My personal favorite is the victory sour monkey.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Went for a late lunch today and decided to eat on the patio. When we first arrived the misters were on and felt great. They turned off and it got a little warm.   Our server was part of a family of servers we learned from the youngest server. She was the older sister that helped with our order. She recommended a beer my wider really enjoyed.   Our food was very well prepared and was on point.   My wife was overheating after we ate and we were trying to find our server who seemed to be on a break. We literally waited 15 minutes before going inside to see if we could fine her. It appears like she had 2 tables inside and must of lost track of us outside.   All in all it was a great lunch and we would have loved to give it 5 stars but paying should not be the hardest part of going out to lunch.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: We really enjoy coming here. There's a terrific beer selection, a lot of different seating options, and a fun glass floor.   There are a lot good food choices here.  The pretzel is massive, fish and chips crispy and flaky, and classic burger always cooked to specification.  The fried pickles have a great batter and the Guinness brownie is thick and chewy and comes with creamy ice cream.  Service is generally spot on, and they have done well when I've come in with a group.

reviews.author: Joseph C.
reviews.description: I have been here a handful of times to watch Notre Dame and the Fighting IRISH play at an IRISH bar only for them to turn a rugby  game on in the middle of MARCH MADNESS. They even had the first half on for us just for them to turn it off when the second half, tied by the way, started. For a sports bar this was very disappointing and I don't recommend coming here for a big game whatsoever. We were stuck watching a postgame report over the last five minutes of a close, actually live basketball game. Ridiculous...

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Cool Irish bar with ample amount of space to have some drinks, play games or watch games even.   Right from walking in it seems like this place gets really into soccer games, so I'm sure it'll be a hit when Austin FC starts playing.  Their draft selection is solid, even looking at their menu they have a good mix of several types of beers. Thought the bock type was a little funny, they also have sours, tripels, you name it. Got a Mcconaughaze, witty name, good ipa from Twisted X

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Great Sunday funday brunch at Jack and gingers. We enjoyed the sun out on the patio. Had a couple of drinks and split the black bean burger. It was actually really good! Sweet potato fries on the side were great as well! Very tasty!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: I've come to Jack and Gingers on multiple occasions, but JandG is a pass for me. I've tried the food AND drinks, and it's nothing out of the ballpark. Food tastes dry and overcooked (INCLUDING THE PRETZEL). Cocktail ingredients are not portioned correctly, so expect your cocktails to taste different from each other. Drinks can be compared to Dave and Busters, which is a yikes considering this is a pub/bar.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: I am so surprised I have never reviewed this place once since first coming to JandG's over 5 years ago. Tons of memories here with good friends, sitting outdoors drinking whiskey and smoking cigars, minus the cigars. The irish coffees to the wide selection of beers on tap, you'll never run out of new things to try. They've got a killer happy hour menu, if you catch them at the right time, you might be lucky enough to get the worlds biggest pretzel with cheese/honey mustard dip. It's like $5 and it's worth every cent. I love pretzels and this one ranks right up there at the top.   The outdoor section provides excellent seating for 'people watching', especially during the night when the Domain starts livening up with interesting sorts of people. Love Jack and Ginger's, one of the nicest bars in Austin.

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: Starting with the positives, the beer selection was really excellent. I absolutely loved the Austin Eastciders cranberry cider, very refreshing and tart. My partner got the Sippin Pretty sour which was also delicious with some hints of guava. There were plenty of options for whatever kind of beer you like.   In terms of the food, that's were the stars got dropped. My shepherds pie was very ordinary, nothing special about it. The potatoes were pretty chunky and it felt pretty heavy with the cheese and sour cream. The salad was airplane quality, just some greens and tomatoes. This was also pretty overpriced even for the Domain, $16 for very average food.  The fish and chips was the superior entree. The fish was ginormous and crispy, albeit pretty greasy. Fries were sitting under the fish which made them go soft pretty quickly. The green beans were pretty crisp but it was so awkward to eat with the low quality plastic utensils. I understand it may be more sanitary to eat with during the pandemic, but they were those small, bendy, cheap utensils you get with takeout which made it pretty difficult to pick up the beans and fish.   Overall, go for the drinks and atmosphere. Plenty of TVs inside and in the patio and friendly servers. Skip the food!

reviews.author: Carter G.
reviews.description: So i left my phone there about a month ago. They confirmed they had it, even asking what the screen saver was, where cracks were, etc. Ok great! I do not live there though. They said they would mail it and I would send shipping. I said okay amazing I will even pay for the hours of the employee and tip etc. Then just crickets. Their phone number doesn't work first, no working voicemail. They respond every few weeks saying "still waiting on tracking" even though they claimed to have mailed it 3 weeks ago. So yea, someone stole it. I spoke with a Candace from their venture group and she assured me it was sent..but, never got it. Crazy. They blocked me from facebook even. Pretty wild.

reviews.author: Karen C.
reviews.description: Totally need more servers!  Felt bad for the only inside bartender manning the whole area.   Food came out ice cold. Very disappointed. First time there.  Im sure would taste better if had been at-least room temperature

reviews.author: Josh J.
reviews.description: Probably our favorite beer/chillin/sports spot. Quality patio. Wide selection of brews on tap. Their pretzel is one of the best I've had. French onion soup is not good but who really comes to a bar for soup, so that doesn't affect my rating. The rest of their apps are all pretty solid choices. Service is always good and the door man is a chiller.

reviews.author: Pratiksha M.
reviews.description: I don't know what happened to the customer service here. A few night ago I ordered the Guinness brownie to go. Not only did it take nearly 30 minutes for it to be ready (while other patrons who ordered food after me got their food before me) but I finally got my food by the bartender rudely flinging it in front of me on the bar... and then walked away. No "here you are" or anything. In a hope to support a business during this time I would have expected a little courtesy. Let alone when you are operating at less capacity. Yikes, unfortunately next time I will be taking my late night orders from somewhere else.   I did add a star because there was a second bartender who was friendly to other patrons, but I had not interacted with her.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Improvement since was there couple years ago. No real service outside but found room inside at bar. Service from bar was great.and quick. Full Irish breakfast slightly missed the mark....charro beans?...really...no pork and beans. Sausage was OK but looked like Pre cooked with grill marks and reheated. Overall huge improvement...but Charro beans a big. No with breakfast and also with their great fish and chips.

reviews.author: Tatiana T.
reviews.description: Love Jack and Ginger's, great beer selection and they have hands down the best Fried Pickles in Austin. They are super dog friendly, and love their large patio space. Their Crispy Chicken Sandwich is also REALLY good. It was our go-to when we lived at the Domain, and stop by now anytime we're there shopping.

reviews.author: Israel H.
reviews.description: Came in for my 21'st got some nice rum, wine and soju. New owner is a great knowledgeable and easy to talk to guy. 10/10 a good variety, prices, guidance and environment. Definitely will be my go to for a while- support ur local businesses!

reviews.author: Natania L.
reviews.description: Staff was very helpful and informative on things to do around Austin.  Nice and courteous young man

reviews.author: Vinisha P.
reviews.description: Amazing liquor store. New owner is kind, knowledgeable and so helpful! He helped us select between a couple of Mezcal and Rum options and was ensuring that every customer was taken care of. We were even able to pick up simple syrup and limes to complete our cocktail-making shopping trip in one stop. Excited to be able to support a local, South Asian owned business. I'll be back!

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Excellent selections. Clean, open floorplan. The place has Big Brooklyn Energy - the decor is nice + minimal (raw wood anyone?), the employees never bug you, the music is always fantastic, you're in and you're out. The way I like it.

reviews.author: Joshua M.
reviews.description: Chill liquor store in a good location, it's really the only one around. They have a good selection of just about everything including a solid bourbon selection. Staff was friendly and very helpful. If you're in need of something unique swing on by.

reviews.author: Bill H.
reviews.description: We visited to buy some fifths of whiskey as gifts. Tucked into a new-ish, small strip mall in what seems to be a thriving part of East Austin. Our friend Chris (who we know from other hospitality ventures in Austin) was managing- and helped us navigate the various boutique brands- we wound up with a good selection at not crazy prices. Immaculate floor displays, well organized, nice vibe. While we were there, several customers came in and made purchases. Shop could use a more prominent sign, but isn't hard to find, with plenty of off street parking.  Did I mention Chris? He's the best. Great guy with a lot of knowledge, patient and thoughtful (also knows music!)

reviews.author: Scott A.
reviews.description: The owners are wonderful people and have provided a local convenient option with excellent selection ! Thanks Zeke's!

reviews.author: Cait T.
reviews.description: This place will do very well. Good selection, nice team working, and great location. The shop is clean and well organized. Love that there isn't too much clutter, but a great range of local liquors and mixers, too.  Welcome addition to the neighborhood!

reviews.author: Zulaikha B.
reviews.description: We were on the hunt for shot size, plastic bottles of liquor and we definitely found it at this place. This quaint place had a large selection of the popular liquors as well as ones that I have a hard time finding in big cities (like Dallas). The cashier was super helpful in helping us with out selection and gave us his opinion on some choices we weren't sure about. If we are in need of more alcohol and we are in the area, this would be our first choice.

reviews.author: Eddie A.
reviews.description: This liquor store in the heart of East Austin is just the place to go for deals on all your liquor,lemons and limes.The employees are nice and helpful and the store is nice and organized." W'ill be back"

reviews.author: Becca R.
reviews.description: Disappointed in their customer service.  I bought 2 bottles of wine and a bottle of bourbon.  One of the bottles of wine was bad upon opening.   I went to take it back to the store and the employee's response was "Sorry but we don't take returns."   He told me restock their wine regularly and there was nothing he could do.  Obviously, I will not be going back to a store that doesn't stand behind their products or take responsibility.   So much for buying local.

reviews.author: Brad S.
reviews.description: Very clean establishment with a fair selection of every verity. Prices are the cheapest I personally found in a 15mile radius. Great customer service!

reviews.author: Chris H.
reviews.description: I live a few streets over and have been eyeing saw Zeke's for the last few weeks.  I got a craving for a margarita so I decided to use that as an excuse to go check out Zeke's to get the ingredients for a margarita. The store is nice and modern inside and has all the essentials that you need.  They also have a very nice stock of Hops and Grain beers from the brewery a few streets over.  It's a welcome edition to the neighborhood and I'll be back again soon!

reviews.author: Blake J.
reviews.description: Nice little chill spot in east austin. I came on a Sunday morning at 9:30a and there was no wait. Ordered an oat milk caramel latte and the strawberry banana bread. The latte was very flavorful without being too sweet and the bread was okay, could have had more banana in it but not bad!

reviews.author: Hazel J.
reviews.description: Crappy matcha latte  I can appreciate that they actually mix the matcha powder fresh for each patron, but having chunks of undissolved matcha powder in your drink is extremely unpleasant and ruined the experience of my $5 12oz drink   Won't be back

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: Employees I've interacted with have been very friendly.  The coffee is always spot on, and, for tea lovers, there is a good selection to choose from. I enjoy their croissants and cinnamon rolls. The shop has a good vibe; seems like a great place to read or work on that novel you've been putting off. There are alcohol offerings here as well, but I haven't tried any.

reviews.author: Chandan K.
reviews.description: This place is real good. The best coffee in Austin. I like caramel latte. They have tacos too but those sell out pretty quickly. Their everything pillow is really good and must try.

reviews.author: Maddie W.
reviews.description: Angela and Madison are stars! I love the coffee here, but lately the oat milk has been too thick :(

reviews.author: Tracey Z.
reviews.description: Cute little coffee shop in East Austin!  The coffee in my opinion is ok. Not as strong as I would normally prefer.  Not a good place to study either, the music is very loud and makes it difficult to concentrate.   I know that have beer and wine though, so I think this would be a fun place to come chat.

reviews.author: Julissa O.
reviews.description: Visiting from Houston and stopped here just bc we wanted coffee and Boy oh boy are we glad we stopped. So good and really cute place. The music was like they were literally playing music from my playlist. We got the Lemon poppy seed bread and blueberry scone were delicious. My hot cocoa was served with marshmallows and was so smooth. Mexican mocha was spicy but good. Chaga chino was good too

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: Stopped by this morning before leaving Austin for some coffee.  The male barista that took our order was so rude and snooty that it really took away from the experience.  If there was a coffee shop that defined snooty, intimidating, and snobby this would be it.  He just stared as we tried to figure out what to order, and made us feel like we were more in his way than wanting to help us.  Aside from the service, the coffee itself was pretty disappointing.  We got: -Texas Teddy (do not recommend at all.  It tasted like iced creamer with a splash of cold brew) -Vanilla Latte (this was a pretty standard vanilla latte) -Nitro Cold Brew (basic cold brew)  There's way too many great coffee shops in Austin than to waste your time here.  Do not recommend.

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: Meh, it was just okay. They don't have many special espresso drinks to choose from, so I got a latte. They have a ton of coffee beans in small and large (5 lbs) bags on shelves for sale. It wasn't crowded, so that was nice. The baristas seemed nice. But I'll stick to Summer Moon instead.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: Another coffee shop down! I've also had Cuvée in my Austin coffee bookmarks for a while, and I had pretty high expectations given the high rating. However, it's definitely one of those forgettable coffee shops. I ordered my classic vanilla iced latte, and I had one sip and threw it away. It was probably one of the worst iced lattes I've gotten in Austin. It tasted almost watery. I definitely won't be back, but I am disappointed to say that Cuvée did not meet my expectations.

reviews.author: Gregory H.
reviews.description: Not worth the money, sorry trying to support small businesses but this is one case I wish I would have just got Starbucks. No flavor at all!

reviews.author: Christine K.
reviews.description: Simple but good coffee! They have a nice, spacious indoor space set up as well as their outdoor space.   Parking: private lot but may be difficult to find depending on the time of day   Free wifi, dog friendly

reviews.author: Vivian H.
reviews.description: Overall: Hipster joint with a good creamy latte.   LATTE: Ordered two almond lattes, with their homemade vanilla syrup. Foam was okay, and it had mediocre art. Taste was nice and creamy. Pricey for lattes, almost 13 dollars.   SERVICE: the lady who took our order was helpful and friendly; AMBIANCE: gives off an industrial like vibe  I do like their cup sleeves - cute and artsy

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here in the late afternoon on a Wednesday. There were a good number of open tables, but it was around the holidays so I might've caught them on a quiet day.   The service was really friendly and I went for their recommendation of a Texas teddy. It's their nitro cold brew with some vanilla and your choice of one of their milks. With nitro cold brew being creamy on its own this took it to a whole new level by adding the milk, I thought it tasted great with their oat milk.   The two main downsides are that their drinks are fairly pricey compared to most other coffee shops in the area, and the seating isn't conducive to spending much time there. There are a good number of tables, but most of the seating isn't too comfortable and the tables are all pretty close together.   Overall, I think it's a good spot if you want to grab something quick and you're near by, but I wouldn't go out of your way to try them.

reviews.author: Reza Z.
reviews.description: Love Cuvee and their coffee. We always have a great time. Unfortunately, today the cashier lady was rude and snappy. We all work hard during the day and this kind of behavior is the last thing anyone needs.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: What's not to love? I can walk to this place. The coffee is superb and beer is great when you may not be feeling a coffee.  I'm a morning regular here and I grab a Large Drip Coffee and a TacoDeli Vaquero almost every morning. Thats how much I like this place.  Do I own some of their swag? Of course! You have to represent your local businesses or else it will all go commercial.  I love the team here - so quirky and knowledgeable about coffee. I never heard of a Texas Teddy before and they have them so there's that if you like those.  The wife always gets an Almond Milk Latte and a Zucchini bread.  Have they messed up our order before? Yes, they are humans after all. Have they righted it times 10? Absolutely, we always leave happy.  I've worked here a few times refilling coffee and listening to some great music here. I just love the vibe here. A great place to experience!

reviews.author: Clara T.
reviews.description: The nitro cold brew was ok, definitely not as good as Starbucks. I sat at Cuvée for about 2.5 hours to do work and the shop made me officially hate Doja Cat by blasting her music loudly the whole friggin time. My clumsy self dropped 8oz of my sour coffee on the floor before leaving so I was scrambling around the shop to find enough paper to clean up the mess. 2 employees just completely ignored it like nothing happened even though I was the only customer in the shop. I'm happy to clean up after my own mistake but would love to have a mop instead of ten tons of tissues / paper towels used. I guess it's hard for coffee shop employees to care these days when unemployment benefits are bigger than their paychecks.

reviews.author: Emily H.
reviews.description: Twice now I've been here and they are so rude.  Will not come back.    If you don't ask if a customer wants cream and sugar (like every other coffee bar in town is doing), then when the customer asks for politely cream and sugar, you shouldn't snap back at a customer that the CUSTOMER should have told you.  And then when you bring the cream (but forget the sugar), you shouldn't muffle something as you're walking away, and then YELL at them "WHAT DID I JUST SAY!!??", as if the customer is a child, when they don't follow the instructions you muffled at them.  WTF is wrong w you.  This man was also asking me just 90 seconds prior if I wanted to leave him a tip on a $2 coffee.

reviews.author: Tony N Rob P.
reviews.description: It's great when you're new to a city and you get to explore and find your new spots!  Well this isn't one!  Total attitude!

reviews.author: Merritt V.
reviews.description: Good coffee and a nice indoor and outdoor seating options. My son and I visited on the patio area and enjoyed the nice weather. Fun, clean, and good coffee.

name: Hyde Park Bar and Grill Central
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Romy G.
reviews.description: I've been coming here almost 20 years and never reviewed this place?!  Here's a fresh look post-COVID. Since the pandumbic, HP has pared down their menu a bit, and it seems like the prices also went up - par for the course. I admit that at first I was upset that the fried egg sandwich was removed from the menu, that really hurt. However! The few times I've opted to visit since COVID have all been seriously five stars. The salads are way better than before, the pan-roasted chicken was mind blowing, and the black and bleu burger is easily the best I've ever had. Plus, the fries, of course.   Today we ventured out for a rare outdoor family dinner and it was top-notch. Although the menu seems smaller in ingredients than it used to be, the execution has really stepped up. The service has been great too. Can't wait to return.

reviews.author: Karen H.
reviews.description: This restaurant has really gone downhill! It's been 3 years since I frequented this central Austin restaurant weekly. We order from a wait person, I order dumplings. I was brought fried dumplings expecting the steamed ones I always had in the past. This service person did not even ask if I wanted steamed or fried. She just assumed! Then when she brought it out, I had asked I think it was a she if they not have steamed and she said that they serve them fried if not specified!!really? So I ordered the steamed and told her I would take the leftovers home. We ordered Wom Kim peach pudding. Mine looked normal with beautiful crust and his looked like it came off another table they cleaned off. It was shaved off and only half of a serving.  I was thoroughly disappointed in the service and the quality of their food.  Don't know if owned by same people, Vic? I will not spend my hard earned money where my business is not appreciated. I feel they think they are entitled, very sad they think that way! K. Hawkins
