reviews.author: Dustin C.
reviews.description: Never disappointed with HP! Great for lunch or breakfast. We stopped in and had to get our fix in. Thanksgiving meal was on point two years ago pre covid too.

reviews.author: Shaan D.
reviews.description: This place is an institution. I see why the fries are rated so highly, they are just THAT good! My friends and I popped in for Sunday brunch, no reservation and we were seated within 5 minutes. You cannot beat $3 mimosas (and they were on the heavy side). The fries are so unique. Crispy but not greasy. We had 2 orders of the honey butter chicken benny which was fantastic, but filling. You might consider splitting that with someone. It was just an explosion of flavors. The chicken and waffles and french toast were well received too. We had a great experience and hope to return soon

reviews.author: Jordan N.
reviews.description: Good service  Ok chicken fried chicken Bitter collard greens  Good mashed potatoes  Good fries Good biscuit and gravy (comes with fried egg and stack of ham)  Nothing really stood out although the best thing was the biscuit and gravy

reviews.author: Miranda C.
reviews.description: 2 stars but just for the avocado fries which were perfection-- I ordered this place with Uber eats because of a promotion. The entree I got was the pan roasted chicken and it was mediocre at best because it looked and tasted like cafeteria food. Not likely to order again.

reviews.author: Jessica S.
reviews.description: I don't know what happened to this place, but we had an awful experience tonight. This place used to be an Austin classic, but the food tonight was almost inedible, there were bugs in my drink, and globs of old food stuck to the silverware. Our server was also inattentive and unfriendly which is why I really can't even give this place two stars, there was just nothing redeeming about our experience. Even the fries, which were known to be a delicacy, were bland and limp. Never coming back.

reviews.author: Suzanne W.
reviews.description: Yum - yes, please!  Hyde Park fries - what else is there?  Oh yeah, there are lots of fab dishes, great brunch, too. Long time lover of HPG!

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: This review is for before the pandemic. Only went here once but it was in my draft reviews.  Great wait staff and a pleasant atmosphere! My waiter was very good with timing and seemed to know the exact time it was best to come around. I enjoyed his service.  The dinner salad was served on a warm plate. It would benefit from some fresh color like from shredded carrots. The small grape tomatoes were delicious. For the entree, I ordered meatloaf because I was missing home. It missed the mark.. maybe it was because it wasn't my grandma's meatloaf, but I couldn't eat much of it. It was meant to come with this meaty brown gravy. Thankfully I got that on the side. There wasn't a baked ketchup layer on the top of the meatloaf, which is often my favorite part.   This isn't normally a place that my friends or I would visit because it seemed that most of the food is pretty expensive. I had a gift card.

reviews.author: Jax R.
reviews.description: The food is always so good. I love the Hyde Park Fries and sauce. The chicken fried steak is my favorite. Very consistent. Great customer service.

reviews.author: Elisha C.
reviews.description: what a surprise! this place doesn't look like much but boy oh boy! the absolute best rueben i've ever had! my daughter had this salad and she loved it. they have a very interesting and unusual menu. so much i wanted to try so i'll definitely have to go back again. note a five star for a few minor reasons; had to wait too long when it wasn't that busy, decor is a bit ho hum. although the local art work for sale is top notch!

reviews.author: Stephanie C.
reviews.description: Few restaurants after the pandemic actually improved in quality and service.  HP is not one of them.  What was once contemporary in concept is gone. Hospitality is hit and miss, a reality for most places these days.  Menu has diminished, both in variety and quality.  All appetizers are fried.  Very limited options for healthier sides.  Desserts have shrunk to two boring, overly sweet, high carb features stuck in a rut from the last century.  Management should just whittle the menu down even further, selling the only items worth positive mention in reviews.  Have the black and bleu burger with fries and leave it at that.

reviews.author: Mateo G.
reviews.description: This food was simple and familiar, but done right. I can't give something like this a higher compliment. It's really easy to do okay, but to do very great is a skill. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Megan M.
reviews.description: Over priced for poor quality food. No side served with sandwiches or burgers.  Chicken sandwich dry. Wendy's would have been better.

reviews.author: Teresa D.
reviews.description: I have wanted to try this restaurant forever!  So cute!  I wanted that painting on the wall w/ the roses!  My husband ordered the HP Classic Burger w/ caramelized onions!  Oh my goodness!  It was SOOOOOOOOO good!  Of course, we had to try their famous fries!  My hubby liked their Hyde sauce! I  ordered the Asian Chicken Salad and ate every bite!  It was so good also!!!  We had a friendly server in training (1440) and he made suggestions on what he had tried (Chicken Guacamole BLT) so maybe I will try that next time!   AND...very close to 37th Christmas Lights, so I know where I will go this Christmas to eat and see lights after!

reviews.author: Dylan T.
reviews.description: Thank you from the bottom of my heart. This Thanksgiving I didnt have the time money or energy to cook for myself. You guys made sure I had a thanksgiving dinner. It felt very homelike. The stuffing and pumpkin pie made my night.

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Food was great !! I was craving a chicken fried steak and I'm so thankful for the reviews that lead me to Hyde park bar and grill. The other entrees that our party ordered were delicious as well. Simon was our server and his clear speaking and explaining of the menu being our first time here was part of this wonderful experience. Thank you Simon !

reviews.author: Marcus H.
reviews.description: The fundementals of the food here is excellent.  In theory the recipes are great and the food should be very good.  I ordered some takeout here yesterday and got served a burnt chicken fried steak.  When you're charging 15 bucks for a plate stuff like this shouldn't happen.  The cook can see it's overcooked, make a new one instead of leaving me pissed off and unhappy with my decision to eat dinne here.  Felt ripped off.  Weather it's old oil in the fryer or lazy/incompetent cooks.. pay someone a little more in the kitchen who will give a shit.

reviews.author: Rolando N.
reviews.description: Austin institution that has been around forever. I'm giving this 5 stars on the strength of the burger and those wonderful fries.  The fries are as good as it gets. Lightly battered with seasoning and a dipping sauce that just won't quit.    The burger was perfect. Super juicy, melted cheese, grilled onions, special sauce and a wonderfully toasted bun. Just perfect.   Service was great.

reviews.author: Captain C.
reviews.description: Atrocious service. One couple sat for almost a half hour, and then went and DEMANDED service. I finally gave up on my waiter bringing me my drink order, and I just went in and took it from the bartender.   I don't know what happened to the erstwhile fantastic waiters, but this new crop should be immediately fixed/fired/waterboarded. We won't be back for some time. Sad.

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: Just a quick update (which I intended to post in December).  Stinson is alive and well in their new digs--now fronting FM 150. Much more spacious. It'll be a great space to spend an afternoon once the pandemic ends.  Call ahead if you want to pick up some of their fabulous Texas Holiday Nog, but remember, only 2 bottles per person per month.  Careful though and drink responsibly. This is not your father's Oldsmobile eggnog. It will sneak up on you and kicks you in the noggin like a freakin' mule.

reviews.author: Kristy C.
reviews.description: The place has great potential. Very cute and good drinks.  But they have a long way to go when it comes to customer service.  The bar tender seemed to be really put out that we were even there.  Didn't welcome us, when we asked if we needed to go to the register part of the bar to order,  he looked at his phone and rudely said, I'll be with you in a min. Then continued to be annoyed that he had to take our order. The place was empty only 1 pinter group of 4 so wasn't like he was super busy.  They even said he didn't really seem to want to be there and definitely didn't want to be taking our orders.  The AC was also very lacking we were all fanning ourselves with the menu which seemed to be the best use of the menu since he didn't want to serve us. The sink in the women's bathroom barley had water coming out if it and they were out of toliet paper but we dare not ask the 1 bar tender as that would have really put him over the top. I wouldn't recommend this place and if I was the owner I'd want to know how bad my employee is. No wonder there was no one inside.

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: This is a must stop place. Don't drive by without going inside for a sample. The vodka is so smooth. The creams are out of this world and the elderflower liquor is perfect for a spritzer or to sweeten that mixed drink from Brad. I can just drink it on its own but I am tough like that.

reviews.author: Claire A.
reviews.description: Quiet little distillery to visit down south, great selection of cocktails. Was hoping to find some wine as well but was told the wine is mainly used for the brandy. This place had board games, friendly staff and is dog friendly! Highly recommend checking it out. Planning to come back when they restock their whiskey and egg nog

reviews.author: Karie B.
reviews.description: I have loved this place in the past.  Drinks were always measured and made to perfection-  delicious!!  The two female bartenders we have had in the past were amazing.   However I think they missed the mark on this expansion.  Sadly this is NOT the same place.  Total different vibe.  The new 'bar manager'  (a dude) made me a Mojito that I couldn't drink. He also told my husband that he is planning a lot of new drinks to put on the menu

reviews.author: Deborah M.
reviews.description: We went on a distillery drive in Dripping Springs and this was our last but BEST stop!  We sampled and bought the premium vodka and then went back and got the coffee based liquor Carajillo and the Texas Holiday Nog.  I highly recommend these and a trip out there to visit the friendly staff.  I might have to buy the holiday rum based egg nog for all my friends for the holidays!

reviews.author: Laryssa B.
reviews.description: This spot is a Awesome. When driving from Austin to San Antonio, we stopped for bbq up the road and then came here to taste. All the liquors were good, the cocktails were too. The gentlemen working were friendly and knowledgeable. (Also patient with all our questions)   We bought two bottles of the Carajillo, which is ten times better than any baileys or other coffee liqueur we've ever tasted.   These guys had a great playlist rocking, and the wood wall behind the bar is beautiful!

reviews.author: Taylor W.
reviews.description: Won't waste your money on this place, service was terrible, female bartenders are rude

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Cool place with great staff. I had never tried anything like this before and a nice change of pace from the wineries. They have a neat setup inside a metal building. It's not the easiest place to find but would be a great place to just hang out for awhile. They have some outdoor seating and corn hole games set up too. Really different experience.

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: A cool little distillery with very friendly staff. Quaint and chill spot to have a drink and relax. My friend and I went on a whim after eating at the Salt Lick and seeing signs to this distillery. We hung out for an hour. We talked with the staff, drank a dram, and played some corn hole. Great little spot with awesome drinks. As a whiskey guy, that's what I wanted to try, but it wasn't ready. Nevertheless, brandy was good. Great time at an awesome location with good people.   Enjoy.

reviews.author: Joe B.
reviews.description: So, stopped in at Stinson's and met a couple of the owners.  There is so much to love about the place.  Good drinks. Original takes on standards like their take on the margarita: The Brandyrita.  Had a great time. But the star of the show was their Texas Brandy, and the Carajillo, which made me a fan.  Can't wait to go back and find out what else they have cooked up.   Great stuff.

reviews.author: Michael G.
reviews.description: Come check out Stinson Distilling. Amazing drinks and staff. Lots of refreshing drinks in this hot heat.

reviews.author: Arian E.
reviews.description: There is only one downside to this place: they make you bring your own funnel for doing Rumstands from the big jugs.  Otherwise this is a fantastic young distillery and one of the best after-hours swingers hangouts in Austin!!!  You can't loose with booze!!!

reviews.author: Kelvin T.
reviews.description: Elderflower liquor is legit! Highly recommend! And try the Citrus Fizz. Had to pull around the back of the building to part and enter the tasting room. Good setting!

reviews.author: Nicole C.
reviews.description: Delicious variety of alcohols to try and great mix drinks. We also had a tour of the distillery process. Tried the Passionate Lady, Citrus Fizz, and reserve tasting- all very good! Love the tasting room decor and environment!

reviews.author: Rafael V.
reviews.description: Love this place. Best mojitos around. Vodka and rum are really off the charts amazing.  The inside is nice and cool and you can play games while you drink. People that go are very personable.

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: We passed by this place heading to the Drip yesterday and since I'd never heard of it, I immediately yelped it.  A new distillary only about 10 minutes from my Casa?  Hell yes, I'm curious.  And I'll admit I became even more curiouser after reading Arian's review....I intended to ask them about this "one of the best after-hours swingers hangouts in Austin!!!" sitch.    The tasting room was a little hard to find as it's around the back of this little warehouse strip but it's open and spacious and we were only the 2nd couple there on a Friday evening.  We were warmly greeted and bellied up to the bar.  Our bartender (and all the staff I think) are in the Stinson family.  She was very friendly and gave us all the history of the place and explained each tasting in length.  They are currently offering a tasting of 4 of their liquors for $7 (these served quaintly in communion cups) and have cocktails they can serve as well.  We sampled everything (of course), the vodka, the white rum and dark rum, the elderflower liquor (think St Germaine) and the Holiday Nog.  She also threw in a sampling of their Bailey's style coffee liquor that's not quite "ready" yet.  I immediately fell in love with the Holiday Nog, which doesn't actually have any egg in it (thank goodness) and is made more with rum than whiskey (again, thank goodness).  This will go great with holiday gatherings.  I will keep an eye on their FB page for release of that coffee liquor!  All of their bottles run in the $25 range.  Hubby and I each had a cocktail, him the mojito and me the Citrus Fizz, and both were made well and were tasty.  We also bought several of their cocktail glasses as they are sturdy heavy glass, perfect for Bourbon.  Which, btw, they are still perfecting their whiskey recipe and will offer that in the future as well.    We really enjoyed talking to everyone and after getting a little liquid courage, I did ask about the swinger's parties.  She laughed and said that was just a friend making jokes....I wonder......

reviews.author: Al G.
reviews.description: Great little secret of Driftwood. These cocktail concoctions are simply amazing. If you want a place that's unique and specializes in great spirits this is your go to stop!

reviews.author: Rogelio S.
reviews.description: Fantastic staff. The drinks are amazing. We almost drove right past it because it is in the back of a small industrial strip. We went there happy, and left even happier!

reviews.author: Dewey L.
reviews.description: We came across this distillery accidentally, and so glad we found it.  It may not look like much on the outside, but inside, the drinks were great.  Nice variety and options.  Will definitely return!

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: If you look up the definition of 'hidden gem', you will see a picture of Crowded Barrell Whiskey and their Fang and Feather tasting room. Period.  What's the big deal you ask? Let me offer a few reasons to stop in:  - whiskey tasting flights of 4 for only $11   - also offering other gin or vodka mixed drinks  - great tasting room with some cool, historical architectural elements   - wonderful deck under the shady oaks to enjoy the quiet Hill Country ambiance  - for beer or wine lovers, they also offer those (and snacks) in an adjacent  building  So this is simply a great stop off the beaten path if you are headed out to the Hill Country or just want something different that is just down 1826.

reviews.author: Christina G.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem, tucked away in the hill country. This spot is funded and supported by crowdsourcing. Very cool concept. You'll more than likely have new products to sample every time you visit. There are flights and a great variety of coctails. Today, there were 5 whiskeys to pick from. Only outdoor seating. The scenic views are amazing. I recommend walking around and checking out the grounds.  Friendly service, great drinks and chill environment. I'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Eleanor C.
reviews.description: A little piece of heaven off the beaten path. Definitely stop in for an Eleanor New Fashioned! It's the best twist off a classic you'll ever have. These people are awesome!

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: We had a stop here on our dripping springs tour. If you like whiskey, this is the place for you. The whiskey tour itself wasn't that impressive, but you do get to taste whiskey right out of the barrel which is really cool.

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: Absolutely fantastic. Had a private tasting with Daniel and Emma. Got to meet Rex, Fancy Dan, John and Brianna. One of the best days I've had. The whiskey is a bit young, but pretty good.

reviews.author: Kate R.
reviews.description: I'm gluten free so could not do a whisky sample. My husband did and enjoyed enough to buy a bottle. If you're not into whisky, there's a trailer on the property that serves beer, wine and some mixed drinks, plus snacks! Great outdoorbtables, lights, etc. Pretty

reviews.author: Marzio O.
reviews.description: This is really for Fang and Feather since the Distillery was closed when I went.  The Eleanors do NOT disappoint! Nor did the Black Walnut Cocktail mixed by the affable and amiable Richard.  I figured to spend about an hour or so but instead closed the joint down! The bourbon is delicious and as a Magnificent Bastard it was a real trip to find my name on the Wall of Magnificence.  The grounds are lovely and well worth wandering. If you get the chance to stop in and sample the whiskey you will NOT be disappointed! If you are a Magnificent Bastard, it is so much fun to see where our favorite videos are shot.  Alas, I couldn't finagle my way into the Vault! ;)

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: This is, quite simply, and awesome little place, nestled in an awesome little spot, surrounded by beautiful country, and serving awesome whiskey.  I had seen the videos on YouTube, and I had some time before my flight out of Austin, so I drove up on a Friday, had a cigar while I waited for the place to open (they have seating for cigar smoking on the porches!), and then sampled some of their wares.  It's excellent, and I really can't say more than that.  Try the whiskey neat, or in a drink - everything we tried was wonderful.

reviews.author: Jeremiah D.
reviews.description: Amazing pilgrimage to drink magnificently! I was in town for a work trip and had to visit the physical location where two of my favorite YouTube channels are recorded. The whiskey was delicious, the tasting room/patio didn't disappoint, and Daniel even spent some time chatting. Still blown away by the experience.

reviews.author: Grant M.
reviews.description: Everything about these guys is first rate!  The tasting experience, the education, the environment and most importantly, the Whiskey!   I hear they make good cocktails too if that's your thing.

reviews.author: Kim M.
reviews.description: We spent an incredibly pleasant evening with co-owner Daniel, his wonderful wife Katie, bartender Emma and the wider team at Crowded Barrel this week. Delicious whiskies and cocktails, outstanding property which was both beautiful and comfortable. If you're able to make the trip you'll have a terrific time, and if you're a magnificent bastard you'll have the time of your life!

reviews.author: Brent M.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic afternoon at crowded barrel. The bourbon is delicious and the cocktails are really good too. The property and the deck are beautiful with lots of seating. My favorite thing was the people though. So welcoming and friendly. Definitely check it out if you're a whiskey fan!

reviews.author: Jenny P.
reviews.description: Went there for a wedding was a very beautiful location, staff was great! We are from California and will definitely come back next time we are here in Austin!

reviews.author: R L.
reviews.description: Being a MB, it's not hard to imagine that I love this place and the people who make it happen. If anyone is curious about what joining the tribe looks like, check out the Whisky Vault and Whisky Tribe...it's a great group of people who love learning about and enjoying whiskey. Join us!  Crowded Barrel is nestled in the beautiful Hill Country of TX and we enjoy sitting on the deck and tasting what's up for the day. If you are curious and want to learn more about whiskey, you will enjoy this adventure.

reviews.author: K. B.
reviews.description: Great place off the beaten path located at the Wizard Academy.   Wonderful tree covered wood deck and gear drinks.

reviews.author: Charles G.
reviews.description: Found this jewel in the hill country Sunday and the place and patio are awesome!  The views are amazing and the bourbon was smooth.

reviews.author: Jon C.
reviews.description: First! Big fan of the whiskey vault. If I make down to the Austin area, I'll drop in for sure.

name: Goodnight Loving Vodka Distillery + Tasting Room

reviews.author: Vicki M.
reviews.description: My husband and I were on a weekend getaway when we came across GoodNight Loving Vodka. After we found our way in through the secret entrance we were immediately greeted by co founder Tim Osburn and invited up to the ultra cool 70s style bar for some tastings. Frank Sinatra playing in the background and Great conversation kept us there longer than we planned on but what an experience!!! I even went home with my bottle signed by Tim ... Loved our visit so glad we made the stop ...

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Great place, great people, great vodka.  Tim and the crew are dedicatEd to creating a top-shelf product with incredible customer care.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: The tour was fantastic and very informative.  Well worth the $15.  More than that, at the end we ended at a tasting room where we sat with others on our tour and chatted.  We ended up walking down to a winery with some of those on the tour with us where we sat and chatted and then ended up going to dinner with them.  I highly recommend visiting the distillery and taking the tour!!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: Well Austin, I finally made 2k reviews on Yelp. I must have no life. haha!  My husband and I had come across Still Austin Whiskey while having drinks around Austin. My husband loved their whiskey and wanted to check out their place of business.  Sunday afternoons a few times a month, they do drag queen bingo. After the gym, I showered and we came here around 1:30ish. The drag queen bingo was underway and quite crowded. We grabbed a drink from inside and headed out to the beer garden area to observe. It was so much fun and recommend it.   They have a variety of drink cocktails to try with either gin, whiskey, and a beer or two. My husband got a flight and said it was good. I opted for the gold rush which was bourbon, honey, and lemon. It was quite tasty and strong.   I would like to note that I am gluten intolerant. I talked to the server and the manager about the gluten content. I was told that due to the distilling process basically, all spirits are gluten-free. I disagree with this information because I have had issues with some booze in the past as well as people in the gluten-free community. However, I am intolerant and usually only affected by gluten digestive-wise. I did have some mild digestive issues later that day but I made the choice to have a drink here. So make your decision wisely if you have problems with gluten.   Overall, this is a great place to grab a drink and chill for the afternoon in south austin. There are plenty of other things nearby to check out including food trucks and places to drink. The parking lot can get crowded so look for the overflow parking area or follow someone who is going to their car to leave.

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: Great place! I am not big on whiskey/bourbon but the cocktails here are pretty damn good. I got the blackberry bourbon cocktail and I highly recommend it.  The ambience in the place is great and staff was very friendly. Overall good vibe, great place for a date!

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Fun spot with outdoor seating.  Whiskey and gin bevs along with a food truck for snacks.  This area on St Elmo is hopping with many fun entertainment options.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: They make local whiskey that is good! Support local every time then you factor in they make amazing cocktails with it. Not basic cocktails but amazing over the top that are so tasty! Wakey Wakey is one of my favorites! Love this area old ware houses that keep the true Austin vibe! And great food around too like next too it so you can keep drinking! You will love this place!

reviews.author: Tony P.
reviews.description: Good austin outdoor spot. Came here for Sunday drag brunch bingo.Good time and the drag host was pretty funny and friendly. Dog friendly. Got an old fashioned for 6 bucks so that was a solid deal. Didn't get any good but it looked like a bunch of fried options which my friends seemed to enjoy. It was about 60% full on a Sunday afternoon. I will say that the music was way too loud during the bingo so that made it hard to talk. Outside of bingo, the volume was fine. Overall I'd recommend it. If not, St Elmo brewing is next door.

reviews.author: Mikhael W.
reviews.description: Our guide was pretty freaking awesome. I don't remember her name but she was a pretty red head with cool tattoos. I'm a tequila girl so I wasn't too eager to learn how gin and bourbon are made, but she really had my attention the entire time!   We were in a group of 10 which was just right. Everyone could get a few questions in if they wanted...laid back...chill...ITS AUSTIN!  Now, to the best part....and boy I was a bit disappointed. I've been on several tours in distilleries and the tasting at the end could get you about 2 shots away from tipsy. Typically there are about 4 samples....1.5-2 ounces each.....  Here....there were 2 samples with 1.5 ounces TOTAL!  I know all they do is gin and bourbon but can a SISTA have a bit more?! The tour is around $15pp, but I'd be happy to pay the standard $30-$40 for a tad bit more licka.    The gin and bourbon are still yummy!  Get a cocktail.....The old fashioned will have you stumbling!

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: The best whiskey tour I have been on!   I booked a tour to surprise my boyfriend. When we arrived, the place didn't have electricity or AC due to an electrical issue in the area.   Rather than cancel, they treated us to some complementary drinks to make up for the electrical and AC issue.   The staff was very friendly, professional, and turned a bad situation into a very fun and amazing time. Couldn't have imagined it being any better!   The guide was very knowledgeable, the tour was insightful, and the tasting at the end was great! Go support this local Austin business!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: So, we decided to just stick with tasting their liquor instead of getting drinks. They don't have tasting flights, but they do have an option to order a taste of any of their liquors for $2 each. That's not bad at all. We were able to taste the whiskey and gin. The two year whiskey was the winner. I did see some yummy cocktails that I would love to try in the near future.   They have inside and outside seating. The outside patio has a cover for shade, but you do have areas where you can get sun   There's a food truck on site.   Parking is available on site, but shared with the other businesses. For those that want to make an afternoon or day out of your visit, the other businesses are all drink or food related.

reviews.author: Katie S.
reviews.description: Maybe the Bummer and Lazarus distillery on treasure island in San Francisco has bumped my taste in gin up a bit, but this place was pretty alright.  Considering they only have one gin, I think this place is still workin on it. I didn't try the whiskey so that's probably what this place hits outta the park.

reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: We booked the whiskey tour for $15 per person and had a great time on a lazy Sunday afternoon. Our tour guide was incredibly knowledgeable and was able to answer all our questions. I felt like I got a lot out of the tour and now have a basic grasp of how whiskey is made.   The distillery is pretty small and they currently sell bourbon and gin as their bread and butter, both of which you'll get to sample at the end of the tour. Highly recommended to check it out as it's just a fun atmosphere.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: Employees are friendly and extremely knowledgeable about their products.  Knowing very little about the best ways to drink whiskey, I really appreciated the education they gave me and the ideas.  I absolutely love their Straight Bourbon Whiskey!

reviews.author: Mark J.
reviews.description: Wow.. I have tried a number of Texas whiskeys and while they are all pretty good, they tend to have quite a bite since they don't have time to age. Still Austin has one of the smoothest Texas whiskeys I have had. They also have a nice gin. Their tap room is nice and the staff was great.

reviews.author: Jenn C.
reviews.description: This place is a must-visit! We loved the atmosphere and setup. The drinks were amazing!!! The attention to detail was impressive including the branded ice cubes in the cocktails. The bartender was very attentive and knowledgeable. We wish we were in town longer because we would visit it again. We will definitely be back during our next Austin trip.

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: Really great atmosphere. Cute decor. They have their own made gin and bourbon and offer $2 tasters of each.

reviews.author: Julie L.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed visiting and discovering the behind the scenes magic at Still Austin Distillery. A scheduled tour with Jason was the highlight in addition to great education followed by excellent samples. Still in Love tour was perfect. Staff all friendly and fun! We will be back! Yum

reviews.author: Marianne L.
reviews.description: We went to Drag Queen Bingo one Sunday for a friend's birthday and had a great time! The drinks were delicious and even our friends who aren't whisky fans found cocktails that they loved. The food truck was delicious, although we had to wait a while for food. They apologized for the delay at the end of the shift and brought out cookies for everyone! The place has great parking, plentiful outdoor seating and an overall good vibe. We will be back!

reviews.author: Cynthia D.
reviews.description: Wow. This place is making some serious showstopper whiskey. Buttery and caramely and ever so lightly sweet, it's so satisfying to sip on this while listening to my vinyl collection, which I've decided is my latest "thing."  They are currently running a live music series, which is how I became aware of them -- they often do cool giveaways with samples to promote local musicians.

reviews.author: Malinda F.
reviews.description: Still one of our favorite outdoor hang outs!! But have to like gin or bourbon  Bearded guy food truck had awesome snacks!

reviews.author: Dan G.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a unique and cool place to taste various whiskeys, try Still Austin Whiskey Company.  The staff was fantastic and knowledgeable and we tried some of their whiskey as well as some mixed concoctions that were fabulous.  There is a great open patio area that shares space with a food truck and the Bearded Bread Company, but the winds were blowing like crazy and the temps were too cold to be outside long. Definitely try this place!  And then explore other spots in the same Industrial Park!  The artwork on the buildings is also great to tour on its own.

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: I must say that Hy Rum has arrived.....and in a really BIG way. How so? Well, let me tell you. 1.) Their new set up on Frog Pond Lane just of Hwy 290 is not only convenient to the ATX visit, but it will become a frequent destination. 2.) Indoor seating - both at the Tiki bar, but the innumerable comfy seating areas look nice - and I can't wait to try them all! They are all in on the Tiki motif, as they really transformed this former pool supply facility into something special. Outdoor seating: Lots. Seating with a view of the Hill Country, under the twinkling lights, in the yard - or even around a game of corn hole. They have something for everybody, including your well-behaved dog. 3.) Drinks: Hmmm...where to start. Their seasonal drink menu when we visited in January 2022 was fantastic. The first thing you notice if you sit at the bar is that the bartenders are mixing and muddling with the using freshest, usually made-in-house, all natural ingredients whenever possible. The Hot Buttered Rum drink is amazing. It will have you googling 'recipes' before you get home. Warm, spicy, buttery, and with a whipped topping topped with a hint of rum flavor (yes, they whip rum into their topping). It was our favorite on this sunny, but blustery day. Another winner was their 'Knotty Hot Chocolate' with Mexican chocolate and cinnamon. On their 'regular' menu, I tried their Old Fashioned (in which you can choose Dark or Spiced Rum) and I can tell you it was spot on. 4.) People. We were promptly greeted and seated by Master Distiller James Davidson who also told us their story and even took time to visit with us a couple of more times. He was super friendly and funny. 5.) The Booze. We tasted several with our favorite being the Spiced, but their rum family offers Dark, White, Spiced, and several flavors: Coconut, Orange, Pineapple, Extra Rich and Spicy ('the Chupacabra' which has espresso, chocolate and cinnamon infused) and even a Scottish style gin (aka Jinn) 6.) Speaking of special, check this out: Hye Rum now has a weekly event calendar with something for everybody: Brunch and Learn, Family Night, Suppler Club, Cocktail classes, and even Mardi Gras. In addition, you can book a facility tour that includes a tasting flight for only $20, which we will definitely be doing next. Soon, they will add an 'Event Room' as well just to cover all their bases. All that said, Hye Rum is making all the right moves and seems to have hit the big time. All I ask is to save us 2 seats because this place may be hard to get into - and we will be back!

reviews.author: Connie C.
reviews.description: I'm so happy that Hye Rum moved right into my backyard here in Dripping Springs! Love their tiki themed tasting room and cocktails - it made me feel like I was on a tropical vacation.   I'm a big fan of coconut rum so I ordered the Cocojito and it was so good. My husband loved their piña colada and our friend had a rum flight and ended up buying two bottles their dark rum.  James, their master distiller and cofounder, was there on a Saturday and took care of us the entire time. It was so nice to see how passionate he is about his craft and the distillery, and making sure that all their patrons feel welcomed.   Looking forward to making this one of my regular spots!

reviews.author: Elizabeth B.
reviews.description: I came here at a recommendation of a friend and absolutely love the spiced rum. If you are a gingerbread fanatic, definitely worth a visit. Followed by the coconut if you loved Malibu in college. Sophisticated, but sweet rum

reviews.author: Koltin K.
reviews.description: Owner and staff are all incredibly Knowledgeable and welcoming! Wide arrange of flavors through their spirits that will satisfy any palate. Will be coming back. Join their rum club!

reviews.author: Tazer V.
reviews.description: Was out antiquing with my wife. She spotted "moonshine" and "tasting room" on the same sign. I said, "we gotta go!"  Walked in and tasted three different types of the variety. I left with three bottles, one of each variety I tried. I recommend Moonshine Ridge. I will be back for more!!

reviews.author: Mr Grant ..
reviews.description: On 18 March 2022  my wife and I tried to visit this establishment. Im a disable Vet that has a spinal injury...I parked in front on the establishment and a few second later we were greeted by a gentleman pointed at the sign that says  only Moonshine Ridge parking. Well a moment later why I was putting on my back brace  the gentleman came back out and said we couldn't park there its only Moonshine ridge parking...so my wife said let's just leave, they don't need or want our business.. I then told the gentleman that I was disabled and it takes me a little longer than the average person to get out of my vehicle. Handicap placard and Military Handicap license place were visible.  Salute to all Disable Veterans   Chief

reviews.author: Joshua R.
reviews.description: Traveling through town and found this hidden gem. We took my mom there who doesn't drink anything other than wine. Her exact words were "this is so smooth, no burn, very tasteful".  Made slow and right, uses all Texas ingredients, including the rain water!! (Talk about being resourceful!  The gentleman helping us was one of the owners/distillers. He had one recipe that was his great grandfathers!  Bought a bottle to take back to Phoenix with us!

reviews.author: Danielle N.
reviews.description: Can't say anything about the actual moonshine but the owner is very rude. He said we couldn't sit on the lower edge of the sidewalk which was pretty much the street. Any time anyone would stand in front of the store for more than 30 seconds he would also tell them to stop "blocking the sidewalk" when it would literally be 2 people and the sidewalk is wide. Not a way to bring in business.

reviews.author: Ashley F.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and service! We were in town visiting for a wedding and had a local recommend this place, so we decided to go check it out.  The owner was very friendly and had some great stories to tell.  Definitely a place you would want to go visit and grab a drink when you're in town.

reviews.author: Julie W.
reviews.description: What a cool place to wander in to! Such a relaxed vibe, the owner is an awesome storyteller and a generational moonshiner. They have a variety of moonshine to sample, but definitely sit a while and enjoy one of their cocktails!! Perfect pit stop for a day tripper!

reviews.author: Jonathan S.
reviews.description: While driving through the area to our destination, we found this gem. We decided to stop in and visit and we're not disappointed. The entrance can be easy to miss if you're not paying attention. Once you turn in, there isn't much parking and the entrance is tucked in the back off the road.   When we got there, the staff were in the bottling area filling, sealing and packaging fresh bottles. It was a cool process to watch from the bar. If you are a whisky fan,definitely stop in.

reviews.author: Shirley P.
reviews.description: This was the most delightful stop!  You won't Be disappointed.  A hidden gem with excellent Whiskey.

reviews.author: Jim B.
reviews.description: I was in Blanco camping at the state park right before Christmas. I was drinking eggnog at another distillery in the area with my wife and friends  when my buddy, John, mentioned they were stopping here on the way back to camp, as well.  When arrived, we were welcomed by a very friendly young man. We sampled all of the products on hand. I was blown away by the full-flavored taste of the gin that they only sell on the property. It is like sipping the essence of a hike through a juniper forest. I have never experienced anything like it. It is destined to be my favorite late night sipping beverage.   I left the distillery with a bottle of Ben Milam Barrel Proof Bourbon and a bottle of Provision Distiller's Gin. I've been sipping on them ever since. I will definitely be back for more!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great little distillery that I expect will be  going places before you know it. It is fairly new and doesn't have much business, but I don't expect that to last too long.  We stopped by on a Saturday afternoon. The tasting room is small, but quaint. Their single barrel bourbon is smooth and subtle. It was our favorite whiskey of the day (we were on a self guided distillery tour). The tasting was $5 for two. Definitely also the cheapest tasting fee of the day.  If in Blanco, don't miss out in trying this whiskey out. You may just find yourself a new favorite spirit.

reviews.author: Michelle C.
reviews.description: Made it back Heather! What a great experience at this quant little place. Brenda was a fabulous host and shared the history of Ben Milam. Thank you!

reviews.author: Marissa A.
reviews.description: Had a great time with friends trying Whiskey. ( I'm not a whiskey drinker but, my friends are) they do have different cocktails to choose from and they also make gin(if you're into that)   Cute outdoor space and spots inside as well

reviews.author: Mac M.
reviews.description: Thank you for your hospitality I loved your whiskey look forward to staying in contact with y'all. Dee Foster and Rikk T. Munroe thank you very much for the tasting!!!! McAllister Family

reviews.author: Matt F.
reviews.description: Driving through Blanco last week and I've always noticed the road sign but I haven't stopped in before. Check them on Yelp and Google and couldn't find much info, so what the hell, turned around to check in out for myself.   First thing I noticed was the large shade tree, several chairs, and lush grass. I could just see me and a group of friends sitting there having a few drinks and enjoying the cooler fall temperatures because here in South Texas 91 degrees in November is just that, cool Fall. I'm having a hard time getting used to that.   Inside is a small tasting room that is put together nicely. The guy working the counter could have been a little nicer. He was busy taking in inventory and obviously working but I'd like to have heard about their process, why are they better than other distilleries in the area, what sets them apart? Who is Ben Milam, I asked and he said it was the grandfather of the owner. I know who Ben Milam was, and that is a leading figure of the Texas Revolution. I'm not a Texan but I am a history buff and there is a lot to know of Ben Milam and he's great a cool story. I purchased a flight and a bottle, roughly $56 for both. At least pretend that you care a little bit more.   The bottle I took home, it was, and I say WAS fantastic. Unfortunately, Game 7 of the Houston/Dodgers game was a little stressful and the wife and I put a huge dent in the bottle on the first night. Ha! I now have to go back and pick up another, darn. Can't wait...

reviews.author: Vince M.
reviews.description: This rating is for my visit, not for the product. I'm walked in and the lady that was in the tasting room barely greeted me. I looked at the menu and she just stood there. I ordered the flight and, again, nothing. I was the only one there and tried to make at least some small talk, but she was too busy with her cell phone to even speak. She told me NOTHING about the spirits, the distillery, nothing. She seemed put out to even be there. Finally, I bought a bottle, THEN she decided to speak. It was a horrible experience and I wish I had waited to buy the bottle at the local liquor store where it was actually cheaper. Can not recommend this place at all. The products are good, but get them at the liquor store that is right up the road.

reviews.author: Eileen S.
reviews.description: Lovely distillery, very knowledgeable and very good! You would def taste their whiskey. Highly recommend

reviews.author: M S.
reviews.description: One of my favorite things about exploring small towns is sometimes you find the most unexpected gems. We traveled to Blanco, TX (pop. 1700) today for Old 300 BBQ, and by chance decided to take a different way out of town than we'd come in. Right off 281 we passed by Ben Milam Whiskey, just opened since March. We had a very pleasant visit and enjoyed their whiskey flight, along with a sample of some of the best gin I've ever tasted. Everything was outstanding, but I couldn't stop thinking about their rye whiskey and had to take a bottle home with me. This is worth a trip all on it's own, even if you have to go out of your way. Nice people running the place, and fantastic whiskey.

reviews.author: Phil M.
reviews.description: I am not a Texan nor a bourbon drinker.  I picked up a bottle of Ben Milam last year.  I think this maybe the best bourbon I have ever had. I plan to visit Texas this coming year and I will visit Ben Milam again.

reviews.author: Ron R.
reviews.description: We just found out about Been Milam Whiskey a couple of days ago and decided on a road trip to check it out. Rick, the Master Distiller, was friendly and informative. He not only knew about the bourbon and rye, he was able to discuss whiskey from other distilleries, places to eat and other topics.   We enjoyed the bourbon and rye enough to buy both before we left. They both had nice aromas and smooth tastes. We will definitely enjoy these bottles and try to spread the word about them.

reviews.author: STEVE C.
reviews.description: I unexpectedly bought a bottle of this whiskey while we were in Johnson City, Texas. The liquor store proprietor said people really liked this smooth bourbon and he sure was right. I like to buy local and support small businesses. I may try to order a case from Blanco.

reviews.author: Sandi D.
reviews.description: We stopped by today and absolutely loved the place! I am not a huge whiskey fan, but i enjoyed their whiskey to my surprise! My husband is a big whiskey man and said it was some of the best whiskey he has ever had.   They also make a gin they was great.  The men who helped us out were very friendly and informative with the tasting.  Thank you!! This place is a must stop!

reviews.author: Marissa F.
reviews.description: Such a great tour from Sophie! Wonderful experience, learned so so much. Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: The South Austin distillery and modern tasting room has a fantastic bar program serving phenomenal cocktails, offers tours, has beautiful patio seating and delicious food by Char.atx.  We visited when they first opened and were in awe of the stunning tasting room, lush green views, and one of my favorite parts is the tour to include a look inside their rickhouse. They are currently aging straight bourbon whiskey in 2020 with a projected release time of 2023. They are currently offering enticing cocktails made unaged new-make whiskey, along with craft gin, rum, and agave spirits distilled in-house.  Not only does this craft distillery provide a welcoming new space but they are also all about transparency and sustainability. Expect live music, events, exclusive events for members and more!

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: What a gem of a place! I go down the street to Meanwhile all the time, but had no idea this place even existed.  Fierce Whiskers excited me as a whiskey fan, but I do like that they have options with rum, agave, gin and other spirits.   There is definitely a lot of potential for this space, it is so cute, however they've only been open for 6 months, so they still have room to grow, they don't have much seating outside, and it would be nice to have some music, or yard games, or something to do as you're enjoying a craft cocktail. Hence the lack of star to only 4 stars.   I had the Gold Rush for my drink, a whiskey, honey, lemon concoction.   That being said, I was here for a happy hour with an organization I am in, and we had a great time. We spread out in the lawn area and everyone had a great time.   They also have a delicious food truck on site: Char ATX.  More on that in my next review where I'll be talking about the food I got there.   Definitely a cute date spot, catching up with friends, but wouldn't say it's great for families or a large group really. I hope that they continue to add on to the space and grow to utilize the space more. I'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: JESSIE C.
reviews.description: I'm a fan! Went with some friends on a Sunday and we fell in love. The drink selection needs a little improvement but they are willing to tweak it to your satisfaction which we loved.  The food truck was very tasty they had a Oyster truck as well we didn't taste that but saw many people enjoying.  The land is beautiful with ample space to go with friends or a date or by yourself it's a chill ambience just like a whiskey distillery should be.  Deff going back!

reviews.author: Mark J.
reviews.description: Great young distillery. I cannot wait until their liquors have matured and are available for mass consumption. Their rye and gin were amazing, even as young as they are. The distillery and tasting room are very nice and a great place to have a drink with some friends. I see good things in their future.

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: Really cute spot! I hope to come back when they are doing tours. The facility is gorgeous, very trendy and welcoming. They have a lot of seats inside and outside and have food trucks on site if you are hungry. I liked their expansive menu of different and fun cocktails, that are also really delicious. The only thing is that you pay for not a lot of drink...but that's ok. Enjoy your company!  I hope they get more staff and maybe some waiters, because their can be a log jam at the bar with a line waiting on the bartenders to make these tedious drinks and it can take a long time.

reviews.author: Jodi G.
reviews.description: Wow!  A rickhouse right in Austin!  Sophie was a stellar tour guide.  David mixes fantastic drinks. Going to be a challenge to wait for 2023 release of their Whiskey.

reviews.author: Christine Y.
reviews.description: I'm in love with Fierce Whiskers! The main interior tasting room and bar area is gorgeous with deep tones of dark blues, leather and wood textures, and moody lighting. The large glass doors open up to a spacious outdoor seating area. The drink menu is fairly priced with cocktails that allow you to taste their very own whiskey, gin, and rum. If you prefer straight whiskey, they have flights/tasting samplers you can ask about.  I loved the food truck parked in their lawn (Char ATX) with delicious yakitori (Japanese meat on skewers).  They have tours of their facilities which sound really interesting. I think those tours are about $15/person (please verify with Fierce Whiskers for most up-to-date pricing).  Good-sized parking lot  This place is a hidden gem. Drive past Meanwhile and head straight to Fierce Whiskers. ;-)

reviews.author: Joanna S.
reviews.description: Super excited about what's going on here and what's to come! We visited while in ATX for our anniversary. Sophie gave us an incredible tour of the distillery. She was excellent and we learned a lot! The interior of the main tasting room is so beautiful and well thought-out with details we learned from the tour. The drinks were superbly made and delicious. Definitely will be back when visiting in the future :)

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: I'm hesitant to leave a review because I don't want to lose the peaceful ambiance of this spot! Such a relaxing location with a great outdoor area. The cocktails are beautiful here. There was a Japanese food truck on-site that smelt amazing, even though I was already full coming in. Will be returning with my pups next time!

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: Came here for a distillery tour and stayed to enjoy the taproom. The tour is $15 and includes a tasting. Fair warning their whiskey is new aged and won't be ready to be bottled for sale for another 2+ years. This made the tasting a littleeeee rough, but I learned a lot about whiskey so it was worth it. The tasting room is really nice and they have a great cocktail list - standard and seasonal. They host events regularly and there is a food truck on site.

reviews.author: David H.
reviews.description: Great new location, very informative staff. If you're looking for a nice quieter place to sit and try some new spirits, this is the place. I'd hurry, I don't think this place will be quiet much longer.

reviews.author: Ana B.
reviews.description: This place is really awesome. The atmosphere is very airy and relaxed. The food truck is delicious. Best part the whiskey! The drinks we had were perfect. They make their own cinnamon whiskey which is a way above fireball. Plus the staff is great. Super knowledgeable and friendly. Miles was our bartender and helped us pick the best drinks for what we were in the mood for. Fire in the sky and an old fashion.  Definitely going back!

reviews.author: J S.
reviews.description: The line is long, the menus are scarce, you make a line where ever you feel like it. I love a craft cocktail but it's basically chaos and wherever you can push in for a drink you should try. If you wait politely you will wait forever

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Had such a great time on the tour today! It was fantastic. Really cool science and technology. The drinks are fun and it was a great time with my friends.

reviews.author: Heeteak C.
reviews.description: This is the first time this place. Cool tour and awesome bar. Still getting thing ready for full on bourbon sell but theyvhave a lot of great drinks. Must come by and experience it.

reviews.author: Matthew N.
reviews.description: Such a cool local Austin spot. Disappointed I have to wait 3 -4 more years to buy a bottle. If you are looking for something different to do go check it out!

reviews.author: Brandon H.
reviews.description: Had a great tour and great drinks here! Space is great for picnics and bringing your dog!

reviews.author: Madison R.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our tour today!  Learned a lot about whiskey and the process that goes into the aging and distilling.  Would recommend

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: First time visiting here and it was great. The atmosphere, drinks and staff. Sophie was supper informative and helpful. She has all kinds of information about the whiskey and membership. The bartender Jeremiah makes the cocktails beautifully. The experience I had with Sophie and Jeremiah is definitely a reason I will be coming became back here.  For food they have the food truck Char ATX that serve snack size portion of delicious food.

reviews.author: Mandy G.
reviews.description: If you're looking to visit some wineries in the outskirts of Austin, I recommend it with Arlen!   Arlen was sweet, knowledgable, and funny. He picked us up from our Airbnb and drove us 45 mins out and back, while we blasted some rachet songs to sing haha. He would check in on us during the winery to see if we needed anything or have any questions, and he would offer to help us take multiple pictures. He also got one of the wineries to allow us to explore their cellars!   On our last day in Austin, he drove by our airbnb to pick up someone else and honked at us as we waited for our uber. We were all so happy to see him again, as we all enjoyed our experience with him.   I recommend Texas Tipsy Tours with Arlen ;)

reviews.author: Brittany Z.
reviews.description: I have so many wonderful things to say about this company. I set-up an appointment online to schedule a private driver to Fredericksburg. Ashley called right on time. She was friendly and very informative.  She helped make the experience exactly what I was looking for. I wanted less sweet wines and a winery with food options. Arlen was our diver and was so knowledgeable and friendly. He picked us up right at the hotel in Austin. I felt the price for the experience is definitely worth it. If you were considering this experience, I highly recommend this company. They care and that is important.

reviews.author: Alli G.
reviews.description: Texas Tipsy Tours is simply the best of the best! Organized, thoughtful, fun, professional, and accommodating! They do all the heavy lifting with the friendliest spirit and let you and your group have the time of your life!  We had the BEST time on our tour and absolutely adore Arlen, our driver! He was the kindest, most considerate, thoughtful, responsible driver ever! He was so fun but also let us have our time to just be girls and we didn't have to open a single door, make a decision, or carry a single bag (if we didn't want to) the whole time we were with Arlen!  Also, the management team was incredible. Wei booked last minute and they were so accommodating and listened to our unique needs/wants for the tour! And we're so detailed in instructions. I have had bad experiences with wine/bus tours with other companies and I was SO impressed with the whole experience at Texas tipsy!

reviews.author: Rolanda H.
reviews.description: If your looking to visit wineries or distilleries in the  outskirts of Austin like Dripping Springs and the surrounding area I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours. They are organized and timely. If you're an out of towner like myself and decide to book accommodations in Austin they will pick you up from there and bring you back.   All of my future bookings I will definitely request Wade. He was very professional and personable, he made sure we were taken care of at each location on our tour. He also was more than happy to take our pictures along the way.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: We were on a girls trip and were lucky to have Arlen as our driver. He was exceptional, friendly and knowledgeable! He gave us great recommendations for places we were unsure about.

reviews.author: Karla J.
reviews.description: Debbie was an amazing host.  We did Winery, Brewery, Distillery on our recent trip to TX.  Such a fun experience.  Would do again in a heart-beat!

reviews.author: Stephanie T.
reviews.description: Y'all BOOK WITH THEM!!!!! I literally do not have one negative thing to say about this company. From the minute I called to book to the minute I said goodbye to our driver the day of the tour they were fantastic.   So when I called there actually weren't any times available. They worked with me to make sure they had a tour time and sprinter available for our group of 6. I had a million questions; they were patient and kind.   Our group was 6 but one of my friends asked if we could add an additional person. Reached out to TTT and they said sure no problem. Literally 3 HOURS LATER I got a call that another girl tested positive with covid and wouldn't be able to come with us obviously- they were so nice and made the switch back to 6. Very grateful for their exceptional customer service.   Day of our driver Bryant was early which was great! Got on the bus and let us have free range of the radio, answered any wine questions we had or any questions about Fredericksburg. He was a fantastic host. Always texted 15 minutes till our time at the winery was up and took as many pictures as we wanted. He was so sweet! He also made sure we were never thirsty or hungry. Which for a group of girls is very important- smart man! Haha   I've heard things about other companies having hidden fees and people getting charges after leaving Fredericksburg and we had none of that. Texas Tipsy Tours was very transparent with all of their pricing and they had no hidden fees.   Thank you TTT for making our trip perfect. You won't regret booking with them.

reviews.author: Mia L.
reviews.description: Sent a request in and received a response on a weekend afternoon in less than 5 minutes. Incredible customer service, they only fit up to 14 on their vehicles so we were unable to use them, but their owner takes quotes seriously!!

reviews.author: Kelly F.
reviews.description: My experience with Texas Tipsy tours was nothing short of perfect!!! From pickup to drop-off, Courtney (the owner) made our experience amazing! When I initially started inquiring about a tour a few months ago, many of the companies only offered private tours for a minimum of 4 people. However, Texas Tipsy Tours offers small group private tours (i.e. 2-3 people). This was perfect for me. She also made planning our trip so easy, and she promptly answered all of the questions I had.   On the day of the tour, she picked us up from our hotel in Austin in an Infiniti SUV (it was very clean too)! She even made a pit stop for me at a CVS on the way to our first winery. Throughout the 6 hour tour, she made sure we stayed on schedule. She even let us change a stop last minute because we wanted to check out a brewery!  One thing that was amazing was the comfort she provided! She allowed us to pick the music, provided phone chargers, and let us control the AC! She even opened our doors for us AND dropped us off/picked us up right in front of each place we went!  Overall, I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours, and I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Audrey C.
reviews.description: Wow!  What an amazing day our group of ladies had with Texas Tipsy Tours.  We chose the half day option and were picked up right at our vacation rental (Farmhouse on Elder Hill) We wanted to just stay nearby so we visited Driftwood Estate Winery and Fall Creek.  We were planning to also see Vista Brewing (all in Driftwood), but we chatted and laughed so much that we ran out of time and Eric, driver/owner was flexible with our change of plans and let us just extend our time enjoying the fabulous view at Driftwood Estate.  The tour service was absolutely awesome and professional.  Everything done with excellence.  Thank you Courtney and Eric!

reviews.author: Ally H.
reviews.description: Awesome experience for bachelorette. Seamless communication with manager Courtney. Helped us make a great itinerary-2 wineries and 1 distillery. Group loved every minute. Driver Keaton was so friendly and professional and best of all company was affordable. Can't recommend enough

reviews.author: Ashton M.
reviews.description: I booked a private wine tasting tour with Tipsy Tours for a bachelorette party and it was seamless right from the start! They took care of everything and even placed our lunch order for us in advance so it was ready when we arrived. It was honestly one of the best tour experiences I have ever had and already booked another tour with them for later this year!

reviews.author: Chelsea C.
reviews.description: AWESOME! I worked with Courtney at TTT to plan my Husband's 30th birthday brewery tour. It was as easy as getting on the phone, explaining what I wanted, and Courtney took care of literally everything else. We picked the breweries we wanted and even included a food stop. She coordinated the bus pick up, drop offs, schedule, and even reserved tables for us at each stop. I love that we had our own bus (very nice one, by the way!), and had the flexibility to create our own tour based on beers and food my husband liked. It was the perfect Saturday in Austin! Payment was very easy as well - they sent me an invoice to my email and I was able to pay directly online for everything. Highly recommend, and thank you Texas Tipsy Tours!

reviews.author: Erin J.
reviews.description: We booked Texas Tipsy Tours twice in one weekend. I have taken quite a few van tours around the hill country and Texas Tipsy Tours sets themselves apart by not just being drivers but they truly host you the entire day. I will ALWAYS use this company going forward. We did a private charter from Driftwood to Austin, TX and back and Keaton our driver was a delight. He made sure we were picked up on time and each of our stops were easy and flexible. We did a mixed tour around Driftwood and Dripping springs the next day and our guide Eric executed the BEST DAY for us. He even picked up on what we were liking and recommended a change to our final stop to Vista Brewing and we were SO glad he did. At each stop he made sure we had plenty of water, snacks and chairs to enjoy the gorgeous venues. This is totally above and beyond what we would have expected from a driver. Courtney was so easy to work with and she helped make recommendations for our group ultimately making our weekend get away FLAWLESS. I promise if you don't use this company, you're wrong.

reviews.author: Kylie H.
reviews.description: Texas Tipsy Tours was absolutely wonderful. They curated a wine tasting for my best friend's bachelorette, and were so helpful and knowledgeable. Courtney and Eric are just the sweetest people! Would highly recommend if you're looking for a relaxed tasting without the hubbub of big party buses, AND if you're looking for a more personalized experience with people who can really throw a party. Fredericksburg can be confusing because of the many, many options, so Courtney's expertise in the wineries proved incredibly helpful. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Christy C.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience with this tour company.  They were easy to work with and to plan our day.  We selected the premium wine tour and stopped at 3 wineries and picked up lunch at Hye Market.  The entire experience was well thought out and planned thoroughly.  Courtney is one of the owners and helped me figure out which wineries to taste.  Keaton was our driver and he was great!  I would definitely recommend this tour company.

reviews.author: Nancy R.
reviews.description: Our driver, Keaton, was amazing! He was so polite and kept us on schedule. The places we visited were amazing and so welcoming. Highly recommend!

name: Dripping With Taste Wine and Food Festival

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: This was my first, and sad to say, my last time doing this festival. A friend who had been a few times before highly recommended it and when I balked at the $40 (plus a $3.50 processing fee) "pre-event discount price" with the at the door price being $50, he assured me it was well worth it because there were so many great food and wine vendors, you get your money's worth.  This was absolutely NOT the case! Firstly, this whole thing just seemed disorganized at best and I am sorry, but for $50 ($40) they could have gotten a much nicer location than a dusty, stiflingly hot cattle stockyard!   As for what you get for $40, 6 drink tickets and 10 food tickets when drinks and food run you anywhere from 1 ticket for a meager barely 1oz pour for most of the wines to several tickets for very small portions of the food, you barely get $10 worth of food and drink! You can purchase ticket for $1 a piece, which is most definitely not worth the portions or pours you receive.   As for the vendors/vintners at the festival, there were not nearly as many as you would expect for the price point and the layout was just haphazard. Also, there were several vendors that were out of food by the time we got there just after 2pm...the "festival" was supposed to go until 6pm...so how the heck were vendors running out of things w/4hrs left!?!   The only highlight, for me at least, was the grape stomp, but even then, they ran out of tshirts to "stamp" with your grape-soaked footprints.   In any case, my $43.50 would have been better spent and enjoyed at an actual local restaurant where I could have gotten multiple full pours of wine and actual food instead of leaving this joke of a festival hungry, overheated, more sober than when I arrived, and feeling like I had just been scammed somehow. Lesson. Learned.   I am honestly shocked this "festival" has lasted 10yrs let alone one!

reviews.author: Valerie S.
reviews.description: I had a lovely time as the guest of a coworker. However, I felt like the overall value wasn't quite there for this event. Drink and food tickets went way too fast when some places asked for multiple tickets for less than an ounce of wine or a small sample of food. The actual value was about $1 per ticket. There were also some vendors that were somewhat rude or rushing. The whole point is to get business by having people try your product, right? Well there's some wineries I'd think twice about giving my money to after their lack of friendliness.   The options for food was more limited than I expected and many ran out of food even though we got there just an hour after the event started. There are lots of raffles going on and free koozies and pens galore. The arena was stuffy inside and though fresh near the doors you ran the risk of also eating dirt.   The music was good but there needed to be more sitting areas to relax and open a bottle of wine. I will definitely go back next year, but I do hope to see more offerings.

reviews.author: Ella D.
reviews.description: This was by far the most awful "festival" I have ever had the misfortune of wasting money on.   First of all, in 2012 it was held at the Texas Hill Country Olive Company. So all advertisements this year were of a gorgeous event at this lovely vineyard - The photos were of a classy event, surrounded by olive trees and rolling hills, adorable art booths scattered about the lovely property, smiling faces holding wine glasses. I was so excited based on what I was reading of the Olive Company event that I had my mother travel up 3 hours on the morning of Saturday the 14th to accompany me. Then I convinced another girlfriend of mine to join. We had our tickets in advance, $40.00 online purchase, and my girlfriend paid at the door - $50.00.   Now, regardless of where the ACTUAL event for 2013 was advertised as being held - between the advertisements on Yelp, on Facebook and scattered about Dripping Springs, it was VERY unclear to anyone coming from outside of town where the hell this event actually was.   So we arrived at the Texas Hill Country Olive Company to find no tents, no events, no nothing but a beautiful building surrounded by beautiful land. Inside there were very few customers. But we were greeted warmly, given amazing samples (DO go there and DO try their olive oils and balsamic vinegars and DO check out their $55.00 romantic date night packages).   Making the best of what was already frustrating, we had a few samples and they sent us on to the Dripping Springs Park Ranch - or something like that, up Ranch Road Twelve.   We were still optimistic until we saw the HUGE metal pavilion looming ahead, situated in the midst of probably two square miles of plowed up red dirt which will eventually be a parking lot. As we navigated in, driving through dirt among hundreds of cars, we noticed piles of dirt, bull dozers, caution tape... this entire venue was a.) an agricultural fair pavilion and b.) UTTERLY UNFINISHED.   I was mortified. I brought guests, I paid money, and we were supposed to be in the midst of lush, rolling hill country sipping wine and sampling cheese. Not walking through 300 yards of dirt to get to an unfinished metal building. This was already so embarrassing and already not worth the money.   We had to enter at the back of this enormous, godawful construction, walk through the art vendors, then across MORE dirt on the rodeo floor (where the paying guests tables were and the music) where we were given six drink tickets and ten food tickets. When we reached the one interior part of the building, we were encountered by swarms of casually dressed, generally rude, pushy guests who were buzzing around a square room with no proper traffic flow. There we found out that each drink ticket gave us ONE OUNCE of wine, which was poured by rude and distracted vendors. We also found that each food ticket did not entitle us to a sample - samples cost anywhere from 2 to 5 tickets. One ticket got you the likes of ONE chip with a dollop of something on it.   I was blocked and almost run over by a RUDE and completely OBLIVIOUS staff member who was blocking the only entrance to the tasting room. Other guests were hogging the only FIVE standing tables in the are, they'd put their purses up there and stand around and send other guests to get them samples, so there was no where to set down your things and you had to juggle a glass of wine, your tickets, your purse, and a plate of food and in order to eat it, back through the ONE door you went, down the stairs to the dirt on the rodeo arena floor.   We left without even using the tickets we had - not worth the paltry return for what we'd spent and what we had to endure to get there.   I will never return to this event. I want my money back from this event. The Dripping Springs Chamber of Commerce should be ashamed of the overall mess and disappointment this fiasco was - they don't deserve a dime of the money they raised from it.   TERRIBLE.

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: This is probably more of a 3.5 than a 4, but the low ratings to date are unjustified so I'm bumping it up.  I enjoyed the wide variety of beer, wine, and liquor to choose from, but I wish there were a few more food options. What made it worth the price of admission was the sommelier talk at 3:30 where there was no-ticket-required wine comparison tasting, and I learned a few things. Take advantage of those demos if you go next year. Also there were a few food stands with free samples no tickets required (pecans were a favorite, olive oil, chips and salsa, etc). I wish I had hit the liquor area sooner, they seemed to have generous pours. I may hit this event again next year, or I may not, but I definitely had a good time.

reviews.author: Miranda E.
reviews.description: This was disappointing. I've been to many similar food/wine tastings, but this one was very low value- you received drink and food coupons instead of the usual unlimited tastings most events provide. Also, expect to experience long lines in a hot event center. I'd recommend treating yourself to a nice dinner with wine over coming here.

reviews.author: Chrystal W.
reviews.description: I thought this was an awesome event!  Yes you had to pay $40 for entrance into the event.  For that money you receive a twin Iiquors reusable bag, some goodies inside the bag including a wine glass, 10 food tickets and 6 wine tickets.  Each wine ticket was good for a 1oz pour.  And the food tickets could be used at more than 10 food vendors for various amounts.  It is called Dripping with Taste because it is supposed to be a "taste" not a full glass or full meal.  I will tell you that I had plenty of food for my 10 tickets!  And got to try 6 different wines!    I will say that a previous post about volunteers having to work 2 hours and then getting unlimited food and drinks is absolutely false.  Volunteers had to work a minimum of 3 hour shifts but most worked many, many more hours not only the day of the event but also prior to the event and they got the same 10 food tickets and 6 alcohol tickets.  I learned a lot about local wineries, breweries, and distilleries and tasted some awesome food from some local restaurants that I had not yet eaten at.

reviews.author: Jared H.
reviews.description: If you choose to attend this festival, DO NOT PAY. You get 6 drink tickets and 10 food tickets for $40. 1 oz pours. That's about 1/6 of a glass of wine. So you pay $40 for a single glass of wine. HEB gave away 2 chips with salsa for 1 ticket, empanadas were 5 tickets. I was denied BUYING a bottle of water, so that the volunteers could have them.   This brings me to the point, if you want to go to dripping with taste, volunteer. They treat the volunteers far better than paying guests. They do their jobs for 2 hours then get to enjoy UNLIMITED drinks and food and get cool shirts that aren't available to buy to us regulars.   I was very unimpressed Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Brandy E.
reviews.description: I was really excited for this, but sadly disappointed. Paid $40 ticket, which included 10 food tasting tickets and 6 wine tasting tickets. Get there and see that almost every vendor is charging 2-5 tickets for food tasting and the wine tastings are  only 1 oz pours. What??! What did my $40 pay for?? A couple sample size appetizers and a few gargle-worth 's wine samples! Furthermore, it was inside and stifling!! I'd much rather pay a little more and get unlimited tastings, at least I'd feel like I got my money's worth. Sorry Dripping, won't be back. Huge disappointment.

reviews.author: Chris T.
reviews.description: They did a good job this year except for signage. There was a huge lack thereof at the back entrance where they were having everyone park when I arrived.  Everyone parking had no idea where to go. Other than that, the new Ranch/event center is nice. There were lots of vendors and lots to choose from. The tickets were more than enough to try things and the staff were friendly. Dripping Springs is a gorgeous city that should be visited by all.

reviews.author: Holmes S.
reviews.description: A piss poor event.   It was raining when we arrived, I know that no one can help that, but we were one of the first to arrive and we directed to park at the back end of a mud field. Instead of filling up the lot nearest the event, we had to walk though a water logged muddy field.   Then the signing up volunteers, one of the online register volunteers, was the rudest person I have met in a long time. She reminded me of one of the Orks from Lord of the Rings.   So you get 10 food tickets and 6 drink tickets. What you fail to learn until you have paid ($50) is that 10 food tickets doesn't mean 10 small samples, all of the samples were multiple tickets. Essentially, your $50 gets you two tacos and the six drink tickets equal about one glass of wine.   A truly crap festival.

reviews.author: Charlene N.
