reviews.description: This year was my second year to attend the festival. I loved it. I did volunteer this year to help and I am glad I did. I saw more of what hard work goes into making it a success. I still had time to taste wine and food and work to help this year be more successful than the last. I had fun and really love this part of Texas. Perfect place and lot of hard work went into making this a fun day.  Good job all who make this happen!!!!

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: After reading the other reviews I felt that I had to write one myself. Just how many wine festivals have these people attended?!  I have attended literally dozens of wine festivals, mostly in California. Believe me that the Dripping with Taste Festival is, by far, the best value on the market. Spending $40 for the initial tickets is next to nothing compared to the analogous events in California. AND purchasing additional tickets for a buck each is very cheap compared to other such events.   I have attended the last two Dripping with Taste festivals and plan to continue to attend every year. I look forward to this event based on the quality of the event and the very, very low cost. Both years I have come away with the feeling that I got more than my money's worth and found several Texas wines to add to my wine cellar!

reviews.author: B L.
reviews.description: Went to this event for my birthday and...gee...what a rip.  Like the other person said its located at a huge agricultural pavilion for horse and gun shows.  I live in Drippings and saw this massive structure being erected.  Its quite the eye sore.  That'd be fine if it wasn't so expensive.  Worse, it is actually held in a tiny closed off indoor part of the complex that's maybe a 1/8th the size of the whole place.  Needless to say, it was over crowded, people packed in like sardines.  My family wanted to leave rather quickly because it just flat out sucked.  Some the vendors were generous some were stingy and acted like it was a chore to deal with you.  Stay away from this event.

reviews.author: Elizabeth N.
reviews.description: The last time I went to this event was several years ago and I was very disappointed with the venue and the offerings and had not gone back. I decided to try it again this year since it sounded like a great venue but I was very disappointed here as well. The place was nice and large but very hot and had a messy, red dirt floor. Really, I spent $40 on a cattle pen?  The wineries were nice but there were not enough food vendors and most were over-priced. My legs and feet were disgustingly dirty by the time we left. It also made me wonder how much of that dirt ended up on the food.  That's two out of two disappointments with that event and I will not be going back until a better location is used. If it happens a third time, well it will be third time and your out. There are plenty of nicer wine events around Texas that don't charge that much for entry and are much more fun.

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: We thoroughly enjoyed our day at Dripping With Taste. Having missed the event last year, we weren't sure what to expect at the new venue. Mother Nature decided that we needed some rain, and she was right! Though we were a little soggy when we arrived, that didn't dampen our spirits. We sampled food from most of the vendors, the quality was outstanding and we found everyone to be warm, friendly and knowledgable. As always, great wines, loved the beer garden, and glad to see the addition of spirits. The music added a nice ambience. We enjoyed our beer, wine and food sitting comfortably watching the shows. We had a wonderful day, we're looking forward to next year's Dripping With Taste. The Chamber should be very proud of this years event.

reviews.author: G C.
reviews.description: Definitely not worth your money. 50.00 per person with very little vendors for the money. 10 food tickets and 6 wine/spirit tickets. Filler vendors for example Sysco and HEB to make the place appear fuller. Don't do it.

reviews.author: Missy K.
reviews.description: Super fun!  Great vibe and great drinks.  Staff was friendly and helpful,  We saw a band when we went and had a great time.  Family friendly and dog friendly which was really cool.  Great place to enjoy summer nights.  We loved it!

reviews.author: Emiley O.
reviews.description: Super cute hidden gem. I have been meaning to make my way out here for a long time and I wish I would have come sooner. Friendly staff, beautiful grounds, and great live music.

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Love this place. They have live music too so check their calendar! Great relaxing vibe.  Great drinks, great staff, and tons of games to play with friends:) just wish they had paper straws. We loved Ashley the bartender on staff. Super friendly and made sure we loved our drink choices (all the drinks here are great).  Special note: They also rescued a baby cow named Moonshine who is like a little puppy- she loves some pets and will lick your hands a few chickens running around too.   Drink suggestions: great bloody Mary's! I also really like their passion fruit vodka!  Food: mmmk they have the best Mac and cheese! This is a must here. It's super smokey I loved it. They have lots of meat options too.  They have fans blowing water/misting you in the heat and twinkle lights everywhere.  Kid friendly? Yup, although I didn't see any when I went they gave a big play structure behind the car!  Parking on site

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem out on Hudson Bend. Catfish is distilling some of the best vodka anywhere, and his staff are mixing up cocktails that rival the trendiest places downtown. And this is all in a laid-back, dog-friendly, wear your comfy jeans, no pretension atmosphere. It's like hanging out in someone's backyard... if that someone had great live music, acrobats, and world class spirits.  And while all the drinks are amazing (you seriously can't go wrong), the Bloody Mary selections are out of this world.

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: What a fantastic venue!! So much open space, seating, fire pits, heaters, swings...great stage with live music... Delicious vodka cocktails served up by really fun bartenders...BBQ food truck on site. Dog-friendly, family-friendly...clean bathrooms. We can't wait to go back!!  (*Covid note - not many masks were worn, but there's plenty of space for social-distance and hand sanitizer placed on several tables)

reviews.author: Kimberly S.
reviews.description: My husband I spent the afternoon at Planet Rock Vodka Distillery and had an amazing time! We are visitors to Austin and Planet Rock was recommended by a local family last night at dinner, so wanting to experience local places rather than tourist spots, we decided to give it a try. It did not disappoint! I have to say that we enjoyed the BEST Bloody Mary we've ever had! Planet Rock's vodka is so smooth and with the added Bloody Mary mix combination and a piece of brisket, heaven! Service was excellent and the live music by Sharon Bourbonnais was very enjoyable also. I'm thinking we'll be back before heading home!

reviews.author: Josh B.
reviews.description: This place is an absolute knockout.   We went as a thing to do while staying nearby, and wow! We will go back just to hang out some more.   We got there for lunch time and to try a cocktail and eat BBQ as it's really near the local RV park. The vodka is delicious. They offer samples and have a broad selection of flavor profiles. We tried a good number of cocktails each of which was fantastic and flavorful. Jackie the bartender was wonderful to talk to and kept my wife ms drink full, my kids happy with mock tails and unsold me on a bottle of vodka, and a cinnamon vodka ( I hate cinnamon). Catfish, the master distiller came by the bar and had some awesome stories and insights into how Planet Rock became a thing.   If that's not enough to get you there for a taste, the BBQ truck does great food. Get the Texas Twinkie. The ribs were great as was the quesadilla and the stuffed potato but trust me, get yourself a Twinkie.   If you are anywhere nearby try this place. It's pet, child, and adult friendly. And they have live music. How can you go wrong?

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: This place had the feel of my backyard, with a great musician, food and of course vodka infused drinks. Highly recommend. Don't forget to pet the baby cow.

reviews.author: L.R. L.
reviews.description: Fun place to get the demonic alcohol that has served to drive me to ruination and lead directly to dissolution to my many human and extra terrestrial relationships.  The demon vodka is a terrible mistress that can weaken your soul, lead you astray and give you many hangovers. The prices of vice, in its many forms.  But I ask, are we to avoid the rich experience of human vice, or is this pursuing human vice that gives us meaning?  Good vodka enables the philosopher that resides in each of us.  Many adventures await us as the consequences of our choices.  Vodka is a choice. Choose wisely.

reviews.author: Kendall M.
reviews.description: This place is very disrespectful to its neighbors. We asked kindly for them to keep it at a respectful noice level and they did until around 10PM on a Thursday and they started blasting it.

reviews.author: Jacqueline L.
reviews.description: Such a cute find! We bring most of our out of town guests here. Live music on the weekend, friendly staff. Near Lake Travis. Only vodka is served here FYI!

reviews.author: Karen N.
reviews.description: Just discovered this jewel near home. Great drinks and food. Fantastic service and folks.  We'll be baxk soon. Love you Catfish and Jenna!!

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: Great bbq and some of the best infused vodka drinks I've ever had.  Music venue is the perfect size for a killer laid back Central Texas evening.  Here's my checklist for your afternoon- 1. Have a killer drink. 2. Have some killer bbq. 3. Say hi to Catfish, the master distiller. He's the one with the magnificent beard and the hearty laugh likely by the bar. 4. Pet a chicken (there are a few running around)  5. Say what's up to Moonshine, their mini zebu cow that thinks he's a dog.  Can be seen chasing squirrels or prancing around the grounds.  If you're looking for an afternoon to enjoy a perfect slice of some of the best things Central Texas has to offer, this is your spot.

reviews.author: Victoria I.
reviews.description: This is a casual venue with clean bathrooms - a total win! It really is a fantastic place were you can catch some live music. Plus, they have the best BLT infused vodka!

reviews.author: Sheldon B.
reviews.description: Owner and his wife were very entertaining and you can tell they really enjoy what they're doing.  Got a quick tour of the property and the distilling process Saturday morning.  Great product and fantastic mixed drinks, I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Rebecca K.
reviews.description: We had such a fun experience! The owners were endearing and gave a great tour of their operation. The painkiller is delicious!

reviews.author: Stephanie W.
reviews.description: This rum is the real deal!! It's incredibly smooth on it's own but also makes some fantastic tasting cocktails. The owners are extremely friendly...you can tell they have put their hearts and souls into their distillery and it shows! Also, if you ask, they will usually be able to give you a tour of the place which is a really neat experience in itself!   If you are not typically a rum drinker, this place may very well change your mind (definitely changed mine) :)  Highly Recommend!!!

reviews.author: Joseph R.
reviews.description: Round Mountain Distilling was a great surprise. I didn't expect to be able to speak to the distiller and on top get a private tour of the facilitates for me and my friends. It's a small operation but they make some great rum and know how to make great drinks. This was an awesome place to sit and have a few drinks with friends. Mike (the owner / distiller) was a great host and his brother-in-law (part-owner) was just as welcoming.

reviews.author: L.R. L.
reviews.description: Ok, after the COVID pandemic, Trump's departure and the Russian invasion of Ukraine, brothers and sisters, you and me, need a break.  This is THE place.  Great refreshment, great ambiance.    You and I owe having a this vineyard   Live is short, do not wait, go to this fine establishment NOW.

reviews.author: Suley Z.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful place! So peaceful and beautiful oak. They have cute dogs here which is a plus. Their wine selection was great. Our host was just great, got 6 tastings for 6. Good wines. Enjoyed every moment of it.

reviews.author: Priya K.
reviews.description: So glad we stumbled upon this beautiful winery while we were visiting the horseshoe Bay Area. Walked in on Sunday afternoon, they took us without reservations. Beautiful outdoor patio seating or you can sit inside. They have 2 tasting menus to choose from for $15 each. Hubby went for the bold reds. They don't have all white tasting but our amazing server let me taste all the sparkling wines which was so fun! The sparkling Chardonnay was my favorite. Hubby's favorite was independence and tandem.  They have charcuterie boards ($25)  or you can bring your own food. We got the charcuterie board and had a great selection of cheese.

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: I am working on a plan to visit all of the Hill Country wineries at some point. I purchased the Christmas Wine Passport to help me with this in December, and Spicewood was one of the vineyards I passed through. The experience was good. The facilities were beautiful, and it was a peaceful place to chill and relax. I got there shortly after opening, and there was only one other couple there, so I was able to get my tastings quickly and easily. The wines were good, especially their dry sparkling, but I was not moved to come home with anything. The selection I was offered was more heavy on bolder reds, and as a matter of preference I would rather have a good mixutre of reds and whites. Nevertheless, this wouldn't be a place I'd cross off my list. Their tempranillos were quite tasty, and I did like their dry sparkling wine.

reviews.author: Joshua H.
reviews.description: GF and I both came in at 1pm on a Saturday afternoon via a prior RSVP to meet Ron Yates himself and do a full tasting experience with him as our server. This experience was amazing!  The indoor tasting room is large and open, welcoming and chill. Adorned with many award-winning wines of theirs that number beyond what I could count.   We got front-of-house seats together and begin our tasting journey through several whites and reds and sparkling wines. After what had to be 10-12 wines, we honed our picks down to the 'cabernet claret' for my GF and the 'tandem' red for me. However, not one of the wines we tried did we both truly feel we hated or disliked. Normally 1-2 are an easy pass but frankly, every wine we had was very good. My GF prefers sweeter wines across the board so the fact that nearly every wine she had still pleased her was saying something.  Ron was a top-notch host and server for us. His passion and love for wine is all but very clear in his conviction to his craft, knowledge of wine science and methodology, history of the business origins, name creations and labels to the wine bottles... all of it is an adventure with him as the animated storyteller of his wines and how the grapy goodness in the bottle got there and what you can expect to experience when it hits your lips.  I have to mention that they host an annual chili cook-off event every last Saturday of Feb with live music, 15+ chili contenders, and wine tasting all day long. It's their most successful event to date each year. When he spoke of that I made plans to be there for that for sure!  Ron and the team have a solid handle on this wine thing that is for darn sure! We only barely looked over the vineyard grounds so next time we come back, its gonna be charcuterie board, wine and time out in the vines for sure!

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Upon arrival at this gem a couple years ago, we had our doubts. The few Texas wines we had tried were subpar in our view. Spicewood's offerings opened a whole new chapter in our wine lifestyle upon completing that first visit.  When we first entered their tasting room, we noticed a plethora of wine award medallions on display. Being a volunteer on the Houston Rodeo, I was especially pleased to see many Rodeo Houston awards. But that wasn't all - Spicewood has awards from wine contests all around the country! Hmmmmm...  As we proceeded through our tasting, we were immediately impressed. Texas wine? This good? Yes, indeed! So good, in fact, that I joined their wine club without hesitation and remain a member to this day.   We visited again yesterday and enjoyed complimentary tastings of six nice wines and picked up our wine club orders from the past couple of quarters. We sat on their patio overlooking the vineyard and remarked how we are so happy to have found this spot. Oh, and the people working here are gracious and genuinely friendly.  Spicewood is a tad off the beaten path, but definitely worth the trek.

reviews.author: Mop P.
reviews.description: Out of the way a bit but worth it. Staff treats each guest like their experience is important. We came out on a Sunday morning got a couple of tables for our family and did the $15 tasting--6 pours but all around 14% Alcohol. Most are only sold on site from what I heard.  Great for families. Nice slow pace; bring whatever food you want they welcome it.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: I've visited many Texas Hill Country vineyards and this place was just okay. Sure, the tasting is cheap but the wine was nothing to leave me desiring more. Atmosphere and scenery itself was also nothing to boast about. Sorry, not for me. Pass.

reviews.author: A E.
reviews.description: As long time Spicewood Vineyard members we always enjoy our trips to the vineyard On this visit we brought our two sons and his family for a picnic at the vineyard. Of course things were a little different with Covid going on but everything was spaced out and carefully planned out for everyone's safety. When we arrived Ron was in the porch helping the guests with their wine selections. He is always very nice and makes everyone feel at home. It's always nice when the owner with everything he has to do remembers your names. After our picnic we got to sit in the Wine Cellar which was awesome. Highly recommend visiting, enjoying the scenery and trying out all the great tasting wines.   Hats off to Ron and Crew!   Adrian and Cyndi

reviews.author: Jim F.
reviews.description: This premier Texas Vineyard has been around for 20 years now. Their customer service is excellent and their wines are some of the best in Texas.

reviews.author: Michae A.
reviews.description: This review is based on their $15 tasting menu which is a great deal for 7 wines.   We love wine and enjoy going to new areas to try tastings so was really excited to try this place based on their reviews but my husband and I were sadly disappointed.   I will say however that they do have an option for an estate tasting that goes for $30 which could be amazing but we decided to pass on it.

reviews.author: Layle M.
reviews.description: Hmm...it has taken me over a week because I hate to say something bad about someone's business. Last Monday we stopped here after a fantastic visit to Marble Falls. We felt...tolerated...at best. We were met by 3 huge dogs who barked incessantly upon our arrival and throughout the visit. When the host finally came out he didn't offer up options for the tastings like we've experienced at other wineries. I'm pretty clear on what I like and had some ideas of wines I'd like to try with the intent of buying enough bottles to make a case of assorted bottles upon departing. The owner, who has great reviews on Yelp, either wasn't there or was busy. We didn't see this person. But we pushed through the tasting, cut it a bit short, and left much, much sooner than we'd ever imagined we would. My intuition upon arrival was to just leave. We should have done that.  This is our experience. And it just wasn't pleasant. We were the only guests yet felt we were in the way.  Hopefully, for others, their visits will be more aligned with this place's other more positive reviews.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: I was pleasantly surprised by Spicewood Vineyards.  Spicewood was originally founded by the Manigolds.  Their vision was to make wine only from estate grown grapes. They were smart when they planted their vineyard.  They analyzed the soil and only planted grape varieties that would thrive in their soil.  Nine of the original 17 acres planted by the Manigolds are still producing fruit. For Texas that means something. That means wine sourced from grapes growing on vines that are now 24 plus years old.  Ron Yates took over from the Manigolds and is now the owner of Spicewood, and with wine maker Todd Crowell is making some good Texas sourced wines.  They now have thirty two acres planted on site, and partner with other Texas grape growers.    I like that the tasting room is a bit off the common path. That means it is away from the hustle and bustle of other Hill Country wineries.  The tasting room is spacious.  It has a homey lodge like feeling that is very inviting. They also have a beautiful tree shaded outdoor space.    The staff here are like family. They are knowledgeable and friendly.  I tasted through a selection of their vast options available. I found them to be well balanced.  Surprisingly I liked their Sauvignon blanc along with other of their wines.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: We love this place. Wine and service is always good. Pretty awesome place to hang out for an afternoon. They have live music sometimes also

reviews.author: Lance M.
reviews.description: My experience was a 4-5 like many of those you will see here. However, our lovely day was ruined when one of the resident dogs or a customer's dog charged us aggressively while I was walking with my 10 month old baby in my arms. I cannot be sure if it was a resident dog or a guest's dog, but it was one of the gray colored Blue Lacey's).  Regardless, the dog was unprovoked by us. I had to hand my baby to my wife while I tried to protect them from this aggressive dog, hair bristled up and darting in at me aggressively as if to bite. Luckily it didn't bite us. The dogs owner chastised me for reacting strongly in defense of my wife and baby, which really frustrated me. We immediately left and I will not be returning. I wanted to post this in case a child is attacked by a dog on their premises in the future. It is documented and the owners have been informed that their aggressive dog or lack of leash laws are creating a liability and awful experience.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: I'm badly remiss in not posting a positive review for almost a year; what's more this is one of my personal favorite wineries in Texas Hill Country.  It's time I corrected this.   Spicewood has one of my personal favorite tasting rooms; while on the inside it's nothing special, the outside grounds and seating mimic an upscale, modern country house that I could see myself living in (*cough cough* once I win the lottery *cough cough*).  There's also a cool little stream they have running through the place so you can hear the sound of running or falling water when you sit to have a sip.  Nice touch.  Spicewood's won a bunch of awards for various wines but the two standouts IMO are their 2013 Syrah and their Riesling, which has a fruity taste and a magnificent green-apple crisp bouquet.  Note: As of May 2016, their site does not show the Riesling for sale, so I'd call ahead if you want to taste it.  As an added bonus, it's only 10 minutes away from It's All Good and Opie's, both of whom have some of my favorite BBQ outside the Austin area.

reviews.author: Sherry W.
reviews.description: This is better wine and value compared to Stone house winery.  It is $10 for seven tastings and only one wine was not from Texas. They have indoor and outdoor seating. There is no view at this vineyard. Staff is friendly. There was a friendly house dog wandering around.  They have t shirts for sale.

reviews.author: Jenn M.
reviews.description: I only put a one because it isn't there anymore. We drove 20 minutes to it and it was closed, I'm assuming. Darn.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: The Good Guy. Wow. It's an excellent red wine. It's smooth and tasty. It's not cheap. It's $42. I couldn't care less. I'll pay for wine as long as it's delicious and this one is fabulous. I like the patio outside. You can bring your dog and  kids if you'd like. The ambience inside and out is relaxing and fun. It's an excellent place to chill out with loved ones. I'll be back.

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: This vineyard has a broad range of varietals for producing their many wines.  Some are very surprising like their Tempranillo Rose, Mourvedra, Cab, and Pinot.   Since they seemed to blend grapes from outside of Texas with estate, gives their wines a different character than most I've tasted from Calif and Washington for the same grape varietal.    For non-wine items to consider, the staff is super friendly and knowledgeable, dog friendly, indoor and outdoor seating with a nice babbling brook adjacent.   They do have an event facility and would make a nice venue for any type of occasion.  They have a hearty cheese plate that won't disappoint.  I would not use the spicy cheese however.

reviews.author: Susan B.
reviews.description: We did a private wine tour for my daughters 30th birthday and had a wonderful time.  Winding Road was accommodating and made excellent picks and recommendations for us.  They planned out all the logistics and kept us on track.  I would highly recommend this company!

reviews.author: Tammy B.
reviews.description: Jaston was so cheerful, professional, polite, knowledgeable and fun!! Katie put together a fabulous charcuterie tray that was such a nice touch mid tour!! We will definitely book another tour when back in the area!!

reviews.author: Maria D.
reviews.description: This was such a wonderful experience ! My second time coming . Our driver Austin is amazing I gotta give him "kudos " for being so patient with the crowds aNF being so graceful. The owners are amazing as well .  They are always truing to make things right if you feel a slight bit unhappy.  The tours were well worth it.  Every time I go I'm never disappointed. The  service is impeccable. There are three stops very rewarding and very well thought out and put together and the winery stops are spread out Enough to enjoy each place .

reviews.author: Thaddeus B.
reviews.description: This was a great experience, can't imagine touring with anyone else in the Hill Country.  Katie and Jaston extended every effort to fit everyone's plans together and were great communicating the plans and ensuring everyone was happy.  Done tours previously, but not had as much fun as this trip.  They have access to the good and interesting vineyards, in an area where new places pop up daily it seems.  The bus was comfortable, the ride was smooth, and the mood was great.  They have earned our business.

reviews.author: Leticia E.
reviews.description: Had a great time in Fredericksburg! The complimentary personal charcuterie tray was a very nice addition to the tour. The Winding Road bus is nice, clean, and well prepared for any weather (blankets, umbrellas, and water). I highly recommend Winding Road Wine Tours, and I will definitely be using their services again.

reviews.author: Kathy W.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time with Jaston on the wine tour. Katie was integral in helping plan our event. She even made a guest appearance at the end of trip. We loved every minute of it. Thanks for helping us put together the perfect Hill Country Wine Tour. We look forward to many more.

reviews.author: Becky D.
reviews.description: Just had an amazing wine tour with Jaston and Winding Road Wine Tours! Very accommodating, took all the pictures we asked and was very knowledgeable. Would recommend to anyone wanting to spend the day in wine country!

reviews.author: Katie O.
reviews.description: BEST WINE TOUR EVER! Billy is so acccomodating and thoughtful. The wineries that were on the tour had amazing wine and atmospheres. Most certainly  would tour with them again!

reviews.author: Adam S.
reviews.description: My wife and I took this tour and really enjoyed it. A relaxing afternoon in the hill country tasting delicious wines. Billy was a wonderful tour guide.

reviews.author: Jerry S.
reviews.description: Absolutely great trip!  Visited 3 vineyards and all 3 were phenomenal!  Billy with WR tours was a wonderful host!  100% recommend Winding Road Wine Tours!  His bus is very comfortable and very roomy!  And he knows a great deal about the wines!!  Will definitely come back to Wimberley and use Winding Road!!!!!!

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: Awesome day and Billy was a great  driver and organized everything perfectly.  We would love to do this again!!

reviews.author: Lori C.
reviews.description: We had a great time today with Billy.  A great time with friends for a bachelorette party. Wonderful safe driving, good food and wine!

reviews.author: Don M.
reviews.description: Looking to experience great Hill Country wines and barbecue - we had both taking Winding Road Wine Tours Salt Lick Sunday Wine Tour.  The tour picked us up in Gruene in a new luxury bus at 10:30. We were greeted by the tour owner Billy Martin.  The bus was very comfortable with a u shaped seating arrangement and a table in the aisle.  Should seat around 12 people comfortably. The bus has a great sound system that is Bluetooth enabled - Billy played whatever we wanted from sources such as Pandora and Napster music service. First stop was Driftwood Estate Winery. Driftwood has perhaps the best winery views in the Hill Country.  I really enjoyed the reds and came away with a bottle of Longhorn Red to enjoy at our next stop Salt Lick Barbecue. Yes, Salt Lick is byob. It was beginning to rain and Billy dropped us off near the check in stand. He's thought of his customer's needs providing us large golf umbrellas. It was busy with people waiting to be seated. However, he got us seated right away. Our final two wineries were Fall Creek right across the street from Salt Lick and then Wimberley Valley Winery. Fall Creek has solid wines and the service for our group was outstanding. Wimberley Valley Winery was an unexpected pleasure. Their tasting room is roomy and comfortable with plenty room at the tasting bars and a comfortable seating area facing a large stone fireplace. They have a variety of wines bottled on site along with other wines from around the world. The grounds were spectacular with numerous large shaded decks to enjoy a glass or bottle as you wrap up your tour.  What a great Sunday drinking Texas wines, eating Texas barbecue and meeting new friends!

reviews.author: Paula B.
reviews.description: This is a wonderful wine tour with Billy in the Texas Hill Country. Billy was on time, friendly and very knowledgeable! There were 7 of us on a family vacation trip and we wanted to have a fun but classy wine tour where we got our money's worth and then some. As a new resident to the area, it's important for me to know what high quality tour guides are available. Well, Winding Road Hill Country Wine Tours with Billy is definitely the way to go, folks.

reviews.author: Jaimie M.
reviews.description: Absolutely 5 star experience! Billy was a great host and we all had a blast celebrating our friend's bachelorette party. The bus is extremely accommodating with a great sound system, places for drinks and COLD a/c! (Which was great for the warm weather outside). We had an absolute blast! Thank you so much for taking such great care of us!

reviews.author: Lisa S.
reviews.description: We were so impressed with our whole wine tour experience from start to finish that we booked a brewery tour the following day! Billy really did his homework! We highly recommend Winding Road Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Wow - Not sure I can adequately articulate what a great tour we had.  The bus/coach is beautiful, immaculate and has a great sound system.  The vineyards selected by Billy are great - wonderful grounds and fantastic wines.  Billy (great guy) is well known at the vineyards and ensures you get great service and a great spot at the tasting bar.  The charcuterie board for lunch in conjunction with a tasting in a private room was very special.  All-in- all just a wonderful experience.  Highly recommend this tour.  I understand he also conducts craft beer and spirits tours (next time)

reviews.author: Terri P.
reviews.description: Clint was a total professional and a wonderful driver.  At our first stop he ordered a different vehicle so everyone felt more comfortable.  What a surprise when he told us!  Didn't see that coming.  Three great tastings with good friends.  Discovered some very nice 2015 Texas wines.  The grapes have matured immensely since 2008 and glad to finally enjoy some good Texas wines.   Can't recommend this company any lower than *****!  Thank you Discovery Wine Tours for a memorable afternoon.

reviews.author: Carlin L.
reviews.description: Used Discover Texas Wine Tours for a 30th birthday. John, our driver, was wonderful. He called me a couple of days before to introduce himself and to confirm the pickup details. He also called me the day of and was on time. He made sure we were settled at each location and made it a great experience. Felt very safe - John wore a mask the whole time. Also, Kathie helped plan the itinerary. She's familiar with the wineries and distilleries in the area, and was very friendly. Couldn't recommend them more!

reviews.author: Lori M.
reviews.description: A.wonderdul time, from reservation phone call to driving away from the limo.once the 6.5 hour tour ended.  John was our driver...we knew from the get-go we were in good hands.  Discover Wine chose the wineries for us and all were unique, fun and obviously tasty (as was the restaurant they selected).  We'll be back!

reviews.author: Lynlee S.
reviews.description: Our driver John was amazing!!! Very sweet and professional. Gave excellent service and ensured my group of 2 had a great time at each location we choose. Booking with the owner Kathy was easy and she ensured the whole private tour experience was exactly what we wanted. Could not have had a better time!!! John the drive wore a mask the whole time and gave us a detailed tour of town while he drove! Excellent and safe driver. Perfect perfect perfect! Thank you!! If you want an intimate experience with lots of sights and great food and drink, chose this company to take you!!!!!

reviews.author: Lindsey H.
reviews.description: I was so impressed with this tour the first time we booked that I had to book it for another party! Well, this time it wasn't as impressive. I don't know if the business has just gotten bigger than the owners can handle but communication was subpar. It took several calls and emails to get answers sometimes.   At our first tour, Kathie took tons of photos and would pose us at the wineries. This tour, we had to prompt her. It was a cloudy day so not the best for outdoor pics but I was disappointed we took most of them ourselves or had to ask her to take the pictures.   Our tour was April 11, it is now almost 2 mths later I haven't received the few pictures we took. I emailed twice and have finally heard back that the SD is apparently not working. I'm not sure why I had to email to find this out, seems like this info should have been divulged as soon as the problem presented itself.   I hate to downgrade the star review but my second time with this company just wasn't as epic as the initial tour I took with them. The wineries all seem to love this company though.

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: I would recommend you take your money elsewhere. The owner Cathy is the rudest person to deal with  and doesn't know manners or customer service. She is unprofessional and just straight out rude. Highly suggest on another place to go to.

reviews.author: Barbara H.
reviews.description: We had a small group of three, but did it right with a Discover Texas Wine Tour limousine. DTWT was very accommodating, scheduled the wineries we wanted to see, ordered the lunches, and then confirmed our selections a couple of days prior to our tour. At the last minute after visiting with a couple in our third stop, we changed our fourth stop to a different winery. Jason (our driver) was happy to accomodate us. My only regret is that we didn't choose a few wineries a little further out of town, so we could spend more time in the limo listening to our Willie Nelson songs. Jason was awesome, and I highly recommend this tour.

reviews.author: Vicki C.
reviews.description: We started researching half-day wine tours for my BFF's bachelorette party several months in advance and chose this company because of its good reviews and cancellation policy (full refund up to 7 days in advance).   First, the bad news. The booking process is way more arduous than it should be. My initial discussion about the tour plans happened over the phone, so I asked for a written, e-mail confirmation of what we had discussed - specifically how the deposit and refund policies work. It took me more than three weeks to get that first e-mail confirmation of our booking and deposit payment. I then went back and forth, back and forth, back and forth with the company, hammering out the details, like setting a pickup location and our choices for the winery stops. Many times, three weeks would pass and I'd have to make multiple attempts before I would get a response to my e-mails. Sometimes, the responses would be incomplete and we'd repeat the process of trying to get information confirmed. Seriously a pain for an experience that costs $129 per person.   Now, the good news. The online payment portal for each attendee was a breeze to use and eliminated the need to handle money all through one person. As for the actual tour itself, we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our driver, Bobby, was on time and wonderful on the day of the tour. He was funny and polite and had good knowledge of the area. Also, very importantly, he was a good and safe driver! The Mercedes bus we took was very clean and spacious, and they provided water, cups and napkins. They also allowed us to bring our own food onto the bus. The three wineries we visited, Driftwood Estate, Duchman and Fall Creek, were all accommodating and fun. The views were lovely and we never felt rushed and made it back on time. It was raining when we got back to our car, and Bobby was so nice and helped us get our stuff back into our car in the pouring rain.   All in all, despite a wonderful wine tour, I'm not sure I would recommend this company, only because I spent way too much time hounding them throughout the booking process. While the wine was excellent, I NEEDED to drink after dealing with their horrible communication. Discover Texas Wines should strongly consider re-evaluating their communication practices and hire more people to keep up with the demand for their service. It's the only way they will stay competitive in the long-run!

reviews.author: Tara K.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience with Discover Texas Wine. Kathie was wonderful to coordinate with, and took care of all our tour requests. Howard was a great driver and had fun music. Lunches were very tasty. Would definitely recommend for any bachelorette party.

reviews.author: Abby S.
reviews.description: We had the BEST time today on a wine tour for a bachelorette!! "Magic Mike" was the best driver and so much fun. Very reasonable price for the amount of time we spent, and an awesome car. Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: We booked a wine tour to Dripping Springs for my bachelorette party. It was so great! Our driver, Roy, is what made it all so wonderful! I would highly recommend him!! He took lots of photos for us and kept us cool with cups of water.  We went to Driftwood Estate (beautiful views and grounds), Duchman family winery (beautiful Tuscan architecture), and Driftwood (had the best wines!). We did a half day and it was the perfect amount of time.   Couldn't have been any better! Thanks Roy!!!

reviews.author: Cyn H.
reviews.description: Had a great time on my stretch limo wine tour.  Hawk's Shadow was the favorite of the wineries we visited.  Bobby was our driver. Polite and helpful and knew to not be too chatty. Made our wine tour effortless and fun. An event to remember!

reviews.author: Carly J.
reviews.description: Wonderful private winery tour with Amanda.  So much fun!  Amanda was awesome and knowledgeable.  We had a great time!

reviews.author: Calley N.
reviews.description: We used this company for  a bachelorette weekend the company was extremely hard to work with. Communication with the company was extremely difficult. However, Mike (magic mike) completely turned a ruined weekend around. He was so nice and fun he sang to us and played guitar. I have never met a more generous and kind person. It might take you sending 3 emails to get responses from the company but definitely use Mike for your tour!

reviews.author: Kate E.
reviews.description: First off our driver, Roy, was the absolute best! He picked us up on time, was incredibly friendly, and funny even though we were a bachelorette party and knowing the possibility of it getting crazy with 7 girls. Seriously, request Roy. He made the trip a blast. There was cold water for us in the bus. Oh did I mention it's a Mercedes bus? Super nice! An AUX cable was available to play our own music too. The selection of wineries was amazing, perfect mixture between red and whites/dry and sweet, so every one of us could have something tasty. The drive was beautiful and not too far out of Austin. Overall, I am very impressed with this tour and the wonderful employees. Would definitely go again.

reviews.author: Jessica J.
reviews.description: I booked a Discover Texas Wine Tour last weekend for a Bachelorette Party. It was amazing! We had such a great time despite the somewhat unpleasant weather. Noel was so great and answered any questions we had before the tour. He was so accommodating and recommended some great wineries to us! I would definitely book with them again and recommend them to friends!!

reviews.author: Becca R.
reviews.description: Held an event with Discover Texas Wine Tour for my business and wanted to thank them again for a wonderful day. We booked this as part of a fundraiser/auction and it was such a success. The bus was wonderful, the driver was great and everything was timed perfectly. Highly recommend Discover Texas Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Dominique S.
reviews.description: Absolutely do not recommend using this company. I made the reservation back in January, gave my card for deposit and was told I'd be emailed a link for everyone to pay. Over the next two months I called and emailed asking about the link so my friends could pay their part and I was repeatedly told they were having issues. Okay fine, no big deal- I also emailed again saying we can just pay the day of if the link wasnt working and never received a response. The day before our tour, as I was driving from Dallas to Fredericksburg I get a call from Some guy at the company and he seemed very annoyed with me saying no one had paid yet. Um.. I'm sorry I didn't realize you finally sent it after months of my asking. (He had sent it the day before calling me to tell me no one had paid) The vehicle I requested was not the one that showed up. The driver Julia was late bc she did not write the address down correctly. We also had 3 girls cancel last minute, so we were down to 5 instead of 8. Considering there minimum is 5 I wasn't expecting that to be a problem but Julia felt the need to bring it up multiple Times as if it caused some inconvenience for her. Rude people, horrible communication.

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our full day tour! None of our group had been to the Texas wine trail, and our Driver Roy was absolutely spot on picking our 4 stops. Roy was a true gentleman and really took good care of our group all day long, making this a truly great experience. Noel was very helpful in booking us, even with a last minute addition to our party. I will be using these guys again in the future, and would recommend anyone who is looking for a first time trip to do the same.

reviews.author: Holly T.
reviews.description: What a fantastic time! Organizing a full day wine tour for 50 people in the Texas Hill Country may not sound like an easy task, but Noel at Discover Texas Wine Tours made it smooth and most importantly, unforgettable. His main goal is to make sure everyone is comfortable and has a good time! Most companies were not able to host a group this size, but Noel made it happen. He made sure our bus was the best he could find, worked to have a lunch catered for us at one of the stops, set up private tastings with many of the wineries to accommodate a group our size, even stopped to let one of the guys who didn't drink wine buy some beer. I can't say enough good things about Noel and how hard he worked for our group. I highly recommend him and look forward to another tour with him soon!!

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Highly, highly, highly recommend!  Planning to visit four wineries on a Sunday afternoon, I hired Vintage Car Service so we wouldn't have to worry about becoming safety hazards on the road. Prior to our visit, Josh offered advice on where to go. Lezli picked us up at our BandB right on schedule. We were impressed with her knowledge of the area and its wineries. She helped us rearrange our schedule a bit when our visit at one winery went longer than planned (that's on me - I tried to cram too much into an afternoon).  THIS is the way to do a wine tour. We will be regular customers when we return to Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Jo Y.
reviews.description: Lezli and Josh gave the best service! Communication is great - prompt responses. This was our first time uses a car service in Fredericksburg and we had an amazing experience. They had suggested stops prior to the day and got an idea of our plans but they were totally flexible too, even offering to call ahead to a winery to see how busy they were in the moment. We had 6 people and we had plenty of room in a comfy and spotless car. Josh was johnny on the spot, carrying all our wine bags and more. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Holley M.
reviews.description: My mom and I went to Fredericksburg for a fall getaway. I was going to hire a shuttle tour of wineries. I discovered Vintage on Yelp. I'm so glad I did.   1) personalized service. Josh took us to 4 wineries personalized to our tastes. Your tour is likely going to be nothing like ours. If you want a distillery tour they can do that too.   2) new, clean vehicle.  My mom has mobility issues. Getting in and out of a shuttle isn't the easiest. We could relax in this SUV and she had no issues getting out of it.   3) private service. Josh was our photographer, tour guide and even purse holder for the day. He knows a lot about wine! At the end of our tour he brought in all of our wine! We could do things at our own puce.   4) the price was comparable to other services. The price does not include tastings but that is ok. Sometimes you just want a glass or two.   Overall, I would highly recommend this service!

reviews.author: Susan M F.
reviews.description: Josh was a great tour guide, picture taker, wine enthusiast and all around nice guy.  We thoroughly enjoyed our day with him and the places we visited.  They can work with just about anything you may want to do and that's nice to know.  It's worth every penny to not have to stare at a GPS while trying to take in the sights and if you are doing the wine/distillery tasting, which we did. We will use them every time we go to Fredricksburg.

reviews.author: Alyssa S.
reviews.description: This was the perfect service for a weekend get away with the girls! A safe alternative to driving around to wineries and our driver knew the best kept secrets of Fredericksburg. They were on time, polite, fun, and knew how to make a day of wine tasting feel like a 5 star experience!

reviews.author: Rachel V.
reviews.description: Great value, great service! The driver was so friendly and helpful, with water, coolers, good tips on wineries, and keeping us on schedule!

reviews.author: Elise L.
reviews.description: We had an absolutely amazing experience with Vintage Car Service. Lezli helped us arrange tastings at amazing wineries (Signor and French Connection), and Dena, our driver, made sure our entire day was seamless and super fun! She even gave outstanding recommendations for things to do the next day at our trip. We could not recommend this company enough and encourage you to book with them when your in town!

reviews.author: Jen V.
reviews.description: Josh and Vintage Car were absolutely the best way to tour wineries in Fredericksburg! Josh is polite, knowledgeable about the area and wines, prompt, and super easy to get along with. The car he drove was really nice and clean. He took some great pics of us during the tour, both staged and candid. Plus it was raining when we started, and he had umbrellas and did all he could to make it comfortable for us. I couldn't recommend this service enough. We'll def hire him again and rec to everyone. Thanks, Josh!!

reviews.author: Mitra C.
reviews.description: This was the best decision I could have made for a wine tour.  Lezli was so helpful and gave me tons of ideas for our itinerary.  Josh was the best driver.  So kind and personable.  He kept my mom and I on our schedule but never made it feel like we were being rushed.  Also, if we were enjoying more time at one place, he called to rearrange our other tasting times.  He had snack and water in the car.  The best part is we didn't have to worry about anything, which was a huge relief when you're suppose to drive from place to place AFTER drinking wine.  I'm going to plan another trip in a couple months with my husband and I will definitely call them again.

reviews.author: Aly A.
reviews.description: Highly recommend Vintage Car Service. Josh is very knowledgeable about wine and the best places to enjoy a good time in Fredricksburg!

reviews.author: Eric W.
reviews.description: We didn't want to drive ourselves to the wineries, and didn't want to take the bus with a strict itinerary. Glad we heard about this new service. The driver took us to the few wineries we wanted to try but also suggested a couple of wineries we weren't aware of that were awesome! Very clean, new SUV, knowledgeable and friendly driver. Would use then again.

reviews.author: Nick A.
reviews.description: My wife and I celebrated our "mini-moon" in Fredericksburg.  We were lucky enough to have Vintage Car Service gifted to us by a family member.  Vintage Car Service made our mini-moon such a special experience.  We had enough time to explore four Vineyards, three of which were recommended by Josh.  Josh was a great driver, knowledgeable of Texas wine, and was a pleasure meeting.  The Volkswagen Atlas was very comfortable and a great ride.  We highly recommend Vintage Car Service if you are in Fredericksburg for any occasion and want to explore some new Vineyards without worrying about driving.

reviews.author: Matt N.
reviews.description: Had a spectacular time! This team was Great! Beautiful vehicles, impeccably clean, and friendly drivers got our group safely from winery to winery (and even provided night time transportation to Luckenbach). The drivers were flexible with our group and provided some custom solutions for a safe and fun weekend!   Awesome and friend drivers. Would definitely use again and recommend to others!

reviews.author: Lindsay F.
reviews.description: THIS IS A MUST WHEN WINE'ING IN FREDERICKSBURG!!! Everything from our amazing chauffeur, Josh, to the spacious and clean car, to the hidden gem wineries he shared with us, and the beyond polite and gentleman service of carrying our purchases to the car. This made our trip and we are already planning to use these services in the near future. Thank you so much for everything. Even the added professional photos which were a bonus surprise! Made us feel Famous in Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Sonia N Casey G.
reviews.description: What a great day today with Josh!!  Thanks for making our day memorable and easy going.  We will definitely call you again!!!

reviews.author: Dan T.
reviews.description: Josh provided:  Great customer service.  Excellent knowledge of the wine country.  Feeling of comfort and confidence in driving skill and safety.

reviews.author: Chase C.
reviews.description: My wife and I used Vintage Car Service for my wife's birthday.  We had Josh as our driver and we had an absolute blast. We were picked up on time and the car was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. Josh met all of our demands and had some awesome suggestions of vineyards to try based on our tastes.  We ended up changing our schedule to fit in one of his suggestions and had an amazing time.  Overall, the experience was well worth the price and was great.  We will definitely be booking Vintage Car Service in the future, it is the best way to enjoy the wineries and not worry about drinking and driving.

reviews.author: Ziara H.
reviews.description: We had the best time on our wine tour with Josh! It was super easy to make a reservation, we told Josh a few of the places we wanted to stop and he made reservations for us in advance. Josh picked us up on time from our Airbnb, the car was spotless and we made a few adjustments to our itinerary along the way which Josh was super helpful with! Snacks and waters were provided in the car, which came in very handy between the wine stops! Josh took pictures for us and even mailed us the most amazing large postcard with our pictures from the trip. Great attention to detail from start to end! Will definitely make a reservation with Vintage Car Service next time we're in Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Jorge U.
reviews.description: We had an awesome experience with Vintage Car Service! After a quick call to plan the trip out, Vintage took care of everything for us. They picked out some great tasting spots to suit the different tastes of everyone in our group. They called ahead and made reservations where needed and offered us lots of great tips along the way. Even with a little rain shower, our entire group had the best time and we felt like VIPs everywhere we went! Comfortable. Professional. Affordable. Worry-free. We can't wait to book our next Texas wine adventure with Vintage!

reviews.author: Brandon M.
reviews.description: We sent the kids with Grandma and headed out for some fun. Josh was our driver and he was awesome. Good people, great service, nice ride....I highly recommend !!

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours made my booking reservation easy and I'm a difficult customer. They worked with me on the wineries and Distillery the group chose to ensure that the time worked within our tour, so everyone could enjoy the tasting and lunch without feeling rushed. Austin Wine Tours also provided us with a great driver. I have to say our driver Charlie was awesome, he called before arriving, he was prompt and ensured we had everything before leaving the pickup spot. Charlie made our tour very comfortable, the ride to and from the wineries and Distillery was amazing. Charlie ensured that we were taken care of.  We will definitely be booking another tour with you folks and requesting Charlie.   Thank you again,  Laurie

reviews.author: Carli A.
reviews.description: 10/10 would recommend Austin Wine Tours! First off, booking and choosing our agenda was super easy and they even let me adjust the headcount when that changed. On the day of, I got a heads-up call to confirm the time and pickup location. We had a larger, rowdy group of gals on a bachelorette trip and our driver Song took SUCH good care of us! She immediately asked us what music we wanted to crank and encouraged all the "wooing" from the back of the van. She also offered to take pictures of us, scouted out the best locations for group photos and even took TONS of candid pics of us while we enjoyed the winery and distillery we went to. She helped with all of the logistics of checking in at each stop and making sure we were taken care of. She also let us make a pee stop on the way home...and overall she was just SUPER nice and was basically hyping us up the entire day, making sure the bride felt special and making sure we all had fun. By the end of the day we all felt like she was part of the crew. Thank you again Song!!

reviews.author: Laura R.
reviews.description: I booked a wine tour for my sisters bachelorette and we had such a great time! The wineries were beautiful and we were able to schedule a stop at the salt lick for our private tour. Kyle was the best tour guide ever!! He was very personable, took numerous pictures for us at each winery and made sure we were having fun! I would def. recommend if you are looking at different companies to pick Austin Wine Tours (ZWay Tours) since I called 5 others and they were the most accommodating with what we wanted for a private tour and their price beat most of the other ones too!  Would def. book them again and request Kyle!

reviews.author: Rakeba S.
reviews.description: Omg! We loved our experience with Austin Wine Tours! Our tour guide Kyle was amazing and made sure we had a great time. Kyle was on time and made sure we arrived safely to both our locations. Overall our experience was amazing and we will definitely book again.

reviews.author: Devin H.
reviews.description: The review that I left in regards to the services booked through Austin Wine Tours was in no way false. I will stand firm by what was written.   I even received a call back in May while on a business trip from the shuttle service company asking if we would pay the overtime for Hugo because AWT had not paid them yet. We even tipped Hugo an additional amount for his extra time spent with us.   The response just posted (almost 4 months later) is also extremely unprofessional and misleading. We were promised a great time for a bachelorette party and were let down. Plain and simple. Those employed by AWT that we spoke with were rude as well. Secondly, I never said that AWT hosted prom events/transportation. I was told that the company that is usually utilized was completely full (by Brad) and that prom happened to be a priority and the school bus that was sent was all they could get us even though we were promised a party bus.   At the end of the day we were completely dissatisfied with the services offered by AWT. Calling a client a bridezilla (who in fact actually never spoke to any AWT employee), claiming your company has gotten PTSD from our group and falsely accusing our group to be racist by saying we told "blackie to leave" is unprofessional and disrespectful amongst other things said in response to our reviews. All of those involved would be happy to discuss this event again in a professional manner since you mentioned that we were offered a full refund when that in fact was not true. We were offered maybe $350 (I could be wrong on this amount since we haven't heard/spoken to anyone from AWT for several months) in return if we removed our reviews.  As a company you should take responsibility instead of blaming others for your mistakes that way you can fix the problem and do better for future patrons. Especially since there has been no money refunded at this point.

reviews.author: Christopher Jon M.
reviews.description: We had a great time this past weekend with Austin Wine Tours. I initially booked online and didn't know what venues to go to at first but they recommended the ones that we ended up going to even though it was completely up to us where we wanted to go which I liked. We decided after to tastings to go eat at Salt Lick BBQ and the food was amazing and hit the spot in between tastings. After that we went to our final tasting at Fall Creek which was right across the street and the service there was great. It made our bachelorette party very fun and we didn't have to worry about anything other than having a good time which I liked.

reviews.author: Julie B.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours is one of the best limo tours to see the wine country we have been on to date!  They were not only flexible with our dates and our last-minute reservation, they even upgraded our package with no additional charge!  We were celebrating four birthdays and  wanted a girls night out  where no one had to drive. The limo driver was prompt and worked with us and our pick up and drop off times.  When one of us left the charger in the limo he even offered to drop it off... We Are definitely looking forward to using them in the near future!

reviews.author: Kelli C.
reviews.description: Had the absolute best time on our Bachelorette party!! Hill Country was so much fun to see and the wine made it even more enjoyable. Sara was very helpful with planning the itinerary and gave us exact times so we could keep track along the way, and the vehicle was exactly as described and in excellent condition! Myron was an excellent driver. You should definitely plan with Austin Wine Tours! Amazing service!!!

reviews.author: Blythe H.
reviews.description: If I could give this company a negative star review, I would!!! Completely unprofessional and was hung up on!! They sent an incorrect party bus for a bachelorette party, contracted out at last minute to another company (who were amazing), sent us to Deep eddys where we were turned away!!! Brad would NOT let me speak and kept interrupting me. The professionalism of this company was simply awful. And they still have not refunded anything from this trip!!! Disgusted and I will never recommend this company to anyone. Spend the extra money and go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Linda T.
reviews.description: Booking our wine excursion was stress free the moment Sara answered the phone! Sara was very informative and laid everything out, giving us a doable timeline for the afternoon we wanted. The itinerary we received gave us a good idea of how long to spend at each venue. There were only 4 people in our group, so we were able to do a very flexible hourly option, with appointments at the wineries.  Since we had less than 5 passengers, our tastings weren't included (informed that going in) however, that did not deter our experience... it was awesome! Buying a bottle of wine at each venue was very affordable when we split the cost among us.  George, our driver, was professional and friendly; and the limo experience was awesome! You might want to bring snacks just in case someone gets a bit tipsy, but most wineries offer food of some kind. Thanks Austin Wine Tours, for making me look like a champ with my high maintenance friends... I'll be back!

reviews.author: Karen O.
reviews.description: After leaving the previous review, the company finally contacted me and issued a full refund.

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: So first....let me say that our group totally dropped the ball on planning.  We reached out to Carla 3-4 weeks before but did not confirm until the week of the wine tour.   By the grace of the "wine" Gods, Carla could fit us in her schedule!  She is completely open to letting you choose your places or you can follow her lead!   She picked us up at our accommodations which were several miles outside of Fredricksburg.  We did introductions and she laid out the things that were already scheduled for the day.  On our way to the first winery, we decided to "reroute" the tour to hit some lesser known spots.  TBH, we were excited for Carla's recommendations.    Our first stop was Six Shooter because of their variety of dry wines, sweet wines and meads.  You have to try the Jalapeno shooter!!!  SO GOOD!   Second, we made our tour time at Real Ale and did a beer tasting. Third, she realized the majority of our groups like Whiskey, so we stopped at Andalusia Whiskey in Blanco!  This place met the needs of our entire group (even the non-whiskey drinker) and was by far the most unique stop of their day!  If you go here, try the Cherry Cola cocktail!   We stopped for lunch at Pecan Street Brewing in Johnson City, where we drank lots of water and had really great food.   Our last stop of the tour was Zero815 Winery which had a cool mix of wines and friendly staff.   At the end of the day, Carla made sure that we made it back to our accommodations safe and sound.  We had the very best time and she knows some of the coolest places that you might miss without her expertise.  She was extremely professional and very down to earth.  She was always around to help with recommendations or just to snap photos of the group!     We highly recommend doing a tour with Carla and Texas Wine and Spirit Tours!   You won't be disappointed!   We'll be booking with her again the next time we are in the area!

reviews.author: Alejandra R.
reviews.description: I scheduled 2 group tours with Texan wine tours with more than 6 weeks in advance. The first tour was CANCELLED THE VERY SAME DAY we were supposed to go to the wineries. I traveled with a group of friends from Houston just to go visit the wineries  They also cancelled the second tour that was scheduled 2 weeks later. Our  weekend plan got ruined thanks to their lack of professionalism.

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: I forgot to review this! But we did our tour with Carla in October and she was fantastic! Highly recommend.  Sending some people your way!

reviews.author: Haley H.
reviews.description: I cannot say enough good things about Carla and her touring company. Some girl friends and I came to Fredericksburg for a long weekend and did two back-to-back tours with her. The first tour on Friday was with another group and they had already decided to do wine so we were able to join in with them and had a blast touring the local wineries. She also took us to a local watering hole afterwards when we decided we all wanted to stay out for a bit longer. She was amazingly accommodating and super fun!! On Saturday we wanted to tour some distilleries and breweries and she helped us decide which ones were more along the atmosphere we were looking for. Carla is amazing and I can't recommend her enough!!

reviews.author: Stacey G.
reviews.description: I planned a bachelorette party for my best friend a few weeks ago. Leslee was amazing in setting up the perfect day for our group! She was always prompt in returning my emails and adjusting our itinerary to meet our needs. The weather wasn't the best the weekend of the tour, but Leslee made sure that we still had a fantastic time! I highly recommend D'vine Tours for a wonderful Hill Country experience!

reviews.author: Erin Y.
reviews.description: We had a blast! Leslee, the tour guide, is great. She knows the town and the people. The van is the nicest I've been in.

reviews.author: Megan B.
reviews.description: My best friend and sister planned a weekend bachelorette party for me complete with a wine and art tour. The weather was pretty bad that morning, so we started a little late, but the van that they have is really, really nice, clean, and spacious. She even has a little stool in case you need help getting into the van, and she helps everyone get in and get out. We went to three places around the Johnson City area. The first one was a quick tasting, the second one we learned A LOT about wine and got a lesson in how to properly drink wine, and at the third winery we got the most interesting history lesson about President Johnson and Lady Bird Johnson from the winemaker himself. Leslee personally knows the places and owners and was just the best tour guide. One of the places on the tour where we were supposed to also eat dinner at cancelled due to the weather, but Leslee was quick to find a different place for us to go to. She took us to a cute cafe in downtown Johnson City where we ate a ridiculously good dinner. We even went to Leslee and her husband's bar at the end of the day for one last drink and got a chance to meet her sweet daughter as well. I thoroughly enjoyed the tour with Leslee and highly recommend D'Vine Tours!

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: We had an amazing day with Clint. While we only reserved the private transportation, he walked us into each winter and made sure we were greeted and that we were part of his group. Everyone knew him!   He had so many tips and was so kind. I will be using his company again, hopefully have him as our driver for another girls weekend. I cannot say enough good things.   Leading up to this weekend I was researching several private transportation companies. One of them had hidden costs. Cellar Rat was very quick to answer my questions and seemed very straightforward with their pricing. That is why I booked with them and I'm really glad I made that choice.

reviews.author: Charles P.
reviews.description: We had a phenomenal time on the tour for our family trip (6 people). Cadye was really helpful getting everything all set up on the front end; Clint's phenomenal positive energy, incredible industry knowledge, and evident rapport with all of of the wineries/vintners made the trip incredibly enjoyable.  Can't imagine doing a wine tour with anyone else.

reviews.author: Megan W.
reviews.description: Just went on this wine tour for my first time in Fredericksburg this past weekend. 10/10! The service, the tour guide, the locations/ connections they have! Amazing! Would not pick any other wine tour!! Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Alison H.
reviews.description: I cannot say enough good things about Clint and Cayde and Rat Cellar Wine tours! If you're looking for options during the pandemic, contact them! Cayde was very informative, professional, and has been staying up-to-date with all the current laws with the changing issues in the pandemic. But the moment your tour starts, Clint takes away all your worries and concerns, and created a fun atmosphere filled with lots of knowledge and wine tasting! If you're looking for a sommelier who knows his stuff, Clint is your guy! If you want your sommelier to not be pretentious, again, Clint is your guy! I would highly recommend them to anyone who does not know Fredericksburg, and anyone from novice level to expert level of wine expertise. We made awesome memories thanks to Rat Cellar, and would use them again in a heartbeat!

reviews.author: Kate I.
reviews.description: Updated Review: We just celebrated our 2nd Anniversary and our 2nd trip out to Fredericksburg with Cellar Rat Wine Tours hosting our tastings. We love these guys more than ever after going out with Clem for a tour of William Chris, Pecan St Brewery, Hye Rum, and Pedernales.   Clem was a fantastic host for the day! With several years in the Industry and a passion for wine making, we received the red carpet experience! We once again had a great time touring and learning from an expert. They will tell you as much, or as little, as you want to know - but make no mistake, these guys know what they're talking about!  Book your wine tours with Cellar Rat, you'll be in great hands!

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: BOOK WITH THEM! From the beginning Cayde was a great help with booking and recommending different places and atmospheres. We were looking for a mixture of red and white wines as well as making a stop at a brewery. As this trip was taken to relax a bit we opted to go a more relaxing atmosephere. The three stops that we made were great and weren't typical touristy places which made it even better. Chris was our tour guide and he was awesome!! He gave us recommendations of where to eat, information about the areas, and overall was very personable! We couldn't have asked for a better tour guide, he took all of our bags back to the car, he mentioned that he had umbrellas just in case, and was great about letting us know that he was on his way and that there was a little delay. This company isn't like others, they listen to what you are looking for in the experience and there were no problems! Chris even found our airbnb that was a bit off the beaten path. I would book with them again!

reviews.author: Danielle B.
reviews.description: This was an amazing experience! We highly recommend booking with Cellar Rat for any of your wine tours. Clint, our guide, was a blast. He was so accommodating and knowledgeable. We will definitely use them again. Thank you Cellar Rat for making my birthday awesome!

reviews.author: Rhonda D.
reviews.description: Cellar Rat went above and beyond our expectations during our tour of Texas Wine Country. You want the best money can buy...then here it is. Clint's knowledge of wine-Texas wine in particular is mind boggling! The entire experience was perfect...booking, picked us up in time, the perfect wineries, lunch....everything! Cellar Rat will not disappoint and I can say that with confidence!

reviews.author: Hannah M.
reviews.description: Chris was AMAZING! He went above and beyond to make sure our bride to be had the best day. Incredibly knowledgeable and so fun!

reviews.author: Angela C.
reviews.description: A group of girlfriends and I came to Fredericksburg for a bachelorette party and chose to do wine tours with Cellar Rat... BEST decision! Clem was our guide and we can't say enough good things about him! It was such a fun, convenient way to see multiple wineries without having to think about anything. Clem was so knowledgeable and awesome! Truly had a blast and all the wine and food we had were delicious! Couldn't recommend this company more!

reviews.author: Karis J.
reviews.description: I had my bachelorette party this weekend with Chris from Cellar Rat Wine Tours and we had an amazing time. He is very very knowledgeable and accommodating. You will be in very good hands with him as your tour guide. This is my second time using Cellar Rat and will only use them from now on. Do yourself a favor and book with them!!

reviews.author: Jerry Y.
reviews.description: Booked a tour with Cellar Rat during the first day of our trip to Fredericksburg since we had never been.  We thought a tour would be a good way to get our bearings.  We stayed just out of town on the west side of 490 so our "wine" tour started with a quick tour of main street which was helpful later when making dining decisions and deciding our our tourist stops.  Clint was very knowledgeable about the town, the wineries, wine in general, and very personable.  He had all our stops planned out and tastings booked.  Definitely relaxing to have all that handled for you so you can enjoy your vacation.  The tours are somewhat determined by the agenda/goal of the people on the tour meaning you stops might be different.  I was told some tours are based on the best views, best wines, and possibly distillery tours if that is of interest.  We wanted an idea of what the area had to offer which took us to Kuhlman, William Chris, and Astris.  We also had some samples during lunch at Hye Market which was a great stop as well.   Several stops included a tour of the grounds and a behind the scene look at the production side of wine making.  We ended the trip that day with about a dozen bottles of wine, a mix of reds and white, which is a testament to the quality of the stops and wines the area has to offer as we primarily drink dry red wines; typically pinot noirs.  Would definitely recommend Rat Cellar and look forward to touring with them again next trip.

reviews.author: Sabrina S.
reviews.description: We had a great time with Cellar Rat Wine Tours!   Everything went smoothly from booking to the actual tour. Cadye provided a quick and thoughtful response to our initial inquiry and walked us through creating the best tour for our group. She was patient while I got consensus with the group of which wineries we wanted to visit.   On the day of the tour, Chris picked us up on time and gave us an overview of what we could expect throughout the day. We had a lot of questions and he answered them well.   Our group stopped at Kuhlman Cellars, William Chris and Pedernales. Having worked in the industry, Chris was able to get us some "behind the scenes" looks at the wineries. He also was patient when we wanted to have another glass at certain wineries. Not to mention, he was always willing to help us document the trip with a picture!  I can't forget to mention we also had lunch at Hye Market where we got to taste some of the Cellar Rat wines! They were great! The restaurant itself is in a post office that is still operating and looks like it did back when it opened decades ago. Chris was also sure to make sure we had snacks and water throughout our trip!  I would highly suggest booking Cellar Rat Wine Tour to learn more about Texas wine culture and the area.

reviews.author: Edith M.
reviews.description: We attended a wine tour/tasting and were extremely pleased with the entire experience.  From the start when I reached out to book it until we got dropped off.  Chris, our guide was excellent and went out of his way to accommodate us.  He is also knowledgeable regarding the wine, spots, and was extremely profesional and nice.  They made accommodations to pick up and drop us off where we were staying.  He kept the van cool for us and our wine during this hot weather.  He also kept us hydrated by having plenty of cold water bottles handy.  Highly recommend booking a tour with Cellar rat wine tours.  You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Melissa V.
reviews.description: We toured with Cellar Rat Wine Tours for the second time today and we had an absolute blast. You are treated to such a fun experience with delicious wines (and not to mention, plenty of learning), good food, and a great travel buddy and conversationalist to boot. Some may argue the company is pricey considering the available wine shuttles, but it is SO worth it. You get plenty of attentiveness, the day is laid-back with ZERO planning on your part, and you get home at the end of the day feeling great and hopefully, with some delicious wine.  I love Cellar Rat Wine Tours and would highly recommend to anyone hoping to check out the wine scene around the Fredericksburg area.

reviews.author: Lana B.
reviews.description: We had a girls weekend, Clem made our wine tour so much fun. He was accommodating, knowledgeable, and very patient with us 8 ladies. Thanks Clem. We had fun.

reviews.author: E A.
reviews.description: My sister and I had a blast! Chris, our guide was knowledgeable, professional and prompt! He was also really nice about rounding up our group to leave to the next winery....we weren't always good listeners regarding the leaving part!! Lol!!!
