Other amenities include a large outdoor pavilion, a retreat center, firepit, and outdoor game area.  Hill Country Casitas is also adjacent to the wonderful Hawk Shadow winery which we recommend for the tastings which are held on an outdoor terrace overlooking the canyon.  If you are a "dog person", Hill Country Casitas also is very "dog friendly". I can't recommend it more highly for couples, family get togethers, wedding celebrations, or corporate retreats.  Five Stars! Check it out!

reviews.author: Jim A.
reviews.description: This is our third or fourth time to come to the casitas and now they have a wonderful pool to spend your summer hours enjoying.  Mary and Ron are great hosts and communicators.  The casita is roomy, clean and far enough away from other casitas to feel as if you have plenty of space.  We're planning our next trip there and would recommend it highly to anyone who wants a convenient get away.

reviews.author: Ellen B.
reviews.description: Great spot for a small, intimate wedding especially during Covid. The casitas are perfect---clean and well equipped with style. Wonderful place to get away for a few days and explore.

reviews.author: Dobi M.
reviews.description: I stayed in Casita #5 for three nights and loved it. Wonderful casita (cabin) and was perfect for just me and could make for a nice couples getaway. I had everything I needed and can't wait to come back. It is about 20 minutes from amenities so bring what you need.

reviews.author: Terri C.
reviews.description: We finally got away from home after weeks of Covid shutdown.  We picked a great location and home base.   The Casitas are so comfortable, spacious for a studio and had all the basics.  We enjoyed evenings on the patio.  We checked out the common area and walked the area---bonus we meet the sweet resort cat!  We will definitely return, hopefully this fall when it's a little cooler and we can enjoy the firepit.  We felt secluded, but close enough to wineries, breweries and restaurants.  We cooked steaks on our grill for our Anniversary and enjoyed a wine tasting at Hawks Shadow, literally around the corner.  My only suggestion (not a complaint) bring a sleep mask if you need dark to sleep late.

reviews.author: Sarah J.
reviews.description: While my fiancé and I were planning on traveling abroad for our summer honeymoon, COVID  put a dent in those plans. I am so happy we stumbled upon Hill Country Casitas! It was the perfect getaway and right in our own backyard in Texas. I definitely recommend to anyone wanting to get away for some peaceful and beautiful views! The casita was clean, the bed was so comfortable and the views are incredible! We will be back!

reviews.author: Craig W.
reviews.description: Our family stayed in #8 and #10 (2 bedrooms each) November 19-21, 2016 for our daughter's wedding about 3 miles down the road at Heritage House. We were very pleased. The McRoberts were helpful and kind from the moment we made our reservation in June until after we had checked out.  My wife and I plan to return in the Spring of 2017 for a fun little getaway.  Our cabins had only been opened *very* recently (a month?), but everything was in order with one exception: both showers in #8 were barely more than lukewarm. They just needed a slight adjustment and this was taken care of very quickly (surely we were actually the first guests to stay in #8). The bathrooms had *plenty* towels and shampoo, conditioner and bath gel was provided.  The kitchen was well stocked with cups, plates, silverware, etc.  The beds were comfortable. The heating unit was a little tricky to figure out and so we were actually a degree or two warmer than what would have been ideal but we will know how to operate them next time.  There was little to no landscaping in place yet but we knew we were staying at a very new facility.  The gorgeous weather we enjoyed that weekend made the lack of landscaping a non-issue for us.  However, there is no asphalt on the property.  The roads and parking areas are crushed stone(?).  I don't know if that would be messy or not on a rainy weekend.  The outdoor furniture on the covered patios is very nice and makes for a very relaxing place to hang out when the weather is good.  Another nice touch is the use of keypad-operated door locks.  It's nice to not have to keep up with a key.  The surrounding area is authentic, beautiful Texas Hill Country.  The Dripping Springs area is booming as a wedding destination but the hospitality industry is lagging way behind the demand for lodging.  So, Hill Country Casitas should have no trouble attracting enough guests to be more than a little bit successful.

reviews.author: Mark P.
reviews.description: Stop looking!  These places are beautiful, quaint, isolated in the hills with amenities and beauty that is unmatched.  The owners are extremely personable and made us feel at home, even came by and said hi when I had a small issue.  My wife and I had an absolutely wonderful getaway, I hope you will too!

reviews.author: Sofia S.
reviews.description: My humans and I spent the weekend here. AMAZING.  Beautiful, quiet, private fireplace.  10 miles from Pedernales State Park.  My humans wore me out with the excessive hiking though.  The place was super clean and private with amazing amenities.  DOG friendly... did I say that already??    My humans are already talking about the next trip there...

reviews.author: Jackie L.
reviews.description: Absolutely LOVED this place! We recently got married at a venue nearby and had our guests stay at the Casitas. We ended up renting the entire property, so it felt very secluded and private. The whole property was breathtaking! Each Casita was beautifully decorated with spa-like bathrooms that were stocked with all the toiletries you would need, comfy beds, and private patios. The private fireplaces at each Casita was such a great bonus, they were perfect for the cooler weather. The pavilion had a fully equipped kitchen with beautiful views which was great for our rehearsal dinner. Mary and Rob were so great! They made sure our stay was stress-free and relaxing. We were beyond impressed with everything. We will absolutely be back for our 1-year anniversary! Thank you for making our wedding weekend beyond exceptional!

reviews.author: Lia P.
reviews.description: THIS PLACE. I cannot say enough about how amazing a The Hill Country Casitas are. This place speaks to my soul, it is that gorgeous.  We rented out all 10 casitas for three days for a mini wedding getaway. I had some funky ideas about what I wanted to do for my wedding and Mary at the casitas was a big part of that. She was amazing. The owners pay crazy attention to detail, they responded to my million emails quickly, and made our stay out there super easy. It is the perfect place to stay whether a romantic vacation or a fun weekend with a big group of people. There is a volleyball court, the most amazing fire pit, an outdoor kitchen that is jaw dropping... I could go on and on. Don't miss out on staying at the casitas! I know we will be back!

reviews.author: David V.
reviews.description: Stayed here over a weekend. Fantastic place to stay. The owners are very nice! Had a great bonfire and dinner with them! I'm definitely coming here again. Stayed in a nice studio cabin, very cozy, modern and clean.

reviews.author: John A.
reviews.description: Stayed at Hill Country Casitas when I was in town for a wedding. High style in hill country is the only way to describe it. Beautifully designed, new, comfortable casitas that sit quietly in the Texas countryside!   I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

reviews.author: Elizabeth R.
reviews.description: My husband and I stayed in the #1 Casita on Honeymoon Hill at the Hill Country Casitas this past weekend (12/2-12/4) and it was wonderful!  The Casita has a ton of windows with incredible views out of each one and this particular casita is very secluded and romantic.  Also romantic is the free standing tub for two and the dual head shower!  The facilities are dog friendly and our dog had a great time.  It was raining over the weekend but it was still a great get-away and we just enjoyed the outdoor fireplace most of the time.  It is only a short trip from Austin but you feel like you're miles away.  Each Casita has a kitchenette, very nicely stocked with essentials, which makes it convenient if you want to cook.  We stopped at the Salt Lick on the way out there; picked up some BBQ and enjoyed that all weekend.  The winery across the street, Hawk's Shadow, has some great wine for tasting too.

reviews.author: Michelle K.
reviews.description: Hill Country Casitas located in Texas Wine Country!  It's a hidden gem...an oasis of tranquility...And, so close to the finest Texas Wineries!  I recently stayed in Casita #7 solo the 3rd weekend of November.  The Casita was an absolute love nest!  Beautifully finished...And, luxuriously appointed.  The Casita begins and ends with a lovely porch - including seating and a wood burning fireplace.  It can be quite the gathering spot or place for quiet reflection.    From the porch the Casita has two double door entries - one to the kitchen and living room and the other to the bedroom.  In the morning I enjoyed drawing all the curtains and opening the double doors from the bedroom.  The views were spectacular.  The kitchen has everything you need - with the exception of an oven (you'll find that in the pavilion - plus, there are gas grills on the property as well) and groceries.  The owners do go above and beyond by supplying spices, olive oil, coffee creamer, tea.  Prior to my arrival - I purchased fruit, veggies, salami, crackers, cheeses, olives, and water.  This was great with my wine!!!  The living room is quite comfortable with a lux leather sofa for relaxing chats....but, I spent most of my time out on the lovely porch.  The bedroom is a dream!  The comfortable bed with bedding that had the perfect weight!  I haven't slept that well in months!  The bathroom is just beautiful!  Dual Sinks and Dual Showerheads...Can I say love nest again?  You must try the wonderful toiletries (the scents are amazing)!  Make it a special day...enjoy a picnic with a glass of wine - I did!  Mary and Ron have placed their heart and soul into Hill Country Casitas and it's easy to see!  I can't wait to visit again!!!  What I loved: The accommodation was self-catering and private.  I enjoyed company and also had an opportunity to enjoy just me!  Absolute relaxation!  It was an opportunity to "check out" vs. "checking in" to a commercial hotel.  Recommendations: Fly into AUS and rent a car and be sure to arrive prior to sunset.  Don't purchase the toll package - it's not necessary.  *When returning your car to AUS stop at the Shell off Hwy 71. https://www.aroundairports.com/map/?iata_code=AUSandtoaddr=2453+Highway+71+E+Del+Valle%2CTXandname=Shellandcat=gas  Stop at H-E-B grocery store for provisions (you will not be close to a store).  *H-E-B is a full service grocery store and pharmacy that happens to be a Celiac's gluten free haven too! https://www.heb.com/heb-store/US/tx/dripping-springs/dripping-springs-h-e-b-611  Recommended Wineries:   Kuhlman Cellars had the most impressive wine tasting.  It was very informative with regard to food pairings - Ask for Oscar.  Special Note:  Call ahead and they will accommodate for food allergies. http://www.kuhlmancellars.com/.  Barons Creek Vineyards had the best tasting wines. Special Note: Picnics are allowed!  http://www.baronscreekvineyards.com/  Compass Roads Cellars has "Charles!" I still have hearts in my eyes! https://store.compassrosecellars.com/

reviews.author: Andrew M.
reviews.description: A last-minute decision to stay at Hill Country Casitas paid off big time. Gorgeous stone cabin. Wood burning fireplace and since they are her favorite, S'mores and coffee. Best bathroom of most anywhere I've stayed. Big comfy bed with a view. Kitchen just the right size. And the pavilion area is gorgeous. Loved sitting in the La Capilla (little chapel). Loved the Hawk's Shadow winery around the corner. I'll come again when I can stay longer!

reviews.author: Gina B.
reviews.description: I recently had the opportunity to spend the night in one of these lovely Casitas. Needless to say the experience was delightful. The small touches throughout exemplify hospitality at its finest, from the binder with local info and hotspots, the ice cold water in the fridge, and to the cream, sugar and coffee so thoughtfully provided, it was the little things that made the stay so much sweeter.  They say the stars are big and bright deep in the Heart of Texas well that is so true out in the middle of the Hill Country. After spending a lovely evening next door at a local Winery (yay, Hawk Shadow!)  listening to some lovely music, I spent some quality time staring into the universe, enjoying the solitude.   I had a wonderful  night's sleep on the most exquisite sheets that smelled so delightful. The silence was quite deafening in its totality out here in the countryside. I know there were other people on the property but it did feel like an oasis. I woke up refreshed and spent the morning watching the sun rise over the hills with a hot cup of coffee in my hand savouring the crisp fall morning. While the property is still in the process of blooming, Mary and Ron were the consummate hosts, making sure I had everything I needed to enjoy my stay. I am looking forward to returning in the future for a much longer visit.

reviews.author: Brianna V.
reviews.description: Beautiful location. My mom and I came here on a spur of the moment thing and has a great time. Service is amazing and the wine tasting was excellent.

reviews.author: Nancy F.
reviews.description: We were RVing at Guadalupe River State Park and wanted to do a wine t asting. We found Pontita nearby. Beautiful winery with lots of additional plans for their future. The Owner runs it as non-profit; only taking in what is needed to run the winery, pay staff and make the wine. He gives profits to an abused woman shelter -- nice!   He also concentrates on Rieslings.  We do not by nature like Rieslings, however, these are not sweet or overly sweet. We did the 5 Riesling tasting and were very impressed with them all -- so much so, we bought a bottle of our favorite.  Our server was super nice, informative and made our tasting even more enjoyable.  Beautiful tasting room and outdoor patio.

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: If you're looking for an amazing local-style experience, then this is your place. They specialize in Riesling wines here, but they do have some outsourced reds available if you really want some. They have a really good variety of Rieslings: some dry and some sweet. I was already a fan of the dry one, but the semi-sweet ended up being our favorite. It was just the perfect balance of sweet and dry! It was so good that we took like 3 bottles home   I also appreciate the ambience and the service. The sunset was beautiful! They have cornhole if you and your friends are looking for something to do, but really the environment was great to sit and talk. I also want to point out that they had excellent service. At one point I got stung by a fuzzy caterpillar, and both our server and the owner kept coming back to check on us. In general, they have a great vibe, and they provide amazing customer service that you can only get at a local spot.   TLDR: We had a wonderful experience. They specialize in Rieslings, and their semi-sweet was our overall favorite. The service was exactly what you'd expect from the Southern Hospitality vibe, and their sunsets really were the best. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Jennifer N.
reviews.description: Came in town to visit my bestie and her daughter in law, wanted to check out a local winery.... This place is a complete gem!!!! What an incredible staff, they made us feel at home instantly like we were with friends and family. They have amazing plans on expanding the location to include a wedding venue and picnic area. I'm from New England so I'll definitely be back to check it out again. The charcuterie board was so good we ordered another! We had the Riesling flight which was perfect! Brought a bottle home for girls night later ‍

reviews.author: Damon R.
reviews.description: Wow! Jenn was absolutely amazing. This was one of the least pretentious and engaging wineries I have experienced. Riesling is probably my least favorite wines, but these were unlike any I have had! I loved all of their wines. It's extremely reasonably priced, very aesthetic, and educational! I definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Joy D.
reviews.description: The staff are very friendly and welcoming. My group and I had the pontita white wine tasting, and it was amazing. You get a taste of 4 wines, produced by the owner, with a bit of background about each wine from the owner himself. I don't know much about wine, so I really appreciated that he took the time to explain its history, the process it takes to make it, as well as the differences among wines, champagnes, and sparkling wines. The wines were pretty good, but my favorite was the semi-sweet Riesling. Be warned, I have a sweet tooth. If you like dry, fruity wines, the tart apple dry Riesling or the rarity dry Riesling are good choices. The physical vineyard itself is a work in progress, which was explained when we first arrived, but I believe when it's completed, it'll be beautiful.

reviews.author: Troy L.
reviews.description: We called ahead to make sure that the winery was open and to see what restrictions they had in place. They let us know that they were social distancing and wearing masks (as well as having plenty of outdoor seating).   When we arrived we were two of the four guests there and were lucky enough to have Pat, the owner, spend some time with us. He walked us through the wine tasting and some really interesting wine history during our visit. He was very welcoming and engaging the entire time. When we left, we wanted to purchase a bottle from him and he graciously allowed us to sample that wine (as we had not tried it during the tasting) before purchase. The tasting area is very nice and open with a beautiful pergola out back.   We were very pleased with our experience and will definitely be back soon for some more wine and some more history!

reviews.author: Ed L.
reviews.description: Great outdoor ambiance and convenient location on Main St. Owner Pat welcomed us and shared his history with the region and the local grapes grown just north of Fredericksburg.  Step off the Main Street sidewalk through the entrance into an enchanting wine tasting garden and chill to your heart's delight.

reviews.author: K R.
reviews.description: Two of my granddaughters were in town from Houston.  We wanted to support small businesses over the weekend.  Pontita was one of the wineries we patronized.  Upon entering the building we received a warm Texas welcome.  We were seated on the patio.  This is a very new winery so the vines are limited and the ambiance under development.  The waitress shared the vision with us in detail.  I recommend limiting this presentation to a high-level with a display board to which they invite customers to review.  We all ordered the white wine tasting flight.  Pat the owner serves the tasting.  With the first wine he spent significant time explaining the wine, discussing the wine making process, and waiting for us to finish that wine.  He arrived with the second wine and continued with another detailed presentation.  I advised him I don't get to see my granddaughters much and we would like to have conversation amongst ourselves.  It was apparent from his body language that he was offended by my request.  Rather than assume customers want to listen to a lengthy presentation with each wine, provide a card explaining each wine and ask the customer if they would like to know more.  While the three of us each has different preferences in wine, we agreed Rarity was the best.  Nice done!  We bought two bottles on our way out.  Once they fulfill their vision for the property and recognize customer preferences, this should be a great place to enjoy some wine and hopefully a better selection of small plates.

reviews.author: Aswathi C.
reviews.description: The owner Pat certainly knows a lot about wines and would give you a good talk on it. But the vineyard per se is under construction, so paying for a tour there is worthless. Would recommend just doing a wine tasting with the cheese plate. We bought one of the wines at the end, and it was 25 dollars, which is certainly a bit overpriced compared to the really good wines you get outside. All the staff were very friendly and engaging as well, and or baby had a great time running and crawling around.

reviews.author: Mackenzie C.
reviews.description: My best friend and I decided to come out here due to good reviews and we have to agree with the 5 stars. Natalie and shawna were kind to us and Pat came around to talk about the venue's future plans. We are anxious to come back. Definitely bought a few bottles on our way out.

reviews.author: Anh-Thu H.
reviews.description: Came here on a whim on our way back home and was pleasantly surprised.  This place is still under construction for multiple buildings in anticipation of the necessities of a wedding venue (anticipated 03/2020).  We had a great experience here with Pat, who is extremely knowledgeable about wines.  We had a great time experiencing good wines and learning about various characteristics of wine.  I am extremely excited to see what they will bring to the table with their own wines and will definitely came back again.

reviews.author: Lydia S.
reviews.description: Truly cannot recommend this place highly enough!! We had a wonderful time and were hosted by the most gracious and hospitable staff. We learned a great deal from pat, the owner. His knowledge and kindness know no bounds. Five stars!!!

reviews.author: Nicole C.
reviews.description: Hidden gem. Great experience. Great wines. Must try Rarity. Super friendly. Small, but growing and allows for an intimate experience. Learned a ton about Pontita, Texas and Wine.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Great vineyard with excellent wine. The dry Riesling called Rarity is a great choice. We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Sara H.
reviews.description: Beautiful location, but a little misleading...the winery isn't technically open yet and we couldn't sample the wines he made for apparently another 30 days. Instead, he showed us his design plans for his future growth of his winery and offered us a selection of wines by the glass or bottle we could purchase. These wines included brands such as Barefoot and Bogle, available at your local Walmart.

reviews.author: Teresa S.
reviews.description: A real work of art. Absolutely beautiful!  I loved the connection and engagement with the team running Pontita!  Thank you for a lovely Sunday Funday on your patio.

reviews.author: Kelli A.
reviews.description: The owner, Pat, not only carries a wide variety of wines but also educates you on what you are drinking. This is a great little hidden gem.  We stumbled across it thanks to Yelp.  We will definitely bring going back.

reviews.author: Juan E.
reviews.description: I loved this place, peaceful, beautiful, the service was great.  We did the wine tasting and the owner took the time to explain everything.  I will be coming back soon.

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: The owner, Pat, is very knowledgeable about wine and loves to share his knowledge, which was greatly appreciated. It was fun to sit and drink wine on the patio. It's definitely a true taste of the Hill Country!

reviews.author: Nilofer M.
reviews.description: If you want delicious and fresh Italian food with a beautiful indoor dinning experience I would highly suggest this spot. I came across it while searching on Reddit and made the best deduction of having dinner there for my 28th birthday!  Our waitress was the NICEST person I've ever met. Super kind, didn't rush, had great recommendations and allowed my boyfriend to surprise me with two little cakes.   Everything on their menu hits the spot but I got the fettuccine dish and my boyfriend got the penne vodka (which he claims is the best he's ever had). The drive is a bit long from ATX but 100000% worth it.  I will be visiting back when the weather is nicer to also enjoy the vineyard next door

reviews.author: Lynn Y.
reviews.description: Ordered to-go. Person answering the phone was delightful and friendly. I ordered the Daily Special Mahi Lupo. The vegetables, broccolini, tomatoes, and artichoke had a very nice flavor. However, the brocollini was served without trimming the huge stalks which were too thick to eat so you really didn't get much brocollini. The bread was stale. The oil for dipping was great. The mahi was disgustingly undercooked and slimy. The fish didn't flake, it slithered. If they fire grilled it, it jumped out of the fire real quick and was almost alive. I tried to nuke it for a minute but it just didn't work. I spent close to 50.00 for a meal I mostly couldn't eat. I love the setting, the villa feel of the place but I can't spend that kind of money for a bad meal. To-go orders are even more important to get right than in-house since there is no chance to replace it or remedy anything. I am a sushi fan and can eat raw fish, but this was like nothing I've ever seen. I prefer my fish dead before I eat it. Come on guys I pay you guys to catch the fish AND cook it for me!   Sorry, my picture are too big for Yelp and I am too tired and disappointed to try to fix that.

reviews.author: Tony C.
reviews.description: It's good... fire wood grill for the meats, pasta sauce was a little bland ... Service was top notch!  Need a reservation!

reviews.author: Kia L.
reviews.description: This place is really great for date night and a good glass of wine. I came here on a Saturday around 5pm which was extremely busy with kids everywhere. I had the Brussels sprouts as an appetizer and they were way too salty. The main was the risotto which was so interesting with the garlic probably wouldn't order it again but it was flavorful. The service was so slow but he was extremely friendly so we appreciated the service. I would dine here again in the summer for a glass of wine in their outdoor area.

reviews.author: Charli V.
reviews.description: Had a great dinner with my partner the other night at Trattoria Lisina. We didn't have an appointment but were able to grab a table right away.  The driveway was hard to see coming off the road but I suppose this is due to the "dark sky" community. Albeit, Some extra signage would be nice.   We ordered meatballs as an appetizer and these were delicious! The garlic toast that comes with this dish is soooo tasty!   Focaccia and oil is complimentary, wish the bread was softer and less greasy but it was free..   We split the taglierini portofino. It was the right amount! The scallops in the dish was perfectly cooked, the shrimp may have been over seasoned but the lemon butter slightly cuts the seasoning.   Over all, We spent about $80 for our meal and 3 drinks.  We were pretty satisfied! Thanks for the great service and delicious Italian!

reviews.author: Brittany D.
reviews.description: We had a great experience!! We came for the day with my grandmother and two infants. Our waitress, Krista, was so kind and attentive. We had two of the local wines and they were so light and fresh for lunch. They made accomodations for me since I'm a vegetarian too. Picture is two of the meals we got- the lasagna and the Alfredo pasta.

reviews.author: Gary C.
reviews.description: Lived here 15 years and this was my first visit. The waiter was very well spoken and versed with the menu, specials and wine list. I ordered the swordfish and it was exceptional! Everything was perfect this the 5 star review.

reviews.author: DrHilda C.
reviews.description: Excellent food, ambiance and service! Absolutely recommend anyone wanting a lovely meal-go here!

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: We brought food from here to a table outside the winery nextdoor.. with wine from the winery. I think this is your best bet if you're looking to eat and be away from crowds (for COVID).  I have to say all the food was good. The linguini was my favorite, followed closely by the mashed potatoes. The breads (focaccia and garlic) were each tasty, i could eat that focaccia all dayyy.  The lasagna was good, a bit heavy for me, though.. but what do you expect with lasagna!  I'd probably skip the Caesar salad next time..  While not my favorite Italian food ever, the grounds are beautiful, and it's a great place to bring a date or some friends and have a picnic style meal with some wine ;)

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: This place is a visual feast--a beautiful building of European flavor with a substantial Vinyard nearby, surrounded by beautiful oak trees, and beautifully maintained gardens.  While it is not easy to get to, it is the only gourmet restaurant I know of that accommodates helicopters.  (We arrived by car.)  We have met Austin friends here several times and the food has always been excellent, but we all agreed that it is now even better than we had remembered it from pre-covid days.  Warm bread came early with a plate of olive oil and herbs for dipping.  The antipasto plate and the fried calamari were both excellent, with a spicy dipping sauce.  Our friend loved the pasta dish with sautéed scallops, and the 8 ounce filet that my wife and I shared  was the best of our eight decade lifetime.  We will be back again and again.

reviews.author: Wes B.
reviews.description: Dinner at Trattoria Lisina on FRI 25 MAR with friends.  The menu was really diverse and the food was very good.  Michelle was our server and she did an outstanding job.  And thanks to Paul for ensuring that we had a great time. A very memorable experience for our anniversary!

reviews.author: J H.
reviews.description: We visited on a Wed evening. The restaurant was not full and the service felt really rushed. We also had an early reservation. The marsala sauce on the veal was wonderful though we could have skipped the lasagna. It is a beautiful, destination restaurant. The service was friendly.

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: Driving to Trattoria Lisina from Austin is always a fun field trip out into a totally different part of Texas. No traffic, windy two lane roads and there you are, in a vineyard in the middle of nowhere. I'd have never guessed a place the size and class of Trattoria Lisina would be nestled in hill country like this.  The inside felt distinctly Houston/Dallas vibes: much more corporate and big scale than a little mom-and-pop, but in a good way. Nice and air conditioned with plenty of space too. Now for the food:  The focaccia they serve with garlic/herb olive oil is OUTSTANDING. I could have eaten it all night, so so good. Like fools we ALSO ordered garlic bread. The garlic bread was toasted baguette slices that were burnt and dried. No bueno. Also: how is one bread item the best thing on the menu and the other maybe the worst? Strange, but anyway, don't get the garlic bread when you have garlic oil and bread in your lap, overflowing. The calamari was ok but the entrees were amazing. The osso buco was SO TENDER and so full of flavor. It came with a little marrow spoon and was a huge portion. My husband got the crispy duck with polenta cakes and cranberry salsa and he was a big fan too.   The service was so nice and sweet and the setting was beyond stunning. I really liked my time here and would definitely take guests when they visit too!

reviews.author: Darla E.
reviews.description: I would just like to share with you the most amazing afternoon we shared with your team. Simply AMAZING. From Tim, our waiter, the manager and that totally handsome chef (younger, with a trim beard, beautiful smile.. Sammy?) cooking on the left side of the grill.  My stepdaughter would like to thank him for a gorgeous dinner  We can't praise your restaurant enough.  We love you and can't wait to visit again.

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: We ordered a little bit of everything for my sisters birthday! Wish I had gotten more picture of the food, but we really enjoyed ourselves and the conversation. My favorite dish was the fettuccini Alfredo with shrimp. Highly recommend the tiramisu!

reviews.author: Taye M.
reviews.description: Wow! Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. This is the place to go if you want Texas fancy. What I mean is it's a relaxed but beautiful place. The food is worth every penny.

reviews.author: Anna T.
reviews.description: We had a large party and one of the waitstaff spilled an ENTIRE TRAY of iced water on one of our guests. We understand mistakes happen but NO ONE from management came to apologize and no concessions were made, not even a drink or the meal of the person who got soaked.   Poor management.   The meal was fine and we still have a generous tip despite leaving with horrible sense of proprietorship.

reviews.author: Mandy T.
reviews.description: Tuscan feel, amazing food and wine!  Loved the pasta lemon butter and shrimp.  Super delish and don't forget the tiramisu - so delish and huge helping

reviews.author: Ka M.
reviews.description: Cute place with decent food. We came here on a holiday weekend (a Sunday night) with reservations and they were very busy. We had the meatballs, crab appetizer, and bread service appetizer. All were very good. I really enjoyed the meatballs. For dinner we had the seafood pasta and the osso bucco. Both were okay and could've had some more flavor. My pasta was a bit bland. Food portions are large and we were too stuffed for dessert. Service was good.

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: First ever dining experience at Trattoria Lisina.  We we did for a special occasion, a "mile stone birthday."  We drove 1-1/2 hours to get there!  Let's start with negatives (which I don't normally do!).  The most expensive menu item, aside from the bottle of wine, was a pistachio encrusted red snapper filet.  The fish was 2x over cooked, and was tough as leather.  The main problem was it's a filet, skin on, blood line still intact.  As a seasoned Gulf fisherman and chef, I know you need the blood line cut out of the filet, even the fishing guys on YouTube get that.  Great piece of fish, tough to cut even with the knife provided.  It's not all about presentation.  Issue raised with waiter (Joseph S), and "he could have the manager come over to discuss."  As a waiter, when the dish is bad, take it away and redo!  The craft cocktails were OK, not worth the $14-$15 price tag.  The star of the evening was the calamari fritti, which was great!  Fresh, hot, tartar and marinara sauces were on point, terrific.  The veal osso buco, the best in TX, by far!  There's something about fresh bone marrow!  Dessert was the tiramisu, which was awesome, until James S added to the bill.  Overall, Trattoria Lisina is a "destination" restaurant, but for the $$, it's not worth the hype.  Enjoy one of the Mandola locations in ATX, the food is better and the price tag is 80% less ...

reviews.author: Kim N.
reviews.description: I discovered Ethyl Ambrosia literally around the corner from my house while walking my dog. What a fabulous discovery. I sampled the product and became a believer. All my friends are getting Ethyl Ambrosia for Christmas, and those who have already received theirs are clamoring for more! Their tasty, vegan, alcoholic shots are a hit in 4 flavors (I'm partial to the rosé).   Give these a try and you'll be sold!  They're perfect for events or just kicking back at home. And their patent-pending twist cup makes shots classy.

reviews.author: Jaclyn L.
reviews.description: The workers were very nice and it was a neat place. It is not the best location and was a little hard to find but once we got there we were very happy. There's free tastings and then you can buy individual shots or a box of 20. They are vegan Jell-O shots and the cups they have are super cool. We got the box of 20 and they're 15% alcohol.

reviews.author: Sarah L.
reviews.description: Always had salt lick in Austin, but never at their OG spot. We had a great time. Def busy on the weekends, so expect a long wait. Trick is to order from their to go line outside. About a 30-45 min wait on a Friday night. You then can sit almost any table outside, versus the 2-3 hour wait to eat inside. Plus they have live music outside so win win! We got the pork ribs and brisket sandwich, both as good as always.

reviews.author: Tim S.
reviews.description: Ya take the good with the bad.   We came south of Austin to the wine valleys here and started with Salt Lick Cellars.   They had the adjoining BBQ place and we were hungry so figured to start here then hit some of the other vineyards.   The place was designed to take in a lot of people.  it was full of folks at 1PM on Friday.  There was maybe 150 cars in a lot that could hold 10 times that. The grounds were nice, with lots of shady trees and people having a good time.  I think it was more of a good time from the BBQ and beer maybe as the wine was nothing to cheer about. we walked and asked for a tasting from the little window that was the winery.  We got an eye roll and were told no.  So we each got a glass of wine, not wanting to waste the stop.   Both glasses were not good.   Not to sound like a boozer but I can finish most any glass, but we had to pour both out sadly.  it threw off our mojo enough that we didn't even get a different glass or BBQ.  The good news was there were plenty more options down the road!

reviews.author: Elle G.
reviews.description: We were traveling back home after a July 4th trip with our pup. It had just rained so we looked for a place that had outdoor seating.  The first time I was there I remembered picnic tables so we took a chance. There was already a line when we arrived at 11:30 am.  All of the outdoor tables were wet and no one was  eating outside. People were just standing around the picnic tables waiting to be called inside.  I asked the hostess if we could sit outside since we had the pup. She said due to the rain they didn't have any servers working the outdoor tabled so she recommended that we order to go and were welcome to use the picnic tables.  We had our waterproof picnic blanket with us so that was perfect.  Also, the picnic area was BYOB so my husband had a beer from our cooler before we got our meal.   We had the ribs and burnt ends plate with sweet tea.  The plate came with potato salad, coleslaw and baked beans.  The coleslaw hang a tangy taste as did the bbq sauce. We both really enjoyed our meal and will be back next time we're in the area.

reviews.author: Bailee C.
reviews.description: This place clearly has a cult following.   Not worth the wait or money.   The BBQ sauce is pretty amazing.   Sunday 12pm was a 90 minute wait for two people. We opted for a to go order. Took about 30 minutes. We ordered the brisket and ribs meal for $27. You would have thought the meat was top notch expensive stuff with how little they gave us. And to think, for $3 more (and 60 minutes more of a wait) we could have gotten all you can eat.  Thank God for the delicious BBQ sauce I poured all over the meat as well as the sides. If it wasn't for the sauce I would have thought I had Corona virus because this stuff had no taste.   I see reviews saying they only accept cash. We paid with a credit card. There was a minimum payment for alcohol though. I think it was $18.

reviews.author: Allison B.
reviews.description: Very good and decent sized combo plate for $20 or so.....the place is enormous and popular so when you see the lines at first you think you'll be waiting forever, but we only waited for 30 to 40 minutes and when we sat down service was very fast. It's BYOB or you can get wine or beer (I recommend lone star) in the cellar that's right next to the BBQ.

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: After eating delicious bbq next door my wife and I decided to do a little wine tasting. A charming western style building houses the wine tasting room.  There are little items for sale like candles and honey.  I tasted a few where one was too tangy for me but did pick up a bottle of Salt Lick Cellars BBQ White.    Outside will find tables under huge oak trees and games to play like bocce ball. This place is designated as over 21. Besides wine they sell buckets of beer bottles to enjoy.

reviews.author: Mike F.
reviews.description: Wow what a disappointment!  Brisket is hard and has its form it's so stiff!  Beans are like a can of ranch style, I thought with all the reviews this place was great.

reviews.author: Gwendolyn S.
reviews.description: Dillon (Dylan) was fantastic. He steered us well during our tasting and we went away with 3 bottles of excellent vino and a mixed 6-pack of beer.  We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves (even had a good laugh at the tipsy women imbibing). Wish we could have ordered wine at the restaurant though. I knew we wouldn't be able to finish a full bottle and still drive back to Austin so the wine stayed stoppered. My husband was able to enjoy a couple of his beers, so a win for him.

reviews.author: Kristina I.
reviews.description: My fiance and I come here on a Thursday and the place was empty (just how we wanted it).  The bartender in the tasting room was very friendly and helpful.  We chose a bottle of wine that was a very reasonable price and finished most of it before we at next door. The grounds are pretty and there is plenty of seating!

reviews.author: Kyle R.
reviews.description: I've been to salt lick two times. I've been to Austin four times. The only reason I didn't go all four times is time constraint/ lack there of vehicle.   It's a nice drive out of Austin, getting a little taste of Texas hill country. Ideally I'd go to a swimming hole near by, then stop at salt lick for a great meal to finish the day.  Everything is delicious and it's an awesome atmosphere. Plenty of outdoor seating which makes it an even better experience.

reviews.author: Frank T.
reviews.description: The Salt Lick Cellars was a nice little bonus to our trip to The Salt Lick bbq. With a little bit of a wait ahead of us, we decided to walk over to the cellar for some beers. You walk down the sidewalk along side of the actual Salt Lick restaurant and drool as you see the other patrons inside eating their bbq.   As you enter the cellar you are faced with various wines wall to wall hut on the far left, their selection of beers. We looked over their beer selection and picked up 3 buckets of various beers including lone star and shinerbock. After grabbing our buckets, we enjoyed some on their benches outside. From there you can enjoy looking at their vineyard or play some bocce ball. Or you can walk back with your drinks back to the wait area to be seating.   Perfect side stop if you're looking for an adult beverage while you wait if you forgot to BYOB

reviews.author: Kristi H.
reviews.description: My review is tainted, I admit, but it is still valid.  What do I mean tainted?  Well, it was a girls weekend, we were soaked to the bone and freezing, unhappy/snippy tenders, and we were jammed in a tiny wine tasting room stuffed with other people trying to avoid the rain.  The fellow customers were likely just as unhappy as we were, but there was wine!  One note though - everyone else was just standing there, we were the only ones that were paying customers and we STILL got attitude.    Our least favorite tasting we did all weekend, but wines were good (not great).  Need to try again one day when there is great weather!

reviews.author: Kyle P.
reviews.description: This place has the best I mean theeeee best bison ribs and potato salad. Open seating for outdoor orders. There are 2 main buildings but the wait for a table was over an hour. Sat outside, food came out super quick. Even got to go in the back and check out where they smoke all the bbq. Authentic as it comes. Texas bbq. This places is BYOB there were even college kids with handles of liquor on their tables as if it was almost a daily event or something to do on the weekend. Atmosphere is cool and kid friendly but you can also have a great time in the winery. Definitely a must if you visit austin, it will not disappoint my meal was about $33 and this place is cash only. The ATM wasn't working so this was somewhat of an issue but we got it handled. Awesome bbq

reviews.author: Tasha K.
reviews.description: Best place I happened upon ever! We were leaving the Dutchman winery and looked over and saw a mass of people. My bf turned around and we decided to check it out. Such a great surprise: BBQ and wine! What's not to like? Beautiful grounds, lots of outdoor and some indoor seating. People from all walks of life enjoying the weather and listening to some good live music. BBQ was really good and came with all the fixings. Winery ladies were very approachable and helpful. So glad we stopped in. It made the day.

reviews.author: Jennie C.
reviews.description: Awesome selection of wine and beers, enjoy here or next door at salt lick bbq. Outdoor garden area and bar are amazing. So many flowers and greenery. Say hello to Maggie  cutest dog. Get the 6 pack of beer ($16)u can always take it home. Wayyyyy cheaper than $4 ea.

reviews.author: Liz F.
reviews.description: We went around 2 on a Saturday and as you could imagine, it was pretty busy, but we still got good  service. I mean what else do you do after a 6 mile walk  through the parks but stop for wine!   We got good service inside, both the woman that helped us and the younger guy behind the bar were very friendly and helpful .   We both did a wine tasting (I did the whites) and hubs did the reds. 5 tastings for 12$ which I thought was pretty reasonable. The Chardonnay they had was pretty good along with another I can't pronounce . Hubs enjoyed a couple of the reds as well.  Both left with a cup of white sangria while waiting for our food next door. It was a perfect day to enjoy it on the patio as well.   Would we take an Uber out from Austin just to go here, meh probably not. However, if you're in the area it's a great spot with friendly service. When we're back in the area with friends we'd go back.

reviews.author: Janelle M.
reviews.description: Pretty decent Texas wine. We did a tasting and we liked every wine we tried and bought the bbq red.

reviews.author: Kevin W.
reviews.description: If you have a long wait and run out of beer, the cellars is a great place to get some beer.   Located on the same property as Salt Lick. Follow the path and you will see signs for the cellar.  Good selection of can and bottle beers.   6 pack - $14 - You can mix 2 different beers. Comes in an ice bucket and you can bring it to the picnic area at the Salt Lick while you wait.

reviews.author: Will A.
reviews.description: Very good wine and tasting experience while waiting on a table to get BBQ. You can take a bottle of wine or beer from the cellars into the restaurant which is awesome!

reviews.author: Yilan Y.
reviews.description: Honestly so disappointed by the service and quality. We waited for a long time to get our six pack, then when we started drinking it, we noticed that the beer had a best by date of December 18th which was a week and a half ago. When I brought this to the bartender's attention, she said that she could only give us new beers if they hadn't been opened. She also said that the best by date didn't mean anything and brushed off my concerns. This is a quality issue. No restaurant or store should be charging full price or even selling goods past their best by date. I find this extremely upsetting as I've spent money on beer that should have been sold a week and a half ago. Also, we opened the beers but stopped drinking immediately after noticing the date on all the bottles. I don't think a cellar should be able to sell beer or wine past the best by date, and I'm sure no one wants to buy it either. Word of advice, check the date on the bottles before opening. Or better yet, don't bother waiting in the lines and spend your money elsewhere.

reviews.author: Peter S.
reviews.description: Take a venture off the main road through the countryside of the Texas Hill Country on rough roads through the forest over creeks to a beautiful vineyard covered meadow and keep going up the hill to the terrace overlooking the field and stream below. You'll have a great time.

reviews.author: Sylvia R.
reviews.description: We chose this winery because we saw a 5star review but found that it wasn't all that. They only offered wine tasting and no tour. The wine selection was rated at 2.5 with a group five of us. However, we highly recommend Wimberley Valley Winery. Very spontaneous, staff was very welcoming and the wine tasting was amazing.

reviews.author: Arely G.
reviews.description: We visited on a Saturday they had live music on a patio that overlooks the vineyard with a Beautiful view. Service was amazing and the wine was great .

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: New winery, family owned and run. Limited selection of tasting to 3 that were made of Texas plains grapes but they were all good wines. The biggest attraction, which will guarantee they'll be successful is the view and gorgeous setting. They put a large deck on the hill so you can enjoy your wine while looking out at the vineyard.

reviews.author: Hilda S.
reviews.description: The views are breathtaking, the wines are fantastic and staff are very friendly. From the whites to rosé and reds, the wines are delightful. Likes them so much that I became a wine club member. Looking forward to returning and introducing friends to this winery.

reviews.author: Caroline B.
reviews.description: Wonderful place with some great wines! The staff was delightful and friendly. The place wasn't too crowded but they just opened in November and I think people are going to be learning about this place and packing it out very soon!   They grow grapes on the property but all the wine I had was outsourced since their weren't ready yet. They had three wines to try (white, rose and red) but will be having six very soon as their home grown grapes are about ready. I enjoy dry, less sweet wines and these were perfect. Highly encourage you to put this spot on your wine tours of Wimberly! They also have some snacks/small bites if you are hungry.

reviews.author: Linda A.
reviews.description: This is a "Hidden Gem"!!! What a wonderful winery!!! We went relatively early to avoid any crowd and the staff were welcoming and informative.  They now have 4 wines and all of them were delicious. I'm not a sweet wine drinker and gratefully none of them were sweet. One crisp white, 2 rosés and a red. We left with a bottle of the red and one of the rosés too. The property and views are beautiful. They have two decks with tables and umbrellas to relax and enjoy the wine, the views, the weather and a fabulous charcuterie platter. It is a bit tricky getting there BUT it is well worth it. Don't miss this delightful vineyard!

reviews.author: Lizi P.
reviews.description: Beautiful and quaint, a smaller winery and much more intimate. Sipping wine on the large patio deck overlooking the vineyard made for a perfect early afternoon.  Charcuterie  was most generous for two ladies that love cheese and their gorgeous white blends, a new favorite spot to be revisited!! Somaliere Darryl was most delightful, definitely knew how to relate the flavors of their wine and listened to accommodate our palate.  Love this spot as would Bacchus!!  Thank you so very much Limestone!!

reviews.author: Kaitlin Z.
reviews.description: Owners were very welcoming and friendly. Wine was great and snacks were so tasty! They had fun games and beautiful places to hang out on the property. Definitely will return.

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: My husband and I are from the North East Austin area and wanted to get out of town for the weekend to pre celebrate our upcoming one year wedding anniversary. I searched online for fun things to do in the area, and this place was consistently popping up. I took that as a sign!   I was worried because my husband isn't too into wine but he wanted to go! We arrived in mid-afternoon and it was pretty quiet. The restrooms are separate from the tasting room so I went in before we start our tasting, my husband went into the tasting room. The restrooms were clean and nicely decorated. When I joined up with my husband he had struck up a lively conversation with the two dudes behind the counter. No, they weren't two of the three dudes, but they took great care of us during our stay here!   We tried all 6 of their available wines and my husband only disliked two of them. I was impressed because he's sooooo picky. We decided on the Texas Red, and we picked up a bottle to share on-site! We also ordered a cheese and meat tray and were told they would walk it down to us so we could go ahead and start enjoying the scenery of their River Deck!! I was impressed by these guys and their customer service.   The winery has such beautiful scenery. As we move into the fall and winter seasons, this is THE place to have a big glass of wine. My husband and I enjoyed the Texas Red SO much, we bought another bottle to bring home so we can have it on our actual anniversary 10/20/2019.  If you're in the area or looming for something to experience while in San Marcos, go for a visit!

reviews.author: Kathy T.
reviews.description: Went to pick up my wine club wine today. The girls that work in the tasting room are very friendly and helpful.   I  have been out of town for quite some time, they were kind enough to hold my wine for me  without any issues or drama.   I believe this was my 3rd visit. The girls actually remembered me.   I love their red blend. It is fantastic. I love the environment at this winery. It's very laid back and comfortable. They have a deck that overlooks the river where you can gather and barbecue if you would like.

reviews.author: Katy B.
reviews.description: Who knew there was a cute winery in San Marcos? We found this on yelp and I love it! We tried each wine, found a couple we liked, and bought a bottle to enjoy there.   I'd we liked the wines, the view was the best part! The winery is on a huge property, with an area over the river to sit and drink your wine. So pretty!

reviews.author: Jessica G.
reviews.description: I loved my visit here! The prices are unbeatable and the older lady that helped us (I forgot her name - I blame the wine!) was amazing. She was very thorough and knowledgeable. She made my first wine tasting experience very fun. I will definitely visit again if I get the opportunity to. The Port wine was my favorite- I couldn't leave without a bottle. 10/10!

reviews.author: Katie G.
reviews.description: Really beautiful scenery here, and overall a good experience. We came here after a visit to The Grapevine on our way back into town.   Most of the wines are pretty sweet, which I wasn't surprised by, I think it's generally a Texas wine thing. The woman behind the counter was really friendly with us and was happy to engage and talk about wine. She was very well traveled and knowledgable on many different kinds of wines and not just Three Dudes.   It's dog friendly and kid friendly here. It used to be named Three Dudes and a Dog but I guess they had to drop the The Dog part due to some legality thing.   The wine was a little too expensive... we bought a box and normally places will throw in your tastings for free when you do that, but they charged us for it. It wasn't a huge deal but I was a little surprised when she tacked it on to the bill.

reviews.author: Jill W.
reviews.description: Any event with endless wine and a riverside deck is worth attending. At Three Dudes Winery, the rustic atmosphere is a perfect balance between classy and casual. The wine tasting room is open daily from 12:00-6:00 PM, and their friendly staff make it a fun and relaxing experience.  The guys behind the counter are extremely knowledgeable about each of the house-made wines, and you can sample four for five dollars. Our selections, from sickeningly sweet to normal sweet:  Texas Black Gold. A dessert wine so rich you almost can't finish it by itself. A bite of dark chocolate cuts the sweetness of the wine to make it bearable.  Texas White Zinfandel. Fruity and floral. A little too floral for my taste.  Texas White. This one is a customer favorite with a great balance between sweet and tart. Served chilled, it's light and refreshing.  Texas Red. Smoky and slightly chocolate-y. They say it pairs well with barbeque.  The only downside of the wine tasting is the size of the room. Any more than six people, and it starts to feel crowded. However, the Three Dudes (and their dog) are talking about expanding the space. You can also take a glass outside to the patio or the deck.  I left with a bottle of Texas White and a slight feeling of disappointment: I did not run into three dudes or a dog. But I wouldn't complain if I had to come back a few more times to find them.

reviews.author: Linda V.
reviews.description: In the town of Lockhart a lady recommend  we try this winery since we r exploring the area. It looks small from the road but once on the grounds it is bigger. They have the grapes sent down from the hill country. They have been in business about 12 yrs and do not mass product or sell commercially...yet!. The white wines I thought were better then the reds! They were crisp but not to sweet, the reds were to heavy for my taste! Apparently they have a deck on the river to sip wine on but today they had wedding and reception to prepare for so we couldn't go down there. Certainly worth a visit!

reviews.author: Janet N.
reviews.description: I thoroughly enjoyed Three Dudes Winery! I came here for a school project and this was one of the best projects ever!   My favorite wine was the black gold! They give it to you with complimentary dark chocolate! Who doesn't LOVE chocolate?!  I wish the ambiance was a little better because this is one of the only wineries in San Marcos. The seating is nice but it's very limited!   The service was great though! The lady that was serving us was very knowledgeable on the wines and the history of the place. There are obviously better wineries in Texas but you should definitely give five dudes a try if you're in the San Marcos

reviews.author: Lynn R.
reviews.description: Love love love!  We first checked out Three Dudes when my in-laws came to town. I instantly liked the wines, and the vibe. Then... my sweetheart started planning our wedding reception  (the ceremony had been out of state). Bit by bit, I fell in love with this place. It was raining on our first visit, so I hadn't yet  realized how expansive it was.  There are 2 levels of deck that sit right above the river. This provides an amazing view of sunsets and allows a nice breeze. The structure is partially covered, with a stage area (we plugged in and jammed no problem). They have tables to rent, and are super helpful with setup ideas and flexibility.  They provide servers for the wine, and totally allow you to bring your own beers (no kegs). They also offer catering suggestions. You can opt to have them do the clean up or not.  The best part: our gal, Angela! Angie is professional and communicative, but more importantly  (for us anyway), she was nice. She was wonderful in offering suggestions and patient with our changing needs. She's genuinely just a cool chica, and an asset to this backyard treasure.

reviews.author: Kaether C.
reviews.description: Let me start off by saying, anything to do with wedding planning can be stressful. I am so thankful that the winery helped pretty much do everything for our engagement party, and took away most of the stress.   We had our engagement party here and the package included setup and cleanup, tables, linens, wine, and food from a local bbq restaurant for 50 people. Overall, everything was great! The winery was very helpful and even stopped a meltdown from occurring. I would recommended this place to anyone! The wine was amazing and the location is perfect.

reviews.author: Hannah G.
reviews.description: We love this place.  Angie is amazing great service beautiful location and even better wine.  After visiting we decided to get married here in July, and the staff was amazing all out guest loved the wine to. But I can not speck highly enough of Angie and her team, she worked with us, so helpful and always has a smile even when it started to storm she mar everything still fun smoothly.  We have signed up for the wine club which is also a great price.  It is worth the drive to visit this amazing spot, and drink great wine!

reviews.author: Caroline N.
reviews.description: Love this dog friendly winery. Amazing and unique wines. Really love the white zinfandel and the Texas red. Also loved the clerks. Really friendly, attentive and informative. Will definitely come back again with our pup!

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This is a new winery.   Hopefully they have plans to grow their facility and quality of wines.  Now their wines in their tasting list are mostly sweet.  Non-sweet wines are not that good.

reviews.author: Kathy W.
reviews.description: This is a lovely place outside of San Marcos. We had tastes of each of their wines. The woman who served us was very knowledgeable about the wines and the wine-making process. The wines themselves were generally a little sweet for my taste although I enjoyed the Merlot quite a bit. They also have a nice port. The river deck is nice, buy a glass of wine or a wine slushy and sit and enjoying life.

reviews.author: Rachael C.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped in to three dudes on our 5 year anniversary. We were hoping to stay and enjoy a leisurely bottle of wine since the weather was nice and the winery has a lower deck that looks out onto the river.  We graduated from Texas State and have spent many afternoons at wineries around the hill country, and this area is near and dear to us. Unfortunately, our experience at three dudes left us both with a bitter taste. The lady who was conducting the tasting wasn't very friendly and even though we tried to engage her in conversation she just gave short answers that left no more room for discussion. She then told us that they were holding a wedding at the venue and that we weren't allowed on the upper deck and could only go to the lower deck. This could have been conveyed in a friendly way - the upper deck is reserved for the wedding, but check out our lower deck, there's a great view of the river! Or something like that. Anything other than just flat out telling paying customers that they were too busy to serve us wine on the upper deck.  To sum it up: we were so thrown off by how unfriendly she was, we just left, and likely won't be back.  They do have good peach bellinis though and the Cabernet is decent

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: We went to Three Dudes for a wedding reception on a day that was too hot to be outside. Despite the heat i thing everyone had a great time. They have a wonderful covered deck like area and a lower deck a little closer to the river.   The wines were good. The port was surprising, it was a big hit that night. There's enough space and areas that people could spread out and have a good time with out being too far away. They have a little stage were two bands played.   I never saw A dude, let alone three. There were two women serving the wine, Alex and Dara, who were pretty awesome. Super nice girls, helpful to the newbies and a pleasure to chat with. They did a great job all night despite the horrid heat. The manager was always around to keep things running smoothly. Super nice lady, Angie.   -100 imaginary stars for the heat but that's on Texas, not the winery.

reviews.author: Holly W.
reviews.description: This winery is so great! It's has a rustic country feel and overlooks the San Marcos river. It's picturesque and is a great venue for a intimate party or wedding.   Now let's talk about the wine. No it hasn't been aged for decades but it suits the down home Texas atmosphere and the service there is outstanding. The Cabernet is dry and light and the Chenin Blanc is refreshing with notes of pear and green apple. They also have frozen wine daiquiris perfect for a hot Texas day!   If you swing by I hope you get Angie to help with the tasting or general service. She captures the sweet southern charm of Texas and knows her wine like the back of her hand. I would recommend this winery to anyone. It's reasonably priced, fun and a great overall experience.

reviews.author: Dwayne S.
reviews.description: Alyse was fantastic!!  What a great line-up of wine and even better customer service!  Great frozen Bellini for the patio too!  We will be back!!   Ask for Alyse!

reviews.author: Nicholas A.
reviews.description: This winery is a hidden gem! We enjoyed our tasting at the main building and then took a bottle down to the deck to relax while looking over the San Marcos river. Excellent service and great wines!

reviews.author: Bonny F.
reviews.description: Had such a great time on the patio with a bottle of Texas Red tonight. Angie and Michael are fantastic and make it feel like home. This is definitely our favorite winery in all of central TX to hang out at on a beautiful afternoon.

reviews.author: Diane S.
reviews.description: If you saw the pics online and thought you'd be sipping wine in an Adirondack chair by the lake, you will be disappointed. You have to be a member of their club to be enjoy that.   However, despite this, you won't be disappointed you made the trip. The suburbs are approaching but there is enough open area on the drive there to make it relaxing. They greeted us as new visitors with a tasting of their Cuddles Cuvée, light and refreshing. We decided to get a couple of glasses of wine and sit outside. They have cheese plates available too. Their Chardonnay and Red Blend were very good.

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: Ok, it's a little off the beaten path from all other wineries in the area, but well worth the visit. They do require reservations, so don't forget to do that! They have a beautiful set up with great views and allow dogs on the outdoor patio. The staff is friendly and the wine is really delicious. We left with a couple of bottles!

reviews.author: Jim F.
reviews.description: Be aware that these people do not do anything without a reservation. They were nice enough to seat us but it was obvious there would be minimal service. The staff present were quite nice, just busy. We were allowed to buy wine to self serve on the back porch and were welcomed to be inside the tasting room or outside which was near the vineyard - very nice out there.  Their vineyard was planted in 1999. That may be a little unusual for the immediate Austin area. The vines and the grounds are very well maintained.   As far as the place, it is beautiful. It has the feeling of Napa but with Austin-area live oak trees.  The property borders Lake Travis though it is barely visible from the tasting room area. There's an exclusive members only area that is on the lake.  We purchased the Claros Reserve which is a Norton grape (hybrid) and is the grape grown on the estate. The wine was surprisingly excellent and cost $35.   I think that, with a reservation, this would've been a superior experience.

reviews.author: Sabrina R.
reviews.description: Our visit to Stone House Vineyard was a true highlight of our anniversary vacation and and a delightful way to cap off our trip. The property is absolutely gorgeous - I mean you can truly just sit and relax for hours while you take in the stunning view. I had made reservations but we arrived a tad bit early and Liz was happy to accommodate us sooner. I'd like to take a moment to offer my sincerest appreciation for Liz as she made this experience so memorable for us. It was our first proper wine tasting and she truly took the time to explain every single wine to us - notes/scents to look for, best food pairings, explaining the difference in textures, where the grapes are from - I mean the whole nine yards. She even showed us the safer, beginner way to swirl the wine to really delight your senses before tasting. I had added a cheese board to our reservation which we thoroughly enjoyed! Liz was patient with all of our questions on the wine (and cheese), had a wonderful sense of humor, and just a lovely personality to deliver a phenomenal package of customer service. Every single wine we tried was delicious! We took home a bottle of Claros but we seriously wanted to take home one of each. If we weren't relocating soon, we would 100% have signed up for their membership. If we get to visit the area again, we will definitely stop in. I highly recommend visiting!

reviews.author: Gina F.
reviews.description: Had an amazing time visiting Stone House Vineyard! I wish I had known about it before. A short drive from Austin and well worth it. The wines were excellent with a lot of variety and worth the cost for the tasting. The property is stunning and did I mention the view of Lake Travis? They graciously let us sit in the members area and explore the property after our tasting and I'm seriously considering joining the club. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Shannon R.
reviews.description: Good wine and great people!!!! Went to a few wineries in the area and this one is definitely worth the visit.

reviews.author: Natalie S.
reviews.description: DON'T COME HERE WITH KIDS. Can't speak of the wine, because we didn't have any. No tastings, just by the bottle. No glasses and no kids aloud anywhere on the grounds. Disappointing, because we drove out of our way and had our young daughter with us. Were hoping to have a nice little picnic. Waste of time. It would have been nice if it were posted on the website. It was a beautiful vineyard!

reviews.author: Sherry W.
reviews.description: This vineyard has a nice view of the water. You get five wines for $20. Only one wine was from Texas. A few of the wines were very poor in taste. It is table seating inside or  they have tables  outside. I prefer Spicewood winery.

reviews.author: Shannon F.
reviews.description: Absolutely beautiful and handling COVID well. You need a reservation but we found that there was plenty of space and it was quiet and we really enjoyed that. The wine is delicious!

reviews.author: Nikita D.
reviews.description: Came here for wine tasting and was very impressed with the vineyard. We were staying at Horseshoe Bay Resort and were deciding between several vineyards to try in the area. I'm really glad we ended up trying Stone House. We decided to sit on the patio for our tasting. I tried the classic tasting and my dad tried the reserve tasting. The wines were mostly from Australia. They had one of their house wines on my menu. I thought the quality of wines was very average. We also got a cheese board which was really good.  The area was picturesque and we were allowed to go down to an area for wine club members. They had an enclosed outdoor area for members only with a view of the lake.  Overall, if you want to go to a vineyard with great views, this is the place to go.

reviews.author: Chassey W.
reviews.description: This is a fantastic little vineyard tucked away on the south shore of Lake Travis. Sit up on the patio or down by the lake. The employees were super attentive and very kind. The cheese plate a great compliment. And they let us have our fur baby on the patio too . The special reserve Pinot noir is excellent!

reviews.author: Kelli C.
reviews.description: A beautiful hidden treasure. The atmosphere is fantastic- views of Lake Travis and grape vines sitting under a covered patio with a blanket and fireplace. It is definitely off the beaten path, but that is what makes it so serene. We enjoyed our wine tasting, and purchased two bottles of the Shiraz.

reviews.author: Ben G.
reviews.description: To start - what an absolutely stunning property! The service and entire staff was incredibly warm, friendly, helpful and engaging. We came with our 2 dogs and had a truly special, romantic early evening on my fiancé's birthday. The wine and tastes were exceptional and we will definitely be back! Thank you!

reviews.author: Lindsay M.
reviews.description: Had such a great experience here with my family. We came on a rainy Saturday and they were nothing but accommodating. We had the best welcome with Jaramy, she was so informative and polite. We were greeted with a welcome drink then walked through their wine selection. We decided on a bottle to share with an amazing charcuterie board. The outside patio was covered with great views of the estate. Overall a great vineyard with great staff.

reviews.author: Amanda H.
reviews.description: This is by far the best winery around the Austin area.  Great staff and there isn't a wine they serve that I would drink.  That's hard to say for most Texas wineries.  They have beautiful lake views for wine club members.  I highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Annie M.
reviews.description: Excellent vineyard. The winemaker is from Australia and they have wines shipped from their Australian vineyard.

reviews.author: Amy K.
reviews.description: Champagne and Rose' Lake Travis views. Absolutely beautiful and relaxing. The service is friendly. Dogs are allowed. Lake views. Relaxing lounges. Champagne is delicious and rose is more on the dry side. Love this place.

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: From the minute we walked in, Jaramy made this a special experience for our group, me especially. She welcomed us and gave us a nice toast of something bubbly and told us about the vineyard and its owner, Angela. The wine of the month was Angela's Wish. I was having a particularly emotional time with it at this point because my beloved grandmother, Angela, passed away recently and had wanted to visit this area. I, of course, had to get the wine of the month so I could keep that bottle. I told Jaramy of my grandmother and the significance of the name of the bottle and she listened with an open heart. My group also got a nice charcuterie board and sat outside. Though it was pouring down rain, we still had a lovely time conversing with others and enjoying the view.

reviews.author: Brittany A.
reviews.description: Warm atmosphere and welcoming staff. Andy was very accommodating of my family and I. The wines were delightful and the charcuterie boards were delicious and had a good presentation. They really made sure we had a pleasurable experience. I will definitely be back in the future!

reviews.author: T W.
reviews.description: The wine was wonderful and the view was amazing!! Bo was our sever. He was great! He took his time telling us about the place and each wine. We almost didn't come because of the reviews about the lake being blocked off , a benefit for members only. We asked and they let us go down and check out the place, no problem at all. We were there for hours!

reviews.author: Matouš P.
reviews.description: Great place. We have been coming here for years and continue to enjoy. We brought our dog with us this time and really enjoyed an outdoor tasting. The wines as always are tasty and reasonably priced. Beautiful property, plenty of room to space out, and following covid protocols.   We called to make a reservation but got their voice mail. Impressively, even though we did not leave a message, Doug called us back promptly and got us scheduled for an impromptu tasting.   Their tasting room manager was our host and we had a great experience.   We will continue to come back!

reviews.author: Erika S.
reviews.description: Carson was the best wine person ever! He was very accommodating and knowledgeable and friendly. We recommend this place to everyone that comes to the Texas Hill country. 10 out of 10!! Carson or bust!!! We bought two bottles of wine because of him. We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Stopped by this place right before closing time. We were lucky enough to  be able to do a tasting. The Rose and Tempranillo were the best out of the 4 we tasted. The tasting was $15.   They have a cute patio where you can bring your dog. You can also bring outside food to enjoy with your glass of wine. They do sell local bread. The tasting room smells heavenly with the fresh bread right at your side.   Staff was great. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Dana S.
reviews.description: We came on a Saturday without an appointment and they accommodated us anyway. Took their time and treated us like friends. Deborah was the best! We truly appreciated it all of the ladies humor and kindness. The wines were also just as great. I bought the swim spot and friends bought several bottles also. The grounds ate very pretty and relaxing. We definitely will come back on our next visit to Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: Leaving 2 stars: one for the atmosphere, they had a nice patio area outside that allowed us to enjoy the shade and still social distance, and 1 for the server who was pretty entertaining. I didn't really care for the wines. They had a bunch of roses which were mediocre. Not sure if that was them trying to find their niche. The reds were okay but nothing I would pay for for the price they were charging. One thing we were disappointed in was they charged $25 for an online reserved "tasting with bites" but when we got there it was basically just a tasting and we had to pay extra for food. They had a sandwich that was pretty tasty but was out of their sourdough bread. There tasting included maybe about 7 wines but I'm not sure if that was also because our server allowed us to try a few more. Didn't think it was worth $25 so I was surprised to find that the tasting "without bites" wasn't cheaper. I can go find better tasting wines for cheaper down the road... like at signor. I'll pass next time and try a different winery.

reviews.author: Vee V.
reviews.description: It's beautiful and so cozy with picturesque view. We sampled a few glasses before deciding on rose wine, round mountain, and white wine, swim spot. Don't miss this hidden gem. Staff is so friendly too!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Doug Lewis and Duncan McNabb are among the younger wine makers in Texas, but are rising the bar in making quality, well structured, Texan wine.  Their tasting pavilion is now open and tastings are by appointment only.  The tasting pavilion is beautiful, open, and overlooks one of their vineyards planted in 2014.  They have several acres of vineyards on site.  You can taste the current releases for $15.  The tasting is refunded if you purchase two bottles.  The bottle prices here compared to other Texas wineries are decent.    They make wines sourced from 100% Texas grapes.  I like how their wines showcase terroir driven single vineyard wines.  They focus on Mediterranean varitels.  Lewis makes one of my favorite Texas white wines, Swim Spot.  I wish they would can that wine so I could drink it while floating on an intertube.    I also like that currently their tasting menu shows the different styles of Tempranillo from different Texas Vineyards.You can really taste how the different terroir influences the varietal.
