Overall, our stay at Serenity Farmhouse Inn was okay, but we intend to try elsewhere for the amount of money that we paid.  I hope that their maintenance improves as it is obvious that they put a lot into getting the cottage built and decorated.

reviews.author: Sona E.
reviews.description: We arrived at 9:30 am in order to be there early for the 10:30 am Wine Tour pickup time.  The staff was so gracious and welcoming.  They informed us that the White Buffalo Bungalow was ready and we would be able to get settled in before leaving for the wine tour.   White Buffalo Bungalow was just breath taking from the private drive to the private jacuzzi.  The room has a full kitchen and had a bottle of welcome sangria to begin the pregaming before the wince tour.  The shower was amazing and the soaps, shampoo/conditioner smelled so good!   This was a Wednesday so we were lucky to be on the wine tour with only one other couple.  Jodi is such a pleasant and inviting soul. She got asked about each person's preferences as to be able to personalize the tour and pick which wineries she decided to take us too.  Jodi is so knowledgeable of the town and the wineries.  The lunch she provides is just amazing.   The pool area is so nice and calming.  Again it was the middle of the week and we had the pool to ourselves which was great.  Breakfast is brought to our room by about 9:45 each morning and was so good. (We were the last delivery.)  I was able to walk around the property 1  1/2 times and get a mile in each morning.   If you are not wanting to leave the property stop by HEB and pick up food to prepare in the room.  This was such a wonderful  experience I am already planning to go back next year.

reviews.author: Mindy U.
reviews.description: I am absolutely in love with the little Poets Cottage we stayed in last week. I really appreciate all of the attention to detail in the beautiful antique linens, fresh flowers, pillows, seating areas, bath tray etc. I could go on an on. It was a beautiful and relaxing retreat. It was in a wonderful central location for day trips to State Parks, great Texas BBQ, cute little towns and wonderful back roads. The view from the pool is spectacular. Nothing quite like a Hill Country sunset or sunrise either.   We really enjoyed the big Jacuzzi tub. It would have been nice to have a shower for quick mornings, but we made do. When the neighbors used theirs, their jets were so loud we could hear them. We could also hear the man's booming voice at times.   Their breakfast was amazing and presented in such a lovely way. I wish we could have gotten it a little earlier. I think 930 is probably perfect for a leisurely vacation where you sleep in, but we were up and hitting the roads early. We did wait around for it one day and I am so glad we did.

reviews.author: Nicolle M.
reviews.description: I really enjoy this Winery. They source grapes from California and Texas, but stick to what grapes from those regions do best. My favorite was their Russian River Valley Pinot and they had a special white from the green valley sub appellation I LOVED.   The tasting room is down to earth and simple- and expect a drop in by the owner! Great wines, friendly crew- recommend for the wine lover.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: Been wanting to check this place out for awhile now. Very close to our house in town and needed a nice Texas bottle of wine for a charcuterie board night.  Made reservations for 2... Very specific time slots available. We were arriving a tad early so I called first to make sure that was indeed ok and I actually got a call service... they weren't on site and first told me that they take walk ins and it was cool.... then he stopped me before hanging up telling me no... reservations required... he couldn't figure it out and didn't have access to the winery to check... that was odd. Walked in and got right in to a different table then I reserved since we were early.  You will feel like you're walking into a house.... lots of pictures and decor everywhere.... they are not minimalists :) Sat down and Ami took excellent care of us with the wine tastings and a couple snacks. We ended up grabbing a bottle of our favorite to go.  We were there for an hour. Felt kind of rushed. The owner was walking around the whole time we were there with an ipad scanning the room and tables... it kind of ruined the chill experience...  loved the nice friendly folks that were there drinking with their dogs... music in the background was nice. The wines were tasty too and Ami was super knowledgeable about them all. She was the best part of our time there.  I prefer outdoor wineries. There are no windows and it's all indoors in a strip center. I am very sensitive to floral air fresheners and strong chemical cleaners and they definitely use both. A lady was walking around spraying windex after people left very close to us and it was so strong it retuned the wine tasting experience trying to navigate the smell and taste the wine....  Overall the wines were good and the people were nice...  Windex spraying, calling a hot line instead of winery and Ipad guy walking around the whole time wasn't for me...  I like laid back relax and stay as long as you choose atmospheres with no strong cleaning smells while drinking wine. The bathroom is also very strong.... extremely blue toilet water... and fragrances... Doesn't mix well with food and wine..  Loved all the dogs and pics of dogs!  Ami gets 10 stars!!!

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: Ok yes, this is in a "warehouse" "strip mall" kind of exterior... HOWEVER, Once you walk in, you forget! It's so very welcoming and cozy...and the WINE! I've been to plenty of wine tastings that I had to figure out one I liked. This dilemma was figuring out if there was one I didn't like. My friends all agreed, and we actually tried to figure out if we could get another time slot reservation because we enjoy ourselves that much. The staff were so welcoming and checked on us often enough but not too often. There were snack options, and apparently on the weekends they try to offer food specials if you come hungry. We really enjoyed ourselves and look forward to next time.

reviews.author: Viviana M.
reviews.description: Family owned and operated the atmosphere was really sweet with pictures of the family hung on the walls. If you're a Cowboys fan reserve the Cowboys table. At my tasting favorite was the 2018 Chardonnay. If you try Bent Oak you will not regret it so check it out! Joanne and Bryan were the best hosts.

reviews.author: Dan G.
reviews.description: what a fabulous find on our trip in and around Austin!  The owner was delightful and the staff was fantastic!  Amie poured various wines and gave a complete history of how they were grown along with what to expect when tasting them.  She also shared with us stories about how she went to college for making wine and growing grapes which was fascinating. An added benefit was that they serve a bowl of pulled pork stew that was to die for!  And the accompanying piece of cornbread was also excellent.

reviews.author: Kevin M.
reviews.description: Walked in on a Thursday to try some wine.  Some amazing wines.  Super knowledgeable team and was a great experience

reviews.author: Jessica T.
reviews.description: Staff is very friendly the man directing our tour was very informative, we learned so much! The food was fantastic tough it would be a little nicer on a glass plate but that is just personal taste.

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: Wow I was blown away by Bent Oak. It really does not look like much from the outside but my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try based on the reviews and we were not disappointed! We easily made a reservation on the website and came in at 2pm on a Saturday. They took out temperatures at the door and we were seated quickly.   We decided to go for the wine tasting first, 5 samples for $15 plus a stemless logo glass to take home! We really enjoyed trying the wines and enjoyed all of them. Our favorite was the Blanc du Bois because it was light and crisp but had a unique fragrant flavor from the floral notes and the apricot.   My only gripe was the reservation was only 45 minutes. I wish it could've been around an hour, we didn't get a chance to finish our wine or our charcuterie but it's not too big of a deal since we just took it back home. We also got another bottle of the Blanc du Bois to take home and they gave us a cute wine bag for the two bottles.   We will definitely be back again to try the rest of the wines!!

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: What a wonderful discovery on a lazy pre-Xmas Sat afternoon. Who would have thought you could find a boutique winery that rivals any that I've visited in Sonoma.   Do not despair as you pull into the generic industrial park hard off of Anderson Mill Road in the CP. Walk-in past the small lobby area and step into their beautifully decorated tasting room.  Since we were the only patrons we received VIP treatment from start to finish.   We opted for their premium tasting menu and selected all reds. I'm not a TX wine fan but Dylan, our sommelier, expertly guided us through our tasting and as we concluded our wonderful stay my mind was changed.   My favorite was the Alexandar Valley Cab will more than suffice if you enjoy a big traditional Cab with a strong finish.   Their Spanish Mourvedre version is deep and rich and has a surprisingly strong finish,   There are a number of "light" reds as well. We were not fans but appreciated the flavor and balance of these wines.   Bent Oak does offer cheese plates and other small plates to accompany your tasting. Check their social media as they have live music on certain days.   Wonderful wine, an intimate setting, and passionate knowledgeable folks equals a 5 star experience.

reviews.author: Vipul T.
reviews.description: Good luck with the attitude at the front desk and the fact that they won't pick up the phone for a reservation. Waste of our time driving here, if you are passing by I would look at other places for wine tastings.

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: The wine selection is truly delightful in an abundance. So happy to have this treasure in our community. Perfect for a low key date night or a nice peaceful book. Will absolutely be coming back.

reviews.author: Claude W.
reviews.description: This was a real treat.  We looked for winery that was open before 4pm. We were staying in San Antonio and wanted to visit Austin TX. We found this place by searching best wineries near Austin. When we 1st arrived, it looked like a little store front in a strip mall. When we entered it was a whole different story. We were greeted by Debbie and Bryan who both turned out to be extremely gracious hosts.  They have wines grown in TX and CA. The TX grapes are grown in the High Plaines near New Mexico where it is warm during the day and cooler at night. I decided to do a tasting with only the TX wines.   The TX wine menu had 5 wines for the tasting menu. Started with the Chenon Blanc (quite nice with a buttery smoothness), proceeded to the Blanc de Bois, then the Roussanne (my least favorite), then switching to the reds starting with the Sangiovese and finally to the tempranillo.  The Tempranillo was my absolute favorite.    What really made this experience so nice was the wine Ambassador Debbie. She is just the nicest person who took good care of us. She also has a very nice sense of humor. Bryan was also very nice. He helped me pick out a few stainless steel wine stoppers. Bryan gave us great restaurant suggestions for Austin and San Antonio.  Do not be fooled with the entrance on the outside. It is misleading in the size and the value you receive on the inside.

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: My experience with this winery has been amazing to say the least! Took two of my really good friends here today both who require wheelchair accessibility and felt very comfortable in the atmosphere. The reservation made ahead time was set up easily and the communication was quick and efficient through email. They were able to recommend a table that was best suited for us all to feel comfortable. It is very rare to actually be able to talk to the owners/wine makers about their products but they were the ones serving us the tasting! It really was a special experience not only for me but for my friends that have not gone out socially since the pandemic. Thank y'all so much for the inclusive atmosphere and making it such a memorable experience, we had a blast!

reviews.author: Pat M.
reviews.description: Very nice atmosphere inside.   Help was very friendly.  Pizza bread was out of this world.  I would recommend

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem! We were sitting at home on a Friday night, trying to find something to do. After a quick yelp search, we saw there was a winery up the street and open late. We decided to take a trip and check it out.  Driving up, you start to question if you are going the right direction but just keep going.   You walk in to this office center and are welcomed to the most friendly staff and environment.  Rarely do you get to sit down at a winery and speak to the head wine maker.   What really makes this place different is the fact that they have California and Texas wines. I'm no expert, but I've been told Texas grapes just don't compare.    The prices are great, and the options are plenty.  This will definitely be the family visit spot in the future.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: Wine: Only tried one wine, the tempranillo. It was fine, not as bold as they usually are. I smelled some of the whites, and they smelled very sweet so I passed. Didn't even look at pricing because of what the snacks cost.  Snacks: wow, expensive. Tried a bunch of them with a group, overall not worth the price. Particularly the truffles. It was $27 for a teensy box of 9 pieces of terrible chocolate. Waxy texture, did not melt when you eat it, chalky, bad flavor. Dark chocolate is my fave, so that's not the issue. Who knew chocolate could actually be yucky? It came from next door, glad we didn't go there after.   Service: very good, sweet ladies.  Ambience: not good. Outside it just looks like a store front, inside is super dark, no windows, and looks like a Kirkland's from the 90s.... everything is red, has fringe, pretty cheesy. Not eclectic, just ugly and full of stuff.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Living in Austin, this winery is located in our backyard. It's nice to be able to drive just 20 minutes and enjoy a good glass of wine, and meet the people who made it. I now have a place for out of town guests just spending the weekend to take a sip of Texas wine.  They focus on creating quality wines sourced from Texas and California grapes.  They do not blend grapes sourced from the two states together.  When you drink a bottle of Texas sourced wine, it is 100% Texas, and vice versa. Bent Oak has been around for about 3 1/2 years, and from what I have heard they are starting to find their stride.   When you enter the space, you will walk through the front gift shop to the back tasting room and production area.  They have gone to amazing strides to make a warehouse space homey. It feels like a Texas hill country family home.  We were warmly welcomed, and they even let us take our three well behaved dogs into the back area to sit and enjoy a tasting with us.  Everyone here was friendly and knowledgeable.    I was pleasantly surprised by the consistent quality of all their wines available to taste.  You can taste up to five wines from their menu.  The Blanc Du Bois was one of my stand out favorites.  There wasn't anything I didn't like on the menu.  I am not a fan of Chardonnay's but their California sourced Chardonnay was good.  Their reds were a bit young, but the Mourvedre from the Texas High plains was tasty and my favorite of the current options.  Medium bodied but with spicy fruity rich tones.  The Sangiovese was satiny smooth, but just needed some time.  I actually enjoyed their Texas wines more than the California options.    Clearly there is a reason why their wine club membership has a waitlist.  It's just a great group of people to hang out with.  It felt like being with family, and enjoying a great conversation over a nice glass of wine.  They are located next to Delysia chocolates towards the back of a warehouse area.  Wine and chocolate neighbors?  Yep, it's an amazing pairing.

reviews.author: Cindy L.
reviews.description: Stopped in yesterday. Always welcoming and we felt so safe especially with all the precautions they are taking. And if course great wines, can't wait to share the Cuvée with friends!!!

reviews.author: Jasmine M.
reviews.description: Great Winery with awesome wine! John (wine maker) was amazing! Super nice and attentive. We came here celebrating a bachelorette party, we arrived a bit late, but they were so accommodating. Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Nanette L.
reviews.description: Great wine accompanied with paired bites...comfortable atmosphere  too come on my own and listen to music...would recommend for all ages.

reviews.author: Amber M.
reviews.description: Andy was wonderful. Welcomed us warmly and shared insights about wines. We each had two different glasses as we sat next to the fire.  Gorgeous atmosphere, friendly service, and great playlist.  Sparkling rose was my faveeee

reviews.author: Beth C.
reviews.description: This is an amazing, small winery with some of the best wine I've had. Daniel, the owner, made us feel very welcome. Our time there was like hanging out and sharing wine with an old friend. I highly recommend stopping by for a glass of the Petite Sirah.

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: Love this place! The atmosphere is laid back and Texas casual. They usually have a band. Beautiful grounds. Their wine cocktails are delicious. AND this winery is open until 10pm! I love that there is a place to go that isn't rushing you out the door at 5! Kick back on the patio, listen to music and enjoy the scenery.

reviews.author: Brad B.
reviews.description: Super friendly server and great location.  This is a fun winery that advertises a lot of events and offers "wine cocktails" which my wife really enjoyed.  It is keg wine so it comes out of spouts on the wall and they fill a bottle for you if you buy one.  This was different and I don't know enough about wine to know if it helps or not.   I really liked the laid back feel.  This doesn't have the pho-Tuscan Vegas facade that some of the bigger places have put up, but it is a fun lil hill country spot with a good sized deck, small indoor area and lots of shade to play corn hole or let kids run around.   The wine was good - we shared a tasting which is what we usually do before buying a glass - each was a good sized pour and I thought they were going to charge us for two but good sized pour is just how they roll.   Plan to return for sure!

reviews.author: Ryanne D.
reviews.description: Awesome patio and breeze on a beautiful summer day. Staff was friendly and Nacho the dog was so loving. They have cocktails, for those that are not wino's  my husband had the wine and coke and it was delicious and refreshing. They have special events periodically and would be a great place to go and hang out and relax more often....we live in the DFW area. Restroom is clean as well, which is always a plus! Will definitely return!

reviews.author: Lisa G.
reviews.description: We had the BEST time!!  Daniel had a wonderful knowledge of wine and was so hospitable!  So glad we took a chance a stopped by here!  Also, if looking for a cocktail, highly recommend the Mr. Edmonds...fantastic!

reviews.author: Doug G.
reviews.description: Zack was great! Very knowledgeable. We did the dry tasting and all the wines were great!  We enjoyed 6 tastings for 15.  The pours were generous. Ambiance was nice.  Has a big deck with a lot of out door seating.  It was two hot for us to take advantage.  The tasting was Texas high plains, Cerritos santo vineyard, chenin blanc. California Chardonnay, williamette valley, Pinot noir 2017, Texas hill country lot 83 red 2017, California Cabernet 2016 and Columbia valley, Syrah reserve 2015.

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: Vinovium is a real standout amongst the growing list of wineries and tasting rooms along 290.  My wife and I have visited many of them since buying a house in the area over a year ago.  What I love about Vinovium are all the great events they put on.  From lounge takeovers, where winemakers give tastings of their wine, to stand-up comedy, to Trivia nights.   The owner and staff are all super welcoming and so knowledgeable about wine.  They've got a large selection of rotating wines on tap and you can get a bottle filled there to take home that can be brought back to reduce on waste, which is another plus in my book.   We'd only visited a couple times before we were sold on joining their membership club.  And since then we've enjoyed hanging out and feeling like we're part of the family.  Trivia night was such a blast.  And it's on the same night as their Prime rib dinner which was out of this world - check out my pictures.   For a change of pace from your ordinary winery/wine bar, I highly recommend a visit.  There's really no other place like this around here.

reviews.author: JoAnn T.
reviews.description: Spent our 25th Wedding anniversary here!! So fun and delicious wine!! Great service and ambiance!!! Try the Mr Edmonds too!!!!

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: Ok the dog threw me off at first. We pulled up and it looked lie cujo was just standing there. Once i realized he was friendly we hopped out and went right in. The staff are so open. Zack and Jennifer made us feel welcomed and helped us during our wine tasting. This place is more like a bar but they do have a great selection of wine that you can buy. They also have awesome bbq next door. If your not scared of dogs i would recommend this place on your visit through wine country.

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: Love this place! This is not your typical winery and tasting room. This is a WInery and Negotiant, meaning they partner with other wineries to offer a wide variety of flavors. In addition to wine, they also have some pretty unique cocktails made with wine and wine on tap! Very friendly staff, casual vibe and dog friendly! We had a great time!

reviews.author: Clyde C.
reviews.description: My wife and I came across this place after visiting another winery.   You must stop here to meet Daniel and his staff.  They have a great wine selection with awesome service.  Daniel is very knowledge about wine and mixes up killer wine cocktails.  We will definitely be back on our next trip to the area.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: We loved this stop on our wine bus tour! They have the most adorable, friendly dog named Nacho that roams around as you sip tastings. Loved it!

reviews.author: Lori N.
reviews.description: This was our last "bonus" stop on the Texas Wino tour and our favorite. The Pink Panther and Back In The Day were amazing. Daniel was great and so patient with everyone's questions. They have stand up comedy, wine classes...so much to offer.  Rags the cat and  Nacho the dog are strangers to no one. Great experience!

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: Such a friendly atmosphere, and the wine on tap and wine cocktails really hit the spot.  I'm partial to their reds like Ocotillo, Sketch, and Syrah.  Love that they are open later than others and their fun programming like trivia, stand up comedy, opera uncorked, etc.  There's even a ping pong table and giant Jenga, and it's kid and dog friendly.  We enjoy stopping in on our way from Austin to Fredericksburg and vice versa.

reviews.author: Amy F.
reviews.description: Love this place! They will fill reusable bottles from their wine on tap to take home. The Baby Cab is my all-time favorite here, but a close runner up would be the double espresso with port. The perfect pick-me-up after a full day of wine tastings. The indoor and outdoor seating options are nice and good for couples or groups.

reviews.author: Kathryn M.
reviews.description: This is a down to earth winery with great oak trees all around! We were greeted by two sweet dogs and the owner Daniel. He was very welcoming to us! This winery has a huge nice hand built outdoor deck with ceiling fans too! The bartender who had a really great name (last name Drake) ask her about it...shewas very knowledgeable and super sweet! The wine was really delicious too! They were the first to serve wine out of kegs we learned and I liked their white blend. If you are looking to cool off from the summer heat we recommend the white port served over ice or one of theirs cocktails. They also have wine bottle koozies too, added bonus for Texas!

reviews.author: Candice L.
reviews.description: The staff is friendly and helpful, including Nacho the dog. Good BBQ can be found here as well. But the real selling point is the time cocktails. They are fantastic. It's a lovely setting to hang out, play some games, and just relax with friends.

reviews.author: Diana M.
reviews.description: Not worth the stop. We came as part of a wine tour and this was our worst stop. They were rude to my friends who paid for drinks and bottles of wine (separate from what was offered with the tour) and would not allow them to sit with us because we came as part of the tour and the table was for "paying guests". Additionally food was withheld from our group, but they explained it was because they could make $15 a plate off of other guests. It was just a bit tacky to explain it that way and made us uncomfortable.   On a more positive note, I thought a couple of wines were good, but given the competition in the area and the blatant price gouging, I would take my business elsewhere.

reviews.author: Trutexn M.
reviews.description: Amazing! A must if you're in the area. Great people and wines, and the best wine cocktails you'll ever taste.

reviews.author: Marie D.
reviews.description: We loved Siboney winery on our trip to Texas Hill Country! We got to meet the owner Barbara who was great, and loved our waitress Wendy who was very knowledgable and told some great stories. We're a very chatty group and loved that she took the time to chat along with us about her life and the region.  We each got a tasting and shared a charcuterie board which had a great variety of cheese and meats.  It's super new, so be sure to stop by and try it if you're in the area!

reviews.author: Rebecca H.
reviews.description: Siboney Cellars is a very new winery with a gorgeous view of the beautiful Texas Hill Country. We got to meet the very charming owners and taste some of their delicious wines. We also got to hear the wonderful story of how Siboney came to be; it's a love story so I won't spoil it for you.   If my friend and I didn't already have too many wine club memberships between us, we would have certainly signed up for this one; I hope to join in the future.   Siboney Cellars is definitely a place to visit and keep visiting. I plan to go every time I'm in the area and hope to see them grow and thrive.   Way to go Travis and Hot Shot!!

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: To visit Siboney Cellars is to fall in love with Siboney.  Siboney Cellars is making phenomenal wines, has a charming story, a beautiful property and very welcoming owners/partners. Meaning lies in each thoughtful detail from the name of the winery, the naming of the wines, their symbol.. I won't share too much as it is such a treat to experience first hand! I am obsessed with their Coral Estrellas Sparkling Rosé made with 100% Sangiovese from the Texas High Plains. After this sabering I am certain I heard "Come quickly, I am tasting the [Texas] stars!"  We have visited @siboneycellars twice and truly enjoy hearing first hand the story of, which is truly a love story, Siboney from Winemaker Barbara Lecuona and Miguel Lecuona.   They welcome you to visit and experience their incredible wines, watch as their newly planted vines grow and also see their beautiful new facility in the hill overlooking the vines  just opened!

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: We finally ventured to the newest winery to open in Johnson City. We have patiently awaited it's opening and wanted to give it a few weeks before visiting. We shared a bottle of the Coral Estrellas Sparkling Rosé and a charcuterie tray that was better than anticipated. The sparkling wine was great and not overly sweet like a lot of Texas wines tend to be, and the charcuterie had a variety of meats and cheeses, olives, dried fruits and nuts and an added touch was the hot crusty bread served alongside the crackers to enjoy all. The view is beautiful! The terrace overlooking the vineyard is perfect especially on a day like yesterday! Wine, delicious. The owners and stories were delightful. My husband opted for a cigar and his day got even better. Miguel picked a cigar to his liking and when he found out he liked slightly sweet, he brought him some honey alongside. Scott was delightful with his deep voice, knowledge and charm. Barbara is the winemaker who also made her rounds. This is a hardworking woman, folks!! Miguel, Barbara's husband and co-owner, was a delight and told his stories charmingly and with ease. He beams with pride telling the work she has accomplished with the wine, and all of the work they and the other co-owners have put into the winery. We got to meet Mary Anne also, another owner of the property and apparently the reason their vision was able to come to life. I would HIGHLY suggest visiting this beautiful place and sampling their wines. You will walk away a member!!

reviews.author: Mark S.
reviews.description: Have you ever had something you loved so much that you didn't really want to share it?  Well that's the relationship I have with the Wine Cellar. This place is amazing and we love it but like a good secret,kinda want to keep it to ourselves. Their wine selection is the best in town and their prices are amazing. Stephen, Tim and John all know and love their wines and are some of the nicest people we know. They offer weekly tastings that allow you to explore all sorts of different wines affordably.  If you love wine, this is your place.

reviews.author: Amy E.
reviews.description: Love this place! Excellent selection of wine and small bites featuring local Austin purveyors. Follow their social pages for unique tasting events. The friendliest most welcoming staff- it's no wonder locals frequent this shop and bar.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Best place near Austin for wine. Very relaxing atmospherere, both indoors and out, unique selection. Steven can get anything. The workers and the guests are all amazing. Steven, David and John are the best people ever. You can ask any question and they can always lead you in the right direction. All the other guests will always help you feel included, if you are nice. A great place for everyday wine, party wine and whatever wine. The people here will always help you out. Plz call us if you're heading over, we'll join you

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: OK so this is a hidden gem for the hills of Lakeway. It looks like a little nothing store in a retail setting. You get inside and it's a really warm atmosphere, the bartender wine host was great friendly. There's a terrific selections of wine, there's a nice little bar, there's a private room on the side, I think it can be reserved possibly?  I have to tell you this was a secret spot that people should know about! The prices were reasonable, the wine selection was great the  atmosphere is five stars!  Give it a shot guys!

reviews.author: Melissa T.
reviews.description: After a wonderful massage wanted to have a glass of wine outside with a friend.  I had my service dog with me, however, there was only one table outside to sit at but there was another dog who tried to attack my dog nearby. So when we asked to sit inside, they refused to let us in with my service dog.  After a heated exchange, I was told "F" You" belittled and verbally attacked by several customers and the owner.  I was very appalled and would never recommend this place that was so condescending and refused our service.  I have the right to take my service dog wherever I go.  This is the most shocking appalling and disrespectful situation I've ever experienced at a public place!! Negative stars!!

reviews.author: Tina W.
reviews.description: Ethel's is the ideal place to meet friends for happy hour after a long day's duties.  (It's a great escape just before OR after the a massage appointment from down the walkway as well!) Fantastic selection of wines from around the world. But it's the atmosphere, the PEOPLE and POSITIVE vibes that attract me MOST to Ethel's Wine Market.  Lovely setting. Great selections. Sincere service.  5+STARS

reviews.author: Gina P.
reviews.description: This is the new location and rebrand of Lake Travis Wine Trader. Same warm and amazing staff, but in a modern and beautiful new setting. I love the classy Texas vibe-a perfect blend of feminine and masculine decor. The staff truly treat you like family. The wine selection is superb, with something delicious for every price point. Ethel's is a gift to the Lake Travis area.

reviews.author: Renee S.
reviews.description: Awesome service, fabulous atmosphere and delicious cheese plates.  We had a Galentine's Day group of friends celebration at Ethel's and what a celebration it was!  Their back room is a hidden gem-so cozy.  We shut the place down!  The choices are amazing.  A go to must in Lakeway!

reviews.author: Toni Y.
reviews.description: This is a hidden treasure in Lakeway. Staff was very knowledgeable and extremely friendly. Great wine selection. Warm and cozy atmosphere for one, couples or large group and events. My husband and I went on a day they had free chair massages. So that was a bonus! A must visit place in Lakeway

reviews.author: J H.
reviews.description: Love this wine market!!  Fantastic place for wine enthusiasts in Lakeway!

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Incredible selection, awesome lounge, great food and service!  The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and the space is perfect for entertainment.

reviews.author: Liza M.
reviews.description: Amazing wine bar in Steiner!  And they are open during this winter storm from 4-6 today.  They saved my day!  Hope they save yours too!  Shop local!  Everyone that works there is nice and helpful!

reviews.author: Niki S.
reviews.description: Where's my sixth star, I mean, glass of wine?! ;) Tucked away in the north Austin hills, this place is a gem, worth trekking over for if you have any excuse to be anywhere near it.  This is the type of place that a group could enjoy, a wine beginner wouldn't find intimidating, and a wine snob could also find something to please their pallet. Good selection of all types, but not intimidating.  THE STAFF ARE ALL SO FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL! I was given a few suggestions from the owner, and they were all so spot on, I loved every one I tried.   Love the clean but welcoming decor, and how everything feels approachable and interactive (Glasses for sale, books, etc) and there's even some outdoor seating for those feeling a fire pit (if memory serves correctly, but the night I was here, the rain kept everyone inside).   Bring some girls, a group, or just stop by on your way home for a friendly wine bar with the coziness that makes you want to curl up and order an entire bottle and chat with folks.

reviews.author: Sara S.
reviews.description: Steiner Ranch has been slow to develop despite its rapidly growing population so I was so happy to see a new wine bar open up. Sloan + Parker was the perfect place to catch up with my girl friends. We shared a bottle of Napa Cab, a charcuterie board and delightful conversation with the hosts. The decor is great, ambiance is fun and it was overall a nice experience. Sloan + Parker is a much needed addition to Steiner Ranch!

reviews.author: Jen R.
reviews.description: What an amazing experience and we can't wait to come back... weekly!  I'm from Indiana, husband from California. We moved here about 15 months ago and haven't found any amazing wines we enjoyed until today! Don't know if anyone else has had this issue in finding great wines, particularly Cabernet, in Texas, but we have! We came in and were welcomed with open arms and amazing conversation! In depth information of wines and tasting until we found the right glass to order.  After 15 months of living here we have finally found our "home" in regards to wine and friends! We will definitely  be back and can't wait to experience all they have to offer! Down to earth people and an experience you won't regret.  P.S. the decor is amazing!

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: A friend of mine that knows the owner and lives in Steiner invited me to a ladies night at this establishment. It was extremely loud and busy.  It is obvious that this area needs something like this.  As a woman owned business, I am happy to see it thrive.  Deep into Steiner Ranch, I am not sure people who live outside of the area would be seeking it out but worth the trip if you are into wine and want to check out the space.  Could be a good place for a celebration.  Steiner probably has enough people to support.  Rose, white, red, bubbles and brews.  Cheese plates.  You can buy bottles to take with you with various mustards, jams, etc in their pantry. Glad I got to experience this location and wish them all the luck moving forward.

reviews.author: Dani K.
reviews.description: Absolutely love Sloan + Parker. I'll admit that I'm pretty easy to please in the wine department, but I really do love all the wines I've tried! I appreciate that the wine list is ever changing and that the employees all do an amazing job with recommendations and descriptions. There is also a pretty large price range so you're able to choose a glass based on how much you'd like to spend, which is great for their range of customers. Now about the decor/atmosphere: I'd like to have my home designed to look similar to S+P. It's fun and new and modern but elegant and sophisticated at the same time. I wouldn't change a thing!   My favorite time to go is on a chilly evening. I love to be curled up by the fire on the patio with blankets (provided by S+P) and a big glass of cab with live music playing in the background. Come on! That's heaven!   Do yourself a favor and follow them on Facebook. They host great events, my favorite being Sip In SWEATS. You will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Kerry S.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! Peyton was an amazing host and knows the name of everyone that walks in. Incredible hospitality and ability to pinpoint you pallet to recommendations that will resonate with you. Hands down, five stars!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: Fantastic place. They have a really nice wine selection plus a solid draft list for those seeking beer. Service is fantastic and they bringing in rotating local musicians as well. Highly recommend S+P.

reviews.author: Eric N.
reviews.description: Locally owned business that knows wine!  My wife and I love coming here for a drink and a bite then leaving with a bottle.  Our go-to place in the neighborhood

reviews.author: Ashley M.
reviews.description: I love S+P! It has a chic yet comfortable atmosphere and stellar wine and beer selections. It's a great place for a night out with friends and also perfect for date night. The owner really knows her stuff too! If you need a recommendation she can give you so many amazing suggestions.

reviews.author: Nate P.
reviews.description: Love coming here to relax (inside or outside on the patio) and get some glasses of wine. There are delicious beer options as well. They also have some snacking plates (cheese, charcuterie) and some other treats. If you're feeling indecisive, you can taste a wine before buying a glass (I find their descriptions to be spot on and helpful), and there's usually a few wine flight options on rotation.

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Came out for a networking group and had a great time. Will be bringing my wife back. She would love this place!

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: Yasssss i love this place. Allison was super nice and she help educate us on wine and wine tasting. I love the atmosphere and its really laid back and relaxed  The wine is delicious, we ended up buying a couple of bottles. I would definitely recommend stopping by..

reviews.author: Lee S.
reviews.description: We had such a great time visiting here.  From the atmosphere (including music) to the lovely outdoor space to the artwork to the people - it was delicious all around.  Great Chardonnay BTW.  Totally a come back sorta place!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: This place was amazing! Since they knew it was my birthday they even gave me a free glass of champagne! Really fun stop on my birthday wine tour

reviews.author: Delores S.
reviews.description: I was winery hopping and I came across this winery by sheer accident. I'm so glad that it happened! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable and took care of my friend and I. We had a wine tasting for $15 and we were quite impressed. Try the Sangiovese. It is so refined!  This winery is right on Hwy 290, so you can't miss it. Explore this gem!

reviews.author: Phillip M.
reviews.description: Nice atmosphere. Their sweets are very sweet their Seriously Red and Petite Verdot are okay. The art is worth the stop!

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: Amazing staff. They catered to us and even went the extra mile to try the petit Verdot. They definitely emphasize the customer experience. The sangria, Petit Verdot and Cabernet were good.  I didn't try too many it their sweet wines although there were quite a few. The ambiance is laid back and there is some artwork to take in as well as a small charcuterie plate and maybe something else, I'm not quite sure. Definitely swing by and check these guys out on your trek along 290. Plus it's close to 281 so it's an easy first. Happy tasting!!

reviews.author: Eloy G.
reviews.description: Visited this place on our own little wine tour and we were greeted and welcomed by Alison. She allowed us to sample some wines before purchasing and we really liked the laid back and nice atmosphere. We purchased a couple of wines a sweet red and a peach from Georgetown. I wound definitely recommend visiting this place if you are in the area or are driving through.

reviews.author: Laura R.
reviews.description: I have been to a few Texas wineries and this place was AMAZING! You can try the grapes (if they haven't been harvested) and you get a fun crash course in the science of wine making. Plus, their POUR CHOICES dessert wine was delish!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: Such an amazing winery!  The staff was super friendly and accommodating.  We were here with a wine tour for a girlfriends birthday.  The owner brought her a glass of champagne for her bday which was super nice.  All of the wines here are pretty delicious.  There wasnt one that I didnt like.  They have a large indoor and outdoor area which is super accommodating.  All in all a great experience.

reviews.author: Byron V.
reviews.description: Great stop. Best of the day!!!  If you like red wine. Great live music and workers that over pour. This is a must stop

reviews.author: Mai Thao N.
reviews.description: This is a fairy new winery that we got to explore with the Wino Texas winery tour. We all got 5 tokens each for 5 tastings. I'm personally a red drinker and the wines here were pretty decent. If you're a sweet drinker I personally recommend the Black Cherry

reviews.author: Kayla B.
reviews.description: Had a wonderful experience here. Was immediately greeted by the owner who talked to us about our tasting choices. Down to earth owners will always bring back business!

reviews.author: Lourdes L.
reviews.description: Quaint place, inside was minimal and modern but inviting.  We went here for a wine tasting, our family's first.  The lady, who we probably annoyed in the beginning, really helped us understand the process and gave us tips on wine tasting.  She was very accommodating and personable.  We tasted the entirety of the tasting menu.  We were also glad the place was not as busy.  There were 9 of us and enjoyed the place.  We were a little disappointed because we waited for the scheduled musician to come but cancelled last minute.  However, the rating is for the wine and the experience and the lady who gave us her time and patience. All deserve an A+.

reviews.author: Hope B.
reviews.description: Cute little stop in Johnson City. Good selection of wine and great atmosphere. It was mucky when we went but I imagine the outdoor area is fantastic to hang out in.

reviews.author: Leslie C.
reviews.description: Big selection of wines decent prices on wine bottles Not their wine/vineyard but others from Texas Oregon California and international. For those sweet wine drinkers - they have a tasting list for you. $15 for 5 tasting but check in on social media get 6th tasting free. Happy hour 3-6 $5 glass of wine.

reviews.author: Luis M.
reviews.description: This was am amazing experience! Warren is a very experienced teacher, we had the best time with him. He was very knowledgeable and worked with us in instructing us the techniques of proper wine tasting. :) You gotta come experience this yourself.

reviews.author: Tiffani D.
reviews.description: Nice winery they just relocated to a bigger newer place very clean and open would be a great place for a party....... really great people running it ... Wine was really nice we just bought a glass want to go back to do a tasting .

reviews.author: Dawn C.
reviews.description: Great place to relax, listen to music and try a variety of wines. The staff is friendly and the building is full of art that looks gorgeous lit by the light from the plate glass windows.

reviews.author: Brooklyn W.
reviews.description: Unsure of how I learned about this place, but I'm so glad I did! It was a little chilly outside so my friend and I opted to sit inside. This location was decorated so beautifully and the staff was knowledgeable and friendly. I loved that each wine choice had a clear description of what we should expect. I so look forward to trying this location in the Summer for all the Summer time events! Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Patricia L.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful winery with great service and amazing wine selections. I came here for a private event to celebrate a friends birthday party. The venue has great outdoor space. A lot of open area with seating. Also a great covered area for music acts and dancing. One thing I noticed right away while sitting outside was NO BUGS. The whole time we did not get bit by a single mosquito. The lawn is treated well. They also have a nice layout indoors. Great bar area for wine pouring and a large room that can be a private space.   Wine selections ranged from sweet to dry. I really enjoyed the Pink Sky Rose, it's sweet and easily my favorite. I mostly kept with that selection for the birthday party.   I will be coming back to experience as a customer and partake in the tasting and music acts. It's also important for me to celebrate and support Black woman owned businesses.

reviews.author: Virginia G.
reviews.description: My friend invited me to hang out. It's such a peaceful drive out there to begin with.  It's not a hard place to find. The gps takes you straight there.   The owner is super sweet. She took the time to come to our table and greet us. Make sure to ask us how everything was going and how we liked things.  She took the time to recommend some wines and go over the different textures and flavors.  I'm not a wine person myself but my friend and her mom are. I definitely learned a lot from them.  We purchased a charcuterie board, it came with cheese , nuts and a super delicious olive jalapeños thing! MY GOD that was delicious.  Did I mention it is a veteran owned , black owned , women business ?! Whooooooo as if It couldn't get better.  But to makeIt better , it is SO peaceful out there Definitely recommend to check out.

reviews.author: Nila M.
reviews.description: Would've loved to give a better review; however, I simply can't. To start the positives, the place is beautiful and clean. Plus the ambiance was upbeat. On the other side, no one explained the different types of wines that we tasted like most wineries do: type of grapes, region, age of the wine, etc. The wine was served in shot glasses. I mean--this is a winery and wine should be served in wine glasses. Most of the wines I had were bitter. If the winery can make a few changes it would be a much better experience. Otherwise, I much more preferred the other wineries that provide the full wine  experience. Room for improvement here!!

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: We learned about this winery from an article and decided we needed to visit. We were greeted by friendly employees and the owner. We did a 6 wine tasting and really enjoyed all the varieties of wine. The charcuterie board was perfect as well. The menu includes several options of charcuterie. We enjoyed our afternoon and returned for the live music in the evening. We appreciated the friendly atmosphere this winery offered. It is the perfect way to enjoy a beautiful autumn Saturday.

reviews.author: Consuelo D.
reviews.description: Can't wait to return!!! Love the atmosphere and the delish wine !!! We went to celebrate for Father's Day !!! Friendly staff and owner !!!

reviews.author: Kate H.
reviews.description: We went out last Friday with a group of friends for a private tasting! Everyone In our party had a blast, Sheila and Christine were so friendly and taught us a lot about wine. Thank you for an incredible kick off to an amazing weekend!

reviews.author: Lucille T.
reviews.description: This is a great place to get away from it all.  A friend wanted to go here to celebrate her birthday so two couples made the trek from San Antonio and we had a wonderful time. The staff was attentive, friendly and answered our questions  with a smile. We ordered the cheese and Italian meat  tray and the chicken skewers and everything was very tasty.   On the Sunday evening we were there, a gentleman was playing some very smooth jazz and adding to the relaxed atmosphere.  The owner came and offered us free samples of some Moscato that had just been finished. It was delicious.  Last but not least, since the owner is a veteran, she offers a military discount on the food.

reviews.author: Jennifer R.
reviews.description: We were looking to try out a couple of new wineries over Labor Day Weekend. This popped up on a Google search. For the tasting, you can choose four wines for $15 or six wines for $20. They are doing all tastings outside so that social distancing can be maintained and they brought all six wines out as a flight. Service was attentive and friendly and all servers were wearing masks. The wines were on the sweet side for my taste (I prefer dry, bold reds). They had a small selection of small plates (charcuterie, dips with vegetables, and pizza). My only reason for giving four stars was the pizza was a cheap frozen pizza that they heated up. We enjoyed the experience and supporting a new winery that opened up during a pandemic.

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: Had a wonderful time at this winery. Even though the tasting room wasn't open, my boyfriend and I sat outside and enjoyed our time. My favorite wine was the Pink Sky Rose. It's not too dry and just enough sweetness.

reviews.author: Kimberly L.
reviews.description: Friendly owner and hostess. Lovely grounds, and of course great wines. Worth the visit.

reviews.author: Pat Q.
reviews.description: I so wanted to give them a 5 star rating  and it truly would have been if they had a better wine selection. The venue is clean, and beautifully decorated. Service was good. Set up makes it easy to socially distance from others. Easy to order snacks from menu.  The one thing that was the deal breaker for me is that their tasting menu offered 7 wines yet all were VERY dry. There was one sweet one listed but sold out. I scheduled a group tasting for 13. Most of the people in my group made it through 4-6 tastings w/o finishing and absolutely no one made a wine purchase and that says a lot.

reviews.author: K R.
reviews.description: My granddaughters were in town from Houston.  We decided to do a local wine tour of three small wineries to help small businesses.  We were seated on the patio which was comfortable.  There isn't a vineyard onsite which detracted from the experience.  The Chardonnay was very good.  Smooth with just the right balance of dry to sweet.  We wanted to love this place as it is veteran owned and the owner was quite friendly.  The waitress was socially awkward at best.  She wasn't able to answer questions about the wine or small plates.  When we asked for more crackers for the artichoke dip and hummus we were told they're pre-packaged so we couldn't have more.  I was certainly willing to pay but that was not an option.  I hope this was a unique experience and they will be successful.

reviews.author: Gary J.
reviews.description: Wine tasting poured in plastic pill cups, and not even once ounce pours. Poor quality wines. Nice atmosphere. They don't accept cash or America Express. Don't waste your time or money.

reviews.author: Toni G.
reviews.description: Super cute winery up 281. I met the owner and her daughter and it made me love the winery even more. Friendly, kind sweet staff. I can't wait to go back  and try more wine

reviews.author: Sara H.
reviews.description: Sheila is amazing, her wine is delicious, her personality is fantastic and her winery is beautiful. Plus she has live music on a beautiful Saturday. My friends and I are enjoying a delicious bottle of Pink Sky on the patio and are having a wonderful time :)

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: What a great experience! Sheila is amazing. The tasting was wonderful and her Rose is delicious on this beautiful day. They were so welcoming and took the time talk with us about their winery. We'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Kisha W.
reviews.description: Amazing amazing amazing winery! Very personable relaxed atmosphere. The winery is beautifully designed and decorated, and the wine is awesome Definitely a best kept secret. I can't wait to go back!!

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Time to celebrate another birthday and boy I love this place. I want to go in a date and romance myself lol!!!!   You are allowed to bring in our own food and we bought plenty of bottles of wine and a cake to celebrate my girlfriend 35th birthday

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: I came here for a wine tasting with my sisters over the weekend.  The staff was friendly, conversational, funny, and engaging.  The wine was delicious and the charcuterie board was nice about $25.  They were bottling wine there in the store which was neat to watch and they would talk to customers about the process.  They have some cute instagramable conversation spaces for seating.

reviews.author: Amy Q.
reviews.description: Super helpful and friendly staff and yummy wine options! We were able to taste several options and guided along the way.  Love this place!!!

reviews.author: Genel M.
reviews.description: It's a lot of fun to go with friends, share  a cheese plate and trade sips from flights of wine. Good way to discover new wines.

reviews.author: Jessica E.
reviews.description: Such a cool joint! Went twice in one weekend! There are many choices and no headaches to go with the wine!

reviews.author: Kaila W.
reviews.description: I love this place! My friend and I decided to stop here on our way back to Austin after a long day of being in the sun and swimming at blue hole in Wimberley. We were a bit skeptical because of its limited reviews on yelp but I'm so glad we went and tried it out. Their wine is great, their flights are customized to your individual pallet, and their charcuterie board is to die for. If you go during the summer be sure to try their peach/apricot wine. I thought it would be way too sweet for my liking but it was a great refreshing summer drink! They are located in a small development that also has a few shops, a bakery, and Nate's coffee and cocktails right next to it... and we can't forget, this place is only two blocks from Louies barbecue

reviews.author: Hayley B.
reviews.description: Owner is very friendly and approachable. The inside is beautiful with huge windows and fun lounge furniture. They also have a patio! Loved the wine we tasted and had a good cheese board accompanying it.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: Cool and casual atmosphere with lots of options.  From the very dry red to very sweet white and everything in between.   A tasting is reasonable and you can make your own menu or the Water 2 Wine team can put one together for you based on what you tend to like.  Then get a glass of your fave and hang out.  Cool casual atmosphere and a great way to start off any night!

reviews.author: Aubrey P.
reviews.description: So happy this place is here! Beautiful interior and great wine! Went for the first time this weekend, and recommend The Carrington for a wonderfully smooth red

reviews.author: Andrea S.
reviews.description: We are visiting from out of town for my best friend's birthday, and this was our first stop! It was close by to where we are staying and a perfect little shop! We did the wine tasting (for 5 people) and 2 charcuterie boards while we relaxed in a cozy lounge area and learned about the winery from the owner! The owner is delightful and very happy to provide an experience for us while in shop

reviews.author: Sherry H.
reviews.description: Our favorite cozy wine tasting room.  Ms. Raven is very accommodating for small gatherings and wine is quite good. We will be going back.

reviews.author: Tati S.
reviews.description: Friendly and very knowledgeable about the product..  Read all the reviews before coming in and I must say they are very accurate ..got us some wine to go and a free taste of all other wines. Thank you

reviews.author: Lora D.
reviews.description: Just spent a wonderful day at this winery. I can't speak to the wine, as I'm not really a wine drinker, but the others had multiple glasses and brought bottles home with them. Judith tried to find a wine for me and I ended up with a nice WHITE sangria. How great to find a white one as red unfortunately gives me headaches. We all sat around, drank, talked, ate and just had a great time. Those lemon almonds just melted in my mouth. Never had those before and want more. Judith had two nice nut, cheese and meat plates for us to nibble. So warm and welcoming like you were in the home of a friend. Look forward to stopping in once again.

reviews.author: Tyler F.
reviews.description: Amazing owner. Wine is Fantastic!! Our favorite was the tannat (purple). The wine was Smokey and fruity. Very unique and very good. Ask about the books!

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: Stopped in here briefly and met Judith the the owner, who talked to us about her vineyard and her wines. We were able to do a tasting and took home a bottle of her Tempranillo. Cute little spot, definitely worth a visit!

reviews.author: Mike And Robin C.
reviews.description: Blanco has many local, historic, and natural charms to this little town in the Hill Country.  Now, it has something people will talk about more when they go to Blanco...a charming winery! Opened since this past April, owner Judith Raven is no stranger to the Texas grape and wine world. For almost 20 years, she has been experimenting with grape growing in the Hill Country near Spring Branch.  The estate has about 6 acres of grape vines planted and is known for Sauvignon Blanc, Tempranillo, and Merlot. The logo on the bottles, a raven, is a nod to the owner's last name. When we visited, there were six wines featured on their tasting menu. The 2018 Sauvignon Blanc is sourced from Sierra Foothills AVA until the Texas Sauvignon Blanc grapes are ready. It is quite crisp with some distinct peach notes. The 2017 Hill Country Tannat is quite smooth with ripe strawberry and jam flavors. The 2017 Texas High Plains Tempranillo features more spice with a smooth finish. You'll be delighted and quite happy with the 2014 Petite Syrah/Sangiovese blend.  Sourced from Reddy Vineyards, it is still drinking quite well. It is bold with nice tannic structure and is well balanced.  The last Esperanza wine is a sweet Orange Muscat. Source from the Texas High Plains, it hits the spot when temperatures heat up during the last three months of the year!  There is also a wine from Fly Gap that you can try called Cowboy Way.  It is for those who enjoy something bold and strong in a red.  We enjoyed visiting with Judith's daughter and hearing how they came up with the name for the winery. The name Esperanza comes from Judith's childhood and relates to many good things that came with that name on her life's journey, starting with living on a street named such. Now, Blanco has more good things going for it with the addition of this winery in the area. Inside the tasting room one will find tables and assorted cozy areas to sit and sip and relax as they enjoy their visit. There are also tables and chairs outside to enjoy the lovely warm fall temperatures of late.  There is new artwork on the walls for sale by local artists making the space even more inviting and interesting. All in all, the space makes you feel right at home. Stop by and check it out for yourself. You just might find some new wines you enjoy and make sure to keep checking in from time to time, because there are more wines planned to be released.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Mike B.
reviews.description: My wife and I went to Bella Vista Ranch for a 4th of July tour with lunch, and we found it to be terrific value for the money. There was a nice lunch from a food truck (the name of which eludes me, unfortunately) followed by an interesting talk about the history of olive oil and the origins of the Italian family farm dating back to the second century BCE. The owner explained how he established Bella Vista on the ancient Roman model and described the modifications he has made to make olives grow in Texas. Then we toured the olive orchard and learned about the different varieties of grapes grown on the property. We saw the processing room containing the "frantoio" or olive press as well as the vats where this year's wines are aging. We then tasted several oils as well as four glasses of wine per person. All this for $25 (the regular tour without lunch is only $15).  Oils, vinegars, wines and soaps are available for sale. These are pretty expensive (e.g. $18+ for 250ml of their basic Texas Blend oil), but I don't mind paying those prices for high-quality locally produced specialty goods. This is a fascinating day out, which I recommend wholeheartedly.  Pro tip: If you're coming from San Antonio, take I-35 instead of US 281 and the back roads. We were expecting a relaxing drive in the country, but construction and traffic made it a stressful trip. Coming back on 35 was a joy by comparison!

reviews.author: Ann S.
reviews.description: So, so rude. The olive oil and vinegar are excellent, but the experience was ruined by the lady--the one everyone complains of here. The hours on Sunday are until 4. I get there at 3:25, and she walks past me with her whiny, demanding voice telling me that they close at 3:30. Uh, wanna put that on your website as your updated hours?  I went in anyway. The gentleman doing the oil tasting was knowledgeable and helpful. He told the lady to close the gate.  You know, what a non-stupid person would do should they slothfully decide to close early since they dont work for a living.  My mother was incredibly upset by this lady's rudeness. When you run a service like this, you stay open until you no longer have a good flow of customers. Closing is at 4? Hi, if a bunch of people are coming in at 3:30 thru 4:00, you keep working. Lazy Texas people who inherited their property and think they work hard by paying others to harvest their crop and bottle it. Meritocracy, right? They are the class of people who make this state an impoverished mess.    Don't run a customer service business dependent upon people stopping by on a lark like a fascist regime. You don't get to do that. Then again, when you dont have a legitimate concern about how you pay your bills, i guess you can just work until you get bored with the whole work thing.   Go sell wholesale if you hate customers. Working for yourself does not mean you get any more freedom. You have are dependent on good will. And you don't have mine.  The lady tried to make up for her garbage attitude when i made my purchase. You know what? Have a blessed day, lady. A.BLESSED.DAY.  Tl;dr. There are other puveyors of Texas olive oil, particularly in south Texas. Do not waste your wine tasting trip here. If you want to support local, consider others who are hard-working enough to sell their products in Central Market.

reviews.author: B F.
reviews.description: We took the tour here three years ago and had a decent experience. Customer service was nothing special but not bad. The olive oil was excellent. Went back last weekend just to buy a few bottles and there was a group tasting inside. The lady who met us was terse and short with us, and the oil lacked the punch we're accustomed to from fresh oil. It was ironic to listen to the speaker discussing the peppery flavor of the oil when it was completely absent this year. Maybe it's an off year. But one thing was the same: it's not a welcoming place at all. They seem to be put out by visitors. They really don't seem to want kids there at all, even when they are standing still and quietly listening.   We've had far better experiences, and far better olive oil, in Dripping Springs at Texas Hill Country Olive Oil. Night and day difference.

reviews.author: Jennifer B.
reviews.description: Such a great tour. We failed to check the tour time and arrived a little late but they let us join the tour and tasting. It was terrific! The tour and history of olives was really interesting. Definitely try the balsamic and infused oils. The wine tasting was pretty brief compared to the olive portion but great none the less. The wines are dryer, not sweet. I thought they were great. A lot of the other local wineries wines are very sweet, but I really enjoyed these! You should absolutely plan to visit if in the area.

reviews.author: Teresa D.
reviews.description: Very limited services. I walked in to see if this facility was appropriate for sitting outside for a tasting. I was immediately met at the door because there was a "tour" in progress. There was no other option other to join the tour that was already in progress. The woman that met me right at the door was very un-hospitable.   The inside smells absolutely delicious, full of olive oil.  The grounds were beautiful.

reviews.author: Marina R.
reviews.description: Worst service ever. Mistreated. Was watched the entire time. Before I could even ask a question about the wine or olives, an employee firmly told me as she was finishing up with another set of customers that "I don't have time to answer your questions."  She then proceeded to hard sell our group to pay $10 for the "last minute" tour. And, to add insult to injury, as 2 of the 4 of us completed their purchases, both employees proceeded to exit the store and watch us walk to our vehicle and  drive off. I will never spend a dollar at your business.  Good luck to you.

reviews.author: Krystle M.
reviews.description: Amazing olive oil. Wine was good but pourer was either grumpy or just to the point?! 5 samples, but we shared a tasting. Not worth the $10 as the pours were barely a "splash." You couldn't enjoy the swirl sniff taste ...

reviews.author: Kerry C.
reviews.description: We went here twice. The first time we went we had a group of 6 and showed up about 15 minutes before they closed. The guy there suggested we go to another place. He just didn't want to serve us so we left.   The second time we went there were 4 of us and it was in the middle of the day. While the wine is fine, the server was the single most rude person I've ever encountered at a winery. Just astounding how she could be that rude for the duration of the wine tasting. I will never go back and suggest no one ever go there. You cant drink the wine fast enough to over come they workers rudeness.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: We liked the olive oil a lot.  However... I think the "thorn" of this place is the owner.  He seems rather joyless in making something that could ideally fulfill the soul.  His 1 1/2 hour (yes, it's long) "tour" is mostly comprised of the history of the Olive, snarky political opinions, braggary of his past career in Silicone Valley, and a hatred for Texas AandM.   Not a place to take a kid. Seriously.  We sat and listened to him for well over an hour then briefly stood under two olive trees, looked at another one that was hurt in a storm, looked at the press machinery, and then did a "tasting." Like I said, the oil was good. I got the impression that the lady helping in the gift shop/tasting room didn't want to be there either. Basically I was confused why this man (and his 5th wife...no lie) were running this business and opening it to the public.  I walked away a little sad that something so wonderful like successfully growing beautiful trees to make a solid product could be reduced to something so joyless.

reviews.author: Alana C.
reviews.description: We were warned at great length that we could not even look at our cell phones during the tour which seemed odd when people might have a kid or babysitter or be waiting on something important from work to come through--I mean we are all adults...but I soon found out why.  Far less than an entertaining traditional tour, you sit and listen to someone talk more like a college class lecture, but with way too many rabbit trails of information that eventually make you tune out.  Like what a certain blizzard is called in different parts of the world, how accounting dates back to the Romans, etc.  I am passionate about olive oils and wine but learned too much about history and every other subject to even focus on what I wanted to know about olive oil. Or feel entertained.  The group I was with concurred.   There are 3 types of learners: auditory, visual, and tactile and the class is entirely sit and listen to one man talk for half of it then stand and listen by a tree then a press for the other half. So only appealing to auditory learners. And no audience engagement during the lecture.  At the end you actually get to see and touch. But they had no bread for us so we had to drink an olive oil and talk about it for 30 more minutes so I left before I tasted the other flavored oils as it had already been a full day of just listening to way too much info to retain.  In a very strict manner rather than entertaining with audience engagement.  And strict rules.  Obviously people tune out and begin looking at their cell phones so that's why they don't allow them.  Rather than making the tour entertaining so you dont' want to--It was in the hot sun as well so it was pretty miserable.  The olive oil was good but I've had better, it was a bit weak to me, we did the wine tasting as well and those were not acceptable to me.  I actually would recommend skipping the tour and talking to the staff as you taste the olive oil because they knew all of the information given on the tour without the lengthy side notes of things that should be shaved off for entertainment value.  And that's really the best part.    I don't think they like people very much though to be honest.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: I will never recommend this place to ANYONE! The main older lady was very rude to my parents, as well as the other couple in front of us. I regret not reading the reviews before coming here because everyone is saying the same thing. We did a wine tasting (which was $10) and were barely served anything. My husband and I both left this place wondering how they are still in business. The wine was super expensive (not good at all), and they have horrible customer service. Listen to these reviews, people!

reviews.author: Jim L.
reviews.description: I can't believe only 5 people have reviewed this ranch. I have been back four times now and each time come away with a little more understanding of the narrative that is offered. While I purchased my typical bottles of olive oil - some for myself, some for holiday gifts - I did also indulge in some olive oil based soaps.   The olives and oil are fabulous. I am not as great a fan of their wines. They are not awful, just not with the properties I care for, typically. The in-laws found a favorite to take home, though.  The tour is still $10 and includes the wine tasting, which is a good deal.  Bottles of oil range from $16-$27 each, depending on size.  Soap is $6.99 a bar.  They also feature balsamic vinegars (not made there) and jars of olives, which are delightful as well.

reviews.author: Ashley F.
reviews.description: Do not judge a book by its cover. Take one look at Jack and the humble grounds here at Bella Vista, and you'd never guess that he has olive friends he emails with back in Italy or that he can tell you all you'd ever want to know about the science and technique behind growing and processing olives.  I would highly recommend the tour - while there isn't much walking involved in this tour, my husband and I found it to be highly informative. And with Jack's red-blooded Texan sense of humor, it was a very entertaining education. Be sure to note the times of the tour (Sat @ 10am and 1pm, and Sun @ noon) since it's a group setup.   After the tour comes a tasting of several types of olive oil produced on site along with some of their balsamic vinegar offerings. While they also have wine offered, I'd recommend sticking with the olive oil - clearly what they specialize in. If you're only interested in tasting the oils/wines (not the tour), it's probably good to avoid arriving at the tasting room about an hour after each tour start since the tasting room isn't overly large and tends to fill up easily with the folks coming off the tour.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: The speaker was very very rude.  Very long winded.  Made a point to tell us about his great computer career in California.  Do not go with children.  Was quite disappointed with this trip.

reviews.author: Alison T.
reviews.description: Super disappointed in the customer service.  Both the lady and the gentleman that run the place were very rude and short with us.  Their products are not made by them in Wimberley and when asked about that they became extremely defensive.  Beautiful place that has a lot of potential if they were friendly and cared about the experience people want from that kind of place... but the vibe is anything but friendly and welcoming.   When they started to bash a particular presidential candidate it killed it for us. Keep your opinions out of your business. Don't bother would be my recommendation.

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Who here likes an hour and a half talk ab everything I ever learned ever?? If you raised your hand then step right up, produce $15 and hold on to your hat!  It went on so damn long I wanted to ask for a hall pass just to sneak to my car.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: A hidden mecca of olives.  In central Texas.  The Bella Vista Ranch was designed as a traditional Italian family farm and features the first commercially grown olives in Texas.  And the olives I sampled are Texas size and Texas good.  Apparently the crowd favorite is the bleu cheese stuffed olive.  We sampled a garlic stuffed olive that was really good.  The ranch also offers delicious balsamic vinegars and olive oils which go for around $17 a bottle.  My lips slurped the Fig Vanilla Balsamic over and over again.  I am sure I was sample cheating but that stuff is incredible.     This is also a working winery that produces several red and white varieties plus a Natural Blackberry Wine!  Yum.  Wine tastings are $5/per person.  I think the owner has a great thing going for him and a beauty of a property. Tours of the orchard happen on the weekend and include a wine tasting for $10/per person.

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: While I thought it was pretty interesting to learn about and taste boutique olive oil (as I'd never been to an olive ranch before) $15 per person does seem a little high when the actual tour is quite short and obviously the intention is that you're going to buy some stuff at the end, and all that stuff is small batch and quite pricey (understandably so.)  So it ends up  being more like $100 for two people when you include the olive oil you will want to buy plus the wine you might want to buy (some people seem to think it sucks, we liked some of it.)  But you will leave with a buzz on and some delicious olive oils!  The owners were away so their daughter gave the tour; I thought she was pretty funny and personable but there were some questions she couldn't answer but it was really no big deal (and she wasn't super long winded like the owner seems to be  but of course some people like that and some people don't.) It's also probably better when there are olives on the trees but it was still overall pretty interesting to see the different trees different olives grow up and hear some history and facts about olive oil production.  I liked hearing about the process and seeing the machinery. And of course I liked tasting the fresh olive oil, which was indeed super tasty and surprisingly spicy. Most of their oils are made from all different olives smushed together but they have one variety that's just made with one kind of olive which we got to try. They also had a blood orange infused oil that I'm now obsessed with; we bought some and later made some asparagus on the grill that had been rubbed with the oil, it was the most delicious asparagus ever! We also enjoyed the wine; we are not wine snobs in any way but we enjoyed what we had and bought a bottle just  because it's the polite thing to do. We sat out on the bench in front of the tasting room and enjoyed our wines and just had a lovely afternoon.   I will say that it gets a little hectic in the tasting room when people come in just for a tasting after a tour- I would say if you want just a tasting, don't come between 1:30-2:30 because it's going to get confusing!

reviews.author: Lyra S.
reviews.description: The tour was all talking with a look at a tree or two and a look at some equipment. If you want to hear the entire history of olives then this is for you. Personally I was falling asleep. The tour guide was rude and narcissistic.

reviews.author: Leigh M.
reviews.description: The couple who own this place are fantastic characters. The wife is sweet and talkative.
