She was delighted to hear that we moved out here from San Francisco (that's where she grew up but couldn't  stand the fog). The husband is an old curmudgeon, but delightfully so. He worked in high-tech in Silicon Valley and moved out his last company to Austin in the early 90s, eventually leaving to grow olives and make wine.   it's not always the case that you visit a winery and the owners pour for you, so that was a treat. They are a very small production and a bit off the beaten path, so it was pretty quiet there too. A small group arrived just as we were leaving, but it was nothing like the bustling tasting rooms at nearby Driftwood Cellars.  The blackberry wine is actually good--you wouldn't necessarily guess that it's made of blackberry not grapes. And the other three reds we tasted were also nice.

name: The OASIS on Lake Travis
accommodations: Garage Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Eva D.
reviews.description: Quiet a disappointment, to be honest. Not sure what exactly was I expecting when we came here. Pretty much all venues were closed, which makes me believe it is a weekend spot. Unless you are there to eat, you will just be walking aimlessly around. Not a bad thing, but as I said, for some reason I was expecting more. They views, however, did not disappoint.   We didn't eat there and my review is solely on the grounds and whatever they offer outside the restaurant.

reviews.author: Arkee B.
reviews.description: How easy for the white people to just switch tables huh? We were seated directly under the sun and I requested to be switched to shaded area its was 95 degrees out, I was asked to go downstairs and ask to switch table and was told I have to go back in line by Ashley. We waited for an hour to get our table.   The white people seated in the same spot and they just switched tables right away, with no trouble. We stayed where we are seated by the way. This place is a big joke. Food were also just ok and overpriced.   Thanks to Thomas our server, the only good thing that happened with our visit.   My mom were also visiting from Italy and found this place hilarious.

reviews.author: Jv V.
reviews.description: I've been visiting this place for 6 years the beer is consistently great, the quality of food so fresh. Incredible view and different atmospheres. Definitely a destination while visiting Austin.  I played a music show today for SXSW and I highly re one that it for mostly any kind of music  Very friendly and charm crew!

reviews.author: Zivanka G.
reviews.description: The staff was friendly, fast, efficient, and over all everything about this was a wonderful experience and the view was absolutely amazing even if it was a bit cold out.   Fajitas came out hot and sizzling, drinks were well made and super tasty and we enjoyed everything about it. I will absolutely come here again. And you should visit if you're near lake Travis.

reviews.author: Chris F.
reviews.description: Okay so you don't go here for the drinks ($12 "hurricanes" that put me in a sugar coma), you don't go here for the food (microwaved food for $20+ a plate) you come here for the camp atmosphere and the view!   The tea is this, you wanna bring out of town guests here, have a group event etc, it's a restaurant that has a gift shop, so know what you're getting into here. It was fun and worth a visit. What was even more exciting was finding a dairy free ice cream Shop on site!

reviews.author: Ryan T.
reviews.description: We hadn't been to The Oasis since 2005 before the original one burned down, so it was wild to see how much it's grown and changed. We went with low expectations considering what we'd read about the food and cocktails, but we weren't disappointed. Is it great food? No, but there are decent options on the menu (beef fajitas and the chicken pecan salad were winners). The Beau's Plate salad and enchiladas weren't as good. Service was outstanding, and so was the view.

reviews.author: Hernan V.
reviews.description: Just for the view that's it. My wife order a Mojito and it was terrible we told the waitress that it had no alcohol. " it has 2 shoots"  Will it's water down. Food we did not order just appetizers. For my Daughter kids menu quesadillas with fries. Fries were cold. After all the bad reviews we read of this place we just went here for the view.

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: ON LAKE TIME!   It was my last day in Austin and my brother wanted t show me something a little out of the ordinary. We had just been going shopping oh and drinking. I wanted to experience the nature side of Austin.   The Oasis on Lake Travis was the place for us to venture out too. My brother said he had not been to it before, but wanted to try it.   To my surprise it was something grand. Absolutely gorgeous views of the lake and the more upscale houses Austin has to offer.   My brother and my parents had had a bite to eat prior to coming here, but I had not. I went shopping a the Domain and they had gone eating. From what I have heard, The Oasis is good for drinking, but not so good for eating. Their food is honestly sub par at best.   We ordered some drinks and chips and guac for the table. But I wanted something a little more in my stomach. I got the grilled shrimp tacos. They were good. But I have definitely had better. The only thing was that they were super spicy. I was not expecting them to be that spicy. All of a sudden my tongue was sweating and I was uncomfortable with that.   This is a must stop for the views. The views are outstanding. But the food was not the best. The mojito I had was strong. It was like one sip and I was already feeling it.

reviews.author: Terri B.
reviews.description: Oasis, oh how I love you.   I've been coming to the Oasis for years, literally my whole life. It has always been amazing, and they have expanded it considerably since the fire. The outdoor decks are sprawling, so many places to take in that view. And y'all, it had the absolute most stunning view of Lake Travis.   I just lost my father and was in need of an escape and some fresh air. Today I brought my dad's convertible mustang out (I MAY have gone kinda fast) to have lunch on this perfect blue bird day. I definitely felt his presence out here with me.   My server was so friendly and had the best customer service. I really enjoyed her serving me. I ordered a swirl margarita and chips and queso which were delivered quickly. For lunch I had a mixed fajita with steak and shrimp, refried beans and the fixings. Food was delicious.   I love the art they have installed around the restaurant. Really gorgeous bronze sculptures and we'll appointed gardens.   Thank you for a perfect experience.

reviews.author: Robert E.
reviews.description: Went for dinner here last night with a colleague! I was honestly kind of worried based off of the reviews that the food wasn't going to be good. The area has changed so much since I was here 20 years ago, it's almost like a little city around the restaurant of stores and even what looked like a little hotel and parking garage.    Anyways the view was of course amazing, known as the sunset capital of Texas, it def lives up to that, we even were able to see a plane land in the water to watch the sunset which was really cool!  As for the drink! I had the tropical depression which was sweet and fruity and perfect for the atmosphere! We both ordered the fajitas and I'm going to say they were some of the best fajitas I've had in years, quality meat like actually real skirt steak in nice sized strips with great quality thick chicken breast strips! Queso was great! Salsa was great! Chips were great! I really couldn't have asked for anything to be better.   Don't always go by the reviews is what my moral of the story was because you might be surprised!

reviews.author: Jenny F.
reviews.description: Paying for the view  Place: It's a good place for family trip or just get together. The restaurant is surrounded by shops like coffee, ice cream, clothes , candies, photo hub and a lot more. BUT the most magnetizing place here is the view of the lake and the sunset.   Food: The food was not that special but became one because of the view and people/person you are with. Honestly if only the food we rating here, I'll give 3 not bad but not good as well.   Also expect long wait/line for the restaurant. While waiting we roamed around so we didn't really got bored. There's lot of shops and artist that offer their services like, caricature drawing.

reviews.author: Jim H.
reviews.description: The Oasis is great for outdoor dining and has an amazing view of Lake Travis, especially during a sunset.  A couple of weeks ago, I visited Austin for a quick weekend getaway.  A small group of us came out for lunch and we didn't have to wait long because it was an early lunch and the weather was a bit cold.    PROS:  Even though the water level was a bit low, the view of Lake Travis was AMAZING!  Make sure to sit outside to be able to enjoy the view.  During the summer, it's worth it to make reservations during the sunset to get the most out of your experience.  The wait staff are super friendly and are attentive to all your needs.  CONS:  I will echo some of the other reviews on here and say the food is mediocre Tex-Mex at best.  We ordered the shrimp tacos, fish tacos and beef fajitas.  The tacos are decently seasoned, but the rice and beans are a bit bland and the dish overall was a bit cold.  The fajitas did come out nice and hot and the meat was seasoned well.  I will definitely be ordering the fajitas for the next time.  The drinks and desserts we ordered:  an Irish coffee, the Fantasy Chocolate Cake (which is a flourless chocolate) and the flan.  The Chocolate cake was surprisingly delicious while the flan was a bit too thick for my liking, but the flavor is really good.  The area surrounding the restaurant also has eclectic artwork to look at as well as small retail shops to explore.  Due to Covid each store has limited hours so you may want to call ahead to see if they're open.  Overall, it's a great area to sight see in Austin.  Especially if it's your first time.

reviews.author: Dean S.
reviews.description: Service was great. View is amazing. Food and drinks were okay but mercy... so expensive. Chips and guacamole, two drinks were $50? We wandered around for a bit. Lots of closed stores in same location. Kind of feel bad giving them three stars but it is what it is.

reviews.author: TJ H.
reviews.description: The Oasis on Lake Travis is one of those tricky places where you have to average out the good with the bad to get a good idea of the place.  The good:  No question about it, the sunset is second to none, awesome views, awesome picturesque scene, and just about all of the outdoor seating has a great view of the scene. An additional positive, is the parking.  Easy to get to, plenty of free parking for the complex they are in, and even has valet parking if you prefer not to walk the 100 yards to the restaurant.  The not so good: I don't want to say the food was necessarily bad, it was just mediocre Mexican cuisine with a relatively small selection compared to your normal Mexican place.  To go along with the mediocre food is a price of about 1.5-2x what you would typically pay, but again you are here for the view not the food. The service also was not bad, but I think "nonchalant" would be the best way to describe it.  So the real question, would I recommend it? Yes I would but just go into it with the right mindset that you are going for the view, you are paying for the view and you will not be disappointed!  I would probably not go back if I am in Austin, but I am glad we went once.

reviews.author: David T.
reviews.description: Came here around 4:30pm on a Sunday to with a party of 5. We waited an hour to get a table outside with a nice view of the lake. Food is pretty basic so just know you're paying for the view. The drinks might be another selling point, but I didn't have any.    In short if you have out of town visitors and want to Wow them take them here for the view. That's about it.

reviews.author: Jenniffer M.
reviews.description: I saw lots of pictures online of this place and decided to go. It is definitely beautiful view. I was able to get an appetizer while looking at the lake. There was a waiting time, but it went by quickly. There is also a gift shop on the first floor that has souvenirs for all.

reviews.author: Jesse D.
reviews.description: Good view... strong drinks... but VERY pricey for average food. The drinks are pricey too. All that I can deal with. But you gotta deal with the hoard of madness and the service is VERY VERY slow. 90min for a table and 60mins waiting for the food to come out of the kitchen. You guys need to figure out something for your staffing crunch at weekend dinner. It's pretty bad

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here on a Sunday morning when they opened at noon, and there was no wait time. Sat upstairs with a nice view of the lake, however b/c it was a square 4 top, only 2 people had the optimal view. I wish they had those half moon booths, so everyone could have a good view.   Ordered the salsa, queso, and fajitas (chicken and beef) for 2, which was plenty for 4. The food came out very quickly, but there were times we struggled to flag our server down for other requests. The salsa was very runny, and the chips were broken up. I wish there would have been more whole intact chips. The queso was tasty. The meat was a bit dry. Beans were good, but rice was a bit too "cafeteria" in terms of flavor and texture. The grilled veggies and guacamole that accompanied were good though.   Overall, you come here for the super touristy experience. I've heard the sunset views are unbeatable!

reviews.author: Ashleigh J.
reviews.description: I was excited to come here since it's so popularized on IG and TikTok. We weren't hungry so we decided to just get some chips  and salsa and a couple of drinks- which we were able to enjoy on the deck as the sun was starting to set. It cost about $50 for our two drinks and chips, but we were sat quickly and had drinks quickly after ordering- it's a beautiful place to grabs drinks and watch the sunset and enjoy the beautiful view.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: I don't get the hate. Are the prices high? Yes, but you're paying for the view/ambiance, not necessarily the food. Having said that, the food quality is pretty good and the service has always been good for me (though we are admittedly only there for weekend lunch service since we always have kids).   My shrimp tacos were well flavored and a good (yet not overflowing) portion. Menu wise they could definitely work on their beer selection - need more craft beers and some varied selection of beer styles.

reviews.author: Diana N.
reviews.description: Super cute, cozy, and clean BandB. One of the more reasonably priced places in Wimberley. Located right off the Square so easy walking distance to restaurants, shops, and the creek. I recommend Kiss the Cook (souvenirs, kitchen gadgets, coffee, etc) and Wimberley Cafe (good burgers and pie). The courtyard is beautifully decorated and relaxing. Plenty of FREE breakfast and pre-packaged snacks available even during COVID (cereal, Nutri-grain and Nature Valley bars, Chewy bars, muffins, coffee, orange juice, apple juice, pudding packs, fruit cups, yogurt, chips, milk and water for $1).  Stayed in the Maeson room. You have to exit the home into the courtyard to access this room, but I liked the privacy. Very comfortable king size bed, fresh linens, very spacious room w/ mini fridge, microwave, and tv, not much counter space in the bathroom though. Hosts were incredibly nice and welcoming. I would return!

reviews.author: Christina Z.
reviews.description: My sister got married last week in Wimberly, TX. Our family thought, "this is so random". Neither of the families lived there and most of us had never heard of Wimberly. Then my sister said she had booked us at The Square Inn and gave us room arrangements.   I had flown in leaving MD at 4 am then getting to Dallas and then drove an hour. It felt like it was 5 in the afternoon but in reality it was 11am.   We walk into the Square Inn and was greeted by the owners. It never even hit my mind from the crazy traveling, check in was at 3 PM. To be honest I didnt think about it till others said there hotels would not let them early check in.   When meeting the owners, it felt like family. It almost felt like we were all coming home. They were so great. They let us in early and was cool enough to say, "we need to run out before the others come, you are in charge."   The whole place was beautiful and amazing. Every room was perfect for single friends, to my other sisters and my crazy, but loveable nephews. Mr. Loyd one of the owners was like a natural grandfather with letting the boys run around but also telling them to close the door to keep AC inside. Lol  My favorite spot was the court yard. It looks like something out of a movie. Plus when it rains you can sit and watch the rain hit the roof. It's so peaceful.   So on top of a friendly, welcoming, beautiful space to stay and socialize, they also cook breakfast. Let me tell you it was the best food I have ever had at a bed and breakfast place.   We could smell the bacon at 6 am. Yum yum   So hands down this is place to stay in Wimberly. Its walking distance of all the cool shops and places to eat in town.

reviews.author: Ali R.
reviews.description: Cons: * There were mosquitoes CONSTANTLY flying around our room. We never left the door open, so I don't know how they kept coming in. (This was the biggest con) * When we placed the "service our room" card on our door, no one ever came to fix the bed or resupply fresh towels. We were gone for like the whole day, and no one came, so that wasn't nice * The water pressure in the shower was too hard * The bathroom floor would get soaking wet anytime we took a shower because the curtain wouldn't stay closed all the way to prevent the water from going outside the tub. * When they gave us the wifi password they spelled it with a capital T, but really it was all lowercase, so we had a hard time getting the WiFi to work until we called the front desk.   Pros: * it is within walking distance to all the little stores and Wimberley cafe. * the staff is friendly. * The price of the room is reasonable   They just need to fix all the cons listed, and I think they would have a fine place to stay. Very unique and quirky. Also, I do think it would be nice if they had cable television.

reviews.author: Chelsie B.
reviews.description: Really neat place, would love to stay here again. Very clean and friendly folks. Peaceful and quite. About a 3 min walk to nearby restaurants and bars.

reviews.author: Arnold G.
reviews.description: Okay. We ended up in wimberley on the coldest days of the year for my wife's 50th birthday. We arrived on Thursday and joined by our two adult sons. We were lucky to have made reservations at the Square Inn.  This place is quaint and hip at the same time.  Our room/suite was large and clean and really comfy.  The staff and owners were great and accommodating. We had to leave early due to the weather so we really couldn't enjoy all of the amenities, but we r definitely going to return. The Square Inn is a great choice for being close to the Square. Lots of great places to walk to and enjoy. Can't wait to go back and we will absolutely b staying at the Square Inn. Thx for making our short stay so pleasurable.

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: My sister and her husband stayed here while visiting from Spain. They loved Everything about it ,  especially the super comfy bed.  Breakfast was delicious

reviews.author: Peachy S.
reviews.description: Fun, quiet place to stay. Fantastic location. Owners were really friendly and the breakfasts were amazing. They even accommodated my dietary restrictions!! Definitely will be back!!

reviews.author: Kimberleigh S.
reviews.description: My man did very well finding this BandB for our short stay in Wimberley. I don't know which was better, the gracious hospitality of the owners' and their family or our very comfortable room. The breakfast, served from 0800-1000 is also awesome. We stayed in the "Lauren" room located by the back patio area. The entire establishment is quiet and clean and I loved having a mini fridge in the room. The Inn is centrally located and quaint shops and restaurants are right outside the door. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.author: Chuck M.
reviews.description: Nice location just off the main square. Great location to explore the Wimberley area from.  Well kept, nicely appointed rooms. Owner is very attentive and courteous.  Excellent pricing, often lower than other BandB's in the area.  I stayed a night mid-week. If you want to stay over the weekend, make your reservations early. It often fills up on the weekend. My room was off the patio in the back, the patio was a nice place to relax.

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: The Square Inn was perfect for my husband and I's Anniversary Getaway.  The staff was very helpful and welcoming.  Wonderful breakfast served every morning with plenty of shopping steps away. Our room was warm and quaint - bathrooms with recent update and decor.  We loved that the BandB had 24 hour come and go as you need as we were attending a wedding outside of town. Each room felt like it had it's own private oasis as it faced in to a beautiful courtyard area to sit and drink your morning coffee or a glass of wine. We can't wait to visit Wimberley again and stay at this adorable little BandB!

reviews.author: Chris G.
reviews.description: Fantastic! Feels just like Wimberley: quaint and welcoming! The room was spacious, very clean, and well cooled even during the hot summer sun. All the details were great: towels were fresh and soft, wifi was fast, bed was comfortable, shampoo was even great!   But the location was amazing! Right on the square, so my wife and I literally walked almost everywhere! If we needed to refresh our drink, we simply walked back to the room. No problem!   Now the food. Breakfast is served daily and is delicious! In addition, they have a great selection of coffees, teas, and cocoas! Snacks like chips, pound cake, muffins, granola bars, microwave popcorn, etc. were available all day.   Can't say enough good things about this gem! Wouldn't change a thing!

reviews.author: Cindy M.
reviews.description: This is a great place to stay in wimberly. The couple the manage the BandB are charming and attentive. This place is like home and has a lovely covered patio. Short walking distance to shops and resturants. Very clean and tidy rooms with mini ref and microwave. A must stay at reasonable rates.

reviews.author: Stephaney G.
reviews.description: this is the worst service I've ever received at a bed and breakfast. They took 20 mins to show up at the front desk when we arrived. they are charging us for damages they refuse to show us documents of. i went back and forth emailing the so called staff there and she told me she didn't have time for my problems. when I asked for her bosses number she gave me her fiances number. which, big surprise was no help because he would only side with her. he said hes the gm and theirs no higher position then him which is a lit because every gm has a boss and while we were there a lady was talking to them about things they needed changed who i'm assuming is Marcilia B. the owner. also the couple who runs the place was arguing so loud while we were there we could hear it from our room, when i went to see what was going on i saw her yelling at him.There was NEVER anyone at the front desk the whole time we were there and they lied about their medicine variety they claim to have. I'm pregnant and can only have Tylenol which the claimed they had in their "large variety" which only consisted of off brand aspirin. when i emailed them asking for documents all they did was argue with me (a customer) instead of trying to resolve the problem. I don't recommend  to anyone to stay here or waste your money because you will only get horrible service. DO NOT GO HERE WASTE OF MONEY.

reviews.author: Renee G.
reviews.description: Loved this place it was perfect for our large family. The food was great for breakfast. The outdoor patio was so comfortable and amazing. Thanks for the lovely well decorated rooms and comfortable beds.

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: My mother and I spent one night at the Square Inn. They were extremely accommodating even though we could only spend one night when they normally have a two night minimum. The room was very spacious,  decorated perfectly and very clean. The inn was fully booked but you wouldn't even know it because it was so nice and quiet. We felt as though we had the whole place to ourselves. The owners are so very nice and informative. The inn is walking distance to many shops and dining options. We weren't able to stay for breakfast but it smelled delicious. We will definitely be going back!!

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: A girlfriend and I recently stayed here one night and had a really nice time.  It was super clean and the inn keepers Keegan and Meg were very friendly hosts.  It was very quiet at night and our beds were very comfortable.  Also, you can't beat the location for walking to the shops and restaurants.

reviews.author: Jon R.
reviews.description: Myself and my fiancee recently visited Square Inn, and were very pleased with our stay.  The Lauren Room was clean, with warm, rustic interiors and a fabulously comfortable king-size bed.  The patio located just a few steps from our door was spacious; nice place to hang out before venturing to either Marco's Italian or Cypress Creek for dinner (both restaurants, by the way..  wonderful).  Square Inn is walking distance from some truly amazing dining, along with quaint knick knack shops (soaps, candy, etc.)-- not to mention you're swimming the Blanco, or tasting at Wimberley Valley Winery, in just a few minutes' drive.  Can't beat that.  Which reminds me: amenities included a big-screen t.v. in the common area, a decent library of DVD'S, an Xbox 360 game console with games, and complimentary wine in the afternoon and evenings.  Really, really nice being able to wind down for the night with a movie, and a glass or two from Duchman Winery.   Marci, our innkeeper at Square Inn, was very friendly, and courteous, even during a fluke front-door locking mechanism malfunction which resulted in our having to wake her up.

reviews.author: Blanca G.
reviews.description: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay.  Very cozy, quiet and comfortable.  Loved that it was walking distance to all the shops. The owners were very friendly!  Enjoyed our *Cowboy Casserole*!

reviews.author: Johnny j.
reviews.description: This is a quiet little place with 6 rooms.  The innkeeper, Marci, serves breakfast every morning in the common area.  According to her, this place is a labor of love, and it shows.  The beds are comfortable and the atmosphere is peaceful.  I will definitely be staying again next spring.  If you are visiting Wimberly for the Square, the inn is literally a stone's throw away.
